column13:
I am a sucker for bibimbap, so I was excited to find a Korean fast food joint near my hotel. I chose the sliced ribeye with an egg and loaded up on toppings. I noticed a reviewer or two who took issue with the varying textures of the toppings, but to me that's one of the great things about bibimbap: no two bites taste the same. It's supposed to be a riot of flavors and textures. The only slight disappointment was that I ordered my meal in a stone bowl, which didn't quite crisp up the rice enough, IMO. 

But THIS should speak volumes: I enjoyed my meal so much that I came back again the next day. BOOM.

This place is like a Chipotle of Bibimbap!  I'm not going to write home about the authentic Korean food I experienced, but it is a good fast-casual option when you just don't feel like cooking.  But, the menu is pretty limited.  
Both my husband and I had the Bibimbap, so I can only review that.  We had the spicy pork and it was really salty which was a disappointment.  But, you get to pick out the various veggies, tofu, kimchi, etc. that you want in your bowl, so that was cool to be able to customize it.  Then, a fried egg was added from the kitchen (you have to have a fried egg with your Bibimbap!).  The serving size was gigantic, I probably could've eaten it in two meals, but I was hungry.  :)  The actual restaurant is rather small and there were some loud children there, so we just took our food to go.  
Overall, I enjoyed the food, but when I go back, I will get the Bibimbap with a different meat or try their tacos.

This place is small but it certainly offers some delicious and unique food.

I had the Galbi bibimibap which was basically
Marinated ribs with various vegetables of which you can choose. They are warmed up and sit in piles in the bowl. I guess it's your job to mix them up. Overall a yummy dish but I maybe expected something different. The ribs were the best part!

I also had the garlic soy chicken wings and kogii fries. The fries were kinda like chili cheese fries but not spicy. They offer another kind of fries I tried and they were spicy but had more flavor.

The wings were the biggest surprise to me. They were crispy on the outside, tender on the inside. The flavor was cooked into the skin perfectly. If you love wings then don't pass these up. 

This place is great for a small group but don't expect to come with a group of 4 or more. They have limited space. Also the food can 10-15 to prepare based on what you want.

Overall an enjoyable experience. I will try to return should I be in the area.

Been a while since my first visit to Kogii Kogii, and my bf and I decided to make a return trip, after some earnest contacts from the manager after the last experience. I did indeed see this time that everyone in the front or back room was wearing a hat, so that was good. 

Though one of the messages had invited me for a free meal, for the purposes of a fair and balanced Yelp review we paid our way and got the garlic-soy Korean fried chicken, as well as some dumplings again. 

The fried dumplings were just as tasty as the first time: greasy-good with the chile sauce at the table.

But the star here was the fried chicken wings!! Managing to be both sticky with the sauce yet remaining crispy-skinned, the meat was also marvelously moist: I was using Anthony Bourdain words like "succulent" and "luscious" as we licked our fingers. Also, these wings dwarf the babies at Buffalo Wild Wings or wherever: I couldn't even finish my order of ten (after the dumplings). I've gotta say too: don't kid yourself, even though this is chicken, it ain't a healthy meal; as my bf put it, "It's basically an elephant ear with some chicken inside." Still, so darn tasty!! 

So we will definitely be back whenever we feel the need for a fried treat!

Kogii Kogii Express is a new Korean casual quick eats restaurant located in the busy Naperville Freedom Commons plaza. Freedom Commons is becoming the go to spot for dining in Naperville as the vast array of culinary selections range from casual to fine dining. My only gripe was the lack of Asian dining choices so I'm happy to see this place open up.

Bibimbap is the main attraction here and Kogii Kogii Express offers a unique make your own chipotle style bibimbap station. For those that don't know what bibimbap is, it's a traditional Korean rice bowl dish that contains rice topped with a multitude of veggies, meat, fried egg, and Korean chili paste gochjang sauce that's all supposed to be mixed up together. "Bibim" literally means mixed up in Korean. Kogii Kogii's bibimbap is pretty awesome.  My favorite is the spicy pork but you can't go wrong with the Bulkogii (ribeye) or Galbi (short ribs). I love the fact that I can choose which veggies I want on top. They do charge you $1 extra for a fried egg or stone pot option. I usually skip the stone pot if its a hot day. For vegetarians out there you can have your bowl topped with no meat or tofu as another option.

The fried chicken wings here are also one of my favorite things to eat and in my opinion the best Korean fried chicken in Chicagoland and may even be the best wings in Chicagoland. They are that good. You can choose either garlic soy or Seoul sassy sauce (pretty spicy). The wings are super crisp and very meaty. A small order ($5.99) which consists of 5 pieces and a bowl of rice is enough to fill me up on most days.

Check out the Korean Churros which are pan fried dduk (rice cake) topped with spicy sauce or cinnamon sugar or the deep fried Chocopie for dessert! 

Overall Kogii Kogii Express is a unique and refreshing addition to the Naperville food scene.  Parking is a bit tough to find during weekday lunch rush due to all the office workers nearby but they do have dedicated parking spot for take out orders. Check it out!

This place is just okay.
I just have had better korean in the city or in arlington heights.

Chicken wings are actually okay! But like I said I've had better.

Bibimbap is a bit bland - i duno what it is but its just not what i'm looking for.

DO NOT GET THE Chapchae - i should have taken a picture but the portion was like 1/8th of the to go pan. All soy sauce - yuck.

Tacos - they forgot to give us sauce sooooo... it tasted a bit bland.

The only good thing is the chicken really.

I always crave Korean food and wanted to check this place out (I may have gotten it confused with the Kogii Kogii in Riverwoods). This is more of a Korean fast food place - the portions are smaller and cheaper. I got the bulgogi and my boyfriend got the kalbi, both came with a bowl of rice (white or brown) and a choice of two sides (we chose kimchi and tofu). The choices for sides are pretty limited and the tofu was cold, flavorless and hard to chew on. Other than that, everything else was pretty good but nothing really noteworthy. Will probably try the wings next time, but I'll also try the Kogii Kogii in Riverwoods!

I've heard a lot about Bibimbap, and this was my first experience trying this Korean staple in the suburbs. I ordered the bowl and got the beef over white rice. I like that they have a vegetable bar and they let you choose your own veggies. I went with mushrooms, carrots, bean sprouts, bok choy, cucumber, and pickled radish. And of course, I added the fried egg, though I was a little put off by a $1.00 upcharge. but hey, that's not as bad as guacamole at Chipotle. The flavor of the rice and meat was excellent, especially with a heaping of the chili sauce. I recommend adding a nice portion of the sauce to add another layer of flavor.

The Korean chicken wings were pretty good. They were crispy and juicy, and I liked that they took 10 minutes to come out because that showed that they are made fresh and are not just sitting under a heat lamp. However, the garlic soy flavor was a little sweet for my taste. Next time, I'd try the Seoul Sassy to add some spice.

I would consider returning when I'm in the area. I can't say it's one of my absolute favorite restaurants, but it's a different kind of fast food and very enjoyable for a decent price. 3.5.

Excellent fresh food!!! Pork tacos outstanding!! Bibimbap bowl fabulous explosion of flavors & textures!! Fresh crisp amazingly tasty vegetable & garnish assortment!! Tip - best tasting fried chicken ever - be patient takes a while but worth the wait!!This place is a real gem - Korean food I will never forget - repeat place many times over!!!

Not everyone can or should make tacos,There is a ratio of meat vs toppings that should be followed. We ordered the taco trio,kimchi fries,and the Seoul sassy fried chicken...total was about $20

O.K. I write long reviews so to save you time- eat there,but don't expect much in terms of great customer service or great tacos.Get the chicken.

We walked in and were not greeted,as we got closer to the menu board the lady just stared at us as if we were Pink Aliens... I noticed a tip jar near the cash register(good luck with that lady who does not smile).

Our food took about 15 minutes.As I waited I observed another customer receiving the same Lack of customer service.

The taco trio was merely O.K. I have a high standard for tacos as its my favorite food.When I travel To other countries I see if they have a version of tacos;It's that serious.The meat ratio sucked,the tacos were mostly veggies.My issue with the taco trio is that all 3 tacos had the same toppings.All veggies don't complement all meats. The corn tortilla was awful.My guess is they were steamed in the microwave which makes them mushy. I'm guessing the chef learned how to cook tortillas from the back of the package- but that ain't how ya do it for tacos man!!!! My tacos came sloppily arranged in a large sheet of TIN FOIL!! Too many mistakes...

The Kimchi fries were good,but once again ratios should be noted.A large amount of fries with a little bit of toppings and cheese sauce. I feel like I'd have to ask for extra cheese/sour cream if I return. The fries were actually good without any toppings.

The best thing was the Seoul Sassy wings. They were crispy,and delicious!! Those wings deserve a solid 4 stars,I even ate them cold the next day and they still held their crunch.

Go for the wings!! The Kimchi fries have a cool flavor- try them,the tacos ehhhhhh.

This place is quickly becoming my favorite Korean restaurant in the western suburbs. It defines fusion comfort food perfectly, with a small variety of choices but packed with great flavors.  Their wings especially are amazing and cooked perfectly.  It may be the first time where the juices and flavors literally burst out when I take a bite, and I personally hope it is one dish that they will never change. 

Definitely a place worth the drive for.  It does not fall short to the high end restaurants in the plaza that it is located in.

This place doesn't look like much and has a small menu, but the food is great!! I really enjoyed the whole create your own bibimbap. The spicy pork was very good, not too spicy. And there was a spicy sauce on the tables to add more flavor. Great place for lunch!

Pretty good, especially for Naperville.  Yes, better Korean food can be had in the "city", but this is definitely worth trying.  I've been here a few times, quick thoughts:

- Spicy Pork was tasty, a bit oily but good
- Wings (both regular and spicy) were very good
- Dumplings are also light and very good (kids love them)
- Kimchee fries - good, pretty solid.  Have had better at select food trucks, but worth it.

I was disappointed in the Spicy Chicken - it was a bit dry (need chicken thigh meat!) when I had it.  I haven't had the bibimbap personally but my wife likes it.  Haven't had that Galbi yet but that's pretty hard to screw up.

The owners/waitstaff are super nice and it really doesn't take too long.  There isn't much seating and a lot of people seem to takeout.

My only other "complaint" is Naperville Commons parking - completely insufficient so if you come at a busy time, you could be circling for parking for like 10m+.

its chipotle with cold Korean sides you pick to top your bibimbap.
I ordered doll (hot clay bowl) bimbimbop, I don't think she heard me because i ended up getting regular.  you pick rice (brown) and protein (bulgogi) and they walk you down the small selection of toppings. which do you want?  I wanted it all.  and she passed it to me.  I grabbed a spoon and sat down.  the "sauce" on the table is spicy, (gochugang) and you mix your bowl all up.  I did ask about my soft fried egg, and she said i did not ask for it. I know now.  Sat down to dine. A little hard to mix the rice up with plastic spoons but it worked. Taste was ok/good. Gave three stars hoping it won't effect the balance either way. 

Original was edited because I sounded mean! 

Edited
Food is fresh and tasty. Menu was a bit confusing. They seemed to really skimp on the veggies in the BiBimBop, but all-in-all it was quite tasty.

I am solidly between 3.5 and 4 stars.  It was good, but definitely wasn't the best I had ever had.  I went with a coworker on Friday for lunch.  I have to say that I was very confused by the process, and because the employees weren't really able to communicate to me what I needed to do, it kind of soured my opinion a bit.  There were a bunch of sauces at the end that I wanted to know more about but the lady behind the counter just smiled at me like I hadn't asked a question at all.  Anyway, I had the bibimbap bowl with beef and upgraded to the stone bowl and the egg for a 1$ each.  The stone bowl wasn't worth the dollar.... the rice browned a little bit, but didn't get crunchy.  I wish I had just had them put everything on, but I didn't understand that everything was included (If that just makes me a dummy, I guess too bad).

Anyway, the food was fine, once I got over the ordering stress.  The restaurant is very, very small.  The two person tables are JUST barely big enough for two trays.  Trays are required if you get a hot stone bowl.  There's no room for anything else.  They give you teeeny tiny cups for water.  Seriously - dentist swishing sized cups.  I had to get up a bunch of times to get more water.  The sound of the refrigerators for the bottles of drinks that they sell is also really loud throughout the whole restaurant.  There are a few outside tables, but all of the ones with umbrellas are for a different restaurant.  If its not super hot, then I recommend sitting outside.  It would be great if this business would get their own outside tables.

Anyway, I won't be going back, I don't think.  Naf Naf and White Chocolate Grill are better options in that plaza.

Came in town to visit a friend and stopped by this new sister restaurant to original Kogii Kogii.  The concept of this place is excellent for quick Korean fix. Quick, affordable and delicious!  I ordered the soy garlic and spicy fried Korean chicken and it was amazing!! Crispy, juicy and full of flavor! The spicy chicken wasn't too hot (for my Korean taste buds) but may be too spicy for some. The hot stone bibimbap with egg on top was sizzling hot and flavorful as well. Definitely worth your money and time. I was not expecting this place in Naperville, but glad it's here.

Just stopped in here today for lunch. The Food was excellent! Made my own bowl with Rib Eye. Def will be back there again soon. I know they are new and are still working out some kinks, I suggest letting the guests know that they have a number on their ticket, I accidentally took someone else's food that was similar to mine and ate half of it before I check my receipt as they called a number numerous times. With a mouth full of food, I then realized I had a number and the number being called was mine - I took the wrong food LOL... Luckily the food I took belonged to someone in my group so we just switched. 

Great place, great food.

Me and my hubby wanted to check out new Korean restaurant in the heart of Naperville. We had galbi dolsot bibimbap, kimchi fries, spicy chicken plate! Everything was soooo delicious. So tasteful even i can choose the vegetable for my bibimbap bowl. The galbi was well marinated , the fires with kimchi was quite enjoyable. 
I come back soon with my friends!
Friendly service at the counter.  Limited selection.  Food was ok, nothing exciting.  Pricey.

Re-Downloaded yelp just so I could review this place. Delicious! I had a bibimbop bowl that rivals those I've had in my favorite Korean places in the city. Kimchi kicks major b*tt as well. No one comes to this place, it's empty. Come here and tell your friends about it!!

Awesome! Healthy Korean fast food! Portions are great and food is fresh! Tried the bibimbop, kimchi fries, and the tacos today. Bibimbop was savory with lots of veggies, kimchi fries were crispy, and the tacos were juicy! Thumbs up on the food!
It's my first time to Kogi Kogi and love their Bibimpap! The staffs are nice and friendly. The place was a bit small but clean. Definitely coming back!

Delicious! My husband & I had the Bibimbap Bowl with white rice, bulkogii (marinated ribeye), fried egg, & choice of veggies. It's sorta like a Korean Chipotle. They have tacos too. We also ordered fried chicken with Garlic Soy sauce, so good & crispy! So happy there's a Korean food place around here in the suburbs!! We'll definitely be back!

Fake ass Korean food, are you kidding me!!? Literally the women here are so rude and trying to rush me. Can I have more than 3 seconds to think about my order???? I've never had worse. Tastes like fake version of bonchon and bonchon is already the fake version of real Korean food. I understand it's fast food but really it sucks. And the dolsot bibimbap is not even in a nice hot stone bowl it's like a hot platter. Only thing I liked was the dumplings which are store bought because I can buy the same thing at hmart. The dipping sauce sucks too.

Fun little Korean place with fast, friendly service and great food. The menu is a little confusing, however, and a little expensive for the amount of food you get. It seems like the place doesn't quite run smoothly yet since it opened just yesterday, but that will probably improve over time. I got the spicy pork bibimbap bowl and the garlic soy chicken wings.

I was very disappointed tonight. My husband and I walked in at 8:15 pm and the employee said they were closed. The website lists 9 pm as closing time, but the door lists 8:30 pm as closing. They were already all cleaned up and chairs were being put up. I was looking forward to trying this place as Naperville doesn't have a lot of Korean food options. I wanted to give it 1 star, but since I didn't try their food, I'm giving it 2 stars.
Bim bim bop was good but the tacos are not that great.    Will go back to try the chicken wings.
Excellent quality food. Very approachable for people who haven't eaten Korean before. Good prices. Will definitely come again

Very good options for those on a Paleo or like diet.  The permutations are impressive.  You can really make a tasty AND healthy bowl.  I had the bibimbap (rice bowl) with the spicy pork and marinated short ribs over white rice.  I then proceeded to load it up with almost every item from the bar.  My favorites are the kim chi, pickled jalapeno and pickled radish.  I added the fried egg and had that put into the stone pot (a heated cast iron bowl that adds more heat to the mix). I would recommend spending the extra for the bowl (worth it).  I will come back soon and try the other items on the menu.
Good food and friendly service. The tacos and bowl were both delicious. Didn't have high expectations but pleasantly surprised. Glad this place opened up and will definitely return.

They get five stars for just being in the area and not by 59 or something. Food is decent not too salty as some places can be. Selection of tacos. Rice bowls, entrees, or fried chicken. The fried chicken is amazing and Carmelites like how I ate the Korean Chinese style fried chicken growing up. I recommend the garlic soy unless u can handle a very very spicy hot chicken. Tacos were definitely nowhere near the level of Del Seoul's. I'd stay away. The rice bowls are done like your Chipotle ones... In a bowl where you choose all your toppings. And definitely do try their fries. Both the kimchi and kogi fries were delish!!! Haven't tried an entree yet only because I'd rather make that stuff at home. Wish they had a salad bowl option with no rice at all. I don't remember if they have any type of brown rice either. Never gone when it's busy but if you're getting chicken, I'd call and order ahead or call for pickup. They had a lot of bugs flying around the ceiling. We've only ordered carry out. Nice decor. Easy to find off the 88 expressway and freedom by diehl. Edit add on: oh yeah other lady mentioned service. For a fast food place not so great but for a Korean place, it wasn't the worst. Korean restaurants kind of have a bad rep for bad service because of lack of staff or a bad day. Do wish there was a bit more energy. If you are the only employee there be happy. First time I went there was a young girl and she was very nice and helpful. Keep it up!

Super yummy and quick lunch food. Great alternative to salads or sandwiches. Can get a veggie option. The bibimbap with brown rice, veggies and eggs was so delicious!  Nice service! Will definitely come back.

This is a great place to grab a quick bite to eat if you are craving Korean. We tried the bulkogii bibimbap, small order of garlic soy wings, and the spicy chicken plate. Ingredients are fresh, portions are good, and prices are reasonable.  My kids loved the chicken which was crisp and meaty.  Great to see another Korean option pop up in this area.

So we were planning to go to kogii kogii in riverwoods but when typing it in Yelp, this express one came up. We were sooo excited because not only is it wayy closer than the original but this one had Korean tacos!! So happy we don't have to go to the city for them anymore. 

They are definitely more fast food type. The food was out fast but not so fast where it's kind of suspicious. The kimchee fries were amazing! They were nice and crispy, which I love, but they were still potato-y? If you catch my drift. The tacos were good, but gotta put the red pepper sauce they have on the table. 

I love my Korean style fried chicken! So I was looking forward to these. They were crispy, meaty and delicious. I personally like my chicken more crispy, but I guess my heart and health would prefer them like this haha. But the flavor was so good I didn't even care. Also, it might've been because it had sauce on it. I usually get plain crispy chicken, so I will try that next time!

The restaurant itself is very clean and modern looking. I like the presentation. Also, there was another man next to us and when he had left the employee cleaned the table right away. Love that they're on top of their game. Can't wait to come back and try the galbi rice bowl!! It's such a reasonable price, doesn't cost an arm and a leg like other places.

Fantastic little restaurant close to our hotel after a long drive in from Nebraska! Very friendly staff and tasty food! My friend for bibimbap and I got the bulkogii rice plate. I loved it but found the sauce a little too salty. My friend was hoping for fresh-cooked bulkogii instead of re-heated (but we went close to closing). Highly recommend from a tired traveler!

YES Korean food !!!

Get the galbi plate with kimchi and white rice. I haven't had good Korean fast food in a long time. 

We just found it by mistake when we were driving to hmart.

three stars because the food is pretty good and surprisingly fast service. However, the portions for the price is too small. I ordered galbi, kim chee fried rice, 5 piece chicken wings and two drinks all of that almost $60 like whaaat. for the portions i would think all my food would equal $35. but all in all food is good.

So, I've been lamenting the lack of a good Korean fried chicken in the western suburbs lately, and I didn't realize they had it here until I tried it today.  It's good.  I got the garlic-soy flavoring and it was exactly what I was looking for.  It's just wings, but that's not too bad.

Also tried the bulkogii, which was tasty.  My wife had the bibimbap with tofu, and she thought it was okay. She was a bit underwhelmed by the tofu which was cold, and maybe that's by design but it was unexpected by her.  The jap chae noodles were tasty.

Two small concerns:  The website doesn't really convey the express menu, it just has the main restaurant's menu, which is more extensive.  Also, I didn't see it explained anywhere what "Kogii Fries" were, and I could have asked or taken a gamble, but I had bought too much to try it out as it was. 

Anyway, it's a quality place, and it seems to beat the somewhat lackluster food court at Naperville's Super H-Mart.

The food is ok. Meat in our bowls came out cold. The food is overpriced. Service was vary friendly though. I honestly don't see what the big deal about this place is... It's good but it's not that good.
Good food but painful service. Worth it if you lower your expectations of fast food timing. Wings great!

Went to this place for an early dinner. The food was very good, the experience was so-so.

I got there around 4:45 and there was only one other group of two in the restaurant. The eat-in area is very small so there must do mostly carry-out business. I had never been there before, so I was a little disoriented about exactly how you ordered and how you got your food and the staff didn't really help. There were three ladies behind the register who all looked at me while I ordered (I got the bibimbap bowl with spicy pork, kimchi fries and a coke) but then none of them told me what was going on, so I just took a seat figuring someone would bring my food to me since there isn't any spot that looks like a "pick-up" area. Then they had me come back to get the vegetables for the bowl but didn't explain if they were all included at no charge or if I had to pay extra for others. Then they all left and took my bowl with them. Uh... OK.... Finally one lady brought my bowl back and set it on a counter behind the register. I took it back to a table but wasn't sure if they forgot my fries or if those were coming later or what. They had a bunch of coolers with drinks in them in different spots but I wasn't sure if I was supposed to just grab a bottle of coke or what. I finally just took one and no one said anything so I guess that's what I was supposed to do. I started eating my bowl and about 10 minutes later someone called "order number 44" which when I checked my receipt was my order number, nobody mentioned that I even had an order number when I placed my order. So the place has some obvious order flow and communication issues...

As for the food, everything was excellent. The bowl was delicious, if anything, I put too many vegetables in it. The kimchi fries, when they came, were very good. Everything was freshly made and the correct temperature. Spice-wise, I don't like things overly spicy and they had toned it down from what I was expecting, so I was happy with it but it might not have the kick you are looking for if you like a lot of heat in your Korean food. The size of the bowl with the fries and a drink were way more than I could eat. If you have two people I would recommend splitting the bowl or the fries because i didn't come close to finishing either of them.

It was a little pricey for one person for a "fast-casual" type dinner, my total with tax was just under $21. I would probably skip the fries next time which would have brought the cost down closer to $16-$17 which is more typical of what I would expect to spend.

This place just opened and we are so happy to see more choices for Korean food in Naperville.  We tried the kalbi bibimbap, garlic soy chicken wings, and kimchi fries.  The bibimbap was the big winner and we enjoyed the big portions and fresh ingredients on the the bibimbap.  The chicken wings were also very good -- not too saucy and very crispy (perhaps the portion size could be a bit bigger for the price).  The kimchi fries were delicious but I would have liked more kimchi on top (just my preference).  Relative to other choices in the area, KKE gets 5 stars from me.  I'll be coming back here for sure.

Tried this place for the first time today. My husband and I both loved their food! I got the hot stone bibimbap with spicy pork. He got chicken wings. We also shared kimchi fries. Everything was delicious. A fun and modern twist to Korean food.
First time I have ever posted on Yelp. This place is delicious. Service was great. If I lived here I would eat here all the time.
I'm addicted and come here whenever I pass the area. I like the zinger burger and

Had chicken wings and gyro salad to go.  The buffalo wings were breaded chicken winglets with sauce on the side as requested.  They came with a small half ranch that was not enough.   The gyro salad came with the meat chopped up pretty fine and in a separate box, the small half gyro sauce was not nearly enough.   We ate about half of the salad and through the rest away.  Not a fan of the finely chopped gyro meat and onions as presented - would rather have some larger strips.   Total for 20 wings and salad was $26.

Nice people here though.

I would come back and try different items on the menu.

I ordered peri peri burger, tandoori burger and zinger burger..All other burgers were ok ok not so great but zinger burger was very good..tasty and crispy..Similar to KFC..I would go only for zinger burger and nothing else..

After my meeting today I wanted to grab something for a late lunch.  I wanted something fast and easy I found Mr Broast in Lombard on Yelp.  It seemed like the chicken zinger burger was their signature sandwich.  

I ordered one and it came out with a perfectly cooked fried chicken with a very crispy crunch (much like tempura), Cole slaw and tasty hot sauce.  It was delicious served hot with a crispy Panko crust.  

I'm going to be dreaming about that chicken zinger tonight.  They also have a $6 dollar combo during the week with a sandwich, fries and a drink so if you're out in Lombard at lunch time stop in and have one

Nothing bad to say about this place.  Quality food, friendly and helpful service with great prices.  When I am in the mood for a fried chicken sandwich this is the place I always went to while living in Chicago.  The $6 lunch special is unbeatable.  Trust me, get the zinger burger which is a enormous piece of fresh white meat fried chicken sandwiches between a sesame bun.  Make sure to get this thing spicey.   The burger comes with coleslaw on top only the meat which adds flavor and moistness.  The burger comes served with fried which are above average.  Make sure to grab a shocker and add some additional seasoning that's on the table.  The meal also comes with a can of soda or water.

My only suggestion would be for them to clean the ketchup/hot sauce bottles more frequently.  They are consistently sticky which is a bit of a turn off but other then that this place is great.

I am basing this review on a single meal. So I can't speak for the rest of the menu. I chose to have the zinger chicken sandwich since it seems that is their premier item on the menu. And I think it lives up to the hype. It was a crunchy yet tender chicken sandwich topped with cheese and a special kind of Cole slaw. 

The sandwich was accompanied by a modest portion of seasoned fries and a drink.

The sandwich was indeed tasty. Though I felt the bun a bit lacking. If you aren't a fan of spiciness then you might find its mild sandwich a tad bit spicy. It's nothing intense but it's not "non-spicy". 

Overall it was a good meal. For $7 you can't complain much.

these people need to figure out if they are a full service restaurant or a fast food restaurant. 30 minutes for a 2pc chicken?? Not cool...My buzzer never went off and when i finally went to the cashier area after waiting for like 30 mins, the guy who took my order told someone in the kitchen to pack my order. the chicken wasn't that great either. just felt like something i could make at home. I'm giving 2 stars only because I feel they didn't have MSG in their food. not sure though. if they have MSG, then their chicken just sucks... going to the popeye's across the street next time.

Don't judge me fellow health conscious peeps. I literally come here once a week for the spicy zinger burger. Which should tell you a lot. One of the best burgers, the chicken is fried to perfection and that sauce is amaaaazigng! Will continue to get my zinger burger once a week and I would also recommend this place to everyone. I haven't had anything else from here so can't comment on that.
Delicious, filling, HALAL food! I love the zinger burger and fries, the biscuits are also quite good. They have good lunch specials, so keep an eye out for that.

The lady at service was in hurry, She didn't gave any attention what I am ordering. When I picked my ordered she said one zinger is spicy and other is not, seriously did I say anything to you make one spicy and other not. I didn't say anything to her. Always check what you are ordering. and yes zinger is not best it is just crispy chicken with mayos on it. It is not ever close to KFC zinger burger.. If you are big fan of mayo burger go for it. I was very disappointed with Mr.Broast. and last but not least don't try Mango lussi.

Update to my update. That evening my wife and I got sick from eating their Chicken Zinger. My kids were OK (they ate cheese burger) but my wife and I had classic food poisoning symptoms with vomiting, diarrhea, and other nasty symptoms. 
When I told a friend about this, he said that he found a chunk of hair in his food a while back! 
Do NOT eat here!

I guess I can cross this off my list.

Not much happening in the way of ambience.  After reading the reviews I went with the  $6 lunch special which is a terrific deal. Tried the Zinger Chicken sandwich, which is a medium spicy fried sandwich. It was reasonably good. It had a mayo slaw sauce on it that was ok, but unnecessary. The fries were run of the mill spicy/seasoned fries.

Next time I will order the Peri Peri chicken which I understand is grilled. More my style.

Packed at lunch, by the way.

Fresh yummy food and lunch specials that include fries and a drink for 6 bucks?? Uh yes please. I had the zinger burger and died. It was SO good. I asked them to make it a lil spicier and it was on point. The fried chicken piece was huge, juicy, and seasoned to perfection. The fries are also delicious!! You could even share the meal with someone it was so big (but u won't want to share that zinger burger trust me)

For my Muslims, the place is halal too- so bring yo parents- it's soon to be their fave spot too! My father in law loves their fried fish there (desi parents' dream come true)

Last night we had the best halal burgers,Zinger & Peri-Peri at Mr. Broast, in Lombard. While searching for our snacking joint I found this place nearby with nice reviews..A restaurant with plain interior is not that inviting but their food is !!!

There is a lot to choose from and really hard not to drool upon, but we tried out zinger burger combo (with fries and Pepsi) and peri peri burger and kept others for our next visit.While peri peri burger I chose to be regular, zinger we opted for the spicy delight.Â 
Zinger burger had a crisp patty of chicken coated with homemade sauce...It was finger licking good.. crunchy,juicy and fully seasoned in a single bite..I would like to mention their homemade crisp masala fries(seasoned fries),very crispy and mouth watering.Peri Peri was all about the spicy grilled chicken...chicken was tender and a moist with after-bite heat sensation.
Overall,I am impressed with this place and their service. It took 10-15 minutes for food to reach at the table, so hold your patience as it will be worth.There is ample seating space for bigger groups of 10-15 people as well..
Do stop at this place if you are visiting Lombard next time.

Who doesn't like some broast? Some zinger burger? I know I do!! But back in LA it's very hard to find zabihah halal zinger. So when I found out il be visiting Chicago, I quickly started looking for halal places and those which other people recommended. Even though this was like 35 minutes cab drive from our hotel,we knew we HAD to try this. 
We were not disappointed! My husband and I had the zinger burger combo and he also tried their buffalo sandwich. But zinger burger was the bomb. 
And it was freshly made too. They had chaat masala for the fries  I use that in literally every food I make or eat. If I ever come back to Chicago,I'm definitely going back!

The zinger burger is good and so is their chicken/ wings. The food overall is pretty Good. The only reason I cannot give them 5 stars is because the customer service here has not been the greatest. The owners are phenomenal but the rest of the staff doesn't care at all. Otherwise definitely worth visiting

I have heard a lot about Mr. Broast, so I went in with high expectations. I am happy to announce that all of expectations were met. 

I had the Philly cheesesteak, after ordering on the phone and just picking up. I liked the bread a lot, but the filling was just way too spicy for me. I eat spices, but my tolerance level is not too high, so I can't blame them. The meat was not in big chunks, like I imagined it would be, and the bell peppers were cut into very small pieces. I know another reviewer said that there was no cheese on their sandwich, but that wasn't the case for me. 

I also like the zinger burger. With a soft bun and crispy, crunchy, juicy, chicken, I actually prefer this menu item over the Philly cheesesteak. I ordered it spicy, and it was just enough spice. Not overly done, but a nice level of heat. The only thing I didn't like was I didn't know that it was going to have mayonnaise on it, and I don't like mayo. Other than that, absolutely delicious. 

I went with all of my fellow yelpers and got an extra side order of fries. Definitely a good choice, the fries are amazingly good. Crispy and the perfect amount of seasoning. 

I also thought the person inside working was super nice. She was cheery and smiling. I would go here again.

Mr. Broast is a quick service restaurant, you order at the counter, they bring the food to the table.

The food is ALWAYS fresh.and oh so flavorful. That's what I love about this place. I usually get the bun kabob, or a Mr. Beef platter. Their chicken zinger burger is really good too!

We went on a SUPER busy Friday night. The place was packed. But the kitchen kept that food coming out hot and fresh. The serving staff was on top of their game, keeping the food moving and the tables clean. It seemed like the air conditioning had given up in the face of the heat outside and the mass of people inside. 

You can also always order in advance and take out.

Came in with a friend for lunch. She had the Zinger Burger and I had the grilled chicken sandwich. Food was ok, kind of greasy. And why do they call it a 'burger' when it's fried chicken. Fries were good. Overall, I'm giving this place 3 stars because the restaurant was just not clean and presentable. They can do better.

Never going back. period.

someone should tell these knuckle heads that chicken wings in this country are bite sized morsels coated in flavored sauce.  when you order 50 wings, you expect to say... "is this going to be enough for a party of 8?"  We ordered this and none of these idiots told us that these were actually steroid grown supersized real chicken wings fried in tons of oil and without any damn sauce!!!!  We ended up throwing away all that food because how the hell could we finish all that? On top of that... it was SO fried that there was hardly any edible chicken left!!! Why did we even deviate from the tride and true WING BROS down the street. 
To some positive however.... some members of our party ordered things like burgers or philly cheese or gyros.  The gyros were rated as a 10 by a teen in our group. I would give this place just a speck of a star but i dont know how to give less than one!

atomsphere - Typical scummy dirty dining area that no thought was given to.  Tables were probably brought off craigs list from a few restaurants that closed down. 

Employees - One person that barely speaks english.  

Bottom line - OF ALL THE PLACES IN THAT AREA - IM STICKING TO WING BROS UNLESS THERE IS A CONVINCING REVIEW TO GO ELSEWHERE.  THIS PLACE WILL EXCEED YOUR EXPECTATIONS IF YOU WANT TO BE PISSED OFF AT WASTING MONEY, CALORIES, AND TIME.
The zinger burger is so delicious. Whenever I'm in the neighborhood I always get the zinger.

If I could give this place no stars I would.
They had pretty decent food once we started going there and decided to try this zinger burger everyone is talking about. As soon as they became more popular they stopped giving good customer service, they don't even bother greeting a customer when they come in (especially regulars,) and the last couple times we went there prices seemed to go up each time. The manager or owner is extremely rude, they have no clue about customer service. All these ppl are hungry for is money. Even then they don't mind insulting a regular customer. Definitely not returning! There's plenty of better restaurants around Chicago that know good customer service and don't hand you a stale burger. Plz dnt bother visiting.

I give zero stars 
The lady I was talking to her name was So called ayman she was working Monday November 23rd at night 
She told me to come in 15 mins I got there in 20 mins 
I called her to tell her my fries were cold 
She hung up on me the first time then I called her again and she acted like she couldn't hear me 
They didn't give me a refund and said I came in too late I came in literally 5 mins after my burger and fries  was ready 
Very bad service 
I used to love their service but now they have downgraded

Pls only come here unless your looking for previously frozen and flash fried food. Stay away from the chicken wings. Tasteless and huge pieces of frozen hormone injected chicken. Ordered a 50 piece for the family and only finished a few pieces. Ordered chicken tenders for my four year old. They brought out something that looked like chicken octopus. Burned and overly breaded pieces of chicken. Burgers were ok, nothing special. Peri peri sauce did not taste like most, not sure exactly what it was. Restaurant is dirty and I don't think they even bothered to wipe the tables down. Don't waste your time. They have a wing and burger joint down the street. Main Street. Who's wings are awesome. Definitely not going back.

Simply put, WOW! Had the Philly Cheese Steak on French bread. First off, the bread was warm and extremely soft. Not a soggy, soaking with grease soft but just a pleasant experience soft. Then, bit into the sandwich and the flavors took my mouth on an amazing journey ride. 

My wife got the gyro sandwich which also tasted great. I can easily see this place becoming a favorite spot. I WILL be returning!

Great price, product, service. 

$6 for a HUGE burger, large side of fries, and an orange mountain dew? 

Great place!

Not much by way of ambience- seating is plenty

Food is delicious. Cooked to order, served hot. When you're in the mood for greasy food, everything here was delicious. Especially enjoyed their southwest burger, mmmmmm.

The food is super tasty and there are many options. The place is clean and the staff is very friendly! Mom and I had the spicy Philly chicken and steak sandwiches with fries and were extremely satisfied.

Great fries, good chicken sandwich and wrap. Problem was that it wasn't a very clean dining area when I went there on a weekday lunch. 
Nice service but just felt a bit grossed out eating there.

Keep Calm and Zinger On! Mr Broast has the best Chicken Sandwich in the Suburbs. You will honestly wonder where this food has been your whole life. Even with the large seating area, some nights leave this place overflowing with customers.

Service: They have a TON of orders. Food will take a while but ALWAYS worth the wait.
Food: Zinger Burger is a gift from some magical place. Fries are delicious. :)
Value: Worth every penny but I still wish it was cheaper.

The place can get hot so brace yourself during the summer months!

I've seen this place for about 3/4 years and never stopped in until tonight. My sister and I stopped in to check them out. The inside was not bad pretty clean. We both ordered Zinger Burgers w/Fries and a pop (meal) $7.99 each. That is a deep fried Chicken Brest on a bun with coleslaw. The coating for the Chicken was very light not oily at all to my surprise I will be going back.

I ordered a cheeseburger and fries unfortunately this must not be a regular thing to order. 
It took a long time to make and while waiting in their restaurant I came out smelling like really old fryer grease...  brutal. 

The burger was not very fresh and the fries had a very unpleasant and unusual flavor to them. I couldn't even eat them and didn't finish the burger. 
No star for food and one star for the can of 7up. 
This place needs to clean up there act, I mean that literally this place was dirty. Also change the oil in the fryer and use a better grade of meat for the burgers.. Come on!!

Won't be back.

Have been going there for quiet some time now. Chicken Zinger Burger is good. Kids tried their Burgers and liked em too. I must say people should try their Bun Kabab. I miss bun kababs from back home and this is as close as I have found here in USA. And their Pistachio Falooda is awesome! It seems like they are renovating the place one area at a time. I just hope they can keep it clean. I agree with one reviewers remarks about the ketchup bottles.

As far as Zinger burgers go this is the best place to go.  Very friendly staff and they always have consistency.  I've never had an issue at any of their locations.  You never have to worry about the food being bad, it's always consistent and on point.  Plus they're 100% Zabiha Halal!!!  The owners are very friendly as well, they do a lot of non-profit organizations and are very involved within their communities.  I say this for all locations!!!

Stopped in for lunch today. Lately, I've been reading about a spicy sauce from Portugal called Piri Piri (or Peri Peri). It's made from tiny, blisteringly hot bird's eye chilis and various savory herbs and spices. Piri Piri seasoning is also the engine that drives Nando's Chicken in Great Britain, an incredibly popular fast-casual chain.

It's no secret that I like it spicy, so I immediately chose the Peri Peri Chicken Sandwich (lunch special with fries and drink, $6). Since this place is known for their broasted chicken, I was sort of expecting a fried chicken breast topped with sauce. Instead, I got a delicious grilled chicken breast which appeared to be covered in Peri Peri and then dropped on the grill. It was topped with lettuce, tomato and mayo (which cut the burn a bit). This sandwich may be a bit much for the spice-averse, but chiliheads out there will find it flavorful and satisfying.

Service was very friendly. The food took 10-15 minutes to hit the table, but that's a tradeoff I'll take every day of the week for a freshly made sandwich of this quality. Next time I think I'll try their popular Zinger Burger (another chicken sandwich). If you're anywhere near Roosevelt Rd. in Lombard at lunchtime, it's worth a stop.

Loved the Zinger burger and seasoned fries. It a huge piece of fried white chicken breast on a bun with Coleslaw and spicy sauce.  Make sure to add extra sauce to get the zing.  The season fries are awesome and remind me of Checkers/Rally fries.  They have awesome week day lunch specials for $6 which includes the Zinger burger.  The only draw back of this place is the cleanness.  I think they need to work on that area a little bit more.  I will definitely be going back because I can easily see myself having a craving for one of these burgers again.

Excellent food and service
 The broasted chicken is amazing. Peri peri sauce has a nice, unique kick. Food is fresh, and made to order. Definitely worth the wait!!
I've been to both the Morton Grove and Lombard locations, and loved both. The food is always really good and prepared fresh. Service is always good as well, friendly staff and quick service.

This place is ok. I really like their peri peri chicken sandwich. It's delicious! I also like their zinger burger. The rest of the stuff on their menu is ok. I usually get take out from this place once every few months. Not a huge fan but sometimes it all the choice I have. Not really a sit down place for families. The good thing about this place is that's halal. The gyro burger is ok.

Peri Peri chicken was outrageously hot.    We asked the guy at the counter if the Peri Peri chicken was pretty spicey hot.    The guy says not that bad.     We were starving and could NOT each more than 1/4 of the meal because our mouths were on fire.     When we brought it up to the guy who took our order and their fix was to give us a little extra garlic cream sauce, that should help lessen the heat.    We tossed over half the food inedible for us.
Good food. Always had a good experience here. Zinger burger is pretty good. Love the chaat masala on fries.

Their chicken--crispy on the outside, tender, juicy and flavorful on the inside.  Greasy but that's to be expected.  Their seasoned fries are pretty good too.

Side note: Many reviewers swear by their zinger burger but I thought it was just OK.  I'll stick to just the chicken.

Visiting from San Francisco I yelped for halal food mr broast showed up I decided to give it a try. Man the zinger burger is good.

Gotta take one star off. Typical desi attitude at the front counter not very pleasant. Maybe a smile can do??
No proper service....... even this time food just taste shit........you guys just lost the customer......

I have to change my review because the used to serve good bun kabobs.  Last week I went there and ordered a bun Kabob and it was THE WORST BUN KABOB  I HAVE EVER HAD! I don't know how the can serve something so bad.  The put the bun kabob filling between two thin omelets.  Not formed as a kabob at all.  Disgusting! 


The also have a chicken Peri Peri burger which is amaxing.  I recommend you call ahead before you head out for a bun kabobs because they run out quite often

For some crazy reason, I go to a place that features some fairly non-pedestrian options and I order the cheeseburger.  It was prepared quickly and perfectly. I did have their home made, spicey sauce on the burger and it was pretty tasty. The place wasn't all that comfortable but it was very clean.   

Please, for the sake of all that is good, try the menu choices here that aren't at every burger joint just down the road.  I'm not sure what I was thinking. 

Because of the lack of comfortable seating I'd probably go for takeout when I'm out this way again.  The guy behind the counter cares about what he's doing and I felt like he went out of my way to make my experience a good one.

Mr. Broast don't do anything poorly but they also don't do anything well. Solid fast food that is halal but nothing special. My go to is the zinger burger with masala fries. Had the gyros once, they were way too oily for my liking.  All in all a solid little place that doesn't offend but doesn't impress either.

I ordered the beef philly cheese steak and buffalo wings. 
First they no respect for the customers. Act like they are all that(white) bro you aren't white. So stop acting like one. 
Second philly had no cheese in while the sandwich says clearly philly cheese steak.
Third the wings smell like they been sitting in the cooler for a while.
I think there are enough reasons not to go to this place.

I've always been a fan of broasted chicken -- there's something about that pressure-fried process that yields delicious, crispy, juicy chicken that's hard to resist. I'd passed Mr Halal many times driving down Roosevelt, but it wasn't until we visited the Dairy Queen two doors down that it caught our eye and we thought, hey, let's give it a try.

I came in around 6:45 on a Tuesday and the place was empty, although it doesn't seem like an eat-in kinda place -- maybe for a quick lunch. There are two longish tables that seat maybe 20 people total.

Don't be thrown off by the Halal part -- Lombard and Villa Park have a lot of Muslim families but this is more or less American food, simply prepared to Halal standards, which is essentially the same as kosher -- just blessed by a different religious authority. The chickens are humanely raised, fed a vegetarian diet and humanely killed. Everything is fresh. 

I ordered the 8-piece family meal which comes with a whole chicken (2 breasts, 2 wings, 2 thighs, 2 drumsticks), 4 biscuits and a large side (I went with fries). I was told it would be 15 minutes and sat and chilled out. I heard the guy prepping food in the back and then he came out with a tray of freshly-floured chicken and placed it in the broaster, which is basically this giant pressure cooker. It smelled delicious, immediately.

Sure enough, 15 minutes later I had a box of piping hot chicken, a large takeout container of fries, and a container of biscuits, which was neatly bagged up for me.

All of this is to say it was DELICIOUS. Crispy, great seasoning (a little kick of spice), extremely juicy and tender meat. I devoured mine in no time. The fries had a slightly spicy kick to them as well which I added to by dunking them in hot sauce (which tasted basically like Frank's). The biscuits were buttery and flaky too.

In short: forget that fast-food place across the street. Please support Mr Halal. I want it to stick around so I can come back for much more juicy crispy fried deliciousness.
The Zinger Burger is a must have, but everything I have had here is good. The best fried chicken in the area.

Ordered the family meal with 8 pieces/one side. The chicken was done to perfection, not at all greasy and the biscuits tasted like they had brushed the outside with honey. Biscuits were warm and flaky. Onion rings were huge and thick sliced. 

The staff were friendly although sometimes a bit difficult to understand while ordering on the phone due to back round noise and maybe the connection. It's a small shop, with a few tables. We ordered to go, seems most people do. Have ordered here twice and wont go anywhere else for fried (broasted) take-out chicken :)
It's all made to order so call ahead!

PERI PERI PLATTER! This place is cheap and honestly for the price, it's got decent quality food. The fries are fantastic. Although they have takeout, I recommend sitting in and asking for ALL of their homemade sauces. They have great fries, and their wraps and burgers/lunch specials are (again) a good value.

I got the buffalo chicken sandwich. Delicious! 

The guy on the phone when we ordered... so nice!!

The guy that delivered the food...also nice!!

My office and I had a bad experience with another halal place and we were really excited that this one worked out! We will definitely continue business with Mr. Broast.

Ok this is a first, i decided to try this restaurant one more time, and this time i wanted to try the Zinger burger everyone was talking about. And I have to say the zinger burger is delicious with the fries. The chicken is fresh and hot. One of the best burgers i have tried.
Good, but not spectacular. Found the chicken to be fried, when was expecting broasted.

The chicken is delicious!  Crispy outside with excellent seasoning and moist and juicy inside.

One note:  they make the chicken to order so it takes about 10 - 15 minutes to prepare (it's not McDonald's, thank goodness) but more than worth the wait!

Ordered delivery. everything was fantastic! Okra, mushrooms, Peri chicken....all very good!! They were out of the cauliflower, but will definitely be ordering from them again - so next time for sure we'll try!! Delivery time was a little lengthy ( about an hour) but worth the wait.  Good customer service (ordering) and courteous delivery driver.

This Restaurant is #1 on my list of the Most Tastiest delicious sizzlingly Amazing Zinger & Peri Peri Chicken sandwiches in the USA. Fries was unique with Masala flavoring Indian people's favorite. Rated #1 for overall performance & made my day extra happy and fun. We just loved the food and location is awesome. Shukria Thank You for being Halal Zabiha.

Solid place to get some lunch.  Modestly priced lunch combos will get you fries, a can of your favorite soft drink, and a sandwich.  Like most, I recommend the zinger chicken... really tasty with a good kick to it.  Lots of seating available as well.

Ordered the chicken meal but when I took a bite of the biscuits to my shock they weren't even cooked throughly! I went to the manager and complained and he acted as if he was doing me a favor by listening to me. Very typical Desi joint. Never going back. Also the place is dirty and not clean. :(

Chicken so spicy
Fries dusted with masala
Happiness is nigh

Pros: 

- Chicken is flavorful and moist. Not overcooked.

- Zinger burger is on point. 

- Fries are fucking addicting. 

- Customer service is on point as well. 

- The biscuits are ridiculously good! They top it off w/ some honey or sometimes it's on the bottom. It's tasty as fuck and hope you bite your tongue if you thought the biscuits tasted anything but amazing. 


Cons:

There is a bit of a wait but it's because they believe in what they sell. It's made to order people so call ahead.


Verdict: Go here or you'll regret it. I hope these guys expand to Chicago because I know damn well they would do very well. Keep up the good work guys.

Everyone knows the zinger burger is excellent. Fried chicken is super crispy but dont ask for bbq sauce for dipping since it tastes like ketchup. Their biscuits are to die for! So are the fries. I recently had a cheeseburger and it was pretty good. I wouldn't come here specifically for that but if my family wanted me broast and I was in the mood for a burger I would order it again.
Nothing too impressive other then the fact that it is halal. Would prefer the Halal KFC just across the road from them to be honest.

Say good-bye to fast food chains, say hello to Mr. Broast.  

The Zinger Burger is their signature; absolutely delicious. If you're in the mood for grilled, try the Peri Peri Sandwich; a mouth-watering, flavorful kick. 

Food served here is far greater in quality then what's served across the street; a night and day difference. It all starts with the high quality organic chicken. That's right, prime quality stuff, and you can taste the difference. 

Oh, and the fried chicken - amazing!

Never eat across the street again. Eat at Mr. Broast.

Meal is amazing, by meal I mean The Zinger Burger. This review is mainly off that one menu item and can't speak for the rest. The place is Halal and by far one the best crispy spicy chicken burger I've eaten. The spicy sauce with the coslaw salade is great. You also get the feel of the burger joint hype with the setting making the experience better for enjoying the meal. Although it's a tad bit much in price, it's worth it.
Fresh food. Always had Good experience. No compromise on quality. Good customer service

This was my first visit to this place after a year. The management has changed and the people working here are kind and welcoming. The place looks much cleaner now. 

Ordered Zinger burger which was good and my my the fried chicken was so delicious and crispy. I just loved it and I guess this is going to be my next favorite place for Fried Chicken. The masala fries were tasty but not crispy and the coleslaw seemed to be a lil overpriced for the quantity.
Overall a very decent place have ZABIHA HALAL fast food. 

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Just came here with my husband! Surprised to see that they have expanded the restaurant. Now they have about 10 to 15 tables that can accommodate may be more than 50 people! I was so happy to see that, as just before coming here I was nagging about the seating issue! 
 We ordered their zinger burger and beef philly steak for the reviews they have on yelp. The food came to the table fast and  both the philly steak and burger were as tasty as described. Yummy! 
The only drawback was the restroom! It was dirty and should be taken care of. That is one reason why I gave them 1 less star and I will update my review with a full 5 stars if that part is taken care of. Would I recommend Mr.Broast. Yes!!! 
BTW,  they have opened a new place in Morton Grove, IL.
The food here was good. It did take a little longer to receive the food but was worth it in the end. I would recommend and will definitely be coming back to this restaurant.

Ordered the peri peri chicken platter and zinger chicken burger - terrible!  Especially the peri peri chicken platter.  Was expecting a few pieces of grilled chicken with rice, instead got a plate full of rice with tiny cut up pieces of chicken and felt like a 10yr old marinated the chicken - just felt like they put pepper and sauce. Will probably not come back to this place. Also had a few flies buzzing by the window and the girl who took our order was clueless of how to describe the food.

Food was really greasy and did not taste good at all. I had the zinger burger and the steak wrap. Both were extremely greasy and full of mayo and whatever else they put. I had indigestion for 3 days as a result. If your stomach is made of steel, then eat here. If you have a sensitive stomach, then look elsewhere. Food is overrated here in my opinion and the parking lot is cramped. Nice people though.

The food is always fresh, the service is great, its certified halal by one of the most thorough and credible agencies (Halal Food Advocates of America). What's there not to like?
My favorites: Zinger burger & the panini sandwiches

Mediocre at best. Fast food type service. Hygiene is a huge issue. Cashier and phone orders may have difficulty understanding English. I've ordered food and honestly it was so bad I couldn't finish it. They do have some items like the chicken sandwiches which are okay. The lunch special is a good deal just be careful what you get.

I believe admitting I have had dinner from this establishment along with my two brothers for 3 days in a row truly tells you how much I am a fan! We tried the now famous Zinger burger, Periperi we requested the spicy versions (you can specify non spicy when you order) amazing!!! I love spicy food and this wasn't too weak. In my opinion the Periperi was a tad spicier but I am not complaining it was juicy and flavorful. The masala fries are extremely tasty as well.

Personally I wouldn't do a Philly here. It's like ordering a cheeseburger at a Mexican joint. The people were friendly and even gave me a sample of the pink color drink I forgot the name. It was good, different but refreshing. Only negative is there is no restroom available, I asked and was told sorry but no. I was only looking to take out so it was no big deal since I live close. 

Happy to have this place in the neighborhood!
Went here to check out all the zinger burger hype. Have to say the sandwich does not disappoint!! Amazing crispy goodness! Will def be going back!
Very good food. Everything is fresh. My personal favorites are the fried chicken, zinger burger and the Philly cheese.

The employees are very kind and thoughtful, even at the end of the day. After looking for a place to get funnel cake on yelp that would be open till 11, I thought I'd found the perfect place. I went there to get a funnel cake 15 minutes before they were closing and they told me, much to my dismay, that they no longer served funnel cakes. They also said that they were too busy to start new orders at this point, but I asked if it was possible to still get a mango lassi and when the man told me yes I jumped in excitement. I reached for my wallet only to find that he was giving it to me for free. All in all, I found my experience very pleasant.
Don't order delivery through the Yelp App. They don't have drivers at certain times and if you pay online, you have to go through the online vendor for a refund, which is extremely difficult.

Not bad but I've had worse. I've also had better. Not crazy about seasoned fries. Staff was nice enough. Food was hot. I would go back if I was in the area. But I would ditch it for Church's in a heartbeat. Better fries. Chicken is about the same.

When I initially tried the Zinger Burger I wasn't a huge fan but I went back and tried their Chicken Philly on a French Roll and their Double Cheeseburger and holy moly was it good. The Chicken Philly had just the right amount of spice and their Double Cheeseburger is solid. I am definitely a fan.

My husband and I just recently went here for the first time, good prices, filling food, and delicious food. In love with the faluda!!! We have tried the Broast Chicken, Philly Cheesesteak, and Zinger Burger; all of which were delicious and definitely better then other halal/zabiha places.

Proof that great things come in small packages!  Tucked away in a small shopping strip off of Roosevelt, this quaint eatery provides amazing food for reasonable prices.  I tried their famous zinger burger, spicy of course.  Phenomenal!  I'm not sure what they put in the sauce but they need to sell it in bottles!  Great food, good prices, and above all - a warm and friendly staff makes this place a win!

The best fried/broasted chicken I've ever had.    Don't let the "halal" scare you, this is as american as fried chicken gets.

The chicken is the perfect combination of crispy and juicy and the biscuits are out of this world.   Get extra!

A 12 piece family meal will be plenty for a family of 4 (with leftovers!).
The food is okay but the place is not clean.The bathrooms are too dirty.

Eat there several time. Food is good. Zinger burger and peri peri burger is very good. Also try the falouda if you get a chance. They have dine in, however don't go in winter as they do not put the heater on... It is usually freezing inside.

Came to this place about 2 minutes after their lunch special ended. Asked the teller if he could still honor the lunch pricing. He was not able to. I understood that, had he done that I would have saved $2 per meal x 5 meals = $10.

Now secondly, we had some guest coming to town who were in transit on their way to Hajj. They only eat halal and were requesting a halal philly sandwich. 

We placed the orders for all the meals, and my friend picked up the food and brought it home. When we opened the boxes we felt like we got the wrong food. Our philly sandwiches were made with panini bread. Not the traditional hogie bun we are use to. I later saw on their menu they offer any sandwich in a panini version but we had not even requested this, so why did they make it with that bread. The bread was grilled but very light. It was still cold on the edges...

I don't think I will return to this establishment again.
Great foood. Cook to order. Had the $6 lunch special with fries and drink and the fries are great.

Why do the Indian muslim act a lot like white racist people when it comes to manners towards your own muslim brother. . Reverts shouldn't complain about lack of respect and non greetings you get from the indo pak community.even visiting your restaurant it's really a fitna. Definitely go stop coming to your establishments.

Really happy to have found a good restaurant (and by good I mean REALLY GOOD) that sells fried chicken/sandwiches. The zinger burger is amazing!Tender and juicy. Make sure to get it spicy. Great prices, great options. The biscuits they have are hands down the best biscuits I have ever had in my entire life & I dunno what they do their fries but oh my god so delicious. Never again will I have commercialized "chain restaurant" chicken again. Their service is also exceptional everyone that works there is really polite as well as the owners.

I came from London a year and a half ago and I have been exploring the best Zabiha places to eat in Chicago ever since. I discovered Mr Halal Broast when researching and I am sooooo happy that I did. Their Spicy Zinger Burger is mind-blowinggg. Simply Deeeeeelicious Zinger Burger and their Masala Fries are divine. The owner and workers know as soon as I walk in what I want and I always order extra fries because they are that good! The best Zinger burger I have ever had. Freshly made. Amazingly tasty. I'm here almost every weekend. I make my husband drive me down all the way from Deerfield so that's got to say a lot about how amazing and delicious their Crispy, spicy Zinger Burger is and how tasty their Masala fries are. Wish they were in Deerfield because then I would be in there everyday :D Yum
Easily the best chicken place around. I highly recommend the zinger burger and the peri peri chicken sandwich with masala fries. I would probably eat here every day if it were closer

I've never eaten fried chicken as delicious as this chicken.  You couldn't tell the difference between dark meat and white meat.  It was all white, clean, tasty, and not heavy.  if you love fried chicken, you won't find anything better than this spot.

24 minutes for a 3 piece meal today.  Then they made it to go instead of for dine in.  First they should learn the English language so they can communicate with their customers.  Needless to say left the food on the table and walked out.
Went there tonight and got the zinger meal. It was really awesome. Chicken was very crispy and the sauce was great. Fries were also really nice and crisp. Will definitely be heading back there soon.

This is a small Korean Restaurant connected to the H-Mart in Naperville, us Koreans would call this place a boon shik jum () and they usually sell Korean fast food types.

Do you ever want to gross your co-workers out by gnawing on the pig's feet during lunch?  This place is it!  I usually stop by this place when I'm shopping to pick up some  and some .  And I usually take the  (pigs feet) to work so I can gross out my co-workers.  Little pricier than the restaurants in H-mart in Niles, but it beats fighting through traffic for sure.

I make a monthly trip to H Mart to stock up on Korean make-up and Asian food.  These trips always make me hungry.  Luckily H Mart has a food court inside.  The food court is similar to the kind you would find in any mall but all the places are Asian.

Last night, my son and I ate at Han Ma Um Snack.  I don't pretend to be a Korean food expert.  The meal I ordered was chew rice cake, eggs, and onions in a savory, mildly spicy tomato sauce.  It also came with a Korean sushi roll.  The kind that has crabmeat, eggs, and radish in it.  (not sure what they are called)  My son is a plain eater...very plain.  He had a bowl of steamed noodles.  We were both happy.

To be fair, I've been here 2 previous times and considered the food good and fresh.  However my last visit there was my last.  .

Those who know beef tendon soup know the meat is supposed to be soft and white.  Mine was hard and BROWN, an obvious sign of old meat.  The more amazing thing is, the place had the nerve to serve this soup out to a customer.  I normally would have returned the food however I was just getting over a really bad flu and didn't have the energy to argue.  
I went with 2 others and felt really guilty for subjecting them to this horrible food.  Their dishes weren't much better.

I normally get the  budae jjigae ramen and its pretty good.  Mh wife and I also stop in for kimbap on the go and that always hits the spot.  Love the snack type food they serve here.  Its a perfect stop for a Korean food fix without having to go to a kbbq place or a full on sit down restaurant.  Overall very satisfied with the food and service.

The best service I've had at a restaurant in a long time!   
Many people keeping water glasses full, delicious ahi tuna for my date and lobster Cobb salad for me. 
Killer biscuits and maple syrup butter were a fun surprise too.  It's a pretty interiors d Sunday night was half-priced bottles of wine!
I'll definitely return.

Nice ambiance in this upscale, strip center restaurant EXCEPT table lighting. My guest and I were seated at a table (not booth). All tables have a spotlight overhead. Initially, this makes it easy to read the menu. Only later do you look up to see the ghastly effect on the visage of you companion. Lower wattage is highly recommended.

Service was very friendly and prompt.

Appetizer was disappointing. We ordered a standard spicy tuna roll. Rice was WAY overdone, making a paste. Ick.

Main was grilled seafood. It was OK. My guest ordered a chef special of scallops that appeared burnt. He did not give a review.

We stopped by the happy hour twice and both times were excellent. Great atmosphere with low lighting, jazz music background and fireplace. It feels like you are steeped out of suburbia and into the city.  

The service is very attentive. The happy hourly specials are a great deal at $7.00 for the cocktails which were perfectly prepared. Loved the dinner rolls with the maple syrup an butter.  

We started with the buck a shuck oysters which were fantastic with an excellent selection. Next we had the lobster rolls; excellent on the toasted rolls.

We are looking forward to trying Devon for dinner after two great experiences for appetizers and drinks.

This seafood and steak restaurant is located in a strip mall. It's very spacious and accommodating. We had a nice meal here and our server was pretty attentive. I had the Japanese seven spice salmon which was very bland. My friend raves about the scallops and they were at the usual standard. If I had to order again I would get the tuna which was excellent.  The shrimp cocktail I had had some HUGE shrimp. We shared a few appetizers among the large group and they were pretty good. 
Overall I would say we enjoyed our meal and service but it's not 5 star.

Food was mediocre. We went for lunch and I got the trout. The fish was overcooked with some thick hard pretzels on it. It was supposed to be pretzel crusted, not pretzel chunked. The potatoes with it were soft from some sort of sugary poppy seed gloppy glaze.
The biscuits they serve were tasty but an entire stick of butter makes everything edible. The hardest thing to stomach was the bill. Ugh.
We went to Devon's and we had an amazing time! Beautiful place and our server Henry was attentive and always checking on us. The food was delicious. We are definitely coming back!

I visited Devon Seafood and Grill for a quick birthday dinner with my mom to celebrate her first born, yep me.  This was my first time eating her and the reviews gave me high hopes.

PLACE AND PEOPLE:
From the outside and throughout, you notice it is nicely laid out.  Dimmed lights, yet light was in the right areas for you to see your fellow diners and the menu.  The waitress was nice and thoughtfully check-in on us and provided her opinions, although she told me a lot of things were good and didn't drive home a certain dish (but that wont lose a place stars).

THE FOOD: 
Cheddar Peppercorn Biscuit: think the whipped butter and syrup put it over the top.  It was good at first, but as time went on it started to lose its luster.
(App) Sushi: reminder, not all seafood places make good sushi. Too big of cucumber in the spicy tuna and the shrimp tempura roll was neither hot nor crunchy, but I was TOLD it was all made fresh.
(Main) My mom had the Seafood Mixed Grill, while I had the Seared Halibut. Let me credit the cooks for the food was the cooked correctly, but the dishes seemed to have a light punch; the food didn't really impress because it seemed it was lightly seasoned and could use a little more finesse (boojie moment passed).  THE GOOD SIDE: the really enjoy and remember the mashed potatoes my mom ordered.  THE BAD SIDE: another lobster mac 'n' cheese where the lobster was small and the mac 'n' cheese didn't stand up on its own or compliment the dish.
(Dessert) The Apple Croustade was not really warm or flaky like a fresh made pastry, so I didn't leave there feeling like it was. The cinnamon ice cream stole the show.

IN THE END:
Took a chance on a birthday dinner and this one didn't seem to pan out.  Main dishes were fresh, but not very flavorful.  For a seafood place, they didn't set the hook well enough for me to recommend eating here again.  If I was asked to go, I would go and hope there have been some additions, but no apps or dessert.

I had a great weekday lunch here. My godmother picked the place because it's one of her favorite places that's equally convenient location-wise for both of us. There was plenty of available parking in the strip mall parking lot, which I really appreciated. 

The ambiance is rather upscale, dimly lit, and the seating is very comfortable. We enjoyed dining in a booth seat. The fish I had was very fresh, tasty, HUGE portions with good sides. I know that's not very descriptive, but it was all just a blur of deliciousness. Also, they give you complimentary biscuits, which ended up actually being one of the highlights of our meal! 

Tip: There's a Yelp check-in offer for calamari (for free!). Definitely make sure you take advantage of that. It's a really big portion and comes with different dipping sauces! 

Devon Seafood and Grill is definitely a solid dining choice in Oak Brook, especially if you're planning on shopping before or after (which I ended up doing, of course)!

We visited for lunch and had a better experience than expected. It wasn't very busy and made for a quiet and peaceful meal.

The bread they served before the meal was unique. I wasn't overly crazy about it, but it was good. The Lobster Mac N' Cheese was delicious. I also really enjoyed my salmon. The zucchini, corn, tomato, basil ragout was kind of weird, but I liked everything else.

The service could have been a little better, especially considering we were practically the only people there at the time. It is still a place I would go to again, but only for lunch. The prices on the dinner menu were too much from what I saw.

Okay I would like to start by reiterating that seafood is my thing. I'm picky about how fresh it is and about texture (the wrong texture can make a gal vom). I've been to Devon a few times and every time there's a common trend- amazing food! Today my fiancÃ© and I went and started off with oysters (blue pointe are my fav) and calamari (check in! It's free!). Both were delicious. If you like your calamari to taste traditional, you most likely won't be a fan of this version. A little spicy/sweet and lightly breaded. Oysters, again, are always perfect from Devon. They're fresh and you can taste the difference between the options. 

Finally for entrees, I totally messed up. My fault though! I ordered breaded shrimp and it was overwhelming for me, but my fiancÃ© loved it! I typically don't like breaded shrimp, so totally my fault there. 

The service was good. Our server was polite, checked in on us often. She recommended a few options for us which I truly appreciate!

The only reason I'm giving this place 4 out of 5 is the ambiance is pretty dull. There's nothing about the place that makes me want to scream to the mountain tops. Everything is good but the atmosphere just isn't that great. Location is in a strip mall a block or so from Oakbrook. Wish it had a better location and vibe.

Again can't complain, though! I'm a picky seafood eater and I loved it! Don't forget to check in on Yelp for the free app!

The Good:
