Chipotle Grilled Shrimp Enchiladas: This dish is like a rainbow of goodness in your mouth. From the freshness of the salsa, the lather of cream cheese and tang of the chipotle sauce with hint of lime, to the tender bits of shrimp in every bite - the flavors in this dish made it one of my favorites of the evening. 

We opted to split a Lobster bisque - and immediately regretted not getting one for each of us. The lobster was tender and cooked perfectly. The bisque was creamy and flavorful. 

The Bad:
We ordered their 12 oz strip steak medium rare. The steak came out well-done. We let the server known and he had another one ordered for us immediately. 

The Ugly:
Waited 20 mins for another steak to come out - came out medium plus/medium but we didn't want to be THOSE diners that sent it back yet another time (and also had a show to catch), so we finished our meal and asked for the bill. Steak was okay - not great. But I guess Devon is more known for it's seafood entrees then steak, or so I've heard. We will likely be sticking to their seafood entrees next time - as they were the highlights of the meal.

Went back here (finally),  I used the vouchers on my mother so if the service was crazy again, that would have been unacceptable.
However the service was a lot better, although my reservation from OpenTable went MIA, we got a table and my party got the food the way they ordered it! 
My mom is 60 something and needs things repeated so usually this is an issue when ordering but Jay H. was very patient with the ordering process, and was clear with repeating the order back to us and with his recommendations. 
I recommend the Joyce Farms  Mesquite Grilled Chicken, the chicken skin is crisp and compliments the parmesan herb roasted potatoes perfectly, the grilled asparagus was fantastic I am a huge vegetable eater so this side was so well done that I would highly recommend having with anything on the menu. 
No hiccups, or getting things I did not order, a plus in my book.

This place has this many good reviews.....REALLY??? Our group of 3 must have been really duped, because nothing here excelled. From the knowledge of the staff about the meals or drinks on the menu "....uh it's a beer from Boulevard Brewing and it's a Tank 7" or "it's a crab cake made with 90% real crab" to the timeliness of service (over an hour to receive our main course when there were literally two other tables occupied in the entire restaurant.

Even if you chock up the in unknowledgeable and slow service to a bad night, the food was less than spectacular. Bland entrees and over cooked steaks are the name of the game. The highlights of the meals were the lobster bisque and the asparagus that came with the entrÃ©e. Everything else was forgettable (except the check that ran about $200).

We knew this place was classy coming in; we just didn't know that classy was a way to under deliver at a premium.

Thank goodness, I can make a better review of Devon.  I cannot lie when I entered this restaurant I had the anxiety.  My husband and I are both stickler's about receiving not just good food but good service.  So all I could think of was the last bad experience we had.  But this time was a totally different experience.  Our waiter made up for all of the bad service we received with our first visit.  I believe his name was Jay H.  He was attentive, and knew when to back off.  No hanging over our table and food like Janet.  In fact, we witnessed her doing the same thing as she did with our table (too close for comfort) and there appeared to be commotion as others came over to the table to communicate with her guest. The guest did not appear to be happy.

Our waiter got our order correct, and it was delivered quickly to our table.  I had the "mixed grilled seafood" again and it was divine.   I also had some black tea (from forte tea in the cutest tea cups) and the shrimp scampi.  Everything was awesome.  With that said, I will definitely visit this restaurant again, but please know if they seat me in Janet's section, I will be requesting another table in another section or I will be leaving.

Now I come
In here a lot so that 1 star review may be for the managing partner who I don't particularly care for but I think that Elizabeth the server in the bar area who has waited on us many times deserves some recognition. Always on the spot. Their lobster was good perhaps not thee very best when we went but the steak that I've had here lately and frankly I won't get steak anywhere else is just so good. The filet mignon is tender and juicy and always cooked perfectly to order. The sides are large enough to have some leftover. Dinner for two will
Run you about 120$ with tip.
Solid food. Was a nice walk in on a Saturday at 8pm. Ambiance and atmosphere was nice and professional. Would come back again. Steak was good. Caesar salad was so so.

First time trying this place with my family, and it was okay. Shortly after being seated, waiter came to greet us. 5  minutes later, he came back to take our order, but we weren't ready yet. Then he never came back again after 30 mins of waiting....I had to flag a hostess down to help us find our waiter again, and it wasn't busy at the time. Table next to us had the same problem. Service wise, 3 stars.

New England Lobster Roll: Has a nice refreshing taste, but the way the salad was seasoned, masked the natural sweetness of lobster. I was only able to taste it a little bit, and the rest tasted like cole slaw. 3 stars

Lobster Bisque: had a nice creamy, lobster taste. With a spicy kick to it. 5 stars

Shellfish Bouillabaisee: broth was really good, well seasoned with a wine taste in it. The flavor of the broth went well the seafood mix (clams, mussel, fish, shrimp, scallop, lobster). 5 stars

Seafood Mixed Grill: The grilled shrimp was horrible. It tasted burnt...that's all I tasted. Scallops were seared fine, but could have used a bit more seasoning. Salmon and crab cake was ok. Overall, the dish was mediocre.  3.5 stars.

Seared Georges Bank Scallops: scallops were again seared perfectly, the lobster risotto was flavorful and delicious. At the bottom of the plate, there is a hint of buttery-lemon kind of sauce that goes well with the scallops. 5 stars.
 
Jumbo lump crab cake: Decent lumps of crab meat in it. Same size as their complimentary house biscuits.
Food was really good.  Service was slow.  I thought it was a decent steakhouse for the price.

My friends and I came here for the Wednesday happy hour and lobster. The service was excellent and we had a great time. We were there throughout the entire happy hour duration and although it got pretty crowded at its peak, there were always a couple tables empty for people to be able to sit and eat. It is a pretty large bar area.  

Lobster that day was $13 for a 1 lb lobster. As you would expect, it came with lemon to squirt and butter for dunking delicious lobster meat. We also got quite a number of oysters. Five different varieties were available that day, $1 each. (The Devon Seafood Grill in the city on Chicago Ave are now $2 per oyster and last time I visited, there were only 2 varieties to select from). 

Checked in on Yelp for a free calamari appetizer. Although it seems like a huge pile of fried calamari at first, half of it was fried filler of root vegetables/jalapenos/other things. Still delicious (and again, free) but a little disappointing because I hoped for more calamari! We will definitely come back another Wednesday in the future.
Great food! Great service! seafood is fresh. Our go-to place for any occasion.

I still like this place a lot. See my earlier reviews.  The ambiance is sophistry,  the staff couldn't be nicer,  they are delightful and professional.  The food is good.  If they added sound in the bar area for the TV ' s it would be an outstanding place for an executive sports  enthusiast crowd to go for game watching.  Now, with no sound,  not do much.  

I'm not your typical sports enthusiast,  but I do see an opportunity to attract a larger vibrant and high margin alcohol drinking crowd to their underutilized bar area.  The restaurant area is separate from the bar area so I believe it is possible to host a bar crowd and a dining crowd simultaneously. 

The restaurant investment cost is already a sunk cost,  why not maximize throughput (and profit), appeal to a broader base of customers and give us another great go to destination in the Oakbrook area. I'm sure the wonderful staff would also appreciate the additional business.  I'm still a fan!

There are few times in your life that requires extreme patience, all while realizing the experience of a meal you hoped to be good would be eventually a disaster in the end.  It is like a slow death of a hamster quite honestly, and it is painfully sad but at the same time appealing to see one get out of their misery, that really was my experience at Devon S+S on Saturday night 11/7/2015.  I marked the date because it really will be known as the worst dinner experience in Oak brook ever.

Party of 11, reserved well in advance and we got there 10 mins before our reservation.  I understand there is some private room, and granted it looks nice, apparently a minimum order of $500 bucks.  Not sure what sense this does, but unless they are leasing that space from some other company, i just do not see why they have to reinforce it.  Especially when you have 11 people, and the bill will be at least 400 dollars.  So we wait, and wait, and finally get seated after 40 minutes.  I was already a bit disinterested in the meal but I felt like i had to oblige to the dinner organizer, who is a retired army general and has his stubborn personality....but can be cute in a way.

Now we get seated, beautiful room, very nice and I am thinking - this is not bad after all.  We ordered our food, and it was primarily a couple of key dishes - some seafood items, a couple of beef items and one guy ordered a burger and well the waitress totally blew him off when he ask the type of cheese and she said "This is not a burger place, we just have cheddar".  The fries that came with the burger were extra hard, possibly not fresh?  We also received some snarky comments again from the waitress regarding the sauce we ordered - and it just went downhill from there.

Decided to finally wrap up the evening and get some dessert, well first we had to ask for the menu since no one seemed to care for us try something from the dessert menu.  We ordered the cookie basket, and a couple of other things.  The cookie basket was pretty much not fresh, it was a day old cookie and wasnt worth it.  Lastly, the coffee we ordered was all burnt up...

Needless to say, very unappetizing experience, part of it was the food and most of it was the service.  Wish I could have written a better review, but this is what I have to conclude for now.

Been here several times. Never disappointed. Lunch or dinner, always tasty. Bartenders are very good at making fresh and creative drinks. Service is always excellent. Price's for the quality and flavor of the food is very reasonable. Try it. You will get hooked. They have Valet parking.

After a rough evening, my mother and I had been driving back from Oak Brook Mall and we wanted to stop for a drink and apps. We were drawn to Devon by the glowing fire in the front window.

When we parked, I was afraid we may have been - little under dressed for a place that looked so nice! We sat at the bar and were greeted by a very friendly bartender who set up our places promptly and suggested the whole lobster special they have on Wednesdays. We were not disappointed! Our drinks were amazing and the apps were exceptional. It was a bit more on the pricey side but between the generous drink special and lobster special, I would come back, at least on a Wednesday!

We came to this location in Oct of this year to celebrate both my hubby's and my sister's birthday.  
I had no problem setting up a dinner reservation on a Sunday evening and I told them it's both of their birthdays and this is our first time eating here.  I've heard good things about this seafood chain.  This one is much closer to us.    
The place is attached to a strip mall so there was plenty of parking or you can also valet as well. 
The hostess greeted us right away and took us to our table in the back.  The place has a modern decor, dim with spot lights over each table, very romantic.  They had a fireplace wall that separates the room from the bar.  I also saw a private room for parties in the back.
When we were given our menus from Nicole our server (we enjoyed her, she was a good and very attentive) it was a surprise that they had both of their names on the fancy paper menus wishing them both a happy birthday what?!?  How cool was that!

Since it was a Sunday dinner, we also took advantage of their half price bottles of wine under $100 or 25% off bottles of wine $100 and over!  Yes, it's every Sunday!
 
Now on to the our meals, we ordered the following:
-FRIED CALAMARI with jalapeÃ±os and carrots, a sweet n' sour,creole remoulade.  Basically, all of these items were lightly battered and fried.  This was a pretty good appetizer, I'd get this again.
-GOAT CHEESE BRUSCHETTA tomato-basil cruda, focaccia crisps, kalamata olive.  This was a nice appetizer, the goat cheese was tangy and we asked for more bread yes please.
-ATLANTIC SALMON (Nova Scotia), my mom had this and it was a nice size portion she liked it not fishy smell/taste as all. 
-6oz. CENTER CUT FILET  with PANKO FRIED SHRIMP.  I liked my dish the shrimp were huge, crispy and not greasy at all.  I'd get this again.  
-JUMBO LUMP CRAB CAKES creole remoulade, mango tartar sauce, whipped yukon gold potatoes, grilled asparagus.  Hubby got this dish it was really good, two huge patties a lot of lump crab meat hardly any breading which he likes and me too.
-SEARED GEORGES BANK SCALLOPS lemon asparagus risotto, fennel, basil oil, balsamic glaze.  My brother got this dish which he enjoyed.  The scallops were pretty big.
-We also ordered another steak soft and how we wanted the steak cooked (medium rare, juicy soft and pink in the middle) and a burger with fries (that was not on the dinner menu but they were able to accommodate.  It's a burger, it was pretty good portion...eh it's a burger ok).
-We also shared sides which is really enough for 2 or more people, ala cart.
-WHIPPED YUKON GOLD POTATOES
-BRUSSELS SPROUTS WITH PROSCIUTTO
We laugh, we ate, we enjoyed our dinner and yes we closed the place out...at 10pm. 
Overall, it was a nice experience especially from the Burbs.

This place was really good. I literally have no complaints about it. I usually can find something to nitpick about but there was literally nothing about my visit here that went bad. I did end up spending over $100 even with a $15 off coupon though, so this is more of a special occasion place for me in the future now.

Anyway, the wife and I recently moved to Elmhurst and found this place on Yelp. We were celebrating our anniversary and she chose this place. They have free valet if you need it, but we found a spot right in front so parking isn't too big. I was wondering how it could be so nice since it was connected to a strip mall, but once you go in, it looks like all the other high class steak places around.

I really liked the lighting of the place. Super dark but a spotlight on every table. Makes reading a menu super easy but still give you that secluded vibe. Anyway, we started with the calamari. It sucks because I forgot to check in on Yelp and apparently you get a free app if you do, so that would have been nice. The calamari was good, comes with two different sauces. I would have preferred it to be crunchier but just personal opinion. 

I ended up getting the surf and turf, 6oz filet with the crab cake. I chose the crab cake over the shrimp because the server said that it was 90% crab with 10% bread crumbs. It was pretty good, though just smaller than what I thought it would be. Steak was pretty good though, really well cooked with a smoky touch to it. I got a side for brussels sprouts along with the lobster mac and cheese. Both were pretty good, but for some reason I was just super full and didn't eat a lot of it. The wife got the scallops and she liked it a lot. The risotto was super lemony for me, but it's her style. Hers didn't come with a side.

We finished our celebration with some creme brulee, and though it wasn't the best one we've ever had (it's our go to dessert and we get it whenever we can) it was still really good. The peanut brittle stick covered in chocolate was a good touch. Our waitress was super nice and filled my water without me even asking. I even got a free sprite for some reason. Either because the forgot my steak knife, or they're just either super nice. Either way, it's a win for me.

Sign up for their email service and you'll get a $15 off of $30 coupon right away.
My first time here. Great menu selection! Our dinner was quite delicious and our server was outstanding! Great place! We will be coming back!

1st time here.  Ambiance and service was excellent.  The food was delicious although the portions were relatively small.  My hubbie ordered the seared ahi tuna.  Loved it.  Served rare as it should be.  My younger son raved about the filet mignon... Best steak he ever had, he said.  "Didnt need A1!"  I ordered the scallops with risotto.  Cooked perfectly but the scallops were smaller than I expected  My older son ordered the mahi mahi.  Just ok, rather blan.  Thumbs up for the following sides, the lobster mac n cheese, green beans with pecans and whipped potatoes.  The asparagus and biscuits (served when you are seated) were okay.  The only thing I would not order again would be the crab hush puppies.  You couldn't taste the crab.  Overall, we gave the food 4.5 stars.  

When II called to make a reservation, I told them it was my husband's bday.  They printed, "happy 47th bday, Rex" on the menu.  They also brought us complimentary carrot cake with a candle!  Nice touch.  And for this, I rate them an overall 5!

Would definitely recommend.  We will be back!!  Thank you, Demi, for the excellent customer service!!

I visited last night with my family for my birthday celebration dinner. Although I've been to Devon several times to the one in the city on Wabash/Chicago Ave this was my first visit to this location.

From the moment I called to make reservations with Marina it was a pleasant experience all the way thru the end of dinner. Juan Carlos was our server & he made recommendations; was attentive but not overbearing & funny!

The food did not disappoint as well. Everything from the appetizers; peppercorn biscuits; drinks to entrees were on point. Nothing to complain about.

Residing in the city & having a variety of restaurants to pick from I deliberately picked Devon & am happy with my choice!

Their attention to detail was noticed most definitely from asking if we were celebrating an occasion; to the happy birthday menus & even the candle on our desert! And being from the city it was ecspecially nice that they offer complimentary valet parking! Nice perk 

Thank you Devon for a great dining experience!

LOVE this place. I have been a few times and have never been let down. After a day of shopping in OakBrook, my boyfriend and I decided to swing by for another amazing meal.
For drinks we had the sparkling blackberry martini and bourbon basil smash...both were so good! I do not usually drink bourbon or any type of dark liquor for the matter, but the bourbon basil was banging.
Because we checked in on Yelp, we received the complimentary fried calamari (thanks Yelp!) which was a hit. We also had the large spicy tuna roll and again, delish. Because we had already consumed so much food, we decided to split the seafood mixed grill and wow, everything was cooked to perfection. The seafood grill was so much food, I could not imagine consuming that plate solo. The crab cakes were meaty with very little filling, if not at all. 
Of course, we just had to do dessert. We were ogling the apple croustade and frozen flavors. My boyfriend and I have to really watch our dairy intake, so we pay extra attention when we are told that the ice cream is freshly made. The apple croustade was divine, but the frozen flavors stole the night and my heart. The mint sorbet with the fresh mint leaves was my favorite and with three different yummy sorbet flavors, they also include a lemon shortbread cookie. Yes, the ice cream was as fresh as promised and we went to bed happy and without any upset stomachs.
Had a HORRIBLE experience here with my friends here, the server was rude, they ran out of chicken, and the lobster mac and cheese was AWFUL so dry and NO LOBSTER meat in it!

We went to Devon for my first Mother's Day meal. Typically, I wouldn't bring my infant, but given the holiday, I had my 11 week old with me. Given that he's too small for a high chair, we brought his car seat in with us. We had a reservation for 10 people, plus my son. We asked for a sling or a high chair that we could just flip upside down. We were very rudely told that there was one slings do it was in use. The hostess then suggested we "just put the baby under the table" and walked away. Again, I understand this is not normally a baby/kid restaurant. But, to be told to put my child under the table while celebrating my first Mother's Day was the most insulting and rude request. 

The only reason I didn't give this place one star was because the food was decent. I ordered the maple salmon. It was slightly above average. I would have preferred it to be cooked a little longer, but the flavor was good. It was served with mashed potatoes which were fine. It also came with asparagus, which were not my favorite. They couple the asparagus with a tomato medley, the two just don't really go together. I will say that the presentation of the plate was pretty neat and unique. Our waiter was the best part of the restaurant. 

You only have one chance at a first impression, and unfortunately our experience was tainted before even sitting down. There are dozens of other restaurants nearby that are $30.00 a plate. I will not be returning.c

By far the best seafood restaurant I have ever been to. They give you this biscuit type bread which was so good. Started off with lobster bisque which was so good. Also tried each oyster which was really good but a bit on the pricey side, $3 each. My husband had the swordfish which tasted fresh and we really enjoyed it, as his side he got the lobster mac and cheese which was yummy! I had the seafood mixed grill which was really good and everything tasted very fresh as well. The only thing I didn't like was the lump crab cake, it tasted better with the sauces it came with but other than that I don't see the hype of it. The x-rated martini is really good for any girl, not too strong or sweet. Definitely can't wait to come back here and also to enjoy their happy hour.

WATCH OUT for happy hour. Devon Seafood and grill has been my go to place for happy hour, the best drinks and best appetizers. I practically live at the  downtown Chicago Ave. location and now I know why I should stick to that location. This place left nothing but a bad taste in my mouth. I had a friend meet me for drinks after a long day at work. She was seated in the dining area, had we known that the hostess needs to have visitors ask for happy hour to enjoy happy hour drinks,  we would have asked to be seated elsewhere. I've never had this problem at ANY restaurant. After speaking with hostess and manager nothing could be done about our bill, because we should have let them know we were there for happy hour. NEVER AGAIN.

I recently dined here with 4 other patrons.  Highlights from the group:  the lobster bisque and the boullaibase.  It just didn't trip my trigger like its cousin, Bristol Seafood Grille in St. Louis.  This location felt much more like a chai restaurant and not at all cozy.  I thought the pricing was on the high side for what was served.  I am not drawn in any way to go back, but wouldn't avoid it either.

My wife and I came in for a special dinner while in town over the forth of July weekend. Her employers were gracious enough to pick up the check to send us out for a fine dinner. After figuring out what places were in the area that took reservations, we had more than enough lines already for one day, we decided on Devon. The food was excellent starting with the lobster bisque, oysters on the half shell and the fried calamari. We actually didn't plan on the calamari until it popped up on yelp as a check in offer, so we figured might as well try that too. 

My wife ordered the filet of beef with crab cakes and I ordered the seafood platter. The food started coming out rather quickly and man was it good. The lobster bisque was so deliciously rich and velvety, oysters top notch and fresh as could be and the calamari tender and spicy with peppers, really good.

My seafood platter featured huge, perfectly cooked scallops, shrimp, salmon, crab cakes and mashed potatoes. Every bit delicious. You got to love flown in fresh Foley's fish. I have seen one of their presentations years ago while attending culinary school, and they're the best.

My wife's filet and crab cake combo was unreal, perfect steak and succulent crab cake, these were so packed with crab I don't know how it all held together. Hers also came with a side and she got lobster Mac and cheese. A first for us and we both really enjoyed it.

For dessert we split the carrot cake, very fine as well, not our favorite dessert but I need to make one soon for a party and I wanted to see how they assembled and presented it. It was very nice but a tad too sweet in my opinion. 

Minor complaints, after dinner my wife asked me how many stars I would give my review and I said probably a 5, based on food alone. She said that the meal seemed a bit rushed and reminded me how long our dinner took. She was right, the meal had been a bit rushed which I contribute to the Holiday making the restaurant 95% empty and my calamari add on most likely screwed up the kitchen's timing. 

All in all it was probably the best seafood meal I have had in years. Was it complicated or inventive food? No, but the perfectly simple preparation of the freshest ingredients made it really stellar in my opinion. Would I spend close to 2 bills of my own money going there again? Yeah, maybe for an anniversary or special occasion. Thanks Devon for an excellent meal.

Fresh seafood and nice ambience. Our server, Hannah, was very helpful.  The oysters were very fresh and they had a nice selection. Happy Hour in the bar
Is a great value. Ask for Steve Castro.

This is a gem in Oakbrook. 

Great seafood and steak. A coworker and I decided to try this place for lunch. They have outside seating which was great for a beautiful day. 

They have a great beer selection. Service was also great. 

Because we checked in on Yelp, we got a few appetizer of calamari. It was done perfect. 

We also ordered mussels.  Not all of them were open.this is why we are only giving them for stars.  They need to pay attention to quality, and at a minimum, have a manager deal with this. 

Other than that, lunch was perfect.  We'll be back.

I had a 7:30pm reservation here for Friday night. My fiance and I went with 2 other couples. I was pleased to see the complimentary valet! We were seated right away, as the restaurant was not full. Our server was friendly and helpful. 

I started with the smoked salmon flat bread and it was delicious! The edges of the salmon were darker, which I don't like, but I just cut around it. My friends started with the goat cheese bruschetta, which was deconstructed. It looked good and they seemed to enjoy it. 

I got the Maine Lobster and for $22, it was a steal! It was a whole lobster, along with steamed asparagus and my choice of side so I went with the roasted potatoes. They give you SO much food! My fiance ordered the filet which also came with veggies and a side. The fries he got are cooked with paprika and pepper and were very delicious. 

Everyone else we were with seemed to like their food a lot. A few of us got dessert as well. My fiance's only complaint was that he felt like the lava cake was really dry. He left half of it on the plate.

I was glad to have my $15 off coupon for their email sign up. We didn't drink any alcohol and our bill was still $90 after the coupon. It was worth it, but I think for me this would be more of a lunch place. I want to come back with my mom and get some salads and appetizers!

Gorgeous atmosphere, and excellent food all around! The tuna tartar appetizer was an explosion of flavors! I absolutely loved the char crusted ahi entree. I would get it again and again. However, the filet mignon was a very close second. The mesquite flavor was like nothing I've ever had. Top notch.

Devon is a great place to go for a great meal.  We like going there with other couples for our celebrations.  They have special offers which you can hear about if you sign up for their loyalty program which are well worth the trip.  I got a $25 coupon from them to celebrate my birthday which was an incentive for me to go there.  In addition, they were offering a Sunday special with was 50% off on bottles of wine.

We had a great meal and a great time!

If you want great food and ambience go to Devon's. One of the best steak and seafood place's in the Western Suburbs. Our meal was amazing starting with seafood gumbo, calamari, and mix seafood grill. Everything was well seasoned and fresh. Our waiter Jay was great not only with personality but recommendations as well. Plus, the drinks had a nice mix; strong but not over bearing. I will be back soon.

Parking can be challenge in the strip mall parking lot especially on weekends. I was here for dinner on a Saturday evening. For appetizers, we ordered the calamari. Luckily I checked in on Yelp and received the free calamari appetizer offer. If we had to pay, it would've been a rip off. It was very skimpy on calamari. They fry some finely cut veggies as a filler to make the appetizer look bigger than it is. For my entree I had the shellfish bouillabaisse. It was ok compared to what I've had in the past at other restaurants.  They serve it with a seafood cracker which I didn't use at all which made me think why they would provide a cracker if it wasn't needed. I read the description on the menu which read: SHELLFISH BOUILLABAISSE mussels, clams, lobster, shrimp, scallops, and fresh fish in a tomato-saffron broth, grilled bread, espelette pepper rouille. My guess was it was for some lobster which I didn't remember having so I asked the server. His response was that they put lobster extract in the bouillabaisse. I was slightly confused and asked again and he kept saying they put lobster extract in it. What in the world is lobster extract? Is that a liquid like vanilla extract? The server was obviously clueless.

Hands down my favorite place in Oak Brook.  The staff is always amazing; the food is consistently delicious and so fresh.  Upon entering the restaurant you would never know it's a seafood establishment, you cannot detect any smell of fish.  That is the best indication of how fresh the seafood is.

Love love love the waitstaff..no matter who is your server you will always have a fantastic experience.  

New uniforms are a great change..very contemporary and classic at the same time.  I could here once a week if I could afford it :-)

Great spot for a nice dinner. Had the char grilled tuna and a side of lobster mac which was outstanding. 

FRESH!!! Seafood is genuinely fresh and flavorful.

My wife ordered the shrimp enchiladas which were perfectly seasoned and fresh to the taste. This was by far the best shrimp echiladas I have ever tried!

Sides: Mushrooms were solid and flavorful but the creamed Kale could use a hint of salt. 

Waiter brought us some home made Carrot Cake on the house for desert - which was AMAZING! I'm not into Carrot Cake but I must say... I'd definately go back. 

The food here is always good but a bit pricey... Will be back!
Disappointed. They were out of many of our choices, even a drink. Pricey. Would not return.

I came here for my niece's birthday, we had a family of 8 people come. The food was amazing but obviously if you want luxury then be ready to pay for a great meal. This place is expensive.  I absolutely loved the interior design of this place. Everything was devine.

Just wow. The food here is absolutely delicious. We sampled various appetizers including the oysters Rockefeller and Parmesan oysters, both of which you won't see on the menu, but can request. We also tried the calamari and lobster bisque- loved them. And the complementary biscuits are some of the best biscuits I've ever had. If you would like to make them at home, the restaurant provides you with a little recipe card. The service was phenomenal; our waitress Hannah was so sweet and accommodating. All in all, one of the best meals we've ever had.

I came here as a second choice to pappadeaux and after my experience tonight I will only come to Devon's  very flavorful, nice. ambiance , polite and attentive staff and food cooked to perfection.... No more pappadeaux for me

The food was a perfect match for the swanky atmosphere.  I ordered calamari and caesar salad apps.  Then I ordered the shrimp scampi, crab cakes and asparagus as my entree.  I was overly pleased with everything except the crab cakes, they were just okay.  The calamari is well seasoned, well prepared and more than enough for 4 people to share.  The asparagus were PERFECTLY prepared and the shrimp scampi certainly was no less delightful.  

The crab cakes were fresh, no filler and nothing but crab however way too much mayo for my taste...they were more like lump crab cake salad than crab cakes.  They could probably earn a 5 from me if they do a little more perfecting to the crab cakes because that's the original reason I chose to go there.  Would definitely go back but not sure if I'd order the crab cakes again...although there's no need because everything else is soo good.  Oh, did I mention I couldn't even eat half my food because their portions are pretty healthy?? My advice would be to skip the appetizer and get straight into the entree OR order both and just know you'll either have to salvage or take some home.  I had to salvage because I was traveling for business.
Shrimp enchaladas! REALLY good. I had a martini to go with it! LOVED it!

Good food, somewhat predictable menu, no standouts that would make you want to prefer them over others. Pretty room with great ambiance. Nice art. So so wine selection. Service has much to be desired. Need a team service approach to deliver at the level they're attempting to portray.

My favorite restaurant in Oakbrook Terrace/Oak Brook!  Always excellent service, always fresh menu items and always a superb dining experience.  Two bits of advice to share:  the valet is highly recommended as parking can be congested and save room for dessert - the key lime pie is my favorite!

Delicious lemonade, interesting fresh iced tea that comes in a cool decanter with hot tea on top with ice in the bottom and the server pours it into the ice in front of you. 


Very friendly and accommodating staff. I particularly appreciated the prompt hot-served biscuits, which reminded me somewhat of a sweeter version of  cheddar bay biscuits minus the cheese.


Grilled seafood combo entree is delicious! Good portion of salmon with a gorgeous crust. Very flavorful. One heavenly delicious scallop (wish there were more), two shrimp - delicious but not much to note. Extremely delicious lump crab cake, good size portion but I didn't want it to be gone it was so delicious!Â  


Potato wedges are ok, nothing fantastic. I substituted the asparagus for artichoke which was perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious with the Garlic parmesan sauce.Â  


There was a tasty remoulade. The sweet mango sauce was only ok but my least fave of the 3 sauce accompaniments. Â  Â  Â 


My boss got the flat iron steak with a wedge salad, the steak portion was VERY tiny but decent flavor, probably not a good value, though, and definitely not good enough to satisfy a hungry man's appetite.Â  


A co-worker got the pork chop that was a good portion size and looked mouth-watering with an interesting and tasty looking garnish top.Â 


Might not be a place I would come normally, considering the price range, but definitely a nice place for an intimate celebration or when someone else is paying!

Service and food are fine. 

Just 2 IPAs on tap and 1 in a bottle /: 
Small list of signature cocktails, too

We ordered drinks and apps for dinner:

Goat cheese bruschetta- best app. Tons of goat cheese, fresh tomatoes (even in February), nice flavor, good crunchy toast

Tuna tartar- a train wreck. It looks like it was burnt in an accident. Good flavor although it's surrounded by ginger... Was I supposed to eat the ginger? Idk but I did and it was not awesome. The crunchy pita it came with also became soggy by the totally unnecessary sauce on the bottom of the plate. A real dud. 

Mini lobster rolls- nice. Solid. Nothing crazy amazing but not bad and in fact pretty good.   There was plenty of lobster, good flavor. The fluffy bun was warm and buttery.

Spicy tuna sushi roll- really good! A home run here. I eat a lot of sushi and this was pretty solid. I would get this again.

I had 6 east coast dollar oysters. They were prepared perfectly. Lots of juice and sliced off the shell. Good job!!! I really appreciate that! Lemon and on ice. Amazing work. The cocktail sauce was lacking a little more horse radish but no biggie. 

Ambience: very nice.
Service: hostesses were good and got us seated quickly at a nice table.

Server was pretty quick but I do want to note that the menus (there were many) were abandoned at our table and that's fine but when the food came there was minimal space for them.  When you give a table of 2 about 5 different menus and 4 different apps at once it gets a little crazy.

Also, I loved the biscuit and butler with maple syrup BUT why did the busers leave the empty tray?? 3 came and saw the table getting cluttered but didn't offer to take take it.

There are some points that can make this place better. Idk why the ratings are so high.... Oak brook tends to disappoint me lately, especially when compared to chicago.

A walk-in on a busy Friday night? Doubtful, I thought, as my husband circled the parking lot. I was wrong.  Seated immediately at a large hi-top in the bar area.  Our server, Jay, was friendly and attentive throughout the meal, which was fabulous. The wine list is well above average, not just the same garden variety labels marked up 50% from what you can buy at Da Jool.  A wide range of price points, too.  I had the lobster cobb salad, and my husband had the seared ahi tuna. Both perfectly prepared. We then helped ourselves to the lobster mac & cheese, which was divine. Split a creme brulee for dessert, and that too was delightful. Add me to the many Devon fans on Yelp!

This review is long over due, I actually dined here mid-July. I remember when this place was originally called Braxton's Seafood Grille in Oakbrook, IL next to Crate and Barrel in Oakbrook Mall. They've obviously moved since then, and are now located (and renamed) to Devon's Seafood Grille. When I had dined with them when they were known as Braxton's it was many years back, I would say 6-8 years back. And I absolutely LOVED the food and quality back then. So i naturally (or not so naturally) I was a little hesitant to try them again many years later. Firstly because I was apprehensive that the quality had remained the same, and secondly because I've had experiences in the past where I neglect trying a restaurant I had a wonderful experience at for some time, and when I finally go back, I've built up the memory of my previous excellent experience so much, that when I finally try it it falls exceptionally short of my expectations. 

Not this time however. This time it still hit all the marks plus more. 

Ambience: The outside is deceptive. It looks small and not that impressive. But like I said, I knew better because I ate with them in years prior. When I finally went inside I was exceptionally impressed. Modern, sleek, and dare I say sexy? Walnut cherry wood decor, tables and walls, ambient lighting with candle lit tables. This is definitely a date or special occasion place to take that special someone to, especially if you don't want to fight traffic by going downtown. Tables are not crammed together, but not far away from the next table. The type of clientele this place attracts would be your younger, but still professionally trendy crowd. I would say the 25-45 age group.

Food: The best part of course. 

Appetizers: We got three. 1) Goat cheese bruschetta: Excellent presentation, the tomatoes were sweet and the goat cheese itself was divine! 2) Tuna Tartare: excellent. I was definitely a fan of tropical twist of the pineapple and cilantro implementation. The use of tortilla chips with the tropical spin on the tartare harmonized the textures nicely. 3) Oysters: we got 2 of the Bluepoint, 2 of the Wellfleet. Bluepoint was mild, slightly briny, and the Wellfleet, was slightly briny as well, but not as much as the Bluepoint, and had a sweet finish. Both were absolutely excellent. 

Entrees: Two dishes. One for me and my husband 1) Mine: I'm a big seafood fan so I went straight for the Seafood Mixed Grill. Definitely not the cheapest entree by any means, but definitely the most hearty, and the biggest bang for your buck. In fact, looking back, I could have most likely shared this dish with someone else with a couple of appetizers. Perfectly charred scallops and jumbo shrimp. Perfectly done salmon that was not over done, still had the right amount of moisture. The lump crab had fresh crab meat that was clearly fresh because of the inherent, almost phantom sweetness that comes from insanely fresh sea fare. Asparagus was decent. Nothing too out of the ordinary. I opted for their smoked paprika fries instead of the yukon whipped potatoes. They made a mistake and got me regular fries and the waiter did seem a little flummoxed and confused, but the kitchen knew what was going on and they got me a new fresh order of the smoked paprika fries gratis. It did take a while though, so based off our waiters other mannerisms I am certain our waiter that night was new and was just exceptionally confused as he was still learning the ropes. 2) Husband got the surf and turf 6oz center cut+4 jumbo seared scallops. He said the steak was decent, nothing to special. But in my experience a restaurant can either be a really good seafood restaurant, or a really good steakhouse-- not both. This was one of those times. (If anyone knows of a place that is both please message me haha). 

Side Dishes: Two dishes 1) Lobster mac and cheese: it was okay. Not too special. If anyone is looking for a good lobster mac and cheese Del Frisco's downtown still holds the trophy in my opinion. 2) Smoked paprika fries: pretty good, the cajun mayonnaise was decent. Fries were fresh, not soggy, so it had the ideal crispness on the outside and softness on the inside. But overall neither side dishes are something I would come back solely for.

Dessert: Carrot cake. RIDICULOUSLY HUGE. Oh my god. Clearly if you got this far into my review you know we already ate a lot, but this was HUGE. I give the cake a 6-7/10. Not to special, but not too bad. Cake was slightly too dense given the frosting to cake ratio. 

TL;DR: 4.2/5. Points off for confused waiter and only center cut not hitting all the marks. Go straight for the mixed seafood grill, don't get steak here, go to a steakhouse for that. Appetizers were phenomenal and the oysters were on point (Bluepoint to be exact haha!). Skip the lobster mac and cheese. Our waiter was relatively new and seemed a bit confused with a tiny hiccup in our order but the kitchen handled it.

The customer service here is outstanding! We went here for the first time and absolutely loved it. We each ordered the mixed seafood grill entrÃ©e and when I saw it, it made my mouth watery. SO good..I can't wait to come back.

An amazing restaurant with top notch service! Left another restaurant to come here and boy did we luck out! Food was amazing and fresh. Janet our server was very attentive ,kind and knowledgeable! I will request to sit in her section next time ! I see why she has so many people request her section ! This will be a definite return for us !

My husband took me to Devon for our 10th wedding anniversary. We had never been to the restaurant before. First, the parking lot is terrible!  I have a small sports car and found it difficult to park. The spaces and rows are not wide at all. The restaurant itself is nicely decorated and the noise level is minimal. Upon arriving, the hostess wished us a happy anniversary which was very nice for them to acknowledge the reservation was for a special night. Our waiter, Shane, also wished us the same. Shane was very friendly and provided wonderful and attentive service. We started with some wine and shared the prosciutto & gorgonzola flatbread. It was a thin crispy flatbread very flavorful with the cheese, salty meat and fig sauce. Very good. Shane brought us two cheddar peppercorn biscuits, which were amazing. They had a little card on the breadboard with the recipe to make at home. For dinner, my husband had the walleye and chose the asparagus and creamed corn with bacon shareable side dish.  His walleye was cooked over mesquite perfectly, moist and flaky. The creamed corn was full of smokey goodness with the bacon. So good.  I had the 6oz filet & seared scallops with side dishes of heirloom tomatoes and lemongrass asparagus risotto. Everything was very good!  We ordered a key lime pie to share for dessert to end our meal. When Shane brought our check, the key lime pie was complimentary for our anniversary. Such a nice surprise!  I really liked my dining experience here. I would go back again but just hate the thought of that parking lot...it's worth it, though, to get that kind of service and food!

I came here again yesterday. I came for the current daily special after 4. There are a good amount of "happy hour" items. One of which is a good selection fresh oysters for $1 each. I have had the oysters here many times and they are always great. Yesterday there were 9 types to choose from that were a part of this special. Also on Tuesdays there are a few martini specials. Goes very well with oysters. I left very satisfied.

Came in on a Saturday night for a quick dinner at the bar where they offer a full menu. I was extremely pleased by their service and the food was even better! I ate the Char-grilled Ahi and it was the best Ahi tuna I have ever had in my life. It was cooked and seasoned to perfection and it came with potatoes, asparagus, and a delish sauce.

I am only in town for a week for work, but I will be back before I have to leave.

I honestly have to stop myself from eating here everyday. EVERY. DAY. Mostly due to the price. But it was worth every penny.

Ah, week-ends. Go early or suffer the consequences. After trying for a table at a couple places near the mall and cringing at the idea of an hour wait, my companion and I drove around and came across Devon. Mutually agreeing upon seafood, we decided that we would wait no matter how long. 

Amazingly, the hostess said it was a mere 15 minutes, but then seconds later we were being spirited to a table. The place was busy yet not noisy, with a dim atmosphere, each table spotlighted with a lamp directly above it. 

The menu holds many intriguing items, but we chose quickly. My companion opted for the maple-grilled salmon, which actually came on a round of wood (as advertised). 

I cobbled together my meal from items on the appetizer menu: a bowl of mussels in lemon and white wine (excellent!) and shrimp scampi (a different approach than usual: a richer sauce, not just melted garlic butter, but quite delicious). 

We had to restrain ourselves from outright gobbling down the signature bread: cheddar peppercorn biscuits with a surprisingly harmonious maple butter. 

Dessert was good but not especially memorable: key lime pie was an actual small pie (nice when two people were sharing :p), but the "marascino-pineapple relish" appeared to be straight-up fruit cocktail, and the mango sorbet was too astringent. The pie would have been fine solo. 

Our server, Mark, was smooth and professional. 

Overall, quite a great dining experience for the seafood lover. Devon is divine; I'll be back!
Was not great, was not bad.  Nothing memorable at all.  If I go to a seafood place...and I love seafood, I want something memorable.

I had my birthday e-mail this time and we had Jennie as our waitress.  She has been with Braxton's before it changed to Devon's.  Also with Houlihan's.  She is a nice and personable server.  The food was outstanding. Filet mignon, crab cakes.  My husband had the mixed grill.  Excellent mashed potatoes, so smooth and creamy, the asparagus is so fresh and crispy.  
The hot biscuits are so wonderful.  The restaurant seating is so comfortable, lighting is just right.  A very nice place to celebrate.  Highly recommend!

Hubby & I stopped in here just before they closed. Regardless of the hour, the food was amazing and service was impeccable. I had swordfish and Hub had a steak. The atmosphere here is relaxing and allows you to savor a very fine meal. Looking forward to returning.
Food and drinks were awesome. The steak was soft and juicy and even the greens beams were full of flavor highly recommend this place.

The food, the ambience as well as service are excellent. Prices are actually not that bad for the quality of food and portions. I got the grilled rainbow trout along the zucchini corn and basil Raguot which were scrumptious. The vanilla bean crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e was phenomenal. Overall a wonderful experience. Great for a special occasion.

Devon may be a little on the pricey side, but the food and service are worth the expense.
We have eaten at Devon a number of times and have never been disappointed. We always ask to be seated in Mark's section. Mark is attentive friendly and helpful without being overbearing.

Just OK place. Honestly I was expecting more. Definitely no wow factor there. Sushi rolls just average, appetizers full of bread. Limited choices if you're Gluten Free. My hubby got taco on flour tortillas after mentioning he is GF .

Calamari was excellent with a tasty dipping sauce. Surf and turf was fixed just right. Lava and carrot cake were great. The rainbow trout came with and interesting dipping sauce that had a great flavor. My mahi mahi needed a sauce to bump it up. It needed more flavor. The atmosphere was nice but a little too dark when trying to read the menu

We had a birthday party here yesterday and I certainly can give them 4 stars. Food was great, there are no doubts about food. Everything was delicious and fresh. They have good champagne. We didn't know which one we should take but the waitress gave us very good recommendations. 
I really liked their seafood, especially scallops. Steak was not bad, but not the best I've ever tried. Strawberry and pistachio salad was good. For the dessert I had lava cake and it was great, I loved it. 
Why I didn't give them 5 stars? Sure, I will explain. We have seen pictures of their terrace on the website and first we booked a terrace table. But when we came and saw that small terrace near the road and parking, we were disappointed. The pictures are lying. So we've got table inside. It was really noisy there, TOO much noise, like in some busy McDonald's. Also their chairs for children are awful, too small and inconvenient. Your kid will be there like in a small prison and he will not like it, for sure. We didn't like the atmosphere there, we felt like we're at some noisy street, there is no privacy at all. Waitress was professional, but I haven't seen at least the slightest smile on her face. She was not friendly, she just did her job. Also we didn't have any salt and pepper shakers on our tables, so we had to ask her to bring them. When we ordered tea, nobody even asked what kind of tea, they just brought us black tea. But what if somebody wanted green or fruit tea? That was strange for me. I thought they should give some choice. 
Nevertheless, I can say this place is worth visiting because of their seafood, at least.

The "Power Lunch" option at Devon Seafood & Steak is absolute steal!  For $13.50 you can have a soup (or salad), and then you can select from a variety of entrees. 

During lunch time on a weekday, they weren't very busy at all, which can be nice if you need to get out of the office for some peace and quiet!

I met Courtney C. here for lunch, who was (luckily) having a slow day at the office.  We both ordered from the Power Lunch menu.  I had the Lobster Bisque and the Crab Melt.  Both were delicious!  The crab melt was served on a buttery toast, which was a little bit greasy, but the half sandwich with my soup was a very filling lunch.

They also served us complimentary biscuits.  Mmm, carbs!

We showed our waiter the check-in deal on the Yelp app for a free fried calamari appetizer.  He looked confused and told us he would have to check with the manager.  This didn't surprise me, since any time I've had a Yelp check-in deal, the staff seem to know nothing about it!  So our waiter went to (presumably) check with his manager.

We then were served our soup, no calamari yet.  Once they brought out our entrees, I told the waiter we were still waiting for our calamari.  I was totally nice about this, but his face contorted and he said, "Oh.  I didn't know you ordered that."  He had quite a chip on his shoulder.  I said, "yes, that was the Yelp check-in deal we showed you."  At that point, it was awkward.  The expression on his face was nothing less than pissed off.  He just said, "oh.  OK," and began to walk away.  THEN he stepped back to our table (entrees in front of us), and said, "Did you still even want it?"

WTF.

Clearly, not all service at DS&S is this bad.  We noticed another table of ladies had the nicest, most attentive server.  He ran through the specials, answered their questions about the menu, recommended various things.  So it appears we just got the dud.  I didn't ask to speak with a manager, since my gut instinct said that this kid was just having a BAD day.

The food is great, but we just had an awkward experience with the service.

My boyfriend and I think the food here is disappointing. Our entrees were the Bone-in Ribeye and the 1/2 lb Lobster tail. The ribeye was nothing special. I feel my boyfriend could have gotten a better steak for less money at any of the other upscale places around town. Also, my lobster tail was really disappointing. It tasted similar to Red Lobster's quality.....no joke. The service was good until it came time to fetch the bill. We thought the waitress forgot about us. The ambiance is great, but we don't go out to eat for ambiance, we go for a great meal! So we had tried the place and came to this conclusion, and we decided we would not be back unless it was free or heavily discounted lol.
  Then I received a B-day coupon for $25 off and an Email advertising Halibut was in season and now on their menu! Plus they had half off wine bottles on Sundays, so I said what-the-heck, let's give it a second chance (since we had all these great offers and I have been waiting for Halibut to be back in season for like a year!).
  We went back on a Sunday around 7pm. We asked them as we sat down at the table if they had Halibut, just to be sure, and they said "Yes we just put it back on the menu" and I explained I came special for the Halibut and I have my heart set on it. There was nothing else on the menu I wanted since the lobster was obviously sub-par. Later when it came time to order, I said I would like the Halibut and I thought the girl was literally joking when she said they were out of the Halibut! Really? At 7 on the weekend? We were so disappointed we just got up and left. It may seem picky, but two strikes directly in a row and you are out!  So we went down the road to McCormick & Schmick's who did have Halibut.

Devon's food is over-rated in my opinion. If you are looking for delicious seafood, try the Reel Club or even Ditka's instead. For amazing steaks, Gibsons, Or for overall great value try J Alexanders. Because Devon did not offer any of these.
Excellent food great service,  got a  free order of calamari with yelp checkin. Loved the seafood platter,  huge portion. ...best calamari and the pear, gorgonzola salad was amazing.

I can't believe this place is so close to my work AND super affordable for lunch. I usually skip anything with the words "seafood" or "steak" in the name because I'm too cheap for that fancy stuff. The power lunch at Devon was $18.50 and I had leftovers for dinner, so it was super affordable! 

I went with the Lobster Bisque and the Blackened Chicken pasta. The bisque was the best that I've tried in a LONG time. I could have ordered another one (but then that would have thrown that whole "affordable" aspect out.) It was piping hot and the flavor, as well as presentation, were so fancy that it made me feel like I'd finally made something of my life. I'm not normally one to order chicken at a seafood restaurant, but the promise of leeks and mushrooms atop a pile of carbs screamed my name. This was one of the best things I've tried in ages and the serving was huge. Like I said before, I had enough to bring back to the office. 

Our server was the least personable of all the servers there. We saw a lady and another gentleman and they were both very talkative and knowledgeable about the menu. Not sure if our guy was new or not, but he didn't explain anything to us. He just asked us what we wanted to order.

Also, don't really expect the Yelp check-in offer. We asked and ended up never getting it. It wasn't enough to deter me from coming back though. I'll be back for another power lunch again soon.

Came here for dinner on my birthday on Sunday. The food was delicious the only reason they didn't get 5 stars was because of the service. 

Our server wasn't much help in picking a wine and after we did be brought it with only two glasses for my mother and I. We didn't see him again for another 10 min and my father had to flag him down to order a drink. 

Everything else was fine aside from my plate of food came out a few min before my parents and it was missing a crab cake.  Someone with long hair that was almost touching the plate (a manager?) brought it out before I got to ask my waiter about it but I still feel like this shouldn't happen at a place that is $200+ for three people. 

Our waiter kept running off as though he was extremely busy but the place wasn't packed and I saw other servers on the floor so I'm not sure what that was about. 

Not sure if we will be back.

Discovered this place very unexpectedly and definitely became a regular customer. Consistently exceptionally good service, delicious food , and many options for great deals. Today received a complimentary entree for my birthday and carrot cake for desert. Bliss! Going back for sure soon.

Seven of us visited the Oakbrook location in honor of a very special birthday event. Devon's staff were more than accommodating, offering a private room for 8-10 people without rental charge for what amounted to the price of a nice meal. Four different types of oysters were offered and they were excellent. I ordered the surf and turf with scallops, a six oz fillet and risotto. The seafood was superb as was the service offered by Brittany and the supporting staff. The steaks were perhaps a bit under seasoned for being served without sauce but, all told, a solid surf and turf. I highly recommend Devon's side room for your special events.

First time visit last night. Very friendly staff and nice decor. Good martinis. Chipotle Shrimp appetizer. Yum. The dinner rolls were really good. Those are the pro's. The con's: extremely overpriced food. The happy hour Oysters were terrible. Not much to them. The chicken my husband had decided to split with my sister looked extremely dry. The Crab cake he ordered was undercooked. Overall all I don't think we would go back for dinner. Especially with a larger group. Just drinks @ the bar and some appetizers.
Smaller portions and much less quality compared to the downtown location. Scallops are half the size and the lobster cobb salad had half as much lobster as the downtown location.

Love the ambience of the place. It was my first time here. I really liked the biscuits and the maple planked salmon. My sister got the pretzel trout and it was okay. Look forward to trying new things from here.

We had been regular visitors to the old Braxton, and have gone to this new site several times. We won't be going there anymore, primarily because they have taken lobster off their actual menu but kept it on their online menu. Twice now I have checked the online menu and confirmed that they had it listed, but arrived at the restaurant to find none. This last time, the manager told me they had stopped serving it because 'the lobsters kept dying', an appetizing thought. This is their right, of course, but then they shouldn't have it listed on their online menu for $22. I consider this 'bait and switch', and we walked out. 

Also, the new location was, I think, a serious mistake. Parking is unavailable without using the valet. It's hard to get in and out. All in all, it isn't the restaurant it used to be.

Came here for my birthday a few months ago with some friends. Can't quite remember what we all ordered exactly but all I remember that it was so delicious that I've been meaning to go back. Best seafood spot that I've been to so far. Very good service

LOVE the vibe to this place! They have an open area to the bar and one towards the back. 

I was able to get my meal covered by Devon recently to try out their menu items for a Marketing event. If I didn't feel bad about cleaning house, I would have ordered more. 

My wife LOVES their oyster happy hour! They also have other great happy hour items like the lobster rolls which was delicious and the lovely biscuits with sweet butter which are free and dangerous. I could eat those biscuits all day!! 

I have also had their bruschetta (VERY GOOD) and flatbread which was also good. Prices are high which is the only downside. Parking can be a pain as well but I do believe they have FREE Valet.

Great ambiance and service! Shocked to see a 3.7 rating; we loved it! Be sure to sign up for the mailing list, they provide many coupons that can make the tastey food much more affordable. Our waiter, Ricci, was outstanding.

I celebrated my birthday with a coworker for lunch at Devon.  The serving of ahi tuna was fresh, generous, and fabulous! The service was outstanding.  If you are a fish fan, this should be your go to lunch place.

Enjoyed a nice meal on a Saturday night. Easily made reservations, had a bottle of wine, tasty salad and an excellent mixed grill for one entrÃ©e and swordfish for the other. Nice atmosphere inside as well, although a peculiar location in a strip mall.

Our waitress, Demi, needs to stop mumbling. And it would be nice if the dessert menus were not covered with food - please periodically replaced the food-covered ones.

So, I'm sitting here in Devon Seafood and I can't help but want to scream over the sound of my rumbling stomach, but no will here me bc it's THAT loud.  My party and I have been waiting for over an hour with no checking in from our waiter aside from when I asked where our food was. The oysters weren't even that good!  I'm pissed to say the least. 1 star, wish I could give none.

So after my not so fun experience in February, the manager/owner reached out to me & gave me $50 free in gift certs. I decided to take another chance. This time I ordered the surf & turf. (Filet & fried shrimp). I ordered my filet medium rare & it was perfectly prepared. I didn't care much for their fried shrimp. It was nothing special about it. Seemed like regular grocery store boxed shrimp. The drinks were good too. Their servers seem really uptight & not genuine this is the same service I received back in February. They just aren't warm or welcoming at all to me. They did redeem themselves with the steak. Thanks alot!
Nice place very comfortable interior attentive wait staff and food quality top notch. See you next time in the area.

3 Strikes and We Were Out!

We were so excited to have dinner at Devon.  They tout all fresh seafood, never frozen and their menu looked amazing.  That is where it all ended.  We started by ordering 2 appetizers the mini lobster roll and the tuna tartare.

The Lobster roll was mostly chopped celery, corn?, and under dressed in some type of sauce we weren't sure what was exactly in it.  The lobster was completely over powered by these flavors and over cooked.  If you are unsure what a lobster roll is suppose to be I suggest you travel a few miles west and go to Parkers they do a traditional lobster roll that will make you think you are on the East Coast.

The Tuna Tartare was saturated in soy and some type of chili sauce that you couldn't taste the tuna, again the flavor of the tuna  was completely over powered, although it was sliced nicely.  But the bed of thickly sliced cucumbers were difficult to eat along with the tuna in one bit if that was the chefs intention.  If you would like a flavorful tuna tartare I suggest you go a bit east and to to Perry's there tuna is fresh, light and you taste tuna.

At this point we were thoroughly disappointed but I also can appreciate a chef trying a new twist on a traditional dish so we ordered a 3rd appetizer since we barely ate what we had.  We ordered the shrimp ceviche with sweet potato, black beans, cilantro.  This sounded great and there is so many ways to do a good ceviche we were optimistic.  Unfortunately again the dish was overpowered by some type of catsup based sauce that completely hid any of the flavors of the fish.  

At this point we did not want to try another thing.  The point of fresh fish is just that being able to taste the fish along with other clean light flavors that highlights the texture and flavors.  So we paid the check, and left.  

I know that many people have written many nice reviews about the entrees but at this point we have had 3 awful dishes and there are too many restaurants in this area to stick around and hope for the next dish to be better.  So we left, went to Perry's in Oakbrook and have a fantastic dinner.

We went here for my husbands birthday and the food was exceptional. My parents also joined us. After a long day of dealing with childish, uneducated people, Devon was a welcome distraction. The wine selection was awesome and it paired very nicely with our food. We will definitely be back.

UPDATE!  1/2 price bottles of wine under $100 on Sundays and 25% off wine bottles over $100.  Damn, I need to go here on a Sunday and hopefully richy rich BIL will pay again!  I also have to get the ceviche appetizer my nephew got.  It looked amazing and he wouldn't let me steal any. :-(

Came here for my birthday dinner, I decided I wanted to try somewhere new. Food was pretty good however I ordered the surf and turf and there were pieces of shell in my crab cake. Not really something you'd expect with your food considering you're paying 40+ dollars a plate for it. Because of this, we will not be coming back. It's a shame that I had to be disappointed with my birthday meal.

Chicago hot dogs and specifically Portillo's is what makes life worth living. It's so gooooooood. Normally I would try and use proper grammar but @$@# it. Portillo's should be the first thing on your mind when you're near Chitown. Go get some now please and if you do, write me back or better yet, send me some of their food or ribs. Barnelli's is amazing too. But yeah. Go get some Portillo's. ASAP :b 

Portillo's is soot yawt (the best) 

P.S.S Go cubs! 2016 World Series Baby, aww yeah. Did you get Portillo's yet?

Can't go to Chicago without some Portillo's. I love the hot dogs, dipped Italian beef, and the grilled chicken Caesar salad. Although the line can sometimes make it seem like you will be there forever, they are always good about moving people through the lines very quickly! Friendly employees, and always delicious!

We love checking out as many Portillo's locations as we can and so far we are very happy to say that each location is unique and always on top of things. Well with the exception of the Down Town Chicago location, which by the way was the original location. 

The staff there are not like the staff out in the suburbs. Anyways just wanted to share that. This being our first time here in this location I gotta say that I love it! It's so cute and fun inside with the decor.

I love the picket blue fence that are up between each booth. It's minimal but I love the homey feel is awesome. There is also an area of about five tables and its surrounded by artificial brick wall (which reminds me of a backyard feel BArbeque kind of way) and there is also an area with large Rick formation around the wall to the floor that I found quite unique from other locations.

The staff was on point, fast friendly and quick with our food. The only thing I was not happy with was the AMOUNT OF MEAT ON MY BIG BEEF SANDWICH. But it was just as delicious as any other time! 

I wish they had this back home in Texas, but now that I live here I am so glad I find it quite a treat. The fee h fries are always nice and tasty. 

We could not go home without a taste of their delicious moist chocolate cake! Soooooo mighty good! Thank you Mr. Portillo for founding such a unique and amazing restaurant! On behalf of all Midwest thank you.
Garbage restaurant where they set it up so everyone can cut in front of you in line. Not going to be coming back any time soon I can assure you that.

I just got food with my boyfriend for lunch and they were slammed at 2:45 in the drive-thru! Service never wavered and we always get what we pay for and then some. Food always hot and we always see smiling faces!

When you dine out a lot, and your best meal of the week is takeout, then you're either on a bad run of ruck, or that takeout is awfully good.  In this case, the latter takes a bow.

Everything about Portillo's Italian Beef is good: moist, tasty beef, a bun worthy of the beef it holds and your choice of peppers, sweet or hot.  It's yummy.

Then there is desert.  For years, Portillo's proudly produced a chocolate cake for which the masses clamored.  The recipe for that cake can still be found on the net with one odd ingredient.  Then they outdid themselves.  They unveiled the chocolate eclair cake.  This is a work of devil foodish perfection.  If the best Tiramisu you ever had could be a chocolate cake...voila! You have it.  

I"m still scraping my and my better half's plates.

Gotta love Portillos! This is really one of my favorite burger places. Always made to order, the food is fresh, hot, and delicious. I love their cheeseburgers and hotdogs. This time, I tried their chicken sandwich on a croissant. The sandwich didn't disappoint, but I think I'll stick with the burgers and hotdogs. Every location seems busy all the time and the prices more expensive than other fast food burger places, but definitely worth the wait and costs.
As soon as you walk it looks very nice and cllean. The staff is great, very nice and alert.

This is my favorite Portillo's in the Chicagoland area.

No matter how busy they get the service is always friendly and fast, whether it's dining in or popping through the drive-thru. 

I'm also a super fan of Barnelli's Pasta Bowl, so gotta love that this location is a combo with my ultimate Portillo's favorites. 

My go-to items are as follows...

Chopped Salad (Barnelli's): Absolutely amazing. Get the dressing on the side. This salad is big enough to split for sure! It also comes with a poppy seed muffin :)

Friend fries: Always. My fave fries ever. Perfect texture - crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Ketchup cups galore.

Hot dog: With everything on it. You're not a Chicagoin if you don't like a Portillo's hot dog.

Cheeseburger: With everything on it. I have not figured out what it is about these damn burgers, but they're amaze. They aren't the thickest, juiciest burgers I've had, but they have me comin' back for more. Maybe it's the poppy-seed bun? 

Chocolate cake shake: Heaven in a cup. I of course am obsessed with the chocolate cake itself, but if you can add in some extras and drink it on the go - why not? This is literally the best dessert ever. Mind you, it's probably about 1,000+ cals, so maybe don't indulge in one of these bad boys too often.

I stopped by at 9 pm for dinner. As always it was packed. The staff seemed a little flighty which is highly unusual. 

Portillo's was recently sold after Dick Portillo ran the company with an iron fist for several decades. I think I miss that part. 

I am also disappointed by the lack of nutritional information anywhere. We all know that it is calorie rich. Just show us the truth.

Also, I ordered a chopped salad with extra bacon (minus cheese and onion) and was charged a whopping $1. That's a bit ridiculous.

How can you not like Portillos! Great burgers, great chili cheese dogs, great cheese fries! Shakes, Malts, and smoothies oh my! They are pretty fast with getting your order, they are all super nice, it's noisy here but just because they are always packed, so that's a good thing! Nothing better for a hangover than a little Portillos! Woohoo ;-)

good beef burger and hot dog. Definitely authentic Chicago style fast food haha. Soooo juicy.  The chicken sandwich is another choice who wants a little less calories al well as good taste. In addition, lI would prefer if they have other options than regular buns, since these carbs make me dizzy during afternoon work

Another recommendation is the ONION RING, which is worth every bite. I am pretty particular about fried food, but these deep fried and crispy onion ring does not have any oily taste.

However, to be fair, ribs are covered with over sweetened bbq source. Salads are overpriced and not fresh with limited topping choices. 

So just get in and order anything supposed to make you fat and fully satisfied;)

We always enjoy potillos  but I have to say this place is very expensive, walked in right up to order my wifey had the apple walnut salad ...and a hamburger and shake, I had the garlic chicken pasta, hamburger, and shake with onion rings,,  the bill  42.00  ,, I would definitely consider this fast food,  the manager on the salad side is awesome older gentleman with a SUPER attitude..you can see he really loves his position there..The food was fairly good,  VERRY GARLICY on the chicken garlic pasta..WHICH IS VERY GOOD THE PORTIONS WERE EXCELLENT AS WELL...

tHE VERDICT..if it is the taste of portillos you want come here but expect to pay over 40 bucks for something that shouldn't cost 40 bucks rather 25-30,, always good to come here the lower score is strickly for the price ,, so much out there for this price that is NOT fast food...

TWO-ONE-FOUR, WAIT NO MORE. Very clever way of calling out your number to pick up your food! They don't do it for every number/not all the number callers do it so you should feel lucky if you get a rhyme with your food. Awesome staff!

I don't really like the Chicago style hot dog but their Italian beef are BOMB! I always get it with the sauce on the sauce so I can dip as I eat and prevents the sandwich from getting soggy. If you like sausage, you can get their combo where they put a sausage in the Italian beef sandwich, too. It is a bit greasy though so don't eat this too much!

Absolutely! Positively! No doubt! The best hotdogs in the world! I have had them Thousands of times and I miss it so much!! But I plan on visiting and just thinking about visiting I am planning my first stop here!!! I wish I still lived in Illinois! California has no hot dogs like this!

Excellent, superior way to run a business.  See below..The begining us for another business.. BUT you come in to save the day! Read on!!!.

If I were able to give ZERO stars I would.  I am also going to be fair and balance this out with an excellent review..BUT NOT for this establishment!  

Here it goes (it's long but necessary): I work for a company that is very well versed in customer service,  my job is to service observe (audit) customer service representative calls. With that being said, I do my best to be as fair a possible, without being subjective when  critiquing anything or anyone for that matter.

The department I work for decided it would be a great idea to order from this particular location. Given that  we order just about every Friday from various restaurants, and there were about 13 people ordering, the courteous thing to do would be to call in our order in advance, right?  Umm.... not so much! 

After collecting everyone's orders I decide to call it in Thursday evening for Friday pick up. Well, apparently when I called them at about 4:45 or so, the young lady (who did not appear to sound too enthusiastic) proceeds to advise that I would be better off calling "at breakfast time" since she was afraid they will lose our order! When I ask what would be a convenient time to call to ensure my order will be ready for pick up before noon,  she again states "at breakfast time". The young lady proceeds to ask if I can hold so she can get a pen and paper (which I am thinking she will take my order); asks for my name and number and what time I would like to pick it up. So now I am thinking this is not good, so you can take my info down and not my order? I give her my information and tell her I will call Friday morning.

Fast forward to Friday morning... I decide that breakfast time would be about 8:30 or so, since again I wanted to provide ample time for them to have our order ready. This time a different young lady answers mumbling something incoherent,  I explain that I called the day prior and would like to place a large order in advance.  The young woman asks me to hold, which resulted in an approximate hold of over 11 minutes!  During this waiting period I can hear a conversation between a few employees, which consisted of nonsense and whatnot. At this point it occurs that my well over $100 order is not needed at this place of business. Unfortunately they lost what may have been a consistent biweekly large order. 

I then call corporate waited about another 5 minutes to get to someone,  explained what transpired was promised a call back. This did happen but unfortunately all of the apologies in the world will not sway me to order from this particular establishment. The best the "manager" can do is offer a discount?!?! 
I think maybe a few free meals and we would reciprocate with being a constant customer. Not too savy if you want business a customer should not have to jump through hoops to give them money! 

This place has proven that it does not handle large orders appropriately. 

So, now on to my positive feedback:
After being inconvenienced and having to collect new orders... Portillos in Naperville to the rescue.. knows how to effectively and efficiently run a business as is evident by their loyal customer base.
