They accommodated my last minute order of 20 (notice how the order grew). They are true upperclassmen when it comes to the food/restaurant industry.  Not only did they take my large order,  they did so accurately and with less than an hours notice!  They also offered to bag and add names to each employees order!  They exceeded my expectations of how a business should operate! 

Hardee's of Warrenville,  take note of how things should be run,  maybe, just maybe, one day you will have the same loyal fan base. 

Sorry it's not our group!

The late Roger Ebert once said that you only judge a film based on if it achieves what it sets out to achieve, not what you would like it to be. The same logic applies to Portillo's Hot Dogs.  Portillo's sets out to provide tasty fast food at reasonable prices, and it achieves that goal with flying colors.  Will eating a roast beef and cheddar sandwich on a croissant damage your heart?  It might.  When I consume a delicious Maxwell Street Polish, am I increasing my risk of a stroke?  Yes I am.  Will the chocolate cake shake make it more likely that I will contract Type 2 diabetes and die without a full set of toes?  You betcha!  But that's hardly the point.  Portillo's never claimed to be health food.  Accept this establishment for what it is, and enjoy at your own risk.

Good pasta, fun decor. But I fail to understand the hype. Chicken sandwiches are dry, stale, and flavorless.  Italian beef is bland without much flavor (Buona Beef's Italian beef is much better, in my opinion). I think their pasta dishes are 10x better than the other stuff.  But not all of their locations have the pasta.

Took one of my friends here recently from out of town since she wanted to know what all the hype was about. She had an Italian Beef sandwich and said it was really bland (I agree).

Also, my husband and I were here tonight and they were so incredibly slow with our order. The place was more than half empty inside, and we waited 20 minutes for my Chicken Siciliano dish. There was no long line of customers inside. My husband got his meal in 5 minutes, and it got cold while we waited for my darn pasta. Not thrilled with this place and our service tonight. Worst service I've ever had here. I won't be coming back for a long time. 

Lastly, they also cater more to the lazy drive thru customers.  There's always a line of 20+ cars in the drive thru and they get their food much faster than the people who actually get out of their car and walk inside to place their order.

I guess all the talk by Dick Portillo about quality staying the same after the sale was just that Talk.
I am a avid patron of Portillo's and enjoy their Hot Dogs best of all. That is until I went to this portillo's the last thee times. The hot Dogs were either too large , funny color or the last time the skin was so tough I could hardly eat it. I will not be getting a Hot Dog at Portillo's  anymore. If they needed to save money they should have looked elsewhere.

Well heading home, my wife and I were really hungry, so we decided to get our favorite meal Portillo's! Little did we know, the service here was terrible. My wife ordered and she asked what comes with her sandwich, and they told her everything. This in fact implies that everything does indeed come with it! When we got a receipt comma I noticed that she was charged extra for what she had ordered. We went back, and the girl, who look like she was in high school, just stared at us after we asked about this matter. She then rolled her eyes and got her manager who came over, and my wife explain to him the situation. He didn't even know about the issue, or the menu! My wife asked what comes with the sandwich, and he said the same thing she did, and also stated that it is not a charge. When we looked up at the menu, there indeed wasn't that an upcharge. That is why my wife ask what comes with it with no extra charge. Instead of saying everything, you should Clearly say these all comes with it for free, and these are what includes an upcharge. Clearly, even the manager, who doesn't know the menu, how would he be able to train the staff. Just very unprofessional. The reason why I gave this to Stars was because my beef sandwich and cheese fries turned out great! And all the other Portillo's we go to are no problem at all.

Im a sucker for the polish and fries. Noting more to say. LOL, the drive thru is super crazy in the summer and winter I guess. I feel like it needs to expands for all the business that it acquires on a daily basis. I have nothing negative to say about this place. I love portillo.
So amazing is was everything I was hoping for from Vegas! So this was my first time! Plan on making the drive to AZ for Portillos!

Good overall food choices, wish they offered special offers.
They need a sampler platter to try all the good food

I've been going to Portillo's since I was in high school in Villa Park.  It's grown from a trailer-in-a-parking-lot location to a Chicago area institution.  And the Naperville location is a great example of the franchise.  Fast, friendly and consistent service.  Fun, antique filled, dining room.  Clean and comfortable.  Most importantly, it has the best darn hot dogs anywhere.  And fantastic Italian Beef Sandwiches!  Oh, sure: if you want fancy "cased meats," this ain't your place.  No fois gras dogs; no duck fat fries.  Just consistently great American fast food.  Love their crunchy-on-the-outside, soft on the inside, French bread used for their beef sandwiches (mine with sweet peppers).  Get 'em dipped, of course.  Also love their "just right" steamed buns on their classic Portillo's dogs - get 'em with everything.  Also love their shakes; fries; and (when we just need a salad) their fresh non-meat options.  Thanks, Portillo's!

Oh man, too die for!  My favorite is the Italian beef but many people like the hot dogs as well.  The chopped salad is amazing!  My son's favorite is the chocolate cake.  If you are coming in from out of town you have to go!
Portillo's never disappoints us, from the way everything looks and the food, it is one of our favorite quick stops in Chicago.

If you've been in Chicago for longer than a week chances are someone told you to go to Portillo's.  I have friends from across the country that get starry eyed at the very idea of having Portillo's Italian beef, hot dog, or French fries.  I could talk for days about how everyone should try these when they come to Chicago, but this review is for the experienced Portillo's diner.

Step over to the Barnelli's side of the line and order a Peasant Pasta.  What? You've never heard of such a thing?  EXACTLY!  This dish is probably the best item on the entire menu, but most people didn't even know it exists!  Peasant pasta is a throwback to an old Italian dish where a little bit of everything is mixed together.  It is loaded with chicken, Italian sausage, and bacon over rigatoni noodles and a flavorful sauce.  The sauce is velvety smooth and flavored with chicken broth, butter, and cannellini beans.  They finish the dish with steamed escarole, fresh parsley, and little parmesan cheese.  As if you didn't already love everything from Portillo's and Barnelli's, this will surely seal the deal!

Great food. Friendly staff. Nice and clean. Great menu with lots to offer. It does get extremely busy during lunch /dinner time and on the weekends. Drive through line is generally long but seems to move along at a decent pace.

Lou Malnati's, Garrett's Popcorn, Eli's Cheesecake. Throw Portillo's into that convo, too!

This place was a nuthouse. What a well oiled machine at lunch time. You know what you're getting when you come here. NO FRILLS CHICAGO FOOD.

If you are living in Chicago, or visiting Chicago, there is no way you aren't coming here. If you don't, well, I'm sorry for you. Portillo's is absolutely amazing! They have the best service and food ever!

I have been to Portillo's many times, but one time, my grade went to Portillo's after a field trip. Since there were a lot of people, Portillo's had servers go down the line of people waiting to put in their orders and took their orders in line and gave them a ticket. By the time you got to the register, you just handed the ticket, paid, and waited for your food. This made it go so much faster and instead of waiting in line forever. This is also the same at the drive thru. The drive thru normally has tons of cars lined around the building. They do the same thing and go to each car and place a ticket on the windshield and your order gets to you much faster. Although, if this is your first time, do not go through the drive thru. You will most likely already have your food by the time you reach where the menu is, so if you are new, go inside the restaurant.

The food is so unbelievable too. I usually get the jumbo chili cheese dog which has a hardy hot dog covered in warm, savory chili. Their fries are always cooked to perfection and are always warm by the time you sit down. Barnelli's, which is a salad and pasta place within Portillo's has delicious food. Their salads are fresh with a wide array of ingredients. Portillo's also has yummy shakes which aren't too thick that it can't be sucked through a straw, but aren't watery; they're perfect. I always get the chocolate shake which has a creamy texture with a sweet, chocolaty flavor. Their sizes for shakes are small and large, but my recommendation is to not get the large because it is ginormous.

Portillo's has such a friendly and fun atmosphere and it feels like you know everyone there. The dÃ©cor has fun objects from old license plates to suspended motorcycles. It is a great deal too because a meal including fries and shakes for a family of four was under $27. Portillo's is for any kind of palate, and will make you smile every time.

Wow, I have not been to Portillos in months and I remember why. You can't even get in the parking lot, the long line of cars in drive thru block your way in. Had to park two stores down at old navy. No one directing people to barbell is or Portillos line so people had to keep switching. I ordered a hot dog, fries and Coke and cashier was charging me $15. What! Then had to wait about 7 min for a manager to swipe his badge. The fries were solid as rock, over cooked, and they messed up my order on top of that. Going to jimmys down street. Cheaper and less crowded. Totally lost the concept of guest service.

Come before either lunch or dinner rush or you will be waiting a long time. The food is really good even though some things have changed since new ownership bought out the restaurant group. I went there this past Friday and waited close to 15 minutes for 2 burgers, a fry and onion rings and they weren't that busy. Normally when the person calling out numbers sees someone there for a long time they ask what your number is and will actually help locate your order on the line to help move it along. Not this time. Not even a shift supervisor rolled past the window and when that would happen they would apologize and offer you a piece of their chocolate cake. Be aware that any time they mess up that is there go to offering to make up for their mishap. Can't tell you how many times I have had that offered to me and I found out about this practice from an employee that works at another location. 
But if you are in the mood for a good burger, beef, hot dog, fries, onion rings or even the chicken sandwiches. Stop by Portillo's and come before the rush. I have seen really long lines at this location for many hours.

We got their drive thru service and the kids outside were just that, a bunch of kids bouncing around outside not really focused at all.  They were yelling and screaming whatever they felt like at each other and rough housing around all the cars.  Not very professional, but we told ourselves whatever.  So when we ordered we had to correct the kid twice when calling in our order but figured with the corrections everything would be good... Nope.  We got home and found out there was an issue with every piece of our order.  First, they forgot (and still charged us for) our cheese cups for our cheese fries, then also forgot the pickles we specifically requested on our hotdogs.  Secondly but probably the worst, I took a bite out of my chili cheese dog and bit into what was probably the longest hair I've ever seen.  Totally gross.  We've never had an issue at other locations but this time was enough to make me never go back to this one.  So upon calling the manager of the place, she seemed to not really care about what happened saying she's "never heard of any of that happening" and told me she's forwarding everything off to customer service anyway.  From now on we'll be staying far away from this Portillos.

If you are not from or currently living in Chicago, you are definitely missing out! Portillo's is one of my all-time favorite places to eat. My favorite meal is a chili dog with french fries. Their desserts are top notch. I can never decide between the luscious chocolate cake and the always satisfying strawberry shortcake. Chicago natives like me love this place. Keep up the good work, Mr. Portillo!

Amazing place, has a special place in the heart of every Chicagoan. Their onion rings are mouth watering, hot peppers are on point, and their cake shakes are the cats meow. The staff has it down to a science, even walking through the drive through to take your order before you actually pull up to the window. Great place and great people always delivering a great takeout.

I was so young when I started going to this Portillo's that I actually thought the dÃ©cor was super-cool;  I'll admit that I've changed my mind since then, but I still love this place--more now than I did then.  They've got a pretty good variety of food, so even if you're not in the mood for what you usually get here, chances are you'll find something you like, and you might even end up discovering a new favorite.  They have awesome hotdogs and really good burgers (they're well-done, but the meat is never tough or dry), they're not my favorite Italian beef place, but they lure my grandmother all the way out from Texas--she has to eat here (she's also specific about the location) almost every day while she's visiting.  They have really good, crispy fries and onion rings, AND if you're eating in, you can wash it all down with a beer--which is awesome.  The pastas and sandwiches on the Barnelli's side are also pretty good (or at least better than average), although I have to say I really love the salad that comes with fruit and some kind of poppy-seed dressing.  They offer a really moist 'chocolate' cake that really doesn't pack anywheres near as much chocolate as it looks like it does, but it is pretty good and--as I've already mentioned--very moist, so, though it will satisfy my sweet tooth, it won't satisfy me if I'm craving chocolate.

If you're looking for something fast, but you don't like fast food, than you've found the place--the drive through and the job they do there are incredible.  The prices are great, again considering that the food is of much better quality than that of fast food chains, which makes this place ideal for dine-in or carry-out depending on your time-restraints or moods.

This place is always great. I always get the jumbo hot dog or the italian beef WITH mozarella and dipped, cheese fries, and a chocolate cake. Yum!!! Last time I tried Barnellis for the first time and got a rigatoni a la vodka. It was not bad... it definitely needs  A LOT more sauce though! I wouldn't get it again...

Normally my wife and I love their chopped salads, but even Barnelli's is downsizing.  Their salad dressing containers are now only one ounce vs. one and a half a while back.  Containers for their blue cheese are also smaller.  First they downsize on the bread offering a quarter instead of a half, now they downsize both the salad dressing and the blue cheese containers.  Even though I ordered extra dressing "to go" we could barely taste the two smaller containers on the salad when we got home.  This makes no sense especially with all the customers they get on a daily basis.  I guess the new holding company thinks we silly customers will not notice.  WRONG!  Say it ain't so Joe!!!

When I was a little girl, I apparently bit the doctor.  My mom made a deal with me then that if I didn't bite the next doctor, she would give me a reward...maybe a sticker, maybe a Barbie...it depended on the magnitude of the appointment.  
I like rewards :) It worked and I haven't bitten a doctor since...

Last night, I had to have my first ever tooth filling.  I called my mom to tell her I'd been brave.  I didn't even have them numb the area where they were drilling around to clean and fill.  She said she thought I could have a reward! I agreed.  

The dentist said I could eat whatever I wanted...hot or cold! SO I picked a Portillos Italian Beef with sweet peppers and small fries and an ice cold Sprite...It was a reward that rivaled a Barbie! Yum!!! (And I didn't even have to get out of the car...8 bundled up waitstaff made the to-go line a zip to get thru!!!) 

Thanks Portillos, for never letting me down when I need a treat :)
Great food but the street access, parking lot, & drive-through are insanely busy! Plan extra time for it.

Drive thru service is the pits!! Terrible terrible!  First time I went through the person dropped my food on the ground and then tried to serve it to me saying ... No.. They remade the salad... Right!! In 10 seconds? That's bull! Second time....the girl didn't know that she was swiping the card the wrong way! I had to tell her she was ! Wow!!! And the the person who gives the food out didn't. He came up to me after I got my food at the window And he said oh I'm sorry I was going to get to you ... But he was too busy chattin it up with the money girl.   What a bunch of morons!!!! 

The food in the other hand is as good as it gets for Portillos.  I won't be going through the drive thru this time at this sorry place .

This Portillo's is a madhouse during the lunch hour.  The wait wasn't bad at 12:00 p.m. inside, but by the time I left the line was nearly at the door.  The drive-thru lanes are just as bad.  They really should open up another Naperville location, maybe closer to 95th or 111th Streets to alleviate some of the rush.  The employees do everything they can to keep the lines moving, but I'd recommend going just before noon, or waiting until after 1:00 p.m.

The food here is just as good as any other Portillo's, and there's a lot of seating.  My onion rings were disappointing this time though, the onions don't stick to the batter and I ended up with some onion strings and empty "casings" of fried breading that I had to eat separately.  I order my italian beef "dry" at this location, since they tend to soak it in gravy and the bread falls apart.  Just isn't my thing.  They too much mayo on the grilled chicken sandwich also.  I love the hot dogs, cheese fries, and italian beef though.

Employees are friendly and fast.  Bathrooms and restaurant is clean.  I'm a fan.

This Portillo's pretty much prints money. Drive by any time between 11-1pm and it is an absolute mad house. It is busy for a reason though. Great food, good prices, and friendly service. Just try to avoid the lunch rush.

Good location. Plenty of seating and clean.
Best fries around. 
Hot dog very good.
Beef okay.
never tried them, but I have been told that the onion rings are also very good.

This is the food of heaven and the best food in Chicagoland. Whatever you order is amazing, especially Chicago style hot dogs, burgers, and Italian beef. However, I'm only giving four stars because if you are ordering your meal to go then be prepared to wait a significant amount of time.

Wow, first time here. I don't remembers these when I lived here in the mid-80's. This place rocks!! Had the combo and it was so good, I wish I could eat 2. My co-worker said the salads are excellent too, but can't imagine having a salad in hot-dog joint, but maybe next time. Don't have anything like this in SoCal wish they did. Well definitely be back when I am in this area again.

If you find yourself waiting in the long line of "Sheeple" outside or inside of a Portillos.Do yourself a favor drive  a quarter mile directly east on Jefferson.If you get lost poke your head out the window and smell the strong scent of a Wood Pit BBQ. As you get closer the aroma will get really strong and just take over your steering wheel and all your windows may start to roll down to engulf your car in the undeniable scent that is "GEMATOS" Thank me later.
Great food, terrible drive through service, probably the worst of the Portillo's chain

One of the better Portillo's in the greater Chicagoland area. 

Great food, great service, lots of seating, and has a BARNELLI'S PASTA BOWL for some delicious pasta with vodka sauce... yummay! 

This might be my fave portillo's location. I love coming here, the fries are always fresh, they make consistently good food, , the bathrooms are clean, tons of parking, and it's fast as hell.

Seriously this place is as good as it gets. Great selection, atmosphere, and the best food. Beef sandwiches are awesome, great hot dogs. Salads are awesome. Chocolate cake is to die for. Some people don't move out of Chicago because they can't do without Portillos.

I've been coming to this Portillo's location since I was a kid and it's always been fantastic. The service is efficient, the employees are polite, and obviously, the food is delish.

I prefer to drive through rather than go inside (especially around lunch time, holy cow!), which is easy here because this location has two drive-through lanes, and a handful of workers going down the line taking orders and completing transactions. At another restaurant, a long line like that could take forever, but Portillo's really knows how to get people in and out quickly. And they've never, ever gotten my order wrong. That's pretty impressive considering how many people they serve everyday.

If you're looking for a yummy Chicago-style dog you can get quickly, definitely come here.

Yep, about as good as it gets.  I have never had anything here that wasn't the bomb good.  When family come to visit, all they want is to go here to eat.  .  Don't be intimidated by the long, long lines.  They are very organized and move very fast.  The chopped salad is best I ever had along with their house dressing.  Italian beef double dipped, beef and cheddar crossiant, breaded chicken sandwich, cheese fries, hot dogs, italian sausage.....all of it is greeeeaaaaatttttt.   You can't go wrong going here.

It has happened several times going through the drive thru.  I order a french fry with my meal, and I get half a french fry serving.  Come on Portillo's!  At least try to get it to look like the picture.  I felt cheated.  This is great food, fast service, but I did not get what I ordered.

I was never well-acquinted with Portillo's until I came to Illinois, although there are only two that I have heard of in Southern California. At first, I thought it was a Mexican restaurant, but it turned out to be an American food joint. Overall, foodie was goodie. I really want to try their hot dogs before I leave town, which I hear they are famous for. It being my first time, I told the lady at the counter that I was newbie and asked for recommendation. She ordered me a grilled chicken sandwich or wrap (I think) with bacon and all the works for perfection!!! Soooo good!!! This is my new go-to place in the Chicago area.

HA! more crazy reviews. Ok recently I ordered a burger with grilled onions and cheddar cheese. Well they do not have cheddar cheese (sliced ) so you get it grated. Worse still my last order came without the burger...yes they gave me a bun and lettuce with no burger. So I drove 9 miles back to complain and the manager in charge made the measly offer of giving me a new burger and fries WOW that doesn't cover my time and gas...basically its a joke of compensation for my time. Well I told him he could keep the fries and refund the burger...he did but did not have the class to refund the whole order...which I think is the right thing to do for such a waste of a customers time.  He did not see it that way...how nice huh?

Never going back again.
There is a drive-thru but I liked sitting inside. Very cool casual ambience. Lots of picnic tables and fun decor! I look forward to coming back.

Really, Dick Portillo?  
Do I give a whoop if Jim Belushi hastily scratched his name on a bad publicity photo that looks like it says "Thaonks forthe besthot dogggs! -Jimmmimim"?  His stupid TV show had me on the brink of insanity wondering how close we were to the downfall of modern American society.   
Do I care if Brian Urlacher's meaty, bullet head is displayed next to the counter where I pick up my Italian beef?  Nope.  His neck-furters make me feel ill when he takes off his helmet.  
Do I need old, rusty metallic things hanging off the walls making me feel like I could get tetanus at any time?  No, sir, I do not.

Oh, yeah, the beef and burgers are great.  
I routinely take off my shirt and rub Portillo's chocolate cake all over my chest hoping i can absorb whatever I can't shove in my mouth and that's only when i'm not shoving my face into a plate of eclair cake.  Me likey.

I'm hoping Portillo's received my letter requesting they cater my funeral where my casket will serve as an all you can eat beef & burger buffet.  I'd like to amend that original request to include chopped salad without chicken or bacon for the vegetarian family members I'll leave behind.  I'd like them to remember me as being thoughtful.  Thanks!

I'm a fan of Portillo's, but this was my first time at the Naperville/Rt. 59 location. It has a country western theme but otherwise is similar to the other locations I've visited.

I've never been to Portillo's when it wasn't busy. It is bustling and tends to feel a bit chaotic to me. There is a lot of seating but the tables are really close together. It's usually pretty loud, which is fine for a quick lunch but probably not the place to sit and catch up with a friend.

The staff are VERY friendly, courteous and every single one had a great smile. Very nice service. They are very efficient with a lot of staff that seem hard working- they take your order ahead of time in the drivethrough and at busy times inside of the restaurant to save time.

The fries are the best anywhere- hot, fresh, perfect amount of salt, crinkle cut- delicious! I ordered a hamburger with just lettuce, tomato and pickle (I love how their pickles are thick-cut) but ended up with a hamburger with everything on it- they took it back and made a new one for me and said "sorry about that". The burgers tast char-grilled to me. 

My husband loves their Italian sausage sandwich.

I often grab a to-go menu right when I get there so I can read up close the ingredients and description of the menu items so that when I get through the line I'm all ready to go. The line goes pretty fast and it feels like you need to be ready quickly. 

I think the salads are fantastic! I also really like the warm lemon poppyseed muffin that comes with all of the salads. My favorite salad is the chopped salad- I order it a little bit different (no cheese, no onion, light on the dressing, add croutons) and it is so delicious! The chicken pecan salad is also tasty- it has a unique WARM honey mustard dressing which adds great flavor.

I was here on a Saturday afternoon and there were straw wrappers and food all over the floor because it was so busy, but several people were cleaning and sweeping the restaurant so got it all before I was done with my quick meal.

Love the wide variety menu from Chicago style hot dogs to BBQ rib dinners! You can go there for a month straight and have something different each time. I love their salads, my favorite is the Chopped Salad. Always consistent and always yummy,

I have lived in IL for three years and ate at Portillo's once before. Frankly, I didn't get the hype. (I said so on Yelp, but my review seems to have vanished...???)

Part of it may be that I don't like hot dogs, which is a major item around which their menu is built. The last time I went, I had a burger and root beer, which were serviceable but not worth waiting in a line wrapped around the building, like there is at any given time.

My boyfriend, however, has lived here a good chunk of his life and has dedicated himself to trying to convert me to the Portillo's mentality. We went last night for dinner. He suggested the grilled chicken sandwich (I got it on a croissant); my eye was also caught by the pina colada smoothie. 

I'm still saying "ehh". The breakdown: 
- the grilled chicken was clearly fresh, but a bit over the top on saltiness. The fact that it was so hot and juicy also made the croissant a bit mushy; a harder roll would have been better, actually. 
- fries were awesome. crinkly (but not like Ore-Ida) with a extra-crunchy exterior, they satisfied a salt craving that I'd had all day. 
- the smoothie was a bit too sugary for me; if they'd dialed back the sweetness a bit this would have been perfect. 

As to the restaurant itself, the theme was for some reason "Old West/Gold Rush" (or something like that). This meant (I'm not sure why) that modern country music had to play incessantly (my boyfriend said this is always the case); maybe that's why so many people choose the drive-thru? (heh) There was a lot of seating space (not only lots of tables to choose from on this occasion, but just a lot of tables in general.)
Overall, between the music, signs, and several counters for ordering/picking up different things, it seemed like a lot of confusion to me.

I will point out that the staff was very polite; everyone we crossed paths with, even for a second, was upbeat and kind. Big gold star for them. 

I still am not a complete convert, but I'm told that their chocolate cake is to die for and I still have to try the Italian beef, so I'll give them another shot. Maybe someday you'll see me in that line of cars outside.

This is the gold standard for Chicago's famous Italian Beef sandwich. Prices are low, food is ALWAYS good ( been coming here for 20 years.. ). Service is wicked fast.. even when the drive thru is packed, its still lightning quick. 

Fries = Awesome

I have been trying to eat more healthy so this is a special occasion for me but the beef is only about 500 calories, so not bad.. Fat is about 27 grams which is a bit high but it packs almost 50g of protein.. so worth it for lunch from time to time.

And they serve BEER!!! AND its reasonably priced!!

I love Portillio's!!

When I saw a line wrapped around the building and out into the street for the drive thru line, and the very large parking lot completely full, I had to stop by.  Im very glad I did!  The Chicago style hot dog was very good, the best Chicago style dog I've ever had.  I enjoy the pickle wedge on top of the hot dog instead of the green relish other Chicago hot dog stands use.  The chef salad with house dressing was also very good, which I find out was just as popular as their dogs!  Another plus: even though the house was packed, and is every time I go in, the service is quick and I don't have to wait long inside or in the drive thru.
The best Chicago Italian Beef Sandwich ever!!!  Their fries and onion rings are good too.  Their ribs are ok, chop salad is money.  :D

Great hot dogs. They have one of the best drive thru systems I've ever seen. The service is pretty good, although most of the people working the drive-thru are young kids. This place gets extremely busy, but they have a way of keeping the lines moving and I've never had to wait long for food.

The best Portillos, but it's always packed.  The drive thru has a constant line.  And there are two lanes!  But the food is conistently good.  Barnellis offers different food items (Chicken Portabella and Chicken Panini) that most other Portillo's don't offer.

Dick Portillo, you magnificent bastard.

I've never eaten a Portillo's product I didn't like.  Hot dogs, burgers, juicy Italian beef, THE BEST FRIES EVER, and the drool-inducing Chopped Salad that haunts my dreams on those lonely nights when I'm away from the Chicago area.  Don't forget to top your meal off with a yummy chocolate cake shake: a chocolate shake with actual chunks of their amazing chocolate cake in it.  I'm gaining weight just thinking about it.

One of my favorite things about the franchise is that they are SO ORGANIZED.  Come to the drive-thru on a busy Saturday afternoon and you'll see what I mean.  They'll have you outta there in five-to-seven minutes, even when the line of cars seems unending.  Truly, God is on their side.

Went here a couple of times when visiting friends that lived in Chicagoland area. This place was da bomb! I had never even heard of Italian Beef but tried it there and was instantly hooked. I have since looked for something similar in the ATL and it just ain't happening. The worst part is, my friends moved to Maryland so it is going to be a long, long time before I am ever able to get back to Portillo's. Good atmosphere, quick service and just an overall interesting experience with the best (Ok....so the only Italian Beef I have ever had but it was darn good!) Italian Beef sandwich I have ever had!

Have been to this location dozens of times and always get my food promptly and 9 out of 10 times there are no mistakes. I still give it a 5 though because they are always very quick to get us to correct food.

In the 'burbs, this is the place to go to get a dog or a beef.  Fast, tasty, juicy, totally flavorful, generally nice staff, ample seating.  The only thing to contend with is, at the wrong times, 50 soccer moms and their broods with dubious manners pouring out of Lexus SUVs and making a generally noisy and chaotic environment - ah, but what the heck, it's Naperville, and if it's that bad just get it to go.

I grew up on *Chicago* hot dogs like Fluky's, but when we were stuck in the 'burbs, this was quite the fine alternative.

I LOVE Portillo's! I just moved to Chicago from Pittsburgh, and never had an Italian Beef before..definitly one of my favorite sandwiches...ever! I get it with the grilled onions on top and a side of cheese fries, fantastic!

Great hot dogs, cheese fries and beer!  What could be better.  Fast friendly service.  Great is you want something quick.  They are always busy but you never have to wait long.  You can actually buy some of there food and have it shipped right to your door.  Although I am more of a experience type person, go there and enjoy.  Chocolate cake  is okay but I can top it.
Best ribs ever! I miss the full slab of BBQ ribs :( The meat would just slide off the bones. EASILY!

I spent the majority of my school days living about a block or so from a Portillo's so I grew up eating Italian beefs w/ hot & sweet peppers and fries.   Totally delicious.   Very juicy seasoned Italian beef in crunchy franchise bread but not dipped in au jus the smooth sweet peppers and the little kick of hot peppers.  I miss awesome Italian beefs like Portillo's I'm Seattle.
What can I say... their Italian beef is consistently good!!! I have a little guilt eating such a big bun but it was quickly washed off by the tasty, spicy deliciousness

I love Portillo's.  For the most part I never have a bad experience at one.  But this one seems to always let me down.  The food is as good as any in the chain, but the service is horrible.  My last visit, last night, I was shorted an item from the drive through (long drive back to get the missing food) and the time before my order was given to someone else on the inside pick up and by the time they figured it out I didn't have time to wait for them to do it again.  They blamed someone else for taking it, but my guess from standing there was they called the wrong number.  The assistant manager who finally gave me a refund gave me a hard time because "it wasn't their fault".  People screw up admit your mistake and move on.  I'm moving on, found Nicky's down the street and the food is at least as good and the service is way better.
Wonderful food very nice and clean. Wonderful milkshakes and chees fries.

i can't understand these reviews.             i truely wonder if most of these reviews relative to portillo's are scams or do our taste buds really differ that much or have the reviewers never ate at the right beef joint???         the hot dogs are average.               not bad,  but not great.         i like hot dogs (& eat a lot of them), but i've never found a place that serves great hot dogs.            the italian beef here  is average.                  the croissant beef very juicy with hot giardiniera is the food that i enjoy the most at portillo's, however , it is not great.       i believe i ordered my last one with cheese.              johnn###### beef ( arlington hts & elmwood park) & chick###### beef (hillside - on wolf road) are the best italian beef in chicagoland , as long as u order it juicy (at least relative to those beef joints that i visited & i tried a lot places in my lifetime).
i even like mr. ####### (on orleans in chgo) & al###### beef & nic##### (on cass ave;westmont -cheesy beef)  better than portillo's, but all 4 joints are not great.                   i probably will return to portillo's, but my expectations are just average food.                  come on,    can u really rate portillo's beef over johnn#### or chick#####beef?                  i dare u to do a taste comparison test.               do it.          then, i bet u'll agree with me relative to the beef & that u will be willing to drive far distances to eat the best beef sandwiches which i have done many times (i live in far western suburbs).           p.s.- i had to put #'s to block out the names, because my first post was not posted.   what's up with that?

I love their handburgers..its just like in and out in cali..real meat, a real burger..their fries are ok..i recently tried their south western bbq salad..yummyyyyyyyyyyyyyy..also, their ribs are finger licking good..i wasnt a fan of their polish hot dog..it was eh, ok..but their handburgers, ribs, and salad..i would go back again!!!

I give them 3 stars. I'd give them 4, but their beef sands were good about 20 years ago, now they suck. I'd give them 5 stars for the cake shake. My god, that's a hellouva shake.  I miss the old logo with the dauschound!

Portillo's is a restaurant I can't live without.  The food is consistently good and reasonably priced.  I usually stick to the hamburgers, hot dogs, and hot grilled chicken caesar salads whenever I go.  I would give it five stars if they offered larger water cups that weren't packed to the top with ice.
Nothing better than a Portillo's Italian Beef, cheese fries and a large root beer!!  It's always the first place I stop to eat when heading back to Chicago!

Hey what can I say I like this place even though I always order the same thing everytime i go...Italian beef sandwich with sweet peppers. Everytime we venture to Aurora, we have to make a stop here. My aunt actually turned me on to this place with her unconditional love for Italian beef. It's always busy there however the employees try to move it along as smooth as possible. The sandwich itself is pretty good and can be bland if you don't add the sweet peppers because the beef is not seasoned.  I find the sandwich to be much better when they don't dip the sandwich in the gravy due to the reason I always get my food to go. The one time I had the sandwich dipped and made it back to my relatives house to consume it, the bread was sloppy soggy. So I would recommend having it dipped in the gravy if you are dining in. On my next visit to Portillo's i may roll up my sleeves and try some of their other dishes.

Everything at Portillos is absolutely fabulous!  I always get the roast beef sandwich, DIPPED of course!, with mozzarella cheese and no peppers, some cheese fries on the side and a large root beer!  I'm not sure what they put into their root beer, but I swear it tastes sweeter than everywhere else I've had fountain root beer!

The only problem I have with this location is that the drive thru isn't very convenient and the location is on route 59.  They divide you into two lines during lunch and dinner at the drive thru and by the time you have to merge to get your food, people are fighting to get in front of each other.  I know they really can't do anything about that, but hey, if it weren't for the location, it would be perfect!  I just hate fighting traffic to get to some delicious roast beef!

I'm not from Chicago originally, so I don't feel capable of reviewing a Chicago Hot Dog.  I can say that I do like Portillo's version, but I also like the version I can buy at random outdoor stands.  So I'm hardly a picky person.

I do love their chopped salad - I think its the dressing that puts it over the top.   The little pasta added in is also great, and I've been happy with the chicken quality.

I typically don't eat in Portillo's because they are usually well organized mad houses.   However, I ended up in here on a Sunday afternoon, and was reasonably surprised.   It was packed with families, but didn't feel too noisy.   I found a spot next to a window, and it almost felt restful.
Great spot for a hot dog in the burbs.  The drive thru is one of the most efficient I have ever experienced.
over all a great place to eat.  Very fast drive through even with long lines.  Friendly, courteous staff, and delicious food.

Most of a time this particular location doesn't make Italian Beef's to my liking.  I prefer the beef to be shredded, tender, and well seasoned.  The one in Downers Grove is much better in my opinion.  I wish they could pick up some lessons from there!

Edit 12/30:  Quality has improved recently.  Upping to 4 stars.

I love me some Portillo's!! WOW, I never knew what heaven was like until I bit into their beef sandwich! haha! Their Italian beef is beyond goodness and until recently only ordered that from their menu! Now I'm hooked to their cheeseburgers, OMG! They are so good... Love their onion rings too! Chopped salad is great! Everything I've tried so far is awesome. You definitely can't get this stuff back at home and I'm glad I live here now, haha! Portillo's has a lifer in me! YEA!

One of the huge Portillo's that includes a Barnelli's.  Pick a line.  Barnelli's is the spaghetti, ceasar salads, etc.  The antipasto salad is pretty good, I shake the oil off my fork, but that's ok.  This location has a giant dining room that is full on the weekends.  The drive-through can take 15 minutes at night.  If you've never been to Chicago, Portillo's is the place for hotdogs.

Amazing restaurant! 

Who'd think we are in the recession by being in there.

Was there for lunch with our department and I think we all enjoyed our various lunches. We were all from out of town.

It was a cold, rainy and dark day so felt like soup and sandwich: I had fish sandwich and soup. The fish sandwich was delicious and so was the minestrone.

I have gone there a couple of times. The first time I went , as I was walking in, this huge tour bus pulls up. Then this swarm of college football players from the Quad city area ascended on this place. So it isn't fair to review based on that. However I was quite impressed that they had that whole football team served in less than 15 minutes. I mean they were quick. 

That experience didn't deter me from going back. I have gone back. I get the cheeseburger. I think it is really good.  My  husband gets the hot dog combo.  MY mom always orders one of the soups. Well even the kids get something , my daughter likes their mac and cheese.

Enjoy!!

This Portillos has the best customer service of any I've used.  From the management to the staff, it's outstanding.  Of course, the food is amazing as well, but it's Portillo's so how can it not be?!?
best italian beef, best hot dogs, best beef & cheddar croissant, best cheese burgers, best cheese fries, best root beer, best chocolate cake shake.  love portillos.

Amazing salad amazing salad made by Mike!! Bravo Mike! 
Great staff, friendly and professional.  Everything is handmade and it shows. 
Once again a great meal and experience! 
Keep it up Woodgrain!

I've come to this spot a couple times and I will definitely be returning again.  The first time I came here my 3 year old daughter nearly ate the entire pizza!  The salad bar is pretty on point as well!  Second time I came, I ordered two pizzas, build your own salad and a drink...with the check in offer my total was about $25, not too shabby.  8.99 for a basic pizza seems pricey, but its actually the same price as Little Cesar's deep dish pizza so...

I really do like this place and when I'm in the area will be making a point to order food from here!

If you are hankering for quick, fresh tasting pizza then be sure to visit here.

The place works much like a subway, but instead of a sub you are making a pizza. You have a choice of crust, sauce and topping. 

Once you pick all your choices they stick in the wood fire grill and within 5 minutes it is cooked.

You also can't beat the price as the lunch special is $7.99 for a pie. Regular pricing is around $10 but if you do a check in through Yelp they take $5 off. 

The pizza itself is delicious and the ingredients are fresh. So I had no issues with the taste. 

I went in for Lunch on Monday and the place had plenty of seating and no line. The staff was very quick to serve. So I have no issues with the facility.

The only reason I don't give this place five stars is because I have tasted much better pizza elsewhere. These are good pizzas but they border on being more of a flatbread with toppings. 

In any case, You won't be disappointed in visiting here for quick pizza. And the price makes it all the better!

What a pleasant surprise. Before I could fill up my drink, my pizza was ready. When I am crunched for time on my lunch, this is a great spot. One thing I enjoy about Woodgrain over its larger rival is that they don't skimp on the toppings. When you ask for a topping, they give you as much as if you were only using that one for the entire pizza, not ask you what else beforehand so they can limit you (cough Blaze cough). I do believe they could cook their crust a little longer for a more uniform crisp, but it didn't take away from my experience. Super cheesey, toppings tasted fresh, and a lot of flavor. I could barely finish it. It was a ton of food for such a little amount of money. They have a killer lunch deal (it escapes me at the moment), but it's all the toppings you would like at a flat rate. I will be frequenting Woodgrain in the future.

I love Pizza, I love trying different types of pizza. However when it comes to giving one pizza place the crown, it belongs to WoodGrain Pizza. I have a couple reason behind this "pizza crown" as well, beginning with how friendly the staff is. I have being going to WoodGrain for a long time now (aka I don't remember when I first went) and each time I walk in the staff greets me with a hello. I have gotten to know some of the staff members through my visits and will usually have a quick chit chat with some of the staff.

The second reason is the pizza itself. Yes, there are speciality pizzas on the menu board, but if nothing on the menu fancies your tastebuds you can always create your own pizza - the same rule of thumb also goes with salads! 

The decor on the inside of WoodGrain is very inviting and is cozy. It is usually quiet when I go there so it is easy to grab a booth and have some good conversations over some wood fired pizza. (granted when I go grab pizza it usually at 2 in the afternoon or late at night). They also offer outdoor seating as well which is a nice change from always sitting inside.

The pizza once it is placed in the oven itself is done quite quickly and you then have yourself a hot pizza right out of the oven. Which you can always add oregano, red pepper or cheese from the condiment shakers if you wish.

They also have recently began a reward program where you can earn points on each of your orders at WoodGrain.

The best part of this establishment is the fact that this pizza is affordable for anybody, especially being a college student you get the bang for your buck in my opinion. The quality of each pizza I have had at WoodGrain is always top notch with fresh ingredients and the same sentiment goes for their salads as well.

If you enjoy such Chipizzapotle establishments as Pie Five or Mod Pizza, Woodgrain is certainly worth trying. Be forewarned that if you request Romano cheese, the flavor is a bit overpowering. Otherwise, the pizzas are delicious as are the salads.

Just amazing .... 2nd visit here and this time I brought friends ... I am so happy to report that the food was consistent and that more staff was on hand .  Super friendly service , very clean and ingredients are so fresh. I just love this place keep doing what you are doing owners !!!
Be back soon
Good pizza ... Felt kinda rushed bc of long line ... Too fast paced for my "Friday pizza nite" style ... Would try it again, but only if in the neighborhood

After reading the glowing reviews this establishment has received I was profoundly disappointed by this place.  First, the good news:  Very attractive space.  I appreciate that they have beer and wine available.  Very friendly, if not particularly knowledgeable staff.  A wide choice of quality ingredients.
Now the bad news: The pizza was terrible. Soft, limp, rubbery crust. The toppings just skate off. Ninety seconds simply isn't enough time to bake a proper pizza. Halved cherry tomatoes were not even cooked. They were hot, mind you, but raw.
But the deal breaker is the crust. My sister, who is, shall we say, a senior, couldn't even chew it.
BTW - That "wood fired" oven? The person who cut my pizza admitted that it's augmented by a gas flame. I call "gimmick."

Went here recently and was not disappointed! The food here was wonderful and fresh! I really don't get why this place has been getting such a bad rep. We especially loved the $5 off for checking-in on Yelp :)

The ONLY reason why I give it 4/5 is because their queue system just sucks. So many people lining up right in front of the entrance and no way to alleviate the flow of people waiting in line. This place seems new-ish and they're still working out the kinks!

My boyfriend and I ordered individual pizzas and for $9.99 you get unlimited toppings - for a topping lover I was in heaven! I created my own with: Garlic Olive Oil as my sauce, Artichokes, Kalamata Olives, Cherry Tomatoes, Mushrooms, Fresh Spinach, Fresh Basil and Mozzarella/Provolone mix. DELICIOUS! My Boyfriend got the Mediterranean pizza and the classic sauce was delicious. I also got a side salad, again, with UNLIMITED toppings!! Such a happy girl right here.

I found out that the pizzas are cooked at 800 degrees for 90 seconds, so by the time my side salad was done being tossed, our pizzas were out. They were FINE! Not soggy, not over toasted, NOTHING. I really think it depends on your toppings as well as I'm sure some of them may release moisture when cooked (i.e. tomatoes..). New Coca Cola machine there with all the soda options. Loved that they had a neat little bar inside as well.

We are definitely coming back!!

We found Woodgrain quite by accident, but we now revel in its awesomeness regularly, to the chagrin of our diets! If you're looking for deep dish, stay away, and go pretty much anywhere in Chicago for a gooey fix.  But if you like tasty thin crust that complements the delicious toppings, this is as good as it gets. 
Prior to this discovery, the best pizza we had ever had was Pepe's a small chain in Connecticut & Yonkers NY... the only "6-star" pizza, in a class all its own.  That style is being imitated now, effectively, just outside Chicago.  Slightly burnty, bubbly wood-fired deliciosness, that we are now totally addicted to.

This place is just awesome. Honest to gosh, every type of pizza that you could possibly imagine, because you get to choose the toppings for your pizza. $9.99 gets you anything you could possibly imagine. Do you want to little bit more, just ask. They will put it on for you.

The pizzas are then toasted up in their woodfired kiln within a few minutes. You can ask for it to be a little extra done, or a little less done, however you want.

They also have make your own salads. All the toppings at a decent quality salad bar. 

You can go by yourself and eat at the bar, and watch a game on their television. They have alcohol, but I'm not ordered any, and so I don't know about the selections. They also have a variety of wines.

Pizza was good; I ordered the Mediterranean which has tomato sauce, olives, peppers, artichokes, spinach and mushrooms topped with mozzarella. Tasted very fresh, only took a couple minutes to cook in their powerful pizza oven. Portion was just right, as it was filling for one or big enough for 2 if you combined it with one of their salads. They do offer a decent selection of beer and wine, as well as having a freestyle Coke machine. 

One small quirk was I had to order the pizza separate from my beer, despite the fact the bar area is next to the oven which is in behind the register. Perhaps this was because most of the staff is underage to serve?

Ambiance wise it is modern with dark wood floors and tables, metal chairs, and white walls. Very sleek and modern! You can sit at a booth, a table, the bar area, or along the window.

I am fan, I definitely prefer this over the other new quick serve pizza chains in the area.

We've driven by here many times and today, we finally stopped in.  So glad we did.  

The place is clean and the decor is very nice.  It wasn't crowded...probably because it was like 2 in the afternoon.   We were greeted at the door and when we said it was our first time there, the guy behind the counter explained everything and how it worked.  

There are specialty pizzas available but we both got the build your own.  An earlier review said they were $9.99 but today they were $10.99 for unlimited toppings.  We both got the marinara sauce since it's more flavorful than the crushed tomato.  All the toppings are on display for you to pick from and all of them look very fresh.  You can also pick from three or four different cheeses or a combination of them and as much as you want.  I always love extra cheese but I didn't have to request it this time.  It was piled on  :)   

We paid for our order, got our drinks and sat down and within just a few minutes, our pizzas were ready.  They were really, really good...tasted really fresh and done perfectly.  

The only reason I gave this place four stars instead of five is because I prefer a crispier crust but I suppose being a wood fired oven, a softer crust is expected.  That being said, though, I really didn't mind it because it was so good overall.  An added bonus is the music played here....classic rock!  

If you're looking for a really good pizza that doesn't take forever, go here.  You'll love it.

Let's begin with the best part... $5 off your order when you check in on Yelp!
Moving on....
I got here around 6pm, and scored the first spot out front.  Plenty of parking, even next to Orange Theory Fitness in January!  This place wasn't crowded at all so there wasn't a wait for the pizza or in line or anything like that.  Lots of seating inside too.

So there are two kinds of crust - regular and gluten free.  There are prices for 1 topping, or multiple toppings, there are also specialty pizzas, salads, etc.  The staff here are very friendly and helpful...

I split a pizza and we both got a side salad with our own toppings.  My half of the pizza had chicken breast, which is an extra $1 charge as a topping.  It wasn't the best pizza ever, but it wasn't horrible.  I do want to come back and try another kind.  They also serve beer & wine if that's your thing to go with your pizza...

I'm not sure if it was the door opening/closing but it was rather chilly in there.  My overall experience was good, I do want to return and try this place again.

A great pizza place, with great service.  Finally a really good fresh pizza with great ingredients to make a Neapolitan pizza.  My entire family likes this restaurant.  The salads are also fresh and have a great taste.  Staff is also friendly and it is clean.  Are number one place to go to now.
Yummy and fun!! Reasonable prices, fresh healthy food and quick service plus nice workers! Perfect combo. Patio seating too

The gluten free pizza was honestly the best gluten free pizza I've ever had (and I've had sooooo many gluten free pizzas).  It's a softer doughier crust that you just don't really find with gluten free and it was PERFECTTTTT! 

The salad was good too!!! Fair priced and good size!!

Customer service was excellent.  The staff is all pretty much young adults and they all impressed me with their polite, friendly, and courteous persona.  

Keep up the great work and keep making bomb gluten free pizzas!!!!

Lunch special 7.99 on a pizza or salad all the ingredients you want Monday through Friday love love love right in my budget will continue to return, not sure how long this special will be running but even regular price 7.99 couple ingredients 9.99 all the ingredients you want including extra fresh mozzarella cheese. cheap dinner and it is done fairly quickly.

I'm on round 2. Enjoying my GLUTEN-FREE pizza immensely. So if it's round 2 this week, one might conclude that I'm actually enjoying this place. 

Best pizza I've had in a while. The staff is always extremely friendly and make me feel welcome. 

Environment is pleasant too. Feels sort of like Potbelly's but without a whole lot of crap all over the walls.  Cozy suburban feel. Beautiful oven too. Which is not something I've come across ever. 

5 stars. Great pizza and that's what it's about.

Wow!!! Want a great pizza!!  I've tied a lot of these build your own,  2-min pizza places and none of them compare to Woodgrain. The pizza crust is crispy, the toppings are plentiful and the taste is melt in your mouth awesome!
The atmosphere is cool  modern and clean. They have a good selection of micro-brews now but I was told they plan to increase the selection and install a 24-tap beer self-service beer station. They said there are two locations open now and they are opening a third this week. I hope they come to my area soon. 
John R
South Florida

Good place for people who don't like traditional pizza.  Or for those families that want different things on each pizza.  I would come here again...hate to say this, but it's like Chipotle for pizza!  Wasn't too busy when I came, but it was later at night.  Have heard it can get busy, but there is plenty of seating.  Also if you check in on Yelp, you get $5 off!!

My pizza crust was raw and inedible.
The toppings were fine but I had to remove them from the crust.
I had a small salad and it was drenched in balsamic dressing and inedible. I took it back and the manager made another one.  It was also drenched in dressing. A little balsamic goes a long way. 
I will not return. Too many other good places in this area.

Wood grain is great for a quick lunch or dinner.  You can make your own wood fired pizza or fresh dinner/side salad.  All their ingredients are fresh and everything can be made to order. They have a few pizza and salad recipes to choose from as well.

First visit here and I really liked it.  I've been to Pie Five, but that doesn't compare.  The pizza's are much better and the quality of the ingredients are good.  As an example the sausage had a sausage texture, not like some chains fake sausage.  The salads were also very tasty.

It also had a soda machine, which is always an attraction.

Good place for a quick pizza(s) for the family.  Will be back

Went to the store a month ago and had no idea how good wood fired pizza is. The staff was awsome especially the manager Melita, she was very accommodating. I would recommend anyone to come in for this dinning experience.
This place is phenomenal! I wish my wife loved it as much as I do, I could eat here every day.

Amazing!!! The dough is where it's at!! Both the regular and the gluten free are crisp and delish! Tons of options to make it your own.  Fast and friendly service and wonderful atmosphere.  Could bring the family or make it a date night because they serve alcohol as well. Price wonderful!

Good taste but they really need to find a way to cook that soggy soggy middle if their tasty pizza. 
Pick up your slices and all the toppings slide off the soggy corner and minimally cooked crust

This fine and modern eating establishment has brought the most of satisfactory comestibles revolving custom pizzas around the area. 

As a professional food critic and being raised in Chicago, pizza is a huge topic to judge. It is very hard to give a good review on pizza nowadays. 

So without a doubt, this Neapolitan pizzeria surely brought an excellent flavor inside my mouth. I only give 4 stars to restaurants that pack a punch inside my mouth. It tasted very delicious and is highly recommended.


Some cons included the under cooked pizzas. My first orders here brought me an undercooked pizza. It was very edible and fine for some. But as a Chicago style critic, it needs to be more crispy and rich. That could be achieved my leaving the pizza in revolving pizza oven for a longer duration. 

Pricing was appropriate on its menu. And coupons are frequently applicable for checkout and are provided by the establishment itself, but with a very limited time expiration date. 

In total, the atmosphere and mood is great. It has a wooden and rustic look mixed in with a modern tint. It serves a reviewer well. Along with the rare Coca-Cola Freestyle Machines Â©, it was a pleasure to eat here.
I really like that they make my pie the way I like it. My wife and I go there once a week can't beat a great tasting pie in 90 seconds tastes great thanks much plan on me once a week

This is my new favorite pizza place!

I have been looking for a good pizza place around town ever since they shut down connies in the exact same place as this place is. But Ever since I found this place, all other favorite pizza places go far below this place. I love how you can practically make your own pizza, they have so many options it's unbelievable. The pizza is DELICIOUS And it doesn't take that long for it to cook! It's great service and spacious too! I recommend this pizza place to everyone!!!

I just moved here from New York. My husband and I have been looking for some good pizza. Why is it so hard to get good pizza around here??? We decided to try this place tonight. The pizza was good. The crust wasn't great, but it was ok. Their business model of "designing your own pizza" is a little flawed. I'll go again.
Great food, awesome selection of fresh ingredients. the Pizzas are just the right size for 1-2 people. Can't wait to go back.

Good concept for pizza place. But do you  like soggy pizza crust?  Do you like dirty tables? Do you like blinding sun because the shades don't work?  Do you like rude and slow service?  Then this is the place for you. On the plus side I asked for double meat and I got a mountain of meat.

What a hot mess.  I ordered my carryout order via app. Yes,  it was Friday night dinner time and assumed it would be busy.  When I entered the establishment I saw the chaos.  If I didn't already place my order, I would have turned right around. If there were signs indicating order here,  pick up here,  etc. I didn't see them.   After evaluating the situation,  I was quickly able to figure out the queuing system.  I bypassed the long line where people were waiting to place their orders. I went to the cashier and paid for my order.  Then I waited in the area where a whole bunch of people were standing, waiting for their orders.  I saw a lot since I had to wait so long for my order to be ready.  I saw that most of the tables were empty.  Most of the customers were waiting,  either to order or pick up their food.  Orders were being messed up; most people were complaining.  Staff were kind to customers.  What really turned me off was the pizza oven operator. He kept hollering at the kid working the end of the line as he was in the way when the pizza maker wanted to slide the pizza off the peel onto the counter.  "You have to mooove!" The poor kid was doing the best he could in the mess. The kid was pulled and put at the front of the line.  They put an older, more experienced man at the end of the line.  Probably some type of lead staff.  I never heard the pizza oven operator yell at the older guy. He waited for him to move so he could put the pizzas on the counter. What a bully!  Pick on the kid! Really turned me of. 
I got my pizza, navigated my way out the door,  which was blocked by the growing line of people waiting to order. 
The pizza margharita was very good.  The crust was slightly under-cooked.
I would only go back during non-peak hours and I hope to see teamwork in place of bullying!

I had a simple Margherita style pizza - fresh mozzarella, basil and the crushed tomato sauce. Well worth the value after experiencing actual Neapolitan pizza from Napoli. This is the closest I've come to the authentic experience. Only a shame you can't order a larger pizza than seemingly twelve inches.
Melita is very friendly and helpful.  Go see her at the bar for some Sonoma Cider.  Also, wood-fired soppressata pizza is really hard to find outside of Cicero, Illinois.  They have it here.
Pizza was lne of the best I've had. Service was very friendly. Decor was very suiting and comfortable
Service with a smile is how I would describe WoodGrain. I came for dinner on 8/19/16 and found the employees so pleasant.  The pizza was good and the restaurant was clean.  Would visit again.

Tried this place for the first time and it was pretty good. We arrived at a busy time so we felt a little rushed to order because there was a line forming behind us. They had several nice sized salads on display. We ordered one salad and two pizzas. The salad was ready right away and unfortunately was about half the size of the display but it was tasty. Our pizzas were done about 15 minutes later. We enjoyed them. Ingredients were fresh, cheese and sauce were great and it was cooked to perfection. We look forward to trying this place again.

Its hard to get my husband to go because he LOVES deep dish, but I am totally into this style of pizza too. They have great ingredients and pizza combinations - creative without getting weird. Excellent cheese, that's very important. Satisfying without making you feel TOO full. The salads are just as robust and satisfying with fresh, well-married ingredients.

Don't order carryout.
I ordered two WoodGrain Neapolitan pizzas online, paying with a credit card. I looked for a carryout sign on arrival, but there was none, so I lined up in a queue and waited and waited.
When a staffer asked what I wanted I explained I was there to pick up online-ordered pizza, and he said to see the cashier. There was a long line. More wait time. I repeated that I was picking up pizza. 
Then the fun really began.
When the pizzas arrived, I tried to leave. Whoops. Even though my credit card was charged 40-plus-minutes earlier, a WoodGrain staffer screamed at me, "You can't leave." 
Everyone within 20 feet stopped and stared. More staff got involved. 
"Did you pay?" 
"Yes." 
"You can leave." 
Again, another scream: "He hasn't paid," even though I had. 
More waiting as the staffer collected from customers who had come in after I had. This went on: One staffer telling me I could go; the other shouting I must wait. The crowd was enjoying the circus.
Finally, I got the pizzas home. An hour and 20 minutes after I placed the order I bit into cold pizza, then pulled out of my mouth bits of whatever paper product WoodGrain Neapolitan Pizza puts between the pizza and the cardboard box. The pizza that had been in the box while Woodgrain staff hurled the verbal abuse had melted into the box, making it inedible.
Of course I complained on company website, and it has not bothered to respond. Yelp won't allow zero stars. In this case, one star is too kind.
Too many good choices in the area to return to an operation that makes carryout customers feel like criminals.

3.5 stars. There's nothing wrong with the pizza; it just doesn't shine in any way. With the 2 for 1 coupon I used ( code EBOGO, on their website and Facebook page) two pizzas for $9.99 was a good deal. I would have been disappointed both due to quality and size (they are quite small, personal pizzas) if I had paid full price. Place is clean, staff cheerful and efficient. If you want real, spectacular Neapolitan pizza (and they give you free cannoli which is amazing) drive downtown and go to spacca Napoli. All of my Italian expat friends go there, and having been to Naples myself, I too can attest it's just like being there.

This place is great! Really enjoyed the whole expierance. Super friendly staff, clean, nice ambiance, and great food. I was amazed how a pizza could taste so good in just 2 min. I will deff be going back to try a new combination. You could be in and out in 5 min if you had to or stay their for lunch.

Not impressed. These build your own pizza places are popping up faster than zits on a teenager.. Most will go the way of Qdoba and wont compete in the face of the originals. The reason this place gets the two stars is because of the service. We had 5 pizzas for 5 people, only one pizza artist was assigned to us, meanwhile another would take orders for those who walked in after us and speed them into the oven. Fine.. first time here, we take some time. They don't spread the sauce evenly so you have just crust on some of the slices. Knowing what toppings should be sparingly dropped is another must know how. I asked for giardinera peppers, which he loaded up on along with a ton of cheese. The pizza came out with a thick layer of cheese that fell off when picked up. When the end of the line cook pulled out the pizzas, he didn't know which pizza belonged to who, we had to figure that out, since he pulled off the numbered metal tent off too soon. They have all the ingredients, just need to communicate with each other more effectively and be consistent with the prep line.
 A couple positives, the crust was nicely darkened in the wood burning oven. I like the dining room ambiance and the Coke Freestyle machine.

I work close by so I have been there six times or more. Everyone is always helpful and polite. I learned by trial and error not to overload the pizza with ingredients or it will got soggy. I now go easy on the cheese and asked them to cook it a little extra. I also like the buffalo sauce and chicken pizza. Good healthy chicken and good tasting sauce. Go get creative, but don't overload. Happy it's there and we have this option. Can also mix it up and have a different taste every day.

Similar concept to Blaze Pizza and uBuild, this has become my go to place for personal unlimited topping quick pizza.  High quality toppings with excellent crust.  Thin crust does get messy as with their competitors but they definitely do not skimp on toppings.   Great stuff and wider variety of alcohol than Blaze

For as nice as it looks, I was really disappointed with my experience. Does the pizza taste good? Yes, when all of your toppings aren't falling off.. 

And as for the cleanliness behind the counter? There really isn't much. I would've expected such a newer establishment to be more on top of it all but that's not the case as far as I can tell.  Most likely won't be returning any time soon unless something changes. 

Honestly, give Olive Theory Pizzeria a try instead. Same concept but a million times better.

My husband and I dined here today for the first time.  I ordered the Mediterranean Pizza

1)   The bottom of the crust was soggy - I could not pick up a piece of pizza and eat it without holding it with two hands so the entire ingredients wouldn't fall off the top
2)   My pizza was swimming with kalamata olives and they were extremely salty.   I had to pick all of them off my pizza - there must have been approximately 1/4 cup on the pizza
3)    The pizza was very hot so at first I wanted to cut the pizza with a knife and fork.  This failed, as the paper under the pizza tore and stuck to the bottom of the pizza
4)    The tomato sauce was very bland
5)    I went to the register and asked to talk to the manager.   Low and behold, he was the person who was holding up the wall behind the bar.   We noticed him while we were eating our dinner and thought he looked like he had nothing to do!   When he came to the register and I told him that there were too many kalamata olives on my pizza, he did not seem very concerned.  I said it ruined the whole pizza and it was as if he could care less.   He said usually they only put a few olives on the pizza - that was all he had to say.   I also asked him if he had ever eaten any of the kalamata olives at this restaurant and he said he had not.   A restaurant manager who doesn't even try the food?
6)   Seeing that this was a new location for Woodgrain, I would have thought that the manager would be walking around asking the patrons how their food was - but of course, this manager was just standing around in the back of the bar area, looking quite oblivious !

Went in there to check it out, being that it's new to Westmont and I live nearby, and I was not disappointed!!!! We walked in and we were  greeted immediately, and given outstanding service from the first step in to the last step walked out. I would also like to add that Jason was VERY helpful in explaining how to order your pizza by giving us different ways to understand different flavors that go with others. Not to mention he gave us some of the best customer service I've had in years. I am definitely returning to this place on the sole purpose of the customer service we received and the because the food is damn good!!!

Horrible customer service and underwhelming pizza.  My wife stopped in to grab lunch and was treated rudely by the kids working the counter.  They had no clue about types of pizzas and were more interested in their smart phones than their job.  She wasn't the only one being treated that way as well.  In a hyper competitive restaurant world poor product and trashy service are a death sentence.  Good luck, I feel sorry for those investors.  Hopefully that's not somebody's retirement nest egg because it's being managed poorly.   Never again - too much good pizza in town to deal with that kind of operation.

Soggy center in my pizza again for the second time. Great fresh ingredients and flavor but the mushy undercooked center is a drag. Try par-baking the crust, it might help. Won't go back unless the center sogginess is addressed.
Excellent fresh ingredients fast!  The crushed tomato sauce is amazing!  We need these in Nebraska!

Finally, a pizza place in the western suburbs that offers plant-based cheese! My family and I came here on a weeknight for dinner. At first I was surprised at how casual the setting is - you walk up and place your pizza order, almost like a pizza-chipotle. Then you serve your own drink and sit down to wait for the 90 second fire to cook your creation. FYI - There is an extra wait for gluten free crust, I waited for at least 10 minutes while others went on to order their pizzas. The plant-based cheese is Daiya, one of my favorites for taste and melt-factor. The pizza was cooked perfectly and the crust was simply amazing. My mom is gluten free and this pizza tasted so good she actually worried that they gave her the wrong crust! I will definitely return for more. I appreciate that they don't charge an arm and a leg for gluten free or plant-based cheese. It's $1 to add the Daiya cheese, and no charge for gluten free crust. This is a nice place for casual pizza with friends or family.

Honestly, I was expecting to be Wow'd! I really wasn't. Pizza is just ok, Crust is not crispy, bottom is a bit soggy. Pizza needs to be in oven longer. I heard that from another customer one time. Gota ask to keep it in longer if you want the results. Yes you get your pizza fairly quick, but I want mine done just right.
Great pizza!! Great service! The manager Jason was very nice and helpful. Definitely recommend! And it was nice and clean in there as well!

I was not impressed with the pizza at all. My husband ordered the beef with giardiniera and if it not for the giardiniera there would not have been flavor. I ordered the sausage and peppers and it was bland I had to put on hot pepper and parmesam cheese. In addition, they have only 4 flavors of wine but were out of 2. I could not get the red wine I wanted. The only saving grace was buy one get one free. I will not be back.
Great gluten free crust. Pizza cooks in 5 minutes! Nice atmosphere; we came for lunch but I would be comfortable coming alone for a pizza and glass of wine at dinner as well.

We were very excited to try this new place but it was disappointing.  We arrived early in a Friday night but no parking and they did not cook the pizza long enough.  While it's a great idea to order what you want the line ends up being long.  Pizza was ok but not worth standing around waiting.  Take out night be a better option. Amy

Best gluten-free pizza I have ever had! This is going to become my go-to pizza place. They said they make the GF crust themselves and it tastes like it. Not the same old cardboard Udi's crust you get at other places. The price is right! $9.99 for unlimited toppings. $7.99 for one topping. Fresh ingredients. Beautiful wood-fired oven, too!

Food is really good and everything is fresh! I like how there is always a manager there watching everyone and even helping at times. Staff is always kind and wacky which helps with there being good vibes in the restaurant.Obsessed and go here all the time!

WoodGrain Pizza is different than your regular pizza chain around here. It is yummy, but didn't fill me up to be honest (I have a big appetite). It is definitely worth a try, quality taste and many options to personalize your pizza/salad. I will be coming back here.  Ambiance is lovely. Also, I love that it is open later than most other restaurants.

Went there about 2 weeks back. We ordered the Meat lovers and Sriracha BBQ Chicken. After seeing many good reviews on Yelp, we have pretty high expectation. But both pizza turn out to be terrible as both were way too salty and I have never tasted any worst pizza than the Sriracha BBQ chicken pizza.

I love visiting small businesses. The food is always delicious and the service is wonderful. I love that we can sit outside with our dog too.  

I've had the vegetarian panini and its stuffed with delicious veggies. Their fries are nice and crispy. 
My other half loves the French onion soup. 

The service is what keeps us coming! The owner and the workers are so kind. They've brought out a bowl of water for our dog, made conversation with us, and always thank us for visiting. 

Once I walked over with my dog and couldn't step-in to order. A young man came outside to take my order and then brought my food out along with anything else I might need. 

Give this place a try!

Date of my visit: 22-September-2016
Time of my visit: Lunch time
