I used to love the Caesar salads, but the lettuce is mostly iceberg and not romaine which ruins it for me at least.  I haven't ordered one in over two years now so sorry if you fixed this issue.
The chocolate cake is amazing, but be careful when you take it out of a carry out bag...chances are the lid isn't attached to the plate properly and a giant mess is incoming.  And avoid the chocolate cake shake unless you are a fan of warm ice cream with giant chunks of frosty floating in it.
Even though our order is always simple, they find a way to miss something half the time (forget the cheese dip for my fries most recently, and two visits ago hot peppers were forgotten on my husbands beef.) When I tried to call just to get my name down for free cheese next visit, the phone rang indefinitely with no answer.  I know how many folks work there...you'd think at least one of them could answer after twenty plus rings!
So although I love the food, I can only give this particular location three stars.

Food is always good but customer service was very poor.  Called to phone order while Hubby was picking up food, was placed on hold by Mark and was told that I was going to have to wait because I had a dozen people ahead of me.  Waited 16:45 minutes and a young lady asked if I had been helped, I told her that I had been put on hold and told that I would have to wait and that Mark was rude about it as well.  At this point, I didn't order it because the Hubby had already picked up the food by walking in and ordering it himself!  I had already been notified by him but wanted to know how long it would take for someone to take my order.

I love the food that's a fact! The menu has a variety for each taste. The portions are pretty great and the line is always big. 

What I like about each location is that it's a fast pace atmosphere and there are people lined up in up to three separate lines but staff are taking orders while in line and then one you head to the front of the line, you hand your doggy bag that has your order to the cashier. Then the cashier will ring you up and send the doggy bag to the food preps and then shortly after that your order comes out. 

I am not sure how the drive thru works, but every time we come and it does not matter which location the drive thru is always busy with double line of cars and staff walking by each car to take their orders. I can imagine that it must be very similar to the inside ordering process. Either way it works for me. 

I have not tried their burgers or salads, pastas or anything else other than their Famous Italian Beef Sandwich! It's just to darn good to change it up. Maybe in the near future I will check it out but for now, I will continue to stick with the Italian Beef Sandwich. I did try their hot dog and sadly to say I was not impressed at all, so that's it for today.

I am still a fan and will always be a fan. The cashier's that helped me were so nice and friendly. I'm really impressed by their welcoming greeting and willingness to be patient as I chose my order.  But there was no line.  I got lucky.  

I ordered their chipped salad and its the same as everywhere else; delicious and magnificent.  The balance of two dressings with the mix of greens, pasta, and among other ingredients were heavenly. I will want to try their pasta next time around.
Wonderful experience. Fast service and great food. All food tasted great and was hot. The culture of Portillos is awesome! Will be back!
Best pasta till date. Loved it . Barnelli's is what i make my visit here for.

3-21-16

I have nothing bad to say about Portillo's in general but ever since Dick Portillo handed over the reigns, I have been hearing and seeing things. I remember Portillo's was Chicagoland restaurant and now they are starting to pop up in other states. Then as my wife and I were about to walk into this Portillo's location, I noticed that they have added a pepper and egg sandwich. What's next, Portillo's creates a breakfast menu?
One of my favorite places! Beer at reasonable prices and best hot beef sandwich there is.

I come to Chicago several times a year but have never eaten at a Portillo's. It was recommended to me by the guy at the rental car place and it looked pretty well liked on yelp so I thought I'd give it a try. I'm glad I did. 

Fast service and great food for a fast food type place. I had the Italian beef sandwich with extra gravy, which was awesome. Savory beef with sweet peppers and just enough gravy to moisten the bread and infuse it will great flavor. I devoured it and was wishing it had been bigger. Fries were good too but nothing noteworthy. 

I also finished my meal with some chocolate cake. Pretty sure I didn't need those extra calories but it was worth it. The cake was moist and chocolatey and very smooth going down. Next time I'll have to try the chocolate cake shake. 

I'm back in Chicago in 2 weeks. It'll be hard to avoid Portillo's next trip. See you soon.
They got rid of my favorite salad, Chicken pecan!  Now I'm forced to get a cheeseburger! HA! The food here is amazing!

Portillo's? 

Oh, you mean the fortress of awesomeness and staple of fast-casual food in the Western suburbs? Yeah. That place. It's busy, but the wait times are not bad. And, it's busy for a reason.

Let me just count the ways:
- Hot dogs
- Burgers
- Italian beef (sweet and hot peppers, and DIP that shiz!)
- Cheese fries
- Onion rings
- Breaded chicken sandwiches (droooool)
- Barnelli's Chopped Salad
- Barnelli's Chopped Salad (I said it twice because it's incredible)
- Barnelli's Chopped Salad (yep)

This location is particularly awesome because they give you a huge wedge of fresh bread with your Chopped Salad. Everything just tastes so good here!

Okay, we know the food is good. Let's build on it:
- Desserts (chocolate cake, cake shake...shut your mouth!)
- Beer (whaaaaaaaaat!)
- Drive thru
- Tons of seating

Finally, if you like cowboys, this place is Wild West themed. I have a showdown with my cheese fries whenever I go there and I WIN. Every. Single. Time.

Was a little confused when I first walked in because I wasn't sure what counter to order from but it didn't take much time to figure out. It was my first time eating there so I wasn't sure what exactly to order but the girl at the register was really helpful with the menu. I decided that since I was in the Chicago area I would order a Chicago style hot dog and onion rings. I was afraid that one hot dog wasn't going to be filling but with all the toppings that come on a Chicago dog it was just enough! It was so delicious and the place was so kitschy that I can't wait to take my family here when they come into town!
Classic to stop at portillos when in town.  Great ambiance.  Food is solid.  I've had better italian beef but still one of my favorites.

This place is a must if you visit chicago, the food is great and the service will bring you back....dont be afraid to let go of any sort of diet you are on to try the many things they have to offer here.

Well done!

I hope to be back soon!

Portillo's never disappoints. I always go for the hamburger because it has the grill flavor. Their Halibut Fish Fillet sandwich is also worth trying. The tartar sauce and the meatiness of the fish fillet makes it worth the $5-ish sandwich. The atmosphere is decorated with an old-west type of decorations which bring about a unique eating experience. Will come back again!

This place knows how to run a business. 

I love their chopped salad, hot dogs, beefs. Everything is good here. You can always expect consistency.

Such great food. Kept it simple for the longest time and just got a hotdog. Tried the chicken sandwich and now I'll never look back! Next time I'm trying pasta. Can't wait! It gets really busy so I understand the wait. The drive through system they have is great.

If u want a scrumptious healthy dinner u should come here. There chopped salads are the best and fresh. It fills you up and the best thing it is good for you. But if u r like my parents who wants something non healthy then get the pasta. It is always tasty. The best thing is the quantity is amazing one dinner portion can feed 4 ppl. 


Also the drive thru employees are friendly and love to crack at a joke :). 

Omg I forgot to mention there Delicious chocolate cake, you need to try it

What's not to love about Portillos? 

My problem is that I don't venture out. If I'm at Portillos I'm ordering one of the following: hot dog, chopped salad, fries or a chocolate cake shake. Or all the above. I'm not a huge beef person but sometimes when I see it on a croissant, I'm tempted.

Service and quality at Portillos are always exceptional. This location does get EXTREMELY busy at lunch and dinner and most hours in between but that place is a well-oiled machine.

I do think it is a little over-priced but that food is just so worth it!

Yummo!  We took the Metra from the city to visit some friends.  They picked us up and we headed to Portillo's.  We were in Chicago for a quick weekend getaway and in doing research had heard so many good things out Portillo's so we were excited to be having lunch there.  

We ordered a hot dog, italian beef sandwich, fries w/ cheese, and chocolate cake.  The place was hopping and the food was extremely satisfying!  We'll definitely be back next time we are in town.  It's been three days and I'm still thinking about the hot dog!

Usually I love this place and I don't know what happened today.  I went through the drive through which maybe had about 5 cars in it.  They were getting ready for peak hours which I understand.  Someone takes your order via paper hands it to you give you a ticket.  Next person reads it off and then you go to pay.  This is where I was a little ticked.  These two Spanish ladies were more interested in talking to each other vs taking my credit card which I had out for about two minutes.   She walked as I followed the car in front of me to almost the window.  She finally then stopped talking to her friend and took my credit card.  Then someone else came running out to his post to help out and she had the audacity to say to him "Finally Louis!!" I was a little shocked because it took her 3 minutes to finally talk to me to take me credit card.  So I finished paying and got told to pull up to the window.  I am sorry but I hate when I have to go to the window to get my food.  The reason I go through the Portillo's drive through is to get served my food by an employee not me having half my short body out of the car because I can't reach your four and a half foot high window.  Oh and also I asked for no ice and I got ice.  Not a good experience today.  I get it, it was peak hours.  But you shouldn't be talking to someone when there is a customer in front of you waiting for your to finish your conversation. 

Thanks
Always wonderful! Now that you're not owned by Dick Portillo, please, please don't change anything. That would be a huge mistake!

This places credit card machines were down on 4/24 so they made carbon copies of your card. Well apparently they can't keep anything straight because they charged my card 3 different amounts!!! I got charged over $65 for $19 worth of food!! What you lost other copies so you just figured mine was good enough. Never will I come here again. I wish there was negative stars I could give. They haven't even tried to make it right.

This place sure has a good hotdogs and for only $2.55 They are super juicy and the bun is really good. A little small for the reg ones so you may want to get two. This place gets really busy and when I say busy I mean the drive through had cars backed up through out the parking lot but it looked as though they know what their doing and it really kept moving. My man loves the big Italian beef served on French bread with peppers and its only $6.90. They do serve a smaller one for $4.99.

Standard Portillo's, but this one has a western theme that's different from the other Portillo's locations I've been to in the past. Stopped by here, since I thought I heard(and I ended up being correct in the end) that Solemn Oath Brewery was BYO food, and I didn't want to go there on an empty stomach.

Friendly service, didn't take too long, and my chicken croissant sandwich and onion rings(decided to try that, instead of the usual fries. and I also view how good onion rings are, as a benchmark of how good a fast food place is....) were both really good. The onion rings definitely didn't disappoint, and passed my test! I don't like their policy of charging for bottled water(and decided for water, I'd wait till I hit Solemn Oath to take care of that factor...), so that's the only small factor that sways me away from 4 stars. As it currently stands, 3.5 stars. If my review was alone about the food I ordered, I absolutely would've went with 4 stars, since my food greatly hit the spot.

See you guys (more than likely, I wasn't too fond of the closest competing chain options for food) next time, whenever I choose to rehit up Solemn Oath and need to pregame with food beforehand. :)

I am a vegetarian and ordered a chopped salad with no chicken, no bacon in a clean bowl. The first salad had a piece of chicken in it. They replaced the salad with another but this time it had a piece of bacon. I was done with the salad and wanted a pasta instead. While they made the pasta they told me I was mistaken. The bacon was really a tomato. Sure. Tomatoes smell like smokey bacon these days. Very poor customer service. I am pretty sure the pasta was less expensive as well but I did not get a refund. I really liked their chopped salad too. Too bad. I will never return. Try The Patio instead. It's right down the road next to Kohls.

I recently met up with my uncle in IL. I hadn't been there in many years, n when i asked him to point out a place to have dinner. He suggested to go to Portillo's.
The first thing i did was Yelping it. I was like ok, sounds good but it's fast food.
Went there not expecting much. Boy was I wrong. I ordered their signature Beef Sandwich. The beef was melt in your mouth good. 
What we really enjoyed also was the fact that this location had both Portillo's and Barnelli's Pasta Bowl. My friend was with me and she doesn't eat much meat. So we hopped over to Barnelli's to get their very delicious Veggie sandwich.

Plus
- Super cheap for what you get
- sandwiches are awesome including Veggies
- Has both Portillo's and Barnelli's in the same location
- Drive thru available
- Way better than expected for "fast" food.

Minus
- Cheese fries were super disappointing, i was hoping the cheese would be poured on the fries, but they give us a side of Cheese...
- There was a large LCD monitor that was scrolling through menu items, we got confused because as to what item belong to which restaurant (but again we were noobies to Portillo's)

I love Portillo's and I have the waistline to prove it. Everything is great! Burger, fries and, my favorite, the Italian beef sandwich dipped. You must get it dipped and eat it as it's falling apart, that's the fun of it. The Chopped Salad is also excellent and quickly becoming one of my favorites.

Portillo's has it down though. The drive thru is run like a military operation. You get in and out and no one gets hurt. Same goes for ordering inside as well. 

This place gets crowded though and finding an open table can be hard.

Portillo's is always the first place I eat at after a vacation. It makes me appreciate the fact that no one can hold a candle to this place.

As a connoisseur of sausage, Portillos has the best hot dog in the universe. 

This Portillos has always been consistent with the food and service, it's a MUST if you're in Naperville.

This is the best hotdog/burger joint EVER!!! The hotdog is cheap, juicy, and the best hotdog I've ever eaten in my life. The burger is charred to perfection. If you want good food in Naperville.. You NEED to come here.

What the heck happened. I use to eat here all the time. Went here last night and the beef sandwich had barely any meat. Looked like a subway sandwich. And I asked for hot peppers. Got 3 peppers total on the sandwich. Are they cutting back on the meat now?

The food at Portillo's is always consistently good, fast, etc.  It just is soo chaotic with kids.  I find it so weird that they don't let you order salads in the same line as hot dogs for the kids.  Does every mom have to then wait in two separate lines?  I also feel like every time I visit a Portillo's one item is missing when I get back to the table.  Then I have to leave my 2 yo or leave all our stuff to go back and retrieve.  I also don't understand why there are no coloring supplies or other kiddie distractions that are so common at other restaurants appealing to a family crowd.  But of course all the otther comments about food quality and friendly employees are right on.

Would have been 5 had I not have to go in because  my beef was not hot and I asked for well dipped  and it was still dry. Other than that the manager  Judy was nice remade the order and apologize. Truly  no big deal  to get anyone  in trouble  minor error  but over all I hope it will be good.  What i don't like is they no longer have a meal  so its  5.45 for the beef 2 something  for a small fry and then also for the drink. By my house back  at both locations you can still get a meal.  would I go back yes I love friendly  atmospheres and quinnton the guy who took my order was very nice.

slowest Portillo's drive thru I have ever been to, even during a non-rush, and even with two drive through lanes.  I guess I'm picky because I worked Oswego & Batavia locations in high school.  Maybe if they stopped socializing outside, they could get orders in a bit quicker. 

But, the food wows.  Always does!

Bad staff, they did not even prepare the food order that was paid. Younger employers acting as if they are "soup nazi". Ohh please, the food is good but I would rather go to Buona or other Portillo stores who know how to be courteous and decent to customers, yeah, please..get real soon to pick better employees, how hard is that to wear a hat and stop acting like you are That Important?? just because you get the "affirmative actions"  serving tasty beef, I could name that employees, To  the Corporate officers, ever heard that fast food employees are Replacable, in a Snap ,too!!
We can eat here every night of the week for a month and not have the same thing twice.  The selection is awesome and the food is consistently amazing!!!!  Great value and AWESOME food.
I mean, how can you go wrong??? If you are near any Portillos, get your butt in there !!! Italian beef is always great !! Get the chocolate cake !!!
Char broiled chicken and chilli dogs were delicious. Also the service is nice. Will visit again to try other options.

I've been coming to this Portillo's for well over 10 years. This is one of the best hot dogs you can get in the suburbs. Be sure not to touch the Native American statue as you walk in, though.

This Portillo's also has a Barnelli's attached to it, so you have many pasta and salad options through them--but enough about Barnelli's...

PORTILLO'S has amazing buns, juicy wieners, and fantastic crinkle cut french fries. You'll put your order in at the Northeast corner of the restaurant, get handed a number, and have your meal ready within 5 minutes almost every time. I've never tried the drive-thru, but it does seem to get very long. The inside is great though because they are pretty quick and the decorations are neat to look at while you eat. They serve beer and wine at a separate counter on the Northwest corner of the restaurant.

I recommend the Jumbo hot dog over the regular sized for just a few cents more--definitely worth it. The chili dog is also fantastic, albeit very messy.

Not the first time i got hair in my pasta. also Wish the bathroom didn't reek like raid Everytime I come here. And honestly I only eat here on occasion because no other restaurant is open around this time at night. On the bright side the staff is friendly.

I drive by on the way home from work and stop to make a Catering order! After looking and figuring things out I get sent away telling it is"old school" too come by and order and it's easier if I go home and order online!!!!! Easy for whom???? 
The easiest thing for me, the CUSTOMER!, is to take my order!!! Since I'm here now, and not on my way home at all!!!!! I'll be going to the Oswego office for my catering order, since these people are "in a meeting" and too busy to get a $600 dollar order!

Portillo's has to be one of the best all around restaurants in the Chicago area. From beef sandwiches to hot dogs to salads to dessert you almost can't go wrong with what you order. Best of the best in my opinion: chopped salad, cheeseburger (trust me it's awesome), dipped beef sandwich. I have to take a moment though to recognize two standout menu items that are awesome and if there was a food award or something I would give it to these: the tamale and the eclair cake. Good stuff.

I hit up portillos when I want a damn good hot dog or beef, and want to look at the stuff they have on the walls. Their old bolingbrook location was great with that. This location is a little toned down. Huge building with a huge staff. I never see this location without a line of cars snaked around the building or a line inside snaked too.

Came here for some fuel before doing some geocaching. Got their classic hot dog, and a lemonade. You might wait a bit to get your order, but the wait is worth it.

This location is fantastic!

I have seen 100 people ahead of me and they always get me the food, as fast as possible. Probably the only negative is the drive thru, its not set up for the kind of business this location does. Yet I still come here every chance I get!

YAY PORTILLOS!

Portillos is a Chicago staple. If anyone who once lived here comes into town Portillos is one of the places they always "HAVE TO HAVE!" Ask anyne who once lived here. Great beefs (dipped) and dogs (chicago style). And then you have Barnelli's. It's almost like a hidden gem in a treasure chest of deliciousness. The parmesean sandwich has been a favorite for me for years! Their pastas are great too, their pesto sauce was pretty darn good!

I'm a huge fan of Portillo's and their product wether it's a beef, a burger, tamale, a hot dog or what have you, so that saves this location from getting a single star rating.  The food product is fine here, it's the atrocious drive thru that kills me.  I'm not talking during peak hours either.  It shouldn't take 25 minutes to negotiate an Italian beef sandwich purchase at 2pm on a weekday afternoon when there's only three cars in line.  This has happened to me on more than one occasion at this spot.  Save yourself the headache at hit the location on Ogden Ave. instead.
Good salad. I wasn't too impressed, but it is decent grub.

A cut above most Portillos.  Great service, good order recognition, clean venue, and a private room.

Why are some Portillo's better than others?  Let's admit that the food is pretty much the same, the offerings are pretty much the same (if it also has a Barnelli's).  So here's why this one is a cut above:
* Order Recognition - One of the best Portillos for ensuring you get the correct order even in the biggest of rushes.
* Private Room - A private room is stuffed off to the back right that is good for small gatherings.

Other than that, it's the same as most other Portillos!

Yes Yelpers, I am the weird person who goes to Portillos to order a cheese burger.  I don't want a Chicago Dog or a Polish, I want a simple double cheese burger with ketchup only.  I like the big beef sandwich of course who doesn't, but that does not tend to provide me the same sense of elation that this burger does.  When I compare the Portillos double cheese burger with Five Guys, Meatheads, or Smashburger... Portillos wins hands down every time.  The meat patties are large and the double gives you 2/3lb of burger.  The cheese slices are thick and are always slightly under-melted, so it isn't gooey and has a bit more flavor and bite to it.  The bun, which tastes like a potato bun, if probably just a white but provides the burger a bit extra sweetness and added structure to the mound of burger and cheese inside.  

I rarely ever get a side order since the burger is so large, but when I do the cheese fries hit the spot.  Also, for those who like malts and shakes, then strawberry malt is delicious and is a great way to end a meal.  

Portillos continues to be a place I crave and I look forward to eating here again very soon.
I had the Italian beef with cheddar n sweet pepper & the Chicago dog...both were delicious! :D
Always eat here when I'm in town :) everything is delicious. So fast. And no need to tip!
Two words: chocolate cake

First came here about 4 years ago and haven't had a bad experience yet.

The decorations, lighting, and table set-up give this Portillo's a really nice, comfortable, and causal feel. It's one of those places that you would rather dine-in than get it to-go, just because being in there makes you feel so "at home". Plus they have a lot of booths and closed-off areas that add to this feel. The interior and bathrooms are clean and taken care of, so no complaints there.

I usually get either the Italian Beef or the Chicago style hot dog with everything on it + fries (delish!). The great part about Portillo's is that your order is super customizable. You can add/subtract pretty much whatever you want and it doesn't really inconvenience anyone. The cashier takes your order on a Portillo's bag, then calls it out to the rest of the crew over mic. The staff has always been really friendly & helpful, and they're pretty spot on with getting your order right.

I don't think I've ever ordered anything from the Barnelli's side, but they have a big selection as well.

For some odd reason I've never taken the time to check out Portillo's.  If I could go back in time to my first trip to Chicagoland, I would punch my past self in the face and then offer a Portillo's Big Beef with hot peppers as amends.  I'm pretty sure I could forgive my future self for showing the error of my choices.

I visited the frontier-themed location in Naperville.  The staff was friendly, my order was taken quickly, and after a short wait my number was called and I picked up my food.  The sandwich I ordered (Big Beef) came out on bread that had the perfect consistency of crusty/chewy with that burst of au jus without falling apart.  The beef itself was good, but was sliced so thin that it disintegrated before I could savor the flavor.  The hot pepper/celery/carrot/onion/cauliflower pickled mix was very new to me, and I don't believe I can go back to what I considered "hot peppers" prior.  Looking around there were a lot of customers, the traffic director in the drive-thru should have been my first clue to this place's popularity.  I appreciated that even with the amount of customers, the restaurant was clean, thanks to the staff that was working hard to keep it that way.  I look forward to my next trip, and if you are visiting the area- make sure to stop in and experience it for yourself!

As one reviewer said, good food, good service. The staff does a great job keeping the place clean. I had the arrabiata, my wife had the chicken parm sandwich. My pasta was cooked just right, the sauce was spicy but very flavorful. My wife said her sandwich was really good and did not need anything at all.

My only complaint is that I cannot order from the Portillo's side while placing an order at the Barnelli's side. I was really in the mood for a beef sandwich but I did not feel like waiting in line a second time. This is the only reason I gave this place three stars.

Portillo's is the reason I will never move from Chicago, or at least Chicagoland.  And if I have to, it better to be California close enough to the one or two there.

Italian Beef, best around.  Dogs, be them hot or chili, best around.  Great fries, fantastic cheese fries.  It's the standard by which all other food is judged.  Just today I got a beef sandwich and thought "this is really good, but for a dollar less I could have gotten it in half the time at Portillo's"

Chili Dog, Italian Beef dipped with hot peppers, fries and a drink.  Delicious lunch, and if you play your cards right you have enough left over beef for a delicious midnight snack.

Food is ALWAYS prompt.  Tables ALWAYS get cleaned fast.  No exceptions.  And that's for EVERY Portillo's.  I've never seen the service or quality of food slip; ever.

The few times I can pry myself from the Portillo's line into Barnelli's I'm NEVER disappointed.  I can remember when I was a kid and it was Barney's Ribs.  And boy are those ribs goooood.  But even since the re-branding Barnelli's focus shifted from Ribs to Pastas and Salads.  All of which are great.   Salads are great because if you're eating light you can easily half the salad now, and finish it later.

Large mug of Miller Lite, slice of chocolate shake from the catering counter, and then send a tub of beef to my unfortunate friends who had the misfortune of moving from Chicago.

Let's face it, the first thing a college kid says when they come home is "we're going to portillo's"

If there was a 6 star rating, I would give it.

If you're from Chicago, you're already a HUGE portillos fan! Which is why I'm writing this review for all the non-midwestern travelers out there looking for some darn decent Chicago food!

Hubby & I come here as a last resort when we're hungry or just in the mood for portillos. Fortunately this portillos also has a barnellis which has pastas and salads. Here are my recommendations: 
- Italian Beef (a MUST for a portillos newbie)
- a decent HAMBURGER . . . I love portillos hamburgers! they're lean, with huge slice of lettuce, tomato, topped with a darn good buttery bun and only $3.75! (*cheeseburger additional $.50) 
- chopped salad at barnellis (delicious! no other salad beats this one ---i swear by it)
- pesto pasta bowl--my favorite pasta at PORTILLOS
- Portillos award winning chocolate cake --- i'm not a huge fan of cake, but this cake is delicious!!! seriously makes you want more. 

ALSO, the staff at this portillos is amazing! They are always friendly, quirky and funny when they call out your numbers. There's this one lady that will actually sing a rhyme when she calls out a number like "number 5, it's time to fly high, your order has arrived!!!" She's so hilarious...LOVE the enthusiasm of all the workers here. =)
Portillo's is the best from burgers to beefs to sausage, Italian or Polish. Wish we had them in Florida. They'd make a killing...just off me.

My in laws took me here after saving my night with the whole car fiasco. 
*Thanks!*Having had a chocolate cake shake and fries many years ago during a snow storm left me with sour memories of the place. I had a baked potato and minestrone soup which was fine for a 9:30 dinner. The decor is similar to TGI Friday's and about a dozen other Americana restaurants. Friendly service and definitely something for omnivore, vegetarian and vegan patrons.
Big beef and cheese fries. This is a good location because they also have Barnelli's so folks who don't like beef sandwiches can eat here too.

I love their italian beef, every time I come to chicago it's a must have.

Delish...

The food is always good except when your order is messed up. This happens & normally it's not that big of a deal; this time was different. The lact of professionalism & lack of customer service made my experience HORRIBLE!!! Jerome should not be dealing with any customers.

I have visited this location numerous times and I have nothing but good things to say. The prices are reasonable and the dining area is huge! I really like Barnellis. I usually get the chicken Parmesan dinner which is really good.

I'm a Barnelli's fanatic. That being said, if you don't get my order right, I get upset. It is a treat to go here and it better not be wasted. I haven't gotten pick up from here. If I did, they might lose a star, since that's where Portillo's/Barnelli's goes wrong. The food quality (of the one thing I always order) stays at a steady "delicious" level. It doesn't take too long, and there's always somewhere to sit even when it's crowded. This is more than I can say about any others in the chain - especially the loathsome Willowbrook location. *shakes fist*

Portillo's still has great service, I only wish the same could be said about their food. Unhealthy, yes like always. Large portions, yes like always. Quality - Nope, since their expansions the quality has taken a real dive. Maybe if McDonalds raises their prices to Portillo levels their perception could change to the surrounding Chicagoans in line?
Way overpriced; way, way, way too salty; food often cold. Workers are usually friendly, although I rarely eat at Portillo's for the above reasons.

Portillo's is okay food.  I think I've been to this location more than the one in Chicago on Ontario st.  My sister is always dragging me here every time we go to Naperville to go shopping at the mall there.  Some say they have the best hot dogs ever but also I hear that about Hot Doug's.  Not sure because I don't eat hot dogs.  I like Portillo's fish though and chicken sandwich.  Also like the cheese fries.  Good fast service most of the time unless they are really busy then you are waiting in line a long time or the drive thru for a long time as well.

We have been to this portillo several times. The italian beef is good but they charge extra for peppers. We actually tried the barnelli's famous ribs this time, and they are ok. The ribs are slightly dry but it does come with soup, salad and bread. Not bad for $13.

I've returned to Portillo's many times due to it's consistent food and friendly staff.  This location, with it's distinct pink exterior and Western theme, is in need of a renovation (or at least a seriously deep cleaning).  And something struck me this trip - you never see a coupon or deal at Portillos.  I understand they don't need to, but I thought of it just as I had to step into the Barnelli's line and get my 7 yr old a $9 buttered noodles and drink.  That's right - nine dollars.
Always good.  I've never had a bad meal here.  Drive-thru can be a little bit of a cluster but they get you thru as quick as possible.

Portillo's really knows the restaurant business.

Good Food - check.
Good Service - check.
Good menu - check.
Unique style - check.
Quality - check.

Sure, they are known for great beef sandwiches and hot dogs, but the really great locations have a Barnelli's and this one doesn't disappoint.  

With Barnelli's, you also have great pasta dishes and additional salad selections.....now if only they would build a restaurant in Plainfield or South Naperville!!

Good food - though sometimes cold.  Other locations are better.  This has horrible horrible parking.  They screw up the order 1/4 of the time and don't bother trying to talk to the manager - even if you can find him - they have no compensation.  The manager offered to make my correct food - if I paid for it.  When I said I did pay for it but you gave me X - he said they do not give refunds and I would need to pay for my new food. (again)

Whenever I visit one of our branch offices in the Chicago suburb area, I must get some of Portillo's great hot dogs and beef sandwich. In CA we have In-N-Out Burgers. In Chicago, I go to it's equivalent in hot dogs at Portillo's. Delicious food at good price.
My favorite location of Portillo's where the food is absolutely fantastic & the floor's are clean & the service is great. I pretty much lived here for my last four years I lived in IL.
The Lasagna at Barnelli's is TO DIE FOR!
My favorite portillo's in the area.over all a great place to eat.  Very fast drive through even with long lines.  Friendly, courteous staff, and delicious food.

How you like your Italian Beef in Chicago is about as diverse as the argument about how you like your pizza.  There's a few different ways to do it, but when you find it, it's manna from heaven.

Portillo's (10/9/2007) does their beef in the way I was raised to enjoy it.  Gonnella bread filled with slow roasted Italian beef and only the clear dark au jus.  I do mine "dipped, no peppers".  This means that once they assemble the beef, they actually dip it into the vat that contains the au jus.  The messier the better!

My wife had the Double Cheeseburger with Bacon.  Burgers are FLAME grilled here and only made when ordered, so they are fantastic.  A double is 1/2 pound of meet and it comes on the ol' corn dusted kaiser bun.

I think I've seen numerous reviews of Portillo's french fries.  Crinkle cuts, always fresh (they must sell tons of fries a day) crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

This particular Portillo's is one of their hybrids, where they have regular Italian food available also through their Barnelli's window.  When you walk in the restaurant, you walk down the main center aisle and you go left if you want Portillo's and right if you want Barnelli's.  I think this is where this particular spot of theirs goes wrong (thus only 4 stars, not 5).  I do believe they aren't doing this moving forward as they open new locations, but if it wasn't for the fact that my wife and I both wanted Portillo's tonight, we would have had to stand in separate lines, pay separately and order our food.

I saw several families who had to order in shifts, or the parents split up and went in the different lines.  However I saw one couple where the woman actually reached across the velvet rope separating the lines to grab her husbands credit card, only to give it back to him as he went to place his order for Portillo's.

Otherwise, Portillo's is consistent, ALWAYS and the food makes me remember back to this little old stand in Chicago called Chick's, where you'd get your beef and they'd roll up a huge helping of fries with it all in one huge package.  Ahh, the old Vienna dog stands of old.  Where ARE they all going?

I go to school in California and the moment I get picked up at the airport by my family I demand we go to Portillo's. I practically get withdrawal symptoms when I think about the hot dogs, french fries and the chocolate cake. This Portillo's is the one I went to the most when I lived in Naperville because I worked at the Fox Valley Mall, but they are all good. I also hear they have a Portillo's in SoCal but I have yet to check it out.  Great place for casual dates, to go with coworkers, the family. There is something for everyone. I actually got dumped at this Portillo's (it was a 4 year relationship, lame) but that doesn't stop me from eating here :) It's just that good, a must if you have out-of-towners.
Very yummy. I am new to Chicago and this is the first place I went. The parking lot and drive through is always full, but we did not have to wait for a seat.
Love Portillo's can't live without it!!! Excellent food, excellent service!!!!

Decided to give this place a try last minute and we were impressed! Everything taste so homemade, it is a little costly but for all the food you are getting with the homemade taste this place is great! 

We saw a Purple Heart on the wall which belonged to the owner which was pretty neat as well.

Decided to try Danelli's for the 1st time last night and i can honestly say it was good italian food. Everything we ordered tasted homemade and not processed. The staff was extremely friendly but our sever was not attentive to our table. I had to remind her about our cheesy bread after waiting 15 min and she forgot my brother in laws coke re fill. She also over charged me for an extra beer when we received our bill. I am not a friend of inconsistency but other then that she was ok.

Going back to the food we ordered Lasagna, and a 15" sausage pizza and it came out in a timely manner and was very good. I really enjoyed the Lasagna my wife ordered and can say it was in my top 5. The pizza was pretty good but the crust was a bit thick for my liking and lacked favor. Overall, i was satisfied with the food but probably won't be a regular as the price is  high for Italian food in the area. We spent $100 and only ordered Lasagna, pizza, dessert, cheesy bread, 3 beers and 2 wines. I understand they have been around for 36 years but lower your prices a bit if you want people to come back more frequent.

Danelli's has the best lasagna in the state!    I've tried many other lasagnas and this is the best!  Great meatballs & dessert as well.  A hidden treasure.  I recommend having a few more specials/variety the weekends.

Great hidden gem in Oswego. Excellent Italian food with friendly service. The seating area is small but quaint. We shared 3 entrees and a small pizza to sample the food. Chicken parmesan was excellent. Spaghetti and meatballs were the size of a baseball. Lasagna was a home run and couldn't stop eating it. I eventually had to and could only finish half. The small pizza was very good and enough for two people. My family and I highly recommend this location and we will be back!

Owners - thanks for the Cicero Beverage Co. soda!

Went for a recent dinner.  inside is super small but nice.  I had spaghetti and meatballs and my wife had lasagna,  both were HUGE portions and were nice.  nothing to race about but good enough to go back.

service was very nice.

All in all a good family place.

One of the best Italian restaurants around!!! Had the lasagne and speghetti, both were excellent but really excited to try the pizza next time!!! Cute, quaint, and excellent service! Not a lot of seating but that's what made it so unique!!! Definitely a new family favorite!!!

We have been coming to Danelli's for over 20 years, visiting all their different locations. The food is wonderful, the atmosphere is wonderful, and the owners and their employees couldn't be nicer. It's a homey, family environment and pleasing their customers with tasty options is what they strive to do. Danelli's will always be our favorite!

Cute little restaurant. First time for me and second time for my husband but it's been a long time. Thought a quick dinner before the Hawks game sounded fun. Pizza seemed like a safe choice based on Yelp reviews. And we figured if you can't make a good pizza, we're not investing in the pasta/entrÃ©es. We had the Abbondanza pizza. Two people + 12in pizza=lots of leftovers. Very filling and tasted great! 

8 smaller booths and 2 long tables. It really is small inside. Bottled beer, wine available. Pasta, entrÃ©es and sandwiches available. We'll be back to try the pasta and entrÃ©es. 

Service was good. Really nice and friendly. Restaurant was full so we stood at the bar for a few minutes until a booth opened up. Short on time and parking lot is full? Order out. Definitely worth stopping in.
I was AMAZED. The pizza was delicious and they had awesome local pop! I would recommend in a heart beat!

Hubby and I came here for dinner. I did not eat;  not for any reason other than, trying to stay away from pasta. I know...an Italian restaurant-really? Well, I had thought I might be able to get eggplant parmigiano and nix the pasta. No luck. They do offer a chicken parm. but I just wasnt interested. 

Hubs had a penne abruzzo with spicy sausage (14.95), which was a fair portion and came with soup or salad and bread.
It was disappointing that the bread was not warmed. It was served with foil wrapped pats of butter, rather than the traditional olive oil and parmigiano.

Service was very good and quite attentive without being obnoxious.  It is the smallest restaurant we have been at in a while, if not, ever. You really feel as if you are having a home cooked meal at someone's home.  The owner puts on his playmix and makes the rounds to the regulars, who seem right at home. 

I believe we will return to try the pizza which looked rather hearty and delicious. The atmosphere is very homey but could do well with a good freshening of decor.
This is a no frills restaurant where you can get a simple meal, that is priced just a bit higher than what is appropriate.
The finest homemade Italian food you can find here in our neck of the woods without going downtown, im there every chance i get....

I have had this place bookmarked for awhile, but since they don't have delivery I always just skipped it. Well I finally decided to place an order an pick it up, since it was on the way home from my wife's work. We ordered what yelper's talked most about, stuffed shells, cheesy bread, and a small half pepperoni half cheese pizza. Everything was pretty good. The stuffed shells came with 3 large shells covered in marinara and topped with a mountain of melted cheese. Delicious. The cheesy bread, which I thought was the star of the meal, was this French bread with butter and garlic topped with again, a monstrous amount of melty cheese. It was amazing. Lastly the pizza, you guessed it, cheese central. I really appreciated these guys don't skimp on the deliciousness and the quality. I mean if you're going to put pounds of cheese over everything it better taste good. I was a fan. The food is heavy and this a great joint to go to or pick up after a night of drinking or you just want some good ole cheese sauce and grease. I noticed they have a lot more to offer on the menu than pizza so I'll be back to try more.

After living in this area for 10 years, I just tried this place a couple of weeks ago and wish I had gone sooner! Yes, it is small inside. But it is comfortable and it seems most people pick-up, so getting a table is not a problem. From the second I walked in the service was great...both friendly and quick. I tried some of the bruschetta, antipasto salad, a shrimp pasta dish, their pizza, and tiramisu. I have not one complaint or criticism about any of what I tasted! Everything was portioned well and simply delicious, I'd rather go here than the Italian places in Naperville or out towards Fox Valley any day.

I'm not entirely sure what to say here, my experience wasn't bad, it wasn't good, it just kind of was...

The staff were friendly enough. The food was okay, but reminded me more of a homemade style and less of restaurant quality. We tried the stuffed pizza. The pizza itself was ok, but the sauce tasted like it came out of a can and the crust was nothing amazing. The garlic bread was pretty good and the wings weren't bad, but then there was the Tiramisu. I think it was covered in Hershey's chocolate sauce and then had cherries and whip cream on top, kinda like an Ice cream Sundae?? The Tiramisu itself was ok, but I'm pretty sure it should never be topped that way, just strange. At the very least no Chocolate sauce... 

My only other question is why they have an enormous bar that takes up a large portion of the dining area, when the restaurant is clearly not a bar!?!?

Overall, it's okay, but nothing extraordinary.

A local business that not only has dine-in, but caters as well? Danelli's operates quite the business out of their tiny location. 

It's a small, quaint restaurant with no decor to write home about, but it's cozy and comfortable. Dim lighting and a darker interior just make you feel like you're in your living room eating Italian food! Nothing on the menu stuck out as my favorite and I haven't dined-in in years, but would definitely return.

The people who deliver the catering are very helpful in assembling all the food in the right way. Salads are huge with great dressings! I'm note a huge mostaccioli fan but it's a standard catering dish, and they do it well.

Very small place, maybe ten tables in the whole restaurant, but very clean and comfortable. Not busy at all, in fact we were the only customers there, which had me worried at first but this place has been around for a long while, so maybe it was just an off night? Our waitress (the only waitress working) was outstanding. Very nice and friendly. The food was great. Huge portions and definitely the best Italian food I've had out here in the suburbs. I would compare it to Rosebuds in Naperville because the portions were so large and it was absolutely delicious, but the prices were much more reasonable and it's not a fancy shmancy place. Get the cheesy bread, bruschetta and chicken parm. Amazing.

I love Danelli's! 

The inside is a bit small, so we normally order take-out. Their pizzas are amazing, and if you like them on Facebook you could win a free one. :)

My husband orders the stuffed shells and says they are also excellent. When we eat in, the atmosphere is very homey, and welcoming. I'd suggest this restaurant for a date night or family outing!

Daniellis is ok, pizza is good but cooked inconsistently.  Some times over cooked or under.  When done right it's tasty.  Went in for food and lasagna was too salty but enjoyed their salad and Garlic dressing.  Cute atmosphere.  Worth a night out to.

This is probably one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever been to!! It is true homestyle Italian cooking at its best. Definitely tops the popular italian places like Maggiano's. I've had the lasagna, spaghetti and meatballs, antipasto salad and their pizza. My favorite pizza is Danielli's Special. Prices are reasonable and they do have coupns for dine-in. I usually get take out here as the restaurant itself is rather small, but I've also ate inside and had exceptional service.
Love this place. Delicious pizza and pasta. Their sauce is really good. Service is wonderful!!

TRY IT, YOU'LL LIKE IT!  We've been patrons of Danelli's since the early 90's, and at their Yorkville location (which is unfortunately now closed).  This place is just so charming and quaint.  Their food is a bit bland, but has always tasted fresh, with super generous portions.  Their bread could be a bit fresher - or oven heated would be a nice touch.

Frankly, we think they may be struggling to stay open in today's economy, and would not be surprised if the order-taker is also the cook - thus the rather harried service.  But that only makes us want to patronize this place more as it has become a fixture in our culinary rotations over the years, and it would be a real shame if it were to ever close as there just aren't any places like this around any more in this area.  

So Try It, You'll Like It!!
This place is perfect! It's old school Italian and the food is always good. My wife and I love to go on dates here. Very quite atmosphere and I highly recommend the daily specials!!!!

If you don't know what you're looking for you can easily miss this place. It's small and unassuming appearance give it is charm. An old fashioned true family restaurant, the owner stopped by outlet table and chatted with us while the food was being prepared. 
It wasn't very busy when we were there so service was quick. There are only about 20 tables so it can fill up quick. 
I had pasta and it was good, the sauce was a little runny for my taste. My wife loves the place and I'm kind of picky so I don't hold it against them.
If you're looking for a quiet place for dinner this is a winner!

This place was always a treat to go to as a child, it was down the street from my eye doctor and the only reason I looked forward to getting my eyes checked!! I moved to Oswego in June and was ecstatic to live only about 5 minutes away! Their sandwiches are amazing, meatball and the godfather beef with cheese and garlic butter are oh so YUM! The cheesy garlic bread is an absolute MUST. thin crust pizza is good but the stuffed pizza is amazing!!! Cozy quaint interior, hometown feel, friendly service... They'd be 5 stars if they only delivered!!! 
We're lucky to live so close but I still haven't found a great pizza place for delivery in Oswego as of yet :(
Nice cozy little place in Oswego that serves up some excellent Italian and pizza. The service was fantastic as well!

Quaint place and a nice option considering all the boring chain restaurants in the area.

I had the lasagna which appealed to me based on using Italian sausage instead of ground beef.  It was tasty, but needed seasoning as other reviewers have mentioned.  Maybe a little oregano besides the parmesan cheese in the shaker jar.  It came with sliced italian bread that was a little on the stale side.

We also had a small cheese/sausage/pepperoni pizza.  The lasagna portion was so large we took most of the pizza home, which was very tasty the next day.

As another reviewer commented, it was cold inside the restaurant and not very comfortable.

We visited on a week night and were two of about a dozen people there. We were waited on by a man who I suspect may have been cooking as well.  We asked for recommendations and was told the Lasagna was a favorite. We ordered the cheesy garlic bread for an appetizer and it was wonderful. Although the pizza smelled good we went with entrees. My husband ordered the lasagna and I the Chicken Parmesan. The lasagna looked nice but my husband thought the sauce could use a kick of seasoning. He did like the Italian sausage that was in it. I did not care for my Chicken Parmesan at all. It was just a cooked chicken breast, no breading, under sauce and cheese. It was dry, tough, and tasteless. The price for a glass of wine was a bit extreme considering the size of the glass. The room was a bit stuffy and humid making it a bit uncomfortable in there. We will probably go back and try the pizza. 

Don't get me wrong. The place is cute and has charm but the two entrees lacked that something special.
Been eating at Danelli's for many years.  Best pizza in the area.  Soups are fantastic.  Great service.  If you'd rather support a local business than a chain, definitely go to Danelli's!

We come to Oswego once or twice a month for business and have come to love dining at Danelli's.  It's a very small, red-checker tableclothed neighborhood restaurant run by brothers.  The pizza and calzones are very good, as are the pasta dishes.  I did not care for the chicken parmesan as it was bland unbreaded chicken tenders, not a flavorful breaded chicken breast.  That is the only negative.  They recently revamped their salad which is much fresher and a nice mixture of greens, and the bread came out warm and crusty.  I would recommend having a bottle of olive oil and parmesan cheese at the table for the bread in addition to the little butter packets.  Being 100% Italian, I know good Italian food as my grandmother from Italy had a restaurant and was a great cook.  Danelli's provide good homemade recipes.  I like dining here so this quaint little place stays in business.  It's a breath of fresh air in Oswego!

Great Food, I mean Great Food! 

We live literally five blocks from the place and our landlord kept telling us that we must eat there. After driving by it, at least 100 times, we decided to try their menu. 

When we arrived there was NOT ONE OTHER PERSON in the place, which would seem indicative of the caliber of food. As we entered' we noticed there was only one waitress working. From the moment we walked in she was eager to help and gave use great service. My husband asked for food suggestions and wanted to know what Danelli's is known for amongst its patrons. She let us know that if we were looking for something other than pizza, go for; the lasagna, sausage and peppers, or chicken Parmesan. Boy was she dead on! I do have to add, that when we tried to get our ticket it was difficult to find our waitress. I think that she felt that since we were her only customers, she could work on her other job duties and retreated to the kitchen. It was at least 5 -10 minutes before we saw her and could flag her down for our check.

My husband had the lasagna and said that he couldn't even identify all the different cheeses. The lasagna was obviously made from the freshest of ingredients and after it was cooked it was covered in, yet another layer of yummy cheese. After the lasagna was made, it was put back in the oven to bake and brown the cheese. Hot, fresh, and yummy. 

I ordered the Chicken Parmesan, which was also made from the freshest ingredients. Although it was tasty and the chicken did not seem processed was a little dry and there was no breading. The pasta and cheese were also seemingly made from love, then put in the oven to bake and brown. Again...hot, fresh, and kind of yummy. 

Overall... 

Service: Great. Yet I am not sure if it was great because we are the only ones in the joint or it is always that way. 

Food: Amazing Lasagna, Good Chicken Parmesan 

Beverages: Only Beer and Wine (and not a good selection) 

Atmosphere: LOVED IT!

Lasagna: huge and good.  Everything else was somewhat disappointing.  I had the stuffed shells with ricotta and spinach.  It was drenched in a very tart/too tomato pastey tasting sauce, then baked.  A previous reviewer was spot on about the wine.  $5-$6 is not too bad a price for a glass of wine, but if it is vinegar-y old Woodbridge, then it's too much!  We may go back to try the pizza.  It was very cold in there, despite the smallness of the place.  Make sure you communicate CLEARLY to the waiter if you are in a hurry to leave or need something.  I think he was in the back a lot cooking?
I'd say this was a hidden gem. Food & service were great.

Tonight I went to Danellis for the first time.  I moved to Oswego from Michigan about a year ago and must say the restaurant scene in Oswego leaves much to be desired compared to what I'm used to.  Danellis was a pleasant change of pace.  It was still almost 90 degrees outside but very pleasant inside.  The dinner salads that came with our meal were remarkably fresh.   I had the broccoli chicken cheese Alfredo that was on special.  It was delicious. Pasta was done just right.  My man had the spaghetti and meatballs (his stand by at Italian places).  He said the sauce was somewhat bland.  The portion was large and the pasta was done just right. (I hate soggy overdone pasta) good old chewey Italian bread came with the meal and was delish.  Did you know this place has been around for 35 years????
Ambience is quaint, casual.  You feel like you're in the old Italian neighborhood.  Felt very relaxed afterwards.  Prices seemed reasonable.

A very quaint & small local restaurant but don't let the size fool you!  When you walk in, you feel like you've really escaped the franchises of the world.  Seating is tight so don't be alarmed.  The rustic decor and ambience is welcoming and casual. Menu has all of your favorite type of Italian dishes.  The lasagna is HUGE and delicious!  This dish can easily be shared by two diners.  The stuffed shells are good. Enjoyed the filling more than the shells.  Bread is complimentary and is okay.  Would suggest serving it with an olive oil dipping sauce instead of butter packets.  Service is quick and efficient.  Prices are okay.  Not the cheapest but I'm sure they are pricing according to their needs against the corporate chains.  It's always nice to patronize a local business!

I like Danelli's. It's good, it's quaint, and it's friendly. Don't go there for the decor... go there for the pizza, pasta, and salads. If you like cheese covered pasta, you'll love Danelli's. There isn't very good seating for large parties. A group of four is comfortable. If you have more, you may consider going elsewhere.
Had a coupon to try this restaurant and they delivered.  The stuffed shells were great and for the price worth it!  Lots of food, nice host and although a small place it was good.

Great fresh food and large portions! Love the pizza, spaghetti baked with cheese and tonight had the warm marinated chicken salad with lots of fresh veggies in a huge bowl! Also, try the tiramasu!!! The owners make you feel ike you are eating at their home.......very friendly and homey atmosphere!!

4 smiles for this place, and I'm not clowning around!

Flow: This is fast casual BBQ.  You get in the line and the food is provided to you as you move along.  There were a few folks in the line ahead of me, but it moved fast.  You pay at the end of the line. You can get bottled pops or fountain, if you get fountain, you'll make your way over to the self-serve pop dispenser.

Table/Utensils...  After that, get your own utensils from the handy dispensers near the pop dispenser.  I like this because they are sanitary.  No reusing utensils here. The tables hold a variety of BBQ sauces with explanations printed on the holder.  Plenty of rolled paper towel napkins are available.

Surroundings: The place is usually very clean, except for the trash area.  You're responsible for emptying your own trash, which is OK, but because meals are served on paper lined metal trays, and because this is BBQ, stuff gets a little yucky. The holes to peel off your paper into the trash are not big enough.

Service: The folks behind the counter are pleasant and helpful, and most importantly, smiling, and not on their phones!

Food: I went for the "two meat" combo and took the burnt ends and the brisket.  Comes with two sides.  I got baked beans and pecan cobbler.  The burnt ends were crisp and tender, and not fatty - loved them.  The brisket was just a tad dry for me, but had excellent flavor. Baked beans are top notch, and the pecan cobbler was moist and tasty. Oh, my Chocolate Cherry Almond milkshake was good enough to go back for all on its own!!

Bathrooms were clean and stocked.  Men's room has one little unusual thing, and that is that the urinals are mounted like six inches from the floor - they still do what they are supposed to do. 

Fast pleasant service, good food, good surroundings. Go check this place out for yourself.  A very good choice for fast BBQ.

I had been hearing the commercials on WSCR for a while, and heard about the turkeys they were cooking up for Thanksgiving. Ordering the turkey was easy enough - and I selected this location for pickup since it's closer to me. The morning of the pickup, I ordered some additional items through their online system and planned to just quickly pick it all up at the scheduled time. Upon arrival, the staff was very nice and the turkey was ready to go, but they had no clue about the online order. I showed them my confirmation email and they were able to pull it up manually in their system, but needed some time to pull together the order. It was an additional 15 minute wait, so no biggie. 

The food itself was just ok. The turkey was pretty dry before we even reheated it. And it only had a very slight smokey flavor. For the most part, bland and dry throughout though. Even my 6 year-old noticed. We reheated it in our steam oven, which helped a bit but I was hoping for more...especially paying $74 (incl tax) for a small turkey. The St. Louis dry rub ribs were ok. The meat was difficult to get off the bone though. Actually, pretty tough. I had to tear meat off pretty forcefully with my teeth. Fries and chicken tenders were all fine. Pretty basic, nothing worth noting. The spinach and sweet potato sides were pretty good. 

These fast casual bbq dining chains seem to be hit or miss. I really was hoping for more here, after hearing those commercials quite often. You can definitely find better ribs in Chicagoland though..mostly from the hole in the wall spots. And I'll just stick to handling our turkeys at home. I really, really was hoping for better here.

I finally made the trip to RUB and had a decent experience.  I like the interior and atmosphere of the place-lively but not crazy.   Drink station had a lot of choices and they have a lot of varied sauces.

The meat was o.k.   Ribs, pulled pork and burnt ends are what I tried.   The burnt ends were less "burnt" than most I've had but were tasty.  The other two meats were just average.  Spicy sauce was good on top.

Sides were good (the bbq beans) and subpar (mashed potatoes and gravy, which was blah) while my boys said the mac 'n cheese was good as were the home cut fries.  Brussels sprouts were o.k.

It's just east of the Oak Brook Square area on 22nd Street-easy to get to and a lot of parking-great location here as there aren't many similar places in that part of the Western burbs.  I'll go back again for sure as their menu including side choices is big.

We ordered a turkey here for Thanksgiving. Call it cheating -- but it was a huge hit with everyone. It was cheaper than getting all the ingredients and attempting to cook out own. And it was 100% better! Even the people who don't usually enjoy turkey had second helpings of it. It wasn't dry. Deliciously moist. We hardly had left overs. It was ready exactly when we wanted it. We brought home a hot turkey and it was ready to be eaten. Easy clean up for us too! We will be doing this every year now. Definitely recommend it!

Always a fan of this place!!! The BBQ is excellent and the sides dishes keep me coming back. There is a lot of good BBQ in the area but they don't all have the incredible sides. 
I have tried all the meats and they are delicious. I do wish they would have rib tips but I except it. Try the pulled pork with the mustard sauce then work your way up to the burtn ends.

The boyfriend and I had a taste for barbecue and after learning that Naperville charges about $20 just to walk into their RibFest we decided to pass and check out a place he's been to in Oak Brook. I'm definitely a fan!

Upon walking in there was so much to look at - the pig decor, the large menu and the silver cafeteria-style counter they have set up to order at. Previous reviewers were right, it will take you a hot minute to come to a decision on what to eat. They have several meats to choose from, a lot of delicious sounding sides, desserts, drinks, etc. 
The line went quickly and the folks at Real Urban were very nice. Instead of them assuming you've been there before, they made sure to ask what kind of sauce, if you'd like pickles/what kind of pickles, etc. They actually seem to care about your order which is definitely a plus.

I had ordered a pulled pork sandwich, a side of mac & cheese and a side of cornbread. Everything is put on a shiny silver tray and looked absolutely delicious. They gave me tons of meat, a perfect amount of sauce, the mac & cheese was decent and the moist cornbread was to die for. Overall, I REALLY enjoyed my meal. Ricky, my boyfriend, had ordered brisket, rib tips, a side of baked beans and the mac & cheese and he enjoyed his food as well. I feel the prices are pretty fair for how much food you get.

The restaurant itself is very clean, spacious and the decor is very fun to look at. I wouldn't necessarily say I felt like I was in the South being there, but I loved the "hip" atmosphere and take on a barbecue restaurant. 

Overall, I really liked this place! I definitely recommend it if you're in the area and want some comfort food.

I had Real Urban Barbecue at the Taste of Roselle recently and the previous year as well. Overall, I rated it A-OK because I didn't find it memorable. I'm sure if I dined a their location I may like it better. 

I had the bbq pork and mac. The meat was good but the macaroni and cheese was so basic. It tasted like it was from an elementary school cafeteria. So I would not recommend the mac.

Having a barbecue joint near work is lethal. I've visited on numerous accounts during the week and I always return to work with a serious case of food coma.

With the proteins, I have tried the burnt ends, Texas sausage, beef brisket, and pulled pork. The burnt ends are a delicate treat and personal favorite. With the higher fat content and collagen, the meat is particularly flavorful, tender, and juicy. So since they're the point ends of brisket, there is a limited quantity for serving and it does come with a slight premium price compared to the other items. The Texas sausage are a bit similar to kieÅbasa Polska while the beef brisket and pulled pork can be a tidbit dry at times. I typically order my meats without the sauce so I can taste the smokiness first. For anybody dining in, bottles of barbecue sauce can be found on the tables. 

For the sides, I have also tried a variety: french fries, sweet potato souffle, golden corn bake, and mac and cheese. So you can either stick with the basics or try a little something different. I like all of them but I did leave wondering if the sweet potato souffle could include chopped pecans to give it a boost.

If you have to stand there for 15 mins just to figure out what to eat, you're in for a good dinner!!!

Yay!!!!  This place make super duper awesome BBQ.  So much to choose from but my family ended up choosing burnt ends and the rib tips.....Mmmmmm.  The sides are great.  Fries, green beans and something called Hoe cake (which I believe is their version of cornbread).  Sweet, savory cornmeal with chunks of corn pieces.  It was moist which I liked.  Not too dry. 

The staff are hospitable and helpful.  Love love it here and happy that there's more options for bbq out here in the western suburbs.

Stopped for lunch and ordered a brisket sandwich, side of creamed spinach and a fountain drink.  The total was $14.76 which is part of the reason for the two stars rating.  (In all honesty, even if the cost were more reasonable, my rating would have been no more than 3 stars.)

The brisket sandwich was just OK.  A nice smoke ring with subtle smoke flavor which is fine.  I don't need my taste buds assailed by smoke.  I couldn't detect much flavor from the bark rub which is too bad.  It's obvious that the brisket was slow cooked nicely but then put in a warmer grill because by the time it was served it was dry.  I always order Q dry and like to apply sauce as a condiment.  In this case, I had to use more sauce than I normally would like to.
The creamed spinach was a nice compliment to the brisket.

In summary, average BBQ at a premium price.

Well for starters....it's called urban bbq in a suburb...lolol.....my curiosity got the best of me. Asked the guy what we're they known for....he said burnt ends..and no I immediately thought of famous Daves ridiculous claims of the same dish...then he gave me a sample...omggoodness.....so then the baked beans are not your mommas dish...it's a mixture of lima beans, kidney beans eventually you will get to the pork n beans...sweet potatoes are wonderful, creamy...just enough sweet....ribs are just what they say they are......award winning....

5 stars... Yes please! 

Urban BBQ is a sweet spot in the suburbs! Stopped here for lunch and glad that I did! 

Split the full slab of ribs with my fiancÃ©. I can't rave about how good these ribs are! I also like the apple harvest BBQ sauce! Yum yum yum! 

As for sides... Mac&cheese and sweet mashed potatoes is the way to go! 

If you are in this area and craving BBQ come check it out! #delicious

The first time I have been to Real Urban Bbq was at the Highland Park location, which is about 40 minutes from me. I always get the 3 meat combo with 2 sides. The brisket, burnt ends, and ribs is now my combo of choice. I have tried chicken and sausage as well which is pretty good too. Fries, mac n cheese, creamy spinach are my choice of sides. I am just happy there is a location much closer!

Disappointing BBQ - especially for the price. I can forgive expensive BBQ if it's worth the money, because I know it's hard to find here in Chicago. But $16.99 for a BBQ platter with maybe a quarter pound of brisket and a quarter pound of "burnt ends" is pretty hefty. My major gripe with this place is that they claim to have "burnt ends" when in reality it's just glorified chopped brisket.

Burnt ends should be the charred ends of brisket and should be carmelized and chewy. They grab their "burnt ends" by the handful out of a metal container and it's cold and limp with no caramelization or char whatsoever. Dousing it in BBQ sauce isn't going to let me forgive your sins.

My brother is always singing the praises is the RUB in Highland Park, so when I finally heard they had one closer to us I just had to try it. The problem was, we went in around 6:30 pm for dinner and most of the meats were sold out, so everything he suggested I try wasn't even available. Pork, pulled chicken, turkey, brisket, burnt ends, and ribs, were all sold out already. They still had another couple of hours to go, not sure what they would have left by the end. 

The restaurant was clean, nice layout, and the staff was really friendly and helpful. 

We ended up getting 1/2 chicken and some sausage. I'm not a super huge sausage fan, it's not something I'd order for myself, but it was good. The 1/2 chicken was decent but nothing really stand-out. The price for the chicken was reasonable at least - $8.99 and included 2 individual sides. 

Normally in a BBQ place, I am not crazy about the sides. But these were probably some of the best sides I've enjoyed. I tend to be a sucker for mac and cheese sides in general, this one was enjoyable. The cornbread was good, on the sweet side, with pieces of corn in it.  My husband ordered the nachos, which comes with your choice of meat (of what's left to choose anyway...), but we'd probably pass on getting that again if we revisit. 

But we aren't really aren't driving to a BBQ place for the sides, and there wasn't enough of a draw from the BBQ side of things to reel us back in. Maybe if we can get there earlier in the day sometime on a weekend, we would give it another chance to hopefully have more meat options to try. I don't know if their dinners usually have such slim pickings or we just had bad luck.

When you don't want to pull out the grill!

Usually will get full slab and 2 single servings sides for $24

Slab of Ribs - the first time I ordered them as "perfection" (Sauce and Memphis style BBQ rub). 2nd time I forgot and only got the sauce (wet) Will never order it again without the BBQ rub.

Burnt Ends - Was good wouldn't mind coming just for this by itself as well. 

Brisket - Probably would have like it better had it not been slathered with sauce on top but bbq cooked on it.

Sweet Potato SoufflÃ© - my fav side sweet potato with marshmallows melted on top. it's...SWEET!

Golden Corn Bake - I actually don't really like the corn inside lol but love everything else about it. (slightly feel a little cheated as other BBQ joints like this give you a cornbread while letting you choose your side)

Onion Strings - Will get them in with ever order from now on.

Smoked Baked Beans - Shrug

Home-style Mac & Cheese - Didn't like it however I'm not a fan of the "traditional" creamy mac and cheese 

BBQ Sauce - Weird but I don't really like the BBQ sauces. I do like the Memphis rub which works with the original BBQ sauce but not without it for me.

As an individual coming here, it's great...as a family of 5 people...who wants a happy meal?

We have been here a few times.  This time I thought the portions were a little smaller on a combination of burnt ends and brisket with two sides.  There was maybe 4-5 oz of each.  The picture makes it look like much more than it was.  The brisket was good and the burnt ends are okay.  We also had a brisket sandwich which is a good size.

I like the pickles they serve.  They are sweet with a little spice to them.  The sweet potatoes are like the filling of a sweet potato pie whipped up and topped with marshmallows.  We consider them more like dessert than a side.

I was a little shocked at the price this time.  My son and I shared the combo which came with two sides, my daughter only had a side of mac n cheese, my husband had the brisket sandwich and a side, we also got an order of onion straws and 4 drinks.  It was almost $50.  

R.U.B. has a fun atmosphere, but it's a little pricey for lunch.  This isn't the place for real bbq lovers, but it'll do in a pinch.

Went here for lunch with two of my best friends. Their suggestions. I've been in Oak Brook/Lombard area a lot lately (spring break, RA Sushi VIP) so this was awesome.

It's in a strip mall with a Chipotle (sky point!) and Roti (never tried but my friends like it).

The menu is online so I knew what I was doing. I knew I was getting the burnt ends and the brisket. TWO MEAT COMBO!! Almost went three, but you get two sides with it so I though, no worries.

Beans were flavorful and the brisket was money! My favorite part was the burnt ends and how tender they were. LIke a girl after The Notebook.

I will be back! 17 bucks for two MEATS and two SIDES! BABY!

Friendly, fast, lots on the menu. Big place with lots seating options (long bar tables, counter bar, a room with just seats and tables can be pulled together, booths for 2, 4, 6 or 8!). Two drink stations. Rewards program. Desserts and amaze-ball shakes!!!!

A little pricey for going during your lunch break from work but the meal I had was sooo delicious. I had the burnt ends entree which included two sides. I chose the mac and cheese and creamed spinach - both were pretty good. The had a ton of sides to choose from including baked cinnamon apples!

I had their lemonade shake up for my beverage and it was super sweet, but still refreshing. 

Wasn't even really busy at the noonthirty hour so that was appreciated. Fast friendly service. 

I'll def be back to try the other meats and those apples!

Just Plain Good

*Burnt Edge sandwich!!!** - amazing
beans - ehh
mashed potato - eh
smoked wings - eh

but that sandwich alone is worth it. wish I had two of those instead of the sides.. one is enough to fill... two if your feeling like going big!

Just Plain Good
Just Plain Good
Just Plain Good
Just Plain Good
Just Plain Good
Just Plain Good

clean environment. nice customer service blah blah blah..

that sandwich!!!

Been to Urban at Highland Park, Vernon Hills, and Oak Brook.
Each and every time I've had a great dining experience.
No complaints at all. Very clean. Fast service.
Staff is always friendly and helpful with suggestions.
The food is great. The burnt ends are a must have.
I order my burnt ends each and every time I visit.
Just writing this review is making me crave some Urban.

We were excited to try a new BBQ place because we're really into BBQ.... We compete, we're certified KCBS BBQ judges, and we eat a lot of it!

My husband got the BBQ nachos with pulled pork. It came with chips, canned cheese sauce, pulled pork and BBQ sauce. Nothing else.  A bowl of dry chips with pork and two sauces on top.  Not very exciting. 

I ordered the redneck taco.  It was a hoe cake with pulled pork and sauce. The hoe cake was delicious! I also ordered baked beans and Mac and cheese. The sides were good but I paid $3 for a 1/3 cup serving. They weren't $6 worth of good in any stretch of the imagination.

The pulled pork was dry and some pieces were hard they were so dry. There was very little smoke flavor but they're cooking on a pellet smoker so that's expected. The sauce is thick and overpowers any flavor the meat might have had.  It was not enjoyable. 

There are many other BBQ places that have better food and better prices.

Burnt Ends sandwich was fantastic.  I have had the burnt ends, pulled pork and beef brisket sandwiches from here.  All good, but the burnt ends is the way to go.

For sides I recommend corn bread and peach cobbler.  You get a large amount of food especially if you get 2 sides.  I have had the fries as a side - they are just okay.  With fries as a side it ends up being too much food.

Prices could be a bit lower, but still not too bad.  Average meal is around $15-$20.

My son and I stopped in for dinner and were very pleased with our meals!  I had white meat chicken, he had pulled pork, and we got Mac n cheese, baked beans, and coleslaw. The food was really quite good!  Even better than the food is the genuinely nice staff. There's also a festive atmosphere and it was a great experience to eat here.
