Real Urban Barbeque is an overpriced mockery of solid BBQ joints, be they in city, suburbs, or otherwise. Gave them a try the other day for lunch. $20 for their "three meat combo" plus two sides. Comparatively speaking, the price is about average, but that's considering the quality of product to be above reproach. Went with the Burnt Ends, 1/3 slab ribs (Baby Backs), and sausage. Visually appealing, albeit the portions were on the small side. Mac 'n cheese and brussel sprouts completed the combo. Here's where they fell:

BURNT ENDS - Decent, less seasoning than other respectable joints, more fat than most, only about a handful portion.
BABY BACKS - Ordered dry, only came with 4 ribs. Undersized, under-seasoned, overcooked. Thrown on the grill to warm up only dried them out more. Sucked.
SAUSAGE - Under-seasoned, undersized, only a tad bigger than a freaking hot dog with no bite. 
MAC N CHEESE - Reminiscent of Old Country Buffet's powder mac. Freaking atrocious.
BRUSSEL SPROUTS - Very bitter, bacon was inconsequential. No seasoning.

After the underwhelming combo, I checked out their ST. LOUIS SPARE RIBS - rubbed. $13 for a 1/2 slab was lofty, and they hardly lived up to expectations. Again, thrown on the grill, dried out and overcooked. Rub seasoning and flavor were decent, but again the ribs were undersized and overcooked. 

First, and last trip, to Real Urban Barbeque. Overpriced, overcooked, undersized, under-seasoned, and well below their competition. I guess when there's not much else around, they're bound to get some business. Hard to believe there's many repeat customers.

Oh, the carvers and cashiers had a weird vibe, almost cold. The whole business leaves you feeling very rushed. No bueno.

Checked this awesome place out on a recent trip to the Chicago area. Yum! Fast service, great prices and super yummy dinner. The brussles sprouts are awesome and you cannot go wrong with the Mac and cheese either. My husband really enjoyed the beef brisket and pecan cobbler. Check this great restaurant out! You won't be disappointed!

I go to different BBQ places for different things.  Each one has one thing I love.  For this place, it's the ribs.  Done in their perfection style, they are the best I've found in the area.

I would give this place 5 stars, but they have one big fault.  If you have a child in diapers, neither of the bathrooms has a changing table.  Once they address this, five stars!

FIVE STARS BABY!!!!  I'm reading some of these other reviews and am astounded at all of the negativity about the burnt ends!  Now I want you to keep in mind that the hubs is a Johnson & Wales culinary school grad so he's no slouch when it comes to quality of food in restaurants. We both discovers this place on Thursday night for dinner and are back for lunch today. This place rocks in every way. Food, service, decor...everything. 

The burnt ends are absolutely delicious. They are not dry and stringy like some reviews stated. I got this with the sweet BBQ sauce and loved it!  With this meal I had the corn pudding and the smokey baked beans, both were delish. 

Today I got the 2 meat combo with turkey and 1/2 slab and spicy BBQ along with mashed potatoes and gravy and the Brussels sprouts. Oh. My. God. The Brussels sprouts. Maybe I'm biased because my cousin Rose makes them this way for Thanksgiving but they are really kick ass. The mashed and gravy were very good as well and the turkey!!  So tender and juicy. So, so good. I liked the ribs a lot as well. They are tender and juicy with great flavor and I don't know what people are talking about saying small portions...1/2 slab with 5 huge slices of turkey and two sides isn't enough portion for you people??  And we wonder why America is fat. 

Real Urban Barbecue is the REAL DEAL.

More of a 3 1/2 star. Its kind of hidden from the main road and tucked in back. They have cafeteria style serving like going on. A lot of options to choose from including chicken, beef brisket, and BBQ beef. Plenty of sides at a typical BBQ place like cornbread, Mac n cheese, and veggies. Portions are on the small side however.

Well this was my first time here and I was a bit overwhelmed by the choices. 
I walked in and it smelled so so good I wanted to try everything. I was just staring at the menu when I spotted what looked to be a couple of regulars. I asked them for HELP, they both suggested the turkey and the chicken. I really wanted to try some ribs so I settled on the 3 meat combo for $18.99. This meal included 1/3 slab of ribs and then a choice of 2 other meats, I went with chicken on the bone and the turkey.

 Well what can I say? Two outta three ain't bad. The ribs we're tough and chewy, the turkey very dry and salty,  the chicken perfection. I would go back as the sauces we're great, service was great and the sides were wonderful. (Beans and brussel sprouts were my sides)

Portions could be bigger for the prices but like I said I would try this place again as the menu was full of choices.

My girlfriend and I come here all the time. She gets the pulled pork sliders every time and loves them. She loves the cornbread as well! I usually go with the Brisket sandwich and its almost always great. Best BBQ in the area

Was a real fan of this bbq. Haven't been here in awhile. Today it was nothing special unfortunately. Got the 2 meat combo. Turkey is very good seasoned and tender. Pulled pork is so bland and stringy. Not good at all. Mashed are a little loose with not a lot of flavor and gravy is boring in flavor. Wish I didn't make this choice today. $20 lunch was a waste. I expect much more tenderness and flavor for this price. A chunk of something dark flew out of the lemonade dispenser. Not as much care in food here as their other locations.

So, the husband and I had the twins in tow and were looking for something to eat - we saw this sign and made a mad dash to turn into the lot.  This is a really great spot.  We both got two meat plates and ordered some peach cobbler and a side of 3 hushpuppies.  All in, with drinks, it was about $45, but everything was excellent and the place is VERY clean.  I love that they have a sink in the open so you can easily wash hands, etc without having to go in the bathroom.

I had the turkey and burnt ends - with sweet sauce. Sides were the corn bake and sweet potato soufflÃ©.  I kind of wish the sweet potatoes were more "lumpy" and less "puffy", but the taste was good.  The corn bake is essentially a softer corn bread - could use a little more sugar, but also good and the kids loved both of these sides.  The sauce that comes with the hush puppies is like a siracha or jalapeno creamy heaven - SO GOOD, but be ready for some serious heat!  The husband had the brisket (he thought was just okay) and the ribs (he thought were amazing).  His sides were potato wedges and sweet potato.  Peach cobbler also very tasty, as was the "lemon shake" drink.  Pickles are offered on the plates - so many and so good!

Nice to also have an assist from staff in getting two high chairs to the table - and that they were clean (although the place is pretty new, so that helps)

This was the second time I have visited Real Urban BBQ.  I had some issues the first time and these same problems were there the second time.  First off by the food was hardly luke warm.  The brisket was very good but very dry.  I shouldn't have to sauce the brisket to swallow it.  The ribs tasted awesome but we're kinda of dry.  The sausage was good.  I did not notice any steam coming out of the warmer where the meats sit in. Flavored were great but temps and moisture were off.  The hottest part of our meal was the cornbread.
Pulled pork sandwich was good but again it wasn't warm. Kids chicken tenders were great.  Sevice was great and very friendly. $7200

Real Urban BBQ has been teasing the residents of Oak Brook with their tantalizing BBQ smells for 2 years now saying it's coming to Oak Brook soon .... well it's finally here, yay!!

I came in tonight not really knowing what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised with their contemporary "BBQ house" decor, tables and atmosphere,  The unmistakable aroma of bbq hits you right away as you enter and instantly makes you drool for everything they have to offer.

I ordered the burnt end and 1/2 chicken entree.  Both entrees were great.  The chicken was not as dry as I thought it would be, and with the BBQ sauce, it's so yummy.  Burnt ends taste so good, and so easy to eat, although I will definitely try a slab next time around.

Sides:

cole slaw - lightly dressed and not creamy like you find at your fatty fried chicken joints.  i like it!

golden corn bake - i would love to be buried in this and eat my way out ... 

brussel sprouts - great!  seasoned well, a tad over cooked ... maybe from sitting out, but still good

baked beans - pretty good, i would rather have two orders of the golden corn bake though

Must get - the spicy pickles!!!  the spice comes as you are finishing the pickle.. it's awesome!

I'll be back and can't wait!!

So I have to say it is pricey compare to what you can get in the area but with standard market not bring back their outdoor bbq they have less competition. So my son and I shared burnt ends and ribs with 3 sides.  Neither of us was a fan of the burnt ends.. it was super dry and stringy for us. The rib on just on the verge of being over cooked but that is mostly what we shared with their texas bbq sauce and their bbq mango sauce. My son loved the mac & cheese, I was a fan of the corn pudding, and the cream of spinach was pretty good too.

The place is huge and each table had a good supply of paper towels, wet naps.and bbq sauce to try.. but what really stand out that I thought was a nice touch was the yok patty you get at the register.. and the open sink to wash your hands.

Came here a few weeks ago after going swimming with the family.  Very happy that we did.  Casual spot that serves a wide variety of BBQ and sides.  Tried the 3 meat combo and the fish tacos.  Ribs, brisket, burnt ends were all very good.  Sides also were very good.  Fish tacos were solid and a good deal considering they were only about $10.  Very reasonable prices for BBQ and excellent food.  Staff also very friendly

This is really like a 3.75 rating.  Didn't want to round down because it was overall enjoyable.  Tried a variety of things on the menu.  Turkey was really good, sausage was too, brisket was very dry and not all that great.  Mac n cheese was decent but seemed like it had been sitting awhile.  Mashed potatoes were great.  Balsamic salad was pretty solid as well.  Got the smores cookie desert and it was very sweet but really good. Overall it was a good visit but not in the top BBQ places I've been to.

Honestly some of the best BBQ in the Chicago area. Burnt ends are fantastic. Ribs and brisket were smoked perfectly. 
Even the sides that I tried were awesome. I had the Brussels sprouts, Mac n cheese, corn bread and baked beans, all were delicious. 
And when your done with all this messy goodness, there's a slop sink outside the bathroom for you to clean up, if you haven't licked it up first.

Pretty damn good barbecue!  Not the best I've ever had cause that was in the south or in texas. But overall very good. Unusual corn bread but I did like it. Mac n cheese not as creamy as I'd like but good. Brisket was very good and I like the fact that they are busy enough to slice it when you order it. Nice selection of sauces also. I preferred the spicy. Looking forward to trying something different next time. 4.5 stars

Great service but be sure to have your bottled drink opened when you check out. I had the burnt ends plate. Very generous portion. Hot sauce nice and spicy. Loved the Mac and cheese and yummy Brussels sprouts. My friend loved her ribs. She also got a peanut butter and chocolate shake. Sooo good.

Ok...   I need to catch my breath here... Didn't want to take a break from eating to breathe....  I decided to try Real Urban BBQ tonight on the recommendation of a friend...   He just moved up to best friend!!!!

Burnt ends are some.of the best BBQ meats around, but here in the Midwest, it seems like no one can cook them right...   

Until I came here....

Not only can they cook them right, they are masters of their meat!!!!!

BBQ sauce??  Don't even think about it...  You want to eat these burnt ends in all their 'naked' glory!!!    Every bite is full of flavor.   Every bite is super tender, with the perfect ratio of crispy edges!!!

There is NO WAY that this will not become my go to BBQ joint in the Chicago area!!!

Excellent beef brisket and loved their bbq sauce.  Sides were outstanding.  I chose Mac and Cheese and the creamiest, most delicious cole slaw that I have had in years!  Parking is abundant and there's easy in and out from their location near the intersection of South York and 22nd Street.  I would give this five stars, but I took a star away for not serving a bread like Texas toast or cornbread on the side.  Otherwise, I highly recommend this as the best bbq in the burbs AND/OR the city.  Be there, bbq fans!

Don't understand all the hub bub.  Heard the owner on the radio 'raving" about how crowded they are at lunch and how many smoked turkeys they sold over the holidays.  I don't get it.  Maybe the turkey is better than what I had.

We had ribs that required wrestling to get the meat.  Me.  .  .  I like the meat to fall off the bone so I can enjoy my meal and not focus on how quickly I will have to find some dental floss.

The "creamy"  cole slaw was on the vinegary side with large chunks of carrots, not creamy.  The French fries were so soggy and under cooked they went into the garbage.  Hubby thought the baked beans were just okay.  AND, even though the web site says that ALL  BBQ entrees come with 2 sides, that doesn't include the ribs, BUT includes the fish tacos.  They tasted barbequed to me.

IF  I ate here again, I would try one of the sandwiches and most likely skip the sides. although they might come WITH 2 sides.

RUB-a dub dub-thanks for the grub AMEN.

This Sh*T is good. Burnt ends were the best I've ever had, and I know my BBQ.
Even the mac n cheese side dish rocked.

A+

Finally a good barbecue joint comes to the western suburbs. I'd been meaning to try this place since it opened and finally had the opportunity today. What I found was a great looking place with super friendly folks behind the counter and tasty food. 

I tried a two-meat combo with the burnt ends and the ribs. Both portions were plentiful. The meat was tasty and tender. Not over-cooked or under-cooked. 

The sauce was slightly sweeter than I would have liked, with a sugary after-taste. Maybe I just had too much, but next time I'm going to order it on the side so I can add it myself. 

Next time, you say? Yes, absolutely. I would definitely give them another try. Some bbq places I'm one and done with, but this one has definite potential and I'll be sure to work my way through the menu. 

Sides are good too. I did the brussel sprouts and corn cake. Both were good. Not the end-all, be-all, but definitely good and a great accompaniment to your meal. 

Prices seem pretty fair too. You're not going to break the bank here. Give them a try and enjoy some great food.
Delicious barbecue in the burbs, fast courteous service even during the busiest of times. Good leadership from Mgt at the Oakbrook store. I'm definitely a customer now.
Had the 2 meat combo, pork and brisket.   More food than I could eat.   Both were delicious and juicy.  A definite go to place
My favorite bbq joint in the burbs! Bbq is good, the sides are excellent, especially the sweet potatoe casarolle

We were there yesterday for a special event of area BBQ folks.  I had the brisket, ribs and chicken.  The chicken was great!  Juicy and just the right about of rub.  Ribs and brisket were decent.  Fantastic beans and mac and cheese.  My wife had brisket, sausage and pulled pork.  Sausage was right on, too!  The pork was a little on the dry and bland side, but the sauce helped with that.  If I were in the area and it was time to eat, I'd go back.

First time visiting.  Ordered the 2 meat meal.  Came to almost 20.00. The place was packed during lunch rush.  Ordered cream spinach and peach cobbler on the side.  Ribs were HORRIBLE!  They were very tough and rubbery.  Chicken was good.  Barbecue sauce was good.  Now the major issue was I decided to return the ribs and asked them to just give me chicken instead.  They took the container and threw it away and have me another piece of chicken.  But,  my container still had chicken in it!  I only wanted to exchange the ribs.  I told the girl and she said it was nothing she could do.  So I asked her why did you throw it away in the first place?  She was like sorry I'll put some pulled chicken in there,  it's the same thing.  Since it was so crowded and I didn't want to make a scene.  I just said okay but it was a terrible experience and I'm calling the manager.

Okay...there is NOTHING bad about this place.  Absolutely everything is divine.  

I had the pick three combo.  I chose a 1/4 dark smoked chicken, Texas sausage, and 1/3 rib made "perfection" style.  Perfection meant the ribs were prepared with a Memphis style dry rub and sauce on!  The smoked chicken was pretty good.  They serve smoked chicken wings with Franks Red Hot sauce - which is one of the best bottled buffalo wing sauces out there.  This combo also came with two sides - so I chose buttermilk mashed potatoes in chicken gravy and homestyle mac & cheese.  They have a shit load of sides - sweet potato soufflÃ©, hoe cakes, fries, grilled veggies, cornbread, baked beans.  Too many to try on your first visit.  


They have soda - like every classic soda that ever came from a glass bottle.  Everything from Green River, to Cherriwine, to Cream Soda, to Sarsaparilla, to Fanta. They also sell house made iced tea in Mason jars and get this....

you can bring that Mason jar back to the restaurant for FREE refills FOREVER!  I chose the watermelon iced tea.  My daughter chose the sweet tea with lemon.  We'll be back for our free refills!

For dessert - they have an assortment of yummy baked goods.  I chose a watermelon cake bite that tastes EXACTLY like a watermelon.  My daughter choose their red velvet cupcake.  Next time, I'd like to try a whoopie pie.  Or some pie!  Or better yet - their pecan or peach cobbler!

DEFINITELY going back!

The set up is weird and very disorganized 
please note when you are paying for your food you will have everyone and their mother reaching over your food as you are trying to pay (not cool).
The peach iced tea is okay
I recommend the lemon shake up instead.
I got the BBQ Brisket, Smoked Baked Beans and french Fries.
The Beans were the best part. 
I had better BBQ from holes in the wall. 
I think because I did not notice a smoker (I'm spoiled I had real BBQ)
that the taste was off.
It was like the BBQ you make in your oven, not at a traditional BBQ
not really worth the money.

First visit for us and I have to say right off it was around 7:30 pm when we arrived.  After figuring out the menu with the Carvers help we chose to three meat platter along with the Hush puppies ( because they were mentioned here) the roasted Brussels sprouts the green beans and the corn bake.  

Portions were weak, the brisket could have has some moisture left in it.  It wasn't overcooked it was just sitting for a while.  That's why I said, we got in at a later time.  The burnt ends were real fatty.  Cut off the point is fine but some of the pieces were just not edible like a hunk of fat with BBQ sauce on it.  The ribs were the highlight, they have a great rub sprinkled over them which really sets them apart.  It's a sweet rub I'm thinking dried brown sugar but that's what made the ribs.

The sides were good, we both liked the Brussels sprouts with the bacon, nice caramelized pieces, some were more done than others but that was just due to the sizes of the sprouts.  The beans, hericot verts were so much better than getting the thick commercial green beans like you find all over.  We both really liked the corn bake it was similar to fresh corn, creamed corn and jiffy corn meal mix all baked into a steam table pan.  The corn bake was a good addition.  Staff was attentive, upsold and just pleasant. 

Love the slop sink idea that's a good addition for us not so neat BBQ fans.  The ribs were good so go for the ribs.  I'll try them again but not for at least a couple months.

I have been waiting to enjoy RUB's barbecue here in Oak Brook for nearly a year, when I first got wind of their Oak Brook location. They have had their share of hurdles to get this beautiful location open. I've experienced RUB's at Rib Fest Chicago (they took 2nd place and were featured on "Anthony Anderson's America Eats" on The Food Network) and recently at the Windy City Barbecue Classic. I've had their Highland Park location bookmarked since they were on Chicago's Best TV, but never made it out there.

They offered free bbq for a year to the first in line and was certain if I got there before 8 am on this frigid morning I'd be a shoe in. As soon as I rounded the corner at 7:45 am I spotted a guy walking towards the front door with a couple blankets... dang it, I should have got my breakfast to-go this morning. I decided to stay and keep Rick company, after all, we both did have a passion for good bbq.

Once the doors opened at 11 am the first 100 people received a free sandwich. I just had to buy a couple of their unique sides. Never seen Brussels Sprouts at a BBQ joint so those and their Sweet Potato Casserole made it to my tray. Love the cafeteria style service and they shuffle you through the different stations efficiently. They did add a nice additional dining room, with plans for a large outdoor patio come spring. 120+ seats inside with hopes for another 88 seats, once the patio is complete. 

Owner Jeff has a great crew and with this being their 3rd location, expect great things to come. They're adding new items to this location and I look forward to them adding Prime Rib to their menu. Great pickles too... there must be some horseradish in them.

Stuck in terrible TriState traffic, we decided to get off the highway and get a bite to eat.  Yelp lead us to this place.  It reminds me of Chipotle except their food line is BBQ with a large dessert offering.  I had the brisket and hubs got the brisket & smoked sausage.  We each got two sides and drinks and the cost was $38 (seemed a bit high for BBQ fast food).  The brisket was pretty good, sausage was OK and the sides were very good (mac-n-cheese & creamed spinach).  Hubs ordered a side of beans that after two bites, he was done with them.  All and all, we felt this place was OK.
Awesome food, but way too expensive. Omg, way over priced :) spicy bbq is great. All the food is excellent.
The pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw pickles was awesome. So was the lemonade in a mason jar.
I haven't tried anything I didn't like here.
Dry ribs have the best flavor, great variety of sides, wouldn't bother with the hush puppies again. They were too dense without allot of flavor. Lots of unique add-ons.

Went with my wife and 12 yr old son. Confusing on how to order the food. We stared at the cashier for a few minutes before they told us to go into the cafeteria type line first. The employees serving the food were nice but a little hard to understand. 
We ordered brisket and pulled pork meals. My son had the chicken tenders and a shake). Seemed a little pricey ($40.00). 
Food was very good. They have a few different types of BBQ sauces to use (mustard, vinegar, sweet, spicey, ect). Place was very clean.

My husband and I went there on a Sunday afternoon and discovered that this is a cafeteria style restaurant. My husband had the pulled pork which came out of the drawer, I am assuming it was a warming drawer and immediately placed on a cold bun. His sandwich was lukewarm at its best. I tried the ribs and the burnt ends. The ribs were OK really nothing special about them. The cook removed them from warming tray and put them on the grill for a couple minutes and slathered some sauce on them and again nothing  special as well. The only thing hot was the fries. The BBQ beans were not good either. There is nothing real or urban about this restaurant!

Baby back ribs were good. Meat came off the bone fairly easily. Mac & cheese and coleslaw were good. Mash potatoes were a little bland if you like them that way. Carry out service was quick. Prices were inline with other bbq places. I'll be back soon to try out some of the other meats.

Food was cold even though no one was in line before us. 

Food was bland. Not a good thing when eating BBQ. I tried all the sauces but the didn't help.  Everything is candy -sweet!




Sauces, pickles, peach cobbler. I expect some sweetness but all in all cold and mediocre food.
Awesome BBQ and many other snappy options i.e. the Mac 'n Cheese, beans and so much more!!  Just go and give a try--knocks the BBQ pants off of the Patio!!  Now, get going and enjoy!!

Interesting take on BBQ. Speed of a fast food restaurant with the quality and price of a sit down. 

Best for those looking for something fancier than McD's or Potbelly for lunch, but don't have the time for a full service meal. 

Ribs taste great, even if they are somewhat pricey. You also get free fountain drinks for life if you buy a mason jar drink. Not sure how they can tell the difference between their mason jars and any jar from Home Depot though...

Cheated on Q BBQ and didn't really enjoy it. We frequent many BBQ places and this place was not impressive. First, bad country music is blasting, which doesn't align to the "urban" name.  The menu and ordering format is a bit confusing. Has a cafeteria style feel to it.  Our food didn't all come out together, so our kids were fidgeting while our sandwiches were getting cold. Once the food all arrived it was just ok. Pulled chicken was tender but the sandwich was too messy to pick up and eat. Sauce was tasty but very thin and runny, adding to the mess. Burnt ends were very fatty and not crispy. Mac n cheese was overcooked mushy slop. Fries were just ok. Chicken tenders were dry and chewy. Our kids love Q BBQ but they barely touched a bite of their food at RUB, which we understood why after we tried their meals. We will stick to Q next time.

Ehh. Most of The food is prepared well before you arrive. The Brisket was well flavored and I had the sweet sauce who had a good flavor. The ribs were nothing special (better at the Patio) and they are clearly just heated up and slathered with sauce. The sides we had included cold slaw, baked beans, corn bread pudding which were edible. The inedible were mashed potatoes and hush puppies which were so over cooked. On the upside the onion strings were made to order and very good which combined with the brisket is why I gave 2 stars. Additionally it is pretty pricey for a cafeteria style environment.

Great lunch meal.  Love the choice in sauces on the tables. 

Got a pulled pork sandwich, good bun which is the key. 

Only complaint is that I may have got the bottom of the fry bin because I had a lot of small ones. 

Will be back for sure.

Got 3 mini sandwiches: brisket, pulled pork, pulled chicken. The pulled chicken was surprisingly the best! Very good pulled chicken. Brisket was solid, have had better, have had worse as well. Shockingly the pulled pork was the worst. It was terrible, but certainly not great. But the sides were fabulous. Corn bread and mac n cheese are both really good. I didn't see their options for shakes until I was leaving, but they sounded very interesting such as a PB&J shake! Fun menu, kind of pricey, but would go back

I reallllllly wanted to like this place because it's so close. Hub and I both tried burnt end sandwich. To call them burnt ends was stretching it quite a bit. They weren't "burnt" and I don't think they were ends. They were 1.5 inch cubes of brisket that were not cooked enough. Bummer.

Food wasn't very hot. I enjoyed my sides (corn bake and dill potato salad), my son liked the prime rib special although it wasn't heated through and looked suspiciously premade (perfect grill marks yet cool). The shakes are good according to the boys and the lemonade was good too. 

Might give them a few months and try the pulled pork but was kind of bummed we spent $60 and no one was really happy with their meal.

The food is delicious over all order the brisket entree...do want to give Jim and staff this review for being on top with customer service. I picked up my order and I was confident that it was all there after I was at work I saw I was missing a meal. No biggie, I called and Jim helped me and was able to get my meal out ASAP. Thank you!

Found this place through a friend who mentioned it was good. Was expecting a typical BBQ place but wow was I wrong. This place has some outstanding BBQ! If you really want to experience what makes them so good, have the Burnt End Sandwich with their sweet pickles. I have never tried anything like it (Warm and tender on the inside with the crunch of crispy ends on the outside). Can't wait to go back with some other friends to see if they think the same! Don't think about it, just go. Highly Recommended

This place is a gem. I love the pulled chicken sandwich; their sauce is great. And they have a ton of other sauces to choose from. I really enjoy their sides, especially the sweet potato souffle. They have a huge variety of uncommon sodas, which is an awesome novelty, and they have some pretty darn interesting shakes that are pretty good too. Not exactly the cheapest, but we'll worth the money. And very well decorated too, with lots of seating space and a nice room with two walls full of tall windows for plenty of natural light. This is my favorite BBQ spot, without any doubt.
Delicious! Tried the mini pulled pork sandwich with the corn bake and fries. So good!!! Cant wait to come back and try more

I really wanted to love this place and was excited to hear about it opening on Facebook. I finally got around to trying it so I took the 20 minute trip to Oakbrook and it's just okay. All of the food I ordered was room temperature or cold, especially the mashed potatoes which I didn't even eat. The ordering process is a little confusing and food is served similar to Boston Market...pick what you want and they scoop it out of a buffet dish. I went to pay and was shocked at the total for what I was getting. I will say I loved the variety of bottled soft drinks to choose from, the cleanliness, and the staff was very nice but there's room for improvement food-wise. I may wait a while and try it again.
Very good! Everyone in our group was very happy with their order.  Just to be different I had the tilapia tacos which I would definitely recommend.

Brisket was great. Enjoyed Mac and cheese and golden corn bake. 

Service was great. Very clean. 

Try potato pancake

Amazing BBQ!!! Large portions and great atmosphere. This place is the BOMB! You won't want to miss coming here. The brisket, corn bake, mashed potatoes, beans, and pickles are delicious! Try the lemonade shake up! Seriously - every single thing we ordered was great. We will definitely be back!

Although the food was good, the name was misleading. Rather than an urban atmosphere, it had a real country roadhouse look inside, down to the loud Charlie Daniels country music. I was confused by what they were going for.  We had the Memphis Rub, which was sweeter than I prefer. I might just go for the plain ribs as they have a nice selection of sauces at the tables. The coleslaw was good, but we did not try any other sides. They looked good. It was pricey for a casual step-to-the-counter place.

Good BBQ, but I just wish they would offer better sides.  How about a simple piece of cornbread; not something smothered in butter, sugar, etc. Potato salad that's not swimming in mayo.  Want to love it, but can't get past the gross sides.

Our first time at Real Urban was not so good.  Had heard so many good things, but can't figure out why.  The ribs were overcooked and chewy.  The side orders were so tiny for the price.  And not one thing came with the ribs, everything was a la carte.  Their sauce is so-so unless you like vinegar as the predominant ingredient.  Anyhow, we probably won't go back considering the other better BBQ options out there.

I realized I made a mistake coming here when the guy ahead of me ordered his sandwich and was asked "regular or hot" and then sauce was ladled all over the sandwich.  I really should have left at this point.  Good bbq doesn't need sauce, especially not that much.  I ordered a brisket sandwich without sauce and it was really flavorless; they clearly dump all of that sauce on the meat to give it some flavor.  The meat didn't have smoke rings and tasted like pot roast and the bark didn't even have any flavor.  To make matters worse the fries I ordered were undercooked.  Sorry folks but this isn't good bbq.

The food was way overpriced and I was way underwhelmed.

I ordered a beef brisket sandwich with 2 sides. I of course forgot to mention I didn't want it on a gold plate, but they charged me for that anyway. 

I was charged $14 for a sandwich, a 1/3 cup of coleslaw and a 1/3 cup of mac & cheese! Anywhere else the meal would have been at most $9.

The mac & cheese was exceptional, but the coleslaw was vinegary and the meat was dry and overcooked. I just can't say the same about the sandwich, though. The server asked if I wanted some sauce on it. I said sure, not realizing that I would get so much sauce that it would overflow the container and my sandwich would be floating. The sandwich was so soggy I had to eat it with a fork.

RUB needs to refigure their recipes, pricing and portions. Their food isn't that exceptional that I wouldn't consider going to another BBQ place that's better and cheaper.

Wow you have to come here. I'm a BBQ fan been to some of the award winning places across the U.S. And these guys can hang out with the big boys. Only reason for 4 stars is the sweet tea is more like a dash of sweet. Not your southern sweet country American tea. Give this place a try you won't be disappointed!!

I go here pretty often after an hour at the gym. Ha! Their BBQ Sliders are a must try as well as the brussel sprouts and corn bread. If you have a sweet tooth like me, you have to check out their mini bakery section. AWESOME! I'm a fan especially now that i have a refillable tea jar.
Great food always on point.love the coleslaw turkey ribs and the sauces just right.my only place togo for bbq

First time visit & I was very happy! Loved the shaken lemonade in a mason jar (that you keep). Food was tasty (pulled chicken, pulled pork, corn bread casserole & Brussels sprouts w Bacon). Great chocolate Carmel Brownie & service. Also Love the atmosphere,  other too loud.

Had the pulled pork, why go over to the carving station when the cold sandwich was already sitting there.  Then the sides area, filthy was where all of those side items were, asked if I could get the hush puppies for a side, told NO, it was an appetizer, cost the same 3 for 1.99.  Don't waste your money, they were the size of a quarter, with a spicy sauce, why a sauce for hush puppies?  Then got the baked beans.  When do you see red kidney beans normally in baked beans.  Terrible, everything cold.  The pulled pork was very fatty.  No one in the place and the fact that they cannot appease a customer was ridiculous.  Won't be back.  Will continue to LaGrange where the sides come with the sandwich for much less of a price.

Reviewing my first and only time there.  I *might* try it again, but am not really sure at this point. I had a full sized pulled pork sandwich with hot BBQ sauce and  cole slaw on top to go.  Boxed into a container that was too hard to get  the sandwich out of with no offer of silverware.  So I literally could not eat the food until I was home with access to a plate, fork and knife. 
Pulled pork was chunks of rubbery pork not really "pulled" to my liking and the sauce was not very good. 
Pricing is very high.  My sandwich was $9 with no sides.  Drinks are $2.50!  I can get a pulled pork sandwich with a side  at a sit down restaurant for this price range and get a complimentary knife and fork.

Writing this as I stuff my face. Awesome all the way! Excellent food with great staff ready to recommend the entire menu. We shared the slab of ribs and the burnt ends entree. Each came with two sides so we got to have even more yum-ness. Sweet potato sufflÃ©, brussel sprouts, fries, and Mac and cheese. Ended it all with a peanut butter double triple milkshake that had Reece's, butterfinger, peanut butter, and hot fudge. Don't say this often, but this was way worth every single calorie. Time to hit the gym!

I ordered the brisket sandwich. It was no disappointment... Tender meat with good flavor. As a side I had the Mac&Cheese and mashed potatoes. Both were great. For this order: it was well worth the price and great taste.  Plus a very convenient location, easy parking.

I've wanted to check this place out since it opened. It's a 5 minute drive from my house and I love barbecue. I'm glad that I did because the atmosphere was great and the food was delicious. The only problem I had was that I ate too much and didn't have the appetite to try any of the baked goods they offered. I'll be back to try them though.

I am no BBQ expert, I'm from Jersey, but this food is amazing! I've never had smoked turkey breast carved in front of me. It melts in your mouth. The burnt tips are perfection. They do ask if you want sauce on your meat as other reviews have mentioned. It is absolutely good with or without sauce. They have a great selection of BBQ sauces. Try them all. I can't even talk about the Mac and cheese without tearing up. I want to live in it. The sweet potatoes with marshmallows is fantastic, and the hoe cakes are the best I have ever had. Tonight is the second time I have brought it home and my boyfriend and I are so impressed. I got the peach cobbler the first time, and I just finished the pecan pie. It was amazing. I planned on sharing it, but I ate the whole thing. The 3 meat combo is the best deal. Get the large container of Mac an cheese, and sweet potatoes. We have enough food for the whole weekend! Do not miss this place. Go hungry and try everything!

So good. I chose this place because my friend eats gluten-free, and we were all quite happy.  I had an egg-avacado wrap with spinach, a latte, and since I was curious, my first ever shot of wheatgrass juice. The wrap was from Brown and white rice. Another person at our table got the egg-feta wrap and gave it a solid thumbs up. I knew my husband would enjoy, so I ordered a to-do wrap. I will be back soon.

Delicious!

I thoroughly enjoyed chatting with the owner, Nicole. She has done a lot of reading about nutrition and gave me some good ideas.
This place is terrific. Whether you are looking for a healthy alternative or just great food, this is the place. The wraps and salads wonderful. I can't wait to come back for breakfast.

Today was our first time there and it happened to be their first anniversary for the business.  I predict there will be many more - it fills a huge need for green, gluten free healthy food that is really delicious.  Everything homemade, fresh and tasty.  Our Americana coffee was just the way we like it, and the added bonus was it is also acid-free.  The atmosphere is energizing and homey, the owner exudes the same - cordial and full of enthusiasm for her healthy and yummy food.

Wow! What a great little cafe. I ordered a scrambled avocado wrap and it was absolutely fantastic. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the spinach was crunchy, and the avocado was fresh! I also bought a little gluten-free brownie and it was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend this place

This is the healthiest Cafe in all of Naperville,Lisle and the surrounding areas. From their homemade soups, salads, and wraps to their eggs, steel cut oatmeal, crepes, quinoa and those delicious healthy green drinks are all unforgettable. The owner puts her heart and soul into this cafe and it shows!  If you have been searching for a truly healthy Cafe serving breakfast and lunch everyday, look no further!  You will not be disappointed!
Went here for Homecoming it was very good people were nice and food is amazing I enjoyed the pasta dishes with salad, great for groups

I love this place! I live right across the street and come here as often as I can! Everything is always so  good and the owner is such a lovely lady. Great place for college square, hope it stays for a while!

Delicious gluten free food where the owners truly care about the food they make. I enjoyed the chicken dumplings that was to die for!! 
The place is very clean and food is made fresh. You won't find and farmed fish or GMO ingredients here. Gluten Free, Bulletproof, or just looking for healthy food? Come here!

This was my first time here as I was in the area and looking for a healthy lunch option and I didn't want Subway.  For $7.00 I got a tasty, healthy chicken wrap.  I also got a kale green tropical smoothie for $6.00.   The owner seems very concerned about healthy food and nutrition.  She was very friendly.  Place was clean.   Will be back.

I ordered the mango-berry green smoothie and was a bit taken aback when I first saw it...a muddy unappetizing green. But then the owner (I think) asked me how it was, I reluctantly took a sip and wowww it's delicious!! It tastes healthy but so deliciously healthy! Naturally sweet and flavorful and thick! Just how I like it.  The people working here are so nice!! I'm also trying their ricotta cheese crepe. Looks good :)
Great healthy food. Very unique combinations. A little pricey for the suburbs but i am used to paying that in the city. I would go there again.
Nicole (the owner) is amazing! Very knowledgeable with food groups, everything is made in house, extremely flavorful 5* I had the avocado spinach wrap & it was superb!

I found this charming cafe by searching for breakfast places. I stopped in for an Av avocado, blueberry, spinach smoothie that was absolutely amazing. Well in there I know she had gluten-free and sugar-free options as well. This is definitely a place I plan on going back.

Really cute place. Seats about 20 in there so not big, but the am we were there wasn't crowded so we ate in. We each had a breakfast avocado wrap and coffee, both very good. Tasted fresh and was made while we waited. My kiddo had a green tropical smoothie which he loved even though it was green! We will definitely be back need to try the crepes. The place is brand new, the lady who I assume is the owner was really nice. One thing to be aware of is they don't have high chairs there, when we asked it seems like she was going to see about getting some.
Every thing is heathy that's ewwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww but it is pretty good

The broccoli veggie soup was amazing! And the owner was very sweet and informative. She has a great healthy menu (Actually healthy! No sugar :) A very cute restaurant- and great if you need to do work.

My husband and I like to eat fresh, organic whole food as much as we can. This is where dining out or getting take out becomes a challenge! I recently read an article about The Healthy Green Cafe and I couldn't wait to try it! I tried the avocado and blueberry smoothy, while my husband tried the tropical green smoothy. Both were delicious, fresh and healthy! I saw the wheatgrass when I came in, so I had to try a shot! This shot is a must!!

Loved this place! I am so happy a healthy cafe opened up near me. I have had a green smoothie and a chicken wrap in the past and I'm excited to come back for more. Nicole, the owner, is very friendly and so helpful! She's very enthusiastic about explaining the health benefits of the food she serves. One note: the food is not cheap (no healthy food is haha) but if you're willing to pay, it's a great healthy option!

I am very impress about this place. Is everything I was looking for.... Clean, fresh, healthy, tasty and very nice service. The person who prepared my meal was very kind and helpful and knows well about nutrition and cook times. I will surely come back again very soon, even when I live 30 min away.
Fresh, healthy, delicious! Fish wrap + tropical green smoothie = perfect lunch. Very friendly and fast service. Highly recommend!

Figures that I quit working in Naperville 9 days ago and I find this gem. Luckily no one was in so I could talk to Nicole and find out the story and understand her objectives. Since I vegan she ran me through the options I could work with but after chatting she offered to make me a veggie wrap using the gluten free brown rice wrap that is usually used for the sweet wraps. Spinach, Kale, Onion, Tomato, avocado, cabbage. She tossed it in grape seed  oil, lemon and pink Himalayan sea salt. I foolishly asked for hot sauce before I tried it and luckily she didn't have any. It tasted so fresh but not too veggie tasting. It was phenomenal. Now I need an excuse to make my way back to Lisle. Cheers Nicole!

I am taking a class at Lisle high school and pass this place on my way. All I have had are the green smoothies but they are delicious. I like them all but strawberry mango is my favorite as it tastes least like the greens put in it. I have seen others eating the salads and wraps and all the food  looks fresh and delicious.

Great place with amazing food! I've gotten a green smoothie every day for the past three days and I feel great! Their chocolate crepes are delicious, not sugary like they can get sometimes, and they have a perfect little crisp on them. I highly recommend getting one of their out of this world green smoothies!!!

FINALLY a heathy place that serves up good smoothies. Growing up in Northern California I'm a picky when it comes to organic. These smoothies are high quality and recipes are unique while not pretentious. If you're sick go right to the Chicken bone soup.   YUM!!!!

I love small places that care about content and really try to be consistent in the quality of their ingredients and their process. On our visit, we were fully confident that Nicole has that commitment in her cafe. 

Good smoothies, delicious Lentil soup, and wonderful crepes. Solid flavors and thoughtful, caring ingredients. We will definitely return fo enjoy more choices.

Although restaurants like these are popping up more often now, I have to say that Green Healthy Cafe and the woman who runs it is top-notch. When it comes to non-GMO organic healthy eating this place to me is the place to go. I love there gluten free breakfast wraps as well as fish wraps. The quinoa is made perfectly! And my wife really loves the ricotta cheese crepes. It really doesn't matter which smoothie I've tried they are all delicious and don't just taste like a bunch of grass! Now you've got me going she makes a broccoli vegetable soup, lentil soup and bone broth soup. All delicious! And if you haven't had enough healthy yet do a shot of wheatgrass. Just make sure to swish it around in your mouth for at least 15 seconds before you swallow it. That's for the person who has never done it yet it tastes much better when you neutralize the acid in your mouth by switching it around for 15 seconds before you swallow. Thank you Nicole for opening your dream restaurant!

I came to Green Healthy Cafe after a long night with a very sick child. I felt run down and needed some good healthy food for energy. I ordered a green smoothie and wheat grass shot. So fresh and tasty and I felt so much better after this mega dose of veggies! I came in two days later for a salad and then a wrap a few days after that. All so tasty and delicious. Ingredients are high quality and super tasty. Nicole is a sweetheart and is so friendly. She puts a lot of pride and love in her food. So happy to have Green Healthy Cafe in my neighborhood!!!

As soon as you walk through the doors of Green Healthy Cafe, you'll be greeted by the caring smile of the owner. She makes everything in house, from healthy, fresh. delicious ingredients, offered in a variety of tasty menu options. You can't beat the quality of her meals for the price, and you won't leave without her coming over to make sure you loved every bite (and you will!). I'm still thinking about that avocado egg wrap I had and I can't wait to come back to order it again!

Super nice owner and clean place! I decided to stop in for lunch and ordered a grilled chicken cobb salad. I'm not sure if they might've forgotten the dressing but it definitely needed some. It was nothing to rant about and was a small portion for what I paid for it (around $10). Other than that, I really enjoyed their homemade lemonade but will have to definitely come back to try something else food wise.
Had a rather small portioned veggie meal yesterday that wasn't especially satisfying. What really surprised me was the whopping price. I paid over $9 WITH a 10% off coupon. Sorry, never again.

This place is awesome. Gluten free, non GMO and very tasty. I have had the chicken taco wrap, salmon wrap, chicken dumplings and the avocado scrambled egg wrap (my fav). Wonderful ladies that work here - always smiling and pleasant. Give them a try !!
The breakfast wraps are delicious and super healthy. Prices are very reasonable, will be back!

Premise/Intro:
A small and chill Greek place that definitely gives you bang for the buck.  Great gifts can come in small packages. 

Decor:
The place isn't a fancy decorated place nor does it need to be since it's very clean and organized.  Depending on how busy it is it can be hard to find a seat but we were able to find a booth.  It was definitely packed which could attest to its popularity. 

Service:
Thr service is quick and to the point. You pick the food you want and you ask some questions and they answer it.  There is no wait service. So you're definitely telling them what you want on your plate and they fill it as you go. Think Subway. 

Food/Product:
The food was good.  The portions were definitely a very good size.  There were potatoes, meat, salad, rice and so on.  They definitely cover all the major food groups. 

Price:
This is the where this place truly shines.  Hard to find a place where you can get that much food for around $7. 

Overall experience/Conclusion:
Definitely a place where I'd visit again.  They have a decent sized menu so they're definitely a lot of good items you can get for an excellent price.

I have passed this place hundreds of times and my family has never wanted to go there.  So, tonight I finally picked up a plate for myself.  I got the chicken kabob dinner.  I can't believe the prices.  Only $6.89 for a plate of 2 chicken kabobs, rice pilaf, 2 large wedges of potato, pita bread, and side salad.  Ridiculous prices.

The chicken was a little dry for my liking, but had a nice char grill flavor.  Everything else was good.  I wish I had some hummus or tzatziki sauce (is that how you spell it?).  Would've made the chicken better.  I am going to try the beef next time.  Great value!

Can't beat the value on the plate dinners.
Everything is very fresh here... Love the salad with house dressing ... One caveat
Some of the meat is over cooked...
Best bets gyros and the half chicken.

I don't know that I can add anything to what is already posted here, but go ahead and add another feather to your cap Kabobs! 

I from time to time find myself in St Charles for work and whenever that happens, I stop here for lunch. A lot of people have the same idea and this place can get busy during peak hours. They have a drive-thru which is super convenient, but I usually eat-in as this can get messy. 

You get a ton of food for the money here. They have platters of food or just sandwiches. It is all good and a healthy option for a quick, inexpensive lunch. Service is super fast too, these guys have a system down and are super friendly.
We have had this delivered at work and everything was so yummy!! Their meats were delicious and their sauces and rice were really yummy! I can't wait to try them again!!

This is the best fast food kabob place! Healthy, cheap, and generous portions, say no more! 

Their chicken pita sandwiches are delicious if you want a lot of meat. 

I would recommend getting one of their meals! 
All dinners served with salad, pita and either oven roasted potatoes and rice pilaf or french fries
Chicken Kabob PLATE ....................................................................................... 6.39 2 skewers of charbroiled marinated breast of chicken

What a steal! 

The meat quality is fantastic and the service is great.
Great food.  Great prices.  Quick.  Not much more to say.  Only restaurant of this type In our area.

This place is flippen' amazing. 

While shopping in Geneva, I ate lunch at Just Kabobs and ordered a combination plate that comes with gyros and your choice of another meat (steak, pork, chicken or shrimp), so I went with the chicken. You get a nice pile of gyros, a skewer of chicken, rice pilaf, a side salad, potatoes and pita bread - but the real kicker is that it's all for $7.39. 

It seems that they are constantly grilling kabobs and have them hot and ready so you don't have to wait. 

OMG - everything was excellent. The gyros was probably some of the best I've ever had (and I've eaten at almost every Greek restaurant in Chicago) and the chicken kabob was so juicy and flavorful. I just wish this place was closer to home and I'd be able to make more frequent visits. 

Awesome food at great prices. Try it!

My whole family loves this place. Portions are large enough that it's easy to split one between myself and my daughter. One of my favorite things to get is a side of roasted vegetables into steak kabobs. I also love the Euro Plate.

This place is good , went for the first time 2-3 months ago now I go once a wk, I've only tried 2 plates (I always order the same thing at certain spots) I will highly recommend this spot (Gyro plate)

I can't believe I had never been to this hidden gem. Amazing shrimp kabobs. My friend ordered the other meat kabobs and said they were excellent as well. I usually HATE rice pilaf but theirs is amazing. The roasted potatoes are excellent as well. You get a lot of food for under $10. I will definitely be returning!!

Great food at a great price.  Friendly staff.  Stoped by with the family. Tried chicken and pork kabobs with rice and Greek potatoes. All I can say is wow. Cooked perfect and great flavors. Will definitely be back.

The food is so flavorful and delicious. Everything on the menu is sooo good. The staff is friendly. The prices are fair. You get a lot of good quality food for a good price. You leave satisfied and with a full belly. You cannot go wrong here, you seriously have to try it. You will not be disappointed.

Imagine a McDonald's where they backyard grill instead of making terrible food...imagine no more cause you have found such a place. Only better! This place is put together like a normal fast food joint but they sell meat kabobs, rice, potatoes, salads, and gyros. Among other things of course. But their staple is the kabobs. 

The food was quickly prepared and delicious. Basically it was like eating at a family BBQ but in a McDonald's. I ordered some Nicky chicken and beef Kabobs resting nicely on a pile of rice with a boiled potato on the side. For the combination plate they also give you gyros meat and tiny pita slices.

Overall a very yummy place to eat and I wish they had more locations. It was a bit of a hike from where I live to get to it so sadly I cannot visit often. I hope this place takes off and we can expect more locations here in the burbs!

Food is good and pretty fair in price. The issue we saw is how the employees act. These grown men are acting like they are in high school. Literally saw them grabbing each other's rear ends in a joking manner and laughing about it. Not sure what is going on with that. Strange and unsanitary.

The food tastes good and the amount you get for the price is hard to beat. This place was packed on a Wednesday night. I'm knocking off a star because the sides are just way too greasy. The veggies are swimming in oil and the rice is loaded with butter. I could happily do without all the extra fat and calories.

First timer. It's was extremely good! The pita bread, TO DIE FOR! So good!! I had the chicken kabobs dinner and it was great. I'm going to be honest, I didn't eat the rice. I was too full, that's how much food they give you. Will definitely be a loyal customer! 

If the drive thru staff could be a bit friendlier, I'd give it an 11/10.

Always up for a great Gyro place, smells amazing as you walk up to the entrance. Fast friendly service, spotless clean& most importantly they put A LOT of love in their food. Chicken kabob plate was delish, comes with rice, potatoes( yeah carbs!) fresh side salad w/ your choice of dressing. My fiancÃ©e had the gyro sandwich& it was instant happy place. Great value for the huge amount of food they give you, kiddo menu, fast drive through service& they cater.

Being a diabetic it is a little disappointing how the kabob plates are loaded up with so much starch. Each plate features a huge helping of roasted potatoes and white rice and you only get a few bites of salad. The kabobs are good but they don't send me off into the stratosphere of kabob excellence. If you get more than one, I highly recommend getting a different kind (beef, pork, or chicken) as they are all good in their own way. My Mom is not diabetic and she would rate this at least four stars, but Mommy is not writing this review. A value oriented fast food experience is featured, so if you are already getting two kabobs it is inexpensive to add a third. They are good left over. Due to the fact that burgers, hot dogs, and falafel are not available the menu is limited.

This place is fantastic.   I stopped by for lunch with a coworker as she really talked it up.  The food lived up to what she said. 


Being new to an establishment, many times I panic and just sort of order something.  I went for the rice and chicken combo.  It came with two pieces of chicken, rice, potatoes, and a drink for 4.95 with tax.  (Pita and sauce came with it as well, but I can't eat it) 


Yes, 4.95.  

It was really delicious too! I just wish they did salad and rice or salad and potatoes.  I felt pretty carbed up with both potatoes and rice.  That didn't stop me from eating it though!

Great place to get kabobs. I got pork, my wife had chicken. Both meats were very flavorful and juicy. For the price (about $7 each) we got two skewers each, a ton of rice, a salad, potato wedges, and pita bread. Everything was fresh and delicious. Service was quick and friendly. Great value and perfect for lunch!

I truly wish there were more of these around. Good food, prepared quickly, at a great price. The beef kabobs are better than most steaks you'd get at chain restaurants, and the rice pilaf is fantastic.

Just Kabobs is hands down the best "fast food" place I've ever visited. My wife and I love this place. You get huge portions of the best chicken, and shrimp kabobs with rice potatoes salad and pita bread. And it's under $10. The service is great and super fast also. We've never had a bad experience here and have probably been here at least 20 times in 3 years. I definitely recommend Just Kabobs!!

I don't know how it took so long to discover this amazing place! I  tried the Combination plate with gyro and shrimp skewer and it is phenomenal!! Great portions and great pricing and they also have a drive through.

Yeah all the other reviews are right.  This place is great.  Quality ingredients prepared well and price reasonably.

Got the grilled chicken plate and it was great.  I got a side of the grilled veggies and they were really fantastic check them out.

A lot of good food at a more than reasonable price. What's not to like about that?! 
2 grilled chicken kabobs, pita bread, sliced potatoes, rice, and a Greek salad for $6.39. The chicken was juicy, the salad was fresh and had a great house dressing, and warm pita bread always tastes great. Also, the grilled vegetable are really good. On a side note, I got an extra beef kabob for my dog, and suffice to say, it was gone in about ten seconds. For one thing that could be improved, the rice could use some more seasoning.
Very good food. Fast service and reasonable prices. We love ordering a bunch of Kabobs with hummus and salad.

This place is great, we showed up just before closing with 6 people and I thought they were going to turn us away here after but they were very accommodating. We ordered kebobs and salads all around, man they had a great variety of different kebobs and salads.  Prices are amazingly reasonable here, we had six dinners three sides and six drinks two smoothies and all for under $80. The atmosphere at this place was also very nice all-around clean and the  personnel  there very very friendly. Overall we had an extremely positive experience here and would visit again if we're ever that far north.
Great food at a great price.  Very consistent.  Never had an issue.  Always good stuff.

Bring an appetite and a healthy love for food. This place is great value. The food is delicious! We split a combo plate (chicken kababs and gyro) and had left overs! The Greek potatoes were my favorite and  my husband loved the chicken kabob. The chicken was perfectly done actually. Can't wait to come back!

One of my go-to's. Tons of food for the price and lots of veggie choices. My faves:  spinach pie, spicy feta, and the grilled veggies. Everything tastes extremely fresh. So glad to have this restaurant in my neighborhood!

This place is awesome.  The food is great and their prices are amazing.  The combo plate with gyro meat and a kabob with rice, salad and potato spears is awesome.  You also have to try the spice feta with pita wedges.  

The place is always busy and they crank through the line with ease.  I've never had to wait more than a minute or so whether it was inside or at the drive-thru.

It doesn't look like much and it is kind of in a tough location right off of busy Rt. 64 near Randall, but it is well worth the effort for lunch or dinner.
Really good kebabs, but a little disappointing you have to pay extra for the tzatziki even with a platter. Big portion size, so you really can't go wrong.
This place is insane. Fantastic quality chicken and gyro s, soups salads at a fantastic price. I almost feel guilty paying so low. Small place can get crowded though.

Well, if you are looking for a romantic fine dining experience, don't go here! BUT if you want a really nice plate of Greek food for a song, check it out! This is turning into my go to "I really don't feel like cooking tonight" spot.

So the meals are huge and you get rice, Greek potatoes, yummy flatbread, a salad and a couple beef, chicken or pork (my fav!) kabobs for $7-9. Gyros is very good and you can get a smaller plate too. Hubby and I can split a dinner with an extra kabob and we are filled up. They guys there are nice folks too! The dining area is no great shakes,  but the place is clean and well kept. I recommend!

We had gotten the gyro plate which was good. The bed of rice was moist and flavorful. The village salad I was less pleased with. Basically some veggies and Italian dressing...I've had better. We went around lunch time and had to wait about 5 cars ahead of us.

Just Kabobs was a real surprise!  My mother-in-law mentioned that she enjoyed this spot, so I bookmarked it a while back. We were trying to decide on a casual, new to us spot and I saw Just Kabobs in the list. We took the 25 minute drive to give them a try. 

At first glance, I was nervous. They have a drive up window and the interior was similar to a McDonald's, Wendy's or a Taco Bell. I took one look at the food and my nervousness turned into joy. The food was very appealing to the eye. 

We ordered a combo plate with gyros and a chicken kabob and a steak kabob plate with an extra chicken kabob. Each plate comes with rice, potatoes and a salad. I preferred the steak kabobs to the chicken ones, but both were good. I preferred the rice to the potatoes. And the salad was fresh with a flavorful dressing. No complaints from me other than the non-exciting pita bread. I wish it was a little fresher. 

Overall, the meal was hot, fast and fresh. We will definitely add Just Kabobs to our rotation!

I do this restaurant on a Friday night and take food home for the family. The place is amazing the staff is friendly, they are fast and they take care of the people at the drive-through window so you can get on with your business!!

The portions are large there's leftovers or you can split your meal was someone else it's plenty of food it's tasty the kebabs are moist the chicken is moist the rice is moist just really good food
This place is a regular stop for our family. It's good Greek style healthy food at very reasonable prices.

Ok fine, I admit that I'm a downtown Chicago snob when it comes to restaurants. I usually turn my nose up when my suburban friends rave about some "amazing" restaurant in the 'burbs. On occasion,  I'm put in my place when I experience a suburban restaurant that far exceeds my expectations. Enough about my pompous personality, let's get to a restaurant review. I visited  my brother-in-law's house in Geneva, IL and he picked up some food from Just Kabobs. We had beef kabobs, chicken kabobs, rotisserie chicken, spicy feta, tzatziki and rice pilaf. I took my 1st bite of a beef kabob and wow....just wow. I'm a beef guy but I decided to mosey over to the styrofoam container with the chicken kabob and took a a chunk of kabob and popped it into my mouth. It was juicy and just perfect.  It's not often that I prefer chicken over beef but Just Kabobs turned another one of my presumptions on it's head. The rotisserie chicken, spicy feta and tzatziki were excellent as was the rice pilaf. I am hard pressed to name a downtown Chicago Mediterranean restaurant that can compete with Just Kabobs. Now it's time for me to beg forgiveness from my suburban foodies.....this time.

Just Kabobs is pretty much my favorite place to eat.

Delicious food.
Super fair price.
Huge portions.
Quality ingredients.

Don't go during peak lunch/dinner hours or you won't be able to park, but don't let that stop you.  Find another time to go and you won't be disappointed. 

I started eating a chicken plate once a week on my lunch break, and only a few months later I found a sweet deal on an apartment.  Coincidence?  You decide.
So good love their rice and potatoes the kaboobs are so delicious and everything is juicy love love love you have to try it  for yourself the pita bread  is ahhhmazinggg
Awesome food, inexpensive but high quality. Have eaten from there twice now. The chicken kabobs are the kabomb.

Startlingly good for "fast food". The building and sign are unimpressive to the point of being off-putting, but don't let that deter you. 
Great for people on a Paleo diet. 
They also cater!
This place is amazing! Literally not a bad thing on the menu!!
fresh food, fast service. the owners are nice! love this place. !

Win, Win, Win!  Three visits and every one was a winner.  We used the drive thru every time.  Very nice people and the building and parking lot look immaculate.  The best part was the fresh, delicious hot food.  We had beef kabobs 2 times and gyros the 3rd.  The potato's and rice are so tasty and I believe the fries are fresh cut.  If not fresh cut fries, they are the best frozen fries I've ever had.  The portions we had were very consistent and generous.  The gyros sauce was just so fresh tasting.  I would order and extra sauce next time just because it was so good.

Terrible customer service!! I asked for fries instead of pita bread. The drive in girl said they can't do that! Oh really, look at your website!! I ask for the manager and he comes to the window and says " we really don't like to do that ". Oh really, look at your website!! I USED to come here all of the time and have used them for catering, but a simple request, which is on their website and I'm refused? Never again!

Food here is cooked fresh and smells AMAZING! Two thumbs up bc now I'm addicted! Please don't be shy and step right in bc once you do you'll see and taste the reason why so many people are raving about this place.
just tried chicken skewers/salad lunch -- very cheap, fresh, tender meat, well-seasoned. will definitely return to try their hummus & other dishes.

I am so glad to see that this place is getting a lot of good responses on Yelp.  I found it on Yelp a few years ago, but didn't even think of giving it a review for some reason.

This place is one of my favorite fast food places that I have ever been too.  If you are ever thinking to yourself that you wish there could be a fast food place that is actually on the healthier side... This is it!  It is healthier, but not at the cost of taste.  The food is amazing!!

So I was and often do some kind of Low Carb diets and wanted to find places where I could get some meat and salad.  They got that!

I wish they used romaine lettuce in their salads, but it could be better off that they don't cause I wouldn't want to eat anyplace other then this place... ever.  Their salads are a good size with low cost.  They only have two dressings, some kind of house (which I don't recall what type it was) and ranch.  The ranch is very good, thinner then most but tasty.

For the meats, I love their Chicken Skewers and often buy some to take home for a weekend, don't wanna do anything but throw something in the microwave and just veg out.

The best part about this place is that it is really affordable for the quality of food you get.

I do have to say that there was one time that I didn't find their bathrooms to be as clean as I'd expect... but that was 1 out of at least 20 times going here.  So, I don't hold that against them, it could be I just walked in after some poor slob left.

I was very impressed with the flavor and serving sizes here. I had the chicken kabob pita sandwich and my husband had the gyro dinner. Next time I plan to get the greek chicken dinner because the rice and potatos that come with the dinners are so moist and flavorful. This place is a winner!
Overrated. People that give good reviews about like it because it's inexpensive.  I tried it once just to see but all hype.

Just Kabobs, in particular, equals two things- 1.) incredibly cheap and 2.) incredibly fast. They offer a fairly wide variety of Greek food all of which is tasty. I will say if you or a family member/friend have a vegan/vegetarian diet- there is little selection. They do offer potatoes, steamed veggies, and salad (ask for no feta). Overall, great place especially for a quick and cheap experience with great quality!
Simply fantastic food. I am never disappointed. Big portions and TASTY! Clean. Friendly people.
One of our favorites for the family. FAST and so nummy. Kebab sandwiches and platters are fantastic. Shrimp kebabs...mmmm!

Fantastic prices, good portions and a pretty addictive flavor. Yep. I'm a fan and have gone there 3x in the last week! This is the new go to spot when I want something other than pizza or burgers.

Their Gyros are especially good, and a great bargan at $4.25

This place is sooooo affordable and after only going one time I know that this will become a regular spot that we dine in or take out. The portions are very very generous and I love that if you dine in you get soup with whatever you order. My meal was the chicken kabob pita sandwich with fries and the portion was so large I struggled to finish it. My husband got the chicken breast plate that was served with a salad and rice, he said that it was very good. 
FYI: their tzatziki sauce is AWESOME so even if what you order doesn't' come with it pay the fifty cents and get a side of it you won't be mad that you did....promise

We came on a Saturday night at about 7:30. The place was packed. I have to say that the kabobs were just ok as was the chicken. The dark meat perfect but the white meat was sadly dry. The potatoes that came with the rice was good and the rice was deelish. The gyros were as expected.  I would probably come again and try other stuff. It's definitely healthier than a lot of other options.

Food is EXCELLENT! The steak kabobs have high quality meat and are cooked medium rare to perfection. The food is well seasoned and the portions are quite large! The staff is fast and friendly. We eat here on a repeat basis. If you want something quick but yet still nutritional, this is where you need to go. They also have a drive through which is convenient!

I love this restaurant. I get takeout all
The time. The food is fresh and delicious. The kabobs, rice, potatoes and salad are my favorites. They also have great soup and smoothies.

This review is a long overdue!! Love the food here!! The even catered my daughter's grad party last year (which was a huge hit.) Large portion sizes, so I usually split the chicken kabob plate with a family member. Everything is made fresh in front of you. Yummy baklava...and they serve Coke products--bonus! I just wish they had another location closer to me.
LOVE THIS PLACE! Wow, I am vegan and am SO impressed with their variety of foods! This place is the real deal. Delicious, affordable, and great service!

UGH MY GOD! SOOOOO GOOD! I've lived in St Charles for 10 years now and just started going here! Seriously, if you want something that'll fill you up, healthy and cheap...this is the place! It's small but I love that! It gets busy around lunch and dinner but I can totally understand why! For $7-$8 you can get rice, two kabobs of your choice of meat, potato wedges, salad, pita bread and hummus! I usually always have some left over. They have great customer service, all the workers are always kind. Love, love, loveee Just Kabobs!

I eat here way more often then I should but I just can't help it!
This is by far one of my favorite places!
My motto tends to be "When all else fails, Just Kabobs"
I'm sure that doesn't sound very catchy to you now
but once you try this place you'll be following the same motto.
 
Let's start with the customer service.
It's fantastic.
All the employees here are so polite!
I have yet to have a negative experience.
They are always smiling, create a little bit of chit chat (the non-awkward type) and make sure you have everything you need.
 
Second, the food...it's delicious
It's all so simple but cooked and seasoned to perfection.
I adore their gyro and the pita they service with it.
I've never had chicken, steak or shrimp here that was dry and over-cooked.
Also, the quantity of food they give you is crazy!
Rice, potato wedges, a side salad and your choice of meat!
If I eat here for lunch, I don't eat for the rest of the day.

Very good marinated shrimp, and tasty gyros plates with a choice of salad or rice. 
Smoothies a deal at under $3. 
Crowded at peak times with minimal seating, parking lot's not huge. Bright and clean.

Pretty tasty and fast for $10. We'll be back.
Can't say enough great things about Just Kabobs. Value Meal is under $5 and absolutely delicious. Love all kabob types, gyro meat, salad and don't forget the spicy feta - it's to die for!
Best kabobs ....friendly people...great food! I eat here couple times a week. Never get tired of it.

Horrible all the way around.  Low quality/inferior meat.  I got chicken kebabs, I nearly choked, could have broken a window w/the chicken, that's how tough it was.  Came with rice, tasted like Minute Maid rice.  Roasted potatoes, what can you say about them, nothing special.  On top of being tough, the chicken was incredibly dry and totally lacking in any kind of flavor.  I asked them for a side of bbq sauce in the hopes of adding some flavor/moisture to the horrendous chicken, you would've thought I was speaking another language, the guys behind the counter looked at me with a blank stare and gave me about a teaspoon of bbq sauce in a ridiculously tiny cup.  I asked for another little side of sauce, they gave it to me but not without a dirty look. Then in Spanish the guys behind the counter were saying, "why does she need another sauce?"  (Unbeknownst to them I speak Spanish fluently.).  On top of that their parking lot is ridiculously configured, I entered the wrong way and the guy behind the counter took it upon himself to call me out on this and said that I need to drive more carefully, I entered the wrong way.  When I apologized and said that I am not from the area and it was my first time at the restaurant he just looked at me w/a blank stare.  Horribly dry, inferior food with poor customer service, employees who totally lack any people/customer service skills.  Heads up to this ridiculous place, Next time you want to talk about a customer in Spanish don't assume that they don't know Spanish merely because they have blonde hair/are light skinned.

Easily one of my favorite go-to's for dinner. Beef kabobs are my favorite, as well as the gyro. I like both of these entrees so much that I have yet to try much else on their menu. The ONLY negative remark I will give them is in regards to their hours. I can understand being open only till 9pm during the week, but I really wish they would stay open past 9pm on the weekends. Such a bummer!
This place is amazing! The food is fresh and healthy, and always quick when ordered. We've also ordered catering from them a couple of times, and have been extremely happy!

The customer service here is incredible! This is my second review but I've been here many many times before. I had the shrimp salad with the house dressing. I also had a side of the grilled vegetables. The shrimp on the salad was great! Firm, fresh, and seasoned perfectly. The vegetables in the salad were also fresh and extra crispy which I love! The grilled vegetables too were perfectly seasoned and grilled. The assortment is full of veggie lovers favorites; mushroom caps, zucchini, peppers, and onions.. No skimping on servings here! And of course the warm pita brought it all together!! Great place to dine in or take out. Must check out!
The chicken kabobs are excellent. I wish they would upgrade their salad to spinach but it is still very good. My young children love this place.

Oh my gosh this place is amazing. Fresh food cooked right in front of you. The guys behind the counter take pride in what they are serving. Light. Prices are crazy good. Huge plate of fresh food for $8. Amazing. And the kids are chowing down. New favorite.

I absolutely loved my experience at Just Kabobs! The food was fantastic- I enjoyed a beef kabob plate. The meat was cooked perfectly, and I loved my sides of potatoes and salad (don't do bread, so I can't comment on the pita). I thought the house dressing was delicious too.

The meal was extremely pocketbook friendly- I paid $8.00 and that included a fountain beverage, and I was unable to finish all of the food. The produce looked and tasted fresh, and the service was super quick and very friendly. I will 100% be back to this place to try other meals (gyros sounded lovely too). Absolutely check it out if you are looking for something quick, delicious, and inexpensive in the STC area!
