Great fresh food at a super reasonable price. This is one of our favorite fast-food options in the area! I would highly recommend the chicken kabob plate...mmm!

I've tried several items from here, all via their drive-thru, and I haven't had a bad experience. Always fast service. Good prices.

Items that I've tried:

chicken kabob value meal ($3.49) - chicken was seasoned and not dry. I opted for rice pilaf and potatoes rather than a salad or fries. The rice pilaf and potatoes were simply good, nothing complicated flavorwise.

shrimp kabob value meal (4.59) - good, but the chicken is better. The salad was satisfying with cucumbers, tomatoes, peppers. It comes with an Italian dressing if you don't mention a preference.

chicken tender value meal ($4.29 with 20 oz drink) - great value. It might be a small meal though for my brother, but the portions work for me.

I've also tried their pork and beef kabobs. The pork was good, but the beef wasn't tender.

This place is a solid, straightforward lunch option if you're in the area. Also, the menu isn't complicated for newcomers, which is a bonus ;)

I can't say enough about how good this place is.  We have only been in the area for about a year but this has to be our most frequented restaurant.  I have even had friends ask me to bring it to them when I travel out of town.  I think that it is very well priced and the food has yet to disappoint.  The dinners and combination plate are very filling and well worth the stop!

This is the most reasonably priced restaurant I know. Good food and fast service make this place a winner. Delicious seasoned beef, chicken or pork, along with shrimp on a skewer. Delicious best describes the dinners here. Served with roasted potatoes and seasoned rice. Pita bread and a fresh salad round out the meal. All this at about $ 6.00 per dinner.  Drive up service is fast, indoor seating is self serve.  Not one complaint about this place, love the food!

Great Find! At first I thought it was a cheesy fast food place, but this place is great if you're looking for something different for dinner, or even better, catering! 

We ordered a small catering order for my Mom's birthday dinner, and then 2 weeks later a large order for my neice's 3rd birthday party. Ironically, my Aunt had Just Kabobs catering my cousin's 1st birthday party on the same day! 

Heads up, they'll split a tray of 1/2 rice & 1/2 potatoes if you dont want full one of each. Also, they used to do veggie kabobs, but they wouldn't stay on the sticks so now you can just order a tray of veggies, but I don't think it's listed on the menu.
Kabobs all the way.  Best post workout meal and a great price. Healthy options and everything is fresh.  I wish they would deliver.

Great food!  Great value!  My wife and I tried the chicken and beef kabob sandwiches. Both were flavorful and tender. The tomato salad and sauce were both fresh. We also tried the roasted potatoes and the grilled veggies which were great on the side. The food was well presented within view behind the counter where you order. The restaurant was clean and the staff was courteous. We'll be back.

This place is great. It is one of my boyfriends favorites. He could eat here 4-5 times a week, and he has!

The pita and hummus is better than store bought hummus. They serve the pita warm and it makes it that much better.

Everything I have tried here is good and it is super cheap! Rice, fries, chicken kabob, steak kabob, all so good!
Perfunctory service but a good value.   Cleanish inside but not gorgeous.   Very fair on drinks.
Eaten here many, many times. Food is always excellent and consistent. Usually get the chicken kabob plate. Can't go wrong!

This is an awesome place to eat at the food is fantastic the prices are some the people are great never get a bad played a food it's economically reasonable and is very very good and fresh food I give it a triple and me for the food that they made we always go there at least once a week

Just Kababs is the perfect place to go if you want solid, cheaply priced food.

It is a favorite for sure.

You really do get a lot for your money at this place, and it's relatively guilt free as far as "fast food" goes. The food is great and flavorful. My only complaint is that the staff is often very rude and come off as if they would rather be anywhere in the world other than work.

Let me start by saying "Just Kabobs" is guilty of false advertising.  They have more than *just* kabobs.  I usually get the chicken kabob combo plate.  The chicken is tender and has great flavor.  The salad is decent w/good dressing.  I love, love, LOVE the rice.  Very flavorful and moist.  I can't stand rice that is dry; frequently that is what you find in restaurants.  But not here.  I could easily see myself eating just a big plate of their rice.  Great portions... for me.  The combo plate yields dinner plus leftovers.

After seeing all of the great reviews, we decided to stop by after a long day out. We got two orders of the chicken kabobs and the bbq rotisserie chicken. The amount of the food we got was gigantic but it was all very good. Salad was fresh, Chicken was moist and rice was very fluffy. We will be back for sure!

Fabulous fresh food!
Best bargain in town!
Friendly, fast service!
Will definitely recommend to family and friends. 
If you want excellent food at extremely affordable prices this is the place for you!

This is our spot.  As my Spartan King likes to say; the food is literally fire every single time.  Get the beef kabob platter with potatoes instead of fries, a side of spicy hummus and feta; and you're in the money.  Most tender and succulent beef of all time.  It's literally like the skies open and the angels and the heavens sing and every Greek god ever known to man falls at your feet and Jesus is happy.  Seriously.  Get thee to Just Kabobs if you have not already.  Like, yesterday.

My friend took me here today and all they did was RAVE about it. After trying the Shrimp Kabob Plate, I realized they couldn't have been more right about all the positive things they were saying about the place. It was honestly some of the best food I've ever eaten. The shrimp was amazing, the salad was delicious, and the rice and potatoes were a perfect side. Not only was the food almost perfect, but the atmosphere wasn't half bad either. Needless to say, I am definitely going to come back here whenever I am in St. Charles.
Great food n prices. I love the freshness of the food and open food prep area. Really quick!

Casual

$ (Cheap Eats - Think McD's, BK, Wendy's, etc.)

Awesome local spot. I avoid fast food but this is a place worth stopping. It's different from the rest of the greasy fast food joints. The service is always quick and friendly, the food is refreshingly affordable and best of all, the food is delicious. I have eaten here four times and have only had one issue (hence why the 4 stars). One piece of chicken on one of the kabobs was hard, bony and cold. It was weird because the rest of the chicken on that skewer and in the rest of the meal was warm, seasoned, tender and delicious. It grossed me out but is the only time I've had an issue like that here so I'm still a fan! I definitely recommend if you're looking for a "one dollar sign" place to eat (as my wife and I like to say).

One of our favorite restaurants. 

We've been coming to this restaurant for many years. The food is high quality! Our favorite server is Amy...she is wonderful!  She came to my rescue one time when I accidentally spilled a drink on our table. 

Every meal has been delightful. My favorites are the flatbread pizzas, the jambalaya and the sea bass. Amazing!

The martini's are amazing too...and the atmosphere is warm and inviting.

The pizzas and the goat cheese cheesecake are rave-worthy.  The Peaches and Cream pizza did not disappoint; the flavors of spiced peaches, macerated cherries, garlic cream, blue cheese, and arugula all complemented one another.  The crust is crisp on the outside, chewy on the inside, and not too thin.  I could not finish the pizza alone, so I took the leftovers home which heated up nicely the next day.  I devoured the goat cheese cheesecake (just TRY it!) it was not overly tangy as some described, the goat cheese flavor was extremely mild, and the cheesecake itself was creamy with a sweet and crunchy graham cracker crust.

Our server raved about the lobster bisque and pumpkin bisque.  I ordered the pumpkin bisque, which is a seasonal item, and if you're heading to Turf Room before the seasons change, you must order this!  He kindly warned us that there's a dash of jalapeno, which added only a slight spicy kick - you've just got to be ready for it.  The bisque itself was thick and creamy, more like a pumpkin puree than bisque.  The spices and texture made for a delightful soup though.

I was disappointed with the parma ham appetizer.  This was a plate of prosciutto slices, a dab of whipped goat cheese and honey, and 4-5 small figs.  We were told the figs "would go a long way" if we cut them, but they were rock hard and too small to cut with butter knives.  The ratio of cheese & figs to the prosciutto was way off.  I would not order this one again, and it especially was not worth $13.

I tried two cocktails.  I loved one, the "Love Me Long Time," which had a laundry list of ingredients including sake and champagne, but the table side presentation was a bit elaborate and showy.  I just sat there, waiting...waiting...OK it was worth the wait.  I didn't like the "Cool as a Cucumber" at all, but I normally enjoy drinks like this.  It tasted way too strong, every sip was burning alcohol in my throat.

It's a breath of fresh air in the western suburbs since finding a restaurant for a proper celebration usually requires going a little farther from home.  The drinks are, without a doubt, overpriced for the area.  Freshly made cocktails or not, $13 a pop is downtown Chicago territory.  The dinner menu is a mix of items from sandwiches and pizza to steaks and chops.  I would have liked to try the lobster mac & cheese, but $20 for a side dish is absurd. The two of us spent $100+ before tax/tip.  I would have not experienced sticker shock if I were in Chicago - so I can only imagine how many locals feel (especially those who rarely leave the Kane/DuPage area) when they see the menu.  Honest assessment:  the food is DAMN good and the prices mostly reflect that.  The drinks not so much - stick with their daily $4.50 beer and wine option!

The atmosphere is like a supper club.  The lighting is dim and casts shadows on faces.  A couple cozied up in the lounge by the fire pit.  The fire pit is pretty, but it is not practical.  After we got home, I immediately threw my clothes into the laundry.  My hair, and even my purse, absorbed some of the smoky odor.  It wasn't necessarily a bad smell, but getting dressed up to go out on Friday night, I did not expect to come home as if we'd just enjoyed some Jiffy Pop and s'mores.  The booths were like sitting on church pews; the seats were positioned far enough from the table that I was hunched over my plate.  

The Turf Room succeeds because of their excellent food, good drinks, and upscale atmosphere.  There is literally no competition in the area.  There are some comparable restaurants in Geneva and Naperville, but nothing in Aurora or North Aurora like Turf Room.

This review is for Brunch only. ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE.

Beyond limited choices
Eggs (typical brunch item)
Sausage,Ham and Bacon (typical brunch items)
Belgian waffle (typical brunch item)
Carnitas Lasagna disgusting 
Prime Rib cold and over cooked
Salmon Eggs Benedict  (not labeled and i dont like Salmon so a very disappointing suprise)
Omelet Station (typical brunch item)

THE WORST SERVICE!
Our waitress looked annoyed everytime she came to the table and completly ignored my wife. On top of that one of the "Chefs" literally stood behind me resting his arm on the top of my seat talking to his parents. Nothing like having a meal with someone literally over your shoulder for the entire meal. 

Coffee and Juice not included in the price! WTF, Ive never been to brunch where i paid extra for coffee and juice. Hell you get that at cheesy hotel breakfast bars. 4.00 for a mostly ice filled glass of juice and 2.00 for an average cup of coffee at best.

So what did this wondeful experience cost? Just the high high price of 58.00. This was beyond ridiculous!

I cant recommend enough to stay away from this place for Brunch.

Now i have heard that the regular menu is great and my wife has eaten there and enjoyed it so i will try it for a  regular meal.

Ate there for Thanksgiving dinner - we brought a bottle of wine as we usually do - a good bottle.  We have been coming here for years - our last visit was in the late summer.  We have always brought a bottle of wine and if you let the waiter taste your wine they will waive the corking fee.  Well when we came on Thursday the hostessed told us NO - we never do that.  We said we have been coming here for years and they always do that and she said NO - I am the OWNER and we NEVER do that EVER.  SHe was extremely RUDE - to the point that she told our waiter to specifically make sure that he added the $20 corkage fee and that it was not debatable.  She was the RUDEST OWNER I have ever met.

Now I do wish I would have spoke to her myself since this was my brother that brought the wine because I would have given her a piece of my mind - AND would remind her that her attitude was unwarranted and unnecessary.

We will NOT visit the restaurant again.  The food portions have gotten SMALLER and our turkey was cold when it came out - and really nothing special at all. Because of this women - you have lost three families that you to frequent your restaurant but no more.

Went for the Sunday brunch.  It's a little pricey at $24 per person but the food is excellent and service was outstanding.  We will be back for a weeknight cocktail and dinner.  Great atmosphere for friends to lounge and enjoy or a romantic night out!  Especially the wood burning fire "pit" with all the sofas. Looks like a very cozy spot!  Extensive wine and craft brew options too!

I've been here at least 5 times by now. When i come to Batavia to visit my family, this is where I make sure we go for dinner.

The atmosphere is very diverse. Having a betting house on the other side of the bar from a very classy dining spot is a first. The indoor sunken fire pit is my favorite place to grab a drink, app, and relax. The outdoor area has fire pits as well, which all offer heat when the night becomes a bit cold.

The food is constantly rotating and paired with martinis which are hand shaken and unique in a good way. 

This place is a real gem for Aurora I will continue coming back when in the area.

When I consider the best balance of atmosphere, cuisine and service I consider the Turf Room. The specialty cocktails are truly novel. I have never been disappointed by anything off the menu and the servers are attentive and knowledgeable. It's pricey for sure but for a special evening out and in this area, you can't beat the Turf Room.

Great dinner here on a Friday night. We were able to make a last minute reservation a really enjoyed sitting on the patio. We absolutely loved the Pena ham appetizer (WHAT IS THAT GOAT CHEESE CAKE CRUMBLE HEAVEN!?) and the prime pizza (to die for)! The only cons: our waiter was bringing us DOWN. He was MIA most of the time and when he was around he couldn't have sounded less enthused. Also the fire on the patio was intense to the point where ash was flying around (and landing on our food/in our drinks) and my hair smelled like bonfire after. But if you visit and order what we did and you won't regret it!

This is my favorite restaurant in the Fox Valley area. The bone in ribeye is fantastic, the drinks are awesome and the flatbread appetizers are great as well. We look for opportunities to go here with family and friends that are visiting town, and we come here to celebrate our special occasions. The atmosphere is great, the outdoor seating when it's a little bit chilly is great because they have the wood fireplaces. The rest rooms are like horse stalls, but in the coolest way possible.I have not had a bad meal at this restaurant in a dozen tries.

Went here for a special dinner with my husband. Delicious! Loved the salmon with a side of apple-cheese salad. Mixed drinks were great, as were the desserts (goat cheese cheesecake... get in my belly!). My husband ordered the meatloaf flight, which honestly was kind of skimpy, but he said it all tasted good. I thought the ambiance was nice, but my cranky old husband thought it was too dark in there, and that's what he seems to remember most about the experience. We will be back, though, because I like it!

Whew. This place is pricey. I went here for dinner with a few of the ladies from work and I was taken aback by how much everything was. I don't think any of the entrees were under $10. I settled on the ahi tuna salad, which has seared ahi tuna, fried brie cubes (that still had the rind on... ick), sliced apples, nuts, and spring mix. It was pretty good but I don't think it was almost $20 good. My co-workers got everything from the flatbread to the pastas, and they all seemed happy. I might have just picked a dud or let my cheapness influence my decision.

I will tell you one thing though: that goat cheese cheesecake is legit. It sounds disgusting but the goat cheese is so subtle that it just adds this little bit of earthy tang and it's rounded out by the blueberry topping. That was worth every penny.

I wasn't as enamored during my subsequent visit to The Turf Room as I was on my first trip.  I had made reservations for 2, and although there was a nice open table near the big fireplace, we were seated away from the fire near the back of the dining room.  The service was slow and impersonal.  We asked for a minute to look over the menu and didn't see the waiter for another 10 minutes.  He got our beer order wrong and the food wasn't as impressive as my first time here.

Filo Chicken $16 - The actual chicken was boring, but the sauce was good.  Unfortunately, the waiter didn't pack any of the sauce when I took my leftovers home.

Duck Pasta $18 - It looked really good, the noodles were cooked well, but I didn't enjoy the taste of the sauce that much.

Lobster Mac & Cheese $13 - This was my favorite dish of the night!  It was buttery and delicious.  They should make one that's a dinner portion.

You have to try the fried calamari. The only bad thing about eating it is no others will ever be able to measure up to it.

Sun dried tomatoes perfectly infused with lemons and tasty sauce. 

The Meatloaf Flight was ingenious. Three types of meatloaf on one plate. My wife's tortellini melted in your mouth. 

Very impressed very good and very eager to go back.

Love the Turf room great crafty cocktails and awesome martinis!  The indoor wood burning fireplace is a good perk on the cold nights to get out and watch a Blackhawks game here. They also have a outside fireplace too in the summer, but it doesn't keep away the mosquitos. If you don't mind smelling like burnt wood when you leave its a great time with friends and family. It's a kinda pricy for drinks and food but both are great. This is a hidden gem in the suburbs.

I like the Turf Room for drinks and appetizers, especially in cool weather. Sitting by a cozy fireplace with a good glass of wine is pretty hard to beat. I like the dinner menu as well, even though a favorite or two has been rotated off the menu - because a new item takes its place, and I have a new favorite!

The ambiance, the service, the food and drinks - always wonderful.

Service was wonderful on Saturday night. We sat in the bar & server Mike G. was one of the best waiters we have ever experienced. The food was great, atmosphere was nice & they were on top of EVERYTHING from the food, drinks, dirty table, etc. 
We definitely will be back!
Great for area, hit or miss service. Turf room attempts but falls short in delivering the upscale vide the ascetics set it up for.

I've been here twice and both times we were treated exceptionally well! The second time was for my 12th wedding anniversary where we were treated to a champagne toast. Both times I have had a special vegan dish that is not on the menu. It's a forbidden black rice stir fry with broccolini and other vegetables. Excellent! Best vegan dish I've ever had at a non veg/vegan restaurant. The drinks were good too! I ordered the martini with fresh jalapeÃ±o stuffed olives. I couldn't finish the glass but it was so good and I could've eaten 20 of the olives!

Not great, especially for the price.  Went on a week night, not crowded at all which was great.  Martini was weak, the entree Cobb salad was meh, just ok.  The lobster mac n cheese, for $19.95 is a complete joke.  There is "lobster essence" in that dish.  No discernable pieces of lobster in there at all.  Capitol Grill's version is a couple dollars cheaper and TEAMING with hunks of lobster.  Don't order it at Turf, you will be very dissappointed.

Truly a surprise I was not expecting.  As a gluten fee celiac, they knew what to do.  I need to find a reason to be back in North Aurora.

The only place I found in the last 20 years that knows how to make a proper Lobster Bisque ... No flour thickner.   Whether the chef used the high end cheesecloth method or a touch of cornstarch, I couldn't tell, but as a GF option, omg, thank you.   It wasn't served in the traditional thin layer in a large bowl, but rather in a bowl that actually appeared to provide a substantial amount.  Again, thank you.  The only place that might compare is Brigtsen's on Dante Street in New Orleans.

I also had the Apple and Cheese Salad.  Wow.  Also not what I was expecting.  Thinking of some apple slices and cheese atop a green salad was my mistake.  I was served something that appeared to be an Asian Cole Slaw.  Holy cow, it was all julienned thin apple strings with similar Manchengo cheese interspersed.  I don't know how they did that, but my goodness, what a great combination of favors.     I also had the chicken on top ... It didn't need it.

I've been here and to their sister restaurant, Saddle Room, multiple times. I have yet to be disappointed. Everything on their menu is very good and different from similar items elsewhere. One thing to note, their flatbread crust is like a cracker. If you're expecting thin pizza crust you'll be thrown off.

Wonderful restaurant with great atmosphere and delicious food. As you arrive, the steel-etched sign with live flame welcomes you in. This theme continues whether you dine outside or eat in the dusky, comfortable dining room (so dusky that every other table was using their flashlight app to read the menu, but that's romantic, right?), as there are multiple wood-burning fireplaces throughout. If you enjoy a glass of wine, you've come to the right place as they have a huge wine library. Their bar also mixes a delicious cocktail, many of them unique to Turf Room. 

The server welcomed us right away, telling us about their evening specials and answering all our questions. She returned almost immediately with drinks and hot bread (lightly sprinkled with smoked salt and served with maple herbed butter). I ordered Spanish Filo Chicken, my wife had Chicken Pesto Tortellini. Both were absolutely delicious. My chicken was made more delicious because whatever spices the chef used were very aromatic, adding to the amazing flavor palette. We were stuffed (the portions are very generous), so we skipped dessert, but the tasty treats at neighboring tables looked great.

If you plan on going, reservations aren't a must, but they are a good idea for a Friday or Saturday night. The atmosphere is a little upscale, but still casual. Diners were dressed in everything from jackets and ties to jeans and polos. A heads up, plan on spending $30-40 per person, add $10-15 if you're having drinks.

My wife and I finally went to the Sunday Brunch - on Valentine's Day, no less - and despite heavy snowfall. It was very disappointing, unfortunately. We've been for dinner once and the food was phenomenal. Given the price of the brunch buffet, I'd suggest ordering from the menu.

First, the food was lukewarm to cold. It seems that the chafing dishes (aka Sterno cans) weren't actually lit in many cases, probably because they didn't want the food drying out or overcooking. The prime rib was kind of hit-or-miss. The first piece I had was decent, but later portions were carved thin and were tough. We tried the made-to-order pizza, but sent it back - twice - because it was undercooked in the middle and doughy (I can just see the judges from The British Baking Show tearing it apart).

The manager comped both our meals, which I didn't think was necessary, but it was a nice gesture.

We'll be back, but probably not for brunch.

Some recommendations for the management:

1. Invest in some steam tables to keep your food hot.
2. Prebake your pizza crust a little, so the dough is fully cooked when it's brought to the table.
3. Add some more standard fare (fried potatoes) instead of the odd/fancy quiche-like thing.
4. Make the area where you serve the buffet a bit more conducive to traffic. It was as if you just shoved a few tables out of the way and crammed the buffet stations into a very tight space.
5. Make sure the prime rib isn't overdone. It's the only thing that's partially justifying the high price.

Great atmosphere, place has a nice decor. Be aware that you'll go home smelling as smoke, as the place has a couple of fire places.  I don't remember the name of my server, but a very sweet guy with a great perception... he saw I didn't like the food that much and gave me a dessert to make up for it. I had high expectations for the place based on previous reviews and sugestions, but the garlic mashed potatoes had no taste.... same for the meat. Beer as cold as I like it and the chocolate pie/tort was superb! Would go back just for appetizers if ever in the neighborhood again.
I love this restaurant!!!! It is so clean and modern. I love everything about this restaurant from the delicious food to the amazing ambiance!! Might be my favorite restaurant!!!

I've been to The Turf Room several times.  I love the Tempura Mushrooms as a side....mushrooms, bleu cheese, drenched in batter and fried?  Yes, please.  The meatloaf flight is a huge serving of three different meat loaves.  The drinks are generously stumble inducing.  I have a friend that can attest to this.  A couple martinis at The Turf Room and we need to prop her up to get to the car!

They are also quite accommodating for those with special dietary requests.  We have a friend that was (but no longer is, thank you!) vegan. They will also make a special dish to accommodate the diner.

I am only giving them 4 stars because I have had a dish where the chicken was dry and bland, but usually all is great!  Oh, and if you go, try and find the bathrooms.  I never know what to do.  They look like horse stables and it's fun to watch newbies try and figure them out.  OTB is there too if you want to bet on the horses.

After driving by many times, we decided to check this place out.  Overall, it was a very positive dining experience with a nice menu that takes some creative risks that you don't often see in the suburbs.  We started with the Athena wantons, and they were good.  The flavor was unique.  My husband tried the pork chili (which I also sampled) and I had the lobster bisque.  Both were layered with flavor.  I had the jambalaya pasta.  It was good; the sauce was rich and flavorful with obvious Cajun influences.  My only complaint was that the texture of the andouille sausage was not as tender as andouille one would have in the south; however, this is certainly not a deal breaker for the plate.  The service was also fabulous.  Our server was attentive, and the restaurant staff takes dishes away at rapid speed.  I'm sure we'll be back.

We sat out in the patio by the fire and it was really nice. The only thing is I couldnt help but feel they forgot about us out there ever once in a while. I got the crab eggrolls but the black rice it came on tasted like nothing. Also the fire generated a lot of smoke. Good if you want to come for drinks.

For the price you pay you would think they would turn the air on. We were sweating so bad at the bar we had to leave.  Suggestion: If we are paying $ 13.95 per drink use that to bump the air up! Time to find a new place.

Been here a million times! Always great food, imaginative, eccentric dishes. 

A bit pricey for me- so it is a special occasion place. 

I always order the goat cheese cheesecake (if available), the venison, the pear salad. 

The daily hummus plate ! The chef creates 3 hummus flavored a day, and the plate served with a scoop of each and warm pita bread triangles - NEVER disappoints. 

I recommend this place to everyone!

Love this place been going here 1-2 times per month since it opened. I've tried just about everything they have on the menu which seems to change monthly. There has never been anything I haven't enjoyed. Their steaks are pretty good .. Tho it'd be nice to see a bone in ribeye for a change. The drink selection is abundant and are always made very well. The service is very friendly and prompt .They are always helpful if your not quite sure what you want ( because it all sounds yummy). The rustic ambiance is great!

I also have a 5 and 9 year old who LOVE this place!! The kids menu is amazing and they love sitting by the indoor fire pit area. 

This would also make a great girls night out for drinks, or a fab date night out whether it's your 1st or 100th!! Also a good night out for the guys/( or gals) with the OTB!

All in all ... 8 out of 10 for the family! Try it... You won't be disappointed.
Be forewarned, the OTB is closed.  If the food is like the Saddle Room not worth the drive to the middle of nowhere.
I've found my new favorite place!  Meatloaf trio was excellent!  Duck wontons were also great. Gia at the bar will take car of you!  Worth the drive from St. Charles!!!!

I hosted a 20 person graduation dinner here.  They were absolutely the most accommodating to a few requests without a question.  We were seated, on a busy Thursday night, at exactly the time requested.  The waitress was able to handle the entire table without a backup server.  She made an excellent wine selection for myself.  There was a good selection of items on the regular menu that satisfied a Vegan, a Vegetarian and one that was gluten intolerant.  All food was served at the same time.

The ONLY downside was how pricey it was.  Some of the smaller plates were overpriced and the wine was a few dollars to high per glass.

Ordered the butternut squash "mock" risotto.  Taste was great.   The squash was creamy and well seasoned. Only complaint --- there was supposed to be nuts and blue cheese as a garnish. Only received 3 nuts and barely a quarter of a teaspoon of blue cheese. When eaten with the squash the nut and cheese added another layer of taste and texture.

Can't tell you how many times I've been here with friends and family. From the Sunday brunch to the late Saturday nights, the martinis are always spot on and the food continues to be delicious and prepared well. Bar staff is awesome here - Can't get any friendlier and more accommodating.

Went here for some after dinner drinks for my first anniversary with my wife.  As usual, the staff and bar tenders were amazing.  The bar tender we had even elected to pay for our first round with it being our anniversary, a very nice gesture.  Drinks were amazing and arrived in a timely manner- even with the place being absolutely swamped.

My wife and myself will definitely continue to be regulars here, for the good food, service, and drink!

Great drinks.  Love their version of the Russian Mule.  Haven't had their steaks or fish, but their pizza and grilled chicken and fries are unique and delicious.  They are very popular though, so make sure you get a reservation.

The lobster bisque is my favorite!!!!!! We came here for my mother's birthday and the service was unbelievably welcoming. I had to try the duck wings, I was told over and over again to order it and I finally did. It's a very light meat and taste amazing. I want to go back now :)
Awesome! Great food and service! Highly recommended  for dinner.  Good location and no wait

We have been here numerous times and I must say the consistency in how delicious the food is and the great customer service will keep us coming back. We have even ordered take out and it tasted as good as when we have dined in. The Lobster Bisque and Tomato Basil soup are a must.

Went to this trendy restaurant last night with four girlfriends. It was crowded and we were seated outside. The ambiance was very nice. 
Before long, the fireplace was lit to take the chill out of the air. The smell was wonderful, but within minutes and for the entire evening ash from the logs was blowing on us, our table and in our drinks. It definitely needs some sort of screen or something. 
Our waiter was very friendly and pleasant . He told us all his personal favorites in each food category. The drinks took forever and he apologized , commenting that the bartender was very backed up. The martinis were huge and all in all, were spot on. 
Our two appetizers, the wontons and roasted grape crostini were very very average. To tell u the truth, no one at our table thought they were worth the price or anything special. 
Two of us ordered the pasta with scallops. It was tasty , but way too el dente. I had ordered a pear side salad, which was totally forgotten.  My water glass arrived with a big crack. 
All in all I felt that with the slow drinks, cracked glass and forgotten side salad, we should have been offered a free drink or dessert or something.
Not sure I'll be running back any time soon.
It's ok, worth the higher prices? Not so sure of that. It was good, just no POW factor :)

Service was good.  Food was overworked and overcooked.  Flavorless recipies.  Presentation seems aimed to impress where the food falls short.  Drinks are very overpriced.  Uncomfortable booths very loud and too dark to read the menu without a flashlight.  Will not return.
AMAZING FOOD AND SERVICE. The menu had a few ingredients I was not familiar with and the waiter was able to tell me in detail what everything was. The drinks and food are out of this world!!

I can't get enough of their amazing watermelon martinis; just incredibly delicious.  As for food, I'm simple.  I love their grilled chicken sandwiches; only on their late night menu (ask for it).  Fries are awesome too.

This place is super cool and cozy. It's dimly lit and not as big on the inside as it seems from the road. There is a comfy little space in the center where you can sit and meet with others. Obviously, the steak is amazing. I have also had the gnocchi a few times though which is completely unique and super tasty. Make sure to try one (or two) of their cocktails, the selection is quite impressive!

Here to lay my annual Kentucky Derby bets. The Derby aside, I've eaten here several 10x over and have always enjoyed their food.  They make a mean kobe burger here. Last but not least, the Turf Room is our pinto baseball league sponsor this year. Cheers for supporting the boys..we won our first game today!

This place was amazing. My first time going here with a friend and we decided to eat outside by the fireplace (not a good idea if you planning on going out after cause you will smell like smoke). I got the filet mignon steak which I said medium-well but it was more on the well side. Still really good and the mashed potatoes on side was good too. We got dessert, but for some reason it took forever for us to get it and had to remind the waiter to check on our order. For dessert we got the AFFOGATO which was extremely good.

visited twice here while on business.  very casual atmosphere with a upper scale vibe.  awesome fire burning pit INSIDE the middle of the restaurant - full sports bar with what looks like betting screens on horse races.  bathrooms are really cool barn type.

food was 'ok' - very good 'out of the norm' dishes.  my favorite is the short ribs.  the deer/venison was very dry and not a lot of meat...i did leave hungry after that meal, but i knew that it was going to be a "boutique" meal when i ordered it.  the waiter did warn me.

i would visit again if offered by another colleague - but if by myself, next time i think i'll try someplace new for variety.

Start the festivities off with a martini (momma dearest is the best) and start with some spicy delish calamari. I had a smoked chicken and have had the chicken phyllo, both very good. Service is always excellent, just on the higher end price wise but you pay for a unique atmosphere. Give it a go!

Went here today for the Sunday brunch. It was delicious and impeccably maintained. There was a waffle station, prime rib, and omelettes. My favorite was a vegetable croquette they had with this lovely sauce. I'm only giving four stars because they charged $8 for a glass of orange juice. That was a nasty little surprise at the end. Go, enjoy the amazing brunch but steer clear of the OJ.
Good food and atmosphere!  Want a to feel like you went to the City?  Go to the Turf Room

What an incredible place! From the moment we arrived, the hostess (who may have been the owner) was so kind. While he had reservations via open table, we were about 20 minutes early. We bellied up to the bar and asked the bartenders thoughts. She was so helpful and ended up steering us toward an incredibly delicious margarita the don quijote. All drinks sounded delicious and I'm not sure you could have gone wrong! All juice was fresh squeezed and the drinks shaken to order.

Our table was secluded and dark and just perfect for our evening away from our little ones. Michael, our waiter, was knowledgeable and genuinely wanted to help make the best of our dining choices. His suggestions were right on. Tuna tacos for appetizer was fresh and clean. So tasty!

I had the short ribs with magical potatoes. The terrine (sp) was so delicious I wanted more and more. The short ribs melted in my mouth. Husband had the prime rib with mashed potatoes. Delicious as well! 

Goat cheese cheesecake for dessert is a must. Holy cow. Unreal. On our reservation, I had noted it was husband's birthday. While I never mentioned it to the staff, the dessert arrived with a candle atop. What a great ending!

All in all, we had an exceptional experience from top to tail. The staff, proprietor and chef are top notch. The food is delicious and we'll composed. It was the perfect birthday dinner! 

Did I mention the magical potatoes? And the cheesecake? ;)

I was very please with my visit here. We were seated right away and drinks taken fairly quickly despite it being a busy time. Our server was friendly and very helpful with menus questions and had great suggestions. Our food arrived in a timely manner, had great flavor and there was plenty of it. We very much enjoyed our visit. Their drinks are amazing, very tasty and a great variety. I'm looking forward to coming back.

Best spot in the area for happy hour! Margherita flatbread is good, and big enough for 2 people to share. Prime flat iron sliders are tasty, and a good deal! Service can be hit or miss, but the delicious martinis (best in town) make up for it!

For the prices the restaurant potentially has the ability to be fantastic. Through out the years the menu has gone through a slight yo-yo of great to mediocre. On my most recent visit I was happy to see a revision for the better on a particular menu item. The atmosphere is great for date night and night out with friends. The drinks are delicious and the wine menu is pretty good.
The OTB is closed, and the food is way overpriced.  Drinks are overpriced as well.  This place used to be the 'go to' in the area, but I would recommend Naperville or Batavia/Geneva options instead.
Absolutely love the Turf Room. We've been there countless times since it had opened and never had a bad meal ever. Top notch service, food and drinks! A++++

This place should be great, but it just doesn't measure up.  The ambiance is great but the prices are really high and the food ranges from "meh" to very good.  

The burgers are great but crazy expensive.  I've done the "make ur own" and added fries, drink and a tip and it's easily twenty bucks.  Great burger but just not worth $20. The hubster had the steak and it was $50.

The look and feel is five stars. The food is three or four stars but the value for the money is a two.

My friend's husband was trying to be nice by getting her and myself a reservation to Turf room.  I was a little worried going in because I'm vegan...at a steakhouse...Upon first glance at the menu I knew if I wanted to eat some changes would have to be made as there was nothing readily vegan on there. I asked my server about vegan options and she recommended this forbidden black rice and vegetable dish that the chef whips up for vegan patrons. Oh.my.goodness. It was absolutely delicious! Perfectly spicy with crisp broccolini, mushrooms and a few other veggies. I was pleasantly surprised that they were so accommodating. My friend said her dish was really good too. I think she got the duck, Life's a Peach possibly?

The ambiance of this place is fantastic.  It's got a cool historic feel to it.  It's hidden in North Aurora but you can easily put this place in downtown Chicago.  Good for a drink and appetizers with friends or your significant other.

This is a good restaurant to bring out-of-towners and family members to. While some of the dishes (and prices!) are less impressive, the atmosphere and, in general, reliability of the cuisine recommend this place. Service is a bright spot, I should note.

(Also should note: VERY GOOD wine list for a place where I don't see too many people drinking wine. More for the rest of us, I suppose.)

Love this place! Lobster bisque is delicious! Staff is amazing and can definitely tell there is teamwork amongst them; if anyone saw we needed bread or another drink they'd ask. Very knowledgeable of the menu as well unlike most places who have no idea what they're talking about. 

Good for date night or for a group celebrating something. Drinks are good and creative and not overly priced either.  Atmosphere is cozy, although must warn very dim lighting which I like!!

New favorite place.  I can't believe I have never experienced this place. 

Drinks, ALL fresh, martini served table side shaken.  
Bread, hot, butter had sweet and salty taste. 

Chicken roasted wad just good.. not fab. 

However, I had the Bubba chop, and I CANNOT say enough.  It was amazing. 

We can't wait to come back.

Very disappointed with our meal tonight!
Have eaten here several times and have come to the realization that drinks, calamari and steak are the only thing I'll order in the future!
Appetizer of scallops were very under cooked- returned twice but they were still served 'gelatinous'
Moroccan Kale sale was unique but interestingly crunchy. Raw sweet potatoes severed on a bed of kale with dried pineapple. That's how the menu should read!!
Tempura mushroom were good but I think they forgot to add the blue cheese...unless the menu is wrong. 
And the lobster mac had no flavor. Kraft Mac n cheese would have been an upgrade, and I'm serious. Watered down with no flavor. 
On the upside our ribeye was cooked exactly as ordered (although the cut was all wrong at well under and inch thick) and the bartender made great drinks. Honestly the 1 star I gave was only because of her.
Had dinner last night, good service, great food and very good wine list.
Great place for date night and very kid friendly , everything on the menu is Amazing we Love the Turf Room !!

I like the physical building and interior, though a bit dark. The food is very good, my biggest complaint (we have been here at least 5 times over the few years it's been there) is that the menu is just too fussy. Too many weird things in the sauces and every time I dine here I have a hard time finding something to get excited about. I am a bit of a closet picky eater and it seems like everything has one thing in it/on it that I don't like. I will say the flatbread we had, Margharita, was very nice. Big and delish as an appetizer then I had the chicken Caesar salad. Big and the chicken was nicely grilled. Service was good, very professional. I like this place, just not sure it's worth the high price tag. I have a pretty high tolerance for an expensive meal now and then, I am just not convinced this is a good value....Two appetizers and the salad, and one iced tea was $50 with the tip.
My fiancÃ© Took me here for my birthday. The food was very delicious and the service was on point. The atmosphere was very warm and inviting.

Ah... The Turf Room! I had NO idea what to expect when I picked this place. I wanted a nice dinner for four people to celebrate an anniversary and two birthdays. I had skipped over this place in my research because it is an off track betting place and I didn't think it would fit the bill. It turns out there are three separate areas. The first is the off track betting, which we didn't try, the second is the wine bar, which we will be back to try, and the third is regular dining room where we sat. 
The service was fantastic! Kate got to know us throughout the meal, learned our pace and was happy to stick to it without making us feel rushed or wanting. She brought us tastes of wine when we were unsure and made fantastic suggestions when asked. She understood her menu and what a food / wine paring should be! Her suggestions were always stellar. At the end of dinner when we asked for a dessert menu, she brought us the two desserts she thought we would like with a candle in one for our celebration. She was so right! The French toast was melt in your mouth amazing! 
The little extras really made it special! Each Friday and Saturday night the chef tries new things and brings them out to the guests as complimentary dishes. They are small tasters. That night was a pea truffle puree, with peas and something green on top. Oh, so yummy! 
The wine selection is fantastic, if you want to order a bottle there are about 700 selections from which to choose. They have many lovely things by the glass including a chateauneuf du pape which is rare to find served by the glass. 
I wasn't given a steak knife with my filet, and I didn't need it! Just the way I like it! The Ahi Tuna was served on a bed of rice which was so unique and so good, that I never want it any other way. We also ordered the meatloaf with the wine flight which is totally worth trying! 
The atmosphere is dark and cozy. There is indoor and outdoor seating with fireplaces which is more casual, but a great place to have a drink and a long chat. The dining room is a little more dressy, but could still be casual as there is no official dress code. 
This place is a must visit if you like unique, high quality food with great service.

My boyfriend and I came to the Turf Room before a show at the paramount Theater in Aurora. The theater isn't very close but close enough and definitely worth it! 

We made a reservation for 3pm on a Sunday, which was not needed. The hostess was friendly and we were sat in a nice booth towards the center of the restaurant. Since it was a Sunday, I was happy to find out there are T.Vs throughout the front part of the restaurant because even though we were not at the bar, my boyfriend and I could still glance over at the football games! (always a plus).

I loved the menu right away, it is like an old newspaper, really unique. What popped out to me right away was all the amazing martinis. They have something for every taste of martini or just cocktail lover. Alll totally unique, mixing ingredients that you might not think to mix together. I ordered the "Love you long time sake sake" (That name though haha ) It was perfect, all of my favorite things. Plum, Vodka, Sake, and champagne? YES PLEASE. My boyfriend is a beer drinker and they had a good selection of that as well. 

For lunch, we decided to split a few appetizer-sized items from the menu. Our waiter was very helpful with deciding on what to get an assured us that the three things would be enough (and they were!) We ordered the Calamari, Oui Oui little piggy flatbread, and the tempura mushrooms. Great choices! I try Calamari everywhere I go and this one was not too breaded, crispy and good. The flatbread was very flat, almost like a cracker, which, I also love. And anytime there is brie on a pizza I will get it. I was disappointed that the ham was in cube form, not really shaved, and it could have been cooked just a bit more to brown the cheese. The mushrooms were excellent, crispy, not greasy,and you usually can't go wrong with blue cheese. The aioli served under the mushrooms was AMAZING as well. 

This outing was for my birthday, the waiter brought out a complimentary dessert. I told him I was not a chocolate lover and he brought out a goat cheese cheese cake with blueberry gastrique. YUM.

Other Positives: Really cool, private bathrooms, each labeled for a different "Old timey" person. Fireplace and seating around it. Flat Screen t.vs in the bar and dinning room. Dim, romantic lighting. 

I would recommend this restaurant to anyone in the western suburbs, its a real treat to not have to go all the way to the city for a place like this. I can't wait to try the brunch.

I just got home from their Mother's Day brunch and will never go back again.  There were 5 of us so I requested a table when they called to confirm and they told me no.  We were already assigned a booth.  Ok...today we were in a booth next to a table and every time they sat people at that table they requested to move.  They also added extra tables so where we sat in the bar we were blocked by tables and had a hard time getting to the buffet.

The food was ok.  I expected a lot more from them.  They only had plates on one of the buffet tables which was ridiculous.  I felt sorry for the one chef making the omelets as he was the only one doing so.  The prime rib was so rare that it would hardly cut...the fat was all left on too.

I've been there numerous times before for drinks, appetizers and lunch but I'll never go back again.  They can keep their carnation...it wasn't worth it.  It was a great disappointment for my daughters first Mother's Day.

The only reason I gave them 2 stars was for the waiter, David.  He did a great job under the circumstances.

The food here is very special at a good price range.  The cocktails are a great value because they use top shelf and you don't need many if you know what I meen. Try the short ribs or any of the appetizers. No frozen junk here. Wait staff highly trained and very attentive.  You can even bet the ponies in the back for those who like that. One of my top 5.

I had the FARFALLE and it was WONDERFUL. I also got to try CALAMARI  and HONOLULU TUNA all of it was too die for. Also I had the drink called The Kracken... Ok so I had two of them I would highly recommend going here if you get the chance.

The staff was very nice. We had a large party of 20 and got put in the back room. Which ended up that we didn't get near the attention from the wait staff that we should have.  HOWEVER this wouldn't keep me from going back again.

I have been a regular (and have brought several clients) here for a couple of years for dinner, brunch and appetizers/drinks. The service here has been consistenly terrible..

Last night was it for me. I went in there with my BFF for appetizers before going to a comedy club. The waiter was not only rude, but advised that there was a $4 up charge for carrots with our hummus. And, they would not give us the pita with it. So, essentially they want to charge us double for carrots and not give me the pita too? I'm not sure about you, but last I checked, I could buy a large bag of carrots for a buck.  My friend got a little snippy with him as we have been coming here consistently for a while and this has never been the case. He was snippy back (customer is always right, no?) 

3 weeks ago I was here and had a filet with burnt sauce on it that tasted like garbage.

So, bye bye Turf Room. It was fun while it lasted. We won't be back.
Awesome place,  100%. Its our new hangout. Food,  service,  atmosphere... all on point
Wonderful  food and ambiance !! We came here for lunch the Kobe burgers are out of this world !!! Strongly recommend everyone is so nice and friendly! We are definitely  coming back for wine nights !
Our go-to when we want a great dinning experience.  Food is always different, wonderful selection.  Drinks are worth the price...try the honey do' me martini
Very good. I had the sea bass was delish. Drink menu is also amazing. Highly recommend any of their signature drinks. I will return

what a waste of money. horrible cat food size portions at Ritz Carlton prices. They have rude servers and the owner with the earring running around swearing at everyone  is a complete unprofessional and condescending a s s wipe. Finally, looks like the Turf Room is suffering from an identity crisis. The staff wears jeans and black tshirts, but they act like they are higher end than The Capital Grille. This place is nothing but a wear house turned into a restaurant with horse saddles and old newspapers on the wall. Seriously people, go somewhere else. High class was their attempt, but what you get is arrogant wine snobs serving wine in blue jeans.

Everything is so good here, I can't just recommend only one thing.

This place is amazing.  It's gourmet dining good enough for any foodie in North Aurora, of all places.

The menu changes periodically, but the staples stay on.  I've been here for Brunch, Lunch and Dinner.

Brunch is awesome, with a great Prime Rib buffet.  They make you waffles fresh and the spread is just amazing in size.  I really need to go back one day, it was so good.

Lunch is great too... They have Kobe Beef Burgers that you call the toppings.  From traditional to Strawberry aioli.  So many different cheeses you won't believe it.  And, I love their home fries served in a can.

Dinner is good, but can get pretty pricey if you are throwing caution to the wind.  My wife once got a meatloaf flight, that had kobe beef and buffalo.

Don't be fooled from the outside, there's no windows really... this place is awesome!

This is a very strange place with an identity crisis.  

One identity is for race horsing enthusiasts.  It has an overall race horsing motif, with bathroom doors that look like stable doors, there is a bronze horse welcoming you into the bar.  And there is a complete bar section just for serious off track betting.  

Another identity is fine food and wine.  The meals are upscale dishes and the place has an impressive wine list.  There is even a bar in the back that's specifically dedicated to wine.  

Still another identity is a comfortable place to hang out.  There is a large stone fireplace you can sit around, a TV showing cable programming and blues music playing on the overhead speakers.  

The strange thing is each identity bleeds into the next, so while you are dressed up sitting enjoying a fine meal and wine, get down blues music is streaming overhead and there's a TV within eye shot showing something you'd probably watch if you were eating left overs on your couch in your family room.  

And although the meals are meant to be upscale, I wasn't impressed with my prime rib-eye steak.  (I usually order filet when I get a steak so maybe rib eyes are just normally 10% fatty and less melt-in-your mouth tasty than a filet.)  If I went back and got a delicious filet, then I could give it another star.

All alone on a midweek morning and outside the snow is falling and I hear the calling; a restaurant with a fireplace and an OTB what else could a girl want for a solo business lunch. I had heard good thing about the food and where else in North Aurora could you get a lovely meal and bet the ponies?
I had a great seared tuna salad and I enjoyed the solitude. The service was spot on too.
Major midday downside, I smelled like I had just attended a bon fire for the rest of my workday. Don't sit too near the fire pit!

I'm not sure if I could adequately recreate the superlatives that rolled out of my mouth last night, after my first few sips, and bites, of our meal.  It would probably just be a bad repeat of that scene from "When Harry Met Sally". You know the scene, right? Well, imagine lots of low humming, smiles,  and excited utterances, and you'll be close.  We've always said, we travel to eat.  And this trip was worth the miles.

As to the actual meals...we started with a Cool As A Cucumber, a drink which shall always live in my mind as a match to the first Hendricks cucumber gin and T we had in Vancouver. But this was made with Bombay Sapphire gin, and was rimmed with hot sauce and a mix of spices.  

Then, he had the meatloaf flight.  And he doesn't even like meatloaf.  I had the smoked scallops over linguine, with a sweet corn sauce of some kind.  Oh, if I could only do that with my Iowa sweet corn...

Ok,menough...go try it yourself.   And write a nice review, to keep this place full and prosperous.  M f

The waitstaff was excellent.  Eric the manager stopped by with an amuse bouche bruschetta. We never went more than five minutes without a contact with someone on the staff.
If you like cat food size portions this place is just for you! But the price tags is a joke! No thank you!

I love this place! Great location, ample parking, DELICIOUS food (duck spring rolls are a must order), I love the ambiance and the wine selection. I will be back again soon. I've visited on 3 different occasions.  Also, individual bathrooms which is very unique. I wish all restaurants had that set up!!!
I like this place.  The food is great .  They do experiment with recipes , which is a good thing. and make s this a good place. Unique dishes and fun

I have been to the Turf Room many, many times over the last couple years. Chef Sean was amazing, and when he left last year there was definitely a period of time where the new chef had not quite gotten his bearings. I can definitely say that is no longer the case. If you want delicious fine dining, this is the place. And the fact that a place like this is in North Aurora is the best.

First, the cocktails. They are expensive but worth every penny. They are larger cocktails, and they fill them to the brim. I mean that literally. They will eek every last drop out of the shaker. And they are fabulous. I have had the watermelon one which is refreshing and delicious, but my favorite is always the Mommy Dearest. My husband gets the Rye Go Home every time, and if you're a whiskey drinker that's the one.

The food is fantastic as well. Their menu changes throughout the year. For the appetizers, the flatbreads are just okay, but the hummus trio and the croquettes are pretty much standard for us when we go. For the entrees, the meatloaf flight is always a hit, even for people that aren't fans of meatloaf. They have different kinds of meat and sauces and sides and it's a great taster. The duck stroganoff is probably my favorite thing on the menu. Yes, it has grapes, and yes it has brussel sprouts and it may sound weird but trust me and get it. It's amazing. Their filet and the chilean sea bass are also delicious. I don't think I have had one bad thing on the menu. And they will often bring out tasting dishes of stuff the chef is trying out and that's always fun to try too. 

And finally dessert, I have had the sorbet and it's great, but if you get anything get the goat cheesecake. Who would think to put goat cheese in a cheesecake? And if you're not a fan of goat cheese don't worry about it, it does not taste like that, it just creates a more luscious and creamy cheesecake.

Worst place ever!! The owner is such a B!;ch.... I can't even believe how she speaks to her guest!! I would not recommend this restaurant ... Portions r very very small and completely over priced. I think a can of cat food has more in it. PLUS the food is so dry and burnt. If I could leave negative stars I would.

Tried The Turf Room on Friday evening. We had a reservation and were seated promptly when we arrived at a nice table towards the back of the restaurant.  

I'm giving only 3 stars based on service and food quality/price point. Our dirty appetizer plates were left on the table after our entrees were delivered - the server never made an attempt to pick them up. Then we had to ask for clean silverware for our entrees.   Sounds picky but it's the small details that make a great dining experience. 

The food was ok but not what we expected based on the price and some of the other reviews. My sea bass was a nice cut and portion but lacked seasoning which was really too bad because it could have been awesome. At a $30 price I guess I was expecting something more. My husband had the meatloaf flight that he said was good. 

After dinner we had a cocktail by the great fireplace. Super cozy on a cold night. 

With all the great restaurants in the area I'm not sure we'll be back. Wish the food was better and the staff gets some more training. So sad because it's a cool place.

I just love the vibe and food at the Turf room. I'm always delighted in those areas. But, yesterday I took my family of 6 there for Thanksgoving....and the service was so poor. I can't imagine ever returning. We were sat at 1p.m. the restaurant was not nearly half full. Our waitress waited 20 minutes for our drinks order. Then another 20 for our food order. We needed drinks filled...never happened.  We need a few utensils...never happened.  Saw the waitress when she brought the check. Saw her 3 times the whole meal.
My girlfriends and I love their Martins and flatbreads. They have a huge selection of wine too. We love to sit outside by the fireplace and chat for hours.
Come here for the happy hour!  Craft beers along with their discounted appetizers.  Stable standard flat bread pizza and tres hummus are my favorite.

Nice decor but crazy prices. Food was marginal and although the waiter was very nice we felt like we were being rushed out the door so he could close out. Portions were decent and the presentation was excellent  First time I've had lobster bisque mixed at the table which was a great touch. I will definitely come back to enjoy the bar area but doubt I would recommend it for dinning.

Went for a second visit to this restaurant with my wife and another couple. Even though I had made a reservation, there was still about a 15 minute wait, they were apologetic and kept us posted.
The waitress rattled off the specials, was very courteous and efficient. I tried the crab ravioli and the reviews I read about it were spot on. My wife enjoyed the butternut squash gnochhi. The menu had an impressive selection and I'll make sure to return in the very near future to sample their other dishes.
Even though they were quite busy, appetizer, soup, bread and drink refills, and entrees were brought out in a timely fashion. We never felt rushed to leave the table, and our friends were very impressed.
It's always a very nice touch when one of the owners stops by to check how everything was and said a heartfelt thank you.
The place was a little pricey, but I felt I got my money's worth and will make this place a regular spot. It's a great place and very rarely do I tip in the 30% range...yes, the food and the service were that good.

Well,well,well ~ I remember when Angeli's opened back in 1996.  It was waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay smaller and down a few store fronts, if I remember correctly.  It  has expanded, added catering, and an outdoor patio, albeit in the parking lot next to the liquor store.  Fortunately, we had reservations because it was almost completely full.  We chose to dine inside.  Was that the best choice?  That's debatable.  They have as many tables as they possibly can inside.  That means the staff is constantly trying to avoid bumping into you.  They rearrange the tables to accommodate large parties.  All those people in a small space makes hearing close to impossible.  Noise level is very loud.
Now, to the food.  Not the best Italian I have ever had, but not the worst ~ it was okay, just okay.  They seem to serve their dishes with an abundance of olives and mushrooms.  Not 2 of my favorites.  They kindly prepared my dish minus a few items ~ that was nice.  Others had 2 different chicken dishes, which my husband reported as  "just okay " (and he's Italian).  We did enjoy our gelato for dessert.
Would I return?  Maybe, in at least another 10 years.

Went here on a Sunday evening, after reviewing several Italian restaurants in Naperville.  It's a fairly small restaurant located in a strip mall.  The atmosphere was very pleasant, plenty of older and younger couples.  There was lots of variety, and the food was great!  Delicious pasta, big portions, and good sides!  All at a reasonable price.  I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a quiet night out.

Having delicious food was one of the most important aspects of our wedding and we could not have been more satisfied with our decision to use Angeli's Restaurant for our wedding.  

We had the opportunity to work with John from Angeli's Restaurant and he was a complete pleasure to work with!  He was kind, responsive and very organized.  We felt completely at ease when we met with him and could tell that we were in good hands! 

The day of the wedding, the food was even more delicious than I remembered from our tasting!  We chose 4 appetizers to serve: butternut squash gnocchi, asparagus and prosciutto, bruschetta and bacon wrapped dates!  Each of these was mouth-watering good!  For dinner, guests had the choice of ordering either eggplant parmesan or chicken margarita.  We also served family style pasta at the dinner table.  Friends and family came up to us throughout the night and exclaimed how delicious the food was and some even said the eggplant parmasean was the best they ever had!  I ordered this for my meal and would have to agree! 

Throughout the evening John checked up with us to see if we needed anything and just made sure we were having a wonderful time.  I thought this was a nice touch.  His staff was also very professional and courteous.  One of the staff even brought an appetizer platter out to us while we were taking pictures during our cocktail hour!

We had a wonderful experience using Angeli's Restaurant for our wedding and highly recommend them to for weddings or a delicious meal in their restaurant!

First time eating experience and definitely will be back.  Great atmosphere, wine list, and the food was outstanding. I would bet it doesn't matter what you order because it's all quality.    From the streer you might drive right by but don't !

I hate to have to give a local restaurant a bad review, but this was our experience. We have an infant at home, so we decided to order take out, which is typically something of a risk, but we figured good Italian should be fine in the 5 minutes it would take to bring it home. However, the problems we had were definitely not from sitting too long in the car. 
We ordered the mozzarella sticks, chicken parmigiana, and gambretti and broccoli with white wine sauce. It came with minestrone soup, which was actually quite good. However, once we opened up the rest of the food, it all went quickly downhill. The mozzarella sticks were hardly warm and didn't look like they'd ever been melted. But the kicker was the bed of "lettuce" they sat on. It was completely brown, and looked like it'd been days since any of it was fresh. Then came the entrees. The chicken parmigiana was a little too salty, and didn't really have any great flavor besides that. The gambretti and broccoli was just terrible. The pasta was really bland, with hardly any sauce, and the shrimp and broccoli were just placed on top of the pasta without any attempt to mix flavors. The broccoli was steamed and tasteless, though the shrimp by itself was actually decent. Also, the bread that it came with was stale. 
All in all, a disappointing experience, especially when celebrating a birthday. Not sure if they gave us sub-par food due to it being a take-out order, but we were thoroughly unimpressed. Olive Garden or Maggiano's would've been better choices.

Fantastic service from Joe.  He was super attentive and cut up with me even while the place was getting busy.  They sat me in a corner in the bar area which was nice cause I had a pretty tough workout and just wanted to relax.  Joe's recommendation on the cabernet I ordered definitely hit the spot.  I ordered the lasagna.  I would definitely pass on it next time.  Too much salt was thrown on it after it was baked.  I could definitely taste it.  The good news is the portions are huge and the food tastes better after taking it home.  I had a relaxing evening and would've stayed longer if I was there with a date or even a group of friends.  Definitely a warm and welcoming atmosphere. I'd drop by again to try the other dishes.

Angeli's was "my" pick for our monthly dinner with the MIL. After last month's disappointing experience, I was apprehensive about my selection. Luckily for me, our expectations were met and my choice was validated.

We arrived around 7:15 or so on Friday night.  We had a brief ten minute wait, so we stood in the bar. The bar area is beautiful, and was full of patrons enjoying appetizers, drinks, and the Blackhawks game. When our table was ready, a nice gentleman (who I presume to the be owner) escorted us to our table.

Now, yes- the dining area is extremely crowded. You can almost brush elbows with the neighboring tables.  Luckily we had a table against the wall so it wasn't so bad. And yes, it's a bit dated. But I loved the lights strung across the dimly lit room; it created quite a cozy and romantic atmosphere. 

Our waitress was Tiffany. We browsed the menu (which contains more items on it than the online version), ordered our drinks and decided to place our appetizer order at the same. We tried:

Artichoke Alfredo - a HUGE platter of artichoke hearts and Parmesan cheese in an Alfredo sauce, with slices of garlic toast for dipping. This was so incredibly good! The garlic toast was perfectly crisp and the dip itself was flavorful and the perfect temperature. 

Antipasto Della Casa - a nice assortment of green olives, peppadew peppers, cheeses, and meats (salami and capicola, I believe). There was a small bunch of purple grapes as well. The fruit was fresh, the quality meats and cheeses were savory, and the peppadews were amazing. They were the mild variety, so they were sweet with barely detectable heat. 

Grilled Calamari - Oh. My. GAWD. This had to be the best appetizer I've ever had. The calamari was grilled perfectly and was garnished with capers and tomatoes in a lemon butter sauce. I could have eaten this stuff all night. Highly, highly recommended!

All of the appetizers are large portions, no stinginess here. It's easy to fill up on them alone.

Tiffany returned to take our entree orders, and although I had my eye set on a particular menu item, I decided to try something off of their "Sneak Preview" menu, which are new items to be introduced this year. Entrees:

Chicken Giardiniera -Two enormous breaded, boneless chicken breasts in a garlic wine sauce. Sitting atop a large bed of angel hair pasta, the dish is generously sprinkled with a house made giardiniera. While the giardiniera was described as semi-spicy, I thought it was very flavorful but not spicy. But that's my taste buds. I opted for the house salad with balsamic vinaigrette dressing over the soup choices.

Filet Pepe Verde - a grilled filet sitting in a beautiful pool of Brandy cream sauce and garnished with peppercorns. This was M's pick, and he chose the pasta e fagioli soup (no "rabbit food" for him).

Crab Ravioli - this was my MIL's entree. The ravioli is topped with shrimp, scallops, and peapods in a lobster cream sauce. She decided to have a house salad with a garlic dressing.

The salads and soup arrived and we dug in. The salads were fresh, crisp, and refreshing. M stated the soup was quite good, but didn't finish it, trying to save room for his entree.

Our meals arrived about ten minutes after we finished the salads and soup, which was perfect. We managed to eat as much as possible, but thanks to the appetizers, we hardly put a dent in our meals. However, we thoroughly enjoyed the leftovers the next day.

Tiffany was wonderful. She was didn't hover over us constantly but didn't disappear for periods of time, either. The busboys kept our waters filled and promptly removed our spent appetizer dishes. 

Overall, we really enjoyed our experience at Angeli's and I look forward to returning soon.

I realize that I give a lot of 4 star reviews but this place is a solid 4 plus.

Easy parking in the adjacent parking is always good and appreciated on a rainy night.

Friday was crowded but found a spot at the bar. The bartender was super friendly and quickly took our order.  

A very short time later we were seated. Our server was nice and efficient.

To the important part- the food.  We ordered pasta with peas, scallops with pasta and a fish dish.

The pasta sounds odd but was delicious  with a vodka and sausage sauce. The scallops could be the biggest and best I have ever had.  Of course the price tag goes along with colossal sized scallops.

Excellent wine selection.

One thing happened that I always appreciate.  The owner stopped by to check on us and to chat. Nice touch.

I'll definitely be back and strongly recommend this place. Good in all phases

Best Italian food ever.  You get what you pay for. Get the butternut gnocchi it is one the best things on this planet. Bigger groups stick the non bar side. The bar side can get packed. They also have a gluten free menu as well

Nice cozy Italian restaurant inside the strip mall. Their patio seating looks very pretty and the people who work there are very kind and  comforting. We came here for my mom's B'day and we all loved the ambiance. We ordered the cheese ravioli and brochette for appies and my mom and wife got the Gnochi special and i got the chicken marsala special. The Gnochi was so soft that it just disappeared after i put it in my mouth. It was not too heavy and my mom and wife really enjoyed it. My only concern / complaint is that the chairs were not comfortable for me so was not able to sit longer. But over all good food, great service and wonderful ambiance. Will visit again :)

The couple times I've eaten here has been good but about a month ago, my husband and 1 year old son went there and the lady at the front was extremely rude! She told us, "We have a party on this side of the restaurant and only high tables on this side, and I see you have a baby so... Sorry." She basically denied us service and didn't even try to accommodate. Unfortunately we will not be going back.

For as highly recommended as Angeli's came, I found it disappointing. The service was adequate, especially on a busy Saturday night. The food was just okay. It wasn't awful, but it also wasn't good enough to make me want to come back again.
Service door to door was excellent! Restaurant space and bar is clean and very nice. Food was fresh and good!

This place has undergone a dramatic transformation in the past 18 months or so. And the best part about it is that the quality of their food is still super high and the prices for the appetizers in the bar are 50% off Monday through Thursday. 

So what has transformed here?

Ambiance baby. Ambiance. 

The restaurant itself is expanded, redecorated and more spacious from one table to the next. Good place for a date. 

The patio is also expanded. So while you are in a strip mall, at least you're outside in a covered deck. Nice. 

Finally the bar itself is huge. Plenty of tables and seating around the bar. Music piped in and bartenders that pay attention to you. 

Give this place a try. And since they are five minutes from my house, drop me a line if you need some fun company to join you!

My family and I went here and ordered a variety of things. I ordered the spaghetti marinara (thinking simple), the sauce wasn't great. It tasted like canned tomato paste lacking any and all spices, however, the pasta was cooked perfectly. The service as far as keeping our water filled and bread basket, that was great. As far as our waitress, I felt a bit rushed. I was barely done with dinner and they were cleaning up our plates with our bites still in our mouths. Our drinks were taken away before we could finish and the waitress was counting her money while we were still sitting at the table. As far as the atmosphere, it feels cozy, however, it def needs an update. The ceiling looks likes it's going to cave in from being old or maybe water damage.  All in all, it wasn't horrible, I may go back to try this butternut gnocchi everyone else is raving about. If I could give it a 2.5 starts I would.

A Very Good traditional italian restaurant.  We ate here on a very busy Saturday night and had to wait 30 min for a table which isn't unusual for a good place like this. I would've even given it 5 stars but the food was real slow to come out. Everything else was great. Love the old world feel of the place. The wine list is a good one, waiter was excellent.
I had a ravioli special which was great, not a huge portion like some places serve but just right. She had a shrimp broccoli dish in red sauce that was delicious.
We will definitely go back.

We paid a visit on a Friday night, and the place was absolutely packed. We were really worried that the wait was going to be long, but fortunately, it was only 20 minutes. Previously, we wanted to try out Clara's at Seven Bridges, but the wait there was 45 minutes to an hour (yuck). So, we looked online for another Italian place and found Angeli's. 

I think the wait is really the only reason why I knocked a star off. We were there around 7pm, and there was absolutely nowhere to sit and wait. The bar was too full, and people were lining up against the wall at the front desk. I really recommend that they re-arrange the waiting area, maybe offer some chairs or even just a corner for people to wait at. It becomes awkward pretty quickly when you're shoulder-to-shoulder with strangers, waiting for a table. People also seemed to be really scattered, trying to find some place to wait. The host (possibly manager) had to run around a few times to try and find the next group of customers to seat. So clearly, there's some opportunity to organize traffic. 

Once we were seated, the rest of our experience was fantastic. Our server was just an absolute joy, and he was extremely knowledgeable about the food. The dishes we ordered were amazing. I had the Pescatori, and my boyfriend had the Eggplant Parmigiana. The seafood in the Pescatori was cooked to perfection, and my boyfriend swears it was the best parmigiana he's ever had. We were absolutely stuffed by the end of our dinner, but ordered two cannolis to take home. Order the cannoli. You NEED to try the cannoli. No joke, one of the best we've ever had. The wine list is also fantastic. You won't be disappointed with their choices.
