Overall, we will definitely be coming back whenever we have a craving for Italian again. Hopefully next time, we can come in on a not-so busy night.

Don't be fooled.  This restaurant, which is really popular among the Naperville crowds, is really not any better than an Olive Garden.  My mom ordered one of their pizzas and it was below average.  The pasta sauce that I had tasted like it came from a jar.  I was really unimpressed and disappointed (given the high reviews found here on yelp).
Looking for good Italian in town and rely on Yelp to find what I am looking for.  Came across this place and so glad I did.  Eat at the bar.  Phenomenal service and best Italian anywhere.....

Actually been an Angeli's customer for almost a decade, not happy to write this so-so review.

The new bar area is really nice, they still have great service, good Italian bread but the meal quality has gone down hill.  

I ordered the Chicken Gardinara.  It was a single pre breaded, frozen chicken breast cut in half on top of some angel hair pasta.  Can you say lazy chef.. Who uses a frozen chicken patty as an entrÃ©e in a real Italian restaurant?  So sad, my wife had the chicken vesuvio but it  was off as well, overloaded with black pepper.

I'm sad to see this decline in food quality, maybe we just got a bum deal on a Sunday night.
Wavering between 3 and 4 stars. The food is 4 but the  Decour in the dining room 2 door was great -  they should get rid of the murals in the one room

Got to say that when it comes to Italian food I go no further than this place. They recently built a new side with a great looking bar and lots of tables. Italian food can be hot or miss but this place hits home runs. I love family runs businesses because of the attention to detail. This is someone's baby which sometimes gets lost in corporate run establishments. The service is great and the owners are there most of the time and have the awareness to remember your name when you become a repeat customer. Great touch. The food is spectacular. Great portions and flavors are spectacular. Always love coming here. Don't pass this place up

Angeli's did the catering for my wedding at Danada House this past weekend.  Everything was delicious and we received many compliments on the food!  We opted for the family style with both chicken and steak so that people could have both!  Tony and John are both great to deal with and they will do anything and everything for you!

We used Angeli's to cater our wedding party at Knoch Knolls Nature Center in Naperville  WOW! First off John put up with me and my many emailed changes and questions.  The day of the party they were professional,  courteous,  top notch.  The food was tasty, hot, and nicely displayed.  John even showed up during the evening to make sure things were going great! Andy (one of the owners) was part of the staff and went above and beyond! (He cut the cake, asked me if I needed a plate of food, and was super nice.)
Thank you Angeli's!

Italian classics in hearty portions in an inviting and casual atmosphere. Winner. Sat at the bar on my first visit and watched the Cubs game. Had 2 glasses of wine at $7 each and the chicken piccata ($18.95) which came with soup or salad. I went with the salad (generous size) and house dressing (a delicious balsamic vinaigrette).  The chicken picatta was delightful, smothered in capers (yum) and served with fettuccine and fresh steamed veggies. I also couldn't help but eat 3/4 of the warm Italian bread they brought me- the best.  Will def be back.

I've been coming to Angeli's as long as I can remember. I predate the renovations that happened some years ago. The food has always been excellent. Service is friendly and engaging. The menu is classic, the wine options are spectacular. There's more space now than ever, though you wouldn't realize it because every time I go, Angeli's is always full!

If you're a fan of Italian, it's well worth the trip. It isn't too pricy, has a nice wine list, has a varied menu (that takes it beyond just pasta and classic sauces that some Italian restaurants get stuck on).

I thought I had wrote a review of this place months ago but any who.....

Wonderful service, friendly old fashioned ( unfortunately) servers who really care that you have a good time at the restaurant, owner who makes a point of walking around and introducing himself.

I had the artichoke ravioli once and it was great, had the shells next time and they were ok. The salads and soups are very good and bread yummy.

I recommend you go- I know its in a strip mall but it isn't their fault. try it and you'll like it I promise

Hubby and I headed out for an early dinner before  a movie. We walked in and were quickly seated. Our waitress was very nice, but made mention that we were at a table that was reserved for a party of 6 coming in 45 mins. No big deal as we were kind of in a hurry anyhow. 

We placed an appetizer order of their house trio. The calamari was FABULOUS! Meaty, thick chunks lightly breaded and fried - delicious. The toasted ravioli was okay. The bruchetta was a bit oniony and seemed to lack a lil balsamic kick. 

Hubby ordered Chicken Vesuvio. Not bad - but the potatoes were the star of his plate. I ordered Chicken Marsala. It was passable. The chicken was a bit tough and there really wasn't much sauce.  

I was disappointed because I feel like the kitchen really wasn't making the plates to order.  I figure they had a chaffing dish of cooked chicken breasts, and then had pans of sauces. The flavor wants cooked in at all. 

We won't return.

Wow. Let me say that again...wow. Best clam chowder I've ever had, and I'm a clam chowder snob. Followed that with the crab ravioli. My wife had veal. Great and very good, respectively.  Bus staff works hard. Obviously well trained. Four young people clearing plates and filling waters, in a relatively small place. Wait person was polite but not too chatty. Nice wine list. Great bread. Owner stopped by to check on things, and seemed like he was genuinely interested, as opposed to glad handing. I'll be back. Too well executed to not give this place more business. 
PS. We ordered catering from them the following weekend.
The staff here really tries to make your experience great. The lasagna is delicious, and the Peroni on tap is good too.

I read this place was rated over Maggiano's and Biaggi in Naperville so I had to give my opinion! This is a traditional old school Italian restaurant with delicious food.  I came with a group of 20 and everyone's dish made me want to come back. They have warm crusty bread with oil/cheese that keeps coming noon stop. I had salmon with artichokes, spinach and asparagus very good if you like cream sauce. I tasted the spicy shrimp over bow tie pasta in spicy diavolo sauce that was worth going back for. The filet with spinach and a side of pasta was a gorgeous plate very generous portion that I heard was amazing. Yes I will be back!!!

Tried them out tonight for a Friday night, 6:30 ish, party of 4, we were seated right away.  The prices were about what we expected, and the food was good quality.  Compared to 'chain restaurant' Italian at the same price, it was definitely better.
This restaurant has the BEST Italian food in Naperville! Cozy environment , friendly staff and an awesome bar!!!  Chicken Piccata is absolutely the best on the menu I think.  Love this restaurant

Walked in and was told there was a 25 minute wait but got seated in about 10 minutes. Nice! Server was great! Chicken Ã  la Joey wasn't super fantastic but the pizza was very good. Thumbs up to an overall great experience without a reservation.
Traveling and stopped in for dinner. Was authentic Italian and delicious! Service was great and I love the atmosphere.

The atmosphere and decor are upscale. The homemade potato chips at the bar are super and addictive. My husband had the lasagna and I had the chicken parmesan. Both were tasty. The pasta fagoli soup was amazing! My husband had the mushroom soup and said it was excellent. If I lived here, I'd come here more often.

Great transformation!
They expanded the seating and truly 
expanded  the guest satisfaction as well.

Best fried calamari I have ever had.

Service was impeccable. The teamwork of the entire staff was admirable.

Food was very good

Impressive!

Can you help Country House get their act together? They lost it with their move.

I've been to Angeli's a few times now and while the food's been good, I haven't been clamoring to go back nor was I notably impressed by any dish.

My first time there I got the lasagna which was good but rather plain actually. The ingredients were good but they came together to really not taste like much. It didn't help that the dish came with some steamed broccoli and carrots - plain plain and more plain. It was a decent portion, but I couldn't recommend getting it because it lacked flavor.

The next time I was there, I had the penne vodka which was much better than the lasagna. It was a very good vodka creme sauce and the penne was cooked well. I would definitely get it again.

I also want to comment on the atmosphere - it's really rather strange. On the one side you have a bar which is small but nice. On the other side you have these tables that are trying to be formal but end up rather strewn about the room because they are so easily moved. You also end up sitting awkwardly close to everyone around you because it's a small place. I suppose that is the homey Italian feel, but Angeli's doesn't actually have that homey Italian atmosphere, it just doesn't.

My in-laws have been coming here for years, so we arrived one weeknightfor a family dinner. We made reservations, which I recommend. There's a kitschy mural on the wall. I'd say on the "dress-up-o-meter" this place is Olive Garden level. You sit down with a loaf of bread -- oil and parmesan are on the table if you're inclined. No beer on tap. There are gluten-free options. I had soup before my meal which tasted like it was out of a can. The "Nonna" is like a deep fried calzone -- my husband likes it, but it takes a long time to cook, and he passed this time. I had pasta with vodka sauce and Italian sausage. It was good but unremarkable. The service was pretty bad, including a waitress who never came around to fill our drinks or check up on us. 

Overall, if it's Italian food in Naperville, go to Francesca's or Rosebud. Sure this place has some charm and is family owned, but your dining experience will be more memorable.

My wife and I grew up in Chicago, with its many, many family owned Italian restaurants. We live in the suburbs now, and we had a date night last week at Angeli's restaurant. It was wonderful. Delicious food, kind and attentive staff (everyone of them), and one of the owners, John Taylor was also walking around occasionally to greet people and ask for feedback. We loved eating there, the prices are fair, and we will be back!!! We are often in this area visiting family, etc.  GREAT EXPERIENCE at Angeli's!!! Oh - yes - my wife had the eggplant parmigiana and I had the "pasta and peas" (which includes delicious Italian sausage mixed in--- yum). Nice people, great food, fair price... and efficient too! We love a good crowd, and Angeli's packs them in on Friday and Saturday nights! :) so, call ahead and reserve!
We love love love this Italian restaurant!!!! We can't find anyone who compares. The lobster ravioli is a must!!!!! Soooo good!!!!!
I'm giving this place 5-stars for the butternut gnoochi. This was the best I've ever had. Stop in and get it. It is really good.

Last night we dined there and had a terrific experience and really excellent pizza.

As Out-of-Towners, we arrived at Angeli's restaurant stressed out, hungry and in a hurry.  We left well fed, happy and relaxed, due to the amazing staff and delicious food.  

We had tickets to a 7:30 show and arrived at another restaurant at 5:45 only to find standing room only and no promise that we could be finished by 7:30.  That staff couldn't even recommend any other restaurants in the area to try.   

Discouraged we took to the road with no idea of where to go, with a hungry teenager and running out of time.   Luckily, we found Angeli's, and they were busy too, but with a understanding and helpful attitude.  We explained our story and they got right down to helping us out.  

The wait staff was professional and quick to help us get going.   We ordered a fried calamari that was served piping hot, a Special Angeli's Pizza, that was delicious, and a perfectly dressed Caesar salad.  

Thank you to everyone who worked last night for your understanding and comforting way.   I only wish we lived close enough to enjoy your hospitality and great food on a weekly basis.

This is what every local Italian restaurant should be! Sinatra music, hand-painted murals, good service, and good food!

We had reservations, which weren't really necessary, but since the place is kinda small, make 'em if you want to be assured of a table. A seat in the back area provided some quiet and removal from the chill by the door. 

Our waiter was knowledgeable but casual, swinging his pepper mill authoritatively like a beat cop with a night stick. 

The food was very good. A seafood bisque to start was good though definitely not the star of the show. As for the entrees, my companion's chicken marsala had an incredible depth of flavor and was accompanied with a tangle of veggies. I made the unusual choice of butternut squash ravioli in a cream sauce: if you like sweet dishes at all, take a chance on this one! While very rich, it was very unique, filling, and almost like a combo of dinner and dessert! 

In a world of too many chain restaurants, this little place is one to remember. Check it out; you may well have an angelic experience.
Enjoyed our Anniversary dinner. Food was delicious and plenty of leftovers. Wait staff was very attentive.
Authentic Italian fare nice quite quaint location close to dtn.      Has a great atmosphere nice and romantic.  Great owner the food is really great as well must try chicken Vesuvio

A pleasant surprise indeed! Wow! I def agree with the previous reviewer in that the ambiance is nothing at all but the food is very impressive.  

We started off with the artichoke alfredo and were absolutely blown away... not to mention full!  But of course saved room for a few bites of our entrees! My husband got something with the vodka sauce which was amaze.  But I gotta say, my butternut squash gnocchi stole the show. Holy hell, I have never had such good gnocchi in my life. My mouth literally waters every single time I drive past this restaurant and think about it.  I cannot wait to come back !!

Our server was a little awkward and kept telling us the price of each item and each additional item we wanted.  I didn't see the need for him to keep pointing out the prices over and over.  But whatever, I'm def coming back regardless !

The older woman in the front was really sweet as well.  She informed us that they were going to expand the restaurant in the future, which will be a great step and will hopefully add some needed windows to the restaurant.  

This is officially my go to restaurant for Italian food, hands down!!

Went here with my boyfriend on a Saturday night.  We called ahead and made reservations for 7:30PM.  When we got to the restaurant, it was pretty packed.  We let the host know we were here, he told us he would be with us in just a few minutes, and directed us to a small bar area to wait.  There were a few other people waiting before us (groups of 4 or 2), and a few other people arrived after us as well.  We waited... and waited... 45 minutes later everyone else had been seated but us.  Not sure if they were 'regulars' and therefore took precedence over us (as this was the first time ever dining at Angeli's) - the atmosphere in the bar was very friendly, but I'm not sure if that really made up for the long wait.

When we were finally seated, the host did offer us a free appetizer or set of desserts, which was nice since we had such a long wait.  We ordered the grilled calamari, the bf had the pizza with chicken, basil, and fresh tomatoes, and I had a pasta dish called 'Angry Butterfiles' - which had a spicy arrabiata sauce, italian sausage, and porcini mushrooms.

Our waiter was very friendly and attentive, despite bringing us fried calamari initially, he checked in on us frequently, but did not make us feel rushed.  The calamari was good, very tender with a good grill flavor (accompanied by capers, lemon, and tomatoes).  Our entrees were mediorce - tasty, but nothing to write home to mom about.

Overall, Angeli's is probably not a restaurant I will be returning to... although it seems that if you are a regular, the staff does treat you very well.  Give it a try, maybe you will have a different experience than we did.

Best Italian in naperville by far.  Compare it with places downtown like Bella notte.  Try carbonara sauce with any pasta.  Lasagna excellent too.  Friendly warm family atmosphere , always great service, recently remodeled with larger dining room and bar.
The food was really good but the service was horrible. We sat outside and felt like we were forgotten. It was even on a slow Sunday night.

Great place for date night, Nice atmosphere good food reasonable price.

Reviewed by
 the Naperville food dude

I won't claim I've loved every dish I've had here, but if you choose wisely it's a fabulous experience. The wait staff is always incredibly helpful and you're treated like family.  The crab ravioli is to die for. Love the chicken marsala. Mostly it's the staff that keeps you coming back when you've been disappointed in a meal.

This is my absolute favorite place for a nice, comfy meal. The food is high quality and presented tastefully. The staff is outstanding. Management makes an effort to make sure that you leave satisfied. You can show in in your most elegant attire or a comfy pair of jeans and the service is the same. Atmosphere supports a fun meal with kids or a romantic evening with your spouse.
I love the new renovation! Beautiful dining area. Went here on August 26th and had a nice romantic dinner with my boyfriend. Service was great and the food was perfect.

Went here for a teacher appreciation dinner...they closed down the restaurant for us!

-Italian Salad was okay
-Appetizers with Calamari, Ravioli...better!
-Chicken and Pasta---To die for!
-Mango icecream...a perfect ending!

Nice staff. Restaurant has been running for years. I know people who like to come back again and again. Based in a strip mall. If I am around that area, I would go back!

Recently went here on a Sunday afternoon with my girlfriend. I had been here about a year ago, and everything was just ok. I had heard that since the last time I had been there they had remodeled, so we figured we would go for a late afternoon drink and then stay for dinner. I was extremely surprised to see the renovations that they had made! The bar area is beautiful - lots of great seats right up at the bar and nice big TVs to watch Sunday football. Server behind the bar was very talkative and friendly, and when she finished her shift, the owner took over for her and he was just as friendly and nice. We had bruschetta as an appetizer, and it was out of this world! Stayed in the bar for over an hour, then we went into the dining room for dinner. From my previous dining experience, it did not appear to me that they had made any major changes to the dining area. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad, but it could definitely use some sprucing up, especially since the bar is so classy. But.... the food that we ordered was great, and the service was excellent. We will definitely be back soon!

I got take-out from this place and thought it was amazing food. We had Gnocchi Arabiatta, grilled calamari, and a special request to get the sautÃ©ed spinach with mushrooms and sun dried tomatoes as a side dish (which is only listed with entrees). Fantastic!! Best calamari I've had since I lived in St Louis and went to "the hill" for authentic Italian. Why would you ever have fried calamari after eating something THIS good?!

I liked the independently owned feel of this place inside, though we did not stay for eating in.  Bar was nice dining area looked too well lit and a bit "stiff", but I will defintely be back to see the service.  Great place!

Angeli's came highly recommended so I was excited to take my date there. The restaurant is unpretentious and very much what you'd expect from a family owned place. The staff was attentive and the owner came out with our wine choice and chatted us up. At his suggestion I ordered the chicken Parmesan and my date ordered the veal special. The chicken parm was underwhelming. The sauce was nothing special and half way through I realized I was chewing on a long hair that was in the breading of the chicken. Given that I was on a date, I didn't make a big deal, but over all NOT very impressed with Angeli's.

Go here occasionally at lunch since its a good 12 min hike.    Their service definitely needs work, the hostess/cashier only seemed to   stay up front for maybe 1 min then disappeared to kitchen, what is she doing surely it was NOT making my coffee to bring out on a -7 degree day ?      They are alway out of many things on menu,  yesterday it was beef at 11:30 am.   Having to wait for gal to get back up front for food boxes.  Strike 3.     $12.50 dish I spring for 3 rating, pork & chicken a little dry no sauce offered (strike 4).  Only 2 other diners in house so this isn't their excuse.

Very cute and intimate atmosphere, good for people who want a homey vibe. I had the Arrabiata (spicy indeed, but good) and lemonade to drink- not too too sugary like most lemonades and just right for me and even had a slice of lemon that came with it. The bread was good- which is fulfill your hunger while waiting for the entrees to come out. Friendly waiters and good service. I would love to come here again!

I've lived in lisle for almost three yrs now and I have to say I am sad I didn't come here sooner. Let's start with the bread and oil/Parmesan dip..simple but so good. The cream of mushroom soup also good. We got the mussels in white wine sauce which was also amazing! Next my bf got the crab ravioli and I the butternut gnocchi which was also Delish! Everything we ordered was great which i think is hard to come by these days. I should also mention the wait staff was very friendly as well ..all n all great experience and I'm excited to go back :)

The ambiance is really nice wait staff and managers were awesome. But the problem i had was with the food. D had the pasta with marinara and i had arridiata  with angle hair. Being raised in a sicilian family most of the sauce my grandma made were well balanced acidly. I found that both sauces were not cooked long enough to get rid o f that bite. Plus it can be a bit pricey . I will go back to try one more time because they do have a extensive menu. One last thing, you have to try the New England clam chowder it is amazing

Yay!  I'm a fan indeed.  It deserves a 9/10.

It looks like nothing from the street - it's a strip mall business with dark windows that evoke images of heads-down, hushed meetings among elderly tough guys.  Not that there's anything wrong with that.

It's a charming place and the service is so hospitable and friendly.

The clincher was the gnocchi - amazingly fresh, filled with roasted red pepper, I blow a kiss to its memory.  Fabulous.  My husband loved his artichoke ravioli.  The pizza is mighty good too, so chilluns were quiet and happy.

Oh screw it.  5 stars.

I was really looking forward to trying this little restaurant, with the 4 star rating I thought I'd love it.  Unfortunately, I did not.  

The service was impeccable.  Even though it took a while for the food to come out, there was fresh crusty bread on the table, and lots of water refills.  

The appetizer was really good, however my entree, which was chicken --was overcooked.  So much so, that I could barely cut it into bites.  I was very disappointed.  

I was hoping to be able to add this cute little place to one of my favorites.  But, no, it just didn't do it for me.  Maybe a new chef ???

We have given this place a few tries always ending up being unimpressed each time. It is crowded with tables so close it is hard to carry on a conversation and the noise level is high.  This time I ordered eggplant Parmesan and felt that the sauce tasted burnt.  I spoke to the owner regarding the flavor and he told me that no, it was not burned. Well, my husband and I both thought it but the owner was quite rude abut it. He did not offer to look into. So, we won't be back
Just finished dinner here and everything was delicious! Fantastic service. Can't wait to come back.

Seriously, who sold their soul to the devil to get the recipe for the butternut gnocchi in the brown sugar cream sauce?  I've been thinking about it ever since I ate here months ago.

This is a cute little place.  A bit small on the inside, but solid food and very nice people.  I plan on returning soon, as stuffed gnocchi is something I haven't found anywhere else.  I'm not sure if they're making it in-house, but it sure is delicious.

Just went back wi out of town guests, both of whom are huuuuge Italian food connoisseurs.  Couple questions were asked about the various sauces.  The waitress excused herself and after several minutes came back with samples of each and a free flatbread appetizer (she said to make up for the wait, but we were busy scarfing the nice warm bread and didn't notice). We ended up ordering a few different dishes and appetizers, all of which were fantastic.  Carbonara, Vodka, Pesto, Arrabiata...muah.  Our guests were thoroughly wowed by the food, service, wine offerings, and recommendations and said it is now on their to-do list for all future visits.  The owners also update the dining area to open up the space.  Good change. As always, service was impeccable!

I am really surprised that this place has gotten so many stars from my fellow yelpers. I ate here for the first time and I was pretty underwhelmed, unfortunately. 

I love Italian food and I always judge a good Italian restaurant by it's bolognese sauce. It should taste meaty and make me think that it has been cooking all day on a stovetop, stirred lovingly by a little Italian Grandmother named Nonna, as she is standing on a small wooden bench singing Santa Lucia. ;-)
Angeli's sauce, sadly, just tasted like canned tomato paste, plopped precooked sausage and crumbly ground beef. It lacked any depth and was just so-so. 

I ordered the lasagna, but the noodles were so overcooked that they kind of disappeared in a meaty mess of sauce! Also noticed that there was no ricotta cheese or mozzerella on the inside layers of the lasagna. Weird. This is how it was served... meaty mess in a sauce, overcooked noodle, meaty mess in a sauce, noodle. Broiled cheese on top.  See?! 

There was some steamed broccolli on the side, not sure why since it just ended up making the lasagna taste even weirder.

So, I am hoping that maybe I just went on an off night or maybe the chef in the back was on a ciggie break when my order came up. Not sure. I might try again, but I think i'lll try ravioli.
Good enough food, atmosphere fine, and waitress was very pleasant. No complaints, but didn't wow us.

Went out here with the family last night for a family dinner. While the dinning room here is very small and tables are close togather it has a nice family style feel to it. The service here was very good on refilling cold drinks also. only complaint about the service was they never refilled my moms hot tea. Fod dinner I had the cheese pizza. The pizza here was pretty good. It was served nice and hot and had plenty of cheese. I also really enjoyed the homemade bread. The bread was brought out piping hot and has a great crust. For dessert i had the Canoli. It was one of the best Caloli's I have had. My sisters turtle pie also looked very good. All and all a nice Itialian place with good quality home made food.
Awesome! The food is spot on for great Italian, and they understand what it means to provide excellent service.

I have to agree with the previous reviewer--the butternut gnocchi is amazing!!  I have been a huge fan of this place for years.  They initially won me over with their lasagna.  It is so good and large enough for two meals.  Then I met the crab rotolo.  All I can say is--OMG.  It is so rich, though, that you should either starve yourself before eating it or eat very light during the day.  It is just a nice, little storefront restaurant that has EXCELLENT service and a great chef.  The Angeli's bruschetta is also a special treat.  Wish they would serve it more often!

A friend of mine recently had a family party and didn't feel like cooking for it.  Although I had never had their catering, I mentioned that their food was amazing at the restaurant.  She went with them as the prices were good and she was impressed with the service from Joe via phone.  After the party, she could not stop raving about the experience.  The food was exquisite and the service was exceptional.

This place is very close to my neighborhood so lots of people go there because it is quick and easy.  Having said that, I will never go back, as I am fed up with the prices, the quality of the food and the cleanliness.  During this last occasion I found a pretty large bug in the my water glass and showed it to our waiter.  He showed it to the owner who swiftly got up and took it to the back.  Why?  I have no idea.  He came back to our table and said something like, "what do you expect, it's summer."  By the way, this was during the second week of September and we were sitting inside which one person in my party pointed out to him and he was just like . . ."oh well, stuff happens."  During the visit prior to my last visit, my friend and I ordered food for carry out.  We ordered a caprese salad and two orders of buttered noodles for our daughters.  The bill was over $30 and we received about four slices of tomato with the smallest slices of mozzarella on them I have ever seen and two 8" round take out dishes with bow tie pasta in them that barely covered the bottom.  Really . . .20 cents worth of pasta  and $2.00 worth of tomato and cheese for over $30.00?  We called and complained and they gave us another order at no charge but after the subsequent visit, I will be going elsewhere for Italian food.

We had a good dinner here.  I had the Angeli salad (pears, apples, walnuts) with rasberry vinagrette dressing...very good!
For entrees my wife had the pork loin with roasted potatoes.  The pork was fantastic but the potatoes were not completely cooked.  I had spinach ravioli which was very good.   A nice chianti and montevino zin complemented the dinner.  Except for the potatoes a nice experience.

My boyfriend and I's go-to place for anniversaries, birthdays and special occasions!

Angeli's is practically invisible: its in a little strip mall off Naper Blvd and Chicago Ave, but it had the BEST Italian food in the Naper-Bubble area. It's a stone's throw from Benedictine University and Downtown Naperville, so if you've got a special occasion, definitely search this place out!

Decor: The walls are painted with cute murals of vineyards and other stereotypical Italian settings. They usually have some jazz crooners playing over the speakers, but not loudly enough to be obnoxious. Do expect things to be a little crowded: the space is kinda small, so the tables are kinda packed together. The lighting is usually low and the table sparsely set, so this is definitely a place to visit with the sweetheart: lots of room for hand holding, eyelash-batting, and other such revolting displays of affection.

Staff: I LOVE coming to Angeli's because the staff is so darn friendly. They are always so personal and are really helpful on crafting your perfect meal. From what I can tell, they've got late high school and older people working the wait staff, while younger kids are usually the runners and bussers. Even though the staff is young, they are really attentive to your needs. When one water server (who must have barely been sixteen) saw that my boyfriend was not digging the bell peppers in his dish, the kid arranged for him to get a new dish, sans bell peppers. Bravo on water minion selection, Angelis!

Food: Oh god, the lobster crab ravioli. Or the gnocchi. Or just the freaking fettuccine alfredo. Everything here is delicious and fresh; whenever I know I'm going to Angeli's, I abstain from eating all day just so I have enough room from the massive amount of yumminess that is the Angeli's menu. The desert is also to die for: they usually have desert specials that will rock your socks off without hurting your wallet. My recommendation? If it has chocolate in it, get it. Angeli's know what they're doing in this arena; they are chocolate desert pros!


Just a note: make sure to get a little dressy before coming in. This place isn't for the jean-clad. :)

I don't like giving bad reviews because it is simply a matter of opinion.  However, before we picked this place for dinner, i looked at prior reviews and was impressed with what others had to say.  Well after eating here, I think all those people that gave it good reviews need to get out more!  The drinks were very small and over priced.  The salad was warm and wilted.  The bar was very small and too crowed to enjoy a drink while waiting.  The wait was pretty long.  The food was pretty good but a bit pricey.  The staff was nice, accommodating and always asked how everything was.  I didn't want to complain when the Mgr asked how everything was but I doubt I'd go back.  
That's my opinion.

This place was great, they have a wonderful staff who makes sure you are taken care of at all times. The food is delicious, I have had the vodka cream sauce and a couple of chicken dishes and they are always fresh and delicious. The owners are friendly and always walking around to see how everyone's meal is. It's a cozy restaurant to meet friends for dinner. I'll be back!

This place would get zero stars if not for the somewhat friendly waitstaff. I came here for a friends birthday dinner. she found the place online and was while looking through yelp reviews felt it would be a good place for awesome Italian food. Me being Italian I was also excited to try some Italian fare and to a great night out. what I found was a hole in the wall restaurant off a major street in a strip mall. as I entered my friend has a huge smile on his face with the look as im sorry..this place is not what I thought it would be!!...I sat down and thought to myself if the food was great I do not care what it looks like inside...with that in mind I ordered the veal saltimbocca and my fiance ordered chicken Parmesan here arrives to plates with child size portions.. that looked almost like a tv dinner my veal laid on a bed of greasy pasta with half melted cheese on my veal...and broccoli as a side.. a portion that in 4 bites will be fully eaten.. my fiances chicken Parmesan was in a thick generic ragu with no flavor!!! we get the bill and with no drinks our entrees and a calamari appetizer came to almost 70 dollars!!!!! i wanted to complain but did not want to ruin anyone's night more then the food and atmosphere already did...my advice go to downtown naperville stay far away from this over priced bad bad bad italian food!! not worth it at all!!

Hard to say anything else that has not been said.  Food is outstanding, service is awesome.  Of course you have to get the butternut gnocchi.  The Angry Butterflies are superb, and even my 10 year old who eats nothing but PB&J loves the lobster ravioli and the clam chowder.  This is a local favorite and you will know why.
This place sucks. Better off eating chef boyardee. Olive garden, maggianos, buca di beppo. 10 times better.

This is a catch-up review... I've been to Angeli's a bunch over the years. Angeli's is an easy, falling-off-a-log 5 bill-stars.

They have as good a pasta as I've found. You know what I usually order at Angeli's... just spaghetti with meatball. Outstanding.

The atmosphere is great. Sit at the bar. Really friendly.
easy 5... yow, bill

My boyfriend found this place on yelp.  The service was horrible though.  The waitress told us half orders are an additional $2 for each half of the order.  However, on the bill, it was an additional $3.  I told the waitress.  The cashier said that's how it is, who told the waitress no explanation is necessary.  The butternut gnocchi also just tasted like cinnamon and peanut butter in pasta.  Despite that, my boyfriend still gave a good tip, because he's just wonderful.

What a pleasant surprise! The ambiance isn't much, but the food is fantastic. The vodka cream sauce was just perfect, especially over pasta with chicken and asparagus. My daughter had portabello ravioli with creamy Marsala, and she was crushed that this was a special and not on the menu for next time. My angel hair pasta was perfectly cooked, and the meatballs a nice medium firmness without being over spiced (though the marinara was just ok). There are no kid's meals, but most entrees can be ordered in half size. Service was excellent. I'd certainly recommend going to Angeli's.

First time going here and went with the entire family. I have a 15 and 12 year old and they accommodated everyones needs very nicely. The food and service was wonderful and I look forward to returning

Visited Angeli's with my family on a Saturday night to have dinner in a relaxed atmosphere.  We had some pretty good dishes at the table, the best being the Chicken Florentina.  The Chicken was juicy and the spinach was so fresh.  It was pretty quiet in there for a Saturday night, which we enjoyed.  

Overall if you are looking for a good quality meal drop by Angeli's!

Dinner for 3, including soda's and tips.  70 dollars.

It is small and very busy. Wait staff was terrific, the food was not that great though. The place needs a serious scrubbing in the dining area. Perhaps it was our table that night, where we were positioned in the restaurant. Not sure what was wrong that night, but husband did not like the place either.

Cute little place -- we had a great time there, and if you're the last table in the place and friendly, all the waiters will come and sit down and have a drink with you! What a riot!

I've never had anything that wasn't good, and while the food itself isn't what I would call "OMG 5 stars wow this is amazing!", it is good -- I've never been disappointed.  The ambiance and staff bring this place up to 5 stars.

My wife and I were in Naperville house hunting and found Angeli's on Yelp.  All the prior reviews were accurate.  A very charming restaurant in the middle of strip mall.  The owner's daughter was our waitress and the owner himself stopped by to chat.

I had the spicy red sauce on the spagetti from their "lite" sauces menu and it was great.  My wife had marinara with meat balls which was also very good.  These along with the special salad, minestrone soup and a bottle of their house chianti made for a relaxing evening for a couple of travel weary visitors.

The diamond in the rough for Italian cuisine!

My absolute pick for REAL Italian! 

A++++
-  Quality of Food
-  Service
-  Variety

Their Pesto Pasta meals are the same as in northern Italy.
If you are anything like me, and love spicy food, try the Santa Fe Chicken Pasta. It is not on their menu, it is usually a special. However, they always make it upon request. AHHH!!!!!!  It even makes MY eyes water at times! I LOVE IT!!! 

I am not sure what kind of olive oil they use for their bread dipping sauce, but I'm a fan! Portions are rather large, so figure you will have leftovers for the next day.  

I recommend making reservations, better safe than sorry!

We had Angeli's cater a backyard wedding reception for us.  They were wonderful.  John Taylor was so helpful, practically a Wedding Planner.  He coordinated the Tent and table rental and the bakery that made the cake.  They did everything.  Came out set up.  The Bartender and Servers were excellent.  As I was going around being a hostess they brought me another drink.  Of course, they knew what I was drinking.  They cleared up.  They were always attentive, and also great behind the sceens.  Can't give them enough positive accolades.

Located in a strip mall, this place is really mediocer at best.  It appeared that some of the food was purchased from the 7-11 next door.  The salad was overly salty and was drenched in dressing.  The appetizers were really subpar at best.  Had to try the vodka sauce, but tasted more like paste.  Being Italian, I believe I have a biased opinion on good Italian food, but I would rank this along the same side as Olive Garden, Fazzolis or Sbarro.  I wouldn't bother.

My wife and I enjoy this little tucked away gem when we are in the mood for a nice relaxing southern Italian dinner. Reminds me of the great little family owned Italian places I used to frequent in New York and New Jersey.
Totally agree, Amy. I have always described this place as a hidden gem, too. It's family run and the food is excellent. Don't pass on the artichoke alfredo app!

I have been visiting this place for years whenever I am around the area. My recent trip here reminded me just how much I miss this restaurant. The food here is always good whether you eat here or bring it back home. The service is friendly and they always get my order right. Definitely the best Chinese restaurant in town!

Beware of this place!! I come here all the time and after my experience this weekend and today, I will no longer visit. THEY SCAM PEOPLE WHO USE CREDIT CARDS. 

This weekend I had a big order and I went in ahead to make sure I knew how long it would take for a bigger order. They guaranteed me 10-15 minutes. I placed a larger order appropriately should have cost around $65-$70. I got there in 15 minutes they said it's done. I was surprised so I asked how long would it take if I order crab Rangoon. The lady said 3 minutes. I said ah it's okay I don't need them. She said it will be quick don't worry. I caved and said yes I'll order as long as it will only take 3 minutes because I need to go asap. I waited addition 20 minutes. I was upset that they would lie. I wanted to say forget it but lady never came back out. After it was all said and done, there credit card machine wasn't working and they swiped my card so many times they locked out my card. I then had to proceed to pay a different way which I did not want to. Then they charged me $85. I didn't question it even tho it seemed hirer than I expected. After I got my food, I kindly told them that it was okay to tell someone it would take longer than it actually would. The lady then started to yell at me and said it was my fault it took so long since I order the crab Rangoon. I told her that I was advised it would only take 3 minutes. She just kept on saying "it's you fault sir it's your fault sir!" I let it go and just asked is she 100% sure it's all there and she said yes she put it all in so I quickly left since I was already really late. 

When I got there, I was missing my rice. The biggest part of the dish. I didn't know this information until later in the evening since no one told me it was missing. The didn't know it was missing because I placed the order and they just thought I may have forgotten to order rice. I noticed they never gave me a detailed receipt. So I didn't want to accuse them for charging me for something I didn't receive. 

I went to visit them today to Get a copy of my receipt. They printed out a copy for me and I was in fact charged for the rice but I then also Noticed I was charged an additional $5 different from what my credit card total was. I question this and she just started to yell at me. She said we didn't over charger you and she said she would pull the credit card receipt from the weekend. An older couple walked in to sit down. The lady proceeded to walk over to them to tell them I was trying to steal from her. This really upset me. She finally found the receipt and she then saw I was charged more than I should have. She then started to blame me for ordering crab Rangoon and that's why it was different. I looked at the detail receipt she provided and it showed i was charged. She then tried taking the receipt from me and stated that she wouldn't give me a refund for my missing item or for being over charged until I gave her the receipt that proved she was scamming me. I took a pic of the receipt witout her knowledge and said I'd give it back to her. She told me to shred it and I said no. She said she wasnt going to give me my money back until I shredded it or gave it back to her. So I gave it back to her she gave me cash back. I then told her that it wasn't right that you would do this to me or any customers and showed her I took a picture of the receipt scam she had going. She begged for me to not leave. I left, writing multiple reviews and will be reporting this company to the BBB.

Update: 
- I wasn't aware or told of an up charge for swapping chicken for beef (as it shows on your menu the same cost in the area) 
- When I asked for a copy of the receipt, the lady working provided me with a copy. I questioned her and stated this is not the exact receipt for my order and she continue to lie over and over stating this was my receipt. So when the owner reaches out and says she didn't give me a copy of the receipt, I question why she continue to claim over and over that the one she gave me was not the actual copy. 
- I also was told they "tried calling me" I check my phone record and no call was made. In addition, no voice mail was left. Another lie.
- I came in simply for a refund for a product I didn't receive and was going to turn around and buy to lunch specials from you. Instead the lady said that your company does not do refunds and became hostile when I would question the integrity of this business for charging for something I didn't do. 
- I wasn't refunded for my time or gas, I was refunded the amount for a product I didn't receive + a fee that was scammed into my charges. If I was told that swapping chicken for beef was a charge, I would be fine with that. The issue is that your company in one day continued to over promise and under deliver. 
- I don't mind paying additional for what I want. I just want to know what I'm being charged, given all the food items I paid for, with the correct amount of time it would take.
Always very good, prompt service. I've been here mainly for pick up, but only once for dine in. I would definitely come back to eat here but just haven't had the time to.

Good Chinese food is still hard to find on Aurora's west side.  We were running errands on the east side, it was going to be a late night, so we were craving Chinese take-out.  

Golden Sea has mixed reviews, but I was very happy with our meal here.  Food was ready in 10 minutes, everything was still hot when I got home 20 minutes later, and the couple working here weren't overly friendly but they weren't cold to me either.

The food was above average.  I could easily eat fried rice and egg rolls as a meal.  Throw in the crab rangoon, and I'm content.  The chicken fried rice was perfect, and the order of crab rangoon was a generous portion for the price.  The crab rangoon were crunchy on the edges and stuffed with filling.  The hot and sour soup was a huge container and full of veggies, tofu, and beef.  The egg rolls were a bit more peanut buttery than I like though.  We shared the Kung Pao Chicken, which I ordered extra spicy.  There were lots of veggies AND chicken, and we were satisfied with the entire meal.
Still the best chinese food I know of!  Owner is so nice and overworked.  Always busy because this place seriously has the best fried rice ever.  And I never get fried rice!
Golden Seas food is always good and consistent. I love the Wonton soup. Always fresh ingredients

I like Golden Sea for both their food and affordability. The meals are largely proportional, and the price is very reasonable. I've only enjoyed the lunch menu, but I imagine the dinner menu to be the same. The service is good and the proximity to work is great.
Have been going here for years, always great. Tonight I had Rainbow #3.  Beef super tender, lots of shrimp, pea pods and tomatoes. Could not have been better.

Worst Service Ever!!!!!! We order 2 large fried rice and they gave us 2 small, and we didn't notice this until we got home. So we called and they expected us 2 drive back which is not that big of a deal but they wanted to charge us for the large order even though they admitted it was there mistake. I'm in the food service industry and that is unheard of especially when we are new customers. They should have offered some discount or somthing especially when we got an order we didn't want and now we have to pay for 2 more? That's crazy!!!

My husband and I decided we needed to try a different Chinese restaurant, so I checked out yelps reviews and decided to give them a try. 

The food was finished in ten minutes which is always a plus when you can get it quick!! 

The crab rangoons were amazing and a great price!! The egg rolls were great too and had pork and shrimp inside. I got the chicken and broccoli and my husband got the Hunan beef.  My chicken was a bit bland, but my husbands has great flavor.  On the menu it said spicy, which I thought it was the perfect amount, but he wanted more spice.  I was a little disappointed that they only gave us one box of rice since we ordered two entrees, but it was a bigger box than we normally get. 

I would definitely order from them again, but I would get myself something more flavorful for sure!!
I decided to check this place out based on the great reviews. I the food was very slimy and tasteless. There was no freshness to the food.

The worst customer service ever.  If I could give no stars I would.  As a first-time customer, if management is not willing to say "I'm sorry" for getting an order wrong nor offer to make-up for getting all the way home with the wrong order, then I'm also a last-time customer.  It took three phone calls, going on site again, stating my case, and getting some cash back for the food they got wrong.  No experience is worth that.  What was most surprising is that they didn't even care that I was a new customer.  There are plenty of other Chinese restaurants like this one where you don't feel like you have to be on the defense as a customer.  Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else.

This was a very unfortunate experience. I am new to the area and I was willing to try a new Chinese food restaurant to see what the area has to offer. I thought the restaurant itself was very typical in its appearance but nothing scary, I have had some good food from these kinds of places, unfortunately this was not one of them. I ordered take out and got the standard fare. General Gau's Chicken, pork fried rice, beef teriyaki and crab rangoon. I should have returned it, it was gross. It actually made me sick. I have a pretty strong stomach, I have eaten plenty of "funky" food in my life and never had a physical illness from it. Maybe they just had an off night. I won't be back!

Another bad Chinese restaurant in Naperville. Only decent thing on my plate was the bbq pork fried rice. Egg drop soup had a weird taste I can't define. Can pop. Eggroll was ok. Worst offense, General Tsao's chicken wasn't spicy at all.

The McDonald's of Chinese food. This is your run of the mill average Chinese restaurant/take-out in the Midwest. All of the same dishes, bland flavors and high prices you can find anywhere. 

Their egg rolls are different than others. Made with peanut butter, they are very good. Thick, not greasy. 

My wife and I have been here numerous times, due to location convenience only. We have both taken a vow to try and avoid these places in the future due to our disappointment in the amount of money paid for average food.  We will be back though. Stupid is as stupid does I guess!

By far, the BEST chinese I ever had my while life!  I have tried many places and no one compares to them! We drive over here, even after moving just to get their food! 
Mike & Connie are awesome!

It not the best but its not the worst. The prices are ok. the food is ok. I feel like this place is nothing to brag about. I had ordered the shrimp fried and crab ragoon and it just didn't wow me. But what's funny is that the best thing there is there mango smoothie and I feel that's the only reason I gave them three stars!! I'm not kidding that mango smoothie is delicious!!! I wouldn't go back per say for the food but I would go back for there smoothies.

I seriously don't get why people rave about this place.  My third time ordering and we won't go back.  Had to hunt for a piece of Chicken in the chicken fried rice.  Egg rolls were mushy and had a very strong peanut butter flavor.  Crab Rangoon was good but they didn't serve it with sweet and sour, which seemed odd to me.  The food is not awful, but it isn't great either.

Hands down...best Chinese food in the area. I live in Naperville now, and I will still drive 15 minutes to pick up Chinese take-out from Golden Sea.

I used to live in the Aurora area, and this was the only Chinese restaurant around.
Luckily for me, it's the only one that matters. Everything my family and I have tried has been steamy hot and tasty. Food is flavorful...fresh veggies and great portions. My kids love this place too. They compare all other Chinese food to this place, and hands down, they prefer Golden Sea. Our favorites are the wonton soup, shrimp egg foo young, Hong Kong steak and BBQ fried rice. In the summers, my kids love their fruit smoothies. 

The owners are genuinely great people too. Very friendly. As long as Golden Sea is around, I will keep coming back!

I've been here a few times now and this is hands down the best Chinese/Cantonese food in Illinois. I've tried the shrimp fried rice, Chicken Egg Foo Young, fried chicken, crab ragoon, and chicken with broccoli. Food is always fresh, hot and delicious. Very reasonable prices...and speedy service. I've tried any places in Illinois and nothing has compared to the food that I've had in Indiana, until I ate here! I thoroughly enjoy their food! Would recommend this place to anyone who wants it authentic and fresh! Like someone else mentioned not the best dine in experience... But takeout is awesome!

I went in and placed my order at the register. I had somewhat of a long wait which I didn't mind too much since I didn't order ahead. I ordered sesame Chicken and a few other items.
 When I arrived home I opened the "sesame" chicken and realized that it was actually orange chicken that they just put a scope of sesames onto of it. The chicken was very sweet and not what I ordered. I called and made this known and was told that sesame and orange chicken was the same thing. REALLY???? 

Then why does it look different on the ordering menu and why does it have two different names. I was told I had two choices drive all the way back and return the food and receive my money back or get another order of sesame chicken. This in itself confused me because they just told me it was the same thing. Why then would I drive back to get the same thing? Why because after ordering from this place many times over the years I can tell you that sesame chicken is not orange chicken that's why. If you were too busy to make what I ordered and decided to just throw sesame on some orange chicken you had ready that's not my fault. 
I will not be going back
Best Chinese food in the area & the owners are very nice! Dine-in, carry out & delivery. Love the egg rolls, crab Rangoon, fried rice & Mongolian chicken. Soooo good

I went here on a whim heavily influenced by my Neice who likes to eat noodles (I will get to that). First, I've Never had tomatoes in vegetable fried rice before. :-/ minus the 2 tomato chunks, the veg fried rice was not bad, but it wasn't amazing either. 
Crab rangoons = cheese cream in a deep fried wonton. 
My chicken Kung pao was nice (sauce wise) but the chicken did not taste fresh/ was too thick and dry (tastes like it was cooked too fast, which can leave a heavy poultry smell). The water chestnuts in the Kung pao chicken were old and tasted slightly sour. 
Now for the noodles, at this restaurant Lo mein was described to me as thin noodles when ordering so we were shown a picture of the egg noodles that had chicken and veggies. The noodles were good, but the chicken had the same problem as the kung pao, dry and smelled like poultry. 
The Mongolian beef was very soft and tender, came out sizzling on a skillet with onions and mushrooms etc. (no complaints)
Per the past reviews, I tried the watermelon smoothie and it was on point! Amazing smoothie. 
I haven't explored any of the seafood options here, but am optimistic, so I might come back for that only. Service, our waitress was quick, accommodating and helpful.

Kung pao combo was terrible, I feel like I ate a plate of dead rats that have been lightly salted with crap. The fried shrimp was all crisco and no shrimp. The seemingly nice lady also over charges if you use a credit card, so pay attention to your bill! I will not be going back to this hell hole.

Did not add one soy sauce or one sweet snd sour sauce to my bag . It was a $30 take out order . The food was standard American Chinese at above standard prices for what it is . Good smoothie though.

What's with the weird , dirty and cluttered area to the left  when you walk in ?  Is that storage ? Waiting area?  Office?

Great food!! Fast, fresh and excellent customer service!!! I had the mei fun which tends to be a hit and miss depending on restaurant. It was absolutely delicious!!  If u are in the area this is a must go!!
you're not gonna get any better than this! This is the best chinese that i've had. Moved to Oswego so I have to drive a little further, but this place is good.

I've been coming here on and off for years and must say this is the best Chop Suey the area has to offer in my opinion.  We also had Mongolian beef and Egg foo young, all of which were excellent.  The Beef fried rice although very good, may be a bit overpriced for the amount of protein in the dish, which coupled with no delivery lead me to consider a four star as opposed to five on the rating.  The portions however, lend value to the price.

The customer service has always been a cut above and when combined with great food, a best in class rating is in order.
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!!! The best sweet and sour chicken and egg rolls around! Highly recommend!!
A pretty decent Chinese dinner. Service was excellent.  I would go back. Like to try a few more things.

I've been going to Golden Sea for about 15 years. It's the best Chinese food in Illinois. It's my absolute favorite place. I order from there every week. When my daughter comes home from college, it's the first place she makes me take her. The owners are awesome, and know everyone by name. The orange chicken, sweet and sour chicken, and Phoenix chicken are outstanding. And the prices are really too cheap. The food is of better quality than what they charge.

The beef broccoli was great! So many veggies in there! Orange chicken was sweet and spicy. The egg drop soup was rich. I'd pass on the friend won tons. They give you a tom and they don't taste like anything. I just figured them have a surfing, but it was just fried noodles. We ordered online and everything was piping hot and ready very quickly. I'll go back!

This place has the best Chinese food in the area as far as I know. The beef and green beans are good, their sesame chicken, egg rolls, noodles are good. Also, they don't load up their containers with onions and skimp on the meat like some other places. They can be a bit busy on the weekends, so order ahead of time.

I love this place!  I would have given 5 stars, but had a bad experience on Valentines Day this year. I used the online ordering and showed up 5-10 mins after I was told my good would be ready. When I showed up, my food hadn't even been made yet, I ended up waiting there for an hour!  But, as for any other day I've eaten here, both the food and the service has always been great!
Favorite place for Chinese food in the area.  Always ready in the 10 minutes promised.  Definitely my go to place.
I think I tried every Asian place within 20 minutes until we found this place. We have been there 6 times in the past couple months and have always had good stuff. Hot and Sour soup is incredible.
Really well done Chinese food. Nothing fancy, just really good. Sweet and sour is EXCELLENT.

I have been going here for over 20 years now and even after moving a few towns over we come here before any other Chinese place! I like the Chicken or Shrimp Subgum Chop Suey which I have a hard time finding at other places. I also order their Golden Sea fried rice to go with it. I have had other choices here as well that were good but that is my favorite. My wife is a fan of the Tomato, Pepper, Beef. Keep up the great work!

This place is the best chinese I've had in a long time! I won't be going anywhere else. Best egg rolls and BBQ pork fried rice. Beef lo mein and general chicken was awesome too. Nice people that run it and amazing quality food!!!

Awesome! Just went for first time. EXACTLY what I was looking for! Can't believe I've been driving past this place for 14 years! Took a previous reviewer's advice and went for the barbecue pork fried rice (except made it spicy) and the basic sweet and sour chicken. Delicious!!! Can't wait to try the Mongolian Beef!

Best Chinese dr food in the area. We get take out from here about twice a month. 

Pot stickers are steamed than fried :)
Pork fried rice is excellent. 

I highly recommend the Kung pao dishes.

Great Chinese food, always hot, and always fresh. Their crab rangoons are amazing as well as their potstickers. The sesame chicken is also very good and not all breading or all dark meat, the sauce is good though at times can be a little too much. Keep in mind that if you are getting the lunch special and want to pay with a credit/debit card that you will also have to order a side since they like to have a $10 minimum. Overall a Chinese restaurant that I would recommend to anyone new to the area.

I've been going to Golden Sea for almost 14 years and this is hands down my favorite Chinese restaurant. Their staff is so friendly and they always remember you. Best service I've ever had at a restaurant. 

Their food portions are very large and I always have lots to take home. I love their fried rice and egg rolls. I never had anything that I didn't like from their menu. I will always come to this restaurant whenever I want quality Chinese food.

There's no Chinese food like the Chinese food you ate growing up. Menus vary from restaurant to restaurant, and you'll go to a Chinese place that puts mixed vegetables in their fried rice and say "WTF?"

I grew up with Golden Sea and it's the best. Lots of personal bias here, but I don't get why people in the Oswego/Aurora/Montgomery area would want to go anywhere else. Don't pass up the egg rolls or BBQ pork fried rice.
Great Chinese Food. This is the best place in the Aurora/Naperville area. Friendly staff, nice portions, worth the drive. The restaurant is very clean  and welcoming

Our go-to chinese carry-out in Aurora (and we've tried them all).  Every time you order, it couldn't be speedier (you're always told it will be ready in 5-10 minutes - and it is).   Super friendly service.   Good standard chinese fare - potickers, egg rolls, orange chicken, shrimp with lobster - all solid.   

If you're looking for high-end/gourmet chinese, you should keep looking.  If you're looking for a consistent, quick, well-priced neighborhood location - look no further.  If it helps, we eat there 3x a month.

NOT good :( we ordered Shrimp Lo Mein, Orange Chicken and Hunan Chicken. All  of the food had a strange slimy coating on it. My husband put his shrimp Lo Mein in the garbage disposal right away. Will not be returning here.

I also grew up with Golden Sea and I think it's the best Chinese food around. I've only eaten in the restaurant once and it doesn't offer a great dining experience, but there's no one better for take out. They are fast, super nice, and vegetarian-friendly. I remember the days I could eat their beef fried rice, but I just transitioned to the mushroom fried rice and vegetarian egg rolls (both delicious). If you feel like eating Chinese, you will not be disappointed. It's also a great value for the portions you receive.

I recently moved to Aurora and I was looking for a good Chinese Rest.  Golden Sea hits the mark.  First off, they have great Egg Rolls.  I always pick a good chinese rest by it's egg rolls.  I usually get the Mongolian Beef and it is awesome.  It's a bit spicy but I ask for it mild and they make it that way.  The owners are very friendly and the service is very fast.  Definitely worth a trip.
just started going here after going to the same place for six years.  there was such a taste difference i immediately changed to golden sea there spicy fried shrimp is amazing 1

I'm not even sure why other Chinese restaurants exist. Honestly. It does not get any better than Golden Sea. Before you shrug me off as a raving lunatic who seems to like Chinese a bit too much, even uncomfortably so, experience it for yourself. I am the definition of "regular" at this place, usually going once or twice a week. I'm not terribly proud of it, and I'm pretty sure they're sprinkling heroin into their gravy because their food is addicting. 

The restaurant is always very clean, and the team that runs it is about as friendly as it gets. The service can be questionable at times (but I'm a server, so I may just be picky), especially when it gets busy, but you're always greeted with a smile. Excuse me while I oil my thighs for the next segment....

THE FOOD

Okay, I only eat one of three things whenever I go in, but I can attest that these recipes were made from the decendants of Zeus because it is fit for the gods themselves. The lunch portions are massive and pretty cheap, but I always spring for the dinners because 1) I'm not a fan of eggrolls sadly and 2) I'm a fat ass. 

Garlic Chicken - Sublime

Kung Pao Chicken - Transcendent

Curry Chicken - Rubbing it all over my naked body as we speak.

One injustice is that they don't deliver, but I would probably be way out of their range anyway (Aurora is huge). 

Also, this place isn't open on Mondays, and a Monday without Chinese food is like a Friday without dressing up in a pig costume and  rooting through garbage for sexual excitement. Wait... I mean....

It's just good, trust me.

Excellent food and service. 

Staff was friendly and the food was fresh...unlike a lot of places similar to this type of food. The atmosphere is bright and clean looking, ( don't let the outside fool you). 

I ordered the chicken Gyro plate with the salad and fresh cut fries. It came with a honey mustard sauce which is good, but I asked for a Tzatziki sauce and it was given to me at no extra charge. 

Lastly, the only slightly negative thing I can say is that the Tzatziki sauce was too garlicky for my taste, but still very good.
This is my new go to place and need a quick bite for Gyros. Service is top notch, food is very good. I'm a huge fan of their Gyros and Fries. Also its very clean restaurant. Will be coming back soon!

It's been a really long time since I've left a 2 star review - but, I have to be honest, no matter how much I dislike leaving a few stars...

In this case - pictures appear deceiving...

I've been wanting to try Oh My Pita for some time since they recently opened...
It's a new spot in the area, located near the industrial section of town and not really easy to find..In fact, its super easy to miss.  There isn't large signage and its located right next to Mexico 2000 (in a connected bldg.) off of Fullerton...They specialize in Gyros, Shawarmas and Greek sides...A mix of Mediterranean and Middle Eastern...

Walking in, there is ample room to eat-in with many tables & even a flat screen.  You can instantly see the various Spits behind the counter and everything is prepared in front of you behind the glass...Place is cute and looked brand spanking new & spotless...
Owner was friendly and engaging.....

I wanted to try a few things. They offer a few types of Gyros meat: regular, Chicken & Pork.
Shawarma:  Beef & Chicken.  I went with the Beef Shawarma plate (comes w/2 sides).
I've had Shawarma at various Middle Eastern restaurants and always enjoyed it..
Sides:  Greek French fries (thin cut fries topped with feta & oregano and slice of lemon) and
Falafel.  Plus gyros...Friend had the Gyros plate, side of potato salad and falafel.  Ordered a side of Hummus also.  I asked for tahini and tzatziki on the side...

4 cut pieces of pita were included w/my hummus.  All plates came with one fresh pita. Meat portion was generous. .

I dove into my beef Shawarma first....

First bite - very tender, flavor & marinade was different, not like anything I've tasted in the past.  Meat texture was off-putting - odd texture.

Second bite was a mouthful of very fatty and tough meat - total opposite of first bite..
I discretely put a napkin over my mouth and disposed of it..
And that's pretty much how the *bites* went...I either had a forkful of oddly textured tender meat -  OR fatty, tough, inedible meat.  I couldn't eat another bite.  I was done.  The Fat Lady sang...

The Falafel presented itself as such, but texturally dense and uninspired in flavor.
Hummus tasted just like Tahini to me...no lemon or garlic to be found...The Greek fries were ok...crispy w/feta.  Tzatziki was very thin.
Moving on to the Gyro....pretty good, not bad - let's just say it SAVED the meal.  

My friend thought the Gyro was ok.  Said the potato salad was bland.  I had him taste my Shawarma and said it left a strange taste in his mouth - he agreed, the quality of the meat was more than inferior.  This place closes at 6pm.  Had they still been open, I would have brought my shawarma back - it was simply unacceptable.

The last thing I'd want to see is a local business owner struggling...
I can only hope some improvements will be made in the near future...

I'll stick with Stav's gyros in the meantime. ..

This place had not been open too long so when driving by it, I felt it was my duty to check it out.
The location is among factory and warehouses on Fullerton Ave. I am hoping that they will be successful here because the location does not have the best visibility since the location is kind of like an oasis in a desert. Could be a tough go.
Anyway, on to the food. Ordered a Gyros and a Chicken Shawarma sandwich to go. I talked about the place with the fellow who was making the sandwiches about the business and how they were doing, the biz, the location, blah, blah, blah.
The sandwiches themselves were very good. Fresh ingredients and they were not skimpy on them either. The place is nicely decorated and very clean inside. Service was friendly and efficient. Give them a try.

Cheers to All

So a few weeks ago I got a menu from here that was mailed to me and I looked through it and wanted to try it out. My bf visited me last weekend and I said that we should try this place out and OMG this place is delicious. We both got the beef shrawma and I got the Greek fries. They've got other stuff of course but the food was so good. Even my bf loved it. They cook the food in front of you and the prices are really good. This place did not disappoint. I'm def coming back to this place whenever I can.

I had a good chicken shawarma plate from Oh My Pita: Chicken Shawarma with 2 sides (falafel and greek salad - that look exactly like the side of tomatoes, onions, and lettuce that also came on the plate).  It's not like Zaytunes, but offers some differences from the normal Elmhurst/Addison flavors that I have come to know; can only have so much Chicken, rice, and/or greek potatoes.  What stood out was the multiple meats they have on the rotisseries.
Good quality ingredients. Greek fries and beef shawarma were both good. Nice clean restaurant. The owner was super nice.
Very nice workers and great customer service. Fairly new and very clean place. Gyros are a must and Greek fries were the best things I've ever tasted.

Came here twice, fist time was really hard to find if you're not familiar with the area. Nice staff and clean even though they mixed up my order. Not a big deal but rather than making me a new gyro they opened it up, picked the ingredients out that I didnt want into the garbage can, then wrapped it back up again. Gyros are good but both times felt they were too tiny with barely any sauce and was charged for additional. Not worth the drive for me. If you're close then it's fine but order 2 if you're really hungry. I live near a place that makes them way more generous so I won't be going back.
I ordered catering for a large business meeting. EVERYONE loved it!
Food was all good. Wife said it was the best Greek salad she has ever had. A little pricey for what it is but still good
I liked it!  The gyro plate with greek fries and falafel was very good.  The portions were generous, plus the service was friendly and fast.

been here once and the food was really good. gyros was fresh and very tasty place was clean and inviting. really dont have anything mean to say about this place. i will be back in the future when i get the opportunity.

I tried this place out for the first time today and was not disappointed by any means. The beef and lamb gyro was delicious and prepared right in front of me, as the grill and food preparation area are in full view of the restaurant's. The pita was overflowing with tender, flavorful meat, and the tzatziki and vegetable toppings were very fresh. Upon mentioning that I was a first-time patron while checking out, I was even given a free eclair desert that was also very good. Overall, Great food, friendly staff, and very nice interior. I just wish the restaurant itself wasn't so tucked away and more people would be able to discover such a great place!

After coming here twice I decided it's time to leave a review. The beef shawarma is seasoned perfectly with just the right amount of veggies and tahini sauce. The Greek fries are fresh cut fries cooked golden brown, lightly crispy, and topped with a generous amount of feta and oregano, served with a lemon wedge. I got a second one cuz I like extra lemon. The Greek salad is big served with any veggies you want. I had mine topped with gyros which is probably the best gyros meat I've ever had. It's also served it with a pita, so even better you can make a sandwich with your salad. Remember to order a side of tzatziki sauce if you go that route. The falafel sandwich is a must try. It's not your typical falafel but it's to die for. If you live in the area they also deliver.

This is such an amazing restaurant with great food ! Clean restaurant, some of the best gyros and falafel I've ever tried, fresh cut fries were very good. Staff was very nice even offered me a free desert. Will defiantly visit again.

When I rate a place I go off cleanliness, quality of food and staff/owner. My review is 5 stars on all of those!!! I had the chicken Schawarma it was delicious/ flavorful and with white meat! That doesn't happen often and the owner is awesome he came out and introduced himself to us. It was a great experience will definitely be back... Probably tomorrow hahaha

Great family dinner restaurant! Our whole family loved the pizza, pasta and salad. The ingredients were fresh and plentiful. Service was friendly. The manager made sure we got freshly made chicken and that our pizza was cooked perfectly. My (picky) 2 year old LOVED the pizza and pasta. We will be returning very soon! 

A couple of recommendations from your new regular customers:
Vodka pasta sauce 
Sun dried tomatoes 
Fresh garlic (for pizza)
Wheat crust option would be great too!

Let me say Great Job!!! 
The food and atmosphere is inviting and also upbeat.
Angela is upbeat positive and an absolute breath of fresh air in a industry of mediocrity...
6 STARS FOR ANGELA!!!

Not a fan. I had the build your own pizza. I found the topping choices to be generic and lacking excitement. 

I guess this is what I get for going to this type of establishment, but for some reason i was just expecting more. 

My son had a build your own salad. This was difficult to maneuver. All lettuce. 

Won't be coming back.

This opened along with another new restaurant in a place where restaurants have not been successful in the past 5-6 years or so.  Hopefully it will stay.

There is a lot of competition in the "fast pizza" category within 5 miles.  There are Woodgrain Pizza, Block Pizza, Pie 5, Mod Pizza, Blaze Pizza, Pizza Barra, Standard Market, Whole Foods, Mariano's, Caputo's, etc. within 15 minutes, not to mention other not so fast pizza places.

The good:  Price is $7.99 for up to 4 toppings, different sauces (garlic sauce mmm good).

The not so good:  Skimpy on the cheese.  There is barely enough to cover the pizza, but I guess it's o.k. for $7.99

Woodgrain is $7.99 for 1 topping and unlimited for $9.99.  If Cucinova could make it cheesier, then it would be much better.

If you want pasta or salad, they have that also and it is similar to the way the pizza is created.  Choose your base, the sauce/dressing, then the meat/cheese all for $7.99

All I can say is Pizza War - Fight !

I like to get all three sauces, garlic, pesto, and red sauce, bring on the cheeses! Be careful though... go too crazy and the crust gets soggy and saturated. Still really good though. Their lemonade was a bit too sweet for me.
The pizza was very good.  Baked in a wood fire oven.  The staff was very friendly.  Very casual.  However, NOT Chicago style pizza.

This place has really amazing make your own pizza, pasta, and salads. Perfect place for lunch. All food was ready in minutes and all of the toppings tasted very fresh. It is tucked away in a little corner just north of ogden ave and west of route 83. I highly suggest the garlic sauce for the pizza.

This place is new, so they are working out the kinks and new employees learning the ropes. Clean facility that is run by Christina, the manager. She came from the Ditka's restaurant program, which means she knows a lot about quality and customer service. Everyone  smiles here, which makes you feel good. The salad is 'build your own', but they help guide you through it. Also pizzas are made in the brick oven. I got a salad to go. It was under $8, and very good. All fresh stuff here, and they seem to run a tight ship, which tells me this place uses all fresh stuff. I will spend more money here, for sure. I highly recommend this place.

Second time in. Both times pizza was great. Love the dough. Has a good artesian quality about it. Just the right amount of chewy and flavor. I like the fact that they don't overload it with cheese and it has a true brick oven quality. Brought my sons, one loved his pepperoni and pineapple and the other added 6 ingredients and the pizza still maintained its crust unlike the other make your own places. The speed is great too. Quality pizza in 2 minutes!! Sylvia the Shift Manager even came to check on us to make sure we were good. All the employees were smiling and very helpful.
