We went to Grill 89 a few nights ago and saw Cucinova nestled next to it. Got a BOGO coupon in the mail this week and decided to try it. It was really good! Very similar to the concept of Woodgrain a little further west on Ogden but I think Cucinova pizza has better crust and higher quality ingredients. Build your own can be daunting, but plan ahead and you won't be hemming and hawing in line. My husband chose to build white sauce with bacon, mushroom, and artichoke hearts. I built mine margharita style with fresh mozzarella, basil, and tomatoes. They were both great!! The bacon chunks were thick and meaty, not some little teeny bacon bits. I like that they take this concept to salads and pastas. I'm thinking about ordering these pizzas for my next get together with friends.

Fantastic service, fresh ingredients and great prices !!   The salads are huge and you can add any ingredients including 1 protein ( chicken or meatballs).  Try the meatballs on your salad, they are tasty.   Haven't tried pizza or pasta but they look good.  New favorite in town.   A must try.

Limited menu but made to order. Salad is very fresh. Pizzas are make your own up to 3 toppings and come out fresh and piping hot. Down side is the crust was not done enough and don't get the bacon. It had a s grange flavor. Overall a Good place for a quick lunch break.

Price is awesome 7.99 for pizza, pasta, or salad. I feel like the portions are big too. My co-worker and I split a pasta and salad. I like that you get to pick all of your toppings. I can tell, like other reviewers said, that they are still working on the process. I would recommend for a quick lunch to be in and out and take to go. Especially since it is so fast.

We have been to WnC numerous times.  Since meme's in Naperville closed this has been our Sunday go to for Champagne     We generally order the cheese board w/ our champagne.  They never disappoint and my wife and I have been introduced to new cheeses because of our visits.  
This past Sunday we decided to go for there Brunch and bubbly.    We ordered a nice cava and glass of OJ  and made our own mimosas.   We shared the egg scrambled and French toast.   They were terrific.     My only negative would be that the potions were a little  small, maybe it's me I'm a big guy,  but still delicious.    Their location is great and the outside seating is terrific.   

One request:   For your brunch and bubbly could you add a quiche Lorraine.   
Thx

I was impressed by this little gem on Lockport Ave in Plainfield. This downtown area has many stores and eateries to recommend it and it's really nice to walk around in. We stopped in at TCC for a celebratory lunch. Sat on the very pleasant patio and put our order in. I glanced up at the umbrella and noticed a wasp trap with several live inhabitants. Well, it's that time of year and I know the hazards of outdoor dining in yellow jacket season. Sure enough, when the cheese plate came, with its lovely drizzle of balsamic, the wasps came on settled on the plate and refused to leave. We couldn't enjoy it under those circumstances, so we moved inside. The waitstaff distinguished themselves by quickly easing the transition. 

So enough about insects. The food is really worth the journey and reasonably priced, to boot. We had the aforementioned Chef's Cheese and Charcuterie Board, subbing out the sopressatta for duck sausage. Three types of cheese, duck sausage, fig preserves, cornichons, crackers and olives. Beautiful presentation. I had the Smoked Salmon Carpaccio, which starred an excellent lox (and lots of it) with capers, onion, greens, and a lovely portion of mascarpone, all set to pile on the warm loaf of french bread. We shared a Red wine flight, with generous pours of Tempranillo, Cabernet, and Shiraz. They were all appropriately light selections for summer. 

All in all, we were impressed with the service, quality, and selection. The inside is super cute too with cozy seating areas and high top tables. Definitely stop in for wine, cheese, and that lox!

Nice place! I'm an out-of-towner visiting my sister and became curious driving past here. So we stopped in and ordered the flatbread (my sister had the mac and cheese) - and I had a couple glasses of a delicious red. My next visit to Plainfield will include a stop here ...

One of better establishments in the Plainfield area. Started by two gals (hence the name TCC == Two Clueless Chicks), this is nice petite spot, where you can relax, enjoy the fine wine selections, sample different cheeses, be waited on by knowledgeable staff, get a lot of personal attention. They have a European style cafe menu and do lots of wine tasting and samplings quite often. We went here at least once a month for a couple of years and enjoyed ourselves each time. Very reasonably priced. Parking is a bit tight in the general area but is available. Has a nice cozy feel to the place. I recommend the baked brie. The Chef's Cheese and Charcuterie is also a good choice here for appetizers style stuff. The Mac-n-Cheese is often chosen and is plentiful. You may bring your own wine, but there is a corking fee. They do also sell just a few wine accessories and decorations pieces. Limited seating and perhaps a few seats outdoors when the weather is fine.

What a pleasant surprise! Four of us came here and were happy with our experience. Our waitress was so friendly and accommodating. We each did a wine flight, both white and red, and we all loved our selections. The food choices were diverse and delicious. We had the flatbread, salmon platter, and bruschetta. The desserts, however, get mixed reviews. We had the small chocolate mousse (can't remember the actual name), and the cinnamon cake, and those were great. We had the blue cheese cheesecake, which is an interesting concept, but the tastes didn't mesh well, in my opinion. Everything else was fantastic, and we've recommended it to many people and have since been back.

Ordered the Cheese and Charcuterie board and bottle of Pinot. Nicely paired.  Went on Saturday night around 5 before it became crowded and sat in the couches looking out the picture window.  Great atmosphere. Looking forward in coming back.

Wine selection is always impeccable. If you have never been there I recommend the wine flights and chef's board to start. They have three wine flights: red, white and sweet. The chef's board includes three cheeses, one meat and comes with nuts, fig preserves and bread. For dinner I would suggest the BLTCC or the Grilled Cheese with tomato and prosciutto dunked in tomato bisque. They have many other selections and their menu is always being updated. They stay up to date with food trends. In the summer they make their own sangria!! YUM! The best part is they take reservations for two! Free wine tastings on too! If you like cheddar cheese order prairie breeze. Asp, the owners are the two sweetest ladies! Feels
good knowing my money is going to them when I am there. The staff is also super sweet and great at giving recommendations for wine. If you like Zins: Zynphomaniac is just to die for. If you like sweet wine: order Serena. Whatever your fancy you will find something you like! I love to krder the truffles for dessert as they are the perfect end to the divine time I always have when I am there.

I can't give them 5 stars yet and that's only because I didn't eat while I was there. I can tell you that it smelled heavenly. I was just there for dessert and wine. My friend and I drank 2 bottles of the Sauvignon Blanc, and I had the raspberry shot, a raspberry liqueur in a chocolate shot cup topped with whip cream, my friend had the truffles. Everything was great, we sat on comfy couches in a corner by the windows. We had a great time and I will most definitely go back to try their menu.

Great idea, friendly staff but way over priced especially for their chef boards/charcuterie boards . I asked for additional prosciutto and they gave me 2 slices for $5. I ended up running out to jewel and adding more stuff before I brought it to my get together . To embarrassed to bring it the way it was .

Our friend gave us a gift card for this place, and we gave it a go last night. They were having their complimentary wine and cheese tasting, which happens every week on Thursday! The servers were great and very knowledgeable about their products. We tried the Silk Oak Zinfandel and oh my.....one of the most memorable wines that I have had in awhile. So of course we had to get the bottle. We followed that with a delicious Garnacha. Our favorite bites were the "Adult" Mac N Cheese with Bacon and the "stinky" Bleu Cheese. Also the Habanero jam was amazing. The atmosphere was very cozy and inviting. A great place to meet with friends. We loved our server and the gal doing the wine tasting did a great job. Overall, this made for a great Thursday night in the Burbs.

Wine and Cheese by Tcc is situated in quaint downtown Plainfield.  It shares the street with one of my favorites MoJoes Cajun and it is immediately next to Capri Sogno which is no slouch. Also, it appears that it will have some more competition very soon( Sovereign & The Spaghetti Bowl). As far as I'm concerned, it should be able to hold its own against any restaurant, especially if it sharpens up a few minor details.  Service and menu expansion.  Menu expansion to offer new and different shareable plates every season.

We were able to get an outside reservation for 7:00 at 6:30 on a Tuesday.  We didn't realize the whole street was shut down for a car show!  We got to sit right on the sidewalk and the people watching was first rate!  
 
I'll go ahead and get my one negative off of my chest... The service staff seemed unprepared and understaffed.  Very nice, but long waiting for nearly everything. This is not the servers fault, it is the management.  Have an extra server working that you cut if it's slow, simple.

So we picked a nice Barolo out of the store and ordered an assortment of cheese and charcuterie that was top notch.  The smoked duck breast and the wild morel and leek cheese are not to be missed!! A++

Second course was;  

flatbread with roasted artichokes, arugula, chÃ¨vre and something else. A (careful if you don't like goaty cheese, chÃ¨vre is goaty!) I loved it!!

Baked Brie with raspberry sauce A (classic )

Salmon Carpaccio. A. They had a wad of fresh mascarpone that made the dish crazy good!

The Ambiance, weather, food, wine and people watching deserved 5 stars.  I look forward to eating here again soon and will be bringing friends here as well!  

Thanks for a great evening!!
Great staff, awesome location in downtown plainfield! Try euphoria cheese...amazing!!!

Two days and back again!  My wife and I went this past Sunday. We had the BLTCC sandwich which was terrific. She enjoyed the cheese sample. The wines were wonderful and the Georgia Pecan Cinnamon Cake was ridiculous. Back on Tuesday and we had the grown up grilled cheese and the hummus. Both were fantastic with a couple glasses of merlot. Atmosphere and staff were excellent. Great place to relax and hang out. May have to wait a little longer to go back. They might put me to work.

My husband & I stopped in yesterday for the 1st time. We had just walked over from dinner across the street. The waitress immediately greeted us & seated us. It was a little chilly inside and the rain had cleared outside so we asked her to move us to the patio. She was so accomodating about it. We tried the sweet wine flight. The wine was delicious. Our waitress came out to check on us quite a few times, asked which wines we enjoyed the most. When we were done we went inside & told her which we'd like to buy and she promptly showed us where it was. Just a wonderful helpful experience all around. Next time we go I plan on having a meal, the menu looked delicious. The only reason I did not give this 5 stars is because we haven't tried any food there yet. The 4 star rating is for service and wine selection.

Very nice interior and friendly staff.  Nice cheese selection.  But, I am not too happy with your "bare hands" policy when it comes to handling cheeses.  Disposable gloves are the norm today.  I would suggest at the very least: wash your hands before handling the food!
Was here during the summer. Super awesome salad, crusty bread and Sangria. Nice little patio area, great for people watching along the main drag. Can't wait to return!

I love this place!  I was there on Saturday and had the spicy cheese plate which was delicious.  It came with a Ghost Pepper cheese which sounds REALLY spicy, but it was just right.  The staff is great with their advice and recommendations.  I'll definitely go back!

I adore the seating in the front window! So private and romantic! They have a nice selection of wines and decent menu. I also participated in a port tasting which was informative and fun. Will continue to come here.

Bought a bottle of Chicanery from the Banging Gavel Brews company. The owner rang me up and the single bottle of beer cost $8.67. She grabbed a bag to place the bottle in and I told her I didn't need a bag. I was going to drink the beer while I waited for my mother-in-law to finish her wine tasting. That's when the owner told me if I was going to drink it inside there would be an "UP CHARGE" for that. What a joke! This is not a special brew and 4 packs can be found for $10. There are many better choices to stop for a drink on the same block.

Great atmosphere and LOVE sitting outside at their sidewalk cafÃ©, sipping wine and enjoying olives and a delicious cheese plate.  This place gets it, and offers a friendly & knowledgeable staff, clean environment, and lovely setting to enjoy some delicious wines and cheeses.  One of my favorite hangouts! Reminds me of downtown Napa, CA :)
Love love love it. Always yummy and great staff. Great place to sit outside and share a bottle of wine.

Sipping an artisan beer, eating a gourmet sandwich, and watching downtown Plainfield roll along. Can it get any better than that? In Plainfield it simply doesn't. If you're looking for the best food in the area, you come here. 

The chef knows his stuff and always crafts great dishes composed of top quality ingredients. The wine selection provides great quality across the board and the beer list is perfect. I'm so glad this place exists in Plainfield.

The people that work here are unbelievably helpful and warm. I have never been to a place where the employees cared so much about the product they produced. Hats off.

The only problem this restaurant has is the number of seats. I guarantee a place like this can seat more people.

A humongous shout out to the friendly service and amazing kitchen staff for making the best experience Plainfield had to offer.

This spot is a secret; even to folks that live nearby. Its been around 11 years and with good reason. Everything is hand made and fresh, including soups. The gourmet sandwiches use great ingredients, are put together well (THANKS, Rachel!!!!!) and the hostesses have been very friendly. Only later did I reveal im also a small business worker in the area. But it made no difference, They were treating everyone well and I was watching. The charcuterie plates are nice ini that you can add stuff a la carte to them. The take home cheeses, pate's, and olives are yummy. I will keep coming back. Nice to have met Anna the owner and talking about how the market is perking up with the latest infusion of gourmet businesses in Plainfield.  Congrats on a great place for a way better than average lunch and dinner experience!

My wife and I have been coming here for years and we always love it. We have had everything from sandwiches to soups to large trays of meats and cheeses. All the waiters know their stuff. They can help you with wine and beer selections. Mike was one of the guys that always helped us, not sure he is there now though. 

Anna is one of the nicest women and she always takes time to ask us about the kids and how things are going. 

They offer many organic and healthy choices and that is hard to find. I have never had a bad thing here. My 6 year old says it is her favorite place to eat. 

Support the locals and eat/drink here. You will not be disappointed.

I sat down Saturday for my first meal at this gem in Plainfield and if not for the service would be a 5 star review easily. I'll preface to say that we are return customers. We've been in countless times for gifts of wine and cheese and always have found a great selection and a great variety that you can't normally find in the area. 

My fiancÃ© has eaten here before for dinner so I joined her, here is the story

Food - 5 stars easy.  My fiancÃ© and I went for dinner on Saturday and were not disappointed.  We ordered a cheese plate, cured meat plate and a salmon carpaccio. Needless to say, there were leftovers.  The cheese selection alone is easily some of the best in the area. We splurged with some 14 yr aged cheddar and it was phenomenal. 

The prosciutto at this place is insane. We had the prosciutto, two salami's (which were awesome) and the andouille sausage which I was a big fan but was a bit too spicy for my lovely last. 

The salmon carpaccio was very good. With the sourdough bread that we loved we made a tcc sourdough and locks which is highly recommended by us.

Now the reason this place won't get 5 stars...... Service

Our waitress was very friendly but was slow. The food came out quickly, but we were empty for a majority of the night and the table next to us told us that they had specials for $5 / glass.  Our waitress didn't tell us which it rally have nobody to blame but myself, but I think it's pretty standard to let the customers know the specials. 

By the time that we were done eating / drinking to the time we paid and left was more than 35 minutes. Other tables that had a different waitress were in and out by the time we had paid our bill. 

GO HERE! We love this place and will return. I'll follow up after the next time we come to see if its improved.

I love this place and can't wait to go back.  Went on a SaturIday night and it was a bit crowded.  There are a few tables and a sofa/lounge area in the back, as well as two comfy chairs and tables right by the front window.  Perfect for a cozy, romantic date night, but also a good spot to relax with a book or magazine by yourself.

And there are complimentary wine flights.  Prices of glasses and bottles are about what you'd expect for this "boutique" setting.  Fiance and I had a glass of riesling and the baked brie with raspberry jam.  Food and wine are superb.  Our bottle and food cost $35 total.

Can't believe it took me so long to finally get here!  Cafe has an unpretentious, but slightly European feel.  Sounded like there was Brazilian jazz playing in the background.

If you REALLY want to impress a girl or do something romantic for her birthday, I'd recommend stopping in here for a glass of wine and small plate, then heading out to dinner or a movie.  I didn't know places like this existed!

This is a wonderful wine shop with a small selection of unique wines.  Spend an afternoon or summer evening on the patio and order some cheese and bread.  Awesome Brie with raspberry spread.  For lunch or dinner, the tomato bisque and grilled cheese are absolutely top notch.  Wine prices and food are reasonable.  Limited seating inside.  Reserve the front or back booths ahead.  Added benefit is their beer and/or wine club.  I have never had a bad bottle.  The owner is typically in The store.  They also have an annual wine tasting in September.  Not to miss!  Go early, it gets crowded! This is a great place to sit an people watch over a glass of wine.
The food is amazing.  The sandwiches are my favorite.  Great wine and cheese selection.  A must stop in downtown Plainfield.

OK, today I went back and tried the cup of soup and half a sandwich.  Just a quick update.  The clam chowder was the soup of the day and it was great.  The broth was perfectly seasoned and just the right amount of potatoes.  For a sandwich, I had sliced ham on a pretzel roll bun with garlic/onion butter, hummus, spring greens, onions and avocado.  They put a smooth chedder on it to finish it off.  

Great food here.  They've been in business for six years now as a wine and cheese shop in Plainfield and opened the cafe portion of their business just last May.  I know it is great because I've tasted the food, but it is also very busy on the outdoor patio in the Summer time.  They have regular tastings to include wine, beer, cheese, etc.

You have to stop in to find out more.  I would highly recommend.

Our favorite place in Plainfield to dine. The food is both unique and excellent. You can expect gourmet food at a great price. The wine selection is good and they have beer too. We appreciate the extra effort that Anna, Jason and their staff put  into the customer experience. The entire TCC crew really want you, their customer,  to be happy. We have dined there nearly a dozen times throughout the years and have never left without saying, "That was really good. I am stuffed. When is our next date night?"  

We thank God that Wine & Cheese by TCC calls Plainfield home as Plainfield would be less without TCC.
This is easily the best dining spot in downtown Plainfield. The food is great, the wine is spectacular, and the personnel are terrific.

This Wine and Cheese boutique is fantastic!!

If you find yourself wanting to go out and try something different, not full on dinner, but not the 'bar scene' either try out Wine & Cheese by Tcc.  

The selection of wine is impressive, she has everything from locally produced stuff to imports.  I was excited to see that she carried some of the wines from Lynfred Winery, one of the best local wineries.  She also carries some of the tastiest cheeses ever, my FAVORITE being the St. Peter's Blue.  I love cheese and the St. Peter's Blue is one of the top 5 best cheeses I've ever had.  

W&CbTcc also has wine and beer tastings a few nights a week so be sure to check them out!!

I've only ever ordered take out from here and ordered cheese and meat trays for Christmas but I must say every time I've gone in to order its been a pleasant experience and the quality of their stuff it amazing. Whenever I go in I order a cheese plate with a couple of meats. I usually know off the top of my head a couple of the cheeses and meats I want but I always have them pick one or two for me and they are always so good! I can't recall ever having something I didn't like. When I was first starting to really like wine I was pretty overwhelmed when I tried to pick one, they helped me pick a wine based of what I was looking for and it was delish. Based off the other reviews I'm clearly missing out by not having actually dined in so I will defiantly be dragging my husband here very soon!

I am a semi-regular here, and a big fan. My daughter and I visited yesterday for lunch, both enjoying 1/2 soup and sandwich. Food is always fresh and staff is very knowledgeable and helpful, I always let them select artisanal cheeses for me and am impressed and happy with those selections. They introduced me to GUS soda and several very good wines....we just bought a Lynfred  Sangria yesterday for my daughter who only enjoys very sweet, fruity wines. After asking a few questions and listening to my daughter, the server brought out wines to taste, making it an experience instead of just a purchase. She has a wine she is happy with instead of a roll of the dice. This is typical of the service at TCC.
The interior is small, but this is part of the apppeal to me, on a stressful day, TCC is a little sanctuary of sorts, cozy and friendly.  Lastly, it is the perfect place to enjoy a nice summer day. Grab a table with your friends, good food and drink, ahhhhh.

Wine & Cheese, in my opinion, is worthy of 5 stars.  However, my recent visit only permits me to grant 2.  I think this is a great gem in downtown Plainfield and love it for what it is:  a quaint location to have a drink or two and some fantastic appetizers.  We walked in last Friday and to our dismay the 3 tables they have up front were all reserved.  What?  We arrived before 5 pm, which we have done before, and there was nowhere to sit and have a drink.  The 2 front window seats were also taken, likely because there were no tables available.

We were ushered to the rear lounge area, given menus and essentially forgotten about.  We walked out and gave our money to a neighboring establishment that gave us a seat immediately.  Sorry, Wine & Cheese, I'm not sure how excited I'll be to come back.  

I really don't believe this location should honor reservation requests.  Even up front, the staff member said "sometimes reservations don't show" so why do you even entertain a request to hold tables?  Wine & Cheese isn't big enough to do reservations AND seat walk-ins.  How much potential business did you lose by turning walk-ins away while those tables were reserved?  Might want to re-think the strategy.

Every so often, my husband and I both get the "let's have wine and cheese for dinner" craving. Usually we would go run to W&C and take some stuff to go and make our own cheese plate but one Friday we decided to stay there and try the place out. 

It is very tiny so it does feel like you are right in the center of everything but it bothered me a lot less than I thought it would. Our server was pleasant and it only took a minute for our wine to arrive. They do things a little differently with regards to creating a meat and cheese plate.  I believe you pay a charge (maybe $5) and then you pay for each cheese by the ounce or two ounce portion. I think it was around $18 for four meat selections. So when we were done, we had a monster of a plate with four meats and four or five cheeses. Don't worry we took it all down. Our motto is "leave no cheese behind." :) 

Overall, it was a nice evening. For our meat and cheese selections and four glasses of wine it was around $70. We will return because it is so close to our house and I feel everything we had was of fine quality. It won't be for a while with the weather changing but it would be nice to sit on their patio next time.

To say this place is a hidden gem would be an understatement.  It is simply amazing what they can turn out in such a small kitchen.  The owners and the staff alike are outstanding.  It does tend to get crowded at times now, which is a good thing.  Easily the best place to spend some time with your mate and enjoy a nice bottle of wine or even a good craft brew or two.

The new 3 course meal was amazing! We came in with a larger group and had a wonderful time.  The first course was a lobster salad over arugula with roasted cherry tomatoes, the second was buffalo short ribs over sweet potato with a veal reduction, and the third was a perfectly done pork belly over heirloom rice with an amazing creamy morel mushroom sauce! You can't beat the service and the wine pairings were superb!  I would come back here over and over!
Great place and an awesome lunch option. Not too many beer selections but great for a date. We may try the wine tastings some time soon.

Always passed by but never went in.  Very small inside but it looked pretty quaint and nice.  I liked the effort of including craft beers into their fold.  Granted, their selection for their beers weren't much (about 10 various domestic and imported 6 packs and bombers) but, their selection seemed to changed with the weather as the focus were on summer styles like wheats and hefeweizens.  

Service was non-existent as I wasn't approached by any of the employees for as I was looking in the same area for 5-10 minutes, not sure what to get.  However, the place was packed and everyone seemed to be very busy so I wasn't too turned off by that.  They have the perfect location, being right at a four-way stop, right in the center of town, and next to Finnegan's, which is packed most of the time.  Don't take my review too seriously since I didn't try any of the foods they made there.  Support your small downtown businesses!
I love this place. I had baked brie with and a wonderful flight of white wines! I am eagerly awaiting my next visit!

Great lunch destination on a cool fall day. Great sandwich's and craft beer. Wines selection is the best in Plainfield. Very friendly staff who encourage to try new items. This place never lets me down.

My wife and I attended a Valentine's Wine Dinner last night . Amazing! Jason and Anna really got it right once again ! You can see that a lot of thought went into the menu and wine pairings . Service was very personal and accomodating as well - Thank You Connie !

The sandwhich I had here wasn't to great, I wouldn't waste money ordering it again.

The cheese selection was weak, there were maybe... 20?

The guy working the counter was nice and had a smile on his face so that's something.

I came here on a Friday night with my best friend.  We needed a nice night to do a lot of catching up and enjoy a glass of wine together.  We sat in the front corner on 2 cute modern couches with candles and a very warm atmosphere.  It was the perfect spot for us.  

Our $7.00 glass of Pinot Noir was nice, but a pathetic excuse for a pour.  I know the glasses are big, but I watched our server use a plastic wine cup measure the amount, and for a wine shop - I was very disappointed.  We saw the pour and thought that we would move on to the next bar rather quickly.  

We ended up staying a bit longer because the menu was so nice, we had great service, and it was the perfect place for us to talk.  The menu was fantastic and overall, I enjoyed the experience.  I'll probably keep looking for a similar place - with more bang (wine) for your buck.

Very professional, informative and extremely friendly!

I have been coming to Wine and Cheese Tcc for over a year now (I believe Tcc stands for "Two Clueless Chicks"). I not only appreciate their fine cheese selection, which has something for everyone, but I love the wine and beer variety as well. It is always so clean and organized inside, making your experience that much better. 

Since they now serve actual food, let me tell you...

I find that the sandwiches are TO DIE FOR!!!! You can tell that they do not have some guy schlepping the food together. This guy is not even a mere chef. He is an ARTISAN! Each sandwich is picture perfect, very fresh tasting (ingredients top-notch) and delicious. Also a must is their hummus. Mmm...

I believe that this is Plainfield's finest little treasure.
Love this place allot, always impressed with their wine selection

First visited this nice little wine shop for one of their scheduled wine tastings which we saw advertised on a small outdoor sign while driving down the street.  It seems that each month they have a several tastings and other food/wine events pre-scheduled.  Each event seems to cover a different wine region or type of food. They all looked interesting, if only we had that amount of time.

The store is small and quaint with a nice selection of wines, cheeses, and other specialty items.  The staff is very knowledgeable about their products and are very helpful.

These sort of shops seem to be the current rage and I haven't been very impressed with most to this point.  However this shop is different and I very much enjoyed it and will be going back.

Information:

Wine Club
Cheese Club
Beer Club

Wine, Beer, and Cheese Tastings
Cooking Classes

Newsletter

Catering
This place has it going on!!  Good wine selection.  Great food.  Friendly owners.  Just wish it was closer to me.

This is a great place to pick up a bottle of wine and some fancy cheese (like the name says). I like how there's a lot of details for all the wine - including good pairing suggestions. The beer is a bit pricey, but go there for the wine and now the brews. Highly recommended

Love this little shop in Plainfield.  They have a great selection of wine and cheese and a little restaurant too.  Their mac and cheese is wonderful and the cheese trays looked awesome.  

They do weekly tastings too.

The Wine & Cheese Shop in Plainfield is awesome! My wife and I are (somewhat) regulars. It is a cozy, relaxing environment. Their wines are excellent and we love their food menu too...everything is GREAT! The real test came this past week. My boss put me in charge of supplying appetizers for our (managers) company Christmas gathering (for about 30 people). Anna, the owner, was extremely helpful. She set us up with a tasting. We loved everything she suggested (especially the little, stuffed red peppers). Anna beautifully arranged 3 different cheeses, 2 types of sliced dried meats, crackers, grapes, olives and of course...the little, stuffed red peppers. My co-workers thoroughly enjoyed our selections. It was a great success! Thanks Anna! You passed the ultimate test! See you soon!

I have been a fan of W&C Tcc for some time now.  They've always got a nice selection of cheeses that rotate and change with the seasons and some tasty wines (at a good price).

    Further more the wine recommendations are usually spot on.  Just describe what you're cooking and I usually get a spot on recommendation (Jason there is really helpful with his recommendations).

    They've recently been getting interested in prosciutto, and have had a nice jamon Serrano (There are almost 2,000 Serrano producers in Spain.  So please, if you try one do not assume another one has to taste the same.  There can be large differences in quality from one producers to another)


     Now for the good news.  W&C by Tcc has started to carry Iberico bellota paleta (shoulder).  If you're not familiar with the Iberico bellota products it is from a very specific breed of pig (the iberian pig) and the bellota products graze on primarily acorns.

   The result is the highest grade of jamon with a deep complex flavor and a resulting fat that literally melts away in your mouth.  I've been traveling up to Chicago to purchase my Iberico ham and I am simply thrilled that a local business has decided to start carrying this product.

   It does cost a lot, but remember that even a few slices can satisfy your Iberico needs.

   enjoy the food!
  dan

I just love this place and I love the people who run it!  Although they do not have the largest wine selection out there, they have a good wine selection, which changes frequently.  They are always ready, willing and able to help me find a new wine for me or for my family and to special order wine.  I haven't been able to check out the restaurant side yet, but I am looking forward to doing so soon.

This place is amazing- you just found a gem!  It's hard to find quality food and a selection of organics in the suburbs.  This place has it all.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  The food is unbelievable!  Everything on the menu I've tired so far has been surprisingly delicious- I would describe it as unique combinations with layers of flavor.  Whoever came up with the menu has a great talent for pairing food combinations.  There are plenty of truly healthy choices on the menu.  You can tell only the finest quality ingredients are being used with organic options too.  And what a great wine selection!  I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience. It's a great find in the suburbs.

This is an awesome place for our little local home town....Great food, priced like Naperville:( though,   and I agree, the "pour" on the pricey glass of wine, could be a little more generous for sure!!  People who would frequent this type of establishment, don't mind "spending" money....but, don't like "throwing" money away...  YUMMY on the food for sure!!

Great food at a reasonable price. Their Naan is fresh and amazing. My first intro to Indian food, and have since tried others, but this place is still my favorite. Very friendly people and are willing to explain what each dish is, but I wish info on the different foods were a little more readily available so I didn't feel like too much of a tourist. Your best bet would be to get a 2-entree combo so you can try a little of each, and pick up a few samosas, and don't be afraid to try the different dipping sauces!

No doubt about it I love Indian food.  I love spice and complexity of flavor.  It can be daunting for a novice to read a menu and dread asking what is??? Bhature, utappam, chaat, Roti, chapati, dosa, paneer and the list goes on.  One of the delights at Tandoor Hut is the friendly and helpful staff, and the tasting they encourage.  Small tasting cups are stacked on top of the counter, food is on display in a steam table but replenished often.  Of course there's tandoori chicken, tikka masala, dal and naan bread.  There's sweets on display and chaat (snacks/street type food).  I crave the onion pakora, a deep fried crusty onion snack that's delicious.  Located in a little strip mall, you can eat in or get it to go.  There's a lunch and dinner special every day.  Lunch for $5-$6 is a reality.  It's base board licking clean in here.  If you decide to eat in, food is put on sectioned stainless steel trays, which kind of remind me of school lunch, but I saw many groups sharing and eating communally.  If you love Indian food or are just curious, drop in, you won't be disappointed.

BEWARE-- if you come with someone else to enjoy lunch, do not expect to eat together unless you order the same items. Either both order thali or both order cook to order items. Terrible customer service. If you ask just a question, owner likes to argue...

If this is biriyani then maybe the word should be deleted from the culinary dictionary!!!! Worst ever!!!
It took me some days to write the review coz we were all busy recovering from the indigestion. Definitely won't be back!!

My wife and I ate here with our daughter for the first time today and we loved it. I ordered goat with naan and my wife had a masala dosa. The food was cooked perfectly! The goat curry was full of flavor and had very little oil. Meat was cooked perfectly and had absorbed all of those rich indian spices. Serving sizes were perfect and very filling. What I really like about this place is that they have set it up as a dine in and takeout place. The way they serve food would serve as a great example to those wanting to get indian food into the mainstream. They have everything ready and even give samples. While there we saw tons of repeat customers talking with the owner and now we know why they came back. If you like Indian food you HAVE to try this place.

I was short on cash and did not have enough to pay for my food. The man working there told me it's ok and still gave me everything I ordered. I love the samosas there and getting the butter chicken with the naan. Everyone is so nice. They greet you when you enter and give you samples after making your chaat to make sure you like it. I don't understand how some people are saying this place is rude. Every time I have been inside I have been treated very well and I have been there over a dozen times. I'll be back!

Casual delicious meals. On separate occasions, had chicken tandoori, mutton, veggie rice, coconut rice, other chicken dishes. All great. Oh, chic peas, cauliflower. All great. Others I had no idea but tasted just great . Then the buttered naan. Yikes out of this world. Every time ! My plates never needed washing afterwards.   So good.

Don't recomend this place at all. This was my first time n ofcourse the last sadly. There is way lot better food at Shree or hot bread .. Just a drive bit more n get better food. Here at tandoor hut their curries were taste less and watery. Also chicken biryani was awfull. Not wasting my money again...
This is very amazing place to eat nice indian food. We especially love their chicken and paneer dishes. The staff is nice and friendly. Must go place.
This guys cheats and over charges if u dont pay attention. Natural problem with indian restaurant owners when they see you are not paying attention they try to cheat u

Was extremely disappointed, that we were forced to throw away too much food! We weren't allowed to take leftovers with us! Owner/Manager missed the point, when he was trying to explain the value of a thali! There are 795 million hungry in the world. I know my thali doesn't make a difference, but my conscience and my actions do.

Delicious, delicious Indian food. My go-to dishes are the Channa Masala and the Paneer Butter Masala (both vegetarian), with a healthy serving of Naan. Whenever my family wants to enjoy some delicious masalas without putting in the effort to cook, we choose this spot. Never had a problem with the food; it's always well portioned and well priced (every so often I find myself needing another naan, but that's a rather minor problem). Definitely consider getting take-out from here if you want to spice up (no pun intended!) a family dinner that otherwise would be pizza, burgers, or sandwiches.

The tastiest meal I've had all week.  It's going to knock something off my weekly restaurant list.  The spices were all perfect, the naan warm and shift, and the presentation perfect in the new metal trays.  I am pleasantly stuffed for about $10.50 but I did get a $3 lassi yogurt drink.  

My only suggestion to get transparent plastic lids so that Indian food novices can see the various dishes or put more of then up on the 8 tvs they have.
Pleasantly surprised! Good Indian food

I FOUND A PIECE OF STEEL DISH SCUBBING SPONGE IN MY FOOD!
when i asked the man to wrap up my chicken pieces in the naan to make it as a "to go" roll... he looked at me half dazed and confused, as if he'd never heard of indian tandoori naan/ paratha wraps before. 
I think the owner woke up one morning and thought, "I can make money by opening up a restaurant!" Terrible Terrible representation of Indian cuisine. Go to Sara's eastern grill in the showplace theatre area 5 minutes down the street for a somewhat better representation of Indian food.
Sorry the chicken biryani lacked taste. The lamb kabab did not have accompanying chutney (mint). Did not try vegetarian options or nan.

Love the naan, and tandoori chicken. Great for quick take out Indian food we don't feel like cooking. We have been going to this place for the last 6 months at least twice a month. Consistently good food and service.

This is the real deal Indian food. Seriously, reminds me of traveling through India way back when. I've been here twice now and tried different dishes each time. The chicken biryani and the shahi paneer were my favorites. And the lunch thali is a great value. 

Only suggestion for them: put a small sign with the cost of the chai above the self-serve And ps - the chai is so yummy, definitely the real deal and not something you would get in a chain coffeeshop.
Loved the food, right amount of spice, Naan were super soft. loved the butter Naan.Very good vegetarian option as well.

Although the Tandoor Hut is located inside the strip mall that time forgot, it's pretty awesome. Just be prepared:

- It's kind of crusty on the inside, and it's cafeteria-style, sneeze guards and all
- If you're an Indian food novice, it's a little intimidating

But it's so good. The staff was really helpful when we were trying to decide on what to order. You can get free samples to taste stuff! And the best part is, they totally trusted us enough to pay for dinner after we ate. It gave me warm fuzzies.

The highlights of the meal for me were the naan and the chili chicken. The naan came on a huge plate all warm, buttery, and awesome. The chili chicken was chunks of chicken fried with some peppers and then totally covered in red pepper flakes. So hot, so good, but not for the faint of stomach. 

This b has an iron stomach, so I am in love.

I've always been iffy about places that serve cafeteria style (who knows how long that food's been there!) but I've heard great things about the authenticity of the food here. The first impression was pretty sad-- random strip mall, no decor, sneeze guards, etc. The staff was very friendly though and let me sample a few things while I figured out what I wanted to order.

I got the butter chicken (tikka masala), veggie samosa, and an order of naan. I was a little surprised at the small portion size given the price, but the portion of naan was pretty big so I guess that's fair. They did have a dine-in lunch special, which gives you five (small portions) different entrees for $8. Honestly, I would love to have gotten that but I really didn't feel like trying all those dishes alone in that kind of atmosphere. The samosa was good; I might start stopping by here to get them for my afternoon snacks. The naan isn't as fluffy as I usually like, but the only real problem I had with it is that my stomach is too small to fit all of its buttery goodness. Sad.

Nothing about Tandoor Hut was mindblowing, but if you're looking for a quick fix for an Indian food craving, it'll do just fine.

I've driven past this place many times and decided to stop in last week.  It must have been between the lunch and dinner rush, because there were no other customers around and some of the workers looked like they were chilling out watching some Indian TV program.  (Sorry to ruin your break, fellas!)  

Now, if you can get over the fact that they have fly paper that needs to be changed hanging precariously over the serving area, then do give the food a try.  The folks behind the counter were very helpful in helping me choose what to get.  I had a two curry combo, butter chicken and an eggplant curry (along with rice and naan).  Both curries were awesome.  The mango lassi I had with the combo was a bit lackluster, but hit the spot on a hot summer day.  The butter chicken was so good I had a double order to go.  

I'd probably hang out here more often if the place had WiFi, but I'll definitely return for more.

Let me just say that I LOVE this place. It's pretty much the only place I'll get take-out for Indian food. It can be a little confusing if you're not familiar with the names of dishes, but just ask and they'll tell you what's in it and offer a sample! The service can be a bit slow, but usually when I go in to grab dinner there is NO wait, and they make the naan to order. I have not had a bad experience here.
Incredible food. Owner is awesome. They let you sample prior to ordering. Great service!! I'm already making plans to go back!!
Not my kind of place- very mediocre Vegetarian Indian food. I am not going back.

This place is bad. And I mean bad. I got the chicken roll which had a few pieces of chicken and was super soggy. Tasted awful. The chicken had am uncooked after taste and it was filled with veggies. Now I d OK nt mind my veggies but when I pay $8 for something with the word chicken in it, I am not happy to get veggies. Over all the place is alright at best. Not professional at all which I suppose is a peeve but they spoke a different language the whole time. Wore no gloves and although the man who helped me was kind, I did not like the food and definitely did not get money's worth. Also I went to use the restroom amd it was DISGUSTING! !!! Someone once told me to judge a place by is bathroom,  and tp this day,  I have found it to be true time and time again. I would not recommend this place

By far the best Indian restaurant around town. Had goat curry and lamb keema which are pretty good. I always order to go since the sitting looks ordinary. Turn around time is also quick and prices are on higher side. But its well earned with the kind of crap others in the area are dishing out.

Overall the food here is good. Definetly one of the best tandoori chicken, if you wait if just come out of the owen. But I have to agree the service is very worst. The staffs at the front show too much attitude and ignore customers. This was a main complaint from many of my friends as well. I like their chicken dishes but not going here just because of the service.

Good - Tantoori chicken, chicken curry disher, veg/non-veg combo, nan, chapati
Bad - Service, briyani, vegi dishes ( quality is not consistent everytime)
Had the goat chop to go... Delicious! Too far for me but have to go back for that and try some other of the grilled stuff..

I have gone to Tandoor Hut three times, the first time the food was good (maybe I had not tasted good Indian food in a while?) but the second and third time the food was terrible....the Chutney tastes as if it is full of sink water. Also the meat and chicken seem to be of a low quality. 

Aside from the bad tasting food, the service is some of the WORST in Naperville. The people who take your order act as if you are an annoyance or bothering them. They do not seem interested in serving you. 

Awful food and awful experience. Look for other Naperville Indian food or head to the city for real good food choices.

This restaurant is good for what it is and that's fast food indian.  I would rank this as slightly below a standard Indian food buffet.  The variety was good and I love that they let you taste everything on their menu before you order.  Is it the best Indian food I've ever had?  Certainly not.  But it hit the spot and has quick service.  

Particularly, the naan wasn't that amazing (a little hard and not as fluffy as usual), but it was sufficient.  I would definitely go back to this restaurant when I want a quick fix to my Indian food cravings.  I've always thought that there aren't enough fast food Indian restaurants, so I'm glad this one is around.  I loved the butter chicken (which is usually my favorite) and they had a few other spicy chicken and vegetarian options.  I also had a samosa, which was pretty standard.

I went here on a Sunday to get a takeout lunch. The good thing about this place is that most of the menu items are on display, so i can look and pick what i want. But, most of those items are there forever i mean forever, I got biryani, some curry and roti to go and roti was the only item that was made today! All other items smelled and tasted bad!

Pros -  Large menu, cheap.
Cons - Not all items on the menu are made today.

I have never come across anyone so rude as the people at Tandoor Hut. I  called in (630-820-3600)  to enquire about the rates for take out catering for a home party. The person was absolutely rude and refused to provide any kind of  assistance/information in helping us order the right quantities. His favorite phrase seemed to be " I don't know...it depends on how much you eat". Well, I really 'don't know' how this place is still in business!

Some other resatuarnt in Naperville who knew their business got my order.

Tandoor Hut is hands down the best Indian food in the Chicagoland area.  

If you have ever been to India you know how the fresh spices flavor the food, and TH is able to recreate everything that real Indian food tastes like.  It is PERFECT PERFECT PERFECT!

YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE!

Went there once. Not a fan. Quantity is too less the prices they charge.

I've had better.
this place was delicious. the food is authentic and not Americanized, however it is very spicy; I mean really spicy, so get something to drink. Loved it and would go back again.

For what it is, this place is great. This is a soup kitchen type of restaurant where you can be in and out in 5 minutes. I often stop in to grab a meal to go without pre-order and am out in 5 minutes (would be sooner but I order naan). I had one bad experience with a teenaged dude manning the register but other than that, they're great people. Food is good for as fast as it is and it's reasonably priced. If you're looking for a 5 star dining experience, look elsewhere. If you're looking for solid, quick Indian food, this place is a gem.

We went to this place yesterday and were shocked to see the unprofessionalism of the owner/manager. They had a sign out in the front announcing that they had a Buffet which also listed the items in the buffet menu. The buffet was not accessible to the customers , you had to go to the counter and ask the server to bring out the buffet dishes , which was odd. The second thing that was extremely appalling was that 4 items in their Buffet menu were not even available. When we asked the owner , he made silly excuses and told us that customers should cooperate. The owner / manager was extremely rude. The food was average.

I would not go this place in my dreams , neither would i recommend anyone else to.

Decent place.  Only got take out.  Based on that, I was in the mood for butter chicken and tikka masala, but they didn't have butter chicken so we tried chicken korma. It was ok.  Tikka masala was really nice.  I was also looking for a specific flavor of dahl and theirs was not it.  But overall, for a local take out Indian place, I'm pretty happy with it.  Portions of course are not so great, but I think that's typical of Indian take out. We will probably order from here again.

Delicious food with a patient staff willing to explain all the dishes to Indian food newbies and even give out samples to see if we like it before ordering! The naan is delicious and fresh, and even the "diet" portion is more than enough to feed a hungry person!

I'm humbled. And very thrilled!

I've had Indian food in several states in the US and have never before  been sufficiently satisfied by any restaurant experience. Also, I'm a hard-to-please Indian-food snob so I religiously looked for areas for 'constructive criticism' but was completely won over by Tandor Hut! I agree with the previous reviews - it can't get any better than this !

The owner and the chefs are cheerful, friendly and passionate people. They let me take my time in deciding which item to taste (test) and even asked for preferences to help me choose better. I started with the chicken roast, moved to tandoori chicken and then chicken biryani. All three items were simply, heavenly delicious. I especially recommend the succulent tandoori chicken - for the first time in this country, the meat beneath the glossy-red exterior was full of juicy flavor. 

I went back the next day and with great difficulty stayed away from the chicken dishes, to try out fresh-off-the-tandoor naans ( it was such a pleasure to be able to see someone make your food with such care, and not to forget - hygeine) dosas, pani puri and samosa chaat. They actually encourage you to customize your  chaat ingredients and have an open grill to make you your samosa chaat/aloo chaat right there - fresh and hot !! 

I have to make a special mention of the Mango Lassi - In all my many experiments with cooking, I thought I perfected this easy drink, but Tandoor Hut put me to shame. The rich ORANGE(not the cheap yellow fare we usually find in desi restaurants) concoction seemed like the perfect accompaniment with practically every dish there. I painfully put my pride aside and asked the owner what they did, to make it so special and he was so kind to share the secret with me. No, I'm not as large-hearted to share it on the internet - go ask him yourself!

Bottomline - Naperville/ Chicago folks, listen up! You have a precious thing here, make the most of it. 

Recommendations : Chicken Biryani, Tandoori chicken, chicken roast, mysore masala dosa, tandoori roti, naan, chaat ( I had pani puri and samosa chaat) and mango lassi
Went here while visiting my fiances mom over Christmas - my fiance had actually gone the day before with his brother.  We both really enjoyed this place especially the HUGE naans that they served!

We've been searching out and sampling the Indian fare since we arrived in the area a few weeks ago. We've tried everything from the take-out sweet shops to the full service "fine" dining. I was really hesitant to make the 15 minute trip here, as it is primarily take out. I am sure glad we did. The place comes across as a fast food place, and that's pretty much what it is. But that's ok, because the food - wow. It beats most or all of the places we had already tried - including the most expensive of the full sit-down establishments.

Many times, I come away from desiraunts wondering if maybe they all get their food shipped in from one central commissary, and just heat it up.  There just seems to be no variation in the selections or the taste.  Not so here.  The curries that we tried (four of them on this visit) were all very individual, with truly unique and vibrant flavors.  Others have mentioned the naan, and I'll put in a word for that, too.  Everywhere else, you fork over $2 for a small and quite so-so portion.  Here, it is included with the meal!  And what's more, it's probably the best you've had anywhere.  Yeah, it's just bread.  But, it's the attention to the little seemingly insignificant things that helps define what a place is all about.  

It's obvious that the owner has a business plan for success, and he's certainly following it.  In fact, take a look at the sign on the front window.  It spells it out in black and white.  And on our visit, it was being followed to the T.  

The place was really clean, too.  Both the kitchen and dining area.  The seating fast food style, but my rating is based solely on the food.

Highly recommended if you're looking for excellent Indian cuisine, and don't need the comfy booth and waiters.

For everything that the Tandoor Hut is, I give it a solid 3 stars.  It's tasty Indian fast food. 

There are some tasty curries, some amazing spicy samosas, excellent chapati bread, and nicely done biryani rice. 

The food is pretty tasty, and although most is sitting in warmers already prepared the flavors are pure authentic Indian.  I am a bit of an Indian food fouchebag (snob). 

I want to give them a 4 star on food, but since the review is based on the restaurant overall, I've settled on 3 stars. :( 

The service is a little bit lacking, there was alot of horsing around between the kitchen staff and the front of the house and it slowed things down while things were pretty busy.  I've yet to eat in, but I will be back to try some different menu items and hopefully do an updated review! 

TASTY FOOD, look past any service flaws, if you're just looking for a quick tasty Indian meal.

We love this place ! When they 1st opened the food was ok and I hated the paav bhaaji . A yr down the road the food there is very tasty. The manger /owner has always been very kind and polite. Once we felt that chole was very little for 2 people, he apologized and next time he gave us very good amount .
Majority of Indian places increase prices and shortchange you in quantity of food. This is the 1st place we feel that the food quantity is very good . The place is clean, restroom for a change is always clean too which is a shock for an Indian place.

We recently tried their aloo ka parantha and loved it . Their mango lassi, plain lassi, bhelpuri,dahipuri,thali,chole batoore and paav bhaji is what we have eaten and have really enjoyed all of the food items. We are not fans of their samosas (tasteless)  , those we only buy from Krishna on 111th.

Decor is boring and nothing great. Prices are reasonable.

Bad food. 

The food has excess chilli in every dish. So completely unfit for kids. First time around the taste was ok - nothing special. Usual oil in everything and a lot of chillli. 

Today the food was simply uncooked and my order was wrong. The curry was completely uncooked and the pakodas were raw. I got naan instead of roti.

The place was empty at lunch time - that should have been my clue. 

Would not recommend it to anyone.
Solid and consistent. love the bread and combo dishes.

Excellent food!  Polite service. I had a 2 entre combo and had enough left over to take home.  This place is cafeteria style so atmosphere isn't great.  But, they will let you taste anything before you order.  That's really cool. especially if you are new to Indian food.
Yep... its really good! ... If you are looking for Indian food that hits the spot then you are at the right place.

I stopped by here on my way out of town back to St. Louis.  What a place!  Clean, diner-esque atmosphere, with brushed aluminum counters and everything is right there for you to see.  The owner was super helpful on choosing items.  I ended up getting the vegetarian combo, a couple of Samosas and the Onion something-or-others (little round bready balls of something) that were excellent.  I've had Indian several times, and I"ve always liked it, but this, ...this was out of this world!  The Nan, fresh out of the tandoor oven (I walked around the side and peered into the back and watched a younger man cooking it in the oven) was amazing, just enough chewyness and the flavor, wow!    I actually didn't start eating this stuff until I was on the road, and when I did start I was amazed.  I pulled over down the road, and turned around and went back and got another order of everything for my girlfriend and her daughter.  It made the trip and they had it that evening and THEY loved it!  I've been back once and was still impressed.  I wish he'd open one here in St. Louis.  The flavors are indescribable, but just fantastic.  Cheers!

Also, look at my other reviews notice that I don't always give good ratings to restaurants, but this one deserves it.  Inexpensive, flavorful, unique, and the owner is passionate.

Delightful!
We were a party of 4.
Started with the local brewery draft and one member had a Riesling that she really enjoyed( 2 choices available, rare to have more than one )
The cheese curds were very good with a 
Nice complimentary sauce.
Here's our choices:
Pulled pork sliders with fries
French onion grilled cheese with gruyere
Smash potato burger with fries
Toasted apple chicken Brie sandwich
All agreed they made the right choices and would all return.
The staff is very young but so incredibly polite and genuine. They worked as a team and we felt so comfortable. The owner (manager) came by to see how everything was. It was an easy conversation since we were all so pleased.
The dining room is small but so beautiful 
with tall tin ceilings and old time lighting.
Boy I wish those old walls could talk.
As we left we received several thank yous from the staff. Again genuine.
Delightful!

Only word of caution:
Not wheel chair accessible. Very tall old time steps.

Located on a corner in downtown Lombard, Babcock's is a genius endeavor.  The interior of the restaurant is like a hybrid of a 1930s farmhouse kitchen and a diner.  The menu is soda fountain meets gastropub.

This restaurant is small, so be prepared for a wait on Friday nights.  I waited about 20 minutes for a party of 2.  There isn't much standing room to wait, so I felt like I was hovering over other diners.  When I walked in, I didn't know where to go, and I certainly didn't appreciate the one employee look at me at least five times without saying something.  If someone walks in with a blank look on their face, especially into a brand new establishment, say something!  I finally noticed that there is a counter with a register and walked over where someone helped me.

Their beers are mostly local, including options from Noon Whistle which is only a stone's throw from Babcock's.  I had the "Fuel Cafe," a coffee stout from Lakefront, a brewery still local to the midwest. 

The food is mostly burgers and sandwiches, but that didn't make it any easier to choose.  I had the French Onion Grilled Cheese with fries.  Honestly, the sandwich didn't "wow" me.  The cheese wasn't melted all the way and the onions were clumped in the middle of the sandwich.  The fries were really good though.  My friend had the smashed potato burger which looked really good.  We also shared the cheese curds which were lightly battered and done really well.  The spicy mustard dipping sauce was an interesting twist too.

So I didn't love Babcock's, but I really did like it enough to consider going back to try the chicken apple brie sandwich, macaroni and cheese, or something else.  The location is a nice halfway point between myself and many friends, so I can see myself going back to try again.

This place is exactly what I've been looking for. We were greeted right away with a big smile. We were there for a late lunch. We ordered at the counter and took a seat. They brought our drinks and food out to us. The menu is wonderful, varied, and casual made with good ingredients. 

We shared a Sweet Potato burger and the smashed potato burger. The sweet potato burger was my favorite... just wish it had a tiny bit more avocado. The fries were awesome! Crispy and perfectly salted. Beer and wine list had a nice variety too. 

We went on a nice fall day and chose to sit outside. The chairs are very comfortable for outdoor furniture. However the inside looks comfortable as well. If you haven't tried this spot, don't put it off any longer... just go.

This place is so cute! I was totally nerding out over the rustic and classy decor. So much so that I took a panoramic video of the place, because I wish my house looked exactly like this.

I met Kate S for lunch and had a great experience here. Located in downtown Lombard on a busy corner, Babcock's has outdoor seating and inside seating. During the day you order up at the counter and they'll bring out your food; at night it's a full service restaurant. 

Their fall lunch menu offers a lot of great options. I decided to go with the french onion grilled cheese with a side of organic mixed greens. This sandwich cost $8.50 and had swiss cheese, gruyere, caramelized onions, and parsley. It was so delicious and tasted exactly like French onion soup! Perfect for a cool fall day. The other option for a side is their Belgium style fries, but I definitely suggest the greens with this sandwich. It's a nice light balance to a very cheesy lunch.

I will definitely be coming back to Babcock's Grove House and can't wait to try out their dinner menu. They also offer beer on tap and in bottles and wine too. Sounds like a relaxing evening to me!

Let me start off my saying I'm sadly unfamiliar with the city of Lombard and all the businesses within it but if it's anything like Babcock's Grove House then Lombard will definitely be seeing a lot more of me. What an adorable restaurant. I fell in love with this establishment even before I had visited for the first time. Viewing the photos and reading the reviews here on Yelp was enough for me to decide that there was a very likely chance of me loving this place - I was right!

Like several other Yelpers and visitors of Babcock's have mentioned, this place is damn cute. The decor is a sort of woodsy chic and I'm obsessed. Before I had ordered my lunch with Jacqueline B. I looked around the space as if I was a kid in a candy shop. The Babcock employees were very friendly and pretty attentive from my experience.

Now enough about the cute space, the food was good too! I had ordered a chicken, apple and brie sandwich with a side of fries. It was pretty satisfying and very nicely plated! Because it had been just a casual lunch (and they didn't have their dinner menus out yet) I didn't dive into their drink menu or anything of that nature. They had a pretty good selection to choose from for just lunchtime though.

One thing that was different for me was the fact that you order/pay at the front counter before you get your meal. I learned later on by an employee that they have a regular "dinner" style menu and serving. I think that means a waiter/waitress takes your order at your table and you pay after you're done eating like most restaurants? I'm not sure. It didn't bother me either way.

I would absolutely love to bring the boyfriend here to grab dinner and drinks in the future. I can see this place being nice for a date night! It's small, cozy and the price range is not bad at all.

Locally sourced fresh food with a 1920's/turn of the century vibe.  Steampunk diner?  Farm fresh speakeasy? While they do have a few outdoor tables, I think the decor inside is much more interesting. And I am not one to turn down al fresco dining!  So,  arrive early and dine in!  Plenty of stools at the bar too! 

As for the food,  I had the sweet potato burger and already went back for another!  Thank you from all of us vegetarians for having some serious non meat options!  We also had the carrot soup with side salad which is super light, but also somehow hearty.  Carrot soup sounds like a winter food but it's actually perfect for summer too.  The turkey burger and chicken schnitzel are also solid choices.  

Our little guy had the mac and cheese.  He was pretty happy about it.  Nice and creamy.  I will caution you to arrive at senior citizen/toddler dinner time (5pm)  if you want to snag a high chair.

Now,  let's talk about the drinks.  Craft sodas like birthday cake flavor (perfect for cream soda lovers),  lemonade and the craft beers!  We had some kind of delicious double IPA on draft.  They also have a special local Lilicia beer named for Lombards beloved lilacs.  It's on the light side. 

And lastly, a note to the genius designer that created and hung the lighting. We love those single bulbs that are hung like octopus arms in the middle of the ceiling.  The cage lights are fantastic too. 

Room to Improve :
1) add a side of fruit or veggies to the kids meals
2) add a high chair or two to the fleet
3) where is the dessert menu?! Dessert please!

Lombard gem!  I came here with my family tonight and was thoroughly impressed.  It's a relatively small restaurant and a bit loud when crowded, but the decor is cute, the service is kind, and the food is amazing!  

Our waitress was efficient and friendly, and the manager stopped by our table several times to check in and chat.  The food was truly excellent.  We split the Bell's IPA Battered Wisconsin Cheese Curds, and then I couldn't make a decision, so I ordered both the Roasted Butternut Squash Hummus and Mrs. Peck's Savory Skillet Mac N Cheese.  My family members also really enjoyed the food they had, and my Autumn Cider Palmer to drink was tasty as well.

I am looking forward to returning!

I drive past this place nearly everyday. Every time I drive by the restaurant is busy with people, dining inside and outside. I had read reviews and I was excited to check them out. 
Last night on my way home from work I decided to stop there for a very late dinner and a glass of wine. I walked in a little past 8 pm and there were a few people sitting at the bar and a few tables were occupied. That late there was no wait. 
I got seated and was given a menu. I was dining alone, something I enjoy quite a bit, and my server must have found that strange since he asked me if I ordering to go. 
I ordered a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and he brought it over right away alone with some water. 
I looked over the menu and everything sounded amazing. I ended up going with the turkey shallot burger that comes on a wheat bun I believe it was. I refused the fries and went with the mixed greens salad that came with a fantastic vinaigrette type dressing. 
My burger was unlike any other burger. It was not greasy at all, it was full of flavor, cooked perfectly and simply delicious. I don't even know how to explain it other than perfect deliciousness. I pretty much devoured my meal. 
The server checked on me a few times, there was also a gentleman with glasses that was walking around and he came over to ask me how everything tasted. He caught me mid bite so all I could go is give him a thumbs up. 
The food was good, the restaurant is trendy and inviting. 
It's been a while since I  enjoyed a simple meal as much as I enjoyed my late dinner here. 
I enjoyed my glass of wine and my meal after a stressful day at the job. 
I can't wait to go back and enjoy more deliciousness.
Great staff! Great food! We happened to speak to the owner not nowing it was him and he was super nice. Love the veggie sandwhich the many options of craft beers. Would deff recommend!!!

Babcock's Grove House is a gem!

I believe it opened about two weeks ago. My fiancÃ© and I were looking for new places to eat in Lombard, and we were ecstatic that this new restaurant is a 5-minute walk from our house. We've only frequented Babcock's once so far. However, after one visit, we are certain to become regulars. Babcock's has a warm, inviting atmosphere and is located in the heart of Lombard by the Metra station. 

The staff is friendly, courteous, and prompt. I can tell they actually enjoy working for this new restaurant. One of the owners came over to our table and talked to us for quite a while. It felt like home - she seemed to know everyone in the restaurant, and she seemed to know every family and business in the area! 

They had a vast selection of sodas and beers, and their food menu had some unique and delicious offerings. I had the Smashed Potato Burger. It was a 1/3lb burger with cheddar cheese and mashed potatoes on the burger. This burger was fresh, filling, and satisfying! The taste of mashed potatoes, cheese, and the burger together was a mixture I hadn't considered before. 

I asked one of the owners about a breakfast/brunch menu, because Babcock's would be an absolutely perfect Sunday Funday brunch location! She said they had plans to roll one out, and they are still ramping up their employees since they are so new. I am very excited to try that new menu when it comes out!

Overall, Babcock's is a fantastic new restaurant and it will surely become a Lombard staple before too long!

I just want to start off by saying how refreshing it is having somewhere like this close to home! There are so many options for all kinds of people. Vegan, vegetarian and omni. 
I had the sweet potato burger. The avocado was a perfect amount. The garlic sauce was good. My mom had a beef burger and loved it. You get to pick a side salad or fries. The fries are a bigger portion but the home made balsamic dressing was really delicious with the salad. 
The only thing different was that you order inside and they bring your food to your table, kind of like noodles and company does.
Overall everything was really fresh. I will definitely be back for the soups and the caramelized onion grilled cheese! Oh and beer of course :)

Babcock's has already became a popular restaurant in the area. I went on a Tuesday night and there was a wait. To me that meant dinner was going to be good if they were that busy on a Tuesday and they did not disappoint. I tried the cheese curds, buffalo chicken salad and I had a couple bites of my boyfriend's smashed potato burger. Everything was great and tasted homemade. We sat at the bar and the service was great as well. I really enjoyed our bartender, she was super nice and helpful. They also have a good beer and wine list.

Beautiful well decorated atmosphere. The history of Lombard is shown well throughout.  Staff is very friendly and service is spectacular.  Servers were very helpful and quick.  The owners are awesome.... even checked up on the table and made sure we had everything.  As soon as we finished,  they collected our dishes. 

Food is phenomenal. I had the smashed potato burger with fries. I never finish a full burger but finished the whole thing.  It was so fresh.  Perfect amount of flavor.  So delicious.  I will definitely be back! !

Love love this spot. They have a great selection of healthy choices and well done home cooking. Their menu seems to change seasonally. Also, one of the few places in the area with outdoor dining space, which is ideal in the warmer months. Most importantly, amazing, attentive staff!

I'm seriously bummed out that i have so far only been here once.

Such a great atmosphere for a local restaurant, friendly staff, and LOCALLY OWNED...gotta support those small businesses, folks!

Met friends for a few beers and food.  Had a Chicken and Brie sandwich, was so very tasty.  The beer selection is also great, again, they are using local suppliers whenever they can, so it makes you feel good about stopping in. 

Looking forward to having the free time to make it back in :)

Based on 1 take out salad, are my thoughts ...   The staff are nice.  The place is lovely and authentic vintage. Seems like they take great pride in what they do.  I appreciate a non-styro take out container (well done).   

No issues except that ...

I wish desperately that they had at least 1 or 2 real comfort food dinner options on the menu.  Example: stuffed peppers,  or beef stew, pork chops, roasted potatoes, baked potatoes, mashed potatoes, sweet potatoes, roasted veggies, salisbury steak, stuffed cabbage rolls. 

I am just not a burger person, and can only eat so many salads.  With Shannon's Deli right across the street, I feel they have more options for me.  There is so little in the way of food in downtown Lombard, and some affordable comfort food would be very welcome.
The Buffalo chicken sandwich is amazing! So glad we have this new place downtown Lombard

Love everything about this place:  location, history, decor and vibe.  Food was quality and beer selection interesting due to local emphasis.  Pretzel appetizer was delicious.  Didn't have room for desert but would love to try next time.  Will definitely come here again!!!

Love, love, love this place! I've been here many times in the past month or so since their opening. What luck to have such a gem come to downtown Lombard!  It has a friendly, welcoming atmosphere with a mix of modern and historical decor (it's located in the old Babcock's Grove House hotel).

Everything I've tried has been delicious - no joke.  They offer a seasonal food menu with "mostly local" beers. Their salads are nice and fresh, the burgers are nice and juicy, and their beer and wine selection is great. For first-timers, I'd recommend the pretzel and beer cheese appetizer, the green goddess salad, the turkey shallot burger, or the stout pulled pork sliders with chipotle cheese.

They recently added outdoor seating, so you know where to find me for the remainder of the summer ;)

So glad to have this place in downtown Lombard. Given the crowd I saw and the great food we had, I am pretty sure they'll succeed. 

We arrived at 5:40 or so on a Friday, and 45 minutes later the place was full with people waiting. We were seated immediately, back in a corner. I know a historic building has its challenges, but I will say the acoustics back there were a little rough, voices echoed back toward our table. The tables are also quite close together. But who can blame them wanting to fit as many people as possible in?

The menu is not big but this is a good thing. Everything sounds very good. We started with cheese curds. They are clearly homemade and all different shapes. And delicious! The dipping sauce was tasty too.

My husband ordered the beer cheese burger and a fancy grape soda; I had the chicken schnitzel sandwich and a peach tea palmer (with lemonade). My husband said his burger was perfect, and devoured it before I got a taste. My sandwich was also very delicious, and the fries were quite good as well.

Service was a little tentative at times (I think the young woman serving us is new, but she was friendly and competent) but overall good. It's a new restaurant so no harm there.

Overall the food was excellent and the place is charming, and I'm looking forward to returning soon.
Came here with my dad and brother- we had a great time! Wonderful food and tasty beer. They even put up with our bad jokes. The fries were amazing and the decor was super inviting.

This is my favorite restaurant in Lombard for a casual dinner Great burgers and salads, as well as appetizers.  The staff are all young and energetic, eager to please and really seem to care about the patrons and their dining experience. Hats off to the owners for a great local experience.
