New local restaurant,   excellent  food and good local beers on tap good and fresh. Been here a couple time and between the food and the beers planning on working my way through the menu!!! Great prices  for excellent food.  Not a place to watch tv since there are none. For date night and family dinner. You wont find any thing better.
NICE JOB BABCOCKS!!!  CHEERS

Fantastic new restaurant and bar in downtown Lombard! They did a great job combining the historic building and the desires of modern diners. Impressive wine list for a restaurant of this size. Kids loved the eclectic selection of sodas. Most items come from local producers. Hand made hamburgers were great. 
Good riddance Cafe 101! DFL rules :)

Lynn was our server and she was absolutely phenomenal! Very bubbly, great at explaining the menu details. 

The Apple Chicken Brie sandwich was to die for!

I highly recommend the cheese curds and of course, Lynn!

We had a nice lunch with friend at Babcock's Grove House.  The bacon and beer cheese burger was excellent, as were the other sandwiches.  Fries were very tasty.  Surprisingly, the coffee was very good also.  Service was friendly and helpful.  Babcock's Grove is not an overly comfortable restaurant but is perfect for a quicker, tasty meal in a pleasant setting.

Gorgeous building, decent menu, worth a visit. Ate there with three people...had the pretzel and beer cheese app, pretzel was huge...cheese was solid with a little horseradish kick.

As far as entrees, had a smash potato burger which was reportedly very good and then split both the chicken, apple brie sandwich and the chicken schnitzel sandwich with someone. Both were good but extremely bland and grandparent-ly safe in flavor. Definitely could use some kind of contrasting flavor...both of them were satisfying but forgetful.

Main problem was, even though it was admittedly a warm day...it was stuffier than hell in there...could use some more air moving around. There's a back corner that's like a sauna. 

Also, no fault of the restaurant, but there were also a couple of blow hards that apparently had mistaken it for the corner bar. Older locals monopolizing a table and the poor server over several beers and loudly regaling her with tales of Lombard past and how many beers they drank and tracked in their phone app over the years. Literally seizing her for 5 minute stretches while they explained how they were drinking "x" beer before it was even available in stores like anyone cared. Don't be that person.

Awesome fresh food and local microbrews (Noon Whistle, Church Street, Two Brothers).  If you don't like local brews, they also have Schlitz in a bottle!  Have passed by  Babcock's since they opened a month ago and have wanted to give them a try.  Stopped in tonight and had a Ferdinand's salad and a Founders porter.   Everything was top notch from the food to the service.  Decor and ambience is great for everyone from couples out on a date to families looking for a reasonably priced meal.  This is now one of my go to local restaurants.

My husband and I went during the summer. Amazing French fries!!!!!! I had the burger with bacon and beer cheese. It was delicious! My husband had the burger with mashed potatoes on it. He expected it to be a little better since there were great reviews on it, but it wasn't bad. We would gladly go back to try more! Though if you're a vegetarian, there aren't a lot of options. They have a sweet potato bean burger for vegetarians, and a rabbit plate (raw veggies w/ humus) and maybe a salad or two I think.  How about adding grilled veggies to the menu, or even a grilled veggie sandwich

I've been to Babcock's Grove a handful of times now since it opened. My fiance and I are committed to becoming regulars. We're obsessed and want to try everything on the menu. I've been here with him, my parents, and even my grandmother.  Getting my grandmother in was somewhat of a challenge because it's not handicap accessible (however, the owner says they're working on that).  Some other patrons were nice and helped me get her up the steps so it worked out just fine! 

Some food highlights: the Sweet Potato Burger and the Turkey Shallot Burger.  I'm shedding for the wedding, so it's nice that they have some healthy options. The mixed organic greens they have as a side option are also very good. Through other people I've tried almost every other dish on the menu, and noting disappointed me! 

Downtown Lombard needed something like this.... we recently moved from the Lakeview neighborhood of Chicago (land of amazing restaurants on every corner) and this is so cute and hip that I almost think I'm back in the city and not in Lombard. I grew up in Lombard, and am pleasantly surprised with new restaurants and bars popping up. Babcock's Grove embraces its downtown Lombard location and the decorations center around the history of Lombard. 

The owners hit one of the park with this one. Definitely try it if you haven't yet!

What a charming place, from the wait-staff to the decor. The menu is has something for everyone - even for a vegan. Ingredients are fresh and local. 
We started out with delicious craft beef and glass of Cabernet and the roasted beet humus. The burgers are handcrafted from Allen Brothers ground chuck perfectly done. The fries are hand cut and of a large portion. 
Looking forward to going back. Extensive wine and craft beef offering. 
Too bad we did not have room for their signature ice cream floats with there fountain crafted cane sodas. Next time for sure!
Got the cheese curds, chicken schnitzel sandwhich, and smashed potato burger. Yummy well priced food and the service is wonderful! Definitely recommended.

Such a classy yet family friendly place to eat. Customer service comes first only to the excellent locally sourced food which is always fresh and full of flavor. We've worked our way through everything on the menu and love it all...however I am particularly partial to the pork sliders.  The team always makes you feel like family, remembering your name and updating you on specials and menu items. What a Lombard gem. Bring your friends for a great meal, or sit at the bar for a beer and cheese curds. Either way you'll love it all.

New place and glad to have it in Lombard.  They're still learning to improve their service.  (Weird to ask you to pay beforehand).  But, their niceness makes up for a few inconsistencies.  Food is stellar with fresh and local ingredients.  I'd recommend their cheese curds, pretzel, burger, and buffalo chicken sandwich.

Went to Babcocks for the first time tonight based on a strong recommendation. Everything other reviewers commented on
was generally how I reacted so won't rehash what everyone said.

Nevertheless, I do have one comment that might matter to some people. I had their classic burger and it was good, no real complaints. Except the burger was slathered with mustard. I've never had a burger at a restaurant that had mustard on it. It may be a personal thing but I hate mustard on a burger. Possibly my fault if that ingredient was mentioned on the menu - I didn't check.

Best burgers in the area!
All organic! Cool Lombard historical building- liqueur license- we will return!
Phil recommends this  place!
Best food!!!!

While nothing holds a candle to Chicago, there are huge nuisances such as parking and tiny annoyances such as crowding. So, when wanting a slight break from the gritty city, but rather not come face to face with an obtrusive strip mall, Babcock's Grove House is brand spanking new to downtown Lombard and their induction to town is FABULOUS! The talented owners took the old Cafe 101 and brought it up to the standards of super cozy cafe with charm out the wazoo! It probably doesn't hurt that the lilac village has been hungry for someone just like the new owners to dust off the pre-civil war limestone and polish the wood. Every inch is charming and it's so nice to have several months to bask outside, European cafe style, in the middle of the Lilac Village. Lots of seating outside, decent amount of seating inside. This locale is just so darling it deserves a big hug! 

Like European cafes, there's a huge wine list and a lot of local beers available. We weren't in the mood for alcohol, but I will definitely try one of their wines the next time I'm in (which will be very, very soon). 

Food - after all, that's the main reason to come here, and Babcock's has very yummy organic, locally sourced, healthy yet delicious comfort foods. To begin with, on a warm Spring weekday, the best drink is unsweetened iced tea which they have down to a science, for a measly $2.25. One can drown themselves in a sea of refreshing, pure tea, and it'll still cost less than $.10 per ounce. Don't need to go back to Brussels, folks, if that's all you're going for are the fries. Babcock's Belgian fries are to die for and then to return for another order, or 2 or 3. The beer battered cheese curds - my oh my oh my. Wisconsin, step right up in Lombard 'cuz there's a new contest and Babcock's might win. These addicting little critters are wonderful and from the ooh's and ah's from other tables, I think they agree. Amazing, in that everything appears to be under $10, and that includes all the entrees. Portions are more than ample, plated beautifully and there's more than enough on everyone's plate to share.  

The chicken Caesar Salad was delightful and delicious, with a mixture of the tastiest romaine (not bitter); kale (yay!), croutons & lime Caesar to add a scrumptious fresh flavor that's also sneaking in those healthy nutrients. This isn't a typical Caesar salad, yet it hits normal where needed while adding something different that forces me to want to order it again and again. I had a taste of the Smokey Sweet potato burger that is just wonderful, especially for a veggie burger. With bean puree, roasted garlic yogurt, avocado on a sprouted wheat bun that brings all the deliciousness together - that was one amazing "burger." Good for Lombard, since this new gem is gonna make Lombard proud. In fact, I think they already have!

This is the best place to eat in downtown Lombard. For starters, they always have great local beer on tap. The owners operate the restaurant (hostess and chef). Menu is smaller but well put together. Schnitzl sandwich is my favorite!

We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner there. The decor is perfect, the atmosphere is fabulous and the food is amazing. The turkey burger is to die for!!  We are so happy to have this little gem in downtown Lombard.  Great work Babcocks!  We will be visiting regularly!

Love, love, love this place - such an asset to the growing Lombard downtown.  We have both dined in and gotten food to go and it was all fantastic.  The cheese curds are melt in your mouth delicious and I've never had a burger I've loved as much as their smashed potato burger!  I really want to branch out and try another burger option but it's so hard when I know how great that burger is.  Keep up the great work!!!

We stopped by last night for a quick bit. Service was good, food came quick and prices were reasonable. The smashed potato burgers were a big hit with the other people at my table. The fries were very tasty, but they need to have a bottle or two of malt vinegar behind the bar. 

We sat outside due to the crowd inside, but from what I could tell the decor is very pleasant. I look forward to seeing how they change up the menu as the seasons change.

I love this place!! Tonight was our first time at Babcock's Grove and we will definitely be back!  The atmosphere was warm and inviting, the service was top notch, and I had the best burger I have ever had in my life- no joke!! My husband shares my opinion on the burgers.  The fries were awesome too and my kids thoroughly enjoyed their banana split sandwiches and fresh lemonade.  On top of all of this, they have a great selection of beers on tap.  I can't wait to go back!!

Great place! The hardest part was trying to decide from the menu; everything sounded so good! I love the decor and history that are on the walls through out the restaurant. The Green Goddess salad was awesome! I loved the dressing!  The Belgium fries, and sauces that came with them, were excellent!  We will be back!

So glad Lombard finally has a great sit down restaurant. Super fast service and friendly staff. The owner is a sweetheart and talks to customers and asks, "how's everything/"how's it going?" Always my families number one place for a quick meal. Sweet potato burger with a salad is the best option for any vegetarian!

Liked the ambiance. 
good to see some serious vegetarian options - i tried the 

sweet potatoes burger- not bad but i think id like some more flavor to it- maybe some extra dressing . 

the butternut squash humus is really good. 
Carrot soup- Delicious. Loved the roasted pecans on it. 

would love to go back there and try their salads. 

good service.

Update- now in business a few months. Still great menu, still great service, and now I am addicted to their french fries. Judging from our frequenting this place, we are in good company because we have run into the same people over and over. The owners seem to know everyone in town and even the mayor was there!  The buzz of this new place seems to have hit the rest of the block because all the businesses seem to be crowded wall to wall with customers.

Food is delicious and reasonably priced, though don't expect huge portions with enough for leftovers to be taken home. I had the grilled cheese with tomato sandwich which wasn't anything spectacular or fancy - just cheddar on sourdough, though it was grilled to perfection. I'd like to see Babcock's "kick it up a notch" by using two different types of cheeses, such as provolone with the cheddar. The side of greens was plentiful, but again, no imagination. Just a small pile of green and purple greens (same variety). It'd be nice to have at least a little bit of cucumber and tomato. The balsamic dressing on the side was very good; nice and tangy. My husband had the evening special: chicken salad on whole wheat. The waiter told us this was the first time having chicken salad on the menu and came back later to ask my husband how he liked it. Hubby gave it a thumbs up. I had tasted a bite too, and it was good. Not saturated with mayo and had a little bit of tarragon. My son had the basic burger and we were impressed to see it was free-formed, not machine-pressed and "perfect". He said it wasn't greasy at all and had great flavor. I tasted his fries and they were amazing - some of the freshest fries I've ever had.

Our waiter was a young man (looking around, I noticed all the waitstaff was very young) who was very courteous and friendly, checked on us just the right amount of times, and refilled our drinks just as they were empty. You could tell he was inexperienced and a little awkward, but that was OK.

As for the restaurant itself...when we first walked in, we were confused as to what to do. You literally walk right into the restaurant. There is no host and no sign that says "seat yourself". There was waitstaff buzzing around, but no one greeted us or showed us to a table. So we took it upon ourselves to find a table in the back of the restaurant. By the time we left around 6:30, the place was mobbed and there were people waiting for tables. This was a Thursday night, so I can imagine it gets very crowded on weekends. The place is small with not many tables. In fact, you have to really squeeze by some of them to get to the back of the restaurant. And, in the back, some of the tables are so tightly packed that the servers were having a tough go with trying to wait on the tightly packed tables and with the customers going to and from the bathrooms, which are right by the kitchen in back of the restaurant, too. Speaking of the bathrooms - meticulously clean, which is greatly appreciated and also a good sign of a clean restaurant! I will be recommending this place to friends and family who live in the area - the positives definitely outweigh the piddly negatives. Food and waitstaff are fantastic!
Great location and it was Muscle Car Sat night; to a worn California family on vacation this was a great Spot; very reasonably priced and bright cheery service; thanks!!

This restaurant was recently rehabbed to have a feel of the original historic building. It has a nice intimate warm atmosphere. We loved the old pictures of what this historic hotel originally looked like. Excellent service and delicious local food menu! We will be back with our daughter to try the Lilac Float!!!

Finally got the chance to check this place out with the wife. The place itself looks amazing. Completely remodeled. Almost gives a vibe as if you're hanging out in a 1920's style speak easy. Lots craft brews to choose from a well as plenty of wine. First thing we ordered were the cheese curds. Hands down, the best I've ever had and that's counting what I've considered to be the "best I've had" up in Wisconsin. My wife got a salad and I got the bleu cheeseburger. Both were amazing. Super fresh and incredibly fast service from the wait staff. We both cleaned out plates. Definitely coming back here many times over.
Great new local spot. Fresh delicious ingredients, great service/staff and tasty beer selection. Caring owner who is mindful of customers and their suggestions. Worth checking it out for sure!

Came in last night on a double date. Even though it was Cruise Night and super busy, we were greeted immediately by the hostess(owner?). She was very welcoming, took our name, directed us to the bar for drinks. 

Booze: Good list of local beer. They have the BEST gluten-free beer, Lakefront New Grist...which made me immediately love this place.  Most restaurants don't stock New Grist and they really should. Wine list was perfect too!

Food: 
Excellent options. Excellent ingredients. There are far too few places in the burbs with a menu focusing on local, organic, quality ingredients. High-five. And prices were perfect. 

Service: you can tell it's a newer place. Our server didn't seem to have lots of experience. Would have like a quicker check-in with us after our food came because we realized we wanted a few more items. But this was nothing major. 

Overall, excellent. Fabulous. Want to be a regular.

We checked this place out tonight and it was really good. We started with the cheese curds, which were really good! I had the chicken apple and Brie sandwich and my husband had the chicken schnitzel. Great beer selection and solid wine list (though I'd add a rosÃ©). The food was great, the service attentive and the space beautifully remodeled. So happy to have another lovely restaurant choice in downtown Lombard. I'd go back in a heartbeat!

I can't say enough about how delicious our meal was at Babcock's Grove House!!  The cheese curds and giant pretzel were amazing, and more than enough to split between 4 people.  I had the buffalo chicken sandwich, it was pulled chicken which was a great surprise and wow, it was incredible.  You can really tell the owners took their time, tasting and picking each menu item, it was put together perfectly.  A fun location with great atmosphere, the service was excellent, I will for SURE be back!

There is a lot of buzz at this prime downtown Lombard location that has long been dark but now welcomes guests with its softly illuminated beautiful building. Babcock's Grove House offers a unique, tasty, fresh (no freezer except for the ice cream!), inspired menu with plenty of options for all.  Thus far my family has tried and highly recommend the following:
   * the turkey burger - so moist and flavorful with shallots and portobello mushrooms in the mix - the best turkey burger my husband has ever had
   * my potato loving daughter raved about the smashed potato burger
   * my other daughter can't stop talking about the Babcock's Classic burger 
   * chicken apple salad - yum
   * sweet potato burger - great vegetarian option; huge - didn't need to eat it all, but couldn't put it down!
   * the Green Goddess sandwich has such a fresh unique flavor
   * as tasty as the raved-about fries are, I opted for the organic greens served with an incredible balsamic dressing on the side (and was still able to steal a few fries from my family's plates!)
 
Drinks (all "made in the USA!"): 
   * a very comprehensive beer menu which offers something for everyone on tap or bottled
   * The wine list has a nice selection of varietals all offered by the glass or by the bottle. 
   * unsweetened peach tea is to die for!
   * craft sodas are fun for the kids and sweet-toothed adults (you have to try the Babcock's Birthday cake soda)

Lastly, the staff is plentiful and eager to attend to diner's needs.

It's so nice for Lombard to have another restaurant that not only locals can enjoy, but one that will surely be a destination for people from neighboring communities and beyond. We can't wait to watch Babcock's evolve over time as we taste our way through the menu. Bravo for a job well done!

This place is ridiculously good. I mean ridiculously good. IPA cheese curds were great. The beer cheese burger I had might be my favorite burger in the Chicago area. Beats Kuma, Labriola, DMK. Hand cut fries were awesome. My fiancÃ©es turkey shallot burger was so perfectly done. A great lighter option. Steve the owner came out and introduced himself and was a great host. So excited this is in Lombard.

Simply put, Babcock's Grove House is excellent.

They have great food and great beer on tap.
I have not had any of their craft sodas, but they sound delicious (and you can make any of their soda's into a float).
They have not been open very long and have already expanded their menu a bit.
Nice mixture of flavors for the burgers and sandwiches.

The owners are extremely nice and responsive and all of the employees are very friendly.

I definitely recommend a meal at this new downtown Lombard gem.

Frank O.
Great sit in restaurant/bar in downtown Lombard. Great burgers and cheese curds.  Service was excellent!  Can't wait to go again?
Stopped by on our way back to the city and had an amazing meal! Staff was very friendly and the food was so good! Planning on coming back on our next trip out to the suburbs.
Delicious food, cool atmosphere and great beer! The sweet potato burger and cheese curds were to die for. So glad they are in Lombard!

A great restaurant that just so happens to be in the great village of Lombard! It is a well decorated, relaxed inside with elements of Lombard History throughout and the only thing that is better than the decor is the wonderful, flavorful food and drinks! 

The smashed potato burger is seriously the best tasting burger I have had in years! The homemade  balsamic salad dressing that comes on the side salad is AMAZING. The chicken schnitzel sandwich is fantastic as well. The banana split sandwich is a fun dinner for the kids. Everything is loaded with flavor and you can tell it is made with fresh, local ingredients. The wine selection and local beers on tap are the perfect compliment to the food. There is even a wide selection of Illinois-made soda choices, which is a fun retro addition. 

Everything is reasonably priced and worth every penny. 

We are so excited that this caliber of dinning is offered in Lombard.  There is some outdoor seating and the overall quant size keeps the feeling "small town" and local. The staff is so friendly and knowledgable about the menu items, which only adds to the perfection of this little gem!  We will be eating here often. :)

This place is amazing! The food was fresh and delicious, the atmosphere was so relaxing and the staff & owners were very attentive and provided excellent suggestions. Dining amongst the historical atmosphere was just delightful -- we will certainly be making many return trips to try other menu items. Don't miss the yummy cheese curds!

Good food (at least the hamburgers that we had - didn't try anything else yet) + reasonably priced + fun & cozy atmosphere + family friendly = future repeat customers.

It is great to have a place like this to go to in downtown Lombard and we look forward to seeing what else comes on the menu once it fully opens next week.

I really like this new addition to the downtown Lombard restaurant scene. This restaurant has a great ambiance with fun historic photos of Lombard and famous Lombard residents and politicians. There is also a cute bar serving a nice variety of local craft beers. The waitstaff was plentiful and eager to help. I had the smashed potato burger with buttermilk mashed potatoes. It was cooked perfectly and those mashed potatoes were a quirky, tasty addition under the moist and buttery brioche bun. I also tried the buffalo chicken wedge salad ordered by my dining companion. It was spicy with a great twist on the traditional wedge. I really like this place, and will return again soon! I'm happy to see more great places moving into downtown Lombard.

What a great gem in Lombard! They're still working out a few kinks, being fairly new, and the servers are young and learning, so be patient. But I Love every item I've ever tried! My top favorites are the cheese curds, smashed potato and shepherds pie burgers, and the green goddess sandwich. Hoping their expanded seating gets here before the cold weather, I could eat here every day! My only major complaint is the side of mixed greens. They could REALLY use something more than just leaves. Something as simple as a tomato, cucumber, or shredded carrots would make it feel more substantial.

We came here on a whim, and we were very pleased! The interior is very chic and cool. We didn't have to wait long to sit outside, despite there not being enough outdoor tables. The hostess was attentive and lovely. Four of us came, and we had the turkey burger, mashed burger, schnitzel sandwich, and blue cheese burger. We all loved our choices; so good! Everything was fresh and seasoned to perfection. I personally had the turkey burger, and it was, by far, one of the best I've ever had. Our waiter was Nile and he was friendly, accommodating, and efficient. I do wish they had a full bar; at least some mixed drinks. Overall, awesome location, cool concept, and great food. We will be back!
Awesome new place! Service was quick, even met the owner who was walking around helping out. Food was great (try the smashed potato burger)! We will be back!
Great new spot. Friendly wait staff and prompt service. Carrot soup was particularly tasty. Definitely will return. Loved the local brew selection.
Amazing food, beer and people!! I wish I could take a pic of my food but I ate it all too quick! So good! Will definitely come back here

I love this place! Great atmosphere, amazing decor, nice craft beer selection, delicious food. I am a vegetarian and this place has so many options that are hearty and healthy. I had the green goddess sandwich and mixed greens for lunch and I highly recommend it. I'll be back to try the sweet potato burger and Belgian fries with garlic aioli soon!

Well, I think the purpose of allowing the owner to comment is to try and win back customers..Maybe some people shouldn't have the ability to write back..I just dropped the couple of stars I did have originally.

I wonder if people will agree that the comments left by the owner were a little condescending. I also feel as if my review wasn't read at all..

A. I do not work at Drytini, Sorry that you assumed that and tried to throw a little sarcastic remark as if you know who I am now.. attempt failed. 

B. I did request the dressing on the side. I said that I was trying to lose weight and my choice is to dip my fork in the dressing. That has zero relevance to anything I already said.

C. I clearly watched the person take it from me and walk toward someone else to hand it to them. Don't lie to try and come back from this. Your silence would have made much more of an impact. Word of mouth, and my mouth especially, is so much more powerful!

Such a Shame.

I've now been to babcock's 3 times.  My favorite dish so far was the chicken schnitzel sandwich. The chicken apple salad was also delicious, I would recommend both!  It is a little tight inside so I'm looking forward to the expansion.  Great addition to Lombard!
Wow is all I can say!! The food here is amazing as it the location and history of the building. Great job in adding another place we can go for lunch or dinner!!

Ridiculously good. Fantastic people.  We have gone multiple times and plan on regular visits. The cheese curds are to die for. The hamburgers unbelievable. The chicken schnitzel amazing. Cannot recommend Babcocks highly enough!!!!!!

We were a group of 6 on a Tuesday night. We had to wait just a few minutes for a table and had a wonderful meal. Half had the delicious burgers and I loved my chicken, Brie , Apple sandwich! 
They have done a great job in restoring an old building and the wait staff was very attentive. So excited to have this gem in downtown Lombard!

Love this place! My daughter and I had lunch here one day. The food was so good. The sweet potato burger was amazing. The employees are very friendly and the service was wonderful. Planning on going back soon.

Great service, especially for the opening week(end).  Staff was very friendly.  Nice looking decor and finishes.  Food was solid, amazing cheese curds! You can tell the ingredients of each part of the meal is of higher quality than your typical bar/restaurant. Glad to finally have a place like this so close to home.  Only downside would be that it is quite loud and there is limited seating.  Can't wait to return.

Went with the boys for our "Burger Night. We started with an order of Bell's IPA Battered Wisconsin Cheese Curds. Wonderfully greasy and very tasty with the Honey Mustard Aioli. The four of us each got a different burger and we found them all to be delicious. We got the Classic, Bacon Beer Cheese, Smashed Potato and Shepherd's Pie (really a Cottage Pie since there is no lamb in it). The burger menu is not as extensive as burger houses but what they have are solid. The buns were well toasted, the patties are hand formed with meat (fresh only) from Allen Brothers Meats in Chicago, nicely cooked on a very hot grill top with a perfect char and well seasoned. The only mark against the burgers are that the patties could be a little thicker and they would be a little better if made with a blend of beefs rather than just chuck (albeit 100% Angus) Doing those things would let us rate Babcock's as a solid 1 (it got a 'wobbly 1'). Their Belgian Fries are nearly perfect. They cut their own fries and fry them twice - first to cooked them all the way through and then again just before serving to make them crispy. That's THE way to do fries. Probably the very best 'regular fries' we've had so far, and the portion was larger than most. Draft beer list of "mostly local beers' although not extensive, is a good one. The Buckledown Belt and Suspenders was excellent. Our server was delightful and the staff overall was quite friendly. They were attentive without hovering. Overall we had an excellent dining experience and would recommend this place to anyone.
Was in town from Cleveland  and found this diamond in the rough. Staff was excellent and burger was great!   I'll definitely be back.   Please give it a try you won't be disappointed.

Delicious!  Yummy cheese curds.  Great atmosphere.  My boys enjoyed the "birthday cake" soda.  I had the Chicken Schnitzel sandwich which was good.  I will need to come back to taste some of the other novel offerings.

Finally was able to try out the newest restaurant in town.  Delicious. Probably best burger I had in quite a while. Also tried the cheese curds.  Well worth it. My only thing is the menu is pretty small. Hopefully they expand on that and this business will be around for a long. Time.  Check it out!

My first time at Babcock's this week.  Great job by the new owners who have clearly put so much heart and soul into creating a special place with a fantastic locally sourced menu.  We went with a group of 8, so we had a lot of feedback and different plates. The good news is that everyone really enjoyed their meals and there were definitely a few standouts including the Turkey Burger and the Green Goddess sandwich. The kids all ordered floats made with various soda flavors and the adults sampled some of the beer selection.  Really unique!    Can't wait to come back and try some more soon!

Babcocks Grove has only been open for two weeks and I have gone three times. It's that good. Great place to bring the family. I have enjoyed the bacon cheese burger, the turkey shallot burger, and the original cheeseburger. Always with the French fries sampler which is served with garlic aioli and Sriracha ketchup. Great service, too. You have got to try this place!
Ordered to go - took forever to get food. During rush plan on it taking up to an hour for you phone order to be completed.
Excellent food. Turkey burger and the schnitzel were fantastic and the sauces are amazing. Get the siracha ketchup for those fries!

Lovely al fresco dining in downtown Lombard. I had the apple, brie, bacon and spinach salad with house dressing ($9) and husband had their sweet potato veggie burger, with peach iced tea. My salad was generously portioned and delicious. If I were serving it I might have added some pecans and/or cranberries, but that's just me. Good service, too. Only reason gave it 4 stars is hubby wasn't wow'd with his selection, though it was good.

their refrigerator was out, so the menu was limited, but it was a really nice meal, anyway. had the burger, fries and a peach iced tea. very friendly place, the decor is lovely, and the food was top notch.

Finally got to check this place out for lunch yesterday. The owners did SUCH a great job rehabbing the place. It is really beautiful (those light fixtures!) and welcoming. It's hardly recognizable from the old place. We sat inside because I wanted to look at all the nice touches, but the outside seating looked nice, too. Next time!  The service was good, very friendly. It's a walk up and order and they bring your food deal. The food was REALLY good. I don't usually love fries, but these are yummy!  Everyone really liked the sandwiches they ordered (cheeseburger sliders, sweet potato burger and green goddess). Our plates were clean!  Can't wait to go back for dinner and try a beer with my meal.

Finally stopped in to try them out. Got the 1/3 pound cheeseburger. It was decent, I'll probably get it again but I'll try something different next time I come in. They have a few TV's which is nice, have music playing also.  Definitely give it a try if you're looking for something different.  I was there at about 10:45 and there were a couple other people here. I'm not sure how busy they get closer to noon.

Got a beef and cheddar croissant. It was terrible. Really wanted this place to be good since I live across the street, but it is not. 

Drive thru took 10 minutes and I was the only car in it. 

Beef was extremely rubbery, tasted like microwaved left overs. Nowhere close to fresh. If you want real, quality Italian beef go to Buona.

Ordered chicken gyros - it comes with tzatziki sauce, not honey mustard. Not what I'm used to. Luckily they put the sauce on the side. I tasted it and didn't really care for it. It was very sour cream-y tasting. So I ate the sandwich plain. There were tomatoes on it but they were not very ripe so I took them off. So the sandwich was okay, nothing special. Definitely missing something without honey mustard in my opinion. I also ordered a garden salad. I actually wanted a side salad but they don't offer those so I got the full sized garden salad. It had feta cheese on it which I'm not a fan of and I was surprised to find it on there since it wasn't a Greek salad but I didn't ask what came on it so shame on me, I guess. There wasn't much else on it. More of the bad tomatoes like on the gyro, that's about it. I said I didn't want onions or green peppers but I figured there might be something else. Oh there were a few cucumbers on it too, almost forgot! And those were good. Ranch dressing which tasted more like garlic. I did get an unsweetened iced tea and that was quite good! All around it was a pretty subpar meal and for almost $16 I don't feel inclined to give it another shot.

One of my favorite lunch spots.... everything $5 menu!!

Wings and pizza are your go-too's, but the salads are generally great as well.

This is not a bad place, probably should have tried something else then their sausage sandwich. This was just a link of sausage in a roll with marinara sauce. Nothing special!
They do have a great selection of beer. A great place to stop off coming home using the train. A great place to hang out at. Since I'm not from the area, I will most likely not be back.

I've spent more money than I care to count at this place. I went last night for Blackout Wednesday. Everything was going fine until the end. They do last call for alcohol, which is fine. I had not had my drink for even ten seconds before a bartender grabs my drink and pushes it towards me spilling all over me and the bar. I say "Do you know how much money I've spent here?" Then Joe, the manager comes from out the bar and starts SNATCHING drinks from all the customers and physically pushes people out of the bar. Meanwhile, all the bartenders are egging them on. I have NEVER seen such terrible service in my life. From purposely spilling drinks on customers, to physically grabbing them. It is save to say that I will NEVER be back. Which is too bad, used to really like this place. Bob Salerno should be ashamed of who he chose to run this restaurant.

Place was busy and seemed friendly enough. Only had one drink and the food (I didn't eat) that was passing by looked good. I'm more of a dive bar kind of person and this place was a little trendy. It's was welcoming though. Now to why I only give it 2 stars.......ordered a single Vodka and Soda. After my drink came I noticed the bartender grabbed the well bottle and looked at it. It was a low end well vodka that I didn't even recognize. No big deal but when I got my bill she actually printed my receipt which I didn't ask for but just happen to notice she charged me for a call vodka. Kinda felt ripped off. Was the xtra buck worth a crappy review?

Used to love their calamari and pizza.  Just ordered delivery.  Worst ever!   45 mins amd it was over an hour plus.   Soggy calamari, microwaved disgusting veggie quesadilla,amd a chicken parm sandwich.    Groupon explains it and we paid full price.   Never again.   Lucanos and paisans still a fav

I enjoy this restaurant being local to my town however it seems as though management has taken a turn for the worst. I used to visit regularly when I lived closer and the service was great, good atmosphere for sports and night life. When I decided to come back it was on a Friday night and there was hardly anyone there, even though there were only a few tables the waitress was rude and seemed like she was pushing my table out. The drinks werent good and when I mentioned this to our waitress she simply asked if she can get me something else. I still had to pay for the drink I did not like. The food seemed as though it was sitting and I had to ask for napkins and silverware. For it being a slow evening I expected great service and good food and drinks. I got the complete opposite. The manager never came to my table to ask how food or service was or to see if we were ok. The bartenders were on their phone the entire time and it took forever to get anything I ordered (which was a long time given that I had to hunt my waitress down). I have been a customer of Evviva for years and years and may be scaling back my visits now if this is how customer service/quality of food & drink has become.

The service here is pretty bad and the place does not serve good food despite its upper luxury bar and restaurant appearance. it is however one of the few places to eat in the tran station area of downtown Lisle and is acceptable enough and the pizza more decent than the rest of the menu. The bar is a simple but elegant bar and is a good place to catch a game when all the sets are turned onto the same action.

If the manager is there service is 5 star. Today if I could give 0 rating I would.  Staff more interested in shots with buddies.  Food sat in window for 10 minutes and came out cold.  If you don't want patrons to time it don't put a window on the kitchen door.  Don't blame the patron for the rating staff just cost you.

It was so nice to sit outside here on a summer evening.  I was surprised at the quick service and being able to find a table on a Friday night during dinner hour.  We shared the nachos that are served with waffle fries instead of chips and the pulled pork nachos.  So tasty! I can't wait to go back!

I'm only giving this 3 stars because of their awful, horrible slow service. If you only have an hour lunch break, don't go. We are easily ther for an hour and fifteen minutes. I've been coming here for quite a while. Their lunch specials are so cheap and their food is really good but their staff is soooooo slooooowww. Everytime we go we order salads and it still takes 30 mins minimum. I've complained to the manager several times.  Nothing changes and it won't ever change because they have no issues getting business. Sad.

I heard great things about this bar/restaurant so we tried it on Friday night. We wanted to sit on the patio so we sat down and asked a server if we could sit anywhere. The sever said "yea I'll find a a server"...then we sat there for 10 minutes and never saw a server. 

We thought about leaving but still wanted pizza so we decided to try a table inside. We found two seats available at the bar. The bartender served the beer and we placed an order for a pizza. We really enjoyed the Evviva Pizza. It was hot and full of flavor. 

Overall-- food was great but the service was only ok. I think I would order the pizza to go next time.

I ordered 2 chopped salads, which weren't great. 
But the food wasn't the problem honestly. It was the wait for the food that was the real problem. 

I ordered through GrubHub at just after 6pm and received a notification saying my food should be expected sometime between 730-740pm. Well around 755pm I called the restaurant to see where my salads where. Management told me he would've there any second......

So I call again nearly 15mins later and let management  (Jimmy? Maybe Timmy? Sorry I suck with names) know the food still isn't here. So he calls the driver and finds out it will be an additional 10 mins til the driver will get to me. All I can think of is how shitty my salads are going to be after 30 plus minutes past the expected delivery time. 

Now here's the only reason I am giving them 3 stars: the manager made 2 brand new fresh salads and drove them to me himself with a conciliatory piece of cheesecake. He got to me by 830 and was polite and apologetic for my less than stellar experience. I can appreciate the effort to make things right.

the best place to go for great good and terrific service.have been always happy with the wonderful servers that make you feel so special. Lunch special menu makes it a go to place just by itself. Burgers,sandwiches or vodka pasta...all outstanding. Great bar specials too. Very well run as Mgt is always on top of things. Kinda hidden location yet great as you can walk from the train.the most consistently outstanding sports bar/restaurant we have ever enjoyed!!!

Giving 5 stars for food, negative on so many levels for customer service.  And have seen multiple times before.

I've come in here to order a quart of bruschetta which I've paid $10 for in the past.  No bread, just the bruschetta, a quart mind you.  Ordered today, my bill was 25$, really?  Was told the manager said was the price.  I said thanks but no thanks and they acted as such an inconvenience.  The 'senior' waitress yelled at the person who took my order (who seemed newer), to cancel the order, so uncalled for.

We come here every time we visit our family in Bolingbrook.  Enjoy it every time.  Pizza made the right way.  .  4 stars because one of our pizzas took a little longer to come out than the others.  Would be more than happy to revise my review to 5 when we most definitely return.

I've known about this restaurant for awhile... Just never made it there. On Easter my family was talking about the wonderful pizza.... And the restaurant being owned by The Salerno's.... So my friend and I decided to try it out today.....  Neither one of us have never been here.... We walk in and stand there? Are we supposed to wait for someone to seat us or just get a table ourselves? No one said a word or acknowledged that we were there so we sat down at a table.  Finally a younger girl with a tattoo came over and greeted us... Brought menus... Took our drink order. This was about 3:00 p.m.... There were a few people at the bar and a few tables with customers as well. This is not a big place.  I got my Sierra Mist. My friend had to wait as they were brewing a fresh pot of coffee. A different server Valerie came and took our order. Pasta for my friend. Gluten Free Pasta Primavera for me. Usually a $3.0 up charge? That's a bit steep. I asked for my veggie well cooked. I got broccoli cheese soup which was light & tasty and my friend salad. Finally her coffee comes! She opened up a small cream container and dumped it in.... ICK! MOLD floating on the top of her coffee....I wish I would have taken a picture;-(;-(... This just about turned my friend's stomach ... And could no longer eat her salad.... It was pretty gross looking.... Blue & White glob just floating on top of coffee? We finally got the attention of one of the servers.... Who looked at it like "what's wrong"... Then she said..."oh you must have gotten some old cream..." She whisked away the coffee and brought out new with new cream she got from the cooler herself. Then we got our food. My friends was good but my Gluten Free Spaghetti Noodles were not cooked all the way through. I took about 4 bites and then decided to wait to get our server (Valerie's) attention. I told her about my chewy pasta and she took my food back to the Kitchen.  A few moments later marching over with my food in hand. "The Chef says he cooked the GF Pasta.. The Normal Time.. Like always.. You must be used to a different type of GF Pasta"...
Really Now..... Hmmmmm..... I've been eating Gluten Free Pasta for 5 years now.  I eat GF Fusilli from Noodles & Company about once a week. I've eaten at Macaroni Grill, Maggiano's...Olive Garden. Biaggi's. Traverso's. Fiamme. Clara's.... All of their GF Pasta's. 

It would have taken a minute to cook my pasta in a microwave(if they have one). That what I did at home. It was much better tasting tonight. It was the attitude that got me. Just.. Sorry.. You're out of luck. Valerie never came back with my friends coffee later.... In the end she did deduct the $2.50 off our bill for coffee. The right thing to do would have been to comp my friends meal;-(. I didn't get the $3 up charge for chewy GF Pasta and Valerie asked us to PLEASE try the restaurant again. She Promised to make it better next time.? Why not make it right the 1st time????My food was great tasting. My husbands Pasta great as well but not too sure I will be going back anytime soon..... Who knows what other moldy ingredients are lurking behind the kitchen door??????The Music was So Freaking Loud you could barely have a conversation? Mid Afternoon on a Weekday?  Of well.. Better luck next time.....

Don't order delivery.  I've tried giving them 3 chances on delivery.  Always at least 30 minutes late.  Food is cold.  Drinks wrong.  And delivery driver blames it on the restaurant.  Keep in mind I live only about a mile and a half away.
The first time I got the food it was pretty good, however the second time the food was cold and a lot of my order was missing.

If you like Pizza-- check this place out!! 

The girls servers are friendly and the service is pretty good! 

We are doing an Absolut Vodka promo tonight, but I have been here before for Pizza night!! 

Live band sometimes and the patio is a nice size. Street parking isn't the best.

Came here for lunch with a friend a while back.  Initial impression: parking is street, and there are a million doors on the building but the actual entrance was not clearly market, or maybe we were having a serious blonde moment, but we seriously walked around the whole building once before it was clear where the front door was.  Ha!  

Anyway.  I ordered the gluten free pizza.  Anyone who eats gluten free knows that pizza kind of becomes just a shadow of a memory, and GF versions are usually just shades of tolerable.  HOWEVER, this was excellent.  I actually became suspicious that they were lying to me and giving me non-GF pizza, it was so good.  Nope, no getting sick.  It's GOOD.  Flaky, flavorful.  More like what I remember real pizza tasting like.  I need to get back there one day.  High recommend.

I have been coming to Aviva for the past 3 years and I always liked the place since the first time I came by. It's a good neighborhood bar in the heart of Lisle , a good place to meet up for drinks and chill. I like having the option of sitting outside in the summer and enjoy a cold beer on a hot day. The food has always been good and I specially like the wings burgers & Pizza. There's always a food and drink special during the week so when you have a chance try it out it's a good place to go.

I've been here a couple times over the years and enjoyed their by the slice pizza at the annual block party more than food inside the restaurant.  

It's decent, but is a bar with tables jammed together that is really loud, which is a combination of bad acoustics (open joist space) and patrons yelling over each other.   Music came and went, then a Hawks game came on and no game or music, so we were entertained by "fascinating" conversations of our fellow patrons on all sides of us.

Food was just o.k. I had a burger with blue cheese crumbles and a side salad which came 5 minutes after my burger.   My wife's entrÃ©e salad was just o.k. as well.  The toasted ravioli appetizer was not worth the money or calories.   The filling was not good or flavorful at all.

We've tried to go occasionally through the years, but there is usually a wait to get a table and no where to sit to wait.  It's a bar that happens to serve food, and that's fine.

I'm also new to the area, and prefer local taverns to the more trendy bars in Naperville, etc. Have spent time here after work sipping a cold beer, maybe a glass of wine. I have not noticed the lack of service other reviewers have experienced. Perhaps the manager is cracking the whip more often but most of the girls seem to hustle quite a bit. Everyone is friendly, music not too loud, plenty of TV's to watch, local clientele who engage you in conversation. All good. 

The only thing that kept me from offering 5 stars was the experience with the pizza. First time I ordered it, I got the traditional crust. The crust was too hard, chewy, and not easy to cut with the side of a fork. That's not my thing, but otherwise the ingredients were fresh, the pie was crafted reasonably well, and while it wasn't unique in any way it was okay for a local tavern. 2nd time I ordered it (can you tell I like pizza?) I ordered the 'thin' crust, and basically got almost the exact same crust. Hard, chewy, and it didn't seem any thinner than the first one. A good pizza place has strict regimens for creating their food, and the quality control here is a little out of whack. Otherwise the pizza was good, not great. Typical ingredients but nothing extraordinary. Go ahead and order it; the grandkids will totally like it!

I can't comment on the rest of the food at this point. Suffice it to say the place is almost always busy and the kitchen is working overtime trying to keep up, a good sign of satisfied customers since it's a destination and not a place you'd wander into. Bon appetit!

Stopped in with my family on a Friday night for pizza before heading to a local festival. We sat outside on the patio. The train station is directly across the street, so if you have little ones, it's perfect entertainment, but if you're going for a more intimate setting, sit inside. Eviva is in the heart of Lisle, and being right by the train station, there's lots of street and foot traffic.

I had to go inside to get menus and to alert staff we were there. Service was a bit slow, but it was 6:30p and business was starting to pick up, especially near the bar. They had great drink specials. We chose the $2 light drafts, but they also had $5 domestic IPAs and $4 Bacardi you-call-its.  We picked a large pizza with traditional crust. You can also choose a thin or even an extra thin crust. The pizza took about 20 minutes and it was just enough to feed 2 adults and 2 very hungry preschoolers (who have large appetites). 

When it was time to leave, it took longer than we anticipated to receive our check to get where we needed to go. But our server was sweet and apologetic. 

Will we be back here? Absolutely! It's a great place to go within our small community to see friends and neighbors and to meet new people as well!

One of my favorite places in the Chicago area. Great location, great owners, great food, great drinks. I have trouble ordering anything beyond the Baked Sausage Piasano as that is so good. Italian comfort food at its best.

After seeing this place featured on Chicago's Best, we knew we had to come try  the Evviva pizza (chicken, bacon, artichokes,  and olives). So after a frustrating morning of shopping we stopped in.

For drinks, we weren't in the mood for beer so we chose Bloody Mary's. They are 25 ounces, and are $9 with $7 refills; I can dig that. On Sundays they have a "Build your own Bloody Mary Bar" but our server never elaborated when we placed our drink order. After deciding to skip appetizers, we ordered a large Evviva pizza and waited anxiously to taste deliciousness.

The inside of Evviva is your typical sports bar- multiple flat screen t.v.'s, a Touch Tunes music player,  and a combo of both low and high-top tables. It obviously is decorated for Christmas with lights strung around the ventilation system and mini Christmas trees hung upside down from the ceiling. 

The Bloody Mary's are very spicy, which is awesome. Between the pizza and the Bloody's (I had two) I left with a serious case of heartburn, which is was fine with me. It was well worth it.

The Evviva pizza was phenomenal. Who knew artichokes would go so well on a pizza? And of course, you can't beat black olives and bacon. The chicken was exceptional; the flavor was so good. I don't know what they seasoned it with, but it was very tasty. The pizza crust itself is like nothing I've ever experienced. Crispy, but not too crispy and chewy but not too chewy.

For a Sunday, it was fairly quiet (we arrived at noon when they opened) but our service was a bit spotty. It wasn't a huge issue, as we were in no hurry.  I can imagine during peak times it can be frustrating. Today was an enjoyable experience between a small crowd (less than 15 patrons), football games, and country music (my fave) playing throughout the speakers.

Regardless,  we will be back. In the bf's words "any place with awesome pizza and 25 oz Bloody's is okay in my book."

queso makes the pizzo


this is now the second time ive had a chance to try the pizza..it's right up there with some of the best in the hood
the cheese is fresh and layered with generous proportions
they are liberal with the toppings and the traditional crust is a perfect thickness

*only suggestion would be to find a way to crisp up crust

ps-the staff is very friendly and very inviting

pps-monday offers discounted food..half off, beat that deal for good dining..not easy
I recently moved to a new address in Naperville and had a frustrating experience with delivery but the manager reach out and was very apologetic and resolved the matter.

I recently moved to the area and was looking for good pizza. I was disappointed when I couldn't find anything. 

Then my fiancÃ© finally remembered Evvivas. He said he had been there back in the day and it was good. I said ok as I was willing to finally get good pizza. 

The food was amazing. We had a pizza which was gooey and cheesy. The crust was traditional which was a pan pizza I think. So good. No complaints at all.

The place is small. We got a table right away. But the place quickly filled up. The drinks were cold. I and 100% going back.

I was here the day this bar opened and have been a patron ever since. That said, I have experienced the ups and downs, and feel confident in my 4-stars.

A number of reasons I can't give a 5, but the #1 is the inconsistent customer service. Sometimes it is spot on and above; other times it is deplorable- just depends on the luck (or, unluck as the case may be) of the draw. Generally, the bartenders are highly skilled, but the floor staff is young and lacking. 

That aside, the food here is great. Highly recommend the pizza (especially Italian beef and giardiniera) and almost all of the appetizers. Burgers are decent and so are the rest of the sandwiches. The weekday specials can't be beat, and the location right off the train makes Pazzos, n/k/a Evvivas, a must-try.

Ask for Katie V. as your server, Jen (friendly blonde) or Camille (doe-eyed brunette) as your bartender, and if Rob the manager/owner is in, say hi and tell him how much you are enjoying yourself
I haven't felt this way about food in such a loooong time! Absolutely amazing grilled paninis and the PANZEROTTI is to die for!!!! 5... 10 stars all the way!!!

Has been  spot when visiting Lisle for old Style and pizza.  Good sauce and offer gf , but  downgrading to 3 stars- average.  To keep the 4s - stay inside and with pizza and beer. 
Lunch missed the mark as service was very slow and sandwiches were cold.

We were there on a crowded night and the waitress didn't split the bills amongst the table. Not a huge problem until the manager came into the equation. He handled the situation extremely aggressively to the two girls in question and pointed fingers and made aggressive gestures into their faces. The police had to be called to resolve this issue. Manager is a huge douche.

Had a great time at this place!!!! It was Tuesday Trivia night with K-Zone and what a blast! 

Nicole was our server and she was extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgable of the wine and food menu. They had this close out wine menu and I was drinking some 3.50 merlot all night- was pretty decent. I ordered a grilled salmon as my entree minus the blackened seasoning plus a side of Spanish rice (I know, weird ... But that was the only kind of rice they had).food came out pretty fast and was amazing.

The place is  a quaint little bar. Was pretty crowded when we arrived because the train was delayed. We were able to find a 4 topper right away so all was good. And of course trivia was super fun. We didn't win but it was an entertaining night. :))

So after doing a review of this place for a newspaper I decided to actually leave the yelp as well. This place overall is friendly but the customer service was pretty rough today.
I ordered their barbecued ribs dinner  after talking about the sauce and cooking procedures with the waitress.  Their ribs are over steamed and came out two different colors (uncooked in middle) and because of the over steaming the meat is watery(soupy texture).
After talking to the waitress about my dissatisfaction to see if they were going to bring a manager to discuss the situation she simply just asked me if I wanted my check. 
Normally I won't leave a yelp on an assignment but this is the worst rib dinner I have ever had in my life. The waitress was delightful but the process for customer service faction and I'll complaints are handled are unacceptable.

$ 5.00 off for waiting over an hour for a large thin crust pizza! And that was only after we sought out the manager and asked him to check on our order. He came to our table and said that in fact we had arrived over an hour ago but he couldn't say when the pizza order was entered. 
He apologized for the delay and offered us a drink but we declined because we were starving. He assured us that he would adjust our bill for the aggravation and get the order out ASAP. The order arrived 15 minutes later and was thick crust and not the thin we ordered. We assumed that the manager would deduct the pizza from our bill but instead he only deducted $5.00 for waiting over an hour and 20 minutes for a pizza that usually takes 20-30 minutes to make. 
In the past the service has been prompt and the thin crust pizza good but not last night.

Was hoping to find a great neighborhood bar walking distance to home, so we wanted to give Evviva a chance. Walked up there tonight with my finance and as we walked in we were instructed to have a seat anywhere. We sat at a two top right in front of the bar. We sat for about 10 minutes, watched both bartenders stand around bored, 2 servers stare blankly out the front door, another server come clean the table right next to us and never even glanced over at us, and all servers walk past us at least 3 times without so much as a "I'll be right with you." Only about half the tables were full. Since no one even acknowledged us in the 10 minutes we sat there, we decided to leave. This was not the first bad experience with service we have had here. Will not be going back. What a shame, we only live a mile away.

Saw cock roaches and watched a manager tell the server not to worry about it. In the biz, and I know how it works, get bombed before the health department shows up. Not cool, at all. Great staff, but doesn't make up for insect/rodent infestation.

I come here pretty often. Food is decent. Daily specials (namely Monday 1/2 off pizzas, Wednesday $5 burgers,  and Thursday 1/2 off wine bottles) are an awesome value.

This place is really convenient as well(i take the metra out of the lisle station).

HOWEVER,  the service is notoriously awful. Waitresses are inattentive and forgetful. And in the warmer weather they seem to have a fruit fly problem. 

The layout of tables is a little awkward as well. There are no defined paths to navigate the space.  Making a trip to the bathroom makes me feel like a rat in a maze. 

Overall worth it for cheap and convenient happy hour but I probably would never go out of my way to come here nor recommend it to anyone who doesn't live/work in a 3 mile radius or catch the BNSF at Lisle.

I'm rating their takeout pizza, not the bar/restaurant, which I've been at once and found  pleasant. I've ordered Evviva's thin crust pizza several times for my family and all of us thought it was very good,,better than I expected for a small bar/restaurant. The sauce is rich and flavorful, the crust tastes like I'd expect from the neighborhood pizza joints I grew up going to in Chicago and the cheese is very good, much better than your average pizza joint. The takeout service has always been dependable. I'm glad to have Evviva nearby.
Just got our pizza. I got the southwest BBQ and it is delicious. Hot, fast, tasty crust. Kids got a pepperoni and sausage pizza. Also delicious and cheesy!

I was preparing to leave a scathing review.  It's Wednesday.  I ordered a pizza for delivery. Within 5 minutes of ordering I got a text from Eat24 saying "the restaurant is busy and your order will take a little longer.  It should be there by 7:45."  An hour and a half?!  For Pizza?  Okay, in many instances, those types of delivery services overestimate the time so I gave them the benefit of the doubt.  Sure enough, it came a little earlier than the stated time, but it still took an hour and 10 minutes...  for pizza.  I was less than impressed by the delivery but honestly, the pizza is actually sorta tasty. (The Bull and the Bear)  The beef was a little too thick for my tastes, but overall, a decent enough pie.

Food is good but service is extremely slow. First time we went there it took over an hour to get our food. Thankfully they comped our meal. Very nice of them. Went tonight for a second time and same issue. Tilapia with veggies was good. My wife got Chicken Picatta better choice. None the less very slow service. Not sure if we will go back again.

My family and I LOVE this place.  Get delivery every couple weeks.

They are always crazy busy so don't be surprised if it takes longer for your food to be made than what was told to you over the phone. Personally, I don't mind waiting the extra minutes given how delicious their food is. 

Customer service is on point, too. 

Definitely try the Tony Salerno's Special! We order it every time.

Really good pizza and i would have given 5 stars however my server was very rude the food was great but the service could have been improved ask her 4 times for a refill on the lemonade and the fifth time was a charm my daughter finally got her refill / lemonade I would not normally write a review but i just think people should know and the company should know that their service could stand to improve they do have a great product but that's not everything

We had 20 family members meet here after a wake tonight. We did not give prior notice as it was a last minute decision. The staff was wonderful and very accommodating. They never showed any stress over the large group coming in at 9pm! The waitresses worked together to take orders and everything came out at once! The appetizers, pizza, and sandwiches were very good. I love the grilled calamari and love the baked clams even more (have never tasted anything close). Kudos  to your staff Rob! They did a great job and I don't regret recommending that we come here. My family enjoyed the restaurant atmosphere and the food.

What a great place to hang out and there pizza is great ,but can't forget about there baked clams they were great ,plus you have to have there Bloody Mary awesome you should stop and try there pizza it's great..

Well you can't have it all I guess. A Salernos family pizza place which says a lot,  and of course the tastes are reminiscent of old time Berwyn  Cicero. Apparently these kids haven't learned anything about service from their parents and grandparents though. Pizza came out first,  then fried mushrooms about ten minutes later,  then five minutes after that my kids' sliders. Not one stop at the table to see how we were doing,  and never did get a drink refill. The place is grossly understaffed and pretty much filthy. I guess that's what kids of successful entrepreneurs do- get lazy, and maybe greedy. It's a crying shame this place is the way it is. With the food it serves, people will come.  However,  I believe there would be double the people if they clean and get people in and out in a timely fashion. All that said,  I will probably still order delivery and try to forget what it smells like in the restaurant. 

If you go bring some baby wipes and make sure you use the bathroom before you leave the house. As far as the food is concerned,  if your pallette is still enact after smelling the place you will thoroughly enjoy a classic Chicago Italian tradition.

This is my fave place for pizza.  The Hawaiian is best by far.  The other food/apps are good for "bar food" as well.  Didn't have a dish I never liked. Service is usually pretty good too.  Fun place when there's no D.J. around.

I ordered for the first time via Grubhub.  My selection of pasta with vodka sauce ($11.00) came without the added chicken ordered (another $3, for a total of $14.00).  I contacted Grubhub and oh, how nice.  The restaurant credited me for $3.  How about a full credit of $14.00?! 

Rigatoni with vodka sauce and no chicken as ordered, is a completely different meal.  And worst yet, as I explained to Grubhub, the sauce was BLAND.  I could've thrown some pasta in a pot in less time that I waited for the order and my jarred sauce would've tasted better!!!  The mozzarella sticks were fine, albeit really salty.  Not sure about the chocolate cake as I haven't tried it (I was starving).  

Will not order from this restaurant again.  I wish I would've looked at the reviews before ordering.... Bland taste and lack of seasonings were mentioned before.  And I'm not happy with grubhub (who I really do love) even though the did give me a $5 credit for a new order.  I reached out to them a 2nd time saying I'm not satisfied bc plain pasta vs pasta w chicken are two different meals.  The noted that all Evviva would credit is $3... NOT HAPPY!  Taste your food before serving, Evviva and make sure the orders are right!!!  To err is human but how about making customers happy???

***Response to Owner's Comments to my Review***
1) Regarding your manager not correcting the situation as well as you would have...This is not an extraordinary complaint.  Clearly there has not been proper training of management on customer service which is key in any business.  I ordered my food at 4:45pm and complained about the error shortly after delivery.  Busy or not, a good manager should know how to handle this sort of complaint without much thought.  And...I find it insulting that you would even mention that many people complain in order to get free food.  The mistake was clearly yours.  I do not need a free meal from you or anyone else, thank you.

2) As to my statement/opinion that the vodka sauce was bland, I stick by it. I am no stranger to vodka sauce - it's one of my absolute favorites.  Therefore, I consider my palate to be a fair judge on what has a good taste and what is bland.  My assertion was honest and in my opinion, correct.  Not to gain a "free" meal as you suggested in your comments - AGAIN. 

3) As far as criticizing my rating of your restaurant goes, I'm in awe.  As a consumer, I am entitled to my opinion.  That's what the Yelp community is about.  And yes, you are entitled to rebut. But you don't have the right to challenge how I felt about my experience.  Most people will take the time to review a restaurant when they are either over-joyed or very disappointed.  It's an opportunity to improve, not complain that you will now need two 5-star reviews to counteract that.

4) I would strongly suggest some customer service training for both you as the owner and your staff.  I have been in high-end sales for 20+ years and have been extremely successful not only for my consultative style but also ensuring stellar customer service.  You can turn a problem into an opportunity to build a stronger relationship with a client/customer simply by demonstrating care and taking extra steps to correct the situation.  Not by providing excuses and insults strewn within a half apology... 

Thank for the offer to try your restaurant for a 2nd time but there are just too many other options and your comments actually made me feel that much more strongly about my 1 star review.

Mediocrity at its finest, if you are planning to get wasted watching a Blackhawks game and numb those tastebuds, then maybe the food will suffice at this loud bar/restaurant with fine views of the Metra station. Unfortunately, I don't drink so I was forced to suffer through a bland at best meal (ever heard of herbs and spices?) in a loud and unappealing bar. I ordered tortellini with ham and mushrooms and the ham was literally thinly sliced sandwich meat. The Mac and Cheese gave my son diarrhea, and I am totally unsure if the cheese it was made with was even real. Anyway, I'm sure this place is fine for booze and wings but don't recommend ordering anything that resembles a meal.

Recently moved to lisle and this place is my go to now. Unlike other reviewers I've always experienced  stellar service but it's usually from one server in particular.

I believe her name is Tabitha. She's outstanding at what she does always on top of refilling drinks and has a great personality. Not to mention she's pretty easy on the eyes :). Besides Tab, the pizza and drink specials make this place great. 

Do yourself a favor, drop what your doing, request Tabitha to be your server and order a traditional sausage and pepperoni. It's the perfect combo.

Not happy at all.  I came home from work very tired, and very hungry; so I decided to order for delivery.  I ordered the Steak Sandwich with cheese, which also comes with a side of Fries.

The cut of steak that I was served was 60% meat and 40% fat, which really irritated me.  If you ask me, that is terrible service; what kind of chef/cook would serve a cut of steak that had so much fat on it.  He/she should have thrown it out and cooked a new one, but instead they decided to serve it to me as is.  I have a feeling that had I been dining in the restaurant, they would have never served me that cut of steak --as I  surely would have sent it back.

Additionally, the steak was seemingly unseasoned.  It lacked flavor, and I can tell that it was neither seasoned before cooking, nor afterwards.  Simply putting sauce would have made it much better, but there was none.

All in all I was very disappointed and will not be eating from this establishment anytime in the near future.  You do not serve steak that is nearly half fat, and you should at least season the steak with salt/pepper --or at the very least forewarn us that it is served unseasoned.

I ordered six drinks here tonight.  My tab had ten on it.  The first three went to the wrong table and it took me 25 minutes to get my first round.

When I disputed my bill I was told that drinks were already taken off.  I wound up explaining my situation to my server then the owner, who informed me that two of the fireball shots on my bill were from me buying him and his employee(a friend who was sitting with us) a shot.  After I informed him I didn't buy him a drink, he said he'd take care of it.  A few minutes later he handed me back the same the same tab with a dirty look and not a word left his mouth.  He glared at me a few more times before I left.  

In all seriousness I didn't think customer service this bad existed..... Pizza's not bad though.

This is my new favorite thin crust pizza place. It's sooo delish! They use a good amount of cheese and the ingredients are fresh and they don't skimp on them. Love artichoke and spinach on my pizza. I haven't tried their specialty pizza's but I plan to in the future. 

I've also had the pleasure of dining in as well. It's a nice space with exposed brick. Gone a few times on the weekends never had any problems getting a table. The patio is also nice. 

Prices on the menu are very good. Plus they offer lots of weekday specials. 

My one complaint is sometimes they play music to loud. I don't like having to shout at the person across from me when we're having dinner. 

Staff is nice, beer is good. I'm a regular for sure!

Our waitress was oblivious and took forever to bring us our check, too busy flirting with the old men at the table next to us. The pizza took forever too. I kept looking around and no tables around us had their food. Once the pizza did finally arrive it was fabulous. Next time we'll order right when we sit down so we don't wait an hour.

I've been to Evviva a few times in the past.  The cocktails were always their strength, albeit they seem to be increasingly sweet over time, so I'm assuming that they are engaging more and more in concocting high-fructose delights.  I must comment that their pizza is definitely one of the best in Lisle, so they have that going for them.
I visited a couple of nights ago, and first of all, the room was ass cold and not comfortable to sit in for very long.  The cocktails were lip-pursing sweet.  The service was slow.  Our server definitely put the "wait" in "wait"-ress.  Usually, we munch on the tasty pizza, but this time we decided to give the pulled pork nachos a try.  Granted, the pork on the nachos was pretty good, and the chips themselves seemed to be made in house.  However, the chips were slathered in cheese (perhaps "slathered" is an understatement; let's go with "drowned") whiz, and some sort of dressing that I think was supposed to be sour cream but just wasn't.  We didn't particularly want to finish them, and tried our best to find some stray diced tomatoes and green onions that were tainted with orange fake cheese.
I'll probably be back to Evviva, but will stick to the pizza exclusively from now on, and forget the drinks.

We had a party of 6, so we snagged a table in the corner.  The beer Celsius wasn't gigantic, maybe 20 beers, but they have alk if the bases covered.  Anywhere with at least some Lagunitas on tap scores ok in my book!  

We had some fried ravioli and 2 pizzas.  The ravioli was good, and the pizza was great. We did wait almost an hour for our pizza, and the previously attentive waitress went M.i.a. For a short while in that timeframe. I'm guessing she had a break and nobody covered for her. 

Overall, service was ok and the food was pretty good.  It's a loud sports bar atmosphere, and plenty of TV's everywhere to see the game

I passed this place on my birthday thinking it was too expensive. I was wrong in the best possible way. Perfectly divey on the inside, this bar/restaurant has wonderful specials (at least during the day) and delicious food. My seafood loving friend said it was a unique grilled calamari that happened to be the best calamari she's ever had. It even looked good to me, and that stuff disgusts me. 50% off every food item in the menu! If that doesn't get you in, maybe the $2 drafts will. 
P.S. the parking lot is stupid.

Why I love Evviva's Pizza but dislike the atmosphere.
Evviva's pizza is my go to pizza for a few reasons:
1.) I live very close. 
2.) My wife is Gluten-Free and their GF Hawaiian Pizza is down right delicious.
3.) Best thin crust pizza due to their cheese choice and plentiful toppings.    

Evviva's Atmosphere is similar to a frat bar with 40 year olds in it, instead of college students. I'm 27 and hate how the patrons of this Eatery act. Not very friendly. 

Overall, stay for the pizza and leave for the snobby a-holes.

I stopped in here a few weeks ago with my brother and was unimpressed. He and my sister-in-law always talk about how cool the place is and how great the food is. The drink menu seemed decent and with a wide selection of drinks and specialty beers, and the food looked pretty good ... except we ordered an appetizer sampler and everything was obviously frozen food, nothing special, including overly rubbery calamari. Oh, and a long, black, curly hair in it.

The waitress was apologetic and the manager did offer us a new platter, but then we had to wait until half hour for the second platter. They offered us free 'house' shots and it seemed pretty nice, until I realized that all the staff were doing these shots with the patrons. Multiple times. I agree with the folks who've already reviewed the atmosphere as older folks trying to act young again. About 5-6 40-year-olds were hanging in one corner doing these free shots all night while the manager joined in on the fun. 

Our waitress was okay ... she seemed to be ready to ask me for refills whenever I was low, but we always had to flag her down to get my brother a refill. One time, we were both ready but she only asked me then walked away - didn't even look at him.

A week or so later, my sister-in-law ordered delivery pizza for my niece's birthday and we were fairly satisfied. I had the sausage, which was flavorful.
