I also tried the margherita, which was bland with giant pieces of basil that I couldn't really chew through and had to pull out of my mouth. The tomato pieces were huge and after 1-2 bites, all ingredients were off the crust and I was left with really bland dough.

Cockroach?  Cockroach?  My most fear bugs!  I was sitting next to Rosie's table when she found one in her plate.  One of the person in our table overheard the conversation when the manager came - not cool how he dealt with the situation.  I'm done with going to that place too.

My brother-in-law and I are from the next town over. A few months ago we discovered Evviva Bar and Eatery and are sure glad we did. Going in, as a Restaurant/Bar place I expected the food to be just okay but was pleasantly delighted to find out that the food is very, very good. 

Today we were greeted by Tattiana with a smile, and she remembered our preferred drinks from the last time which was nice and made us feel welcome. We like going in there on Sundays since the appetizers are 1/2 off. Not only that but it is the only place in the area that we know of that has Grilled Calamari on their menu and is it ever tasty. 

To go along with the Grilled Calamari, I had a Blackened Salmon Salad which was very tasty and my brother-in-law had a delicious burger. 

Not only is it a great place to catch a game as they have a great deal of HD TV's in the establishment but it is also family friendly and conveniently located with convenient parking. 

We will certainly be back again soon and will recommend Evviva to our family and friends!

I want to like this place... but after trying it 5 x or so, I just don't think I can.

I want to say "it's me, not them", but I think it's them.

Now don't get me wrong, lunch is 50% off, for that price I can occasionally deal with the slow SLOW service and indifferent attitudes of the staff. 

But anything other than lunch, it's not a good experience at full price.
 
An typical example would be last night, I seat myself outside and sit 15 min before the staff notices I'm there. 
The waitress acted as if she had never heard of the beer I ordered, even though it was on the menu. She even brought me the bottle and asked me if it was the right one. 

I guess no one has ever pronounced "Hacker Pschorr weiss" properly in this bar so the staff doesn't know that's the beer I want. 

We ordered the thin crust tomato cheese pizza... it was... bad... no flavor at all. After raiding their cart of spices, we made it edible by dousing it in Olive oil and pepper. The cheese on the pizza had no pieces of spice anywhere.  for 20 bucks, I really was expecting tasty pizza, but no.

In the middle of dinner, workers decided to start drilling into the building. They were putting up 4 TVs. Why can't this wait till you don't have 10 + people on your patio? 

In general, the parking is a PITA, the service slow and indifferent, the food just ok. 
And it's noisy than a coffee can of angry hornets inside in the  bar. With the occasional train and now the TVs outside,  the hornets will now be outside too. 

I recommend you take a pass.

I live right by the train station and I LOOOOVE Evvivas. I bring my family, my friends, co-workers you name it I bring them here because I tell everyone this place has the BEST pizza & a great selection of beer. I've never had a bad experience. The servers are always nice and makes me feel welcomed each time I go. Please if you're ever in Lisle STOP BY THIS PLACE! You will not be disappointed. I've stopped by to wait on for a train (made my train). This place is simply the best. So yeah you should go there
Yum!!  Great pizza with great service!  Always a good time there!!  This bar is "on campus" for us so we frequent there often!!

I have visited this eatery a number of times, and it's normally been a good experience. The pizza and cocktails are great. However, the place is dingy and I was once given a dirty plate. I mean, I'm talking about a plate someone just ate off, with food bits on it. That was gross enough to make me not rush back to this place. Also, be warned the music is extremely loud in here. It doesn't matter when you visit; that's just how it is. You cannot have a conversation in this place. It's a fun environment, if you like the loud modern music. 

I suppose I do recommend a visit--if you don't mind the grimy atmosphere. The food is quite good.

If you're on a BNSF train crawl, make this one of your stops! It's small, but great. It does tend to be crowded, but if you look around enough, you can find a spot. They mix their drinks well, and have GREAT pizza. I hear the other food is good as well, but have only tried the pizza. Bathrooms are in the back corner, which is a far trek when its so crowded. Also, service can get a little slow/snippy if you're not all ready when they come by. Place is right off the train stop, can see the tracks from the front door. Will be back soon! :)

Evviva is a super small bar, that is crowded every weekend with good reason. First of all, the food is great. I've been here on numerous occasions and have always enjoyed it. The panini's are some of the best I've had, and the pizza is equally as delicious. They also have great drink specials, and fun events several times a month. If you're looking for a faux-dive bar, this is the place. It feels secluded but it's really not. The location to the train does make it a popular spot for train crawls. I have had sub-par service in several times I've been here, but that's to be expected.
The food is good but the service is incredibly slow. Asked for extra napkins and she only gave me one and it had someone's order written on it

It's so tough to decide on how many stars to give this place. It's a fun place, right by the train station. We always go here with friends for a beer or some food. The pizza is to die for, and the vodka pasta is one of the best i've EVER had. They always have fantastic food and beer specials, the atmosphere is warm... i could go on and on.. Rob, the manager (owner?) really cares about how the food and drink go out to tables, and you can always find him there at night. There are a LOT of TV's here which is great to watch games and they're really good about changing them for you. 

They have recently updated their taps and have a lot of craft beer to choose from, including one of my favorites, Purple Haze. The wine list they have is actually pretty good for a "hole in the wall."  They have a lot of different events including the block party which is a lot of fun, but it's crawling with people... i would totally suggest going to anyone!

Here's my issue. A lot of the girls there... are not great. It's a seat yourself atmosphere, and sometimes seat yourself is a gamble. You can be sitting there for a few minutes before anyone comes over (busy or not). More often than not, you're sitting with an empty beer before they even come back to see if you want another one.  The bartenders are extremely self-absorbed, but AWESOME at what they do. It's hard when their boyfriends / regulars are sitting at the bar to get any sort of attention. It has gotten better over the years, and i think the service will get there eventually, i just wish it got here now :) 

Go here if you want some awesome comfort food and a good atmosphere!

My wife and I wanted to eat out, but couldn't find anywhere on Rt 59 that was good, but didn't have an hour wait. We decided to drive over to Lisle and I'm glad we did.

I wanted gluten-free, and they have a pizza that fit the bill. It was a thin crust, and the topping (chicken & BBQ sauce) were fabulous. And the wings are pretty good, too.

Perfectly located in downtown Lisle, this sports bar fits the bill as a beer and burger joint or a beer and pizza place.  Pizza is piping hot and very tasty. Crust is a thick version of thin crust. 
 Our only negative is that it is very noisy.
love this place, summers, the patio is where I'm at. great drink prices, friends girls, nice place to unwind

After wandering around the DT Lisle Farmers Market, my boyfriend and I stumbled upon this little gem. We stopped in for some lunch and beers and found ourselves staying much longer than anticipated. It reminds me of Cheers, "Where everyone knows your name". Our bartender/server, Stacy, was so attentive and nice. She was so helpful recommending items on the menu. I really appreciate it when servers can honestly tell me which items are good, and which items are not preferred. 

Sure seems like a neighborhood bar - but not the kind that is unwelcoming. Everyone here was really really nice and fun to talk to. We will definitely be back to try more on their menu. 

Also - prices are very, very reasonable. Solid find.

I enjoy Evviva!  It's a fun bar that's lively and a good time.  They have a great selection of beer and the waitresses come by frequently to make sure all is ok.  Their pizza is awesome!!  The rest of the food isn't anything special, though.  I have spent many evenings at Evviva and it's definitely the nicest place in lisle to get a drink and relax.

Came here for drinks and a late dinner with a group of four. Left here thinking that I would have been fine with just ordering the drinks.

We got the chicken wings for our app, and by the suggestion of a someone in the group who frequents this bar, asked for the "tequila flavor" (not on the menu). They ended up being dry, tough and had very little meat overall.

The sausage pizza for our entree was an improvement. There was a lot of meat and just the right amount of gooey cheese. However, there was little seasoning so I topped it with whatever shakers of spices were on the table. Plus the crust had a bit of a cardboard texture.

In the end, the drink specials and friendly/divey atmosphere made this place semi-worth the late night visit.

Evviva might have fixed their service problems.  We arrived about 5:30 on a Friday.  The place was almost full.  We were greeted within seconds of walking in.  We picked a table and a minute or two later, Maria was there to take our order.  We started with the much hyped wings.  They were good.  Crunchy skin and moist on the inside.  We got the "mild" which had the right amount of heat for us.  We followed this with a burger, well done, and the combo sandwich.  The burger was cook properly but not dried out.  The combo was OK.  The fries were average.  While we sat there I looked around the room.  I noticed that, not counting staff and my wife, there were only three other women in the place.  And as someone else has said it is LOUD in there.

Bottom line: Average food, good service.  Give it a try when you are in the mood for a bar atmosphere.

Holy Cleavage, Yelpman!

Yep, you heard right. The boobage here is off the charts. I guess that's great if you want to see some bewbies but don't want to tell your significant other that you went to a more blatantly named restaurant, like say 'Hooters' or 'Jubblies' (hypothetical), but I don't know. It made even this former queen of inappropriate cleavage a little uncomfortable for them. But hey, if you feel good about yourself and your boss is okay with it- get that money, gurl.  

Speaking of jugs, they're one of the few places in the area that offer mixed drinks in fish bowl sized jugs. I, personally, am not a fan because I don't have health insurance and I'd rather not get sick from sharing some super sugary novelty drink but the place was packed so obvi there's a market there for it. 

It would've been nice to see some better quality beer but judging from the large crowd on this particular night, they're doing alright with what they've got. 

All in all, it wasn't my kind of place but it seemed like it was a hit among the college aged crowd so I'll let the kiddos have this one.

I came here with friends for lunch.  One huge plus...all lunch items are half price every day.  I got an enormous buffalo chicken sandwich with fries and a coke for $8.00.  That $8.00 included a $2 tip!  The food was pretty darn good, I must say.

There are a couple of downsides to this place.  One is, the parking is a nightmare.  The other is, don't go here if you are limited on time.  Service is extremely slow.  We were just lucky that our boss was out of town and we didn't have to be back so soon.

Went on a little bar crawl of lisle and came here last weekend. Decent place, patio is good for people watching, pizza was also very good. The only gripe I have was the bartender, she was not friendly at all, very short with us and then spent a majority of the time sitting at the bar, looked like she was talking to regulars, and eating in between making drinks. If I were to go back, I would sit at a table to avoid her or go back after she has the baby.

Yep, the service is not so good.

We arrived towards the end of lunch. Someone cleared an empty table for us and we sat down. It was almost 10 minutes before anyone realized we hadn't been helped.  We ordered our drinks and they were delivered fairly quickly. However, the soda my friend got was flat.  When she mentioned it to the server she said that she had noticed that it looked flat.  So you brought it anyway? Awesome. She also had to ask twice for water.

Two of us were craving pizzas so we asked how long the individual pizzas took to cook and were told about 15-20 minutes. Ok, so we ordered.  About 30 minutes later the server came and told us that there had been a problem with one of them and they'd be up in 5 minutes.  17 minutes later they finally came out. This is my lunch break, I don't have all damn day.  The pizza was pretty decent, lots of toppings, too much cheese for my taste. 

Since we were running so late now, my friend said we were going to need the check soon even though we were only halfway done eating.  One could infer that maybe we were in a hurry? The server brought it pretty quickly, we put the credit card in the folder and set it back on the table. The server walked past several times with out looking at it, then vanished into he kitchen.  We didn't have cash so we had no choice but to sit there.

The only saving grace is that they do half price lunches. So two soft drinks, one appetizer, three lunch entrees only came to $18. But it took an hour and a half which is ridiculous. They also don't have their own parking which can be a real pain.  We might go back occasionally, but most likely not for lunch and definitely not when we're in a hurry.

Had a groupon for this place and came on a Saturday evening.

It was packed, there's no one greeting anyone at the front so my boyfriend and I were confused as to if it was seat yourself or if we had to wait for someone.

When we got to the table we had a chair missing...and it took a while to find one.

Waitresses ddint' come around often enough...we were left waiting.

Food was decent. Not horrible but not great. Thats the only thing really going for them....

This review is based on two visits and in both cases the experience was absolutely the same.

This would be a fair to good bar if the gals tending the bar were all sat down by management and informed that their prime responsibility was to wait on customers rather than fluff their hair, text on their phones, pose for photos and other personal activities that have nothing to do with waiting on customers.

It's a good thing that they have TV's with sports on because odds are you are going to be waiting a lot.

If i should happen to go back-i'll check the menu on their website so i can avoid having to ask for a menu and then waiting again.

I felt their food is better than average with a good menu of choices, drink specials are good and the pour on mixed drinks is on the generous side.

@Candice- I am wagering that the melons on display are store bought rather than home grown; It sort of ruins the experience for me. What say you?
We have been here several times with friends.  We love the pizza and its a great place to watch a sporting event (lots of TV's)  Tables are tight together and service varies.

This place has some great Pizza, for Lisle, that is ;)
I have no complaints about this place, even when the service is less than average because it's so good, close by, and I keep coming back.

Once in a while they have theme nights, or live music...it's not overly crowded after work as it's near the metra and also has outdoor/indoor seating.

One of our last visits there we got a coupon from Matt (one of the Managers) for a free pizza on our next visit as we informed him of what good service we got from the bus boy.  Our waitress took our order and was never heard from again...apparently she had a family emergency and left so the bus boy took over but even he gave us great service.  If you aren't coming for the nacho fries and pizza...try the punch, it's a chalis for about $12 but it's sooooo worth it!

My friends live in the area and decided to stop by for dinner. Early dinner on a Sunday night,  they had a decent crowd but it wasn't busy. Our server Lydia didn't seem to keen on us being indecisive about what we wanted in our first 5 minutes of sitting down. She frequented the table enough but the service wasn't on point and below basic standards. 

Firstly, she brought out everyone's order but the wings I ordered and walked away without mentioning anything. When we asked about them she said they didn't have enough clean dishes. I don't understand what kind of excuse that is but my wings came out 15 minutes later with no apologies and I had to eat while my friends were done eating. Then, to top it off she brings the check and we have to ask 3 times to bring out a to-go container for the wings that I obviously didn't really want to pay for. 

Overall,  the food was ok. Nothing special, if we had better service or at least a smile. Maybe I wouldn't mind coming back. Sorry but I'll take my business to Shanahan's. At least they can get my order out on time and the crowd and servers are much friendlier.

I honestly don't know how anybody rates this place over a 2. The staff sucks. They take forever. They mess up orders all the time. The owner hires a bunch of decent looking girls that have never served before. The food is awful. You don't go here for food anyway. You go to watch a game and have a miller lite. They don't serve much else in the way of beer. I rate this a 2 because they have tvs that play bears games and beer.
Great when it isn't crowded...slow when they get packed...noisr level of a normal bar...GREAT summer block parties...pizza is really good...if you get the extra thin crust...

We have been back here a half dozen times or so since my last review so i thought i would give a little up-y date-y. 
I have only been there for lunch and today we went again. They have half price lunches and that is a sweeeet deal! However, the service is usually below average. They are nice but dont plan on getting any drink refills anytime soon. We know one of the servers and she always takes good care of us...thats good, but she doesnt work lunches very often...thats bad.

The burger and fries is good. The buffalo chicken salad is also quite tasty, but spicy so beware. Pizza is average. 

Not open for lunch on monday. The half price lunch is only on the food, not drinks (even soda). Dont plan on a quick lunch there...be prepared to wait. It can be crowded during lunch too and it becomes loud...just sayin.

We also saw this place on Chicago's Best. The thin crust pizza was good with plenty of cheese. The atmosphere and music was upbeat and our server Tabatha was great. They have plenty of TV's and positioned well around the tables. It would be great if they could add some portabellas and kalamata olives to the mix. In any case, we will be back next time we are in the area.

I love this place but the last time I went there I was a little unhappy with our experience. The server and bus boy were excellent but the bartender wasn't so nice. It's a little embarrassing when your friends drive a distance to meet you there and the place tries to kick you out way before they close because the want to go home. I had this happen a couple times but this was the worst one. It was a Sunday and they were open till 1 am. I get it if it's empty and the staff wants to go home but you shouldn't make paying customers feel rushed and give them attitude. It was like 10:30 pm and I could tell they wanted to leave. All the chairs were stacked up on the tables and instead of coming over to us and saying "hey we will probably close early so whenever you finish we will close down" the bartender shouts at us and says " ok time to go...get out." And I looked at my friend in disbelief. Like you aren't going to thank us for our business but instead say get out! Honestly we probably would have left on our own within 5 minutes because there were a few people who just left and it was obvious they wanted to leave. But to shout at us was not only unprofessional but rude. Maybe they should change their hours. Just a thought!

I only come for half price burgers but I really enjoy it here. Staff is friendly and welcoming and don't mind if I stay for a while watching a bulls game even with just one drink. The burgers are the pretty standard but they're consistent and worth the price (even at full price I would say). They also don't mind when I ask to add jalapeÃ±os and they don't usually charge extra. 

All in all I like coming here with a buddy and catching up. Its rarely packed on weekdays so its a nice place to relax.

If this place ever has some kind of contest just know its a ploy to get you in the door. This weekend they had a cowgirl contest and you could win a $250 cash prize. So, my sister and I grabbed our cowgirl hats and got ready for some line dancing. We heard this place was a cougar bar and figured we'd have it in the bag (which we would've if they ever bothered to do the contest!).

When my sister called the place to make sure it was happening, the guy on the phone said it would be from 7:00-8:00pm. Great. At about 8:30pm we asked our waitress (some lady who was too eager to get the bill jacked up. she must've asked us 10 times in 12 minutes if she could get us anything else) when the contest was. About thirty minutes later she said she'd ask the manager. Meanwhile, sister and I learned some line dances which were easy and fun but we were like 2 of 5 on the dance floor so that made it pretty lame. 

Then, at around 10:00 our server said the contest is happening at 10:30. Fast forward an hour later, still no contest. They advertised 8:00pm an event would happen and over 3 and a half hours later it had not. Lame and aging crowd, b.s. promises from the establishment, over priced drinks, and an over eager wait staff make me never want to set foot into this place again.

I used to really like Evviva, especially back when it was Pazzo's.  The pizza used to be so good, but the last couple times I ate there, it's not the same.  The crust was somewhat dry, and everything else was just so-so.  But my biggest complaint is that they can't seem to get the half and half ingredients right.  It's not rocket science, but twice now I've gotten a pizza that was supposed to have different halves, and the ingredients were all over the place.  The last time it happened, I complained, and they took a whopping $2 off my bill!  I'm about ready to scratch this place off my list, which is too bad, because the atmosphere is great and they have decent drink specials.

Chili's is one of my favorite restaurant. Usually we dine here for dinner.

On this particular day, we went to have lunch. We ordered Cajun chicken pasta & mango Chile thilapia. Its 20 for 2 meal. Oh boy, its yummy. One thing to appreciate Chiili's is their timely serving and reasonable. When i mean reasonable i really mean it. Unlike some restaurants, where they will serve the main course and then our appetizer will be served. Chilli's is unique and the customer service gets more than 5 stars. That brings me often here. I tasted almost all the items in the menu. Everything is good. More then anything, good for kids. They provided my Kid with crayons and a small book to play with. 

Overall another excellent experience at Chilli's Naperville.

My wife, son and I were there last night Oct 25, 2016. Terrible experience, screaming kids, parents refusing to control them, extremely slow service. The host packed eaters into one side of the restaurant, food was flavorless, small portions. The only time the waitress moved, is when I asked for the check. The place is a pig sty.Tables dirty, wooden blinds have not been dusted in months. This is the last time we'll be eating at any Chili's.

My wife and I went here a month and a half ago.  We asked for the meal to be without meat (the salad) since we're vegetarians..  What was in it?  Meat.

My wife went here again today and they placed chicken in her salad.

They did apologize and took the tab for the first time we went there.  However, it's happened twice, and I will do whatever to avoid.  

If you're vegetarians, please be careful when you receive your food.

What can I say but it sucked!!! I ordered the chicken fajitas, the service was really slow but our server very nice . the food came out tasted very blah and burned. Now I know why I only go to real Mexican restaurant s. But I was with my niece and that where she wanted to go. The only reason it got two stars was because are server was nice.

I would give this review a three star, but that would be pushing it.

Do the servers that work here even care at least an ounce towards their customers? The server I had sounded so empty and not welcoming. Not to mention the fact that he was too busy talking to other servers to pay attention to anyone else.

My sister asked for the bill and then he said he would bring it. While we are waiting for the bill, we see him talking to other servers and totally disregarding our presence. I had to remind him again after ten minutes of waiting and then when he brought over the check, he just dropped it on the table with no care whatsoever. 

The other reviews about this location are right. Avoid this one and go to a different one if you can. The one in Plainfield is so much better.

Disgusting blinds! Filthy FILTHY dirty!! AND whoever the hostess is working the door tonight, shouldn't be. I have not seen her smile NOT ONE TIME! What a very dull experience. No rush on food either.

I must say I don't normally dine in corporate restaurants because they always lack in service but our bartender Juan was great. Very attentive and polite. The kitchen was dirty. Every time I walked to the restroom the floor was covered with chips and filth. The manager just seemed to walk around with a slight limp without asking anyone to clean. The 4 stars are for Juan not for the environment. Go Juan!!! Quit that job and work somewhere that deserves your hospitality skills.

The waitress was really helpful. She returned to the table a few times and was very attentive. I like the new computer tablet screens that then have. It allows you to pay on the machine as well as do a review on the service.  Great idea.

We had a really great server just recently. I wish I could remember her name to acknowledge what an exceptional job she did! Our server was so friendly and helpful, knew the products, had great recommendations, good timing, and always had a smile. It seems rare to find this kind of service much anymore. It was even nicer to find it right here at Chilis. Enjoyed the food, good deals for the amount of food we ate! I would return to this one and hopefully get our cool server again.

Every single time I order from this location my order is wrong. I kid you not, every single time!!! I don't get it! One time a manager was standing right there when I opened up my to go box and it was wrong. He didn't say anything to either me or the server helping me he just walked away. I keep going back to this location because its convenient to my work. But literally, everyone at my work always jokes with me if the order was wrong each time. Love the food, but common! I may be a little picky.. but when I ask for no meat, or no tomatoes... there shouldn't be any.

I wish I could give zero stars. This place is terrible.  When you have a nasty experience it ruins everything. First of all my pick up time was 5:20, and I didn't get my food until 5:45. It wasn't busy but they seemed to have a full staff fooling around in the kitchen from what I could hear.  But the worst of it was my salsa. I got home and we started eating it until we found a soggy old chip in it. They seem to have all their chips pre-packed. So there should be no way a chip could fall in. Unless they are recycling their salsa from the dine in tables. Which seems to be how this location would operate. I'm disgusted and done with this chilis for good. Too many other options in the area.

I honestly love Chili's food. This location has had such bad service to the point where I was just tired of complaining and gave up and started going to the one in Oswego that renewed our hope in Chilis. The food at this location is almost always cold. We continued to have an issue with rare burgers, including the kids meal burgers. We kept having issues with cold fries. I even had a waitress tell me that I couldn't get soup with my meal if I was going to give it to my daughter because only the person who ordered the meal was supposed to eat the soup. My daughter was 5 at the time and loves soup. She was trying to make me pay extra for a cup of soup. I did complain to managers and I even got a gift card and kept giving it a try but the service was just too bad. I hate complaining to managers because I don't want to come off as someone who is trying to get free food. So I just gave up on this location.

I do not know what has happened to this Chilis. It used to be a great meal and great environment, a destination on route 59 for dinner. Now I am genuinely worried every time that I go in with my family that something will go wrong.

We go out to eat as a family once to twice a week in Naperville. Family of 3. We have visited this Chilis 3 times in the last 3 months and twice had a poor experience.

From under-cooked steaks, to slow service, to waiting at the door for two minutes before a hostess greets you when the restaurant is empty, to 45 minutes to prepare your food and not even an apology even though people who came after you are eating before you, to dirty tables, to not being allowed to sit in a booth because no one is assigned to that section (its five feet away from where you are going to seat us!), to burnt kid's meals. I can go on all night.

This Chili's has seen its standards drop. Construction hurts business, but that doesn't excuse filthiness, food that isn't prepared correctly, or service that forget what the word service means.

Hopefully one day Chilis will care enough to go inside this restaurant and fix it. Get it back to what it once was, a fun clean and well staffed place to go for a good meal.

Its a chain restraunt, if you are going expecting the greatest of great food. You have wrong expectation.
I like the chill's we have on Rt  59, the servers are nice , helpful. The place is very vibrant and has a positive feel to it.
The food is good too. 
Over all a great place to go with friends etc.

My name is Sree Varma Kajuluri. This is the most horrible restaurant service of my life!! Go here if u want to be seated by somebody after 20 minutes with a face asking "do u really wanna eat here" Booths were available, but when asked the waiter was lazy enough to say "all the booths are either occupied or not clean" Wow, that was new!! Finally somebody comes after 20 mintues to piss me off to an extent thatqe walk out!!

Chili's, in my opinion, is going downhill FAST! The last few times I've gone here the food takes forever, service is just OK, food is warm/cold, and nothing tastes good. Also, since it is a chain, there is a huge lacking for tasty low-cal meals.

Unless there was a huge group of people I was with out-voting me, I don't think I will be back.

Why does Chili's keep changing their menu?  Obviously their business model works, they are a chain restaurant and people keep coming.  A few years ago, they took mozzarella sticks (excuse me, fried cheese) off the menu.  Then it came back.  Now the Southwest chicken wrap is off the menu.  Curse!

I had lunch here with my parents on a Saturday afternoon.  It was very busy, and it appeared the waiters had a little trouble keeping up with the tables (mostly families with small children).  It could've been a kitchen issue, as it took a long time to get our food.

The food was good.  I really like the Triple Dipper (choose 3 appetizers) when I can't decide what I want, and when I promise myself I can't eat an entire plate of chicken crispers.  Chicken crispers alone are delicious, but it's a massive, artery-clogging meal.  The Triple Dipper is too, I can't lie about that, but I love their southwestern eggrolls.  I usually get the fried cheese (eyeroll) as my 3rd choice and it makes a perfect, guilty-pleasure, I-eat-like-an-American, meal.

This time I had the eggrolls, spinach & artichoke dip, and the mini burgers.  The burgers were terrible.  Dry bun and patty, with a teensy bit of cheese and some bacon crumbs.  Blah!

Great food, good service, overall not a bad option in the Fox Valley mall area.

I haven't been to Chili's in ages and felt like trying something from their menu.  I ordered the bacon and avocado chicken sandwich with fries on the side.  The food was absolutely terrible.  The sandwich was lukewarm, and the fries tasted like cold, dehydrated potatoes.  The server was good about bringing me some "hot" fries, but these had the same bland leathery taste.  

Very disappointing meal and I won't be back any time soon.

This review is based on what I ordered the last time I was there. I got the guacamole burger and a strawberry lemonade. The strawberry lemonade tasted really good and the guac burger was AMAZING!!! The server was really nice and it was neat how you could pay at the table. My only complaint is I literally only got like 7 steak fries with my burger... my coworker got double the amount I got. It seemed like someone with small hands grabbed as many fries as they could and put it on my plate.

I came in for a late lunch. It was very busy but my waitress was both efficient and friendly while also dealing considerately with a large group and a custom order.  chillis food is pretty standard fare--but reasonably priced.

I'm updating my review because my experiences have gone from bad to worse. I stopped going there for some time after my last review but my wife and I figured we'd give them another chance the last couple of months. Last night remind us why we stopped going there. Our appetizer was cold, took forever for our server to come back to even take our order and we had to flag other servers down to refill our drinks because our server couldn't be found. A previous newer post that was saying that his drinks were always full and meal was warm must be a paid rating because that's been farthest from the truth fr our experiences.

Typical chain restaurant in the burbs. Can't say too much about this location.

Food came out fast and the 2 for $20 deal is great.

Also cool about this location is the game devices on all the tables. You can play unlimited games for $.99. You can also review the bill on the machine. pretty cool

The food is your typical chain restaurant mix, but there is a good variety to choose from. Portions are ample, and the food was served hot. Ordered the Tableside Guacamole as an appetizer. My server was Jake, and he did an exceptional job preparing and presenting. Jake is what made the meal stand out as exemplary. Drinks were always filled, and he made sure the service was excellent.  That's what builds repeat customers!  Overall, a great dining experience.

Food was good. The service was awful.  Our  server was slow getting our drinks. And when our food came, he slammed them on the table and just said "okay" and left.  He never came and checked on us afterwards, not even for the check.  Not really sure why he was so abrasive to us because he was uber nice to the table next to us......I will not be going back to this exact chilie's location due to the service I received.

Very bad.
Manager not able to read how old I was on my European drive license.
I'm 41 and he refused to serve me!!!.... He should change his job... Hopefully there are many other place to go.
Some people like to loose customer

What is with all the sad reviews? :( Is it again because I'm just not picky and want to spend tons of money on food all the time? 

Well---I love this place. Especially if I just go with one of my girls...when we can't decide on a place to eat on 59 ..we go here....it's in the middle of all the restaurants on 59 and there is never too much of a long wait. 

They got a good deal right now! 2 people eat for 20 dollars...really? Can you beat that? I know these kind of deals are popular right now but still...you get to sit, customer service is delightful, and this place can leave a you enough food to save for lunch the next day!

I always love their wings and eggrolls (similar to the one at Cheesecake Factory!) and my absolute favorite is their Cajun Chicken Pasta (I like spicy -and this is spicy-yum!) My girl is a Vegetarian and even if she smells meat in her food she does not eat it...and once she smelled it, they apologized after doing their research and finding out that the oil is cooked in with the same food they made for her and they without her complaining took it off the bill and she got something new! 

If you are a VEGE lover, you can get the cajun pasta with veges like broccoli, tomatoes, whatever (they add it without trouble!) 

I have always loved Chili's..probably have been to this one more than I can count of my fingers!

Recipe for the (sadly discontinued) Southwestern Cobb Salad:

Step 1: Go to Chili's and order a regular Cobb Salad.

Step 2: Apologize to the waitress, but you'll need the following alterations to your order:
- Add pico de gallo and corn relish
- Omit the red bell peppers
- Substitute crispy chicken for grilled chicken

Step 3: Apologize again, this time adding that it's really Chili's fault for taking this glorious salad off the menu in the first place

Step 4: ENJOY YOUR DELICIOUS SOUTHWESTERN COBB SALAD, MOTHERFUCKERS

You're welcome.

The food was good, and the service great, very nice people. Two stars for the following 2 reasons. 1) all the condiments literally had water added to them.....2) the place was dirty.....plates were still wet when they brought them out, and some had little specks of food. If Matthew the manager reads this, please take it as constructive criticism. Y'all have a nice restaurant just some of the rough edges need to be ironed out.

I used to love Chili's but not anymore. The last 2 times have been lower quality but Chili's has always been a favorite so for my birthday it was the obvious choice. Unfortunately. The specialty drink I ordered tasted like water from the first sip. The glass was filled to the rim with ice so perhaps the liquor, ect was all in the sticky overflow napkin mess I was handed. My steak was undercooked & my daughters food cold. We did not bother to stay for desert as planned. The waiter was sub-par during service & charged us incorrectly for our meals. As my husband paid I went to the bathroom but found it, along with the back of the restaurant, unclean. It did have a surface clean to it which reminded me of how the kids "clean" their rooms. Given the caked-on gunk in the floors I doubt it had been cleaned in days. Or weeks. I literally felt like to vomit. We immediately left. We will NOT be back!

It's your typical Chili's, the food is always wonderful. I ate there for lunch with my girlfriend while waiting for an oil change. It was quick in-and-out, which is what we wanted. Being the lunch shift it seemed like we had a younger server just starting out, but apparently they have some sort of zone system with their servers because his partner was a lot of help for him. 

But my Honey Chipotle BBQ Chicken Crispers are absolutely wonderful, with fries, and corn on the cob (which at first I was hesitant to try, but turned out really well). I will always keep coming back because the only problems I have had is a slight lacking of excitement from the hosts. But you only interact with them when you walk in after all.

My husband and I came here for lunch with our daughter.  We had a coupon for a free kids' meal if an adult entree was bought.  SCORE!

I ordered the bottomless salad, soup, and chips combo, my husband ordered the lunch combo that comes with soup, a sandwich, and fries, and my daughter got the cheese pizza.

The chicken chile soup was AMAZING.  The first soup I got was the broccoli cheddar, and upon tasting the chicken chile soup, I was instantly envious and I knew that would be my next bowl! :)  My salad was good, and my daughter loved her cheese pizza.

As always, the fries were phenomenal, and my husband's chicken fajita sandwich was DELICIOUS as well!!  The only thing that was a down side was our waitress.  She was attentive, yes, but I was sort of put off with her attitude--she never smiled and sort of acted like we were always bothering her. 

Our total bill WITH tax and tip was $20.  Twenty dollars well-spent, I say :)  I also liked the computers on the tables now--there are games, you can order food from there, and you can pay your bill directly from the table!  What a time-saver!!

Busy day.  Bad food.  Waiter was apologetic. The sliders had all the salt in the dead sea and the wait would beat a crowd waiting for iPhone 6. Would have given 0 stars but the non existent manager did take the bill on the house.

SLOOOOW! Waitress ignored us, for the first 15 minutes. When we ordered she seemed very confused. It seemed as though she wasn't very familiar with the menu.  the order was wrong when it finally came out 45 minutes later. Fortunately the error we in our favor as my wife's entrÃ©e was larger than she had ordered. The manager who brought our food out said that he would correct he bill to ensure that we weren't charged for the mistake. We Asked for an extra plate to share one of the meals, the plate never showed up; however she was there immediately to clear my plate? As I took my last bite and as I set my fork down she snatched the plate away. Oh and don't expect to have any drinks refilled ever, ever, ever. I do recall our waitress stopping by the birthday party table next to ours a few times to check on them. These check-ins at the birthday party table stick out in my mind because she shoved my chair in every time she squeezed her way over to the far side of their table. I guess we were in the way. I have to assume that the waitress was inflicted with a bad case of diarrhea that kept her busy for the duration of our visit. Regarding the food: it was fine, not exceptionally good or bad. The Oswego IL Rt-34 location is far superior to the Naperville IL Rt-59 location. I am consistently a 20% tipper for reasonably good service, but this was so bad that I just left the difference to the next dollar and felt that maybe that was still too much.  This review is more one star for a horrible waitress than a bad place to eat, but why risk it, just go somewhere else.

As far as Chili's go, I think it's pretty standard. We've had pretty good service when we eat in. Generally, we order to go, but learned not to order online. 

The one time we ordered online, we were told the food would be ready for pick up in approx 15minutes. We arrived in about 20 minutes, no one was at the counter (which is normal, we've found, at the pick up station), and when someone arrived and looked for our food, discovered the online order was never cooked. So we waited. And waited. No discount was given, but I think they gave us some free extra chips for our queso. 

The queso is definitely the redeeming quality of any Chili's. It's like a non-spicy chili cheese dip with chips. If we have leftovers, I even like to dip cold fries in it the next day.

Generally, I'm also a fan of their Texas Cheese Fries - unless overcooked (as they were during our last visit). Steak fries, melted cheddar, bacon, jalapeno slices, and ranch. Good stuff. Good boneless buffalo wings, as well.

In short: Dine in's generally ok. To Go can be spotty. Don't order To Go online.

Also, the To Go area is NOT wheelchair accessible. There is a large post blocking what would be a wheelchair entrance, but alas, steps and wheelchairs don't mix.

I wish I could give less than one star. Stopped by for quick lunch on Father's Day Sunday. Has to wait for food for about 40min, waitress didn't even bother to apologize... And restaurant wasn't even busy, it was past lunch hour... When food finally arrived,  one of the orders wasn't right( wrong side) Again no apologies from waitress, she just said she will get it. By the time she brought out the rest of the order, everyone was done with lunch so we said we don't want it anymore. When check came, there was a charge for stuff we never got:( very disappointed,  bad service, if they will not improve, they will go out golf business
Fast service is key!

Whats sad about this review is that about 3 years ago I was a huge Chili's fan. 

This review can be directed to the entire Chili's chain because of them cutting down their portions and raising their prices! Especially with the Chicken Crispers and other popular dishes. By the time you tip, you are spending $15 on your meal and taking no left overs home. 

This specific location was bad because the heat was on so high that I felt like I was in a sauna. I asked the waiter to turn it down 2 times and then the manager once. It was really annoying and uncomfortable. The food wasn't even good because it came out cold. Maybe they thought the temperature in the room would cook the food. 

You would think they would want to give value to their customers and not rip you off especially in these economic times.

This Chili's was a lifesaver. I had a project to work on with a co-worker, so we left the library for something to eat. Chili's had Wi-Fi so we started working on our laptop computer. When the laptop when running out of power, I asked our server, if there was an outlet available. She moved us to another table that had an outlet nearby. We finished our project and the staff was extremely nice about not rushing us out and kept me hydrated with iced tea even after we paid the bill. My talapia was delicious.  Thanx

I absolutely hate coming to Chili's. Every time I go there I always get food poisoning and spend the next 24 hours throwing up. The food is sub par and I've even had a meal come out that was pretty cold. The only thing I like from there is their Queso chips. The staff is very nice and attentive but, I just can't stand their food.

My boyfriend and I walked in with his best friend for a late night meal this past Saturday. There was no one in the front so we waited for a few minutes until a waitress came and sat us down. We had yr four month old, in her car seat, so she sat us in a booth. She took our drink order and gave us a few minutes to decide what we wanted. Our drinks came rather quickly. No straws.... Okay. My boyfriend's friend had the yelp app which guaranteed he'd get ffree chips and salsa if he checked in. When those were brought out she took our order. My boyfriend got the taco  pizza, and his friend and i split the 2 for $20. We both got the 6 oz steak, his medium rare mine medium well, and half an order of the fries. The food arrived in about ten maybe fifteen minutes. The pizza was... well a taco pizza. but my boyfriend said it was good. Our plates had mashed potatoes, broccoli and garlic bread. Because i got my meat medium well it was a bit dry. Over all it was good, my daughter enjoyed the mashed potatoes. Halfway through our meal our waitress refilled the guys' drinks. Shortly after i finished mine but it sat empty for another ten minutes... Awesome..... When she did realize it was empty she said she'd bring another out but that took another five minutes while she cleaned a table and brought another order out. There were other employees, my guess busboys, who were just walking around not helping the Two waitresses clean anything. It wasn't very busy but having worked in a restaurant i know how hectic it can be to have tables close to closing and having to clean up as well. So i didn't really mind too much. Our bill came and it was a little over $50. Not too bad, but still a bit pricey considering what we ordered. I might be back with other people but not as a first choice for a date night.

I knew this was a fast casual restaurant, but it's been degrading with each year that passes... and I don't mean this location alone, the whole franchise is.

The last straw was when my significant other ordered a fish dish and it came late, and semi-frozen... I can understand that Friday and Saturday nights are crazy busy, but semi-frozen food? Please.

Also, it's just a huge old ribfest, or they try to be. I'd rather go to a real BBQ restaurant for ribs than to a Chili's. Service is also mediocre because, to be fair to the staff that's above the age of 20... they're overworked and just can't split their concentration in that many ways and do a good job at the same time.
Very good food selection for value. Service is GREAT. Ask for Big Jake. Good server and very helpful.

We came here on a Sunday night around 8 PM, and whereas the food was acceptable chain restaurant quality, we were surprised by how long the food took to arrive, and how long we waited for the young waiter to bring us our check, bring back the card, etc.

He didn't seem that busy, but other than a couple perfunctory checks on our well being, he was absent from our space. And what is it with the young college age people who wait at these lousy chain restaurants in the north and western suburbs? His attitude was polite but icy, like he was doing us a favor by being our waiter. I have gotten this before at other chain restaurants in the more upscale suburbs. I am guessing these are young people in one of their first jobs, resentful that they finally have to work for a living. Guess what, kiddo, attitude doesn't earn you a tip.

P.S. And like the other reviewers, we came here because it was the only restaurant open. You would think the western burbs would have more variety for dining. It can turn into a ghost town quickly.

Why review chili's? To point out the terrible service at this particular chili's. I like chili's, I am a simple man. I recently ate at this location with my wife and daughter, and the waitress acted like we were bothering her. We had two burgers and drinks, and it took forever. Shame on you Chili's! FOR SHAME!!!

We just had dinner - I had the sirloin with 2 sides (cole slaw and broccoli), and my wife had the mini-bites. The sirloin was very tasty and nicely seasoned. The Cole slaw is new on the menu and is pretty spicy. Broccoli was good. My wife loved her mini-bites. At 6:30pm on a Friday night, we had to wait about 7 minutes for a table.  Service was good - not too much and not ignored.

horrible service.. cold food.. such a shame. no management present to oversee operation.
so sad

We stopped for a snack at about 8pm last Saturday night.  I had a tough time getting past how dirty it is in there.  I must have put hand sanitizer on three times.  I did eat the southwest egg rolls and they were good but I get a little hinky when I'm somewhere that is sticky.

Blah.  I really don't like any thing from Chili's.  Honestly, if you want Mexican or Tex-Mex, there so many other places, with much better food, would love to have your patronage.

They have healthy menu options, so I respect that.

The very, very best thing about this Chili's is that its open until 11 pm on weeknights.   Everything else on Rt 59, including the IHOP, closes at 10.   Which is bad when you are starving, and just spent 2 hours locked out of your apartment.

And, sadly, I must admit I sort of like Chili's.  I can get happily tipsy on one of their 3 dollar margaritas.  The food is, well, not so hot, but heck, I can get tipsy on one of their 3 dollar margaritas!  What does it matter that my cheeseburger somehow ended up medium, and yet oddly tough?  I'm drunk!   I'm flirting with my SO by arguing about the 2000 election (Yes, it was Soooo sexy.).   

Oh, and the night waitress on Wednesdays is super duper nice and sweet, and will listen to you babble endlessly about how IHOP is supposed to be open 24 hours and it isn't.

There's not much I enjoy on the menu and it's got that cheesy chain atmosphere.  The servers do a good job, I must admit, but I only come here when I'm with other people who really want to go.  There's an appetizer I like - southwestern eggrolls, I think it's called.  Chicken and black beans in pastry roll.

I have been here 3 times in the past 3 years and evrey time came out with a worse experience than my previous visit. The food is always served cold and I have tried all kinds of food with my family and also from colleagues at work here - burgers, fries, tacos, soups, salads. Every single item is served cold or without any flavor. Every time I go there, I will convince myself that the food might be better now, but nope, it is never. The management has to do something. Our recent visit here made my son sick eating pulled pork sandwich. I had shrimp tacos - soft tacos were so dry in the corners and I had to tear them and trash them, shrimp had no flavor and I my stomach hurt all night. Waste of money and time. Don't ever go there unless you heard that the management changed. Sucks.

My ladyfriend and I come here once every other month or so. I have always enjoyed it  She has always enjoyed it.  It has been crowded and loud on some of those occasions, and so I would recommend for those who do not like loud to check with the place ahead of time as to what time would be quiet.  Loud does not bother us.  The service has not been bad either. Besides, I am not shy about finding my wait person if they appear to have disappeared.

Sometimes we just go in for a drink and the fresh guacamole that is made at the table.  Stop on in and enjoy!

Have been here many times for dinner and it has always been outstanding. Today however I decided to impress my out of town relatives with a late lunch at Rito's and could not have been more disappointed. The service was abysmally slow, the food cold, and just generally tasteless. The tamales had obviously been reheated and were dense, chewy, and dry. The cheese was barely melted on the top of any of the food. My dad had one beer and the waiter never came around during the meal so that he could order another. We were one of two tables in the restaurant, surely he could have spared the time. With all the great restaurants in the area to choose from, today's experience made this an embarrassing choice.

When we first started frequenting Rito's, we went at least once every few weeks for several years. This was our staple! Towards the end, we started noticing a change in the business and quality...I withheld updating my review because I thought it was just a few bad experiences. But now it's been one too many.

We visited this Monday and it was likely the last time we'll go. It's a sad realization, because we truly loved Rito's but Monday's experience was just horrible. 

Long story short: it was a MONDAY night but you'd have thought it was a Friday. Two servers for the entire restaurant. We waited over an HOUR for our meal from when we ordered it. We ordered an appetizer - asked for AN order of guacamole. When it was delivered, there were two cups of guac and we assumed one order was just split up - nope...the server took it upon himself to order us TWO apps and charge us for two as well. He also delivered the guac but no chips...and we sat for 20 minutes waiting for chips. My husband's meal was also incorrect.

Very disappointing service. Our server was clearly frustrated and rushed but other than an apology, we got nothing. This is a situation where a manager comes out or we're given a cheap dessert for free. We saw other tables walk in after us, and leave before we even received our meal. 

Adios, Rito's. It's been real.

Ok look this place was not good at all. The salsa was horrible, tasted like it was tomato soup! The Service was super slow also. The peanut colada had no taste. Please go else to another Mexican restaurant.

This is the taco/margarita dependable standby.  Yes, I know I can find more authentic and better Mexican food BUT the place runs drink specials, has a lively vibe, supports carry out, patrons and staff are friendly and I just like it.  Good margaritas, and even if I get it to go, I belly up to the bar and pull down a margarita for the wait!  The food is good if not stellar but it is a standby!

I hosted a group of 8 here on a Thursday - when they have their famous $5 margaritas. Wanted to do separate checks but on this day they stated they could not do so. [Also did not take reservations on Thursday due to the drink specials] .....Oh well. However the atmosphere was fun, place was full and the $5 margaritas were huge! We opted to try the table side Guacamole, prepared right then and there with a chattering server who kept us entertained. Very fresh and tasty. In  fact we did this twice as a few folks came late and it was worth the repeat performance. We also had them give us a "flaming" con queso demonstration too! Plenty of salsa (I of course asked for the super hot versions) and tortilla chips. That nearly filled us up, but we had room to try the Ritos combination (little bit of everything) and one of us ordered the Casa Del Mar (large sized shrimp cooked and served on top of rice). Interior did feel a little bit like we were in Mexico, plenty of family tables. Since we had time and were in no hurry, did not worry about the service too much (they were busy!).
Our first time here. It was so welcoming and the food was amazing! We will be coming back to enjoy their daily specials!

I'll be honest, I was a little nervous to try this place based on some previous reviews. But so glad we did! Had a great dinner with our family of 6. They do a nice job accommodating kids with a nice kids menu. Small quarter slot machines available for toys for the kiddos too.
We tried the burrito sumbrosa, enchiladas, taco salad and tacos. All got thumbs up!! Their chips are delicious and salsa spicey. And most important, the margaritas delicious!
Only reason for 4 stars was they forgot my son's dinner and we had to wait. An honest mistake, and thank goodness we had chips to keep the 2 yr old entertained!!
So fun.  Great service. The guacamole that the waiter made was delicious.  Margaritas and piÃ±a coladas are spectacular.

In the Chicago area there are many good Mexican restaurants, and that is just what this is, a Good Mexican restaurant. The food is the standard fare, nothing really jumping off the menu as a specialty that would have you go out of your way to go there. They do have a pushcart that goes from table to table making fresh guacamole which is a nice touch. Rito's has drink specials and my wife enjoys their frozen Margaritas. On a Friday or a Saturday expect a 30 to 45 minute wait for a table.

My friends and I have been going to Rito's for over 5 years.  Thursday night is especially fun because of the lively atmosphere and $5 margaritas.   Food is always made fresh and the guacamole is prepared fresh at your table, most of the time, by Jose "The Guac Guy"!   Gustavo is second to none when it comes to serving your table and Rito, the owner, is always there to make sure your experience is the same...second to none!!!  Try this establishment out, you will NOT be disappointed.
Hmm mmm good! Food was delicious. I ate steak tacos with refried beans and rice. They were so good. Friendly and attentive staff.  I would go again, and again.
The food is great! The atmosphere feels more like a bar though. The servers are more interested in getting you the next Margarita than say more chips! Good times.

I was torn between a 3 or 2 star review but after our last visit I was content with 3 stars. Let me start with we have only been here for lunch and only 5 times but we have only been out here for a year. The lunch service during every meal except the last time we went was awful!! We waited for a check once for over half an hour after our plates were taken!! We always seemed to get the same guy serving us also. This is just my feelings and I have absolutely no idea if it is tue but it kind of felt like he was a relative of the owners and the owners just did not want to have to deal with the rest of the family if they fired him.

On to the food. I found it good enough to keep going back. I like the burrito and tacos. My husband like the salsa and chips and is hooked on the steak tacos.  We also tried the guacamole and I was impressed, my husband who is not fond of guacamole even enjoyed it.

Sadly, I used to be a huge fan of Rito's.  We love the table side guacamole and the margaritas are great. The last 2 times we were there, however, the service was atrocious. I know what you're all thinking, "oh she's one of those 'the service was awful' people".  I'm not, though. I have no problem if someone doesn't check on my meal and refill my water glass every time I daintily sip from it.  This was a case of waiting 20 minutes to even SEE any sort of server-like creature. I didn't get a margarita until I'd been sitting there eating chips for 30 minutes. We waited another 35 minutes to try and order additional drinks and/or dessert. Unfortunately, we didn't have the opportunity because someone (not our server) just brought our check. I even tried to talk to someone (Rito, who is frequently there, or a manager, which they don't really have) but they told me it's because we were sat in the wrong room. Ummm. You sat us!
I am more forgiving than my partner, who insists we will never ever go back, but it almost feels like a bad breakup. It makes me sad.

Good Mexican food outside of the immediate Aurora area. The best part is the guacamole guy who comes to your table and makes the guacamole, the difference with this guy is he carries a decent conversation and is very engaging

The service is terrible
Food ok! But they don't care customers!
Avoid this place if you looking for service!

Our entrees were delicious, however that is where the positives ended.  The queso con chile was literally a block of cheese, edible with a knife and fork...lastly a deal breaker in my book were the chips, AWFUL!  They tasted stale, and if they weren't bland they were burnt tasting.  So overall a disappointing first experience.  Will not be returning.

The "owner" or whoever I spoke with charged my card $100 without my knowledge which is ILLEGAL and then refused to refund me my money. Who knows who else this has happened to? Every time I have ever been there they have messed the check up. I have my receipt that says I authorized $30 then checked my statement a week later and BAM! I was charged $130. On the phone the "owner" was acting like a child and was giggling until I threatened to call the police because he charged me illegally, believe me that was not the only thing I was doing. Please be cautious if you go to this place because he is probably charging people more then what you actually owe. How pathetic and bad does that look for your business, charging people at random ILLEGALLY!!!! If this thing would allow me to I would leave a negative review. Such a joke. 
       oh and p.s - probably the WORST chicken quesadillas ive ever had,      taco bell is better.

Well if you have at least one of the powerful Margs here it will help you forget about the horrible food...you're prolly ok if you stay with tacos and burritos but anything loftier (Fish Veracruzana, Chiles Rellenos) is likely gonna be a poor choice; was for me...service polite and attentive, pretty good guac, too...
Have gone a couple times and every time the food and service has been horrible...Would never go back!

Rito's is one of my family's favorite local joints that we try to frequent at least a few times a month. The food is what you would expect for a $10-15 a plate Mexican restaurant, but it is always tasty and never disappoints.  The re-fried beans at Rito's are fantastic and one of my favorite things about this place. What is normally an afterthought of a side dish at most Mexican restaurants, Rito's really excels with its beans. They're amazing in texture and a perfect level of saltiness that I have yet to find replicated. The flaming margaritas have a bit of performance flair while tasting great, but be warned they are big and one will most likely take you out. Fresh quacamole made right at your table is wondeful and we have had great success with the service during all of our visits. Obviously, I highly recommend this place.

To start, my husband loves this place, so it's definitely worth going to ONCE. I personally think the chips are stale and unsalted... Which is a total deal-killer for me. The guac is decent, but nothing special. Everything I've tried seems like it needs more salt or heat, or a combination of the two. The drinks are watered down. You're better off ordering a beer or straight tequila with a lime wedge to save a buck.

Horrible!  I ordered the steak taco meal with corn tortillas. When they bring my families food out everyone's order is wrong. I tell him I ordered corn tortillas and he tells me that it's flour. That is what is written down. I tell him that I ordered corn. They take all our food back and we wait and wait. When the food comes out AGAIN mine is flour tortillas. So I send it back again. They don't listen to their customers. When my food came back the third time it was correct but by this time my entire family was done eating so I took it to go. So upset I wasn't even hungry. No apologies from them whatsoever. Very rude service. Bye bye Ritos. I'll never eat there again and be treated like a nobody.

The $5 margarita specials on Thursday (and the table side guac) make this the place to go in the suburbs on a Thursday. The food is good and the atmosphere is great. Thursday's are busy so expect to wait but if you're sipping on a marg you'll forget about that soon enough, 2 and you're on the floor they're delicious but potent.

Ritos serves the best frozen margaritas! Mango mixed with strawberry flavor is my favorite! The waiters are so nice and we were seated right away upon arrival despite the busy atmosphere. Out food also came out at a decent time. I always order fresh guacamole made on spot right bin front of me for my chips while I wait on my main dish... I am glad this restaurant is by house...I will be a repeat customer for life!

The best carne asada I've ever had! You definitely have to try their margaritas also, you'll see every table has one. And very friendly staff! I moved to Wheaton from Aurora and I still visit this place for amazing Mexican food!
$5 margaritas on thurs with lively atmosphere. Delish food. GREAT service, not expensive. Will be a regular for us.
This is the worse Mexican food ever. Server never gets order right. Too Americanised. This is a place for drunk white people to spend their money on disgustingly Fake mexican food.

We came here for lunch, the place was quiet and we stood by the door waiting for someone for about 2 awkward minutes. Finally we were seated and 2 small red and green salsas were brought to our table with a basket of chips. The green salsa was stale but our waiter did not look very friendly so I didn't want to say anything. 
After waiting a long while for our food and looking at the chips in front of me, I finally mustered up the courage to tell him that the salsa was not good. The waiter looked perplexed, took the green salsa behind the counter and took a taste. He made a "there's-nothing-wrong-with-this face," topped off the same salsa, gave it another taste with the same expression and brought it back to the table.
Two glasses of water later, the food came! I got the Flautas with chicken and my husband ordered the Green Enchiladas with chicken. The rice was great, the Flautas were good but the beans were bland. Also, I didn't like how they covered half my Flautas with guacamole, I don't eat them like that, I would have preferred it on the side. My husband said that his Enchiladas were just okay. 
All in all, the service was mediocre and the food was passable. I will not be returning to this place since there's actual authentic Mexican restaurants out there with better service.

So glad we found Rito's, a place where you can eat a tasty, authentic Mexican meal while also enjoying a margarita and table service. I was starting to think I had to go to the little taquerias to find good Mexican around here. The tableside guacamole was a nice touch. And how can you refuse when it's offered to you by a bubbly, joke-telling young fellow.  Great place to take the family or some friends for a casual and inexpensive sit-down Mexican feast,

The best Mexican food I've had in a long time.The food was amazing. The salsa was very flavorful. ( mild & hot).Both of our meals were big in portions.  ( doggie bags to go) .And tasted amazing. Then we have the service. Our server was very attentive, the plates were cleared as we were taking out last bite.We will definitely be returning. Even if it's an hour away.Sometimes you have to travel to get the  best.

If your looking for a good Mexican restaurant KEEP LOOKING this is not it!!! My husband is Hispanic so I've been spoiled by home made Mexican food. One date night we decided to give it a try. I got fajitas he got mole we each had a margarita that we choked back.The drinks were out of a mix and the food was awful. I gave an extra star because the service was good and the guacamole kid was entertaining!

We had been to Rito's for a Sunday lunch after Church service.  The food was good, but nothing special.  Tonight, a Friday night outing, was considerably better.  The table side guac and a specially prepared Margarita with my favorite blanco tequila topped off a wonderful evening.

Excellent service in an establishment where everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.

We live about a mile away and tried this restaurant for the first time.  Our experience wasn't much different than what we were expecting.  
This place is always busy and had heard good things about it, about their margaritas and food and they both were just ok. The food lacks flavor and also the spice. It's not much different then what you'll have at Pepe's. Chips and salsa are generic,  nothing to rave about. Service was mediocre at the best.
I have had better margaritas and mix way better myself,  then what you get here.
I understand it's reasonable prices on food and a good neighborhood place,  without going to go to downtown Aurora,  but it didn't hit the spot for us.

As usual, the food is terrific but the service is terrible. Love most things on the menu. Margaritas are a bit pricey except on Thursdays. Wish they could figure out the service issues. 

Changing my review to 1 star. We had a drink at the bar and paid the bartender. At the end of our meal, the waiter basically called us liars and said we should be honest next time. Meanwhile the bartender is pocketing the money for my drink. Never coming back here again.
Love this place! The flaming margarita is awesome and the molecajete special is not on the menu but is available every day and is to die for!

The personal hospitality is great, I like different food choices and this place delivers. I have been going there since the doors opened and go at least once a month. Kids like it and the wife and I enjoy the spirits.

I was torn between a 3 and 4 star review. We pass this place everyday since moving to the area about a year ago. We do not go out to eat often but decided it was time to try this joint after hearing such awesome things.

We originally were supposed to have 6 people in our party. My boyfriend and I showed up first and thought we would get a table. The hostess said she couldn't seat us until our entire party showed up. I could understand that, as we walked in right in front of three parties. Eventually the hostess sat us at a 4 top and said we could move to the 6 top next to us when the current people had left. Turns out one of the couples had to cancel so it was just four of us, so we stayed at our original table.

We ordered the tableside guacamole, which was fantastic! The gentleman who was making it was very friendly and asked us exactly how we wanted it; spicy or not spicy, lots of onions or light onions etc. The chips and two salsas were also great! I am a fan of a smoother salsa vs. chunky salsa so I really liked both of these. 

We had heard that we must order the flaming margarita, which is a normal medium sized margarita with added alcohol that they light on fire and pour into your glass. I am not entirely sure exactly what was in the flaming part, I would assume maybe Bacardi 151 or the like. I had heard from multiple people that you will not be able to drive home after one of these margs. I was a bit disappointed that I didn't feel much after drinking the entire thing. After receiving our bill and see the hefty $14 price tag, I was even more disappointed. For $14, I should be a bit more drunk. 

Now onto the food. I ordered the beef tacos, with no tomato. I was expecting the tacos to come with the beef, cheese and lettuce, as described on the menu. I received my meal with carrots, onions and what looked like celery on the tacos. I hate onions so I had the task of picking those out. I also thought it was just weird that they were not as described on the menu. Overall they were very tasty, along with the refried beans and rice. 

Overall the food is very good. Disappointed in the margarita but I will definitely come back to have another try, as sometimes restaurants have off nights.

I love Rito's.  The food is great and so are the drinks. Their prices are very reasonable and their servers are attentive. Get the 'special' margarita and tableside guac! I promise you won't be disappointed!

Went to Ritos today for lunch. It was after 1:30, so post lunch rush and pre dinner rush. I was on the phone when I walked in and sat myself as the place was empty. They brought water and chips as I continued my call. Ten minutes later I was done and the waiter promptly came over to take my order. The lunch menu is quite simple: I ordered two steak tacos with rice and beans. Also ordered the middle Margarita- 26oz. It is $9 but on Thursdays they are $5! 

I conducted two conference calls in the nearly empty restaurant.  The staff is attentvie but courteous.  Juan was my server and he did a nice job, and was pleasant to speak to. I understand how things might get busy on a weekend as they have 100 seats and the arrangement is tight in the front dinig section. 

A nice lunch experience.
Once again did not disappoint. Love the Carnell Asada gratinada. Friendly service. The only thing missing from this place is Cadillac margaritas.

Been here a few times, to dine in and carry out. The times I had been there the only thing that impressed me were the margaritas. My bf and I decided to give them another try since I live down the street and see that this place is always busy and I read good the Yelp reviews. 
We went on a friday night and it was very busy. Hostess said 25 min wait. We decided to go to the bar and ordered margaritas. I had a regular frozen margarita and I must say that I liked it better on the rocks. We waited for maybe 15 min and then were seated. Water and chips and 2 different kinds of salsa were brought over right away. The salsas were ok, one was spicy and the other medium. 
We waited about 10 min for our waiter to come take our order. We were ok with that because it gave us time to look through the menu. 
I ordered the Bistec Cazuela which was chopped steak with onions, tomatoes and green peppers. My bf had the combination fajitas. We were both very pleased with our food. My dish was perfect, the steak was tender and very flavorful. The rice was good too. 
We didn't get the table side guacamole but it looked good and the guy was super friendly and entertaining. 
I am so glad that I gave them another try. I will for sure go back. I'm already craving the bistec. 
I would have given 5 stars but the server was not very attentive. We sat without anyone checking on us for a while.

I love this place, thr thursday special Magritte are to die for. Better get their early or you would be waiting for hours :(
Food is great. have no complains.
The specials are a little on the pricey side for a Mexican place and the portion size can be better.

I've been going here since high school, it is by far one of my favorite Mexican restaurants. My favorite in the area by far, the staff is always friendly and more than happy to answer any questions. I have yet to have a bad meal here. The table side guacamole is amazing, a must try. Its very convent and parking is great. I've been here with very picky eaters too and no complaints from them. 
Even when I have friends and family come from out of town love Rito's and make sure we get dinner there before leaving.
Their food sucks, look like you eating at Taco Bell this not Mexican restaurant it look more like a margaritas hangout bar..... lol

I have come here a bit since moving to the area and the food quality has always been great. The staff are friendly, allowing me to sample the infamous margarita, and even though they don't know my name, there's a facial recognition there that I haven't had in a while. The table side guacamole isn't a new concept but Ritos does it well. I haven't personally seen a slip in service quality between when it is busy and not, but would hope that others who do just try to be patient as when the food does arrive it will be worth it. Be sure to try the flaming margarita, the steak fajita and the fish tacos. These three items are great standby items. Bonus: if you come here and the bears game is on, you'll be sure to make friends with the fans that come just to watch. Same with the Hawks and the Cubs...they represent and hard!

Best Margaritas in town...maybe in the state! The staff is very friendly and the food is delicious. I recommend the steak tacos. The only reason I can't give 5 stars is because lately they seem to be short staffed and we have had to wait forever just to even get menus.

Ritos is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! It's a tiny little place at the end of a strip mall, so you might pass right by it, not knowing the awesomeness that is tucked inside. But it is definitely worth the visit! Their food is to die for. Generously fat burritos, fresh tacos, delicious enchiladas (I always order the mole sauce. They make it perfect!) even their fresh salsa & guac are amazing! Plus, they offer very generous-sized margaritas. The atmosphere is laid back and fun fun fun. This place just puts you in a good mood. Bring your gal pals asap!

I'm kinda disappointed with Rito's of late. Our group of 5 stopped in on Sunday afternoon for lunch. All the lights were off. The restaurant was open but they didn't have any lights turned on. That just didn't say welcome to our restaurant. I felt like I was bothering the staff by being there.

Our server was just meh. I've gone here and the service has been excellent. But apparently go on an off time and it's bad. I wanted to order a beer-margarita.
