The table next to me had one and I'm even pointing to that table ("I want that one!"). He kept pushing me to the flaming margarita special. I understand there's a communication gap but c'mon. Finally I gave up and ordered a frozen margarita.

I really liked this place but the service was awful. I guess if you don't go during the rush of Thurs-Sat, expect crappy service.
The food was amazing. The Queso appetizer was a bit on the oily side but it was awesome. I had the Guisado de Res and my wife had the Lengua con Salsa. They were both very flavorful.

The service is pathetic. 1.5+ hrs from sit down to check paid.  Server never checked in after the food came, water glasses sat empty, took 30 min to get our check. 

The food is nothing special.  Standard mexican, somewhat bland. Chips aren't salted, salsa is watery, husbands burrito was cold.  

We won't be back.

Super slow service, but the food was ok.  Not great, but not horrible.  No one here was of Latino decent so I'm thinking that this is more a white person place to dine, than an authentic Mexican restaurant.  With so many truly authentic Mexican places to dine at in Aurora, we'll probably go to those instead.  Ok, but...meh....

The very first time I came here, I enjoyed Rito's and planned on coming back a lot. But coming the second time, now I'm not so sure.

        We were the only ones in the restaurant because we arrived when they were going to be closing soon. Our server greeted us, and pretty much never came back. I understand if they are busy that their service slows down, but we were the only ones in the restaurant and it was completely unacceptable for how long it took. Also, when he finally did come back, it took him an ENTERNITY to take our order.

       When we finally got our food, the food was good. I enjoyed my food and that was pretty much the only part of the experience that mirrored my first experience at Rito's. I not positive I would be coming back. After that bad service, I'm really not wanting to come back.

First time at Ritos. Our service was extremely slow, the food just okay, they said they could not make me a margarita from scratch (without sour mix) and they tried to charge us for four drinks too many. 

Others have raved. I see no reason to go back.

Rito's: one of the best places to get Mexican food in Aurora!

The food at Rito's is outstanding!  From the pre-meal chips and salsa to the leftovers you'll undoubtedly be snacking on at 3 AM, everything tastes fresh and flavorful.  I recommend the Tacos Al Pastor!  For drinks, I usually just have a Modelo, though I'm told the margaritas are outstanding. 

One small warning: it CAN get really packed in there from time to time (I guess that's what happens when you serve good food!)  Also, the restaurant is located in a strip mall, so parking kinda sucks sometimes...  It's worth it!!!!

Enjoy!

Fresh guacamole made table-side and the BEST margaritas I've ever had!!!  The only thing I've ever eaten is the guacamole, but I've never heard anyone complain about their food and we've been there many times with friends.  Servers are always accommodating and the owner is very friendly.  Go on Thursday - margaritas are half price.  Plan to have someone else drive you home if you have more than 1 margarita, lol!!!

Relax people. The service is as attentive as you would want. The hostess, waiter, tableside guacamole guy were all with us within minutes. Extremely crowded on a Friday night, which is always a good sign. The food is fair to good, but you're not eating at Rick Bayless, so what could you expect? The table side guac is certainly a highlight. But the real magic of this place is the margaritas! Whether you do a flaming one or a classic, they are potent. Delicious. And will tempt me back again.

GREAT margaritas--and if you want a LARGE one, they're huge.  I always get the Blue Flaming Margarita--not too acidic and will kick my ass.  The food is excellent as well with some really good mole and the Queso Fundido is to die for.  The one hit on this place is that it's typically REALLY busy and as a result, can be slow--usually a wait for a table and then the service is slow.  As often as they're busy, I would think they would get a few more staff members hired to get diners through quicker.  However, we always have fun and drink the margaritas so the wait typically isn't an issue.  Love this place.

Great margaritas, especially worth it on Thursdays when they have their $5 specials. Their service can sometimes be a little on the slow side, especially when they're busy, but overall, we've had great experiences here, with good food, good drinks, and good company!

Have to reduce my stars to 3.  Was here on a Friday night...bummer and never again.  I don't know if it was because it was busier than normal, but the tacos were tasteless, the queso fundido was overcooked (so the cheese separated and then when it cooled it was hard and chewy), and the service was lax.  Even the table-made guacamole was mediocre...too much lime...not enough seasoning!  I will go back, but never again on a Friday (or probably Saturday for that matter).

Tasty and strong margaritas. Queso fundido was also worth the trip. My guisado de res was pretty mediocre though, and the service was just a tad under the radar. Her enchiladas con mole were quite good. I read about tableside service of guacamole on weekends but not this Sunday. Overall decor and especially the restrooms (you can't afford a mirror, really?) left a bit to be desired. There are tons of Mexican restaurants in Aurora and much better considering the price point.

Flaming Margaritas what more do you want. Food is decent. We go there several times a month. We tip well and always get good service. We can go in many Friday nights and get a bar table no problem. They are busy most evenings.
Visit Thursdays nights! $5.50 margaritas, great service  and excellent food! Go there, its fun and filling!!

We tried to go on a Saturday to dine in or carry out... even carry out had a 30 minute wait. This place was packed!! I hear the food is good and would give it a second shot, but would definitely go earlier so I could sit down and dine comfortably.
Their margaritas are the best.  The food was good too.  Maybe a bit on the pricey side but it was delicious.

Usually I would not take the time to review especially if it was a bad experience (not worth my time), but I can not express enough how bad my experience at Rito's was tonight. First the waiter was rude,  my friend ordered a drink and after telling us he needed our table he left and a half hour later came back and my friend from work asked where was her drink and he told her she never ordered a drink. I am not sure what passed between them at that moment,  but I did hear her say. ' we are spending money' then more of our group was coming and the girl from up front told them they could not sit next to us though the table was open. I called her over and told her straight out I would write a review for the way she just responded to that and when I told her the waiter was also rude she smiled, shrugged and turned her back to me and walked away. I have never in my life been treated so poorly as tonight at Rito's. The food is not even that good it is just that it was close to work and easy for workers to get together.  I will never return to Rito's
I loved Ritos. The tacos and margarita were awesome. Everything was nice. I don't know why the rating is only 3.5 on yelp. I'm glad I finally checked Ritos out. I will be back soon.

Hands down: the best authentic Mexican joint in the area. From the food, to the drinks, to the atmosphere, to the amazing SeÃ±ior Rito himself (who is one of the most friendly and genuine restaurant owners I've ever met), if you live within a decent vicinity of Rt 59 & Montgomery Rd, this place is a must!

Prices are fair, food is fresh, the $5 mega margaritas on Thursdays are tasty and strong (get there early, Thursdays = long waits & standing room only). Absolutely start out with the freshly made guac when the cart is wheeled over to your table. And make sure to visit for birthday celebrations. Rito is known (99% of the time) to trot out with a staff-parade who are shaking maracas, singing and clapping, while Rito slaps a hilariously gigantic sombrero onto your head, tilts you back, and pours a tequila shot into your mouth while restaurant on-lookers cheer and smile. 

The only "negative" (which isn't even that, it just needs to be made a forewarning to the impatient diners)... Rito's is a laid back place! Doesn't matter if it's lunch or dinner, weekend or not. If you're in a rush, don't even bother. Rito's is about taking a breather, relaxing, enjoying good company, good food, good drinks, and good times, etc. We are regulars and recommend Rito's to everyone.

The waiter was wonderful!!!! Had a great meal and enjoyed the atmosphere! I ordered the steak fajitas and I would definitely order them again. My strawberry margarita was huge and delicious. Definitely recommend.

This is a fun place to go on a Thursday night... I think that's the night of 1/2 price margaritas. The food and drinks will be great but the service will definitely be terrible on a Thursday.  Jut a heads up.  I've been here on nights other than Thursday and it's like a totally different world!  Ghost town. I always get one of the steak meals when I come here.  They are very good.  I think I get the carne asada gratinada or something like that.  The guacamole is amazing too...  And I always get that margarita on fire!  Boom!

Thursday's are the night to go. $5.00 jumbo margaritas. It will
Be crowded so don't expect to sit right down at 7 pm. The food is good though I think people have rated it a bit high. If you go try a flaming margarita or a shot of Rumchata!

Really enjoyed the food- had the sampler plate-  fresh tasty ingredients, lots of flavors.  The Chile Relleno was AMAZING.  I enjoyed the enchiladas quite a bit as well.  I think I inhaled a basked of chips with their salsa too.  They had margaritas on special-  wow-  it was so tasty and really strong.  
They were also really accommodating to my friend's 2 year old- gave her things to color, had a kids menu, and even made a fake kids margarita (pink lemonade with limes on the rim of the kids styrofoam cup.)
If I lived closer to aurora this place would be my second food home.

A friend and I went here last Saturday night to check it out for the first time.  Got seated right away and our drink order was taken right away.  Good start I thought. Well that's where it ended! I ordered a mixed drink and I'm not to sure what I got but it definitely was not a Jack and Coke. Got the chips and salsa, they were ok at best. No flavor at all. After a long wait we were finally able to put in our food. I ordered three beef tacos with lettuce and cheese only. My friend got chicken quesadillas. Nothing hard to put together at all. It took 50 minutes to get out food. When the food finally came it was wrong. My tacos had everything you could imagine in them. Not cheese and lettuce only! Meat had no flavor,  and the beef in my taco tasted exactly like the chicken in the quesadillas.  Not sure how they pulled that off! I also ordered a water to go with my meal ( plus I could not even drink my mixed drink) they bring me a sprite. Can't even get water right at this place! Over all very bad experience,  I'm sorry I had to pay $40 for all the wrong stuff.

I have been going here ever since it has opened it is the freshest best tasting authentic Mexican food made to order.  They also have specials on Thursday for $5 Margaritas the are so delicious!  If there is a down side to this restaurant it would be that they are so good that you might not get a seat if you go past 6:00pm on a Thursday.  Also if your in a hurry don't go here on a Thursday the waiters are so busy serving that paying your bill might take a little longer.   Definitely going to keep returning to this yummy restaurant.  Oh by the way the staff is so polite and the owner Rito is super friendly and always comes out to greet his returning customers he is a great business man!

OMG, this place is nasty, awful and a complete waste ot your time.

No Service, No Taste, No Value.

Seated at a table against the wall.  The bench seats on the wall are 6" too high so that peoples thighs were against the bottom of the table.  We should have left right then and there.

10+ minutes to place a drink order, 15+ more to get an entree in, 7+ more to have table-side guacamole (not bad, but tiny).  15+ more to to get the order.  4 top set with 3 plates and glasses.  Waiters had to be flagged down for water, salsa, everything.

The guacamole consisted of 1, yes, 1 medium avocado for a table of 4 people to the tune of $6.95.  You're kidding right?

I had the sample plate and couldn't believe how bad EVERYTHING was.  They tore the taco making it, so just added another tortilla around the outside instead of starting over.  The mini chimichanga was literally 2 inches long and I had to search for any filling.  The Tamale was also nothing but corn masa.  The enchilada was barely filled with dry, tasteless chicken.  The Chile Relleno was the absolute worst I have ever had.  No taste, bad cheese, soggy breading.  The rice was dry and tasteless while the refried beans were not even as good as the junk in the cans.

Another at our table had the mole chicken, and while the chicken was moist, the mole was way too sweet and straight out of a jar.

Finally, the $9.00 medium margaritas were short on cheap tequila and long on Kool-aid margarita mix.  If you like these, you have never had a real margarita.

They cleaned up our 1/4-1/2 eaten plates and never even asked if we wanted to take it home... they obviously knew better.

Again, nasty nasty nasty.  Without a doubt, the worst Mexican food I have ever had in 50 years on the planet. 

You've been warned.
Really good drinks!  As many of the others mentioned, food is pretty good but service could certainly be improved.
We visited again on a Thursday at about 6:00. Service was much better and friendlier. I think from now on, we'll avoid Friday and Saturday evenings.

I went her on a Thursday night with work friends and I've gotta give this place credit for the effort.  For a corner of a strip mall location, they really are trying to be unique.  Lively atmosphere in a good-sized location.

We just had chips, salsa and appetizers, but they were good.  Having someone go around to offer table side guacamole is a great idea.  Much easier to sell that with a cart of fresh ingredients at the edge of the table than trying to describe it on the menu.

The drinks were good as well.  Some at the table got the flaming margarita and that was a nice, festive touch.  Drink prices were very reasonable and didn't necessarily appear to be on special ($3 for a bottle of all of the main Mexican beers).

A good place for this sort of gathering-the entrees looked just o.k. but I'll give it another try one of these days.

I was so surprised that a restaurant in a strip mall that's close to my house could ever be so good and have authentic Mexican food. The puerco guisada was spectacular and the yummy green salsa it was roasted in was made fresh not from any can. The rest of my table had a wide variety of dishes including mole and fajitas. All were really good and at a fair price. It was my first trip and I met the owner, Rito,  who was not only making sure everyone was happy, but was quick to help his attentive staff. The margaritas were also made fresh and perfectly too. I have not had a margarita this good since my recent trip to Mexico City. 
 We need to support restaurants like this because they are part of our community, they deserve the same dinner dollars I would spend in the city,  and they have earned my return. Great place!!!
I was so looking forward to this "authentic" mexican place, but I was unimpressed. Lacking atmosphere, margaritas were average at best and food was just OK.

Ok, we were back here on a busy nite, and it looks like they have figured out their former "slow" problem! Bueno.  Tried the chile rellenos filled with ground beef, which were good.  love the table side- prepared guacamole. As usual, beans were tasty. and sometimes at Mexican joints, the chips are not fresh? Well, they have always been very fresh here. and the marg's are also whipped up fresh upon your order. No pouring old pre mix which always tastes kinda limey to an extreme. The staff has always been very friendly. Go there a few times and they remember you. A nice Mexican option in the Aurora-Naperville area.

We went in on a Wednesday evening around 6:30. The place was not quite half full. We waited well over 45 mins for our 2 taco dinners. The salsa had no flavor other than heat.  The rice with my dinner still had crunchy rice in it.  We never saw our server after he finally dropped off our food. I was finally offered a refill on my diet coke as we were paying the check.

We always judge a restaurant on whether we need to go back. We don't need to go back.

I came with my mother on a whim for some lunch. I just moved back from Texas and I can say this is better Mexican food than 98% of the "Mexican" places in Texas,  due to the fact Texas really only knows texmex,  which is completely different and subpar.   I was pleasantly surprised they served horchata, which was delicious,  and I later asked if they made micheladas and the waiter said yes (I have to go back and order one to try). I had ordered the skirt steak which came out juicy and tender. The salsas were fresh and great.  I'll definitely be going back to try other things on the menu. The service was great when we went,  but my mother and I and 4 other couples were the only ones there,  I haven't experienced it when it's busy.  This was 2 weeks ago.

Oh Rito's what has happened to you in the last couple of years. What was once my favorite Mexican spot in the area has gone completely down hill. The service here has been awful on my last few visits. One time I understand but it has been 3 times and the service has been awful. Tried to take my boyfriend to eat here last weekend and we stood by the desk for over 10min and were not helped. Moved by the door since a few other people were waiting (and figured they weren't taking names) and two other people came in and there names were taken ahead of us. Really we were there 10minutes earlier how did you miss us. The food here has also gone down hill. It has come down to a place to go for Guacamole (still the best in the area when the guac boy is working) and the "Rito's special Margareta". Don't think I will be going back for a while after my last few visits. Time to get your act together guys!!! This service is unacceptable.
Excellent service, food and the Margaritas are THE BEST!!  Specially if mArgaritas are mixed with Casa Noble tequila.   Chicken mole and fresh table made guacamole are worth the wait.  Kudos!

I have eaten at Rito's several times, great food, great drinks, flaming margarita's are a hit but their service is absolutely terrible. Wait to get seated, once you are seated wait some more to get your drink orders in, drink orders take forever, wait a little bit more to order your food. God forbid you need a waiter to bring you another round of drinks or even just a glass of water or some extra napkins. Want your bill, be prepared to wait and wait and wait for that too. This is solid 4 star quality authentic mexican food but the service is 1 star. The owner needs to crack the whip on his staff and teach them about service.

Our family has been going there for over 5 years at a minimum of once a month.  So I guess you can say we love it.  Love the food, fresh guac, awesome Rito's special rita, atmosphere, service has been friendly & fantastic.  Sad to see some low reviews, they should give it a second chance.  This place can get real busy (I guess because everyone likes it) and you can expect a slower service, but not to deserve a low review because of it.  Keep it up Ritos!  And congrats on the opening of your second location!
The flaming Margarita is definitely the way to go

Amazing Ritas!!!!! Best in the burbs!! Great people. They remember everybody that is a reg. they make you fill like family. Thurs are slammed pack. Good food. Short drive home!!! Best Mexican overall near by.

I've been there twice. First experience was better than the last one. We were seated with menus for the kids only. Very slow service! Once our waiter finally came around we asked for the regular food and drink menus. After another long period of waiting they finally come to take our order and forget to ask what my boyfriend is having to drink! Pretty rude I'd say! Everything else from getting our food to getting our tab took another hour or so! The two stars given are for their tasty chips & salsa and their frozen piÃ±a coladas.. They were good but not good enough to make me go back!

Good Mexican food in Naperville is as rare as a Naperville SUV without stupid family stick figure stickers.  Trust me, that's rare.

Rito's is really good Mexican food.  I won't say great, because I've gotten a couple of dishes that didn't wow, but by and large, I appreciate the restaurant as a whole.

One of the best parts is the tableside guacamole service.  As soon as you sit down, a young guy shows up and asks if you'd like guacamole.  Say yes.  He makes a mean guacamole customized to your tastes (mild or hot, onion, no onion) and is very friendly and talkative.  FYI, he's a college kid studying accounting.  Tip him and support education.

The other best part is the two brothers who run the place.  These guys know how to create customer loyalty.  Everytime we visit, they both stop by, shake our hands, tell my wife she looks lovely (making my day better) and make sure the food is good.  If I ever owned a restaurant, I'd want guys like this managing the floor.  

The margaritas are pretty good.  Not the best i've had, but they come in big glasses, aren't obscenely expensive and get the job done.  However, I advise caution on getting the golden margarita which is the usual margarita with a flaming shot of Cointreau.  This drink is friggin' delicious.  And considering it has that extra kick of alcohol, it's also deadly serious.  I only discovered this one night when, not paying full attention, I drank two and ended up taking a cab home and falling asleep (see: "pass out")  on the bedroom floor.  There are other details that are hazy and better left undiscussed.

Try the hangar steak.  Love it.  They used to have Norteno Tacos with a bacon-chile sauce that was fantastic, but it's been off the menu for awhile.  Hoping they bring it back.  My wife orders the veggie burrito and loves it everytime.  The beans and rice are eh, but then again, these dishes aren't exactly expensive, either.

Ritos is in a strip mall on 83 just west of 59.  I wouldn't have stopped here if I hadn't been recommended on a few occasions.  The inside is nothing special and the bar really needs to be rehabbed.  If they had a remodeled bar that was more friendly to socializing, they'd be kicking serious tail.  If you're going there with 2-4 people, you probably don't need a reservation on most occasions, but if it's a larger group, it wouldn't hurt.

Ritos has very good mexican food.  I had the green salsa enchiladas. They were muy bueno.  For an appetizer I had the queso fundido.  A great choice along with some tortillas.  All in all, good cuisine.

The restaurant itself leaves something to be desired.  The seating is poor.  There are benches along the walls that are hard and the 'back rest' is the wall.  Additionally, it's a family restaurant but there's arcade games there which are a bit distracting during your dinner conversation.  Another complaint is the lack of quality margaritas.  The basic margaritas are passable, but no top shelf selections 

Only three stars.  I would return to give them another shot because the food is so good.  Because of the atmosphere, I might try a few other restaurants before returning.

I would like to give them a negative star.  I have NEVER been treated so badly.  Federico the bartender  waiter was not even apologetic when we found a quarter size chunk of plastic in our food.  The manager acted like we put it there ourselves and was extremely rude.  A nice restaurant would have comped the appetizer or bought us a drink as mistakes do happen. Not Ritos.   The food is not that great and is overpriced   they just rearranged the nachos and put them back in the oven for a minute and then said they "would never do that" when clearly that is exactly what they did.     ugly, cheap atmosphere.  The only reason to go is for the $5 margaritas on Thursdays. Ill be taking friends to Tap house instead. Great service, food AND drink specials on Thursdays!

My wife loves Mexican food.  I do not like it - but this place is an exception.  Hidden away in a strip mall, it's looks are very deceiving.  Inside on a Tuesday night it was a busy bustling atmosphere and it took some time to be served our food, but the wait was definitely worth it.  I highly recommend trying this place - I know we'll be here again soon.

This is our go-to chinese food restaurant.

Food is always good and prices and very affordable.

I took my daughter to the martial art place which is the next door to China Kitchen. Since we only had 40 minutes between the activities, I decided to get the dinner for us here. 

We got the dinner comb with Fish and veggitables. This place is a typical take out place so I didn't expect the fantastic food. However, the fish fillet was too small to be found. Usually this means both the quantity nor the quality were not good. Since the fish was frozen for a long time so it broke to small pieces when they cooked it. The broccoli tasted OK but not the baby corn nor the carrots. The side is the chicken fried rices where was totally dark due to the excessively used soy sauce. Didn't think Chicken was fresh enought neither. 

Maybe just one time glitch for this place where other visitors had a better experience. I will just leave this one alone.
Typical takeout Chinese place. The food is okay. But it comes quickly and is very inexpensive. Good hangover food.

My husband and I have ordered from here a couple of times and we've been very pleased with the quality of the food. It is a small place so we normally do take out. I wouldn't worry about calling in your food ahead of time either. They are so fast when it comes to making the food that your wait is normally only five to ten minutes at most after placing your order. It's definitely one of the better chinese places I've eaten at in the area. 

They have a large menu with a great variety and I was extremely surprised at just how cheap they are considering the large portions they give you. We always order the dinner combo: for $9 you choose an entree and you also get a huge side of chicken fried rice, one crab rangoon, one egg roll, either egg drop or hot and sour soup, and a soda. It's soo much food that you could definitely share one dinner combo between two people without a doubt.

I'm not going to lie to you...the soup is awful. Way too thick, almost like syrup. But the beef entrees are awesome (especially the hundred flavor beef, soo spicy and delicious) and the egg rolls and crab rangoon are perfect. Plus, the fried rice is the real deal. Not that yellow fake stuff! Overall, China Kitchen is great. I will definitely continue to order from here.

We ordered via grub hub. The food came 50min AFTER the given time. One of the entrees was wrong. I ordered a chicken dish and I got a completely different shrimp dish. After all that- the food was just "ok". We had tried the Hawaiian fried rice. It was pretty good but I've had better. Not sure what shrimp dish I got, by it was just ok. Same for the Mongolian beef. The egg rolls were not very good. The pot stickers were average, and were small in size. I will not order from here again. There are many other places around that are much better. Was very disappointed.

As a great low-cost Chinese takeout in the Naperville area, there's not a whole lot to complain about. The people who work there are friendly, although seem to strictly abide by "Chinese takeout time measurement" where no matter what you order it'll always be "fifteen minutes" even though it might be ready in as little as five. When I go here, I don't eve bother calling as I'd rather stand around for five or ten minutes and have my food hot and ready than planning on being there after the pre-designated fifteen minutes only to have had my food getting cold for the last ten.

Here's some tips:

-There's a unadvertised dollar menu that you'll see when you go to pick up your food. On this menu there's things like single egg rolls, plain fried rice, and other single-serve basics. All of this stuff is prepared almost instantly too, so if you want something quick and don't care about getting fancy, you can buy yourself a feast for like $4.

-Insist you want them to go "easy on the sauce." China Kitchen is yet another Chinese place that'll go absolutely insane with saucing your food, leaving your chop suey swimming.

-Avoid the chicken, I'm not sure why, but it always seems to be weirdly rubbery and full of gnarly bits that you can't really identify.

-The potstickers, eggrolls, and crab rangoon are all great.

-If you order a small fried rice, ask for it in a large container. Instead of a container that's bursting out the top barely held together with a staple, you get a much more sane packaging option.
The place is very clean! Their food are always prepared fresh and hot. Takes about 10-15 mins for pick up. Highly recommend the hundred flavor beef and honey walnut shrimp! Yummy-yummy!
I can't say this place is anything fantastic, but it's that typical small takeout Chinese place. The food is okay and great when I'm not trying to drive far to get my broccoli beef fix.

We used to get takeout from China Kitchen but stopped after some unsatisfactory meals. We decided to give it another try. The egg rolls were overdone and almost burnt with little taste. I have never gotten chop suey without one mushroom in it until now. I guess they've had to cut costs at the expense of taste. We have permanently taken them off our list. Too bad.
Thought it was okay at first then I realized how how dry and unfresh the chicken was, it looked grey and highly fatty. The last strike was when I found a tiny bone in the meat, won't be coming back.

This place suprised me! When we ordered for the first time, we didn't know what to expect, except the menu was cheap. It's a very plain storefront in a strip mall, really basic. 

The portions are HUGE - the "small" is a standard size....I'm sure the "regular/large" could feed a small army.

We had an order of tofu & veggies, general tso chicken, egg drop soup, wonton soup, 2 egg rolls, all for $20!! And since we spent $20, we got a free order of Chicken Fried Rice. (If you spend $10, you get a free egg roll!)

I highly recommend this for cheap chinese in Naperville!

The food here is so-so, but the location is only minutes from my house, so this was our default carry-out place. I got a coupon printed on the back of a grocery store receipt that said "buy one entree - get one free" for China Kitchen at this exact address, this exact phone number, with NO expiration date. I decided to use it recently. I ordered 3 dinner entrees, soup, 2 appetizers - around $45. When I gave the cashier my credit card and coupon, she refused to honor the coupon! She said they don't take coupons, it wasn't valid, it wasn't theirs, etc. etc... Really? They printed these coupons and now won't take them? Is this their idea of bait-and-switch? When I asked for the manager, the cashier offered me 10% off the total instead. The price of a free entree should be $10 off! - but I didn't want to argue and my kids were waiting, so I took the 10% and left.Won't be coming back for this kind of treatment. I found a great place in Lisle.

My wife and I ordered take-out for lunch from here.  Lunch specials are very inexpensive (less than $6 for a crab rangoon, egg roll, fried rice and some type of meat), and the portions generous.  
We ordered pepper steak and mongolian beef, and also ordered orange chicken off of their dollar menu (a bargain).
Food quality was good, as was flavor.  I've had better chinese food in Naperville, but not at this price.  China Kitchen is definitely a solid place to eat.

China Kitchen is a small restaurant, but the food is fantastic.  They have a very good selection, with many Cantonese dishes.  The portions are very generous and they will frequently run single day specials using thier Facebook page.

This is some of the best Chinese food I have had in a while, and they are able to do it consistantly.  I would recommend them to anyone looking for Chinese food in the Naperville area.

We've ordered take-out from here a couple times now, and we've decided this is our go-to for Chinese! We like ordering their family dinners and find it to be a great value. Delivery has come much faster than expected both times!
Good Chinese.  Lots of food for a reasonable price.

Had not ordered from here for quite some time, but decided to get Chinese during the snow "storm" Thursday and it is the closest to our house.  Much worse than I remembered.  Will not go back.  Sauces heavy and flavorless, ingredients so-so, egg rolls tasted like they were out of the freezer case at Jewel.  Skip this place!

A rare commodity around here to find a clean, efficient and well-staffed establishment in this part of the suburbs. The only caveat is the location is kind of hidden in the strip mall where the DMV is. But rest assured, if you find this gem, you won't be disappointed. There are other pho places around here as I've written in my prior reviews, however this one thus far has won by a landslide and here are my reasons why. 

Service, with food sometimes taking over, service sometimes (and oftentimes) dwindles among certain cultural communities. This location doesn't sacrifice this. The staff has always been very tentative and always speak to you, not at you. I've been here about three or four times and this has never been an issue. I've always felt very welcome to come back. 

The food here is above par, I would say it's not far off from Viet town in the city. All dishes are appropriately portioned and they have a wide variety of authentic Vietnamese dishes, including smoothies and coffees for you to quench your thirst. Their sandwiches are always fresh from the bread down to the spices they use. If you want to talk about flavor.. it really doesn't get any better!

Pricing is beyond fair and you get quite a good amount of food for the price you pay- which doesn't hurt your You wallet so bringing a small group of your friends here should be no worries. 

The establishment here is always clean. Well kept, constantly swept and unlike many other places I've been to that are authentic- there are no bugs constantly flying around. 

Take a trek out here. It's well worth it. You'll be glad you did!

I love noodle soups. Pho Thien is one of my favorite pho restaurants. This is very tied with Green Basil in Downtown Naperville. 

Reasons its a great place to check out: 

1. Their Pho is phenomenal. Great tasting broth that doesnt over kill the quality and taste of the meats. 
2. They give you plenty of options fish sauce on the table, crushed red pepper puree, red pepper oil if you ask for it, anything you can ask for really.
3. Their service is personally really comforting compared to another pho place on rt 59 which i wont mention these guys are Superior. Always welcoming, cater to what you need, checking up only when they see that we're ready. You know when you start looking around and they'll pick up on it. 
4. The rice dishes are just as awesome as the pho. I have some pics but that doesnt do it justice. 
5. Ambience. Music is key to my heart and Pho Thien always has a good selection. Plus tv's if youre feeling antisocial.

Thats my 5. Good luck! Hope you enjoy as much as i did. I typically go a couple times a month.

My husband and I definitely agree that this place serves one of the best pho we both have had in a long time around the Chicago area.  The broth is the most important part and we did not have to add any sauce because the flavor is spot on.  

In addition, I also really appreciate the effort on making the chicken pho delicious as well because usually at pho places the beef broth takes the priority.  I was pleasantly surprised by my rich flavored chicken pho with perfect tender chicken breast pieces!  

We also ordered spring rolls (which the flavor and texture can be improved) and an out of this world mango pineapple smoothie.  We will definitely return!

Great food!!! Friendly staff! I would recommend pho tai, the lotus salad is delicious if you're vegetarian. The chicken salad (goi ga) is bomb! I've had almost everything on menu. Prices are affordable. Great location with plenty of parking space! Oh and they serve bun bo hue on weekends!!!

My sister and I usually go to joy yee for a vermicelli bowl, but we decided to try this place and we're glad we did!

The drinks came in a cute mason jar and the food was very fresh and tasty! We already cant wait to go back!

I was going through one of my friend's snapchats when I came across this delicious bowl of Pho on her snap. I instantly texted her asking for the name of the restaurant. I looked it up on Yelp and two hours later, we ended up eating there for lunch. The customer service at most Asian places are poor, with the exception of this place. My friend and I was seated right away and our waiters were extremely nice. Free soda with a check-in on Yelp with a purchase.

The spring rolls at this place are equivalent to Green Basil. I was planning on getting Pho, however, they had a weekend special on Bun Bo Hue so both my friend and I ended up getting it. When the Bun Bo Hue came out, the broth was so clear and the first thing came to my mind was "OMG, this gonna tastes like water". But I was mistaken, the broth was actually favorable (actually tasted better than Green Basil) As for the drink,  I got an avocado smoothie and it was refreshing since they actually used real fruits. On top of that, it was in this cute mason jar.

This was pretty good but to be completely honest, it made my stomach very bubbly and I had a bad experience in the bathroom after eating lunch here. The food tastes pretty good though and the service was too, it just didn't make my stomach feel too great afterwards

I'm being pho real: this place is alriiiiight. It's clean, modern, and the servers are very nice. 

I've had the pho and it's okay - broth is a little weak in my opinion, but there's plenty of stuff in the bowl, so I'm definitely stuffed when I leave. The last time I went, they also served regular basil instead of Thai basil, which was kind of disappointing. My son once got the Bun Cha Gio Thi Nuong (grilled pork and egg roll on rice noodles) and it was ridiculously awesome. 

But the best part about Pho Thien? The soundtrack. The jamz were so strong, I couldn't help but bust out the ORIGINAL running man in my chair (not this fake, running man reboot dance I see on the YouTubes). They were playing TLC, the Fresh Prince before he was in movies, LL Cool J, basically every incredible early 90's jam that I loved and listened to in my formative teen years. I even asked the server for the station. For the record, it's the Pandora Janet Jackson station. You are welcome!
Ordered the P1 and the avocado smoothie. Both were tasty. I would definitely come back.
I love this place. Pho is my ultimate comfort food and this is the best I have had. The rice plates are delicious too. The service is really friendly in this great family owned place.

Delicious!! Hot, flavorful, and delicious Pho, it truly nourished my tummy and made me feel like I was home. I was greeted and seated quickly, the service was perfect I felt taken care of but not that someone was hovering around, which is nice. I requested more cilantro and lime and they were quick to accommodate. Thank you so much for serving delicious Pho I seriously have come here two days in a row on my business trip and plan on returning for the two remaining days. I can't say I have ever said that about any other place. 
Amazing!

I've been here a few times already and the service is amazing, which is half the battle. Super attentive and quick, and always served with a smile. 

Com thit nuong is the best. The grilled pork is so tender and flavorfull. I prefer the boneless skewer. A lot of Vietnamese places haven't got their thit nuong half as amazing as this place. I live in lisle and It's a quick drive for me. I'll never go down to argyle for a rice plate anymore. I'm still drooling over my dinner last night. I also order 2 banh mi to go for today, and I can't wait to toast it up  and consume.
This is my  new go to pho place in Naperville. Service is always great and the food is always on point. My wife and kids also love this place.

We go here so often they don't even tell us to take a seat anymore. We just walk to a table. Their food is super fresh and the staff is super nice. Everything is clean and parking is ample. The best part is the home-y environment. Green Basil doesn't compare to the ambiance at Pho Thien. It's eating among friends, not at a restaurant. The music is always amazing (I don't know how they do it but it's always music I'm in the mood for). 

I'm absolutely in love with their bun bo hue. It's a spicy noodle soup with beef. I honestly wish they made it a regular menu item!! It's a weekend special and definitely worth coming for. 

There isn't anything on this menu that I've tried that I haven't liked! Including the Thai iced tea, smoothies, egg rolls, spring rolls, pork party rolls and pho. We love the staff and food so much that we are here every weekend (sometimes twice a weekend). 

Try their grilled pork banh mi with an egg. Yum!!

Finally.. a good Vietnamese restaurant in the area! And it's actually owned/operated by Vietnamese people so the food is as authentic as you can get in the 'burbs. 

We arrived about 30 minutes before they were closing and were greeted with smiles from the staff which shows great customer service, in my opinion. We tried the pork chop over rice, pho tai, and goi ga (chicken cabbage salad). Our food came out quickly, the portions were huge, and the quality was great. They even heated up our soymilk beverage when we requested -- I've been to other Vietnamese restaurants where they refuse to do so and just give you the can.

We had a great first experience here and will be back. The service was friendly, the restaurant was very clean, and the food was good. What more can you ask for?

I came here with my friend how lives in the area but didn't know about this place. We found it on yelp and it had good ratings. We both ordered the Pho Dac Biet (Pho Thien Specialty). The service was quick but we are talking pho here. The pho was really good and it had enough meat in it. The place was busy and clean. I also used the bathroom before we left and it was impeccable. Overall nice experience but way out of town for me.

Clean, modern, and new. Decided to try out a new pho joint in town. The food was ok.  We had: egg rolls, pho tai bo Vien, Com Dac Biet, lemonade, and soy milk. The service was good they were friendly and kind. They ran out of their house special bun no hue and pork chop.  Kind of sad but when your out your out. Pho broth lacked they full aroma of spices. The egg rolls were small and needed more filling.  The fresh squeezed lemonade great.  The rice special good but it would have been better with a fried sunny side egg too. This is your basic Vietnamese restaurant. No piazza or frills. But check-in on Yelp and receive a free soda.

Just moved to the area from up north and was craving some pho and spring roll. I was hoping to find a place that is close by that serves some homemade pho and spring roll, however this was not it. It was very bland and on top of that the sauce that I was given for the pho was in a mini container that barely gave the broth any flavor at all. The spring roll was ok, kind of annoying that they decided to cut off the ends of the spring rolls cuz the noodles were falling all over the place. The spring rolls were not tightly rolled at all either so that did not help. Very disappointing. On to the next pho restaurant I guess...

this star is for the service only, the food is still decent. it's hit or miss with the wait staff, unfortunately we missed this evening. I would train the waitress staff some more! thanks but no thanks..

Legit!!! I can't believe I found a good viet place in the Naperville. Now we visit once a week. They have Bun Bo Hue Fri-Sun and I like it better than Cafe Hoang. The flavor is there but not as salty. Their Pho is super good with noodle cooked just right. Condiments are fresh and cut just right. Staff is really professional and friendly.

Hidden gem! Who says you can't find good pho in the burbs?! Competitive pricing, abt $10 for a healthy portion, and well worth it. Fast service and tentative staff.

Down side: ordered wings for $5 anticipating the whole wang. Asians love gnawing on each of the 3 sections. When the basket came out... We got the 5 lil sections - drumlettes. Com'on now. Tasty, yes. Worth $5, no. 

Aside from that, we were there for the pho. We will return, just won't order the wings again :)

Pho Thien is AMAZING! The PHO broth is literally cooked homemade, for many many hours, by the grandmother who's right back in the kitchen! We are now obsessed with the refreshing Lotus Root Salad... You must try it! Their decor is really nice too: simple, modern & very clean. The staff are mostly all family, and incredibly kind + friendly! Don't miss Pho Thien!!!!!

In general, I find anyone that considers themselves a "pho fanatic" to be an overly critical douchebag.

Now that we've gotten that out of the way, this place is pretty freaking good.  Went here one night and liked it so much, we came back in less than 24 hours and brought MORE PEOPLE.

The pho is really good. 
They have BÃ¡nh mÃ¬!  Also really good, and they put a fried egg on it if you want.  Multiple meats available.
The pork chop is really good,
The people are really friendly.
The place is very cozy.  Not too small, but not cavernous.
Parking?  Ample!

I really wish I had a place like this close by as I'd probably come here every week.

Definitely coming back.

Been craving pho for weeks! Came in with a friend who had heard good things. All good things were true! Place was clean & people were really nice & attentive! I ordered Pho Tai & it was delicious! Definitely satisfied my craving for pho! I'll be going back to hopefully try a couple more things! Already looking forward to it!

Small menu:

Pho (beef): meh, small portion, lack side veggies 
Pork chop special: small, super thin, only a small amount of meat to go with all that bone.

Always leaving hungry and not worth the price the entrees cost.

Service is good otherwise. Will opt for Green Basil instead or just make the dishes on my own.
We have been looking for an authentic Vietnamese restaurant around Naperville and just found it.

I'm so happy there's another Vietnamese restaurant in Naperville! It is slightly hidden behind Play It Again Sports (we missed it the first time). There is a lot of seating, nice atmosphere, and family friendly. Their pho was not as salty as I would like, but the fish sauce was already on the table to fix that right up. They even brought out some food scissors so I could cut up my daughter's noodles and a kid-friendly cup of water without even asking. My husband also got a Thai iced tea which was delicious and came in a cute mason jar. But I did think $4 was a tad bit overpriced for it. Overall, we had a good experience. We will definitely be returning.

Wonderful service and great food! The pho is outstanding and the steak is very tender that you can order in the pho. It's a real meal that fills you up and looking forward to enjoying it this winter, will really fill you up

The main attraction of any Vietnamese restaurant is generally their hearty bowl of pho. The pho broth is made by simmering various beef parts with aromatics in water (for 10+ hours), served with the cuts of beef (brisket, flank steak, tendons, etc) used for making the broth along with some vegetables( raw onions, bean sprouts, mint,and basil), served with with condiments ( cilantro, limes, jalapenos, sriracha, hoisin, etc)   to accompany the broth. I love and appreciate a good bowl of pho. A good broth is hard to find. I was very excited to try this place. While I can appreciate a small family own business, it is an appropriate fix if you are in need of some pho, in the burbs. I ordered the Pho Dac Biet priced at $10.50 a bowl. The bowl itself is quite large, you get lots of soup, a ball of noodles about the size of a softball, and 3-4 bites of the different cuts of meat(steak, flank, brisket, tendon, and beef meat ball). What I really enjoy about pho is the broth. The taste of hearty beef flavor with the complexity of cinnamon, cloves, fennel, and star anise mingled into each slurp. Which I felt that the broth here was a little watered down. I think I read in another review here that if you come during lunch, the broth is great, but gets a little bland towards dinner... I will have to make it a point to visit here during lunch and order some appetizers and rice dishes.
Good Vietnamese food!  I recommend trying it.  We mainly just had the Pho, which was good.  I will go back and try more.

This place surprised me! I stopped in on a whim as I was really craving pho and this place was on the way to my errands. Friendly staff. Good portion. Base was flavorful. Definitely better of the phos I've had in the suburbs. Will be back!

Being Vietnamese I'm pretty picky so here's an authentic run down.

Nem nuong cuon- this is similar to Brodard in Garden Grove, CA. Has more lettuce than Brodard's and less nem (Vietnamese sausage) but solid. No orange dipping sauce like Brodard's but still really good. If you love spring rolls give this wrap a try!

Goi cuon- Viet shrimp spring roll. ubiquitous at Vietnamese restaurants. Good.

Bo Kho- reminds me of my childhood. It's a beef stew but thinner in sauce. Love it with the French baguette. Homemade bread 

Banh Beo - solid. It's close to the quality you'd get in Houston or Cali. It trades the chewiness for tenderness but this is a matter of preference. I prefer chewiness and others prefer tenderness which is what you'll get here. These are little steamed tapioca flour cakes with shrimp, chicharron, and green onions in top. Put a generous amount of fish sauce on it and eat. 

Flan- get it without the ice and ask for some viet coffee on it. The ice to me dilutes the flan flavor. Vietnamese flan by the way is much softer than Mexican flan. Viet flan is similar to creme brÃ»lÃ©e without the burn sugar on top. 


Pho- this is the reason you're probably going here. The broth to me is lacking spice. I'm a Viet northerner so the style of pho I'm used to is less sweet in broth, thicker, and heavier on spices. That said I thought it was a good southern style pho. The bowls are huge as usual and they don't skimp on the ingredients. Fresh noodles not the dry noodles which makes a big difference. 

Given the style of pho here I think I will try their chicken pho Bc style wise Northern Vietnamese make this sorta similar to Southerners. Chicken pho is light and  clear like chicken  consommÃ©. 

I'd definitely come back and plan to tomorrow! Can't believe they have a place that makes Nem Nuong cuon here !

The wife and I just returned home from enjoying a really simple but tasty dinner at Pho Thien Vietnamese Kitchen in Naperville. The shrimp spring roll appitizer with peanut sauce was promptly brought to the table along with our drink order and was a pleasantly light prelude to the entree. We both ordered beef Pho. They offer it on the menu in variations. The menu lists each dish in Vietnamese while showing the main ingredients  in English. If you like beef noodle soup, you will love the complex and satisfying flavor of the Pho. It is served with a selection of tasty add ons. You can spice it up with a varity of condiments. My wife was initially skeptical. Now we can't wait to return. 5 Stars for service, flavor, authenticity and cleanliness.

I love supporting local small businesses and so pleased to see a new Vietnamese place in town! They just opened in January according to the sign outside. I really hope they make it. The service was so friendly and my husband and I really enjoyed the food. The broth in the pho was definitely flavorful which is the top thing I look for. Keep up the good work! We'll be back

Found my new favorite pho place! Food is fantastic, I ordered #1 pho with everything, broth is flavorful with good balance of spices and not loaded with bunch of  msg. Ingredients is super fresh and presentation is beautiful. Serivce is good, staff greeted with smiles as soon as we walked in. Also, their smoothies is excellent, a must try!

I was excited when I saw this restaurant opened. It is not easy to find a good Pho place. I am not Vietnamese but I have craving for Pho from time to time. I went there by me self and only ordered Pho. The rice noodle was a bit hard but I was OK with it. My disappointment was the broth, which I think it is the most important thing for Pho, felt like it has been watered down. By the time I finished my noodle, the broth tasted like water. I am not sure if it is because I went there late in the evening.

The husband & I wanted to try this place out since we saw a post about it from a friend.  I'm picky when it comes to Pho,especially pho in the suburbs! 
The place was nice, staff were friendly, & food was very tasty! We ordered the spring rolls- which had an even amount of ingredients in the roll. At some places I feel like I'm eating a "lettuce/mint" roll with a piece of shrimp. I got the Pho tai bo vien- that's with thin slices steak with beef meat balls. Like I said, I'm very picky with my pho, & let's just say I'll be back again! Broth is flavorful, seasoning is not as harsh/strong tasting as some places make theirs. They aren't stingy with the noodles, sliced steak & meatballs. My husband ordered the Bun thit nuong cha gio- rice noodles served with grilled pork & eggrolls. He's a very picky eater & he actually really enjoyed it & said he would order it again. I'm actually surprised he didn't order "safe"  with a banh mi sandwich. Lastly, we ordered some thai iced tea to go & you can't go wrong with that drink! (Next time we'll check in & get that free drink:)  )

Thanks Pho Thien Vietnamese kitchen! We'll definitely be back & tell our family & friends to check you guys out :)

We ordered the spring rolls, Pho Ga (chicken) and Pho Dac Biet (flank steak, brisket, beef balls).  It was very fresh, hot, and delicious!  Spring rolls had fresh mint, lettuce and shrimp served with a house peanut sauce.  We hope people read this and want to come in so it stays in business!  It's a small little place with nice friendly workers.  It has to be family run.  Try it you won't be sorry!

This place is on my Saturday ritual.(after honey do list)
I go there around noon every Saturday and if gods smile on me (if wife allows) on Sundays too.
The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. Post on the  door says "Wait to be seated". But as soon as you get in .... some smiling face will let you know where to sit where ever.
You are attended to in time you sit down. 
Menu is explained to you. Dont be intimidated ... ask questions. Staff is well informed.
Place is clean and music is bumping.
Food is awesome. I have tasted their entire menu ..... kick ass.
The Pho is awesome. Banh Mi is off the hook.

Piece De Resistance .... Bun Bo Hue ..... on the weekends.
My man Dung and Super awesome Falicia hook me up with dish with Thai Bird Chili in the broth.
OMG.
I have had every dish on their menu, 
They kick ass. A must visit.

I wasn't sure how I would like the food here since it seemed like vietnamese restaurants aren't as prevalent around here, but this was a very pleasant surprise! Service and food was good and impressive, given that they just recently opened. I ordered pho (#23), and it reminded me of the pho we have back home in San Jose (If you know anything about California or the Bay Area, you KNOW San Jose is the place to go for Vietnamese food! haha). If I'm ever back in the area, I look forward to coming back to this spot and trying out the different items on their menu :)

We just tried Pho Thien Vietnamese Kitchen for the first time and were blown away! The food was AMAZING! It's tucked into a corner between the DMV and Garden Fresh. I took it to go and they packed everything separately so it would travel well. We also had a spring roll, which I highly recommend. Super nice owners and they give you A LOT of food for the money. We had leftovers for lunch the next day.
Wanted to check this place out for quite sometime...have had my fair share of Pho and this restaurant is great!! Service was over the top..friendly and the price! We will be back!!

I am always skeptical when trying a new Pho place due to the fact that I myself work at a Vietnamese restaurant and I have to say my boss set the standard pretty high. (I will not advertise the restaurant I work at as it would be very unfair and unprofessional to do so on another business' Yelp page).

My friend and I order an appetizer and a couple entrees to share. We orders the House special wings, pho tai gan (sliced beef and tendon) with added meatballs and bun Thit Nuong cha gio (rice vermicelli with grilled pork and egg rolls).

The server brought out our two entrees first and immediately came back with the appetizer. I was confused cuz I would assumed we would be eating our appetizer first but I got over it. The wings were really tasty. It's a dry rub spicy wing as opposed to a saucy wing. I prefer the dry rub so I loved it. My friend likes saucy wings so she said it was ok. 

The pho was also ok in our opinion. The broth didn't have much flavor to it. The slice beef was tender and so was the tendon. The meatballs were... let's just say I've had better, homemade meatballs, rather than store bought, processed meatballs. 

The bun dish was also ok. The noodles was served cold, not my preference but the grilled pork was tender and flavorful.

The staff was all very friendly from the moment we walked to the time we left out the door.y
Great place. And great food. The servers are very polite and collected.

This is our new place for Vietnamese in the Naperville area, before we had to drive all the way up to Joliet to get good Pho. I have had the Pho Tai Bo Bien, Pho Ga, and the Bun Dac Biet (the grilled pork with noodles dish) all three were excellent. I'm looking forward to trying the Bun Bo Hue special on the weekend.
Very good pho. My kids say it's the best in NapervilleShe loves the meatballs. I love the taste of the broth.

I'll preface this review by stating that whenever I see a new Yelp page with an abundance of five star reviews, and said reviews are the ONLY reviews the Yelper has ever left, I am extremely skeptical to say the least!

Having a Vietnamese wife with amazing culinary skills, I am no stranger to the flavors of traditional Viet cuisine. She has insisted we try many of the Vietnamese restaurants in both Chicago and the surrounding suburbs, despite the fact that we almost always leave dissatisfied. Unfortunately, Pho Thien was no exception. As a someone with a major preference toward eating pescetarian, I was very disappointed to see that the menu offers no vegetarian or strictly pescetarian entrees. It is 2016 now and vegetarians or pescetarians are no longer anywhere near the extreme end of the restrictive diet spectrum. I know plenty of vegetarian Buddhist Vietnamese as well so traditional ingredients is not an excuse either. I really didn't want to order anything, but given that it was well past dinner time, and I hadn't eaten for most of the day, I reluctantly did so. I opted for the Bun Dac Biet, asking that the grilled pork and pork containing egg roll be omitted, and the Banh Beo Tom Chay as an appetizer. I thought the appetizer was tasty, my wife on the other hand did not, citing the lack of fried onion and substitution of sauteed shrimp for what should have been dried shrimp. This Bun Dac Biet dish was neither amazing nor terrible (not that it could be given its very basic ingredients). However, my wife was very disappointed to see that the wide variety of mints and leaves traditionally included in this dish had been severely scaled back to only cilantro. She ordered a bowl of beef Pho for herself, and a bowl of chicken Pho for our sons. They aren't old enough to to know how bland the soup was, but my wife certainly did and she forced me to try a spoonful of the beef broth. There was merely a slight aftertaste of the cinnamon, cloves, fennel, and star anise that define the distinctive Pho flavor. Coincidentally I asked my wife what Thien meant, she informed me that it indicated this place was claiming to be Pho Heaven. If this is the case, an eternity in Pho hell should be something they threaten all badly behaved Vietnamese children with. The only thing that saved this experience from being one star was the service. Both our waitress and the manger were very attentive and pleasant.

I visited the Chicago area from California with a few of my friends. Some of us were craving pho so we decided to look for a Vietnamese restaurant nearby and stumbled up this newly opened one. Upon entering, we were immediately greeted with friendly smiles by their staff who wore traditional Vietnamese dresses (which we found really cool!) While my friends ordered Pho, I ordered #3 and #32. The pork spring rolls and the sauce, I might boldly add, are better than the ones from Brodard's in Los Angeles. The vermicelli noodles and grilled pork were full of flavor and had me debating whether I should take another round to-go. The food and service here was top-notch, and probably the best we experienced while visiting Chicago and its suburbs.
Great to find pho here in the area.  As good as I have had and the staff is very sweet and provide great service.

I visited the area from San Francisco, California, and I was looking for a warm bowl of pho. That's when I found this gem that just opened! The staff wore Ao Dai (traditional Vietnamese dresses) for their grand opening and greeted me with friendly smiles. Everyone was very courteous and polite. I got the Pho Dac Biet (#23) and it was exactly what I needed. The broth was on point and the noodles and beef were fresh. If I'm ever in the area again, I'll have to come back to try their rice plates!

I visited this new PhÃ´ place with great anticipation. The soup was pretty good, but not the best I've had in this area. I noticed how attentive the service was for other guests. I visited alone, and often got over looked while the servers catered to the parties of more than one. They had one customer's order memorized as he was a regular. Not knocking this place at all, overall it was ok. I'll def come back w more people and try other menu offerings.

I came in for a quick lunch after hours of waiting at the DMV. I'm always very picky about pho, if the broth is not good or authentic, I will not eat it. This place took me by surprise! I ordered the pho tai, and it is delicious!! The service was very fast and friendly and prices are very reasonable. Highly recommended!
Very nice restaurant.  It has some of my favorite appetizers, Pho Dac Biet was great and Che Ba Mau was awesome!  One of my favorite Vietnamese restaurants.
The Vietnamese shrimp spring rolls are perfect and the pho has an authentic flavor. The staff is very friendly and easy to talk to. Very fresh!!

A few days before Pho Thien's opening, the owner (?) had been driving around and giving free to-go box samples of food to businesses around their restaurant. I received one and really liked the variety and quality of the samples. Later that week, my mom went to the opening day celebration to try the food as well. 

My mom and I went into the restaurant again for a late lunch yesterday. When we first entered into the restaurant we were immediately greeted by the waitresses and quickly seated and served. I was also impressed by the cleanliness of the restaurant. We ordered a Pho Dac Biet, Bun Dac Biet and Com Tam Dac Biet (a special pho dish, rice dish and vermicelli dish). The Bun Dac Biet and Com Tam Dac Biet were to-go. Though service and the quality of the food was good, my mom and I were disappointed by the quantity of the food. My mom had also tried the pho, pork rice dish and a banh mi on opening day; however, she told me that the quantity and variety of items during the opening day were greater than when we tried it yesterday. The pho we had yesterday was mainly soup and noodles but there was only a few thinly slices of meat and only two halves of a meatball, one small tendon and a tiny sliver of tripe. Though there were a lot of listed meats on the menu, we did not seem to get that bountiful display. 

Additionally, after taking our to-go orders home, the first thing my mom commented on was the fact that the pork rice dish was missing some items that she had seen during opening day (such as grilled shrimp). And once again the quantity of food was low. On the vermicelli dish, we only had two grilled shrimp and a few small cuts of meat and some pickled vegetables as well as some cucumbers. The rice dish had one slab of meat, a salad, pork skin, a sugar cane shrimp and an egg. Though the flavor was very good, the amount of food that we were getting for the price just did not seem to add up. Back in Oregon, we used to go to a few different Vietnamese restaurants and the costs there were lower there and the amount of food we got was also more. However, since they are a very new restaurant, the consistency and quantity of food might just be something they need to work on for next time! 

Pros:

-Good and fast service
-Clean restaurant 
-Good tasting food 

Cons:

-Overpriced for amount and variety of food you get
-Consistency of food day to day
They serve real Vietnamese noodles.  Good service, good food and the place is clean.

I love the name Pho Thien, which implies that the pho is "heavenly" or of heaven, definitely a nice metaphor and great name for a restaurant! Don't get me wrong, I love the pho--a good amount with clear tasty broth. However, in my opinion, this place should really be highlighting their Bun Bo Hue and Pork & Rice plates (try the Grilled Pork), which I feel are the dishes that make this place shine! If you are craving pho, definitely stop in. But once you are satisfied with knowing that the pho is good, I urge you to be adventurous and step beyond your comfort zone by trying something else on the menu! The servings are good-sized. The Bun Bo Hue is served on weekends only but worth the trip. And the service is excellent, it looks to be a family-owned operation. I'm so glad that they are located here in south/west Naperville, close to home and where there is nothing just like them! Best wishes to the business!

My hubby is a pho junky and he is pleased by this place! The soup is way better in lunch time and becomes bland late night, so go there early! Four stars because variety wise, u don't have many options, it is a pho only joint
Only have had the Pho so far but it was outstanding.  The wait staff was super friendly too.  I haven't found a better Pho since moving here so I highly recommend it.

As promised, I went back to check out their "weekend special - Bun Bo Hue," and found this dish to be very good!  I definitely would come back for this soup and would recommend this to my friends.  Way to go guys on making this soup as "authentic" as possible, for a neighborhood restaurant.  Once again, the service was fantastic with friendly staff.  I will be back for more Bun Bo Hue!!!

We went there for their grand opening

Decoration was decent, service was a bit slow but friendly
We ordered their combo Pho, while the food was decent.  It was very over price, especially for lunch.

The pho here is good but not great. I ve been here several times and will be back. Their service is very good the girls running the food are wonderful.  My main gripe is that it's a pho kitchen but the pho is just ok . Several times I've ordered it and it didn't come out piping hot it was just warm.  I think the rice dishes are better.  May be on my next trip back I lol be surprised and adjust my review.
Solid Pho-- good broth and noodles, the steak slices were good, but not great .  Will come back and try more of the menu.

It is one of my favorite restaurants. Compare to other Vietnamese restaurants, the pho tends to be little bit expensive. But the place is cleaner. The staff is more friendly. The wait time is shorter. I recommend the spring roll, pho, chicken wings, grilled pork.

I went for a late lunch, so there was not a big crowd. The service was very attentive. That was my first real spring roll, I'm not a big fan of mint in my food but I enjoyed them very much. The Pho was a very large portion for me especially getting the spring rolls. I was able to take half of it all home. She put it in the take out containers for me and in the bag she included chop sticks, plastic wear and napkins which I thought was above and beyond for to go. The next time I have a taste for Pho I will return.
Very authentic Vietnamese food. The service is great and the suggestions they gave me were extremely good. Overall a good place for eats!

Our new favorite place for Pho in the area! Excellent service and food.  We ordered Spring rolls, Pho and the pork chop plate and would order them all again! Pho is often hit or miss with the broth - their broth was flavorful and mild enough for our kids to enjoy.  Would definitely recommend this place to families with kids.  It's located right by the DMV so there's plenty of parking and very easy to get to! They don't have boba shakes, but they do have Thai iced tea and iced coffee.  I missed the desserts section of the menu but will definitely try them out at our next visit!

This place is a hidden gem. We ordered two different pho, two different spring rolls, egg rolls, the BBQ pork bahn mi, and the BBC pork entree. All of it was absolutely delicious. I've had pho at many restaurants and this might be my favorite. The broth was so rich and flavorful, and the steak was sliced very thin. We ate almost everything, except a little bit of one bowl of pho. Our waitress packed it up, and when she came back, she said she gave us some extra. That was so sweet of her. The service was great and the food was even better. I highly recommend this place!

New favorite pho place!! Went to try this new restaurant out for the first time and everything tasted super yummy! Got the pho special and the broth tasted just right! Also tried the thai iced tea and the banh mi xa xiu sandwich and it tasted really good! If your in the area give this place a shot, really good food and service too!!!

Went there on the grand opening day. Being vietnamese myself, the food isn't that great at all. We ordered the meatball pho, the special rice plate (com bi Suong cha), and the grilled meat rice plate with an egg. The pho is too salty and too much msg. The bi smell. The special rice plate have too much food and not enough rice. On the other hand, the grilled meat rice plate have too much rice and not enough meat. I think Joy Yee have better food. Also, there is no napkins on the table or sweet and Lo packs for tea. They only have sugar water.

Excellent place for lunch or dinner. Great small plates for sharing, excellent wine selection and even very good sushi. I also like the fact that you can order at the grill and have it delivery it back to the cube.

Service is a little hit and miss but still a great place.

We have been to the Cube several times since moving to Naperville. Standard market does a generally lovely job of making a grocery store a place you'd want to hang out. The Cube is a great concept- it's isolated enough from the regular grocery section (I'm looking at you, Mariano's), has dedicated staff, and a simply impressive wine and cheese selection. 

I've had a good experience during the day with the cheese mongers. They are experienced and knowledgable.

By night, however, the servers get crabby and scarce. It is hard to get a server to come to your table, and on two occasions, it's been nearly impossible to get your free cheese board on ladies night. Due to slow service, not large volume of business. There can be some great deals, it's a nice atmosphere, but just don't have high expectations for customer service!

I want to love this place as we live so close and they have great food and drinks, but the service is just terrible. 4 times we have been and I swear the servers and bartenders go out of their way to avoid making eye contact with you. Never once have we been asked if we need anything or brought water without flagging someone down after about 10 minutes to ask.

Just dropped 3 figuere$ yesterday at the cube... the classy restaurant of the Standard Market. Who would have thought. It's an excellent date spot! We missed the memo on being able to buy liquor, and drink it at your table. Therefore we paid way to much for 3 glasses of wine. The grocery store is very expensive as well, but it looks like they have some high quality produce.
This was made evident by the amazing Sopressata. the Prosciutto was also good, however these 2 meets, +3 cheeses, equate to a $24 board... We shared the 16oz Ribeye which was to die for, and also around the $25 price point. The waitress made a point to said they prefer to cook it medium rare, though it appeared to be very medium, and we both would have preferred it more rare. The Brussel sprouts came out way overcooked, literally blackened. We should have taken a picture because it was almost a joke how crispy and oily they were. 
Don't get me wrong, we'll be back, abusing the beer wine purchase program, and savoring another Ribeye ;-)

We enjoy coming here any time of the day.  We're not picky about the time of day we consume our wine.  We've been for mimosas and brunch, as well as for wine and a cheese plate after work.  Sometimes the service can be a little spotty (I mean... it's not that big. They have to notice when someone new walks in...), but not enough to prevent us from coming back.  Last time we were in we bought a bottle of red wine at the retail price and we were able to drink it while sitting at the bar; they'll also package it up for you to take home if you don't finish it.  Their beer selection is great too.  Lots of local brews to try all in one place.  Overall, great place for a class of wine or a beer.

The reason I give this 4 stars instead of 5 is because the menu is limited and once when I ordered macaroni and cheese, it didn't taste very good but I didn't complain and I ate it ... but I didn't care for it.

HOWEVER, because I tend to find what I like on a menu and stick with it, I keep going back for the wine and the rainbow sushi roll!  It.  Is.  Amazing.

The Cube is a GREAT place to go to watch sports without a sports bar feel and it has great wines and, aside from the macaroni and cheese, which is just my opinion, has a very nice menu.  The service is good and the atmosphere is trendy and classy casual.  I feel that if Frasier and Niles ever had a bar they frequented, The Cube would be it!
The service is impeccable and consist. The staff is always knowledge and willing to offer advice whenever it's solicited.

Be Careful with their wine labeling practices! Overpriced and mis-labeled!

Misleading advertising on their wines. They placed a $40 dollar bottle of wine under a $15 dollar of wine rack and once we drank it, they would not acknowledge their mistake.

In other words, after we received the bill, we told tell them about their mistake in placing the $40 wine bottle under the $15 wine bottle rack and they brushed us off (actually, they quickly went to the wine rack to fix their mistake; they placed the bottles in the correct place). We had to pay the $40.00 since we did not make a fuss.

We wrote an email after the fact to explain--since we thought it was not our waiter's fault in the first place--and they never wrote us back. We would at least like to hear "I am sorry for your experience." 

Standard Market used to be a classier place, or at least they should own up to their mistakes.  After all, we are sure they are making a good profit.

Standard Marketing Naperville has changed for the worse!

My husband and i drive almost a hour every weekend and usually always has good service but tonight was HORRIBLE. Waited over 20 minutes just to get a food order in and had to ask other people to get more drinks because our server never asked if we needed anything else after getting us our first drink order and ignored us the whole time. If it wasn't for the other servers and cooks we would not return again.
Very good for lunch. Tastes fresh and relatively quick. They need to work on their salads options. There are only 3 or 4.
Great vibe, friendly wait staff, sushi is always fresh but they got rid of the smoked salmon sandwich which was seriously what I always ordered, So delicious! Wish they would bring it back.

I'm so glad we found this spot. We decided to try this place for a late lunch and went with a charcuterie selection and the mussels. They have prices for single serving, 3 selections, 5, and I think one more. We went with five because we were hungry and so often restaurants will kind of skimp on the portion size of a charcuterie board. Not here. Holy crap was that a lot of cheese. Not only were the meats and cheeses all delicious, you literally get a nearly full wedge of cheese plopped on the board for each choice. So, I'd say for the prices (I think $15 or so for 3, and $24 for 5 selections) it's an amazing value. Meat portions were not as generous but I haven't found any other place in the area that serves Olympia Provisions meats. 

The mussels were also delicious. My wife's a bit of a mussel fanatatic and said this is probably in the top 3 mussel dishes she's had.

Service was very attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly without being too overbearing. 

We ordered drinks off the menu, but you can also purchase a bottle of wine or beer from the grocery right there at retail price and drink it in the bar. 

Definitely will be coming back here.

Due to my car being serviced at the Infinity dealership down the block, I ate at the Cube and had some decent tapped beers for about 2 hours.  The sea bass sushi was really good, as well as the  sashimi.  Cold and delicious.  I like the fact that if you do not like what they have on tap you can grab a single bottle and drink it at cost. Aaron the chef is very distasteful in the fact that I ordered quite a bit of food by myself, but he let the 'men' around me sample some of his dishes, while ignoring me that probably spent more then the others that were around me, making me feel alienated.  The mussels must have been over cooked because the mussel was so tiny inside.  All in all, a good experience.
