Second of all, the waitstaff was very friendly. This was only their second night, but they were professional and eager to please. Almost everyone came by to ask us how we were liking everything. The owner, the manager, several of the waitresses and a nice woman named Jennifer (one of the owners?) came by to talk to us and make sure everything was good. She explained that they wanted to make their restaurant a little bit different than other places, from the food to the atmosphere..

Thirdly, the food was fantastic! I had the filet mignon and shrimp and my boyfriend had steak, shrimp and chicken. Pretty much the same deal as other hibachi places. You get a mushroom soup, salad, fried rice and shrimp appetizer. The food looked great and tasted even better. I am in love with that clear mushroom soup they serve. The beef was melt in your mouth delicious and the drinks were reasonably priced. Then, there was the sushi. I had the philly roll and 2 tamago. The boyfriend had our usual spider roll. It was fresh and cool and very tasty. My philly roll was velvety-smooth and the spider roll had a hint of sweetness that he loved. Just as we finished stuffing ourselves, the waitress came and mentioned, oh, by the way, you get ice cream with your meal too. And we got a plate of oranges (probably because we kept telling them how great it all was!). 

We will absolutely be back and i would recommend it to anyone who loves hibachi and/or sushi (they have a cool little sushi bar in the back and the pieces are on a little conveyor belt.) It's a little pricey, as most of these places are, but it was our anniversary so we spoiled ourselves.

I love this place! It is literaly 3 minutes from my house. The owner is very nice.The food is great. 
We usually dine at another HIbachi restaurant  in Wheaton. The only thing that i hate is why I leave there my clothes and hair reak like grease. This place (Tairyo) must have some great venilation because I have not smelled like that at all coming out of there.
The only suggestion is: if you go there for a Hibachi dinner, dont expect to eat right away or get out of there quickly.
Last time I was there we waited for about 45 minutes- hour for a seat. The whole dinner process was like a 2.5 hour ordeal!!!
Great for a social night out with time to kill.

I'm so excited that we decided to try Tairyo. I used to eat here when it was that Chinese place.. I was skeptical to stop in because I remember the other place being kinda dark, dirty, and run down.

Alas! Tairyo is nothing like any other Japanese Hibachi experience that I've had. It's very trendy, clean, nicely decorated. Huge bar, many many hibachi tables for groups. Also, unlike lots of places, you have the option to just order your food- without the 'show', and..they will do take-out unlike Domo..

Our chef was really friendly, engaging, and talented. He truly made us feel special, not like he was just doing a mundane routine (which I'm sure can get tiring..).

Typical menu with all the great staples. I highly suggest the egg yolk sauce (don't even look up the calories..) and the side of garlic. Each side is a PERFECT topping for anything that you will order. The portions are huge, we went here for lunch, split a meal, left full, and still had left overs.

We will definitely be back, as a matter of fact.. we've already booked their private party room for an upcoming birthday. Can't wait!

They deliver which is fantastic.  We always get hibachi with a bit of sushi.  Food is always delicious.  I like that they added shrimp fried rice to the menu. Best part is they make special rice rolls (just sushi rice with seaweed paper) for my son.  Prices are extremely reasonable for the quality of food and service you get.  We go there about once a month.

Best Hibachi place for miles around for sure! We have eaten Hibachi in almost all the western suburbs a number of times and this one is the best by far! Actually best all-around restaurant! Great service, comparable prices to other Japanese steakhouses, but superb service that surpasses any other place.
We also have gluten allergies and can't have soy sauce, usually the servers and cooks don't understand or have sympathy when we tell them we have special requirements. But at Tairyo they were awesome! They were happy to make everything with the special soy sauce we brought and they also made sure to double check with us for everything before serving it!

Went with a group and they served the Sushi on super fancy platters. I was very impressed. Food was some of the best and freshest I have ever had. the atmosphere is a "Must See". 

I would avoid high-end drinks. I ordered what I thought was a reasonably priced $11 scotch. I said light ice. I watched her measure a 1 oz shot and poor it over a half glass of ice. It was the stingiest portion of scotch I have ever gotten... When I refused to except it she said "That is light ice". To that I replied it is also light on the scotch. 

Other then that everything was great and we ended drinking saki instead.
I've only ordered sushi for pick up from here. It's regular, tasty, nothing special or extravagant, just your average rolls.

this place hands down is the best Japanese steak house , lots of flavor and really good sushi!! 

We arrived with my in-laws to celebrate there 19th wedding anniversary
nothing special there , friendly greeting and got seated right away. the hibachi show/food was excellent , lots of flavor , only complain is our waitress was not as attentive as i would have liked and seemed to be and didn't speak the greatest English. but its not a deal breaker, will hopfully be back !, this places is great for groups or large parties, as its a bit pricey

I was there during their grand opening and partook in the teppanyaki grill for lunch.

The service was extremely attentive.  I nearly felt like I was being stalked as they watched for my tea cup to empty so they can refill it.

The cooking was typical teppanyaki, with the same tricks and jokes (that's not a complaint, just more of an observation).

The food is excellent.  Fresh ingredients, great taste, and a lot to eat for the money.  In addition to the steak, I also tried a piece of sushi.  I'm basing this review on the teppanyaki and my steak (I'd probably knock a star off based on my one piece of sushi [not quite fresh enough for my liking] - however their sushi bar had a  covered conveyor like one I've seen in Japan).

The building is an old Chinese restaurant built with over-the-top Oriental style, but the inside is significantly improved.  They did a nice job inside.
I also noted that their china was really nice and had more style than even more expensive places of any ilk.

It's worth checking out and I'd go again.

This was my first time having hibachi and it was a load of fun! they give you a lot of food and the guy making it on the flat top was hilarious. also, sushi was really delicious and a very large portion. i went here w/ family for my brother's birthday and they sang to him, took our picture with THEIR camera and printed a copy for us. i'm assuming it's going on their website which is fine, but yeah overall-- cute staff with personality, delicious food and generous portions. can't wait to bring my friends!

My girlfriend and I really enjoy our sushi and so we can sometimes be slightly critical, but this was one of the best places we've been to in the Naperville area. The food was phenomenal, the ambiance was great and the service was also very on point. Definitely recommend this place if you're a sushi lover like we are!

I am a big fan of Japanese Steakhouses and this is the best that I have found in recent times.  There is just one thing that I can't figure out.  The half dozen or so times that I have been here, the place has been relatively dead with only about a dozen or so customers in the place.

The food here is absolutely fantastic.  I usually order the steak, chicken, and shrimp dinner.  The amount of food for just over $30 is unbelievable.  On average, I always receive roughly eight ounces of filet., in addition to the generous portions of chicken and shrimp.  The chicken fried rice is the best I have had at this type of restaurant, and they serve it with no extra charge.

The service here is great and they always keep glasses full of whatever you may be drinking.  So far, this is the best Japanese Steakhouse that I have been too, even eclipsing my old favorite, Kampai Japanese Steakhouse.  I just wish Tairyo would develop a spicy garlic sauce too!!!

Incredible! Don't avoid this place just because the dining room is empty.  There is some serious catering and take-out business happening.
I had the ham and brie sandwich.  Delicious! it was carved and browned ham with warm rich brie on a croissant smeared with spicy mustard. Atop the brie was an apple-golden raisin compote.  
A lovely salad accompanied the sandwich.  Romaine, baby spinach, baby beets, tender carrots, thinly sliced radish, halved grape tomatoes and large capers.  On the side was a generous dollop of moist and creamy goat cheese.
When I was preparing to pay, they dropped off a packet of little cookies!
I'll definitely be back here!

Come here if youve got some free time and are looking for an out of the ordinary eating experience.
The chefs craft beuatiful and remarkably delicious plates. I really want to host an event just to have them cater!

We went for lunch! Gave us lots of good recommendations. We opted for salad and pizza. Both were very fresh and delicious. Would give them 5 stars but the wait for the food was pretty long especially for lunch. If you can get past that I would recommend this place for sure.

This was my very first time hosting a large event. I'm so happy I chose Smokey Tomato for the catering. They went above and beyond my expectations. The food was delicious. I highly recommend their  Chicken Flautas. They're very professional, helpful and friendly. I look forward to using their services again in the future.

Food is superb. Too bad it arrived 90 minutes after promised delivery time. I had a house full of guests and no food. I ordered crab claws in shot glasses and got no shot glasses. Delivery guy told me they left Downers Grove 20 minutes after the time it was supposed to be delivered & I live in North Barrington. My company uses them for pricey events so I figured they'd be a class act. Such a bummer because they have great presentation and wonderful food.

If I could rate them a ZERO I would. The owner, Roberto, promised us a quote for a catered party over a month ago. We were told twice that we would receive a quote. Emails went unreturned and their deadlines for a quote came and went. When I spoke to him on the phone I couldn't believe that he was so rude. Apparently their business is so good that they can't even quote a party for 100-150 people. Customer service here is horrible along with his attitude. Smokey Tomato?? More like Rotten Tomato.

This is hands down my all time favorite restaurant! Everything I've had here has been outstanding!! The portions are huge!! I have had almost everything that is vegatarien friendly on the menu. The pizzas are paper thin with loads of toppings (whatever you would like) I have opted for veggies that have included zucchini, and peppers with goat cheese. The owners/chiefs are friendly and always offers fresh cookies to go, (which are amazing-gluten free peanut butter are my favorite). Moreover if you ever get a chance to go when there is the vegan cauliflower soup you MUST order it is out of the world! I wish they would have had the Friday Night Taco Night during this summer for the Downers Grove Car Shows. Their tacos are the best I've ever had!!!!

I can understand people's frustrations with Smokey Tomato.  My impression is that the the two chefs try to do the "front" business as well as cook, and they may not temperamentally suited for doing the server jobs, especially when it's busy.  They are artists in the kitchen!   We went to the ST with friends for lunch, and it took them an hour and a quarter to get the food on out table.  My wife will never return.  

That being said, the food is excellent.  I stop in for breakfast occasionally, usually in the early afternoon when there are few diners.  Eggs, omelets, toast, potatoes, bacon are all excellent.   I occasionally take home sandwiches for dinner.  Yesterday it was the ham sandwich - ham, greens, mustard, and sauteed apples.  Very tasty.  Accompanying any sandwich is an excellent salad which is a meal in itself, plus a serving of soup.  It's all been very tasty and well prepared.   Coffee is Americano, so it has plenty of body and flavor.   

So...when you dine at Smokey Tomato you may have a bit of an unorthodox experience, but the food is excellent.

I was in Downer's Grove for work and my colleagues and I had to walk past the Smokey Tomato to get to my destination. We saw it and immediately knew we wanted to eat there after our meeting. First off all, it took anyone 20 minutes to even give us a menu and then another half hour to place our order. This was nothing compared to the massive wait to actually receive our food. The man who delivered the food was not very nice and seemed to be annoyed with us. We had to ask for to go boxes (multiple times) when they delivered the food because we'd already been there an hour and needed to go. Our boxes took another 15 minutes and by this time we were going to be late to our next meeting. We left very upset and were not expecting the wait for a cafe restaurant that serves only sandwiches and salads. The food was good, but expect to wait a very long time. Meanwhile people were coming and going and leaving with food. They seem to prioritize their catering services over their restaurant services.

My new fav lunch place! Before I even ordered, they served me up a fresh fruit plate and some water with a cumber slice. Not sure if that is normal or I just got lucky, but it was much appreciated. I ordered what turned out to be the BEST sandwich I have ever tasted -- no kidding!! Ham (think-sliced off the bone!) & Brie with thinly sliced apples, caramelized onions on a fresh croissant. It all came with a nice side salad (I think w/goat cheese). I even got a complimentary bag of fresh chocolate cookies that were still warm from the oven! We happen to be moving to DG on Monday, and I plan to be a regular that this place. 5 stars!!!!!

This place is really cute and the food is incredibly fresh and flavorful. The chefs are really nice and you can tell they care about the customer experience. Plus they kept offering me free cookies, which of course, I accepted. Definitely recommend this spot

Everything on the menu is absolutely delicious!  I love how you can customize your own pizzas and omlettes from a list of fresh ingredients they have in the cafe. The ginger mint lemonade is to die for.

Make sure to stop in on a Friday night during the Car Show and grab a street taco!

My mom and I went here for lunch a few Saturdays ago. She got the BLT and I got the flank steak sandwich. The portions are insanely huge. The two owners were there doing all the cooking and were attending to us as well. As other reviewers have noted, do not expect traditional waiter service here. They do the best they can. They also gave us samples of things they were preparing for that days catering orders when we inquired about the catering business. Everything we tasted was just fabulous. So we just ordered an appetizer tray for a party next weekend and I expect it will be delicious. I used to think you could only find a high quality place like this in the city, but lo and behold, Downers Grove has a great non-chain restaurant with a unique menu. This place expanding into a full sized restaurant is just what downtown Downers Grove needs in its absolutely pathetic restaurant scene.

Recently I had lunch at Smokey Tomato.  I went with friends and we had the Best Lunch, Service and even special treats.  The afternoon couldn't  of been more fun.  We ordered a salad and large roasted vegetable pizza.  After placing our order,  we were asked if we would like to try a complimentary bowl of chili.  We all accepted the offer and bowls of hot spicy soup ladened  with cheddar cheese quickly appeared.  The chili was excellent and a marvelous way to start our feast.  After the soup our salads arrived and were excellent as well. 
The salad was a medley if mixed greens, fennel and green beans.  Gorgonzola Cheese and a Raspberry  Vinaigrette Dressing topped this salad.  All the vegetables were fresh crisp and outstanding.  Our pizza was the best I have had in a long while and was very different.  The crust was cracker thin and the topping of cheese and roasted vegetables was fantastic.  When it was time for the bill we were each given a cute take home bag of fresh warm cookies.

 After this marvelous experience I ordered catered appetizers for a meeting I was hosting the following evening.  Again the food was exciting, new and a big hit.   I can't wait to return and am seriously thinking of having these two talented chefs prepare my Christmas Eve Dinner.

Ordered take out for lunch, it was amazing. A coworker and I ordered a pizza with sun-dried tomatoes, goat cheese, basil, beef filet, and roasted red peppers. Very friendly, good prices, and out of this world food. Highly recommended!

Incredible food and service!

The quality of the food is unbelievable. I ordered an omelet with peppers and herbs and it was divine! It came with a side of crispy potatoes which were to die for. Also, the ginger lemonade is amazing! Everything was so fresh.

Although the place is small, the atmosphere is very cozy and inviting.

The man serving us was one of the owners. He was so friendly and helpful. Some people say the service is bad, but I completely disagree. The business isn't run by that many people because all their money and energy goes into the wonderful food they make! They are also slaving away in the kitchen preparing huge catering orders too so people seriously need to cut them some slack.

Can't wait to come back!

We did pick up for dinner.  The offer was soup, salad, bread for two. The squash soup was very flavorful, spicy.  The salad and dressing were delicious. My husband loved the sourdough bread, and finished the small piece I couldn't. They were very friendly at pick up, as well, and gave my kids some mini cookies for being good while I paid the bill. We will be back for more.

Let me start by saying that the ONE time that Smokey Tomato actually gave me the food that I ordered, it was good. But other than that one time I have never been able to successfully place an order. They have told me they 'ran out of food' or just aren't open during normal business hours. Today though has to take the cake. I ordered well ahead because they are known to take a very long time. When I went to pick up my order I was immediately met by the rudest man I have ever had the displeasure of speaking to. He told me I never actually placed the order and that I could order my sandwich but it would take at least 30mins to make. I told him I was pretty sure I ordered and he immediately snapped at me that he 'isn't hard of hearing and I NEVER ordered'. He made no qualms about hiding his anger with me. I have never had a place i am trying to give my business to be so incredibly rude to me. The immaturity continued as I was walking out, confused and disappointed, and he yelled after me waving his hand 'BUHBYE'. I still can't even believe a restaurant would conduct themselves in this manner..

Ordered catering for a lunch and was thrilled with everything. The vegetable platter was a work of art and everything was delicious. My guests were huddled around the table talking about how great everything was and taking pictures of the food. The preparation and presentation is incredible. I don't cater very often, but will always use Smokey Tomato.

If you want a break from the traditional restaurant atmosphere, this is the place. Not only is the food consistently delicious with a gourmet flair, the menu is constantly changing. The restaurant menu is informed based on the catering side's overflow of ingredients, so you'll get to try combinations of things you may have otherwise skipped -- and you'll never be disappointed! The prices are reasonable for the amount and quality of the food you get, and the owners always strive to give out little extras (chocolate covered fruit, delicious cinnamon toast). Although this is a different dining experience since smokey tomatoes' main business is catering, the food makes up for any missteps people may  notice in the service (the owner/chefs often wait on tables personally, so their attention is divided between serving and cooking!). Bottom line, go there!

I would give 5 stars based on food alone. It's amazingly fresh, flavorful, and delicious. We came on a weekend soon after it opened and had breakfast. The food was to die for. 

However, the service isn't the greatest. Perhaps a two star. The girl assisting was friendly but forgetful. There was a small rush and I could tell she was having a tough time getting everything done. She forgot drinks, almost gave inaccurate change back,  and just seemed frazzled. 

Also, the hours. What hours? It's so confusing. I've tried stopping back three+ other times for breakfast/lunch and they aren't open. 

And it's frustrating to see another table sit 10 minutes after you and yet get a pizza 10-15 minutes before you get your omelette.

Fast forward three months to me trying to possibly order some catering for Thanksgiving. How can that possibly go wrong?! I call and inquire if there is a menu to order from and the guy who answered the phone was incredibly d-bag rude. Hello, I'm a freakin' customer prepared to spend $$$ at your establishment and you are flipping' rude on the phone?! Next time you put a menu on your Facebook page, take into consideration that a person is not going to scroll down through a page or more of comments to find said menu... If you comment about individuals placing an order for Thanksgiving, post the damn menu again as well. 

Yes, the food is good. But service, seating, friendliness, and being open like maybe some set hours are kind of required to have a truly successful eatery/catering spot. 

I've given up on this place.

Food is really good.  Big sandwich with a salad.  Just walked in and said make me whatever with chicken.  And I had this massive sandwich.  I posted the pic.  But I have been here before and the service is slow.  I have learned to call ahead and get it to go.  It reminds me of the soup natzi episode of Seinfeld.
Food looked appetizing, tasted fresh, and their ginger lemonade is awesome! The owner/servers were super nice. Can't wait to come back again!

I eat here on a weekly, sometimes daily basis. The food is most excellent as they always use fresh organic ingredients cooked to gourmet perfection. 

What makes this place so especially unique is the fact that you never know what is going to be available, as the menu changes from one day to the next. The serving portions are plentiful so no bird appetites need bother, unless you wish to take the leftovers home (which, I always do). 

The prices are extremely reasonable, the service always amasingly pleasant, and the atmosphere very relaxed within this very cozy little place. However, if you are in a hurry, forego a visit until you have plenty of time to spare. It is not an "assembly line", fast-paced restaurant. There is never a rush which is part of its charm. In many aspects, it reminds me of the small bistro-style cafes you will find in Europe, only nicer. 

I have been a guest in many of the world's most renown restaurants over the years and this place is definitely one of my all-time favourites.

Based on the food- this review should be 10 stars! 
It does have some quirks though, but if you want a fabulous meal and don't mind the anticipation of waiting for a truly artistic meal, this is your place!
(if you have the patience of a 2 yr old and are just as sensitive- then head to the nearest  fast food chain where you'll get your meal within seconds of ordering, with no personal interaction from the "chefs".)

My friend took me here, just raving about the food.  
We sat ourselves outside on a gorgeous afternoon and after a few minutes one of the owners/chefs came out and asked if this was our first time...as it's kinda "self serve".  So we went inside and got our own water cups and silverware.  
No big deal.  (my friend filled me in that they usually had a girl working there as hostess, and that this particular gentleman was a bit gruff, but the other guy was more friendly.)
While inside, we asked for a menu- which was a cute little parchment on a clipboard.  Menu was small, but there was a great selection w/ salad included with the meal.   My friend warned that they usually are out of items, so I was not surprised when she ordered a steak sandwich and was told that they were out of the steak.  No big deal, many other options to choose from.
(perhaps because their business is mainly catering, they run out of items unexpectedly.  Still, no big deal.) 

She ordered the lemon chicken sandwich, I ordered an omlet.  I'd asked what veggies were available and he loaded it up!  (I brought 1/2 of it home for tomorrow)   I've never had a salad that was so flavorful... it had fresh corn, dill, dandelion, some type of soft cheese and a dressing that was barely noticable- yet made all the flavors pop!  I will go back just for the salad.
And if you go- definitely order the ginger lemonade...it is to die for!  SO fresh (w/ mint and lemon zest) and it's made as you order- so don't be alarmed that it isn't delivered to your table within a minute...It's FRESH SQUEEZED!

We were given a bag of fresh, hand-crafted cookies with our bill.
After the meal, my friend decided to have them create a picnic for her to take to Ravinia next week.  She told them what she and her husband like, and they wil created the meal with whatever they have on hand.  These guys know food!
As a few other reviewers mentioned- they are culinary artists!  
You will not soon forget your meal.

I used STC for catering last week.  My guests were taking pictures of the food with their phones, it was so beautiful. Lovely display, great flavors, artistic presentation.  Lots of oohs and aahs.  They cater all over, including to downtown Chicago, so try to plan ahead.  They were able to fit me in, which I will be eternally grateful for...and I will definitely use them again.

I came upon this restaurant by accident.  I walked in & the music & aromas were enticing, so I thought I'd give it a try.  I'd actually love to hear French and Brazillian music here~ I think it would be a perfect fit.
Anyway.. I tried their roasted vegetable sandwich on ciabatta with monchego cheese, couscous side and fresh salad (it was all included- for under $9 I'm not lyin'!)
  It was Absolutely DELICIOUS.  
I adored the food, the atmosphere, and Mickey.  He's fantastic.
You have to go!  Remember their hours~ don't come and be disappointed.
Check them out: www.smokEytomatocafe.com 
=9'
FRESH and FUN! Downers Grove needed this place so badly! Excellent food. Hope they expand. Real food that tastes good. Generous salad portions. Not the same old tired entrees like other local places.
Absolutely delicious. So good it made me finally sign in and write a review. Owners are super friendly, food is fresh, and the ginger lemonade is a must! Catch them when you're in downtown DG!

Dropped in because we were looking for a brunch place.  This place lived up to it!  Food was amazing, coffee was great, even the pre bruch "desert" or raisin cinnamon bread was delicious.  It's a must try for anyone...keep in mind, it's small and fresh so it may take time, but well worth it.

Food was good.... But unfriendly service,! Charged an extra $3.00 for an extra plate even when 2 people ordered 2 entrees.  Very, very small, very very cramped, very  very SLOW.  Very limited menu. If you  order mushrooms....be prepared for a large clump that were very chewy. The cost  was high based on what you got.. and no ambiance. We were there for Sunday brunch... We won't go back.

I had lunch at this restaurant today and the food was spectacular!!! The freshest food I have since my last trip to California. We split the pizza and salad and I fell in love the minute I took my first bite of this salad.  Who knew a radish could be so good!  Fresh herbs everything prepared down to the smallest detail on the salad and pizza.  Beautiful thin crust.  We were served a perfect small plate of fresh fruit the minute we sat down.  The ginger lemonade was fresh with real ginger. Beautiful chocalate covered strawberries at the end of the meal.  Extremely reasonable pricing.   I will drive from Wheaton anytime to eat this food!!  Go visit, sit down and enjoy beautiful fresh food !
I love this place! the menu changes daily and features fresh, seasonal ingredients. The quality and flavors are excellent, I would highly recommend.

If you like eating at Fridays or Joes Crab Shack this place isnt for you.  As I understand it they are primarily a catering company and it is reflected by only a few places to sit and dine.  That being said my palate has not experienced this much joy in the suburbs in a very long time.  In every sense(s) was I turned on, visually stimulating and my buds were happier than a clamcake.  Their service is slow as compared to a regular establishment but this is no ordinary place, it is extraordinary and if you go expecting normal you will be dissapointed.  Go expecting great food and delivered in a not so normal fashion in the best way possible.  Follow them on Facebook would be my recommendation so you can opt in on any daily soups and stuff.  If I had a critique I would like for them to post more things on Facebook so I could get in on the goods more frequently but hey, theyre busy!!!!

This place has very tasty food. They lost a point for me because of their lack of menu. I think it's cool that they change the menu daily, but this makes it really hard to place a to-go order unless you call and have them read the list to you. They have a Facebook page, but they really should utilize it better. Post ALL the options every day, so that people can see what's available before they call.

Honestly this one small thing is the only reason I don't eat here very often.
These two guys have brought delicious,fresh and unique to Downers Grove!

We hired Smokey Tomato to cater our housewarming party.  They were absolutely amazing.  I could seriously not have improved upon a thing.  Their crew was extrememly nice and were very sweet to all guests.  They had things under control the whole time and served wonderful dish after wonderful dish.  Mickey and Roberto had a great handle on what we needed.  We gave them a general idea of what we had in mind and what we liked and they worked with us to create an eclectic menu.  We did 5 diferent types of grilled pizzas and 5 different varieties of tasting spoons.  People were raving all night (and the next day) about the food.  Many said it was the best pizzas they had ever tasted.  Smokey Tomato is very creative and uses only fresh, in season flavors so everything popped really well.  They used figs, goat cheese, proscuito, fresh corn off the cob, pulled pork, polenta, chicken, apple cider slaw, avocado, herbs galore, mushrooms, amongst what seemed to be a million other ingredients.  The homemade ginger mint lemonade was a hit - especially when spiked with tequilla :)

We would hire them again in a heartbeat.  Can't say enough good things about them.

I Just had lunch here with my wife. This is a real hidden Gem. They only have a few tables but boy is it worth it. This has to be the most creative and original new spot in the western suburbs in years. The flavors are creatively balanced and the portions are perfect for lunch. I had chicken on Polenta baked (?) in Banana leaves. The sides of potato salad and artichoke salad were a great addition. It is a very spontaneous, shifting, whatever is fresh this day menu on a clip board experience. I don't know exactly where these guys came from but there be talent here!

Went for lunch this week and will definitely go again. Food is exceptional & staff very friendly. Loved the water glasses and decorations of fresh flowers on each table. Comfortable place to relax and enjoy a quiet lunch.

service  is weak, so bad i was ready to leave, food came out and i know why it took so long !  5 min. earlier i was ready to bury this restaurant, it was the best steak sandwich i have ever had, one of the best salads i ever had, the potatoes were incredible, this truly is culinary art, they need a bigger place, and they need to hire some help  because i think the man who served the food also is the chef or at least helps, the bottom line is the food is a 11 on a scale of i to 10

Horrible experience and rudest staff I have encountered at a restaurant. I got an email in the afternoon about a $15 dinner including salad, entree, dessert and lemonade. I called to make a reservation and they said they could accommodate our party of four. We got there, and they seated people without reservations, and then there was no seating left for us.  They then sat us outside. The table was at such a slant, we had to set our water glasses on the ground to avoid water falling off the table. At the end of the meal, we got our check and were charged $18 each, not the $15 promised in the email. When we questioned the bill, we were told the extra $3 was for the lemonade. We did not order lemonade, but they did bring it to us, and it was included in the list if items promised for $15 in the email. The check was changed to the $15 promised, but when we handed 2 credit cards and asked to split the check, which they apparently don't do.  He threw our credit cards down on the counter and shouted "I'm not doing that! We will put it in one card!" You have been a problem group from the start by making a late reservation!" We understand that not all restaurants will split the check, but we would appreciate being politely told so.  Also, if we were told that there were no reservations left, we would have been happy to go somewhere that actually wanted our business. Lots of attitude that I could do without.

Peanuts has a patio along the riverwalk. It is a nice spot to have drinks when the weather is good. They have 18 tap beers , and several more selections in bottles. Typical bar menu; burgers, sandwiches, appetizers.
The patio is dog friendly. 
We just had some beer, and did not order any food, so no review of that. 
The river is fun to watch, although we saw a 4-5 ft watersnake swim by, not so fun, along with carp, bass, and a number of kayak ers.
Service was fine for us unlike other reviews for here.

Let me start off by saying that I work in the industry. That being said, I understand everything that goes on behind the scenes and usually give restaurants and servers the benefit of the doubt if my service wasn't great.

My friends and I went to peanuts yesterday on a slow Saturday night (I know it was slow because I had just gotten off work early as it was slow there too) and from the moment we walked up to the door, this place had one of the worst attitudes and vibes I've seen in awhile.

We asked the guy at the door checking id's if there was space on the patio. He replied "no. You can stand and drink...like you would at home". Ummmm okay?! Clearly you don't want us here..
Got a drink at the first bar then headed outside where there were plenty of tables open. One guy brought us a late night menu then told us he'd get our server for us. No one ever showed up and by the time we asked someone to order food, I guess the kitchen was closed. 
I'm not writing this review based on the door man or the poor service. I gave this place one star because of the manager. I made sure that peanuts closed at 2am because we got there a little later and I know naperville businesses lock their doors one hour earlier than posted closing times. At 1:07am I heard the manager telling the staff that it was last call. I've never seen a place go any earlier than half an hour of closing time for their last calls. My friends and I got our last drink and sat outside continuing to talk and finish our drinks
At 1:40am we heard this guy barking at us "okay guys finish your drinks and go home. Go to work tomorrow. Finish them" we looked at the clock confused as he continued to be SOOOOOO rude to us. We all had three drinks and we're in no way being rowdy so why would you treat paying customers that way? This guy was also grabbing the bartender and just over all being a greasy slime ball. I will never go to this place again because they have absolutely no respect or desire for customers. Sorry this was so long but it honestly baffles me how a manager would think that behavior is acceptable. I sometimes stay an hour past closing time for my tables.

Horrible service, owner is very unprofessional he has no customer service skills at all! Refused customers over an hour before bar close then after us questioning "allowed" us in. Will never Come back

First of all, there's nothing more annoying than getting a greasy well done burger when you asked for medium.... Actually it would be worse if you had hair in your greasy burger. And it would be even worse if you complained about it and the manager made a joke about why you had eaten half of it already when you say you won't pay. I guess they deserve the one star for not making me pay for my burger..... Maybe I ate half of the burger because I had paid for it, and maybe I stopped eating it because half way through I found hair in it.

I'll start by noting that I've never eaten here, but have been in for drinks twice. I can't believe we never knew they had a patio- and a patio overlooking the river no less! Pretty awesome. They should probably put a sign out front to let peeps know. The service is good here and they have a dart board.

Despite the reviews we decided to give it a try after seeing it from the riverwalk a few times. Went in for a late lunch on a Monday, and we were immediately asked for an ID, before I could even finish asking if the patio was open. When the bartender found out one person was under 21 she stated rudely that "she would have to keep an eye on us, just to make sure." We didn't even intend on drinking, only came in for lunch. First time there and I won't be back. I understand being careful with who you serve, but don't make diners feel like criminals when your dining room is empty. If you only want patrons above 21; put a sign up and we won't waste our time, or yours. Bar Louie across the street was a much better choice anyway.

Peanuts has a great outdoor patio along the river with a few games of bags set up outside. I went on a week night so it was pretty chill. They have a decent beer selection and some pretty good week night drink specials. The service was okay but the staff wasn't particularly friendly.

Of all the bars on this block, this place is definitely my least favorite.  It's a little hole in the wall, but not exactly what I'd consider a dive bar.  For one, it's pretty small, the actual bar is small as well as the space.  I guess I'll have to come back in nicer weather when I can check out this patio as I've heard better things about that.

This was the last of several bars I tried St Patrick's Day weekend and it wasn't a place I loved or anything...in fact I decided to end my night after hanging in there a bit.   It was big crowded, for one. The service was fine, it just didn't do much for me.

I like peanuts.  And I like free peanuts.  So I guess you could say that I like Peanuts.

I haven't had a chance to check out the patio, but it's not a bad spot for a bar crawl or a quick drink.  There is no drink menu, but there is a full bar and at least one cheap beer special.  There isn't a lot of seating, so I wouldn't recommend this for large groups.

But there is nothing unique about Peanuts.  It's laid back (so no pulsating, obnoxious DJ competing with the TVs) but other than a bar crawl, and the one time I came here with co-workers, I can't think of an appropriate occasion for this place.  They have TVs, and even though I don't care about sports, I can definitely say that a game can be better viewed elsewhere.  I really prefer Jackson Ave Pub over the other casual bars in the area, because their food and drink options are better.

I'd pass on Peanuts in colder weather and wait until the patio opens up.  They need some kind of kitsch here like a signature drink or inventive food menu.
Great outdoor area for the summer months...but when that's not accessible I wouldn't be caught dead in the actual bar itself..its smaller than my one bed apt and isn't much to look at either
I love the patio on the riverwalk and the digital jukebox inside.  Overall, it's a great little hole in the wall bar!

Not crazy about the servers. They wear what they want to, which I'm really not a fan of at restaurants no matter how casual, and most of them have poor attitudes. But I do enjoy Peanuts. I love their patio on the Riverwalk, they have great drink specials every day of the week, and they have an awesome menu. Unlike Jimmy's across the street (I hate Jimmy's so much), their menu actually consists of real bar food: wings, nachos, potato skins, bosco sticks (sooo awesome!!), sandwiches, pizza, etc....The stuff people actually like to eat when throwin back some beers, not hummus, fruit, and deviled eggs. So take some notes, Jimmy. They also have great prices! Appetizers ranging anywhere from $5 to $12 bucks and entrees from $10 to $15.

I ordered the nachos and they were outstanding. They came with all the toppings nachos should have like chili, cheese, jalapenos, tomatoes, black olives, onion, guacamole, sour cream, and pico de gallo. They were on point! A friend of ours ordered a pepperoni and sausage pizza. It was thin crust, just the right amount of cheese and sauce, and was the perfect size for an individual portion. He was able to finish it no problem. The waitresses did annoy me, but despite the fact that they were not friendly, they got our order right, they stayed on top of refills, and they continued to clear off our table as needed.

Peanuts is definitely one of the better bars in Naperville. I will be back soon!

If you do not frequent downtown Naperville for a bar crawl and the such, you may look at the interior of this place and say, "What a dump." It's a dive for sure, but its tiny on the inside, so why does it stay open? What is its big appeal?

OLD PEANUTS: Never crowded, could always get a drink (like shots or PBR). But That's about it. There was nowhere to sit in the back patio, except for a few chairs/tables. It had a great deal of potential, but it clearly was one of those places with regulars and served as a pit stop for people looking to do a shot or two.

NEW PEANUTS: Always crowded. ALWAYS crowded. But they have a sweet patio out back! And they actually give you MENUS now! There's food and drink specials, and theres even a bar out back! Why the change? Don't answer that question, Peanuts, it's definitely bringing you some business at a low expense. They just added a few plastic patio table sets, some umbrellas, and set up a bar, and VOILA! This place is your standard, happenin' Naperville bar now, with corn hole sets and all. 

I feel like I needed to note the new and old Peanuts, because there could be a varying level of reviews here. I have never ordered food here, I've just gotten very drunk here. The service is usually good, and the drinks are cheeeeeap. You can get a tallboy of beer for a few bucks (don't look for anything craft, though...it's all swil). If you want to sit outside and enjoy some drinks and you abhor Jimmy's as much as I do, then head here.

A Hidden Gem!
Peanuts has great food and a large outdoor patio facing the river.  Definitely try the spicy chicken quesadillas or the chicken nachos!

I would go here, but I'm not sure I'm up to date with my measles vaccine. The drunk old bartender is a nice touch together with the clueless wait staff. Thankfully there was a bar manager who made a point to be a completely dismissive snot. Not that anything in Naperville is very relevant, but this is the worst place to spend your money.

Peanuts is definitely my favorite place to go in downtown Naperville! Specifically, their back patio/ upper balcony section. It's such a lovely view of the river and is pretty big back there, unlike the tiny inside. Good drinks, not super pricey.  Their food is very good too. I had a BBQ chicken sandwich last time that was delicious and flavorful. Staff is friendly and kind. I'm taking away a point because of the fact that they had a band on a Tuesday!! We just wanted to go and chill, once we found out there would be a band, we called it a day. But I will be back!

This place is the worst. You wanna drink a beer on "special" that'll be an arm or a leg, ugh. Most expensive place in Naperville. The place smells and if you go out to the patio you'll spill half your beer with how unlevel it is.

The bartender in the place was nice. We walked to the patio and sat at a table. The server walked past us around 6-7 times and only then did we stop her to ask for menus. She never came back or asked if we needed anything. Another person came and took our order. He never came back after that. We ordered nachos. We never got them. We waited for at least 20 minutes before we just left. The man who took our order saw us leaving and didn't even stop us. Makes me think he didn't even put in our nachos order in the first place. They weren't packed and other tables had been tended to. I work in customer service so I'm pretty understanding when it comes to people being busy. However, my friend and I were just blatantly ignored. Won't be coming back.

Redeeming factor: large patio on the river. Great in summer time!

Otherwise, it's a plain old sports bar with BAD food. I ordered a grilled cheese, and it was literally made with wonderbread and those kraft single cheese sheets. I mean, I hated those when I was little, let alone as an adult. Sick. I realize it's a bar, but I stand by my belief that a bar shouldn't have a menu if everything on it is awful. And the waitress, though nice, was a total space cadet.
I'll never eat here again. But if you're down town naperville and want to sit outside in the summer, this is definitely a great view.

Where there is a patio along the river--you had me at hello.

I honestly, have passed this bar so many times, and was more surprised by it when I finally went in. It's one of those--don't blink otherwise you'll miss it, unless you're looking specifically for this or are on a bar-hop.

Low maintenance is the key word. A bar like Peanuts in Naperville is kind of a treat. I like the glitz, and the glamour like the next girl, but give me a beer on tap and a whole lot of whatever in the mix and we're even stevens.

Inside, is a standard local bar with service a go-go. The staff is friendly and on top of their game. There's enough seating for any size of a group. Outside is a whole other ball game. There's plenty of seats, another bar, bags, flatscreens. Oh and did you know you can smoke outside?

For all you smokers--there 'ya go. Not that I smoke, but smokers are the fun crowd and this makes the bar feel like you're not at a bar, but hanging out in someone's backyard. With service.

Jammin' on the Peanuts. It's a fun spot, cheapo beers and an overall good place to meet up with some friends and drift away for a night.

Friendly server and owner but the food really let us down.  The cheese sauce looked like a melted candle, the wings were extremely tiny and were ordered as mild and weren't.  Also, the quesadillas which I was told were their most popular were lacking in flavor and served with browning guacamole in spots.  Nice vibe for drinks just don't come hungry.

During the summer months this place is a solid 4 star.  During the winter a 2 star.  Their food is less than average and beers can leave a little to be desired but the patio is a wonderful retreat from the hubub of DT Naperville DBs.  The specials are always a nice addition.  Juke box is also a 4-5 star.

Great little bar with a pretty big patio with some great tables right next to the river.  Great drinks, great service, eclectic music on the box, and fun people.  

There seemed to be not as many college kids here, so come here if you looking to get out of the craziness and into a more laid back environment.

There's street parking right in front (if you come on a weekday) and parking lots very near. 

Would be a great place to stop after a late river walk.

The bar itself is pretty standard, not the biggest beer selection but not too shabby. The menu is limited, (one page) and the food is standard pub grub, but the staff is great and the patio is awesome during the warmer months.  It's right on the river, and there's ample room for a good crowd.

This place is cozier and more humble than the other bars downtown Naperville, which are exceptional characteristics for the area. The food is decent, the prices are reasonable, and the drinks are stiffer. You can't go wrong stopping in here to get a quick drink, or two, and a small bite to eat. Cheers.

This place is a pretty decent bar.  It's tucked away and looks much smaller than it actually is.  My only gripe: it's in Downtown Naperville and everybody still remembers me.  I was approached by someone I didn't know who apparently knew my band from when I still lived there.

The prices here were pretty decent.  I was drinking bottled Old Style the entire time, which excited me.  Definitely a Chicago style bar if they have Old Style!

The music is not what I like, but the crowd was into it.  I spent a bit of time on the dance floor and met a very interesting woman who thought  I would know an album released in 1982.  "I'm 23."  "Oh, I'm 30." "that's nice, goodbye."

In other parts of the bar, the music wasn't as loud and facilitated easy talking over beers.  And the outdoor patio was just amazing.  Sitting out there drinking Old Style and smoking was a good time at this place.

I do love this bar!  I highly suggest it.

Went here for lunch on Saturday and very glad we stop here. The patio seating on the river was very nice and the waitstaff was great. Our waitress was on top of things and relaxed, which was very nice.
We started off with their chips and salsa and they were amazing! They make their own chips and they make their own salsa. The chips were crispy and not greasy or oily at all. The salsa was perfection. Not too hot but not too bland. My friend ordered their BBQ Chicken Sandwich with fries while I ordered their Chicken Kabobs that came with a small Greek salad & fries with olive oil and feta cheese on top. The fries were absolutely amazing! My friend enjoyed her sandwich very much as well. When you think of "bar food", you usually think greasy hangover food, but not here!

I would give Peanuts 5 stars on a WEEKNIGHT, but although it's not their fault- it gets a bit crammed/uncomfortable sometimes on the weekends due to the small size. I wouldn't really call it a sports bar as there are no dart boards or pool tables- it's like it has a mini game-less sports bar vibe with peanuts instead of popcorn. The drinks were comparable to just about everywhere else of similar description, but the people it attracts are far nicer than just about everywhere else downtown Naperville. It wasn't full of a bunch of pretentious snobs or over-tanned rich kids either like many other of the downtown Naperville bars. The food was good-typical but quality comfort style bar food. The patio is GREAT during the summer and allows you not to be crammed like sardines inside over the weekends. 

Bartenders were prompt, fun, and friendly- the owner was a real nice guy too.

Love love love their patio! More secluded, on the river which is nice. Would not bother getting their food again, unless you're super hungry! They seem to be out of a lot of food items, but the drinks and fun chill patio make up for it!

I like this place. 

If you have a jukebox in 2008, I'm a fan of you almost immediately. I have to admit I haven't been in a few years, so the atmosphere may be a bit different now, but when I did go here...

The crowd was quaint. The bartenders were friendly. The drinks were reasonable, and the music was good. It's a nice change from the chain places that have seemed to consume the town I grew up in. 

It's one of the few local spots left. I like it a lot there.

This place TRIES to be the Lantern, but with, wait for it, peanuts instead of popcorn. 

There is little that distinguishes it from elsewhere. I mean, 3.50 Miller Lites can be found elsewhere in downtown Naperville. The location is what helps this business stays afloat in the warmer months by having an outside patio that overlooks the river. The drawback about that, patrons out there can not have peanuts out there due to the wildlife that is present. 

Anne works hard to keep everyone lubed up. She does a good job, albeit that I dislike this place. 

To make things awkward, the mens bathroom has a urinal and a toilet, yet no divider. Male bathroom lines are present, which sucks when you break the seal.

Meh, it was alright. I went there for my friend's birthday last weekend. Maybe it was because it was a Sunday night (we all work in schools and had Columbus day off...Sunday Funday!), but the place was dead. We did get a few free shots from random old guys sitting alone at the bar (which was weird, because we were on the patio, so unless they were like peering out the windows at us...), and the waitress was SO nice. And maybe it was the free shots and couple of pitchers of beer we had, but the food was amazing. We just ordered the standard drunk food (mozz sticks, poppers, something else I didn't eat because it used to be alive), but it hit the spot. I like anyplace with a patio, but for me, this was just a run-of-the mill place that happened to have a patio and good fried food. I've been to lots of bars like it. Not too bad--go there if you feel like a retiree when you walk into Features. =)

(PS--under the survey questions, why did 5 people select "none" under alcohol? This place is a bar. If they don't serve alcohol, I was definitely getting beer and shots from somewhere...)

This place is very close and very personal.  Well, it could be, but instead they have some live dude playing guitar and SINGING REALLY LOUD!  I mean it completely ruins the experience of the bar.  

This place gives up the vibe of a small, cramped, cool place to hang out with friends.  But then, as if the guy who owns it is best friends with a guy who's a struggling guitar player has decided to help out his friend and has decided to throw his friend out there, despite the fact that any live music in general is completely out of place, and let him play his heart out at the loudest volume possible.

In other words, if they quiet down, this could be a nice, great, homely, hang out with my friends sort of place.  But instead, it turns out to be a rather small, way too loud place to have one drink (if you can handle the noise) before going out in what is lame as an f-ing suburb.

Ah, so many good memories here when I lived in Wheaton coming to downtown Naperville and chilling here. The staff is always accommodating, helpful and friendly, great service. My fiancee and I loved kicking back here and munching on peanuts with a nice frothy pitcher.

Not sure if he is still there, but Neil who watched the door a lot of the time, treated us like family. Always knew what we wanted, and would sometimes sit down with us to shoot the shit.

This is a good bar if you want to relax and make conversation with your friends over a few good pints. I think the main clientele here tends to be older, but if you go around 10 or so, you may see more 20 somethings taking up all the tables. It's a great place to go if you aren't interested in the 21 year old mentality of Jimmy's and Features, but don't want to age 40 years by going to the Lantern.

Small bar and I was here in winter when patio wasn't open. Don't know how much better it would be as in the summer the mosquitos of the Dupage river would have a feast. Most people who come here probably are bar hopping between different locations in the area.

Fun, laid back bar, with a great heated winter beer garden.  Never crowded, and a little bit cheaper than its competition, but still pretty expensive.  Small room, but never over crowded, and never have to wait long for a drink

Peanuts is probably my favorite bar in Naperville (for you city snobs, there are actually quite a few in the dtown Naper area).

It is a little older crowd, but I like it because it's pretty low key.  I think it has a great atmosphere.  This place is kinda "hidden" from the rest of the popular places in Naperville, even though it is on Chicago Ave like many others.  Smaller bar, smaller sign.  People may look away at first because right next door (and sharing a porch with Peanuts) is an ice cream parlor that's open pretty late, teens and tweens hang out here right in front of the bar.

My favorite part of the bar is the JUKE.  Good stuff, lots of classic rock.

Every night they have specials, everything from cheap beefs to burgers, pizza on fridays (AWESOME one-person pizza, fits on a plate, nice and crispy crust) to bloodys on Sunday.

One less star because it opens at like 4pm, so no lunch hours.  Bummer.

When I was managing a restaurant in downtown Naperville and our best bartender didn't show up for his shift on our busiest day of the year I thought it was one of the worst days of my life.  However, being forced to fire him set off one of the best chain of events ever that resulted in him working at Peanuts and (either out of guilt or love) me having unbelievably low bar tabs for the rest of my days there.

Free drinks aside, Peanuts is a really great dive bar that manages to be fun and not attract the douche bags that hang out at Features and Bar Louie.  Typical bar food--buffalo wings are a stand out, and on Thursdays I think they're on special.  They usually have live music 1-2/week and for the days that they don't they have a great jukebox full of classic rock or the bartenders will hook up their ipods to the sound system--or yours if you ask nicely and have good taste.  

The owner, who often watches the door, is unbelievably good about taking care of his customers and really watches to make sure that some of the regulars (not regulars in a good way) don't harass any girls which really makes coming here a welcoming experience.  I never hesitate to stop into Peanuts whenever I'm visiting friends in town.

Peanuts is one of the few bars in Downtown Naperville which still has a local feel to it.  There really isn't much to this bar.  Its pretty tight fit in the front with a few tables a small bar and a corner for live music on occasion.  And out back their is a real nice patio on the DuPage River.  the back patio and the local feel make this place a 4 star in my mind.  And of course free PEANUTS!!!   Overall it's a great place to chill out with some friends and have a few beers.
only had a pitcher of beer.  pretty pricey (20 bucks) but service was great out on patio by the river.

Peanuts sucks, these wankers lost my credit card and essentially stole money from me charging multiple drinks on it.  Great Job Peanuts you assholes, Oh yeah and then they found it the next day and decided to apologize, rather then apologize the night of.  They run a terrible business and should be sued for improper treatment of customers.  I will never go back!

I love this place, great service, and good food in a homey atmosphere. I have yet to try the dinners and lunch, but the breakfasts are the best. Get there at 8:00 AM, and get the fresh cinnamon rolls right out of the oven.  The owner and his son love what they do, and it shows in the food.

Adorable! What a fun blast from the past this downtown diner is, and yummy breakfast to boot! My friends and I stopped in for breakfast one morning and noticed the menu was fairly standard. My friend ordered a Canadian plate that was disappointing as they were out of everything he tried to order with it. I had a Mexican chorizo breakfast plate and aside from it being a little too spicy (with tons of jalapeÃ±os) for my liking, it did pack a flavor punch. The pancakes were perfect though, hands down the highlight! If ever in Oswego again, I'd stop in again.

We came in on a Sunday morning to, as expected, a large crowd. Even so, we were seated in less than ten minutes. The waitress was prompt and friendly, taking our drink orders immediately. She came back a few minutes later and I ordered the Canadian platter (Canadian bacon and peppers and onions cooked into the hash browns). 

The waitress brought the meals out to our group and apologized to me because they were out of Canadian bacon. She offered ham, bacon, or sausage. I chose ham and began to eat. She came back and told me they were out of ham. I went with bacon this time. It came out a few minutes later, cooked to perfection. At that point, I realized there were no onions or peppers in the hash browns. Hungry and exasperated, I just finished my meal. I will say that the pancakes were fabulous, however. The rest of our party enjoyed their meals, but weren't particularly blown away by anything. Average, hearty diner fare.

My most recent experience here was, sadly, my least favorite. If it had been my only experience, I'd have probably gone with two stars, but previous experiences even things out. I'll be honest and say I'll likely return.

I wish I lived closer because this is a wonderful, little diner in a small town.  The places oozes charm.  Bring cash cuz they don't take plastic.

You cannot go wrong with breakfast or lunch anything. The prices are so reasonable you will think you are in Mayberry circa 1961.  My husband loves biscuit and gravy.  I don't, I call that dish prison food but he says this place has some the best he's ever had.  They have a Friday Fish fry here that will rival any Wisconsin Fish Fry.  Perch you ask?  Yep!  For breakfast I usually get eggs benny and the eggs are always perfect.  You can customize your hashbrowns so if you like them extra crispy, just nicely ask for them that way.

This place is the perfect start to a Saturday morning, especially in the Spring and Summer.

Love this diner!  It's a throwback to years gone by. It's a small place, maybe with 15 tables, and a bar with stools. They only serve breakfast and lunch. It gets busy as it's a popular local place, one we frequently visit when we're in town working at our properties. The service is quick and friendly. Our favorite servers are Theresa and Jackie. They always provide service with a smile. I usually order an egg white omelet with spinach, tomatoes and mushrooms and it's huge and good. The hash browns are cooked perfectly, crispy brown outside and tender inside.  The prices are fair, too.  I always enjoy coming here and seeing friendly faces. It reminds me of a place out of Mayberry...I love it!

How have I never left a review? I always enjoy my visits to OFR. It's like stepping back to a small town for me. Growing up in a close knit town always leaves me looking for that feel that you can only get in a place like this.

Friendly staff and breakfast is always on point. They have a great breakfast special menu with some very unique meals. Definitely going to have to try the Savory French Toast when I'm feeling experimental, you should try stepping back in time soon. #bringcash
Love this place! Great fresh food, generous portions, and a friendly staff! Try to go every Sunday for breakfast.

Very cute little old school town diner! Lots of items to choose from, service is excellent and very friendly. We had breakfast and everything was perfectly prepared!! Nice place and ask for Jackie, she's the sweetest!!! :)

Maybe this is a great place if they know you, but if you're not a local don't expect to be eating. We brought my boyfriend's teen daughter and her three friends out this way to go to the trampoline park for her birthday. After seeing the reviews we decided on eating breakfast here. We got in and it was full, which is fine. We waited and I said we could easily be split into two parties multiple times. Instead of letting us sit at any multiple table that opened she sat everybody around us instead. She even sat one couple that came in before anybody else on the waiting list because they were clearly known there. Awful start to the birthday day.

Wonderful little cozy restaurant. My daughter and I stopped during a rain delay at her softball game and were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of food and service for the price. Everything was excellent!

Ok so with 4.5 stars out of 51 reviews Im thinking man I'm going to be in for a real treat. I couldnt have been more disappointed the food was average and the coffee was burnt. Maybe it was just a off day for them. Its unfortunate I wont be back to find out. 

Also as a fyi its cash only thats always good to know. The service and old world charm were nice but everything else was just average.

I have eaten at the Oswego diner on several occasions and every experience has been pretty good. On my first experience, I was served biscuits and gravy and I noticed a piece of hair in my food and they immediately replaced it with no questions asked. I have had everything from omelette's, biscuits and gravy, potato pancakes, bacon, toast, hash browns and eggs benedict. Everything was really good and tasted homemade. Also, I love coming here because the prices are good but they only except cash so make sure you stop at an ATM before you arrive. If I can ask the restaurant owner, please have your cooks and staff where hair nets so I don't get hair in my dish on the next visit.

Just enjoyed the best pork tenderloin sandwich I have ever eaten in my life here!!!  They pound out the fresh pork, bread it and fry it to golden perfection!  Well seasoned, tender and juicy!  Try it the next time you visit. CASH ONLY!!!!

Found this little gem of a family restaurant on yelp.  Took my wife, and grandmother.  Had biscuits and gravy with eggs and bacon, gravy was really good.  Grandmother ordered a ruben  with fries and loved it.  
Service was down to earth nice!
Can't wait to go back.

We love going to family owned restaurants and with the amazing reviews for this place I had very high expectations...I have to say I was pretty disappointed with our experience.

This is clearly a place for locals to meet and greet. Everyone in the restaurant seemed to know each other and if you weren't "in" then you were given strange looks. We had to wait for a table and everyone in the place was staring at us...very awkward.

We didn't realize it was cash only...there are no signs...again, it must be a local place where "everyone knows". Luckily I had some cash on me, but that is a rare occurrence for most people these days, I highly suggest some signage.

The food was nothing great. It was breakfast food, nothing on the menu was unique or special. The service was alright...not bad, not great.

We were clearly not welcome in this establishment and no worries, we will not be back.

I would have to write for a long time to tell you what I like about this place.  
I have to tell you to just go and visit,  never had anything I didn't like here. Well,  I don't like their hours,  but I appreciate that they have time to rest.
Skillets are one of my favorites. 
Remember : Only cash for payment.

Such a cute family place if you're looking for homemade food at a good price. While the food is not 100% top quality, you definitely get great food for the price! Me and my little family LOVE going here whether it be for breakfast, lunch, or dinner!
Terrible breakfast I will not return. Omelette way over cooked as we're hash browns. I asked the omelette to be cooked light no brown. This is not a 4.5 star restaurant

Delicious fresh food served quickly by super friendly waitresses. We absolutely love this gem in Oswego. Today I had a veggie skillet and it was very good! Our waitress even remembered is from last week and everyone is always so friendly. It's nice to find a place with great food and service that we can bring our two small boys to.

Excellent food, excellent portions and excellent customer service. 

This place is a small, old fashioned restaurant/diner in the middle of Downtown Oswego. The decor maybe a little dated, such as their cash register, but I think it's one of the things that seperate this place from the rest. The dining room is small, but I have never had a problem being seated

My only gripe is that it is cash only and they don't have a sign anywhere indicating it's a cash only establishment
Old dinner type. This place is truly really cute as far as atmosphere. The food is good. You can't live in Oswego and not have eaten here at least once!
Great little family restaurant. Stopped by for breakfast. Not bad. Just ok.  Definitely need to know. CASH ONLY. Surprisingly stuck in the past.  Most people don't carry cash.  Good service.

So we went to eat breakfast downtown Oswego, we wanted to try that little diner and we never get to go out to eat.. Afterwards we go to pay and she tells us they dont take debit or credit cards! I told her they should put up a sign, that is ridiculous! She tells me they try, but the owner always comes in and takes them down. So she tells us we can go to the bar across the street and use their atm (and pay convienence fee!). My husband walks over with the kids and theyre closed till noon! So then she tells us to try Walgreens atm across town! My husband walks all the way back to the car, there was no close parking, amd had to drive to freaking Walgreens to pull out money. Meanwhile she doesnt offer to take any money off for causing us problems, and im left standing their like a punk this whole time for 30 minutes. I was so maaad! Bad business etiquette, they lost a new customer!

We have been here 3 times and I have gotten the homemade beer batter cod each time . It is consistent and delicious !! They have baked sweet potato that are delicious also , served with brown sugar a sour cream . They are so good , it doesn't really need any toppings ! Their homemade soups are delicious and comes with your meal. They also give you free homemade dessert ! Very good! Prices very reasonable but it is cash only .
We regularly come here for a quick meal, the staff is friendly and the food is always great. The prices are the best part - cheaper than going to your run of the mill chain restaurant. Great place!

Love this place! No frills just good home cookin'. I usually get a egg, bacon and hash brown combo. My eggs are always perfect and the hashbrowns are crispy on the outside and soft and buttery on the inside. My kids love their pancake breakfast and my hubby was surprised by the deliciousness of their steak and eggs. Now it is a little on the small side so when it's packed it can be a bit tight. But the food is delicious and affordable you can't go wrong.

It's nice to have a small diner downtown, has diner feel (cozy, crowded, friendly waitresses).  The food is pretty good.  We had a couple experiences with food served on dirty plates though.  My salad plate had fried egg yolk on it once.  I recommend the salmon or skillets.  Prices are good too.

The prior reviews are spot-on. The food is tasty, the prices are fantastic, and the service is great!  You don't go to a restaurant like this for its decor, you go for a very good meal at a great price.  I had the cheeseburger skillet and it was yummy.  The hash browns were fresh, not frozen, and the eggs were cooked perfect, the pancakes were fluffy and not gummy, and the syrup tasted like it was made from scratch. They had great portions also.  I My wife and I went today, but next time, we will bring the kids with us.  Great breakfast, but bring cash with you.

Small restaurant with big flavor. New to the area, we found this place cause it's close to home. Now like a 2nd home. Great to get back to the cooking like when I was a kid. Neighborhood place, neighbors and friendly strangers all enjoying their meal.

Always have a great time here, any time of the day.
The wait staff is friendly and the food is great, they make it how YOU want it.
They are typically busy and they only accept cash or checks, no credit cards.
We go back often :)
Great, straightforward, smalltown breakfast. Perfectly priced, perfectly cooked. A nice establishment I will frequent....since breakfast joints are scarce in this town...
LOVE LOVE LOVE IT HERE! Great breakfast! Great service! Just remember to bring cash!!!

**WARNING**  THEY ONLY ACCEPT CASH!!!  And they do not say so anywhere on the door, inside or on their menu.  Any place that does not accept debit cards is a serious rudeness in this day and age in the US.  I want to boycott them just because of this.  I'm still extremely angry that we got surprised by it only at the end and then had to walk a couple blocks to an ATM.  This is a ridiculous and archaic policy of theirs and I wonder why the owner chooses to operate in this backward business model, unless it is for some tax advantage?
Having given it a FIVE STARS, however, it is obvious that I am stuck to going back there again and again.  They put an aphrodisiac in the hash browns or something. My Skillet Special was perfect in every way, the gravy was neither too heavy, greasy or salty.  The Canadian bacon?  It was thick, as in I've never seen it so thick, and there wasn't a gristly piece or dry piece on it.  Eggs, perfect, service outstanding! Atmosphere very pleasant.
I'm pretty sure I'll get over my debit card/cash issues the next time I want the perfectly made breakfast.  Zero complaints.  My wife, who is a notorious complainer (bless her heart.  She is NEVER happy with anybody or anything) LOVED this place.  She did not have one bad thing to say about her eggs Benedict.  Best hollandaise she's ever had and she raved about the Canadian bacon.
One "bad" thing?  The portions were huge for us.  I had to leave a 1/3 of it and I will daydream about that 1/3 the next time I'm starving.
Great potato pancakes. Busy late on a Sunday morning but worth the wait. So far everything on their menu has been great.

Delicious food! Great prices!  But one draw back... when I first tried this place, I wasn't aware that it was a "cash only" joint (should've consulted Yelp first!) Anyway, I didn't realize it until my daughter and I were done eating.  The waitress was nice enough to let us run across the street to an ATM. They should really put a sign up or something!!

This is my second time here. We wanted to try it again to see if it was as good as the first time. I think it was even better! I had the beer battered cod. It is some of the best fish I have ever eaten. I also had a baked sweet potato. Talk about nice & creamy. All and all, if the rest of the menu is as good as the fish, I'll be a customer for life!!

We had come here for lunch a couple times and it was very good both times.

Last weekend, however, we came for brunch on Saturday and we were BLOWN AWAY! Everything on the plates was perfect. I'm quite picky about breakfast foods. Apparently, they share my passion at the Oswego Family Restaurant.

I ordered the "4 Deuces" breakfast (I think that's what it was called), with 2 eggs, 2 pancakes, 2 bacon, and 2 sausage links. So, I got to sample several items. All were excellent! I think that was real maple syrup, too.

We will definitely come back here again and again. Probably too often. ;-)

I won't bother going anywhere else for breakfast in this area. It doesn't get any better than this!
This is how they do it in Oswego!  I can tell you they do it right. There isn't a bad thing on the menu

Good small town family breakfast place. Packed on the weekends. 

Anything really on the menu is good to eat. Cash only!

Everything was wonderful. The Eggs came out how I ordered them, over medium, steak was cooked Medium Rare, hash browns were nice and hot and crispy. Pancakes were great as well.

Nice layed back atmosphere.

My only complaint is that it's not closer to where I live...

I so badly want to give this FIVE stars.  I really, really do!

First off, the food is excellent!  The atmosphere at OFR is that of a wonderful small town diner, none of that corporate chain restaurant feel that is far too prevalent these days and that I cannot stand!

I'm especially partial to their breakfast food, which is just about the only time I've gone there - weekend mornings. I can vouch for their omelets, specifically their mushroom, cheese and spinach offerings.  I have it on good authority that the sausage skillet is also very good.  You can't go wrong with the food.  The service is attentive and they work very hard to keep up.  There just simply isn't enough of them to go around during the peak weekend morning time frame. 

About the only issue I have with the place is its size.  Tables and aisles are too close together. On weekend mornings, it feels as if the entire town of Oswego is trying to have breakfast there at the same time.  There is always a wait to get a table during that time and depending when you arrive, it could be lengthy (20 minutes or more).  I suppose it's a nice problem to have if you're the owner of OFR but you have to wonder how much more business the place would do if it were a little larger.

It is also a cash only business so bring greenbacks as they don't accept credit or debit cards.  Prices are VERY reasonable.  It's a great addition to Oswego and it's definitely worth the drive  - and the wait.

We enjoy this little place.  It's very crowded on weekends which is a good sign. And it gets a bit noisy but the food and service are good. They meet expectations. The menu has your typical diner breakfast foods. Not good for large groups.
Food and prices was great! Gets packed, so make sure you go early! They only take cash, which is kind of annoying but now we will just plan ahead. We will go here again!

Old fashion family restaurant.  Complete with the exact same decor as it was years ago.  :).    Has the type of American food you would expect at this type of restaurant.  Fresh,  good and inexpensive.  Breakfasts are really good.
This place is a classic little diner. Fast service and good food. I recommend the breakfast.
Absolutely the best breakfast around for the best value possible.  We enjoy everything about the Oswego Family Restaurant.

I went here because it had almost 5 stars... It was one of the worst breakfast meals I've had in years. The bacon was almost black, the sausage links had a strange color and flavor, my scrambled eggs looked more like an omelet, and my french toast was bland. You get what you pay for! Speaking of paying, it's cash only. I didn't even know cash-only places existed anymore! There is no sign posted anywhere, so we had to go to an ATM. Only reason I gave 2 stars is because the staff was friendly.

We have been here for breakfast, lunch and dinner.   Good home cooking.  The only problem you will have is what to order because everything is so good.  My favorite is the biscuits and gravy Special.   My wife changes a lot but loves their soups.  Extremely friendly staff and fast service.   Give them a try and you will be a regular.  Just a tip - cash or check only.
