I also tried the McCarthy Red Ale.  This one is more carmelly and toasty (because it's a red ale...duh), but still has a pretty good hop bite.  Last, I tried the Oatmeal Stout.  This stout is nice and dark with strong coffee notes and a nice creamy finish.  The food is good too- I've tried the pretzel twists (YUM), the Cheddar Ale Soup (Cheese? That you can just slurp? AWESOME.) and the Firestarter burger (yes, you have to sing Prodigy when you get that...how can you not?).  The burger has come out overcooked a little each time, but it is still good because it's covered in Sriracha and bleu cheese (I add the bleu cheese as an extra. DO IT.), my two true food loves.  You HAVE to like spicy food to get this though...your lips will be on fire.  Thus the name.  Emmett's don't mess around.
Overall, I would go here again if it were closer, but since the service is so crappy most of the time, I will probably buy my beer at Binny's instead and call it a day.
Boring!  And crowded.  Always crowded.  Drinks are fine, but nothing stands out about this place.  Older, mature crowd.  Another Round is a better choice.

I'm not a beer drinker, but after checking out Emmett's fine-looking menu I decided to stop in for dinner after a haircut on Main Street tonight. Glad I did. 

Emmett's is more than just a pub. Half the place is indeed dedicated to the bar atmosphere: dimmer lighting, with smaller tables and, of course, the bar to belly up to, as well as the brewing equipment in the window. The other half of the building, however, is a restaurant proper: brighter lighting, larger tables, and table service. The room is a mix of sophistication (with cocoa-colored walls, curlicued chandeliers and dark wood accents) and rough-hewn accents, such as the unfinished ceiling beams. 

There wasn't anyone at the hostess stand so I hovered for a few minutes, not sure if it was a seat-yourself situation, but one of the waitresses came and took care of me after a moment. My waiter was a nice fellow, and I quickly figured out what I wanted: the first thing on the menu, Baked Pretzle Twists brushed with garlic butter and served with cheddar cheese spread, as well as a cup of corn chowder, and a root beer. 

The root beer arrived first, as drinks do; I kinda figured it might be home brewed, as it often is at these brewery places (Goose Island, Gordon Biersch, etc.), but if so there wasn't a lot of pomp and circumstance about it, and it wasn't mentioned on the menu. In any case, it was rather flat and also tasted rather sweet. So I hope it wasn't representative of their own product. 

The food was much better. The chowder was happily hot (oh how I hate to get a bowl of soup in a restaurant that is pathetically tepid!), and had the taste of fresh corn, the bracing flavor of peppers and the smoky essence of ham. 

The pretzles were nothing like your shopping-mall-Auntie-Whoever concoctions. Tightly twisted and burnished brown, they bore the kiss of garlic and salt. There was no need for the cheddar spread. Carboholics unite: this was a fabulous feast, though $9 seems a bit steep for 4 pieces of bread. 

Overall, good food in a nice setting; would be a suitable place to bring the beer connoisseur in your life.

I wanted to love Emmett's......  

I've given this place numerous chances (I live in Downers Grove) and I always leave disappointed.  Let me say it's a very nice location, with good service.  The beer selection is "OK"....their brewed beer is alright, nothing spectacular.  They don't have a very big selection of total beers though.   

My biggest complaint is their food....it's really bland and average at best.  I've tried a lot of their dishes (pork sandwich, meatloaf, baked mac and cheese, burgers, pasta, cheddar soup, wiener schitzel) and all have been average at best.  I don't think they use very good ingredients.  I recently had their 3 tenderloin medallions with different sauces.  The beef was just awful....really bland and almost cafeteria-like.  Is this low-med grade Sysco food?  I  felt ripped off leaving there.

For the record, I want to see successful dining in downtown Downers.  We certainly have the Italian food market covered, and the brewpubs, although Ballydoyle does much better pub grub than Emmetts.  I was hoping Emmetts would evolve into some classic American dining place, offering steaks, chops, etc....but it never happened.

FOOD - Meh. I have had much better food. Its slightly overpriced. If you read the menu it all sounds great. The only explanation I have is that they spent their money on a great writer instead of a great cook. most of what we had tasted like it was cooked in a microwave. Fries overcooked and dry. I will not be eating here again.
Drinks - this is their savior. The fresh brewed beer is great, with some very traditional twists. HOWEVER, I am a part of their MUG CLUB and they recently decreased the sizes of their large mugs to probably save money. 
Atmosphere - overall has a great look. Lots of classic wood among the large brewing containers. 
OVERALL - Downers has some great bars now and this poor quality food will not cut it anymore. Go for drinks and thats it.

We were disappointed. Service was very slow and seemed frustrated. The restaurant was very loud. The soup came out at the same time as the entree. The pretzel appetizer was very good. The menu seemed pretty limited. We asked the server's opinion about two menu options and though I appreciated his honesty, it seemed strange that he said straight out that he didn't like the Maui burger and said he thought there were better entrees than the pork tenderloin (but didn't say which ones or make any suggestion). I got a chicken sandwich on pretzel bread and it was very good (great mustard sauce) but the chicken only took up half the roll which was strange with so much bread leftover. The chips are great. Overall I don't think it's worth the money for the frustrating service and options.

My BF and I went here on Friday night after trying to avoid a large crowd like that of Bally Doyle across the street. Emmett's was not at all busy, with plenty of empty tables to choose from. Score! Then again, the fun loving atmosphere was a little lacking because of the minimal people but the crowd was still a friendly one. 

We saw that they have a little brewery and got some of their house beers. Both were pretty good, mine a little more hoppy than I was expecting (made me crave rye bread) but it was still darn good. 

The staff was so very friendly and inviting, offering us a chance to taste any of the beers right off the bat. They had baseball on several tv's and one projection screen which my bf enjoyed (but would have enjoyed more had his team won). 

We checked out the appetizers and I was between the nachos and the homemade potato chips... I wish I would have gone with the nachos. I mean, the homemade chips were really good and came with a horseradish aioli but the nachos were only $1 more and looked sooo much better after we saw the other tables around us get them. Ah well. The homemade chips were also a bit pricey at $8- yikes! The nachos appeared to be worth all $9 though. 

Overall, we would go back again, get the nachos, enjoy the beer, and brings friends.
Food was good. Service not so good. We came in when it wasn't busy at all and waited at least 20 minutes for our order to be taken. Probably won't come here again.

I have been to the other Emmett's locations, so I decided to give this one a try.

The beer selection was the same as the other locations. I was only planning to have lunch and a quick beer, so I went with the one that I knew I liked. The McCarthy Red was good as usual. My wife tried the seasonal which was a Beligian Wit. It had a nice citrus hint and the flavor went well with food.

I have found that the "high end" entrees at the other locations have been disappointing to me, so I decided to keep it on the simpler side. The salmon sandwich was pretty good. It had a nice grilled flavor and the fish was still moist. My wife had the spinach and strawberry salad, which she said was good.

The atmosphere in this Emmett's was similar to the other locations with lots of dark wood. The number of TV's was less than obnoxious also. It was about noon on a Friday of the July 4th weekend, so the place was pretty dead. This made for a nice quiet dining experience for our visit, but I don't know what it would be like on a busy Saturday night.

Overall this place is acceptable, but I am still underwhelmed by the beer selection. When considering the driving distance, I would have done better to go somewhere else.

The food was excellent.  Service good.  BUT, the PORTIONS are VERY SMALL.  My Beer Battered Cod entre was very small...it was mostly fries....$17 for fries...NOT A GOOD VALUE.  The beer prices were good however, and the Munich Light was very, very good.  I took two stars off because the prices are way, way too expensive, for the small quantity of food!!  I wonder if my cod was really two little guppies.... :-(

We have eaten at Emmett's several times over the years. It's a great location in a very nice building. 
The food and service is decent but seldom outstanding. It's not my first choice when we talk about going out for lunch or dinner. I really wish that they were better because it is such a nice looking and pleasing facility. Why can't management put some more focus on their overall quality? Oh well.
Was there this past St. Patrick's day and was able to get a table in the bar area. This day the food was fabulous. You would hope that the corned beef would be top notch on St. Patty's and it was. Lean, thick sliced, tender and moist. Absolutely wonderful. 
In summary Emmett's is just good enough that we will return again. Just wish that they could step it up a notch so it is our first choice when we think of DG restaurants.

2nd time here, waitress threw down the menus after waiting 10 min then b-lined it away from our table as quick as he could. When he came back he took our beer order, I asked it we could order food too & got the response "...if you want." No eye contact during entire interaction. Terrible. There's several other choices down Main St with bar food & beer!
Burgers are very good, especially the spicy burger with peppers.  Their food overall is pretty good, not like mind blowing good but quite a bit good.
We get a keg from here every year for a family party, and every year is better than the last. Service is great and so is the staff. Definitely a great place to go!

The food has been good in the past, but the service is terribly slow.   Even the kids have asked several times why our food isn't here and other tables that arrive after us are getting served.  Plus, the manager is running food orders.   We should have left when we told them no one check on us after ten minutes.

So...  After previously having had some of the absolute worst service in the world, I decided to stop by Emmett's the other day for a growler.  
When I walked in, the bar area was all but empty.  When the bartender saw me she decided to ignore me and walked into the back instead.  Meanwhile, one of the waitresses said, "someone will be right with you".  
The waitress actually came back and rung me up.  Meanwhile, one of the obvious bar regulars sat down next to me and immediately was waited on by the bartender.  " Oh, how are you... so and so", she said.  All the bartender could say to me was, "you've got to pay".  "Twice", I asked?  Well, appartently the waitress had not actually rung me up, so now there was additional aggravation and confusion.
Once I was rung up, I walked out and spoke to the waitress.  I told her I was thankful for taking care of me, but the reason I do not come here anymore is because the service sucks.  She apologized.
I can say that at Emmett's has at least one employee who cares.

Meanwhile, I attempted to contact Emmett's via email regarding what had happened, but of course, there's a problem and you are unable to send an email.

It was a one time experience. The service was terrible the food was average (and that's being generous). Everyone says the beer is the reason to go and even that was sub par. Of all the choices in Naperville this is certainly not one I'll be going back too.

My husband and I both love a good beer so Emmett's seemed like an ideal spot for us to try.

We have been to Emmett's twice in the past two months, once for appetizers and drinks and happy hour and once for dinner.

Both experiences were enjoyable, but I'd have to say that happy hour experience was a little bit better than dinner.  During happy hour the bartender was more than happy to offer samples and suggestions to help us decide on a beer selection.  The staff was all friendly and the environment was warm and comfortable.

When we came back for dinner we both enjoyed our food and drinks but the service wasn't QUITE as good.  The restaurant was busier and things were a little rushed, but I guess that's expected at dinner time on Friday.

The only really downfall...I am a dessert-a-holic and nothing on the Emmett's dessert menu tempted my palette :(

We will be eating at Emmett's again (just going somewhere else for dessert!)

Beautiful decor. Beautiful furniture. 

The only thing was that the food sucks. I know I wasn't there for the food, but everything I tasted was terrible! Potato skins, portabello fries, chicken nachos, Southwest steak salad drenched in dressing... all ick.

Emmett's is by far my favorite beer ... particularly the McCarthy Red. The food is always great too. It's not your typical bar food, and they offer a wide range of dishes and tasty appetizers. The servers are always friendly and prompt with our food/drink orders. And I love the cozy atmosphere of the bar area. I've never sat on the dining side, as it seems a bit more closed off.

All in all, a great place to go have a beer or two. And by far the best tasting brew in the area.

My boyfriend and I have gone here several times and we will keep going back. It's a nice bar with pretty good food and great drinks but the prices are a little high for the food. The bar staff is really friendly and they even remember us from coming in. :)

We are considering joining the beer club which comes with some nice perks.

I was very happy and full from the Cobb salad I ordered and my boyfriend ordered the roasted rack of pork and he enjoyed that.

So overall I personally give Emmett's a two thumbs up!

WOOHOO

I was here for the first time this past weekend for our best friends wedding reception. We had about 75-100 people total throughout the evening. Everything was AMAZING! The location is super pretty, right on a corner with that great downtown feel. The inside is beautiful- lots of woodwork and pretty windows. The staff. The staff was incredible.  The food was great, right on time, hot and delicious! The drinks were wonderful as well :) Emmetts is probably top 5 as far as service goes of everywhere I have ever been for events. They were polite, quick, fun, professional...the list goes on. Katie assisted me throughout the night making sure all of the dances we had planned and special moments happened as we wanted them to. Jackie and Angelique were just as great! I would HIGHLY recommend this place. Thank you so much to all of your staff for making the special day extra special!

Fiance and I went here last night.  Our food was amazing - really exceeded our expectations!  I had the sirloin steak, which was $19.99.  It was AWESOME! It comes topped with blue cheese crumbles and onion straws - I ate every bite and I am a really picky meat eater (won't eat the fat or any "weird" looking parts).  He had a prime rib sandwich which he said was delicious.  I can't wait to go back - but I will probably order the same thing because it was perfect.  

We have booked our rehearsal dinner here for next year - and after the meal we had last night I know we made the right choice!

SO GOOD!

We love Emmett's. We used to stop by all the time when we lived closer.
Beer is good. Stick to beer. I made the mistake of getting a mixed drink here, it was awful.
Sometimes service is slow/lacking.  But it's a great place, good wings! Usually crowded so you may have to wait!  Trust me, it's worth it!
Best Reuben at around here.  I love this plac

Quick lunch idea. So we can't make up our mind on lunch today. Stopped in front of Seriano's and decided on something new. 

Awesome choice, the smell made me even hungrier. Really friendly service and atmosphere. I asked the gentleman in front of me what was good. He literally said "Everything is good here. I come at least twice a week'

Then the sweet nice older man behind the counter was adorable. Who told me every Monday is half off pizza. 

We got a cheese and sausage pizza brick oven and 2 hot sandwiches.

Yum.... Definitely will be back.    ;-)

****I would have given 5 stars but they didn't have rice balls***

I saw Serino's featured on the Yelp Chicago Burbs' Facebook just this morning. I LOVE sandwiches and wood-fired pizza, so of course needed to check it out! 

Since Mondays are half off pizzas, I ordered TWO (3 hours of hiking gives a girl an appetite, and I love leftovers)! My total was less than $10!

+ Veggie - 4/5
I really enjoyed the unique veggies and the tang from the sun dried tomatoes! I wish there were a few more veggies since it was a tad imbalanced: mostly eggplant and sun dried tomatoes.

+ Verde - 4/5
The three cheeses really lent some great flavor..I just wish it had a teensy bit more. The heaping topping of peppery arugula was so fresh!

The crust was delicious and chewy.

Of course I'll need to try more menu items, but as it stands I'm a total fan of Serino's pizza! I just may be back next Monday to try some others!

Tried the margarita pizza and it was very good. The pizza was mostly crust and could have used a little more toppings (sauce, cheese, pizza) but it was still delicious.

Service was great! I ordered ahead (via Yelp) and my order was ready when I arrived 15 minutes later.

I love this place. MONDAYS are 1/2 off brick oven pizzas.  You can get a pizza for $5 on Monday.

I also love their selection of sides that they have at the deli.

Lastly, they have a variety of drink selections to choose from.  You can't go wrong with this place as their food, drinks and service is by far superior to most places around the area.

Make sure you come early as it gets packed quickly.

Cute Italian deli with lots of seating! Has potential, but the woman working tonight was less than friendly.....I explained I had never been there before and would need a minute to look at the menu. She proceeded to stand there and stare at me until I placed my order....I went with the American sub, yummy sandwich and I like that they put the mayo inside the meat so my bread didn't get soggy! Price was fine for what I got. Fine experience, but nothing to write home about.
The breakfast burrito was the dankness. Local, fresh, fast - I ordered mine to go and looked around the deli while I waited. Nice little spot.

Everything I ordered from pizza to deli antipasti, mermaid salad, olives, all had a great fresh quality to it. I will definitely be back for more!! My highlight was the Sicilian chicken wrap, the flavors were phenomenal! 

The prices are more than reasonable. Very affordable, large portions & great quality.

I need to update my review for Serino's. I live right down the street and have been in here at least a hundred times. I was thinking about this place as I was enjoying one of their delicious pizzas and it dawned on me that I had NEVER had anything from this place that was not excellent. Once again, NEVER.
  Always prompt service, always excellent sandwiches and pizza. Try the Serino panini, or Caprese, or the Italian sub, or anything they make. It's all good.
1/2 price pizza on Monday can't be beat. My fave is the Margherita.
A gem of a place.

Cheers to All

They do a better job than most with their Italian subs! Also a very excellent assortment of pasta. Service is very friendly and fairly quick considering how busy they get, which tells you something. The only real downside is if you go while they are busy, it is tough to find parking!

Ever since the Army Trail Rd. restructuring, the ONLY exit out is West! 
Tricky going back east, but worth Ã®t.

This deli is amazing! Super affordable, delicious food, and everything is fresh. I highly recommend becoming a regular here...

Just an example, I got a sandwich on Monday but then my boss bought me lunch... So I saved it for Tuesday's lunch. When I opened my sandwich... My co-workers were like "omg, where is that from?" Once I told them... They jetted out to get subs for themselves. A day old sandwich still looked delicious and btw it was still amazing! 


The only reason I am giving 4 and not 5, is that some of the staff isn't exactly friendly. However, most of the girls are super nice.

After seeing the positive reviews on yelp we decided to swing by and pick up a few sandwiches. They were pretty good, I wouldn't swing through again unless there were some sort of deal or coupon. 

I got the 12 inch Pesano sandwich, the bread was good but tough.

The muffuletta was decent but had a big chunk of olive pit that almost broke a tooth. 

The caprese salad was good but it's so basic I would be shocked if someone messed it up. 

Will maybe come back to try the pizzas as they look very authentic Italian.

What a great place for a quick lunch.  I stopped in after a scenic route trek home from River Forest and I'm so glad I did! 

I ordered the Sicilian Grilled Chicken wrap, which contains chicken, swiss cheese, lettuce, tomato (I ordered without), roasted red peppers, jalapenos, and mayo.  It had to be one of the greatest wraps I've had in a long time! So flavorful, and filling. And it was only $4.99, which was a steal. 

They have a large variety of sandwiches, paninis, and subs, and of course they also have pizza and pasta dishes. There's a deli where you can buy cheese, meats, and prepared salads (pasta, macaroni, etc). They also offer catering.

The food portions are very generous and the prices are extremely reasonable. I can't wait to visit again.

Super disappointed! :/

Menu item not as described! ~Grilled Chicken Caesar (Pita Wrap)

I ordered online and expected it as stated on the website.

The meat is actually not grilled chicken breast, but chicken lunchmeat. The romaine lettuce appeared to be standard shredded lettuce. There were no croutons and minimal tomatoes and olives. The green peppers were there. However, no cheese that I was aware of. And the dressing was very watery and more mayo-like than Caesar-like. 
I was disappointed and will not order from there again.
I got the Serino wrap and Italian Ice and both was delicious. They have a drive through (bonus!) and the inside is a great place to grab lunch with a friend. Will definitely be back.
Had a awesome Italian sub , ate that whole nine inch up. Service was nice and very clean atmosphere.
Very good sandwich. Not busy at all around 6PM but couldn't even get in parking lot at lunch. Will be back to try other things.

I now have a new pizza place. Serino's is excellent when it comes to pizza. I haven't tried anything else. My wife likes the vegetarian and I like the Margherita, we share and I've never had a bad experience. 

The pizzas cost about $10/ea. You can add a bunch of different toppings if you want. The pizzas have that authentic Italian taste to them. If you're looking for Chicago deep dish, go someplace else, but come here if you want flavor and quality.

Although I've not been to Serino for a while I'm going to post this review. I used to work nearby and now that I don't I miss regularly enjoying their awesome sandwiches. My favorites were the Italian sub and turkey sub. Bread was fresh and crusty, and no other sandwich shop around gets anywhere close as far as the bread goes. Topped with their Italian dressing these are wonderful sandwiches and a great value for the quality you get.
The Serino's beef sandwich has become my new favorite and has replaced my love of Portillos beef. This sandwich is huge and delicious. Can't wait to try more items from the menu!

Wow, If you are looking for an authentic great tasting Italian sub you'll never go wrong at Serino's Italian Deli in Addison, be sure to ask for the authentic Italian bread it makes the difference. Elvio and Bruno have a great team who consistently deliver an awesome experience and great tasting food. Kudos to Serino's
Every time we go for lunch and every sandwich I've order has been awesone! Try the chicken bruchetta,  fabulous!

From a full Italian, this is delicious. They close at 8, so I missed them last night, but glad I tried this place tonight. Ordered on the phone, flew down there and it was ready in 8 minutes after I called. Basil is sweet, sauce is light, and charred to perfection. Well done!
So far so good!! Staff is friendly and the Italian sub is delicious. Loved the Reuben!!

Grilled chicken pesto $6.29  - delicious! :)
Mozarella tomato homemade pesto -delicous ;)

everything tastes good here!! 

food portions are decent as well!!
Good food so close by to work we order from them often. Sometimes the bread is too hard but overall it's a great Italian deli.

If you dont know it is here you would miss it..  I highly recommend the Serino Salad, huge with meats and tons of delish cheese.  The Italian dressing is very good on the salad.  

You can get a variety of items from cold subs to soups.  They also have an actual deli where you can get good Italian and American meats.  They recently added more seating so it is not as hard to get a seat at lunch.  But it is always packed at lunch time M-F..  So you know its good!!

I highly recommend the breakfast sandwiches. I've tried other items on the menu, but the works on the old school bread is heaven. Give it a try. Order in advance and pick up from the drive thru window.

The italian sandwich is the best I've had outside of Italy.  Fresh, not over salted meats, a flavorful dressing that is not too oily or too overpowering.  The place itself is homey and familiar, a neighborhood spot where you don't feel out of place.

An oasis in a vast wasteland of houses and trees and the 53 corridor traffic trap. his tits I do like turtles feast of the senses. Get lost in the gelato case frolic through the options in the deli cold cuts and house made salads out of bars do you want breakfast sandwiches? Oh they got breakfast sandwiches! 4609 stomach size! Or maybe you want to make your own sub sandwich burrito? You have old breakfast options you could ever desire.

A delightful staff? The best in he biz.
Amazing, opens early morning, everyone is friendly.  Food is delicious and is extremely reasonably priced.  Lunch time is a mad house though.  My favorite place in this area :D

Stopped in based on all highly rated Yelp reviews. Monday special 1/2 off brick oven fire cooked pizza. Super clean, very friendly staff and delicious food. I would definitely recommend and plan to come back to try their sandwiches next time I'm in Chicago.

Serino's pumps out quality product.

They are always busy and for good reason.  I usually go around 11 as it helps me avoid the lunch rush.  I've also been there during the lunch rush and had no problems, it's just a little crowded. 

Every single thing I have ordered there is solid.  The Italian grilled cheese, American Sub, Meatball sub, Pizza, Friday Cod Sandwich, Bruschetta Panini, are all really good.  

No complaints here, quality product, and a friendly staff. A lunch staple at least 2 times a week for this guy.
I stopped here the other day when I was in the neighborhood.  Good, good, good.  I had the Serino panini --- prosciutto, red pepper, cheese, etc.  Well seasoned.  Nice bread.
Been going here for 20 years and never disappointed. Love the sandwiches and fresh deli

Outstanding submarine sandwiches! Choice of a few types of bread. Salads galore and all very tasty. Fairly quick service, noon time can get crowded. All workers are very happy, cordial and ready to serve your needs. A fellow coworker of mine who used to work there told me they really do try their best at making everybody happy and serving the best foods. I would definitely put this on the list of must stop in when in the area.

I really love Serino's! They have great daily specials, my favorite is half off brick oven pizzas on Monday, you really can't beat it! And $4.99 Chicken Parmesan Sandwich Wednesdays.

4 Stragione is my favorite (and only one I've had) - Ham, artichoke, mushroom and black olive...all my favorite toppings on one very affordable pizza! The sauce is savory and I like the little charred pieces on the crust, you can tell this is a fresh-made brick oven pizza and not just some slab of processed junk cooked on a conveyor belt. I always get extra cheese, though, because I like it nice and gooey and they just don't put enough cheese on for  MY taste.

The chicken parmesan sandwhich is really good too, there's really nothing on it except for the chicken breast, cheese and sauce, and yet it is far more filling than a sub from Subway and by far more tasty!

The only problem I have with Serino's is that they have all these other delicious things like cookies, salads, deli sides etc. all displayed temptingly near the checkout, so I'm always tempted to buy more than I need...I'm a real sucker for their peanut butter cup cookie. OMG it's so yummy and big!

This place is, by far, worth driving a little out of the way to pay about the SAME amount you would at a fast food place. You definitely get a more satisfying meal, that's for sure!

The parking lot is a bit scary, especially with the construction on Army Trail, but, again, worth it.

I love this place. I go here at least once a week for lunch - maybe even twice. The sandwiches are always tasty and always have generous portions of meat. The pizza deal on Monday (half off!!!) is always good. Prosciutto on pizza = yes please. I've had a bunch of the different paninis and the normal sub sandwiches. Gotta get the Serino dressing. Always busy during the lunch rush - sometimes you'll need to circle around the place to get a parking spot. They also deliver - but be prepared to wait if you want delivery.

My family and I were in need of food before our 5 hour drive back to Saint Louis and stumbled upon Serino's thanks to yelp. The food was amazing... I had a Serino's classic panini. The other sandwiches and pizzas looked just as good. We were even able to grab a few snacks for the ride home. The workers were very friendly and informative about their house-made products. I would definitely recommend this place! Also, if you happen to be here on a Monday, be sure to take advantage of their deal on pizza.

Went for an early lunch.  Excellent food and very reasonable prices.  Wait time for them to prepare the food was a little slow, but worth the wait.  I'd highly recommend if you're looking for a neighborhood Italian deli with good food at good prices.

This place is awesome!  Came here at 5:30 am and ordered a Sub to bring to work for lunch .... No problem they said... Very nice staff, awesome bread, meat and ingredients.  Great hot giardiniera-  a must. One of the best subs in the area.  Next time I'll try the pizza.

Rating: 4.6
Short description:  Traditional Italian Deli
Similar to:  Frankie, Mikes
Pluses:  Hot giardinera is amazing, staff is super friendly and gave great recommendations, great sandwiches
Negatives: Sometimes have goofy hours, so check beforehand.
Recommendations:  Get a jar of hot giardinera for home!

I have been wanting to stop here for months. Problem was, I was only passing it on Sundays, the only day of the week they are closed! 

I took a Friday off and decided to pop in for lunch. YUM! YUM! YUM! 

The place was packed. I grabbed the only open spot in the lot. I ordered the 9inch Italian and a garden salad to go. The sandwich was so delicious!!! The best I have had in years! The garden salad was HUGE! It was two servings for me. 

As I grabbed my food from the cashier to leave, I asked if they had packets of mayo. Instead of pointing me in the direction of where they were located, he ran over to the other side of the counter and reached over to one of the condiment bins for customers to help themselves and came back with some mayo. That was so nice of him! 

I'll definitely be back!
Very quaint place perfect for lunch! everything was great! the owner is very friendly and the food is delish totally recommend it.
Wanted to try it out and it was so good!! I had a pannini for lunch and I'm coming back for more
Very good Italian deli with the best personal pizzas. My co workers and I go there for lunch on Mondays for the half off brick oven pizzas. Can't beat it. Other days I get subs and they're the best!

My favorite deli in all of Chicago.  Hands down.  Bangbangbang.  Whatever you get, put that homemade jardiniere on top.  

Owner is also a peach.  Such nice people.

One of the best deli's I've been to.  This family puts love into their food.  From the Larry'o to the pizza.  The deli counter is filled with great things to bring home.  Top of the line service, and always friendly.  Been coming here for years, and always looking for a reason to drive over there!

I was looking for a good sandwich shop other than Subway or Jersey Mikes.  What a great surprise to find this place!  Typical fast food prices, but the quality of the food was great.  Loved the Greek pasta salad too.  Can't wait to come back to try this place again.  

Employees were really nice too.

The tiny parking lot is the only thing that I can imagine as a negative for this place. It is always amazing with friendly employees. The Serino special (prosciutto and mozzarella with dressing) is a sandwich that never disappoints. Great place that is sort of hidden in Addison, but a place that I crave and visit frequently.

I've only been there for lunch, but I have to say, the Serino Special on old-school crusty bread is the best sandwich I've ever had.  Fresh mozzarella, prosciutto, plum/roma tomatoes with house dressing.  The best.

I love Serinos subs, with a whole pickle quartered. Lunchtime crowds usually backup service a little bit, but it's generally worth the wait. fresh pasta salads very good sandwiches. I believe we may have used them for catering services at work? I know people I work with go there for lunch their menus are laying all over our lunch room counters. I like it and I think you'll like it too!

This is by far my favorite sandwich place in the West Suburbs.  Lots of choices, great ingredients, and good prices.  I love the Caprese sandwich.  Italian bread with eggplant, fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, dressing, and seasonings.  Fantastic.  When I was preggo I craved it almost every day!

There pizzas are pretty good too!  A very thin crust with your choice of toppings, even eggplant and artichokes.

They also have an actually deli counter in case you want meat to go to make your own sandwiches at home.  

This place also opens super early.  I think it might even be 5am!

Simply awesome. I'm usually in the Elmhurst/Addison area about once a week, and I was in the mood for a good quality sandwich today. I came here based on the good reviews, and I wasn't disappointed. Very fresh, great quality, and they have a big selection. My boyfriend and I both had a "create your own" sandwich and two drinks for $15, which is a great deal for how fresh everything tasted. Another plus: They're open pretty late for a deli. We'll definitely be back.

So the husband has been after me to come to Serino's for a couple of years - I have been full of excuses and I take full responsibility for the fact that he was right and I was wrong.  

It all started when he brought home a sandwich from Serino's along with a jar of giardinera.  The bread on the sandwich was nice and crusty, in the best possible way, with just the right amount of not-too-salty meats and some nice, soft cheese.  Who could be mad at that?  And then you throw in the giardinera...  I grew up watching my grandfather spoon giardinera on to everything and I would like to think it was this stuff from Serino's that he was using.  This is the best giardinera I've ever had, to the point that I was eating it out of the jar with a spoon and using the leftover oil in a vinagrette.  Awesome stuff.  We repeated this and dined inside a week or so ago.  Friendly, quick service, and the bread was nice and soft and fresh.  I like that you can pick yourself up some sides from behind the counter or grab a bottle of pop or a fountain drink - self service with a fair amount of options and even some service.

So I was wrong - wrong to resist for so long and now I dream of Serino's on a daily basis.  Go there.  It is well worth the effort  in getting there.

This place never has let me down. Because of an early work schedule I will call in on the way to work to place an order. Food is always great and most important the order is correct. I have retired places that screw up an order.

Best brick oven pizzas around!
Get the margarita pizza.  It's proper with basil, fresh moz, and the sort of paste like sauce on hand stretched dough of course.
Serino special sandwich is the bomb.  Homemade sauces are great too.  Just a little pricy at $7 a quart.   Wish they would extend their delivery hours and be open on Sunday.

I am hoping that the lunch rush brings out the worst in them because my first experience was fairly sub par. I am willing to try it out again with all of the great reviews but it would have to improve quite alot.

I ordered one of the specials of the day which was a hot pastrami on rye. My first issue was that even though I enjoy a bit of fat on pretty much everything this needed to be trimmed more. When you bit into it and your teeth wont go all of the way through resulting in pulling most of the meat out in your first bite - no good in my book. Secondly it was on the small side portion wise. Other delis in the area pile it on and this is not one of the places. Looking past that the flavor was good and the bread was fresh.

The second sammie that we ordered was a panini that had tomatoes, fresh mozz, pesto, and some greens i think. It would have been great if it was warm enough to melt the cheese. If your gonna have a panini it at least needs to be heated long enough to melt some of the cheese.

Like I said I hope it was just a bad experience during a lunch rush hour because I wanted it to be good. The price was reasonable and the line moved quick. During lunch it was a bit of a problem to park but you can circle the building and eventually find one. Im gonna hit up a couple more delis and then head over here again. Wish me luck this time...if I can find a parking spot.

I have been here many times without complaint.  
I normally have a sandwich: Paisano or Italian.  They have plenty of choices for sides and drinks. 
Their Italian deli is very good for the small space- they have another location in the Roselle area.

For this Addison location let it be known they have parking in front, sides, and back of the establishment so don't be scared the whole 5 or 6 spots in front are taken.

Closed Sundays.

Yummy in my tummy.
This small place is jam-packed full of Italian goodness. Fresh-made subs, panini, wraps, etc., homemade gelato, antipasto, salad, pasta, cheese, plus ready-to-grab ice cream, chips, drinks, etc...
So far I can report that the prosciutto is a touch fatty but very good, the fresh mozzarella is VERY fresh, the dressing is fantastic and the bread is perfect and chewy...

Yep, we'll be back to this small neighborhood gem.

The breakfast sandwich on a croissant rocks!.  I used to get these on the way to work whenever I had a chance.  It has egg, sausage, green peppers,mushrooms, onions and is greasy and perfect to wake you up early am.  Good morning energy to get you thru a long day of work.  The Deli sandwiches are fresh and taste great also I usually get the american with hot peppers.  The employees are always nice and greet me like family even thou I just met them a few years ago.  If you have heartburn they have some real old school Italian Seltzer.  Kinda like Alka seltzer but without the additives.  Pick up a bottle and pour it into some ice cold water after your worst heartburn kicks in and you will thank me.   I still have yet to try the brickoven pizza I will try that next.
Great family owned deli.  Fantastic Panini's and subs.  Great lunch spot.

Serino's is one of those places that takes me back in time.  Growing up on the NW side, I used to pedal my bike to a little storefront sub shop at the corner of Belmont & Central Pk.  Jimmy's had a small menu with maybe 7 or 8 sandwiches and the only "sides" were your choice of Jay's chips. But, man did Mr. Jimmy make the best subs around.  He used Gonnella French bread, the kind that Mom used to grab out of the tall barrels at the A&P or The National.  You know it had that hard crust but tasted so good on the inside.  I loved the end pieces and would ask Mr or Mrs Jimmy if I could have the end piece.  They were always so nice to us little snot-noses as long as we behaved in their shop.
Mr & Mrs Jimmy's really built a heckuva sub sandwich.  It's not like the corporate sub chains where you get precisely 3 slices of meat and two slices of cheese BUT you can have all of the iceberg lettuce you want!  And some of these chains brag about how they bake their own bread "so many times a day".  Yeah, big deal, it still tastes like doughy fluff.  How boring...

OK, that's right, I'm reviewing Serino's.  Sorry for the time warp.  We've had subs from Serino's at least a half dozen times and we love 'em.  I'll drive past 2 Subway's and a Quizno's just to go to Serino's, they're that good.  Let's see, I've had the Italian, American, Serino Special and Paesano.  You know, I can't say that I have a favorite.  I love them all.

Veggie friendly?  Serino's has you covered.  The Caprese (grilled eggplant, fresh mozzarella and tomatos) is fantastic!  They also have a "Veggie" which is mostly cheese.  My wife isn't a big meat lover and loves it when I surprise her with a Caprese for dinner.  I even like them especially with a glass of Pinot Noir. 

They have a nice little deli area where you can buy meats, cheeses and specialty salads.  I have bought the small containers of salads to go with our subs and have never been disappointed.

Here's a little tip when you want to cook up a quick pasta and red gravy for a fast meal.  Try Serino's Marinara or Meat Gravy that they have on the counter with a box of Barilla pasta.  Their pasta sauces are cooked right there by a lady that could be "Mama Serino" and are better than anything you can buy in the store. 

Geez, this was an awfully long review for a sub shop.  Sorry about that but I really like the place.  The only thing preventing me from giving it 5 stars is they don't use that crispy, crunch Gonnella bread that I love.  Don't get me wrong, it's pretty good bread but just not quite Gonnella.  If they ever switched to that great bread, I think I would have to find me a Schwinn Stingray, put a baseball card in the spokes and travel back in time to 1971.

Yum yum yum!

The food here is simply fantastic. When I worked out in this area, I would go to Serinos at least once or twice per week. My favorites were the Cajun Turkey, the Caprese, and the Tomato & Mozz Salad. The adorable little old man taking the orders will greet you with a smile and will probably start to recognize you on your third or fourth trip to Serinos.

However, parking does suck during the lunch rush and you often have to do a few circles around the building before you find somone leaving. I would recommend going during off times... like 12:15 or 12:45 as opposed to 12 or 12:30.

All in all, Serinos is fabulous.

Husband & I were in the area after a long meeting and needed some quick eats. I saw the awesome Yelp reviews so decided to grab a few sandwiches at Serino. It's hidden behind a gas station and doesn't look special from the outside. When we walked in we were immediately greeted with smiling faces and made some quick menu selections (meatball panini & Italian panini). We asked to sub the chips for a pasta salad & although we later learned he was not supposed to, the young man agreed so we were delighted! The sandwiches were very tasty! I regret not getting some hot peppers on my Italian but it was still great. The sandwiches are a good size and I had trouble finishing mine. I wish I lived closer so I could frequent this place and try some of their other wraps/sandwiches and order some deli meat. I was shocked there were only a few people there considering how delicious our meal was (perhaps this is due to the construction immediately out front or the fact that it was 3pm)!

Genuine Italian creations and a great atmosphere.  Subs, paninis, foccacia, whatever you choose the toppings are high and the taste, superb!  Add a deli with a mouthwatering Caprese salad and a vast beverage selection and I've found myself a lunch spot I'll be returning to as soon as possible.

I love this place for lunch. My favorite sandwich is the Caprese Panini which comes with Eggplant, Mozzarella Cheese, and Tomato. Serinos Italian Deli has many things to offer. A hot-spot for lunch and a must try!
Best sandwich in western burbs. Must try the caprese and serino special.

Best subs around. This is the ORIGINAL that sparked another location in Roselle. I love their pita wraps while my hubby swears this is the best Italian Sub he's ever had. Get the Serino dressing, it's like an italian dressing with a little something different. This place gets pretty busy around lunch time and sometimes parking can be a pain, but it's worth it. 
 The staff that works here is always very friendly and enthusiastic about their business. You can tell it's a family run place and you will see a lot of the same faces if you eat here often enough. After years of driving past Serino's wondering how it was, I finally visited a few years ago and they haven't been able to keep me away since. I've turned on a number of people to this place and haven't heard one complaint yet. Nice amounts of meat on the sandwhich for the same price you would pay at Subway, skip the chain, check out Serino's.

This place makes me so happy I moved to Addison.

The first time I ventured into this little deli, the owner greeted me and asked me if I was new to the neighborhood (which I was). He was really warm in greeting me and explained the menu. I picked the Caprese sandwich, which is to die for.

I've been back a few times since then, and haven't strayed from the Caprese. There are lots of other delicious-looking items, though!

you definitely have to try their brick oven pizzas.  you can't beat half off pizzas on mondays.  gives you something to look fwd to on mondays.  LOL.  Husband and I love their brick oven pizzas.  One of the best suburban places we've found so far.  We also get our sausage from here for pasta sauces.  GREAT people and great food.  what's there not to like?!?!

Fantastic sandwich and service. Quick, attentive, and friendly as well as a generous portion. The bread was good as was the freshness/quality of the meats and cheese's you may need an extra few napkins). I did get trapped to piece of the thick pan pizza hoping it would be like Dearborn Italian Bakery or Villa bakery (Both in the Detroit area) but I should've left it at a sandwich. The pizza was not very good but hey, the service and other tangibles make it a lock that I'll be back in the future!

I've been going here for 10 years and have had at least two dozen people convinced to go with and are now regulars. I worked in Elmhurst and would travel. I then worked in Woodridge and traveled there once a week with co-workers. I now work in Naperville and still go there. Everything is fresh and authentic Italian. Their sandwiches, bread, pizza, and salads are perfect. Try their daily specials to get a taste of perfection. Lemon chicken is unreal. Breaded steak is even better. One of a kind!!!

Any time I'm in the area, I always stop for a sub or a slice at Serino's. They have great Italian Subs. I've eaten several fantastic sub places in New York and this place totally reminds me of that. Quality of meat is excellent and the bread is freshly baked. Their slices of pizza are decent as well. I usually go to Francos by my house in Streamwood. Serino's has a much better variety though.

Wow! The breaded steak sandwich here puts Ricobene's to SHAME!!! SHAME!! SHAME!!!  Well seasoned and still crispy thin and tender steak nestled in a bed of melty provolone cheese and homemade "sugo".  (you can also order it "American style" with mayo, lettuce and tomatoes).

My coworker introduced me to this place for lunch today and I was shocked at how busy this little deli is!  The place needs a revolving door.  It's truly a gem in the neighborhood and everything is made fresh to order so don't come here if you are super tight on time. 

I love that you can buy little antipasto's for about a buck!  You can also get mini tiramisu (which I skipped today but will try next time) and the deli area is packed full of awesome homemade sopressata, capicolla and salami!  Just wonderful!  I can't wait to go back!

(if you're a fan of Bari foods in Chicago, you'll LOVE this place!)

Fresh and authentic Italian sub joint. They also have a great deli for take home cold cuts and Italian dishes. The parking is a pain but understandable bc the place is always packed bc food is fantastic. Make sure to go with the old school bread.
Caprese sandwich is the BEST -- Not just among the Serino's sandwiches on the extensive menu, but anywhere. Get the footlong.

Serino Special is a great sandwich!  I go to Serino's on my lunch break all the time with my co-workers.  Great subs, and good prices.  Lunch time can get a bit busy, but the service is still pretty quick.  The brick oven thin crust pizzas are very good.

First of all, lets say front and center I am an Italian deli snob.   Subway does NOT make sub sandwiches - they just make sandwiches.   Quiznos, Potbelly, all of them do NOT make a great Italian sub.    But this place, man, they know exactly what they are doing.   You know you are in a good place when they guy who takes the order has a heavy Italian accent.   The Italian sub is hands down the best within 50 miles.   They also have fantastic panini....  with the "Muffeleta" being the best panini I have ever had.   The parking is nearly impossible most week days as the locals fill the place up.   You can expect a wait for 20 minutes to get your food.   You can order ahead.   You will not be disappointed in this family owned, small town, REAL Italian deli.   deliziosissima!!
This is an excellent Italian place. Small but loaded with very tasty food. Everything here is perfect.

This is a great go-to place.  They serve beer & wine which are adequate.  The place rocks for a group get-together!  All is good... the pizza----- improvement needs to be done, especially for group gatherings. The pizza dough tends to be burnt.... ask that they watch for the dough to be perfect.  A careful eye....  Everything else is really good.  Love the service...especially for large groups!

My colleague that grew up in Chicago took me to this place saying that they serve the best Eggplant Caprese Panini. Boy was he right!. The panini was great. The eggplant was well marinated. I also had a side of artichokes that just tasted fantastic. This place serves some real nice homemade Italian food. Highly recommended..

One of the best Italian subs I have ever had.  The service is great, and so is the pricing.  They use high quality meats, cheeses, and bread.  It gets really busy at lunch time, but the line moves quick.  I still have yet to try the pizza but it looks amazing.
Serinos has the best subs in my area! Also nice deli. Coupons at the counter too!

I found this place by accident, and I am glad I couldn't find where I was going. They have a 25 foot deli counter with all kinds of fresh meats. Their subs come in 6, 9 or 12 inch and the french bread is packed tight with meat. They have about a dozen subs but will cater to your whim. They have homemade pizza by the slice and pizza bread. Both are very good. They have panini's in the case if your in a hurry, but it doesn't take them long to fix up something fresh. They have all kinds of slaw and potato salads in the case and again they are made in house. They also have canoli's and tirimisu. This place is a ketch all with the quantity and quality of the goods they offer. One side is like a convenient store with soda's and a humidor. The other side has all the deli and baked goods. I also saw someone come in to get a quart of sauce. But they had no carry-out or catering menu's? Great little hide-out.

Are you looking for the best fries in the Chicago-land area? Because the French fries at Shrimpy's are pretty close: cut in long, perfect blocks from fresh potatoes, steamed, slightly dehydrated in a low-temperature oven and then finally boiled in a bath of beef suet and peanut oil until they are tawny and crisp.

You may be familiar with the process of French fry triage, in which you eat what appears to be the crunchiest fry on a plate at the Apple Pan or somewhere, then the next crunchiest and so on, until you are left with the pale, mealy also-rans that you hate yourself for eating. The fries at Shrimpy's are all the best one on the plate, crisp, slightly hollow and a bit creamy inside, straight and uniformly hot -- a kind of perfection that can take a minute for the mind to process. Fries aren't meant to be this good, or at least not this consistent.

The herb-frosted New Orleans style shrimp that the fries come with isn't supposed to ease itself under your teeth quite the way it does -- outsourced shrimp is usually chewy and dry. You don't really need the tartar sauce, but damned if you are going to let it go to waste, so you essentially self-baste with the stuff and promise yourself that you'll spend an extra half-hour at the gym tomorrow morning.

If you are a restaurant-goer of a certain age in Naperville, you certaintly already have feelings about Shrimpy's, whether you've been there or not. The restaurant occupies the building formerly occupied by the beloved Long John Silvers. Its Catalina-tile fountain was moved out into the area in front of the restaurant, old-school creole jazz blares from the sound system and an oyster bar sits where the bakery counter used to be. Josh Schweitzer's iconic blocky lintels have been blown out in favor of sheer open space -- the former apartment court, which Charlie Chaplin built for his child bride in 1929, now resembles a soaring medieval banquet hall, dominated by wooden booths that stretch the length of the open kitchen. Prime-time reservations are exceptionally hard to snag.

The chef, whose polished, modern cooking you may remember from Bastide and Church & State, and maybe Patina before that, is one of the few people in Chicago capable of orchestrating a proper New Orleans tasting menu and commanding multiple Michelin stars. More than one of his followers assumed that Shrimpy's was going to mark the chef's return to the haute cuisine game after his detours into bistro cooking, the abstracted tacos at Petty Cash and the informal cafes in the Philippines. Fine dining, as opposed to cooking that includes sea urchin in the guacamole, is a neglected art in Chicago at the moment.

Shrimpy's signature, if you can call it that, is the elevation of familiar dishes through mastery of detail. Cajun shrimp, lightly fried in rice bran oil, are tucked between the petals of a nicely folded napkin flower, a presentation both attractive and practical. "Fried Catfish" turns out to be a paper cone of the feather-light chicharrones served with diced raw Tasmanian sea trout on a smear of drained yogurt with cucumber and mint, like a Mexican/Japanese/Lebanese take on surf 'n' turf.

You do find a lot of big-flavored bistro tropes here, including fried , Raclette-drenched Alsatian tarte flambÃ© scattered with a handful of chewy bacon, and tiny crocks of snails drenched in garlic butt. It is all fantastic.

Will Shrimpy's remain populist and delicious? At this point, we can only pray it does.

The worst I've ever had! Service was ok.. But the food was horrible! Manager outside washing his car. While cook serving cold food! 
Catfish- nasty
Carb cake- over cooked 
Corn on the cob- frozen (seriously)

Never again.

So maybe because this place is in an old Long John Silvers, I just always assumed that it was going to be the same sort of thing. And because I was never a huge fan of LJS, I never managed to stop into Shrimpy's until today, when my mom and I wanted something a little different before our trip to the mall.

But LJS never had scallops, dungeness crab, crab cakes, crawfish, crab legs, or lobster, all of which are on Shrimpy's menu, along with an abundance of shrimp. You can get it fried or boiled and with assorted seasonings. Cajun is the theme here (from the zydeco music to the mardi gras beads to the flavorings). 

We went with fried shrimp, which were large, simple and tasty with a light cornmeal batter, and the crab cakes, unassuming-looking pucks that yielded yummy seafood as well as some spice and bits of bell pepper and went well with the remoulade. 

The two staff members we interacted with (lady at the counter and guy who had been in the kitchen but came out to clear our table and asked how we liked the meal) were both very friendly.

Shrimpy's has a drive thru, but it did take a few minutes to get the order inside (not a big deal; I don't think of seafood as being "fast food" the way a burger is), so I would say plan accordingly if you are hoping for a to go order. I feel like fish tastes best when freshly prepared, so I would rather eat in anyway!

Decor is a combo of Mardi Gras and craft store sign extravaganza. 

I will definitely return to try other menu items!

I had the shrimp boil here, and boy oh boy was it good stuff!!! To be able to find a Cajun flavored shrimp boil cooked to perfection in these parts of town is nearly impossible so I really appreciated this place! Oh, and the hush puppies and the sweet potato fries were pretty awesome too! This place does need an upgrade on the decor though!

Stopped in today to see what Shrimpy's was all about. Not terribly hungry, I ordered the "adult" Fish and Chips dinner. First of all,  the signage is a bit misleading as the meal does not come with a drink as shown. Secondly, with only one family (5 people) in the store, you would have a thought there would be a short wait time. Not so. After at least a 10 minute wait, my food was finally ready. Granted, the fries were good, but the fish was absolutely tasteless. Perhaps other menus items are better, but I'll never know because I'm one and done.  And I cannot imagine what they would do if a crowd showed up; panic?

This was my second visit, and I reserved my review until I'd tried it again.  Shrimpy's looks like a fast food joint complete with drive thru, so I'd passed it by for a long time.  I heard it was the former location of a Long John Silver.  It's not fast food, the menu is replete with every shellfish except I don't remember seeing oysters.  Blue crab, crab legs, mussels, clams, lobster,  shrimp (head on or off), calamari, cat fish, cod, etc. There are sides like hush puppies, corn bread, garlic bread, corn, and the ubiquitous fries including sweet potato fries.  The first night, a Friday, there was a wait of 20+ minutes for a fried shrimp dinner that included 6 "jumbo" shrimp, fries and two sauces.  Seafood by the pound both fried and boiled, seasoned boiled included garlic, Cajun, and  one other I can't remember.  It showed promise.  You can eat in or carry out, no delivery.  My order to go was sad, limp fries, only 5 shrimp that were borderline "jumbo" and I paid extra for 6 oily hush puppies.  Second visit I told them I got only 5 shrimp, (no comment) ordered 1/2lb steamed shrimp with rajun Cajun sauce and garlic bread.  The garlic bread turned out to be a short bread stick for $1.89, which should have been free and in no way simulated garlic bread. Problem with food like this is it's not heavy and overly filling.  The satisfaction of seafood is taste.  No taste, no satisfaction.  The steamed shrimp were good, not enough alone so it needs a side or 1/2 lb of another fish!  Should I give it a third try for a third star?  Most reviews are inconsistent, hoping for a 4* experience! Stay tuned!

I finally checked Shrimpy's out after passing it by so many times.  Which I can't figure out why I just discovered this place since it's at a major intersection I pass through frequently.  

The seafood here is excellent.  I ordered the cajun shellfish combo, which was served in a steamy plastic bag: shrimp, crawfish, crab legs, red potatoes, and corn on the cob.  The sauce everything was served in had just the right amount of flavor and heat to it and didn't take away at all from the natural deliciousness of the insects of the ocean.

Service was excellent--the staff were very friendly, had character, and were quite interactive.  The place was clean.  Even the bathroom smelled delicious, not even kidding.  There was a little bit of a wait time as it was a Friday night during the Lent season, but it was all worth it from the second I opened that steaming bag of fresh seafood to the moment I dropped the last empty shell at the top of the boneyard I created.  I'll definitely be back.

Very disappointed! Especially when I had such a big craving for shrimp...what a big let down. Shrimp was not cooked properly and my corn was still cold/frozen...yuck! Will not be going back to this place. What wasted seafood potential...smh

The food was excellent, service was excellent, my wifr and I had the sampler platter, my son had the chicken fingers (he is 3 lol), the food was great!  There is a bit of a wait but the food is made to order do its completely understandable.  Everything was served hot and has that awesome homemade flavor so many fish places fail at!

I was excited to try this place. Today was my second time trying Shrimpy's. The first time the food was fresh and tasty, but today I was served pre-breaded "catfish steaks" which were neither fresh or tasty. They tasted frozen. The first time my fries and hush puppies were great, today the hush puppies were dry and the fries were warm and unimpressive. 

This place has really great tarter sauce, but I asked for tarter sauce today and I was told to "try the "special sauce" He did not want to give me any tarter sauce because he was so excited about his "special sauce" which was anything but special. The sauce tasted exactly like ranch dressing mixed with hot sauce. I don't like ranch dressing on my fish.

While the food was good on my first visit, the prices are still too high for the amount of food that you get. I paid $10 for the 4 piece "Jumbo Shrimp" basket and my child was still hungry after eating the tiny portion of food. I knew that there would only be 4 pieces, but I thought that there was some new Giant Alien Jumbo shrimp that I'd get to justify the price-It was just a regular sized shrimp.

The employees are very nice. The restaurant has sit down prices, but its setup like a fast food joint, that might not work if it ever gets busy because you'll have 15-20 people waiting near the registers in a tiny space for their order. My orders took about 15 minutes each time so be aware of that if you are going on your lunch break.

I really wanted to like this place, but the setup is wrong, the prices are too high, the portions too small, and if I'm going to wait 15 minutes for my food I want it to be hot and consistent.

UPDATE- A "MR. G" sent me a message saying " Hello young Khalilah would you like to see the kill dates?" WTH? I hope that he is referring to the fish and not my untimely "young" life...Dude is Cray Cray for harassing anyone who leaves a review. Mr. G you should read Yelp reviews as constructive criticism and not as an attack- take this time to improve.

I Ordered three dinners, the Basa fish dinner (1 fillet), Cajun chicken wing dinner (5 wing pieces, not whole wings) and Jumbo shrimp dinner (4 jumbo shrimp). All the dinners came with fresh cut fries and hush puppies that were good and everything was cooked fresh.

The taste of the fish, chicken and shrimp were very good, the seasoning was excellent.  The customer service was very good and welcoming, they took time to explain the menu and how  everything was prepared.

My only gripe was the portion sizes for the prices, I paid almost $10 for 4 shrimp, fries and two hushpuppies. The chicken wing dinner consisted of 5 wing sections (not 5 whole wings) fries and 2 hushpuppies and cost about $7

All and all the food and service were good, but if they want to compete with other places in the area they will have to either adjust their prices or increase the portion sizes. Too expensive for what you get.

Shrimpy's is a really cool concept for the far western burbs- which is fresh cajun-style seafood.  I'm glad I didn't have the same negative experience others have complained of.  My experience was so different that I'm thinking this restaurant may have just attracted a few crabby complainers. ;)

I was greeted by a girl in a chef ensemble at the counter. She was friendly enough.  I ordered the popcorn shrimp basket and a drink. My total came to just under 10 bucks.  It took about 10 minutes till it was ready. My basket had a hefty serving of extra crispy crunchy popcorn shrimp, a fair size portion of delcious skin-on hand cut fries and a cup of coleslaw.  My basket came with a side of fry sauce (i think it was a mixture of mayo and tabasco) and a side of cocktail sauce.  They also offer packets of various other sauces at the condiment station, but we didn't see ketchup anywhere- little strange.  I would definitely go back and hope to try something different and more adventurous next time like one of the 3 fishes they offer.
Manager hyped up the place. I really wanted to like it, but now at 3 am, as I'm sitting in the bathroom with what seems to be food poisoning, I am not going back! EVER!

I'm trying to be fair with this review. Had I not waited 30 minutes in the drive thru I would have given this one more star. 
I had seen this place for a few months ago and I had made a mental note that I should try it. 
So on a Friday evening I decided to pick up food for dinner from this place. 
Like I said before, the wait was a little over 30 minutes. I ordered two shrimp meals. It included fries and coleslaw and also a kids meal fish and chips. 
I knew I was in for a lengthy wait when I was offered a drink while I waited. I took a Sprite and it was served in a small cup. I sat and sat and sat waiting. I could see through the window that bags of food were being packaged and each time I would be hopeful. Each time I was disappointed. I waited for 30 minutes!! Did I say that already? Ugh.. 
I had a 3 year old with me who was being impatient so after 20 minutes the drive they girl asks if she can refill my drink. I declined but asked how much longer, she asked the cook who said my order was next. That was an additional 12 minutes later. 
After I finally got my food and got home I opened up my to go box and I was disappointed. The food just did not look good. I have to admit that the shrimp tasted better than they looked. I ate my dad looking shrimp and fries and called it a day. I can tell you that my meal was not worth the 30 minute wait. I can go to culvers and get the shrimp meal in about 8 minutes. 
I won't be returning. I can't justify sitting in the drive thru waiting for 30 minutes. Food was not worth the time. 
The drive thru girl was pleasant.

At Shrimpy's. ok I always wait for a bit when i see a new restaurant. Man sure wish I hadn't. The shrimp is served New Orleans at its best. Spill it out in the tray, pour it on the table, eat it your way. The Catfish was piping hot and tender and juicy fried right. The okra was incredible. Everything here is made fresh and you get your money worth. The staff are very knowledgable about seafood in its entirety. The atmosphere is fun, friendly, southern hospitality. I feel like I'm home in the bayou. Restaurant is kept clean, the food is hot, and the staff couldn't be more inviting. El is an amazing man at this southern style, cajun, joint. Plenty of choices, seasonings, and seafood options.

Head on shrimp boiled in the bag with the ragin' cajun sauce extra hot! Soooo dank! And affordable....


Also the fried perch.

Also he fried okra.

Did I also mention they have the BEST service in the world!!!

You will be well fed and well taken care of guaranteed.

My best friend and I were in the area shopping at 2nd & Charles across the street when we got hungry. I had seen Shrimpy's from the street so we decided to give it a try. I honestly was not expecting the quality seafood that we got. With multiple "seafood boil" places popping up lately, it is great to see one with high quality seafood at a good price. The staff was extremely nice, the manager was very friendly, and our bag of crawfish was cooked to perfection. Shrimpy's really is a great addition to the Naperville/Aurora area.

I love food. I love independent thoughts. I hate shrimpy's. Soooo let down that Shrimpy's had good food but cheap, lazy, and disgusting feature's. Walked in at 2pm with four dirty tables and at least 2 dozen independent fries swimming the floor of shrimpy's. No soda fountain and I have gotten better effort from constipation than the workers at the Cleveland Browns style of let down. I cant imagine any reason to do this again. Quite simply: won't be back and won't be back with your gastrol system.

At the night manager's request, here is my review: we were not disappointed.  I loved the raging Cajun sauce, though I might have got it hot instead of medium.  My girlfriend LOVED the crab cakes.  Said they were the best she'd ever had.  The Cajun fries were fresh and very tasty, even without ketchup.  We are definitely coming back, and I will be trying the crawfish and she will be trying the hush puppies, okra and snow crab legs.

Price is ok with the serving amount. I ordered half lb craw fish and get a whole bag with two corns and a lot cube potatoes. However, claw fish is 1/5 live, 3/5 dead, 1/5 worse than dead. The Cajun sauce has no flavor at all. My friend got shrimp which taste like it comes from the frozen family size bag in grocery store, although it is still better than the dead craw fish.

2 star is for the nice people working there.

My wife and I saw Shrimpy's on Route 59 and decided to give it a try.  This place is great!!   Everything is made fresh and Al, the manager and I believe the owner is very friendly and personable.  My wife ordered a 1/2 lb of Garlic butter Shrimp and 1/2 lb of the Ragin Cagin Shrimp.  I ordered a 1/2 lb of the fried shrimp and we shared an order of sweet potato fries.

This is is not fast food.. Food comes in about 15 minutes and is well worth the wait.  The shrimp are ridiculously large... I could not believe it and the breading and seasoning were phenomenal.  My wife devoured her shrimp which were excellent.  She LOVED the Ragin Cajun Shrimp... So much we went back the next day.
Our first time trying this place I had hush puppies , basa and perch! Amazing great to find a place like this in the suburbs! And great staff everyone is soo engaging

I actually do like this place. Everything about it is cute. Although I have never had the hands to just sit down and eat here but from the looks of it people seem to enjoy themselves while their there.  I have eaten from here about 3 times now and I can honestly say that at first they reminded me of the angry crab restaurant on the north side of Chicago because the concept is the same. They serve you seafood in a bag by the pound or half pound but they also have other dishes too. However I am not truly in love with the food lately. I think for the location and I guess seafood market prices they are fairly priced but as far as flavor is concerned, I think it's lacking in that department.  When you crack into a crab leg and dip it into the sauce the flavor is just suppose to burst in all over your tastebuds but lately I did not get the same quality I did when I first visited. Who knows maybe it was an off day or something. I am still willing to give them a shot. By the way the young ladies at the counter are always so friendly.

Shrimpy's is great! 100 percent authentic East Coast, New Orleans style seafood boils. We had a couple of the shrimp dishes and they were excellent both in terms of flavor and quality.

This joint would make money hand over fist in downtown Naperville but I worry it won't last due to poor visibility, parking and general expectations of what the place should be.

There is a problem with the service. It took too long for the food to be ready. We were the only people there the afternoon we visited. I can only imagine how it must be when they are really busy. This is something they will need to overcome to survive. Part of it is the expectation that they are serving fast food, which isn't really the case. I think the management would be rewarded by giving every table some kind of freebie appetizer, like hush puppies or something, to keep patrons distracted while they wait for their food.

True, the prices are a bit spendy but the quality and flavor of what you get in return was one of a kind in this area.

Great seafood!  I had the Ragin Cajun shrimp and the sweet potato fries.  They were excellent!  My husband had the fried shrimp.  There are very lightly breaded.  The shrimp were very big and fabulous.  Not greasy at all!!  

This is not your typical "Fast Food"?restaurant.  It takes a bit of time to make, as it is all made while after you order, but it is worth the wait!  

Give it a try!

most of these reviews are, i'm guessing, from people who eat at and expecting JJ fish/Sharky type of establishments. The one from auroraf was the most ridiculous review I've ever read on Yelp. Seriously, you never even tried to place and you gave it the lowest stars? BOGUS


anyway, i felt compelled to add a positive review because this place is definitely not the place some misguided reviews paint it to be. i ordered a pound of the head on shrimp in the bag, a pound of the crawfish, and the chicken planks with fries. the head on shrimp and crawfish were so good. very fresh, naturally sweet and the sauce was very good. head on shrimp spoils very quickly so this was a great indicator of freshness. the chicken planks were ok and the fresh cut fries were good except they sprinkled a great spice mix on it but too spicy for my kids. It was my first time here so i'll know next time to request it without.

as for the price, i had nothing to complain about. seafood is not cheap, but this was a bargain. a pound of head on shrimp was 16.99 that day(i imagine prices fluctuate often due season and availability) and came with corn and potatoes. you're not going to get much shrimp at red lobster or any other chain. 

great seafood in the bag for a good price. ill be coming back as long as the quality remains.

Came into Shrimpys excited to try some shrimp (obviously). The man who appeared to be the owner was very friendly and showed us the entire menu. They have an impressive selection of different types of fish, even crawfish! 

Trying the recommendations from the owner we order the Basa fish basket and the jumbo shrimp basket both with come with fries and hush puppies. Hush puppies were delicious, but the fries were very soggy. The jumbo shrimp had a plastic kind of taste to them making them inedible. The Basa fish tasted good but it was very greasy. Along side the soggy fries it made for a bad combination. The portions of cocktail and hush puppy sauce were so tiny it made for only one or two dips. To top it off the same song played on repeat throughout our entire meal. As much as I wanted to like Shrimpys I was disappointed.

I visited Shrimpy's for the first time today.  The Naperville/Aurora area has been lacking a QUALITY Cajun Seafood restaurant for quite some time.  I'm beyond pleased with the quality of food here, and will officially become a regular.

I ordered the Shrimp basket and added a piece of Basa fish.  Food took a little time to be prepared, but this was a good sign... I knew right away the food is made to order.  

They brought the food over, and the appearance was quite pleasing.  I was also provided some homemade tartar and cajun sauces for my seafood choices.  First thing I took a bite out of was the hushpuppies.  I have NEVER eaten hushpuppies this fresh and this tasty.  I was also happy to see some corn niblets and some scallions inside.  

Next thing I tried was the shrimp.  Soon as I bit into the shrimp, I immediately knew by the texture this was some seriously fresh shrimp.  It had the desired "snap" when your teeth sink into it, and the taste was extraordinary.  It was also juicy, and not dried out as you commonly experience with frozen shrimp.  The shrimp itself (ignoring the breading) had that fresh taste.  I did see on another review that it tasted "plasticky"... no no sweetheart, that taste is fresh shrimp.  As for the breading, it was perfect.  Just enough to coat the shrimp, and provide the wonderful cajun seasoning to compliment the freshness of it.  The cajun dipping sauce was also very pleasing.  It had the right balance of seasonings, and had a nice kick to it as well.

Next up was the Basa fish.  Until today, I've never heard of this fish before.  I was very happy with the texture of the fish.  The breading was just right as this filet is thinner (similar to tilapia, but had a grouper texture), and it wasn't heavy or greasy.  Also, the seasonings were mildly added, which is exactly what I'd want out of a fish filet like this.  I could still taste the fish, and it wasn't overpowered by the breading/seasonings.  The homemade tartar sauce was a delightful compliment to the fish, and also liked that it was not too salty...  I've had my share of tartar sauces that always are heavy on salt or onion seasoning.

Now, for the fries.  Folks, these are FRESH CUT fries.  So, if you've never had them before, don't be surprised as they will NOT have the crispy outside you would expect from treated frozen potatoes served at your chainy fast-food restaurants.  They tasted excellent, and again, the ratio of seasonings was just right.  I could still taste the potato, but yet it was nicely complimented by the cajon flavors.

The staff at this location are very friendly as well!  It was a pleasure chatting with the owner about how much I loved the food.

Overall, I'm very pleased and will without a doubt be returning to try the other offerings.

I have now been to Shrimpy's twice! Both times wonderful service, good food and not a long wait time at all for fresh food. We ordered the Crawfish (both times), kids shrimp meal, hush puppies & the fries; all of which was delightful. The owner was walking around saying hi to everyone and suggesting items, very nice man. Cashier was over the top nice, checked on us twice even though it is a fast food restaurant. 

I am taking my mom there for the first time tonight, she needs some clam strips. Would love this place to make it. Do not let some bad reviews keep you away from a new place.

Pleasantly surprised as it doesn't look like much from the outside.
