Shrimp was big and juicy, coating/breading was different than most - but in a good way, little bit of Cajun spice and not over breaded. Sweet potato fries were fabulous! Service was pleasant and cook was friendly. Food was fresh, so it took a little while, but well worth the wait.

I had the most horrible food and customer service experience at this restaurant. The seafood was not fresh and when I returned to address my complaints, I was insulted and basically inferred to be a liar.

First off, the service was deplorable.  They were short-staffed and the staff clearly had not been trained so it wasn't their fault personally, but gads was it terrible.  Phoned in ahead and still waited 15 minutes in the drive through. The guy who finally gave me my food forgot half of my order, then forgot my drinks.

Then the food: It actually made Long John Silver seem like gormet seafood.  Everything was clearly taken out of a freezer and dropped right into a fryer, and it tasted like cardboard. Soggy fries, undercooked mushy hushpuppies.  And way overpriced for the sub-par quality of the food.  We won't be back.

Great food,  even better customer service!

I was initially going to stay away due to some of the low reviews ...but went anyway and so glad I did. 

Food was fresh and tasty.

I've traveled around the country and have Cajun food and crawfish. The owner was friendly but the service was slow. The owner mentioned he had live colossal crawfish. After waiting 30 mins for our order we took our food home and found out the crawfish were tiny. They were also frozen not fresh. The seasoning wasn't very good either. We also had crab legs and had corn, potatoes and sausage. The corn wasn't fresh and the potatoes were still hard as rocks. After $95 worth of food we were so disappointed! This place is not worth the wait and is way over priced. The places in the city are a lot better.

I gave Shrimpy's a two star because both times my food was fresh.  I have had the cajun wings and they were very small for the price and much, much too salty.  The fried fish seemed pre-breaded.  There is a wait but fresh food is worth waiting for so I can't knock them there.  If you are not familiar with their menu, go inside, do not go through the drive through because it's a little confusing in my opinion and they seem to rush you so go inside.  The sauces are good.  The prices seem to be a bit steep on some things.

On the busy rt59 where majority of restaurants can't make a fried rice right or call them self a Japanese restaurant but serve undercooked Chinese food  Shrimpy's is the gemstone in the mud of make believe restaurants.
Seafood here is fresh like it's been just caught this morning, I mean shrimp has this crunch to it like it was live and kicking 20 min ago.
It's my second time at Shrimpy's in last 3 days and I think I'll be coming back tomorrow. There is so many things on the menu that I still want to try like basa fish, clams and mussels, fried calamari and okra just to mention few of my favorites. 
Staff is friendly just like at New Orleans and atmosphere is like in the kitchen of a Italian family and it brings that out in customers who comes to order food, striking conversation with a random person becomes normal and good experience.
So overall bring your friends, your family, your coworkers share grate food and moments with those you love.

Had a crab leg boil, my husband had a mixed shellfish boil. Everything was so delicious. The owner welcomed us, came out & checked on us, and shook our hands when we left. I haven't gotten service like that in 4-star restaurants. I will definitely go back soon. Oh and the prices were great.

Seafood in a bag. In the space formally occupied by Long John Silvers, this restaurant offers reasonably priced cajun food. The space still has the Long John Silvers feel to it so its still rather nostagic

I had the king crab boil tonight, once again amazing customer service and the food was outstanding. The wait was 10 minutes which was expected since everything is cooked fresh and made to order. I have been there on a Friday night when they had a full house and I received the same great service and my wait time is exactly what should be expected for freshly prepared food.

Went to Shrimpy's for the first time today. We got the fried sampler platter and the 1/2 pound seafood combo boil. The service was awesome and the girl at the counter recommended what we got and it was fantastic! She did a great job advising us what would be the best order in order to try as much as possible. We got a lot of food for $30 total. The fried sampler was great - Basa fish, shrimp, wings, fries, and hush puppies for about $10.99.  It was a huge piece of fish and with the the boil combo, it was the perfect amount of food.  The seafood combo boil had crawfish, shrimp, and crab legs for about $13.  We chose the butter garlic sauce and it was delicious. There was also the option to add corn and potatoes, but we decided to just go with the seafood. 

The service was great, the food was enjoyable, the only reason I marked down was because of the decor/cleanliness/atmosphere. When you first walk in the decor and cleanliness, may make you think twice, but I definitely recommend sticking around for the food. Worth the trip!

Definitely would recommend the owners do a restaurant makeover to help bring it up to par with the food.

The food is good however it is rather pricey! Either they should give more food for the price or lower the prices. It is set up like a fast food restaurant but everything requires a wait so the set up is strange. But hey to each its own. The food is good enough for me to go back but the prices will make sure that I dont go back too often.

This used to be an old long john silvers, that is now given a new orleans feel. The decor is pretty cool because i'm a big fan of new orleans/cajun. They also have a lot of ragtime music playing which i like.
     As for the food. I ordered the pound of crawfish and i really liked it. I had the cajun flavor and it came with a piece of corn and potatoes, all made together in a bag. I really liked he cajun flavor. It was not too spicey but had a really distinct flavor. At $13, i thought it was a fair price. It came with a creamy sweet cajun sauce that took me a while to get used to. My girlfriend went with the fried catfish basket and she didn't hate it but she felt it wasn't worth the price. I agree because her basket was $8 but only came with 1 piece of fish and a small order of fries. She enjoyed the fish, but felt the value was not there.
   We feel this is a good place to check out and see if it's you're type of restaurant. Especially because it won't cost you an arm and a leg. 
    The reason i feel this is 3 stars is because even though i liked my crawfish i can see how the catfish was a bit dissapointing and did not stand out in any way.

Ok we have been going there since loved the food . But went last Friday and bought $80 dollars worth of food and was told take 25m. So wife waited over 20 m and called my wife told get money back so when she food was particularly ready the manger threw food down  and he had attitude . My wife came home over hour 30m wait  and shrimp was over cook  So called  ask for the manger waited 10m on phone So called back girl answered the phone ask for the manger told he would call back or never did . I understand you get busy but if told 25m food should be there if need longer you tell people .  The manger has know idea how run and treat people better I will never go back there again .

Pleasantly surprised by this little fish fry shack. I have driven by the place numerous times and finally decided to give it a whirl. I tried the shrimp basket, which was beyond what I expected. For 8.99, you get 6 large shrimp, what seems a pound of fries and cole slaw (along two dipping sauces). The shrimp were great with a little bit of spice. The fries remind me of larger cuts from Great Steak & Potato fries. Overall, I'm impressed and would come again.

I had a really good experience here, we had the 6 piece jumbo shrimp with fries and coleslaw and it was AMAZING!! They were JUMBO so I'm not understanding some previous reviews unless it was some mistakes with their grand opening or whatever??? Not sure but they were awesome and the dips were incredibly flavorful. We will be back for sure.

If I could give negative 5 stars I would.   Waited over an hour for our food ( one shrimp basket and 1perch basket). Food extremely well done and dried out.  Threw the food away.  Will NEVER return . Girl taking order was very pleasant...only positive.

EDIT;
Since leaving this review have been receiving nasty "compliments" and messages from a Mr. G,  Most recently today I received below comment.

Mr G: stop praising your racust bigot ways we will be seeing you in court for your slanderous remarks we have now obtained your address , cell and home phone.

We, too, wanted to like this place.  The portions are way too small for the prices. I see from reviews, and as indicated on menu, the jumbo shrimp used to be 4 pieces.  They have since upt the count to 6.  However, We also ordered the perch dinner, which I had to hunt for amongst the mountain of fries. The coleslaw was old and disappointing.  Staff was friendly, but with so many other options, we will not be back.
I  came in for the first time ordered the jumbo Shrimp basket. wasn't horrible but not equal to the price. I think I will stay with Amato for their jumbo Shrimp dinner. better value

First time in. Stumbled across this gem. Good food. Love the independent local feel. Gotta step up the service. Need to do better to explain unique menu and offerings. Need better smiles and confidence at the counter. Looking forward to returning. Hope they make a go of it.
I don't agree at all with the bad reviews. This place was awesome. The food was great, and the owners behind the counter were extremely friendly. Those were the best crab legs I've ever had.
Bad overpriced food,  bad service dirty don't go here. Really small cups. Makes Long John silver's look like red lobster

No Coke products. Service was terrible. Spilled ice tea on my Mac. Napkins weren't really soaking up the spill. Person slowly sauntered out from behind the back. She had a rag in hand but I had to run over to get it because it would have taken her a good :30 to get to my table. There were no customers so it wasn't like she had to focus on anything else.

Food was hot.  The seasoning was great.  I was told that the hush puppies were homemade and you could tell the difference from what is usually served at other places.  The servers were really friendly and helped offered suggestions.  I tried the crawfish in a bag with corn and potatoes in garlic butter sauce and it was to die for!!!!!!!  I will be returning.

Went  there for lunch today the lady working behind the counter was totally awesome and very nice. I ordered the fish basket and a diet soda bill came to just under $11 bucks. The meal consisted of one fish fillet about the size of your hand, french fries equivalent to one small potato, and a container of coleslaw equivalent to one large tablespoon. I found it to be very salty and greasy. I don't think I will go back.

The shrimp are good but the 40 minute wait for fried shrimp fresh or frozen is ridicukous. I didn't even go during a peak time (3:40 PM on a Saturday)and it wasn't that crowded. If you go here you should head there about an hour before you actually want to eat.

Jumbo Shrimp Basket was flavorful, fries were greasy. 15 minute wait for our food. I requested tartar sauce and was handed a handful of packets called "Seafood Sauce", which ended up being cocktail sauce (I hate cocktail sauce). No tartar sauce, Strike 1. No drive thru, Strike 2. Portion size for the dollars spent, Strike 3. And you're out. Shrimpy's didn't deliver for us, so unfortunately,   we won't return.

Coming from Houston, I was very excited when this place opened. I stopped by to see what it was like and I was very impressed. The food is good, the service is excellent. The guy at the register was very welcoming and the owner is very pleasant. This is now my new seafood place for the Aurora/Naperville area! I don't complain about prices because I only eat out when I am prepared to spend some money for the convenience of having someone else cook my meal. One thing I know for sure, it is much cheaper than Pappadeaux.

Sooooooo good! shrimp was cooked well and seasoned in garlic butter which was amazing.  The service was friendly and very patient as I had never ordered there before.  Wait time was not very long for such a good product.  Overall was a very satisfied customer. Will definitely be trying out the rest of the menu very soon!

Had the fried shrimp and catfish. The food was good and made to order.  They appear to be understaffed though and it took a long time for anyone to acknowledge me and take my order. Hopefully they will work out the kinks. Worth checking out if you're not in a hurry.
Food is good and cooked to order. Nice spice on the batter and fries. A little pricey. Cashier was rude and unprofessional.
Wait too long, prices too high, portions small. Probably won't go back. Food ok. They said it was jumbo shrimp which in reality was medium at best.

We ordered a lb.of snow crabs and a catfish dinner. All of the food was very tasty and reasonably priced. We were given nice portions which were very filling. The service was friendly and fast. I would definitely recommend this spot to satisfy your seafood cravings.
Great place!! Al is amazing- great customer service!! Crab Legs are spot on - can't wait to come back and taste the crawfish.

Just went to Shrimpys for the first time. Great menu and it's all fresh.  I had popcorn shrimp, garlic shrimp and fried clam strips.  Also had hush puppies that were very good. The person with me had crawfish and she said it was great.

So if you want fresh seafood that's reasonably priced Shrimpys is the place to go.

The seating was very nice and parking easy. Also we were served very quickly.  The owner was quite accommodating.

We have been at Shrimpy's 3 times and will keep coming. We enjoyed a similar restaurant in DC called Hot N Juicy Crawfish. We have always had the either the crawfish, shrimps and crabs by the pound / in a bag in ragin' cajun (medium) .... absolutely delicious. Crawfish and shrimps are really fresh ... the blue crabs were OK. For the sides, our fav is the fried okra ... cole slaw is pretty good too. The sausage is good and has a nice spicy kick ... just a bit small size portion.

I stopped by not knowing what to expect. The counter worker was vey friendly. My husband ordered the shrimp basket- they gave him extra shrimp. I had the fish basket, choosing perch. Both portions were sufficient for us. The food was good, the home style fries were delicious. The bathroom could have used a little attention but overall our experience was good and we will return.

Waited over 25 minutes and asked how much longer it would be. The cook didn't even have our ticket anymore, meaning he gave our food away to someone else. We asked for a refund because we could not wait any longer and were told we had to wait for the manager. We waited over 5 minutes for the manager and the employee told us there was not one on site and that it could be another 10 minutes. The manager came out hostile, telling us we could have waited for our food. We told him we did not have time to wait because we needed to leave. He was yelling at us and then proceeded to say that we were the type of customers he did not want. The place is filthy. The employees play with their phones then touch your food without washing or wearing gloves. Wish I could leave negative stars.

Authentic Cajun boils. I've been to Louisiana numerous times and the boils I've had here can stand up. My boils didn't have the corn and sausage I am used to having in low country boils in LA, but they were great nonetheless. I had the cajun sauce in medium heat. I tried some of the fried Basa my husband had and was light,non- greasy - so a win as well. We'll definitely be back. I hope people get on board to support this place as is a nice addition to the flavor profile of the area:)!

I enjoyed the bag of crawfish that I received. However there are glaring problems with the restaurants processes or lack there of. I went to Shrimpys a Friday during lent so I understand that a fish establishment will be busy.  However the gentleman working the register was also trying to expedite the food.  I watched food die in the window as he took orders and I watched people grow impatient as they waited to place an order. As I waited for 45 min I heard them continuously promise waits of 10 min to the new tickets. While I was there they lost a couple tickets and saw at least three people complain about incorrect orders and one who demanded money back after waiting a hour. I spent much of my 45 min exchanging looks with other customers waiting as we watched the glaring organization problems. I think much of the frustration came from customers being misled on ticket times. I appreciate that things are being cooked to order, but I also appreciate honesty.

I finish by pleading with Shrimpys to fix some necessary issues because I would like to see them succeed in the nitch they are trying to fill. I will return to Shrimpys because the food was enjoyable and because I will give them the benefit of being a young business. I hope they are able to iron out the kinks.

My husband and I gave this place 2 chances.  I will give them this: the service is good.  They are friendly and helpful. The food,  that's where the problem is. 
The first time we got the shrimp basket. Nothing special. The shrimp was mushy and flavorless.  The fries were mediocre at best.  I was unimpressed and disappointed,  as I really wanted a great seafood place in the neighborhood. 
The second time just solidified that we will never eat there again.  I ordered the crawfish (why do they stuff the fish into 2 huge plastic garbage bags?) and it was disqusting.  It was like looking at a plate of large red crickets that tasted worse than they looked. The only way I'd ever eat that is if it were the apocolypse and I was running out of dead frogs to eat. Gross. 
It cost $50 for some bland, soggy shrimp,  a garbage bag full of dead red crickets and some lifeless lukewarm fries.  It took 2 days to get the stench of their food out of the house.  I tore up their menu.  Return? Never again.

Finally came in to try it out . I have to say this place is AWESOME ! Love the concept of the New Orleans style . Amazing flavorful food . The owner is very nice clearly explained the menu and makes sure you enjoy what he has to offer . This isn't your typical fast food place down the street . You can tell that everything is made fresh to order . There is nothing like this in the area which is a breath of fresh air to the neighborhood. Give it a try you won't regret it !
2nd visit....great food.  Fresh, hot, filling and tasty.  I had the shrimp basket, my husband had the crawfish, kids had the crab legs and  my mom had the crab cakes.  No complaints from this camp.

If you enjoy SPICY food, this is the spot for you! The employees were very patient in explaining the menu and their products. Good but not GREAT seafood. I guess I expected a little more food for the $ I paid at this place today. I tried the jumbo shrimp basket. They should notify the customer that all their food is SPICY!!!! I'm extremely sensitive to spices. I could not enjoy the "average" size "jumbo" shrimp because of the heat. Owners should consider offering a batter for their fried foods with no heat. I added on hush puppies which were really good. I also added on corn on the cob which was a 5in. Ear for $1.89.....really? Finally, you would expect a really good tarter sauce at a "Sea food" restaurant. Unfortunately, they only had a generic store bought package of tasteless tarter sauce.....disappointing. There was a "special" mustard based sauce offered.... Not sure what it was supposed to go with. I will go back to try one of the boiled bags....... no spice please!!

Our family really enjoyed everything we ordered. We had the seafood in the bag which was awesome!! My 14 year old son gave the fried chicken a "thumbs up". I saw the 2 stars, but we still gave this place a try and will definitely come back!! Thanks Al for the great customer service.
Food is good.   Wait time is terrible!   I have gone there on more than one occasion and they are consistently slow!!

Not exactly the worst place for seafood but I can tell you its not good seafood. Ordered a bag of boiled shrimp that smelled very fishy, which only means its not fresh. Good Shrimp is supposed to be sweet not pungent and fishy. The andouille sausage was undercooked and tasted like school cafeteria hotdog. The only thing that tasted good was the fries..and on top of that, me and my wife can hear the manager in the back yelling at someone, i think it was the cook. Not professional! Will not come back to this place..

Go to Italian restaurant in the area. Kind of hidden, but such a great find. The service is great, very friendly and prompt. Like typical Italian places, they give you bread, oil, and TONS of parmesan. Great wine selection. It's a very romantic area in the main dinning section but also has a casual bar area. Large but very tasty food portions. I had the prosciutto chicken, which I highly recommend, and my husband had the chicken parmesan, which was also delicious.

Wow! What happened? I gave this place 4 stars a year ago. Used to be good, I was willing to cut our server slack, he seemed new, not sure of anything, screwed the order up, and took for ever.
The main issue was the fish I ordered was not even edible! Super dry, came in a bunch of small pieces like it was whatever they could dig up at the bottom of the freezer. It was supposed to be sautÃ©ed? Not sure what they did to it. Sweet potatoes tasted weird as well. My wife asked to see the manager, took him 10min plus to show up adding to our 2 hour saga.  And he seemed disheveled, just said they would take it off my bill and that was the extent of it. Truly couldn't care less. 
Just a bad experience start to finish, to bad.
Honestly the only positive was they bought out the water quickly and had bread to eat while waiting an hour+ for food -although whats with 3 rolls for 4 people??

As we often have, we came here for a celebration, a joint birthday dinner for da wife and our oldest. We did 6:15 on a Saturday night, and while it wasn't utterly packed, there was a healthy crowd.

I like how the place doesn't pack you in like sardines, as they do at the Wildfire Grill. Plenty of room, and you don't run into other people when you pull your chair out.
We started with a server named Emily, who was fine, but then we got switched to a guy named Greg. He offered some excellent suggestions on wine and entrees that turned out to be spot on.

Everything was prompt, service was great, food was phenomenal. We started out with a round of drinks and the grilled calamari, which is the best anywhere. A little spicy, so be warned, but I love it.

Minestrone was fantastic, and everybody else had salad, which they were pretty happy about. The bread is dangerous, because it's soft and warm and easy to fill up on. We specifically reminded each other not to go nuts on the bread because it's very good and they keep bringing it.

The family ordered, respectively, shrimp Bellagio, linguine with clams, and honey-glazed salmon. Everybody seemed more than happy. I went for the filet mignon, and killed it. Perfect medium, with asparagus and outstanding garlic mashed potatoes. 
We got some dessert to go, since we had birthday stuff to do at home.  On the way out I was fortunate to meet the owner, who's one of those guys who is personally involved with the business (which is great for places like Absolutely Delicious and Sweet-and-Savory in Westmont, and killed the local Brat House). I was happy to tell him, dinner was a very happy experience, and our server was great. 

In fact, I thought I had tipped well, and when I got home, I realized I had made a boo-boo, so I went back and threw some extra cash at Greg. 
This was yet another good visit, a highly successful birthday dinner, and everybody went home more than happy.

Unfortunately l, this restaurant has gone way downhill. Whatever you do, don't order the sautÃ©ed perch. My husband ordered this and it was fried, dry and tasteless. My kids had cheeseburgers and that was probably the only predictable items. The sweet potatoes tasted like they had lemon juice in them. Talked to the manager and he took the nasty perch off the bill but didn't seem to concerned we asked him to the table. In addition, we were late receiving our Italian wedding soup and it was "freshly@ made but undercooked and the pasta in it was a bit too el dente. Even my kids noted the pasta was undercooked. Sorry I will not be returning ever again.

Wow! The white fish Vesuvio was spectacular!
I can't remember having quite as flavorful fish dish. The minestrone usually a throw away was also flavorful and served piping hot. The missing 5th star is due to the amateurish service.

After reading many positive reviews about this restaurant, me and my husband went there for dinner.. 
We had no reservation, so we got seats next to the bar. The restaurant looks classy and have nice decor with full bar.
Many options in menu and we opted for Vodka chicken thin crust pizza as the name sounds unique.
For drinks they have good collection of wines and I opted for Little Black dress Merlot.. 
Scapa Kitchen serves variety of pastas and we ordered Cavatelli Carlita and it was not at all good.. 
Personally, I didn't liked this pasta, it was undercooked and flavors were missing. So,Vodka chicken pizza became our dinner savior. I would also like to mention the Balsamic salad which comes with pasta was totally bland.. 
I'm not going to visit this place again..

Thank goodness we had a Groupon.  I booked our reservation through Groupon, I received a written confirmation and at least 4 phone calls to confirm our reservation, including one on Thanksgiving Day.  Surprise, they did not have our reservation.  However, we were early enough that we were able to be seated.  When you enter the bar is to your right and then the dining rooms begin on your left.  Yes, rooms.  They even have 2 booths surrounded by draperies.  These are clearly visible right next to the stairs to the basement.  We were seated at, what we were told, the warmest table in the place.  Thank goodness I was wearing layers, not very warm.
Our server greeted us and explained the way they redeem their Groupons, it's different.  Since we had not been here before, he constantly stressed how fresh everything is made, after order is placed.  Okay, so the sausage and peppers were lukewarm at best, why?  I will say the rolls (3 for 2 people) were very tasty and the garden salad I had was excellent.  My husband said the Caesar salad was just okay.
We frequently dine in Italian restaurants and in all the years have NEVER had veal Francese made with a cream sauce.  It did not taste good and if you scraped it off, the veal had NO flavor at all.  My chicken parmigiana was not warm and I found a bone in my pasta side dish, that was served at room temperature.
One server in this particular room and our used dishes sat in front of us until the next course was brought out.  Just after we received our entrees, a bus boy did refill our water glasses.
Not a positive dining experience.  We will stick to our usual place for good Italian food.

We have been coming for a while and loved the quality,  prices and service.   In the past year we have seen the prices going up and quality going down.  Looks like it is time to find a new up and coming restaurant. 
We wish the best to the owners and hope they see the problems that are happening.

I am so stupid for continuing to give this place more chances.  Last three times I've gone, they haven't had my favorite dish.  Every time I take the chance,  get my hopes up, and then nada.  There's been a lot of turnover too. I will say the staff has been apologetic, and nice (comping another order for instance), when the dish has been unavailable,  but come on guys!!  Take selections off the menu if you can't reliably have it to serve.   It's a shame because Scapa was really good and reliable once.

Great hidden gem in Clarendon Hills. We were lucky enough to have good weather and eat outside. As people have mentioned the blood orange martini and grilled calamari were fabulous. We also had pasta abruzzo and the cavatelli with short ribs - both great!

Finally tried this place on a Sunday afternoon. I was very pleased with the beautiful ambiance this restaurant had. The food was very good and the staff overall was friendly. The host and busboy were especially welcoming and accommodating. However I have to knock this place down a star because of our waiter Bernard. His unpleasant and unwelcoming demeanor was very felt throughout our meal. It shouldn't feel like ordering, or asking for something extra is a favor the waiter is doing you. Maybe he was having a bad day, but never a hint of a smile was given or any kind of energy that would make anyone feel welcome. However the rest of the experience will make us give this place another shot.

Enjoyed dinner here last week for the first time while in town visiting family.  Tried to order veal limone but they were out of veal, so I tried the chicken limone.  To be honest, it was delicious and while I can't say for sure, I probably enjoyed the chicken more than I would have the veal.  The chicken, of which there was plenty, was cooked perfectly with just the right amount of artichoke, lemon, and capers.  The dinner salad that was served with it was also a nice salad with lots of tasty tidbits in it.  My dining partner had a bowl of minestrone soup which was good, but the bowl of soup was a small bowl - hardly a meal-sized serving.  I would love to try some other things on the menu. The service was good.

This bar and Italian restaurant has amazing Italian food. First you are given oil and an entire bowl of parmesan for the table. So no awkward waiting for them to scoop/shred it for you and feeling like you should say "ok" but you really want an entire cup and a half on your plate. The bread is a soft warm roll with herbs and butter on it. Each meal comes with soup or salad so we got the pear salad which was good. It looks like the sliced the pear with a mandolin but in the center of each slice there was a thin layer of cheese. I loved the salad, the dressing was a little too plain and oily for my taste though. Then I ordered the lemon chicken and angel hair pasta with capers and cream sauce. Very hearty and creamy but delicious! For desert the tiramisu was perfect. We also got cappuccinos which didn't taste that great- coffee tasted burnt or left out too long or something. But everything else was amazing- will definitely be coming back. Also, they have tables that are surrounded by curtains so its very private- request if you are making date reservations

Scapa has become a family favorite, not just for a big or small family outing, but it's one of our favorite places to order in. It's not your 1960's kitschy Italian restaurant (what Buca di Bepo goes for.) Yet, when we came recently for my dad's birthday, he found pieces of that Italian American nostalgia that he grew up with, AND the gourmet modern touch that keeps the dining experience fresh. Basically what they achieve here is the right blend of modern and rustic that is so en vogue these days. It reflects in the dishes offered (pastas, steaks, fish, etc) the flavors, and the restaurant decor (You won't find the walls lined with silly faux family photos, rather a combination of simple art work and trendy Edison bulb light fixtures.) Great food, great service, great atmosphere. Impeccable sauces, if you have Italian heritage, you know how important it is to get sauce right. The first item I ever ordered was a simple pasta with meat sauce..basically THE benchmark. It was right on! I've been a fan since. Go dine and enjoy!

We made a 5:30pm reservation on Valentine's Day for our family (husband and me, three kids).  Thought early would be a good idea, since it was likely to be a busy night. 

From the moment we arrived, every employee we encountered was in a complete tizzy. Manager trying desperately to correct lights that keep blinking, waitress informing us that: the wine we ordered was not available/neither were the Italian sodas my kids came here for/and the calamari my 6yo ordered for her entree which arrived very early shouldn't be sent back because "it was a very busy night and I am not sure we have any more calamari."  Really?! An Italian restaurant is going to run out of calamari at 5:30pm on Valentine's Day? Also, the dining room was freezing. My kids kept their coats on for the entire meal.

I will add that the food was hit or miss.  Calamari was good, dinner salads were tiny, Shrimp Portofino pasta was under sauced. 

We will not rush back to Scapa.  It's really too bad because the location is great as is the interior of the restaurant.

I was attending an event in Clarendon Hills with my 16 year old daughter this past Saturday and decided to try Scapa.  I had been there once for a communion party for my nephew and decided to try it for myself.  My daughter is a pretty picky eater, so I wasn't sure how she would like it.

We arrived early (before 5 pm) and it was not very busy at that time.

We were offered a seat at a semi-private table with curtains that provided a certain amount of privacy.  My daughter liked the bit of privacy and seemed to be impressed.

Our server, Bernard, was courteous, friendly and helpful.  He gave us just the right amount of attention. 

We both ordered gnocchi.  She ordered the country version with gorgonzola cheese, sausage and vodka sauce.  It comes with soup or salad and she ordered the salad (balsamic dressing).  She enjoyed her meal very much.

I ordered the gnocchi carbonara, with smoked bacon, peas and a crÃ¨me sauce.  I also ordered the salad (blue cheese dressing). The salad was good, and the gnocchi was outstanding!  It is definitely a new favorite.  

We shared a dessert of bananas foster, a dish we make at home periodically.  It was extremely good and the server flamed out the alcohol at the table - a nice touch.

When we left the restaurant, it had become quite busy, both in the restaurant and the bar. It seems to be quite a popular place in downtown Clarendon Hills.

The price was reasonable, service was great and parking plentiful.  I would very much recommend this establishment!

I have been to Scapa three or four times and every time I have gotten a different result. The pasta is either very good or lukewarm. Every dessert has been good and the service is fair. The carbonara has been hit or miss but the vodka and Alfredo have been delightful. The minestrone and Italian wedding soups are both very good. I do like the decor and the restaurant is spacious. Scapa is good for a week night Italian craving.

Matt provided excellent and attentive service.  His knowledge of the menu was very good.  We both enjoyed our piping hot soups (Italian Wedding & Minestrone).  I had the rigatoni and Italian sausage.  To me, it was great that they sliced the sausage into the dish.  Just dive right in!  The sauce was excellent and the pasta a perfect al dente.  My wife enjoyed her risotto quite a bit.  Dessert was two mini's--the tiramisu--superb.  Not soaking wet or mushy like so many and the cannoli--also excellent.  Not too sweet, yet very fresh.  I highly recommend and we will be back.

Ive never felt the need to write a review with negative connotations, until now. First, we had called about 10 days in advance to ask that a certain dish be available as typically it would be in short supply.  After our server took our order he came back about 10 minutes later because he had forgotten one of the orders, which happened to be what we called  in advance for to make sure would be available for us.  Another 10 minutes goes by and a different server comes in to tell us that they are out of the dish!! Then the owner comes out to apologize..unacceptable.  Our server was very slow and generally unattentive.  After dinner a few coffees and desserts were ordered.  The coffees came...with no dessert.  Then, heres the best part.  Another manager type lady comes in to say. "Ive got some bad news." This room has another reservation so you need to leave!!!! We never even got the dessert! Ive worked in the restaurant  management business in the past and that experience was a complete breakdown on all levels by them.  Its too bad because we have been coming to this place for years.  Never again

My craving for rigatoni and vodka sauce paired with my realization that my hunny and I never go out for Italian food collided --- so I scoured the internets for a local place that could fill these voids. 

Scapa is a good place to eat, no doubt. We had good service, too, so no real complaints. I'm happy we tried a new place - one of the few in a 15 mile or so radius with both rigatoni AND vodka sauce on the menu. :) 

Sunday is BOGO apps - yay for us. We had the shrimp with polenta - delicious - and the grilled calamari - also good if you can take your calamari naked! Ha. As for our meals, I got the rig + vod with italian sausage. Yum. I had the salad on the side and it was not good, though his minestrone was great. His lasagna left a bit to be desired but it was pretty good. 

We did an early dinner to avoid the crowd (and cause we had a late breakfast). And, by the time we left, it was incredibly loud and there were way more preteens than I'd expect to see on a Sunday night. It looked like maybe some sports event/dance had gotten out because there were loads of families with young girls piling in. No matter. Scapa is good.

Took my girlfriend yesterday for her birthday and we absolutely loved it. I made reservations with the OpenTable app and added it was her birthday dinner and from the time I checked us in everybody was wishing her a happy birthday. We were seated at a private table with beautiful drapes all around us and our server Michelle went above and beyond to ensure a wonderful dinner. When she brought our desert she began singing happy birthday to my girlfriend as I joined in and it was a very private and special moment. Our first time here and I promise it won't be our last!!!!

Food was good but service was lacking. Ambiance is meh. The waitress asked if we wanted coffee or dessert before we even received our soup and salad. I'll chalk that up to a busy night.

The grilled calamari was unique, the chili flake flavor really comes through. Ravioli Siciliano was good, the sage butter elevated it from just another boring pasta dish.  The simply seared whitefish is exactly as described, but borderline dry.

Service was slow and confused.  We had to ask for Parmesan, tell her who ordered what... Just confused.  We had a group of nine; two of the pasta dishes were terrible - clumpy, cold and just bad.  The sausage stuffed chicken had so much fennel it was just not good.  The chicken parm was okay, as was the chicken piccata.  The pizzas were just blah.  The ambiance is good and it wasn't bad when we came here a few years ago,  but I wouldn't go back anytime soon.

i'd go back just for the roasted calamari.  I don't know what the seasoning was and we couldn't get over it.  I had some amazing fish and hubby had the short ribs. it was all so fabulous, we would love to go back. corkage was decent.

Food and service is excellent
Live music in the small bar but it cannot be heard in the restaurant
A bit pricy

Used to have great meals at Scappa but the last 3-4 times have been terrible. Not sure if the chef has changed but the food has turned incredibly bland. Service has always been adequate but not enough to go back

Absolutely delicious!  Seated very quickly (though you probably want to make reservation if it is Friday or Saturday).  Meal started w/ amazing garlic rolls and the salad we ordered was fresh (the wedge salad was so good!). Portions are on the larger size and selection of desserts is excellent!  Highly recommend!!!

I will preface this review by saying that I live in Clarendon Hills and have been a patron at Scapa since it opened. I have tried much of the food and drink menu as it exists today and as it did in the past. I find it difficult to write a concise review of Scapa but I very enjoy when people get to the point in reviews, so here is my best attempt.

Food (4 Stars): Pretty standard Italian fare that will not underwhelm but will not blow you away. I am a fan of the recent cutback in portion size. I always leave full but never so full that I regret my meal. I would recommend the Pasta Bruno, the Lasagna Bolegnese and the Almond Crusted Tilapia.

Decor/Ambiance (4 Stars): Nothing too crazy. The feel is what you would expect. I find it difficult to give a poor rating or an exceptional one. It can get loud on weekend nights with families and the lighting can be a little dim but by and large, a quality atmosphere.

Price (3 Stars): It's a little pricey, especially if you order drinks, but not so expensive that it's unreasonable. People complain about the price given the portions, but I don't think that's justified.

Service (4 Stars): Since an ownership change a few years ago, I have yet to have a bad service experience. I never put too much weight on service though, because it is the most volatile aspect of rating a restaurant in my opinion.

A long time fan of Scapa. Good food and typically friendly, efficient service. Our most recent visit was somewhat disappointing. We made reservations for a large party and confirmed the reservation several days in advance. We arrived and the host stated there was no reservation but quickly set out to find us a table. The staff all seemed a bit frazzled and hurried making us feel we might be a burden. Our waiter was great but harried as well. The restaurant was quite warm as if the AC had not been turned on yet. Our meals were very good as usual but cocktails odd which is not typical. ( I.e. A strawberry martini with chunks of strawberry and crushed ice with vodka.... apparently not purÃ©ed strawberry and ska ken w/ ice & strained)  Maybe just an off day for a usually good restaurant.

Our family held an event for about 20 people at Scapa and they did a great job all around. We had a long room on the side to ourselves. We arranged a family style meal and it worked out perfectly. Shared bruschetta and calamari appetizers, individual soups and salads, entrÃ©es of steak diane, chicken limone and two pastas, and dessert platters of tiramisu, carrot cake, chocolate cake and cannolis. Every dish was great and the pricing for this feast was reasonable. The service was likewise attentive and excellent. Thanks to Scapa for a successful event.
2 stars sums it up.

We had our 5 year anniversary dinner here. My boyfriend had the lobster ravioli & I had the "steak Diane"; both meals were delicious. Started with the breaded ravioli & finished with the tiramisu. Everything was excellent. Service was great- didn't get his name but he even shook our hands at the end of our meal & thanked us for coming. We ate out on the patio- couldn't have asked for a better night. We will be back!

The food is delicious. Everything I have tried is amazing! I have been there several times and have never been disappointed. The service is good. The food always comes out in a timely manner. Plus they have a lot of gluten free options for me.
My new favorite restaurant!
My favorite Italian place around. The eggplant parmesan is done better than anywhere I've tried it. They have private booths that are cool for a one on one date.

My grandma has a few "favorite" restaurants, and this is one of them. She usually treats us to birthday dinners at Scapa because it is just the right blend of upscale, friendly, cozy, and tasty!

Since moving back to the area with my husband, he and I have really grown to love this restaurant. They have these "private" tables that are separated with a huge curtain, so it doesn't feel like you're eating with everyone else in the restaurant - very cozy, private, and fun for a date night.

The food is consistent - we've yet to have a bad dish here. We ordered the fried calamari one night, and it was quite salty (but delicious!). The bread that comes to the table is always hot and fresh, and the olive oil and parm. cheese is a perfect pair for the bread.

We went on a Monday night a few weeks ago and they had BOGO appetizers. I had the Caprese salad and he ordered a sausage platter - both very good!

Overall, the staff is friendly (the owners often go table-to-table to check in on guests which is a nice touch). The bus boys are incredibly attentive (you'll never need to ask for a refill of water - they are great at refilling your glass). 

Lately it feels like we have been hit-or-miss when it comes to servers. Some are really attentive and friendly, and we have had one (on more than one occasion) who comes to the table with smokers breath and seems to play the "cool" card more than we'd prefer.

If you haven't been there, give them a try! It's a great place for date night, it doesn't break the bank (one appetizer, two entrees = about $40), and it's always nice supporting a local restaurant.

I wish the service everywhere was as good as Scapa's.  My wife and I went to dinner here last month to celebrate our 16th anniversary.  I requested a private "cabin" booth when I made the reservation.  Given we were going to be there on a Friday night, I assumed they would respond with a stock answer that I typically get from most restaurants like "we can put the request down but can't promise."  Instead, they said  that it would be no problem, and when we got there, they gave us the best private booth.  A few of the staff stopped in to wish us a happy anniversary and they even provided us complimentary desert, which I had not expected.  

We both had the almond-crusted tilapia and mushroom soup, which were very good.  Service as attentive but not annoyingly so.

Definitely, definitely going back!

Went to celebrate my grandparents' birthdays last night. The rest of our group was seated when we arrived, and the waitress was over asking for our drink order as we were still trying to sit down (mind you we were still 5 minutes early for our reservation, so we weren't putting anyone behind). I appreciate the attentiveness, but I'm not sure anyone could know their drink order that fast! We had the caprese and sausage and peppers for our appetizers, and both were great. The rolls were good and I appreciated the bowl of parm on the table. Our meals came with choice of soup or salad - we all chose soup, and enjoyed it. Everyone enjoyed their meals - my grandparents both got the scallops and risotto, which they both said was excellent. We also had the pesto chicken (some pieces of the chicken were a little dry, but overall, I enjoyed it), chicken parm, veal parm, and lasagna. They have my grandpa a free cannoli for his birthday which was a nice gesture. Service started out quick and then got a bit slower as the night went on, I think because our server had a lot of larger tables. Only complaint - it was SO loud. We had to shout to hear each other. We'll be back!
Excellent pizza. Tried it for the first time a week ago. Had a second pizza tonight. It just might have been better this time. It's becoming a habit...
Had braised short ribs. They were outstanding. Excellent service and atmosphere. Wonderful experience!

The service was pretty horrendous.  It took quite a while before anyone ever came to the table.  When we ordered our food they asked if I wanted soup or salad and I passed because I didn't want to fill up before the meal.  The person I was dining with suggest I get the soup to go, so that's what I did.  I guess they missed the to go part.  The meal I ordered was the Chicken Saltimbocca.  It took about an hour to hit the table I would compare it to S'barro, but that would be insulating to S'barro.  The chicken didn't quite taste right and it was a very flavorless.  It makes Olive Garden look good.  At that point I really wished they didn't take my soup away as it had to be better then this, even though it probably would be cold after an hour.  And They didn't even ask to take my soup away that I hadn't touched yet, they just took it when I went up to the bar to get a drink since we didn't see out waiter for about half an hour.

All and all it was just a terrible experience from beginning to end.  For the prices they charge and the ratings they get I expected a whole lot more than terrible service and flavorless food.

The food and staff at this restaurant are both pretty good. However, I've been there twice now and each time I was given a dirty dish with old food stuck on it. The first time was a plate and the second time was a glass. They need to get better at washing their dishes!

Dined here last night. Our usual table for ten (mostly freeloaders). The ambiance was warm and cozy and holiday themed. Friendly staff and we were seated immediately.  We were well attended to. Two orders of Chicken Francese, crispy polenta cakes with spicy shrimp and an assortment of pizza's and pasta dishes for the kids. A new menu offering of "simply grilled" fish was a welcome addition for the Paleo type. The complimentary garlic oil (?) coated bread is very good. Prices are reasonable and the portions are generous (we all brought leftovers home). The bar is a wonderful spot for a cocktail and keeping your eye on a game. No need to drive far from home for a decent Italian meal. Patronize this place.

We went to Scapa as a party of 10 (made reservations in advance).  Really nice restaurant that accommodated our party size well.  That's about where the good feelings end.  For starters, they have gluten-free options noted on their menu with an official-looking "GF" logo.  When you ask how these items are prepared, they come clean and say that they are not prepared separately and can have some cross-contamination.  While I applaud their honesty, that should be disclosed on the menu itself.  People with Celiac disease tend to have high sensitivity to gluten, so they need to know that what they are ordering was prepared properly.  This is not some fad diet, it actually impacts people's lives.

We all ordered, and waited, and waited, and waited, and waited (took an hour).  Then a manager stops by and says "sorry for the delay, your meals are literally coming out right now."  Fifteen minutes later (yes...fifteen!!!), the meals come out.  Of course, they forget my wife's meal and then say "it's coming out right now".  Again...almost 10 minutes later, her food arrives.  It was just pasta and veggies...how long does that take to make?!!!  Why was that not placed as a priority when they realized they screwed up?  Why am I asking rhetorical questions?!!!

I had the Chilean sea bass, which was cold by the time it was placed in front of me.  Seriously...we waited this long, and you bring out cold food?  Then we get the bill (this is not a cheap restaurant)...and...no discount or anything taken off for our troubles.  They just hand me the bill (with the gratuity baked in for good measure), and I just had to pay it.  There is a line for additional tip, to which I would normally add, but not this time.  That's pretty insulting, considering how much we ordered and spent.  

I am not the type to sit there an argue, especially since this was my family and I was paying for everyone.  I did not want to cause a scene, but I was furious when I got the bill.  I could feel the steam pouring out of my ears, but I just bit my tongue and swallowed the blood (best part of my meal that night).

We are not going back.  The food was not that good, overall service stunk, and the prices do not warrant all of the above.  I am willing to pay a higher price for great food & service.  This place does neither.  

There are too many good restaurants in the Chicagoland area...don't waste your time at this place.

If I could give this place negative stars I would. That's how bad of an experience my husband and I just had there. It was not our first time there but will for sure be the last. The first time we had awful service but the food wasnt that bad. We decided to try one more time since it's close to the house and we saw a groupon that was a great deal. Now I'm regretting buying the deal because we didn't even use it so a huge waste of money. Everything started off ok. Appetizer was good (fried calamari) wine good...service was slow but we weren't in a big hurry so it didn't really bother us until we ordered the entree. After a half hour we realized we'd been sitting for almost two hours and and still no entree. Finally it came out. My husband ordered the cavatelli con carne which is cavatelli and short ribs I ordered chicken limon. Omg can you say the WORST meals I ever had at an Italian restaurant. I'm not exaggerating. My husband is Italian so we eat out at a lot of Italian restaurants . I'm pretty picky so I usually order similar items on menus. One of them, being cavatelli. I tried my husbands and it was so undercooked and flavorless I couldn't take a second bite. I mean it may have been taken right out of the package and put on a plate. That's how hard it was. My chicken limon was even worse. The chicken was fine but the sauce was so thick and smelled so awful I'm not even sure lemon was used in it. It tasted like mayonnaise based or Dijon. I have never in my life had chicken limon like this.  I have never in my life sent back a meal let alone two meals! We kindly asked the server for a manager. It took about 15 min for tony to come out. Really?! Talk about the worse customer service ever.he instantly had an attitude before we even talked and pretty much told us we didn't know what we were talking about and the food is fine. They did take off the two entrees  from the bill but we bought a groupon so that did not benefit us at all. Now we still have this groupon we will never use. I will never step foot in this place again after being treated so awful and will make sure everyone I know doesn't either. Tony I wouldn't be surprised if you are out of business by the end of the year. There is No way this is the same owner that's been there for years. I had been to Scapa with my parents many years ago but never were treated like this and the food was never this awful. Good luck

The menu is huge and they offer many different selections, so this place is a good choice for large groups. Service was great. Food was mediocre. 

For my starter, I had the scallops with risotto. The scallops were good size, cooked perfectly, but overly salty. The risotto was a bit bland, so if I ate a bite of scallop with risotto, it balanced out. Scallops also had sand in them. If not for the sand and too much salt, would've been a nice dish. For my main I had the braised short rib with tagliatelle. The tagliatelle tasted homemade and had a very nice bite to it. The braised short rib was again VERY salty. It was as though the chef solely used salt to season the meat. I left 90% of the dish on the plate. The main entree came with a house salad that had fresh greens and vegetables. 
Service was the best part of the meal. Our server, Mark, was very friendly, showed the right amount of attentiveness - attentive to our needs but not overly annoying and coming back every bite we took. He had a great personality and was a fun server who clearly enjoyed his job!
Overall the prices were very reasonable and if not for the over salting of my food, I would've given it 4 stars.

The menu ranges from a wide variety of pastas with different sauces to your traditional chicken, veal and fish entrees. You can always find something good. All entrees comes with a salad or a soup.  The food is great! I just would like to see some menu items that are not so traditional.

Friend recommended this place and it lived up to what he hyped it up to be.  Great service, great food.  Try the chicken picante and get a sicilian orange (blood orange) martini. I tried the calamari, but I think you can skip that, along with the eggplant rolltini, get the caprese and the lobster mac&cheese instead.  My wife had the 8-finger cavatelli w/ arrbiatta (sp?) and she loved it.  If you're looking for good Italian in the burbs, this is the spot to go.

I went here for a celebration dinner with my family and it was a very nice experience for us all. The waiter was attentive and helpful. The wine selection and menu were great. 

Everyone enjoyed their food and the service was really spot on.

I had the Rosemary Whitefish, which was really great and enough for three servings. My boyfriend had the 8-finger cavatelli , which was something none of us had tried before and it was delicious! My friend had lobster ravioli in lobster sauce, which was AMAZING! I enjoyed my dish, but when I come back here I'm definitely getting this ravioli. 

They also knew it was my college graduation party, so they brought out molten chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream. Delicious! But be careful... my sister burned her mouth since it was fresh from the oven haha. 

It was nice for a group, and it seems like it would be great for a date!

This was our third time at Scapa. The first time (close to when it opened) was great! Loved the food, especially the soups, the service was good, and the ambiance is relaxing but lively.

 The second time we ate there was a stark difference from the first. The food was noticeably lower quality (canned green beans) but service was fine. So, we stayed away for a long time thinking it was already going down hill. 

We returned again last night to be pleasantly surprised. The food was back to where it was the first time we dined here. I had the braised short ribs and parsely pappardelle that was fantastic, Italian Wedding Soup, homemade, light, and delicious.

Great server (Thank you, Ryan!) and other friendly, staff. We will be back!

Stopped randomly in here randomly on a whim and found a go to place in the burbs!!!! The food, the service,the ambiance!!! I can't rave enough about this place.  Our server was exceptional, knowledgeable on the menu and suggestions, and just plain nice and pleasant to have around.  The food was incredible!  I will be back and soon.

Given the praise from other reviewers, we were expecting more from Scapa Italian Kitchen.

The atmosphere is rather generic, the decorations outdated and have a chain feel to them.  When we dined there they had live music but unfortunately the musicians weren't very good. 

Our server was very friendly, but incredibly slow.  In fact, we ended up paying with cash as he never came back to our table to pick up our credit card to pay for the meal.  In hindsight, we probably could have left without even paying!

The food was fine, nothing to write home about but not terrible.  My husband had the pizza which had a nice flavor.  I had the cavatelli; it was flavorful and made with fresh garlic (which I love), but I wasn't wild about the dish on a whole.  Our bruschetta appetizer was adequate but seemed to be made from a bunch of pre-packaged ingredients.

All in all, Scapa's is "okay."  If you are looking for a quick bite to eat for a casual evening out, I'd recommend.

I've been to Scapa a few times and every time I have yet to be disappointed. My first time I got the chicken parm with their vodka sauce and the proportion was huge!! I had left overs for lunch then next day and dinner. Their vodka sauce was very creamy but not too thick. 

The next time I went was with a group of women so we split a bunch of the appetizers. I got the white pizza which everyone loved! Another fan favorite was the calamari and the eggplant parm.

The last time I went I just got the chicken caesar salad. It was really good. The chicken was cooked and seasoned perfectly and was not burnt. The ceasar dressing was also up to par! 

I will definitely be going back every time Im craving Italian.

My fiancÃ© and I LOVE this place. I work in the industry and we are very picky about where we frequently dine. The food is decent, seeing as I am a food snob, it certainly doesn't blow me away, but very good none the less. 
The key factor to Scapa is the customer service. They always take care of our sometimes extremely fickle needs. When I train my staff on customer service, I use the staff at Scapa as an example. 
My fiancÃ© also loves the little booths with the curtains, it's a great touch.
All in all great place, good food, good prices, and great people.
See you next week Scapa!

Excellent food, always excellent service, and just such a GREAT little place in the suburbs.  

My boyfriend and I first came to Scapa about a year and a half ago and we have loved it ever since!  We are city people at heart, but (somewhat reluctantly) moved out to the suburbs two years ago, and don't really care for the big chain restaurants at the malls.  We like restaurants/bars that have more of an intimate, downtown Chicago feel and atmosphere--where we can jut sit and relax and have a glass of wine, or get an actual meal, so when we found Scapa, we were thrilled!  They have a nice bar with some high-top tables to sit at (where you can usually find us!) but they also have a lot of space in the back with booths and tables.  It can get crowded, but never overwhelmingly so.  We moved to Clarendon Hills this past summer and now we go to Scapa at least once a week, we just love it there.  

Only complaint is that they don't have many "healthy" options for appetizers...don't get me wrong, all the food is DELICIOUS, but I really wish they had some lighter items available....

Service was awesome! The staff here was very welcoming and made our entire experience phenomenal.  As first time visitors, I knit pick every single little detail when it comes to experience and they topped every single one! The food was good and the atmosphere was warm. Definitely worth coming here.
Great fish, good pasta...be ware if you have celiac disease as they offer gluten free pasta but cooked it on the same water as the regular pasta and our guest got really sick.

Know that Scapa just moved to 1 Walker Ave which is the location of the old "Soul" restaurant along the tracks in Clarendon Hills.

Food is still great.  But now you have alot more room to enjoy it in!

Two weeks ago on a Thursday I had ordered take out. The young lady that answered was very well spoken and patient as I questioned the menu and the ingredients. She was very knowledgable of the menu and suggested her favorite entrees.  I ordered the chicken picante which was fantastic and melted in my mouth when dipped with the lemon butter sauce and still maintained a great crisp - which was the young ladies number one choice. When I went to pick it up, the young lady with red hair came out with my order and was very kind. Once I arrived home the food was still hot, and all of my expectations were met even with my extensive order. The carry out woman remembered all the extra sides such as ex sauces, cheese, bread, etc. I will definitely be ordering more takeout with the friendly staff and the attention put solely into my order.

Not a thing to fault here. Service was fantastic! Angel took care of us and she was attentive and knowledgable. The food was way above average too. Everything was serviced hot and tasted as good as anything in the area. Bar has nice ambience. Have also had takeout pizza and chopped salad before, all good!

I dined here for the 1st time at my families recommendation  last week and enjoyed a wonderful meal in a very appealing setting.  The restaurant is attractive & welcoming inside. We had drinks at the bar & I appreciated the bartender swapping out one glass of Sauvingnon Blanc for another at no charge as my wife did not like the 1st glass. 

Rhonda was our server and, though she was very busy, she was extremely attentive and timely in her service & very helpful re: the menu. My wife had the Red Snapper that was very flavorful but a bit over cooked. My son had the Filet Mignon and thought it was delicious  I enjoyed Veal Parm that was pounded thin and delicious. A simple dish but very good & a dish I would order again. 

I recommend you give Scapa a try & hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Looking for the next great Italian restaurant, and willing to try something new, we gave Scapa Italiano a try. I should have known when a 6:30pm reservation was not a problem at 4pm on a summer Saturday, but we gave it a try. Hard to find running parallel to the Burlington railroad tracks, the place looks decent from the outside with outdoor dining You enter into a long bar almost running the length of the room, and not a human being there. Gulp. We were escorted into the dining room with zero ambiance, not even a picture on the walls. The server was nice enough, albeit for dessert she took the other couple's order and walked away while the four of us looked at one another in disbelief that we were not given the opportunity to order anything. Strange. I and a dining partner had the veal parmagian and one look at the "pink" sauce said this ain't gonna go well. It didn't. Dry,tasteless, both the pasta and veal,for both of us. My wife's salmon was nondescript. Never saw more than 10-12 people in the place. A lot better choices out there.
Was just at Scapa with some friends for dinner.  Food was excellent as well as service.  I would highly recommend this neighborhood gem!

Scapa Italian Kitchen has new owners! 

As of this week, Tony & Kristin Swegen have taken over this popular restaurant in downtown Clarendon Hills. 

I had dinner at Scapa last night and met the new owners. Tony has a wealth of experience in the restaurant business. His talents range from being an accomplished chef to have been on the managerial side by serving a general manager for Cheescake Factory for over 10 years. 
Kristin's expertise is in public relations. I think this is important. As he local people know, Scapa is definitely the best local Italian restaurant. However, if you are not familiar with the streets of Clarendon Hills (think spaghetti bowl), this could be a difficult place to find.

Tony & Kristin do not propose any radical changes right out of the gate. However, expect improvements to be forthcoming. Initially, the servers will be wearing plain black shirts as opposed to the uncomfortable chef jackets which they now wear. Soon, Scapa will be open for lunch, too. A better beer selection is already available at the bar. Expect some tweaking of the menu to occur as well.

All in, I anticipate the new energy and balanced corporate experience to have a profoundly positive impact on my favorite neighborhood Italian restaurant. Come taste for yourself (and order the Chicken Giuseppe).

Went to Scapa with two other couples.  I was prepared to have so-so service based on what I read on here.  I have to tell you the service is some of the worse I have had anywhere, which is very strange because it looked like they had plenty of help.  We got to the table with no napkins or silverware which we had to ask for.  The waitress was nice but was very hurried.  It took us 45 minutes from the time we ordered to get our soup and salad.  The food got mixed reviews. My husband had the linguine and clams but was still hungry afterwards. For $22 you should be full.  I had the almond crusted tilapia which was good.  Everyone else at the table had mixed reviews.  You would think with all of the negative reviews about service that they would improve.  Don't think we will be going back unfortnuately

Wide menu choices and good Italian food.  Busy on Friday and Saturday nights, but still a hidden gem.

Good service.  Outdoor seating weather permitting.

Such a disappointing experience.  My husband decided to try this place because he saw it in the newspaper and it sounded really good.

The experience started with a waiter (we'll call him Lurch---because he never smiled or showed any indication of being a part of the human race via smile or personality).

Hubby ordered baked clams and fettuccine Alfredo----what Italian restaurant screws up alfredo sauce?  It was like milk with parmesan cheese added...really poor quality.  And the baked clams, fahgedaboudit...really small, boring for an outrageous price.

I should have done this review sooner, because I've forgotten what I had (not very memorable).  But we both remembered the fettuccine Alfredo fiasco.

The owners would come into the small dining area and schmooze with a table of their friends, but not go around to any other tables to see how their guests were faring.

Forgettable. Overpriced.  Absolutely the poorest service ever.

We have visited several times since my December review, and I'll happily be the first to admit that everything I'd previously griped about has been corrected. 

The staff has been markedly more welcoming & upbeat, and now encourage you to fill out a comment card/review of your experience. Be sure to include your email address to be notified of promotions & special events.

Pasta entrees are made available in a half-portion for the kiddies (which is still a ton of food!).

Kudos to the management for paying attention and responding to your clientele.

Now under new ownership.....very friendly and accomadating.  Scapa is a local favorite.  Great food....nice warm surroundings.....with a cheers-like welcoming environment.  My favs are the 8 finger cavatell with vodka sauce, the meatball salad, chicken vesuvio salad.....They served a beautiful Caprese salad and braised ribs on a bed of mashed for a charity event I was just at....FABULOUS!

Nice choice for date night....but the kids are welcome too.  Love the live music on Friday nights.

Just moved into the area and I can't even begin to say how amazing this place is. It's our new favorite restaurant! I had the scallops and asparagus it is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G! 

Also a must try is the grilled calamari! = YUM!

I can't wait to go back!!!

The service is casual in some respects and we are usually fine with it but it can be  uneven.  The breaded chicken and veal dishes seem a bit flat on flavor because of the breading, but otherwise the food is consistently pretty good.  We really appreciate the appetizer specials they have certain nights because it makes eating here less pricey for a weeknight dinner out.  They also have a great kids menu.

I was looking for an Italian restaurant that served veal picante and discovered Scapa. From beginning to end, it was a fantastic dining experience. The service was genial and attentive. From the bread thru the salad to the entrees, it was a wonderful dining experience. My wife had sea scallops, one of her favorites and was as delighted as I. The meal was capped off with a superb glass of port. 

You cannot go wrong by going to Scapa. You will love it.
We did take-out with two orders of 8-fingers this past Friday. It was the first time we have tried this restaurant.  We were very disappointed in the portion sizes.

Scapa Italian Kitchen - New Owners Kristen and Tony Swegen!

Great for parties! 

I was at a party at Scapa Italian Kitchen last Saturday night that was held in a private banquet room. I was extremely pleased how they handle larger parties.  My group was a neighborhood babysitting coop that my wife and I are a part of (ask me later!), many of the parents know each other quite well, so it wasn't uncomfortable being in a room figuring out drink tabs and such.  Scapa makes the space quite comfortable with family style tables, heavier window treatments and a well sized plasma TV tactfully positioned for guys like me to sneak a peak of the game.  It was perfect since an NFL playoff game was scheduled!   We were served bruschetta and fried calamari for appetizers the main course a terrific Vesuvio style chicken and a Cesar salad.  Two servers were reserved just for our party so there was never any waiting for drinks or anything we needed.  It was a reasonably priced party for sure and the food was delicious!  

I have eaten at Scapa Italian Kitchen too many times to count, spent various times sitting at their charming bar for a quick bite and ordered out many times as well.  The food has always been excellent.  I'm excited for the new owners to put their special twist on their favorite dishes.  My favorite for a lunch or quick bite at the bar has always been the meatball salad (Two good-sized meatballs with marinara sauce and a house salad).  My recommendation for dinner is the Scrimp Siciliano. 

I first met the new owners, Tony and Kristin at the Clarendon Hills Christmas Walk when Tony was cooking up Fettuccine Alfredo for the masses of people trying to get into the restaurant on a cold winter night.  If you have ever been to a Clarendon Hills Christmas Walk, you know then, it is a mix between a festival and a free-for-all.  Owners of businesses in the downtown area roll out the carpet for anyone willing to come into their shops and sample, drink or say just say hello.  It's really a unique event that everyone should experience.  The chamber of commerce puts on the event where the kids can see Santa, ride in a sleigh and sing along with carolers and the adults.

I live just around the corner from Scapa and love going here. They have excellent gluten-free pasta, which is extremely important to me since pasta is why I go to Italian restaurants. They recently changed owners and the bread they put out on the table is to die for (I may have cheated my GF diet for a piece once or twice) and I wish they could make a GF option for the bread. Overall, I really enjoy this place and it's a hidden gem in the western suburbs.

We've been looking for an Italian restaurant that combines great food and service.  Our server, Diana, was warm and friendly.  You can tell she is really passionate about the restaurant and committed to delivering a great experience to her customers.  I had the Osso Bucco Ravioli which was full of flavor and well balanced.  My boyfriend had the Veal Parmesan which was also quite tasty.  He said he would get a different pasta dish next time, but there will be a next time.  The ambiance is sophisticated, the food was tasty, and the portions were generous.

The food is delicious but the service is just plain awful.  We waited 15 minutes after we were done with our food for the waitress to acknowledge us.  She poured wine for the table next to us (with her butt in our faces) and never turned around to ask if we wanted coffee or dessert.  Never again.

Let me tell you that Scapa went above and beyond for my daughter's graduation party!!! Our server (Massimo) was awesome!!! From the wonderful wine list and luscious appetizers to our delightful dinner we were amazed! My sister has booked her corporate Christmas party already!! The atmosphere is cozy ,warm and inviting. There are rooms to meet every need. We had our own little private room for our party . That was real nice.I give a thumbs up and my highest reccomendation!!

The printed specials menu tells you everything about Scapa. It's a jumble of items you see everywhere and doesn't stick to Italian cuisine. Prices are high and food is okay. The dining room was excessively noisy on a Satruday night with people occasionally SCREAMING to be heard at their tables. There are better choices, many even within 2 miles.

I had dinner last night at Scapa Italian Kitchen.  I must say, we had a very good experience, start to finish.  As we were taking my elderly mother I figured I'd see if they took reservations, as she would not have been too keen on waiting in the bar for a table.  Yes - they take reservation - - even confirmed it via email.  (Although we really didn't need them on a Wednesday night - plenty of tables available.)  However, the reservation did score us one of the three "curtained-off tables", which made the dinner more intimate.

Wednesday / Thursdays are $5 Martini nights, so we got an added bonus here!  Good sized drinks that are well made.

As for the food, our entrees included soup / salad.  The house dressing was great!  Our dinner portions were very generous.  My Mom's Eggplant Parm was HUGE.  She had enough for another meal.  Same with my wife's Chicken Saltamboca.  She loved it!  I had a pasta dish that was large and tasty.  Next time I will try a chicken dish or house specialty.  Waiter and staff were very attentive.  Also met and talked with the owner.  Overall a great evening.

Will come back for the bar, as there was plenty of room to eat and drink there, as well.  Also looks like a great place on a warm summer evening with outdoor dining.

Real nice place. Happy to have this restaurant so close to my home!  Solid bar to sit down and eat a good meal at.  Only had poor service here once on a very busy night. Understandable I guess!  Try the chicken vesuvio and veal piccata... Both very premium dishes

I have been the Scapa several times an continue to come back from time to time. I live in the local town and this is one of the few places to eat that has lasted for a long time.  The food is great. I personally like the Linguine and White Clam Sauce best but I must admit I am yet to taste anything bad there. It is comparable to Maggiano's, if you have ever been there, but not quite as good as that restaurant (however cheaper). Overall I would recommend going here.

Fabulous! 

Service and food are terriffic!

We showed up at 6 pm on a Saturday with no reservations.  After talking to 3 hostesses, one finally said, "Well I have someone booked for the table at 7.  Can you be done by then?"  Talk about feeling unwelcome, I regret not walking out at that moment. 

This is a neighborhood red-sauce joint dressed up as something more high end. My wife and I both had pasta dishes.  The pastas were overcooked and the sauce painfully bland.  I had calamari over linguini, which is pretty hard to mess up, but the cheap salad-bar black olives and lack of fresh garlic managed to disappoint.  My wife is not picky but after a few bites of rigatoni with fresh motzarella, she was done.

We hosted a party for about 45 people at Scapa this past weekend and could not have been more pleased. Kristin was amazing with the planning and all ran seamlessly at an extremely fair price. We will be sure to use them again in the future!

I think it's a hidden gem in Clarendon Hills. Great food, service, ambiance. Nice little private rooms with curtains if you want a more intimate setting in addition to  regular seating and outdoor dining, so it has it all. Plenty of variety on the regular menu and the dessert. We loved it and will definitely be back.

Has been just okay at best for us.  The new location is really really really noisy.  (Was super noisy when it was Soul too.)   Sat at the bar one night with a foul mouthed middle age "hit on me" crowd.  (If your into that, the bar should be fun for you.)  And the food has been hit or miss for us.  My daughter went with a group with a reserved table they had booked well in advance for a HS dance and they had to wait over an hour to get their table.  (I know because I had to drive them late to the dance after!)   Very much prefer Antico Posto in Oak Brook... or Tuscany... or Vincintori.
