One of my favorite local Italian places. The chicken picante is awesome!  We also enjoy getting take-out from Scapa for the benefits of a tasty meal from the comforts of home.

I took a bite of my Chicken Picante and bit into what appeared to be a large staple.  I gave our waiter my plate and he went to look for the manager.  We waited at our table for at least five minutes but no one came to speak to us.  My husband had to get up and look for our waiter, who he found in the kitchen.  Since there was no indication that a manager was going to come and talk to us and my family did not want to eat any more of their food after my experience, we left.  Completely unacceptable.
Food is delicious, service has been great, and the atmosphere is very nice.  Easy with kids too.

We came to Scapa's  afew wednesdays ago.  We had never been there before.  The decor and and the ambience are welcoming and warm.  We had a very private table in a little tented alcove, very nice.  Our waitress was very attentive  without being over bearing, not an easy balance.  The menu was vast!!  Everything we ordered was done very well.  We really enjoyed our evening and we will be having another Wednesday at Scapa's
good food, friendly service, and very nice restaurant decor

Very good food and service, which was both friendly and knowledgeable. My wife had the salmon limone and I had the veal picante. The salmon was good, but the veal was even better: buttery, lemony, and crisp in a white wine sauce with pine nuts. Very tender, also, and served with a good meat sauce pasta. The house salad is nothing special, though, as another reviewer mentioned.

I haven't written a review quite like this before so I'll start with the positives. 
Scapa's food is delicious. The food deserves at least 4 stars (but keep reading to see why I gave it 3). Especially the special cavatelli, giambotta, sauteed spinach and their mussels-  their red sauce is really good and spicy. Meatballs are also great. (We've been here a lot!) 
But my favorite on the menu is their "Braciole" (pronounced "bra-shol"). It's flattened flank steak, stuffed with Itaian herbs and breadcrumbs, tied, sauteed and then slow-cooked in their red sauce until it's super-tender. I've made it before at home (it requires some skill and attention) and theirs is outstanding. They only offer it as a side dish and I don't know why- it's that good. Which leads me to one of the reasons I gave this place 3 stars- and almost gave it 2.

I don't understand the business decisions the owners of Scapa are making . Recently my husband and I ordered some take-out and we placed an order for a side dish of braciole. Normally it comes with 2 pieces (price is $6.95). We ordered 2 orders (totalling 4 pieces) so we could enjoy it with our special cavatelli and salad.  After we get home with the order, we look in the bag and there was only 1 piece of braciole per order. We thought it was a mistake and called the restaurant. The woman on the phone told us that the menu had "recently changed" and now it was 1 piece per order. Basically they halved their order of braciole on the menu - but still decided to charge $6.95! 
  I haven't run a restaurant before, but if you have a hit on your menu, you don't half the order after a year or two and still charge the same amt! I've heard of people upping the price after a while but doubling the price?? They should have just made it an entree with some sides and charged more- at least that would have made sense.
Also, another complaint I have is the value of one of the appetizers- their toasted ravs. We lived in St. Louis for 4 years where toasted ravs are on every menu and beyond plentiful. They must grow on trees down there. Yes, some places just buy them frozen, but some make them homemade.  When we've ordered this before at other restaurants, places (homemade or frozen) usually give you at least 10 or 12 pieces for about $7-$8. At Scapa, 6 toasted ravs cost $6 bucks! A buck a toasted rav? please. Toasted ravs are really cheap to make. Scapa is trying to nickle and dime in all of the wrong places. LIke I said, I just don't get it.  I really hope Scapa figures this out!
Good restaurant.  Competent, friendly staff.  Manager always comes through and asks how things are.

Good food, decent prices, and LOUD!!!.   At least on a Saturday evening.  Not merely noisy, but mind-numbingly LOUD!!!  If I go again, it will not be at prime time.  And what's with the 50 cent  "snifter charge" when you order Sambuca?  I didn't catch that item on the bill until the next day, and when I called to inquire, was told it's added because Sambuca is a heavy pour and to let the bartender know what glass to use.  Now, most restaurants seem to be able to hire competent bartenders and know how to program drink prices in their POS system, but I didn't press it.  It's not the money, it's the. . . I mean, what's next, a "martini glass" charge?  That's a heavy pour in a specific glass.  Hell, maybe they do, but no one at our table ordered a martini.

My friend and I were planning a Chinese meal, but traffic prevented that. We got to a preview show @ Hollywood way too early, so when we spotted Capri, we figured "why not". I felt like we should play lotto after having this delightful meal. What a win after a traffic designed disappointment! 
The table offered small sliced Italian bread with a spicy (not too) parmesan for dipping. OMG... if I actually cooked, I'd want that recipe. 
I think my friend ordered Veal Parm... which she loved. (I was too busy enjoying my food to know what she was up to).
I wanted something light, but filling, so opted for eggplant ?? Rigiletto?? How refreshing to have a real Italian flavor, not the version made by Mexican cooks who think food is only good when it has heat. 
FLAVOR... that's the secret to good food. Well, they certainly offer flavor at Capri. I look forward to going there again... and again... and again. 

Thank you Capri for bringing real Italian flavor out here... not Ragu or red gravy with hot sauce.

Insanely perfect.  Decadent flavors. Amazing staff.  Intimate ambiance. Actively engaged owners.   I am so in love with this "restaurant".  Yes this is a true owner operated restaurant.  Bartenders are amazing. Lighting for me at 48 years old ..... love intimate dark and it's perfect. Food will blow you away! Martinis classically done and plentiful with blue cheese olives.  Offered.... not hidden. They focus on quality.  This is a 5 star recommend from a foodie! Yes. Yes. And yessssssss.

Quite impressed with this new place. Ladies were all here for a late dinner and drinks. The automshpere, food, drinks, and services were all impressive.

We were kind of looking a place between Darien and Naperville. This place poped on the top of the list due to the shinning reviews. And I have not eaten here so we settled for this place.

We started with riesling and some complimentary warm bread. Loved loved the olives came with the bread. The spicy mussels was no so spicy but tasted great. We all loved the seafood risotto which had the plenty juicy seafood and rice was even better. 

We tried the lava cake and Hazelnut gelato. Both are heavenly but I loved the gelato just a tiny tiny more. 

Services were great. The owner also stopped by a few time to chat with us. Definitely will come back again.
Great place for dinner and entertainment!! We go often and are continually impressed. Staff and Management are very attentive to your satisfaction.

Such a great restaurant for an Italian dinner and perfect for a date or for bringing family. It's intimate and welcoming. This was nothing short of a five star experience, from the attentive staff to the amazing food. We got the eggplant parmesan and their homemade rigatoni, the portions are generous and the food is spot on, really delicious and very fresh. It will be hard going back to store bought pasta after tasting their rigatoni. Both dishes came with a soup or salad, and I picked the escarole and white bean soup, absolutely perfect for a chilly evening! I would come back here in a heartbeat when I'm craving really good pasta.
Make sure you bring your own seasoning if you're ordering the Fettuccine Alfredo #bland-as-hell

5 stars all the way.... Review for March 26th...  

Idiot me, posted this for another Capri... Meant for this one...

So let me start by saying... It was rough Saturday evening when we went to see Superman vs Batman...

7pm 8pm and 9pm sold out whaaaaat?!?!?

Then we see Capri right next door -- so my BF and I decided to just eat dinner... 

My BF is half Italian half black and went to culinary school -- so he is very critical of Italian cuisine 

We see most customers going inside,  were older Caucasians/ Italians.... So we were intrigued...

I was greeted warmly by this lady.. She told me their full but could be seated in 15 minutes or we can sit at the bar. We opted for the bar... There is live music tonight.

The moment they served warm bread, they also served olives... My BF was almost in tears...

His grandma.... Pure Italian who lived in Berwyn (mist Italians did) died recently at age 90, and would always serve warm bread with olives... So my BF felt at home right away.... Two stars for that... And mind you... Not a midget size but a decent size platter.

We ordered bruschetta -- supposedly free as I checked in with Yelp --- they still charged me -- so watch your bill 

We ordered Cozze Capri -- we ordered spicy sauce -- mussels were fresh and delicious

Escarole soup --- ohemgee to die for... 3rd star

My BF ordered Vitello San Guisippe -- really good

I ordered Homemade rigatoni -- this is the other 2 stars - I can eat this all day... Noodles with a bite ( al dente ) and oh so flavorful without being salty.

Oh damn I can only give 5 stars right? 

Well the homemade tiramisu was exceptional too... Not too coffee-ish tasting but very delicate.... I love it

With the cappuccino -- wow outstanding

Giovanna and joe ... They were the owners -- both were very friendly ... I am the only Asian there and again my BF is half Italian but looks black.... So we were basically the only minority there ... But treated warmly by the owners 

The singer serenading us with Frank Sinatra songs and old school songs were a delight too especially after a couple of drinks....

Kudos to Tammi the bar manager and Crystal......

We will be back for more....
My first time at Capri Italian Restaurant in Woodridge. Food delish service superb and atmosphere was gorge. Thank you for an amazing meal. Ask for Chris he was great.

Taken as a birthday gift last Friday. Company, service music awesome,,
Food less than warm or cold or tasteless. Owner was lovely and did not
have the heart to tell him how bad the food was until those that went Friday 
met up on Saturday. $$$ and not worth it, go to Capri Burr Ridge.

So we came back to our new found neighborhood gem after a week. Again, everything was amazing. Hubby had a dish off of the specials menu... something with chicken, fresh pasta & peppers. There was a ton of food in fact I packed the rest for his lunch today. He said it was amazing!!! (I don't do peppers so I didn't try). I ordered the gnocchi (lots of gnocchi) with a huge meatball!!! First off I'm a foodie and really picky about my gnocchi. They better be pillowy soft & melt in my mouth not just a pasty, dough ball and let me tell you.... Capri delivered!!!! The only gnocchi better that here that I've had was homemade at an Italian Chef friends house (sorry Capri, lol). Seriously, I'm in love with these gnocchi!!! We ended our meal with a molton lava cake that's sure to please any chocolate lover. Keep the amazing food coming out of that kitchen Capri!!!!!
This place is amazing! The portions were perfect, everyone was so nice. They had complimentary valet which was a treat. I really enjoyed myself.

Had an amazing time here! Was here on a Friday night so they have live entertainment that creates a great atmosphere. The service was outstanding and the food was amazing! So happy that we finally have a classy independent Italian restaurant in the area! Looking forward to coming back soon!

I think these places find me,  an hour and half waiting for food, fascinating.i cant blame the server it was only one, but when the room of 13 ? Tables and only 5 or six are emty and you still wait that long for 3/8 thick steak that they claim it takes 45 min plus to cook. Ok.
I think thats enough i don't need to go into the food.
So to recap the intertainment  was good they had Vito Zato server was good,  food and time ifor it to come out not so good.

This place has only been open for 6 weeks. It is located right next to the HOLLYWOOD BLVD. CINEMAS.  (It used to be an Asian  restaurant). Only 3 other tables with us, on a gorgeous  Sunday afternoon. 

We both had the escarole & white bean soup, which was excellent. 
My husband ordered the chicken  Vesuvio ,  which was very tasty. 

I started out with the veal colculetta, and  spinach.  The veal was dry, over crispy, and  bland.  I sent it back , and  ordered the veal marsala, instead.

I just moved here from New York less than a year ago. One big problem my husband and I have had is that we had yet to find good Italian food. That was until last week. We happened upon this restaurant sheet seeing a movie one night and liked the menu very much. I have been looking for some good veal francese. We ordered or food to go. I was not expecting what I got. What I got was the best veal francese I've ever had in my life. That's even comparing to Little Italy and Mulberry St in NYC. My husband ordered chicken parm with penne. It too was amazing. Now I find myself craving this food every minute of the day. I am going on for a kidney transplant next week, but you better believe this will be my last big meal before surgery. I can't wait! I am in love with this restaurant. P. S. Even the pasta fagioli was great.

This place was great!  Food was awesome, service was great (Paige was our waitress).  Very comfortable restaurant.  Oh and price was very reasonable.  Pretty pumped that this place is very close to where I live and worth while if u have to drive.  Can't wait to go back.

This restaurant has not been open for lunch since May 8th. They now open at 4pm except Sunday when they open at 2pm.Their web page has not been updated with this change and neither has Yelp. Found this out the hard way. Food is very good as I have been there several times and will go back. This review is just a warning to others not to waste their time driving out to this restaurant for lunch. There should at least be an update to their webpage regarding their new "summer hours." Maybe some more bad reviews will spur them to action.

We had the lasagna the first time we visited and it was excellent. Our second visit surpassed the first. We gathered a group of friends and descended on them for lunch. They escorted us into a private room that was so cozy and comfortable. This time my husband and I had the veal parmesan and it was superb. Not only was the food great but a basket of warm bread, olive oil dip, olives and a plate of cheese, salami and peppers with balsamic vinegar was served before the meal. Who does this? Capri.

A few of us went for dinner and each had a different entree. Surprised at reviews since I found the portion sizes to be rather skimpy for an Italian restaurant, with the exception of a chicken dish.  Furthermore, the house salad was disappointing - there must have been 3 lettuce leaves, max.  Unfortunately, I found this place to be just ok.  Much prefer the Capri in Burr Ridge which I find outstanding every single time.

The food is definitely Italian. Good food , nice ambience and the waiters/waitress are fantastic. The martini specials are excellent. We take our guest here because I know the will enjoy good food and it won't break the bank.

Glad to find a new Capri close to where I'm staying. Sunday afternoon - no in the dining room but me!  Service was excellent - attentive to a single diner which is often challenging. Good wine list. HUGE portions. Fresh caprese salad. Fresh pasta with sausage. Makes all the difference!  Filling. Odd location and challenging with movie theater next door - hope they make it because it was excellent!!

This is probably my new favorite Italian restaurant- the food is amazing and their service is great-very attentive! They also have a person singing on Saturdays. Save room for their Italian lemon ice dessert served in a lemon!

Great food and great portions, Rigatoni Vita Mia and the Pollo Francese were awesome that my wife and I had. Definitely coming back and would recommend. Finishing off the meal with the lemon ice served in a hollowed out lemon was great too! We went on a Saturday night and there was someone singing too at a proper volume and made perfect background music.
Great food and service. This will probably be the best of the Capris. Everything is delicious and its a very nice atmosphere.

The Veal Piccata & Veal Marsella as well as Service outstanding. Got to try the homemade pastas and table side bananas foster. Dessert and a show! Definitely coming back! And our server Kerry was awesome!

This is the only authentic Italian restaurant in the area that we have found . Had the gnocchi and spinach.  Delicious! It was lite  and flavorful, almost floated to the sauce. Only been once, but looking forward to the next time

Debbie is the best waitress here. She's always the one the serves me and my family and she remembers everything you like such as what you would drink and what you would normally order. The food is delicious and I'd come here often all the time over the weekends. I'd recommend the creamy soup such as chicken or broccoli and little did you know if you order a full dinner you can replace the salad with an additional cup of soup if you don't like salad. I also recommend the steaks cooked medium it is delicious. 

Coming back soon :)

Just Fasted for blood work this morning. Left Doc starving. Tried Family Square for breakfast and was not disappointed. Big portions, tons of selections, and fresh pies. My server Sheryl was great. Great place to dine.

The food is a solid 4*, good and cooked to our specifications. 
Service was nice too. 
Howeveeeer... This place is really outdated. Would not mind it but there's a strong smell right where you walk in: stinks. Then the bathroom (ladies) could definitely be more clean. 
And something else that bothered me is that the chairs are so big that people walking behind anyone at our table would have to squeeze by and still bump into us.

Came here for breakfast before setting out for our road trip.

Decent service and decent food.

This place is a big no go for me. I hate giving small businesses bad reviews because they're so important to our economy but this place was just not good. Dirty floors, poor service, and greasy breakfast. I asked specifically for no oil or butter because it really upsets my stomach and I had to practically strain the oil off of my potatoes. 
This place gets 3 stars though because of the grilled chicken breast alone, It is so yummy!
They never have any Black employees, even though it is a very eclectic neighborhood.  Not to mention the food is old.
Skirt steak rare..and eggs over easy...omg to die for!  Staff always friendly, lots of room to accommodate any party size.  Always a pleasure

Good local place for breakfast.  Super busy and my friends who live here visit often.  We had s big party and every one arrived at different times and it was busy and although I'm sure we were totally annoying to the staff they were still great about it.  I would come here over a chain pancake place everytime for sure. Good prices too

Live nearby and first time here for breakfast and my sisters food had a long hair cooked in her eggs .... Luckily she noticed right away. Waitress was nice and got her a new meal quickly but they didn't even take it off the bill or anything...
This place is great!!! Doesn't look like it serves quality food but it's amazing. I am a regular now.

If you love comfort food, this restaurant is for you.  The menu Is awesome....Something for everyone! We went for breakfast as we were really starving after our move to this area.
We were greeted warmly and seated promptly even tho they were super busy. Coffee was poured immediately and since we knew what we wanted, our order was taken without a blink and served in no time at all. I ordered bacon  (limp-not burned), eggs over easy with hash browns and pancakes.  My daughter ordered bacon (well-done) scrambled w/cheese, well-done hash browns and well-done toast. Surprisingly,  everything came as ordered. Coffee cups were attentively refilled. 
We will definitely be going back.  The daily specials  all sound delicious.
I never give 5 stars, but this restaurant is in the running for a 5* review.....stay tuned!

Only good thing here was the water and the soup.  Chicken salad was terrible.  Not even real chicken breast tasted like it was canned.  And the most disappointed was my wife's taco salad.  The ground beef was like eating a pile of grease.  The wife took 2 bites and stopped.  Can't speak for the breakfast as it seems to be why it gets all the good reviews.

But maybe the thing is to not eat LUNCH here!!!
Breakfast is outstanding. You need to come before 10 for the biscuits and gravy. Pecan waffle is the best! Haven't tried anything else here besides breakfast but I'm sure it's just as good.

Came here a couple weeks ago with my husband and i thoight it was delicious! The pancakes did taste a but too sweet but they were good! I LOVED the cream of chicken soup and the bread they give you with it! So delicious. Will be coming back soon!

I've eaten here on several occasions and they never disappoint.
Spacious parking, diverse and hearty breakfast and lunch menu, cheap prices, and prompt service. Dining alone, I've been in and out in about 30 minutes flat! No gimmicks, just good food at very reasonable prices. Went there the other day with a couple of friends, got an entire French toast combo with eggs, bacon, sausage and all the coffee I could drink with a huge slice of cheesecake for desert all for $15!! I walked outta there stuffed! And they don't skimp on quality with their hearty portions. Highly recommended if you're in the area.
The food tasted amazing. Great customer service as well. Came in during my lunch break a couple times and they never let you down

Family Square never disappoints!!  It has been a staple in Bolingbrook for at least 30 years.  Everything is homemade!!  Breakfast to a huge steak dinner they have it all!  Their soups are yummy.  Family Square offers 4 homemade soups daily, one being cream of chicken with rice which is served daily.  My faves are breakfast, the club sandwiches and the open face turkey sandwich.

They offer several daily specials as well plus a lunch menu!!  

No frills or fuss just yummy food!!

Disappointed   there quality isnt what it used to be.. i used to think their gyros were the best in town  but not any more   they were dry and lacked the great taste of spices they used to have   and what happened to yoir greek potatoes?  I wont be coming back.

They have a good breakfast and lunch is OK with good prices. Sometimes I just want a bowl of soup for lunch and this isn't the right place. It's not great and with a tip it costs close to $7 not a good deal in my opinion.. I'll go to Boston Market and have their unlimited soup deal for less money.

Family Square has always been one of my family's favorite restaurants in Bolingbrook. They have an excellent, varied general menu; friendly staff; and plentiful portions. We try to eat dinner here whenever we visit Bolingbrook.

One of the worst dining experiences I ever had. Wrong omelette came out, so I just had coffee while other person with me ate. We were in a hurry. Waitress took omelette away but left English muffin on the table. So, being hungry, I ate it dry. When check came, I was charged for the muffin a la carte and coffee. I asked if they planned on giving it to someone else. I asked why it wasn't removed with the omlette. I explained that since she left it there, I was sure it would be thrown out anyway. Absolutely no response. When I got to the register, the woman taking money was ruder than the waitress about it.  She made me pay. No apology from anyone for the wrong omlette either. This place is absolutely pathetic. I'll never go there again. Ever! From the looks of the workers hanging around the open back door - weather permitting - to chain smoke in the doorway, it seems like a good place for the Board of Health to come a-knocking, too.

Stopped late night due fatigue and awoke this morning looking for a small family restaurant with charm and character. This restaurant is just that. They have a wonderful steak selection for breakfast and the service was fantastic. The prices were extremely affordable and one of the largest varieties at a breakfast location I have seen in a long time. I am completely satisfied and will be back.
Great place to eat I got the veggie omelette and my daughter got the cheese burger! Then after lunch we ordered a slice of cheese cake! Yum so good! So many pies to choose from :)
My husband and I had breakfast here and it was delicious!!! Lots of variety on the menu with reasonable prices. They had breakfast and lunch available.  The staff is fast and friendly to boot.

Huge portions, friendly staff!
Mediocre food, but loads of food options.
Great for going with grandparents!

Been here quite a few times and the food quality has always been consistent. Not a flashy place but the ambiance is definitely welcoming and the service is pretty good too. Pricing is very reasonable especially for the amount of food that they give. Have a nice selection if deserts but I just haven't found one that I particularly care for yet. Not a date restaurant but very nice casual restaurant.

The Family Square is what you want in a family restaurant: lots of homemade menu items, quick, efficient service, reasonable prices and a tidy dining room.
My bowl of soup was large, as was the bread basket filled with a variety of warm rolls, corn muffins and crackers.

Will not return!! Food was cold and what was warm was not edible. Even worse we had ants crawling on our table. Wanted to try some place new for breakfast. Waitress barely acknowledged us.
Asked for eggs to be scrambled with cheese. Got folded eggs with two slices of cheese thrown on top. Grits were thick and lumpy. Bacon was cold. Would not recommend.

Best in town...lunch specials you can't beat...it's like going to your family house real good food...the staff is always friendly...my husband drinks alot of pop and the waitress always know to real fill his glass...if you need a breakfest place it's a must...

Cream of chicken & rice soup. Hot, fresh rolls. HOUSE MADE RANCH! This place, is the best of the best. Beyond delicious, well priced, good variety, cozy and just YUM!!! Been coming here since birth, and even ate it right AFTER giving birth to my daughter at Adventist bolingbrook hospital (:

Went to eat on a Thursday evening with 2 kids. Service was great. Our French toast was not fully cooked all the way through and neither were the hash browns, called the waitress over to advise and took care of it by replacing with a new fresh order. No nasty looks, no attitude, no questions asked. Wow!! It's been such a long time that I have not experienced exceptional service. The owner came over and apologized as well. I will definitely come back. Oh, by the way, cream of chicken soup is delish!!

I just love this place. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are very reasonable. I love the Chicken Breast Salad with the house dressing. The salad is huge and the dressing is so yummy. The staff is always welcoming and service is very good. We usually go once a week.

One of our favorite breakfast places, prices are reasonable and the food is awesome, exactly what you expect. I typically get some sort of skillet that is always great, comes with either toast or pancakes. My husband is also a big fan of their breakfast, he likes their country fried steak or a meat lovers skillet. The only downside is that although we typically have decent service, some of the staff isn't the friendliest, although most of them are great. I recommend for an inexpensive, comforting breakfast.

To the person who wrote about complaining about them cleaning pie case while you're eating, maybe you shouldn't be there then when they're cleaning to close. You ignorant people bother me I've done serving as a side job and can't stand customers who come in minutes before closing and stay past closing when we are trying to go home. And then the half of you order slow cooking meals. Have some consideracy. I feel for these ladies here. they work hard to bust their butt off for you rude, inconsiderate, and unappreciative people.

No wait, very nice service and the breakfast was great. Had the skirt steak and eggs and it was delicious. Portions were big and choices were many All around great experience.  I have had the best club sandwich on other occasions. Its carved turkey which taste better than lunch meat. I have yet to have anything I wasn't pleased with. Breakfast is always great, lunch is great and dinner is also great, you cant go wrong.
I recommend the club or burgers and always the skirt steak and eggs or omeltte.

My husband and I have lived around the corner from this restaurant for 3 and a half years and we had yet to try it. We enjoy driving past the restaurant and reading the menu board to each other over the phone since their 3 specials always seem to be so hilariously incompatible with each other (for example - Chicken Teriyaki, Stuffed Cabbage, Pork Fajitas). OK, maybe we're the only ones that find this hilarious. But all of that menu reading made us eventually want to try the place.

We ended up going for breakfast on Friday and it was good. The bread basket they bring before the meal was some tasty bread. I got the egg white veggie omelette. It was good, not great, a little less flavor than I'm used to. I asked for a little bit of cheese and I got a lot of cheese, but that was easy enough to eat around. The fresh fruit I got on the side was actually a better variety than I expected - probably a good 6 different types. My husband got a pineapple filled with chicken salad. His brunch was much better than mine, it was a half pineapple cut up with this really awesome chicken salad inside. I don't even like chicken salad and I could've eaten it all.

The waitress was nice, nothing special bad or good about the service.

Overall, I'd say most everything was right in the average category except the delicious chicken salad in the pineapple. So order that one. Maybe it'll be on special with spaghetti bolognese and samosas next week.

I love this restaurant. My family and I go here at least twice a month. They have the best Cream of chicken with rice soup. My mouth waters just thinking about it. The staff is very friendly and always makes sure you have what you need. The portions are huge and you will not walk out of there hungry. I love ordering their lasagna when they have it as a special and my son has to have breakfast every time we go. I have been going here since I was a child and they really have cleaned the place up since then. We never have issues getting a seat but we always make a reservation when the whole family comes out. I highly recommend eating here.
This place has the best soup, bread and also the best ranch dressing! I go out of my way at least once a month just to eat here!

stopped here with my friends before headin back home 2 chicago. its kinda ur typical diner food the serves breakfast all day. i had the gyro & feta cheese omelette which came wit hashbrowns & pancakes. the hashbrowns were good but the pancakes werent good without any syrup. my omelette was fantastic tho! good combo, especially with that gyros cucumber sauce! deeeeeeelish! reasonable prices and good service as well.
This is a great breakfast place!  We ordered breakfast and got great service plus the waitress was knowledgeable of what was available and portion size if you ask her. Reasonably priced as well.

I love this place! I have been coming here for breakfast for years. Just went their this morning and it is wonderful as always. Friendly staff and great breakfast food for very reasonable prices. I have always got the waffle club and it is so yummy! Eggs are always cooked prefect and same with my bacon! Awesome coffee as well.

This has become a work day lunch spot favorite. The feel of the restaurant is very family and everyone is welcome and tended to. I liken this to a diner from NJ, the food is fast and plentiful. There won't be any James Beard awards anytime soon but all the food is tasty and quick not to mention very well priced. If ever in need of a good meal at a low cost Family Square is the place to go.
Wonderful friendly and clean atmosphere. Decent coffee. Breakfast was cooked nicely. Pancakes weren't rubbery. Whipped butter, not hard margarine. Quick service. I dig it.

This place exemplifies the kind of place that I like to frequent on a regular recurrent basis. If I am not craving anything specific, I enjoy going to a standard diner/family restaurant. Their menus are never all that different from one another and you pretty good idea on what to expect when you step in the door and sit down for a meal. This place is the poster child for this kind of establishment in my mind. 

The place is a good size and kept clean. The booths and the dining area were very comfortable and not crowded together. There was not anything at all that particularly stood out in this place as far as decor is concerned but I really didn't care. Our server did a very good job taking care of us. I have absolutely no complaints.

Their menu is quite extensive as typically found in these types of places. I ordered two eggs over easy, gyro meat, hash browns, and pancakes instead of toast. As far as flavor is concerned, nothing really blew me away but everything was very tasty. Although I was hungry when I walked in here, by the time I was  of the way done, my belly felt like it was going to bust! I was a very satisfied customer. I was even more satisfied when bill came. I was very pleased that I was able to partake in that size and good quality of meal for such a reasonable price.

I can officially add this place to my mental list of solid places to go for a good meal at a reasonable price. It did not let me down and I am looking forward to my next visit when I am in the area!

I've been here twice, once dining in and once to take home a "french silk pie."

Dining in was awhile ago, disappointing is all I remember. Chicken rice soup wasn't good and too lemony and all white rice in some nasty thick yellow I don't know. Although the portion was massive... but I definitely don't want a generous portion of nasty I don't know...

The chocolate pie was nasty, can't believe I wasted $14 on it. Should've just drove to Jewel and got their actual french silk for $8. It's much better. Family Square's tasted like that generic brand crappy chocolate pudding powder mix you buy at the store and add skim milk to. Gross.

I miss Baker's Square...  :(

The food is good, but the waitresses are plain ol' rude.  I came in with a small party - 4 adults, two kids (ages 4 and 6), and one baby (7 months old).  Both young children were well behaved, and my 7 month old slept the entire meal.  Our waitress treated us like the scum of the world; she acted as though we were taking up too much space and ruining her tip average.
We left her a great tip, even though she didn't deserve it.
The quality of food doesn't make up for the poor service.  I suppose this would be a great lunch stop if you ordered to go!
I'm giving it four stars on account for breakfast.  Good specials specially the omlettes.  Not too greasy

3 stars, really? The service is friendly and quick, the food is outstanding, and I have been going here since I was a baby. Seriously, try the breakfast food and/or the gyros and fries. Btw, we cone here from Oswego now because no place compares to Family Square. :)

I have eaten here over the years whenever we are in town visiting our kids/grandkids.   I have always found the service to be exceptional - not once have I waited long for anything I needed.
My husband loves the breakfasts and patty melt while I love their kabobs - you cannot get Mediterranean food in the midwest and that dinner is so delis, coming with salad and what tastes like homemade rolls - superb.  It is a treasure of a diner and places like this one are rare and hard to find in this franchise kind of world.   The coffee is more than decent.
I highly rec this place if a good meal with good service with huge selection is what you are after,

I consider myself a pancake critic.  I've tried over 15 pancake restaurants in the Chicago area.  My rating below is based on a basic breakfast sampling of regular (original) pancakes, sausage, eggs and coffee.  I rate Family Square a 4 overall.  The staff is friendly and the food a great value.  If you like the hometown, comfy cafe setting then you'll love Family Square.  

Pancake (original) ****  great taste, a bit wheaty otherwise great
Sausage (links) ***
Eggs (scrambled) ***
Coffee  ****great coffee

Use to be better back in the day. This is a neighborhood restaurant where if they dont know you as a regular lets just say be he happy to have them server you.  Food is in par with that of a greasy spoon type restaurant but has a better decor.  Been there three times in the last month because my boys like it (gives you alot of food). One time got the veal was over cooked and greasy. Next time i got an omelet with toast the omelet looked like it was ready to give birth and the toast appeared to be buttered on both sides? Strange, I have definately had better and if my boys didn't like it then i probably wouldn't go there.

I have eaten at this restaurant for the last ten years and I have to say it's one of the best diners you can find anywhere. Their food is really good. Try their gyros and Greek pork chops! Their breakfast items are always awesome. 
The service is always good. Never had a problem at all. They are courteous, clean and fast. 
Also, the price is always right, in case you are on a budget!

Although I generally avoid greek diners, I've frequented this place for some 20 years. And while the prices have recently gone through the roof ($10-$12/person for lunch), the food and service are, as always, very good.  The waitresses will refer to you as hon or babe, which is kind of nice considering the typical treatment received at less expensive eateries. I especially enjoy the greek salad, the rueben sandwich, and the top flite gyros.  The soups of the day are usually cream based-cream of brocolli, cream of mushroom,etc.  They must buy cream base in 55 gallon drums, and I would agree with a previous review relative to the hesitancy to dispose of stale rolls.  All in all, a local favorite.

Your standard family restaurant, with a huge menu that covers anything from breakfast to pastries for desert (The try to make it sound fancy- French Pastry Case.  But last time I checked German Chocolate Cake and Apple Pie really don't count as French Pastries.)  The food comes in variable types of mediocre.  Not once when I was in here was anything really outstanding.  Last time, my fried chicken was spent a wee bit too long in the fryer.  But they do have a few positive notes:  The coffee is always fresh, service is friendly, they serve breakfast all day, and the Heinz Ketchup clock they have near the entrance is really cool.

Typically, we only eat breakfast here and the meal is always very good.  The omlettes are huge and the hash browns are fried to perfection.  Most of the meals offer a choice between toast or pancakes - the pancakes are very good but are usually too much for me along with all of the other food.

Terrible wait staff, terrible customer service, and terrible food.  The oil used for deep frying was old and imbued my food with a horrid chemical flavor.  Upon informing the manager about their kitchen's error I was told that I would need to pay for my sides.  Then again, what can you expect from a restaurant in Bolingbrook?

My family and I come here regularly and we love it. My 3 kids love eating at the "Square." The food is always excellent, the soup is always home made, and you always get a basket of bread. It's the best family restaurant in town. If you dine here, ask for Lynn, she is an awesome waitress!

Updated 12/20/13.

Just added two extra stars..this place is much better these days.

 

Large menu, good selection, wait staff are above average. 

My only beefs food wise are;

!. Some waitresses still serve soup all sloppy running down the side of thw bowl and spilt on the saucer.

Our server was David he was great went above the norm for a family style restaurant you would have thought you were in a 5 star with the service he provided.  Lots of good food for reasonable price. Little tip for you ask for David as a server. If Davids not there ask for barb tremendous waitress also!!

Having recently traveled to Spain, we had a hankering for tapas and knowing that this was one of the better known spots for this type of food - we decided to give it a try.  I have been to other tapas restaurants in the Chicagoland area and this is the best I have ever had.

The restaurant isn't huge and reservations are taken and recommended.  Because tapas is an experience, dining can take awhile.  

We got a variety of things to try and everything was good and would be worth of a second order should the opportunity present itself:  The dishes we had were the sauteed escargot, dates wrapped in bacon, grilled calamari and something they had on special that were venison empanadas.  We also had the sangria, which was delicious and the baked pineapple dessert which was interesting.  

I would come back here again and again and try some new things as well as ordering all of this again.  You won't go wrong with this restaurant.

I really enjoyed our recent trip to Emilio's.   We'd tried the location in Wheaton a few years ago and it was good.

A recent Saturday evening spent in this cozy spot which is in a great location-accessible from just about anywhere in Chicagoland within 40 minutes.

Red Sangria was tasty-good balance of sweet and alcohol.   

Food was really good with one great item-the bacon wrapped dates, which were perfect-larger and better cooked bacon than at the best tapas restaurant in Chicago and the entire area-hint, it's in Naperville.

The garlic potato salad was excellent and the baked goat cheese and tomato dish with toast points was as well.   Meat items were tasty-well cooked tender selections with great sauces and vegetable garnish.   I'd go back any day and recommend it highly for a mix of a nice restaurant in a laid back atmosphere where it's all about the food.

Let me preface this update by saying that I don't personally know these people, but I've been eating at this restaurant for years and it has always been at the top of my list.
This morning, as I write this review, Ann Marie and Emilio are on their way to the restaurant to meet my husband and me, so that we can get my husband's phone (that he left on the table lastnight, when we were there having paella). My husband has to catch a flight today and needs that phone. I called the restaurant and left a message, asking them to please call me (even though they open at 4:30 today). Ann Marie called me back right away and said that if the phone is there, we can get it at 10am.
These people are THE BEST. Hands-down, our favorite restaurant in the area, for its delicious food and great service!!

TAKE OFF YOUR TAPAS

Let's get wild and pass some plates around!

Emilio's has hosted several family gatherings for us over the past decade, and on every instance the visit has been met with the consistent quality and friendliness we've come to expect from them.

I should mention, though, that my mom's social circle of restaurateurs and foodie acquaintances allows me to say that I know the owner.....by a few degrees of separation.  As it turns out, our good friends Jeff G & Janet G knew the namesake proprietor back when he first opened this Spanish eatery back in 1988.  They dined here nearly every week and my parents joined them on many occasions, so my family's affinity for Emilio's runs deep.

They pride themselves on a kitchen that offers plate after plate of delicious share-able food.  While main entrees are available, I highly recommend getting a bunch of smaller items to split amongst the table, as this allows you to try a greater variety of unique and delectable dishes.

Most recently, we came here for Sunday night dinner and once again enjoyed some of the best tapas in the Chicago area.  I arrived late (what a shocker!) but was happy to sample a small dish of garlic potatoes and another of chicken curry.  Following that, our table ordered a carne asada which was cooked medium rare and served with potato shoestrings and mixed greens.  Dessert is what impressed me the most, though.

The five of us ordered a tasty trio: molten chocolate lava cake, caramelized banana, and a blueberry bread pudding.  The latter got rave reviews, which was the perfect amount of sweet/tart and came served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  Molten choco cake was on-point, and I'm told the banana was great (I missed out, because I'm slow & clueless).

Our server did a nice job, whose mother had apparently been the first employee Emilio ever hired some 27 years ago.  So that's a pretty cool snippet of history.

Bread = 4.5
Circuses = 4.5

Out of 270 reviews, a 4.5 aggregate rating for Emilio's is pretty damn good.  This indicates user opinions are "very favorable" and nothing I've experienced here would lead me to say otherwise.  Food's great, staff is great, and chances are your experience here -- be it a birthday celebration or casual dinner -- will also be great.

This family favorite in Hillside has been around for decades, and I'm very happy to hear that they're reporting great revenue figures for 2016.  One would hope that they'll be around for many more years to come, and if they keep serving up such tremendous tapas, my thought is that they will be.

The quality remains after 20 + years of going to this authentic tapas.   It a bit of a drive but well worth it.   Everything was delicious.  I wish I can make some of these dishes @ home.  But preparation would take a while. So it's easier to be served.  It's almost as good as going to Spain without a he flight

I had my group's annual ladies dinner at Emilio's. There were about 8 of us for many of us it was our first time at a tapas restaurant. What a great experience who would have thought that so many small plates will fill you up to the extreme. The Spanish paella was fantastic that alone could be a meal by itself. The selection of wines was very good and our server and the rest of the staff were awesome highly recommended.

I loved Emilio's Tapas. Service was great and food was amazing. Every single plate we ordered was really good. I dont even know what to write. Just go here and check it out. It isnt super expensiveness and the portions are  normal Tapas sizes. Patio area is super cool and made eating there even better. 

Only funny thing is the bathrooms are marked in Spanish. But they are big Spanish words I didnt know. I have no clue what bathroom is guys or girls.

Stayed at a hotel nearby for a conference. We were looking for a nice place to eat and came across Emilio's Tapas and I am so glad we did! The food and service here is outstanding. So great, we came back here the following month during another conference. 

For starters, you get some bread and butter. You also get a bite size dish for each person as an appetizer that varies per day.

Things to try:
Calamari con ajo y limon (grilled calamari with garlic, lemon and EVOO) - This dish is possibly the best calamari I've ever had. I got this on two separate occasions. The calamari is so soft! The garlic, lemon and EVOO goes perfectly with it and is so good, you'll be tempted to lick the plate! (Just use the bread instead!)

Paella - Very delicious! Lots of flavors and textures. There was a lot of it even for a single portion. 

Sangria - You can get a great sampler trio of these. 

Overall, a great place for a meal. Excited to go back!
Top notch!  Best Tapas I have had in Chicago.  If you want real Spanish Tapas this is the place to come too.  This is it!
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Emilio is a friend of a friend and his food is delicious! Hillside location often has special events going on and is a fun place to eat.

Bland food!!!

Patatas bravas horrible!!! They were undercooked and the sauce was like minestrone sauce on top of them. Not spicy no mayo nothing to do with traditional patatas bravas. 

Tuna stuffed canelone was good but 9 dollars!!!! It was a sheet of pasta stuffed with canned tuna the size of my pinky finger. It had diced tomatoes on the side. This dish was good but it's worth like 4-5 dollars it's ridiculous. 

Gambas al ajillo Were gross !!!!! They were swimming in grease and had absolutely no taste they were bland!!! Another rip off dish 5 shrimp for 9 dollars!!! Seriously 

Seafood pasta was another joke. It was so bland I finally gave up and asked for a salt shaker!!  

Stuffed mushrooms were ok, pulpo a la plancha was ok, flan was ok. 

I had never had to reach for a salt shaker at a tapas restaurant. They are removed from the table like it's an insult to add salt to their horrible bland food.

This is another gimmick well located restaurant. There is nothing around for miles. If you want good tapas you have to go up north. This is like the senior citizen version of Cafebabareeba !!! Insult to tapas...

I've been to Emillio's in city many times, especially the location Ohio street many time.  I must admin i'm not a fan of that location.

I was very pleasantly surprised to enjoy Emillion's in Suburbia!! 

My favorite was sautÃ©ed scallops in tomato saffron sauce, what a amazing combination!  Everything we ordered was delicious.  Ambiance isn't world class, and from first look restaurant might appear small, it's pretty big with back room which isn't visible at first.

Staff is very friendly, they noticed our group liked extra spicy food and sent a plate of grilled peppers on the side.  We also received one tapas which wasn't on the menu as complimentary to try from the chef.  

This type of service, taste or friendly staff is unheard of at any Chicago Locations!!  I'll be returning to Emillio's in suburbia if i'm in the area again!

Emilio's tapas is great for large groups with a beautiful casual ambiance. I come here with my family all the time. I don't have a favorite dish because everything is outstanding. I live nearby so that's a huge plus!! I definitely recommend this restaurant to all my friends in the area. Last note- check out the out door patio.

I love the tapas here. I live near by so that's even more a plus. The spicy potatoes are fabulous and so is the octopus. I come here with my family all the time and we love sitting on the patio when the weather permits.

They get 3 stars for service,desert and the sangria. Food was barely warm, and wasn't that good. My friend and I actually felt ill in the middle of the night. 
This was our first time there,although we had been curious about it for a couple of years. Sad that we won't be going back, as we hate making the trek into the city for Cafe Iberico.
This is the real deal... Amazing Spanish tapas! We lived in Andalucia in southern Spain for three years and this is as close to authentic that I have eaten in the us. We  Will definitely be back!

Loved this place! Glad my friend made reservations. We got there at 6:00, the place was empty, and without 30 minutes it was full!

I'm pleased with everything we tried. We were a table of 8, so we tried a lot of different things- ham, chicken, shrimp, goat cheese, all great!!

I'm really not sure Louis G ate at the same places. We all loved the patatas bravas and loved them!

I had a flight of sangria, since they have 5 flavors: that was fun, but I still preferred the red one. :-)

We ordered a selection of the desserts too, all fantastic. I would say this place is family friendly because of the atmosphere and the noise level (high) but the toddler that was with us didn't like the food too much, picky phase maybe. All the grown ups loved it! I'm definitely going back!

A lovely tapas restaurant!  The food was very tasteful and the service was excellent!!  They had a nice variety to choose from and the waitress was very knowledgable.  I would definitely visit again when traveling to Chicago!
Phenomenal food and service! Flank steak and scallops, both fabulous! A must try. Best time 4-5pm.

I was 17 or 18 when I last came here about 13 years ago.  I think the typical age range that I notice is usually 30-60 years old. Which is probably what kept me away for so long...(I'm old now so I fit right in lol) I don't remember the food at all the first time. The only thing I remembered about this place was my sister telling me about the guy sitting behind her who was on a blind date set up by co-workers and for whatever reason he kept talking about how he really enjoyed having sex....lol..at 17 this was straight hilariousness to me. (Is this what I have to look forwarded to when I grow up? lol)

Being that this is a  5 min drive for me. Yelp kept throwing it as the number 1 spot in my face every time I searched with the app...so they got me to look lol Read something about Happy hour and figure why not update my experience with this place.

The food was amazing. Sharing 10 tapas across two people for only $20 was pretty sweet deal to me. I'm always disappointed I can never find a place within a 5 min drive that basically isn't everyday fast food joints. So I'm very ecstatic that I've rediscovered this place.

I think the happy Hour is a great way to test out the food to give you an idea of what to order for lunch/dinner. I'm pleased with this place where I'm already thinking about coming here for my birthday....8 months from now.

About 3 minutes after ordering I asked for one of the tapas (garlic potato salad) to be replaced with a different tapas. When the food was brought out I was for sure that tapas had not been replaced. Although my waiter assured me it wasn't the potato salad. I was still skeptical up until trying it out while she stood there and I was wrong lol my fault.  What surprised me was the waiter brought out the potato salad free of charge just to point out the difference and why it was good. (and it was)

I had the peach margarita that I thought was good and refreshing. Not everyday you see peach on the menu. Wanted a mango for 2nd drink but was told they had ran out. Most  specialty drinks cost $9.Beer about $5 The only slight drawback I had with my drink is that I thought the highball glass was small for a margarita. for $9 I was expecting a 24oz glass not 14oz (not a bartender so I'm guessing don't quote me :D )

Emilio's Tapas is a small and crowded place.  Tables are close together in a relatively small space.  The foods ordered when we were there were a fish-based soup which was quite good, and a number of tapas plates which were shared.  Included in the selections were halibut, mushroom, and chicken wings as well as a tomato-based dip which was soaked up bits of bread.  The wings and tomato-based dip were quite good.  Also, ample amounts of bread and butter are brought to the table to help fill you up.  For a satisfying meal, sodas - but no desserts - for ten people, the bill was about $200 plus tip.  The service is adequate.  The biggest drawback is the crowded tables.

Soooo annoyed right now.  I don't know if I should be annoyed with Yelp or the business. I'm all excited to taste the food that has rave reviews and I place the order for take out and I ask for the pork medallions with potatoes dinner.  When I get home I have something totally different, so I call and it seems the host doesn't know the menu so in addition to trying to find out what it is I have, I'm being placed on hold several times..... why she finds out why I didn't get what I asked for.

I kind of blame myself because I should have checked before I left but she should have told me that they didn't have it when I ordered it. 

I don't even know how the food tastes because I'm soo annoyed right now that I don't even want to eat it. I don't get an apology just, "the menu I ordered off of is an old one and they can make me what I asked for if I I want to some back and get it.

They lost a customer before even getting one.

Nothing like being hungry and paying good money for a meal you don't want eat.

We went there for a family birthday celebration for our daughter. The food was delicious! The goat cheese with honey, poached pear, and nuts was our favorite but everything was very tasty. We would highly recommend. Also, as it was our first visit the chef sent out 3 desserts for us to celebrate our daughters birthday. Yum!!! Thanks for a nice evening with family and great food!

Emilio's Emilio's Emilio's

THIS is a fine example of what every restaurant should strive for. 

My wife and I were fasting for Ramadan and asked the waitress if she could try to have the food ready according to the time that we break fast. The timing and service we received were more than we could have expected. We obviously understand food preparation times cannot always be coordinated as we wish, but it was perfect! 

The family and traditional vibes were priceless. We were having conversations across tables with other guests, it was such a nice open atmosphere. We really had a lot of fun.

Don't get me started on the most important part - THE FOOD! I don't need to tell you what to get because the waitress will advise you and deliver! 

Look no further, Emilio's will deliver an amazing experience every time for any occasion.

Emilio's Tapas restaurant is one of Chicago's true dining treasures. Recently, I dined there with a business associate who was in town from Barcelona. I've always enjoyed dining there but I was very curious to see what a true Spaniard would have to say about the food. I was told by him that the food was not only genuine, it was also outstanding which is high praise indeed as he travels the world and his dined at many excellent restaurants within his home country.

Chef Emilio himself was there to greet us and the bread and circuses were both phenomenal. My favorites were the Paiea, the bacon wrapped dates, and the banana dessert but once again, everything was well prepared and tasty.

Fire!!! Tapas style Spanish place with a great atmosphere. I would highly recommend to eat in since it's worth the experience. You can't go wrong with the menu items. I have to eat there again to try a couple more things before I wrote a longer review.

Roberto is a great and attentive waiter.  I love Emilio's decor, food and service    
The patatas rellenas  con solo millo was my favorite tonight but all food and sangria was delightful.

This is my absolute favorite new restaurant (new to me not a new restaurant). I love the bacon wrap dates and goat cheese dip....the best I've ever had!!! The sangria is also amazing....very strong!! They also always bring a small plate of something for you to try on the house which is so nice and much appreciated!

The wait staff is also really nice and the price is right!

I can't wait to go back!!

I've been wanting to check this place out for a while. Well we finally were able to check it out! We tried the bacon wrapped dates, spicy wings, curried chicken salad, toast points with Serrano ham and manchego cheese, eggplant dip, grilled shrimp, and there grilled lamp appetizer. Everything we had was OK. Not bad, but nothing special. I'm not a picky person in general and wanted so desperately to like this place but it was just OK. We also tried the mango sangria (pass), red wine sangria (good) and the patio (tasty but not strong).

I've been coming here for over 15 years. The food, service and atmosphere has been consistently great every time. They have a wonderful bar selection as well as gluten free options. During the summer it's wonderful to sit outside. This is a great place to celebrate special occasions or have a nice meal. They even have live music.
Really good food, cute atmosphere, great service... If your looking for something original and not formulaic, definitely tris place.
Worst paella ever.. and the service i didnt even get napkins or a fork... never again

This has been my family's favorite tapas restaurant for many, many years now. Things we always order include the escargot, basked goat cheese, bacon-wrapped dates, and profiteroles for dessert. The bacon-wrapped dates will always be my absolute favorite dish no matter what! They are just incredible. My last visit, we went with a large group and ordered many, many tapas. New standouts included the grilled octopus, suckling pig, and salt and pepper beef tenderloin. We always order paella and the last time, it was a little soggy and the shrimp was slightly overdone, but tasty nonetheless. Emilio's is timeless to my family and I know we'll be back for years to come.

You could very easily miss this wonderful place if you're not looking for the small yellow sign. But it's well worth it. The atmosphere is very Spanish with a bar, another room of tables, and some outdoor seating. Great casual ambience for a date or talking with friends.

The service is very attentive, and there is constantly someone taking empty plates from your table or filling your water. 

I've been here twice and I highly recommend the sangria (any of them. They have like 5 kinds), or the unique Spanish beers they carry that you don't see very often. 

In terms of food, I adore tapas. I always want to try everything on everyone's plate anyway, so this gives me a socially acceptable excuse! I love that there are always plenty of little plates piled in the middle of the table so you can switch out whenever you need a new one. 

First, if you love garlic (I do) get the garlic potato salad. It is garlic extreme, but it is also amazing! The grilled shrimp are great, the cannoli with tuna that also had other ingredients mixed in was fantastic, and came with a very mild, yet  complimentary vinaigrette and tomato pieces. Basically, both times I've been here, I was never disappointed. I don't think you can go wrong with selections. They do also have nightly specials, which we got the smoked salmon with dill sauce, capers, red onions, and toast points. Fantastic .

For dessert we had the puff pastry filled with vanilla ice cream and covered in some sort of heavenly chocolate sauce. Along with that we both had the cafe cortado. The espresso was wonderful with great flavor. 

In summary, if you're anywhere near here, this place is wonderful, relatively inexpensive, has great service, a great bar, and is a very tasty dining experience you won't forget.

Bummer evening.  My husband and I brought the kids for dinner around 6:45 on a Monday night. 
 We were seated by the hostess and as we are walking to the table I said,  I brought gluten free bread for my child and she said " I guess we can make an exception this time". What??? She was serious too! That irked me a bit andi thought it was an odd thing to say.  If you don't have a gf bread option what's the big deal? 

Our server came by after a while and took our drink order then went back to the bar. It took forever.  Then she took our cold tapas order.  The pacing was so slow so we ordered another drink.  I realized after she was gone a while that she was making drinks for all of her tables behind the bar... while the hostess stood around doing nothing.  Not pre-bussing. Not filling water.  Nor helping bartend. I'm giving 3 stars because the cold apps were delicious. 
After cold apps were done it was 8pm and we had been there over an hr having yet to order hot tapas . We asked for our check, told her it was taking too long, got in the car and got a couple of chik fill a's from Lombard on the way home.  Now that's a 5 star place!

My family has been a fan of Emilio's for over ten years and we consistently come back here for any type of special occasion within our family. There is a reason for this as every part of the experience is outstanding. The staff is friendly and timely in their service, the food is 5-star and fresh as can be and the restaurant is full of all local Spanish artistry. 

I also love that the portions of the items you can order are so small so you can try several things without filling up so quick! I always recommend this place to everyone I know looking for something different and looking forward to going back soon

Kind of like Americanized tapas restaurant.  All of the tapas were fineï¼but none outstanding.  The potato salad was da bomb.  The beef tapas was a little meh...
We got the seafood paella, portion was generous, rice was not mushy, exactly the way I like it.
Service was quick and nice.

More of 3.5 stars since nothing stood out except the potato salad.

Selection was overwhelming, but the dinner specials menu offered just enough options to give a choice without overwhelming.

Ambiance was quiet enough for normal conversation, and lighting was low. White table clothes (with white paper covers) and attractive place settings lend a refined feel. Dress was casual--more towards business causal than T-shirt and shorts, however!

Service was excellent--empty dishes were instantly cleared, and at no time was our conversation abruptly interrupted by a server. The courses came out at a good pace--bread, cold tapas, hot tapas, desert.

My coworker and I shared 6 tapas (3 cold, 3 hot), and we each had our own dessert. Honestly, this amount would have fed three, but was just right for two hungry men.

No two tapas were remotely similar--the variety was truly wide-ranging.

The Spanish Tuna Salad over avocado was a surprising standout among cold tapas--topped with a hint of lemon and a large shrimp, it made a flavorful mouthful from ingredients I wouldn't have imagined in the same meal, let alone the same dish.

The roasted salmon over artichokes was another standout--this one among the hot tapas. I would have this for the salmon alone, but a bit or two of artichoke was definitely complementary. Fish was crisp on the outside and moist in the inside, and crusted with a very mildly spicy rub.

Finally, the flan was the genuine article, flavorful and sweet without overwhelming the tastebuds with excess sugar.

A gem of a restaurant, and on a Thursday evening the place was buzzing, but not so busy we had to wait for a table.

Welp what can I say... The hype is real ..... 
Damn... This place rocks!!!

Decor service food --- amazing !!!

I'm so happy we found a restaurant that's worth the trip....

We were seated right away by the hostess -- love the Spanish wall decal..... Mosaic tiles... Colorful pottery... Lots of Spanish mauresque style dish.... Love love love it....

Service was awesome.... Luz, our server... Was friendly and gave us lots of recommendations ...

We started with a Tapas Frias ( cold tapa appetizer )

Cecina de vanado $10.50 -- lightly smoked venison w cranberries manchengo cheese cherries 5/5

This is delicious... It's carpaccio style.. Refreshing and no game-y taste at all...

Then we got a couple of Tapas Calientes ( hot appetizer )

Queso de Cabra Al Horno $8.95 -- baked goat cheese 4/5 ... We love different kinds of cheese... Goat cheese is one of our favorites ... Baked goat cheese is just a whole upscale level

Caracoles Emilio $7.95 -- escargot on croutons 4/5...
Tad bit salty for my taste but definitely tasty

Datiles con Tocino $7.95 -- dates wrapped in bacon 
5/5.... Anything with bacon is good right?!

Paella a La Mariscos $19.95 -- seafood 5/5.... Anything that's flavorful without being salty is impressive to me... 

Btw... This needs to be pre ordered... Takes 30 mins to cook -- perfect timing though.... If you order maybe 4-5 small plates before expecting this dish to be served....

For some odd reason .... The timing of all the plates were served perfect timing... We were not rushed at all....

Then we ordered Delicia de tres satires $7.50 ... Three layered chocolate mouse of some sort with raspberry sauce on the side --- light and decadent 4/5

Cappuccino was good with this dessert...

Our bill was $103.... With a Castillo de Monjardin wine bottle --- not pricey at all... 

Noticed that 95% of their guests are Caucasians .....  We were the only minority.... Me being Asian and my BF being black ( half Italian )....

Very interesting .... We do not go to Hillside much... Don't know the demographics ... Just an observation though .... Everyone was friendly here --- both the servers, managers and guests....

I cannot wait to try everything else... Will be back!!

Cozy little spot. I'm definitely an extrovert so I love the layout of the dining room. The food was pretty yummy too. I'm into smaller portions to have a smorgasbord of tasty food. The server got the job done and made great suggestions.
Been around forever and never disappoints .Great food ,service and wine selection along with killer margaritas round out a delightful dining experience
Good cocktails, I've only had a few tapas but all were tasty and decently priced. Very good overall.
Awesome. We had goat cheese rolled in pecans, penne pasta, and chicken. All prepaped well. Mark, our server was great.
Spectacular place. Great staff who really helped us make great picks for our kids. Very busy place so plan ahead. Best tapas restaurant I've ever been to
Authentic Tapas, ample parking.  A lot of the items are similar to Meson Sabika in Naperville.
Love their food and the wonderful customer service. Tapas and sangria were very good! Nice family place!

Very nice atmosphere! The menu is satisfying and the staff is nice! 
Tried a few tapas and the chicken paella! It was good.
The only thing I would suggest to the owner is to make sure the meat is properly deboned and trimmed, as we stumbled upon a cartilage in our chicken croquettes.

My brother and i tried a Spanish tapas restaurant for a 2nd time but my parents and a friend of ours had their experience for the 1st time. It was an experience. Our waiter was friendly and very helpful to tell us what they have over there. From shrimp to clams, from patatas bravas to the halibut. Everything was good especially their paellas. I highly recommend the restaurant.

Loved it! 
Our first visit here and every moment was special: the atmosphere, outstanding service by Axel, food, decor. Wonderful options for food make it difficult to save space for dessert. Loved figs in bacon, flan, even coffee tasted great. We'll definitely be coming back.
Excellent menu for the value. Very original creations. Grilled octopus was excellent. Shitty locale. Would attract more people if located in LaGrange or Hinsdale.

Thanks Yelp for another incredible find.  Had some of the best black bean soup I have ever had and an amazing seafood dish called Pincho Marisco.  Reasonably priced, nice setting, and attentive service.  5 stars!!!

The restaurant was very good.  The food was served fresh as it was made and every plate was delightful.  There are many choices to pick from and such a variety that it would be easy for people with dietary restrictions to eat from.  The price was great and well worth it.  It was  Friday night and there was a band playing, it wasn't too loud for the restaurant and the noise wasn't overpowering. The ambience was great, although there was a band, there weren't people dancing or going nuts.  It was very chill. The service wasn't too bad.  It was a tad slow, but it was busy. She was kind and very helpful to answer any question we had.  I went with some friends and I will go back and bring my significant other there.

Grilled Calamari, Garlic potato salad, and dates with bacon, we're all outstanding. This is an excellent tapas menu. We had seven or eight of the small plates including dessert. Each one was a pleasant surprise with only the meat balls being slightly bland. However they went down smoothly with a pitcher of red sangria. Wait staff was prompt and courteous. A definite return visit is in order.

The standouts were the bacon wrapped dates, goat cheese and lamb chops. We also all shared a 3-person order of paella that was savory and delicious, plenty of food after sharing the smaller dishes.

I would highly recommend getting a diversity of tapas and possibly not doing the entrees.

The food was decent. I've been to other Spanish tapas restaurants and I was excited to try this one but I was a little disappointed. The paella was good. Igot a free bottle of wine & Emilio offers cooking classes so I thought that was cool.

Another fine meal last night at our favorite suburban tapas restaurant.  Been here many times over the 25 years they've been open.  We and have usually just gotten a tapas assortment,  the aioli potato salad,  beef brochette and escargot Emilio being Repeat favorites. 
Tried the paella Valencia last night.  It was quite good featuring chicken,  shrimp and some very large mussels.
We sat in their outdoor patio and there was live music,  something we didn't recall evr seeing before. Two musicians who go by the name Montage played a great assortment of Spanish flamenco and other styles.  We'll try to get back soon on a Friday just to hear those guys.

Fantastic friendly restaurant with a cool vibe. The octopus, calamari, bacon-wrapped dates, and goat cheese spread are all delicious faves of ours. Try to come every time I'm in town! Very friendly, knowledgeable service. Always look forward to my visits.

My husband rated this place before, the food is amazing. 

Queso De Cabra Al Horno was my favorite, that'll be the first thing I order when I go back. I wish they had a better beer selection.
Great Place and great food, you can honestly do not go wrong with this place.. great suburb restaurant to go to.

We have been to Emilio's downtown location couple times and this was our first time in Hillside location. 
Our server tried her level best to make sure it went well but not upto the level of service you would want. 
A table which sits 4 people was fairly small and hard to keep more than one dish. 
The patata bravas was one of the worst...we have tried tapas at lot of restaurants and also in Spain and this was not even close to any of them. I give it a -5 points for this dish.
The other dishes were fairly okay not great. 
The paella ordered by our server was the wrong and she came in and told us it will be 15 more min to get the correct one.
At the end the check was messed up too, she charged us for the wrong paella luckily we checked and realized. 
Overall not worth going again!!

Great place for tapas in the burbs.   Seating was plentiful and the tapas are so tasty.   The ones that stood out for me include the PATATAS CON ALIOLI (love the garlic taste throughout), TOMATE CON QUESO Y ALBAHACA (loved the fresh mozzarella pieces), CHAMPIÃONES RELLENOS (big mushroom lover here), and GAMBAS A LA PLANCHA (tasty grilled shrimp with lemon sauce).

The sangria was okay but I've had better.

Look forward to going back again.
Nice place to visit after the zoo.  Outdoor seating goes into a parking lot and you hear lots of street traffic.  Food is good but Tapas Gitana in Northfield is the best!!

So good!  I was am very fortunate to have an amazing family that loves food as much as I do.  My cousins drove in from the city to take me out, one snowy Saturday night.  Luckily they made a reservation.  The place was still busy at 8:45pm, but it was the day after Valentine's.  

1. QUESO DE CABRA AL HORNO - baked goat cheese in tomato sauce w/ garlic bread
2. PATATAS CON ALIOLI - potato salad was way TOO GARLICKY...you know when it's actually spicy, so there's no way anyone would even consider kissing you?
3. DÃTILES CON TOCINO - dates wrapped in bacon.  I'm usually not a huge fan of dates EVER, but these were AMAZING!  Sweet dates - crispy outside and soft inside and crispy, salty bacon that are accompanied by a perfect sauce.  
4. PAELLA A LA MARISCOS (for 2) - **This was ordered first, since it takes 30 minutes to make.  Worth the Wait!  Loved the seafood.  It was really unfortunate, the three of us were pretty full when the paella arrived.  I wished I had saved room for more.  

The sangria was disappointing.  3- 2oz. tastings for 10.95?  not worth it.  I've had sangrias all over the country.  The ones I tried were how to put it??...boring.  I had the red, white, and raspberry - all simplistic and one-dimensional.

Been going here since it opened. Very good food, the potato salad is fabulous. I would give it 5 stars, but the red sangria, although very good, is not quite as it used to be. If you want to enjoy a variety of tastes, to share, this is the place.
This place was very friendly and their food is delicious they also carry a variety of wines .

Great food, but our server was slow and not helpful.  Actually read Yelp reviews vs asking the waitress.  Dates were great as well as the soft shell crab.  I really likes the goat cheese.  Ribs and flan were ok.

I really enjoyed this place. Perhaps it was a combination of the company, food and the patio. Either way, I'm sure they'll take their 5 stars any way they can get it. 

 I'll start by saying the menu is humongous. There are way too many items to choose from. Seems like we spent 15 minutes reading the menu like you were trying to find the answer to the teacher's question before everyone else did. If you did not participate on class, just play along. ....We almost fell into the trap of ordering way too many because everything sounded so good. It's a relief that we narrowed it down as not to ruin the rest of our evening with stomachs tight enough to pop. 

Friday night dinner date. We arrived around 8p and the place was packed. There was a ten minute wait or immediate seating available at the bar or on the patio. We chose the covered patio and hoped for no drizzles. After all, the forecasters could be right some of the time. 

The weather was ideal and the soft music piping through the outside speakers was a real treat.

Here's our list: 
Traditional Paella = 4 stars
Chicken, chorizo & mushroom = 5 stars
Grape leaves w/ rice = 4 stars 
Tuna salad and avocado = 5 stars
 

You are given bread, butter and marinated mushrooms to start. I only tried the mushrooms and they were knock your socks off good.

This place is incredible! Every single time I eat here I am transported. As a celiac disease sufferer, Emilio's Tapas is one of the very few restaurants I trust. Chef Emilio and his kitchen staff are well-versed on the ins and outs of proper preparation. Not to mention the fact that chef Emilio has always used premium ingredients for all his INCREDIBLE recipes!

Recommended dishes include the bacon wrapped dates with heavenly red pepper sauce, patata con aioli (how do they do it?!) the charcuterie board (that Serrano ham! The olives! The Manchego cheese!) and oh yes, the beef croquettes. Not to mention whatever specials the chef recommends AND the sangria. OH, also, they have the best tawny port I've had in my life there. 

I can't recommend Emilio's Tapas enough!
