It is incredibly redundant to craft a glowing review of a place that already has a stellar reputation so I'll keep everything short and sweet.

My wife and I decided to come over to Emilio's about a month ago. I've lived in the area my entire life yet have never decided to stop in. Thanks to Yelp we saw the positive reviews and decided to give it a shot. We were seated instantly on a Thursday night by a polite hostess. The wait staff was great - the explained the menu and gave great recommendations. 

Not only is the food gah damn fantastic but it is priced fairly. The biggest problem I find is that you just want to gorge yourself when you look at the menu because everything looks good - and frankly you don't have to because I feel the portions are generous - even for tapas. 

If you're on the fence about it, just cross on over. It's a great experience that I would highly recommend. As far as I'm concerned they have my patronage for life.

I'd go with about 4.5 stars here.  It's a quaint, colorful place for tapas. They have a couple of colorful dining areas and service was quick and efficient.  They have the full selection of tapas you might expect.  I thought the paella was a bit pricey though at $18.95 per person, but the serving size is quite large.  A serving for one could easily serve 2-3.  It's a fun place for a social outing.
Loved the goat cheese!! Everything else was great too, especially the profiteroles.

This family owned gem should be enjoyed by all
EMILIO and family are always there making sure your meal experience will be remembered
My family and I have been eating there for over 20 years
Whatever the occasion special or just hungry there variety is authentic
And vast -if you have menu questions the wait staff are always glad to explain in detail  your meal choice questions - the menu changes so when u arrive there may be a welcome surprise
That may not have been on the menu at your last visit
Although they do get very crowded thankfully they do take reservations and we have always been seated on time 
I am sure if you try them u will be back again and again

It is nice to know if you don't feel like messing with traffic there is a tapas place in west burbs. They have alot of favor sangria and the peach was pretty good, I just wish their was more fruit in it as it looked more like a garnish.  My favorite was the tomato and goat as it was creamy and I like the olives if you wanted it a little saltier, also they gave you a good portion of goat cheese.  My next favorite was the grilled calamari, cooked to perfection and lightly season. You can't go wrong with bacon wrapped dated but I wasn't a fan of the potatoes bravo, a little mushy but good favor. The least favorite and I probably would not order it again was the lam chop, it had a strong gamey odor and favor so that ended my taste for lamb for several months.

it  is worth the drive for the garlic potato salad alone.

On our last visit we had sandwiches - One ham, one beef - and they were delicious.  We tried not to fill up on the bread but with little success.  We shared the olives and loved the complimentary bruchetta.

I wish the Chicago location had not moved to such an inconvienient location because we would go there much more often.

The patio is lovely.  I am really going to make an effort to get to Emillio's more often because the food is wonderful.

Best Tapas I've found in the south west suburbs.

The good:
I feel like at a Tapas restaurant is when reviews come most in handy since you're buying several items some of them are bound to be great and some not to your liking. My favorites were the warm tapas on the specials menu; Lamb Chops and Goat Cheese on Eggplant. The Lamb Chops had good fat marbelization that made it especially tender and juicy. I really like the combination of goat cheese and eggplant because they are both so soft. The orange sauce they put around it is delicious!

Could have been better:
There were a few tapas that were not so great either. I was not a big fan of the bruschetta served on a yellow tomato although it would have been better at the start of the tapas rather than after all our meats. I liked the cold tapas Serrano Ham and Manchego Cheese but thought it was a bit much for $16.
Although the marinated octopus was good I felt like the veggies and sauce around detracted from its flavor.

I am not a big fan of the dÃ©cor although I don't' think it detracted from our experience, it reminds me of the wild style at Bucca di Beppo.

Desert:
I'm really into chocolate and thought the chocolate raspberry dessert was to die for. The chocolate is fluffy like a mouse and goes well with the raspberry puree around it.

Overall great place will definitely be back again.
Had the best waitress ever! Julene was so super sweet! The food and Sangria was so good! a must try!

When we're in the mood for tapas - this is our favorite restaurant. Service is always great and willing to offer suggestions or explain a dish. They never hurry us along. Great place to meet friends and catch up over good food and very good Sangria!
Emilio's is just fantastic. That's all I can say. Try Sangria and anything on the menu and you will be pleased.

Great food even better service. 

My mango sangria was awesome.

Our tapas were all tasty. 

10/10 would come here again.

I moved out to Hillside 10 years ago and finally got a chance to eat there on a spur of a moment a while ago. The place always looks like it's closed but the place was packed when I went (it was valentines day). 

The ambiance was romantic, the food was excellent, and the service was fine. But, as always...tapas are always known to be kind of expensive so this would be a more of special occasion type of place for me.
This is the best place to go, only a little frustrating as they did not have the tuna canneloni and state it is because the pasta is flown in.  That is one of their signature dishes.

I have been coming to Emilios since I was a little kid with my parents. This restaurant is really wonderful! The staff is consistently friendly and accommodating. The drinks are always perfect (especially the sangria!). And the food is fresh and delicious. Highly recommend for a delicious dinner.

It was nice portions were small and a bit pricey I thought.  Our server Alfredo was standing,  patiently waiting to serve us. I had asked about the wine list and he said no you want to order from this list here they are all 50% off tonight.   Well later on after we had enjoyed ordering several small entrÃ©es we decided to get another bottle of wine. When he brought it back to the table he said you do know this and the last bottle are $32 per bottle.  Right then I realized we were mislead. The price on the menu was originally $32, according to his statement they should have been $16 per bottle, mind you we found those bottles available for $7.99.
That was really the only thing that ruined my night. I left there feeling I was taken advantage of. :(
Great food, great service and great atmosphere!!!!  You must try the garlic potato salad,bacon wrapped figs and the flank steak with potatoes yum!!!!

I've been here a couple of times on my way through Chicago and have liked the food.  Definitely worth checking out if you are nearby.  They also have branches on East Ohio and in Lincoln park but I haven't tried those spots.
Great sangria. Great service. Beautiful restaurant. Everything I ever ordered from the menu was excellent.

Nostalgia may be fueling my stars.
I love Emilio's.
I love the decor.
I love the sangria.
I love the bar.
I love the tapas.
I love getting blotto on sangria at the bar while eating the tapas on a quite Saturday afternoon.
And finally, I love the banana dessert.
Oh, and I love that the staff makes fun of the drunk blond girls at the bar sharing the very phallic banana dessert covered in nuts and caramel with a dollop of ice cream on either side of the banana. 
Well played kitchen staff, well played.
I happily play into stereotypes for a good laugh.
Cheers Emilio. 
See you Saturday.

I love Emilio's!
This place is a neighborhood gem. I've eaten here eight times and everything I ate was fresh and delicious. Not only is the food great, the fact that the owner(Emilio) will walk around to tables and introduce himself and ask you about your dining experience makes this a five star. My number one place for spanish tapas!
Outstanding on every level. Service...food...atmosphere. Looking forward to coming back to try some different dishes. Highly recommended.

Went hear back in 2007 and was not impressed. In fact, my wife had food poisoning from the bad ground beef dish. I doubt there will be a second try.

Thank god for Iberico & Barcelona

This place is so amazing food, staff and atmosphere. I had a salmon because their recommendation. One of the best simple dish with a great source and side. Will have to come back here to try other dishes. 
Don't forget to order their desert!

Great food and customer service, cultured ambience. My group tried everything on the menu, including the on-the-house tapas from the manager and Chef Emilio. My wife and mother in law, said the sangria's were ok. My daughter enjoyed the chicken skewers, and chicken croquetas. I enjoyed the datiles con tocino. 

A must go restaurant.
Great find if u don't want to drive up to the city. Food is authentic and ambience great

You can't go wrong with Emilio's! Wonderful, classy, cozy establishment. Good vibe inside. The staff is friendly and helpful, and they know what they are talking about. We like to ask their preferences. Sangria is tasty, and the tapas selection is broad. One of my favorites is the Pinche de Pollo al Mojo (chicken with a garlic & cumin sauce). Simple and delicious. You could dip your shoe into the garlic cumin sauce and it would be delicious. Last time we tried a dish that may have been on their features menu - it was similar to chicken piccata and was absolutely divine. The potatoes that came with the dish melted in our mouths. I hope that this is a dish that is there again when we go back. I'd also really like to try their paella. 

We try a range of dishes and are impressed every time. The first time we visited Emilio's we had a fruit flan for dessert and it was so good I wanted to order a second. Freakin' wonderful. 

Prices are decent for the amazing quality, in my opinion. We go for dinner and will order five or six dishes to share and are stuffed when we leave. Such a fun way to have dinner, too =)

We have been going for years. The food is always exceptional. the Prix fixe menu is a bargain when it's available in the winter. Best food for miles around. Lovely setting for a business lunch or intimate dinner.

Like most folks, I don't look forward to grocery shopping.   I have, however, found an exception; shopping at Mariano's.  

What makes the  experience different?  I'll start with the physical space.   Mariano's is open and inviting.   There is something about walking in the main entrance that makes you aware of all the exiting options that lay ahead, depending on which direction your fee carry you.  If you are lucky you will be greeted by an employee offering you a sample of their famous fresh squeezed orange juice.  They are wisee to do this; it is practically inhuman to take a sip and not follow it up by tossing a container or two into your cart.   

Are you hungry right now?  They say never shop on an empty stomach.   No problem.   You have your pick...fresh salad bar, hamburgers and other meats made to order, enticing baked goods, a sushi bar, freshly made smoothies...the list goes on.  Help yourself and choose where you would like to munch .  My favorite is the atrium reminiscent of the  tropical dining area at navy pier. 

Marianos is set up to please today's eating culture.  It offers many partially or fully made dinner options at fair prices.   The employers all genuinely seem to be happy to be there and help you out.   They are knowledgeable about the products in their area.   

Obviously, I could go on amd on singing their praises.   Instead, I  encourage you to indulge in the experience yourself.   I'm guessing you will be hooked, too.

Duh. It's Mariano's; the place that has had every grocery store in the area shaking in their boots while the new location was under construction. The place with the ridiculously legit food court, a trail mix station, a guac station, an oyster bar, and the second snobbiest cheese area I have ever seen (shout out to Standard Market for the cheese cave!) 

It's Mariano's; the place that has all of these awesome (and questionably useful) amenities yet still manages to have comparable prices to the Jewels of the world (still hate you, Jewel!!) The staff is always friendly. The LaCroix displays are impressive. The popcorn is good. The fresh juice is verrrrry good. 

Just go! Drink a beer and throw back an oyster for me when you do.

Well. It seems as if my cross-contamination issue has been taken care of. I noticed people were MUCH more cautious with this issue. Team Members seem more attentive to the hot bar & grill areas as it relates to this subject. 

As for the rest:
1. Cheese selection is fantastic.
2. BIG fan of the Sicilian pizza. It's almost a cousin to the deep dish but different crust. 
3. Nice spot to get peppers (hot in particular). Some places are somewhat beat up, not here. 
4. The brisket and (in particular) the sauces are also good. I don't think other grocery stores can come close to this. Same with the pizza.
5. MAYBE beef up the staff (e.g., more bodies) working in the deli during peak times. This may help with the longer waiting times but it's about the same wherever you may go. 

No place is perfect, but this works for me. Great selection and a good flow to the place. A keeper for me.

Hurrah, Naperville finally has its own Mariano's!

If you're familiar with the Wheaton store the layout will look somewhat recognizable to you, with a few additions: the Naperville location also has an oyster bar, wine bar and spice market (it seems a little weird that open baskets of rice and quinoa are just sitting out; the spices are in big open dishes but are covered by a salad bar sneeze guard kind of thing from the general open air). Like Wheaton, there's sushi, BBQ, a smoothie stand, and gelato.

It's a testament to the functionality of the store's traffic flow pattern that on today, the first day when it was mobbed with people, it was still fairly easy to maneuver around and we were never completely stymied or bottlenecked, even in places where vendors were giving out samples and taking up space with tables. 

I previously shopped in the Wheaton and Aurora stores, and this location seems to be consistent with brands (among other things, I was glad to find Vernors ginger ale by the case [vs. 2 liter] here: Wheaton stopped carrying it, but Aurora still has it). I particularly like Mariano's for meat and indeed bought a chuck roast today, and their bakery is also top-notch (try the all-butter chocolate chip cookies!)

Service was a little harried today, which isn't surprising as it was pretty crazy; in her haste, the clerk who checked me out forgot to run my coupons (which ended up being a couple of dollars). But the customer service desk was able to painlessly do a refund for a simple solution. (Still, be mindful...) Overall, though, they really were on top of things: staff was everywhere, even the Executive Chef!

Another big plus to this location: parking is SO much better than Wheaton or Aurora!! 

Well, I know already that I will be here all the time. See if you agree with me! Welcome to Naperville, Mariano's!!

Had to update my review from my experience yesterday. Stopped at the oyster bar to have the lunch special of oysters, shrimp, crab claws and lobster bisque or clam chowder soup for $13. This is my third time at the oyster bar and every time John has been at the bar shucking oysters for me. He's always friendly, knowledgeable of his products and I always receive service with a smile.  The midnight bay oysters I had were large and creamy, the shrimp were huge and the lobster bisque tasty. It's so nice that my Mariano's offers this amenity and John is certainly an asset to the store!

They have nice fresh produce here, including a section on organics. Small selection of bulk goods. There is a bar inside! How crazy is that? Also a counter to order sandwiches and other cooked foods. The fresh fish area smells funny to me, haven't tried any b/c of that. Large meat selection, an area for fancy cheeses. And then aisles with normal grocery stuff. Small selection of exotic meats, venison, etc. 
What I find wasteful is that they knocked down a larger store to put up a smaller store.
But I like this place.
This is a review for the awesome shopkins cupcake cake that the bakery did for my daughters 6th birthday! And only $25 for 24 cupcakes!! She said "mom, this cake is too pretty to eat"

Pluses: Mariano's has a great selection of hard to find items, and the people in the various departments are super-helpful. For example, someone was checking the stock of the cheese in that department and when I was wondering if they had a particular kind, she immediately wrote it down so they could order it. They have all kinds of interesting little departments and places to eat and drink, including a nice bar. Need olive oil? I've NEVER seen this many kinds in one place.

Minuses: The meat department. I had to wait forever for them to bring out more ground chuck, although they were very nice about it. But I really feel like the staff in the meat department doesn't really know anything about meat. One tried to sell me some little fatty piece of brisket to add to my other piece so that I'd have enough poundage as requested. I would have had to throw that away. And today I paid about $15/pound for organic Scottish salmon. When I opened it to make it for dinner, it was obviously nowhere near fresh. Pee-yew. 
Other minuses: the store layout is weird, and you get trapped in the floral department. The international aisles require that you just go in and look because the signage in there isn't clear at all. Does "Pisa" mean that the Italian items are here? Not necessarily.
Biggest minus: price. I price check, and they are consistently a little or a lot higher than other places.

Why do I come here? Convenience. When I am in the area, or short on time, I'll go to Mariano's rather than make separate runs to Trader Joe's + Fresh Thyme + Casey's + Target. All those other stores beat Mariano's hands down for various items. But sometimes, you just don't have time to run all around! Plus grocery shopping isn't entertainment for me; I'd like to get my things and get out.

I really like this place!  Great selection of quality produce, meats, etc. Quality on par with Costco without the need to stock the freezer every time we shop.  This place has changed our shopping habits already.  I hope they continue to provide the level of selection and quality going forward.  We're in.

They also have salad bar, hot bar, bbq and grill court, oyster bar, and a wine bar.  Plan to try them in the coming weeks.  

Tried the hot bar.  Not bad.  Had mostly fried cod.  It was very good (hard to find a decent fried fish these days.  This was as good as most restaurant fish offerings.  If there IS a good one somewhere, please tell me about it).  Also good were the mac and cheese and roasted brussel sprouts.  They did not have malt vinegar for the fish@  Seriously?

Mariano's brings a breath of fresh air to grocery stores in the area. And lots of competition too. Since Mariano's has opened, I've noticed that other nearby chains have stepped up their game to compete, offering sushi, fresh squeezed orange juice in almost the same exact bottle with label, hot foods bars with similar items, etc, etc, etc...

So Mariano's is great for the neighborhood. But what I like best about Mariano's is the warm fresh ambiance that sets it apart from the typical chain. My favorites are the 3 flavored popcorn that they sell near the fresh breads, the salad bar where I load up on various toppings, and the rotisserie chicken that is tasty like no other.

The employees are generally efficient but I have found them to be a bit impersonal and standoffish, and the prices are a bit high. However, I enjoy shopping here and I'm glad to have another option in the neighborhood!

I have to say that this is my favorite Mariano's. Definitely my go to grocery store.  Big wide isles, very organized, clean, friendly, huge selection... love love love this store!  They have the healthy Whole Foods items for much less AND have things like Cheetos and Jiffy peanut butter.  No need to stop at two stores to shop trying to make an entire family of six happy. They have everything!  The staff is extremely friendly and have always gone above and beyond.  Deli, produce, salad bar, soup bar, coffee shop, smoothie bar, oyster bar, alcoholic  beverage bar (yes, you can have a beer while you shop if that's your thing), imported cheese department, the butcher department, bakery, health and supplements, everything is top notch! Even the other customers are awesome!!!  If you haven't been, you need to go.  The one in Mokena/Frankfort is also a nice one.  They are all not the same though, so don't let one location turn you off to the others.

Please don't slip to a 3 star #MyMarianos. Training your staff to be better listeners and attentive seems to be a weakness. I hope you don't slip to Jewel's standards. Perhaps you're still bringing in new people? Please get some qualified people in Todd's BBQ.

This location used to be my go-to grocery store when it was Dominicks.  While I'm glad to see Dominicks gone and Mariano's take it's place, I'm only giving this store a 3-star rating for the time being.  They really need to work some kinks out of the service before I give them any more.

The good: brand-new store built from the ground up.  They hired lots of really good employees- I find the checkout people to be really friendly and quick.  There's a huge selection of everything, and the store layout is like every other Mariano's.  The popcorn stand and the cheese "cave" are definitely the two best parts of the store.

The OK: the produce section is really well-stocked.  I have found frequently that produce I buy here goes bad after only one or two days.  This is not acceptable.  I don't have this issue with the Wheaton or Westchester stores, but I have also found that Aurora's store has this issue.  Why?  Prepared foods are average, sometimes they are lacking both variety and quality.  I have gotten to the point that I rarely eat here anymore since the quality is hit-or-miss.

The bad: the deli.  There's never less than a 10 person wait.  It's like going to the freaking DMV.  I think they need to really train the people at the deli counter to work a little quicker or something.  It's beyond annoying.

Overall this store is a huge step-up from Dominicks and it's definitely better than any Jewel, but they shouldn't rest of the laurels of their reputation.  The other Mariano's in the area (Wheaton, Westchester, and Elmhurst) are better.

The guys over at 'Todd's BBQ' are in absolutely no rush to attend to customers waiting in line. Of the half dozen times I've been here there was just one associate behind the counter who couldn't be bothered to even pretend to move faster than at a snail's pace. I've come back several times (both on and off busy hours) with no perceivable change in service. Not once were my long wait times (10 minutes plus) ever acknowledged. Most likely will not be giving this store any more chances.

Tried this place Todds BBQ inside the store 3 times now and all 3 times the experience was infuriating, The food is not the problem it's pretty damn good, but the people working there must of come from Dickies BBQ where they are also clueless.

Biggest complaint was ordering a LB of brisket and getting a 1/2 of brisket and a 1/2 lb of sliced fat , I literally had 1 piece that was 90% solid fat., The person who made it had no care what she was giving me.  She also shorted me 1 side and I had to repeat my order 3-4 times.

This place like Dickies is poorly managed, which is too bad since it's hard to find good BBQ brisket in the burbs.

We've been very eagerly waiting for this store to open for what seems like forever. I clearly remember the day that the Dominick's on that corner closed, just after Christmas, in 2013. It was predictable, as the lot had been nearly empty for many years. The service and prices at Dominick's were consistently deplorable! The parent company had lost their way in understanding Midwesterners.

It has seemed like every other suburb, from 2010 to now, was getting a Mariano's, except for Naperville, which perplexed me immensely. The first Mariano's that I visited was the one on North York Road in Elmhurst. I knew right away that Naperville needed one.

So, to this location in Naperville, I went with my partner, late on grand opening day. It was kind of crazy, but no regrets. I am most familiar with the Wheaton Mariano's, which I like immensely. This store has a similar layout. The polished concrete floors are beautiful.

The staff was consistently helpful and courteous under the very busiest of conditions. The south end of the store, where the Todd's BBQ is located, was the most packed. They were giving away free stuff, and samples, left and right. The liquor department is incredible, as is the deli and just about everything else. Even on OPENING DAY, we did not have to wait in line to checkout! Trying doing that at a Jewel store! If a staff member catches your eye, they will ask if you need any help.

In many ways, it seems like Mariano's has managed to keep the prices of its offferings in the reach of the middle-of-the road customer, AND maintain an upscale, bright and diverse shopping environment. There are plenty of gluten-free choices. While it offers some of the amenities and the vibe of Whole Foods, it is not the least self-righteous like Whole Foods, neither is it pricey. You'll find products that contain Aspartame and extra caffeine right along with stuff that is more "natural" in its composition.

I think that it was most appropriate that Mariano's chose to tear down the old building rather than just convert it, as they have with some other properties.

Even if you are a diehard fan of Jewel-Osco, challenge yourself to step away from the one across South Naper Boulevard, even just once, and give the new place in town a chance.

(May 30, 2016) Since I wrote the first part of this review, I have been frequently utilizing the service whereby one can choose a meat or piece of fish, and then have it properly grilled at Todd's BBQ. So far, the results have been restaurant quality delicious and grocery store inexpensive. I've tried ribeye steak, seasoned salmon and burgers, and they have been grilled as desired. I can't wait to try more selections and to check out an alternate salmon selection. It's like getting quality restaurant food minus the big waits for a table, slow service, higher prices, ridiculous sales taxes on prepared food and guilt-driven tips for incompetent servers. Also, while the food is on the grill, it allows for time to shop for some tasty sides at the deli.

Went here during there grand opening and ordered myself sushi to go and it was horrible. 
1. Presentation was horrible 
2. Over priced 
3. Only couple pieces 
4. It wasn't that spicy for a spicy tuna. The taste wasn't bad but I expected better 

I rather just order sushi from a sushi place instead. It is not worth spending your money at Mariano's sushi place. 

This market is great but everything is overpriced in my opinion. If you afford spending a lot of $$ for groceries then go for it. The market is very clean and fresh. It is like another Whole Foods.

After much anticipation and great fanfare a new store has recently opened in Naperville. it is much grander than the previous Dominick's store that occupied that spot carrying a larger assortment of items.  One of its much admired offering is a wide variety of prepared foods than can be consumed right there in a food-court like setup.  Many families use it during lunch and dinner times instead of going to a restaurant.  

We were there on a Saturday evening (around 9 PM) for a dinner of fresh sushi and the salad bar.  We were sitting and enjoying our meal when at an adjacent table 2 couples started to have a very heated conversation, one particular person in that group was very belligerent using extremely profane language that was offensive to many.  It appears they had consumed at least  2 bottles of wine which they bought at the store which also provided them formal stemware to consume it in the store.  

Apparently, the store does not have any restrictions on where and how the alcohol is consumed incl. in the food court where many young children are also present.  There is no monitoring by the store of drinkers on how much alcohol is consumed.  We were not the only people disturbed by the presence of this table, while others decided to pick up their food and move elsewhere, we decided to bring the matter to the attention of one of the store managers (James) who offered to call their store security.  We left the store since we didn't want have showdown so I am not sure if any things was done, but this has left a really bad taste on our mouth about eating in the food court (one of the only bright spots in the store).

My first trip to any Mariano's.   Man was it packed - and for good reason.  Lots of choices for a meal on the go and don't  have to cook.

Plus a full grocery store.  Great produce selection, nice looking meats.  Delicious hot bar and soup bar and salad bar.   Great cheese section.

Several sampling stations.

Like a Whole Foods without exorbitant prices.  Very reasonable.  Will be heading back for sure

I kinda have a love hate relationship with this place.

Pros - Tons of choices for something to eat if you want to grab some dinner.  
-Food is usually good. 
-Good coupons in the mailer.  
-Really good deserts by the bakery (especially the cheesecake).

Cons -Stood at the sandwich counter for about 5 minutes wondering if I needed to take a number or stand somewhere else because no one was offering help.  
-The french? bread they use for sandwiches has a really strong taste that overpower anything and everything on the sandwich.  
-The 2 times I actually done shopped here (as opposed to just grabbing a quick something to eat) I waited about 5-10 minutes in line, and then they shut down the register I was waiting at due to technical difficulties.  Update: Make that 3 times.
-Managers take about 5 minutes to come ring up alcohol for the kids at the register. 
-And lastly the staff seems to have no clue what's in their circular.
-I saw a manager through a garbage bag on the ground right in a high traffic area.  I still can't fathom what she was thinking.

Nice grocery with all the standard fare plus extras including deli, grill, bar, oyster bar, prepared food areas.

This is a good alternative to Jewel across the street.  Most of the store is a standard grocery, formerly Dominick's.  If you like extras and a fancier environment, you will enjoy this store.  At the grill area, you can have items you buy in the store such as steaks, cooked to order while you wait.  There's a sushi bar, oyster bar, and wine/beer bar.

Ok really folks this place is amazing! Forget the fact it is a grocery store for a second where you buy all the typical stuff, there is a food court area and a bar! You can eat, drink, and then go grocery shopping all in the same building! Prices are fair. Why go anywhere else?

OMG I love you Marianos! Everything under one room and more. 4 weeks since grand opening and its still packed. Go during off hours if you can, Early morning or after dinner. I asked a women in the bakery 'do you make all your bread fresh'? She said 'we bake it here but all our dough comes from Italy' Holy Hell! 'faints' I still have more exploring to do but I had alot of fun along with alot of good deals.

This grocery store is amazing. They have literally everything, an oyster bar, fresh salad bar, sushi, smoothies, and the list goes on. By far my favorite part about this store is the grill. Buy some meat or fish, and they cook it for free at the grill! I shop while my meat is cooking and kill two birds with one stone. Also, the staff is super friendly and helpful - nobody ever seems grumpy here.

Mariano's is my favorite grocery store, but what is going on here the salad in the salad bar was all wilted this morning and there was no quinoa salads or spinach  blueberry salad, I left this morning with no salad for lunch I'm very disappointed I hold Mariano's to a higher standard

Thank God they finally opened this new Naperville store; we were starved for great produce that you can buy on Saturday and it is still good thru the next week! Love the meat/fish/chicken counters, so much variety. Always some good deals going on to plan dinner around. Bakery is great, breads, rolls, pastries, cupcakes, gorgeous cakes! 
Couldn't be happier!

I live in Bolingbrook and don't mind driving to this location in Naperville to get groceries and lunch. Keep up the good work! Great selection, clean store, and friendly employees. I will definitely be back again.

Very attractive store (laid out much better than the Wheaton store) and the prices (currently anyway) are much more shopper-friendly than the competition across the street. But I'm taking off points for the lack of self-check stations--like many people I know, when Jewel removed their self-checks, I switched to a competitor that wisely added more of them and that's now my go-to. I'd be tempted to switch to Mariano's if they installed them here.

I ordered a cooked shrimp cocktail platter on Friday afternoon for pick-up on Saturday at 3 pm. On Friday afternoon, I received a call that my platter was ready for pick-up. I called them to let them know that my order was for Saturday pick-up not Friday. They assured me that I would have a new fresh cocktail platter ready for me on Saturday--that I wouldn't be getting the one they made on Friday. I believed them. When I got  home on Saturday I noticed that the cardboard box said the pick up date was for Friday at 3 pm. So they lied & just gave me the day old one. I will not be shopping there any longer.

I'm a two minute drive from this location and was excited to have such a great chain opening up so close to home, but every experience I've had here has been negative. Although I was hoping for a greater selection of organic foods and the parking experience is quite frustrating, my major grievance surrounds the customer service. From being told that the store was closing ten minutes before its actual close time and then being ushered to the exit by a rude manager to having another rude manager treat an elder cashier who was ringing me up with utter disrespect, I've been shocked to find such a careless management staff in charge during a crucial time in a store's life cycle. All in all, I'm fine making the 15 minute drive to the Whole Foods on 75th if it means I get the parking, product, and service I'm looking for.

The prepared food is just ok. Salad bar average. Grocery store is full of a variety of standard, organic, and unique foods. Biggest complaint is the speakers for the announcements are directly over the eating area and it too loud. Announcements are made like every 2 minutes. Very difficult to have a conversation.

Was stranded in Oak Brook at a conference and desperately needed to get out of my hotel.   A fellow attendee suggested we cross the road to the mall and check out dining options.   I was immediately was attracted to the Pour House because, well, beer!

Entering, we were greeted by friendly hostesses and they let us know it would be about a 30 minute wait.  We went to the bar where a friendly bartender served us immediately.  There were 90 taps! 

A couple of seats opened up so we sat at the bar to eat.  We started with cheese curds and fried pickles. Both were great and the appetizer portions were substantial.   After another round of beers (including my Nitro Old Chub), my buddy had the duck reuben and I had the filet mignon sliders.   He raved about the duct and my sliders were excellent.

Service was friendly but unobtrusive all night.  They do a great job of training staff.   With a great selection of interesting beers, delicious food and terrific service, this is definitely a four star place!

I came here on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving for their Rare Beer tapping.

Our party of four all ordered Bourbon County Brand Barleywine. We received two pairs of very watered down (yet different) beers. The server realized that the bartenders weren't pouring the right beers and apparently couldn't keep things straight. Not great when you're pouring a $11 draft beer.

We did enjoy our food ---- smoked wings and mac and cheese!

Had check issues at the end where we charged for more beers than ordered. Too bad for an establishment that has such a promising tap list!

Worst night manager of ALL TIME! My coworker and I went there to eat and watch the cubs game. The place was crowded! Having joined a larger group, we sat down and ordered an appetizer.

Having finished our appetizer, we placed an order for dinner. During that time, the larger group left. Not soon after does the host come over and say "you guys need to leave, we need this table for a larger party."

Ok... I get it... it's a large table and only two of us remain. So we ask where we'll be reseated. She goes we don't have tables available, I'll go get the manager. The manager comes over and confirms that there are no tables available and we needed to leave the table.

So at this point, I'm thinking as a courtesy, she'd offer to pay for our appetizer or ask if she could box the food we just ordered and take it with us. NOPE! Not this women. She goes, of course you have to pay for the appetizer.

... if I had EVER asked a patron to leave their table, I would instantly pay for their $8 appetizer and offer them a drink at the bar while they waited for the next available seat. Sometimes it's the simplest things that go a long way. After that experience, i will never be eating their again.

POUR SOME LAGER ON ME

Ooohh, in the name of beer.  

If you can excuse the Def Leppard pun, perhaps you too can have a rockstar experience at this Oak Brook bar & restaurant.  Although it's not cheap by any means, it's far less likely to send you to the _poor_ house than the other nearby eateries (Perry's Steakhouse, Wildfire, Reel Club, Mon Ami Gabi, etc).

Meeting up fellow Brand Ambassador Olivia B for dinner one night, we sat 'al fresco' and were thrilled to find that the outdoor patio was very lively.  Several other tables were already enjoying beer flights and we quickly followed suit.  OTPH features beer flights (4 brews at 6oz each) that can be grouped together by type -- wheat ales, porters, fruit/sours, pilsners -- or you're free to create your own.

The coolest part isn't the serving caddy (which itself is admittedly cooler than a wooden paddle) but rather the customized printouts that accompany your beers.  So regardless of whether you order a preset flight or pick-and-choose, you'll get a paper that identifies each one in turn, along with a beer-related quote by Benjamin Franklin, a well documented drinker/genius inventor/founding father/notable pervert.

After catching up on all things Yelp, we placed an order for food.  A very short time later, our crab fondue arrived.  It consisted of jumbo lump crab, goat cheese, chives, breadcrumbs, and came with garlic crostini ($14).  Delicious and surprisingly filling, something I'd definitely order again on a future visit.

Not long after that the rest came out, to the tune of a wedge salad & chili for me and a turkey burger for O.  Alas, my eyes were bigger than my stomach, so the majority of the wedge salad ($8) + chili came home with me to be consumed the next day.  Even ~18 hours later, the lettuce was still of passable quality and the blue cheese was ample.  Came with house cured lardons, a fancy term for premium bacon cubes.

The "1871" chili ($8) was made with angus steak, pork, chipotle peppers, flavored with milk stout, topped with crÃ¨me fraiche and red onion relish, and served with a cornbread muffin!  It was an excellent value and totally delicious, something worth getting.

Unfortunately the good news ended there, as O's turkey burger had a piece of either plastic or bone in it which has a tendency to ruin one's appetite.  I felt bad for her (as did our attentive server, Elliot) so it got comped and came off of the final bill, which was the appropriate thing to do in this instance.  Aside from inedible bits of questionable origin, it came with mozzarella, avocado, cranberry chutney and fries ($12).

Bread = 4
Circuses = 4.5

I was impressed enough with the menu and atmosphere to warrant a return trip, and the beer flights were priced reasonably enough as to not break the bank.  Old Town Pour House is actually quite affordable if you order items to share, which is a great idea since the portions are sizeable.

So do you take your ale, 1 pint or 2??  Grab a bottle, mix it up!

I was about to walk into the Cheesecake factory when this place caught my eye so I walked over and tried it out. The staff was super nice, they had a great beer selection, veggie burger, fish n chips, etc. so I tried it.

They have a stunning patio, great decor, tons of TV'S, and prices were reasonable.

I ordered a New Holland Dragon's Milk and Fish n chips. When the food arrived i asked for extra tarter sauce and ketchup but the guy never came back and it took a while before my server came back for me to ask her for it.

The actual fish n chips came together in a small basket and looked more like cheese fingers. I also waited a hell of a long time for the bill.

All and all, be prepared to wait, the fish n chips and service were a bust but the beer was good.

I sat at the bar and Joe hooked me up with some samples from the many taps they have. The selection is varied and great. They have many local beets as well as some from out west (CO and OR).  Service and selection were awesome. 
I had read that the food wasn't so great but mine was. I had a grilled cheese with brisket and fries and it was delicious. I would frequent this place if I lived here.

Great beer selection and perfect for watching Sunday football!   Their bloody Mary's are awesome and provide a skewer full of yummy treats on top.   They offer very friendly service and a cool atmosphere !

This was the perfect place to meet friends for dinner and chit chat! 

Environment- Both indoor and outdoor seating available. We had the chance to sit outdoors on the patio. The weather was perfect! You can even view the TV outdoors.

Food - Between us girls, we started off with White Bean Hummus and Firecracker Rolls. Both were plentiful! That was followed by dinner- fish tacos. The tacos were amazing! A little spicy! It is paired with Spanish rice. The night was topped of with Butterscotch Bread Pudding. This desert was big enough to share with a few people.

Overall we had a great time. The staff was wonderful! It definitely is a place to just to relax and have a good time.

My friend and I had an hour before our movie started so we stopped by Pour House to grab a drink and a bite before the movies. We got seated right away on a rainy Friday night.

Between the two of us, we ordered the duck confit nachos and the BBQ chicken flatbread for appetizers. The drinks came out immediately and the food came out shortly after. The BBQ chicken flatbread was a bit too sweet and not much BBQ flavor. I grew to like it towards the end. The duck confit nachos were not that good. I enjoyed the duck but overall, the combination of the nachos and duck did not taste that good.

Service was friendly and fast. Our waiter was very attentive. The ambiance was mellow and not too loud so I was able to converse easily with my friend.

Good place to have a big party or an intimate date!

Went for lunch, was a little wary d/t only 3/5  stars even tho my wife found higher ratings on another site. I would come back just for the duck nachos and squash soup. Bacon cheeseburger was also excellent and cooked appropriately to order. Good wait staff, environment quiet enough to converse easily (place was ~30% full), this is a place i would come back to watch a game. Good selection of beers (as one should hope given their name). Prices decent, comparable to the surrounding restaurants.

Good place for a beer and apps. Large selection of craft brews in a very roomy environment. Service is fast and friendly and get a work day lunch in well under an hour. 

Loved the seasonal beer selections and the buffalo shrimp with blue cheese. I also had had the Cesar salad with salmon was good too. A little over priced for what U get but on par for the area.

We were here last Friday, it was our 5th anniversary and I lined up a couple of things for myself and hubby. Hubby loves beer! After reading a couple of reviews i decided to book our reservation and it was a good decision. We didn't order any entrees as we were still full from breakfast. I did have one of their appetizers, it was hummus and I like it. Hubby on the other hand was like a little boy in a toy store... it was 90 beers + a selection of limited/seasonal beer!!! He likes Hercules and another beer whose name I couldn't remember. Definitely coming back and will try their burgers and other beers. Place overall was nice, the huge TV was great especially on a sports night.

Hello again Yelp! Life has finally slowed down enough for me to write reviews once again :) came out to Pour House for a little family send off. First of all, kudos to them for handling a party of 20 on a Saturday night! Our server was great, offering great suggestions and was pretty knowledgeable about the cider menu. Personally I would have liked 2 servers since it took him a while to get through 20 orders while still taking care of another table or two, but again he did well!

I started off with a short pour of the Original Sin Cider. I appreciate that they have short pours of all their beers! This one was a great suggestion from our server, with a nice crisp green apple flavor. Ended up also trying sister's peace cider, which really tasted like biting into a ripe peach!

The table ended up ordering quite a few appetizers and starters:

Pretzel bites: pretty good bites....pretzels were soft and you could really taste the IPA in the sauce

Cheese curds: if you're looking for your good ol Wisconsin cheese curds, you will be disappointed. I think they should rename these as cheese fritters, to be more accurate. Delish....yes. Sadly, squeaky cheese curds they are not:(

1871 chili: ok....by FAR the best chili I've had in a long time! This is a true Texas chili....aka NO BEANS! The addition of the creme fraiche is delish!

Short ribs: I had a hard time picking my dinner, but our server gave me great suggestions on everything I was considering. The short ribs were definitely the stick-to-your-ribs meal I was looking for since it was chilly today. The ribs were pretty tender, although a little dry on the outside. The bacon tomato jam was a good accompaniment to the beef, and it came with a pretty tasty au jus gravy which I'm glad I got on the side. The star of the meal, however was the shrimp grits!! I could have eaten a whole BOWL of the grits and been perfectly happy! I'm not sure what cream/cheese concoction they used for the grits but they were so creamy, seasoned perfectly, and came with pretty large pieces of shrimp!

The one downside was where we sat, which was right next to the door of the patio. Although perfect for corralling a toddler while still allowing her to roam around, the opening and closing of the door made for a chilly dinner :( 

Is this a keeper? Yes! And since the menu seems to change pretty frequently, it's always worth a try for some new flavors!

I used to absolutely hate this place. When it first opened the service was terrible, food was disgusting and drinks were watered down. They've come a long way and earned four stars easily! I stopped in Sunday evening for drinks on the patio. Love the patio because it has two fire places, TVs to watch sports (if you're in to that, I'm not.) and wonderful service. We started off w/ the Chicago hot dog appetizer. A little funky, but good nonetheless. I ordered the basil lemonade drink, so delicious and a great size! Finished with the BBQ chicken salad, the chicken was great and seasoned perfectly with a slight kick. The crowd isn't the best, you get a pretty broad mix of annoying drunk girls and then also stuck up burb ladies. That's probably the only complaint, but obviously pour house has nothing to do with that. Keep up the good work!

Man, I don't know if I hyped this place up too much before I came in but it totally fell short of my expectations. Here's why:

1. They do not have high chairs. Yes, I realize this isn't a "family restaurant" but people with babies like craft beer too. How are you going to have changing tables in the bathroom but not have high chairs to contain the beings who need said changing tables? (They do have boosters...which we never got either. I suppose we could've asked again but it probably wouldn't have worked for us anyway.)

2. The beer list is extensive but if you're a beer snob you're still probably not going to find anything you haven't already tried. 

3. The food was just okay. I was expecting some gastropub worthy stuff and instead I got some overpriced bar food. The cheese curds were gross...too airy and salty and greasy. (And I love grease. It's just the breading was soaked in it. BLECH.) The Mac and Cheese was decent but not really truffly or big enough for the price. The only thing I was really impressed with was the filet sliders. If I ever come back here again, it's likely the only thing I'd get. But again, they were overpriced. Seriously, we dropped $80 on three appetizers and two beers. That's just ridiculous. 

4. Service was good but not friendly at all. Everyone who works there pretty much hangs out at the bar or at that douchey station that I assume is for the front of house manager to sit in. Don't get me wrong, I don't want service to be in my face the entire time, but for the money I'm putting down it would be nice to have it a little friendlier in there. 

5. Last is the parking situation. What the hell is going on over there? You pretty much have to valet for $4 (plus tip!) or park faaaaaaaarrrrrr away and walk because there's like 5 restaurants in a row with a parking lot big enough for 1 restaurant. 

Honestly, this place reminds me of an overly hyped Chicago 'gastropub' that misplaced itself in the 'burbs and it's not worth your time. Or money. Unless you happen to be at Oakbrook (already parked elsewhere) and want to drink a good craft beer to dull the horror of shopping.

The ambience was great!  We sat outside in front of the fireplace and it was lovely, very cozy and intimate.  However, the ambience does not make up for the price tags of food.  The veggie burger was not flavorful and depended on the spiciness to make up for it.  It tasted like someone opened a can of beans and fried them up. The accompanying French fries were also overdone and limiting in taste.  Definitely not worth the $12 price tag.  My husband had the duck Reuben and stated he did not enjoy it.  $14 was definitely overpriced.  I may or may not go back, but if I do I will not order any food, only beverages.

Had a double date at Old Town Pour House a couple weeks ago. We decided to make a reservation there based on their extensive craft beer menu... So many options! Loved that you could order samples of any draft beer. Tried several! 

As for food, we started with calamari and cheese curds for an appetizer. Both were good, but the cheese curds were my favorite! For an entree, I had the Duck Reuben. The flavor was most definitely there, but the duck was way too fatty. I wouldn't order that again. 

The restaurant seemed to be a hot spot around 5:30, though by the time we left, the rush seemed the be over. There were barely any reservation times available several days ahead (the options were 5:30 or 8), and there was pretty much no parking available anywhere near the restaurant. Another small complaint - the tables are super close to one another which was a little uncomfortable.

Overall, the experience was decent - would probably go back for drinks and an app while shopping at the mall. Not sure if I'd go out of my way for a reservation though.

Made a last minute reservation for a happy hour and had no trouble whatsoever! The table was ready for us when we arrived and the server was fantastic. Drinks were reasonably priced (90+ beers on draft) and the food was fast and tasty. No complaints.

This is the coolest place for people who love craft beer! Which is, A LOT of people in Chigago.

Expect the Oak Brook Pour House to be crowded during happy hour and evenings, just like the one in Old Town. However, because it is the burbs, the crowd starts lightening up at around 9 PM (sweet!)

Pour house has nearly 100 beers on draft which is way awesome. This is what keeps me coming back! It's so cool to see all the beer on tap behind the glass at the bar. I can't imagine what their energy bill is keeping all those kegs cold.

If you are overwhelmed by the selection of beer in the menu, just look for the card with seasonal specials! My recommendation is to get a beer flight, choosing 4 beers off this menu. 

I've gotten a few of the food items off of the appetizer menu, and I remember them being good. I loved the filet sliders- they were fresh, and cooked to the perfect medium rare. My coworkers and friends talk about how good the food is too!

Highly recommend Pour House for a fun place for beer & happy hour in the west burbs.

I've been here 3 times.

1st time I got the grilled cheese and truffle mac and cheese. Not a fan of either of them. No way.

2nd time I shared some appetizers:

Chicago Dog: YUM absolutely love this. A deep fried hot dog with unhealthy but tasty seasoning and awesome relish sauce

Pretzel Bites: Meh, average

Cheese Curds: Not really a fan

3rd time I came here again for appetizers:

Chicago Dog: Delicious as I remember!

Cheese Curds: Honestly, I forgot to write a review last time so I forgot that I do not like them. Now I will remember. =)

Overall, just OK. Good place in the mall to go get some casual drinks and apps.

This is a delayed review. It was saved in drafts. I was at The Pour House on a Sunday afternoon. The reason for only 3 stars is due to the slow service. In fact, we almost left because the service was so slow. However, there are 8 televisions and one big screen with sports and very entertaining videos to keep you distracted from the long weight. Food average.

This place was just meh...
The only thing we ordered that was actually good was the cheese curds. 
I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, while my friend ordered their Pour House burger. We ordered some drinks and chatted for a while. The cheese curds came quite quickly. However, it took literally 40 minutes for the food to come. I don't know why it took so long, because it was 4:00 on a Saturday.
I was not impressed with the food at all. Pretty disappointed with it. 
My friend's burger looked sloppy. Just looked like a regular burger. The description of the Pour House burger was described as "Handmade 8oz angus beef patty, aged white cheddar, lettuce, dill pickle, beer-battered onion ring, vine-ripened tomato, white grain bun".... and it lacked the onion ring and tomato.
Our waitress was no where to be found. 
Let's go to my pulled pork sandwich... I felt like Costco did a better job with this. Their sandwiches are only 5.99, and this place? It was 13 dollars. The pork was dry, the bun was hard, the Cole slaw was tasteless.
Maybe I'll give this place another chance... maybe not.

I've only been to Old Town Pour House for drinks but I knew I would come back for lunch or dinner. I noticed in in open table so I thought I would make a reservation and check out their lunch menu. 

I arrived and was seated right away. I was there as they were open so there were only a few people seated. I went ahead and order a 312 beer--I was shocked at he price! $8! They do have a large selection of beer. I would recommend taking your time with the drink list. 

I ordered the chicken caesar wrap for lunch. The menu listed a lime Caesar dressing and I thought that would be a nice twist. The wrap was ok but pretty dry. I think I will order something else if I return for lunch or dinner. My husband ordered a burger and that looked pretty good. 

Our server was just ok. He was very sarcastic in the beginning...not the best way to greet his table. He brought the food and drinks but I did notice all the servers standing around near our table. Maybe it's a different atmosphere on a busy night. 

Overall-- The visit was ok but I think I will only return for drinks.

I didn't have high expectations for this place but I was pleasantly surprised that the food was legit.  I made a reso on Opentable and requested outside.  Often times, the restaurant doesn't get that or is unable to accomodate but they actually greeted me and said 'did you still want to sit outside?'  Why yes, yes, I would!  It was a beautiful day out.  We went outside, which was about a third full at 11:45 and asked to be in the shade (sun was also out), which they did.  The exterior is brick with multiple TVs.  TVs outside!  I was impressed.  The service was good most of the time and our server was actually very friendly but there was a period of time that she disappeared for about 15 minutes and I needed a drink refill.  Other than that, very good.  FYI, they do not have their awesome bloody mary on Mondays  (this was Memorial Day) but apparently it's the same as the awesome one just without the skewer.  Since I enjoy bloodies for the drink and not the skewer, I'm totally okay with this.  The bloody was pretty good; not the best but not watered down either.

They have a really good beer list and my friend always gets some raspberry cider that she says is amazing and hard to find.  They have an okay wine by the glass menu as well.  Decent pricing.  As far as the food, this is where I was really impressed.  I'm a city girl and it's hard to find what I have come to expect in the city in the burbs.  I want to pay for quality, not quantity.  Given that portions in the burbs tend to be much larger that what I'm used to, we decided to split two items for lunch between three of us and it was the perfect amount.  The duck confit nachos were awesome.  The duck itself was very tender and it came with a good amount of other fun things like onion, tomato and jalepenos.  I could have used a bit more of the other stuff but it was still a decent amount.  The jack cheese sauce was tasty and the white bean was an interesting pairing.  I wasn't sure I would like it but it went very nicely.  The wonton chips are perfect because they are light and not greasy and hold up well to the duck and cheese.  They were perfectly crispy.  The only suggestion I would make is to perhaps shred the duck instead since the chunks I had were hard to eat on the nachos themselves.  We also had the filet sliders.  These were outstanding.  They were good size for a slider.  When we ordered them she asked how we wanted them prepared (medium rare, of course) so I knew they would be real filet and this made me happy.  They were and the filet was perfectly done and I mean tender.  You didn't need to knife and fork these; you could eat them just like a slider.  I could have perhaps used some more of the horseradish and onions but overall, very well executed.  The fries that come with were solid too.  I will definitely come back to try more.

Really cool suburban bar/restaurant. Perfect place to have dinner and/or a few drinks after exhausting yourself from shopping at the Oak Brook mall.

When the weather is nice, they have a really nice outdoor patio area with stone floors and shrubbery for decor. The interior is very nice, I love the lighting behind the bar. They have hightop tables, low tables, and booths all available, plus seating at the bar.

They have an awesome beer menu with rotating options. I haven't had much food, just a few appetizers, which I loved. Definitely a great place to come and sit at the bar for a drink and a small meal, enjoy the game and what not. It can get crowded at certain hours but it's not overwhelming like it might be at some bars.
Extensive beer list and fantastic shareables. A must visit if you want to enjoy drinks outside by a gas fire while people watching!

This was my first and most likely my last time here. It wasn't terrible, but it was far from great. The food was bland and tasteless. I ordered the pickle chips and they tasted like fried nothing. No pickle flavor at all. Then I ordered the mac and cheese. Same, tasteless. The service was friendly, but extremely slow. It wasn't that busy, so I am not sure why it was so slow. The beer selection is out of this world and the saving grace of this restaurant. If they can get their food to have some flavor and have the servers be more attentive, I might give it another try.

I've been here a couple times- mostly to watch the Hawks games on their multiple tvs. The environment is great for a game. They keep the sound on so you always know what's going on and then during commercials and intermissions, they play YouTube videos! It's a great place to hang out for a couple drinks. That being said though, it's pretty expensive. They never have any drink specials and the lowest cost I've seen is $5 for a Miller Lite. Then there's the food... I've tried a few different items and my husband and I just decided if we plan to go back for a game or something, we'll just eat before we go. I'm not saying their food is awful, it's just not as good as other restaurants that offer the same types of food. The truffle Mac n cheese is literally a joke. Very bland tasting and the mix ins are hard to find. The mushroom flat bread was decent, but the amount of arugula thrown on top was just ridiculous. My favorite part on the flatbread was the caramelized onions which were very well hidden. My husband got the pulled pork and I had a bite. He said he thought it was alright, but we agreed there are many other places that make a much better pulled pork for the same price, if not cheaper. I guess I could just say that Old Town Pour House was disappointing on the food and specials front. The environment is really the only thing to go there for in my eyes. If they could just kick up the rest a notch, they would easily be beyond 5 stars.

Update:
Went back as my coworkers really wanted to go there and they are literally across the parking lot from my office.  They did good, the service was great, food was great and best part is that I did not get sick.  I actually got the tacos because I love me some good fish tacos.  I will absolutely try again and if i don't get sick I'll delete my review that I posted a few months ago.

From a few months ago:
I am gluten free and had the gluten free tacos and sure enough shortly afterwards I got sick!  That was very unpleasant and the worst part was the tacos just tasted okay.  They sounded amazing but they were just okay.  They were not bad but they also were not worth $14 and not very good.  If I had not gotten sick I would have tried something else but they failed and I will never try them again.
One word.....Terrible! Read ALL the reviews before you try this place. Even the "Not recommended reviews" that don't make the Yelp cut give them one star! There is a reason.

Nothing special here, it's not like the one downtown.  They've got some TVs on the walls and a decent choice of apps and meals.  The beer selection is good though, they'll have what you're looking for the majority of the time.  This isn't the place you'll want to go out to eat to but it's a solid place for a happy hour or to watch a game.

If you are looking for a place to have drinks and appetizers, then this is a 5 star place.  We had some beer and Moscow mules and they were delicious.  The apps were very yummy as well.

If you are looking for a place to have dinner, then this is a 1 star place.  We ordered the fish tacos and they were way too spicy.  We couldn't even finish them.  We also got the filet mignon sliders and they were plain and bland.  We also got the chicken salad and it was OK but overpriced for what is basically chicken and mayo.  

It's a fun place and looks cool from the outside.  The inside is cozy with lots of TVs.  Service was decent.  Overall, I gave it 3 stars.

Great place to bring the family! Extensive menu where everybody could find something they love. They do have a kids menu for the littles. Service was great and food was on point. The location can't be beat! We will be returning. I was impressed! Loved to see that they had a chicken ceasar wrap! yum!!!

Went here last night with some friends and had a great time. The service was a bit slow, but the atmosphere was great. I don't know if we actually had all the drinks we were charged for bc I was still coherent, but it doesn't matter bc I had fun. The apps were good but the duck nachos get soggy fast so be careful of that. Loved the arugula and mushroom flatbread.
They would not serve us past 1am. Even when people had already shown they're IDs. And they were super rude.

DEFINITELY on the SHORT LIST OF GREAT BLACKHAWKS-VIEWING LOCATIONS!

Hipster Factor: Zero (It's a NO-BEARD ZONE, BABY!!)

Much like its big brother in the city, this place has excellent food, booze, and people.  The ambiance is as clean, with a  smoky feel to it.

Service speaks for itself: they're going to get you the beer you want A.S.A.P.

I admittedly have lost step on beer culture, as I am not up to date on the most current releases.  However, this location had new releases and old standards alike from both the "craft" beer culture as well as the standards we all know and love.

I suggest bringing a friend, watching your Blackhawks, and cheering with your fellow fans for an overwhelmingly worthwhile experience.

Cheers!

I wish they would rename this place "Ye Olde Town Pour House"!  See, there is nothing old in Oak Brook.  Nothing.  Nothing at all.  Unless you consider a black Benz from 2009 old.  You may spot one of those in OB.

This place though, I like...a lot!  It's in the mall so if dining in a giant mall ain't your thing you won't like the vibe here.  I'm pretty sure my mom delivered me in a mall so this place works for me.

You'll find lots of young OB moms with the friends here, lots of peeps that work in the area and a few families but I wouldn't say this place is great for kids.

Huge ass menu and even more beer selections.  IDK how they did it but their lobster roll is very, very good.  You can graze here or be a fattie.  I enjoy their duck nachos and filet mignon sliders.  My husband likes their fish tacos.  Comfort food?  Yep!  The braised short ribs with a homemade tomato confit are awesome and the meatloaf got rave reviews from another diner.

If you have jumped on the trendy beer bandwagon, you'll like it here.

Service is fine.  It's a bar/restaurant so don't expect stellar service.  They have outdoor dining so if you like sitting by a parking lot do ask for a table outside.

Fantastic beer selection here.  There were so many choices I wasn't sure which way to go.  I finally went for the Anthem cherry cider.

The food was decent.  We started with the buffalo wings.  They were more spicy than most, so I was definitely pleased here.  I also ordered a chili, and wasn't thrilled.  It was made with smoked brisket.  All I could taste was the smoke and burnt ends of the meat.  Not the best chili I've ever had to say the least.  My husband got the meatloaf.  He thought it was just ok on the flavor spectrum.  The gravy on the meatloaf was pretty good, however.

The service was horrible.  The place was far from packed because we came early.  The guy that took our order never looked at us.  He stared somewhere off in the distance the whole time.  We had to ask for water 3 times, and when he did bring it, he only brought one glass.  I figure he probably wasn't sure there were 2 people at the table because he never looked at us.  Also, I specifically asked for my bowl of chili to come out with my husband's meatloaf because the chili was my dinner.  They brought it out with the wings.  I asked guy to keep it warm and bring it back with my husband's meatloaf, and he seemed irritated.  Sorry to upset the balance man, but it's not really a big deal.

Would only come back for the beer.

If there's one thing that turns me off an establishment that prides itself on good service, is  bad or discombobulated service. While OTPH's service isn't exactly bad, it isn't good. Back up to December when the restaurant had a holiday freebee promotion. Our waiter had 6 of us open envelopes he gave us to see what we won for free at our next visit. I won an appetizer. Mind you, there was no expiration date and nothing specifically stating how long the offer was good. In mid-June, my mom and I dined outdoors at OTPH, telling our waitress we had a coupon. Not a word regarding an expiration or she wasn't aware of a coupon. Nada. We ordered the $13.00 smoked wings app along with two burgers, 1 non-alcoholic drink and bread pudding. Come time for the bill, our waitress returns in a snap to inform us that she's charged us for the wings as she was supposed to open the envelope and the promotion ended in February. Not to get in an argument over chicken wings or 13 bucks, I reiterated precisely what the 6 of us were told in December, and that I didn't see anything written on the envelope, or I would have read what it said. Our waitress, Diana, tells us again, that I'm wrong, and that the promotion is over and we weren't to open the envelope - she was. On a $53.34 bill, we gave her $9.66 for a $63.00 total. I know we can do a lot better for lunch elsewhere, especially around Oak Brook Mall and for outdoor seating as well. All this establishment needed to do was to either catch the mistake BEFORE we ordered the app, or give us the app for free, just as the coupon card stated. So, for $13.00, OTPH lost at least these 2 customers and the 5 friends I dined with here in Dec.

Was really looking forward go giving this place a try but I don't know if I'll be back.

I saw there were the premade flights for $12 and I asked if I could make my own and was told yes. I assumed it would be $12. You could imagine my surprise when we got the check and it wasn't. It would be nice to have servers remind tables that it's not $12 as it was easily over looked at the bottom of the menu.  
The food was okay. Friend had chicken which was served on a huge plate but the portion was small. I ordered the duck nachos. WAY too many onions. You could smell them instantly.

Server was okay. She was able to split up our check my for us.

Just eh. Wasn't impressed by the way they make money off customers with the beer flights.

A-OK is truly the perfect adjective for this restaurant.  

I came here with my daughter for the mac n cheese competition.  
Here is how I rate the 4 competitors:

WINNER - Quack "n" cheese from Seasons 52 - I read this going in and thought...really, duck confit?  BUT yes, it was amazing.  The Korean glaze worked well with the cheese and duck, a touch of spice would have been nice though.  this one actually won the whole competition.  

#2 - Pumpkin Gouda from Redstone - so good, fantastic taste and texture.  

#3 - Truffled Mac from Reel Club - whatever crumbs where on here complimented the mac n cheese so well.  The taste of truffle is always good, but now it's getting kind of old news ...

#4 - Baked truffle from the Pour House - bland beyond belief - just because you add a sliver of black truffle on it doesn't make it any better.  one sliver can't really add the woodiness taste to everything.

Is it so bad that on their facebook page I posted that I was happy that the quack n cheese won and that I voted for them?  They deleted my comment for some reason...??  Service was great except I ordered a soup that I never received.  My daughter enjoyed her plain American mac and cheese.

Best part is that instead of the same ol' crayons they give wikki stix out for the kids.  These are awesome and kept my daughter entertained, so thanks for that.


I definitley will be back to try the cider flight one day ... mmmm

We were here from the Cubs playoffs game vs cardinals.  The place was packed but we had reservations.  The place was busy but service was on point.  Everyone was very friendly and just wanted to enjoy the games.  

The flights ( different beers) were my hubby fav.  
The appetizers were great.  

I definitely recommend coming here for any games especially in the summer time when the patio/ fireplace is on. It's really pretty

I have been here a few times and I really like this place. I love the place itself all the way around. Great drink selection, a variety of beers, the food is good, it is a great place to start out your night or go catch a game since they have TVs all over.
I mostly always sit at the bar, I have not had a bad experience there. The bartenders are always attentive and take care of everyone fairly quickly, even when it is super crazy. It can get very busy on the weekends or a night that a major sports event is on so get there early to get a seat at the bar or make a reservation. The crowd is always fun and their little seating area outside with the fireplace is pretty nifty. I have ordered a few of their appetizers and salads and I have liked everything I have tried. I was there this Thursday and the guys seated next to me ordered the pork chop and OMG did it look absolutely delicious!! They were both raving about how great it was. It made my little salad look pitiful, lol.  I will be ordering the pork chop and bringing my appetite next time that I am there.

Decent bar environment for the suburbs but every time I come here it's like pulling teeth to get a server to our table. Also when the server refused to serve my table I went to the bar and asked for a pino noir. I watched the bartender pour me two glasses of A to Z ... She then charges me $36 for two glasses of wine. I was in my server uniform so I don't understand why she thought she should up sell me. I clearly know the business and I didn't appreciate her not giving me the house. If the house is A to Z then there's a problem with the menu and having decent price points. I highly doubt that is the case. Be careful when ordering here... This is not the first time this has happened.

Since I've been staying in the area I have been to the Pour House 3 times in the last week.  It's been a mix of customer entertainment and dinner with colleagues,

Last night we ended up sitting in a booth by the entrance and the waitress havppened to be our bartender from the evening before.  She actually remembered what I was drinking. That is excellent service!

The brisket sandwich is also very nice.  The cheese sauce along with the BBQ side is well worth the price!

My husband and I have been here once before and had a mediocre experience, so we thought we would give them a second chance. Unfortunately, our second visit has officially become our final visit. On a positive note, the hostess was very friendly, as was our server (I believe his name is Andy). He timed our courses well and didn't pressure us to fly through our meal given how busy they were with the Cubs and Blackhawks games on TV. Quite honestly, the only reason I gave 2 stars instead of 1 was because of our server. 

When we were waiting for our table, my husband and I went up to the bar for drinks. We waited for a solid 5-10 minutes without being noticed by the bartenders...there were 4 or 5 of them and they weren't particularly busy at that point; they seemed more concerned with talking to each other and chatting-up the men sitting at the bar. 

When we were seated, the food was a disappointment. The cheese curds were great, but the fish tacos were bland and overpriced. The Kobe beef burger was just sad...I ordered it medium, and it came out completely overcooked. To overcook Kobe beef like that is to ruin the integrity of the food, and I couldn't believe we had to pay $18 for that (and some fries "fresh" out of a frozen bag). 

While the ambiance and beer selection were the motivators to return for a second chance, there are dozens of other restaurants in Chicagoland that offer craft beer and food with flavor and integrity. We will not be returning to Pour House.

Beer lover's paradise. Martini lovers's dream. Great crowd & ambiance. Not too loud. Lots of tvs to catch your favorite team. Extremely friendly service & management. Great for happy hour or to take a break while you're shopping.

Came here on a Thursday night for a drink and app before dinner because it seemed like the coolest low key spot but the service was really slow and every time my drink came out something was in there.  First a hair on my lemon then black stuff.. My experience wasnt horrible though because the weather was absolutely perfect!  Ordered fried pickles and cob salad which was pretty good so I gave them 3 stars, my lemon martini was pretty good too.. Light and refreshing.. Looking back food and drinks were good, I'll change to 4 stars!

Greeted by fantastically nice people. Sat at the round booth with the ability to see all the TVs. Love the live music videos and music choice - classic rock. 
 Our server Jack was super sweet, friendly, interested in us. He kept our water glasses full and brought out lemons. He stopped at our table a great amount of times to make sure we were OK. And had a lovely conversation with us about how he loves his job. We could tell he took pride in his work.
The buffalo shrimp, pretzel bites with IPA dipping cheese and sweet potato crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e were to die for. I highly recommend the sweet potato crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e for fall weather dessert. 
Would go many more times and recommend to others.

Not impressed. We went last night on a quiet night in oakbrook and sat at a great booth, but the service and food were not great, hence the 1 star. My husband ordered the duck Reuben, which he said was good, but not a ton of meat, and I got the truffle chicken sandwich- so gross. Dark meat, weird after taste, and dry! Stacked high on a Hawaiian bun (which was good), but 1 bite, and all the fries later- the waiter asked me if I wanted my once bitten sandwich packed up (no...), and I declined bc it was not good, he didn't ask how we liked our food once- and I am not one of those people who goes out to complain. So we paid $13 for fries and a side of 1 bite of pretty gross chicken salad sandwich. 

Place was sort of busy, so I can see the lack of attention w/service, but $45 bucks before tip for 2 $8 beers (healthy pours- but one special of the yum yum that they advertised as a seasonal- was out), and 2 pretty gross sandwiches on the tiniest plates was a rip off. Disappointed since we just moved from the city, and we're looking for a good food and craft beer spot!
