First off 90 artisan beers on tap! I'm visiting from California and love to try local beers when I travel. Joe the bartender knew his beers and recommended some great locally crafted brews. Paired with a delicious cheeseburger, I had a great experience! Highly recommend...

Stellar draft beer selection. 
The largest in the Midwest... or so their telephone on-hold recording claims.
I'd believe it.
And boy will you pay for it.

Buffalo Shrimp. 
Just get like 3 orders of those. Done and done.
(and then hope someone else picks up the tab because it's like $15 for 5 shrimp)
(but I gotta say, TOTALLY worth the splurge)
Trust me. I know my skrimps from Buffalo.

The Chef here. He knows what he's doing.
I can't wait to come back. 
I've got my eyes on you, Lobster Roll. 

The only neg I can grasp at is that you pay about $2 more per beer than you'd be paying for that same exact beer at just about any other bar in the tri-county area. It seems especially high for a place that specializes in craft beer, but they do have the best draft selection I've seen, so I'm sure keeping all those kegs stocked costs a pretty penny... not to mention that they're actually located (sort of) within Neiman Marcu$ at Oakbrook Mall, and I'm positive their rent tab is astronomical.  

If the higher price point beer offends you, you can of course go to any number of other Chicagoland businesses who cater to brew-minded folk, but if you're already at Oakbrook Mall and need a good beer, Old Town Pour House is a REALLY nice option to have and I, for one, have to say that having OTPH here makes going to the mall a little less stressful knowing you can kick back with a high-quality cold one, and a lot more appetizing knowing I can hoard a plate of buffalo shrimp here.

Parking can be a pain in the ass if you don't know the parking trick (which I'm not openly sharing because I still want to be able to do the trick the next time I come here and want to park), but you can also valet for something like $4, which is probably worth it to avoid the headache. 

I came in during a weird off-peak hour (2pm on Tuesday) where the whole place was basically empty and still got the same great service and atmosphere that you'd expect to find during peak restaurant/money-making hours. I think that says a lot about the quality of the staff with how well they uphold standards of service throughout a long day with many ups and downs in seating and turning tables.

Had I done a full meal here with a beer I could have easily ran a tab of $50 just for myself,  so that's something to know going in. Don't expect pubs-style pricing or eats, think gastropub and know that while your wallet may be lighter upon leaving, your stomach will certainly be full of happy and hoppy vibes.

This restaurant sits at one end of my very favorite malls, Oak Brook Mall. And for that, I will probably be back because 1. I love shopping 2. I love beer.  
 
After enjoying a picturesque Fall day with my momma pursuing the shops, we stopped in for a late lunch. Large TVs line the wall of the bar above the mile long row of beers on tap. This is a great bar for watching a game while sipping on a more unusual beer. Add the fried pickle chips to that and your heart will be content.  
  
Our entrees were not the highlight of our experience. My moms fish tacos were a messy, unable to be picked up as the single corn tortilla was soggy. My chopped salad was satisfactory, needed a little something more.  
 
Bottom line: If you like beer, come here. Prices are on point for the area. Pricey.

There is no way this place should have under 5 stars.  We came in around lunch hour and there was plenty of seating.  Our server was great!  

Ordered the Pour House Burger.  Holy EFF!  Amazing.
The chili tho.......I have no words!!!!!!!!

Yeah so even after we paid more than we normally would for a burger (approx $13), it was SOOOOOO worth it..

Did I mention the chili?
Food is American comfort food. Drinks are extensive. Customer service is attentive and helpful.

The hubby and I have come here a couple times with friends and always have a great time! My most important tip: MAKE A RESERVATION!!! They usually have an hour plus wait for walk ins! Yikes!! They have a great bar area and quite a bit of seating. Their extensive beer menu can be overwhelming but the staff is quite knowledgable on the beers! Food has always been good! I love the fried pickles and last time the hubby got the fish and child Which were pretty decent! Price wise I would say they are upper average for their food and average for their drinks!

They have fun music and videos playing starting at about 830/9 which adds more fun to the evening!

Parking sucks over there, so park by The Lord & Taylor!!!

Enjoy! Have a beer for me!

Very nice service and the place has a great vibe. Food, meh?? Short rib grilled cheese, about 2 oz of actual meat, not great. Beer choices were very good.  Server was really good. Cannot recommend, unfortunately.

Great beer choice and service at the bar. We came here because there was a 3 hour wait at Wildfire. We were told an hour wait so we decided to sit at the bar. The bartenders were awesome. They have a great beer choice. We ordered food and it was really bad. I had an America Kobe burger with braised short ribs on top. The burger was ordered medium rare and delivered at least medium well. It tasted like the grill. The short ribs were painfully dry. I was so disappointed. I give it two stars because the staff at the bar was great.
Great food, great beer and cocktails, but HORRIBLE service. Very disappointing.  Our server had 3 tables and still couldn't manage.

Horrible inattentive bar staff, could never get their attention even on a slow Monday night to order a dinner entree to go with my beer. Staff seemed more concerned with socializing at their Servicr well with servers than guests at the bar wanting to order. 
I will not be returning.

"Poor" is what the name should be.  Just left there terribly disappointed.  Tony J was our server. He couldn't provide much guidance or suggestions on the menu although he said he worked there 3 years.  Martinis were awful, had to send back 2xs before they got it right.  Salmon was decent but very small compared to what two others in my group got. When I told Tony,  all he said was let me get the manager.  She was useless too. Said that she'd let the chef know to serve same size portions. Big help! When the check came it was $190 for 4 poeople...martinis were $16. Not only was service and food poor, the manager didn't even offer a dessert on the house, a small gesture of $5 may have made up for the shortcomings and prevented me from posting this honest review. Poorly run business,  poor service,  poor management. I won't be back to this "poor" house.  I don't mind spending for a good meal,  this was a waste of money.  If they get above right,  they may have a chance!

Would you like to know when businesses start losing stars?! It's no wonder this place only has 3 stars with 90 reviews. 

Went here recently when my company office party of 20-25 people to get drinks. After being barely greeted my a waiter that looked like he didn't want to be there himself, took our order. He told my co-worker "I can't read your mind." 

What waiter would ever say that in this business? Not mention this place is a gold mine for folks networking after work. Bad customer service my friends. You need to train your staff better.

As the night went on and the tabs went up, they decided to hold my other co-workers coat hostage because another person at her table didn't pay his $20 bill. How is that her fault? And how can you legally hold a coat for ransom?!?! 

Your business is just waiting to get sued by the wrong person your staff decides to take things from. Get your act together or word of  mouth and bad reviews will ruin what you started.

Chili and beer are good but that's it 
Service is absolutely the worst
If you go,  order everything upfront and get the check at the same time.

We found this place by accident and very glad we did!  Noon on a Monday. Our server was most attentive and she was most helpful in answering our questions and checking back.  No need to write about the variety (an understatement for sure) of beers on tap.  If you are a beer connisuer  this is your place.  Food was GREAT.  Caesar salad was very fresh, tasty dressing  and large enough for us to share.  My husband had the veggie burger and shared it was one of the best he has eaten.  Burger was extremely moist and tasty.  I had the filet sliders. YUMMY YUMMY.  I would definitely order again and hopefully soon.  Limited dessert menu but worth the calories.  We shared the Cookie dough and snicker pie desserts.  SSSSSSSSOOOOOO DECADENT.  

Atmosphere is relaxing and the outdoor patio is inviting.  We will definitely be returning.  Highly recommend you drop in as you will not be disappointed

Had a terrible experience this past Friday night. My friends and I came in around 9:30pm. We were a group of 9 and waited just a few minutes for a table. Our waitress was Elizabet and she was fine at first, but as soon as we mentioned we were just drinking and not eating, it was like a switch went off. Instead of cramming a bunch of people into the booth side of the table, we asked if we could get 1 extra stool. She made a big production about it and went over to the host stand, which we were right next to, and started talking about our table. She did finally bring another stool over but said nothing when dropping it off. The place was full, but there were a few empty tables and it's a bar, not everyone eats, so I don't know why she was so bothered by us. 2 friends joined the party after we had ordered a round of drinks and when Elizabet finally came back, she only asked 1 of the newcomers if they wanted a drink. My other friend couldn't even order anything before she was gone again. A few of us wanted another round of drinks but she did not come back for over 20 minutes. When she finally did come back, 1 person asked for their tab. Instead, she brought over the entire bill for everyone thus effectively ending our night. She was rude, VERY inattentive to our table and spoiled what could have been a fun night out for our group after we had enjoyed dinner at the Clubhouse where the service was MUCH better.

Came here for drinks after dinner at Reel Club. Very nice atmosphere. We sat inside at first since there wasnt any available tables outside. Good place to come for drinks and hangout after work or just hanging out. We went outside afterwards since there was a table available. Played nice music in the background, weather was perfect. Good experience. My team really enjoyed the different flights they offered.. their favorite was the cider flight.

I think this place was pretty decent.  The service was slow, and it was on the expensive side for what it was, but the food was good and they have a very, very good beer list.  My husband and I sat outside, each had a beer and a burger and the bill came to 45$ before tip...  I don't think I'd make an effort to go back, but if I was in the area and was very hungry/thirsty, I'd rather go here than bevy of steakhouses in the immediate vicinity.

Service was slow. The server came to the table next to us 3 times while not checking on my table. I actually had to tap him with our checks top get him to take Thanh at the end of the meal. I got the pork  belly burger, while the fries were excellent the burger was mediocre and not worth 16$. The prop belly was so tough I had to take it off the bun. The beer selection is great, I would go back for beer but I would eat somewhere else.

We ate here a few months back. The food...just ok and the service was terrible. We were back in Oak Brook yesterday and instead of going to our usual favorites, we decided to give the pour house one more try. Maybe it was just a bad day for them last time? BIG MISTAKE! There's a reason why it's so empty here. Again....food was less than ok and the service was worse than last time. When a restaurant is busy, I always appreciate how hard the servers run their behinds off. But when a restaurant is empty and the service is horrible, there is no excuse. I'm not sure if the waiter should be fired or the manager for allowing horrible service. NEVER AGAIN will I waste my money here. There are too many restaurants in Oak Brook that offer excellent food and service EVERY time. Keep walking when you see their fun outdoor patio!

First off.. Gorgeous outdoor seating.  Seriously, this patio is beautiful and surprisingly not extremely hot on hot and humid days. I think that is because NM and Perry's up top, block the sun a bit. I mainly came here because someone told me about the Cheese Curds and Filet Sliders.  Both were great!  The mini Filet sliders had so much taste to them.. well done!  However, the rest of the food is pretty basic.  The fries were not that good, nor were the fried pickles.  This is place is more of a place where you socialize, have a drink(s) and eat.  I will definitely go back to do this.  However, next time all I want will just be the cheese curds.  I don't have too much to say about this place.  It has great people watching and is your typical outdoor/indoor bar and restaurant. Don't get me wrong, I will come back to this place, but in a group, not for a date.

Old Town Pour House was a remarkable surprise. Beer bar restaurants often underwhelm me because beer food fare--meat, bread, fried stuff--doesn't interest me. I'm at these places to be supportive of my boyfriend's preferences, which means I order the veggie burger that is rarely anything to write home about.  

Old Town Pour House, however, has a gem of a veggie burger! It may even be the *best* veggie burger I've ever had (top honor previously went to the quinoa and black bean burger at Nashville's Burger Up). The burger is made with a savory mix of garbanzo beans, black beans, and red quinoa and covered in a lovely crushed tortilla crust. It reminded me of falafel, only in beautifully-presented colorful patty form. I wish I had taken a picture, but I'm sure I will when I return to Pour House in the near future. 

My PSA for vegetarians aside, here are some other comments: 
-My beer nerd boyfriend was pleasantly surprised that the encyclopedia of beers in the menu were all available on tap. Even I took advantage of the beer menu and ordered a 6 oz. of Finch's delicious Secret Stache stout.
- The appetizer of pretzel bites was comprised of little balls of dough very similar in size to Dunkin Donuts Munchkins. I found them to be a delicious way to enjoy pretzels yet also limit portions before the meal.
-There are three desserts on the menu, and my party ordered and enjoyed them all: baked cookie dough, bread pudding with rum raisin ice cream, and peanut butter chocolate pie. All very rich and indulgent! 
-Very friendly service that was just attentive enough. We went on a slow Sunday during lunch time though, so I can't comment on how it is during peak hours.
Great cheese curds, awesome beer, and amazing staff! They also text you when your reservation is up so if you don't feel like hanging around, feel free to go do some shopping!

Great place to watch a game while enjoying your favorite brew. They have to have at least 30 micro brews on tap. I would call it upscale pub food. I had the pourhouse burger my daughter had the pork chop. Huge portions and tasted great. The staff was friendly and my glass was never empty. Situated in a shopping center among other upscale eateries such as Maggiano's and the Cheesecake Factory.

Usually have a great time here, but was here last Wednesday with a group sitting in front of the fireplace outside. We asked to move our tables together and they said it was restaurant policy for that not to happen, and we were not allowed to sit in seperate tables so we basically got moved to another table in the cold. When we moved, writhing 15-20 minutes, a group of guys were seated in our old seats with the tables together. Could not believe they allowed this and asked for an explanation when we were told that they asked for sitting like that, when we asked for a manager, no one ever came. I could not believe how I was treated and was definitely not happy.

I love this place! It's right in the oakbrook mall so perfect place to fuel up before or after some intense shopping. They have outside seating with tv and fireplace as well. Staff are always friendly as helpful on beer choices.
I'm not a big beer drinker but I love their cider. I like the cherry one but just tried the pumpkin flavored for fall and I definitely approve. They have a million selections- banana bread beer! 
We love the chili and corn bisque (with real corn) to start. It's a must! I've tried the beet salad and it's really good, dressing is perfect. Always try their specials- today we had BBQ quesadilla and it was good- it came with a BBQ dipping sauce which was too much BBQ if you ask me but still yummy. This portion was huge- enough for three people. 
Come here to watch games, they have upscale bar food and large beer selection!
Pretty great place for some casual food and drinks.

The food is certainly nothing to rave about. Haven't really found anything that's too fond. Burgers are rally sub standard. Calamari was hard and didn't taste fresh. Small food selection in general.As pretty much any restaurant in the mall parking might be a pain u less you want to resort to valet. This place is not five stars because it doesn't offer beer specials or happy hour. Service is too laissez faire nothing that compares to places around. Water refills took quite long, greeting a table too a while as well as getting our drinks and checks. Nice place to try craft beers and hang around the fireplace and catch a game but nothing more to this place. Crowd and music are decent 30/40 crowd type the times I been there it seemed.

If you are a beer fan, this is a must visit place.  Since I am not, I am reviewing my dining experience.  It was okay.

The pretzel bites were served warm and bite sized.  Not a fan of the Gouda cheese sauce they were served with, but just a personal preference.  My smoked brisket was tender and flavorful.  My dining partners could not say that about their filet mignon smalls, which is their fancy name for sliders.  I am told they were too chewy and not cooked properly.  Dessert menu is limited, there were 2 choices offered to us.  The one selected was something like a butterscotch bread pudding, my dining partners ate some of it.

Ambiance:  it has a warm feel to it.  Large bar area with TVs, dining area, a separate room for a small, about 14, party.  There is an outdoor dining patio with a fireplace.  Very welcoming, but remember that is in a parking lot next to delivery area and garbage receptacles.  I would think the fumes from the deliveries would spoil ones appetite during the afternoon, but be more enjoyable in the evening.  There were at least 2 deliveries during the time we were eating lunch, we ate indoors.

I would visit again.

Do come for the Bloody Mary (Churchill)! We loved them. Nice beer selection. Friends loved the fish tacos but my brisket was very fatty-so much that I sent it back and while they replaced it with a salad at my request, it made me hesitant to agree to return when planning another dinner out with DH. I do recommend the friend pickle and it was my favorite part of the meal! I can say that we will give this place another try as the ambiance and sticks are well done. But this is the second or third time the food has disappointed me. The spinach salad was ok but more like what I'd expect to find in an airport restaurant than at Oakbrook dining!

Don't order shrimps they are too spicy. 
Don't order steak salad , steak was dry and over grilled, disgusting on taste.
Fish tacos are okay. 
Atmosphere is fine so 3 out of 5.

Came here to watch the Blackhawks game and found a nice laid back atmosphere with a decent outside patio to take advantage of.
Located in the mall, I can see this becoming a quick stop after shopping and especially during the summer months!
We tried a variety of items that included the pretzel bites which were so good, the cheese curds which I think may have been the best I've had! Both the curds and bites came with dipping sauces which I didn't think much of, but that was ok because both were good on they're own. The buffalo shrimp were great and the filet sliders just so-so. 
Did I mention they have beer, beer and beer?!! For someone who loves craft beer you have to come. If your a newbie to the world of craft beers, they offer beer flights. I've never seen so many beers on tap! They have cider and wine, and cocktails too.
A good spot after shopping to relax and enjoy.

Went here on a Friday night and sat at the bar. Loved the variety of beer options and great recommendations from the staff. Ordered some apps and really enjoyed our time out. Only down side is that it is a little on the higher $, but that is to be expected being at oak Brook.
No complaints, food was just plain ole good & satisfying. Service was good. Wouldn't exactly seek it out for lunch again.

I made several attempts to have dinner here with friends...third attempt was the charm!  The other two times we had a conflict and well, couldn't seem to make a reservation for that date/time either for some reason and I'm not sure what they had going on at the place on those particular times.  I'm glad we made a reservation just because of the area, and lots of offices in the area, etc.  I didn't notice a wait on a Thursday after work but reservations are just good to have no matter what so yes, you can make a reservation on their website.

So I guess they have a big beer selection here...I'd say so, just because it takes up most of the menu, the food section is much smaller.  It was a big loud as the blackhawks playoff game was on.  They have a nice patio in front too.

This place is a bit on the pricey side, I want to say it cost about $16 for a flight of cider beer, $8 for a glass.  I had both.  I had filet mignon sliders for my dinner that came with a side of fries...good, but more on the appetizer side.  There were many things on the menu I'd still like to return and try - both beer AND food so yes, I want to come back here.

This place is mostly your average sports bar.  Slightly upscale since it is connected to Oakbrook mall.  There also looked like there was the option of a valet.  I came on a Friday night with my main squeeze around 10pm and the place was pretty packed but there was no wait, which was good.  I had a glass of wine (weird, I know since this place has many beers, but I was craving a glass of wine), and the cheese curds.  I really enjoy trying cheese curds at different places.  These cheese curds were perfectly fried and not too greasy.  I didn't have any other of the food since I had dinner earlier in the night, but my boyfriend's burger looked good and large.

My first and last time dining here, for sure, por seguro!  I rarely drink beer and went out with my daughter, her girlfriend, and her mother. A sort of Mother/Daughter night out! Company was great but food and atmosphere were below par.

I ordered the lobster roll, which at $18.95 should have been decent. There was less than 2 oz of any fish and question if it was really lobster? The roll was too buttered.  The side of fries were over salted and cold. Ordinarily I would have complained but it was noisy, busy, and I was with other people so I let it slide. My friend's mom ordered the pulled pork sandwich, which was not much more than 3 ounces, was also cold and cold fries.

After all, I am the one who booked this reservation on Open Table, which is a necessity to get a table on a Friday night at 7pm., ANYWHERE in Oakbrook center Mall!  BTW, most tables are bar height. I am 5 feet tall so I literally had to climb onto the stool/chair! So short people, beware!

If you love beer, are under the age of 40, then you might a like this place, which is a step up from a local college bar. Plus, you better have a Champagne wallet because this is not an economical place to eat/drink.
But, hey this is the western burbs of Chicago and it is a price to pay.
Even Valet parking is $4, which is ridiculous since there is no place to park because of ALL the restaurants: Perry's Steakhouse, Wildfire, Maggianos, Mon Ami Gabi, Cheesecake Factory, and now Old a Town Pour House.

The only way to enjoy this place would be to meet a friend for a beer and sit at the bar. The beer selection is pages long, too!

On a positive note, our waitress was very efficient and brought us extra water and allowed us to sit and chat and not clear off the whole table to get us to leave! We left her a 30% tip!

My fellow Yelpers. Now we have another reason to visit Oak Brook Mall. 

Old Town Pour House has beer. *Cheer!*
They have at least 80 different kinds of beer. *Cheers louder*
And they're all on tap, making it easy to have short pours, sample different brews and my favorite, the beer flights. *Cheers, whistles, standing ovation*
*has to shout over cheering* there's wine and a fully stocked liquor wall for those that don't want to drink beer. 

Now that I have your attention...there's more.
There's an nice menu of eats too. Danielle S tried this wonderful-looking bacon and caramelized onion burger. *Intrigued*
And there's other good stuff. For example, the Grilled Cheese *Cheer!*
There's Pork Belly in it *Cheers louder*
And a sunny side up egg *Incredulous Cheering*
And it's served with a side of the creamiest/flavorful tomato bisque for dipping. 
It was pure heaven. *Cheers, whistles, standing ovation*

Service is great. Knowledgeable about brews. Glad to see they have a short list of seasonal brews too. That's how I got to try 4 Elf by Dark Horse and the Christmas Ale by Great Lakes. 

If you have to catch a game, there are many Flat Screens for your viewing pleasure, but no worries non-sports people, it's not intrusive. Great space. I'll be visiting again soon.

Two stars because my drink was good but no more because my food sucked. Came here for an late Brucs- my friends and I wanted to get some burgers and we all like going to this bar downtown so we figured we would give it a try. Maybe two other people in the whole place and it took forever to be served. I will say our group was a bit difficult ordering and changing up the menu so I totally get the kitchen time being longer but our waiter was inattentive and never checked on us or our drinks. My burger was severely overcooked to the point it was actually charred and tasted like charcoal. I didn't want to make a scene in front of my friends so I just ate the fries and picked away at the small part of my burger that was salvageable. Nonetheless, I would only come back here for drinks and nothing else- their Moscow mule was good.

I think I have found the love of my life.

First off, this is located in the Oak Brook mall (across the parking lot from the Cheesecake Factory). Parking isn't fun, but you'll have that.

When I first walked in and saw all of the beers on tap, I thought I died and went to heaven. there are 84 (YES) beers on tap. Nothing is bottled. They are from local breweries from around the country. There is literally something for everyone. If you don't like beer, there is a nice wine selection as well as liquors. You can try any beer you want, or create your own flight. They have suggested flights in their menu as well. I ended up trying the Tangerine Wheat (almost like a Blue Moon with orange...only more orange tasting). It was very good!

They have a nice food selection with a variety of treats. Aimee M. ordered the pork belly grilled cheese and said it was very good. I ordered the Angus Burger with blue cheese and caramelized onions and bacon. Holy cow...it was amazing. Good food paired with good beer!

Our waiter was very helpful (in his words they are all beer geeks there, so ask any questions you have!). Everyone was friendly and the service was quick. The atmosphere is nice as well - dimly lit with a large bar, plenty of other seating, and TV's scattered. It's like an upscale sports bar.

I can't wait to come back and make more of a dent in those 84 drafts!

Ridiculous price of $15 glass of wine without being told. 
Always wanted to try this place and was able to stop for a drink after having my birthday dinner at Wildfire next door. My husband ordered a craft draft and I asked what red wine they had. The bartender told me Cabernet or Pinot Noir. I chose pinot noir. He then asked bottle or on tap. Weird to have wine from tap so I said bottle. It was A to Z pinot noir. We finished that drink and got our bill. It was $21. MY GLASS OF WINE WAS $15! You would think that could have been mentioned. I will not be returning.

As a fan of the original Old Town Pour House located in Old Town (clever name, eh?) I was skeptical that they could pull off the same upscale, sports bar vibe in a location that is basically in a mall in the burbs.  Part of what I like about the Old Town location is the constant activity, the whir of people coming in and out and the windows that open out to the street.

So how did this newest sibling fare during my recent visit?  Pretty good.  And given I work right across the street and am always looking for somewhere to meet up with friends in the area, the Pour House will certainly go on my list as a choice for both lunch and dinner.

The interior, while smaller than it's sibling, is contemporary with copper topped tables.  There is a large patio out front complete with a couple of fireplaces that will certainly see it's share of business during the warmer months although I'm hoping there will be a ton of greenery to block that you are basically looking out at a filled parking lot.

We were warmly greeted and shown to our table.  They have a ton of beer (about 80 different types) but also a great selection of whiskey so my whiskey lovin' friend was very happy.  The other nice thing is that it looks like the menu is the same as the one at the other location so my chopped salad was just the way I remembered it and my friends brisket sandwich was also to his liking.  They also have the pork chop that I've had at the other location so that will be mine to eat at a future visit!

People watching on this night was limited as there were only a few other tables that had people at them, but given it had only been open a week, I am sure that is going to change.

The only down side?  If you are going to open a restaurant about beer . . .then the servers need to understand the differences in the beers.  My friend is maniacal when it comes to beers so he will ask questions just to see if the server, bartender or sometimes even the manager know their stuff.  In this case- the server got a failing grade, but a quick trip up to the bar restored his faith in the place as the bartender was on his game.

Speaking of games- you can be sure to catch your favorite one here as there are plenty of TV's for you to watch without a bad seat in the house.

And know before you go- that unless you want to add exercise to your evening's activities you should probably use the $4 valet out front.  Sure- it's in a mall with tons of parking- but because this sits on the east side of the mall with many other restaurants and limited parking- parking is very hard to find.

Dinner with drinks ran about $80.  

Always nice to see a familiar "city face" find it's way out to the burbs.  Just makes the burbs a little more interesting.  Check it out!

If beer is one of your food groups like it is mine, I highly recommend checking this new bar out. They hand you a menu that I mistakenly took for a food menu. Turns out, there are 6 pages of beer, 4 pages of wine, 1 page of whiskey and only 2 pages of food. Plus, there's a seasonal beer menu, as well. Feels like home. I love that you can try pre-made beer flights or MAKE YOUR OWN BEER FLIGHT!! The servers and bartenders know their way around a keg and speak beer. So far, so good on their recommendations. 

My companion says they have a shockingly good whiskey collection; something foreign to me, so I'd take his word for it. He happens to be a bartender, as well. Oh, there's also a "DJ."  Or a dude with a MacBook playing music. Either way, not disappointed!!

5-star rating if it weren't for just one thing... It's located under Neiman Marcus next to 4 Lettuce Entertain You restaurants and another brand new joint. Translation: no parking. You can valet for $4; this is Oak Brook, so many will be willing to pay. Meh. We parked by Cheesecake Factory and hoofed it. 

Try it, you'll like it!

Good overall. Nice vibe, lots of TV's for sports but definitely not a sports bar. Food is very good, garlic fries are excellent. Beer list is good if you're new to the craft beer/beer geek world, but beer nerds will have tried most of what was on tap when we went. A deeper dig for new beers would be perfect.

Suburban beer enthusiasts rejoice!  Old Town Pour House now has a location in Oak Brook Mall.  My city friends were raving about how much they loved Pour House so when we had the chance we quickly took advantage of their 90+ taps and American menu. 

We had a reservation, but arrived 30 minutes early and we were seated in minutes.  They do not have a lot of room at the long bar for you to stand and wait so I was glad that we didn't have to wait long.  The atmosphere is very LOUD.  It was difficult for my boyfriend and I to talk to each other with how loud the music is playing in the place.  It grew frustrating as the night went on because it's hard to have a date without conversation.

They had an incredible beer menu, but our waiter clearly had not been educated on the menu.  We asked the question, "What specials do you have?"  We were met with a blank stare until he started reading off of the specials menu we hadn't noticed on the table.  We asked, "What pairs well with the brisket or pulled pork?"  Blank stares.  We knew that the place was newer so we decided to just make our own beer decisions since we were causing our server distress.

Their food menu takes what you know about American food and turns it upside down.  We ordered the fried pickles, bbq pulled pork, and the brisket.  The pickles were sliced too thick and breaded too heavily for my taste.  The batter had great flavor, but it was very difficult to eat the pickle slices because they were so large.  The BBQ pork had a smoky heat that filled your entire mouth with heat.  It was very flavorful, but the seasoning was more than I could handle.  My boyfriend had the brisket and we both agreed that it was very well prepared and the Hawaiian roll was a great choice for this sandwich.  We were both disappointed with the French fries.  There was nothing special about the fries at all.  They need an aoli or a fried egg on top to call themselves "American with a twist."  

I'm interested to see what becomes of this restaurant as it settles into it's new location.  The suburbs need more restaurants for beer and food pairings.

If you like beer, this is your place. If you like food...at a..uh hum...restaurant...skip it. I work really close, so a group of us frequent Pour House often, but my colleagues know it's my least favorite place to visit. They love beer, so I don't put up a fuss. So if you like beer, go. If you like food, don't. I've tried several items from the menu. The only thing I've enjoyed are the fries. The filet sliders-dry, tiny and shriveled. Pork belly burger-sounds delish, right? Nope, the pork belly wasn't at all crisp so it tasted like a big pad of fat on the burger. Sigh. Pretzel bites-pass. The cheese served with it tastes like a big dunk of bland. I had some sort of beef sandwich last fall-also not impressed. Nothing tastes like anything. To be fair, my colleagues all love the fish tacos, so maybe those are good. So that's one meal from the menu that may be tolerable. Boo. The cocktail also leaves a lot to be desired. This place is also super overpriced for what you get. Now when I go, I order fries...

I took my sons and grandsons to this sushi restaurant after shopping and I must say, we were all pleasantly surprised.

The atmosphere and ambience were very modern and upscale. However, their pricing was very laid back. The service was very fast, the wait staff were all very friendly and the sushi was outstanding. The huge selection was also very well presented with photographs and descriptions of every roll. 

We really enjoyed the total experience. Definitely considering a return visit!

YAS. YAS. YAS!

This was my first time trying the rotary sushi experience, and it's AHHH-MAZING! 

My group and I had an absolute blast! Great experience, honestly. This would be a really fun date experience or for lunch or dinner or breakfast or family dining or anything! A great experience to show anyone! 

It's pretty affordable in my opinion because each plate is priced at different amounts, so you really get to try a large diversity of dishes while maintaining your budget! At all-you-can-eat sushi, it would be $20 per person, and my group and I paid less than that each when eating at rotary sushi! I felt just as full & satisfied afterwards too! **There are desserts on the conveyor belt too, and they're delicious! I recommend the green tea cheesecake because that's something you can't get just anywhere!

The environment is very clean and unique. The table has a little drawer to keep menus in which I think is bomb because the menus are always in the way, and the little drawer is super cute!

The servers are EXCELLENT! They work so quickly and efficiently! I never had an unfilled glass of water, and the table was ALWAYS cleaned up of unnecessary lids or straw wrappers or any clutter. They were very conscious of when I needed anything! I pulled out the menu & chose what I wanted (you have the option of ordering from the menu if you can't find what you want on the conveyor belt), and before I could motion a server over, she was already on her way! So aware! Love it! All of the servers were very KIND as well. Very amicable people.

Bathrooms are clean as well, and my grandpa always told me that you can tell how good a restaurant is by the cleanliness of their bathroom, so this place is the BEST by those standards! 

Such a great and fun experience! I had lots of fun, and I recommend everyone to try it! I would love to answer any questions about it if anyone is confused, lol!

Alright so i have my 5 reasons why i like with 1 reason for a small concearn.

1. Great ambience, food comes to you! You can choose out of the menu or decide on the rotary sushi bar.

2. Plenty of options. Im asian and i dislike sushi with a passion... i only eat certain meals. Here they have tons of options including Binto Boxes and Ramen ^_^!!

3. I am a music lover and they typically play todays music. Which i am a fan of.

4. Great seating, plenty of room for over 4 people 6 people easy fit. 

5. It is nearby. I live in Warrenville and Naperville is very close. 

Customer service is decent, a little hard on the english but they keep close attention to your water level. They make sure to swing by to check up on you. Overall satisfaction 4/5 as well as the review im making.

My one dislike/concern inconsistent cooking/chef work. When i first went with my girlfriend we both got Binto Boxes with beef. It was phenomenal! Great taste, flavor, plenty of juicey goodness! This most recent visit that wasnt the case... Dry... not flavorful, very dull. So beware your food may not be consistent. My only flaw. Otherwise ramen is dead on each time. Same thing with the sushi! 

Good luck!

Totally awesome! The value at this place is amazing! The sushi is as good at more pricey places but this is so much FUN! I was like a kid in a candy store just grabbing plates off the belt! Desserts? More please! $50 for the wife and I? What a bargain!!

I was expecting it to be overpriced and mediocre sushi, but was pleasantly surprised. 
We stopped here with our kids, and they LOVED the concept, so much so that we even got them to try stuff they wouldn't normally eat. So now we can convince them to go out for sushi which is great. They were also eying the desserts as they went by and we used that as incentive for them to eat well.
The maki rolls are pretty Americanized, but whatever, there is something for everyone. And if it's not on the conveyer belt, you can order it off the menu. The service was very attentive and friendly.

This is great for eating without waiting, and getting just as much as you want without over ordering. In the end the bill was very reasonable for what we all got.

I can't wait to come back here even though it's really far away from us, as we live in the city.

This was the first time that I came here, and I LOVE sushi so I walked in with high expectations. The inside of this place was so cute! There was a sushi train that was going around the whole restaurant and you were able to grab anything off the train or order off the menu. I was not feeling adventurous enough to grab anything off the train but I surely ordered off the menu. 
If it says "spicy" on the menu, it is actually spicy, don't take it lightly like I did! But even the spicy roll was amazing even though I don't like spicy food. 

The sushi was good and the desert was AMAZING, 
I would definitely come back and eat off the train next time.

Stopped in for dinner with the husband. This is basically a trendier Sushi Station. And we love sushi on conveyer belts.

The service was great. Our waiter was attentive and on top of clearing our plate toppers.

The only downfall was the sushi pizza. The photo provided in the menu was quite misleading and I did not have any mango on my Adventure pizza. Honestly, with the slice of cheese, tomato, and globs of mayo, it tasted more like a sushi burger.

Otherwise, the sushi was fresh and plentiful. Seaweed salad was great! I'll be back but will skip the sushi "pizza".

Red plate blue plate one plate two plate

.......yellow plate green plate empty plate sadface :(

I happened upon this restaurant during their soft opening several years back, and having returned on 02/13/16 I can say that things seem to have improved greatly.  Better variety of stuff, more diligent service, overall a more polished dining experience, really.

For those of yous unaware, this is the place with the sushi conveyor belt.  Yes, THAT one.  A refrigerated conveyor transports various sushi rolls--along with appetizers like edamame and spinach salad--around a track that snakes through the dining area twice.  If you find yourself fancying a particular roll, you simply open the plastic shutter nearest to you and grab the plated item off the belt.  VoilÃ .

Sushi+ uses a clever pricing system that can totally sneak up on you if you're not making a mental tally as you go (and I mean really, with moving sushi plates going on in front of you, who's got the time to be doing crap like adding numbers together?)  Most sushi items were 4 pieces/plate and were on either red, blue, or green plates.  Each plate color denotes a different price to pay.  White is the cheapest, with things like plain albacore sashimi ($1.50/plate), while purple was the most expensive ($6.50/plate) and had items like dragon roll maki and something called 'white devil', among other specialty handrolls (sidenote: why is it that whenever I hear/see 'white devil', I keep thinking of Ace Ventura When Nature Calls?)

The best plate I had was called 'Snow White' and was shrimp tempura with crab, mayo, avocado and crunch topping.  The 'sunrise'r' was creamy white tuna wrapped in soy bean paper, and the 'volcano' was spicy salmon maki topped with flaming hot cheetos.  That last one was pretty gimmicky, I gotta be honest.  Things like your basic California or Philadelphia rolls [cream cheese, cucumber, salmon] were on green plates, priced at $4.50ea.

What surprised me the most was Sushi+'s selection of desserts.  They had a green tea cheesecake that was thoroughly underwhelming, but the real treats were the CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e and the coconut pudding that made a few passes in front of me before I said "ahhh why the hell not?" and snatched them off the conveyor.  The CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e was a smooth custard with a nice hard top, and although the coconut pudding was far closer to coconut Jell-O it was pleasantly refreshing nonetheless.

The dining area was impeccably clean.  As in, if I dropped a piece of sushi on the ground I'd have no hygienic concerns about picking it up again within 5 seconds and eating it.  Staff maintained a pristine bar for patrons and the general look & feel was just very tidy.  Servers were efficient in refilling my hot tea and in clearing away debris.

Bread = 4.5
Circuses = 5

The bill came to something like $50 and considering the borderline disgusting amount of food I ate, I'd say the pricing scheme was fair.  If you keep a running track of plate colors, then your bill won't spiral out of control, because a hungry date like me can cause that to happen in a heartbeat.

I love Sushi+ and would highly recommend it for lovers of all things maki.  But heed this warning: when your stack of colored plates hits the ceiling, it's probably time to ask for the check.

Oh my gosh. This place is TERRIBLY addicting!!!! I was skeptical and didn't try this place for a while because it sounded like a buffet but really, it is AMAZING!

First off, when I'm hungry, I like to eat ASAP. Here, there is no ordering, just grabbing what you want! The plates are covered and the case is closed as it goes by, so as a bit of a germaphobe, this place keeps their food safe!

Second, the sushi is actually good!!!! I mean, it's perfect for a casual night out!

This is a new fav for my son and me! Fun, casual, and good!

I LOVE SUSHI + ROTARY! This place is addicting! I take my family and friends here even if they don't like sushi. They have a lot of other dishes that non-sushi eaters can enjoy. They advertise and app called "Belly" that you should sign up for if you come a lot. You get points just for checking in that you can redeem for things like a free blue plate for $30 for your check. I use it and I'm almost to getting $30! My mother in law loves their soft shell crab! I can eat here everyday if I could! Service is great here too. Fast and friendly. The atmosphere is all around amazing! So far I've been here on weekdays and weekends and they get busy everytime we visit! I can't wait to come back!

I'm surprised how much I like this sushi restaurant.  I love the concept of the rotary bar as you can choose multiple plates of smaller maki, sashimi, salads, etc.  You also can order off their very extensive menu.  I loved the chuka idako, which is a marinated baby octopus salad, the white devil, the sunrise roll and of course just the fresh sashimi of tuna, red snapper and yellowtail.  The service is quick and friendly.  On Tuesday, they have $3 specials like spicy tuna chips which were yummy or gyoza.  Their desserts are smaller more manageable portions and look good; although we have yet to try them.  My husband and I are taking dance lessons close by, so we come here after our lesson for a mid-week date night.  Love it!

As you can see, I have given this place 2 stars, twice. And since those first two reviews, I have been to Sushi+ about 6 more times, with all them happening within the last two months.

So of course, why did I change my mind?

Well, the main reason I gave this place another chance was mainly because I was starving one day and I was craving sushi bad. And I knew that this was a place I could come to and get my food quickly, while also not looking like a weirdo if I was eating alone. So I gave this place another shot and I had a pretty good experience.

Before, when I wrote my past reviews, I was just a "kid" - granted I am kind of still a "kid" today, but I have a college degree and a real job/steady income so I can afford to spend a few extra dollars here and there now. Back then, I was just looking for the best bang for my buck, and that essentially meant eating at All You Can Eat sushi joints. However, what really convinced me that this place wasn't too expensive when compared to AYCE places was the Tako aka boiled octopus nigiri, which was only 2.50$ for two pieces - which I thought would have cost way more than that. 

For those of you who haven't been to a AYCE sushi place around here, like Sushi City or Sakura, they typically cost around 25$ for dinner after tax and tip. If I were to eat like that at Sushi plus, we'd be looking at around 30-35$. So it's not too much more, and you get a bit more variety here. An example is the Ramen - which taste great and is around 10$. I also love the sushi sandwiches; the Tokyo Sandwich and the Rotary Sandwich. I dont know why but they both taste great. Another thing to note is, if you are a smaller person (I am over 6 feet tall and over 200lbs), eating here where you can pick in portions of 2 or 4 pieces, will be cheaper than eating at a AYCE place because you probably can't eat $25 worth of sushi anyway.

In addition, the conveyor belt style of sushi is also iconic and people love going there just for that. So a nice place to take your friends or date as well.

What bothers me is still the wasabi packets - fresh wasabi would really be a nice touch. That, as well as the cost, is keeping me at 4 stars. But still an improvement. Check it out if you like sushi or japanese food, they have more than just sushi!

What a different concept - you get to pick your sushi while it is rolling around on a conveyor belt! Kind fun and you get to see it before you choose. I also loved the second concept of color coded plates, so it is easy to figure out your dinner total. Came back here a few times, but only now getting around to share my yelp review. Great place to go after work and relax, me and my group came here on Monday nights - was not crowded and we enjoyed it a lot. We all played a prank on a first timer by having them try the wasabi straight up! LOL

I have been here twice now and have really enjoyed both experiences. I came here the first time a few weeks ago for a quick lunch while out shopping, I sat at the bar. I was able to get 4 sushi rolls for $12.  The next time was yesterday, my husband and I went because I wanted to see if he liked the place too. We sat at a booth, I had sushi from the rotary, while my husband had 2 rolls he also decided to order the egg rolls and dumplings. Both were quite delicious. I love this place because it is quick,easy, and good food.

A nice place to hang out with friends, everything is yummy  (or maybe i'm hungry, it might not be a good idea to come here if you're super hungry, because you can build up the plates really fast...). 
Other than the sushi, the baby octopus appetizer and the green tea cheese cake are good too. Will definitely come back !

I have fallen in love again. For a while I'd lost interest in food and could not get the satisfaction from it like before. When I'm here, it all changes and my hear just skips a beat. 

Their customer service is top notch with the right amount of attentiveness. The ladies remember me and that always makes a customer feel welcomed. The gentleman are also wonderful. They know the food well and can describe the taste. That helps because I can be indecisive. 

My favorite dish here is the Hama Kama, Grilled Yellow Cheek. It's just so good with rice and soy sauce. Pair it with salad and it's perfect.  Another great is the Spider Roll. The combination of the crunchy soft shell crab with the avocado and other ingredients all come together really well.  Otherwise their bento boxes are also great. The portion is perfect.

I come here for lunch regularly. I'm not an adventurous sushi enthusiast, so I stick to the standard Californian and Alaskan rolls, which they prepare very well. I've also had the ramen and the fried rice, both are delicious. The ramen comes in a very large broth bowl, so be prepared. I recently started ordering the tuna poke bowls (they have other types as well), and they are delicious! It comes with miso soup, which is always welcome. Very affordable and quick! 

The unfortunate part is that I just ate at Sushi Nakazawa and saw Jiro dreams of Sushi...so the sushi board style restaurant is going to be hard to come back to. :( but this still a great lunch option and is very reasonably priced.

Three stars for the sushi, five stars for the service.

Husband and I decided to try S+RSB on a whim after hearing a few things about it from friends. We went on a Sunday afternoon so it wasn't too crowded. We got a table right away and were greeted with hot towels and tea immediately. We picked a few items off the conveyor belt and munched away.

The taste was decent - not the best by any means but certainly not the worst. Everything was freshly prepared. The servers were always on time and swooping up any covers we took off the plates or any paper trash we made from used napkins, etc. They were the real stars of the show!

Prices were decent for what you get but there are better options out there if you're really a sushi fanatic like me. Great job to the staff though! You'll feel like you're being pampered :)

I've always wanted to go to one of these.

The cousins and I decided to drop by here after a visit to Centennial Beach. Overall it's pretty good value, and once you get the hang of pulling out the sushi from the belt not spilling octopus salad all over yourself, it's actually kind of fun to boot.

I don't remember all of the dishes that I grabbed, so I'll note the ones I remember:

Egg sushi - the cheapest plate on the belt, this one was sweet and tasty.

Oyster shooters - okay, bear with me here. Three shot glasses of raw oyster served with over an ounce of different vinegars.

This. Was. Awesome.

I'm not sure if you're supposed to chew on the oyster. I don't care. It was delicious. Briny, vinegary, lively, worth the purple price.

Route 59 - Because every sushi restaurant needs to name a dish after the street they're located on, this mixture of crunchy, tuna (I think), cream cheese and something hot worked very nicely.

Adventure Pizza - My brother is insane, but this avocado-laden sushi pizza actually tastes good, especially the crispy rice on the bottom.

Some Sort of Soup - best miso soup, if that's what it was, I've ever had. Deep, intense flavored broth with right-sized noodles.

Anything That Comes With That Special House Sauce, Especially Sushi - delicious. A thickly sweet teriyaki sauce with a hair of soy sauce in it, it's used to great effect on one particular dish on the belt.

The servers were very attentive and kept bringing fresh, cold green tea. If you're looking for fresh fish that never stops moving, Rotary is for you.

Fun, quick place to have lunch or dinner or stick around for a while, both work! We dine hear about once a week, in fact, since we enjoy it so much.  A lot of choices and all are wonderful. Our favorites are the crab maki rolls, Godzilla rolls, and the Route 59 rolls. 

Polite, super attentive, staff in a modernly decorated, trendy, and clean restaurant makes this a great place to bring friends and family, or for a date night. We also like how the sushi is freshly made near the tables and then presented on a covered dish that is rotated on a belt that passes right by each table. You just lift the door at your table as you see a dish that appeals to you. A fun way to try new dishes too. It's easy to budget because each dish has a colored ring around the plate which tells you the price. At the end of your meal, the waiter tallies your plates and presents your bill. I wish all restaurants did it this way!

Besides the items on the conveyer belt, there are great choices that can be ordered on the menu too. We especially  enjoy their beef skewers, tokyo sandwich and mango rolls. You can tell that the owners and employees are proud of their restaurant and really want to make their diners happy. They greet you with a polite smile and are genuinely glad to see you. It is located in a small strip mall, but don't let that fool you. Once you enter, you are in your own world. A really great place all around!

First time here. This place is fun and quirky. I was a bit concerned about freshness with rotary sushi, but everything we had was fresh and delicious. I'm impressed. Even the wife enjoyed it. 

One word of caution. This place might seem cheap since they advertise plates for $1.50, $2.50, etc. However, unless you really only want low-end items, the bill can add up real quick. I'm not sure I saw any $1.50 plates.

This is a great way to eat sushi! The food is great, the colored plates make it easy to keep track of what I'm spending (I'm not made of $$), and I'm not intimidated by some of the unique plates that slide by. Wait staff can be hit or miss. Sometimes we get a pleasant server, sometimes they're a little creepy, to be honest. But unless you're ordering a lot from the menu, they only bring you a beverage and the check. I would highly recommend the edamame bowl. A good quantity snack/appetizer for a couple bucks.

Not the best but we are in the suburban....!

We always order w/ the waiters as the conveyor belt doesnt always have the good/better sushi!

The wait staffs are always pleasant!

They price well, probably the only sushi place we go to in Naperville....way better than Sushi Station :)

One of the best sushi restaurants in the burbs. I've been coming here since they opened. Always excellent service and consistent food. They do have a kids menu and vegetarian options. 100% recommended.

We tried to eat here today, left our name and were told ten minutes. Twenty minutes later we asked why people arriving after us were being seated before us. My wife was told our name had been crossed out when they seated someone else. They just told her "sorry".  She then returned to me and told me what happened. We both walked up front and I said " You crossed our name out?" And they said "yes,sorry".  I responded " So someone pretended to be us?"  The two guys at the desk did not try to stop us from walking out. My wife later called to speak to the manager. After a somewhat heated discussion he began to raise his voice, then he hung up on her, because we "were the ones that walked out"

Was very sceptical about going here but figured to try it anyways. I was not let down everything was amazing from the food to the wait staff everything was fantastic. Reasonably priced good atmosphere and all around good time i would definitely return again and again

This place is AWESOME! I was hesitant about trying this place but so glad I did. Great service, staff very friendly! The conveyor belt is the coolest concept! Everything was delicious. Got the meal for two, sushi sampler for $30 which was a great to try everything out. This included soup, salad, multiple sushi samples and dessert. I will definitly go back. The plates on the conveyor belt were marked by price so it was easy to tell the pricing. AND everything was delisious. The interior was very cute as well.

I'll admit I visited this place because of the conveyor belt novelty. I expected fair to acceptable sushi and was greatly surprised that everything I tried was fabulous! The place is clean, sharp, and interesting. The people are friendly and attentive. 
The rotary rookie will catch on quick read the color coded sigh open your sliding door and fetch your delicious dish before it gets away. I was disappointed there are no eel choices but you can order it from the menu. 
I also want to mention this is a great place for the lone diner / business traveler like me. It's entertaining to watch and anticipate as the plates roll by. I want to go back today, do they open for breakfast?
FoodDude!

I thought this was a pretty below average sushi experience.  I think the food is probably more like a 2 star deal, but I had so much fun staring at the rotary belt and reading all of the signs that it has to get the third star.  Seriously, sushi is such a beautiful food.  It's really fun to watch all of the little plates moving past.  Everything comes out immediately, so it would be a great place to go for lunch if the food were just a little bit better (or maybe 20% cheaper). Despite being unimpressed with the food, my husband and I had a ton of fun with this meal.

I don't know if this is a universal thing, but there are some sushi rolls that I have just come to think of as more Americanized (i.e. anything with cream cheese... but seriously they have a roll with cheetos on it) and if you stick to those exclusively, then I think you might actually be in good shape, but avoid the things that rely on the quality of the raw fish.  For example, I tried the red snapper sashimi, and definitely regretted it.  It was a little bit rubbery and mostly tasteless.  The thing that I thought was the worst was the spicy tuna roll - mushy and bland!

We didn't try anything on the menu that you actually have to order, so maybe that's better. I won't be back to try it.

Here's a tip - try to sit as close to the beginning of the belt as possible!  It goes clockwise from the perspective of the sushi makers.

Best sushi I've had in a long time/maybe ever!  (and I've now eaten sushi in 7 states)

We drove an hour each way to eat here and we ended up visiting twice. The first time was on black Friday when they happened to be having a 20% off your bill promotion. I had planned on visiting anyways so this was just a bonus! We arrived and they were packed with a line. They asked if we were okay waiting for a seat at the bar and I told them yes. I was chatting with the lady and I told her I was from Omaha and I was visiting my husband and had been looking forward to eating here for like 3 months. (My husband just completed Boot camp for the Navy Hooyah!) She was just amazed we would drive that far. We sat at a booth in the middle at the bar. The sushi was fresh and they kept it coming fast. The selection was good, and I also ordered some Inari and masago. The only roll I didn't enjoy was the spicy crab, but (funny enough) I'm not a fan of fishy tasting things. The maguro was AMAZING and fresh. I'm a fan of big eye tuna so I looked forward to it. 
We ate a lot (mostly my husband) and we tried many different things. I kept forgetting to take photos because I was just over the moon happy with my sushi. 
The bill came and the same lady I talked with told us they were giving us 25% off instead of 20% because we drove so far. Honestly I think it was because my husband was in uniform, but either way I was appreciative. She also helped me get one of their loyalty cards set up which is pretty cool. 
Well I loved it so much that on my last day there (the next day) we drove back again. The guy (who might be the owner/manager?) was surprised to see us. I told him we loved it so much I had to have it again.
My only complaint would be the lack of maguro slices until when I was leaving, but it's my own fault because I didn't feel like ordering it special. Didn't take any photos this time... too busy eating sushi. Both trips were like $40 bucks give or take. 
Prices compared to everywhere else I've eaten are dirty cheap and usually when you're talking sushi that's not a good thing. It works here. I also found out they DO have sashimi (even though it's not on the menu). As I was leaving and so full I might have to be rolled out to the car I saw tuna sashimi on a purple plate ($6.50) If you eat sashimi you can appreciate how cheap that is. I know what I'm getting next time.

Hopefully I'll be moving to Chicago soon and I can't wait to eat here probably far too often!

Had lunch at Rotary Sushi place near Fox Valley Mall. Interior is very clean and modern.  It was pretty busy during lunch on Friday around 1:00. Server was attentive. They have a good selection of sushi rotating around on this glass enclosed metal belt. Signs and descriptions of the items are large and clear.

I tried a few rolls and ordered tonkatsu ramen spicy with pork belly. The pork belly was grilled and flavorful. Ramen broth wasn't too spicy. Overall very delicious. I have been looking for a good ramen spot in the burbs outside of mitsuwa food court and I think I finally found my place. Will definitely be back!

Better than expected. 

I've been to many of these places in Hong Kong while residing there. Also been to a few in NYC. 

This one does it right, and well. 

Good job!

THE PRICE IS RIGHT!!!!!!! The staff is so friendly and so is the owner! The food is so yummy and already made right when you walk in, so if you're very hungry or in a rush, it's a great place. Even if you have all the time in the world the place is fantastic. It's very clean and very fast service. Ask about their rewards program!!!!

Had a craving for sushi last night, knew they delivered, delivery was fairly prompt within 45 minutes , Sushi was very tasty , but a minimum $35 order fee. When it's just one person that's fairly expensive sushi. Hope they will consider bringing delivery down to $20 or $25.. Wound up being a whole lot of sushi for one person.P.S. oyster shooters we're pretty good, could be real dangerous if you added vodka.

This place is so much fun! I love the fact that you can choose stuff off the rotary or order it for the same price. My favorite is the tamago or egg maki, their California rolls, and a must try is their cooked scallops from the kitchen! This would be a great date night place if you like sushi!

#Yaaaaaaaaassssss

Sushi is awesome.
Appetizers are awesome.
AND THE RAMEN!!!! finally ramen in the southwest burbs.
I am so happy. I have no regrets moving to the southwest suburbs.
And the staff is so accommodating and very hospitable.

Love ! Love! This place. I'm in sushi heaven. They serve just about everything . Nigiri, Agemono etc. Food comes around on a conveyer belt . Choose what you like. Color coded priced plates. You can also order off the menu. Excellent fresh quality of food. Service was right on! And get this! They deliver to your home!

We have been to Sushi + 4-5 times over the last 3 years.  Colored plates indicate cost of each plate.  Its a fun place with outstanding service. The decor is modern and trendy.  Coconut and mango pudding for dessert were outstanding.  We did have a few times that there was nothing we wanted on the conveyor belt.  The solution?  Order exactly what you want!  We found that we can order and while we wait, supplement with the conveyor belt.  This turned out to make a much better experience!  

Just keep track of what you want to spend or you'll suffer sticker shock when the bill comes.  If we take our teenagers, we ususally give them a budget.  They can prioritize and figure out their budget to get the best meal :)

Don't waste your money! Dishonest practices to save money....

Came in about 7:30pm and no sushi going around the conveyor.  We we told since they weren't busy they will not put any out.  A bit disappointed because I have never seen one of these outside Japan.  Think it is Chinese owned. We ordered multiple pieces of nigiri sushi off the menu and other items.  I noticed that the fish was all sliced too thin.  Even the scallops I ordered show a picture of 3 thick full size sea scallops when the arrived I saw what looked like one scallop sliced into 3rds to get three thin pieces.  It tasted great but I showed the photo on the menu to server/manager who told me "do you know how much one scallops costs?  We need to make money too so we cut them." that's is not acceptable to me...  Then raise your prices and serve quality or retake the photo and tell the customers due to cost we have to give you thin or charge you more.  But don't be dishonest about it!
Love their sushi, spicy squid salad, and red bean mochi. They have good ramen too. My daughter loves the beef skewers. This is one of our favorite sushi restauants.
This is my new favorite place for sushi. I eat sushi 2 to 3 times a week. The Sushi is awesome and reasonably priced I will definitely be back.

Like the stars say, I've eaten at much better places.
Tried this place out today. Salmon was good. Tuna was absolutely awful; had a strong spoiled odor to it. You know it's not fresh tuna when you keep burping it up after several hours!
Rotary system took too long for new stuff to come around. 
Most likely will not come back. 
I will stick to my usual places:  Renga Tei in Lincolnwood, IL and Dotombori in Des Plaines, IL.

My family and I come here at least once a week because we like it so much. The food is delicious and fresh, staff is super nice and attentive, and the whole place is clean and very modern looking. It's affordable too! I love sitting at the rotary bar and being able to try different kinds of sushi while not breaking the bank. Also, even if you can't grab a seat by the rotary bar (sometimes there's a wait), their menu has all of the rotary bar items !  I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for quality and affordable sushi, the trendy environment and rotary bar is just a plus!

We used to eat lunch on Saturdays at Sushi Plus, due to my daughter (4 years old) love to eat there her sushi: California sushi and for dessert Moshi, Moshi.
We like the rolling table offering, the staff is friendly, all the food is fresh.
I love the Tokyo Sandwich, my mom usually eats there too: Ramen soup.
A lot of good options in the menu!!!

Blah blah blah... I've had better sushi in (insert big city on the ocean here). You don't come to Aurora for sushi; you come to Aurora for ROTARY sushi! Rotary sushi is hard to come by in the Chicagoland area and my kids were jonesing. A trip to the Paramount Theater brought us to Aurora and Sushi + Rotary Sushi Bar kept us in town for dinner.

Nope, it's not the best sushi I have ever had - not by a long shot. BUT, it is good sushi served on an awesome rotary belt. Beat that, boring sushi restaurants! We got there early enough to get one of the coveted booths adjacent to the rotary and set our kids free. The food was good and the fun of rotary sushi just can't be beat. There is something about stacking up those colored plates that just makes dinner taste better.

The decor was sleek/modern and the service was excellent. There is also a lot of good Japanese food on the menu for non-sushi eaters and you can order sushi items a la carte as well. When life takes us to Aurora, we'll be back for sure.

Seriously who doesn't like conveyor sushi?!  I was estatic when I found out there is another conveyor sushi joint! We've been to Sushi Station a bunch of times but the quality seemed to be getting worse and worse with each visit. Luckily, I had my car and was able to venture out to the burbs for a visit. 

The place is pretty schnazzy inside. Everything is brand new and clean. The restaraunt is pretty open and you are not squeezing around everyone.  They move around the seating I've noticed on different visits. The nice thing is that they've boths along the conveyors. So much easier when dining with groups.  

The service here is great!  I don't think I ever had to ask for a refill and my glass was magically always full. The waiters were very attentive that any trash, wrappers, lids or empty plates were taken away within seconds. In addition to being attentive, the waiters were very nice and happy you are there.  Been here over 3 different times and always had excellent service. I think the service here is better than some of the fancy sushi places I've  been to in the past. 

Now lets talk about dem rolls!!!  The selection of rolls and nigri is pretty darn good.  You can grab off the conveyor or order from the menu.  FYI...They've a sushi pizza that looks pretty cool. The sushi taste fresh and portioned appropriately.  They've a bunch of speciaity rolls and constantly changing the menu up. In addition to sushi, they've added ramne to their menu!

Overall, great sushi spot with stellar service that can please any crowd. You know I am coming back here!

This is my first post and I had to complete a review for this place first! I absolutely love it here. Although I have had better sushi, (not to say the sushi is poor), I just love how fast everything is-walk in they seat you right away, hot towel and water all ready, food ordered from the menu comes out fast, they always have enough plates on the belt and are constantly refilling the belt, and they come and pick up the lids and extra stuff you don't need on your table frequently! On top of that, everyone is friendly and they've got some pretty comfy white booth seats with big TVs to keep you occupied. 

This is my go-to sushi place! Everyone knows I'm here almost every week. I'm saving my points on the belly app for a free roll!

It's always fun to come & take family/friends here - especially the ones who've never been to a conveyor belt sushi bar! Price point is pretty decent & the menu is solid. The interior is super cute & it's generally a trendy place to be. A true gem for the Aurora/Naperville area.

Eating sushi from a conveyer belt amplifies the whole sushi eating experience by a million. I wish there were more of these places around! 

I came by myself with a Groupon for lunch. By the time I made it, it was late afternoon and the place was pretty empty. I was seated right away at a spot at the belt. I presented my Groupon to the friendly server, just to make sure that I was able to order anything that I wanted off the menu and that there weren't any stipulations. She said it was valid for anything off the belt and anything on the menu. Since I'm the kind that has to scope out the menu prior to dining, I already had my heart set on the American Idol roll. I decided to only order one thing from the menu so the rest of the food could come off the belt. I waited and watched everything for about 15 minutes before grabbing just so I could see everything they had to offer. I was surprised there was still a nice variety on the belt even though there weren't a lot of people dining.

I first took the squid salad (green plate = $4.50) This was one of my favorite items that I ordered. Sometimes I feel like it's rice overload when devouring sushi, so I like to get a salad to feel better about myself. The flavors were great and the squid was strangely addicting. Next, my American Idol roll was placed in front of me from the kitchen. This was absolutely heavenly and really huge. Had I not had a minimum amount I needed to spend for the Groupon, I probably would have just ordered that particular roll and the salad. However, to get all of my money's worth - I also grabbed the Snow White Roll off the belt (red plate = $5.50) This one was pretty standard and not my favorite of all the kinds I've tried, but that was just preference. I usually prefer the ones with a little bit more of a kick.

My server was really great about explaining how the whole 'conveyer belt' thing works and she was even nice enough to box up my last roll since I couldn't finish it. 

I wish I would have brought some friends along to experience the coolness of this place with them, but that just means I'll have to make plans to come back here soon.

Had it for take out.  Prices were low so we ordered a lot.  I liked just about everything I ordered.  I was very nice inside the restaurant and I want to go back to experience it.  

Not 5 stars but a solid 4.

Sushi + Rotary Sushi Bar is A-OK. Service is fabulous and I can't fault them at all for that. My usual conveyor belt sushi spot is Sushi Station and so I can only draw a comparison between the two. Sushi + Rotary has less options overall, a few creative options but overall less inventive rolls and the prices are quite a bit higher. Alas, my heart still belongs to Sushi Station.

My buddy and I had:
Japanese green tea $2
Diet Pepsi $2
Beef skewers $3.50
Chicken skewers $3.50
1 Dragon Ballz Nigiri $5.50 - Little balls of rice topped with fish. Cool to get one time but overall more rice than a piece of nigiri should have along with it.
1 Veggie Sushi pizza - interesting concept, liked the crispy rice and it really was interesting having a rice pizza.
4 Yellow Plates $10
2 Blue Plates $7
2 Green Plates $9

$52.30 + tip, of course. Everything I had was decent but I wouldn't call it amazing. I had various rolls like crispy spicy tuna and a dream roll, as well as trying skewers but I thought the best thing of my night was the Veggie Sushi Pizza. 

I wouldn't shy away from eating here again if I had friends interested in but am going to stick to my usual conveyor belt sushi spot.
Great place to grab lunch!! First time here & we loved it! Great service, very friendly & the food was great!
Really cute place. Great customer service. Great sushi! Very clean. My new fav sushi place.

This is our go-to stop for clean, fresh, attractive sushi outside of Japan!

This restaurant is sleek and modern and friendly. The food is always beautiful and delicious - and who doesn't love a sushi "train"? Amazing drinks (kids will love ramune soda!), ramen (new!), and desserts (cannot get enough mango cheese cake!) as well! Prices are incredibly competitive, and in my opinion, incredibly worth it! 

My husband and I have made a pact to eat our New Year's Eve "last year meal" at Sushi + this December!

I can't for the life of me remember my server's name... but lawd she was amazing. I'm a sushi noob (well, extremely unadventerous in the realm of raw fish) and the concept of rotary anything was new to me. My server explained everything, made me feel super comfortable, and is probably the reason why I spent way more than I expected. 

The sushi slowly tantalizes you as it rolls around the track. Plates are color coded so you know the price, and there's little description cards telling you the goodness inside. There's also an a la carte menu if waiting for something you like to roll by isn't your style. 

I got an appetizer, two strawberry ramunÃ©, and probs 3 different plates of sushi and before tip paid around $30. I'll be back the next time my sushi cravings pop back up.
Exactly as the name suggests, sushi on a conveyor belt. Other highlights include ramen

I've had a lot of sushi since living in Chicago, but this is tops in my book. It isn't a buffet, but why do you want to subject yourself to all that rice and stuffing yourself? With Sushi Rotary, you pick from a wide assortment of sushi on a conveyor belt that is filled with freshly made sushi. If there's something you don't see, you can order directly from the menu.

I've gone here three times so far, and each time has been excellent. The seared scallop absolutely melted in my mouth. The same for the rainbow roll. I like that this place doesn't load up on the rice, but really lets the ingredients speak for themselves. The white devil roll was also a nice combination of spicy tuna, avocado, and crab though I'm a bit disappointed that they're using imitation crab instead of soft shell crab.

I'd come here strictly for the sushi. The bento boxes are ok, but I've never been the biggest fan of these. If you're afraid of sushi, these are a consideration. On the other hand, the fish here is not fishy! Good sushi should not smell or taste fishy. I'm glad that I can go back to a place consistent in quality and service (attentive!) when I'm out in Naperville/Aurora.
Love the rotary aspect of this modern looking restaurant. Great for kids and adults alike. Melina is the best waitress/manager of anywhere we go! The sushi is tasty and creative. Great value too.
