Great Sushi restaurant with a a good concept. I have been going here since it opened and have never been disappointed. The Sushi is always fresh there Lunch Specials are great. Its hard to find good sushi in the suburbs, this place does a great job you can order from the menu to take it ready to go. they also have a rewards program for frequent guests. 
The White devil is my favorite.

Will DEFINITELY be back! Went for the first time last weekend with my aunt who suggested it.
I'm pretty picky with Sushi, as I am still a newbie. 

We got the Spider, California, Godzilla,Dragon, and American Idol rolls.
All of them were SO tasty. We each got a pepsi + these rolls and our total was $30.
NOT BAD at all for the price!!!! 

We did not do the conveyor belt seating as it was jam packed on a Sunday at lunch time(1:30), but I am okay with that as I am not that experienced in my sushi eating. :)

Will definitely be back here when in the area.

I went here with my kids and parents. Normally it's hard to find a place to please everyone.  Everyone loved this place. The idea of the conveyor belt was novel for all of us. The sushi, though it wasn't as good as my favorite sushi place, was still good. My dad enjoyed it which is high praise for sushi. The kids ordered bento boxes which were enjoyed also.  Definitely a must do.

National Beer Day! Extremely cute host (don't be creepy), excellent service, tasty sushi, stellar layout and decor, and with that groupon it was a steal. That conveyor belt and privacy was worth the trip and made me feel like I was in Japan. That squid salad could easily be double the price a block from my house! 

OPEN A NEW LOCATION IN THE CITY!!!!!

I love the atmosphere here. Unlike, Sushi Station, you actually have plenty of space when seated next to other people. The wait is not that bad either. There's plenty of tables and booths. The rolls are pretty good. Volcano is one of my favorites, as it comes with flaming hot cheetos on top. Godzilla and dragon rolls are also delicious. They are actually having $1 off the blue plates, I believe, for the month of October. So make sure to check them out!

One of my roommates' and my favorite sushi places. Decent sushi at a good price. Eating in is a lot of fun with the rotary bar. You just select the plate you're interested in from the conveyor belt and get charged based on the color. They also participate in Belly rewards and have great offers.

What a fun place to have sushi!  We came on a Friday night and waited about 15 minutes for the first available spot.  There are 2 seating options - straight across bar style or in a booth.  The decor is very futuristic looking and clean.

You can order off the menu or just start picking out sushi from the conveyor belt.  The sushi/food are on colored plates that represents different prices (white plate = $1.50, purple plate = $6.50, etc.).  There's a plate with the name and description preceding the actual dish so you know what you're picking up.  The options include maki rolls, nigiri, seaweed salad, edamame, mango pudding, etc.  

Here are some of the ones I tried:
Ocean 13 (4 pieces, lobster salad, avocado, crunch top with seared salmon and spicy mayo) - My favorite, has very good flavors.
Volcano (4 pieces) - Good, love the flaming Cheetos on top
Red Dragon (4 pieces) - There was some flavor I didn't like in this one and was glad I didn't have to eat the rest
Sake (2 pieces of salmon) - Disappointing.  Looked good and nice portion, but the actual fish didn't have much flavor
Seared scallop (2 pieces) - Meh
Mango Pudding - Or was it called mango jello?  Not bad.

I would definitely stick with the specialty rolls here.  They have a frequent custom program called "Belly Rewards" to gives you 5 points per visit.  You can use points to redeem a free plate of food or 100 points will get you a $25 gift card.  I saw a bowl of the rewards card by the front door.

Between the 2 of us, we spent about $50 on food and were stuffed.  That's comparable to what we would spend at an AYCE.
Great place; fresh sushi on a conveyor belt. I make it here as often as possible. Friendly, courteous staff, clean spaces to eat and enjoy, delicious food.

Well I was excited when I got there the first appetizer that came out was so good!  The scallop bake.  So good.  The the disappointment starts...   the shrimp poppers were way too sweet.  It was like mayo with sugar on shrimp.  Yuk.  Also my iced green tea was tasteless I had no flavor at all.  The worst thing was the ramen.  Really???  The broth was bad it was a rotten pork smell.  I was horrible.  I almost spit it out.  It was such and awful taste. Wow.  The servers there were terrible too.   Geez.  This place needs help!!
My favorite Sushi restaurant ever! Always clean and accommodating. The food, staff and atmosphere is the best!

I came here on a Tuesday evening with my husband and our brother. You notice the really cool ambience right away (they had me at sushi on a conveyor belt)! We were seated immediately and they gave us warm, damp napkins to clean our hands. Prices range from $1.50-$6.50 per plate of sushi from the conveyor belt, you get around 4 pcs (there's also a choice of different desserts and salads). *Side bar: they had a spicy crab roll topped with flamin' hots which creeped me out, haha! The Godzilla & White Devil rolls were among my favorites. Also the seaweed salad w/cucumber was pretty tasty. We also ordered with our waiter a tempura mix with shrimp, sweet potato, mushroom and one unfamiliar (the batter was so light and fresh), sumo fried rice (had corn in it), and the hamachi jalapeÃ±o (be prepared for the jalapeÃ±os to have a serious kick- but spicy foods are my thing ). Prices from the regular menu are also very reasonable. To drink, we ordered green tea (hot) and a soft drink- the wait staff was very attentive with refilling our drinks that the drinks hardly reached empty the whole time. My favorite sushi experience thus far and one of the best restaurant experiences ever. Definitely would recommend and will also be returning customer!

Most Extreme Sushi Elimination Challenge! 

Starring: Me, AndrÃ©s D, and conveyor belt sushi topped with Flaming Hot Cheetos. 

In the great words of Haru, The Great White Ninja (RIP Chris Farley): "Holy Shinto!" 

It may very well have been the best day of my life. I mean, it's easy to assume I'm being facetious, what with with the combination of fish, dairy-product, and vending machine novelty snack all wrapped up in one roll, but I assure you, I'm dead serious. That (f)ish was gooood. 

By far the best thing that we ordered was the Sushi Pizza, which you won't find on the conveyor belt, you have to order it from their menu and there's 3 different options. We went with the traditional and at only $5.50, it was phenom. 

The conveyor belt experience was what I was most looking forward to and it was a blast to begin with, but having my bestie, Andres D, there and racing with me to grab the plates we wanted was the most fun. It's a test in your reactive time for sure and you've got to be on the ball and keep your eye on the prize. It felt like foodie Disney World... but more fun. And they basically play the soundtrack from the arcade version of Dance, Dance, Revolution... which is only one of my most favorite past times. 

I was thoroughly impressed with the quality of the sushi here. A part of me was worried that the experience would be more about the novelty of the conveyor belt, and that for sure makes up a HUGE part of my excitement about our experience, but the quality of sushi, though not up there with Michelin-rated restos, was better than All-You-Can-Eat sushi place's sushi (and a much better deal here) and better than most standard Midwestern sushi locales. If you're a sushi snob, don't plan on being wowed with the fair, but expect an amazingly fun time with better than average sushi and some creative flair as well. 

As far as sushi I grabbed off the rotary, I was really impressed with my super white tuna nigiri. It was super fresh a majorly generous cut, and just melt in your mouth stellar. I don't often do nigiri when I go out for sushi, but for places I have tried, Rotary had the best super white tuna. The spicy scallop roll was also the best I'd ever had of that sort. It had avocado in it but I could still taste the scallop and the spice was definitely in there, which was a nice change of pace because normally when I get that other places it's not spicy at all and I end up being disappointed, but not here. 

Our servers were on it. Andres and I must have gotten 40 refills on our hot green tea and they were always on hand to remove the plastic covers form our many rotary sushi pulls, that would've otherwise really piled up. 

Andres and I normally do All-You-Can-Eat sushi places for lunch and the pricing usually runs around $16-$25 per person. Here, our bill was $35 TOTAL, for both of us, and we left stuffed. Like whoa. We wasted nothing and everything was fresh. We did arrive right at 11:40, only 10 minutes after they'd opened, so I think we got the best selection possible based on our timing, but there was no point where your rotary options dwindled, though the plates and option did change in the hour or so that we were there, so if you see something you really need to have, grab it, but if you do happen to miss something you want, you can order it off the regular menu for yourself for the same price as it would have been, and it'll just take 5-8 minutes more. 

I literally just text Andres about going back this week. Our experience was a blast and everyone who worked here was eager, smiling, knowledgeable... I'm so excited to have this new addition to the Aurora/Rt 59 strip... it's (and I might be crazy saying this) worth sitting in the god-awful and perpetual Rt 59 traffic/construction/mayhem for... but obviously if you have the option to take any way but Rt 59, do that, because that sh*t is insane.

I like the concept of a Rotary Sushi Bar in Naperville, but even at noon time, the sushi didn't taste very fresh. Plus most of the items were made with imitation crab meat and catered to the American Sushi style of adding cream cheese and even one with flaming hot cheetos. The scallops we ordered on the side tasted good but not where I would go for quality sushi (though it probably isn't trying to lure in that population anyway). Gimmicky, good for kids or those seeking an intro to sushi only.

I have only been here once for lunch, but based on that experience I'll be back sometime.  I know that conveyor belt sushi is often not the best idea, but I am a total sucker for it.  It's just so fun to see the sushi going around and around.  This one is a little more sanitary than others I've been to because of the doors that separate the diners from the sushi.  Plus, the plates have covers over them.  So, the appearance of the place is definitely clean and neat.  

The sushi itself is pretty good, particularly because it's conveyor belt and the prices are so reasonable.  Against my better judgment, I ordered some nigiri to try based on the comments about good fish quality.  They were not bad, but certainly can't rival a much better (and much more expensive) sushi restaurant.  I tried escolar, marinated salmon, and saba.  The escolar and salmon weren't bad, but I wouldn't get the saba again--it was over marinated and a little tough.  I also tried some maki sushi that was pretty good.  They definitely have a lot of the Americanized type with a gazillion ingredients and sauces.  There was even one topped with flaming hot Cheetos when I was there!  I am more of a minimalist, but I am not too much of a snob to admit that Cheetos on sushi might taste good, though it's kind of silly (didn't try it this time, though).

Service was very friendly and prompt.  I went with a friend and they did separate checks for us, but only took one Groupon for the table.  I"ll definitely go back to try some of the items that you need to order off the menu.

Cool concept or idea/ rather poor quality of sushi. 

Been here once.... Probably won't be back. Just wasn't a fan for the money. Have had better sushi for the kind of money.

So we came back to dine "in" and the experience was as good as the take out. Unfortunately the rotary area was jammed when we got there on a Friday night, but they had other seating right away for us. Yeah! The service was fast and friendly, we had several sushi rolls and they were excellent, price was right. The atmosphere is bright, clean and lively. The only downside here is there choice of alcoholic beverages, they only have Japanese imported beer, which I notice a lot of sushi places have. You'd think in this day of craft beer craziness they'd have a few of those. They also only have bottles of wine, no by the glass wine... girlfriend didn't like that. They do offer sake, although neither one of us cares for it. We're definitely going back!

A great place for lunch! Monday through Wednesday they have cheap small plate appetizers. They have a conveyor belt of sushi that are on plates that indicate their price. They also have a full menu of sushis that may or may not be on rotation and entrees. They also have bento box lunch specials. I have had the tonkatsu ramen. It was pretty ok. Not great or bad, just good. Super convenient and a good price (depending on your appetite!)

Is it just me, or is this about the most fun you can legally have in Naperville/Aurora? Okay, my life is a little bit unexciting at times, but for me, this was a pretty exciting night. 

I loved this experience 100% and my wife and I already have plans to return another time. Now, admittedly, I found out about it from Andres D. and Candice G. who held an epic sushi throw down and Yelped about it. 

So we tried it this past Saturday night and it was just as awesome as they said. Conveyor belts that wound their way through the dining room with small plates of sushi (usually 4 pieces, but some had 2), incredibly attentive servers (we ordered one dish off the menu- the beef & asparagus yakitori - amazing!) and a fun experience (when you see something you like, you open the little doors on the dome over the conveyor belt and grab it). The prices are determined by the color of the plate, and everything is pretty much under $7. 

You can have a little or you can have a lot. Being the pigs that we are, our meal was fairly expensive, but no worse than going out to any normal priced sushi restaurant. And due to my wife's fin-fish allergy, this way she was able to see exactly what she was about to eat without worrying about something she can't have. The descriptions of each plate roll by on a little sign prior to the actual dishes themselves. Totally user-friendly. 

The sushi was fresh, the prices were decent, service was awesome. Looking forward to a return trip.

We eat at Rotary at least once a week. The staff knows us, and caterers to us with attentive and welcoming service. We generally order large amounts of sushi directly from the kitchen and pick our maki-rolls from the conveyer belt. The place is fun, and it reminds me of the sleek sushi houses in Asia. Over the prices are extremely affordable compared to sushi restaurants in the area. I highly recommend Rotary.

http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g29297-d4854292-r296903706-Sushi_Rotary_Sushi_Bar-Aurora_Illinois.html#

This is the first sushi bar that I have been to that has all of their sushi placed on a conveyor belt.  It is so cool and such eye candy that I take my friends and family with young kids for their birthdays and for a nice enjoyable meal.  They all get a kick out of it!  

When I first heard of it, I was kind of turned off.  I had questions---like what if nobody wants the sushi on the belt, does it just keep revolving around until it's...gulp...spoiled???  No qualms!  The conveyor belt is in a refrigerated clear plexiglass tube that is enclosed, so no real reason why anything would spoil.  Each table has it's own "door" to open into the tube, and that's where you can self-serve your own plates of sushi.  I love how each dish is "labelled" with a sign that tells you what it is.  They certainly do know how to make each dish appetizing looking!  The dishes are each color-coded so that you know the price of each.  At the end of the meal the server will come by and add up your total that you own.

There is also a hot menu with skewers of beef and chicken, and also combo meals that you can order.  I personally prefer the chicken as I feel the beef is a bit tough the way they cook it.  All of the sushi items can also be ordered from the server off of a menu if you don't see what you want circling before your eyes.  Finally, various cheesecakes are offered too and they are located on the conveyor belt for you to peruse as you eat your meal.  

The food here is fun!  The atmosphere is fun!  It is nice a contemporary & modern-looking and clean.  No worries!  What better way to enjoy a meal with friends & family???

It's fun to eat here and convenient 
Service is good, they are always cleaning

White plates- $1.50
Yellow plates-$2.50
Blue plates-$3.50
Green plates-$4.50
Red plates-$5.50
Purple plates- $6.50

I like the idea of having sushi rotating around and grabbing it
But it's quite dangerous bc prices add up quickly.

We came when they first open and ever since! The wait can be long on wkends but we normally just sit in the back and order so we don't have to wait too long. Everything that's on the belt can be ordered. Sushi is really good, love the "grand fatty salmon". We always get 3-4 orders each time! I also love the chicken wing yakitori, and try the "white devil", it's amazing :) 
Had the ramen once when they first added it to the menu during the winter time but it was okay. Little too salty, nothing spectacular. Didn't satisfy my ramen craving.

For the longest time I had thought that the two Sushi Stations were the only conveyor belt sushi options in the Chicagoland area. Then in the span of a couple weeks I find out about this place and that Kampai in Elk Grove has it too. I had been to conveyor in Seattle and LA and was longing for a similar experience here.

Sushi + Rotary Sushi does it for me. At Sushi Station I've experienced things like no food on the belt and icy salmon. Fun but way too inconsistent. Rotary has a clean but fun modern feel, helpful staff and surprisingly good quality sushi. Also the chefs were diligent about keeping the line stocked even though it was only lunch. Sushi-wise, I'm usually wary of mackerel, but here it was fresh and not too metallic tasting. The smoked salmon was also great and probably my favorite plate.

I've been to Sushi Para all you can eat far more times than I can think of, and while it's not unlimited at Rotary, I was still satisfied for the same price and with better tasting food. If only they'd open one closer to the city...

Super cool sushi place, would definitely come again! Recommend sitting at the rotary belt because it's a very unique experience. The plates are priced differently and you can take whatever looks good off the belt. They have a hot Cheeto sushi that was really good  the tonkotsu ramen is also superb. The place is clean and was extremely fast on a Friday night. Overall great place to eat

Our new favorite sushi place!! I have always been a fan of Rotary bar sushi places because of the smaller portions and large selection. We used to go to one in Arlington heights which is closer to our house but the longer drive is totally worth it!!

What a fun place! I was new to conveyor belt sushi, but my husband was apparently in-the-know.  I love that you can try samples of all different kinds of sushi and not commit to just one or two items. :)  Everything here was tasty and fresh, and served slightly colder than room temp. Sushi and drinks are reasonably priced, but it definitely adds up when you can take whatever cruises past your face. The servers are very attentive, but for me, maybe a little too attentive. I was asked by 3 different people if I wanted more wine within a minute and a half. That's where they lose a star. The restaurant is super cute and modern, sparkly clean too.

If you're a parent to two toddler like me and time is a valuable resource, This place is great because the sushi is right there, hardly any waiting time to get your food. You can get in and out fast and kids just love the "sushi train". Oh and all the plates are plastic so no worries about breaking a restaurant expensive pottery ware from japan. 

My kids love the udon noodles which comes with tempura and they also love the beef yakitori, sometimes my two year old will eat some raw fish too! (Not more than 1 PC)

Sushi pizza is fun! And the tuna tataki is very fresh, get the dragon balls! So cute and fun!

Not fan, I felt like the sushi was poor quality (fell apart once we grabbed it). We also ordered the beef yakitori and gyoza, both of which we thought were more all presentation and no taste. If you are looking for novelty it might work but if you're looking for a good meal move on.

I've been going here for about a year. They've definitely stepped up their menu and service since I started dining here. 

What I like about this place is the rotary. You can go and eat real quick and leave. If you like sushi you can get it pretty cheap too and if you go for maki it's still priced fairly. I also like how you can use the belly app here and use it for free plates and even gift cards.

One downside of having the rotary is I saw a kid with his family he dropped sushi on his table and put it back in the rotary. This is why I gave 4 stars, someone should have noticed this and removed it from the rotary. I couldn't have figured out which roll it was based on my seat but it's just not right. 

Overall, I do recommend this place and if you don't want to eat from the rotary you can still order the food at no additional charge which is nice. 

Favorites:
Maguro 
Sake 
California 
Snow White roll
Awesome sushi! Good flavors and special rolls. The rotary sushi bar is such a cool experience. We come here all the time. Its our favorite place.

2nd visit and not disappointed !

Great Sushi ... Good service

The dragon roll was great.
Grilled scallops - outstanding
Ramen noodles did the trick as well

This is the place I fell in love...with sushi. I highly recommend this place if you're willing to try something new & it's good to try new things. It's decently priced for tasty sushi. There are good vibes from this place. Oh, and the music that played over the speakers was killer!!

Place is great. Weekend service is amazing!
Try the Tokyo sandwich and the red bean mochi!

I have been here a few times and would recommend this place. The actual space is cool and the getting to pick your rolls off the conveyor belt is fun. The sushi is pretty good. I like the snow white roll, sake salmon, scallop, the sushi pizza and the creme brulee. I will for sure being going here again.

I am not a sushi connoisseur so this is the place I like to go to. I can see it on the rotary bar and share things and go at my own pace. However, tonight I found out that this places closes the kitchen before 9 despite the place being opened until 10. So if you want anything you have to order it on the menu. I was not excited about that. And the way we found out was when the rotary belt was empty we had to ask about the food. And we were told they closed the kitchen except for menu orders. Just very disappointed.

It's probably the best sushi bar around. Not that there's a lot of options around but even so. I sat with a Japanese family one time and even they had good things you say. The place is unassuming from the outside. It's clean and the staff are all authentic and friendly.
I've been back here a lot.

Been here weekly and have only had one problem. While dining in the server forgot to put in my dessert order and then pretty much ignored us from then out. Whatever, food was still good and the hostess (malena) is so awesome that it made up for the bad service. I will continue to come here!!
No complaints, their stuffed pizza is great and they do not give it luke warm instead of hot.

Had a stuffed pepperoni and spinach pizza. Was to die for! Maybe my new favorite! The sauce yummo, the ingredients were perfect and fresh not frozen. The butter crust was crisp but not overdone or dry and tasteless. Great pizza! Excellent improvement over our last visit to this to go place restaurant.

After hearing for about a year how great Lou's is? In Chicago for the first time I had to try it. My daughters boyfriend is from Chicago, and she has visited this area twice now. So her boyfriend has taken her here a couple of times and she loves the place. since all I have heard from my daughter how great it is. I had to come by and try it. I order the Chicago deep dish special, it was very good! I loved the crust, cheese, and the fresh tomatoes. Sauce is good, but had better. The  pizza was great, I can not complain. Before I return home. I will probably come by again. Customer service was awesome. Had to wait a little for the pizza, so the best thing to do is call the order in. I have to say the pizza is in my top three. Excellent food.
My go to order: Deep dish Lou with sausages. Typing that out made my mouth water. I'm craving it. I'll see you soon, Lou.

We had only one thing to check off on this Chicago trip. A Chicago style deep dish pizza. So we ordered a vegetarian pizza and a small sausage pizza from this joint. 

*Back story* We were once given a frozen small Lou Malnati pizza couple of years ago. One of our colleagues from Downers Grove had family visiting and got a few boxes for all us mid west migrants. It was very delicious and that was the reason behind trying this pizza out during our trip. 

We ordered delivery. Pizza was delivered within an hour and it was extremely hot to touch. The pizza was devoured by our hungry toddlers and family. We managed to complete both the pies in half an hour. The crust was a tad bit too crunchy/hard for my liking. I think Tony's Little Italy in Placentia, CA is better than this pizza's?

We ordered the thin crust with sausage, mushrooms, green peppers, and garlic WOW! this was an awesome pizza, of course after eating it you couldn't go out in public not after all that delicious garlic mmmmm we all stayed home and just spoke Italian, Amore

Lou Malnati's is my all time favorite deep dish pizza but on this date and at this location I picked up a pizza that has left me thoroughly disappointed! This pizza was simply not that good at all!! The tomatoes were severely lacking and the crust and ingredients didn't taste very fresh! Good deep dish pizza is hard to find where I live! I was so looking forward to enjoying my favorite pie and also introducing it to my fiance for the first time....she's even more disappointed than myself!  I'm not giving up on Lou's but very likely to not order from this location again!
Favorite Chicago style pizza. Always on time and reasonable prices. Can't go wrong with the Chicago classic.

This was my last meal before exiting the charming greater Chicago area!
I rate Lou Malnati's in Bolingbrook, IL a 4.5 but, will give a 4.0.

Solid, tasty pizza!  The thin, butter crust was a little bit more than I thought it would be compared to another Chicago deep dish eatery but, it works.  Pepperonis were on the top (and that's fine) and not blended  in like the other establishment I had tried that week.  Absolutely scrumptious cheese and spinach--also layered.  
All was tasty but, I was not completely wowwed that I'd give a perfect rating. 

My family had picked up the deep dish pizza and brought it back home so I didn't get a chance to view the eatery itself.  When we return to Chicago, we will definitely return.  Perhaps the next slice would be the wow!! slice or slices.  Thanks LM!

Location is very accurate when order will be ready.
I love ordering the Lou and the lou salad.
Everyone is friendly.
I have no complaints!

Not my favorite.  Pizza Hut's pizza was thicker than the pizza I got last night.  I ordered the personal pan Chicago style.  The waiter confirmed it was Chicago style and it was about 1/4 an inch thick...overcooked as well.  Now the people I was with ordered a small pizza and it was over an inch thick. So maybe it's just their personal pan pizzas.  Last time we went I got the thin crust and it was dry and overlooked also.  The salad was good with their house sweet onion. I might go back one more time to try a bigger size pizza.  If third time is not a charm it will be my last time there for pizza.

Pizza perfection!   Delivered to a local hotel - took about an hour but the pie arrived hot and to schedule. Friendly and personable driver.   Always love to crack a Chicago deep dish when in town, and I've always found Lou's to be top of the heap.  World Series on the TV . .. Lou Malnaties in the room... wife 2000 miles away.  Heaven.

Quite possibly the worst pizza I've ever eaten. Paid $30 for an extra large sausage with delivery. The whole thing had about 5 pieces of sausage on it and it was disgusting. Sauce was bad, cheese tasted old and rancid. I wish I had went to little Caesars abd just picked up a $5 ready made pizza

I'm such a fan of their thin crust pizza. Tried the buffalo wings for the first time and they were very meaty. Not too spicy and appreciate the good supply of celery on the side. Delivery gal is super nice and courteous.

If I do order a deep dish, it has to be from Lou's. I'm old school thin 99% but every now and then I get the urge. I never laughed so hard when Mark Malnati showed up on Jon Stewart's The Daily Show, classic!

http://thedailyshow.cc.com/videos/g4hb45/strife-of-pie---a-pizza-truce
Ordered the deep dish and this is where Lou's shines. I'm typically a thin crust fan, but when in the mood for deep dish, glad to have a Lou's so close by!

By far one of my favorite spots for pizza in these United States . Ingredients are always fresh and copious amounts are placed on your pizza. Service is courteous and prompt  with fast friendly delivery.

The pricing of this establishment is essentially quite cost prohibitive and I only opt to order from there on special occasions when budget allows. I wish they were able to lower their prices and maintain the same quality. I feel that this chain relies too much on brand recognition as a basis to inflate the price of their product which will eventually catch up with them.

Went to a different location last time I was in Chicago and knew I had to come again when I was back. Best pizza in town and the staff was extremely friendly- they even brought it to me when I said I was going next door to Starbucks while I waited for it to be ready!

I like Lou Malnati's pizza, don't get me wrong, but I'm rating this location 2 stars because of how my pizza was handled. I ordered carry out, I picked it up and brought it home, very excited to dig into some great deep dish pizza. However, when I opened it, I was disappointed to see that whoever put the plastic cover to I guess keep it warmer had managed to pull the toppings completely off of one half the pizza and pulled them to the other side. I literally had half the pizza with crust and very minimal toppings on it. Needless to say, I won't be ordering from this location again.

Update: The Malnati's customer service team reached out to me and made it right by sending me a gift certificate for a free pizza. I certainly appreciate them doing it and will give them another shot at this location.

Today we enter the Highly controversial realm of pizza.  I would not be surprised to learn that wars have been fought  over the various kinds of pizza. On one side you would find the thin Quickly cooked New York style against  the deep dish Chicago style pizza.  On the different front you would find the fans of the mid western crispy crust pizza that may have originated around Saint Louis.   I avoid the whole argument by saying that all these Pizza's are different dishes under the general heading of Pizza and the best type is the kind want at the time.  This week, I was on a business trip to Bolingbrook , so I ordered a Delivery pizza from Luo Malnati's.  I just want to say it was a pretty life changing experience.  I can only judge the restaurant by the food and by the friendly way it was delivered.  I ordered fairly early knowing that these guys were pretty famous and it might take a while to get my pizza and they told me up front that it would be about an hour before i would get my delivery.  About  an hour later the delivery person showed up with my pizza.  It was piping hot and ready for me to eat.  The pizza itself was wonderful.   Close to a quarter inch of cheese covered the top of the delicious buttery crust  and the sweet Italian sausage on top of the cheese was meaty and perfectly seasoned.  Topping the sausage was a delightful tomato sauce that wasn't too sweet and wasn't too acidic. Sometimes, i find that tomato sauces can have too much acid.  I am usually not inclined to eat the outside crust or "pizza bones" as my family calls them. But the crust was so delicious i finished the whole slice with relish.  My stomach was full after the second piece but ate a third because the whole thing tasted so good.  My daughter lives in the north western Chicagoland and was familiar with Luo Malnati's.  Now that I have had one of their delightful pizzas, i'll be back.

I think this is one of my favorite pizza places around (not including several located in Chicago). The pizza is to die for. I've only tried their thin crust (butter crust) and the deep dish and both of them are amazing. Lou Malantis is my family's go-to friday night pizza place.
Helpful staff and they Wanted to go above and beyond to make the order right!  Service with a smile and great food too.
We always order delivery from here. The pizza is always delicious and we've never had any issues. Best pizza around!

I grew up in New Jersey, so the thin crust weird stuff people in the Chicago area eat and call pizza is pretty nasty to me. I'm all about New York style pizza. I wasn't even the hugest fan of deep dish after moving here. But I have to admit, Lou Malnati's made me a believer and now I have a hard time deciding if I like Lou's or my native pizza better. They're two completely different styles, but they're both awesome. Lou's has a thick, buttery crust and it's got the exact right amount of toppings. None of the other deep dish pizza places can even compare. My favorite toppings is the Giardiniera, it gives the pizza an awesome kick. I also love the garlic spinach. I do wish they had a pineapple pizza - but they do say all over their boxes that "Lou doesn't do pineapple!" Ah well, everything else makes up for it.

I've only picked up orders from here, no delivery, but it's the Lou Malnati's quality you expect. I was so excited that they opened a location in Bolingbrook because before we had a little hike to Naperville to get this pizza. 

Good on you, Lou. You turned this Jersey kid on to Chicago style pizza.

Thank you for opening this location.  I like buying the frozen pizzas to go, and they have "The Lou" variety available now in frozen form for $13.10.  "The Lou" is an amazing vegetarian pizza.  It has mushrooms, spinach, garlic, tomatoes, and a three- cheese blend.  The only noticeable absence was I didn't taste the butter crust that I get when I have it in person at a full-service Lou's.

I was told when I was there that they will be opening 20 more locations in the near future with the goal of having 50 locations open by the 50th anniversary of the restaurant.

My votes for new locations: Plainfield, Shorewood, Joliet, or Morris.

This is some awesome pizza. They are consistent, the customer service is good, they don't mess up your order by leaving your pizza in for too long or too little, and they don't "forget" to put certain toppings on your pizza. Overall, this is the best deep dish around, and I'm so happy I don't have to go all the way to downtown Naperville for it!

Lou Malnati's Pizzeria is the BEST pizza around. Friendly customer service and always with a smile when you go in for it. One of my favorites is Lou's Special.  OMG!!  It's so delicious. The way they lay the sauce, cheese, and ingredients on it...Hmmmm... Making me hungry just typing this.  I shall be back soon.
Amazing, unique Chicago-style deep dish pizza. I order from here all the time and have never had a bad pizza. Make sure to get the butter crust!
Not the best Lou Malnati's but it definitely lives up to the experience.
Over-rated !!!  Largest pizza is 14" for the same price of an 18" anywhere else.  Go to Salerno's.  It's so much better.  Lou's will never see me again...rip off !!!!

This is a take out location only, but it's the awesome, quality Lou Malnati's pizza we have all come to love and expect!  They do have a few frozen "take and bake" selections available to purchase at this location too.  We've actually pre-ordered a few of these to bring to re-located family around the country when we travel.  Always a big hit!

This was my first time ordering delivery from this Lou's and I am sadly disappointed. 1) The person taking my phone order was rather rude. 2) The driver attempted to delivery to the wrong unit in my townhouse. He did call me whem the other family said they did not order pizza, which was nice, but it would've been nice to know that he was coming to my garage instead of my front door!!  3) After all this we were left with cold, tasteless pizza that my husband threw out... and he never refuses food!!!  Long story short, we  will not be ordering from Lou's anytime soon!!

Amazing, can't believe that Lou's has come so close to home. We used to make a pilgrimage to Elk Grove back in the day before the Naperville store opened and Naperville is good but the parking on a Friday Night? 
The Chicago Style Pan Pizza is GREAT, also ordered a salad that lived up to Lou's reputation. In our wildest dreams we never thought that they'd deliver to Romeoville. BEST pan pizza in the area!

I just wanted to send a follow-up to my previous review.  We decided to give Lou's another shot and it was much, much better.  The service was fast and accurate, the food was very good.  The crust was nice and crisp and they did not water down the pizza with a lot of sauce.  Overall we will repeat.  I am glad we gave them another shot.

I've always had a good experience at this location.  The people behind the counter are friendly and my pizzas have always been delicious and exactly as ordered.  The Malnati salad is the best with their sweet dressing.  I also pick up a few of the frozen pizzas for an easy weeknight dinner and the quality, for a frozen pizza, is excellent.  Sometimes they have the half-baked pizza which also cooks up very nicely at home.  So glad they opened in this location as it's super convenient to pop in.

For the past 10 years or so, it's been a family tradition to go to the Clubhouse every time I visit them in Chicago.  This restaurant holds a special place in my heart; the first time I went to the Clubhouse was the day after my brother got married.
My favorites from the brunch buffet are the omelets that are cooked by a very nice Mexican man; he does it right in front of you, every time I go he always knows who I am, and says hi.  I also love the roast beef, shrimp, pastas and eggs benedict.  They have a big selection of desserts.
The service is always good.  The buffet prices are more than what I'm used to for a buffet, but it doesn't hurt my wallet since I only go once every year or two.
Our next Chicago trip is in April, and of course I'm looking forward to make more memories in the Clubhouse.

Attended a birthday party where they reserved one of the private dining rooms.  We had a shortened menu to choose from but the food was really good.  

The servers were very professional and attentive to our needs.  

The only issue was the lack of parking due to being in a mall as well as the valet seemed to be MIA.  I am a fan of valet parking for nice restaurants and was disappointed that I needed to park on the far end of the parking lot.

The Clubhouse is a place we come sometimes when we're in Oakbrook and can't decide what to have or don't feel like walking all the way to the other side of the place to get something different.  There's a lot of seating, though a lot is reserved in the late afternoon and evening.  

The menu is standard fare for an "American" restaurant.  Large salads, steak, fish, chicken, etc.  The food is good, though a little expensive for something so typical.  The drinks are kind of pricey and the Bloody Mary was not spicy, as advertised.  I got one and was really disappointed.  Sigh.

The Clubhouse is a good place to go if you have a large group, want to meet friends, and want something slightly less expensive than the Greek place.  The decor makes The Clubhouse seem super fancy but most people just wear jeans, even for dinner, and it's fine.  There's space to reserve for large groups and parties, I could see this being a decent place for a rehearsal dinner or bridal shower.

Wow what a disaster. I made it clear that I am gluten free, ordered off the gluten free menu. Once my food arrived. I again asked if it was gluten free they said yes. After i started eating. they came back and said no the sauce is not gluten free. I had already eaten part of it. So yes I got sick. Second. they brought me my next course and it had gluten on it. Disaster. Even the manager walked over. 3 times a charm. NOPE. i ordered fish. It was so over cooked i could not even eat it. Response from Manager. "we will take all this off your bill' Really, you made me sick, did not give me one thing i could eat and your not going to charge me. Stupid response. Sorry but this place is not gluten free friendly.

I really enjoyed the space and atmosphere. It was very conducive for the work meeting that we had, and the staff was very friendly and accomodating.  The appetizers and drinks provided were right on time, and all of our guests really enjoyed the ambiance.  I would absolutely show up again.

I really liked the vast menu of this place and its Cheesecake Factory-like atmosphere. Portions were generous also, which made it more so like the famous chain. I ordered the salmon salad, which was a great healthy dinner option. I was very satisfied with my meal. The service could have been a little better, but everyone was nice and accommodating. My server was fairly new and just didn't know a lot about what she was doing. That being said, it was a nice solid pick of a restaurant at the oak brook mall!

Have not had meatloaf and ears and then glad I waited for this! Wonderful presentation very good. My wife had the salmon BLT sandwich which was also large, flavorful, and perfectly prepared.

Good value, wonderful atmosphere.
Great place to eat. Has the best Calamari. They have good variety of salads. Good sitting place. Valet parking. Great appetizer to start with. Love this place.

Yaaaas in my Wendy Williams voice. They did not disappoint. We had brunch on Sunday 11/13. This was my first time but my boyfriend has been here before. Great food and good service.  There was a group of ladies celebrating a birthday near us - they were pretty loud I mean way over the top. Some of the wait staff were even giving them looks. I'm very surprised an employee or mgr didn't speak to them. We were in the upstairs room, but besides that everything was very nice. We will come back.

Our go place for celebration meal!!  

Get the lamp chop if they has it as special.  
Lunch salad and lobster bisque are in good portion, fresh and tasty.  
The Sunday brunch is awesome.  Our favorite are the prime rib, crab crawl, oysters, banana walnut french toast.  This place is crowded so be sure to make reservation.  The staffs are well trained and professional.  Most have been there for a long time.  We are minority and always feel comfortable with the staffs there.  
The celebration is extra special when they bring you a ice cream puffs with candle and take your photos for the wonderful memories.

I really enjoyed my meal here. The venue is very elegant and I almost felt under dressed when I came in. The service is impeccable, I noticed a very nice function room/private dining room that looked like it would be good for private events. I got the penne vodka with shrimp. Large portions and very tasty. PLEASE try the fries! Wish I could go back!

Another place that I've been telling myself that I need to go - and now finally did! A $20 off appetizer / dessert deal from the "Taste of Hope" event was helpful encouragement, but I was also in the mood for a decent dinner when I went as well.

And a decent dinner it was. Sat at the bar as I was up for a drink or two - service there overall was pretty good and pleasant, though the food was a little slow to come out of the kitchen. Discovered a crab cake appetizer and figured that would be the best use for my freebie. I was right - one of the best crab cakes I've had anywhere, just the right amount of sauce on the dish and cooked to a nice crispiness, yet was very moist when I dug in.

A great selection of entrees to choose from, but the Jambalaya is what caught my eye. Jambalaya is one of those dishes that I rarely if ever go "looking for", but if I see it on a menu, I usually order it. Glad that I did - flavorful Andouille sausage, shrimp - without tails - and chicken cooked in Cajun spices. When delivered, it didn't look very large, but as I dug in, I discovered that it was a pretty hearty portion. 

One thing I did notice... an elderly couple came in around 8:45 and waited at the host stand, unattended. Finally after about five minutes, it appeared that they had come in with the intent of ordering dinner, but were turned away - too close to 9PM?  Not entirely certain of the situation as I did not hear the conversation, but if this was the case, that's not right. If it says 9 "on the door", then that's what it should be.

This place tries really hard to appear as a fancy restaurant. It's not, far from it, actually. Went there for their Brunch. And for $35/person buffet, expected there to be some quality food. Extremely, mediocre, food is what I got. Definitely not worth the insane price tag. The English muffins the Eggs Benedict were on has the consistency of jerky. The seating arrangement was awful and clearly set up by an incompetent idiot. Our table of 7 had 3 seats backed into a corner, and a 4th extremely close to another table. So if any of those 4 people needed to get up, almost the whole table had to, for them to get out. The bus boys were not very attentive, every time we needed water we had to flag them down. For the ridiculous price they charge, they should do a much better job checking on patrons. Overall very frustrated and disappointed. Only way I'm going back is if I get paid to go back.

We have been going here since The Clubhouse opened and had not been there in a while, went to brunch last week and were surprised to see the dilapidated condition the restaurant is in. Even just replacing the frayed carpet and paint would be a big improvement, needs a renovation.

I am writing this review for the Christmas Brunch. Of course I am writing this review from my living room couch as i am still digesting my food from The Clubhouse. The Christmas brunch was my first time visiting the Clubhouse and I thought it was a great unconventional place to spend some of Christmas. 

Our waitress, was a little under the weather, so service wasn't a 10, but she did very well under the circumstances. She was very apologetic for some of the small issues during our meal, and I appreciated that. 

The food options were plentiful for both meat eaters and vegetarians, but more so for meat eaters.  They offered some pretty good salads, cheeses, chilled seafood, pastas, carving stations, breakfast foods, and many desserts. By many desserts, I really mean that there was almost every dessert you could ever want.  The whole spread was pretty impressive, but I would expect nothing less for almost $50 a person. Thumbs up to the Clubhouse for providing a wonderful Christmas brunch experience.

My mom and I decided to go out for Thanksgiving this year since it's just the two of us and one of us (me) doesn't eat turkey. I've been to The Clubhouse before for a private work event; the food was good and it was well executed, so it seemed like a good choice for us.

The Thanksgiving buffet menu is great; there's something for everyone (except maybe vegans). There were traditional sides and fixings, prime rib, ham, raw bar, pasta bar and much more. We weren't sure how many people went out for Thanksgiving, but at 4 the place was packed, without seeming chaotic.

We dined upstairs and I have no complaints. Serving dishes were frequently replenished. The choices were vast. The food quality was high. In other words, we wanted for nothing and left stuffed to the gills.

I'd recommend The Clubhouse again for a holiday meal.

The service, food and cocktails are amazing! The lobster and shrimp risotto was scrumptious! I couldn't resist cheesecake with fresh berries for dessert. This is an excellent restaurant to dine and it's convenient to Oak Brook Mall.

I've been here several times over the course of the last 7 years, and I never had a bad experience up until now. I usually base my ratings on my overall experience with the restaurant, but my most recent visit has really tarnished my view of The Clubhouse.

I came here on Memorial Day for my mother's 63rd birthday. The restaurant was empty when we arrived, and we were immediately seated. Our server, Nickolai, greeted us and told us about the specials. We ordered a lot of food and she provided great recommendations.

When the appetizers were brought out, half of them were cold. It was 4pm, at that time, and we hadn't eaten all day so we ate them cold. We did, however, inform our server that the some of the food was cold but we ate it because we were hungry. She didn't apologize, took our plates, made a face, and ROLLED her eyes! I'm not hard to please. A simple "I'm sorry" would suffice, but we couldn't even get that. Instead she responded with a rude, unprofessional attitude.

We informed Nickolai that our appetizers were cold to assure that the rest of our food would be hot, not to make an aimless complaint. Our server proceeded to bring out cold soup and cold entrees. The vast majority of our food was COLD. We sent it back and asked to speak to the manager, Brett. 

Brett was really helpful and worked hard to enhance our experience. He hand delivered our hot food and threw in champagne with my mothers free birthday dessert. He also comped a good portion of the meal. When the food was hot, it was delicious! I had the Salmon BLT, which is a new addition to the menu. It is fantastic! 

Thanks to Brett, I had an OK experience. It was very kind of him to go out of his way to try to make things right, but I wish I received quality service without getting the manager involved.

I like the clubhouse.  There are sandwiches, wraps, burgers, pastas, steaks and seafood.  

Our party ordered burgers and salads for lunch.  Service was good!  Its nice atmosphere adds to your meal, as well.  None of us ordered dessert, but omgeeee you might want to by the looks of what they offer.  

Great place to eat, hello....... Middle of Oakbrook Mall.  

Only one bathroom on the first floor, strange for the size of the place.  If you want, climb a rather long staircase to go to a much larger bathroom upstairs... So do not wait till the last minute if you have to go... Ha.  

Service.. Pretty ok.  Not overly impressed, but not horrible neither.  

Not a bad option for OB Mall.....

We went to the Clubhouse during lunch to celebrate my coworker's recent engagement. When we arrived, we were promptly seated by the woman at the front (she wasn't very pleasant, but the server made up for it). We ordered some bubbly and our entrees. I ordered the Southwestern Chicken Wrap with French fries. It was delicious!!! My companions both ordered the fish tacos that came with different toppings and a Mexican style coleslaw and they had great things to say about it. The server was very prompt and checked in with us. He was very friendly and we didn't have to wait a long time for our beverages or meals.
I will say that the prices are a little higher than average for what you're ordering and based on conversations I had with others, I'm not the only one that feels this way.
Regarding their food, they get 5 stars, but their prices and the women at the front bring their rating down to 4 stars since they can't be bothered on arrival or on our way out. I hope they improve on the first and last impressions.

I'm a frequent patron for the Sunday brunch $35?? and highly recommend reservation for the brunch. For under $40, you get delicious tender prime rib, fresh oysters (very fresh), jonah's claw (it was frozen, but it was just okay), shrimp cocktail (bigger shrimps) made to order omelete (the usual average), variety of traditional breakfast food (average), chicken (few variety), different types of pasta, and the dessert tablet (including chocolate fountain). Overall, a very enjoyable seafood brunch. I recommend getting the "Really Nice" reward card for discounts and giftcard. I received a $50 giftcard for my upcoming birthday.  

I've been here for the regular dinner menu and the brunch that was served is on par with the prime rib that was served at brunch.

Great food and service. Very cool atmosphere inside, quick and friendly service. Some of the best lobster bisque I've ever had. A bit pricey but worth it in my opinion.
Dinged a star because our table candle was out and our booth seat wasn't clean.

I was here for a company function.  I absolutely loved the brunch items and of course the mimosas.  The upstairs banquet is very elegant and do spacious, perfect for weddings, showers, birthdays anniversaries etc.  

The service was on point and always cleaning and of course the very important refilling the drinks. 
Brunch items included 

The amazing French toast, pancakes, waffles, eggs, ham, hash browns, omelet station, potatoes, fruit, bagels etc.  It was all very very good.

Totally overdue for my review here....I've been to the Clubhouse many, many times.  It's a swanky joint with swanky people...and if you want to see the epitome of 'swankiness', come here on the first Friday of the month!  Free buffet from 6-7pm (pretty decent eats too..) and a D.J.!!  and yes, you can dance...if you want to...

The best part is you get to see the 'swanksters' in action!  Definitely your Oak Brook-ians and Elmhurst-ians, among others.  A good time if your into people watching - who doesn't want to witness cougars in action? and the elderly 'Don Juan'? yep, they're here...don't get me wrong, you still have your twenty & thirty something's, BUT a good percentage of 'Trump' a-likes and cosmetic surgeries gone wrong....yet, I've had good times here...

Drinks are mixed well....the food is very, very good.  For app's I've had the seared tuna (delicious).  The basil orange salmon is usually my go to and is always cooked perfectly.  I've had the Filet Mignon as well which again was cooked perfectly (med rare) and melted in my mouth.  You can't go wrong ordering fish or steak here.  Service has always been very good and yes the menu options are pricey so be prepared to spend some dough.  I'd recommend putting that cute little black dress on too....

Delicious, but a little over priced. This place is great for lunch or holiday brunch. Their Christmas brunch included a large variety of their favorite dishes, a carving station, and several desserts. The service has been consistently exceptional at every visit. I highly recommend trying their pecan crusted tilapia!!

One of my family's favorite spots near my grandparent's house. Located right in the Oakbrook mall. Prices are reasonable for the quality of the food and the place is big enough that there is usually no wait. Wait staff is prompt and friendly. 

On weekends, they have a great brunch upstairs which is buffet style and I think around $25-30 a person. If you have a big enough appetite, it's worth it. But you can also sit downstairs and order off the regular menu. They have brunch specials like $4 mimosas.

Came here for lunch a couple of days ago with my father who wasn't home from Baltimore. He hasn't been to this restaurant in years. I ordered the infamous lobster bisque and it was amazing. I also had lunch size portion of salmon which was great with no fishy taste!

I am very familiar with the Oakbrook mall and Ive been going to the Clubhouse, not regularly but enough times, over the past 5 years. My old job would give us gift cards to this restaurant. I've never had a problem, Ive always been happy with my food, and their mojitos are AMAZING! 
For New Year's Eve last week my boyfriend and I decided to go here for NYE dinner. I worked until that 9 that night (damn healthcare industry) so I looked for a place near by that could accommodate us, last minute for a very late dinner. I came across the Clubhouse. I made my reservation online on their website. I had to make my reservation with s credit card and there was a warning that there would be a 25.00 charge for not showing up. I made our reservation for 10:00pm but we got there a little early. So we found a spot at the bar and had done drinks. My boyfriend had whiskey and I had a Raspberry mojito, it was fabulous! The right amount of everything in my drink. We were finally sent a text telling us that our table was ready and we were told to go upstairs and check in. We were taken to a nice little table. I had never been upstairs, had only been on the lower level, so I was impressed at how huge this place really is. 
For NYE they were offering a special menu and a 6 course dinner, which was affordable and the price was per couple. We decided not to go with the 6 course meal and I kind of regret it, not for myself but for my boyfriend. We ordered the scallops wrapped in bacon as an appetizer. Our appetizer was excellent! Nice size scallops, great flavor, they were served over a bed of greens. For my entree I ordered the shrimp and lobster risotto and my boyfriend ordered the grilled salmon. My meal was fantastic! The risotto was amazing, it had plenty of shrimp and my lobster was a decent size. The portion was big enough that I had leftovers. My boyfriends meal on the other hand was not do great. His salmon was drier than the desert. He kept dipping his pieces in the sauce that it came with but it was still dry. I didn't taste of but it looked dry, dehydrated piece of fish. We aren't ones to complain, so he ate what he could, his fish came with mashed potatoes and asparagus. Both sides were good. At the end of the meal and after we paid we told the server that the fish was real dry, he asked if it was supposed to be that way and she said no. She described it as being very moist. Ok so they dropped the ball and over cooked it. At that point she couldn't do anything so she said next time let her know before. Ok no problem. Our server was ok, friendly enough, can't say she was attentive since she only checked on us once during our meal and it was at the end of our meal, can't blame her I think it was a busy night. 
For NYE they had a DJ playing and they were offering free champagne for the midnight toast. I thought that was pretty cool. After dinner we headed back downstairs and enjoyed people watching. We waited till midnight, had our champagne, danced a few songs and left. Fast forward 5 days and my boyfriend noticed 3 charges from the clubhouse. One for our pre dinner drinks at the bar, one for dinner and an extra charge of $100. We did not know where that charge came from. He called them and the manager wasn't in. He got a hold someone yesterday and they said they would look into it, and today he got a call and told him that they are reversing the charge. We don't know how it happened or why he was charged but that left a sour taste in our mouth. Probably won't be returning although that risotto was delicious!

Very disappointing. I talked a friend into coming here for lunch because I had a graving for chicken pot pie. How is this a favorite!? Three bites of chicken, zero peas, no sauce and nothing but mashed potatoes. Worst experience I've ever had here.

Service wasn't much better. Waitress went to three different tables and refilled ice tea and then went off to get a customer's coat, fine...that's a good thing, if I had to wait another few minutes for her to come back and I still needed to flag her down for a refill Really? 

I will be hard pressed to come back here.

I haven't been here in a really long time, but decided to make this our destination for Easter Brunch.  We were on our own for the holiday and thought we would go somewhere fancy that had all of our must haves: prime rib, oysters, and a chocolate fountain.

We made reservations a week in advance and had to settle for 10AM as that and 5 PM were the only time slots left.  The holiday brunch was about $20 more expensive than their regular Sunday Brunch.  I didn't mind this because it was a holiday, but now looking at their regular brunch menu - it didn't have anything different on Easter to justify the premium price.  

I did really appreciate that they had two buffets out - one for each floor so that people dining upstairs didn't have to trek down that staircase to get to the food each time.  I will also say that they replenished the food frequently and almost everything was fantastic.  The only negatives for me were on the seafood table.  I am a huge seafood fan - so I was really looking forward to oysters and crab claws, but they were awful.  As others have said, they were obviously frozen and not fresh at all.  The oysters were not cleaned properly and after one bite of seafood from here - I stuck to the rest of the buffet.  The prime rib was awesome as well as the other cooked items.  The dessert station was great - but I wish that they would have had some labels to distinguish what the different cakes/pastries were.  

I will also say that our server was phenomenal.  Granted he didn't have to serve us any food, but he was super friendly and kept our table clean of old plates.  He was also great about refilling drinks.  It was a pretty good brunch overall, but I would have given more stars if the seafood were any good and if I weren't paying a premium for the same food I could have on any other Sunday.

We come here every now and then for dinner and drinks.  The food is above average, they have a nice mix for everyone from pasta to salads to steak.  This wouldn't be my first choice for steaks but it's a nice spot to grab dinner and have a couple drinks.

This review is strictly on their Sunday brunch. Which happens to be the best Sunday brunch buffet in burbs! Consists of quality meats and cheeses, and gourmet caramelized banana french toast, bakery items, desserts and more. The only knock is that they've significantly raised the price over the past couple years. This why I only gave 4 stars. Word of caution, you will also be out commission for the rest of the day.

It's been quite a few years since I've been here. Haven't had any issues with service. The atmosphere works for a variety of social functions. The food and menu are the reasons we no longer patronize this place. They used to have these bone-in steaks that were just sublime. That's no longer on the menu. We have tried other dishes but they've either been too dry or insipid in general. They have a wonderful drink menu. Their desserts look delectable but when we tried the miniature versions we were left disappointed. Such a shame!

In October I made a reservation for December 11th at 7pm for a group of 15 so my friends and I could celebrate a Christmas dinner. I have to say, the process was really smooth. To be honest, I had called some other restaurants first and they would not take a party that large. The Clubhouse was great about it. They did ask for a credit card and said I would be charged if we cancelled day of, but that was fine. As soon as 3/4 of the party was there we were able to sit down. We sat upstairs and the place was decorated beautifully for the holidays. Many large groups were there as well. We had 2 servers for the table, which was awesome and they even offered to split checks. I was so surprised they did that! I had told everyone to bring cash since it was a large party but they did the checks with no problem. Our male waiter was a little rough around the edges and we felt like he was rushing us a bit. One of my friends arrived and still had her coat on and hadn't even sat down before he was handing her a drink of water. However, by the end of the night he was better and even took a few pictures of the group for us.

My friend and I started with the bruschetta, which was very good. I had the lobster bisque and wedge salad and both were awesome. My only complaint with the salad was that there was way too much dressing on it and the bottom part was soaked. I would get it again but dressing on the side most likely. A different friend and I shared the creme brulee for dessert, and while it wasn't the best I've had, it was decent and large enough to share. I didn't drink, but almost everyone else did and seemed to enjoy their drinks. People ordered all sorts of entees from the Ahi Tuna to the Chicken Picatta and everyone seemed to like their food. Our waitress did an awesome dessert presentation and almost everyone ended up ordering something. The desserts are huge and most come in half sizes as well. 

There is valet out front, but there was a line up to use it when we arrived and then it took a really long time to get our cars after because they went from 2 valets down to 1. I know that's not technically the restaurant, but I would recommend more valet employees during such a busy time of year.

Anyone that dines out with large groups knows that it can be a problem sometimes, but the Clubhouse did a great job accommodating us and we really enjoyed ourselves.

Went for brunch with my sister and her boyfriend. If you take one thing away from this, get the brunch buffet. They have the best prime rib it was so tender and delightful. Also they have basically everything you would want. The shellfish area had left something to be desired but was still very good dont get me wrong. The dessert table tho... do not miss the dessert table. Chocolate fountain,  the creme brulee... get out of here! The drink menu was moderately priced and very tastey. Also, the kids food game is super strong mac and cheese was very good. They have small pb&js which are so cute. I will most definitely be returning.
This is not my first time here.  I had the lobster bisque and lobster and shrimp risotto. The service was great and the food was good, but all my food was lukewarm.

At The Clubhouse and after coming here on several occasions, this is the worst experience ever. Continuously our food was sent out cold; even after stating to our waitress Nikolai that our appetizers were cold, cold entrees were sent out. When making our waitress aware, she did not apologize, yet instead she made an annoyed face. After receiving our entrees cold, my party asked to speak to a manager, and the greeter Kim asked him loud and clear as he was approaching us, 'are you ready', as if talking to us was going to take extra energy or be a hassle. When making the waitress and server who brought out the food aware that our food was continuously cold, our concerns were not addressed and their attitudes were disingenuous. 

Our experience did not turn for the better until the manager Brett came over. He was very apologetic and addressed our concerns. This occasion was my mom's 63rd birthday, and it was not a joyous occasion.

If it were not for Brett, I feel as if our concerns and the lack of customer care would have continued to fall on deaf ears. 

I would have given this experience if possible zero stars, but because the manager took control of the situation I'll give it one. All of my prior experiences at The Clubhouse were superb, which is why I'm even more disappointed. I'll just assume that since it was Memorial Day, maybe the staff just had a more relaxed attitude towards service excellence. 

I would like to point out, that despite being treated poorly, my party was polite and respectful towards the staff in verbalizing our concerns. I tend to always and try to give every establishment the best reviews if you would look at my Yelp history. Thanks Brett, for trying to turn the experience around! I appreciate the happy birthday dessert for my mom. I WOULD GIVE BRETT 5 STARS. Despite the poor service turnaround, we still tipped our waitress $20.00.

So we had a gift certificate that we had to burn up. Drinks, I had a couple of Jack sours and they were terrific. Then we started with the garbage salad. Big enough for two and had lots of chicken. I then went for the $19 dollar vodka pasta. Seriously! It looked like the watery mess I would come up with when I didn't know how to cook. It was flavorless and swimming in sauce with boxed noodles. Now I looked over the menu prior to ordering and it seemed like they are going after the value conscious shopper at the mall. Everything was quite inexpensive, except what I ordered. But the burgers for $13 bucks seemed cheap for this location. That is what my buddy got and then couldn't get off of the pot the next day. I had the right choice on a bad menu. I got the key lime pie which looks like a small pie. Overly sweet and as my buddy said. It's Cool Whip on top. Yup! I could taste the plastic. Did I mention the service? Our server shot out of the gate and had a good stride. Til the couple next to us left and we were all alone in back of the stairs. We had to wave him down to get another drink. When he brought it to us he asked if we wanted dessert and walked away. After 10 minutes he came back with the check and asked if we were all set. Um! NO! I ordered desert and a drink. We got the keylime and no drink. When he came back after 15 minutes, we gave up on more alcohol and parted ways. If I would have known this before I would have sold the certificate at a loss and gone to Wildfire.

whooo-WEEE was this place expensive.  Then again, it's Oak Brook.

The coconut shrimp were large and came with quirky "Styrofoam" noodle thingies, as well as a tasty dipping sauce.  The lobster bisque was positively delicious.  Their breaded fish dish (can't remember what species it was) was nothing special, but the plate presentation was great and the redskin mashed potatoes were enjoyable.  My burger cost w-a-y too much, even though it was cooked perfectly to a medium-rare state.  The blue cheese fries (an extra $2) that accompanied it were dusted with red pepper flakes and tasted out of this world.

We didn't order booze or soft drinks, choosing to stick with water only, and the tab STILL came out to be ~$60 + tax/tip.  Probably the most expensive lunch I've had up until this point in my life, but I suppose it was worth it......maybe?......ehhhh

My family and I always have excellent meals and service at this restaurant. My husband says the filet mignon is the best he has ever tasted. Never ordered anything that tasted bad and the service has always been good. We also like the atmosphere of the restaurant. This is definitely a restaurant to check out if you're in Oak Brook!

EXCELLENT!  every time I dine here with friends or co-works.  The staff are profession and nice.  Love all their food and their signature dishes.  

Some of the reviews are so unfounded.  Not sure why people feel entitled to free food.  Last time I checked restaurants are for profit and not charity.  If you complain just to get free food you are a SCUM and free loader.  Not sure why I need to tell them this but I'm sure they can't even read...

Save some room for Desserts as they got all type that will make you think your in heaven!

I was getting together with some friends I had not seen in 8-10 years.
The Clubhouse was suggested for their good food. The food was good. 

What tainted the experience was the service. From the time we got there, before we could even irritate the server he had an attitude.  
He was rude and condescending.

Why a man who makes their living on tips is rude is beyond me.
The whole attitude ruined any goodness that the chef's put into the food.
It appeared that either the server did not want to be there 
      or he did not want us there.  

He won. I will not be returning.

This past Easter Sunday, we came here for the Sunday brunch buffet and I was very impressed with the abundance and quality of food options. Salad, seafood, meats at a carving station, omelettes, chicken dishes, pastas and a massive dessert table are just some of what is there. I made a reservation weeks in advance because of the holiday and I'm glad I did because this place was completely slammed. People from all walks of life come from miles around. There was a buffet on each floor of the restaurant which was very convenient. I should also mention that I loved my Bloody Mary and our server was friendly and attentive. This buffet is a great deal for what you pay. xoxo

All menus are excellent, good variety, quick service, attentive service, the cops were very juicy, Apple's sauce the right twist of cinnamon, mashed reed potatoes good fit. The prime rib chili very good star with just the right zesty spice. Topped off with mixed berries. The over head of seventies hits does not fit the talk decorum it is intimate not ostentatious.bar is tasteful. Overall a good experience.

I've been here twice and I'll def be back many times more.  

Robert S. recommended this place to me as a great date spot.  Ended up here on Feb. 15th.  It was so busy that the hostess told us it was totally booked, and there was only first come first serve tables in and around the bar.  I was able to find a couple seats at the bar. Ended up ordering all sorts of appetizers, chili and a seafood Cobb salad.  It was all great.  I don't even like chili, but the Prime Rib Chili here is amazing. It's a MUST try.  The calamari was great.  I really liked the sweet chili ginger sauce they use instead of the traditional tartar or marinara. And we basically fought over the last buffalo shrimp. They were that good.  And the bartender that served us our drinks and food was friendly, helpful and fast.

Second trip here was brunch with mom.  Check out my pictures.  That food was as tasty as it looked.  I couldn't find a single item that didn't taste perfectly prepared. Everything was served at the right temp, which is no small feat in a busy buffet.  Items were refreshed promptly, as were our drinks.  

I don't know for sure, but this may be the best brunch in the 'burbs(throws down the gauntlet).

We have been in this restaurant many, many times. We had Sunday brunch here too and the price is pretty decent. I love the dessert especially the chocolate fountain. From the very first time we came here we never had a bad experience. The servers are polite, overall the service is good. We always order the sweet ginger calamari, lobster bisque. kobe burger and hand-cut delmonico ribeye cook in med-rare. it is pricey so yes be prepared to see $$$ after dinner.

I have been to The Clubhouse countless times and every time has been a great experience. I have tried diverse things on their menu including the salads (which all have been very tasty), the mini sliders, and my all-time favorite, the Elmer's Sundae. 

They also do a very good Brunch on the weekends that I have enjoyed tremendously. I highly suggest this restaurant if you are in the Oak Brook area.

Honestly, I was not super impressed by this place. Yes, it definitely has its perks such as the decor. However, when my guests and i arrived we were not greeted in a friendly manner. The hostess did not even smile and seemed irritated. In fact, many of the workers did.  Our waitress was friendly but hardly came to the table. On to the food, we ordered the artichoke dip as an appetizer and, I must admit, it was the highlight of the entire meal. The cheese was perfectly melted into the artichoke and it was so so delicious. For my entree, I ordered the sea food cobb salad and thought it was okay. I'm a salad queen and had way better salads in my days. My guests both ordered the grilled chicken sandwich and said they enjoyed it. At the end of the meal, we noticed the samples of desserts they had displayed. We all declined dessert after agreeing that it did not seem worth it. Overall, this restaurant is OK in my opinion.

So, I went back hoping for a better experience.
Went on a Saturday afternoon for lunch.  I ordered the garbage salad and mashed red potatoes.  Both were gluten free. 

My friend ordered a burger.  Nothing fancy.

After 25 minutes our waiter asked if we got our food.  Ummm... Nope.
 After30 minutes and our find did arrive, my salad had croutons on it.
They took it back to fix it.  
So my friend ate her meal while I sat there and vice versa.

I'm done waiting, the service just plain sucks.  If I ordered a huge meal I could understand a wait, but 45 minutes for a salad and mashed potatoes.  
Not going back, not worth my time .
Was able to finally get in here for dinner. Ambiance is nice, a pinch on the loud-side but no complaints. Food was great & the service was top notch.

Decent place to eat. I highly recommend the lobster bisque. Drinks and appetizers are a tad over priced but the service is impeccable. Wait staff is very attentive and accommodating. The atmosphere is great, with a tempting selection of desserts. If a fancy lunch is what you fancy, try this spot.

I've been here a few times and liked it so my wife and I went here for an anniversary dinner. When I booked the table I told them it was a special occasion and asked them to prepare a dessert with "Happy Anniversary " on it.

First they gave us a terrible table near the waiters service hallway - why book ahead when this is what you end up with? Service was fair, food ok. After we finished the waiter just brought us our check. Wow, ok sorry I guess no special anniversary dessert. Am I supposed to ask for it in front of my wife. It's called a surprise for a reason. There are too many options in this area to ever go back. Lost a customer.

Mother's Day... We come here all the time and mother in law wanted to go to one of her favorite places. Set a reservation, confirmed the reservation, then they even called for a Credit Card to hold the reservation... Never a mention that they wouldn't be serving dinner and ONLY have buffet style eating... WTF? Seriously? 
Completely unacceptable and a horrible inconvenience especially on one of the busiest restaurant days of the year. We had one choice, eat buffet style or leave. So we left.

Bomb. Diggity. 

I've never been here without being happy and super satisfied by the food. More importantly, the dessert is awesome!!!!!!!!! All of the staff were extremely friendly. From the  greeter, manager , waiter to the bus boy that held the door open for me in the bathroom. I find the decor even more impressive. For some reason it made me feel super swanky and ritsy without all the pompous pricks and even more pompous arm candy. Lol totally drank my diet coke pinky out. seriously though. I highly recommend.
