I've been to The Clubhouse twice now, both times for lunch. The service and food are pretty consistent and the staff is warm, which is a plus! I've been seated on the lower and upper levels, and love the decor from the holidays (which is still up)!  

I ordered the Tilapia last time and it was very good. The only part of the meal that was not up to the mark were the dense mashed potatoes. Other than that, the dining experience was pretty pleasant. You have to try their flavored lemonades! I ordered the peach lemonade and loved it.

As others have mentioned, the only drawback is mall parking on a busy weekend. I would recommend The Clubhouse to those who are looking for a good meal and great service at a classy spot in Oak Brook. There was a good mix of people dining out at the same time as us, which is always a plus when you go out for a meal.

The clubhouse is a nice restaurant to go to every so often.  Decor is nice, but I think it's time for an update.  Food is pretty consistently good.  So at least you know that if you come here, you are in for a pretty decent meal.  Brunch is great here.  If you have any vegan peeps in your party,  more than likely your vegan peeps will order something off the menu instead of eating the brunch, you will have to be seated downstairs while the brunch is upstairs.  So if you have people in your party that have trouble walking, it's kind of a pain to go up and down.. even though there is an elevator... just something to keep in mind.  

Service is pretty consistent as well.  Everyone is nice, quick and efficient.  My most recent meal was just me and my daughter and our server was so nice to her and talked with her.  It's nice for her to get interaction like that from servers.  

I had the house salad.  it was great, but a tad over dressed.  Wish I had asked for the balsamic vinaigrette on the side.  Their mushroom soup is decadent and rich.  Glad I just had a cup vs. a bowl.  My daughter had the chicken and fries, these were great!  It's not the traditional flour breading, it's rice and it's really crispy and delicious.  They weren't greasy at all!!!  I live pretty close so it's nice to have a standby when you want to go somewhere a little nicer.  

Only con is that you have to deal with mall parking .. and during the holidays .. GOOD LUCK ... I am seriously opposed to valet parking (unless it's free) in the suburbs ... so that is really the only bad thing.

Oh you fancy, huh? 

The Clubhouse is a super trendy place with super fantastic food. A bit on the pricey side, but the portions are big and the restaurant itself is very put together. I love coming here because I legit feel like I'm ballin'. All the while I can order gourmet American food from a menu that has countless options that are sure to satisfy my tastebuds. Of course I've ventured their drink menu as well - love a good martini! Their Flirtini and Clubhouse Martini are my fave.

I've been here for my friend's birthday and also to celebrate my own 21st (back in the day half a decade ago). It's a great accommodating spot for groups. They have tables downstairs (as well as a bar), upstairs and outside - the place is huge! Plus, the menu includes a ton of fan favorites so you're sure to please everyone!

I've had a number of entrees here, but most recently I enjoyed the Seafood Cobb Salad and their famous Lobster Bisque. The salad was perfection. If you're a seafood lover like myself, you're in for a treat! One (huge) bowl holds these mouthwatering ingredients: Shrimp, jumbo lump crab meat, mixed greens, plum tomatoes, green onions, blue cheese crumbles, bacon, black olives, hard boiled egg, avocado and ranch dressing....PHEW! That. just. happened. AMAZE. The lobster bisque was not as spot on as the salad, but it was good. Not the best I've had, but definitely still tasty!

Each week The Clubhouse also has different specials going on - so that's a good feeling for your wallet. The location is super convenient, perfect ending to a day of shopping :)

Final thought: If the entree you order doesn't come with fries, either get a side of them or steel from your friends plate. These fresh cut beauties won't disappoint.
Their buffet is the best. Waiters are very accommodating and it was a great time. Definately will go back.
The food was good and the drinks were okay. I love the atmosphere. I will dine there again.

Would have given them 5 stars but the service was AWFUL!!!  I know it's Valentine's Day weekend but restaurants, especially a nice restaurant like this should be prepared!  We sat down at 615 and no server for 10 minutes.  We went to ask and a manager came over and said we have a great server and he will give us a treat at the end(no special treat at the end!!) the food was good we had lobster and shrimp risotto and jambalaya!  Our server never checked in, rarely got refills, a bus boy packaged our food up and we had to ask another server for our check!  So disappointed and we left at 8:45 and we only had soup and an entree.  We like there food to still go again maybe but it will not be our first choice.  And we won't go during a holiday time!!! The table next to us has cold soup they sent back twice and another table by us waited forever for their entree.

We love Sunday brunch here.  The coffee is great (we are coffee snobs).  The Prime Rib is to die for and the seafood selection is abundant. Try the Sunday Brunch here and I
Am sure you will love it.

I dined at the Clubhouse on Saturday night with my husband and another couple. We had a 5:30 reservation and were seated at the very last table upstairs. That should have been our first clue. The service was HORRIBLE! I had to constantly ask for a glass of water and our waiter was awful with getting drinks from the bar and making excuses for our order being so late. We had a 7pm function to attend and did not arrive until 8pm! We did share the Valentine dinner, but did not have the dessert because we had run out of time and the dinner was bad. My steak was cooked too long, and my husband's potatoes were crunchy on top because they were obviously under the lights too long. I know it was Valentines Day weekend, and there were kids there prior to their Spring Dance, but there was nothing good to say. It was my first time dining there, and it will be my last. What a disappointment.

Decent place. Salmon salad was ok. My friend didn't even finish half his burger.  Another thought the tuna sauce was too salty.  We asked for the desert menu 4 times and just decided to stop asking.  Surely enough we received the bill before the menu.
Late Sunday lunch. Super crowded and high noise level.  Food was not flavorful and portions were on small side. Slow waiter service but food arrived very quickly. No plans to go back.

The Clubhouse always goes the extra mile to make you happy. I have been here several times for casual dining. Our company has also used the restaurant for holiday parties. The staff members are attentive and the management team is obviously present and ready to direct and assist.

Today I ordered the vodka pasta with chicken and my guest ordered the salmon. She let me taste hers and it was delicious! Mine was great as well. The sauce was creamy and the pasta was cooked perfectly. 

When I ordered, I ordered the pasta with chicken, but it's possible I spoke too softly or the waitress didn't hear me. Anyway, something happened and the pasta came out with no chicken. One of the management team members came to check on us as soon as the food arrived and I mentioned that I ordered it with chicken and he immediately apologized, took the plate, and said it would be out very soon. The waitress also came over and took complete responsibility for the mistake and didn't make any excuses for herself or the kitchen. It was a very pleasant and customer service oriented way to handle the situation.

THEN when the new plate came out, the management team member said to save room for dessert because he'd like to offer us one. This was not necessary, but quite indicative of how The Clubhouse takes care of their guests and corrects mistakes. So we did end up taking him up on the offer. The chocolate truffle cake with ice cream was to die for. Wow. A great end to a fantastic dining experience!

Dined here recently with 6 of my girlfriends. They were polite and accommodating when I notified them that most of our group was running late (as they should be since it was mostly empty at 7pm on a Friday night).  My one friend who arrived on time and I sat at the bar and had awesome Moscow Mules and some beef tacos while we waited. The tacos were pretty mediocre, sort of reminded me of Taco Bell.  Anywho, on to dinner. We all ordered drinks and appetizers to start.  Once we placed our dinner orders, we pretty much never saw our server again, which means we never got a second cocktail.  I tried making eye contact with him several times with no luck. For dinner, I had the chicken and mushroom pasta which was full of fancy delicious mushrooms but a little light on the chicken.  All in all, this place was not thrilling by any stretch of the imagination, but could be a nice place to take your grandparents if the service was better,

I hosted a baby shower for 30 people on Sunday at the Clubhouse.  The room was set up beautifully, the staff was helpful and accommodating!   We had the brunch and all our guests raved about the food.  Our servers could not do enough for us, they were always available but never hovering.  We didn't have to ask for more water or coffee, they were right there.  Can't say enough good things about the experience.  My gratitude to the management and staff for making this event memorable.
We have dined here before, their pork chop  with cinnamon applesauce is amazing!

I have been coming to The Clubhouse with my family since I was a kid. We love this place. Always a great meal and good service. Before I became a pescetarian, I always got the Chicken Piccata but now I get the Orange Basil Salmon. Both are my faves. The lobster bisque is also delicious...and the bread they give your table is amazing. Definitely one of my favorite places to dine in Oakbrook.

Recently had dinner here after a long (3 year) hiatus.  Not much had changed... which is a good thing.  My prime rib was perfect as were my sides.  Service was friendly, unobtrusive and efficient.  They continue to do a good job!

Definitely a place you order a fancy dinner from. My husband and I tend to come here on special date nights such as birthdays etc. So we usually splurge when we are here. Steaks are delicious. Salmon in the orange cream sauce makes me want to lick the plate. Shepherd's Pie is put so artistically on your plate. These are just a few good things to eat here.

I love that the service is usually spot on. If you are celebrating even the tiniest thing, you will probably get some type of free dessert with a "Congrats on the Baby" or "Happy B-day" written on the plate in chocolate. 

That being said, there are a few things that I don't exactly love about The Clubhouse. 
- The decor needs to be re-vamped in the worst way. Everything looks like it is from the early 90's and they haven't done anything since then. 
- The bathroom situation on the first floor is seriously a problem. ONE stall for men and ONE stall for women. I know you don't get seated on the first floor very often, but when you do you have to inevitably run upstairs to use the facilities. If you are pregnant or have kids, you know what a pain this could be.
- If you are in the mood for something easy like a sandwich, I wouldn't suggest ordering it from here. Way too expensive for a cold, deli meat sandwich. Ugh.
- While most servers are amazing here, there have been a few times that the servers seemed confused with food orders etc.
- There are many tables that are situated in horrible spots. Such as near the stairs, near the bathroom, near a walkway so there are constantly people walking 2 inches from your chair etc. 
- Their famous Lobster Bisque is like drinking hot cream with teeny tiny pieces of lobster. I'd say pass on this and order the chili instead!

We also came here this past Valentine's day and decided to order off the pre-fixe menu. This came with a petit filet mignon as well as crab-stuffed shrimp. My husband ordered his medium and I ordered mine medium well. His came out rare and mine was burnt to a well done crisp. We unfortunately had to send both of ours back, when we got our steaks out the second time and they were correct. However, once our steaks were fixed our shrimps were cold. We didn't have the heart to send our food back a second time so we just dealt with it. But when you are paying over $100 on a meal, I think that is horrible. So just watch out for pre-fixe menus because you might not get the quality they normally turn out.

Overall I really enjoy this place. I will be coming back for the next special night out!

Restaurant review
AYCE Sunday brunch, likely one of the best I have been to recently. For the low price of 29.95 this is a top notch Sunday spread. The hot carving station includes slow roasted prime rib (better than a steak house) and turkey/ham. They make omelets to order. Other breakfast items include pancake, french toast with banana and walnuts, eggs, bacon etc. The highlighted items include the chicken picatta cooked to perfection and vodka pasta. They used to have a white fish dish as well. From the cold display there is smoked salmon, shrimp cocktail, and crab claws (small versions of rock crab claws). There is also a wide selection of salads and cheese spread. The dessert is top notch with a chocolate fountain and a wide selection of pastries. I will be back!

Pro: wide selection of Sunday brunch items, all you can eat crab claws (small but tasty), smoked salmon, chocolate fountain. All fresh and tasty

Cons: Pricy but worth it, make reservation of prepare for a long wait

Hidden gem:  Sign up for the really nice restaurant frequent diner club. You pay 25 dollars, but they give you back 25 dollar food credit. Also when you dine on Sunday you get double the points. Also on your anniversary of signing up you get 50 dollars in food credit also on your birthday 50 dollars as well. Good deal!
The best! That's all I can say. Great for family's, couples or even taking the little ones for brunch.  The service is always so great & fast.

I was in the Chicago suburbs area for a business trip 2 weeks ago. My colleagues and I were looking for a place to eat and came across The Clubhouse. The restaurant is huge with 2 floors, and the decor reminded me of an upscale circus, like Cirque du Soleil. Looking around it looked very similar to a restaurant that used to be located inside South Coast Plaza in Costa Mesa, CA but closed down several years back. I asked the hostess and she confirmed that they indeed used to have a restaurant in California but this now was the only location.

We all had flown in earlier that day and were ready for a round of drinks. I settled on a Lemon Drop Martini. It was ok, but I've had better. There just wasn't enough lemon flavor.

For a starter to my meal, I ordered a Wedge Salad (iceberg lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, red onion, bleu cheese crumbles, bleu cheese dressing). The salad was so good, very refreshing.

For my entree I ordered the Kobe Burger (8oz kobe beef burger, monterey jack cheese, mixed greens tossed in balsamic vinaigrette, tomato, caramelized onion, garlic aioli, brioche bun). I ordered the patty medium rare. It comes w/a choice of fresh cut fries or creamy coleslaw. I like coleslaw but since I was already getting a salad with my meal, I opted for a side of sweet potato fries. The burger was really good, 4 stars good. The patty was juicy & temperature cooked to perfection, the bun was super soft and the flavors of all the toppings meshed well together.

A couple of us shared Creme Brulee for dessert. It was topped with a few pieces of strawberries & blueberries and a dollop of whipped cream. We were both so disappointed with this dessert. The texture was so dense, almost like flan, and there wasn't much of a sugar topping. Fail!

Overall, my meal was A-OK!

Fun fact: Oak Brook is a small town with a population of only 7,937 (2011 census) and is home to the world headquarters of McDonald's, Ace Hardware, Blistex, and the non-profit organization Lions Clubs International.

I recently went to The Clubhouse for a business dinner. The appetizers were incredible and I ordered the Pomegranate Chicken Salad. The fruit was fresh and the portion was huge. No complaints there! The server was very attentive and I really enjoyed the ambiance. The bar area was pretty busy but the our booth tucked away and surprisingly quiet. I was pleasantly surprised at the amount of parking! Many of the restaurants at Oakbrook Centre are tight on parking and require a valet, but The Clubhouse is has plenty of parking and I was able to park right up front. Definitely a plus!

We came here for my 12th visit. We got the Valentine's Day special. We each got a cup of lobster bisque, side salad (house with balsamic vinegrette and bleu cheese for me, caesar for hubby), 16 oz prime rib w/ rice and vegetables (asparagus for hubby, spinach for me), and shared a slice of chocolate cake for $99. We also got a beer and a side of bleu cheese fries ($7)... we did not know a "side" meant a huge table portion made for 4-5 people!!! But it was really good. We were both so full that we asked if we could get a lot of food boxed up, including my untouched prime rib. Two different people boxed up our prime ribs. When we got home, we realized both of them did not include the au jus sauce!!! Thus, we had to eat it them dry. =( This seems to be a common occurrence at the Clubhouse for us. We keep forgetting to ask but we think it's expected! If it comes with the meal at the restaurant, it should be boxed up as well. Anyway, the food was all yummy as usual!

13th visit: Crab and brie fondue and vodka pasta. YUM.

14th visit: Crab and brie fondue, vodka pasta, bleu cheese fries, and ribeye cooked medium rare. I did not enjoy the ribeye- it was too burnt on the outside. =(

This place is always packed.  Lunch, cocktail time, dinner and brunch..this place certainly packs them in and it's beginning to show.

They need to shut down for a week or so and rehab the entire place.  The chairs are all beat up, the carpeting on the cool spiral staircase is threadbare, and the huge funky lamps look dirty.

That said, I enjoy having lunch here.  Get the lobster bisque.  Seriously, get the lobster bisque.  The bar is fun but beware on Thursdays and Fridays it turns into cougar town.  I guess that could be fun too but I'm not a 20 something year old male so I digress.

Pass on the Sunday brunch.  It is way too crowded, very loud, seating is cramped and for some reason, every large family in the Chicago area makes this their brunch destination.  It's hard to navigate the trek from your table to the buffet stations among tables with seating for 12-20 people.  The brunch buffet itself is OK but not great.  Since it's so crowded, the food doesn't get replenished as often as it should.  Carving station and omelette station are both decent but nothing other brunch places don't have.  I prefer Shaws for Sunday brunch over this place.

So go here for a cocktail and some soup.  Pass on the brunch.

I've eaten here tons of times with my family and we always have a fantastic time.

The portions are large and the staff is friendly. The decor is fun and classy. It's been a few months since my last visit but as soon as I get back in town I'm excited to go back.

They've been open for a few years now and I'm impressed with their ability to maintain consistent quality. Although I can't speak to any one dish in particular, every time I eat here I am impressed, full, happy, and glad I came.
Also, they have a large dining room upstairs and can host large parties which is important if you are looking to host a party here.

Brunch on Sunday is busy. We arrived at 1:00 for a 1:15 reservation. At 1:11 I asked Justine how much longer. She said "it's only 1:11, closer to 1:15", ok. Then they call us at  1:14 and my sister and I reply oh are you sure? The other hostess quipped "Do you want to?" Oh my. 
Manager apologized.
The food is good at the brunch but it is crowded on Sundays so be prepared for longer lines for food and larger noisy parties, rather than a more subdued dinning room.

This review is only for the Sunday buffet brunch, I have had no experience with the restaurant's lunch or dinner menu.  I had high hopes for this place and wanted to really enjoy it. First, ambience and greeting was on par with Red Lobster, the noise level was off the charts and it felt chaotic and disorganized.  The first floor was open for lunch and several people were waiting for seating.  The buffet brunch was on the second level and we took an elevator up, were immediately seated in the window overlooking the parking lot, which wasn't the worst thing in the world but the sun beating down on us was unbearable,  Rather than moving to an area that was even noisier, we had them lower the shades, even though the wait person quipped "you can always get a tan!"  The buffet was explained with a run through of the variety of foods: omelette station, carving station, cold shellfish, hot entrees, breakfast staples and a dessert station.  Off we ran to the shellfish, hungry for oysters on the half shell, crab claws and poached shrimp, stopping to also grab some smoked salmon, cream cheeses and a half bagel.  

What can I say:  the oysters hadn't even been loosened from the shell, and tasted rancid...kiss of death.  The shrimp were well poached in the shell but had nasty black veins running up the backs...not cleaned... promising a foul and gritty bite.  The crab claws were freezer burned and still partially frozen and melting onto my plate, also inedible!  The smoked salmon was good, only success on the cold table.  Feeling disappointed I returned to the buffet trying to find some breakfast staples that I'd enjoy.  The French toast, sausage and scrambled eggs sufficed.  But the salmon, although well cooked was definitely NOT FRESH!  The carving station had some tasteless roast beef.

Both times we returned to our table the old plates hadn't been cleared away and we had to wait, had to ask for utensils and more napkins that were gone,  I would not recommend this place at all for a $39.95 brunch. The coffee was insipid and I could have spent half that for breakfast at the pancake house and enjoyed it more! Plus I felt I was running the risk of eating rancid seafood!  Double yuk, and if I could I would give it no stars, better yet it owes me stars!  I couldn't wait to get out of this place! 

This morning my daughter who stayed home from work with diarrhea, and vomiting all night long, called the restaurant to inform them she'd gotten sick.  Their comment, "feel better!"

Stay away!

Have been coming to the Clubhouse for several years and have watched it consistently go down.  Brunch reservations were made for a recent Sunday.  Requested seating in the Club Room because it tends to be quieter and more relaxed.  Were being shown to a table in the main room where the buffet is set up and where you can barely hear the conversation.  When I informed the hostess of my request when making the reservation she took us to the worst. smallest table in the Club Room which was not even set up for service.  Asked if we could sit at a larger table, but was informed that she had no other ones available.  Apparently she has x-ray vision because she could see into all of the other rooms.  Attitude of the staff is terrible.  Most stand around looking self-important, but doing little to accommodate guests.  Sorry Clubhouse, but that was the last strike.  Clean up your restaurant, educate your staff and teach them the meaning of "hospitality".

First of all, the Brunch is listed as $31.95 which quickly turned into $39.95 upon arrival. I know we can say  Holidays prices, but that should have been posted also. Secondly, now there is only coffee included with the buffet (instead of mimosas) and the buffet is smaller and a cup
of TEA was extra.
 Also the dessert table was a mini version of what used to be. Overall, I would say that the Clubhouse food /buffet has become mediocre and overpriced and not worth the trip my friends and I took from Chicago.

This is the worst restaurant I have ever been to in my life. The food was nothing special and the service was terrible. The bus boy made a rude comment to the table and the manager had the audacity to stick up for him and say that "that wasn't what he meant". I would say it's just a place for snotty stuck up low lives to go to feel fancy. Save your money.

I went there for Sunday Brunch this past weekend. I thought most of the items in the buffet were pretty good especially the French toast, pastas, prime rib. The desert table had plenty to choose from. I only gave this place 3 stars because of the terrible service. My party of four arrived way before the lunch crowd and it was like pulling teeth to get any refills on beverages. It was not busy yet I felt we were being ignored by our waiter. We kept having to ask the bus boy for things and he would just tell our waiter what we needed without bringing it:( For $32 a person a refill on coffee for my dessert would've been nice. Won't be back for a long time.

This is one of my favorite restaurants!!

I first came here for work in 2007, and it quickly jumped the list of favorite places in the suburbs. Between items I've ordered and those I've tried of others', the food is consistently fantastic with a rich flavor (but not too much so!).

Two words of advice: LOBSTER BISQUE. I've had Lobster Bisque in Boston, at Gibson's, at other fine dining restaurants...nothing beats the Clubhouse's version. It is rich, creamy...and lobster-y :) It has a lobster flavor unlike any other soups I've tried at other establishments, and it is consistent every time. 

More advice: Join the Frequent Diners club. It's $20, and you get a free dessert the day you buy it, and multiple deals throughout the year...$50 for your birthday and your anniversary month (anniversary of joining). 

I cannot literally list everything I've had here, but I'll say my two favorites are the Carne Asada Cobb Salad, and the Tuscan Sliders. And if your menu choice comes with fries (or maybe even if it doesn't) order the blue cheese fries! Amazing.

Lastly - the brunch is a great deal also. Come hungry!
Really fabulous Upper Scale Restaurant in Oakbrook. Lots of variety in where to dine and the drinks are spot on!

I haven't been to this place in years I forgot how great it was! I had the flirtini martini during happy hour for only $6 it was delish! I also had the mini Cesar salad and bbq burger and everything was great! I sat in the bar and had a very nice server.  She explained everything to me and was very attentive. I will let definitely be coming back more regularly.

Love the way this place looks- not always the actual experience. I guess you could say that I love the idea of The Clubhouse, but just kinda "like" the overall time spent here. 

You walk in and it's like "wow I love this place" then if you are lucky you speak with staff who are slightly personable and somewhat disheveled- but I've found most just don't seem thrilled to be there. Nobody ever seems to really know what's going on here, and none seem like they really like their jobs anymore here.

Some of the food I love and rave about (like the calamari!) but most doesn't really seem to impress. Overall, I would have given this place a solid 4 stars several years ago, but these days I think it's really just OK.

My husband and adult kids treated me to brunch for my birthday today.  The atmosphere was great, Christmas decorations are elegant and they had a Santa Claus for the kids.  The food was very good.  The price of the brunch was fair as I indulged in Oysters, crab claws, smoked salmon, shrimp, and prime rib... did not bother with the usual breakfast or pasta stuff.  The dessert table was fun and the chocolate fountain a treat since I dip bacon on it - Yummy. 

Our server was fantastic; he was polite, funny, and on top of our needs. 

The downside, I truly disliked the women at the front desk.  They were into themselves, rude, and snooty.  They were not paying attention to the needs of their guests as they were more interested in carrying on with their private conversations.  They were not helpful and one person suffices to do the job that all three were doing.  Disappointed, truly disappointed

When this place opened, the big rumor was that Kevin Costner is a co-owner. Or an investor. Or something. Is this true? I wonder how these types of arrangements even HAPPEN. Like did Kevin Costner wake up one day and say he wanted to own a chain of pretty good American cuisine restaurants nestled in upscale malls throughout the country? Seems weird. 

Anyway, in hopes that rumor is true, I'm writing a Kevin Costner themed review of my recent evening at The Clubhouse. I apologize in advance.

It seemed like A PERFECT WORLD, having a Saturday night that both my husband and I were free. We had to run back to Oakbrook Mall to pick up a ring I'd had repaired, so we decided to stop in to the Clubhouse for a late dinner. I assumed at 8:00PM we'd get right in, but the hostess took our number and said she'd text us when the table was ready. We didn't have THREE DAYS TO KILL, but luckily, 5 mins later, she called us over and we were seated. 

I ordered a glass of wine and the husband ordered a mojito. I'd read a bunch of the reviews here and worried the service would be terrible, but our waiter was like a BODYGUARD - attentive, polite, and paced our experience well. We started with a crab and Brie fondue and I ordered a bowl of the lobster bisque - I guess you could say we ordered a veritable WATERWORLD of appetizers! The fondue was delicious but the bisque was unreal. Rich, decadent, flavorful, addictive. The flavor was complex and it was like DANCES WITH WOLVES on my tongue. I felt like I was in a FIELD OF DREAMS. Had I known I would like it so much, I would have just ordered soup and a salad, but alas, we pressed on to the main meal. I ordered a special - the dry aged ribeye steak sandwich. It was served open faced with mushrooms and melted cheese. It was a bit chewy but otherwise delicious, and served with a TIN CUP of fries. Husband ordered the chicken picatta which he enjoyed, though he thought the butter sauce was a little bit "gloopy," he plowed through it like a MAN OF STEEL, so it certainly wasn't UNTOUCHABLE.

Though RUMOR HAS IT the desserts are great, we were way too full to even try them. The Clubhouse is a little expensive, not exactly a ROBIN HOOD type place. Two drinks, two appetizers, and two entrees was $100. 

The only thing I didn't love was that our waiter was a little condescending - when I ordered my sandwich medium rare, he explained to me that that meant a "warm red center." Yes hello, I'm 31 years old, I know what medium rare means. THE UPSIDE OF ANGER is that's the only time he did that (I think he saw that I was annoyed) so it wasn't a big deal - definitely not a HATFIELDS & MCCOYS situation, but still.

I think we'd come back to The Clubhouse, but not with frequency. The menu is a bit small and there are so many other great restaurants right there vying for your business. But if indeed Kevin Costner is a co-owner of this joint, he should be pleased with the quality and manner with which this place is run.

And if Kevin Costner ISNT a co-owner of The Clubhouse, I hope you enjoyed this non-sequitur extravaganza as much as I did.

Been going here for years. Great Vodka Pasta, Mac n Cheese, and fantastic Chocolate Cake (seriously good, I know it sounds crazy but it's some of the best you'll ever have [I'm referring to both the cake and the Mac n Cheese]). Service has been OK, but never bad. The place is large, yet intimate feeling. It's just one of those places that once you start going to, you never really stop, because its a reliable choice that'll satisfy you every time.
Really good sandwiches and salads.  Not great if you're a noisy group, unless you're at the bar!  Great bartenders!  Dessert tray is amazing!

I came here with my family to celebrate Mother's Day.  My mom and sister had already been there before but it was a first time for the rest of us.  I was excited to try their meatloaf but they had a buffet for the holiday.  Darn.  (Sarcasm)  It was amazing.  I especially enjoyed the vodka pasta.  I didn't think anyone could do vodka pasta better then Maggiano's but this place came close.  For dessert they had this amazing, unbelievable cheesecake.  It had a layer of chocolate fudge on the bottom and carmel dripped over the top.  Since then I've been trying to find a similar recipe on pinterest.  Everything was great, it was nice being able to try lots of things for one price.  My only suggestion would be to have smaller servings of the desserts during the buffet.  I wanted to try a little of everything but felt too guilty grabbing such large slices!  Luckily I was happy to eat off my family members' plates.

For review 280 I chose a place that I have been to a considerable number of times.  Since I have a fairly large family that continues to grow we need a pretty large area to gather with multiple food options.  The Clubhouse certainly meets the needs.

On Sundays they offer a large buffet which allows the family members their choices.  Made to order omelets, pancakes, french toast seem to be big hits.  They do offer a number of lunch items and salads if you are looking for lighter items.

My parents always request a particular server and he has always been excellent.  I recommend the Sunday buffet if you have a large group with varying tastes.  I have not heard a complaint from any family member on quality taste or selection available.

I wish I could give less stars than one but alas...

Carole C. and I went for a 39.95 brunch to celebrate the holiday and new year. We were excited to try the seafood selection which ranged from oysters on the half shell, crab claws, shrimp and smoked salmon to the cooked variations of salmon. The cold seafood left way to be desired. Carole had the unfortunate experience of swallowing a rancid oyster as I was only lucky enough to taste it briefly before I spat it out. The shrimp, while large, were not cleaned and smelled weird and the claws were definitely frozen. I left a whole plate of food untouched except for that spat out oyster. Our server, Andrea, didn't seem too concerned that we were spitting out food or that we were seated at a tiny table by the windows with a lovely view of the parking lot. We would have happily moved, but the noise volume was so loud in all the other areas, we opted to take Andrea's advice and work on our tans. Yep, she actually told us that was an advantage of sitting there. After drinking weak coffee and a tolerable mimosa, we decided to enjoy the hot selections of French toast (probably best thing there), carved piece of beef with a flavorless au jus (makes me wonder if they are catering to the more affluent side of known for no-flavor Cracker Barrel) and scrambled eggs, sautÃ©ed salmon that was a bit too ripe in some sort of glaze and the sorriest eggs Benedict I've ever tasted. Stuffed with carbs and defeated, as I just wanted to leave and was beating myself up as coming here was MY idea, we paid our $98 and left. 

But the Clubhouse was not done with me as only a few hours later, I became violently ill. Not to be TMI but things were coming out of both ends that looked so foreign, in my delirium I may have asked Carole to call Father Merrin. It was that trill. I was up all night making my bathroom my new bedroom and was repeatedly saying to myself 'the power of Christ compels you' as I trudged back and forth. I even had to call off work as the rebuking crept into the next day and out of concern for others, called the restaurant to tell them I was sick. 'Get better' being their response. No real concern for my well-being or offers to do anything. NOT that I'd ever go back in life. Not the staff, Andrea, you reading this review, Ellen Barkin or Linda Blair could make me. 

Place was mobbed so I couldn't tell much about ambiance and the elevator that you take to get to the second floor...on the way out it smelled like the Exorcism started in there. Should have been a warning sign to get the holy water prepped for the thing most foul that was soon to appear...
Nice place, good bartender, very good chopped salad, nice atmosphere, the only odd thing is the decor. A bit between classy and funhouse. I would say a cut above the Wildfire class of restaurants.

Yum yum yum - yes yes yes! So good! We had the Cali, the Paris and the Razzle Dazzle. Delicious! Service was quick, the space was small but sweet and they have outdoor seating. Odd that they don't have coffee - but a Starbucks is next door so no big deal. If you want a crepe and in the area, this place is to go. 

Food: 5/5 
Service: 4/5
Space: 4/5 - tiny, just be aware

Prob the best crepes I've had in the Chicagoland area. Reminded me of the amazing crepes you get in Cali. Nice, modern decor. Great service. 

We made our own savory crepe with goat cheese, mozzarella, caramelized onions, sun dried tomatoes, mushrooms, and arugula. For sweet, we got the Nani's Salted Caramel which had amazing Ghirardelli chocolate, pecans and homemade caramel...it was unreal.

Def check this place out!

We devoured a Kosmo, French Twist and a California. Took desserts to go. Nutella Fella and Nani's Salted Carmel.
Seating is tight and close, very Euro
Excellent crepe! Savory and sweets! We love the French Twist and our Build ur own of Nutella, strawberry and banana.
Place is super tiny but has outside seating.

Really yummy crepes both sweet and savory. Lots of healthy options and build your own add ons. 
Only negative is the limited seating...  Had to be creative to seat 4. 
Met the owner... Very friendly and accommodating. Will definitely come again!!!

The place was empty for a Tuesday evening but it felt very French indeed (music and decor). 

The Pinot Grigio was very good and service fairly fast.

The savory crepes does not quite match the unique "galette" taste from my dear homeland - Brittany but it was very good. 

I will go back soon to try more recipes.

I can't believe I didn't try this place sooner - the crepes were amazing, the staff and owner are really friendly and the place is very nice (modern and cute).

The Strawberry Suzzette is just phenomenal. I'm definitely coming back here more often!

I cannot say enough about this hidden gem! It sits behind the Starbucks in downtown Clarendon hills and at first, wasn't something I saw right away... But am I glad I did! There's a lot of care that goes into the service and making of the crepes and I'm hoping they stick around! The standard Nutella and banana is always delicious but try something new! You won't regret it here!

Out in the enclave of Clarendon Hills, in a corner shop by the Starbucks, is the new quaint family-owned and operated (and appropriately named) Little Creperie. What lacks in storefront size, though, is certainly made up for in big crepes with big flavor!

The many crepe options come in a neatly folded package that can just as easily be taken on the run as enjoyed in the few seats (a couple tables and some bar seating) available. Craft sodas available in the small fridge in the corner, take your pick as your crepe is freshly made.

You can feel free to build-your-own crepe from a dazzling array of fillings, or simply choose one of the many delicious combos. In any case, the crepe comes out crisp at the edges and soft and warm as you get to the center (at the bottom as you go). The holder is cardboard that tears as you eat down the crepe, until at long last you reach the bottom epicenter of warm crepe and gooey cheese which ends your satisfying meal.

Friendly staff and delicious crepes. Perfect texture and so many types to choose from, even choose your own fillings! 
These crepes are so clever, designed to be a finger food- no utensils needed!
Great little spot that should be checked out.

Cute little place right in downtown Clarendon hills! The staff was really friendly and crepes are really good with average prices! I had the razzle dazzle and my friend got the caprese and we both loved it! I do wish that mine had more raspberries, it felt like the crepe was huge but everything that was inside it was in tiny portions, but it was delicious none the less!
As close to authentic in flavor as I've found in Illinois. Definitely going back! It's more of a "to go" spot but it has beautiful decor! Love the options!

This place is quaint and cool and neat. I like it. 

The crepe is perfectly done and the combinations they make blend really well together. I got sweet and the wife got savory and both hit homeruns. The crepe is more filling than expected so no worries on leaving hungry and this only being a snack. Also based on this, the prices are very reasonable. 

We will be back!

Wonderful little place. The crepes were absolutely delicious. We thought they would not be enough for dinner, but they were plenty with a shared one for dessert. The service and the staff were more than nice.
We recommended they add a crepes with dulce de leche and chocolate -- it would be to die for.
Will definitely be back.
This place is extremely cute and the staff are very friendly. I love the crepes and dÃ©cor. Its definitely worth the visit and I'll be coming back very soon.

This place is excellent. I can't say enough. It's cozy, cute, welcoming and delicious! Linda the owner is very sweet and is always so engaging. I really enjoy that you can watch them make your crepe and see all the fresh wonderful ingredients they use. They also take a lot of care into each crepe they make so it's like you're having a little work of art for lunch :) I can't wait to go back and try a new one every time.

We came here a few weeks ago about 10 mins. Before closing time. They were patient and helpful considering we were minutes from closing time... We ordered our crepes and they came out quickly, they all were yummy, the friendly owner came to check on us, we chatted with her for a few minutes and as we finished our crepes she brought us some dessert ones to sample... I know this probably won't happen in a few years as they get bigger but it was greatly appreciated and surprising that she did this... We Will be coming back for more in near future..

What an amazing summer spot tucked next to Starbucks.. Decadent sweet crepes !!! The Baby Doll was to die for!! Savory you name it they have several specials daily !! And because the customers ask for them daily they keep them on daily!! It's like walking into your own kitchen!! Great atmosphere!! Wonderful service!! And amazing healthy options for all!! Young or old!! My new spot 
Can't wait to meet up with the ladies for a night out!! Since they have closed party's as well with BYOB..
Love this place ! It was great for a afternoon date with my husband. Food  was good ! service was super friendly! I can't wait to come back ! Outside eating area was nice and friendly

Visited this little gem over the weekend for the first time after trying to find a great creperie.  First of all the staff is top notch and the crepes are out of this world. Fresh ingredients and light fluffy thin crepes...our search is complete.  We had to have seconds to take with us they were that good, this will be a regular weekend visit and well worth the trip if you can make it. 

Exceptional!
i had the French Twist, and my friend had the Paris.  they were hot and delish. we were too full for dessert, so i have to go back for that! owners are very nice, very friendly. a great little spot!

This place is so amazing. I had the chocolate chip cookie crepe and I was amazed. Will be back soon, I was thoroughly impressed with the wonderful staff and amazing crepe creations. Would recommend The Little Creperie over other creperies in the area (Euro crepe, Nu crepes) cute little place tucked in Clarendon hills.

Little Creperie makes a delicious Nutella crepe that has the perfect amount of that tasty chocolatey goodness in every bite. Very nice location with comfortable chairs and tables outside to relax and enjoy seeing the world go by in pretty downtown Clarendon Hills. 
I haven't tried the many other crepe options here because their Nutella crepe is my excuse to periodically splurge on a decadent treat.
 If you to find a better Nutella crepe, post the place here.
Yummy, beautiful crepes! I can't want to drive 40 mins to go there again!

Oui, Oui, Oui, tres bon; no - c'est magnifique!!!.  This little shop is a crepe lover's dream.  The signature crepes are creative and varied, ranging from dessert sweet to dinner savory.  The custom menu has so many ingredient options, you could make up just about anything.  This place is not to be missed for a change of pace, breakfast, lunch or dinner.

The only negative is that the shop is so small, it can really only seat about 7 people, max.  While they try to make up for this by serving most crepes in hand-held wrappings, some crepes cannot be eaten by hand and you need a plate, fork and knife.  The Crepe Suzette, for example, is served on a flat palette board, but two people each eating one at the same table would be cramped.  If it had more seating, my rating would be 5 stars.  Once the warm weather rolls around, though, and outside tables and seating are available, this is a 5 star joint.

Tres Bien!! Delicious Crepes both Savory and Sweet!  My wife and I stopped here after a long bike ride. We had heard good things about this place. Everything on the menu sounded good so we tried a couple different options. We decided on the Cosmo(goat cheese arugula honey... mmm) the Tuscany( salami mozzarella pesto and arugula) and the Holy Cannoli which was bought for us by the very friendly owner who really wanted us to try one of the Sweets!. All of them were excellent!! Very fresh ingredients and the crepes are just luscious!!! We were so happy we stopped and can't wait come back to try some of the other choices. Highly recommended!!

This little shop is so cute! Its very tiny so there is limited seating but they serve the crepes in containers that are easy to eat on the go. Or you can ask for a plate and silverware if you are eating in. They have a menu with sweet or savory crepes listed, lots of delicious and unique options. Or they have another board with every ingredient they own so you can be creative and make your own. When we were there they had a girls birthday party going on which was a great idea. My crepe had goat cheese, fig spread, roasted pecans, arugula, honey, etc. - so good! I normally go for a sweet option but I'm glad I listened to the waitress and tried a popular savory item. Its such a good idea to take crepes on the go and they are affordable- under $10 per person. I will definitely be back.
Delicious crepes. My only complaint is how messy it can get without a plate, especially for the kids.

The crepes here were the best Iv'e ever tasted. I was skeptical because I'm not a fan of store bought crepes, but after ordering the Caprese and Smores crepes for me and my daughter I was very happy I decided to give crepes a second chance. These crepes are so so delicious and one was also very filling. I will be coming back here for more next time I'm in the area. Thanks Little Creperie for the awesome food and concept.

Excellent spot! Crepes are outstanding, specials are creative, and inside and outside seating is perfect. Linda (owner) even made a crepe for my dog, which he devoured. He only barks in french now....can't understand a woof. Get here!!

The Little Creperie is such a great addition--and frankly a much-needed one--to the western suburbs. The crepes are delicious and restaurant warm and cozy. My family has tried about half the menu and we are excited to go back!

I drove 20 minutes during rush hour to get a crepe and arrived at 6:45 and they were closed on a Thursday when their hours say they are open until seven. I guess the business hours don't mean a thing. They should really stay open until they say they were. I had to drive all the way home in traffic with no crepe

Your crepes are fantastic and I'd rate you a 6 out of 5 if only you'd open before 10am on the weekends.  My husband and I live a couple of blocks from your adorable restaurant, but have only been there twice in the past six months.  I can count at least ten other times we've wanted to go, including bringing house guests a few times, only to remember you don't open until 10am.  While crepes are fantastic for lunch, they're even better for breakfast.  Won't you please consider opening at 8am?  Other Yelpers, does anyone second this request?

Wow this place is good!  My husband stumbled on this quant little shop during one of the concert series in dt CH.  We split a crepe thinking we weren't that hungry,...bad idea.  I devoured the whole thing.  Will definitely come back for lunch with friends.

Clarendon Hills is turning into a foodie hotspot! This place is a unique addition with really good, freshly made crepes. Creative and TASTY! You get a big loaded crepe with good ingredients for a decent price. They have sweet and savory selections, both awesome. I love the French Twist and Crepe Suzette. Recently had the Caprese and it was bursting with flavor! If Clarendon gets a wine shop again, it will feel like a little Midwest Yountville.

I have visited this new addition to the Clarendon Hills / Hinsdale area several times since it opened, and it is a true gem. I have tried varieties of both the savory and sweet crepes, and each one has been fantastic.
Everyone who works here is very friendly, which makes the experience very positive.
Try it out!

The crepes here were great! They had a wide variety of options, plus the option to make your own. This place is tiny!! I wouldn't plan on eating in on a busy morning/afternoon. However, it is very nicely decorated and delicious.

Just visited the place last week and enjoyed the sweet crepe with strawberries and "special"sauce... delicious.  Will definitely come back with my husband and my nieces for more. Unfortunately please place don't have many varieties of drinks but owner even suggested herself that if I would like some coffee I can get it next door at Starbucks and enjoy it it my crepe.

My friend and I finally stopped by here a week ago and had the nutella fella and she had a custom order. It was absolutely delicious! Usually the nutella crepes are overwhelmingly sweet and stuffed with globs of nutella. This place got the ratio perfect. It was sweet, filled with bananas and cookie crumbles which gave it a wonderful texture. I am excited to return and try something else! The place is adorable, kind of small but just perfect for a treat and the owner is just fabulous.

Both the sweet and the savory options are fantastic. While it is a little expensive - it was a great place for a special treat. We ended up getting way too many as they are huge portions but took a few home to enjoy later in the day. Highly recommend.

Yum
Yum 
Yum and begin delish
Reminds me of eating crepes late at night when I was in Europe love it here! A must try!!
Good food, very few tables inside, nice outside seating available.

The crepes are thicker than the traditional French ones; but, Toto, we're not in Paris anymore - and to be fair they are tasty and clearly compromised of high quality ingredients. The "Paris" crepe needed 3x more Brie and double the ham than was within. In the incarnation I received, I was basically eating mouthfuls of dough and my tastebuds could barely detect the super thin, sparse slices of cheese and meat nestled in the folds. It was a disappointment, especially at $8. With a lot more filling, it would have been gooey goodness. The second crepe I ordered was a holiday special that was evidently no longer on the menu (white chocolate, cherries and grand marnier) - the manager kindly offered to recreate it as best she could given she didn't have grand marnier. Her impromptu creation turned out terrific: sweet but not overly, lots of filling and creamy. I'd love to see some simpler crepes on tap like a traditional Suzette and my favorite, lemon and sugar. In summation, the place needs some tweaks but it has potential and the staff is accommodating and seems adaptable to improvement.

I highly recommend this place to all who enjoy crepes, as long as you're not in a hurry. The food is delicious. Very fresh ingredients, lots of organic options. You can order savory or sweet recommendations, or you can build your own crepe.  I have visited three times, and found the service extremely friendly. It is a small shop, with one chef at a time, so it can take a long time for them to make your crepe if there is anyone ahead of you. That is the only reason for taking away one star. If you have time to sit and relax and wait for your crepe, you should definitely check this place out. Very unique! My kids love it too and keep asking when we can go back. Also, the crepes are very filling. Before eating there, I wondered if they were worth the money. Totally! One is extremely filling.  So for $8-9, you're getting a whole meal.

Fantastic crepes  My husband and I went in for the first time and it most certainly will not be the last! As soon as we walked in the owner Linda introduced herself, showed us through the menus (sweet and savory) and helped us narrow down our choices from their huge selection. The crepes were made fresh, served hot, and were so delicious. The store was pretty tiny but really quaint and cozy. Overall we had a lovely and joyfully satisfying meal. I'm totally in love with this place now.

My hubby and I checked this place out today and we were not disappointed. The store is very easy to find and when you walk in, it's a cozy space that has the most adorable decor. They make the crepes right in front of you and you can see how fresh everything is. I ordered the kosma and my husband the Tuscany. It was so delicious! The crepes come in these adorable crepe pocket holders that make it easy to eat. The owner is so nice and polite. She really took the time to get to know us. We are expecting a baby very soon and our dessert crepe she put on a wooden board with the baby's name on it and really decorated it nicely. It was so sweet and really unexpected. Downsides are it is a small establishment and if there are a few people in front of you, the turn around time for your crepe is a little longer. It was worth the wait. Can't wait to go back.

Love Love Love this place!    The staff is so friendly and the food is amazing.   My daughter loved the Nutella crepe and I personally like the California one.     Very fresh ingredients and reasonably priced.    This is just what Clarendon Hills needed.     Will definitely be going back often.

The little Creperie is probably the best place to go get food in Clarendon Hills. It is quick and delicious! It has a wide selection of sweet and savory crepes to choose from and you can even make your own! And the owner, Linda there is very passionate about her job and is very friendly. I definitely recommend this place!

The staff at this place are super rude and argumentative. I came in here expecting a mom and pop feel, but what I got instead was the feeling that mom and pop were going through a messy divorce! After ordering a blackberry crepe and it taking FOREVER to get (come on its a crepe it shouldn't take that long to make) I missed my train! The crepe itself wasn't all that good....I've had better crepes at home. This place has so so food and the arguments between staff members made me feel akward.....I won't be visiting again.

Note: this place is a true dive bar and I am rating it as such.

This place is just fun and doesn't claim to be any more than it is. Unpretentious straight up divey fun. Not everyone's cup of tea but if you're looking for a dark spot to throw back some beers and hang out with the regulars, this spot is the place for you. Not glamorous or fancy, just a gold old fashioned dive bar. Kinda dingy, a little dank. This place isn't the ritz but it does make for a fun night of tipsy people watching. 

My friend and I came here for Cinco de Mayo. They had live music, cheap beer and tequila, and exceptional prices. We even wandered into the Latin dancing place a few doors down and had a great time.

The bar is full of regulars and the staff is loyal and friendly. Willing to grab or make you whatever drink you may want. They even grabbed us some cactus beads! Fiesta!

Dive bars are some of the best kinds of bars. Well, at least my 28 year old self thinks so. I've definitely come to appreciate a good dive bar, so I was happy to have stumbled across Danny's Pub last weekend with my husband and parents.

We spent the afternoon hopping around a couple places for drinks and as the day turned into night, we were looking for someplace chill to go hangout. Our go-to dive is typically The Lantern downtown Naperville, but that place is actually pretty packed on a Saturday night. Plus, I'm always in the mood to try somewhere new. Luckily, my Yelp app led me to Danny's!

The decor of this place is everything you can imagine a local pub to be. Nothing fancy, mix of tables, long bar, pool table... pretty standard. Our waitress was super nice and let us know of the domestic bucket special which was too cheap to pass up. We mixed and matched the 5 beers with Budweiser and Michelob Ultra and ended up sticking around for probably 3 buckets. My husband ended up ordering some wings which he seemed to enjoy.

We had a fun time hanging out and drinking at Danny's (without breaking the bank!). On a Saturday night it was lively, but not overly busy which was nice because we could actually sit down and hear each other talk! I will definitely be putting this pub in my bar repertoire moving forward.

I didn't eat or drink anything here - I walked out after about 2 minutes. Why?

First, anyone who knows me (or reads my reviews) can easily tell that I love exploring non-corporate, non-chain franchises and out-of-the-way places. While I am definitely a foodie, I am not a "snobbie." And therein lies my issue with the girl tending bar I encountered during the day last week. 

I saw a sign saying "Burger Heaven" out front, so I wandered in, sat at the bar and got some info from the bartender about their burger deal. After I told her I was a foodie, she says "Oh no - you're a snob! You're going to find a flaw with whatever we serve you." After I tell her I'm not a snob, she says "Oh, I think you are." And then: "You can leave for all I care." Which I immediately did. 

I'm guessing the bartender is not the owner - I wonder what they would think about her speaking to/pissing off new customers like that? 

Well Danny's, here's your dubious honor: I have never encountered anything like this in all my travels (here or abroad), and I'm sharing this story about your place and your ridiculous bartender in the "you won't believe this one" category.

First, I used to live five minutes away from this place and was in Danny's a few times. That was a few years back so some of the information in my review may no longer apply, but it's weird enough that I had to post.

My first trip to Danny's ended in me being thrown out. It was not for fighting. It was not for screaming or being rowdy. It was for swearing. I was kicked out of a fucking bar for swearing, in a conversational tone and volume, to a friend of mine. The bartender (which I believe is the owner's daughter) heard me and asked me not to swear, which seemed odd since we were sitting in a bar surrounded by adults, so I replied with a stunned "...whathefuck?" and out we went. I did wind up returning without incident, but it did not get much better.

This place is so heavy on regulars that it's almost depressing, and be prepared to wait for your drink until everyone in the first-name-basis club gets theirs. Danny's makes the classic mistake of pandering to the people that are there every day. Those people will be there every day regardless. What they need to do it attract new people, but they tend to do the opposite. Whatever.

Oh, and this is NOT, NOT, NOT a dive bar. It's nothing close to a dive bar. That's just a buzz word that gets casually attached to far too many places.

Only go here if it's thursday or friday when Shawna is working.  The blond bar tender that is there most of the other time is horrible.  She is slow, rude, can't make a drink right and will yell at you if you don't leave her a big enough tip.  She actually even double charged me when she didn't like my tip I left her.  Other then her its a fun dive bar but I will not be going back until they get a good bar tender during the rest of the week.
Soggy, greasy fried fish was awful tonight. Basically inedible. Told server and minimal reaction. Otherwise, a decent small bar.

As I've gotten older, I've grown to appreciate dive bars. Sure, the "trendy" spots are fun when you're newly 21 and dressed to impress people you don't even know. But those days are long gone, and now the thought of going somewhere for a drink in jeans, a sweater, and no makeup on New Years Day is pretty exciting. 

Before our annual NYD dinner, the bf suggested we stop here for a Bloody Mary, which sounded fabulous. We made our way through the unplowed streets and inside the bar.

Once inside, we felt silly sitting at a booth since food was not on our agenda, so we took the last two open seats at the bar, opposite of the three youngsters (compared to us) slamming shots. The bartender came over to us immediately to take our older. The bf told her we'd like some Bloody Mary's. She asked if we wanted regular or spicy; of course we picked spicy and she proceeded to make the drinks right in front of us. These Bloody's were garnished with three green olives, a large pickle spear, and of course a stick of celery. 

The Bloody was delicious, and the bartender certainly did a great job of making it spicy. I finished mine long before the bf was halfway through his. We probably would have stuck around for another, except for the fact that obnoxious rap music was playing (thanks to the young kids who kept feeding their money into the music player), which ruined the atmosphere. This wasn't your usual hip-hop/rap you hear on the radio and know some of the lyrics to, but gangsta rap, which leaves you wanting to kick a dog in the ass for no reason. Feeling agitated from the music, I couldn't wait to get out of there. We paid our tab and left to go grab dinner.

We'll probably go back, as this is the only bar within walking distance (something to consider for warmer months). I've heard their food is pretty decent, so I'll probably give something a try next time. I just hope there's a nicer mix of music being played.

This is my first yelp ever. I work in the service industry so takes a lot to push me over the edge. But I have NEVER been treated so poorly at an establishment ever!!!! It was my friend's birthday and she really wanted to go sing karaoke Friday night. So a group of us friends went over. We live 2 minutes from this bar so I was excited we found a new place to go! We were standing around talking & listening to everyone sing when all of the sudden this drunken SLOB comes up to us calling us every name in the book and then kicks my friend and pushes him into the pool table! Are you kidding?! When my friend and I went to go tell the bartender, she tells us she doesn't believe us and that he is an amazing customer....never will I return to this disgusting, sloppy, sad excuse of a "dive bar". I will definitely be spreading the word.

I've been on a quest to find the best fish fry around. I really like the idea here that you can have a single serving order or the AYCE. I find myself never eating more than they give on a single serving, so to save a couple bucks never hurts. I also really enjoyed the "chips" instead of fries. They're roughly sliced potato chips that are chunky and unique. You can get fries too if you prefer.

They have cod in filet form. I prefer the log style, as the filet got lost in the batter and was almost too thin in spots and had no texture. The batter has a great flavor and is super puffy and crispy. Nice homemade flavor in the tarter and the coleslaw is off the hook. As Katie my wonderful waitress said... she can eat bowls of it. I concur and they give you a fair serving, but a monkey dish size is always a good thing, when it tastes this good. 

I've been in over the years for their great lunch specials and a few years back even made it in for Tina's Karaoke Night. I don't drink, so the real lure of this spot doesn't shine. Never made it in for the live music either, so I have no real input there. As stated , my server Katie could not have been sweeter. I need to get in again for their weekday lunch specials, as they are a great value.

OMG. So upset I haven't visited this place previously! One of my besties lives just minutes from here, so we finally visited for a Hawks games and were not disappointed. Perfect "hole in the wall" type feel, very small and cozy, with great service. I don't know how the prices compared (I didn't pay) and didn't have food, but definitely plan to do both (pay and eat!) sooner rather than later. I can't wait to visit again!
Danny's is a great place to stop after work. The staff is friendly and eager to please. Food is simple but delicious!
Favorite local bar.  Renee is awesome, knowledgeable, friendly, attentive and makes a good drink! Good burgers, chili, wings and my grilled cheese w/bacon was excellent.  Good music too.

So I was led to believe that this place attracted a young crowd. Everyone there was in their thirties or so. The overall "feel" of the bar was a little sleepy to be honest. I heard there was karaoke and thought it must be a really fun and energetic atmosphere but mostly it was lazy conversation and pool. Then the bartender refused to serve me because she said she "didn't take my kind of ID." So apparently government issued driver's licenses aren't acceptable IDs or something?
It wasn't a terrible bar but it definitely was sleepy and kindof an old people bar.

Definitely a dive bar. The staff is very friendly and really the best part of the bar. The food is ok, basic lower end bar food with no frills. The place is pretty dark and kind of smoky. There is just something missing from this place and I definitely wish it was cleaner. I might go back, but given the choice I would try to go elsewhere.
Our server was very courteous and friendly, but the burger really seemed like a very recently frozen hockey puck. No craft beers, if that's your thing.

This place is awesome!  Great decor and even better mini tacos!  I personally had the Reuben sandwich.....with a sir of the Reuben soup!  It was to die for.  Ran into an old friend, pictures below.  Good things happen when you're drinking at Danny's!

This place is alright by me. We came on a Friday night for karaoke and their bucket special. I'm not a big fan of Bud Light, but at $9 per bucket I wasn't feeling to frowny about it.

It says they are a grill, but they didn't have food at the time we were there; however, the girl working the bar said we could go grab food anywhere nearby and bring it back. I thought that was pretty nice.

Everyone was friendly. We did a couple group songs with total strangers and sang to them. Everyone had a good time.

A hidden gem on Rte 59 in West Naperville... Actually the ONLY bar in Naper that I go to. Great staff, great people, great food, great drinks... They also have GT, darts, pool, and awesome entertainment! Trivia Wednesday, Karaoke, and Live Music... Basically everything you could ever ask for in a bar! If you see me there and you are not enjoying yourself, I will buy you a drink! Promise!

I'm a fan of dive bars.. Usually have great service and fun regulars. I was not very impressed with Danny's. Service wasn't the greatest, however I would consider giving it another chance. Full bar menu, pool table, etc.

Danny's is a real local bar. Not a chain or TGIF or some downtown Naperville place. There aren't a million flat-screen TV's all over the place. No fancy aperitifs. No hot, young servers trollop-ping about. No manicured entryway.

It's just a local bar in a strip mall (right next to the pawn shop). It was nice. And the prices were pretty reasonable. I think the highlight was the Killian's on tap. 

I asked our (very nice) server if they had chicken fingers on the menu. She replied that they did, but they were very large... more like chicken hands.

I'll go back again.
yow, bill

PS - I have this mental image stowed away in long-term memory. Parked outside Danny's was a small compact car with a large plastic, misshapen foot attached to the roof advertising foot massages for $25. Excellent.

This place is a must visit for everybody who is new in town. The owners and the regulars will embrace all new guests and involve you in their conversations. Danny's Pub & Grill is a real life "Cheers" where everybody knows your name.
Thank you guys!

Danny's is a local bar with typical bar food, fried appetizers, burgers and sandwiches.  They have daily food and drink specials.  The prices are fair and the portions are generous.  They have Guinness on tap so that is always a plus in my book.  Nice little pub to watch a game and have a few beers. The staff is extremely friendly.

So this is the first time I have rated a restaurant online- but my experience last week at Dannys is making me.
Lets start off my stating the owner closed the kitchen at 8:00PM, even after I called to verify the kitchen being open later than this.
The bathroom was disgusting- it appeared that it has not been cleaned in weeks. My boyfriend said the mens bathroom was equally as disgusting- he even said he was afraid the urinal was going to fall off the wall
There was also an odor of some type of plumbing leak.
Needless to say, there are plenty of other options in the Naperville area.

I am a fan of Danny's...

The best part is its one of those places where you go if you know everyone. Its like living in the show cheers. I ended up going because someone from work frequents the bar. It might have been strange however if i didnt know a regular. I loved the fact that there were signs that said "NO CURSING" on the wall. 

Made me think twice until i realized that was a joke to all of the people who had never been in... like me. There is always a drink special so I dont have to worry about breaking the bank on feeling good. 

A bonus perk... Free pool on the one table during the weekends. Also, karaoke with a cast of randoms on Thursday! I'll have to take a stroll back in there.
Great place for a cocktail!  They mix it right.  Lori and Matt are great as well as their staff.  Thanks for giving us a great local place to go!

Went there this weekend and had a great time again. The bartender remembered me and was very friendly.  They also had some great live music. Just a guy with his keyboard singing some classics, but it added some nice atmosphere to the bar. And yes, of course I had a cake shot.

Ok in order to like this bar you have to like Local hole in the wall bars. I have never eaten here, but I have spent some time bellied up to the bar with the little lady. Everyone knows everyone and I love that. We were quickly welcomed by the regulars and had some great conversation.

So normally I do a GOOD, BAD, and UGLY segemnt to my reviews, but I think I will just leave it as UGLY.

The UGLY (and there's a lot of it.): So I came in the place to try to pick up some food since I've been to all the other places in the mini strip mall (I work down the street, and wanted to grab something new). I go into the dim lit place and sat at a table rather than sitting at the bar. The place has about 3-4 people in the place but it's pretty much dead for the size. I sit and wait....and wait....and wait for a menu. Finally, I get up and ask for 1 from the lady at the bar. She looks at me as if she were sizing me up for a fight. Really who does that? In the words of Chris Rock, "I would never hit a woman...but I would shake the *$%?! out of her!" Then she responds in a snobby tone, "Yeah sure." With my right hand cocked back ready for an actual fight with this lady, I took the menu with my left. I was hesitant to ask for a drink since I already had this bad of service already, but I asked for a Miller Lite since it was on tap. She actually was quick with that. The beer for some reason tasted real flat and bitter. I mean Miller Lite isn't the greatest tasting beer, but I knew it shouldn't taste like that. For me that was it. You screwed up the service and now you screwed up the beer. I was already afraid to think of what the food would taste like. I left the rest of my beer at the bar and stormed out of the place. I went next door to Subway and grabbed a footlong and a cookie I believed I deserved for putting up with all that crap.
Good food, great service! My favorite is the pumpkin pancakes with cream cheese sauce. You know it's a good place because all the over-60 locals eat here

Sweet potato cafe has changed and unfortunately isn't a great as it used to be. 

Although they were very friendly and the customer service was great, the food wasn't. They allow you to order items not on the menu from the past owners which was a huge plus, it just wasn't the same. They've admitted they they have changed cooks, that is 100% the reason why the food is how it is. They used to provide with a basket of bread, they no longer do that. I ordered the flank steak and was probably the worst skirt steak I have I tried. And I love skirt steak.  It was not properly seasoned, lack of salt as well as their hash browns. Literally had no flavor. I will probably not be returning here

If you name your restaurant the "Sweet Potato Cafe" then your sweet potatoes need to be *on point*. 

I ordered the sweet potato hash skillet and was served a dish with roasted large chunks of under cooked sweet potatoes, onions, carrots, and roughly chopped red peppers. 

The roasted sweet potatoes were so under cooked I couldn't put the fork through them. (Note: the menu said the skillet comes with sweet potato hash - I was expecting smaller diced sweet potato that had been pan fried...)

When we told the waitress that the sweet potatoes were under cooked she was very nice and apologized but also mentioned "yeah, they tend to under cooked the sweet potato - that's just how they make it".

The service was s-l-o-w. But, very polite and nice. Our waitress was great, whenever we eventually saw her. 

I think we will give this place another shot - but definitely steer clear of the sweet potato hash skillet... because it's actually a roasted root vegetable skillet.

Sweet Potato Cafe in Warrenville is in a shopping center on the NE corner of Batavia Rd and Hwy 59.  The shopping centered is anchored by a wonderful family grocery store aptly named Family Foods.  The store and it's donuts is another review.  Next door to the store is a cafe named Sweet Potato Cafe.  Living up to it's name the cafe does offer almost everything sweet potatoes.  However, the key word in the last sentence is not sweet or potato, but the word everything, because everything we tried was wonderful.  

SPC offers vegetable and vegan offerings as well as meat.  It seems for a moment that the restaurant is trying to be all things to all patrons, and how often does that work? Well...let's find out, shall we?

I ordered an Aloha Burger which encouraged our waitress to do a little dance.  The burger is a half pound of angus with provolone, thick ham, onions, pineapple and barbeque sauce for 10 bucks.  This burger would stand up against Chicago's finest.  

Homemade dessert sounded intriguing, but we were about to be disappointed when there was no more death by chocolate cheesecake.  Would it be wrong to say the Bread Pudding was to die for? But it was...best I've had outside New Orleans.  Some chefs, cooks and bakers know how to use basic elements and proper techniques instead of artificial flavoring to enhance taste.  It seems Cindy has the recipe and know how to deliver a genuine bread pudding.  

SPC has an extensive menu.  They are a breakfast and lunch place that now does dinner.  Beef stroganoff...how good can it be?  Let's find out, shall we?

Normally, this place is alright, typical, breakfast food. However, today, for the first time, my office ordered it to-go. Never do this. Apparently if you're not there to complain, the food will be done lazily. All of the food was cold. I ordered a side of corned beef hash (literally, nuked, not fried at all), a skillet (that I ordered no onions or jalepenos, and it had jalepenos, which I had to pick out, also no hot sauce was added on the side as requested), a co-worker ordered a sandwich without tapers (it came with tapers), we also ordered soup with extra cheese on it (and it had zero cheese) and we asked for lots of ketchup and got about 4-5 packets. So, if you go here, make sure to personally go, because we will not order to-go again. The one co-worker just moved here from Florida and we were saying what a great place this was, now she's disgusted and refuses to try here again.

This looked like a good place to try out for breakfast, so we hoisted ourselves outta bed early and journeyed out for a bite to eat...

First, we were confused by the name... I was hoping that there would be more items with sweet potatoes... Hashbrowns, pancakes, crepes, something! Nope... Nada... So, what's the deal?!

We both felt like having the Country Fried Steak... I can't say that we were much impressed by it though. The breading was bland and the steak seemed more like a frozen patty. The eggs were really greasy. And I love my sausage gravy; I rate all breakfast places on how well they make their gravy... This was a lackluster gravy. It lacked seasoning and was strangely thick.

Our server wasn't very attentive. It was a little like going to a buffet. She stopped by twice. Once to give us drinks and take our order... Then once more to leave us the check. I wouldn't recommend this place.

We've eaten here several times but we do carry out at least once a week, if not more. 
The breakfast portion is so big that we usually just share one item. 
Their breakfast burrito, soups and the skillets are good but regular fries don't taste the best. We usually opt for sweet potato fries if we can.

2/20/16
It's 8:30, I've driven up and down 59 with a burger on my mind all I see is fast food and I know what it's gunna be like.....nothing to write home about. About to give up and settle for Burger King, I see the open sign at Sweet Potato Cafe. Siri tells me they close at 9 and I've worked food service and hated to be that guy that's the reason the kitchen that's in the process of being cleaned has to get greasy again. So I asked if I have time for an order and they said of course. I'm handed the menu and immediately look at the burgers. I go for the build your own with pretzel bun, Swiss cheese, mushrooms and bacon. I'm offered beer battered fries which I've never had anywhere so of course I'm gunna try them, and then I'm offered some soups, I decide for the sweet potato chipotle.
