Man oh man am I glad I decided to come in! The soup, perfect balance of sweet potato flavor with a subtle kick of heat that was just surprisingly delightful. Soon after I finish this the burger and fries come out. The burger is nearly overflowing with the mushrooms and bacon. I dressed it up with a lil mustard and ketchup, the provided pickles, tomatoes and lettuce and was ready to dig in. First bite? Tasted like I grilled it on my own grill in my back yard! Juicy and delicious! Man did that hit the spot! The fries were excellent too! At that point, my journey for a satisfying burger was over. Every bite was delicious. I almost ordered another one to go. Yes, it was that good. So my star rating just got boosted to 5. The service is great, it doesn't matter if it's jam packed in the morning or if your the last guy keeping them open, they are friendly and ready to make sure you enjoy your experience and your food. No matter what time of day, they have something on that menu that will satisfy and that is truly rare to be able to excel at at their level on any food service at any time of the day. I feel truly blessed to live just down the street! Keep up the great work guys! You're putting out some fantastic eats!



Prior review which kicked it up to 4 stars...I forget the date.

Came back in for the Cinnamon Swirl Pancakes. OMG, it is literally the best pancake I have ever eaten. Their pancakes are light, fluffy and flavorful to begin with but then somehowe they make a spiral in the pancakes and fill the seam with a delicious cinnamon and sugar concoction that when paired with the icing on top tastes amazingly like a pancake that would be produced in a Cinabon, except, they don't make them, SWEET POTATO CAFE however DOES!!!!

These were delicious. Hands down. The other special items they had on the board were very tempting! Portabello and Fried Green Tomato Benedicts, those were hard to pass on today, but I will certainly be back for more!

Keep up the great work!
Have always had great experiences here! Love the menu, everything I've tried has been pretty good. Love the cinnamon pancakes!!

Shanna was an amazing server. Literally read my mind every time I was even beginning to want something. They have a pretty good variety. The food was just decent  and reasonably price. Truthfully, the 4 is as a result of the great service.
Good food, great service. Love it!! Had the classic skillet with Turkey sausage it was so good.

I had never been here when it was WPH, so for my first impression, I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived to find a full dining room (always a good sign). The hostess greeted us and we were immediately seated in a booth.

Sandy was our server and she was very pleasant. I ordered the Acapulco Skillet, which comes with scrambled eggs (I chose egg whites), Chorizo, onion, and jalapenos, topped with monterey jack cheese. M tried the Lumberjack Skillet, which has hash browns, corned beef hash,and a  melted blend of cheese. I opted for wheat toast and M chose white. We also shared a side of bacon.

Our food arrived sooner than I had expected. We dug in, and I was impressed. The chorizo was perfect; not overly greasy but not bone-dry. The hash browns were good, but we both agreed they could have been cooked a minute or so longer. M enjoyed his skillet; he didn't leave a scrap of food behind. I was surprised, as he usually doesn't order skillets and he was a bit apprehensive about ordering one at first.

What I noticed about SPC is how hardworking the employees are. Not one person stood around. Even the hostess would tuck in chairs at nearby tables if she wasn't tending to customers. I saw the owner walking around, putting down fresh coffee cups and wiping down tables. He didn't stand still once. I was impressed. 

Sweet Potato Cafe was a great find. M's only gripe is that they don't have alcohol so he couldn't get a Bloody Mary, but that isn't really a deal breaker. I did notice that while Sandy was great and kept coming by to refill our coffees, she didn't offer to refill our  near empty water carafe. Aside from that, I enjoyed the food at SPC and look forward to future visits.

I love this place!
The menu is fabulous and the food is delicious. Coffee is always filled and always fresh.  This was my second time here and both times the experience was great.
Staff was fast and friendly and we were seated right away both times even though both times were packed.

Hint- If you check in on yelp you get 10% off your bill!

Okay so we'll start off with the good qualities of this place. 1st the parking is ample so no crowded lot to worry about on Saturday or Sunday mornings.  2nd it was nice and quite when we went, and the place was clean. 3rd they have a gluten free menu, which is s major win in my book. 4th, the cream of chicken soup was great, I am a chicken soup lover so any time I see any kind on a menu I have to try it. The soup was hit and creamy with a decent amount of chicken which most cream of chicken soups seem to lack so that was a win. For my meal I got a cheese omelette that was large, but was lacking in abundance in cheese and moisture. Also when we went there was only one waitress which I'm guessing isn't normal so I'll ignore the wait times as just a fluke. I think I'll give this place another try sometime.
.

For a far west suburban neighborhood cafe in a strip mall, Sweet Potato Cafe fits the bill. The menu has a lot of traditional breakfast items to choose from and the food is generally good. Nothing is spectacular, but then, nothing is inedible. Service is alright, but nothing spectacular either. First, servers decide when you've had enough coffee and it's time to leave. Not that anyone is waiting for your table...it's just time to get out of your seat. Dining with 2 friends I don't see often, it's nice to have a leisurely breakfast, except no one appraised our server. We didn't have fresh coffee for quite a while when realizing they want us to leave after an hour and 1/2 - so 10:30. Eggs are good and they know how to make a poached or basted or sunny side up egg. I didn't have any, but my friends pancakes looked good and he enjoyed them, as well as the steak and eggs. Two of us ordered toast, both of which were cold. Not the end of the world, but it's nice to have toasty toast instead of cold toast. Oh well. I could have done without the hash browns. They weren't awful, but they were salty, in fact, they were very, very salty. My friend who loves salt didn't say anything about the potatoes but did comment about the cold toast. All in all, the food here is 3 stars decent, maybe 3 1/2 to be exact. There's a lot of things on the menu, and maybe pancakes are a better option than toast!

The quality of food that this place is dishing is right on! I am a fan of their pancakes and have enjoyed their skillets. On a busy Sunday morning we have never had to wait to be seated and the staff is always quick and curious. Will definitely be back!

First time I have been here since the name changed. Nothing much seems to have changed on the inside though. Came here with some friends on their recomendation. I had the Acapulco ("Mexican") skillet and my wife had her usual Belgium  Waffle.

Our server was a friendly enough young woman but when our food arrived the first thing I noticed was a large chip in my plate. Not just a little chip but a large clam shell chip on the side.  It didn't look like it was done recently, just an old plate but I thought that it shows quite a bit of disrespect to serve your customers food on a plate in this condition.  This dish should have been trashed. The restaurant was not well filled so I am sure they could not have given out all the good china already!  I did not want to make a scene in front of our friends who recommended the restaurant so I bit my tongue and proceeded to eat my meal without comment. Bad enough that this chip was mocking me as I was eating the skillet also did not fit squarely on the plate causing it to spin around like the tea cup ride at Six Flags. I must have looked quite comical tackling this breakfast. The food itself was unremarkable and looked like it was plated in a rush. The potatoes in the skillet were overcooked and gluey. Held together in a big old lump. My wife thought that her waffle was dry and not up to her expectations.

The coffee service stopped abruptly after our plates were removed. Although the restaurant was by no means full it seems we were no longer welcome to sit there and talk a bit. All in all I hope our friends do not ask us to come back but we have a good "breakfast club"  that likes to go out and try different restaurants.

The sweet potato cafe was a cute little diner like restaurant.  We went in around 5:00 on a Saturday and there were only two other couples.  A few regulars came in after we were seated. 

I ordered the sweet potato soup in a bread bowl and it was delicious!! My husband ordered the poppers and they were good, but they were very different than what we were used to.  They do serve alcohol also. 

We would definitely try it again if we are in the area!

I only gave two stars for the dinner hour, otherwise it's four stars for breakfast. I am in here at least 2 or 3 times a week. I had the All you can eat Fish Fry. I was very disappointed with the fish. I was told by the server that the fish is frozen not fresh. The fish was mushy and the beer batter was very greasy. I did not even want a second helping. 
I will return for breakfast but will probably skip the dinner hour.

Ordered the veggie grinder to-go. It had Wilted lettuce along with it missing the mustard, asparagus, and blue cheese. Disappointing Mothers Day lunch for sure. 
My husband ordered a breakfast dish and they didn't include syrup or butter to go with the pancakes.
Food was ok and reasonably priced. Our server Shannan was excellent (5 stars for her).

This place is pretty good every time I go... The Breakfast stuff seems better than the lunch menu ..the Soup is usually really good and I have never tried the dinners..good atmosphere. .usually not to crowded.
They changed the name but the food is the same. Bland bland and more bland. Tried it twice. Won't waste my money again.

The breakfast menu is somewhat limited, but they have a lot of gluten free options for those that can't have gluten. We tried it for the first time last night and it was a little disappointing. I ordered cinnamon apple crepes, which weren't very good at all. They were very greasy and some of the apples were burnt, it tasted like frozen food or something too. My fiancÃ© ordered a cheese omelet and gluten free pancakes and he said they were just "okay." However, the employees there are friendly and the food isn't too pricy at all. Not the worst place I've eaten but not the best either.

Freshest vegetables they crunch when you bite into them. This is the best breakfast in the area. The owners have the right idea about how a restaurant should be. Great job job to everyone that works there. Please never change.

Recently I've been searching for something between my home and my mom's for Sunday brunch. Sweet Potato Cafe absolutely fit the bill! I read a few mixed reviews and figured "Meh, what do we have to lose". 
Initial impressions were good. One of my husband's biggest qualms with some of our regular brunch spots is that they feel claustrophobic from the moment you're seated, and Sweat Potato was surprisingly spacious! Our booth comfortably sat 3 adults and 1 spaz-tastic 2 year old. 
The menu was expansive which initially concerned me, because usually that means horribly mediocre food, but that wasn't the case here. We each ordered different dishes and we were all very pleased with them. I also appreciated the availability of turkey/chicken breakfast meats. I personally don't eat pork so still having the option of a protein other than eggs made me happy. 
The service was also good, our food came out fresh and fast. 
Overall we'll happily be adding this spot to our rotation.

Your typical breakfast fare. Had a basic skillet which was good but didn't notice on the menu that it had mushrooms in it, yuck. My bad. Service lacked a little but again could have been our fault for asking to move to another table after being seated so we could be in the front to keep an eye on our bikes on the back of our car.

We have been enjoying on average a meal a week at Sweet Potato Cafe. It never fails to please us and any guests we take with us! From members of the older generation in our family/friend circle to the younger grandchildren, everyone leaves raving! For breakfast, lunch or dinner, their selections are wide-ranged and well-prepared. Additionally, they offer daily specials that are excellent! They use fresh ingredients and take pride in their daily homemade soups which they offer in take-home quantity at a discount rate late in the day so they never serve anything but daily-fresh soup. The diverse menu offers something for every taste palate including vegetarians! From the warm greeting as you arrive from one of the owners or hostess to the great, friendly service you are assured of a lovely meal experience!

I have only been here for breakfast ~
Very good friendly service and the food is quite good.  
The menu is varied and the prices are reasonable. 
This is a place where you can easily become a regular and the staff would know you by name.
Cinnamon swirl cakes need I say more???? Great breakfast awesome staff. Love the John's special breakfast added biscuits and gravy yummmmm but what ever you order GET THE CINNAMON SWIRL CAKES.....

Sorry, I won't be returning here. I had never been to Warrenville Pancake House so I have no comparisons there. I went here for lunch using the Yelp $20 for $10 since I had never been here. I can't say it is even worth it when you have that.

My mother and her fiance invited me for lunch since they were nearby. When we went in it seemed... normal strip mall reatraunty? Sorry, I don't know that I have a better word to explain. I order a patty melt as I haven't had one in a while and was craving it. When I got it, I noticed right off the onions were raw onions, not fried like every other patty melt I have ever had. I get that a patty melt isn't a special advanced item, but to just take 2 pieces of bread, a peice of generic american cheese (It didn't even taste as good as Kraft) and throw some raw onions on it is lazy and laughable. I could a MUCH better one from Hardee's and spend far less money. Oh and the fries were standard bulk fries, no seasoning.

My mother ordered the meatfloaf which I can't really speak for, but she ate maybe 1/4 of it and stopped eatting. She said she would never order it again. My mother's fiance ordered crepes, he also didn't eat much of it and said it was very bland. Oh and they didn't even provide any syrup for the creepes, lazy waitress or poorly trained staff? I don't know, but she should have at least asked if he wanted any.

Sorry, I won't be returning, 0 out of 3 is not a good record for dishes served. No one in my party was ever slightly impressed.

Great place in the middle of Warrenville. The new ownership has done a good job in bringing in new life and items that have rejuvenated the vibe of the restaurant. The staff is friendly although it can get a little slow when busy. I pick up take out for lunch and also take family members from time to time. The food is great and there is a good selection. I know they are open for dinner now too! I have not tried it yet but look forward to it soon.

I have been here numerous times with my boy friend and we always share the banana macadamia crepes. The crepes are cooked to perfection and the creamy sauce is so delicious! 

The lack of one star is for the service. Although it is often slow I would like to be checked on more frequently. I find myself often in want of a new drink or ready to leave and waiting for the check. I did address this with the owner on my last visit. I look forward to this problem being remedied when I return.

What a gem of a place!  We had to ween ourselves a bit...a group of us from work dine here for lunch OFTEN!  It's difficult, but we are trying to stick to just once a week!  Never are we disappointed!  If you are looking for the best french fries ever...try the beer-battered french fries.  Best fries anywhere in the area.  Even Red Robin can't come close.  If you go (and you should), ask for Julianna.  She is a great server, so friendly and personable!  We always look forward to our lunches out at Sweet Potato Cafe!  Very diverse menu, all homemade and TASTY!!!  - Kristen and friends from Bekins A-1 Movers

Looking for a place to get a nice relaxing breakfast with plenty of options on the menu.  Hostess staff is always very welcoming with a great big smile each and every time.  Seating is very open, you do not have that feeling like you are eating on top of each other.  Hooray for elbow room!

This was my second visit to the restaurant and by far the best! My family and I left church and decided to grab lunch and give this location a 2nd try since the first visit was not the greatest. I am so glad we made the choice the food was excellent especially their pumpkin pancakes just delicious!!! Will be returning soon

Well I can't choose zero stars, so I'll go with one

The food they serve doesn't match the menu pictures or descriptions. (They serve hash browns instead of country potatoes in their skillet, and will give you Kraft American singles instead of real cheddar cheese)

When we complained, the only offer to "make it right" was to make us something different.... Not even a discount off the bill. 

$60 for four crappy meals. I'll stick to my regular restaurants.
Love Sweet Potato Cafe!  Have enjoyed the new/updated menu and really appreciate that they are open on Friday and Saturday night.

I am very familiar with Warrenville and understand old traditions are the norm.  It is one of the reasons why I like this small west suburban gem of a town.  Yep, I want to WPH often and loved it!  They had great food and some unique offerings that were a welcome surprise.  Times change, well kind of in Warrenville, folks retire and sometimes a new place takes the place of a familiar old friend.  In the case of WPH the new owners have done a great job of maintaining the old vibe but with friendlier service.  We had a wonderful waitress yesterday at breakfast.  Substitutions were gladly accepted and my oh so picky BEST friend who is a completepancake snob licked her plate clean!  Prices were fair, coffee was good and hot and diet Pepsi came in a huge cup.  I'll be back for sure.  Come on Waterville folks, give this place a fair chance.  Change can be good!!!!!

I have been coming here for 10 years (before it changed ownership). I appreciate the changes made; more healthy selections, new tasty dishes, & updated interior. Sweet potato hash was delicious. While the owner is trying new things, she is also keeping some of the old favorites. It's a perfect small town cafe.

We have been going to the warrenville pancake house for years and the staff is always so friendly and the food comes out fast. When they changed owners and began opening on Friday and Saturday nights we weren't sure what to expect. We took our teenagers with us and we all ordered different meals. I loved their dinner menu as there was something for everyone. My daughter ordered the potroast and raved about how tasty it was. My husband ordered the fish fry and the fish was tasty with fresh grilled vegies. I ordered the fish tacos and they were delicious served with a chipotle fish sauce and hot sweet potato with cinnamon butter. We definitey will go again.

Service is very slow, and food is average.   The main problem is not getting what you ordered especially in carry out.  They offer to replace it but it usually is still wrong.  Either the cooks don't know the recipes of items on the menu, or the ingredients are not available.  I think the customer should be told when ordering that certain ingredients have changed, not after the food is served.

It was very busy, a little loud, but the food was good.  The dining room was cramped to navigate to the back corner by the kitchen, which is where we were seated. The gf's veggie wrap was under the hot lamp, but it was raw veggies, like lettuce.  Odd.

We came at 6 pm for dinner. We ordered soup and lasagne. The soup was disgusting and cold. For lasagne we waited for over 30 minutes. We were in hurry so we told waitress that we had to go. After additional 10 minutes she gave us that to go. It was tastless. The worst experience ever.

We live right across the street and have been coming for years. They are always super friendly and it's nice to see the same faces everytime we come in. I grew up in New Jersey where diners are pretty much the culture and this gives me a homey feel since it's the closest thing to a diner in the area. I come in with my young son almost once a week and they're always very accommodating to his picky food requests. I appriciate the additional vegetarian options since the menu changed. You always get a large portion of food for a very reasonable price and the soup is always super good (a must for a diner!). The omelets are always super fluffy and never dry. I love this place. :)

Food remains good, but the atmosphere is strained, the wait staff argue and snip at each other in front of customers (especially the newest waitress) and the new ones do not appear to be well trained. We have been going there for years, but nolonger.too many times we have witnessed the stress there, as have others. Too bad.

We were a large group there at 11 on a Sunday morning.  Service was great, food was amazing. We had omelet's and skillets all were excellent.  Monte Cristo sandwich with the biggest onion rings, so good.  Will be returning to Sweet Potato again.

Dope Chinese food close to where I live. Curry chicken, pan fried noodles, Mongolian beef, hot and sour soup, general tso chicken, chicken friend rice, egg roles, and the delicious smoothies are some of my favorites. If you live near by there isn't a better option for take out but this isn't a sit down type of place so a long drive isn't really worth it but south Naperville and north Plainfield people will love it.

This is a typical neighborhood Chinese take-out restaurant.  The food is what you'd expect, quickly prepared, tasty & fresh.  Very professional service.  Of course, it's not gourmet--it's home cooking, but you're also not paying high prices either.  Our total for 3 very LARGE dishes was $22!

Really good non-greasy food. We order for our workplace from there all the time always good always on time and always (at least seems) seems healthy and Yummy.  Prices (especially their specials) you can't beat. Go!

In the ever challenging mission to find great Chinese food in the Oswego/plainfield area, Sun Wong is middle of the road.  My family ordered cashew Chicken, mongolian beef, chicken fried rice, eggrolls, and crab rangoon.

The cashew Chicken and the beef were ok. I've had others with more flavor. The friend rice has decent flavor, but could have used a splash of vegetables, as it was just rice and chicken, essentially. The egg rolls weren't very good. Just cabbage and white filling. No vegetables or mini shrimp.  Lastly, the rangoon weren't bad, they were crispy on the edges and soggy in the middle. Each of them had a lot of stuffing inside, so that was a plus.

Nothing at this restaurant stood out enough so we would crave Sun Wong again, but nothing that would deter us from coming again.

This location has been several different Chinese take out places in the past. Not sure if it's new owners or not, but they currently have great food! Always made fresh and fast and the service is always friendly.  Crab Rangoon is A++++

The food is very good and the portions are generous. Everything tastes fresh. This has become our go to take out Chinese spot. The young lady who, I think owns the place, is one of the nicest people you will ever meet. She always has a smile and is pleasant. The menu is varied and the prices are very fair. My family recommends Sun Wong highly.

So, I feel really bad about this review, but I gotta be honest. The young woman who took our order was exceptionally nice. She engaged me and my girlfriend about the Univ. of Il, where all three of us attended (at different times). She still took our order and I appreciated her ability to multitask. We waited no more than 10-15 minutes for our food. I watched through the kitchen door as the cook prepared everything fresh (relatively. I think the chicken was pre-breaded). I was very pleased with their efficiency and was looking forward to getting home and trying them out. 

We ordered sweet and sour chicken, Szechuan chicken and a large shrimp fried rice (no eggs). It smelled amazing and was still pretty warm after a 5 minute drive home. It still looked appetizing after being unboxed. Alas, everything was mediocre at best, with the fried chicken being greasy and a little salty. The rice was pedestrian, not bad but not great. The Szechuan chicken was the best. It lacked chicken but they heaped on the veggies. 

HERE IS THE MAJOR ISSUE: within an hour of eating, my pregnant girlfriend suffered from loose bowels. I mean, it came like the running of the Bulls. I thought maybe it was something she had eaten earlier in the day, until I was awakened at 5am but the bubble guts. I sat on the thrown for a good 20 minutes, emptying my belly of Sun Wong. I don't know what they did, or what we have a digestive aversion to, but it did not go over well. My thought is the excessive grease...

Two stars...
Really delicious food for a god price! There's not much to say. If you love Chinese food, you'll love this place.

Absolutely loved this place! I ordered a small orange chicken and a small lemon chicken. One small is enough to feed 2 people and it was decently priced too! I've tried Taste of China and Yen's but this one is my favorite by far on quality/quantity of food and price. To top it all off they were fast at making my order as well!

Totally worth it!  A  terrific value for the family.  This is your typical neighborhood Chinese take-out restaurant.  The food is what you'd expect, quickly prepared, tasty & fresh.  Very professional service.  Of course, it's not gourmet--it's home cooking, but you're also not paying high prices either.  Our total for 3 very LARGE dishes was $22!  Other similar restaurants would charge $35-40 for exactly the same order.  Sun Wong, you've saved me on my busy nights when I don't have time to cook.  I hoping that you'll be around a long time!

I wanted to try something new after the Basils horrible review i had to give..This place was refreshing,, Loved the food,  although i would say this is NOT a steak place i had the new york strip it was char cook and had a robust flavour, complete with rolls, mouth waterering vegatables  carrots califlouwer, and broccolli. with a nice baked patato..  my meal was 22

Wifey had a italian chicken also very  good, hers was 13.95

prior to the main meal we had their nachos  and they were EXCELLENT...
add a great server and coffee  and this place hit the spot..

I was surprised to see also this place has a small slot  machine room to top it all of we went to put a 100 bucks in and try our luck  in was 6 spins later we got the bonus on the saberian tiger machine,, and picked up an extra 21 bucks,, so we cashed out and left ahead..

Meal was 60 including tip-  less 20 for the slot winnings..  Compared to a failed basils meal prior  we probably saved over 100 bucks  and found a new home to dine at before we honnor the sabbath of Yah..  check this place out  

4 stars...........

It's obvious that the owners have taken to heart Ramit Sethi's advice that one  has to generate multiple revenue streams if one wants to succeed in the new millennium.  You got your full bar, you got your video slots, you got your pastry cabinet, and you got your full service restaurant.
And you got a vape shop immediately adjacent.  You never have to leave this strip mall....

The restaurant was the attraction today, and it's a pretty good one.  The service was slow, but the eponymous salad was really good-very fresh and flavorful.  The gyro was average, and the roast beef sandwich was reported to be tasty.  And of course, as most of these places are, it is very easy on the wallet.

Taste so good, especially the French toast and onion soup. The Belgium French toast is like puff and donuts. It is fried outside with milky cream inside. It matches great with powder sugar and fruits on top. 

The skillet is just soso. However, the swerving size is worth the price;) 

Like the environment. I will try sit outside next time.

We had just landed in Chicago and were absolutely starving. Luckily Yelp was recommending this place so we decided to check it out.

The interior is really cute, a definite homey feeling with home cooked foods. 

We ordered the Irish skillet with pancakes and the eggs Benny corned beef with thick cut French toast. The portion size is also really big!! 
Irish skillet, pancakes and eggs Benny were good, nothing too special but just a standard good.
The French toast was not that great, what's funny is that I had made French toast a day before we left and mine tasted a lot better (I had someone 2nd that). 
The waitress didn't really seem to care about us too much, she wasn't rude but she wasn't friendly either.  Just kind of gave us our stuff and left, never smiled at us or anything.  When I asked for hot sauce she didn't offer ones they had or which one they had and instead just grabbed one and put it on the table and left. 
Overall, food was good.

This is a beautiful restaurant that is much bigger than it looks from the outside. We had lunch where I ordered a chicken ranch sandwich. The chicken breast was over an inch thick and very juicy. I added fresh jalapeÃ±o peppers to the sandwich and was very pleased to see large split peppers instead of just a few slices. We ordered the French onion soup which was very impressive with lots of delicious melted cheese. The wait staff was very friendly and patient as we looked over the menu. So many choices!  We are definitely coming back!

Came in for Saturday brunch. The hostess was not very pleasant and our outdoor table was covered in syrup- we are not off to a good start.

Thankfully, our waitress was attentive and much nicer than the hostess. And she cleaned the syrup off the table.

I ordered the Tijuana skillet and it was very good! I would only ask for more veggies to balance out the meats and cheese. I was not able to substitute the toast for a fruit cup... Weird. I would've been fine paying an up charge, I'm just trying to make good choices!

My husband ordered the steak and eggs and said it was "okay". He's a man of many words.

Wow! You Yelpers are correct. The French Onion soup is the best I have ever had. This is really saying something because I have had it hundreds perhaps even a thousand times over the years. Surprisingly the cheese is not the star here. There is gobs of it and it is broiled to perfection, but I think a lesser quality than Gouda or Gruyere such as Swiss or provolone is mixed in and I'm not sure Gouda or Gruyere are even present. Whatever is used the cheese works and the soup is still the best. For me the broth is the star in that it's not too rich or salty and features a ton of caramelized onions.    

Another standout is the mac and cheese and it is one of the best I have ever had. The menu claims it is only available on Friday, but our waitress said they could probably do it any day of the week. The quiche is available every day and while not the best ever very good and recommended.  A good selection of sides is available to complement the quiche or a sandwich such as fries, cole slaw, a cup of soup (which can be upgraded to a cup or even a bowl of the F.O.) or fruit. 

I'm not wild about the atmosphere. It's family style laid out like a Denny's or some such similar restaurant. Ok it is nicer than Denny's (God I'm SO embarrassed to admit I ever stepped foot in one), but that is still not saying much.  If you have any interest whatsoever in French Onion please come here for the experience.

PARKING
Medium sized parking lot and we had no problem finding a spot at all.

INTERIOR/ EXTERIOR
Display glass of cakes available right in front and the bar to the right of walking in! There are tables outside if you choose to sit out on a nice day. There are many tables inside and it looked busy upon our arrival for brunch. 

MENU
We were famished by the time we got to the restaurant. The party of three ordered a three piece Strawberry Crepe, Hawaiian Omelette, and the order of two eggs that came with a small fruit bowl and pancakes. The omelette was easily my favorite with bacon and pineapples inside. Everything else was delicious as well, though I did not like how the strawberries on top of the crepes were warm. However, I really liked the whip cream that came on the side!

SERVICE
Our waitress was so sweet and nice! She made sure to get our order in as soon as possible because they were a little backed up and did not want us to wait. She brought us everything we needed and even made recommendations that would best suit what we were looking for!

Not bad place for breakfast or lunch. The service was okay. We had the pomegranate Benedict and western skillet. They were both pretty good. The baked goods is the reason for my 2 star review they were store brought I saw because the tags were ripped off the container.  Not impressed. They do offer gluten free options and have a lot of  other choices for breakfast and lunch.

For me, Pomegranate was just okay. While the menu is extensive and has all my breakfast favorites, I thought the food and service were just average. 

I live nearby, so my husband and I came here for breakfast one morning to "celebrate" national pancake day. I think it's safe to say I'm always looking for a reason to celebrate!

With that being said, I ordered the 3 chocolate chip pancakes ($6.75), a side order of sausage links, and coffee. The pancakes were beautiful and it was a huge order. You have the option to get 5, but I'd say the smaller order of 3 is more than enough. I took about half of that home. The chocolate chips were plentiful, but to me the cakes were just too dry. I ended up having to dowse them in syrup which was extra sugar I did not need to ingest.

Coffee was good and refilled I believe once. The sausage links were not my favorite. I can't quite pin point it but they almost tasted like chicken sausage.

Our waitress was really sweet, but it took her forever to come around for our order and then another long while for us to get our food. The kicker was that they weren't busy at all. I was just a little disappointed all around with our experience since I read such fabulous reviews.

Pomegranate offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner, so I'll have to stop by to give their extensive menu another try since I live right in the neighborhood.

Thus used to be my favorite near by stop for breakfast, not so much anymore. We had to wait about 20 mins to be sat which is honestly fine with me I don't mind waiting on a Saturday morning, it's to be expected. However once we got sat, it was obvious the table was still very dirty. That's  unfortunate... I didn't come to bus my own table. There was a bunch of empty creamers, and empty sugar packets, and left over half empty table syrup and the tip still on the table and the table clearly hadn't been wiped down. But weirdly bout there were full ice waters on the table... At this point we could only assume it was left from the table before us and not actually new waters lol needless to say, we didn't take our chances with the gamble waters..
   Our waitress comes, grabs the trash we have collected for her at the end of our table and grabs her tip and asks for our drink orders, like a solid 5 mins later I get mine but my boyfriend didn't get his, she passes us about 8 times when we realize she clearly forgot there's a second person at this table that ordered a drink. So when she finally came to take our order he tries again to get his drink, she says sure and apologized. But still nothing lol our food comes out now,  30 mins later and he's like yea, can I get that milk yet? And she said sorry and ran back to get it. 
   Now to the food, I ordered the biscuit and gravy skillet with over medium eggs and he got the crows eggs Benedict (made with corned beef hash) and we got a side "cup" of fruit and a side of bacon. ( more like a tiny little 1/4 of a cup of fruit or 3 bucks! And bacon side, a whopping 4.25, for 3 slices of bacon, come on) mine was just "okay" I didn't eat the potato part, they were realllly cold, the only thing hot on my plate was just barely the gravy, everything was like room temperature though, and my eggs were definitely over easy not over medium which sucked. His, one of his poached eggs was already broken and it was all pretty sloppy, it takes 3 minutes to poach an egg, do it right, and sure as hell don't leave a broken one on a plate, I would if refired that in my kitchen, no question asked. All in all id say it was a pretty disappointing visit, could of been an "off day" but how many people really buy that excuse? Do it right or do it again. I know this isn't the city and maybe I have city standards, but I'm just holding them up to their last performance when I visited, they were fantastic before, they should be even better now. Your only as good as your last plate. I doubt I'll be returning, there's other options for us to explore
We're fans. 5 stars is a great compliment from me on breakfast. The food was great, portions were huge,  the prices were on point, and the service was perfect. We shall return.

We had such a great first experience we came back for dinner... then they really kicked it up a notch. 

Great food, great place, great service, and customer-oriented owners. 

Based on Yelp reviews, we gave this place a try for breakfast on a Sat morning.  At first glance, this place is nicely set in a strip next to the road, and has a very nice home fell upon entry. We were promptly seated, but we definitely should have taken more time with the menu before ordering. While our breakfast was good, we didn't know about their specialties listed on a separate small blue menu on the table.  During our breakfast the owner dropped by to ensure everything was to our liking. Very nice experience. 

We were only in town for a day, my local family wanted to go out for dinner, and my wife and I wanted to see what else this place had to offer. Again, promptly seated, and our server, Donna, was just like a member of the family. She took care of us through the meal, nudging us to some really great food. My wife had the Reuben, I had the gyro, and my son had the Oreo pancakes. My gyro was good, my wife said the Reuben was great, but my son's pancakes were over the top!  Seriously, take a look at look at the picture.  Another family member had the turkey dinner, and again, awesome. Apparently, At the same time we ordered another large group ordered, causing a slight delay. Donna and the owner ensured we each received complimentary dessert, without us saying a word.  Seriously, the wait wasn't too bad, but everyone there seemed personally involved with ensuring we had a great experience.  If you've read this far, good for you; however stop reading and give this place a try. I hope you have just as great of an experience.
Breakfast here was ok. I had the corned beef hash which was out of a can and not very appetizing. Others had the pancakes which were not very rich and the Belgian waffles were mediocre as well
Really had high hopes for this place. Bacon came out cold. We informed the waitress and this is what we got back...extra crispy....extra burnt bacon.

As good as breakfast is here, their lunch definitely competes! And I haven't had a French onion soup as good as this since...I don't know when. All that perfectly bruleed cheese melted down over a bowl of rich, heady broth and caramelized onions...hnnghh. 

As ever, service is very earnest and friendly. This is one of those places I can just come back to over and over. Check it out the next time you're in the Fox Valley area, for any meal!

We went on a Saturday morning at 11 and we're seated right away thanks to how large this place is. The marscapone French toast is amazing and consists of 5 "sandwiches" of marscapone and blueberries between French toast slices. My husband got the southwest frittata and said it's the first time something has had enough jalapeÃ±os and spice that he didn't have to use hot sauce. Great place.

I've been here a few times and tried some different skillets. I've also had their biscuits and gravy. I think the food is decent but there are definitely better options in the Naperville/Aurora area. He competition is to too stiff to just be ok. The service has always been good so that has to play in for something.
We go here for breakfast quite a bit. The food is always amazing! The only problem is....the service absolutely stinks....super super slow.....

Thank you yelpers for highlighting this great restaurant!
Tried it for lunch one day and recommend their onion rings (best I have ever had) and nachos. Their pomegranate margarita is yummy!
Had to come back for breakfast with the whole family!
Excellent and friendly service. Especially attentive if you have kids :)
Definitely a great place and can't wait to go back!

I work close by so this is always a favorite for lunch and breakfast meetings. The omelettes are delicious, particularly the butchers block and the Denver. The French onion soup with baked cheese on top is the best I've had in Illinois!

This place is absolutely amazing!! Can't say enough about the great service we received from our server Donna! She helped my gf out in figuring out how to make her omelet perfect! And my Chicken Quesadilla was a taste bud smack of flavor!! I recommend anyone to go and try their pomegranate mimosas and ask for Donna! Tell her Antoine sent you! Also the owner was such a pleasant guy to speak with. He showed us around to see all the stuff their place had to offer! Great service, excellent experience!!
Nice friendly staff however the food is terrible.    They need to fire their cooks get someone new in the kitchen.

Absolutely amazing!! I have been here twice and both types were delicious. The first time I got a portobello and ham omelet with mozzarella. The second time I had the Sonoma chicken skillet. Both were delicious. The pancakes are absolutely amazing as well. I highly recommend coming here if you want a breakfast place with LOTS of delicious choices.

We have been coming here for 2 years now and have yet to go through the whole menu. Service is always friendly and you get to know the people there including the  family owners who are always present and happy to chat you up. We love going on weekends for brunch, highly recommend the Pomegranate mimosa!

I've been to Pomegranate Cafe twice now, once for breakfast and once for lunch and both times the food absolutely blew me away.

I had a large, delicious, perfectly cooked omelet for breakfast. The ham and cheese were the perfect ratio to the light and fluffy eggs, the sides were nicely sized, and I had to leave some on my plate because I was so full. I am not a small man and leaving food on my plate for any meal is very, very rare.

For lunch I enjoyed the fried fish sandwich with some clam chowder. I'm always looking for delicious fried fish and this was a really good sandwich. The bun was toasted perfectly, the fish cooked really nicely, and the tartar sauce was exactly what tartar sauce should be. (You'd be surprised how many places try to be fancy with their tartar sauce and screw it up.)

Service was great too and I'll definitely be going back. I chatted with the owner for just a bit before I left the second time and told him how much I enjoyed the food and the restaurant itself. He was friendly, funny, and generally genial.

I will definitely be coming back to Pomegranate Restaurant and bringing friends. I definitely look forward to trying dinner some time!

Food looks good! Just wish I had mine!!! Me and my wife waited over an hour for our food after ordering. We saw multiple people who came in well after we did get there food before and we were repeatedly told our food will be right up and never showed! I'd write a review on the food if I ever got it! Defiantly wasn't worth the wait.

We drove almost 20 minutes to come to this restaurant because of the high ranking. It was a large restaurant and they have an extensive menu. I ordered "The French Orchard," 3 pieces of cinnamon spiral bread dipped in french toast batter with toppings. My wife ordered the California Omelette. The French Orchard was a lot smaller than I expected and was pretty plain. I was expecting a lot more flavor, sweetness, or something to excite me and it was pretty boring. I ended up eating quite a bit of my wife's omelette. My wife was underwhelmed by the omelette as well but I thought it tasted pretty good. 

The service was fine and food came out quick. There seemed to be a few regulars there that loved the place and were interacting with the staff. 

I was very torn on a 2 or 3 star review for this restaurant. We won't return because there are numerous other breakfast places around that taste a lot better and I am surprised to see the great reviews on this place. It wasn't awful but there are better options out there.
Lovely restaurant hidden behind Fox Valley Mall.  Wonderful surprise!   Great patio, outstanding service and appealing menu.  Waffle fries a must!   All 5 meals were very good.

One of my favorite breakfast spots next to Lemont Street Cafe. This place is tucked away in a strip mall near Fox Valley Mall. The food is good and atmosphere is decent. During our recent visit, the wife and I had a vegetarian skillet and their famous Pomegranate waffle. The skillet was very good -- nice mix of veggies and potatoes -- while the waffle was delicious -- topped with berries, bananas, and some scrumptious jam.

I'm giving this place 5 stars bc I've always liked this place and to be completely honest I'm not really sure what it is. Cause I've only been here a handful of times. Today I got the almond thick French toast and it was sooo yummy. It came with fruit too. My boyfriend got the western skillet which was also really good. They're always busy which is a good sign too.

My family is huge and hungry so we had to find a great place to host my God sons baptism party.  We found the perfect place! Food was outstanding, the Greek food is fabulous! Service A+!  I come in often now and have enjoyed everything on the menu. Especially the French onion soup and skirt steak! They make you feel welcome and at home!

Everyone at the table liked their food. Yes breakfast food may be easy, but some places can screw up pancakes or scrambled eggs. 
But there is one drawback that is really unfair and not right. My friend wanted a side order of scrambled eggs with her almond French toast. But there is no such thing as a side order of scrambled eggs. You have to buy the eggs breakfast which includes 2 eggs, hash browns and 2 pancakes. Which is a lot of food. But she ended up taking most of it home. 
Cheating your patrons to buy more is not the way to keep them coming back. I hope they change this. 
My portobello omelette was delicious. It's a lot of food. It comes with hash browns and 2 pancakes!! A lot of food for the price.

Very good food. Service was outstanding. I ate breakfast. Large menu with choices that will satisfy everyone. I asked about an item and they brought me a sample. Family run and it shows in the quality and the service.

One of my favorite breakfast restaurants. Service is always good and the food is excellent. I love their skillets. They have a full bar which opens early. My coworkers and myself have enjoyed a few drinks in the morning after working nighshifts.

This is my new favorite family restaurant.  I can't believe that it took me this long to stumble upon it, however I'm making up for it now. I've been here 5 times in the past 2 weeks.

Their many variations of Eggs Benedict are eggseptional (sorry, I couldn't help myself), and they make all kinds of pancakes, crepes and waffles.  I asked if they offered Dutch Baby oven baked pancakes and, like almost every restaurant, they do not.  A few minutes later our server brought us one saying their cook wanted us to try one that he made for us anyway.  It was wonderful.   They really do go all out to please their customers.

If I had to come up with one complaint it would be that their portions are so large.  Try as hard as I can, I cannot finish the whole meal; I'm forced to take some home for snacking later.  Yay!  

I'm looking forward to dropping in for dinner soon (they are open Thursday,  Friday and Saturday for dinner) to try their prime rib.  One of their servers told us their prime rib is the best in the area and I have come to totally trust my new friends at Pomegranate.

This place is fantastic for a delicious and quick breakfast. They have a lot of menu options, both sweet and savory so you're sure to find something!

I went with sweet and got the French Connection without walnuts. The French toast was perfectly cooked with a nice crust on the outside and warm and fluffy on the inside. The apples were fresh and tasty and the caramel sauce was perfect -- no need for syrup on this dish!

My husband and our guest went with savory dishes: a chorizo omelette which was HUGE and the Mexican skillet (equally gigantic). Oh my goodness, I tried both and they were incredibly tasty!  I think my favorite dish of the meal was the Mexican skillet. The eggs over easy were perfectly cooked and mixed in so well with the rest of the dish to make it creamy. Also, the hash browns that came with the omelette were warm with a delightfully crispy outside. 

As for the service, it was incredibly quick, but almost too quick as if we were being rushed out. It wasn't busy, so I don't know why they would want to turn the tables so fast. Our water glasses were always full so I can say they were attentive.

For a great breakfast at a great price, I would highly recommend Pomegranate... just don't plan on spending too long there!

What a great breakfast place hidden behind Fox Valley Mall. Okay,  First off, this place has the three most important things for a great breakfast:

(1) Outdoor Seating - Again, this place is a hidden gem behind the mall.  This means no heavy traffic to listen to while eating on the patio.  It is very serene and quiet, peaceful, which makes the outdoor experience all the better. 

(2) Fresh ingredients/Great Pancakes.  I know this may sound weird, but my omelet tasted like it was made with fresh eggs.  You can tell whether its fresh or from a carton. Also, not every breakfast place can make pancakes, but this place can! 

(3) Lastly, amazing coffee.  Usually breakfast places have average coffee.  This place has specialty latte's etc.  I order a Vanilla Latte and it had the right amount of Vanilla/Coffee balance, which means the coffee was not extremely strong. 

I will be back to this place very soon! Enjoy =))

Perfect place to brunch in Aurora! Drinks, outdoor seating, good food, what more could you ask for? The service was so friendly and the food was fantastic! I got the asparagus and mushroom skillet. My eggs were cooked perfectly, and there was so much cheese! My boyfriend had the Pomegranate Benedict and he loved it! Again, his eggs were cooked perfectly too. Our waitress Donna was awesome, and she is probably why I'm even writing this review in the first place. She was so friendly, personable, and what made her so great was that she basically anticipated our needs so we never really had to ask for anything. Definitely will go back if we're ever in Aurora again!

Service was mixed. The waiter and owner? We're very nice and attentive -- think I managed to have five cups of coffee. However the food took a really long time, which was surprising since we ordered breakfast. 

The food itself was decent. I had a Santa Fe omelet which was large, but wasn't nearly as flavorful as I would have liked and the salsa looked to be from a jar. On the plus side they brought the toast un-buttered which was a nice touch. All in all typical Midwestern cafe lots of food for a fair price.
I had the Bavarian creme French toast it was so good I never had a stuffed fried French toast like this will be soon fast and friendly service and reasonable prices

What a great place; I can't believe we didn't come here sooner. It's a hidden gem, to say the least. As busy as this place was, we only encountered a 15 minute wait at 12:30 p.m. Parking can be a nightmare, though.

Our waitress came to take our drink order; we of course chose the Bloody Mary's. The garnishes weren't anything impressive; just a stalk of celery, a lime wedge, and two green olives on a spear. But the drink itself was fabulous.

We placed our orders; I stuck with my ol' standby, but the fiance actually tried something new. I ordered the Tijuana Skillet, which had Chorizo sausage, jalapeno peppers, onions, salsa, cheddar cheese, and sour cream. I went with my usual eggs over easy and wheat toast.

M ordered the Mexican Fiesta Omelette, which is oven baked and had Chorizo Sausage, black olives, green onions, jalapenos, tomatoes, and jalapeno Jack cheese. He chose an english muffin in place of toast and opted for no tomatoes as he hates them.

Our food arrived in a timely manner. There's only one word to describe it: foodgasmic. I've had tons of Mexican style skillets, but the one at Pomegranate is by far the best. Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted to fresh. M was equally impressed with his huge omelette.

We were going to call it quits as we finished our meal, but our sneaky waitress managed to have us order another round of Bloody's before departing. Damn, she's good and she received a generous tip from us.

I'll definitely be returning in the future, as their vast menu has some rather tempting items, including a Bacon Waffle, Chocolate Chip pancakes, and Biscuits and Gravy.
Their lunch choices look good, too.

I went back for my second visit this past Saturday around 10am and was very disappointed. Although there were only people at three other tables in the entire restaurant, it took 40 minutes for my boyfriend and I to get our breakfast once we ordered. I'm sorry, but anything over 20 minutes for an omelette and two eggs over-easy in an empty restaurant is unacceptable. Our waitress seemed much more interested in her other table while barely paying us any attention and stating that our food would be "out in just a minute" when in reality it was fifteen minutes later. Won't be going back soon.

I am a huge fan of their omelette breakfast options. The omelettes are huge, and come with a selection of other side items such as toast or pancakes. Every time I order an omelette I am extremely pleased with how it comes out of the kitchen. 

On one of my more recent visits, however, I decided to try something else. The eggs I got with it came out of the kitchen only lukewarm, which was a major disappointment as that was nearly half of the breakfast. I think this was probably a fluke, and due partially to a slightly inattentive server. 

That being said, because all of my other experiences here have been positive I would most certainly recommend as a breakfast location!

I went to Pomegranate Restaurant yesterday morning and I should have picked a different restaurant.  I order the crepe sampler with eggs and bacon.  The single crepe was horrible, almost like it was deep fried in old grease from a carnival food truck.  It not only tasted horrible but looked bad too.  The bacon was weird, like it was fake. My friend also ordered a sampler but with pancakes, he said his scrambled eggs were pretty bad.  
The staff was friendly and they had a clean facility.

Overall, I will not be going back there. Not worth it at all.

Go to brunch/breakfast spot. Every dish we've tried here has been sumptuous. Only place we don't have to specifically tell them how to cook the bacon. Other places just char or crisp it past the point of consumption
The food and service were great! We were in a time crunch and even though it was busy, we were in and out in a flash. The Popeye Skillet was AMAZING. I would definitely go back.

Wonderful for breakfast!!

Get the eggs benedict.  

And coffee.

And try not to order all of the the stuffed french toast, decadent pancakes, and ginormous omelets while you are scoping out the menu.  

Genuine service.  Hot coffee.  Delicious food.  Bookmark it, baby.  If you find yourself in the 'burbs, lets say, on your way to the Kate Spade outlet store, you should probably stop here!!

Love that this place is so close to me! They have really good coffee, great service & food. 

I always get corned beef hash breakfast items because they make it awesome here. I also always elect to get their Greek toast, it's my favorite.

If you try anything here, get the french onion soup! 
After my dad got out of surgery, all he wanted was this soup. Instead of just taking our money, the owner advised us to dine in, instead of taking the soup to go, saying it was a far better experience. And it was! ! Being our first time there he gave us a sample of all the homemade soups!  But the oven baked french onion soup is to die for! I will definitely be going back :)

My family has loved Pomegranate since they opened. We were out with our dog on a beautiful day and they allowed him to join us on the patio for lunch. It wasn't too crowded and we were able to sit in the corner out of the way of other diners. The waitress brought water out for him right away. Now the whole family gets to enjoy Pomegranate!!  Greek Chicken and is a hit!  Cream of Chicken with Rice soup is the best!

There are a lot of breakfast place in the area but this is by far the best. The atmosphere is comfortable without smelling like food when you leave. Service was quick and friendly. The menu was extensive and lots of waffle and pancake options. The food was delicious. Great family breakfast spot.

This restaurant exceeded all of my expectations in every aspect. My wife and I went in, impromptu, after reading the reviews here and being in the area. We walked n and were seated promptly by (who turned out to be) the owner. After sitting a few minutes and perusing the Greek inspired menu, the owner came over to ask if we had been helped yet. With a no response, I continued with a question... "What's do you recommend?" His eyes lit up as he asked if this was our first time. I responded yes, and his excitement to talk of the menu grew. This passion from the people running a restaurant is what makes one great. I asked about one of my Greek favorites, the souvlaki. He literally guaranteed it was the best I'd ever had. Literally. He continued about the Greek chicken, one of my wife's favorites, and ended the conversation by offering to buy us cocktails, since it was our first time and all. WHAT?!?! Really? So we settled on the Greek chicken and the Souvlaki, and Saganaki to start us off. The saganaki was very good, large portion, and a uniquely creamy center. We loved it. The pork was tender and flavorful as was the pilaf. Too often, the pilaf is rice. I mean just rice. A filler of sorts. This was tender and flavorful, played nicely with the souvlaki. My wife's chicken was equally as amazing. Really really delicious, with no additional trimming needed. My wife is a trimmer, and believe me when I say that if you trimmed anything off this chicken it would just have been meat. White, tender, succulent meat. Although the portions were large, my wife and I let no challenge go unanswered. We forced every bit delicious bite down. Fully satisfied, we talked over the meal as the waitress approached. "What would you like for dessert? It's on the owner, he insisted"  Oh boy, another challenge? I thought. Well with the delicious selections of death by chocolate, strawberry cheesecake, carrot cake, etc... we couldn't resist, and didn't. We both had the cheesecake, said our thanks, and rolled out of there. I wish I knew the name of the owners (his wife was there too) as well as the waitress. Everyone who we had any dealings with us treated us as though we had trekked the scape for thousands of miles and landed on their doorstep tired, hungry, cold, and penniless. VERY gracious people. Thanks again to them, and we'll be back!!!

I tried this restaurant as it was highly rated. 

It took quite some time to get waited on and I found myself  trying to get someone's  attention  for service. The owner must have seen me looking  around and came and tried to rectify the lacking in  service.

Upon receiving  the food "I found HAIR IN MY EGGS" that was the end of my Pomegranate experience.

I will not return and do not recommend this establishment.

I love this family restaurant!  My husband and I pretty much visit once a week.  Chris, the owner, always greets us with a smile, handshake and asks how we are.  He gets to know his patrons and is always visiting and making sure everything is good, when he's not running the register.  Very nice man and his wife is very nice, too!  We came in today to celebrate my mom's birthday and Chris came by to sing a little, tell a few jokes and made sure my mom received a HUGE piece of cake with a candle on it, for all of us to share.  So hospitable!

The restaurant is always clean and the service and food is consistently great.  We come here consistently and when we do, I see other regulars.  This is a "come back to" place.

I'm the type of person that orders the same most of the time, so I can tell you a couple of things.  The ranch dressing is phenomenal!  I'd put that stuff on just about anything.  I ordered the pecan/banana waffle, today and joked with the server that I'd have ranch on the side.  Now, that's just gross.. and I was kidding, but that stuff is so good!

Their baked french onion soup is delicious, as well. I get a cup almost every time I'm here.  The seasonings are a little bit different, which makes it so much more yummy than other restaurants.  I've become an expert in peeling off the baked on cheese all around the cup! mmm mm mmmm mm!

I've had their Prime Rib.. great, salads.. fresh and full, burgers.. good, sandwiches.. tasty, breakfasts.. awesome.  Nothing like one of their hot chocolates on a cold winter day.

BUT WAIT!! THERE'S MORE!!  I'm not even sure if it's a good idea to tell you..  ummm... debating.. debating.. debating....      ok..  They just put in 5 slot machines in a new addition about 2 weeks ago!  My mom and I had to check this out after lunch.  What a fun time!  I could have come home more of a winner, but I am a gambahol dummy.  I played on $40 for nearly 2 hours and left a little more than doubling my money.  Chris was so nice to have made us a couple of Pomegranate Mimosas, on the house, while we played.  I have never had one of their alcoholic beverages here, but wow.. it was so good!! Fruity and refreshing.  I want another one, right now! :)

Support this great, local business.. great people, great food... and now, fun slots!

Donna, our server was awesome.  Coffee was excellent.  I had the Tijuana Scrambler and hubby had the Butcher Block Omelet.  Food was delicious, hot and well prepared.  Will definitely be back to see Donna!

Came here yesterday morning for breakfast.  The wait for our food was pretty long especially for a weekday.  The service was below average and  the food was probably the worst brunch food I have had in this area.  I usually order the same dish no matter where I go (Mediterranean omelette with hash browns and specialty pancakes).  The omelette was pretty sad - way too much feta cheese.  The hash browns were not tasty at all.  The nutella "crepe" was a joke.  We were really looking forward to this place based off of the reviews but will not be back.  There are many better brunch places to go to.

My wife and I has made this our weekly breakfast spot because of their great service and above average food quality after newly discovery of this cafe a month or so ago. The coffee also taste better than most other breakfast restaurants in my opinion. We have a 3 month old and usually have a stroller, they have been very accommodating to locate us at a more spacious table for easier access. Would highly recommend this place!

Wow..first time I can remember that I was offered more hot water without having to wave someone down!  That is indicative of the extreme service at Pomegranate.  The owner/manager stopping to check on satisfaction, frequent coffee refills,,it's all there.

And the extensive choices make ordering a difficult process.  This is the also the first time I've ever ordered breakfast without oatmeal, even though they had THREE choices (including baked with fruit, which was fire-roasted).  I just could not resist the cinnamon swirl French toast with caramelized apples, raisins and pecans. I did order egg whites, scrambled, hoping to head off a sugar buzz and crash, but I'm not optimistic about that.  

He had the ultimate restaurant challenge...chicken fried steak with eggs, pancakes, and hash browns.  He gave me a half pancake (to counteract my really sweet toast) and still left full and happy. 

And, as other reviewers mentioned, there is a patio for al fresco dining.  Wish we lived closer.

My husband and I found this place by chance and we're so glad we did.  Ever since Grandma Sallys closed, we've been searching for a yummy breakfast place with a casual, down-home atmosphere.  We found it at Pomegranate!  The food was excellent, the portions HUGE and it is a step up or two from Sallys! Loved the coffee too. Roule was our charming server and she did a wonderful job explaining the menu and showed us the large private dining room for functions.  We will definitely go back.

We went for dinner on a Saturday night, and the food was good. Big portions, so we have leftovers. It was quiet, and so we were able to have a conversation. I love that. 

I wanted a mixed drink, so I studied the libations menu and chose one. They didn't have the makings. So I selected another. Same thing!  The third time out, our server helped me choose the pomegranate margarita. I suggested a price break, and they only took $1.50 off...

Pretty good food and great service! 
Our late breakfast started off good with great service. The waitress serving was really understanding about taking our order late and waiting for a friend to come to the right restaurant, aha things happen. 

The place has a traditional set of food to choose from for a breakfast/lunch place. I wish there were more Pomegranate options and I'll be sure to come back to see if there are!

Everyone was satisfied with their meal. We got the pomegranate waffle, stuffed French toast (SO MASSIVE), and gluten free option. My gluten intolerant friend was so  happy to try some gluten free options and the waitress was super accommodating again. 

Laid back, good food and servcie. I'll be back!

I think the soup's are great!  The food quality and service is always exceptional. I have been dining here for year's. I usually come between peak times. So being promptly seated is never a issue. It's a little difficult to navigate the parking lot.

I stopped here for breakfast with my mother-in-law and my husband's aunt (my aunt-in-law?) on a Saturday morning. We were seated right away and our waitress was right there to take our drink order. She was very attentive the entire time we were there and provided some great recommendations. My only gripe was my bacon was under cooked for my liking (I had ordered it 'crispy'), but apart from that minor thing, it was a good deal and a really tasty breakfast for us all.

This is my first review after my elite badge was stripped from me... I think today is only the third time I've dined inside. I need to try something other than breakfast alfresco. They have an endless soup bowl with their specials. This will make it a great value for me. I can fill up on a couple bowls of soup and take 2/3rds of my meal home.

Owner makes it a point of checking in on his customers and I love they leave you with your own coffee pot. Their dinner options are something I need to explore.

My server was super sweet and Christy even stopped by and filled my cup of coffee. If your having a birthday, they have a waitress with an incredible voice and very cheerful. She almost got a standing ovation.

My wife and I, love this place!  We're here at least twice a month.  I just realized that I never reviewed this place before.  And, it's really a staple in my lazy day dinning needs.

The owners are very nice and always keep us coming back for more.  They pride themselves on there great Yelp reviews.  That's how they get a lot of their business.

The staff remember your "usual's" after a few times coming in.  Which makes you feel like home.

They make their own ranch dressing and it's AMAZING!!! I've asked them for some to take home too, and it really helped bring some life into my own salads. Also their Baked French Onion Soup is very unusual, has some extra spices that really set it apart from others.  If you get a chance try the Beef Stew too.

I don't think I ever had anything here that wasn't really good.

As soon as you walk in, you see all of their bakery fresh pies and cakes.  They always cut the pieces extra big too.

The other reviews talking about parking, I'm not sure if I understand because there is always parking.  I've come at all times of the day.  Sure, sometimes you might have to park on the side, but this was not a big deal at all.  Every parking spot seems to be pretty close to the same distance from the front door.  Maybe they had problems because of the snow or something, but I never did.

They even have a nice room for small banquets.  Would be a great place for showers, or a wedding rehearsal dinner.

I've had this place bookmarked for a while now...just the name alone had me interested. I love pomegranates!

I love going out for breakfast and Pomegranate did not disappoint. It's less than 10 minutes from the DuPage Children's Museum so it makes for a great stop for me and my son before heading to the museum. 

Service was so friendly from beginning to end. Family friendly and anticipated our needs quickly. High Chair, crayons, coloring pages...BOOM. the trifecta of toddler dining needs brought to us in a blink of an eye. And for the mom--a smile, friendly greeting and a coffee CARAFE offered immediately. The trifecta of busy mom's needs in the morning. 

The menu offers a nice array of selections from pancakes/waffles, omelets, skillets, french toast, crepes and egg specials. 

We opted for the silver dollar pancakes (which were much bigger than what I expected) the eggs Florentine Benedict and a side of sausage. I loved my eggs dish. The eggs were perfectly poached and the hollendaise was well-made. The spinach was also well-cooked and everything just came together wonderfully. My son has never met a pancake he didn't like but he did gobble these up and enjoyed them. The sausage was perfectly cooked as well and very tasty.  A very good meal at an affordable price. 

Just as a side, there's one waffle dish that offers a pomegranate sauce and because I love pomegranates, I asked if I could have a small taste of it and they were more than happy to bring me a small sample. It's mildly sweet and almost jam-like. It was pretty good with the taste of pancake I sampled from my son's plate. 

Great place. I'd love to make it back soon. Clean digs. Comfy setting.

I cannot say enough amazing things about this restaurant. Be it breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner you are looking for you really don't need to look further!

The owner, Chris is so nice. He really cares about his patrons and wants to make sure everyone who walks in the door has a positive experience. 

All their food is cooked to order. If you are in a time crunch, this may not be the place for you, but if you are looking for high quality, delicious food, then come on in! I have tried many menu items as I have been coming here for years (and haven't posted a review yet!!) and have yet to have anything less than spectacular!! Their ranch dressing is home made and is the best I've ever had!

The food quality and quantity for the price is unbeatable. I always have enough for a second meal to take home. If you are able to split something with someone, I say do it. They'll even separate the plates for a buck and give you each full size sides. They will also customize just about anything, all you have to do is ask!

Tip: There is typically a longer wait to have brunch on the weekends. They recently put in a small waiting area towards the back and offer free coffee while you wait. They also put in a few slot machines, if that is your thing, to make the time pass!
You can't go wrong here. The whole menu is pretty much awesome! The staff was great and accommodating for our large group, and the mimosas were delicious.
We live in the area, and this restaurant never disappoints.  While we do eat at other breakfast places, we often find ourselves coming back here.  Good food, great staff, and nice atmosphere.
It was fine no complaints from me. I'm just a bacon and eggs guy nothing fancy . I'm probably not the best person to review the place as what can you do special with bacon and eggs?

I live down the street so I have been here many times for breakfast mostly although their lunch and dinner is good too. We keep coming back for many reasons. The service is friendly, timely and consistent. The food is fresh and served hot. I love the skirt steak skillet. It has savory pieces of grilled skirt steak cooked perfectly along with the potatoes, green peppers, onions, and mushrooms. It also comes with blue cheese, but I substitute american. It is sooo good. The coffee is not the best I have ever had, but it's not bad at all. I like that they have a good selection of flavored cream, however, they do not have raw sugar. They also serve alcohol, their mimosas and bloody marys' are good. I also enjoy the nice outdoor seating area during the summer.

Consistently good breakfast. My wife and I come here on a regular basis. The servers are all professional and nice. The decor/layout of the restaurant leaves something to be desired. But we have never had a bad experience here.

I usually am very generous with my compliments to an establishment. I usually will not give low markings even if our service was mediocre. However, Mediocre service would have been an improvement from what we received. From the moment we walked in, some dude cleaning the windows mumbled about someone will seat you-- and then we sat by the hostess desk for a full 30 seconds while the servers kinda just stared at us from the kitchen. Finally someone came over, glummest look I've ever seen. No "good morning" or "sorry for the wait" or "welcome". "Two?" Was all the server said and seated us at our table. 
After such an unceremonious introduction to the place I finally took a look around. I could have forgiven the tacky decorations of fake pomegranates if they hadn't been covered in dust. The wood on all the benches had grime stains and there was this wall with what I can only assume had some sort of decoration previously. Someone must have ripped whatever it was off the wall as there were all these spots on the wall of missing paint. 
Then our server cAme along and asked if we wanted coffee. We got a big canister of it at the table. Which while that could be nice in a n exceptionally busy restaurant. There were only a small handful of customers and it gave off more of an air of "here! Serve yourself!"  The server told me no favorites or specials. She merely motioned to a rather crumpled looking piece of paper at the opposite end of the table to let us know where the "specials" were. 

Each time the server came to our table she would "talk" to us while looking to her left or her right. No eye contact. No warmth. I have no idea what her issue was. She spoke with the couple behind us at length about their baby and it looked like a regular she paid attention to. 

When our food came-- I did not receive my toast and had to ask a different server if I could have toast. No butter on the hot toast when it came. 

The food was waaaaaaay better than the service. And I actually liked my skillet. 

But I was so distracted by the staff. Not to mention the manager who LOOMED around. A big scowl on his face. Lounging over the furniture and watching all of us eat. It was awful. 

My husband and I finally were so appalled we had to start laughing. It seriously was so weird! Especially from all the previously "great" reviews. Maybe staff later is better? I am not sure. 

I can only say this. Don't listen to all these other reviews of great promise. I would keep driving and find another restaurant. We will NOT be returning.

Not very pleased with the quality of food. Apple pie A la Mode tastes better at the frozen section in walmart. The reuben and waffle fries tastes like card board.

My first and last to come. Save your cash and move on.

I've been here so many times. Food's delicious,  servers are awesome and go above and beyond. However, I went this passed weekend with my 3 year old and my mom, we sat in the patio. A gust of wind came from no where and 2 or 3 umbrellas  flew off of other tables, one heading straight for my daughter! Had it not been for another gentleman dining there, she probably would've gotten hurt. None of the owners came out. My mom had to go in and ask if they were aware of what just happened and the lady said,  "yea, I saw". That was it. No apologies,  nothing. She later came out with a bus boy to remove all of the umbrellas from the tables? And still said nothing! Once I went in to pay she mentioned wanting to apologize, I said she could of done more and made the other diners more comfortable as well. She walked away. Sad to say I won't be going back there for a very long time.

I have been here a few times.  It seems like a cozy family owned place.I have seen the owner a couple of times.1 star less , I wish they had more veg options,I find their veg quesadilla a little bland. Their chocolate chip pancakes are very child friendly, I have had their strawberry waffles. Service is ok, depending on your server...either way worth trying if you are a breakfast kind of a person

We tried this place for brunch today because of the good Yelp reviews and the menu looked amazing. Everything tasted delicious and came out exactly as expected. The eggs and potatoes were especially good, cooked to perfection! The staff was very friendly and the place has a very comfortable/relaxing atmosphere. After our meal I got a slice of coconut cake to go and it was amazing! I'll definitely be returning.

This has been our go-to breakfast spot for about a year now, so I have no idea why it's taken me so long to write a review. 

Pretty much everything I've had from Pomegranite is good (with the exception of the coffee - the coffee is weak - and the "thick-cut" bacon is not thick by any stretch of the imagination.) BUT... don't let those things deter you.
