The breakfast is pretty much what I stick to despite the time of day, so I can tell you the pancakes, waffles and stuffed French toast dishes are all damn tasty. Their omelettes are approximately the size of a football - the Butcher Block is my favorite - and I've never been disappointed. 

On Saturdays, the potato soup is the special, and it's RIDIC. We have gone just for the soup during winter when we've had a craving. I'm married to a chef, and he craves this soup like mad. So that says something. 

They get busy but there usually isn't much of a wait. Service is generally good - it was kind of hit-or-miss last year when we first started frequenting the place, but it's gotten significantly better since we started going several times a month. In fact, we've been three times in the last week, and I think they recognize us now. 

Solid breakfast spot. But don't forget the soup!

Side note: The spicy Bloody Mary is actually pretty excellent. I'm a fan.

Our first visit to Pomegranate was for an early dinner 4:00pm.  I was going to have breakfast but then our server told us about the prime rib sandwich special.  I ordered that and my wife ordered the Pomegranate burger.  We started with chicken rice soup.  It was hot and very flavorful.  Obviously homemade.  When we had finished the soup the owner passed by and asked if we wanted more.  The sandwich and burger were both very good.

Our server was like being served by your favorite aunt.  She treated us like regulars even though this was our first visit.

We will be back (for breakfast next time).

Let me preface this with a couple of caveats:  I went for breakfast and did not have anything from the bar!  The coffee is very disappointing which for me is a deal killer and unforgiveable.  It was watery, bland and if you go order tea!  It is not that difficult to brew a rich robust cup of coffee.  And then there's the eggs.  My eggs were over medium in the Popeye Skillet.  One if my eggs broke and the yolk was already oozing and congealed.  The dish was called "Popeye" because it had spinach.  Spinach was chiffonaded like basil and barely there.  And in this dish the bacon was in crispy shards throughout.  Not memorable!  My dining companion had a "Benedict" dish with hard poached eggs that were so hard they looked like walnuts!  There was a side of pancakes that needed just another half minute on the griddle to not taste gummy.  Many of the reviews rave about lunch... I can't speak on that, but I'll go elsewhere for my next breakfast.

On a positive note service was great, friendly and prompt.

I've been here twice now, and I would drive back to the suburbs just for this place. I found it because I was staying at my parents' house in Naperville and wanted a brunch spot. This is the only place I could find in the area that did brunch instead of just breakfast. I used to live in Naperville and have never heard of it, but the reviews seemed good so we decided to try it. We ordered like 5 different things, a bloody mary, coffee and everything was perfect. The service was great and everyone was super friendly. I went back for Mother's Day because my mom loves bloody marys and she needed to try this place. She was just as impressed as I was! I can't wait to go back.
Fast, friendly service.  I ordered the asparagus & mushroom skillet and it was great! Eggs were cooked perfectly.

We came here after early Xmas shopping for brunch. This is a pretty sized restaurant. There were several people waiting in line before us, and the wait time was probably less than 10 minutes. I think the restaurant manager brought us to our seat which was in their private room. I like the fact that they opened up their private room to serve their customers..instead of making us wait. This other lady who was the hostess was going to make us wait even longer, but we're thankful the manager brought us to our table. 

I ordered one of their skillet dishes and my husband ordered some kind of breakfast item that I can't remember. My skillet was good. Nothing really can go wrong with a skillet. My husband liked his dish. He also ordered a side of chicken noodle soup which was yum. They serve Lavazza coffee. My husband had a cup. I had a glass of their homemade fresh squeeze OJ which was good. 

Our waitress was nice. Although majority of her tables were on the opposite end of the restaurant so we didn't get to see her much, but she does check in every now and then and told us that we can ask the other waitress if we need anything and she's trying her best to check in with us every now and then. She also left us a pitcher of coffee, but the waitress behind our table took our pitcher and fed it to her table of guests GRRR. We thought she would return it but she never did. Good thing my husband didn't want any  more coffee.

Overall it was a nice brunch place to eat!

The food here is awesome! Gluten-free pancakes for the win! I love the veggie panini or turkey bacon panini on the tomato focaccia. The french onion soup is yummy. Only downside is the service sometimes. I meet a friend here on a Saturday once every few months to catch up. They are usually busy and try to rush you out as soon as you're thru eating. I get it, I used to be a server, too. But don't be rude about it.

Best omelette in town! I order from here all the time, they always have the order ready in timely manner. Few months back didn't have the best experience eating at the restaurant and I shared my feelings with the owner of the restaurant. He was apologetic, showed genuine care and reassured me that it won't happen again and won me back as a customer.

This is my go-to whenever I visit my aunt in Naperville, we absolutely love it! I haven't had a food item on the menu I haven't liked yet. The owner(?) is a really awesome guy, overly friendly. I highly recommend the saganaki, it's REALLY good. Service is always attentive and friendly. A++

I've been here for breakfast a lot because my family loves this place. It's relatively good. The omelettes are alright, the skillets are very good, and I love the benedicts; the eggs have more or less been poached perfectly (I've never had a hard-poached one). I'm not a fan of the hash browns most of the time since they're not the shredded kind. There has been one time when the cheese in an omelette hadn't completely melted, but aside from that I haven't had any issues at all. 
For anyone that's gluten-free, they do have gluten-free pancakes and waffles and they're delicious! But it's safe to assume that there's a risk for cross-contamination since this isn't a dedicated gluten-free restaurant. I also recommend avoiding the hash browns since they do have gluten in them.

Everyone has always been very friendly, even when it's very busy, which seems to be rare at other places.

Overall, it's a very good restaurant, at the very least for breakfast.

Good food. Atomsphere pretty typically of locally owned restaurant. They have good variety and some twists to the normal recipes, which i like. As everyone said hashbrowns were great! They even have agreek toast that is like texas toast and scrumptious.
Abby was a great server too, always given a refill and checking in on us, as we werr there longer than usual.
I will be back.

Best place for fantastic breakfast for dinner Crows nest is my personal favorite and my wife typically gets the down under..  Not to mention they have slots!!!  Owners are wonderful people alway makes my wife and I feel like we are walking into a family members house,  maybe because of our Greek connection...

I went to this place on Sunday as I visited aurora... We were a group of  9 adults and 3 kids.. I expected the wait time to be length and i have no complaints about that ...
I ordered the quiche with baked onion soup as it was most reviewed.. The soup was extremely salty ..I failed to understand.. how did people gave rave reviews to this soup .. Quiche again was nothing extraordinary ..The dishes my friends ordered most of them had ordered skillets and omlettes were not up to the mark .. Even pancakes  we felt left a lot deserving.. We had as a group dined at wild berries .. deerfield bakery and  i  infact think ihops was better than the experience I had at Pomegranate..I am still shocked at the reviews people gave..maybe the chef had a bad day the Sunday i visited...

Great friendly service, breakfast food; scrambled eggs, hash browns, toast and turkey bacon were cooked to perfection. (Although that darn turkey bacon just isn't the same as pork bacon). Nice decor, we were seated when we arrived there on a Sunday morning at 10:15 which was a pleasant surprise. All in all you can't go wrong.

I love this restaurant!!!! They have so much to choose from on their menu and everything I have had is delicious. Couple that with friendly service and a manager/owner that personally comes around asking how everything is and you have a great family restaurant. My kids love going as well. I definitely recommend.
Nice place and unlike big chain brunch places this has got real taste.

This is my favorite place in the Chicago burbs! Yes, my FAVORITE! I've been many times and each time I go back I think, "my past wonderful experience MUST have been a fluke because it can't possibly be that good again" and then I'm floored that it turns out even BETTER! 

Laurence (the owner and som) is absolutely fantastic! His palette is precise and he never settles. The wine selection is unmatched even when compared to some high end restaurants.  But to add another level of awesome sauce, Laurence might be the owner, but the staff -- from the bussers to the cooks to the wait staff -- know their jobs and perform them with precision and excellence. 

The first time I went we tried to order off the menu, and it turned into Candice and Laurence bringing us what they liked and the pairings they enjoyed the most. We were really spoiled that night. 

The next time we had Iris and we got the SAME treatment! We didn't even LOOK at the menus that night! We dined on absolute deliciousness and had some things we wouldn't have ever thought to order! Everything was spectacular and paired perfectly from their large wine selection. 

Each and every time we go back, without fail, (so far) we've had the same treatment, the same excellence, and the same perfection! 

They have fun events, so check out their website too! I'd recommend a reservation also, but the don't do online or open table, so call them.

My feelings about this place are mixed. I saw it initially on Check Please, and perhaps that was my biggest issue -- it created expectations that could not be fulfilled. 

I came hungry -- famished really -- and was hoping for a much bigger menu selection than it offered. I didn't realize that the menu was so limited. I know the name is "Bread and Wine," so maybe it's my own stupidity, but I was hoping for a meal such as chicken or steak, that could give me a substantial amount of protein.

The ambiance wasn't as expected either -- very small inside area with a bar, a few plain wood tables and unimpressive chairs. 

So those were my disappointments. We almost walked out... But we were already seated, and I don't know the other downtown Geneva restaurants too well to know if there were any better or more of what I was looking for, so we decided to bite the bullet and see what it was like.

The service was fine, and the food itself was extremely good. My boyfriend and I shared a meat and a cheese tray, and I had the tomato and bacon soup. Great presentations, very tasty -- no complaints there. However, wine and a couple of cheese/meat plates would have been just the start of the meal I hoped to enjoy that evening. Since both of us are laying off the carbs, a sandwich would be unacceptable. I would have gotten a salad, but none of the three on my menu sounded too exciting.

So it is what it is! If you are looking for a low-key place to enjoy a few glasses of wine and some tapas-like bites to go with it, it's the perfect spot. Dessert there might be good too. But don't go expecting a full-out meal, because it isn't what this place is about.

Thank goodness this place has 2 lovely outdoor patio areas (one is under an awning) because the interior dining area & bar is tiny. There are even heat lamps for when the temps turn a bit cooler outside.  Since I knew this ahead of time I had been waiting to pay them a visit when the weather was decent on a weeknight because Geneva in general is just way too packed on Fri/Sat/Sun.  Last night the weather was perfect and even being a Thursday night the restaurant was busy on the patios (inside only had 1 couple dining there & 1 at the bar). They squeeze plenty of tables on the patios & in the dining room so when busy expect to be privy to the neighboring tables' conversations.

Our server was Iris and she was perfectly pleasant and attentive as was the rest of the staff.  I  thought the prices were quite reasonable as well, especially in comparison to other trendy wine/small plates places.  The obviously have an extensive wine list and they also have about a dozen specialty cocktails and a dozen beers on the drink menu.  We shared the Spanish cheese plate, the Lamb Meatloaf Focaccia sandwich (conveniently cut in to 4 pieces) and the Crispy Duck Spinach Salad.  The cheeses and the salad were outstanding!  The Lamb Meatloaf sandwich, while tasty, could have used some arugula or other greens to dress it up a bit. The sandwich did come with preserved lemon on it (I'm not sure what form it was in but you could definitely taste it and it was a very nice complement to the meat) and was supposed to have pomegranate molasses as well but we really didn't notice that part if it was there.  What we DID notice was the sandwich had cheese on it, I believe it was goat cheese, and this was not mentioned on the menu at all.  Not that we mind cheese, we love cheese and reading the menu I thought the sandwich would be better with it but I could see for some people who do not want dairy this would be an issue.  For us it was an added bonus.  Sharing those 3 items was perfect for the 2 of us along with our drinks as we don't normally eat big, heavy meals.

We had a hard time selecting what to try since so many things sounded delicious so we'd definitely like to come back and try some other items.

Great date night spot.  Fantastic wine selection and a large variety of hot and cold small plates to sample. Don't be fooled though, its not just a wine bar; the food is phenomenal and the plates are quite large and filling. It's a smaller venue and reservations are highly recommended. Every member of the staff we interacted with was super friendly and helpful. 

We asked our waitress to recommend a Cab Sauv and she suggested a great one w/ the Obsidian Ridge. Oaky and on the drier side, we loved it!   

The bacon jam, blue cheese, and arugula crostini is killer. The bacon jam is pretty sweet and tasted exactly like pulled pork to me. The more bitter arugula and tart blue cheese nicely balanced the sweet flavors making these the perfect starter.

The duck salad was good but just not as memorable as the other 2 plates.  The crispy duck was kinda too crispy but overall the mix of duck, spinach, and fresh cherries worked really well.  The salad was quite large for us to split and nicely dressed. 

The cold roast beef sandwich was fantastic!  Best plate of the night. The beef was nice and rare, super juicy, and piled high. The bread was a little on the hard side but tasted great. The horseradish slaw wasn't too strongly flavored and worked perfectly with the beef and roasted onions.

Love this place! I have been here twice and couldn't be happier. We have tried lamb meatloaf sandwich and spicy sausage casserole. Both are so good. 
I really appreciate the service, ambiance and quality of food here. They don't rush you and let you enjoy your time and wine. We came early around 5 pm on Saturday night be cause we didn't make a reservation. We got to sit in the back enclosed porch. It's so lovely!

The staffs are very friendly.  The food are AMAZING!!

My first visit was happy hour and we sat at the patio.  Very relaxing as it was a nice day and not crowded yet.  The owner stopped by and chatted with us.  The cheeseboard were divine, short rib casserole was good.  I am not a dessert person, but the bread pudding is to die for (MUST TRY).

My second visit is lunch to celebrate my birthday.   The host with the cute tie and I shared the same birthday :)
We sat at a tall table up front.  I am super impressed how this restaurant able to make simple dishes taste so good and memorable.  The grilled pastrami sandwiches and french onion soups were delicious (only$10 as lunch special).  You can taste the quality of each individual ingredient, including the mustard.  The mushroom tart with pastry top were served hot.  Everything was just well execution.

Now that I work in Geneva, I will come back often.  Good value for great food and services.

I was totally disappointed at this restaurant.  I saw it check please.  I was hoping for good food.  I order a pulled pork sandwich.  I only ate 1/4 of it the bread was cold.  And so was the meat.  If I am going to have pork it better be at least warmed up.  The  pulled pork sandwich had the slaw which was too tart for my liking.  My friend had the beef pie.  Ok it was a very small square dish with a crust on top of it.  How horrible if you are serving a pie make look like a pie or collect something else in the menu.  Or is a lazy way to make a pie.

The only good thing there was the French onion soup.  It was tasty and it was not salty at all.

I will not be coming here for sure.  I had better pulled pork

This place is my favorite in the Fox Valley area. Simple, and absolutely delicious, fresh, from scratch, everything - bread included. The menu changes regularly, and I don't think I've had one thing on the menu I wouldn't get again. In addition to some amazing American fare, they have a great craft cocktail list, which also seems to change seasonally. 

The place is very quaint, and I've never been for dinner, but I would assume a reservation would be smart if that's when you're planning on dining. Highly, highly, recommend to anyone and everyone.

Came here with a few friends for lunch. We were greeted right away, and seated about 10 minutes later. This was our first time here so we had no idea what to order. The waitress was very kind and recommended the most popular options.

We started off with the European cheese platter. The cheese platter was amazing! Our favorite was the Saint angel cheese nice and creamy loved it! Perfect combination with a crispy little baguette and some wine! 

My friend and I both had the cup of French onion soup with a half of the pastrami sandwich. It was amazing! The soup came out super fresh, and I'm usually not a huge French onion soup girl but this was amazing finished the whole cup! The sand which was very delicious as well, had a nice combination of mustard, pickle, and the pastrami tasted homemade. My other girlfriend had half of the tomato bacon soup with half grilled cheese. From what she said it was amazing! 

Overall we would definitely be back here for lunch!

Adorable spot in downtown Geneva! They have all of my favorite things...wine, cheese, charcuterie, and did I mention wine?

The hubs and I came here for some apps and wine and let me tell you, it was a darling little date. The restaurant is small and dimly lit. I'm obsessed with their wine glasses because they're huge! I honestly can't remember what kind of wine I had, but it was red, full bodied and delicious. Our server was very knowledgeable when it came to wine, so he provided great suggestions.

The menu boasts options like sandwiches, soup, salad, charcuterie, cheese, small bites, flatbread, and of course dessert. Everything looked amazing. We ordered a couple small bites and a spread of their charcuterie. I'm not sure if it's still on their menu, but we started with a spicy linguica sausage cassoulet with duck confit, pork, and apricots. WOW. Amazing. 

Following that we had the housemade lox with dill rye chip capers. I couldn't believe how much flavor was in such little bites!

To wrap this little preview of their menu up, we ordered a charcuterie board that included speck, Barolo salmi, and duck prosciutto. I mean, I'm basically STILL dreaming of the duck prosciutto. Perfection.

The menu was a tad intimidating just because there were so many different items I've never had before, so I'm glad our server was an expert! It was such a fun date spent grazing over delicious bites that paired well with our wine. If you ask me, that's the way to dine here! I have heard excellent things about their other menu items though, so you better believe I'll be back.

Pro tip: They have delicious bread for sale, so grab a loaf before you go!

Very nice, mellow authentic , hipsteresque,gastro pub, wine bar. Along Geneva's Charming and historic 3rd street. Cozy front and rear interior space and even more charming people working there. Interesting and unique lunch menu choices such as short rib pie with cippolini onions and smoked trout rillette Cristian with fennel and granny Smith apple salad.

Beautiful back patio with tapas portion food that leaves you excited to come back for more!  We celebrated our wedding anniversary by bringing in our own wine and paying a corkage fee.  From beginning to the end of our meal, we were delighted.  We had the watermelon salad, sada something crostini, mushroom tart, Spanish cheese platter with amazing pickled beets and bread pudding to finish it off. The waitress was amazing and definitely added to our positive experience.
A little gem in Geneva!  Great wine, delicious food and relaxed, intimate environment.  Highly recommend!

Drinks....cheese....charcuterie....perfect! A girlfriend and I came here after work for a drink, and so glad we landed here! We were actually planning on going to another location in downtown Geneva, but it turns out the location was open but didn't serve food until 6pm. One requirement for me when I'm drinking....I must have some sort of munchies, so that original place was out. We walked a few blocks and found Preservation Bread and Wine, which had a great menu of small plates and unique drinks. 

I can't remember what drink I had, but it was a delicious mixed drink and STRONG! Typically I only have one drink, but I can handle two when going out with co-workers. This one? I had to eat more to take the buzz off before we parted ways for the evening! The mixed drink menu is small, but each drink that me and my girlfriend had were awesome!

Spinach & Artichoke Bread Pudding - It sounds odd, but that's one of the reasons we ordered it! It's exactly what it sounds like.....savory bread pudding. It was an awesome take on spinach artichoke dip. I think the best part was the chunks of toasted feta that were sprinkled on top....mmm!

European Cheese Plate - love cheese plates ;) They are so yum! We couldn't choose, but our server gave us the suggestion of the european cheese plate. It had a great balance of cheeses, with my favorite being the saint angel cheese ;)

Charcuterie - we had some sort of charcuterie plate, but I can't remember which one we had (they have two). It was great with the cheese, but who can really screw up a plate of delicious meats?

This is a great place to have a glass of wine with friends to sit and relax ;)

Preservation doesn't need a long drawn out Yelp review. 

It needs you to get your ass in a taxi (because you shouldn't drink and drive America) and sample some of the finest charcuterie, cheeses and wines you can get in the USA.

Lawrence (the owner and sommelier) is quite simply a rock star.

Preservation Bread & Wine has the best grilled cheese sandwich I have ever had in my life. I love the crunchy brioche bread done to golden perfection featuring a blend of oouy gooey white cheeses.  The best thing to do is to get the creamy tomato bisque. This way you can dip the sandwich into the soup. It is amazing how they can elevate something as basic as a grilled cheese sandwich to a gourmet delicacy. My other favorite items are the mushroom tart and the short rib puff pastry. They could get away with using the same crust for both items, but I love how one is like a pie crust and the other a puff pastry. I also highly recommend the cheese boards and charcuterie. The cole slaw is one of the few items which is not to my liking. If you like ginger get the ginger martini. Even if it's a little chilly at the beginning or end of the season, don't be afraid to try the porch. It is fully enclosed and has heat. Please be aware the portion sizes are small plate. If you have a big appetite, it will be pricy but well worth it.
Love this place. Small foodie plates and a great vibe. Prices are very good. Can't beat it.
One of the best in Geneva. Great wine, great food and great service. It is a great spot for getting a bunch of small plates and sharing with a group of people. We love this place.

Came here for lunch with a friend and sat outside on the patio. Cute little place - it might be fun for a girls' night out on the town or a date night. 

We each did the lunch special which was your choice of a sandwich and either french onion or potato leek soup. I ordered the grilled vegetable on focaccia sandwich, because I'm pretty much a sucker for anything involving focaccia. My favorite part of the meal was the dessert - bread pudding. Probably the best bread pudding I've ever had!

I live in downtown Chicago, so it was quite the trek getting to this place - but it was easily accessible by Metra. I didn't think it was anything spectacular, but I might stop in again if I'm in the area. Service was excellent, so I added on an additional star for that.

Cute little spot in downtown Geneva, steps away from the metra.

My friend and I were really impressed with the quality of food we ordered (two lunch specials, a cheese plate, crostini, and the bread pudding) and the wine was delicious.

We loved the patio seating, though we did feel as though we were right on top of other guests due the close proximity of the tables.

I would totally come back to Preservation if I'm ever in the Geneva area again!

Great romantic date spot.  My husband brought me here on a Saturday night for wine and cheese.  Warm atmosphere with a cozy bar and exposed brick walls.  More seating in the back, think four seasons add on patio room complete with wired patio seating.

We came for apps only but can't wait to try their short rib pot pie next time!  Menu's definitely small but the quality's there.  We ordered the Spanish charcuterie plate ($12) which came with speck, salami al barolo, and duck proscuitto.  It was a nice mix mild, rich, and textured meats.  Fell in love with the garnish of small mild peppers.

We also had the European cheese plate ($12) that included a soft Saint Angel from France, a mild Zamorano from Spain, and a stronger Balarina goat cheese from the Netherlands.  They again got creative with their garnish of picked watermelon rinds.

I'm not sure how people get a half star, but I would definitely give this 4.8 out of 5! What a delightful lunch. The service was excellent, the food was great, even the people around us were so nice. 

This place is small, the front space seats 30. They are very conscience of seating people smartly. We came in, there was a table for 4 empty, and they asked for our name and number so they could text us when a two top opened up. 

We had the pork rillette, which was heavenly. It's a lovely rustic pate that, when done correctly, is devine. And this was!

I ordered the pastrami lunch special with baked french onion soup. The soup was so good, no overload of cheese, just a really great broth and very well done! The pastrami was not good. The pastrami was incredibly dry, as was the dill rye bread. Seriously hard to swallow. And no pastrami flavor, very disappointing.

My husband ordered the spicy linguica with duck confit cassoulet. I loved it!! damn good!!

The overall experience was really wonderful. We drove about an hour, and it was worth it. It was great and right next to my favorite Spice House!!

A fantastic place. We have been here many times. Great assortment of small plates which change seasonally. You cannot go wrong with any of them. Our favorite salad is the watermelon. Love the mushroom tart. Try any of the soups - fantastic. Wednesday our favorite flatbread (Kale and bacon) is available. Simply the best flatbread I have ever tasted. Great deserts - try the pine nut tart when it is available.

If you haven't tried out one of their special wine dinners you are missing out on a great experience and value. We have attended 5 of the New's Year Eve's dinners and recommend them highly too.

The staff is very friendly and helpful. Lawrence (the owner) is an expert sommelier and great at providing insight about his many wines.

Can't say enough good things about this place. Try it out for yourself !!

After 4 stellar visits, I suppose, all good things must come to a temporary end.  I dined at Preservation Food and Wine alone for lunch today.  I have been attempting to limit carbs because of my diabetes, so I chose what I thought might be the friendliest plate -- weisswurst (thinking Oktoberfest), with spaetzle and beer cheese sauce.  I figured that I'd a a bite or two of the luscious German noodles and then concentrate on what I felt might be two links of Bavarian sausages.  

The first warning occurred when the smallish restaurant began to smell like something was definitely burning.  Although my blood sugar was definitely on the low side, I wasn't otherwise in a huge hurry, but I still hoped silently that it wasn't my dish.  Afterall, who can burn weisswurst when properly braising them in a bit of water so that they can be eaten in the traditional manner?  Unfortunately, my server delivered the bad news to me that the cook/chef feared that she had overcooked (read burned) my delicately seasoned veal sausages.  BUT, she assured me, the cook/chef was going to start over. The second attempt, if it was indeed a fresh start, was dark brown and crusty. 

Not awfully long afterward, I received my $11.00 plate (not listed as "small" on the menu) with one burnt link of weisswurst snuggled next to something which resembled rabbit droppings.  OK, I'm thinking, they lightly sauteed the spaetzle in brown butter or something equally as delectable.  Sadly, they were solid and rather chewy/crunchy but not in a good way.  

The owner approached me while I was eating to see how I was enjoying my food.  I always try to be positive, so I told him that even though I had lived in Germany, I had never tasted crunchy spaetzle.  He simply explained that they "sauteed" it.  I also commented that my expectations for the wurst were also based on the ritual eating of it in Bavaria.  I did not claim that this was the only way, however, and pretty much left it at that.  

We had a nice chat about the restaurant business.  He has always been very pleasant, and I will go back. As you can see by my previous review, I have had excellent experience(s) there and love their charcuterie and cheese boards.  The 4 friends I brought with me the last time all said that they would definitely return as well.  

I haven't decided whether I'm off base on my culinary preferences, or whether whomever was in the kitchen today was slightly clueless.

Fresh baked breads everyday.  I love their preserved lemons.  And the chardonnay?  So crisp it could probably slice a piece of paper.  Small menu, but that means that what they do they do it well and are able to control every aspect of their product.  Can't wait to go again.

I was meeting a friend for lunch. Geneva is about halfway between us, and I had never been to Geneva before. I've been living in IL for 4 years now, and what a shame that I never went to Geneva before. What a great town. 

I was greeted & seated by the owner, who gave me the brief background of how he started this great place. After learning it was my first time, the lady at the next table offered some dining selections (which I took). My friend and I both took advantage of the lunch special, which for about $1 more, you can add a cup of soup or salad to your sandwich. We both got the smoked turkey/apple sandwiches. I got the tomato bacon soup, and my friend got the French onion soup. We both enjoyed the meal, then spent another hour or so walking around Geneva.

We both agreed, that when me meet again for lunch in a few weeks, we are going back to Geneva.

Stopped in for lunch with a friend. I also say it on check please. We were seated promptly. It is a very small reasturant. Nothing how it was presented on the show
 Anyway .. They had a interesting menu. They had little tapas Style casseroles.. also different assortment of cheese trays. We both ordered sandwiches made with their homemade bread, grilled to perfection.I think I would go back for drinks and appetizer's. Not necessarily for a meal. They offered a extensive crafted drink menu, and wine list.
Vibe was great, wine was best but the food was just okay. I mean.....besides the cheese, that was wonderful! :) And really, what more do you need than good vibes, good wine and good cheese?!

Highlights of the meal were the bacon jam and blue cheese crostini, roast beef sandwiches, short rib pie and the steal of a French syrah/grenache blend from their sprawling and reasonably priced wine list. My wife and I shared our meal from top to bottom and the staff absolutely nailed it on the timing and order of the plates. The vibe was unpretentious but still romantic for a date night, will definitely return and recommend to friends ... Thank you Preservation for a great night!

My wife's and my favorite restaurant hands down. Very friendly staff and amazing food. Can't go wrong with the European cheese plate, short rib pie and the chocolate tart. We are here at least once a month and it never gets old. Hidden gem.
Fantastic every time.  Quality ingredients, clever menu. Interesting while remaining solid.  And the atmosphere is simply pleasant.  Definitely a standard place to go for us.
Excellent food, tasty drinks and a great wait staff. I thoroughly enjoyed Preservation Bread & Wine and will return!

Nice little restaurant with good wine and food. The short rib pie was delicious but not filling enough. My girlfriend really liked her three cheese grilled sandwich. We ordered a bottle of Pinot Grigio which we both thought was very tasty. We will definitely go back sometime but next time I'm ordering an appetizer because a main course in my opinion is not filling enough and the meals do not come with sides.
So delicious and such wonderful service! A little pricey but well worth it. They have a lovely outdoor patio and I would recommend going in the summer.

Amazing Restaurant!!! If you have never been you got to go! 
Simply Delicious!  Seating out back is great!

I feel like such a pretentious turd when I say this but there really is nowhere around here to get a decent charcuterie board. Husband and I love Preservation Bread and Wine for just that (duck prosciutto? WHAAAAAAAAT). Their bread is delicious (as can be expected) and they do have an extensive wine list, but we are not wine drinkers so we can't attest to whether or not they know their stuff.

The whole staff = friendly and attentive and willing to answer any question you might have. Highly recommended :)

Most likely the best value restaurant in the area. Great food at a very reasonable price. European style food and taste. Felt like we were back in Spain.  Great place highly recommend it.  Also we didn't know it had a back seating area so it's bigger then you think.  Servers are always very nice.

Lawrence and his team make my taste buds dance. I like to have varied foods and strong flavors on the same plate and you will find that here with excellence. The atmosphere and seating is varied also so you eat here more than once a week and feel like you are in a different place.

Excellent food and service.A real treat in everyway.The staff is very friendly and infomative.Love the lightly seasoned salads.The tomato basil soup is my favorite soup.The lamb meatloaf sandwich is always my choice for lunch.

Amazing food, Amazing staff, Amazing atmosphere. The food is absolutely delicious, rich, and fresh. I've truly enjoyed every new item I have tried. And the wine! I love that I can say "I want to try the duck salad", and I'm guided  in choosing the perfect wine. (Wine menu is amazing. For all taste buds, no matter what the budget, each wine delivers) whether  it's a night out with friends filled with laughs, a romantic date night, or a much needed relaxing day/evening Preservation always caters to your needs.

Myself and my wife were wondering down 3rd Street last night, looking for a place to enjoy good food and good wine. We stopped in on a whim and were warmly greeted by Lawrence. They had one table available at the time, so we took it and sat down. Lawrence came up to us almost immediately to tell us about a special bottle of Rioja that he had just opened and was available by the glass- only 3 left. Being the wine enthusiasts that we are, we took him up on the suggestion..and it was amazing! We then ordered a bottle of Sancerre to enjoy with the rest of our good, which was also delicious. We loved the food concept, which they have smaller plates that are meant for sharing, kind of like tapas. It worked out perfect for us, allowing us to try several different plates with our wine. We definitely recommend the carpaccio, the Spanish cheese plate, the duck rillette, the salmon bake, and the bread pudding! All delicious! We will be back, so happy we found this little place!

You cannot live in, live near, or visit Geneva without eating at Preservation. If you miss Preservation Bread & Wine, you've missed one of the Western Suburbs' great restaurants.

If you are out to dinner (or lunch) with someone you don't like or that you don't like talking to, then don't come here. Go to McDonald's or something and get it over and done with quickly.

If you enjoy the person you'll be eating with, then come here. The cheese and meat plates at Preservation are terrific for long, conversation-filled meals over a bottle of wine. The staff can always recommend excellent wines to go with whatever you choose from the menu, and never ever will you be rushed. All the crostini are good, all the flat bread pizza is good, and the Charcuterie and Spanish Charcuterie are terrific.

If there are any of the Chocolate Espresso Tarts left when you go, have one. Or two. Or three. Along with coffee. You'll be happy.

Preservation Bread & Wine is one of our favorite restaurants. They may have some of the best food in the area. 

We've been there a few times now and always order the Lamb Meatloaf Focaccia. It is incredible. Other than that they switch up their menu seasonally so we end up trying new things. In the Fall/Winter they usually have Reams's Bratwurst and Spaetzle which is also delicious. 

They have a deceptively large seating area because there is additional seating behind the restaurant in a covered patio as well as an outdoor patio.

Had lunch on the inside patio area. 

Positives:
-Small and quaint atmosphere, nice inside decor and open windowed patio area. 
-The dulce bourbon drink was delicious and strong  ($11 and tiny, but hey this is geneva) 
-Interesting and intriguing menu, will likely return to try some of their cheese dishes/small plate items and other cocktails

The only negative was that my shrimp and chorizo baguette was disappointing. The amount of meat on it was so small, the chorizo was unusually chewy, and the baguette bread was too hard. Maybe baguettes just aren't my thing...

Seems like a nice place though, I'll likely give it another try for cocktails/small plate items for a quick bite.

I will start off by saying that I am not exactly a wine and cheese guy, but my girlfriend is so we got a reservation. With that being said, her assessment was the same as mine.

Positives:
-Quaint (super small dining area)
-Creative dishes (I got the lamb meatloaf sandwich on focaccia and she got the shrimp and chorizo on a baguette)
-HUGE wine list
-Cheese plates were delicious
-Nice and knowledgeable staff

Negatives:
-While the dining area is quaint, it almost feels invasive. I felt like I had to talk over the groups to my right and left who I was practically shoulder to shoulder with. I disagree strongly that it is a romantic and intimate place because of this.
-The creative dishes were a major letdown. My lamb meatloaf sandwich was dry and had a huge kick of lemon that I was not a fan of. 
-Prices. I felt like I barely got any food for the almost $70 I ended up spending. It was like that Cheetos commercial where they unveil the steak dish and there isn't even a steak so they start eating a bunch of Cheetos. Only instead of Cheetos we stopped at Jewel and I got a steak and cheese burrito for a dollar.

Great people working there.   Limited bar but everything is carefully chosen and works.  Space there is limited too, but that somehow works as well.    I love this place!   Real bistro atmosphere.  You can dress anyway you want and not feel out of place.    Ginger martini is an amazing concoction of theirs that will rock your world.   Everything on the menu is above and beyond what I expect...every time I go in.   

Consider me a Preservation cultist.  Just love the place, the owner, the help.  

Very convenient for commuters...steps from the train station.   You could miss this place easily and that would be a terrible mistake!

Music is really good their too, btw.

This place is great for delicious tapas and glass of wine, best as a place to start a date night for two, really wouldn't try to bring four or more due to the very small space. Good atmosphere and great cheese plates.   

+ The service is great, very friendly and helpful
+ European eating style (they do not rush you) 
+ Long amazing list of wines, by bottle and glass
+ Many small tasty plates offered 

- Space is limited, very small bar area
- Seating a bit tight (best to come early avoid dinner rush)
- Not very much privacy as the table are very close to each other

Call ahead for a reservation as there is only so much room once inside. :-)

This place is awesome! My sister and I went in the summer and had different small plates and wine. We sat in their outdoor patio and it was just fabulous!!! We had so much fun and the food /wine was great!! It is a bit pricey, but if you have the money to do it, you should!

What a great find. We have been trying to make time to have dinner her. Valentines Day was coming and we finally went. It was a pre-set dinner and wine paring. I generally don't care for this, but I was presently surprised. Everything was so fresh and of great quality. You could tell the moment the first dish was served.
The atmosphere was very relaxing and the staff was knowledge and friendly. We started with Endive Boats, they were perfect little salads that you ate with your hands. Dinner was Crispy chicken thighs cooked with olives and baby bell peppers. I can tell they seasoned the meal with fresh herbs, nothing from a bottle. It literally melted in your mouth. Dessert was Chocolate Bread pudding with fresh strawberries. Every course was pared with a different wine. The server explained what the wine was and why it was picked in the most un-pretentious manor. The picks were spot on. We can't wait to come back to order off the menu and try different dishes. I highly recommend this restaurant for a romantic date night, to a casual dinner with friends. Can not wait to return!
Excellent service. Great food. Excellent service. Been here a dozen times and they always make me want to come back. They're on to something. Try it. It's great!!!

Stopped here on a winter afternoon. Wife and I shared the Wild Mushroom Tart and Grilled Sour Dough & Turkey sandwich. Both were excellent. Good wine selection and service. Good stop fr a light lunch in Geneva.
We had a great experience. The wine that was recommended to us was delicious and the cheese and charcuterie plates were outstanding. If we're ever in this area again we'll definitely return.

Happend upon this restaurant and happy we stopped for lunch.  The taste, food quality and presentation were first rate... I highly recommend the  roast beef and grilled cheese sandwichs... Both were outstanding!  Oh and I look forward to going back and enjoying some of the wines with all the fantastic food...

They have a nice restaurant, and great little bar. It's a small space, but that adds to the charm. I enjoy sipping a glass of wine while enjoying their beautifully served charcuterie. The service has always been good. I'm a fan!

Oh, how I love the food here! The lamb meatloaf is sublime. The Chicken Pot pie is spot on. The salads are lovely. The service is friendly and efficient. It's a tiny place and it can get loud. But, overall, the experience always warrants a 5 star rating.

Man....good food, cozy place, and friendly service...like a personal gormet chef cooking for you. I first took my older daughter for lunch. We shared a grilled cheese and a grilled vegetable sandwich...Finger licking good. Then my husband and I went to have dinner. We had the artichoke bread pudding which was a savory lip smacking dish. We finished it off with desert of peach cobbler and some chocolate dish (I forgot the name). Both were great!!!  The Riesling wine I had was pretty good too and my husband enjoyed his lager beer.

A friend from college was in town and since wine bars were our thing in college we decided to try this place out (though it's not quire like the wine bar in downtown Bryan, TX).

We made a reservation and were seated quickly. Waters came quickly. Our server asked us if we had any questions and what our wine preferences were so she could help us choose. The reisling I got was killer (I'm kicking myself for not writing the name down somewhere). My friend enjoyed both of her reds that she got. For her second glass our server brought her samples of two that she may like. 

We had the american cheese platter. All 3 cheeses where good, but the parmesan was just difficult to work with since it isn't soft. We also had the flat bread which was really good, but less olives would have been okay in my opinion. 

I forgot how quickly tabs can build at places like this. We hit 70 dollars total and probably could have stayed for more wine if we had unlimited wallets.

Overall, this was a great first time at this place. Looking forward to returning or finding other wine places similar to this.

We popped in here on date night while waiting for a table at a nearby new "hotspot." We were seated immediately and ordered drinks and a few crostini apps to pass the time. Neither my husband nor I had wine, but I have heard the selection is impressive and reasonable, and the owner is a Sommelier.
I can however speak to their dirty martini with bleu cheese stuffed olives and it was perfectlion. I was so impressed by how attentive the staff was while the restaurant was bustling. More than one person stopped by our table to make sure we had everything we needed which I appreciated. The smoked salmon crostini and bacon jam crostini were both delicious as well. I can't wait to go back and taste more of the menu.

The service by every single employee was warm, personable....top notch.  We (4 of us) arrived on a Friday evening without a reservation and they did everything they could to accommodate us and make our wait pleasant.  Cocktails and wine were delicious, as were the bites we had to eat.  I would definitely recommend it to anyone in the area. Thank you for the hospitality!
Really liked our meal. Small restaurant. Had a relaxed meal with my Mom and Wife. Really interesting menu choices, cheese plates and charcuterie. Very good service.

We came back for a second visit after an iffy lunch experience a few months ago.

(++) Staff was great. Our waitress was extremely informative and offered lots of suggestions and helpful descriptions.
(+) I am a sucker for cheese and charcuterie plates and this place offers options. I had the European cheese plate and was not disappointed. Portions were fantastic and beets and pickled watermelon rinds were tasty. Short rib and chicken pot pies were perfect winter dishes. 
(+) I had a fantastic Pinot Noir and the gentleman had a Manhattan. Cocktails looked good. Extensive bottle selection of wines. 

I look forward to outdoor drinks and nibbles when the patio opens up in Spring.

Everything outstanding. Cocktails were unique and delicious especially the pear vodka concoction....holy hell was that good! Charcuterie and cheeses were great. Best French onion soup I've ever had....so deep and sweet. Short rib puff pastry dish was top notch. Can't wait to go back.

Decided to try Preservation Bread and Wine after living in Geneva for almost two years and all I can say is why did I wait so long... We had the short rib pie(me- devine), salmon potato bake( my guys- delicious- can we go back tomorrow), a bean cassolette, European cheese platter and finally their traditional charcuterie, all were fantastic. We will return regularly. Reservations would be recommended as it is small.

Tapas style plates served up in quaint enviroment.  The owner is welcoming, passionate, knowledgeable,  and world traveled. His perspective and knowledge about the wine he chooses to carry is extensive. The wine list allows customers to have the typical mainstays or be adventurous and allow him to pick wine to suite your palate. The food is delicious and full of delicate flavors that explode when paired with the right wine. 

The owner and server know what wines go best with their food so let them take you on a artistic culinary adventure. 
For those who throw caution to the wind and really enjoy great food and wine pairings this resturaunt offers a 4 course wine pairing every second Monday and I am looking forward to the journey and story the owner tells through his wine and food selection.

I had heard from many many friends about how great this place was. Honestly for some reason my husband and I had never been (despite our proud wine-o status). I had heard that the food was "small bites" or tapas style and so when I would suggest it my husband would usually respond "but I'm too hungry." But finally we went and I am so glad we did.

First, it is tapas style, but it is filling. After a few plates, we were stuffed. Which was sad because there was so much more we wanted to try. The food is delicious. We had the Spanish charcuterie (amazing) and Cow Cheese plate (great, but nothing crazy exciting), the turkey, Apple and walnut sandwich (waitress suggested it as their top seller and I can see why - delicious), and the mushroom tart (to die for). The wine list is also fabulous but be prepared to plunk down some $$ for it. The seating area can be really tight, so go to the bathroom before you're seated and be prepared to be close to strangers. 

All in all a great place to enjoy wine and some delicious foods. We'll be back.

A great place to have wine and a light snack. We enjoy there wine dinners, and also they're drinking classes. I like that this has a big city feel, in Geneva. Lawrence, the owner, is always very welcoming and makes us feel at home. The only suggestion is to offer more Wines By The Glass, my husband and I do not always drink the same wine, and may not want an entire bottle each.

We went on a Thursday night and sat on the patio.  It was beautiful.   The weather was great and we had enough room to converse without feeling like everyone was listening. - We had 5 people in our party.  The place is pretty small but very comfortable.   The owner was so attentive.  He told us all about the smoked meats and how he incorporates his food with spices and such.  The wine was incredible.  Wow. What a selection!
The waitress was very informative on pairing and was very personable - Probably one of the best I've had.  

On the the food! My favorite was the mushroom  pastry. I could tell instantly that everything here was made to order,fresh and homemade.  
I think this restaurant will do very well for years to come.   I know we will be back again and again.  Next time I'll have to save room for dessert!

Wonderful food, wait staff and definitely a different dining experience. Charcuterie and the lamb meatloaf sliders are ones to try for sure.  A definite go-to for anyone who is looking for great food, comfortable surroundings and a laid back experience.

To die for! The best food in Geneva, hands down. You can get hand crafted, creative, delicious dishes that are a cut above for the price of around ten dollars, which is very surprising considering the quality of the food. The staff is super friendly and the wine selection is top notch. I recommend absolutely everything. An easy five stars!!!

A friends and I are not quite regulars, but when we can meet for a Friday lunch this is where we love to go. The food is varied and a little unusual for a traditional suburban location, but it's not 'tragically hip.' The wine list is impressive, and the staff makes good recommendations (we've asked!). Personally, I like ordering a cheese plate - they have a few - and one of the charcuterie selections. Ask a question about ANYTHING, and they will tell you whatever you want to know. And when you've been there once, they treat you like a regular - even if you're not quite a regular. They will remember you, and give a warm welcome. What's not to love?

Everything I've eaten here is delicious.   The charcuterie and cheese plays are my favorite; they could use a little more bread though.  We ended up there once on a Wednesday when they offered wood fired pizzas and in all thinking about that pizza.   Go on a Wednesday if you can.

We ate here for lunch yesterday - a Saturday afternoon - and were pleasantly surprised that there wasn't a wait for outdoor seating. We were greeted by a man in a white linen shirt who led us to our table. He also came out a couple of times during our lunch to make sure everything was OK. Owner? Manager? Chef?

Our waitress was friendly and seemed to know the menu well; she took the time to explain things to us since this was our first visit. We chose the $10 lunch special (asparagus soup and sandwich) which was a decent price compared to other things on the menu. We tried two different sandwiches - the turkey and pastrami. Both were delicous. We were told that they smoke their own turkey and that they make the pastrami in the restaurant. We also ordered a buttercrunch citrus salad. It came in a tiny bowl (barely enough for one side serving) and the citrus consisted of a few microscopic pieces of grapefruit and orange. The photo on their web site is deceiving! And for $7.50, this salad was definitely a rip-off. Save your money and don't order this salad - unless you don't mind paying $7.50 for a few bites of lettuce.

We would like to go back to this place with some friends so we could taste some of the other offerings. After all, this place is more of a tapas or small plate place - food made for sharing. If you're REALLY hungry, you're going to be ordering a lot of little plates of food and spending way too much money.

Was looking for a more-special-than-usual place to treat our mom to a nice dinner for Mother's Day. After calling a few other hot spots in Geneva and unable to get a table there, we were pleased to book an early table for 3 at Preservation. 
Well, it must have been our lucky day that the other two places were booked because this was an experience!
First....upon walking in right at our scheduled time, we were promptly greeted by the owner who apologized that the table wasn't immediately ready and that they were working on a "creative solution." We were seated within three minutes and the creative solution was a cozy table in the back dining room (enclosed patio) in which the third seat was a chair with the legs cut off to fit into its spot---so cute, we loved it!
They had an awesome selection of cheeses- many of which I'd never heard of but luckily if you had any questions about anything the servers were extremely friendly and knowledgeable. Most of the "small plates" are set up with about three or four different cheese and meat options fort about $10-$15 a pop- the plates have suggested groupings but you can design your own plate by picking anything that you want- that was super cool! Everything we tasted was totally delicious and beautifully plated. Do not miss the flatbread pizza!
All in all a bill for three ladies with  a few drinks a piece was a little over $100 w/o tip so definitely not a cheap place but I personally found it to be really reasonably priced for what this was- a wine bar essentially.  
My mother had the best time and we will be back to celebrate another holiday here- planning on bringing the men next time to see if they love it as much as we did!

By far our favorite place in town. It's 'Our' date night place to go.  The mixed drinks are amazing! The ginger martini and lazzais pear are a must. We've tried almost everything on the menu. The lamb meatloaf sandwich,  reubens, and chicken salad sandwich are Yummm!  These are great and everything else is good.  The owner is very friendly and the staff very courteous.  Pride of Geneva.   John and Mahereen Ahearn.

This is one great place to eat and drink. Staff is attentive and informative .Have visited several times and it just gets better. All the menu items are top shelf and delicious. The owner has went to extremes to pair the wine choices with food.Some wine choices are above the rest and show it .This is our # 1 pick when in Geneva

I would really like to give this place 3.5 stars but i guess Yelp doesn't trust its users with half stars. $10 lunch special was a great deal. My French onion soup came minus the baked cheese on top which, I thought, was the point of the French onion soup... 

The cheese plate was good,  but nothing that exciting or new. Our plate was served with pickled watermelon and chopped beets. The pickled watermelon was very interesting and surprising good, but no one likes beets. No one. Stop serving cheese platters with beets. Try some small nuts, jelly, crackers - anything except beets.
Very good! Mac and cheese and grilled cheese is great! Definitely worth a stop if you're going through Geneva.

The food and service was very good.  The food is at a quality level that you would expect in the city with a creative offering.  Some other issues however, cast a cloud over our experience.  The wine list is extensive but too expensive.  Half bottles are the price of full bottles at other restaurants.  Glasses of wine are typically $10+.  Corkage fee is $25, essentially ruling out bringing in your own wine.  Overall price of our meal with a half bottle of wine came in at $85.  The restaurant facility is small and typically very loud.  There is a seating area in the rear of the restaurant that is best described as an all weather sun room.  Our feeling was that a $100 dinner should involve at least a table cloth.  Unfortunately the ambiance in this rear section is not much better than a fast food restaurant.  We will come back and hopefully they will improve the experience over time but the frequency of our visits will only be a couple times per year at best.

I didnt care for the backroom last time I was here, so this time we asked for, and were graciously given, a front room table.   Everything I have ordered here has been good.  There is care and thought put into the menu.  The service is friendly.  Not a cheap eat, but one that is worth the price.

Awesome place for lunch; my husband and I have started to come here regularly. I wish they would get more vegetarian options though, especially the soups; I've always had a hard time finding those with vegetable broth. I forgot to ask about the base in the soups last time and had the cheddar, it was delicious, but now I cannot have it as it is made with chicken broth. :/

It's a good idea to make a reservation for dinner at this tiny place. Even on a week night it filled up quickly. 
The atmosphere is cozy and dim; huddle up with your wine for a chat with your dining companion. 

Our waitress was efficient and very knowledgeable about the wines (I had questions about a couple of the reds, i.e. which would have a "smoother" finish -- she recommended one, but brought samples of two for me to try. The recommendation was the one I preferred.)

Preservation serves dishes tapas-style, so lots of little plates. 

We started with the European cheese plate (generous for two people); perhaps even more enjoyable than the cheeses were the watermelon rind pickles and beet-ginger chutney that offset them.

Their special that night was flatbread pizzas; when I first came in and was waiting for my companion, I'd started talking with the people beside me, who'd ordered the duck flatbread pizza and were raving about it. I must admit it would never occur to me to get this...but then my companion suggested we get it. The duck added a rich counterpoint to sweet caramelized onions and the crisp bread. An unusual dish. 

We also ordered the dish of macaroni and cheese, but this was a sort of strange excecution: large shells (say an inch), with the cheese sauce sort of underneath them, so the mass had to be mixed...it just didn't do it for me, though my companion (who had dined here before) had recommended it specially.

The mounting tapas plates were a bit challenging to arrange on our itty-bitty table, but our waitress swung by at convenient times to help relieve us.

Overall, there were some adventurous dishes, but I can't say it was the best tapas I have ever had. Still, good service, adventurous food and many more items on the menu. You can preserve this one in your memory as a possibility.

Love this place! Staff is extremely friendly and they have a great menu selection. We shared the charcuterie along with the Spanish cheese plate (delicious)! Also the duck rillettes were a favorite. Great wine selection as well.

((clap... clap.... clap, clap, clap, clap....))

That's right, Preservation Bread & Wine, you get a slow clap for being so awesome. What rich foods and defined wines you have?!?  My lamb meatloaf sandwich, coupled with a lovely medium bodied red wine, which by the way was randomly picked by our waiter- shout out to Alex, were delectable!  Equally important, the entire staff was courteous, prompt, and easy going! Seriously, you can't beat that!

As for the ambiance and atmosphere?  LOVE IT!  It's alright for small groups but  truly ideal for intimate dates or one-on-one get togethers with good friends!  This place does get crowded, but it has this charm that's makes it okay.

Anyway, you PB&W,  you got yourself a new patron! See you in the near future!

My fiancÃ© and I dined here recently, and LOVED it! We consider ourselves foodies, and found everything to be top notch.  We had their meat platter, cheese platter, French onion soup, and a couple of their dishes in ceramic bowls (duck cassoulet, OMG! So good!)! Fine dining quality food, but in a cozy, home style, and approachable format.  We will be back for sure!

I wish I could eat here everyday!  My husband and I can not get enough of the turkey sandwich or the asparagus salad.  Great place for a very reasonable lunch with gourmet food.  The staff is always wonderful and the wine list is top notch!  This place will not disapoint.  Heading back again today,
Love this place! Amazing sandwiches and the drinks are just as good! Fun and different with a mellow atmosphere.

Preservation is solid!

First, I know this makes me sound really douchey, but I had no idea there was this kind of stuff in out here. I'm an urbanophile through and through, but I was amazed at how cute and dense downtown Geneva actually is.

This place could easily fit in any yuppie neighborhood of a major city. The cocktails are simple enough not to be pretentious, but still full of flavor. The food really shines, from the perfectly-smoky tomato-bacon soup (served with awesome homemade brioche) to the short rib pie, which is the staff favorite, for a good reason. And the service was prompt and friendly, which is not something I'm accustomed to after two years on the west coast.

This was another excellent Yelp find by my wife, and I know I'll get a craving for it again the next time we're in Geneva...but with so many cute shops and restaurants there, we'll have to force ourselves to try something new!

I LOVE Preservation!

When i visit my bro in Geneva we always make a stop here. Its very tiny, so get there early if you want to snag a table. In nice weather they have a patio out back which provides additional room for seating..yay! 

Great wine selection and they do a good job with cocktails too (and i'm a serious cocktail snob). What really keeps me coming back though is the food!

THe cheese and charcuterie plates are well executed. Very generous portions and I live the sides that accompany them (picked veg and such). My fav is the spanish charcuterie plate.

Also a big fan of lots of the small plates i've eaten. Too many to list but one recent stand out was the falafel (who would have thought?) -the honey tiziki sauce is insane. If you live nearby or happen to find yourself in Geneva...come check this place out!

This restaurant is awesome. The sandwiches melt in your mouth. Menu has a wide selection of gourmet appetizers, soups and entrees that will appeal to just about any taste. Wine selection is also very good, naturally. Probably the most "Chicago-like" restaurant I've found in Geneva in terms of atmosphere, menu and overall food quality. The owner seems like a great guy and really tries to make every patron feel welcome.

Randomly stopped in here for lunch with my friend yesterday and we loved our meal. We split the andouille sausage and potato salad and the spinach artichoke bread pudding--very unique lunches that were so tasty, I am going to try to recreate the dishes at home!  My friend had  a glass of riesling and liked it and i had coffee, which was excellent.  We were too full for dessert but smelled the pies or tarts that the table next to us had and they smelled delicious. We also loved the screened in patio --it's a very cozy and modern atmosphere--can be a good date night place or just with friends or family.  Definitely worth a trip and my next time in Geneva will be split between this place and A Toda Madre (see that review too), depending on what I am in the mood for!

This was an amazing lunch. The food was delicious (a little too much lemon on my sandwich but that's forgivable). They have such comfy chairs and the warm colored decor gives such a welcoming vibe to the place. The waitress was such a cheerful sweetheart and the host was very polite. I was seating facing the kitchen and watched how it was run like a gentle and efficient machine. If you're looking for a place with awesome food and chill atmosphere this is it.
Reasonably priced wine and excellent service! The food perfectly pairs with your wine every time!
Great, friendly & knowledgable service. Delicious food with perfect wine pairings. Nice outdoor seating. Ideal for lunch or taking a break from shopping. Hidden gem!

This place is delicious! We were visiting Geneva 2 years ago from out of town and were here on a Sunday and unfortunately Preservation was closed. Thankfully, this time, when we popped in for lunch on a Saturday, it was open. We were greeted by the owner, who was so friendly and upbeat and passionate about his food and wine. My husband (who is a vegetarian) and I split the grilled vegetable sandwich with a cup of squash soup, the mushroom tart and the spinach and artichoke bread pudding. All delicious! The only thing that was a little odd was the pine nut tart. Not bad, but just a weird combo of flavors for my liking. The bottle of white wine was excellent. My husband knows his wine and was so excited to see this bottle, which was unique and different and not easy to find. We will definitely come back here the next time we visit Geneva!!

Just had the lamb meatloaf sandwich. I was afraid it would be too heavy but it was really a clever sandwich. 

The meatloaf is cut thin so as not to be overbearing, then set on an almost pillowy light foccacia (which I also feared would be too heavy, but was perfect). The heartiness of the meatloaf was balanced delicately with the tanginess of a soft cheese and the bright sourness of preserved lemon.  

Can't wait to try another one in 2 weeks (have to come to Geneva from work).

ALL great home made food!!!!!   SUPER fresh food and portions were of great size.  

The hot sauce on the table is perfect amount of spice and also made fresh daily.  

Highly recommend to anyone that is in the area.

I had just finished 9 hours of intense landscaping and I  could have easily devoured every taco and burrito in the kitchen! Needless to say, I came to Burrito Parrilla Mexicana starving. 

My fiancÃ© and I both ordered 3 tacos a-la-carte. She ordered Al Pastor, and I ordered Lengua (tongue). Lengua is my go-to at a Mexican restaurant, and Al Pastor is hers. These tacos were fantastic! I ate three large tacos in about 4 bites. I was able to sample her taco as well, and it was just as tasty! 

Service was fast and friendly, and the tacos were affordable. The complimentary chips and salsa added a nice touch, and the salsa was outstanding! It was flavorful and packed a punch. However, it wasn't so spicy that I didn't enjoy it. 

I will definitely be returning to Burrito Parrilla Mexicana in the future!

Faaaan-tastic fajitas and chimichangas, with all-you-can-drink horchata and virgin pina colada - It's like a dream come true!  I seriously love good grilled chicken fajitas.  I often joke that "they're my medicine," helping me cope with the world.  I'm only half-joking, though.  I would probably be a horrible human being, if I didn't get good fajitas every so often.  The chicken fajitas here were excellent, with lots of perfectly-grilled veggies.  The fresh flour tortillas were perfect, as were all of the sides.  The portions were generous, but I still managed to pound down two glasses of their horchata (I like that their wasn't too sweet), and two more glasses of the virgin pina colada.  

There are plenty of other places to get a great fajita dinner, but the service here is above-and-beyond any of the other burrito places in the area that I've tried thus far.  The restaurant has lots of seating, is very clean, and I enjoy the table service.  You'd think that the extra amenities would put them out of the price range of many of their smaller competitors in the area, but the prices were very reasonable.  There are so many great places to eat in the Lombard area, but this is a clear contender for one of top 3 in the neighborhood.  I'm looking forward to getting lunch or dinner here again - it's WAY cheaper than therapy, and probably more effective!

Very nice restaurant in Lombard right across the street from Yorktown mall.  Very nice presentation of the food, but nothing exceptional.  It was a decent meal and certainly worth trying.  Much nicer interior then the dump I ate at last night.

We ordered a torta de milanesa, torta de pollo, chicken burrito for kids, and churros for about $29. The tortas were good but a bit plain compared to other authentic Mexican places like LBT. They are also more pricey so it doesn't justify the cost, although avocado is usually an extra charge and here you get it either way. What we did not like were the red salsas that came with our meal. There was a spicy and a mild and the spicy tasted worse. We threw those out. The churros were really good and soft. I think we would go here again if in the area and want Mexican food but otherwise we won't go back.

Actually sat down this time instead of ordering and it was quite pleasant! 

Enjoyed the chips and salsa. I ordered the chicken taco salad this time and was amazed! 

Give this place a try for lunch!

Good food, great prices, fast service. Authentic Mexican food.  Nice staff.  You can shop w the money you save instead of going to Uncle Julio's. Everything looked good. We got a steak and a chicken burritos suizo, huge.  The pineapple coconut water was tasty. Free chops and salsa on tables. We will be back.

Great Americanized Mexican food! Everything from the enchiladas to the nachos are always very good. My favorite is the steak nachos, which I highly recommend. Everything comes with chips and salsa, which is mild for those who can't handle too much heat. 
There's a large seating area but at peak lunch and dinner times there may be a short wait. When you first enter, you order at the counter and place your number on your table. The staff is always friendly and happy to help with anything you need.
Perfect for a quick lunch or dinner when you're in a hurry!

Being from Colorado I have not been to any Mexican restaurants here, but today we went to Burrito Parrilla and the food really surprised me. Salsa was not the best and there was no heat from it. Had two tacos with rice & beans. Carnitas was some of the best from a fast food restaurant. They were very happy to bring you anything you needed or wanted. Great service!

Can't go wrong with the enchiladas with white poblano.

I'm always too full for dessert but next time I'm going in the famous Horchata and/or Fried Ice Cream.

Amazing food and service. We are in town visiting, and found this restaurant on yelp. You will not be disappointed. It is clean, the staff is friendly, and the food is outstanding. Give them a try you will not be disappointed.

For a colleagues b'day we ordered lunch for 10 from here and man it was a feast enough for 15 people. The chips, gauc, chicken fajitas were really good and not forget the beans. we will be ordering from here again!

Like all the other reviews have stated, this isn't your typical hole-in-the-wall authentic Mexican food. It is more Americanized and in some way, probably healthier. 

I came in for an early dinner over the weekend w/ my friends and I got the al pastor tortas w/ a drink. The total was around $9 and the drink is unlimited pineapple coconut juice or horchata. The pineapple coconut is refreshing and really sweet and tropical. The horchata is on point, perfect amount of cinnamony flavor in the drink.

My al pastor tortas was decent, nothing too amazing. I would want to try the fajitas because I saw another customer eating it and it looked really yummy.

This restaurant is spacious so you can easily assemble a big party here.

Free chip & salsa when you eat at the restaurant!

I ordered myself a steak burrito during my first visit and I was really disappointed with my order. I expected the food to taste better since my friends from school kept telling me how good the food at this place is. I decided to give this place another try. For the second time around, I ordered tacos (al pastor) and it was delicious. The meat was juicy and tender. I ordered a combo plate that came with three tacos, bean and rice. I got two al pastor tacos and a chicken taco. The chicken was dry so I would not recommend getting the chicken. 

While we waited for our orders, the waitress gives us free chips and salsa. One of my favorite parts about this place is the unlimited refill of horchata and pineapple coconut juice. So refreshing and delicious.  I would suggest getting the tacos or torta with al pastor and stay away from the steak and the chicken.

Burrito Parrilla is my favorite quesadilla place! The steak quesadilla is tops, and it's perfect for lunch or dinner. It's a little on the pricier side, being that it's listed as an appetizer. However, the steak has really good flavor, and they give you very tasty guacamole and pico de gallo to put on it. Their tacos are pretty good, as well, but the quesadillas are the stand out for me, obviously. 

What I really like about this place is that the food is not your standard greasy Americanized-Mexican food; it's very fresh. My only big con would be that it's impossible to find a place to sit during lunch rush.

I look for local places when I'm on the road, and this place didn't disappoint.  Other reviews were spot on: low prices, a lot of food, good flavor, cool atmosphere. Good variety of menu items too. Check it out

This is like an upgraded version of Taco Bell or your regular hole-in-the-wall taco joints. The restaurant is clean and pretty big with friendly staff. A waitress brings free salsa (delicious) as you sit down, and if you choose to get horchata, it's unlimited. The horchata tastes like real horchata, and the tacos and the enchiladas are priced decently and worth it. Choose Burrito Parrilla over Pinched next door! Heehee.

Been there a couple times.  Worth a trip if in the neighborhood.  Think The Patio for mexican.  Order, get drinks, salsa shows up, entrees delivered to your table.

Pros
Tasty el pastor pork and fajita items
Great tacos
Great iced tea and pineapple/coconut drinks
Free chips and salsa
Good green salsa condiment
Decent to good guacamole
Great customer service

Cons
Red salsa is pretty bad
Lettuce in burritos... just stop this people!!!

I'll be back.

I had an el pastor burrito dinner. This pork is marinated like the Chinese red pork cha sau except it also had hints of pineapple. The skin was crunchy and the meat tender but not dry. Burrito came with iceberg lettuce, refried beans, and pepper Jack cheese on top. The dinner option includes a side of rice and refried beans.

 In terms of portion size one is more than enough.  Burrito could barely fit into my hand. It is at least 4 inches in diameter and 6 inches long.

Food was served quick and server's were very responsive for a semi cheap fast food place.

Decorum is mostly modern space wide open from hips up. Chairs are comfortable. 

If you are looking for a reasonably priced burrito place not full of hipsters, that is family oriented, and tastes awesome, this is the place to be.

On the steak fajitas: steak had no flavor at all and was way over cooked (I asked for rare and it came out well done). Guacamole was equally bland. The fajita veggies, however, were OUTSTANDING - awesome flavor, and the tortillas although a bit small were super tasty and clearly homemade (or very locally sourced). Free chips and two salsas were a nice perk. I'd come back for veggie fajitas for sure.

And the churros, wow!

Just went there for the first time.  I have a feeling that the next time I go there my rating will be a full 5 stars.   Delicious.  Had the chicken tacos and a small guac.  Since it was my first time, did not know that chips and salsa would be brought to the table.....this is the type of place where you order first and then they bring the food to you.  Very good, better than most and I can't wait to try all the other items on the menu.

Went back and had the cheese enchilidas with mole.  Yummmmmm

Cute restaurant with tasty food. I had the three enchiladas with cheese, chicken and veggies which was good. Their rice is also tasty. I also had the pineapple and coconut drink which was good and unlimited. They give a small amount of chips at the beginning of the meal which is good so you don't fill up before meal. At this restaurant, you order first at the counter then get your drinks then your food is brought to your table so it's great for a group of people.
