See yah qdoba... See yah chipotle..... This place is unreal.  From the nachos to to the taco salad, and chicken burrito.  Everything was awesome and tasted fresh, and the fresh pineapple coconut drink is probably the best thing I have ever had.  If you want Mexican and big portions, this is the place
Cannot go wrong with anything on the menu - steak anything a must!  Try the pineapple coconut drink - Refreshing and delish!  Great food and great customer service.

Everything this place does is awesome. Down to the rice and beans on the side. Amazing fresh flour tortillas and ingredients! We come here when we want Mexican food - period. Great for kids too. My four year old girl loves it! 
I am and will continue to be a loyal customer!

I had an al pastor torta and while the al pastor was so tasty, the bread was a bit too hard (probably grilled for a bit too long). Also the chile de Arbol sauce was not too spicy and not too sweet, which was pretty complimentary to the al pastor. 

My boyfriend had the grilled steak burrito and he said it was good however he wanted more steak! Also they didn't sell any Jarritos, which is surprising since the Naperville location sells it.

Great chips and salsa as well! Overall, I would come back again and try other items!

I'm craving the nachos right now!! Will lunch time come faster!

I've been here a couple times and now I know what my favorite dish is.  The Beef Nachos, which comes with tomato, lettuce, sour cream, guac, cheese and pico -- OMGGGGGGG yum!  I would def say this is the best Mexican food in the area.  It is very nice inside and clean mod decor.

I love that they give you salsa and chips while your waiting.  There is another green salsa in a squeeze bottle on the table that is very good if you mix with the salsa on the chips...I have it down to a science LOL.  The people who wait on you and at the register are very nice.  Even though it is fast food, you do not get this feeling when you are inside, which is nice compared to other Mexican cuisine restaurants around here.

Good Mexican food in a nice, clean restaurant. I always get the enchiladas or chicken tacos. You're guaranteed a solid meal whatever you order but you want be blown away either. Still nothing wrong with a good consistent place

Best tacos I've ever had. I don't say this stuff lightly people. I have eaten a lot of tacos in my life. Fact: homemade flour tortillas, beautifully marinated steak, carnitas so tender it melts like butter, homemade salsa. Just when I thought it couldn't get any better I tried their torta; holy guacamole. I haven't had a bad thing there. Just go there and see for yourself.

I used to come here about 3 years ago when it first opened must say they still got it the steak tacos are amazing and you can't go wrong with their guacamole and chips.  I must say their chicken wasn't up to par this time around .  But what I love the most is that the steak is chargrilled   So you don't get that greasy taste and pork doesn't mix with the steak because it's on a separate skewer.  I love the pineapple coconut juice they and to top it off their churros are off the chain with a delicious Carmel dipping sauce.

Two words: unlimited horchata!!!

That is all.

In all seriousness, we used to live in the area but moved away a few years ago. In fact, this review is long overdue. We have yet to find a restaurant in our area whose horchata compares to Burrito's. We go directly to Burrito as soon as we are in town for our horchata fix. No joke. Other than the horchata (I'm craving one now and our next to trip to Chicagoland isn't for many, many months, boohoo) we appreciate the friendly service and cleanliness of the restaurant. Food is fresh and tasty. My kids are fans of the quesadillas, and I enjoy the enchiladas. Did I mention how much we love their horchata?!!
The Al Pastor tacos were phenomenal. I had asked the server what his favorite was... And he was spot on. Go eat there. Recommend cheese, cilantro, onions and lettuce on top.
Amazing food and service. I enjoyed the taco salads and tacos. Great Americanized mexican food. The portions are decent sizes, friendly staff,  and the restaurant was clean.
Pineapple drink, cheese enchiladas with mole sauce, chips with a squirt of arbol sauce...done...Hawks win.

Been here a few times. Amazing every time. The grilled veggie taco salad is so fresh and tastes amazing!!! 
The horchada is so good! Everything is great.

My and my co-workers come here at least once a week. Food is always good and fast. The tortas are especially good.

The only issue we have ever had is trouble finding a seat.
The food here is good and the salsa they have on the tables is very good. At times it would get very crowded and it was hard to find a table, but that's usually just at the height of lunch hour.
This restaurant was awesome. I ordered the beef fajita and you could taste the freshness of the vegetables and the salsa. The beef fajita was out of this world!! Awesome amazing experience in total

Pleasantly surprised!  Thought it would be too Americanized but it's authentic.  The chips are light and salsa delicious.  I had the guacamole which was fresh and yummy.  I had the steak taco combo.  It was delicious.  I will definitely come back.

This place is marvelous. Everything we've had to eat has been fresh and all around great, the facility is appealing and clean, and the service is prompt and pleasant.

We used to come here a lot about a year ago. Due to busyness and a second child, life hasn't brought us this way as often lately. Today, we're back! Bottomless horchata, how I missed you. I'm pretty sure I drink my entire day's worth of recommended calories each time we're here.

I like: the salsa, the stunning restroom, healthy kids meals under $5, and of course, ALLOFTHEFOOD! Seriously, you can't choose wrong.

As others have mentioned, this area has lots of offices, so this place (and most other places around), gets busy at lunch time. Lucky for me, I don't often have my life together enough to be eating meals at regular mealtimes, so it has been okay.

I don't know what to think of this place.

I got a steak burrito, nachos and some horachta. The steak was way over done and could not of been drier. The burrito was wrapped poorly (which is a common complaint of mine). I had too many bites of only 1 ingredient. I would give the burrito just 2 stars.

The nachos were solid and the all you can drink horachta was good as well. I feel like I should give them another chance but I really felt like Taco Bell delivers a better burrito than them. 

To be honest, there's so many good mexican places in the area I would just skip this place...

I hate having to write a string of less than stellar reviews. I always let them sit in my queue and wait to do them until I have nothing left to review. 

I really, really, really, really wanted to love Burrito. I've had friends that have nothing but great things to say about it. But when we went, on a steamy Saturday afternoon in August, there was just nothing that great about it.

We tend to eat lunch really late on Saturdays. Like around 3-4 p.m. It's not that we sleep in and have breakfast late or anything, we just get so tied up in whatever we're doing in the daytime that we kind of put it off until we're starving and can't wait anymore.

So we hit Burrito, actually craving Chipotle, but this place was closer to our new house.

And we paid sit-down prices for what was really a Chipotle-style meal with some beans and rice as well as complimentery chips & salsa. Meh.

My wife had chicken. I had the al pastor. They were both burritos. They were both dry as hell and pretty tasteless except for the hot sauce/salsa stuff we kept loading on them to choke the things down. I'm sorry, but flavorless is just not my style. It was absolutely not worth the money we paid and I feel that we would have received a better value and better product had we just gone to Chipotle as we originally planned.

I really wasn't expecting much just quick gloppy Mexican food but boy was I surprised. It's fast but fresh great chips and tomato salsa. Rice and beans were great not pre made minute rice . The hand made tortillas were light and tasty . The tacos al carbon are fantastic and loaded with fresh tasty pork. This is a gem and on my list when I visit Il again

Their steak enchiladas with the white pablano sauce........delish!

Must try...group of 4 went and were extremely happy with service, food and price!

Was gonna go there.  
But saw the price list in 'photos' wow that's pricy for Mexican food
Pretty darn good. Steak is good quality, along with chips salsa and guac. Any complaints are just being picky. This place is solid.

We ordered a taco dinner (al pastor and carne asada) and an buritto (al pastor) suiza style. Both were excellent and the white poblano sauce was amazing to have on the side. Their unlimited horchata/pineapple-coconut juice were both delicious. Would definitely come again

Gold star for excellent service, large portions for an incredible price, very authentic tasting food and the best homemade sauce/salsa (not the red one- request it on the side for a to-go order)! 

Hands down, their food is significantly better than Uncle Julios down the street. Half the price. 

Recommendation: Chicken burrito with rice, beans, fajitas, pico, guac. Could probably feed two people with how much food they give you.

This is like Chipolte on stilts. It's the same concept of ordering your meal and paying for it BEFORE you eat but 20x better. 

The manager who took our order was seriously delightful. It was 91 degrees and only getting hotter and I probably would have hurt his feelings if he acted like a jerk. He told us what was good, how we ordered and pretty much hooked us up.

The menu is small but they pretty much offer the standard Mexican fare with a meat, bean and cheese of your choosing. 

The burritos were 6.99$ and were a nice size. Lets just say, you won't walk away hungry. The guacamole was perfect. Well, almost perfect. It could have used a bit of lemon but seriously? Amazing. 

BEST FAJITA TACOS EVER. I don't know why I've never insisted on FRESH cilantro on my tacos but these guys know what's up! I'm still drooling over those tacos. Your choice of corn or flour tortillas as well.

They offer chips and salsa in private smaller bowls and unlimited refills. The salsa they offer is mild but he said he keeps the "burn your a*s" stuff in the back. (JK, I said that, but for real, in the back)

The place was exceptionally clean, affordable, the service was spot-on and I really enjoyed my food as did my husband and best friend.  I'll be back, if only for the guacamole.
Great chicken taco salad. Pineapple drink and horchata is the bomb. I will definitely be back

Very nice place, you can watch them prepare your food. The prices are on the high side but the portions are also large, so they do cancel each other out. Order the combo fajitas to take home. Like I said the portions were great, though I am glad I order the combo the steak was great but the chicken was rubbery could not even eat it. Will come back but no chicken
Parilla has the most amazing steak taco salad. They use the best steak I've ever had at a Mexican restaurant. Add extra meat (chorizo) and it's game over.

Forget Chipotle, this is Mexican fast food done right! This place is tucked away in a plaza close to Belsoie Jasmine bridal on Highland Ave in Lombard. Lots to choose from on the menu and the staff are quite courteous. Everything we chose was delicious. Horchata was pretty good too! Will definitely return
Good food - especially if we're in the mood for something different than our usual Mexican spots. I usually get the steak tacos, which are delicious.  Everything we've tried has been good though.

Only have been here for take out (which is really awkward...you literally stand at the back while people get their drinks). I have the carnitas tacos and they were pretty good! The beans and rice were also excellent. It's very authentic and very reasonable! The horchata steals the show though..so good!

So many veggie options!! I had the enchiladas, 2 ranchero and 1 creamy cheese, which were both really good! It came with rice and beans which were also really tasty. Their salsa in the bottle has a kick to it!

Great atmosphere, food very good although the portions are small.

You place your order, you are given a number to insert on the stand at the table, and a server brings it to you.

Premises appear to be well maintained.  Decor is very pleasant.

You should try this place at least once.

For a non-descript strip mall Mexican restaurant this place is A-OK. I came here several times between December-March and not a single complaint, five star experience all the way. Unfortunately, when I came again in July, much was left to be desired. I ordered a kids veggie burrito for my daughter. It came with fries. Fries? Why not beans or rice? Speaking of, no beans or rice in the burrito either. It was literally a few sticks of deliciously sautÃ©ed zucchini and peppers hidden amongst a big blob of cheese. What could have been amazing and healthy was gross and almost inedible. If I have one suggestion, cut back on the cheese a bit, add more veggies, throw in some black beans and plate it with some iceberg and tomato and a scoop of rice. On the plus side, some of the best horchata we have ever tried. I have had the breakfast which was great and the veggie enchiladas which were good. Could have been better if they offered verde sauce and again increased the veggies and decreased the cheese a bit. Great guacamole. Very little in terms of ambiance. All in all, a good suburban Mexican restaurant.

A great meal!  We stopped in at around 8:30 pm. It was fairly busy but plenty of searing available. You order, get a number and then just sit and wait for your meal. We ordered fajitas, tampiqueÃ±a steak and a quesadilla. It was more then enough food to feed 3 adults and 2 toddlers. Everything was perfect. The meat was cooked flawlessly. Their pineapple and coconut drink is amazing. Normally I go for horchata but this pineapple and coconut drink is a must from now on. People are nice and very attentive. I will definitely be back and often.

Good take on the Chipotle dealio, but a little pricey for the slivers of protein and 3 palm sized tortillas you get in a $10 fajita. 

Its a modern place in a strip mall located close to a bunch of eateries catering to the business lunch crowd... for the same about, better deal to go to Sweet Tomatoes about 20 ft away.

NOTE: If you come in during lunch and plan on staying, grab a table asap BEFORE ordering, it will be gone.... plant a coat or person...

My husband and I really like this place. I've been looking for a good Mexican spot since moving to Lombard and have finally found it!
I got the steak tacos & they were delicious. The rice was okay, nothing special. My husband got a chicken torta and loved it, along with the horchata. Oh, and you can't go wrong with free chips, the salsa is pretty tasty.
The place is nice inside, they always have catchy music playing and TVs if you care to watch. Burrito Parrilla has some new regulars :D
Love this place! Free chips and salsa with your order! The steak tacos and steak torta are my favorite! Steak is not fatty and greasy. I haven't had anything here I haven't liked!

This place is great, I go here often for lunch during the week. The Mahi taco's that they had during lent were awesome, I wish they would permanently add those to the menu! Location in Carol Stream is also great, I with they had the avocado salsa at the Lombard location.

Pros: friendly staff, quick service but still with real plates and nice presentation, massive amount of meat in the burrito.
Cons: carnitas burrito was very salty, chips were slightly stale. 

I like the ambiance and the staff was very friendly. The carnitas burrito, suizo style, looked very good and was quite large. But the meat, although a massive amount inside the shell, was a little saltier than I like. 

I would try this place again, but not order the carnitas.

I visited the new Carol Stream location today for lunch and was not impressed with what I had. Beef Burrito dinner with guacamole and sour cream and chips and salsa to go. The whole meal was very bland and tasteless, it had no flavor or character and t cost me $15+ out the door with a soda.
With the other two powerhouse Mexican joints in the area, El Famous and Los B's that serve great tasting food, it will be interesting to see how this joint works out. 

I will not be going back but I wish them good luck.

Chorizo burrito. Try it with rice instead of beans. You're welcome. 

This place is delicious! Don't be fooled by the mini mall location, their hot salsa makes this place legit. 

Chips and salsa while you wait for your meal they bring complimentary chips and 2 different salsas. The hot salsa will set your mouth on fire. 

Eat your churros while they're hot. Practically melt in your mouth. The caramel dipping sauce just adds to the yummy. 

Every time I'm out in the burbs I hit up this place and I always leave smiling.

I have lived in Lombard for about 30 years.  I've been to all the popular Mexican restaurants in the area, and this place is hands down the best!

So far I've tried the steak burrito, taco's (el pastor, steak, chicken and beef).  All of them have been excellent, with lots of flavor.  The food seems very fresh, and they do a good job displaying the food when it comes out to you.  

They also give complementary warm chips and salsa, and have all-you-can-drink horchata and some other kind of real tasty Mexican drink.  

Try it out, you won't be disappointed.

Decided to try this place as we had pasted it on our way to the patio.  I was expecting something like Chipotle.  But it seems to be a step up from Chipotle.  

You order and then sit down. They bring you chips and salsa.  Which were bland and nothing special.  The tortilla chips were good.  I got tacos and my fiance got a burrito.  Both were good.  Nothing totally special.

Food was good, the plave is clean and nice.  I probably wouldn't go back just because it was bland and I like Chipotle way more.
Burritos were okay, definitely not what I expected. Meat was a bit dry. .but horchata was free to refill

AMAZING.

I'm literally getting hungry just writing this review.
We driven to Lombard about 6 times in the last 6 months just for this restaurant.

The steak tacos are to die for. Generally we crave steak tacos so we hadn't tried anything else... But on our last visit my fiance tried one chicken, one pork and one steak instead. The pork was delicious! It had the texture of duck confit - buttery, melt in your mouth awesomeness. And don't get me started on the wonderful housemade tortillas!

You get chips and salsa when you dine in. The tomato salsa has great flavor, and the salsa in the bottle has a barbeque flavor to it that is unique and delightful. We like to mix the two together.

Complete the meal with either their deliciously not-to-sweet horchata or pineapple juice concoction and you won't be disappointed.

The service has always been great. 

One tip - we try to avoid going during traditional lunch hours because it gets crowded (as any good restaurant does)

So, after reading the reviews, I thought I would try for lunch.  I got the al pastor taco dinner.  The rice and beans were blah.  The tacos were OK, but I've had much better. For what I ordered, I thought it a bit pricey.  

OK, so maybe I ordered the wrong thing.  I went back again yesterday and ordered the chicken enchiladas.  Again, everything was sort of tasteless and very Americanized.  Chipotle is much more flavorful and less expensive.  The one plus was the spicy salsa, which was very good, but then any good Mexican restaurant makes good salsa.

Sorry, two strikes is enough for me.  I'm not planning to go back.

Coming from predominately Latino neighborhoods in Chicago, I would say this place is pretty legit compared with most other suburban alternatives I've encountered so far. Also clean, cheap, fresh food with great customer service. And yes-- I always love a place that doesn't skimp on the free chips y salsa. Mas comidas libras por favor.

I've been going here for a couple of years, and it has always been pretty good. I'm glad to see that it is finally getting a good customer base. Last time I went for lunch it was packed! 

The setup is fast food style. You order at the counter. I highly recommend the taco plates, especially with the onions and cilantro. You get a number, self-serve your drinks and find a seat. While waiting you get warm chips and salsa. The service is always quick, and most items cost around $7-$9. The food is always good quality, fast, and reasonably priced.

I find Burrito Parilla Mexicana to be OK. The ingredients are fresh and assembled to order. Orders are ready fairly quickly and reasonably priced. I like the tacos al pastor (though I always have to search for the pineapple), the lengua tacos, the chorizo tacos, and the carnitas tacos. I like that I can get my tacos with fresh cilantro and onions instead of cheese and (ugh) lettuce. There's a generous portion of meat on each taco, but it is underseasoned and sometimes dry. The rice and beans are bland so I no longer order a taco plate. 

Compared to many other local fast food and fast casual choices, I'll choose Burrito Parilla Mexicana's tacos because they're fresh and the restaurant is very clean. And I'm swayed by the fact that Burrito Parrilla Mexicana is convenient to my home and the service is friendly.



.

I stumbled upon a find in suburban Chicago. I wanted a snack before a very large dinner and ordered the kids plate, which proved to be more than enough for me. When I'm traveling I never eat at chain restaurants that I can visit at home. I learned this was a family owned restaurant that has several locations in Chicago. The quality of the food was very authentic and fresh. No grease, no guilt. They even have something I have not seen since Chi Chi's closed in the 90's--- Fried ice cream! Coconut Pineapple slushies. I want it so badly, but what will I do later when I have a 3 course dinner?   Guess I have to hit this again before going to the airport.. Very modern decor. Friendly service. Beautiful open kitchen. Immaculate dining room. I will return when here again.

If 0 stars were an option, that would be the clear choice. I just returned home with completely the wrong order. When I called the store in an attempt to rectify the situation, I was met with defensiveness and hostility. I am holding the receipt, know what I ordered, and can clearly see what I have in front of me, which is wrong. 

The person on the phone said there was no manager, assistant manager, or owner who could be reached...what if an employee was injured, the power went out, there was a fire in the kitchen, etc. still no one. Adding insult to injury, I was also informed that they were closed for the night and there was not even a way to refund the order. So I guess half my family eats, and the other half goes hungry. 

When they get it right, the food is great. However, this isn't the first this has happened. So the gamble is no longer worth it. 

To the owners/management, please reevaluate those who represent your business to your customers. The fact that my family is essentially out $40 worth of food without any form of rectification, isn't just inconvenient, it feels a lot more like questionable business practices

Clean place, simple setup, INCREDIBLE food. Chorizo nachos were fire, the corn steak tacos were fire, the steak torta was FIRE, and the churros were the best I've ever had. Unlimited refills on horchata, piÃ±a colada, and soft drinks. If you find yourself in a position to give this place a try, I highly recommend it. I don't usually leave reviews but this was so good that I couldn't in good conscience keep quiet about it.

The food quality is quite good and the staff is very friendly.  I'm a big fan of the steak burrito.

I also love the fact that they're open later than some of the other taco places in the area.

If you're near Yorktown and looking for Mexican food and don't want to spend a ton of cash, this is the place.

I was finally contacted by a manager about my horrible experience with them months ago.

The manager offered me 3 free lunch vouchers for my troubles. I ended up giving them to my co-workers. Fortunately for them, they all had wonderful experiences and good food. I'm glad it worked out for them.

Wow!!! I love this place. I went here today for lunch and was not expecting this. It is like an upscale Chipotle but with really good Mexican food. The setup kind of reminds me of a Noodles. We went to the Lombard location, and it was bright, airy and clean. There was ample space for a lunchtime crowd with a bunch of tables and booth seating.

Anyways, I ordered the veggie fajitas, and it was delicious! !! An ample amount of food for the price. The veggies were delicious! The tortillas were soft. Honestly, it was all soo good. We had the nachos as well which were delicious. Also, they gave us salsa and chips while we were waiting which is awesome!!

All in all, I will definitely be back here!!

Very good Mexican food.  Even though the place is designed to be like Chipotle/The Patio.  You pretty much go order your food, they give you a number to place at your table and they will serve it to you when it's ready (which is usually about 5-10 min)

The food portion is huge and will definitely be full when your done.  They serve it on actual ceramic plates(real plates)!!  The food was also amazing.  Must check this place out whenever your in Lombard! :-)

Came here while out shopping and I really wanted some Mexican food. I ordered the fajitas for myself and a quesedilla for my daughter. Her food was a nice size and came with French fries so it was plenty and we took the rest home. The fajitas were good as well. More average than anything. Everything was good however I'm still a die hard Chipotle fan.

I've never had a bad meal here. Their torta sandwiches and burritos are awesome. You get free chips and salsa as you can't beat that. Their service is pretty efficient. I will be coming back for lunch.

I have never been disappointed here.  This place is always clean, no matter how busy it is.  They make the food right in front of you, so you can watch the birth of deliciousness.

I typically go for the burrito al pastor.  The burrito is about the size of my thigh, and they pile on the meat, cheese and guac if you ask for it (take that Chipotle, with your measly portion sizes).  I weighed the burrito after I got it home one night.  It weighed in at over a pound, and yes, I did eat the whole thing.  All this for around $8?  Awesome!

I want to also mention that the staff is super friendly, and very attentive.  I'm so glad this place is in my neighborhood!

I'm surprised I haven't written a review for Burrito Parrilla Mexicana yet.

This is located on the northwest corner of 88/butterfield/highland.  Yes, that shitty intersection.  Nearby restaurants include the Patio, Pinched, etc.

As others have stated, this is kind of an upscale type of Mexican joint.  I like the food here.  It may not have the autheticity you expect at the typical dive, but it's still tasty and great for a lunch.  The prices are a tad on the higher side, but with the free chips and salsa, you can usually get by for lunch no problem.

The concept is similar to other quick service restaurants like Panera or Chipotle, but it takes a little longer so you order and then you get a number which you place at your table.  They have fountain drinks and horchata and a pineapple coconut drink.  

I usually get the torta.  Something about that sammich just hits the spot.  I like the slices of avocado and the other trimmings.  It doesn't come with rice and beans, so that could be good or bad depending on your interests.

Order completely wrong after driving six miles for carry out. Manager not there. No assistant. Unresponsive. Serious language barriers results in consistently wrong orders. Love the food when right but so unreliable that we can never go back. I hope they go out of business soon so that a better place can come into the real estate.

I have never been a burrito person (I prefer tacos). But when the restaurant sign just says "Burrito", figured I'd just go with it. 

Walking in, it looks like it could be a sibling of Chipotle but with partial table service. You order at the counter; pay;  they give you a number;  you get your drink self service style (and it's unlimited refills on Horchata--don't forget that!); find a seat;  a server will bring you chips and salsa;  and minutes later your food arrives.  Nice! 

I met Michele S for lunch as she knows what's what.  There basically tacos, burritos, tortas, mixed grill items and salads on the menu but you can customize it.  I ordered the al pastor burrito with lettuce, cheese and beans. With Horchata, my total was about 10bux. Not bad for a filling meal, made to order, fresh ingredients and unlimited Horchata!

The burrito was a very nice serving size and pretty yummy.  The meat was well made, not as flavorful as my favorite taco joint's al pastor, but for a fast foody type of place, I was pretty impressed. The salsas on the table were good too. I especially liked the smokier one, it added some good flavor to the burrito.  

Clean digs, friendly service. Just be careful in the parking lot--it's busy and situated close to the Patio's drive thru--it's crazy sometimes!

More pricey than other Mexican restaurant. 
Location is probably why and the building looks very clean and new. 

I got the $7 steak burrito. Pretty average but the sauce is what stands out. They give you a deal red sauce with peppers and it's amazing. Also ask for pico De gallo and cilantro, they don't come standard on the burrito.  And also you have to try the white poblano sauce, it's spectacular. The burrito is a big size but I've seen larger. 

Your table gets chips and salsa for free.  I would go here again.

For authentic Mexican in the western suburbs there is no where else to go. Food is excellent,  tortillas and chips made in front of you, and the horchata...  Mmmmmmm. Cleanliness and attention to detail is second to none in the Mexican food market. Blows uncle Julio (restaurant a mile east) out of the water. Enjoy.

I was extremely impressed with this place!  we have been wanting to try this restaurant for a while now, but just kept forgetting to try it out as it is not very close to our house, but not very far either.

right off the bat, it's very nice and inviting. service is walk-up, order, and grab a number-they bring your food out. the cashier was so nice! we told him that it was our first visit and he made great recommendations. he didn't just tell us 1 or two things that he liked, he asked us how hungry we were, what we were feeling, and made recommendations in every food category. I ordered a steak burrito and my wife ordered a mixed taco plate. they are very accommodating!  I asked if I could add tomatoes and he said of course and offered pico and rice with cilantro too!  

when you sit down, they bring out chips and salsa and are more than happy to bring you out other salsas to try too if you like a little more heat. the burrito was great!  my wife really liked the tacos, and said the al pastor was the best of the ones she tried. she also had carnitas and steak. the others were great but she liked the al pastor the best. the food was so fresh!  I didn't feel like I had a really heavy meal like Mexican food can make you feel sometimes. don't get me wrong, we got a lot if food and were very full, but we just didn't feel like we ate a big heavy dinner. we wrapped up our meal with some flan to-go and it was great. 

overall, a great experience, great food, and amazing value for the high-quality food we received. I am excited to try the salads and tortas in the future!

I remember this place being fresh and clean ( see previous review) and it still is! good quick service despite being completely full! The burrito i took home suizo style with beans and rice was a bit off today. Saltier than it needed to be. The rice was slightly under cooked. It was not a horrible meal, i would try a torta next time, there are so many options. Its like a cleaner better take on traditional/real mexican cooking. Not your fast casual chain type food.

Unlimited refills on Horchata!

They had me right there.  

I've passed by this place a million times and finally made it in the other day.  It is a spacious, clean, mexican restaurant.  At first I wasn't sure if I should just walk up to order or sit down, but since I was greeted by the cashier, she guided me over towards her.   

I was with the fam so we decided to order a variety of items to see how things tasted.  We ordered one of the taco plates, a torta, and the carne asada.  The carnitas taco had a great flavor.  The ham and cheese torta was tasty (I know random, but the kiddies wanted it), bread wasn't too soft or too hard, ham wasn't too salty.  The carne asada was a good serving, I would have liked it to be a little less done.  The chips and salsa kept the kids happy until the food came.   

The staff was nice and asked us if we needed anything, refilled our water cups, and after we were done eating asked if we wanted some dessert.  Very attentive staff. Decent prices for service and the area it's in.

Pretty good fine. Tend to think qdoba and Chipotle is over rated.  I had the grilled steak tortas. The breading was great. Nice, crisp, warn delicious taste. Actually wrapped the other half up to take home. Steak tasted great not fatty like some places I've had.  Loved the coconut/pineapple juice.  Wasn't' to thrilled with the churros (slightly over priced dessert)

Had lunch there today, my second time at this place.  I read all the reviews and tend to agree with the negative reviews (except the carry out mix ups because I ate in).
It's definitely upscale, the food ranges from chipotle style burritos, which I had last time to carne asana, which I had this time.
The burrito I had was the al pastor.  It was a bit dry.  However it was well balanced between the meat, beans and rice more so than chipotle.  Also the price is a little better since you also get comped on the chips/salsa.  They gotta fix that dry meat problem.
Today I had the carne asada which is skirt steak: asked for med rare, got rare.  Not a big problem, better than over done.  Came with black beans, rice, pico de gallo and tortillas.  $15 is a bit much, probably worth $12-13 but it is what it is.  Flavor was excellent and I would get it again.
This place will be a winner if they correctly prep the meat fillings for the burrito/tacos and nail the steaks.

Husband and I love Mexican food and literally falling upon this place could not have been more perfect for us! Food was so good. Service so friendly and this place is immaculately clean. It is still fast food but it so much better than your chipotle or qdoba! Please try this place. Oh and AFFORDABLE! Try their steak, yummy

Try Chetinad Briyani when u dine in or plan To-go. It's awesome. Buffett has limited dishes but very tasty. Must dine in if u are a avid South Indian food lover. 

Excellent hospitality.

I first came to this restaurant with a Groupon. I didn't have a great initial impression from the look of the outside. It doesn't appear well maintained. The door isn't in great working order. I went in anyway  since I already bought my Groupon. I am soooo happy that I did. I can't stay away now. The food is fabulous!! The service is slow, but again the food is so worth it. Maybe try take out instead.  I am now used to it. This is by far my favorite place to eat now in Naperville!
Nancy from Naperville

I must say that I should have stuck with South Indian dishes at a South Indian restaurant. I dont regret getting the chilli paneer which was pretty good. The Paneer here is incredibly soft, like it was made on site which is rare and ironic for a south indian restaurant. My family loved the dosa so much they asked if they sell the batter separately. I had paneer makhani with some kind of paratha instead of naan. It was different, not horrible but more oil than I like to see in a makhani, really soft paneer which was great, gravy was good but had bay leaves and cloves  in it which is a southern thing. I really recommend coming for the south indian and trying what the owner recommends to stay safe. The only cons are the cleanliness of the table cloths, they can do without the red napkins on the center of the tables and just have plain, clean white table cloths.

While on a drive through Naperville we suddenly had this yearning for Indian food. A short Yelp search later we decided to go to Karaikudi for an early dinner. 

The food was really good and we loved all of what we had. We tried Medhu Vada - 3 sizeable vadas which were perfectly soft & crispy with side of Sambhar and 2 Chutneys. The Egg Kotthu Paratha & Egg Dosa which we had were also very good and tasted delicious with just the right amount of spices. 

The restaurant decor is decently done with comfortable seating. One thing I would like the management to pay attention to - the restrooms needed some cleaning!! There was water strewn all around, no toilet paper - Just a roll of hand paper and generally it needed to be cleaned!

All things considered, Am surprised this place hasn't been reviewed by more people, we would certainly be coming back!! Loved the food at Karaikudi.

This place is terrible. While the food was pretty good when I've been able to eat here, the service is horrendous. The last two times I've tried to get the lunch buffet, they've had their doors locked during posted "open" hours. The most recent occasion was on a Wednesday at 1pm (listed open until 2:30 for lunch) and the staff was sitting around eating the buffet themselves. They turned and signaled "X" to me as I tried to open the door. Safe to say I'm don't trying to give them my business.

This was a pretty good restaurant. We went for friday lunch here and it was BUFFET for July 4th. The appetizers were good, but the paratha was amazzinngg.. Oh my godd, soo thin - the best of any Indian restaurant anywhere in all of NW suburbs that I have had (had maybe food from 15 odd indian restaurants). Chicken chettinadu was pretty good too. The veggie dishes were ok - paneer masala had too much salt.

If you are looking for authentic (atleast very close to authentic) , spicy,  chettinad food (South Indian cuisine) then don't miss this place.  It's kind of hidden by location but it's worth the search. 
Kothu paroota is a speciality . Have been here 3-4 times tried different dishes, everything that I tried has been awesome.

Should have left immediately, but we had a Groupon.  First off, they had to send someone to open the door, which didn't work properly.  5:30pm and we were the only ones there.  The 2 guys staffing the place looked more like they were there to clean the bathrooms than waiters.  The one who "waited" on us seemed like he would rather be anyplace else.  I asked about the item pictured on the Groupon, which is what attracted me initially.  "Oh, that's only available during the week."  Then, we attempted to order -- the first items we wanted -- "oh, that's only available during the week."  Does not say any of this anywhere on the menu.  When he arrives with the food, he spills on the table and almost on me.  There was no drink menu.  We asked if they had diet pop.  Sure, diet coke -- which came in cans with straws, no glasses.  I really don't get the point of having a restaurant if a good portion of your menu is NOT AVAILABLE ON A WEEKEND (and I'm assuming there are more items that were "only available during the week", as we couldn't have been so unlucky to pick the only 3).  We will definitely not be back.
Do not ever try fish curry for here. I had my worst fish curry ever in my life. Mutton soup so salty. Chicken chettinadu was good. Thank God I order that so I could finish my dinner.

Tried Karaikudi for the first time and ordered the Chicken Biryani for pickup at 1:45 on a Friday and was ready 15 minutes later. I liked that their online ordering system, Beyond Menu, required selecting the heat level. I opted for Spicy and it was just right. Came with nice touches: fresh cilantro and sliced onion, hard-boiled egg, yogurt (use like sour cream to cool things down and add some creaminess at the same time), and some extra sauce. Meal was 10.95, and enough for two. I would order this again, and looking forward to trying their buffet (good way to try many of their dishes), which I was glad to see was still set up at when I was there though it was beyond the lunch rush.

Went last night to the Thursday Evening Veg Buffet and was very impressed. I'm very familiar with Indian cuisine, but not this region. I'm not always a big fan of buffets (too much of the same sort of thing), but they had many dishes that were well done. We plan to return and try it off the menu to try new things. Worth the try.

Was very excited to learn I could get Chettinad cuisine in Naperville  when I moved to the area. Visited Karaikudi for a weekend lunch buffet.

The ambience wasn't particularly inviting. There was a very strong smell of non vegetarian food (fish specifically) as soon as we entered and the smell kept lingering in various proportions throughout our lunch experience as our vegetarian olfactory senses kept fighting it. 

The vegetarian options were very limited and taste-wise, forgettable. After filling our plates with the first round of entrees we waited for Naans.. and waited .. and waited some more.. They arrived after we started using the dosas (or mini uthapams) as substitutes for Naans and got half way thru our lunch. The waiter started avoiding the tables that were waiting or Naans and magically appeared only when they were ready. No apologies, no explanations!

The only things that were worth trying the mini uthapams and pakoras. Guess how I filled my stomach.

The deserts were very pale looking. The payasam was highly diluted and didn't taste anywhere closed to how it is supposed to. All in all, a very bad experience! Will not be back to Karaikudi.

Had been there twice. 
Awesome Chettinad Biryani. 
Kothu parota was very good.
Worst Hyderabad biryani.
Below average customer service.

This place is no better now, taste and quality declined over time

Pros: low cost buffet, non veg items

Con's ambience, taste

We went for dinner during a week night,  there were not many people but the ambiance was good.  We ordered Kothu paratha which was very tasty without being overly spicy.  The biryani was also good and there were a lot of choices on the menu.  Looking forward to visit during a weekend to taste the buffet

I have been there multiple times and have always left happy with the food and the restaurant staff who make you feel like family. The food which has Chettinad flavors from Southern parts of India was a very different experience for me having grown up on the rich North Indian food in India. But I just love the taste and flavors in the food which are so different yet so comforting(but that's also because I like hot and spicy food). It is a perfect meal especially on cool days. Whatever I have tasted so far has been extremely tasty. I would highly recommend anyone to try this place for the food than anything. It is a family run small and simple restaurant which has some great jewels on it's menu.  Recommended dishes for entree: VEG. KARA KUZHAMBU, KARAIKUDI CHICKEN, MUTTON SUKKA MASALA, ANY KOTHU PAROTTA, Appetizers: Gobi 65 or Chicken 65

P.S: they tend to not have some items on their menu many a times but understand they are a small restaurant and cannot keep changing their menus to highlight that. So please check with them before ordering if there are some dishes that are not available.

Just had Buffet at this place. I must say it was totally disappointing. First the price of $12.95 was too high for a very mediocre choice of items. Secondly the food was not promptly replenished. The taste was OK. Rasam had too much tamarind to savor on its own. At same price there are lot of restaurants in the near by area with lot of choice and better taste. Not worth trying this place.

We had a buffet party at work for our colleague's farewell and Karaikudi made it special.
Veg dishes were as good as Non veg. If you visit or order please do order Kuttu paratha, it has both veg and chicken options. Lip smacking dishes..taste was just awsome. I would  definitely opt for a ordering catering option when i have  a chance.
We had many more options like Veg/Chicken biriyani, chicken curry, brinjol curry, kat mirchi. Yes The gobi manchurian was a hit too,

Thanks to Ravi, who made our day with all his effort getting us the good food.

I tried the catering and found the food to be very delicious and great value. 

I don't have much knowledge about authentic Chettinad cuisine, however I found the food here to be pretty good and comparatively better than most south indian restaurants.

The rice dishes and curries were very well done and seemed healthier than regular restaurant food, however the Chutneys were very well done and add an extra zing to the palate.

I also found the catering really good value for what we paid for. We ended up with more food than needed, however the guests were happy to take home the remaining food. Some of the food showed up as lunch the next day in our office lunch room, which I took as a positive.

I haven't tried the sit-in restaurant and the non-vegetarian dishes yet, therefore the four stars. Will update and provide more details as I try them out.

We ordered Chicken Biryani to go. First of all, we had to wait for 15 mins and on top of that the quality and quantity was not that great. The food was overly salted to an extent where my tongue got numb. Will surely not go back to this restaurant.
Have been here for once for weekend buffet. Have reasonable varieties in both veg and non veg. The naan was tasty. Taste was typical South Indian. Will try again for A la carte order and update.

I am a big fan of Chettinad cuisine and travel extensively to eat at places like Anjappar and Karaikudi. I was so delighted to finally have a Chettinad eatery near home and wasted no time in getting there. 

Ambience - a small place which still seems to be struggling with publicity and demand. The restaurant was mostly empty at 7pm on a Saturday - doesnt bode well for the future. But otherwise the restaurant appearance and decor was clean and simple

Food - I ordered the goat biryani and chicken chettinad - was sorely disappointed. The food is nothing even remotely Chettinad - its Andhra cuisine at best. For instance, Chettinad biryani is never made from Basmati rice - this is mostly a northern selection. Tamil rice is mostly short grained Sona Masoori. Also the flavor penetration was similar to that of a Hyderabadi biryani - nothing like the Chettinad biryani where flavors run deep and throughout the biryani. The chicken chettinad was a pathetic imitation. The food was eatable and probably enjoyable if you didnt already know what to expect from Chettinad food - but I would recommend the restaurant get a genuine Chettinad chef. This doesnt even pass.

I may return but with much more timid expectations going forward
Had lunch buffet which was very good. Had take its few times (Goat Biriyani, Chicken Lollipop, and fish curry) Fish curry was okay. Biriyani and Lollipop were excellent)
Buffet foods items and taste was great. Really felt i was in India. Hope its maintained at same standards.

Awesome lunch buffet. All items tasted great - chicken 65, baby corn manchurian, chicken biryani, mutton masala, chicken chettinad, paneer masala, egg curry and okra fry. Payasam was little sweeter for my taste. Overall, great experience. 

If you like good Indian food. This place is definitely a try.

Food was average, nothing spectacular but not bad either, really needs to get the act together if they want to survive in the area. The chettinad dishes were ok, chicken 65 was very dry. I am sure they will be improving in the near future, but definitely needs improvement in Customer service and greeting, Food and Ambience. If you are focused on food and you want different flavors from the South of India, this is a place to consider at least once, and determine for yourself.

Amazing hidden gem.
If you are craving for Mexican food check it out.  Don't get turned off by what the place looks like... It is not high end, but it is CLEAN, amazing tasty food, and affordable.
Check it out and if you like Mexican food I guarantee you will like it.

Good food, good portion, good price, good people. Can't ask for much more. It's not fancy or unique really, just simple tasty Mexican food cooked to order. We've been going here about 6 months and I prefer it to many of the other places nearby.  For what you pay you get the best quality and flavor here. I've yet to have something i didn't like,  but my favorites are the steak and chorizo and potato tortas/burritos/tacos. I like the guacamole too, it's like how I'd make it at home. The best part is it's the closest Mexican restaurant for me!

Excellent food! The middle-aged guy that is always in there when I go to pick up my food is really nice. The first time I ordered take-out I was a little skeptical about the location. It looks a little bit seedy, the same with the other places in the same shopping center. Don't let that discourage you. The inside is small, but always clean. Some places like this aren't super friendly to non-Hispanics who don't speak Spanish and can be intimidating. I never felt like that with El Barrio. They are always super friendly and helpful. It is one of my top 3 take out places in the area.

First time here and it's amazing! My first time at any Mexican place, I always get tacos and get three different meats. I got Al Pastor, Steak and Chicken. They were all delicious! Al Pastor was my favorite. Super nice, super attentive, family owned! We will be back!!

Stopped here with a friend based on the good reviews on Yelp.  It's located in a strip mall building and has about 8 tables.  It's a tight set-up and is similar to a hotdog-type restaurant, in that the cooking is done directly behind the register and can be  seen while at your table.  I ordered the steak nachos and my friend ordered the steak enchiladas (they were out of beef when we were there) and a couple cokes.  The food was decent and the bill was about $27.  I'm not sure I would go back there, as I felt it was just "ok".

Let me give it to you straight. This is not 5 star dining, HOWEVER. If you want, AUTHENTIC, DELICIOUS, FRESH, Mexican food, at a fair price, look no further. Hands down, the FRIENDLIEST service I have had, attentive and spot on.

I was in with my family, had the Tapiquena with cheese enchilada,  Chorizo taco, Tacquitos, and Enchilada dinner. EVERYTHING was delicious. Beans, Rice, Horchata was delicious. 

Fresh chips and Salsa, Green Chili and red tomato salsas. My mouth is watering thinking about it now. Mexican coke (real sugar) and Jarritos, ice cold. Also can's of coke, with glass of ice. I asked what Tamarind Jarrito tasted like, so the waiter shared his with me so I could try it. 

Best place around, and I am super picky when it comes to food. Come give it a try, you'll thank me later.

Awwwww yeah. The taco quest continues, and I think a new front runner has emerged. I've lived less than 2 miles from this place for the past 8 years. I haven't stopped in until now. Such a travesty. 
   Walking in I was greeted right away. The staff was very friendly pretty much as soon as the door opened. I would say friendliest staff I've encountered so far on my taco quest. I ordered carne asada tacos and al pastor tacos to go. Both types were delicious! They were piping hot of course because they were fresh. The meat was seasoned wonderfully, and their hot and mild salsas for the tacos had tons of flavor. The restaurant itself was decently sized and was clean. 
   Now I think that living less than 2 miles away might be a bit dangerous for me. Tacos all day. Everyday. Looking forward to trying more of the menu and dining in one day.

Tucked away in an old strip center this is a hidden gem. This is tasty food and you can watch the process. The are (5) tables that seat 4 people and (2) tables that seat 2 people. I ordered a junior steak burrito meal (the day's special), a junior steak burrito, and 2 steak taco dinners all for under $21. The requested sauce and sour cream came at no extra charge. They accept major credit cards and you can order thru Yelp or another online vendor. Check out their daily specials and give them a try.

Went for lunch today after reading the reviews and was not disappointed with the food or service. The staff was very friendly and the food was very authentic with a great taste. I would definitely recommend the guacamole, tacos, and gorditas. I will definitely be returning to El Barrio in the near future.
They are always super friendly whether we dine in or carryout. The food is great and is always done fairly quickly. One of our favorite places in the area for sure.
Amazing food and very friendly owner. He really made sure we were comfortable there. I had a quasadilla dinner- I really liked the chicken.
Good Mexican food! I had a carne asada burrito and I can say I will come back again if ever in the area for another one

Food was beyond good! Very authentic Mexican food.  I was with a big group so it did take a minute to get all the orders out but the restaurant is definitely worth a try! Everyone in our party left full and happy!
Really a great authentic Mexican food spot. I usually have tacos but I've also had tortas and burritos and all have been delicious. Definitely recommended, they also serve beer .
Great lunch-AGAIN! We really enjoy coming here. Food is always hot; relaxing; no rush to finish. Stop in and take your time to relax, talk and have a beer!  Keep up the great work!!

Really great food, and excellent customer service.
I've had their carne asada burritos and it's just like having one of my family's home made one.
Really the food here takes me back!!
Will come again and highly recommend.
The food was authentic and simply delicious.  No frills and thrills, just good food.  We can't wait to return!

Their service is extremely slow. Ended up walking out of this place. I believe they had run out of ingredients because the owner walked in with grocery bags. Decided after an hour wait it was not worth it. Their food is nothing spectacular. Had only been here one other time before. I tried their chorizo and potato tacos which were decent and steak tacos which were not good. I like my meat grilled and their meat tasted fried. Not good quality. I think this place needs some remodeling Waiting for my food so long made me realize this place is dirty and I don't want to go back.
Awesome little hole in the wall! Great food and amazing service! Has truck parking as well and that helps!
Very friendly service food was the bomb enjoyed it very much and hope they are there for the long haul will be going back!!!!!
Very friendly and helpful. Had the Carne Asada platter. Yummy! Hubbie had tacos Barbados and liked it.

I have been a loyal Mr. Taco patron for 3+ years, until now. A few coworkers have been raving about El Barrio, so I decided to try it for lunch. Phenomenal! They make the food fresh, the workers were extremely friendly, and the food... so good! They paid attention to the detail of making a good burrito: the ingredients were nicely distributed and the tortilla was very well wrapped. No spilling sauce on this bad boy. Highly recommend checking it out!

Love this place! Good, authentic and cheap food. They really get to know their regular customers and they are a super friendly, family owned business. 

They even gave a shirt and a special treat to my boyfriend who has been going there for years. I really appreciate great service, especially when you don't see it very often.
The food always tastes great.  The workers are friendly and nice.  Everything I have had tastes great.

One of ,if not the best Mexican restaurant I have ever been to! What ever I order is real good! The owner & his whole family are one of the nicest people around. Even though it takes then a long time to serve you . It's worth it. Always I mean always fresh. Love this place. This food is real Mexican food period!

Ordered some tacos and they are on point and the green sauce has just the right amount of spice. It's hard to believe that this hidden gem is less than a mile away from my home and for years I have just drove by due to the fact my favorite pizzeria is right next door.

Best Chicken tacos and the steak burrito was very yummy. I was interested in the chicharones taco. I expected it to be crispy chicharones. They were not, so not a fan of that one. Be careful, the green sauce is the hot one and the red sauce is the mild. The customer service is phenomenal. I will definitely be back!

We have Lived in Romeoville for 12 years and just found this place now . It's so good the best Mexican food in town by far..I have had the steak burrito con papa's so good! !...The ambiance isn't much to look at and it seems a little dirty but you over look it for the food..
Nice small family owned restaurant. Food very authentic. It takes a while but looks line everything is done fresh. Had a streak burrito. Sorry too late for a picture! Lol!

One of the best places to eat in the area, it's both authentic and inexpensive.  The horchata is tasty, as are the burritos.  The inside is small and a bit cramped, but very clean.  It's definitely a tiny joint, but that's not necessarily a bad thing.  

Everything just about is cooked to order, fresh and hot, and it's fantastic.  I don't think I've ever had anything bad here.  If you are hesitant and start with the burritos you won't go wrong.  A super large drink and one comes in under eight or nine bucks.  For a huge amount of food and drink, that's honestly the same price as fast food, and you get something far more delicious and fresh. 

If you're at Lewis and you've never stopped by, skip the Taco Bell on Weber (blech) and head here.  You won't be sorry!

Great food, always fresh. 

Since moving into the neighborhood, I'd been driving 20-25 minutes to get good Mexican food (because I'm super picky when it comes to Mexican food).  Now that I've discovered El Barrio, it's my go-to spot for my taco, gorditas, burritos "fix".

A small storefront located in a stripmall next to a pizzeria.  Inside had an open kitchen with some tables on the side.  Dined in and got a 2 taco dinner (asada and al pastor), breaded steak burrito, and a jamaica drink.  

The chip and condiment salsas did taste homemade as the owner was telling my buddy how he makes it and the ingredients that were used.  Couldn't find anything wrong as everything was delicious!  Prices were quite cheap and the employees that work there were very friendly and personable!

Not very expensive, but not very good either.  I ordered take out for work.  It's never a good sign when you walk in the door a half hour after you've ordered and they realize- oh crap, they have not begun preparing your food yet.  We ordered a steak burrito which was fine and two torta dinners which are supposed to include rice and beans.  They left those off the order.  I won't be back, what's the point in calling ahead when they can't have your order ready and then don't get it right?

Food is really good and you have to wait for the family that runs it to cook it, so you know it's fresh.  I will strongly recommend the guacamole as a side dish.  I am a burrito freak so that is usually what I get.  One day I strolled in after they closed like an idiot but they let me in anyway, did not complain, and cooked our food and were ok about it, I still left early because I did not want to put them out of their way but they put no pressure on me at all.  The food here is cheap too.  In comparison to really good places in the city this place would not compete, but for the burbs especially Romeoville, they are a slam dunk!
Very slow, however that's not a big deal as long as I'm getting a great meal , unfortunately the meat had a bad taste can't really tell what it was but definitely it wasn't right.

Always fresh, great food. I have tried a few things so far and haven been disappointed.  Steak burrito is very good. The sopes ( pork) are as good as homemade.  The chorizo con papas taco was sooooo good. I recommend this place to anyone who loves Mexican food.  It may take a little longer but its worth the wait.

Steak burritos are good and rolled pretty tight.  A big plus for me is the meat is not fatty and not chewy.  Not to many options out this way but for quick authentic Mexican food this is my go-to place.  Rice and beans are pretty bland for my taste but the carrots are delicious!!!

Best authentic Mexican in the immediate area. The food is cooked fresh, unlike the place a few stoplights north. The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  I love the bistek a la Mexicana with a habaÃ±ero!

Do not be discouraged by its little whole in the wall appearance. This place is spectacular!! Their food is always amazing! Yes it's not big and flashy but all the chefs are wonderful and the food is always 10/10. Anytime we celebrate birthdays, anniversary etc we go to Shogun!!

1st time to Shogun in Naperville and WHAT A GREAT EXPERIENCE! Sang was our chef. He is young, personable, funny & made the night so entertaining. Everyone enjoyed the food (my combo of filet mignon & shrimp, onion soup, fried rice, seasoned veges & a terrific ginger dipping sauce was flavorful & cooked perfectly).

A very cool feature - the walls are lined with pics of guests all the way back to when they opened, in the 80's...oh the hair & glasses!

I didn't rate 5 stars only because I'm not a fan of carpet in a restaurant.

I will definitely come back again.

I went here with my parents and a grandmother who has Alzheimer's. I am so glad i chose this place. The place was a little hard to find but its right on the corner of the outlet area by Olive Garden. 
They sat us right away (we had a reservation). The waiter was attentive and friendly. The chef was fun and energetic which i was glad for. He paid special attention to my grandma which i was grateful for as i chose this place specifically because i thought it would keep her attention and be enjoyable for her.  She loved the show! The food was excellent and just the right portions. Id go again and again! The prices were very inexpensive for Hibachi. I recommend for anyone!

I have been going to Shogun for over 10 years so I don't really know where to begin. I almost always get the salmon teriyaki dinner ($16). The dinner includes a shrimp appetizer, soup, salad, vegetables, steamed rice and noodles. I like the fried rice (extra $1.50) and extra noodles ($3)---- so it can get pricey. The soup is just okay--- but the salad is amazing. I believe the ginger based salad dressing is made in house and the best I've ever had. My other favorite thing here is their egg yolk sauce-- smooth, like butter except better. Don't be shy about asking for extra egg yolk sauce! It's supposedly goes over the shrimp appetizer but I ask them to smother my salmon as well (see pics under Cristina. F). 

Service is polite and efficient. The chefs are friendly/enthusiastic and are always a hit with my family/friends. This is our restaurant of choice for birthdays, graduations etc and the atmosphere is kid friendly. My little sister ordered her first Shirley Temple here, haha. 

They also have sushi on the menu-- which is okay-- I wouldn't go here for sushi. I guess we always order it in addition to our teriyaki entrees and it usually ends up being a mistake (read: too much food). 

I also recommend going during lunch for the great deals. Although, my only bad experience at Shogun was at lunch when they appeared understaffed so I guess ~you get what you pay for.

I was there in a first date last night. Sang was our chef. He was really funny, charming and a great chef. Our food was awesome, the steak was GREAT! The chicken portion was a little on the smaller size but the lobster and shrimp portions were great. Fried rice was so tasty! I never eat left overs I ate them today and they were even better!!! They make their own teriyaki sauce, you can tell they put a lot of love into it! Wonder if you can purchase it!? The date was awful, thank god sang was there to entertain me! I live 40 mins away and I'd come back!

Seriously can't go wrong! Most people miss this place because the larger chains are right by it and this is in a tiny shopping center. The decor isn't amazing. But it's def amazing. Covered in photos of everyone who has dined there. The food is to die for! 25.00 a person average with a drink and you walk out unable to eat anything else. So stuffed! Ask for Seng or Felipe. Both will impress! I can't recommend this place enough.

Great food and always great service.

The food is DELICIOUS and the prices are great for what you're paying.

Very cozy, great for large groups or smaller one on one occasions. Also pretty clean which to me is always a  biggie as common knowledge goes a kitchen will be as clean as it's bathroom is o_o....

Also, the grilling style is much gunner and at times better than some larger more franchised/corporate counterparts....
Food and show are too notch!!! Highly recommended. Our chef Joe was very entertaining!!! You won't be disappointed!!!

I've been going here for 8 years now, and every time I go, which is once or twice a year, it always makes me want to come back every week! Chefs are amazing and always have a smile, owner is there every day and always remembers me. I've referred 10+ friends and they all say the same thing about the food and experience. I really love the Egg yoke shrimp! Also never a wait and carry out is easy too!
This is our go-to hibachi restaurant. Great food great chefs. Always a good time. You have to try their honey sauce. This place is the best.

THE Best Japanese Steakhouse in Naperville . Dined several times, the soup could use a little more substance. However the salad, noodles, steak, chicken and egg yolk shrimp are all top notch. For a small cozy place you will be very surprised

Awesome place, great food and excellent service.

The food, environment, and presentation were horrible!!! We got very small portions of food and there was poor ventilation throughout the restaurant. Not to mention, the cook was discussing politics with customers while cooking. Very professional... Horrible experience overall!!! Stay away!!!!
Update: the sushi is good but the hibachi is better! Always go for egg yolk, it's necessary.

I love shogun. Everything was great!!! I have no idea how some people hate this place and never want to come back. It's my favorite restaurant and I go there all the time. If you are reading those bad reviews and want to decide if you want to go there just give it a try.

We had a great time tonight and have been going here for years but the quality of the steak was terrible very fatty with grissle & tough. Not at all what we have had in past visits. VERY  disappointed.  Seems like they are trying to skimp on portion & quality of beef & shrimp
Delious! Hibitchi and Sushi both 5 star! We ordered steak, teriyaki chicken, and shrimp. We will go back!

If I could give this place 2.5 stars I would. Good place for hibachi. Not a great place for sushi. Someone in our hibachi grill group spit up their sushi because of how bad the piece was. I don't know if they have their sushi pre-made but it didn't look like the fish was fresh. I don't know what the reason was for them covering up their sushi bar but I've never seen a sushi bar keep their customers from see'ing what goes on during the prep.

I have not been to this reastaurant in year's.  They have great lunch specials. Hibachi ,  sushi  , appetizer. Enjoyed them all!   Soups and salads  included with the entrees. Great friendly service.. And very reasonable in price. Looking forward to my next visit.

We loved this place when we lived in the area. We've moved out of state, but ALWAYS come back. It's still as great as we remember. The owners Lisa and Peter still take good care of us and the portions are hugh. Stop by and try this place, you won't be disappointed.

First time at this establishment, and everything was perfect... Our cook Felipe bay nursery Tristan were both top notch... Everything was just delicious the best of everything I've ever had!!!

Will be coming back again here for sure!

My favorite thing is the ginger dressing. I became obsessed with it when I came here as a little kid with my dad and I was not into sushi. 
The waiters, chiefs, sushi makers, and hostesses are always friendly and welcome you with smiles. 
My little brother who is not a sushi fan, comes here and gets the hibachi while myself and boyfriend eat sushi. We've tried every roll, as we've been coming for years, and have yet to have a bad roll, or experience here. 
I love the pictures on the wall and enjoy trying to remember where I out mine when I celebrated my birthday here, and seeing the new ones. 
This place has been around for years and it'z not surprise why, the staff is amazing and the food is just as great and you leave thinking you can't wait to come back.
Great food and even better food. Worth the 35 minute wait for a seat. Was always curious for 14 years what was in this jount and so sad I waited so long to come here but SO glad I stopped by

We absolutely loved it here! Our chef was great & really entertaining. He was very talkative which we all liked. The food was great I tried some of the sushi & loved it. My dinner was the chicken teriyaki & it was delicious my 3 year old even loved the food & the experience. Whenever my son asked the man for more fire he obliged right away. I had a strawberry daiquiri and although it was delicious I would say it was a little strong but it was still amazing. It was very clean & the staff for the most part was very accommodating. The reason I am not giving them 5 stars is because like myself a lot of people brought their babies with them & when my 3 month old son needed a diaper change there was no where to change him. I had to drag his car seat into a very cramped bathroom & change him on there. But other then that it was a very good experience. I will be going back again.

Great Japanese steak house!! Love their food I've been here over a dozen times Never been disappointed by their food or service. The prices are good for a hibachi restaurant. Shogun has been at this location for years and owners are always there. Owners are very friendly and make sure everything is right. The inside has looked the same for years it's not updated or fancy like most hibachi restaurants. If your looking to impress a date or anyone else this isn't the place. If your looking for great food at a reasonable price then this is your place!!!

Shogun is our "go to" restaurant for family birthdays, gd report cards, anniversary, etc. Been a customer for over 15 years. Never disappointed. Food quality and taste excellent. Wait service and chef show outstanding. Not as glitzy Benihana but their prices are reasonable.

My friends and I had an awesome time here the other night. Everything was the tops - food, service, you name it. Our chef (Joe, I believe?) was funny and sociable, he added some great pizzazz to our evening. Will definitely come back!

I have been going here for over 10 years and no other Japanese style steak house can compete with this place. They seem to be a smaller business than the bigger chains out there, but they are 10 times more amazing when it comes to quality and taste of their food.

They have the best egg yolk sauce and the very best teriyaki. The sushi here is also very well made. 

All of the chefs here are wonderful and very skilled however, my very favorite is Andy. Andy drives all the way to work here from Rockford and I am so thankful. He makes the best Japanese hibachi I have ever tasted. He is also entertaining and a great conversationist.

Best Japanese food & Sushi around!!! Home made sauces, dressings, great portions, birthday celebration special, noodles are the best ever! Family owned and operated. I travel a lot and compare places, no one comes close to this place without you paying an arm and a leg for it! Mmmm.
We've been coming here since the kids were little. Still love the entertaining chefs!  This place is a Must-Do whenever the kids come to town. Food is always yummy.

Always great! You get so much food with the hibachi entrees it's awesome! Miso soup, salad, veggies, rice, and noodles !!!  We had bad sushi tonight and left very disappointed so we came here knowing it would be great! Thank you Shogun!

You like hibatchi?
(What am I saying, of course you do.)
Then you'll like Shogun.

It's a great little place tucked away into an underwhelming strip mall, but once you walk in you'll be greeted and welcomed warmly. Our hibatchi chef was extremely talented and funny, and he served my father and I very quickly. If you're used to the service at a place like Domo, you'll be thrilled that there's still all the show but it takes maybe a quarter of the time and costs less than half as much.
Long time customer (20 years+), felt it was time to write a review.  Others come and go, but Shogun is here to stay and there is a reason why - the food is consistently good.

My family and I have been coming here for years and it is one of our favorite hibachi restaurants ever! The owner is so sweet and remembers you time after time! 

The menu has your traditional fares, and an extensive sushi menu. The prices are fair and the portions are large, definitely enough for two meals. 

The food is delicious and the chefs are absolutely hilarious. Very social and accommodating to food specifications and allergies.

The atmosphere is cozy and warm, very fun and clean! 

Definitely stop by for a great meal and be sure to bring all your friends and/or family for even more fun!

Best Japanese Steak House around!  Food has so much more flavor then you will find at Domo & Shinto!  I have been going here for over 20 years and my family still goes to this day.  This is a must try and definitely try the egg yolk batter on your shrimp...to die for!

The service is one of the best! The servers will not only remember your face, but names and anything else you talk about. When you walk in they always greet you, and will ask how the family is. The hostess even remembers the month i got married in and will say congrats every time it rolls around.

The lunch deals are pretty good for what you get. Usually during the lunch time the shows aren't as grand; but if you bring children with you the chefs will make the time to perform just so it's as grand as the dinner performances.

I've read some of the reveiws complaining about portion sizes; and i've never had a problem with that. I always end up with enough left overs for a complete lunch the next day.

You can taste the different flavors to the food between the cooks, but all the food is done great. I've had hibachi from several local places (even the more expensive domo), and will always come back to shogun because they are truely the best.

I just moved to the area from out of state and finally decided to try a Japanese steakhouse.  I'm a huge fan of another Japanese steakhouse where I used to live (in Florida), so it's going to be a tough feat to beat that one!  

Shogun's portions were smaller than I expected.  The interior is dated and I felt an little too close to the hot cook-top while I was seated.  The chef did a great job and was entertaining and the waitstaff were attentive and friendly.  Didn't get any dipping sauces.  Not sure if I'd go back--there are a few others in the area I will try.

I took my family here for my birthday.  The food was very good and the show was great.  My wife and I had steak and chicken...the steak was cooked perfectly and the flavor was great.  Our girls had the shrimp.  They were not fans of the egg yolk sauce but they still enjoyed their meal.  We all liked the noodles and shrimp appetizers.

This is the second hibachi place I've been too in the last 3 months and it was delicious!  You have got to get the egg yolk topping on the shrimp appetizer. First is the shrimp appetizer, then the noodle stir fry, then fried rice and then your protein. It is a lot of food but with wonderful sauces and flavor. My kids love this place and they loved having a toddler visit!
I have been visiting this establishment for 20+ years.  A very nice family run restaurant.  The noodles and the egg yolk sauce for the shrimp are a must.  Highly recommend!

Why we're sad we moved:

The food is awesome and the people are even better! We miss them dearly.

The "show" was pretty good, and the chef was pretty funny, but their sushi is just so-so (I ordered the shogun platter) and its a little pricey. I liked Nagoya a little better for their selection of sushi and the price. This place was fun though, so that's worth a lot.
Portions are great! Andy was amazing!  Add garlic to the fried rice, to die for!!! Definitely going back soon.

bad service, and dirty!  The Chef was friendly, but the chicken teppan was dry.  The waitress was not attentive, they provided kiddie sippy cups that looks like the one time use type where other restaurants give to you, they asked for it back as we were walking out.  There are so many other Japanese steak houses in the area, this is not worth it for the price.

Shogun is my absolute favorite hibachi place. I have gone to this one alone for years and years and will continue to frequent it in the future. Although it is smaller compared to other hibachi places, I love it because it's not loud and it makes it more intimate and personal when I'm with family and friends and I can actually hear them. The shows they do with the food are the typical hibachi shows, nothing special, but it's the people that work there that make it so great. They are so friendly and have always provided the best service. We used to come here for a friend's birthday every year and they always made it so special. They would bring her a free dessert and have everyone in the restaurant sing Happy Birthday. They would also take our picture with their Polaroid camera and post one picture on their wall at the front when you walk in and give one to us. They also signed the bottom which was really nice. You don't have to be a regular to receive this kind of treatment. They provide great service to anyone and everyone who walks through the door. The food is consistent and always delicious. They give just the right amount of food so you aren't overly stuffed or hungry for more. Sometimes hibachi places never get it right, but they hit the nail right on the head every time. If you are ever in the area, check it out. I can guarantee you will also become a regular like me!
Attentive servers and cooks compliment the fabulous food! Thank you to Felipe for the great show too...amazing

The food here is really good but no Japan or Domo 77. The portions seem MUCH smaller and when I leave here, I'm never full like when I leave Domo and Japan 77.
