Their egg yolk topping is great but on several occasions we've come and the soup before your meal is only broth with a few chives- nothing else. No mushroom, no onion, no tofu, no nothing. 

Also, I'm pretty sure a pineapple dessert is supposed to come the lobster dinners but only once has it actually come to the table. 

On the plus side, they have coupons in the penny saver adds and the coupon books you get in the mail.

First off, let me say that the main course here was very good--and at a reasonable price too! Surf and Turf for 2 for only 59.95 is quite a deal imo.

With that being said, the side dishes were sub-par, and the service was just insulting.  

I'm a college student, and so I may not strike everyone as the type of person to tip well. However, I work hard and save my money to treat people I care about from time to time. This was one of those times. I called to make reservations, noting that it was my partner's birthday, to which the hostess graciously asked if I'd like to do the "Shogun Special, which costs, I think, like 5 or 10 dollars and we'll give her a pineapple dessert." Okay, I thought, why not embarrass her!  I give the hostess my name and time, and we're all set. Easy enough, if a little unprofessional.

As we walk into the restaurant, we're greeted by the management, who is very friendly. We walk up to the hostess, and I give her my name even though the restaurant isn't busy (in order to let them know the birthday girl is here!), but am waved off and smirked at by the younger waitress (my age) standing with the hostess behind the table.  Ok... 

We're seated with a family of 4, no problem at all, I understand at Hibachi that is what you do if you don't fill a table. The waitress takes our drink orders, and takes our orders, simple enough.

Soup comes out, and as a reviewer before says, it's quite bland with no onions or chives or tofu in it.. just a clear, bland broth with a couple noodles.  That's fine, I'm not in the mood for miso as it is. 

Our salads come out with our appetizer, and sushi for the family across from us. The salad is a simple house dressing on top of iceberg lettuce with carrot strips spattered between.  The soft shell crab appetizer is quite delicious, crunchy and sitting on top of the same, not-so-great fake salad, the type you'd get in an elementary cafeteria catered to children who don't care for the taste of vegetables. 

Here comes the next insult to me: the waitress goes to the family next to us, which is a mixed couple, and asks all of them if they would like chopsticks and refills. They say yes, and she hands them chopsticks, and walks off to refill their drinks. She looks at my date and me, and walks off. 

Our chef comes out, and is a very friendly guy named Andy. Andy does some really cool tricks, and cooks up our fried rice and shrimp appetizer that comes with all the dinners. They're good. The waitress comes back, and my date and I ask for chopsticks. I kid you not, she looks at me, sitting without my mommy, and asks, "okay.. do you want like the kiddy ones? they're really easy to learn with." What. I keep my composure, and politely tell her that I think I can handle the normal ones.  Now, I'm not sure if that's Japanese hospitality at its finest, but I'd appreciate being treated with some respect by a waitress, who happens to be working for a tip from me.  It'd be one thing if she *forgot* to bring us fresh drinks throughout the night or to ask us if we'd like chopsticks, but just because I'm a fair skinned American doesn't mean that I'm not competent enough to use chopsticks.

The rest of dinner proceeds.  Steaks are cooked just right, the lobster is seasoned superbly. The waitress brings out a pineapple dessert for the family, who was seated at the same time as us, and has the restaurant sing to the child. We were promptly brought our check without any recognition of my date's birthday.

I pride myself on tipping well. However, I reserve a generous tips for generous service, which I did not receive.  Come here for the main course, go somewhere else for the respect.

The best japanese hibachi steakhouse around. The waitstaff is super friendly and the chef was funny and excellent with food preparation. Shotgun has been in business since the 80's and for good reason. My family took me there when it first opened and most of the fox valley mall area was a corn field. It's really neat how the walls are covered with Polaroid pictures of former guests. Nice touch. If I had to recommend something off the menu it would be the steak and shrimp. If you decide to order the shrimp you MUST get the egg yoke on top. The flavor is through the roof. I've tried all of these hibachi style restaurants in the area and this is by far the best tasting and most rewarding.
Loved the food service and showmanship of the chef. He was very friendly. Excellent food.
Amazing dinner experience for two.  Had the filet and lobster combo. Each cooked perfectly and perfect portions.  Highly recommended.

My favorite Japanese steakhouse!

My boyfriend and all my friends always come here together. I've celebrated everything here including my own birthday. But majority of the time I just come here whenever. I used to be a big fan of Benihana's until I discovered a cheaper version which was Domo 77 (also known as Japan 77 in Chicago). We all used to go to Domo 77 a lot. My newspaper staff was writing a review on Japanese steak houses and I wrote one on Kiku. One of my peers wrote about Shogun and I had never heard of it prior to the release of our paper.

I decided to try it out and was surprised. They are not only a lot cheaper than Benihana's, Domo 77 & Kiku (I always pay around $13-18) They are also better!

Their french garlic is a lot better than any place I've gone to. One of the chefs was even nice enough to tell me the recipe!

All the chefs have their different personalities, some are laid back and don't do much tricks while other spend a lot of time entertaining you.

This place is perfect for a group of just a date!

My plane ticket to Chicago, IL= $447.44
My room/board= $0 
Spending time with Family= Priceless
 
It was the heart of winter and I planned a quick visit to my family in the suburbs of Illinois. An excellent time to visit where the weather is extremely cold and the wind chill hits you sharply in the face. A great time where your face is so cold it burns until you are numb and where your toes are so frozen you can hardly move them. Yes. An excellent time to visit. 
 
Luckily, during this cold and blustery trip I was able to visit my aunt and uncle's restaurant. Located in Naperville (about 30 miles from Chicago) I was uber excited. Teppan style food is definitely the way to go in this freezing temperature. I've had my share of Benihana's during my heyday, but Shogun is far from that. FAR. Better quality food, fresh ingredients, better service and most importantly delicious food. My favorites: the filet mignon, shrimp with egg yolk, and noodles (included in the dinner). 
 
An amazing time with family, great entertainment and great food! Who can go wrong with that? This is my favorite place to go when I'm visiting the Midwest. The best place where I can see my family (literally) and a place for good eats. So, as I am back in Los Angeles, I droll as I write and only wish I can be back with my family soon. A wishful thought as I hope to see them again, because as we all know, spending time with family is. 
 
Priceless.
Oh my the Little Delicious is the tastiest sushi I've ever had!

I have been coming here for years, always bringing different friends and family. Excellent food - I always ask for extra veggies and they are always cooked to perfection. The shrimp with egg.. Well anything with egg on top is to die for! They also have Japanese soda which is great for kids!

we had 6 adults for a sunday 6:30pm reservations. 

we were seated on arrival and immediately attended to. although the decor is underwhelming, the atmosphere is very kid friendly and perfect for family dinners. 

and the FOOD! omg! delicious heavenliness on a plate. 

the soup and salad were delicious. 
shrimp, noodles and vegetable appetizers were delicious. 
shrimp and fillet mignon entree were delicious. 

did i mention the food was delicious? 

for a hearty-feel-good-this-must-be-what-being-addicted-to-crack-must-be-like food, shogun is the place. definitely will and have returned numerous times!
I think the cooks at Shinto put on a better show, but the hibachi is good.  Lunch specials are good.

My husband and I went on a double date to Shoguns.  We were really excited to get a babysitter and get out of the house.  We made reservations and showed usp on time.  As soon as we sat down they asked us to order before the other couple had even arrived!  Not 5 minutes later the other couple joined us and we placed a drink order.  The waitress then asked us to order again.  We informed her that we had only been inside the resteraunt 10 minutes and would like to start with sushi and then order dinner after.  They got us a sushi menu and asked us to order as soon as they handed it to us!  We asked for a minute... and thats exactly what they gave us.. a minute before they came back again and asked us to order.  We placed our sushi order and they demanded that we order our dinner at the same time.  We did, but told them we wanted the sushi to be our appetizer before the meal.  They did not care.  They brought us our soup before our sushi and started cooking our food at the same time.  We were bombarded with all our food at one time.  While we were still eating they asked us twice if we were done and needed a box.  They got us our bill immediatley and waited in front of us while we were looking it over.  They grabbed the bill as soon as we were done and came back immediately.  We had half a beer left (as we had no time to even enjoy one full drink during our dinner becasue they rushed us so much) and as we were trying to finish our drink the waitress told us that if we wanted to socialize and finish our drinks we needed to move to the waiting area so they could seat other guests! We were totally rushed through our whole meal and made to feel that it was an inconvienve that we were there at all.  It was an absolute terrible experience.

So I basically love Tepanyaki.  I'm a big fan of the sauces and ginger dressing.  The food here wasn't bad.  The sauces were good.  Salad Dressing left something to be desired.  As far as the meal went the honey glazed chicken was very good.  This is the first time I have tried the egg yolk sauce, its something we don't have on the west coast.  I would definitely go back again.

I decided on this restaurant as my birthday dinner this year.  My parents had found a really great teppan Japanese Steak House near them in St Charles - but the ownership changed... and unfortunately, so did the food.  It just wasn't quite as good, so my husband and I had really high hopes that Shogun would be a suitable replacement!

Lucky for us - it is definitely comparable!  It's definitely an old restaurant.  But, the decor is Polaroids of customers who shared their special occasion there!  We got to add a picture to the wall!  It is on the pricey side, so nice for a special night out.  The food was great, and the show was fun.  The chef was very entertaining, our kids loved most of it (the large fire ball to start the evening startled them both pretty good though.)

The noodle side was different than I've had at other similar restaurants, usually fried rice is the standard, but it was good... and great for the kids!

Overall a really good experience - and we'll definitely go back!

Three things keep this from being a 5 star review. 1) They only give you one sauce (a really tasty ginger sauce) with the meal, no matter what you order; 2) The decor is pretty tacky (wallpapered with faded Polaroids of past customers); and 3) The night we went (Saturday), they only had three chefs for the eight packed tables. 

We had reservations for 7pm on a Saturday night, and showed up about a quarter to. We were seated just about 7, which was fine, and then promptly brought our drinks and the soup course (pretty tasty). Before anyone had finished their soup, they brought out the salad (pretty bland). Upon finishing the soup and salad which had all arrived within 5 minutes of us being seated around the cooktop, we sat around for a while... almost 40 minutes worth of sitting. This night saw only three chefs rotating between the eight tables that, being a Saturday night, were packed with people (like us) watching the shows put on by those chefs at the other tables and wondering when it was going to be their turn. To be fair, there was a "regular" seated at our table who said it was the craziest he had ever seen it in there.

The routine performed by our chef was entertaining, but I have seen better. Coming more for the food though, I didn't really care about that, nor does that factor into my rating of this place. I ordered the steak and lobster, and was very pleased with that order. The chef overcooked both my steak and my wife's steak though (I ordered medium rare, she ordered medium well), but the lobster was done perfectly. As I mentioned above, we were offered only one sauce, the ginger, for all of our food. Now, I'm no expert in the area, but I have been to three other teppan style restaurants, and at every other restaurant there were multiple sauces available (mustard based sauces, fruit based sauces, etc). Using the ginger sauce on everything (mushrooms, noodles, steak, shrimp, lobster) was a little like using ketchup at a steakhouse... I love ketchup, but certain situations call for certain condiments. 

Finally, the price was fairly reasonable. Less than $30 for my steak and lobster, and about $20 for my wife's steak and shrimp. We skipped the adult beverages this evening and ended up with a total bill, including tip, of about $70. 

I would definitely go back.

One more thing, sorry. People... leave your babies at home!!! Who the hell takes their babies to a restaurant where there is open flame and whirling knives less than three feet from your face? There were at least three or four high chairs scattered throughout this restaurant the night we went... if your kid is small enough to be in a high chair, they do not belong at a restaurant like this... come to think of it, they should be at home in bed! Come on, what kind of retard takes their toddler out to dinner after 7 at night to a place like this. They were still walking in when we were leaving at 8:30.

MAN oh man do my wife an I love, love, LoVe this place. Just simply fantastic chow, and polite and entertaining staff.
The restaurant is divided between a general waiting area/sushi bar, and the hibachi tables.  A little dark, and the carpet could stand to be replaced, but you don't eat off the carpet!  A neat thing is that posted all over the walls are pictures of previous guests that have celebrated birthdays, proms, anniversary's, and all other sorts of happy times there.  Some people might think its funky, but those people don't know how much the owners and staff truly enjoy being a part of your special moments, and how happy they are to cook for you.
My family has gone here too many times to count and I tell you we feel right at home.
The offerings isn't' all that different from other options you may have been to, but the flavor and quality of meal is much better in my opinion.  Something that these guys have that most others do not is a stir-fried noodle course.  These are great and we typically order "extra noodle" along with fried rice when placing our table order.  Also we really enjoy the Garlic Shrimp, with its cripsy, garlicy, buttery breadcrumbs - MMmm.

I think you, and everyone you know should come here.  Stop in, spend some time watching a cooking show right in front of you... not on TV, its just great!

I'm a regular at Shogun partially because it's such a comfortable place to eat but mostly because of the egg yolk sauce.  My family an I are avid diners and we love going to Japanese steak houses, but Shogun has THE best tasting food overall.  It's a bit pricey for the portions compared to some of the other JSHs in the area.  The portions have gotten smaller over the last couple of years but the taste is still impeccable!  Recently one of the chefs had a spill while preparing our meal and the dinner ended up in my hair and on my shirt BUT I'm still giving them 3 stars!  If you are a foodie, that can appreciate a relaxed atmosphere then this place is for you.  Enjoy.

Food is awesome and is always the same only thing I wish their egg rolls were different not a big fan of their taste.  Overall can't go wrong here they're menu is good! Orange chicken and Chicken with broccoli are very good!

A fellow Yelper suggested this place when I had seemingly run out of local eating options.  Thank you, Tim H. for the great suggestion! This is a pretty good option for fast carry-out Chinese that is much better than the swill served up at the Panda Express down the road.

This is a relatively small establishment located in a strip plaza behind the Buona Beef.  Although mostly built to handle carry-out, (no delivery option as of yet) there are about five four-top tables for dine-in counter service guests.  The first thing you notice is how clean the place is.  The floors are clean, and there is a counter with a large carafe of tea and a cooler of water with cups lined up for both, and the kitchen is a relatively open area, so you can watch food being prepared if so inclined.  The kitchen is just a clean as the dining an waiting area.

We placed our order as walk-ins, but our food was ready in less than fifteen minutes.  We had wonton soup, pork fried rice, and a Mongolian beef dinner special (which came with fried rice and an egg roll.)  Prices are decent, and the orders were large portions, so it was a great value.  I have never met a wonton soup I didn't like, so that was fine here.  The rice was fresh, but I can't say I am a fan of the peas and carrots mix that was cooked in.  ( I guess it gave me a high school cafeteria kind of vibe.)  I had the remainder of the Mongolian beef special the next day, and it was definitely my favorite!  The sauce had a good spicy flavor, and it there was a perfect onion-to-beef ratio.

Ordered Kung Pao Chicken and Cashew Chicken.

Kung Pao tasted decent, but Cashew had a fishy aftertaste. Soon after, we both became very sick after eating it. 24 hrs later and still with food poisoning. Stay away.

Gotta try this place..
They are fast and affordable,
I highly recommend their Shrimp egg foo young and Kung pao chicken..

I ordered Cashew Chicken. Sat down to eat it, and it was super oily and my cashew CHICKEN tasted and smelled like fish!! I am allergic to seafood, so I couldn't eat it!  I luckily didn't have a reaction to it. But the next day I was feeling sick and nauseous all day. Never going here again. Tried my friends good and it wasn't any good either. Seriously forget this place.

Walked in for the first time for a lunch special deal and to order four meals in addition to mine. I don't eat pork or crab so I asked if I could substitute the egg roll and Rangoon for a spring roll. They refused to do anything at all claiming that they can't do anything because that's what the meal comes with. And if I wanted to change the lunch menu entree for a dinner instead, it would only come with white rice instead of fried and be $4 more expensive. And If I wanted the spring roll I would have to pay the extra price and the pork and the crab sides. Like really? Never going back. No wonder the place was empty.

My absolute favorite Chinese place around. I love far from here but will travel to get their Chinese food. Everything is great. Best crab Rangoon. Can't say enough good things about this place! Other Chinese places in the area are great, but zen house is my favorite!
Consistently good Chinese food. Mostly take out but also has eat in tables. Good, fast service. Excellent prices. Plenty of food. Expansive menu. Great value and quantity on their lunch special menu

This place is a hidden gem on weber road....compared to China house and little china (also on weber), this joint probably has the best chinese you can get in the romeoville bolingbrook weber area....im not saying its top notch...but compared to the other places in this area, this is one of best i've had so far.

I must applaud the cook for using jumbo shrimp in their shrimp fried rice....almost all the places i've gotten shrimp fried rice from had premature baby shrimp....yes PREMATURE baby shrimp...most places use these titty bitty annoying baby shrimp...you'll have to use a microscope to find one in a pile of rice..thats not that case at zen house......the shrimp here are built like chicken nuggets.....plump and juicy like Beyonce's thighs...

Another thing i noticed was that their fried had traces of scrambled eggs and mixed veges....it wasnt just bare fried rice loaded with soy sauce like the other places....its was decent.

i tried their kung pao and mongolian beef.....much more flavorful than the other places.....it didnt taste gooey and starchy....it didnt taste like straight up soy sauce....the sodium content was just right....the flavors were balanced enough....

SIMPLE 
BALANCED 
DECENT
PRICE APPROPRIATE


I like this place...no more china house and little china RUDENESS.....i live in romeoville but i'll rather drive to ZEN house...

GIVE IT A TRY...its not bad at all...i wish i could rate them 3.75 stars but i cant so a 4 star rating it is....

Went for lunch and ordered the chicken with garlic sauce lunch special.  You definitely get your money's worth with the lunch specials.  Food came exactly as ordered.  Quality of food was very good.  The only small complaint I might have was that it could have had more chicken.  There was plenty of rice and vegetables but the amount of chicken could have been better.  But for the price I am not going to complain.  The eggroll and crab rangoon that came with the special were both very good and not greasy at all.  Will definately be a regular here.

My family and I moved from New York and were desperate for something close to the really great Chinese food back home.  We found Zen House years ago and we were hooked! The food is great quality and always ready in 15 minutes.  I have never had a bad experience or poor customer service in 8 years.

Worst customer service at counter. Later realized that they had charged extra for dishes we had not bought. Unacceptable!!!! Food was atrociously gross, tasteless and overly greasy. Meat smelled. This place gives bad name to Chinese cuisine. Would stay far from this place.

Best takeout Chinese in the area! The egg rolls (esp the shrimp) and potstickers are exceptional. We love the pork with mushrooms and the beef with broccoli. Mu shu pork is really fresh and not all cabbage. There's a nice dining area if you want to eat your takeout there. Just remember to grab whatever sauces you like as they don't automatically put them in the bag when you take out.
Fast service, great food always fresh. Best Chinese food in Bolingbrook.  Awesome combination meals.  Lunch value meals are great with fried rice and egg roll included with meal.

This is my favorite Chinese food place.

Fantastic food.  Huge portions.  Lots of veggies, and they're fresh.  Delicious!

I really do wish they delivered.
Best Chinese place in town. Everything is fresh, flavorful, and made to order. Just wish they delivered.
This is a great place. We have been going there for years. Fresh ingredients, large portions, good price, fast service. Wish they delivered.

Walked in here on a whim, in need of some lunch. Place is pretty generic but does offer some seating so you don't always have to always get take out. The staff is nice and helpful. The food has been consistent on all future trips. I would recommend to anyone in need of some quick Chinese food in the area.

I have recently started going here after passing it constantly.  I was very amazed at the quality of both the service and food.  They have great Egg Fu Yung and the presentation of the food actually matches the pictures.  Their lunch specials are a great value and provide enough food for both me and my wife.
Really good food and always fresh as others have mentioned but not happy they got rid of the small entree dishes and now only offer large in some but other than that really good

Boo.

I got this menu delivered to my door and since I'm new in the area, decided to give it a try.

It's pretty bad when a Chinese place messes up fried rice, but this was the saddest fried rice I've ever seen.  Rice w/ soy sauce and a pea here and there, some really thin (looks like spaghetti!) strips of chicken....The crab rangoons were the smallest I've ever seen in my life.

It's not horrible but it's not good.
Awesome fresh food! Their lunch and dinner specials are affordable and you still get a lot of food! :)

Fantastic food.  Huge portions.  You get what you pay for.  This is by far one of the BEST Chinese places in Bolingbrook.  Fresh veggies and no MSG by request.  Always pleased with the portions.  Only problem is that the lady at the counter barely speaks a word of English and their kids are ALWAYS at a table off to the side.  Food is great though and the DUCK dishes and eggrolls are outstanding.  Very traditional Chinese food.  Wish they delivered!
This the best Chinese i have eaten. They always use fresh vegetables, It is run by a dedicated couple. Their Garlic Broccoli is my favorite

I literally have 2 complaints about this place that aren't really complaints.

1: I wish they delivered, so so badly.
2: Be forewarned. If you get a dish spicy, prepare for spicy. My Vietnamese girlfriend dumps sriracha on everything like it's ketchup, and the spicy option on EAT24 had her in tears.

Those tears were also tears of joy, lol. Even though our noses were running, the heat had a lot of flavor. We kept going back bite after bite. 

Excellent quality, generous portions. Typically I review places after multiple visits, and as always this joint has been a 5 star experience for pick up (never dined in)

Went here with the family on a Saturday night... kinda late around 7:45 or so. Was not that busy, 2 other tables of 4 but did see about 5 or 6 take outs come in. Our waitress was pretty good but did not seem that knowledgeable about the menu. Got the appetizer platter which was okay, and I know that crab rangoon is not a Thai thing, but was the best app on the platter. The app platter had several different sauces and what I would call "little salads" of cucumber and onion in different "dressings" Was tasty and fresh. 
We all eat family style, so we share all the dishes between us... we had the pad thai, which my wife thought was average, but I thought was 4 stars. The noodles seemed much smaller than I have had in the past. 
We also had panang curry with beef. The curry seemed much thicker that I am used to, but it was tasty. My son ordered the Thai sesame chicken.. not something I would order, but he liked it. Seemed like the chicken was tough.. not sure how chicken can be tough and chewy but it kinda was. We also had a vegetarian Thai fried rice. Was good, my vegetarian daughter liked it. 
Had leftover panang curry and fried rice... stirred it all up in a pan the next day... so damn good! 

Overall, the staff was super attentive... The  lady that came out with the waitress seemed to be the owner or the cook.. she was super cool and made sure we were taken care of. 
So overall.. was pretty good, but not outstanding, but one thing that really was a home run for me was the Tom Kha soup. I love that soup! and this version was outstanding!!! Will most likely go back for take out and get the soup and pad thai. 

Overall 4 stars.

Suggestions for 5 stars
Get a bus person on the staff. Table was kinda sticky and not very clean. 
The water glass I had seemed to not be that clean. Waitress poured warm water into my glass with little ice. I asked for more ice later and some lemon.. and was brought promptly. 
Train wait staff on the menu so they can explain the selections.

I've rediscovered this reincarnated place over the last 3 months and am astounded at the rise in quality. Lemongrass was completely underwhelming but Khao Suay is great in my book. In talking with the waitress they had to dial-back some of the heat on their dishes. So if that floats you're boat..and spice is you're game..talk with your server before ordering about the level.
I've sampled about 35 different Thai places and this one rises to the top. Service has always been fantastic.
The Tom Kha (Coconut Lime Mushroom Soup) is simply to die for...with out without Chicken. Pad Sew Ewe... Great
Fast, friendly service.  The food was better than words can describe.  See the picture!

Thai tea is fairly good. Food is nicely portioned for the price, but it's oily and bland. My Pad See Eiw had so much oil, it was downright slimey. Not happy about it after spending $30 for 2 entrees and two teas.

It's by far my most favorite Thai restaurant. My boss and I came here to eat lunch one day as we happen to drive by it. It's a small and quant little restaurant. You can definitely see mom and pops written all over it which is what I am always looking for. 

The cashier was very prompt and welcoming. Her friendly personality gave warmth to this cute establishment. Her patience was also something worth noting.

I ordered the tofu panang curry.  The texture of the tofu was just perfect.  There was no rubbery feeling to it.  The freshness of the ingredients was evident with every bite. The flavors were on point and I couldn't be any happier.

I'm definitely a fan and excited to come here more often.  Thanks for the food and great service.

I really didn't understand the Yelp fuss. I went with a group of friends who all love Thai food, we all ordered different dishes, and we were all equally underwhelmed. One of my friends left her leftovers in the restaurant and realized it in the parking lot and said it wasn't even worth the effort to go back in for it. 

It's located in a small strip mall on the south side of Odgen, easy to miss. Cute and cozy decor inside. As a plus, our server was very attentive and amicable. 

The prices were reasonable and portion sizes were decent.

So the food here is EXCELLENT.  Their curries are more peanut based and thicker than usual but I really liked it! Pad thai was pretty good... but that Larb with fried chicken was everything! Best thing we had on the menu.

I would recommend doing take out because their service is quite terrible.  Not very personable, understaffed and rushed service.  But I WILL be taking out from here in the near future... several times...

We decided to pop in on our way back from Chicago to Iowa City. I would say they served decent Thai food with generous portions. 

We shared a noodle dish, basil fried rice and a Tom Yum Chicken. The Tom Yum Chicken was a little sweet for me and lack the sour and heat that's typically its signature in Asia. 

A hint of warning: we ordered both the noodles and rice at 'Hot' level of spiciness and it was crazy. On the table was my in-laws, visiting from Indonesia, and accustomed to fiery levels of chili, so when they say it's spicy, it's spicy. Kudos to the attentive staff topping up our glasses with ice water!

Found Khao Suay Thai with the help of Groupon. I ordered the Khao Soi (curry noodles) with seafood (shrimp, scallops, imitation crab, and mussels). I expected the noodles to be slightly covered with curry but this was more like a curry soup (it was still good). In fact, there was so much curry left over that I brought it home and ate it with rice the next day. My boyfriend ordered pad thai and he had no complaints. Our waitress was courteous and food came out fast. Overall, I would come back if given the opportunity.

Excellent taste! Decent service and fair  pricing for what you get.  Unfortunately I couldn't give it 5*s because our table did get a few dirty plates and our table were sticky from not proper cleaning . I would definitely go back for the food and do a carry out next time.

By far, one of if not my most favorites Thai restaurant!

Its so good to know there is a good place that serves pretty good Thai food close to home!  Altho, food were great there is a few small issues with the services.  

We have been there several times and always ordered thai iced coffee/tea, I always order large but everytime when I am there they give me different sizes!

Love the pad kee mo, pretty good crab rangoons, good tofu panang curry, basil shrimp and pad thai!
The thai good here is amazing. The staff is courteous. The portions are good. Had lunch with teammates last month.

I really liked mystop here.  It's good to know that there is a place that serves good Thai food close to my home.  Although the food was really good, there were a few small problems with the service.  We both ordered  the Thai Iced Coffee and though both of us ordered the medium, we were served our drinks in wildly differing glasses that seemed to be completely different in size to the naked eye.

The Finger Food is something not to be missed and is the perfect delightfully light and well balanced bite to start off a meal with.  Slightly acidic and just barely spicy  with a refreshing bit of cucumber it is the perfect palate clenser for a great meal. 

For my Entree I decided to go with the Pad Kee Mo.  Though it was quite a tasty dish I was slightly disappointed by the lack of spicyness.  When I see a little chili pepper next to what I select as a dish to eat I expect it to deliver a  bit of heat (especially in a Thai place).

All things considered it was a great meal.

Tried new Thai place tonight.  It was excellent,  ordered too much, but after the first dish wad so good I wanted to try other dishes.  All really very good.  I tried the chicken satay, squid tempura, beef soup, and of course the Thai custard. Every dish was really great. 
I'll be back even though it isn't really close to where I live or work. I say this is a real 5 star place.

Very good food, fast serving, and I got a SUPER nice waitress. 

Tom Kha soup is great
Red curry is very good
Mango Lassi was fantastic

Highly recommend
Not super busy but there's always people in and out. 
Great for take out!

Recently was here for an early dinner with my mom and wow! Really impressed. Our waitress was super friendly and helpful, the restaurant was really cute (bonus: clean, well-kept bathroom, always important) but most importantly the food was excellent! We got the green papaya salad and it was one of the best I've ever had. Then we got the beef pad kee mao. This was good, but I've had better. The star of the show, however, was the tamarind duck. A-freaking-Mazing. The skin was perfectly crispy while the meat was tender and rich. And for like $16! I live near Chicago. This was an awesome price. Seriously worth the trip back out here!!

Yes sir,  very good restaurant. Great customer service,  pad see ew with thin noodles,  huge portion me and my wife split and i was hungry! Crab rangoon, best ever.  Find someone better.......topped off with coconut ice-cream,  which was fantastic. Highly recommend.

When glowing reviews of Khao Suay kept showing up on my news feed, I was intrigued. When I looked it up and saw that it was down the street from my house, I was elated. After a week of  reading review after review, my steadfast dieting flew out the window. --I hadn't attempted Thai since I was served a gelatinous (jarred) mess at a downtown Naper Asian establishment last summer. I wasn't about to allow a little diet to stand in the way of at least a bite of massaman curry. Not when I 'd waited so long for a place like this.

I looked over the menu online and had a plan in mind for staying on track. However, I'm afraid I wasn't the best date. I told him I was ordering the Tom Yum soup because it was clear broth. --fewer calories. I loved the soup. It didn't taste spicy at first sip (just sour), but created a nice steady burn at the back of the throat. My diet was still on track. But then his curry was placed in the middle of our tiny "built for two" table. No matter how much I stuffed myself with my clear broth, the curry just kept teasing me. I caved and ended up eating 1/2 of my soup and a 1/3 of his curry. On a cold night, and with so much time since I'd had it last, it was like heroin for the soul. 

He also ordered green curry fried rice (my favorite). It had a nice curry subtlety with a peppery aftertaste. Would you think less of me if I admitted to eating it with a serving spoon? I didn't.... but I wanted to.  We'll just pretend it was carb and calorie free though.

I have a party to attend in 3 weeks and a leather skirt to wear, so no more Thai for me. Until then, I will longingly look at the menu and narrow down which items I will try next.  Only 21 more days.

My friends and I where looking for some good Thai food, without having to go to the city and we found some! This place was delicious. I got the red curry it was so flavorful! The crab rangoon was a tad bit too sweet, but still creamy and yummy. We are defiantly coming back.
I got take out pad thai, and it was just fine. Not especially good, but fine.  Ordered online, it was ready when I got there.
Thank god with a groupon. Definitely not worth the price , the taste was below average and so we're the portion size.

Love this place . Very friendly staff . Super great food very flavorful and big portions . I had a pad Thai with chicken , great flavor! And pad kee Mao with tofu , medium spicy . Also Thai ice tea . Great place , highly recommend !!!!

Came in with some coworkers on a recent weekday for lunch. Our server came over and asked if we were ready to order before we even had enough menus for everyone and before we were given water or had our drink order taken. We asked for another menu and a few minutes to decide. Eventually, I ordered the pad see ew lunch special. It came with a spring roll and cucumber salad which were ordinary but good. The pad see ew was pretty meh. It didn't have enough noodles or enough sauce. It was full of cabbage, which I don't recall being a key ingredient in the dish at all. But I'm guessing cabbage is cheaper than noodles. I asked for hot sauce when my dish arrived but it never came. The restaurant wasn't busy at all so I'm not inclined to be forgiving on the service aspect. Probably won't try this restaurant again.

Really don't understand the high reviews for this restaurant.  

Ordered take out and got the Orange Chicken which tasted like ketchup chicken and the Pad Thai which was average at best.  

Service was good but unfortunately will not return.

Nice and cozy interior, love the table cloth (looks like traditional Thai skirt). Highly reccomend the N8 Khao Soi Ga, medium spicy. Curry sauce is light and refreshing, peppers are spicy but not overwhelming. In our other dish the eggplant was excellent, very fresh, and cooked to perfection.

I was looking for a Thai place to go to when I visited home for Christmas break. OMG!!! Khao Suay hit all of the culinary spots! We ordered duck pad Thai, shrimp pineapple fried rice, chicken tom kha soup, the taro pudding dessert, mango sticky rice dessert, and the shrimp Thai fried rice. It was all amazing, especially the tom kha. My entire family stuffed our faces and was proud of it. There were no leftovers and I will definitely be back every time I visit home. If you like Thai or are curious about it, you NEED to stop by Khao Suay Thai!

As far as Thai in Naperville goes, the food here is better than most.  However, the last time we went there there were tons of little gnats flying all over the place and it was very unappetizing.  They need to do something about the gnats.

Great Thai option for Naperville! I've been once since the ownership change and I like the new restaurant much more than the last. Service was excellent and the food was even better. I had the basil fried rice with ground chicken and lemon grass and ginger tea. My friend had VERY spicy cashew chicken and we shared an order of spring rolls. We were both very pleased with the food and have already planned to go back for our next lunch.

Out of the way and hard to see- but honestly some of the best Thai around. The cashew fried rice dish is outstanding. The orange chicken is great. The kids always order this wherever we go, but it is especially good here. A little pricey, but it seems all Asian food has gotten more expensive lately.

5 stars well deserved.  I'm not from these parts, but the "double noodle" sure made me wish I was. If I come back, this place is definitely on the list.  Admirably better than any run of the mill Thai food!  Thanks guys

Good tasting food overall (tofu yellow curry, tofu tom kha, Vietnamese spring rolls). Prices were a little bit high for the quality/quantity, but nothing crazy. (Yellow curry was $12 vs the $8-9 I've come to find elsewhere). The big bummer was the service. Didn't get water for 10-15 minutes, and after waiting 25 minutes for the curry to come out, they gave us beef instead of tofu, so we sent it back. After about another 25-30 minutes we got our curry, which was delicious, but we were out of drinks etc and never got them refilled. After we were finished eating we waited another 15 minutes for our bill. This would have been pretty fine had it been a slammed dinner rush, but there were only 3 or 4 other customers in the entire restaurant. 

TLDR: Good food. Little pricey. Bad service.
Very good food, convenient. Went here for lunch several times and enjoy the service, location and food. Lunch prices are excellent.

The sesame chicken was the perfect amount of tangy, spicy and sweet. 

Pad se yu (or how ever you spell it) was good, but not as bomb as the sesame chicken.

Owned by a couple: AWWWWWWE

I checked this place out accidentally yesterday after work. It'd been a long day to say the least so, admittedly, I was actually trying to get to McDonald's, but I missed the entrance. I turned into the Khao Suay Thai parking lot just to turn around, but the inside caught my eye. It was pretty packed in that tiny place and Thai food sounded a whole world better than whatever McDonald's would have churned out so I ventured in.

I didn't want to stay so I ordered take out. Look, I'm a Thai noob, so I ordered the fish cakes and the Pad Thai with chicken. I know. Don't judge me. The (very friendly) server informed me it'd be about 25 minutes so I went to the car & took that time to finally call my mom back about scarves for winter or whatever.

25 minutes later I had a deliciously smelling plastic bag in hand. 10 minutes later I was home. 

Yo, the Pad Thai was amaze-balls. The sauce, the peanut crumbles, the perfectly cooked noodles, the fresh, crisp veggies... look, it was delish. And the fish cakes? Omg. Super crispy on the outside, almost creamy/tender/idek but an opposing texture that was yummy on the inside. And with just a touch of spice to kick it up.

This place is great. Check out the menu online, call in your order (or dine in, it looks super cute), and enjoy some pretty good Thai food. 

(Any suggestions on what I should order next would be super great!)

We go to this restaurant all the time. Lunch specials are great - and a bang for your buck! And, the evening portions come with a great amount. 

Our favorite is the Cashew Chicken (medium spicy). Whether I choose Tofu or Chicken, it's always great!!! :)

A hidden Gem in Naperville.
The best Thai food I have had in a long time. Large portions friendly service. Can't Waite to try their lunch specials. I will definitely be a regular here.

~THE NAPERVILLE FOOD DUDE~
So delicious!!  The sauces are what make this a gem. Highly recommend this place. Definitely will be back.
Had the panang curry and it was outstanding.  The pineapple fried rice was delicious and loaded with vegetables.

I ordered Vegetable Red Thai curry and crab Rangoon's. The food was amazing and to the Thai taste that I like.

I would highly recommend going here.
The service is excellent and with a smile.

I will be back.
Pleasant service and good food.  With Groupon it was a good deal.

Heck yes. I've been waiting for an awesome Thai spot in Naperville for years.  There are a lot of 'good', but this is great.  

The yellow curry is great. You can adjust the spice any way you want and it's pretty creamy and made any way you want it (I prefer w out onions). Wifey got the pad Thai and said is was also awesome.   The crab Rangoon was outstanding. A little doughy, but w tons and tons of delicious filling.  

The service is not really that good. They seem always understaffed and trying to catch up.  The servers are good, just challenged.

Great Thai & lunch specials if you want to try a bunch of their offerings. Some of the typical curry & traditional Thai dishes have a twist and worth re-exploring. I'd suggest asking a lot of questions on what some of their unique offerings might be when you check this place out. Don't be fooled by the crappy, cramped strip mall location, the interior is clean, nice decor, interior, food is piping hot when it arrives at your table. Make sure you try their Thom Yum soup for starters. Happy eating!
One of the better Thai places out here in the suburbs. When I can't go to the city to get what I really want, this will do. Good service, good food selection and quality.
My husband was obsessed with the tamarind duck. The spicy catfish was delicious too. Will come back again to try more soon.

This place was delicious. I ordered a vegan friendly meal: friend spring rolls, sticky rice with mango, and pad thai (no egg, request for no fish sauce [I don't know if they have fish sauce]). I did carry out. When I walked in, the place was full--that gave me confidence my first time there! The staff was attentive and friendly. 

Best of all, when I got home and ate my meal, the flavors were on point--delicious, tangy, sweet, spicy...all the good flavors. I look forward to meal number two.

It was not a planned stop. We were planning on Indian but the restaurant we intended to visit wasn't open yet.

This restaurant was tucked into a tiny strip mall. The outside was nondescript with a changeable LED sign. So, we were joking around about how the restaurant changed every week. The inside was colorful and tasteful. Large poster-size pictures of Thai food markets hung on the wall. The wait staff was attentive and friendly. 

The food:

The fish cakes were amaze balls! Crispy outside, creamy insides and packed with favor. 

 I had the crazy mama with duck. It was spicy heaven! My lips are still tingling and the sinus headache I was nursing is a thing of the past.

John had the spicy catfish. There was quite a bit of fish and it was flaky and delicious. It also had these weird peppers that looked like sleigh bells but tasted spicier.

me and my girlfriend came here on a sunday night. we heard that this place just opened so we wanted to give it a try. the place was just a little hard to find because its kind of tucked in a corner and it was dark. walking into the restaurant, the decor is mediocre and could use a better eye. there were no customers in the restaurant when we came in and we were kindly greeted by our waitress. i forgot our waitress's name, maybe allison lol i could be very wrong. but she was very helpful and catered to our needs. we ordered the chicken satay, beef salad, basil beef, and the pad kee mao. which was very very good. we left with a satisfied stomach and happy foodies. 

overall if your loooking for good authentic thai food and want great service, this is the place to be. i could care less for the decor, im there to eat so im not complaing bout the decor :)

Service is great.  Food is delicious.  I come here for lunch quite a bit.  I always get the same thing.  The Pad See Ew with chicken - excellent.  I often order the sticky rice with mango for dessert - yummy!  Coconut ice cream is a favorite as well!

Fantastic hidden gem in Naperville. I am particular about my Thai food. The Thai restaurant in my hometown knows me by name and always delivers top quality food. I love finding small local establishments when I travel and this certainly satisfied. Fast friendly service and a spice to taste ratio that was very nicely balanced. Enough to let one know what you were eating but not enough to take away the enjoyment. Thai Iced Tea was excellent Pad Ki Mao was very nicely done with a mild smokey flavor and a nice pepper blend. Tom Ka soup was spicy but nice and rambuken stuffed with pineapple and coconut ice cream for desert was an excellent finish. Overall an excellent meal for a reasonable price.

Good but not great Thai cuisine, we especially love the soups. The appetizers are very good but either the portion is too small or the dishes overpriced depending on how you want to evaluate value. I do not understand the comments for large portions. At other restaurants we have leftovers but not here, the portion is just enough to satisfy. That may be viewed as a comment  on the value of the entrees as well. This is a fairly small dining room therefore they must charge enough per plate to cover the overhead and make a profit. I guess they should make sure the entire experience is worth it for the diner - GREAT service with GREAT quality for the price charged. Maybe a little more work is needed.
Affordable lunch specials and fantastic service. We will definitely be back.
Uh oh, they seem to be slipping.  Food quality is not what it was.  Different wait staff each time we go back, as if they can't retain workers.

I've ordered pickup twice from this place and both times they never failed to disappoint! First time I got the red curry dish and second time I had the Thai sesame chicken. We also had some appetizers, vegetarian spring rolls and the pot stickers. I also tried mango lassi for the first time. All delicious! 
The second time we picked up we forgot our mango lassi and had to go back and get it. The hostess who checked us out and gave us our food was very nice about it and threw in a Thai iced tea at no charge to us. She also tried to give us some crab ragoons but given my mom's seafood allergy we respectfully declined. The tea was amazing though! I'll definitely be coming back, pickup or sit down!!
Duck Tamarind is excellent. Wonderful service. Don't miss this treasure! The best food in Naperville!

Food is good but not up to the mark as what I expected. We asked for soup to be medium spicy and it was extremely spicy as you started eating more. We ordered take out and the quantity of the vegetable fried rice was less. Flavor was ok and could have been better. One dish we all enjoyed was the double noodles! They gave us 10% discount when they shouldn't have charged us at all for the soup, plus they said we can give you some Thai iced tea because the soup was spicy and they charged us for the Thai iced tea as well, but instead they gave us 2 fortune cookies. I don't plan on going back.
Best authentic Thai food in the area hands down... Their "thai spicy" is very spicy. I've tried pad ke Mao and red curry both excellent.

Khao Sauy Thai  restaurant served me my favorite Thai dish ever: The Double Noodle. It has another name in Thailand but I prefer their rendition. I would describe it as Pad Thai Covered in yellow curry with crispy noodles on top.  The owners and the staff are super friendly. They truly love their restaurant and it shows!

Worst Thai food I've ever had.  Seems like Indians trying to serve facsimiles of Thai food, but not doing it well. All dishes were exceedingly greasy.  Had a stomach ache after I left, as a result.  Should have sent the food back and left.

Enjoyed this place much more than Yum yum Thai in town. We ordered the Pad See Eiw & Khao Soi Curry, both were good, I liked the flavor of each. The curry was delicious. Jasmine tea was hot, good flavor, and the chicken pot stickers came with a sauce I wished they sold in store. The service was top knotch-one woman working the floor. She killed it: I felt well attended to and served promptly. She was A-list as far as any service I've had, and it's in the 'burbs! Definitely will be going back.

The food is delicious. We were a party of 5 and we got the green curry tofu, pad kee mao, pineapple fried rice, and red curry chicken. We also got wonton soup and shu Mai. 

The service is really good and they remember what we ordered last time we went there. They even served hot tea to some of us who ordered hot tea last time. 

The prices are reasonable and they serve food fast. Highly recommended!

Wow this was delicious. Ate there for the first time today- well, I ordered pick up. Food was ready on time, hot, and so tasty. Lunch special is a great size and comes with sides too! Will definitely be coming back here! Take out recommended- not the most romantic place to dine in but very clean :)

I drove to get my favorite pad Thai from Lemongrass Thai. Turns out they changed the name from Lemongrass to Khao Suay Thai and the pad Thai was really bad. 

No flavor, carrots weren't even chopped up into strings, chicken was giant chunks and there was way more tofu than chicken.

I'm very sad, What happened!?!? I won't be back.
Best Thai, no doubt! We will definitely come back very soon. The chef special entree was so delicious!
Their crab fried rice and pad see yew are very delicious. But to be honest, their pad Thai is not that great.

First time at this restaurant after reading reviews decided to stop for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. We were not disappointed. The hot yum soup was very good and the spicy catfish was excellent. Will be going back again

I almost feel bad reviewing here and just leaving a 3. There are so many stellar reviews that I was ready to fall in love with what I had, but I honestly feel like it was good, not great. I ordered spring rolls and the red curry with beef, and it was pretty standard, as far as what I'd expect. Spring rolls were nice and crisp, but pretty average, without anything exceptional going on. I liked the veggies in the curry, and the beef was the standard thinly sliced stuff without a ton of flavor. I will say that when I asked for spicy, I did get spicy, they're not afraid to amp it up when you ask. That was really nice. But at the end of the day, this struck me as just standard Thai food. Would I come back? Yes, absolutely, there's nothing bad going on. But I'm not sure if it really distinguishes itself from any of the other Thai places I've had in the area. Maybe it's unfair of me to expect epic 5 star Thai in Naperville...but I have to be true to my rating system and call this what it is. I'll probably be back, as I want to try a few more menu items - maybe I'm just ordering the wrong thing?
So delicious!!  The sauces are what make this a gem. Highly recommend this place. Definitely will be back.
This is a little gem of a place located in a strip mall. Food is fabulous and service is pretty good, we will definitely be back!

Great restaurant. We love Thai food and are so happy to have such a great place so close to our home. We frequently get take out and have eaten there a few times. We enjoy the curry noodles, pad thai, thai fried rice, mango lasso and Vietnamese spring rolls. We have young children and as it is a small restaurant, it can take longer than my children can wait to make the food if the restaurant is crowded. However, it is worth the wait. So glad to support a local independently owned restaurant!

Fantastic food, everytime!  For takeout, the good is always ready on time and it is very tasty.  owners are very visible and are working hard to be successful, I will continue to support this business as my needs for Thai food presents itself ;)

I bought a groupon and went here with my family. The food was decent and the price was fair. The portions seemed smaller than other Thai restaurants I'd been to. The restaurant was clean; although, there was only a one stall bathroom that wasn't too stellar. We got a Thai iced tea, Vietnamese spring rolls, green curry, pad Thai, pad kee mao, pad see ew, pad woon sen, and sweet sticky rice with mango. The Thai iced tea was a little weak and the sweet stick rice with mango was a bit salty and out of season; however everything else was fine taste wise. The spicy level was also pretty accurate. Our waitress was attentive.
Great Lunch Specials.  I had the Basil Chicken.  Authentic Thai food in the suburbs is rare.

Tried this place two times now and have not been disappointed yet. Being Thai, I am always looking my go-to thai place. This is one of them. We've tried the Satay, Green Curry, Basil fired rice and Pad se ew so far and loved each one. Food cooked and tastes just like my mom use to make.
Loved the food. We ordered Tom Sum soup, Basil Shrimp on wok, Thai fried rice and red curry chicken. Everything excellent. Service was good for an Asian restaurant.

Found this place on Yelp. They are the highest rated Thai restaurant in my area. Little did I know they just opened a few months back and they already have almost 5 stars on Yelp. I was impressed and decided to give them a try. I ordered the Tom Yum Soup with Beef and Shrimp. It was delicious!!! The staff was super friendly. I will definitely be back to try other dishes as I've just found my new favorite Thai restaurant. Be sure to check the hours of operation before you go. They are open for lunch and then closed for a short break, but they reopen for dinner.
Great service, we had the Penang Curry and tumyam fried rice. Also had the Tumyam Soup. The soup was excellent, the best I have had in a very long time. I highly recommend this place.
Amazing fish cake. You can order either deep fried or pan fried. Good environment with polite service.

I tried this place for the first time the other day. We had a coupon and decided to get takeout. I called to put my order in and the lady was very nice. We ordered two Panang tom yum soup and the app. platter. Everything was so good and the total came out to be $50.00. The only thing I didn't like very much was the fish cakes, just not for me. But everything else was excellent! I will be back!

Really good place. Nice environment and really really polite and nice service. The Thai tea is really nice. Cute decoration as well. The stir fry noodles are authentic and the specialty dish (we asked for Thai spicy) is really spicy and good. Total 5 stars. Will come back for other chef specials!

Everything was absolutely delicious!! They were also very accommodating as they do not offer a kids menu (which I wish they would add), however they were happy to make a smaller plate at a reduced cost for our son.  Crab Rangoon tasted so fresh!  We will definitely return as this is now our favorite spot for Thai! Great food and service.

one of the more authentic thai restaurants in the area. the pad see ew was a little greasy, but green curry, tom yum soup, papaya salad were all delicious. our 2 years old ate all of the chicken skewer w/ peanut sauce. LOVED it.
Great food and amazing service!! Very reasonable prices with generous portions! My favorite is the Thai basil fried rice, amazing with either chicken or beef

Food is very good, however I thought my meal was going to be spicy bc it had a chili pepper by it on the menu, but it wasn't spicy at all. No option to add one spring roll to your meal, must order 4. No alcohol. Indians work here, not natives of Thailand, which takes away from authenticity.
Pad Thai is excellent here.  Plan to be back to try other dishes.

Such nice people! The food is excellent! In a state where Thai food is easily found, Khao Suay offers a nice difference in taste! I can't think of enough great things to say. Perfect experience! Will definitely be back again. Delightfully crispy spring rolls. Pad Kee Mao had well balanced kick of spice. Love, love, love!

Excellent food and service. Great addition to Naperville. The pad thai noodles and green curry are a nice combination. Try the thai iced tea. 

Very personal service. We will be back soon

Great food with great ambience. 
Must try the Tom Kha soup and the Penang Curry. Undoubtedly one of my favorite Thai restaurants.

My sister and I went to eat here for the second time today, and the food was as delicious as the first time we went! The service is also great! Definitely worth the trip to get your thai food fix out here in the burbs!
One of the best Thai places in our area! The staff is so kind and their food is fantastic! I would recommend the Pad Kee Mao! If you're craving something sweet the Thai iced tea hits the spot!

Liked the old Lemongrass and was excited to try this out. We are pretty picky about Thai and we loved everything we have tried so far! We got carry out both times and the second time they forgot our rice with the entrees. My husband called back and was about to go back to get it, but they offered to deliver it right to our door! Great service and food, can't beat that! We will definitely be back!

This Thai restaurant is probably amongst the best that I have tried here out in the suburbs. 

Upon arrival, you're instantly waited on & the waitress is super pleasant in answering any questions that you might have about the food. She's suggested great dishes to try & they've been great every time. 

The food is flavorful & served fresh! I went there with my family for the second time today and they absolutely loved everything we had. I would recommend this restaurant who wants to taste delicious Thai food.

I also recommend having their green tea ice cream- it's awesome!

Best new Thai place around. Great presentation and taste of the food. The staff is amazing -- extremely friendly and welcoming. If you like peanut sauce, get the Panang Curry! Also, the Basil Fried Rice (spicy) is another favorite!
Great lunch specials! These guys have never let me down. I LOVE the cashew chicken.

Ordered beef pad thai and crab rangoons. The rangoons were greasy but good, but the pad thai was almost un enjoyably spicy, and although we ordered beef, had a faint fish taste. Not sure what happened there, but was not what I had hoped for. =(
Good food, good service, not all in your face but there when you need them. Food was out fast and tasted very fresh and good. I'll definitely go back.

Slowest wait time ever for an Olive Garden for an early Sunday dinner.   The parking is poorly structured. A blonde woman manager was meandering around the restaurant like she was clueless. Lots of open tables yet the amount of people waiting in the lobby was horrendous. 

Ordered the chicken piccata and it was very dry. 
The only positive was our server, young guy with dark hair. He was very attentive.

Nothing all that spectacular about the experience, nothing terrible of note either.  Food was decent, brought out in good time, and the service was just about what you'd expect from this caliber of restaurant. The music was really good though, as irrelevant as that might be to the dining experience. Nice, upbeat jazz. I ordered the garlic rosemary chicken, which was decent. Mashed potatoes were spot on, but the spinach seemed like it was just thrown on there to make the dish seem like more than just meat and potatoes. I also got the Zuppa Tuscana on the side. I've been getting this soup at this OG location for years now and it has declined in quality recently, as have the breadsticks. 

On the whole a pretty meh experience.

I've been sitting at the front for a good 10 minutes and no one bothered to greet me or ask me if they could help me.  There were about a good 6-7 people at the front where all they were doing was chit chatting amongst each other.  I'm guessing this is why it's slow in this particular Olive Garden.  You just get ignored. 

I decided to transfer to the bar and it's been five minutes and no one has greeted me still.  Amazing!  I wonder if their food is gonna be better than their attention span.  Out of five employees, two are working.  The other three are just standing talking or staring.  Yup!

Their saving grace was the person in charge of to go orders.  She was very organized and on point.  Her customer service was great and she was able to convince me to give her an awesome tip through her service.  

The other saving grace was the food.  I ordered chicken and shrimp carbonara, zoupa toscana, and grilled chicken flat bread.  Don't order the chicken flat bread to go.  It's not worth it.  It's cold by the time we got to it.  As for the carbonara, that was awesome!  The grilled taste of the shrimp was just to die for.  I was truly impressed that the food I ate came from that restaurant.  The cooks/chefs cooked this to perfection.  It wasn't salty, nor was a it overcooked.  The shrimp was at the right chewing texture, and the chicken was had great flavors to it.

I give the cooks 5 and overall customer service 1.  The person who gave me good service got a 5.  So, it's a 3.

Dear Olive Garden breadsticks, 

I'm not sure what it is about you that makes you so extraordinary, but you are the reason I had a delicious carb overload the other night. Thank you, and damn you.

Sincerely,

Sorry I'm not sorry.

So yeah, this one time my hubbie was out of town for work and I was swamped with work myself. Grocery shopping was just not in the cards for a few days and I was craving some pasta on this chilly fall day. I remembered I had a Darden restaurant gift card, so I popped online to Olive Garden's website. Turns out you can order take out right online and it's super simple!

I definitely got a little carried away with my order, but I justified it by thinking it could be lunch/dinner for a few meals since I was avoiding taking the time to pick up groceries. With that being said, I ordered the spicy calamari, ($9.99), five cheese marinara dipping sauce for breadsticks ($3.49), braised beef & tortellini ($15.49), and chicken & gnocchi soup (which came with my meal). 

YEAH. Moral of the story, maybe don't make a carry out order when you're starving and stressed.

The website said my food would be ready in 45 minutes and it was there ready to go right when I arrived. The girl working take out orders up by the bar was super friendly and efficient. She double checked my order in front of me and made sure I had silverware and napkins. Here's the breakdown of my meal(s)...

Breadsticks: 5/5 - The main reason I will consider a meal at Olive Garden. I was given 3 breadsticks with the dip I ordered and another 4 with my meal. That's a lot.

Spicy calamari: 2/5 - Just enough spice. I wish the calamari was crunchier, it was a little too soggy for my liking. I did enjoy the two different sauces it came with though. FYI, not so great when re-heated.

Five cheese marinara dipping sauce: 5/5 - pretty straight forward, but cheesy and delicious. A great pair with the breadsticks.

Braised beef & tortellini: 3/5 - the tortellini was awesome. They're huge and filled perfectly with asiago. The basil-marsala sauce and portobello mushrooms were good too, I just wish there was more of it. The slices of slow-braised beef were a little disappointing. I thought they would be more along the lines of meat that melted in your mouth along with the pasta, but they were just pieces of beef that seemed out of place.

Chicken & gnocchi soup: 3/5 - Just okay. There wasn't much chicken, but the Italian dumplings and spinach were good. This soup wasn't as creamy as it should be though.

Everything reheated well as leftovers accept for the calamari, so maybe keep that in mind if you decide to go on a random Olive Garden binge like I did :)

For the most part, the waitstaff here is ok. Tonight we had Kyle C, and he was extremely attentive! Ask for his area for sure! I had an issue with one of the hostesses (she seated us to a table with only 3 chairs, but I felt it was unprofessional, and when I asked for the chair next to where i was sitting, she glanced over at 2 guys, happened to be a manager, then back at me like I was "one of those" customers, I felt that was disrespectful). Other than her, this was a nice event :-) they have the buy one, bring one home meal, so I have lots of food!

First i went at 4 pm and the hotess said, "I am waiting on my sever, could you wait 5 minutes?" 5 minutes turned into 10 then I was given a table, when asking for a booth, I was told no so I left very disappointed and going to the Olive Garden in Bolingbrook.

Delicious food especially the pasta the only thing I don't really like is they put too much salt in the food
I like that they have great offers like buy one take the other one home

Our initial experience going in was not good. We waited yesterday over 12 minutes for someone to even come to our table so we went up to the front & asked for a manager. Justin turned that experience into a great one. He served us & made up for the initial experience. Great management style to go above & beyond to make sure we were happy. Took it upon himself to service our table.

Definitely very disappointed with this location. Food, service and staff 5 stars at Bolingbrook location. There was a lot of slamming dishes onto table by staff and food served for money spent was ridiculous.  Bathroom was also very dirty.

I'm not a super big fan of places like this but my boyfriend likes the franchises so I compromise every once in a while. I'll say service was good, our waitress was very nice. I got the soup salad breadsticks and mini bowl of fettuccine Alfredo. Breadsticks are always good, salad was a bit over dressed, and my pasta was bland, very bland. Tasted nothing like Alfredo sauce, more like a white cheddar macaroni. So I sent it back. Other than that, it's a toss up with a place like this, and if course there are several better pasta options. I'll still try to avoid the franchises as much as I can lol

We had a fabulous dinner and drinks at Olive Garden this evening. Amanda was our server and she did a fabulous job. Everything was very hot and delicious. We will definitely go back! The bring one home option was a great treat.

Found a spot in the bar was with a gal pal and another couple that sat after us were given menus and asked for a drink order hmm completely ignored by the server behind the bar , after requesting menus , i had to tell the staff lady what i wanted ,and i was specific bacardi and coke in a pint glass , what do i get a rocks glass ,ummm , i then again asked for the pint glass which she poured it into and brought me a pint glass half full , hmm , i had an appetizer and my gal pal had ordered her entree , which was an epic fail it was a long wait again food was given to other patrons that came after us .
.

Meh. Supper slow to be seated (over an hour-why did we wait???), waitress was ok'ish. Wine service consisted of putting the bottle on the table and not pouring any into our glass. Food- used to be great (in 1990) but the wait for the food was long as well. No one even attempted to pre-bus even though several employees walked past our table to the kitchen empty-handed. 
Saving grace? For a nominal fee you can swipe your credit card to access a tablet filled with game apps to distract the ravenous children at the table.
Unfortunately I would recommend any other restaurant but OG. Sorry but there are much better options in the Chicagoland area.

The service was not so bad but I left  after ordering an appetizer that was $10 and my plate looked pretty empty like they count every piece of it, I was so angry I decide to leave and did not order a meal, I guess when you don't go to a really good Italian restaurant that is what you get
Horrible service. Had to beg for refills and they still didn't come. Bread sticks were stale. Overall a horrible experience.

I don't usually review the chains but I had to review this time because our server Keshawn was really good. Very personable and attentive even though you can tell he was really busy.  The 4 stars is really because of the server :). Although don't get me wrong I actually love Olive Garden as a chain...probably the only one I really like.  The breadsticks and soups are very good and you can pretty much fill up on them and be full enough to just take your main entree home for leftovers.  The desserts are awesome...so good. My favs are zeppoli and the apple crostata.  The prices are just right and we usually don't have to wait in line too long.  I've been to this particular Olive Garden soooo many times but for some reason this server really impressed me the most.  I really haven't had any complaints with the others but he is better.  Anyways giving 4 stars since I've consistently had good food and it's about time I gave a review of this place.

Oooohhh the breadsticks and soup.

Seems like this olive has a lot of young, unexperienced waiters and waitresses...hey, it's okay, you gotta start somewhere.

I know I know it's olive garden it's not a 5 star dining establishment. But really? Last time we went the waitress was so timid and had chewed off nailpolish which really freaked me out.

Other then that, the food is good. Meaning, If you are looking for a quick bite to eat before you shop until you drop, this is the kind of place.
Service and Food were both very good.  I have been here about 3 or 4 times and service and food has been very consistent. They have also been very busy everytime we have went.

The service and food here was excellent today. We were immediately greeted and seated and our server, Eric, was very friendly and attentive. Even my husband was surprised at how good of a service we had since we've had some bad experiences at other restaurants. To top it off our food was delicious--chicken Alfredo, eggplant parmigiana, and an appetizer of calamari and stuffed mushrooms. Everything was great.

Went for late lunch with a party of 10 difficult people all my familia lol Remy and Megan were are servers they were awesome!  Everyone ordered from the new items and usual had a blast the house wine tasting was great we bought a bottle. Yummiest ever! Gracias to everyone involved we truly enjoyed all the meals and our servers! Remy and Megan probably spelled the names wrong .

The food has the same goodness and great taste as all other Olive Gardens. The wait staff tries to earn larger tips by fawning all over their customers at the table, sometimes a little to much which is when it becomes annoying and causes me to leave a lower tip. Speaking of tips, Olive Garden is one of the restaurants that lists what a 10%, 15% ,20% tip is at the bottom of your bill. However, they are taking the entire price of the bill, INCLUDING SALES TAX, which we all know that YOU DON'T TIP ON THE SALES TAX,, you TIP ONLY ON THE SUB-TOTAL OF THE BILL, before sales tax is added!

The food here is okay but I specially like the all you can eat breadsticks and salad they keep bringing you more and more and then you get filled up before the main entree when I order the entree I ordered the sausage and pasta Rustica and was mild not too spicy the sausages well done tasted great with the pasta and I would definitely go back just for the money 2 for great deal good service great wine selection and I would recommend it to a friend

I have never, ever, thought of Olive Garden when thinking about where I want to go eat, but because this place is popular, I often end up here with a group of usually-sane people.  Because of that, I've discovered a couple of things on the menu that I like, and that I might actually crave if enough time passed: the mussels appetizer and the mushroom ravioli with the sun-dried tomato sauce.  The mussels are flavorful and usually cooked well, and I have to say--I think I might actually REALLY like the raviolis.

Otherwise, the pastas are bland and over-cooked, the sauces are bland and depthless, the soups are bland and boring, the salads are okay, the bread is decent, and the desserts are forgettable--literally, because I actually can't remember even one.  Thankfully, I've found a couple of things that I enjoy, and I should also mention that my experience with the service here, so far, has been very good; a couple of times the service was a little slow, but it usually isn't, and it's always been friendly.  I feel, though, that I have to give two stars--and not three--because on the whole, the food there is pretty bad.  The service and the two things on the menu that I like are the reasons its not one star.
Terribly slow service. Ordered carry out and the place wasn't even busy but took forever to get us our food that we preordered an hour prior. It also smelled pretty bad in the restaurant.

Since when did only 'soup salad and breadsticks' cost $11?  You so crazy Olive Garden.

A few new dining options, including a small plates/Tapas section, are a much welcome addition to a typically ho-hum menu.  Our server was good, and when he asked if I wanted cheese on my food, I told him to 'cheese it up, my good sir.'  My date gave me a look because he was putting cheese on an already-cheesy pasta dish, but I countered her disapproving stare with "yo dawg, I heard you like cheese, so we put cheese on yo cheese".  Our sharp waiter picked up on the Xzibit meme, so kudos to him.

My Tour of Italy was good as per usual.  The salad didn't have any pepperoncini (those midsized green sport peppers), which are my favorite part of the whole damn thing.  It was nearing closing time @9:45pm so I didn't press for any dessert, but I know for a fact that their mini dolcini are both adorable and delicious.  Another solid outing at The OG.

A solid 3 stars. Service is hit or miss. Food is typical, mediocre Olive Garden fare. I recently went in after the construction on this building was complete. On a cold winter day, the soup, salad & breadsticks lunch completely hit the spot.

There are definitely a ton of little kids which are usually crying or screaming or throwing food. 

I had remembered that the Italian Sodas (or French if you prefer like me) were delicious on a visit over this past summer. This last visit they handed me an Italian Soda with - maybe - one squirt of cherry syrup. It was basically colored soda water. *Sad Face* The waitress did correct this for me which was very much appreciated.

Overall, if there is a wait time, I will skip this place. Totally not worth the long wait times. But every now and then it's a good place to stop.

We do not go to Olive Garden very often. In fact the last time we have been here was about 7 years ago, mainly because there isn't one in our area.  

The only thing I found odd was the fact that the dining room was practically empty when we arrived and they told us the wait was about 15 minutes, maybe less- we were the only family in the wait area.  We took a seat and then a minute later they called my name like the wait area was crowded. They could have been going through a shift change, but it was just one of those moments that leave you confused without an explanation. It didn't bother us, we just found it a little funny. 

Our server was fantastic (I think her name was Lexi?!) and patient (we had our children with us) and  answered our questions about menu items knowledgeably.   The children's menu was good. My son liked building his own meal and the stickers and crayons kept my toddler busy. The bread sticks and drinks were continuously refilled and we didn't have to ask for anything. The food was delicious and overall the price wasn't as high as we were expecting for the four of us. Our dining experience was very pleasant. 

If we are in the area again, we'd definitely come back.
