Havent been at Olive Garden for some time. I had my house salad with some yammy bteadsticks. For the main dinner, I had Grilled Chicken Tascano. Good combo of flavors. Of course, no dessert. I did nt even finish my main course. :) breadsticks were filing. Service was good enough. Speedy as well. Friendly atmosphere. Make sure to call ahead for your reservation if you do nt want to wait for a bit, especially on the weekends. Enjoy.

I like Olive Garden I think they have some good dishes decent service and wine. I just wish I could enjoy the nice atmosphere without screaming babies and children and running around the restaurant even when you try to go at a later hour. So I get my orders to go. Not really olive gardens fault just ignorant people I guess.

The waitress was very nice, but seriously hire some extra staff!! The service was absolutely terrible.  We waited for about 40 minutes for a salad and soup ???  Really ?? Then they forgot my chicken .  It's not the servers fault, she was the only one for the bar and dining room .  Seriously hire some more staff, you need it !
One of the best Italian foods in Naperville. The Food was great and the prices were good comparatively.I love the starters than the Entrees. The Smoothies are great too.

Great chain! Just got back from out of town and needed lunch BEFORE grocery shopping. The Olive Garden has a great kids menu, so we stopped here and weren't disappointed. We like how family friendly they are. We were surprised to see they have Gluten Free options, something we keep an eye on for family that comes to visit. 

The food and service are always good.

If you are going there for lunch than Kelsey is your co to sever! What a  prodigious server, where to even start on this service. I swear she has to be a mind reader with her uncanny yet delightful intuition for the things I needed, might have needed, and didn't even know I needed it yet. If I was even thinking about possibly in the future needing a refill, BAM, it was already there. On that note she's quick and stealthly like a ninja which is  l kind of cool if you think about it. She's also extremely knowable. She could easily be the Poindexter of olive garden. On top of all that she's genuine about everything she does. It's kind if you mixed mother Teresa with your own mother....long story short, she's simply the best

The service was good and if you find a food that you like, order that. My wife ordered something different that on TV looked great but after the food came it looked nothing like it at all. She said that the taste was not good and filled up on the soup and salad.

food was mediocre, service was too. Sad because we've loved Olive Garden for a long time. Being from California, we are familiar with the chain and have always had excellent customer service. This was was not excellent. I think the waitress was trying her best to be good, but just couldn't get it right. Definitely prefer other Italian restaurants in the area at this point.

My husband and I went here for a early dinner last night. We went and sat at the bar top. Which only has about 12 seats. A group of 4 girls had just gave the bartender their drink order as they waited for their table in the diningroom. Understanding the bartender was busy with that, we waited. Time went on, they got their drinks and the bartender proceeded to play with his closed out reciepts. He made eye contact with us, but proceeded to ask other at the bar if they needed anything. Not once did he say Hi, I'll be with you in a moment, NOTHING! Finally after 15 mins my husband said something to the bar back asking if we could get service. Hunter the bar back seemed nervous but helped us, even though it's not his job title. He was Great! Took great care of us for the rest of our evening. The "Bartender" if that's what you call this type of professional, never once looked or spoke to us. Although every other person who came to the bar top was greeted and acknowledged within moments. Even though we did recieve a glass of wine and appitizer on the house. Never once did the manager Jackie come by to apologize or make sure everything was ok. What a shame. 

Keep in mind I do work for a upscale restaurant in downtown Naperville. I understand the does and don't of the customer satisfaction "guidelines". 
I understand busy times and I understand being overwhelmed. But what I do not understand is when a customer is nonexistent. He was more worried about closing out his previous reciepts and getting his tips, other then simply saying, "I'll be with you in a moment!" 

For "this Bartender"  and his actions. We will not return to this location and we will tell everyone we know our experience with him! 


A side note for the MANAGERS. Thank goodness I wasn't a secret shopper. That wouldn't go over well.

Went here on a Friday night a couple of weeks ago. I make reservation a few hours before I showed up and had a table ready for us when we showed up. They food was very good. The soup and salad were delicious and all of our entrees came out piping hot. They're new chicken meatballs were out of this world. The staff was really nice and friendly but looked as if they were a bit understaffed. I really don't care if I have to wait a few minutes extra just as long as the food comes out hot. I will be back for sure.

I really used to enjoy going to Olive Garden, but the last 3 visits have all been pretty terrible, and I probably won't be giving them a fourth chance. With each of the last 3 visits, the first thing we've noticed is that the restaurant is really cold and uncomfortable. Wherever we sit, even far from the doors, there seem to be cold breezes which worsen throughout the meal. 

Heating, or lack there of, aside, our family seems to have a target for slow service, cold food, or incorrect food. We have had three different servers and I don't know if they are overworked or just really slow but we do not feel well taken care of. Although a server can't help a slow kitchen, it is very obvious that something is wrong when the server completely disappears from the floor and is nowhere to be seen for anything, including  the bill, drink refills, or orders to be placed. 

The first of our bad three visits included an over 30 minute wait for our food after we had received our soup/salads. When our food finally arrived, one of us received the wrong thing. The replacement amazingly only took a few minutes to arrive. The second visit netted one of us the wrong thing (spaghetti instead of cavatappi) and the spaghetti was soggy it was so overcooked. Our latest (and last) visit began with cold hot chocolate for two members of the group and ended with stone cold pasta for another member. The appetizers were tasty but pretty cold. With last night's meal, our server was gone for long periods of time and was quick to blame anyone but herself for the cold items. 

Each time, the kitchen was blamed, but when the food arrives completely cold, this seems more of a service issue than a kitchen issue. Also, the fact that the servers disappear for ages at a time is not a kitchen issue. When servers were aware of our dissatisfaction, we were offered free desserts but the manager never once approached us. I'm not sure if management has changed recently, but the service we receive has definitely declined. Olive Garden was once decent place to eat for the money but is now a complete let down.

The service is ABSOLUTE horrid. I'm writing this as I'm sitting at my table. They brought our food before we got our soup. What?!? I told them I don't want my food now, the runner looked utterly confused as I said we hadn't gotten our food yet. Never coming here again.

They have these new table top computers that they're trying to get you to play games on while you eat. Seriously? Is this a sports bar? Is there no one out there who wants a screen-free dinner experience anymore? Not to mention the things are probably total germ factories since I doubt they wipe them down after every customer. We were made to use the computer to pay, and if you choose to leave a tip, the lowest you can leave is 20%. The waitress didn't earn a 20% tip, but we didn't want to totally stiff her. This used to be my favorite restaurant, but I don't know if we'll go back. If we do, I'm asking them to take the computer off of the table first thing.

Unlimited soup, salad, and breadsticks is a great thing for $7.  But when the servers don't check up on you frequently, it's a bad thing.  

First, the "unlimited" food is served in a rather limited fashion.  My friend and I finished our first bowl of soup quickly and had to wait for our server to ask for a second bowl.  The soup, chicken & gnocchi, barely had either of those ingredients in it.  It was mostly broth and shredded veggies.  The salad was fine, typical Olive Garden salad.  The breadsticks were hard (how is that possible before noon?), and we had to ask for more breadsticks.  You're running a lunch special, but the bread isn't fresh?  That's a red flag to me.

Our server was really slow on refilling our drinks.  I again had to ASK for a refill when my glass was noticeably empty.  He was friendly, but either didn't notice or ignored our need for more items.

I stopped going here years ago for pasta.  But now I don't think I'll go back for their soup, salad & breadstick special either.  It took more than an hour to be served and I started to feel like a cow because I had to keep asking for things.

First of all, I probably go to Olive Garden about 5 times a year, My experience yesterday in Naperville was Tops!  My Server, Kelsey, treated me like I was her only client.  I realized that she had other customers that she was serving, but she was very attentive to my needs.  My salad bowl was never empty, my breadsticks were replenished before I was out of bread.  My Soup was delivered before I had time to wait.  Overall, Kelsey was the best server I have ever had in an Olive Garden.  It was definitely the best Olive Garden experience ever.  (I have had other times that the service was great but Kelsey has set the bar very high!)  I won't be disappointed in the future, but it would take a lot to improve on this visit.

Went for a dinner one day with the family, we had a 20 min wait before we settled in, the service was great, they have online order service at each table where in the kids menu can be ordered and it was quick, however, the entree service took a lil bit of time never theless the food was delicious and the service.

Overall Very disappointing experience. My girlfriend and I were planning on going to Carabbas but they were closed for lunch so we came here. For an appetizer we got the risotto bites which were adequate at best, no real flavor at all, very disappointing. For the entree I got the chicken parmesan sandwich which was very chewy, dry and flavorless; chic fi la has a better chicken sandwich. The girlfriend liked her lasagna so I'll give this place an extra star for that.

it's so average.....why did I let my kids make me come here???  ive had better food on airplanes.

the only thing here worth eating is the salad.  I have to admit it is pretty good.

but.....how does this place keep filling the seats?  I have no idea.  it had been 10 years for me...and for sure will be at least another 10.

We went with a big group and this Olive Garden and it was no problem for them. The food was all good and fresh. The prices are a little high, but that is how Olive Garden is and if you are hungry you can make it worth your while. The salad and breadsticks were awesome, so definitely take advantage of those.

The Naperville Olive Garden is not worth the time I spend driving to it.  (We live 10 minutes away.)  Since my daughter's diet is limited, we go there to pick up dinner about once a month.  I was told it would be ready at 6:15 pm and I asked how much it would be.  The girl who took the order told me it wasn't her regular job so she didn't know (Duh).  I arrived promptly at 6:15pm.  The one girl at the front station totally ignored me so I continued on to the bar where I have always picked up our meals.  The bartender ignored me even when I told him I was there for a pickup.  No help or attention at all for 10 MINUTES.    Then after 2 more people arrived, they asked the 3rd person if she was there for a pickup, then turned to me and asked me if I was  there for a pickup (another DUH).  Needless to say, I didn't offer a tip.  Didn't their mothers ever tell them it's gauche to ask for money??

I arrived home 10 minutes later and the FOOD WAS COLD, STONE COLD.  I will never go back to that restaurant again, I'll spend an extra few minutes and try the one in Oswego.

An additional note:  for a restaurant with such a large population of older people, their driveway and parking was a mess -- full of ruts.  They could spend a few dollars and put salt out and then have it plowed.  Please!  We do it for our driveways, they could do it for theirs.
Food was obviously under a heat lamp for a while. It was okay. service was a bit slow even though it wasn't busy.
Service was great fast and friendly. .food was good..wish they had more options for the buy one take one
I love Olive Garden! I love their soups, salad, and pasta. I'm so sad they got rid of seafood portofino. Now I resort to chicken and shrimp carbonara or braised beef tortellini. They are pretty good.

I know that Italian Restaurants are expensive, but I do enjoy Olive Gardens menu a bit more than others. The ambiance is romantic, but not to the point where is not "kid friendly" like some fancy restaurants. You can't go wrong with the delicious and salad and bread sticks but my weakness as well as others is filling up to much on that. 

Ask for lunch portion sizes (although you can't get away with everything on the menu with that). Everything is delicious and cooked well on the menu!  I don't think they do reservations (which is not cool) so you will expect a long wait on a weekend night. The service is good, I feel like the servers know the menu well. They are very busy, so you probably won't always get the warmth you want. 

Going around at 5 for an early dinner is your best bet! It packs up fast after that. Also, Italian Garden beats Carrabbas and that other Italian Restaurant (next to Meijers) on Route 59.

I have had good and less than wonderful experiences at this location. Today, however, there was no wait time for a table (just for two people). Service was prompt and courteous by a bright, cheerful and attentive server named Kristina. It appears that the management has cleaned up their act since a less than positive experience two summers ago. This seems to be a very high traffic location ostensibly due its location on Route 59 near the myriad shopping venues.

I ordered a dish that did not include pasta and it was fine. The endless salad was welcome.

The place has been remodeled in the past year and one can still smell the paint.  It does look better. It does not look like they were able to do much to the men's bathroom. It has a goofy layout, but works. To do it well, they should tear the place down and put a new facility, like the one in Bolingbrook.

For me, Olive Garden is certainly not a first choice for dinner, but if you're looking for lunch above a fast food level experience, on the go, then it's fine. It can work for office get togethers, such as when someone is moving on, etc. However, I doubt that anyone with a thoughtful heart seriously plans Nonna Livia's 90th birthday celebration there.

So, give it a go.  They even have some gluten-free selections.

My waiter name was Aaron and he was extremely helpful and funny. It was lunchtime and busy but he made sure he kept our glasses filled and our desires met. He also laughed at my mother's corny jokes. Cant wait to return to this Olive garden and im definitely asking for him.

Oh goodness. Olive Garden is like part of the fabric of Midwest Suburbia. Anyway, I hadn't been here since um.. elementary school, but my mom got a giftcard from work, so here we were. As I braced myself for another suburban chain restaurant with packaged crayons.. and yes, plastic grapes hanging from the ceiling (I'm not sure who decided this would make it look classier??), I pretty much got what I expected.

Stuffed mushrooms swimming in butter and standard pasta dishes I could have made at home. The tortelloni with braised beef and portobello with a basil marsala sauce was not bad. And the "side salad" that comes with your meal is just HUGE. Also, I actually really like the marinara dip that comes with the calamari. 

Hm I guess the breadsticks are always good here (fond childhood memory).

Olive garden is a great place to eat. I like that they change up their menu for specials. Is this authentic Italian Food? Hell, I wouldn't know. Never been to Italy. But, the things that they do, they do well and I'm a fan. It's pretty inexpensive and the breadsticks rock and roll. So, I'll continue going when I want a cheap "Italian food fix".

The two stars was for my waiter that checked in on me but I will have to say not the best I've had @ olive garden,  I had the chicken Masala! My water had some stuff flotting around in it so I didn't drink nor ask for another glass!

The management at this place is not good.  I feel bad for the staff here there is not enough to cover all the customers. That being said the food was not great my pasta was bad I have had better in a frozen microwave dinner. I would not recommend eating here.

The food was forgettable (we didn't even take home leftovers) but the service was nice.

We won't make the mistake of going to Olive Garden again.  You can get much better quality Italian food for the same price elsewhere.
Great food.. as previously assumed but my waiter had a terrible attitude.

We stopped this place a few months ago.  Service was slow.  The interior was  ok.
 
While the TV commercials were promising, the food could be better.  The portion is tiny relative to the price.  I would prefer Applebee's over this place.  If you have a taste for Italian food, drop by Maggiano's over by Freedom Drive in Naperville. Or if you want somewhere closer - try Fontano's Subs.  The food taste way better for the price at these places.

This is a GREAT location!!!  The food was great and the service was fantastic!!

My husband and I went in for lunch around noon.  We were seated right away, and that was a big plus.  Our waitress (shoutout to Dana!!) came right away and discussed the drink specials.  She took our drink orders, and then asked us if we were on any kind of time constraint.  This was a big plus in my book because my husband DID need to get back to the office since he was only on his lunch break.  I though that was really thoughtful.

We ordered appetizer when you choose three from the list: We got the ravioli, calamari, and fried zucchini.  They came out fast, piping hot and delicious.  I ordered the Venetian Chicken w/ the pasta e fagioli soup, and my husband got the lasagna rollata w/ minestrone.  

Dana was really good about our breadstick and soup refills (woohoo!) and was really on top of the timing of when things came out and asking us if we were ready for certain courses or if we were ready for our soup--it was a nice change from other experiences at other restaurants I've had where they just put in orders and bring them out whenever THEY feel like it.  We also ordered the apple crostada which was really good! 

I will be dining at this location again--the food was delicious, and our waitress was phenomenal :)

Yesterday was our first trip to this O.G. since I was craving pasta, and my bf had only been to an Olive Garden once in his life, over 10yrs ago. 

The hostess and waitress were both fantastic. My legs were having a particularly painful day, and the hostess offered to seat us closer to the door, and asked if we'd like a booth so I could elevate my legs. The waitress made suggestions and anticipated our needs. 

We split an appetizer of the Smoked Mozzarella Fonduta with little toasted Tuscan bread slices. REALLY good. I could've had a 2nd order. Salty, creamy, yum.

The big bowl of salad that you split when you order salad with your meal? Less than half-full. Not that we could even finish it. But I was still surprised. Maybe they're cutting costs? Would've liked to see the prices reflect that, if so.

I had the new Four Cheese Sacchetti with Chicken. The 2 chicken breasts were average, not bad, but nothing special. The pasta was kinda dry, wish it'd had more sauce on it. Tasty, otherwise.  My boyfriend had the Chicken Scampi and said he really liked it.  

No room for dessert, though I was happy to see they now have the option of the mini-desserts now.  Will have to go back and try some of the desserts!

One of my favorite Olive Garden restaurants. The food is very good and the portions are huge. I always have plenty to take home. The staff is always friendly and I always have a great experience there. 

My only issue is the parking is horrible. I've almost gotten into a couple of fender benders trying to go through their one way road around the restaurant. I usually end up parking in the back of the restaurant.

Love this location. I live 3 minutes from the Oswego location, however would prefer to drive out to this one. Hosts and servers are always very nice and attentive. Even if you go on a busy weekend, service is fast and the staff checks in on their tables. The food is awesome, especially considering it's a chain restaurant ;-)

I feel as I have underestimated olive garden for far too many years.  Its a place I have relegated in my memory as the dinner place for junior high dances.  I don't know what drew me back but I have to say the service has been great (including a "how is your meal" visit from the manager on each visit),  prices aren't bad, and the food is decent.  I am quite guilty of abusing the all-you-can eat soup/salad/bread sticks policy and won't lie, its what will keep me coming back.

It's pretty much what you'd expect.  Not bad food, but not very good either.  Recipes for the masses .. nothing that really stands out.  My daughter really loves it ... but she is 11 ... there is one chicken, pasta and broccoli entree that she begs for, so from the child's viewpoint it as a good restaurant.  I go there because she thinks it's a treat.

The service is usually very good and the prices are right.

I already love olive garden as it is but between justin the manager making sure everything was good, our server was even better, one of the best iv had in a long time, this particular olive garden was amazing :) I feel like anyone who is giving this place anything less than 4 stars is just being ridiculous and are thinking too much about it. every olive garden is the same it just all depends on when it was built for the exterior/interior. The food just like any place you order from there can be a mess up from time to time we are all human including the cooks definitely not a reason to give this place a bad rating. Needless to say I love this olive garden.

Parking is horrible. I showed up Saturday late afternoon very crowded. I was told the wait will be 20 min. for a table for 2. We got seated in 15. Very happy with that. Waitress was really good, very professional. She had to deal with a very difficult family. The rest of the staff really helped her out to maintain great service!!! The only reason I'm not putting 5 stars is the parking, the service and quality of food is worth the wait for every time I have been there!!!!

We went there last night and wanted to celebrate our 2nd wedding anniversary...it started off ok with having a waitress that was in training and she was ok....then once a large party with really loud obnoxious kids show up, we can get either of their attention.  Luckily a nice waitress saw this and helped us box up our leftovers and get our bill.  I usually am ok with this location, now we will probably stick with the Bolingbrook or Orland Park location, much better customer service.
Ordered a chicken fettucini Alfredo with Toscana soup..and got a whopping 2..yes..2!!! Bread sticks..check your food before your leave..economy and all aside..2 bread sticks!? Camon'

I went here for a late-afternoon lunch on a Saturday, and the place was still pretty full, like pretty much any Olive Garden.  I knew more or less what to expect, but I still came because I had a gift card.

The food and setup is pretty standard - soup or salad comes with every entree.  The problem is that our waiter didn't bring a spoon for the soup or a bowl for the salad apart from the serving bowl.  He also didn't offer cheese to go with it.  By the time my wife had flagged the waiter down (he was hard to find) and gotten a spoon for the soup, the entrees were already there - and suspiciously fast.  I'm not sure how they could have reheated the food so quickly.  The food was kind of floury/salty, and the waiter was "creepy."  With that said, if I end up with another gift card, I will go back.  It can be worth the price - if it's subsidized.

I've been to this Olive Garden on several occasions over the last 10 years. I've only had 1 good experience with this particular location. That would be my most recent visit. Maybe they're under new management now (God I hope so!) because before my most recent visit, the staff was rude, not helpful at all, never checked up on us, took almost 40 minutes to bring our food to us (This includes soups and salads as well as appetizers), no refills on drinks, etc. It's just been so awful. The only reason I'd go there ever is because my friends live in Aurora, and they always want to go to the Olive Garden. I like the one in Downers Grove the best. I must say though, the last time I was at this location, the service was just fine and everything was brought out in a timely manner and I didn't feel like they were ignoring us. So maybe things are starting to change over there.

I went to this Olive Garden last Saturday evening with two girlfriends. It always surprises me at how long the wait for a table at a chain like this can be. Now, they were nice enough to walk around with a hot, fresh cheese pizza to nibble on while we waited for our table. I just moved them up to Three Stars. The waitress seemed like she had somewhere else to be. Working in a restaurant requires you to be a service-oriented person. At least pretend like you care just a little about our business...please? Moving on...the breadsticks were fresh. I have the pasta fasuil (sp) and it was tasty. One of my girlfriends had the salad which was crispy and dressed properly with the soup as well. My other girlfriend has spaghetti which she said was fine. Our glasses were often empty, but the food was fine. The toasted ravioli is one of my favorites!  But, I won't head back here on purpose, but if we are in the area and someone else has a hankering for OG, then I will give them a try again.
I went there last Sat with my mom, food was not bad. I ordered the Shrimp pasta dish and my mom ordered the seafood pasta dish. The dishes were okay. But service was pretty slow.

Ah Olive Garden - my old friend. It's always a good place for that comfort food. I prefer to order take out because the service isn't that great. But the food is always changing which I like so I can try different things. Nothing super over the top, but like I said good comfort food for a pretty reasonable price.

I can never come to this Olive Garden again.  We were there on Christmas Eve with a large party of 18.  We thought it would be such an easy alternative to someone hosting, especially with kids.  Wrong.  Two servers assigned yet we waited 20 minutes for someone to even take our drink order (and I saw one of them standing around waiting for his buddy).   Two and a half hours after we got there, our entrees arrived.  Well some of them.  My brother's was wrong but the waiter suggested he eat it anyway because well, he ordered it from the kitchen correctly.  The other two missing ones came about a half an hour later.  Our compensation was a couple of free kids meals which is really funny because that's not what was missing and they cost about $5 -- less than a drink.   It wasn't the waiters so much, they got some things right for sure, I think it must start from the management (or lack of?).  The kitchen was way off, the general attitude was way off.   Its just not working as it should.

"It just keeps getting better and better."  from will and grace

not really!  Average at best "fake" Italian food, but who can complain for this price.  The best deal in town is the soup and salad combo.

I recommend the Pasta e fegoli.  Yummers!
Food was decent, however service sucked. So slow on refills, breadsticks, everything. They need to get it together!
Our regular breakfast spot for years now. Omelets are always delicious. Kitchen is fast. Try the Hungry Man omelet. Yummy! Niko is a fantastic host. He really knows his business.
Great food, great service, Nikos is one of the few places you can get pretty much anything on the menu

Stopped on here on the way home from Joliet. Cute little diner of a place, I got crepes and the boyfriend didn't really like what he got he said it was bland and the peppers and avocados were huge chunks and would of preferred them chopped smaller. Mine was pretty good except I ordered crispy bacon as a side and the waitress comes to my table and says "are these too burnt for you"  ok first of all of you have to ask, don't even bring it to my table hahah I was like what the hell haha it was charcoal for sure so I said umm yea that's pretty burnt lol and she went back and got me more which were better, I just thought it was funny she even would think to not only bring me bacon she knows is black but to announce it once she got to the table too lol anyway cute little diner, owner is really nice and walks around saying hello to everyone, they have some good options I'd say stop in

So on our day off today we decided to make a trip to Nikos  to try out their breakfast and see what all the hype was about.

We arrived and there were a few people there, which surprised me for a late Monday morning. Our server was very friendly.

Due to all the reviews I read about the portions being so huge, the hubby and I decided to share a skillet. The server was so kind to have the chef cook and split everything for us and we didn't even request it. We ordered the veggie skillet. My hubs felt it needed more veggies. The flavor was good the hash browns were terrific and they were my favorite part. The veggies were good as well as the eggs. We also each got a slice of cantaloupe and it was great.

We got pancakes for the side. The pancakes were delicious, light and fluffy. I didn't like the syrup though, the flavor tasted different.

I ordered the Nutella crepes, per our servers recommendation, they were topped with strawberries, bananas and whip cream and a tiny drizzle of Nutella. The crepes were a bit eggy tasting for me but the fruit was good. I do wish they put more Nutella as it was very scarse and the flavor did not shine through. 

Overall the food was decent, the prices were great, the service was excellnt. Was it the big hype everyone made it out to be? Not really. I didn't find anything about it to stand out above and beyond your typical breakfast place.
Great service, everyone seems genuinely happy. The health nut omelet (substitute spinach for green onions) and pumpkin pancakes were delicious
Been here many times and I never get disappointed... Food and service are always great, not to mention that the owner is always walking around making sure all is well. Will definitely come back
I tried this place bc of all the good reviews. Went with family and no one enjoyed their food... disgusting.

Niko's is the place to eat! We are from out of town and came to Niko's because it had great reviews. It did not disappoint! Excellent Spanish omelette. Pancakes were fluffy and delicious. Niko and his staff were so friendly and our food came out quickly. We'll definitely be back when we come through this area!!

Just from the outside its not a place id typically be dying to go in and try, but I decided one day that me and my boyfriend should give it a shot. Most places don't last more than a year if they aren't doing it right, this place has been here for awhile now and has to be doing well I assumed.
      Great food, great waitresses both time we went. Cute little place that's close to home and has big portions for the price you pay. We will be back again I'm sure.
This place was not good at all. The food was pass dry and the service was not good at all. Mr Niko said hi to everyone there table by table and pass us up, like we was not there.

This is the best breakfast place in the area. Don't tell anyone but ask for the red potatoes instead of the hash browns, you won't be disappointed. Pancakes are really good and if they have it try the red velvet French toast!! Niko is A really nice guy who truly cares for his costumers, no one I would rather give my money to!!
Stumbled upon this great breakfast place before playing golf and was delighted with food, service.  A great spot with an extensive breakfast including some interesting variations.

Love the place. My girlfriend and I go at least once a month. The staff is always friendly, the owner even walks the floor to say hello to everyone. The countryside skillet is highly recommend as well as their Benedicts.

Fast and friendly service. Impressed with this whole in the wall minus the crack in my water glass. Else I would have given 4 stars. I had the streak and eggs, steak was well cooked, eggs were a little underdone, but I ordered them over easy so that's understandable.

My husband and I dined at Niko's for breakfast for the first time this morning.  The restaurant is your typical breakfast place with booths and tables and a counter across the back of the restaurant.  The decor needs updating...it's outdated.  The menu has a lot of choices and so many different combos for skillets and omelettes.  My husband had the Eggs Benedict and I had the Health Nut omelette, which was an egg white omelette with turkey bacon, avocado, green onions and low-fat cheese served with salsa.  We both thought our food was good and portion size was generous.  Our server Jess was attentive and friendly.  She offered soup to go, which I think is the restaurant's practice.  Very nice touch.  I used the women's restroom before I left the restaurant, and it was not in the best shape..the floor was dirty and the wastebasket too full.  Nothing turns me off than a dirty bathroom.  However, the food and service was good and I would definitely go back.

My wife and I visit this location a few times a month on weekends. The service, and the food, are always phenomenal. The owner, Niko, can be seen greeting guests, and ensuring that everyone is having the best experience possible. That is not something you see very often!

Free cantaloupe with every entree is a nice touch, and they will also sometimes give you a free bagged up soup to go! Every visit here is an amazing value. 

This place can sometimes be packed on the weekend, but that is a good problem to have in the restaurant business. We have never waited more than 10 minutes for a table, and service is always expedient. 

My wife and I will continue visiting this location until the day we pass from this earth (or until we move away!)

5_stars. Every time.

First time here ...and what a gem in a strip mall. Food and service outstanding  ..and the owner himself was clearing tables and asking how we are. I will for sure be back and bring my pops. Price is right and portions plentiful. Can't believe the one to attention that this place gives each customer as I sat and watched..try this place out you won't be disappointed!

Niko's is a small diner with lots of potential.  By potential, I'd like to point out that hanging PAPER PLATES from the light fixtures, even if they are 4th of July themed, is grossly tacky.  Not to mention, it's early May.  But hey, if the food is fantastic, you go ahead and dangle whatever you want from the ceiling!

The best thing about Niko's is that they serve an inexpensive breakfast & lunch menu.  I think all of the entrees were less than $10, and the portions are huge.  Don't be disillusioned - large portions don't make up for the fact that the food isn't great.  It's mediocre in many ways and not at all the 4.5 star rating that is reflected on Yelp.

I had the Monte Cristo, which was good, but could have been better if the French toast wasn't soggy.  I regretted not ordering the strawberry crepes, but if I had ordered those, would I have regretted not ordering the sandwich?  The sandwich was served with a mound of fries and a bowl of chicken noodle soup.  The soup was VERY salty.  My husband said his breakfast was good though.  Niko's could be better if they focused more on the quality of the food and less on the delivery of portion size.  

SIGH.  

'MERICA.

The service was terrible.  So many reviews mention the owner, presumably Niko, walking around and greeting people.  Our SERVER didn't stop to say hello or take a proper drink order.  She stood at the next table and hollered, "coffee?" over her shoulder.  She served my husband a cup of coffee but didn't stop to ask what I wanted to drink.  They didn't stop to drop off water at the table either - which she later blamed on the bus boy but never acknowledged her own errors. 

When she returned with my husband's coffee, she quickly walked away.  When she came back to take our food order, I also asked for an iced tea.  She forgot my drink again when she delivered our food.  There wasn't even a quick "sorry!" to acknowledge us.  Not surprisingly, she dragged her feet with refills and didn't bother adding any ice to my ICED tea.

It wasn't busy when we arrived, we were seated immediately when we walked in, so this server appeared to buckle under no pressure at all.

The food and the price is the selling point here, so an A-OK 3 stars it is.  The service really needs improvement though.  I might go back to try those strawberry crepes or bananas foster waffles, but you're more likely to spot me and my pocketbook at a place I haven't tried yet before duplicating efforts at Niko's again.

Been eating at Niko's for months and generally enjoy the food. However, this morning my food contained a little packet of whipped butter where someone removed the lid and then replaced it with clear tape, and then put the lid back over it. I don't know if someone was trying not to be wasteful but you just don't serve something like that to customers. I will never eat there again.

Irish plate, eggs over medium, wheat toast with a side of hollandaise sauce.  That's my order and everything about it is perfect.  Do this and you essentially end up with a corned beef hash breakfast.  The strawberry OJ is great as well.   I go to this place all the time for breakfast, so why might you ask does it only get four stars?  The owner can be rather intense if it's crowded.  It's just common sense to express your anger out of the view of the public but come in here for breakfast on a weekend and he's bound to erupt on some poor waitress.

There are plenty of options on the menu and everything is of pretty good quality for breakfast. Part of me wishes this was a 24 hour denny's type of diner so I can enjoy some higher quality late night eats that this neighborhood needs.

Niko's is the best restaurant in Romeoville for breakfast and lunch. I am there at least 3 or more times a week. I have never been disappointed with anything......the food and the staff are excellent. But it would seem someone named Vaughan J ( who is a women if you read some prior posts at other locations) has some issues with Niko's???? I have seen both Niko and his staff make "things" right with any customer who has food or service issues. Let's face it some people are very demanding and expect things to be perfect. Any business has issues beyond their control.
People calling in sick , unexpected crowds ( a good thing in the restaurant business) and demanding customers who would rather write a bad review on Yelp than talk with someone to make things right. I find Vaughan J's recent review on Niko's comical and totally incorrect. My advice to people who use Yelp to find a restaurant is.....go to Niko's Breakfast Club in Romeoville and you'll be happy you made the trip!

I come here so often because their breakfast is truly excellent. I always order to go and my food comes perfectly packaged. They think of everything: knife, fork, ketchup, jelly, etc all packed neatly. Food is always hot and tasty. My favorite is a mozzarella and spinach omelette after the gym!
Fantastic food, courteous staff and a very engaging owner. Can't say enough good things, will be back!!
Eh, your typical Greek diner. Service wasn't too good and food was so so. Probably better places in the area.
My husband and I do our best to visit Nico's as much as possible! We absolutely love it! The food is ALWAYS great, the service is wonderful, and the atmosphere is one-of-a-kind and home-y!

Love Nikos! We've been here a few times for breakfast now. The food is great, the staff is friendly and attentive, it's reasonably priced, it's clean, and the service is quick. Even when they were busy at 9am on a Saturday we were sat immediately. The owner is super sweet, and he's actually there all the time. It's nice to see a business owner who cares about/talks to their customers, and actually helps the wait staff clean tables, seat guests, ring out checks, etc. Definitely a place worth checking out.
First time here.  Food was good. I had eggs southern Benedict and my wife had the Monte Cristo. Niko introduced himself and was very friendly as was the staff. We will be back for sure.

I'm not a big breakfast person, but my wife loves it. I'm constantly being dragged to these places. As breakfast places go this one is very good. The service is always prompt and the food is very good. What more can you ask for. They also have a pretty extensive menu, as do most breakfast restaurants. All in all a great little place.
The food is delicious, and affordable. Plus the service is good. I don't see how anyone can write a bad review about this place.
Great hospitality, terrific food, cheerful service...what more could you ask for?  Looking forward to our next visit!

My husband and I love to eat brunch at Niko's! If you get here before 10:00 am on a Sunday, there's not much of a crowd. Even after that, we only ever have to wait for maybe 15 minutes, and the food is worth the wait!

My favorite dish is the raspberry cream crepes. My husband loves the bacon waffles (with a side of bacon).

Nikos is a wonderful family restaurant. All of their meals are delicious.  Their servings are huge,  they don't skimp on the ingredients you can't beat the prices.  They're always super friendly and remember a friendly face.
Food was good but more $ than usual. Very crowded but pleasant. Nothing special really, water had a very unpleasant taste.

I thought this would be our new breakfast spot when I don't feel like cooking. This is my second weekend coming here as the first experience was really enjoyable I decided to come here again today. Niko was here greeting last Sunday, I observed him visit every table to ask how they enjoyed everything. Had I decided to review after the initial visit, i would have rated at minimum 4 stars being the wait was 20 minutes and the waiting area is very small, we were nearly touching and I'm one for personal space. Now fast-forward to my visit this afternoon. I decided to take my mom for lunch it's just after 1pm and the place is not crowded, we were immediately seated mind you I'm happy about this. I ordered the same thing I had last week. After a quick glance I took note that Niko was nowhere to be seen and with that my visit was pretty much the opposite of last weekend, granted I will likely not return. Thinking to myself is it when the "boss" is away the service is piss poor. I asked for a straw twice, mistakes happen I get it. I asked for no pork in my omelette and was served an omelette with ham, mistakes happen I get it. I returned the plate to the waitress and started eating my pancakes which were pretty good. Maybe I should have just ate those, paid, and left. Upon the rest of my food being served (again) I started eating my food and I was drawn to the heat of hot pepper on my tongue however nothing I ate should've had pepper (omelette and hashbrowns).  I begin to examine the food and plate. Thinking to myself where did this heat come from as my mouth is literally on fire. I noticed there was food stuck to the side of plate, I wondered if the plate was in fact just not cleaned prior to the food being plated. Hopefully that wasn't the case but I sincerely wanted to located this heat that was burning my tongue. I spoke with the waitress about it and she stated the cook probably had my food too close to something else that was being cooked on the grill...mistakes happen but the restaurant was not crowded not even half full. I gave her my plate because at this point I couldn't eat anything else. Upon checking out, when asked how'd I enjoy everything I informed the lady of what happened (mind you my mouth is still on fire) and she said I should have told them to fix it over. As I paid the bill I thought to myself...I should have waited a third time? Craziness. I decided to get this review over with while sitting in the parking lot. My tongue is still burning as I am not a fan of anything that hot especially when it's unexpected. My mom didn't finish her food, she said the bacon was salty and decided against a to go box. So much for our lunch outing prior to Mother's Day!
Food...was great. I ordered the frittata with the blue cheese in it ( can't remember the name of the dish. Good food, good service
This was one of the best breakfasts I have ever had. Huge menu, friendly and efficient staff and delicious food. I will definitely be coming back.

One of my favorite places! 
Everything from the pancakes, Crepes, French toast, and even those skillets have all been amazing! Their best selling is the Countryside Skillet. Comes with ham, bacon, sausage, peppers, mushrooms, an egg prepared how you like, cheese, and those delicious hash browns! The price is great for the amount of food you get, compared to other places! 
The freshly squeezed orange juice is great too!  Love coming here!

Thanks again Yelp, needed a place to have a nice breakfast. I ordered the Nicos skillet special. Over easy eggs on top of crispy hash browns, steak, peppers, and Monterey cheese. Excellent combination, and gives you plenty of food. Only in the area because of work, but if I ever come back. I will definitely come here again.

Shame on me for not knowing this place even existed. I recently received their Clipper magazine promo in the mail which sparked my interest. Apparently they have been open for 5 years with a second location in Oaklawn.

I was greeted by the owner (Niko) immediately upon entering. He is sort of a funny guy calling everyone "maestro". My server was a friendly gal quick on the coffee refills and also had a humorous side to her which was much appreciated. 

I ordered the Black & Bleu Burger served with mushrooms, bacon and bleu cheese on a toasted bun. It was cooked just the way I requested (medium) served with a side of skin on fries. The side garnish was lettuce, tomato and onions as well as fruit. To be honest it was plentiful and includes your choice of soup or salad. All this for only $7.99.

Don't let their location in a strip mall fool you. They have quite the extensive menu ranging from fresh squeezed Strawberry-Orange Juice...YEAH I SAID IT...strawberry orange juice. As I glanced around the room I noticed omelettes, frittatas, scramblers, crepes, waffles, quesadillas, chopped salads and wraps. Lots going on here.

I will definitely be back to give their breakfast a try since that is what they are known for.

OPEN 7 DAYS A WEEK 6AM-3PM.
Good food at a great price, ask for Jess(she waited on us and did a fine job). The strawberry orange juice was very good.
Greeted right away. Friendly server. Great menu choices!! Homey feel environment. Food is flavorful , fresh ingredients . Definitely will be back!!

One of the best breakfast places I've been to. The setting is cozy, almost home-like. The owners and staff are very pleasant and courteous. Kids are very well taken care of. Coffee is perfect for breakfast. The fresh-squeezed Orange strawberry juice was unbelievable! We shared frittata and omelette and both were delectable. When we were paying at the counter, the owner gave us chicken soup for the kids after she knew that we were going to be on the road for a while - totally blew us off our feet. I'm sure we will be visiting again!

This yelp is so long overdue. This place is the business!!! Couple of friends and I were on our way to Chicago and I decided to search Urbanspoon for a nice but different spot. They got a pretty high rating on there so we decided to give it a try. It's a very unassuming place but the service and food are excellent. We ordered a few dishes to start such as the skillet, hash, and pancakes and somehow our appetites expanded. We couldve been rolled out by the time we were done. Unfortunately I dont live close by but you can count on a visit EVERY time I'm headed to Chicago.
Great food. Fantastic service and fair prices for the portions. Found our new breakfast spot. :-)

By far the best breakfast place in the area. Outstanding service, the place is always packed, the servers are always hopping and my coffee never becomes empty. The food selection is great and it is always very flavorful and comes out fresh and hot!  The prices are very fair and with the great service it is a great value for a great breakfast. My only complaint is that they close by 2 or 3, I wish I could go for dinner sometime!
Always has friendly staff and the owner is very genuine! The food always comes out fast and hot even when the restaurant is packed!
Amazing breakfast with huge portions and low prices. Super fast service. All employees are very friendly. Highly recommended.

You will never leave here hungry! The food is great, wait staff is wonderful and friendly. Quick seating and served just as fast. You really can't beat the prices. I love the chickens decorations too!
Very good breakfast joint. I had the veggie skillet. Good fresh veggies. Hot pancakes and good turkey sausages.?

Niko's is amazing quality food! I moved to the area in May and quickly found this place! I'm glad I did! I order food from here almost once a week and have never had a bad meal!  Their soups are to delicious, their burgers are great and their breakfast is to die for! Keep up the good work Niko!

Nikos is our favorite place to go for breakfast & lunch we go almost every weekend. Sometimes twice  lol
The service is superb, the portions are wonderful, they dont skimp on any of the ingredients and the owner always comes up to greet you as you were family!
Always always delicious!!!!!
Best breakfast I've ever had. The owner is there constantly to ensure that everyone there has a great meal

This place is pretty good for quick service and nice menu selection. They have a lot of creative choices where some other breakfast restaurants are lacking. Will definitely be back. One of the better breakfast spots in the area.

Two thumbs up for this place! We've been going to crispy waffle since we moved in last year to the Joliet area. It was okay for our breakfast once a week, but I wanted to try something new so I looked up so breakfast joints in the area and this had the best reviews. After visiting I understand why. This place is better, for so many reasons. First the wait staff here is super friendly and attentive.  Second the food is much better, and the portions are bigger. I think pricing is about the same, but you automatically get fresh fruit with your breakfast a Nikos included in the price. I'm always ordering a side of fruit so that is a huge plus for me. The decor is like being at your grandma's house in the 80's. So many chickens! It's amusing to me though. I always notice something different. I think a modern upgrade to the decor would be nice, but I'm not there for the scenery. The food is always great, the place is clean and the servers do a wonderful job. This is our new go-to place for breakfast.
Amazing food and service I will 100% be back everyone here is very nice including the owner Niko! :)
Omg! So good!!! The food is great! All though walking in you might question it. Lol there is rooster statues everywhere!

another gem, will miss coming here on sun mornings when i move, ive tried a dozen things on the menu they are all good im partial to the irish plate. reminds me of going to the dinners when i was a kid with my parents.
Portions were huge. Niko himself sent over fresh rolls and said we were too skinny. People are friendly, food is delicious, decor is warm and homey.

My boyfriend and I just left Nikos not even 5minutes ago, and I made a yelp account just to write this review (that's how good it is). 

I ate at the other nikos location (oak lawn) last time I was in the Chicago area, and made a point to visit again.   This time around we were in a rush, and so the Owner(?) himself went to the kitchen to aid the cook in having our food out to us in less than 3minutes! The service itself is worth of praise, but the California omelette  is in a league of it's own. Large portions, friendly staff, and incredibly fast delicious food.

This is one of my favorite places to eat breakfast. Quick turn around time makes for a short wait if any. Food comes quick. Excellent!!! Delicious and huge portions. The staff is great too! Highly recommend. We always bring our out of town guests over and over!!!
Had a great breakfast and excellent service. I really liked the California Crepes! The food came very quickly.
Been coming here for a few years. Good service, quick seating and Niko is always greeting people personally.
A regular breakfast spot for us. Omlets are consistently good. Good service and Niko is a great host.
Great food and unbelievably fast. Great service with the personal touch from Niko himself! Last time I had the low carb omelet,  mmmm!  Nikos is the best for breakfast or lunch!

Came to eat brunch with my girlfriends before leaving my wonderful girls weekend in Chicago and got the Santa Fe frittata. It was filled with avocado, cheese, and bacon while the sides consisted of american diced potatoes and their 3 layer stack famous pancakes. The great thing was that it was all under $8.99 for all that food along with a cup of joe!

 It was quite delicious! I will most definitely be back when I visit Chicago! :)
Food was good, just kind of an average breakfast place! Will return to try some other things!
The best breakfast restaurant I've ever been to. Everything on the menu is delicious and the service is amazing! Also I love the large portions!!!

PROS....Decent customer service. i was greeted by 2 employees as a stood by the door....smiles...not overly friendly and annoying...just enough to make you feel welcomed.

Contrary to the pics posted online, this place is not as spacious as it seems. Everything about this place is BARE BONES and BLAND..the interior is bland and bare. The food is generic and bland. Tastes like grocery store pre-made food thrown together. Something is up with their eggs or their oil...This time, i ordered the meat lovers omelette called the "Hungarian" and it tasted ok....you would think that the flavors from the pieces of meat will enhance the omelette but that wasn't the case...i honestly could have made an omelette like that with MY EYES CLOSED in the comfort of my home....The pancakes were bare and far from enriched....tastes exactly like generic store brand pancake mix..no enhancements by the chef....they could have at least added some cinnamon, vanilla extract, or nutmeg to add some dimension to the pancakes...that wasnt the case either....if you have functional taste buds then this place will not WOW you....this is a small town mom and pop joint....you are better off going to ihop, dennys, or even tasty waffle which is 5 mins away....THAT skinny brunette cougar at the cash register needs to humble herself....
They had a really extensive menu, I would recommend going there if you were looking to try something new. I wouldn't recommend the creamy crabby omelette though.

My boyfriend and I come here for lunch and breakfast all the time! I definitely recommend the ultima waffle :) they also have good chopped salads! Our favorite thing on the menu is the soup, though. I've never been disappointed by it and they serve it with this nice warm bread and butter. I would come in just for the soup and bread alone!! The owner always greets us and is very friendly. He sometimes even sends us home with soup to go for free! Definitely the best breakfast place around!
Niko's is the best place in the area for breakfast - good food great service & low prices what more could you want.

I went last year and left disappointed after my Crab Benedict turned out to be a "K"rab Benedict.    However I returned today and was unbelievably happy with the menu, food and service. 

Everything was done perfectly and the portions are huge. I'll certainly be back for more

Besides the best breakfest. The Best thing about this place is the experience you get. The setting feels like your in your grandmas kitchen. The waitresses and waiters are so so nice and BEST of all the owner Niko is the nicest guy you'll ever meet. Once you walk in he will welcome you like it's his home and he checks on you to see how your doing. The man really cares and is very kinda hearted. What more can you ask for in a breakfast place.

I love this place. It's very good food, it's awesome on Sunday mornings if you can be there 9-9:15 you'll beat the after church rush. The owner is always greeting meeting and thanking the customers. Their servers, hostess, & busboys have always been on top performance, and it's always a great experience.  It's a great Sunday breakfast routine spot. :) I love it.  Clean, good mood setter for the day.

I have to confess to a dirty little breakfast secret, I am a closet lover of potato pancakes.  Not just any potato pancakes either - they have to be the authentic made from grated till your knuckles bleed potatoes and then fried just right and serve them with applesauce and sour cream.  In my youth, I ate them at Al's Deli in Homewood, rip, and have been on a Grail like search for a new source ever since.

Imagine my delight when I happened upon a new spot for breakfast and my eyes fell upon The German Breakfast with, you guessed it, potato pancakes.  Ach du lieber, I was hoping for some liederhosen level of lip-smacking potato pancakes.

They arrived and the surface looked smooth, not a good sign.  It usually means they're made a mix or mashed potatoes.  I closed my eyes and tasted them and no yodels of delight, these were your disappointing, easy to find mediocre potato pancakes.  Sigh.

The eggs were fine, the English muffin was pre-buttered, which I hate when they assume that, but the bacon and orange juice were really good.  The man bussing the tables was a delight, super polite with a twinkle in his eye who seemed to genuinely like his job and his life.

As I left the waitress who took my check was complaining that she had to  perform cashiering duties plus her own job.  Not a great way to end my first visit there.

One day, one day I shall find my potato pancakes in the south suburbs and I'll never go hungry again!
Great breakfast diner. Good is good, reasonably priced but the service is the best. The place is warm and inviting and the staff is awesome.

This was my first time going here and the experience was fantastic. Very clear the owner loves what he does and really wants his customers to have a memorable experience. The food is rather inexpensive and not a long wait at all. Very tasty too! I will definitely be back.

Absolute best breakfast in a 45 minute radius. Well worth the price, which is moderately low. Great service and such a knowledgeable staff. They save me money every time I go in by suggesting alternatives instead of me spending all the money on side orders. You receive your food so fast, you always see the owner walking around greeting people. It's very homey, delicious, and all around great.
went for brunch and was super satisfying. portions were huge, food was delicious, and wait staff was very attentive. I recommend to anyone that likes a good breakfast.
Delicious food!!  Fast and very friendly service. Boyfriend recommends getting there before 10am to beat the crowds.  NÃºmero uno omelette was delish! Will definitely be back :)
O why not five stars it is, because they are fantastic and treat you right, they are a breakfast diner, can't expect award winning food.
Great coffee and a great breakfast, no complaints from me or my wife.  Service was quick and price was reasonable.

This is your place if you like weak coffee and runny eggs. 
Service is excellent.
Price is little high and used to be worth it. Portions have gotten small and quality is poor. I can get better elsewhere. I wish they would get back to the way they used to be a few years ago.
Awesome food, friendly and good portions.

We've been either ordering food from here or actually going in to eat breakfast, and we've never had a bad meal! I always go for the corned beef hash and eggs or the MBA skillet. Both are delicious, and the toasts always come out buttery. Their servers are always friendly and attentive. If you're looking for a breakfast place around the area, you can't go wrong with this one!

Best breakfast place ever! Friendly service and niko, the owner, is usually there to greet you and chat. He recognizes his customers and makes everyone feel welcomed and special. Affordable and generous portions, too.  :)
On 2 seperate locations found hair in one persons food in our party, ordered chicken salad and got tuna salad
Excellent menu. Go early for best service. Younger waitresses not very attentive to guests,  more interested in their phones or talking to each other.

Good breakfast food, great staff. Everyone is so friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is definitely coffee shop like but very warm and comforting. The portions are huge. Especially love the corned beef hash with eggs over and rye toast. Outstanding!

It's like heaven 

Love this place. 

There salsa is top notch 


I want more and more.

Pro's - Excellent authentic Mexican food.  My favorite is the avocado salsa and there Carnitas.

Con's - Not really a con, but the reality is that the dining area is very small.  The place is so popular that it can feel a little overwhelming when you walk in for the first time.  Your best bet is to phone in your order, arrive 15 minutes later, and walk in and walk out.

I really wanted to like this place. Unfortunately, I must have visited on an off day - but the place was filled to the brim with folks and this was after lunch hour. 

The cashier was nice and took my order correctly. I paid nearly $30 for just two three taco dinners and a half side of guac and chips. My order was to go and they did not provide utensils and napkins - I had to run back inside to fetch. I wouldn't be complaining about pricing if the food was actually edible. Here's a run down on the meal. 

* Tacos - dry tasteless corn tortillas, no authentic Mexican flavors

* Rice - just orangey rice, no authentic Mexican flavors

* Beans - just beans, no authentic Mexican flavors

* Guac - just mushed avocado, again ZERO authentic Mexican flavor 

This was a very underwhelming meal. I will not make an effort to return to determine if I received that one bad meal or not - mainly because of price and the extra effort needed to exit the parking lot.

My friends and I came for dinner and walked out glowing...literally.  The grease must have been airborne and adhered to our skin causing us to shine in the light.  It's a small price to pay for delicious food.  $2.49 for a taco, which is a little pricey.  You can have then in American style (with montery jack cheese, lettuce and tomato) or Mexican style (with onion and cilantro).  Besides tacos, they have the usual Mexican fare such as quesadillas, fajitas, burritos, enchiladas and tostada.  In addition, they offer  burgers and fries.  You can also get a large order of freshly made guacamole and chips for $8.  The $2 pina colada is mainly just pineapple juice and it's very sweet.   When dining in, they provide complimentary chips and salsa.

Well Done! I'm hooked and a fan. 

This was my first stop here and it impressed. When I drove up there were no cars in the parking lot and my first thought was damn another very well review place that shut down. Not so with this place. I spied the open sign and parked. 

The sit down portion is small maybe a dozen tables. The stars here are the food and service! I was greeted very warmly. I decided on the three taco (chicken) meal. $12 with a drink. Not bad considering. Well before I could sit a gentleman was bringing out warm salsa and chips! I could see the heat rising off of the chips and salsa. I thought sweet I love warm chips and salsa. BTW they were fantastic! I would go back and just eat chips and salsa if I could. Before I had down half a dozen chips my food was out and in front of me. See attached pic. I was amazed at the speed. Plus it looked damn good. Let me say I tried both sauces the green and red. Neither were overly hot both added to the meal and experience rather than sending me running for cold milk to put the fire out.

Over all the place is great. If your lucky enough to be close stop by and give them a try. They are close to me so if you see me say hello. I'm sure by then I will have tried everything and be able to make suggestions.

Stopped in for a Thursday date night. The salsa and chips were warm and delicious.

I ordered the enchiladas dinner and it was so good! I couldn't stop eating. The rice and beans were amazing and a large portion.

My husband ordered his standard carne asada and said it was the best he's ever had. And he's done extensive research.

Why only 4 stars? The atmosphere was lacking- the music was a tad too loud and there were many children being fairly obnoxious. Not the restaurant's fault, but we will order out in the future.

Since moving here five years ago, we have been looking for an excellent Mexican restaurant and we finally found it! My wife had the three taco dinner (shrimp, fish, and steak) and they were all amazing. The meat was perfectly seasoned and no salsa needed! I had the steak burrito and that was one of the best burrito I have ever had! We might go to this place once a week! Great food and very friendly inside!!

(1st & last time we shall eat here.) 
*The only good thing is their horchata w/free refill. *Too small of a place to dine in. 
*When you arrive you are not welcomed. We weren't asked if we were dining in or take out. They assumed we were taking out and asked us at the register for our order. So not knowing we did and sat down. We asked the waitress for napkins and eating utensils she's like "oh you're dining in, your order is getting prepped for take out 
*Rice has no flavor
*Enchiladas de Mole (NOT MOLE) plain red sauce(no flavor)
*Tacos are basic 
*Place was filled with smoke from the cooks. Our eyes were very irritated and couldn't eat comfortably. The place had no ventilation. Finally the waitress opened both doors to get some air.

I definitely do NOT recommend this place. Besides if the food is no flavor to basic imagine by the time you take it home to eat. Thumbs down!

Taco Madre is my favorite taco spot in the Aurora area.  Black beans may not be authentic, but they sure are hard to come by at these tiny tacquerias.  Nevermind, Taco Madre has black beans, and they're served in crispy little tostada bowls!

The Al Pastor is sweeter than my other favorites in the area, but it's still fantastic!  Unlimited chips and salsa, including their suburb green/avocado sauce, and unlimited horchata sealed the deal for me.

The counter service is friendly, and there's plenty of seating.  They refilled our chips several times without us even having to ask.  Although Taco Madre is a little off the grid for me, it's still local and full of flavor.

I understand now why there's some buzz about this taco joint. The FOOD is awesome for the price!

 I would say they're more than just a take out place since there's few tables available to sit on and I was able to fit my family of 6 including myself and a car seat. It was still busy even on a Sunday late lunch. They have a lot more to offer than just their tacos, including Mexican favorites like enchiladas, burritos, rice and beans breakfast plates,  parilladas (grilled) offerings, sizzling plates, etc.

But I got my appetite set on tacos. So they do start off with warm salsa and chips (we got 3 refills), that's a plus for a hungry mob like my family. We ordered for Nachos Supreme for starters. This may sound funny but I would still pick Denny's version since the ground beef is too bland for my taste, what actually brought this dish to the ok level are the pickled jalapenos, mayo, and guac.

But the next round bumped this whole dining experience from ok to great! I got the taco al pastor, the marinade of spicy + sweet flavors married to the very tender meat, soooo good! I also ordered for the lengua (beef tongue) if you're a little adventurous. It does taste better than what it sounds and flavors of tiny pieces of steak is what it really taste like. This is common to tacquerias at least on my experience. Then we had the mahi-mahi tacos with whole slices of avocados and the red mayo dressing, wife loved it instantly. I'm also impressed with how everything was presented on white rectangular flight plates, even the beans are on a small taco bowl, I bet the lemon wedges was also artistically placed. It felt like that our orders came out from a high end resto's kitchen. That really added the extra oomph to the presentation. They also have great service. The server was polite and prompt with our orders. The Manager even came over to check on how we're doing. I'm a fan already and would definitely recommend if you're near the west burbs (Montgomery/Aurora area).

Food is ok. They overpower everything with onions and cilantro, so if you're not A fan of onions I would suggest you omit the Pico de Gallo.  A little on the pricey side as well. They never have any specials which is kind of a bummer. They do deliver, which is a plus.

Wow - we were really blown away by the good food in this place. 

We went camping in the Sugar Grove area on a weekend, and decided to give this place a try for dinner on Saturday. It is a small unassuming diner-like place where you order at the register. The service is very friendly and nice. Hubby ordered the veggie enchilada dinner and I ordered the grilled vegetable salad. We were served complimentary chips and warm salsa. We couldn't stop eating it - it was so freaking good! The food was served, and we were really surprised by the presentation - very good, fitting for a white table cloth restaurant - not what I was expecting here. The food was phenomenal - fresh ingredients, tasty and perfectly seasoned food. I wish they have a restaurant in the city somewhere - I would definitely be a regular patron there.

We first met Israel through some friends of ours, who frequent our place.  They told us we would love the food and small atmosphere! how right they were !
  Israel and staff pack a mighty punch of culinary flavors.  We have taken family and friends there.  in those visits, we have tried everything on the menu.  
Fresh guacamole, delicious tacos, burritos, 
and all homemade !  Make sure you don't leave without trying the avacado tomatilla salsa...
.dine in, order to go, just don't miss out!!!

Good neighborhood spot for Mexican. We had dinner there this evening it was our first time here.  To my surprise they were packed on a Thursday night!  The staff was friendly and once we got our table we received warm chips and salsa.  It was nice that for a change the salsa was warm but it tasted like it had too much tomato. I had the 2 taco dinner with al pastor and side of rice and pinto beans. It was pretty good it wasn't your usual greasy spoon type of joint. We also had beef burritos as well and my friend loved it! I'll defiantly try this place again especially for desert next time because they have fried ice cream and I need to have an empty belly!!

Oh and one more thing they are opening a Niles location next and Naperville location coming soon!

Prices are high, food isn't the greatest quality or quantity. The nachos supreme are served with white queso cheese instead of nacho cheese and /or shredded cheese. The tacos are small for the price. The tortas dont have much meat on them. Tried quite a few times as a lot of people seem to like their food, but I'm not a fan at all. Probably will not go back anymore.

What a satisfying dining experience. There's two types of dining out:  one is about the experience and the other is about the food. This one is all about the food. High-quality, very fresh, extra delicious. Steak tacos had all fresh ingredients and it was just a perfect balance of flavor and spiciness and crunch and freshness. Presentation was excellent. I believe it's important that food not only tastes delicious but looks delicious as it's served. Since you order at the front of the restaurant and the food is delivered to your table, I was not sure if tipping is appropriate. Any input on this would be welcome.
Highly recommended.
My new favorite taco place.  Food is fantastic.  Service is friendly and fast.  Restaurant is clean.  I will be back for more.

Was looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant after moving to the area so I searched Yelp. It is a gem.
I went with one of the daily drink specials, the Paloma...Tequila, Sprite, and lime with salt. It was delicious. Got the horchata which was great but also loved the pina colada! We were served promptly, the food was super fresh. The salsa was warm and not too spicy. Started off with guacamole+chips which was great. I got the chicken enchilada dinner and the chicken was really moist unlike other places. The rice was awesome with bits of vegetables in it. The friend got steak tacos and the steak was cooked perfectly. A side of guacamole to start with which was very fresh as well. The waitress was very friendly as was the manager who came to check on us too.

The downfall? It has a small eating area, and too much noise from customers, cooks, along with music and tv. It is too small of space. Also the cooks were busy cooking fresh in the back and we could barely keep our eyes open so we can only assume it was because of the fresh cut onions. ??? We were ok halfway through, but at first couldn't stop laughing about it. The slot machines on the side lessen the class and it also would have been great to have outdoor seating...
  All in all its a good place to go to. The service and food are awesome and that will bring me back. I might get takeout though.
Delicious homemade Mexican cuisine! I highly recommend this family owned restaurant to anyone who enjoys warm, traditional food.

Hip, awesome service, and the best tacos and chips and salsa in the area! Only drawback is the sewage smell outside of the restaurant. Only been once so not sure where the smell came from or if it is a regular thing.

My husband introduced me to this place and I loved it. Delicious food and very nice people working there. It's always clean inside and everything is well put together for carry out. It's too bad I moved out of state but whenever I'm in the area, I'll be stopping for a burrito!

I Absolutely love the food. Very fresh and delicious. On Friday and Saturday's the have a delightful guacamole salsa. My family has been enjoying every Friday night since I discovered this authentic restaurant. Staff is always friendly, and building is clean.

We were looking for some good eats in the neighborhood and saw the reviews on Yelp. The reviews were spot on. The service was definitely friendly and the salsas was definitely delicious. Folks were right about the avocado salsa. That was very good. There was also a smoky red salsa and another greenish tomatillo salsa--both absolutely deelish. 

I ordered two fish and one shrimp taco --probably some of the best fish and shrimp tacos I have had. They don't put a slaw on theirs. It's covered in cheese, tomatoes and lettuce. The fish is not a heavy batter. It is a reddish color and lightly battered and deep fried.

Definitely worth checking out.

Nice little cozy Mexican restaurant with amazing steak tacos, excellent ground beef enchiladas, excellent salsa and chips. The seating is very limited and it is a little loud inside - so try not to eat during peak times. The wait staff is very friendly and very accommodating. Great place for authentic Mexican food, not a bargain in terms of price but very average priced food.

I stopped in ordered beans and rice for 20, quick service and very polite. Food looks and smells awesome. My event went perfectly and the rice and beans were perfect and delicious. If I could give them a 10 star rating I would. Great job!!!!

This place is great! I know the owners they definitely serve quality Mexican food. The food is amazing. Not to mention the chips and salsa are awesome. So next time you are craving Mexican food this is the restaurant to go to.  Skip Los Comales and come here.

It's nice to see a local, family-owned shop nearby serving ridiculously fresh, authentic Mexican food.

The steak they use for the tacos and burritos  is juicy and flavorful and I love it. But, my favorite is their pastor. I can destroy a half dozen of these tasty seasoned-pork tacos. And don't forget to try the refreshing pineapple-coconut punch!

The service here is very friendly, so chat with the ladies here while you wait, and the restaurant itself is so clean, it borders on stark. A little more decor couldn't hurt, but it is hard to fault their cleanliness!

Welcome to North Aurora, TM! Yummo! They just opened in this location a week or so ago. I have been 3 times already. I think I am addicted. The shrimp taco is my favorite! So glad they have a drive through, I like to grab a taco and go. Once I ate inside though, and I like the modern decor. It's a small dining room, but there is also outside seating. For super casual setting and tasty Mexican street fare, this is a good addiction so far.

Wow...loved this place! I ordered the two taco platter, shrimp and Mahi.  I ate inside and got complimentary chips, which were seasoned.  There was a dish of salsa and three bottles for the meal, nice variety.  The shrimp taco was very good, with a nice sauce.   The Mahi was fried,  not my favorite in the first place, but the ends were very hard, either too much breading or overcooked.  The dinner comes with rice and beans.  I was able to choose black beans, which had a nice flavor.  The rice was good, too.  It had vegetables in it and cooked perfectly.   

My new favorite taco place close to home!

Disgusting, Is the only word I can describe this place. I have had a billion times better Mexican food. Food was cold and burritos were small for the price. Never go here, not good at all. Don't waste your time.
