Dear god, you beautiful steak burritos, you. Though my review is for the steak burrito only, it's the best I've ever had. I drove past this place and wondered if it was good for a while and then it turned out to be a favorite of a guy I dated so I did get to try it and I was not disappointed. I've had their horchata too which is a nice change of pace and refreshing drink option. Now I want Taco Madre!

Kate Shields
john greene Realtor

Great place! Good food! Restaurant is very small, tables really close together. 

I liked the warm salsa. The guacamole was ok, not great. I had the tilapia tacos, those were perfect. 

Good prices.

Best best best freaking restaurant around! Haven't  been here in awhile and after eating here tonight I'm so mad I haven't been eating here lately . Shame on me for waiting so long to come back. I feel like the steak taco tasted even better tonight than it ever did. Will never go anywhere else... the meat is so flavorful!

Excellent food, quality, and taste. 
Presentation is very original and food taste fresh.  Waitstaff are kind and very professional. 
The carne asada is great, the carnitas are not greasy and well seasoned, you can tell the al pastor meat is not coming from a trompo, but still, they garnished it perfectly with pineapple, celery, and onion, just like a traditional one you would get in Mexico City.

The prices are average. The portions are decent. Overall, it's not a bad place to eat. 

It's like Doggie Diner, but with Tacos, Enchiladas, etc.

TampiqueÃ±a here has been outstanding on numerous occasions. Most of the time I'm full 3/4ths the way through the steak but it's so good that I continue to finish it anyhow. They do a great job cooking to order. Great stuff here. Highly recommend the guacamole as well. The seasoned chips make for a delicious touch.

Everything I've tried from here has been excellent, friendly service and call in orders are always ready on time . The chicken steak and carnitas are my favs. The nachos are huge and delicious also . 5 stars and will be a regular customer
Excelent service,  the food was very good. The hot sauces were yummy. Great place. Wish the reataurant had a bigger sign though. Didn't notice it at first.

Used to be my favorite Mexican restaurant in town. The last time I visited, my husband called ahead and ordered our food. We ordered 6 tacos. No sides, just tacos. When he ordered on the phone, they told him you would take 20 minutes. I came to the restaurant in 20 minutes, to pick up our food. I paid for the food, and sad and waited for almost an hour. I finally asked one of the waitresses, and she said, that they don't start cooking your food until you arrive. So what is the point of ordering ahead?

It took them an hour and a half, to give us our food, which was 6 tacos. The night I was in there they had messed up multiple people's orders. Previously when we order from there and brought it home they have missed items, or given us incorrect items. I will not be visiting here in the future.
Outstanding food. The tacos are some of the best I have had. If you like horchata you will love theirs. Even better to take some to go and put some rum in when you get home. Definitely will be back.

This place is good!  
The wife and I ate here during the week on off-peak hours, so it wasn't busy at all. 
Staff was extremely friendly and place was pretty clean, overall.  

It is a little pricey for the size of the meals, but if you dine-in, you get free chips and salsa and free refills on horchata.  I have never been to a restaurant that offers free horchata refills, so I didn't feel like I was jipped.    

Tip - if you order sides of sour cream and/or guacamole, make sure you specifically ask for it on the side if that's how you want it.  Otherwise, they will just bake it right into your burrito/enchilada, etc. The steak and ground beef are what to order!

Taco Madre was excellent, it's a little on the pricy side but probably worth it if you like authentic tacos. We got a variety of different ones and all of them were good, Carne Asada tacos were juicy flavorful and fresh. Pastor tacos were excellent perfect balance of spice and sweetness. Probably the best chorizo taco I've ever had. The beans and rice were average but that's not why I went. They make their own tortilla chips, they're warm and delicious. Will return.

Alright, now this is what we have been searching for since moving to the Chicago area! We are Texas transplants which makes us a little picky when it comes to Mexican food. 
This place is an absolute gem! Off the beaten path but worth the drive. The food is unreal! Never had a bad dish. The Steak Tacos are my personal favorite. Even the chips and salsa are amazing. They put some kind of seasoning on the chips that give them an extra flavor. I have brought friends and co-workers here and all have returned and or recommended to their friends. The staff is awesome. The owners or a family member is almost always present. So if you have any issues they are all over it. It is a little small and it can get crowded quickly so make sure you are prepared. There is always the option of take out which they do a lot of business in. Great job Taco Madre!

Have been 8 or 9 times now and it's excellent every time. Steak burrito is off the charts. It's been a nice secret so far, but the word is getting out. It's been busier every time I go in. And I hear they are expanding into the space next door, which will be great. But if they keep up the quality and service even that may not be enough space. It's basically a fast/casual counter but the manager Sean treats customers like it's fine dining. He really does a great job. Keep it up Madre! Best food around.

First time trying it, and the food was delicious!!  The steak and shrimp tacos were really good.  Service was fast, and staff were very friendly. The prices are a little high... $42 for family of 4 (two of the meals were kids meals), but because the food was so good, definitely will be back!! :)
This place started very strong and still has its great nights but only when the staff isn't all kids.  The kids close early and don't prepare the recipes as well.

What a great find - thank you yelp!  So good I have to add another stellar review!!! You walk in and order at the counter but a waitress will take care of you from there.  They bring chips and salsa which is very good and the salsa is served warm. YUM.  I had mahi mahi taco and a shrimp taco - both were AMAZING!  Served with rice and beans.  Best shrimp tacos I have ever had.  I will definitely be back when I am back in the area. Can't wait!

I am really really excited that this suburbian taqueria could hold a flame to any in Chicago. We came in with a big group and although they hey were slammed, they are also really efficient so we were able to get a table pretty quickly. The steak tacos are perfection. No weird gristle to be found, seriously amazing. Also the fish tacos are great! Friendly staff. This place is amazing!
They have the best tacos and horchata in town. I also love the chips and salsa they bring you when you dine in.

My family and I have been looking for quality Mexican restaurant all over Aurora, Yorkville, Oswego, and finally found it in Montgomery!  Tried the burrito Al Pastor, tacos de lengua, tacos de carnitas, and Chile Relleno.  All dishes are EXTRAordinary!

This a small joint with big flavors.  The pastor here is incredible.  I eat a lot of Mexican food in a lot of areas because I drive everywhere in Chicagoland for my job.  And I'm telling you, the pastor here is fantastic, top notch.  They make their food here with pride.  You can tell, because it is evident in their salsas.  I come here whenever I'm in the area, and you should too.

THE BEST TACOS WE HAVE EVER HAD!!!!!! I always have the fish tacos and they are tender flaky and not greasy.  My husband has the steak tacos and they aren't dry...very juicy!  Our kids have the cheese enchiladas with the green sauce because they don't like mole....seriously nothing left on their plates!

I just can't stop going there. I've been trying to choose a favorite taco - the mahi mahi or the chilango (skirt steak, chorizo, bacon, melted cheese, jalapeno, onion, and cilantro) - but it is impossible to declare a winner. Just order one of each. 

I realize that it's a crime against authentic taco joints, but we have ordered the nachos supreme multiple times, and they are amazing. Judge me if you must. 

Chips and salsa are very good. All of the sauces are, too. It's the first taco restaurant I've visited that has fountain Cokes. 

The service is friendly and efficient. The seating area is small, but we've never had to wait long for a table. By the time our food is ready, we have always gotten a place to sit, even on a busy Saturday night or during a weekday lunch rush.
The steak burrito was very good. The service was great and the people were friendly. $6.99 for a streak burrito was well priced. I would come here again:).

We discovered this gem the day we moved to Montgomery. There aren't too many non chain places in Montgomery or Oswego, this place has great reviews on Yelp so we figured we would give it a try. Little did we know that we would eat here twice in two days! The service is fast and not very personal, but that is because they are busy. I've had the chicken tacos (get them Mexican style) and the chili rellano. Their rice and beans are really good and their guacamole is fresh and tasty. This is our go to place when we don't not feel like cooking. The prices are also very good!

Solid three stars. Five being BÃ®en Trucha in Geneva. 
Good food. The restaurant is basically a good traditional mexican restaurant with an attempt at being trendy. The atmosphere is a bit gloomy, but the staff is super nice. 
I'd give them four stars if their salsas were much better. They aren't spicy at all and a bit on the bland side. But the tacos are solid and well made.

Nice to see a new place pop up in Montgomery that's actually good. You can tell that each menu item was thought out and planned. This is definitely not the typical Mexican restaurant you will find around here, it's not the best I've ever had but for the area it's definitely my favorite! 

I wish other restaurant owners gave effort that taco madre does! 

Thanks!
Yum yum yum! The steak nacho supreme is absolutely delicious! Looking forward to trying more items here.
My favorite Mexican food around!  I love their veggie tacos and burritos.  I have also ordered the shrimp tacos repeatedly! Great find.

Wonderful taco dinners! Love how the food taste, perfect amounts. Excellent people. They have a little eating space in there as well. My only complaint is it was really hot in there and I hate eating when it's so hot.
The BEST Mexican food in town. Customer Service the BEST!!! We have been coming to Taco Madre since they opened.
The food here is excellent.  You can order a single item or make it a dinner for a few dollars more.  Will be hack often!!

By far the best Mexican place we've had since we moved out here. They bring out the food for you and the people that work there are always so helpful and super nice. I recommend any trying a new Mexican place to go here! Its well worth it.
Taco Madre never fails us when we need our Mexican food fix. Their food is excellent! The shrimp tacos are amazing as well as their fried ice cream! We always have them deliver, and will never stop.
Excellent food not as authentic as I like it but never the less great place , amazing salsa I could drink it.
This place is a hidden gem!!!!!!!! My family and I love this place. Now we don't have to drive to Chicago for great Mexican food!

Oh No, what happened? I think this place went to the owners head
with the crowds and reviews. Nacho Supreme with steak went from
$6.99 to $9.49 Yiks. I thought maybe the portion would be larger But actually  the
portion and toppings got smaller. They changed the menu to up prices.. Very disappointed not worth it!!!

We go here because it is close to work. Atmosphere isn't the best just a tad small for the number of customers. The dining area is clean and the food is amazing. I usually spend $12 for delicious tacos, beans and rice and a drink. 

I do miss the old light green (avocado I think) salsa. The smoky chipotle salsa they serve with the chips is a bit smoky for me. 

Overall this place has great food at a good price.
Hands down the best Mexican food north of the border! I'm a regular and tell everyone I know about the quality of food this place provides on a constant basis.
This Mexican food is awesome.  Some of the best in the area.  Everything on the menu is excellent and the service is great as well.  I will come back.

We have been hearing nothing but good about this place so we decided to try it. Absolutely delicioso!!! One person had chorizo tacos and there was no greasy mushy meat. Fish tacos were lightly breaded and wonderful. The steak was tender and the carnita was wonderful.also. Both black beans and refried beans were perfect. Beverage for both parents and kids were just fine. Definitely coming back

This place has amazing food.  We have lived like 5 minutes away for almost 8 years and never realized it was there (their signage is not that good).  It really is a hidden gem.   Inside is nice but has very limited seating.  I recommended to call ahead on the weekend for your order since they are really busy.   I have been told they deliver but not sure of how far.  I highly recommend trying this place if you like quality Mexican food.

Best tacos and Mexican food in Aurora! Tried every taco place near Aurora and this is by far the best. I grew up by Gage park and in Cicero and I know what a good taco tastes like. Great salsa too. I was suprised that I could not find a good taco place in Aurora since there are soo many mexicans that live here. They just can't cook! El Burrito Mexicano in Lisle has the 2nd best tacos in the burbs.

YEEEELLLLPPPPP!!!!! I'm hungry and I want Tasty Tacos!?!?!? Low and behold a new taco place should appear. 

1-10

The Place: Kinda off the side of the road behind the W.M. Parking lines need to be re-painted. Inside is very minimalist. You have a choice of Black, Grey or Stainless. I hope that a Menu or a Chalkboard with the basics is coming soon, because if there is a line, it's kinda hard to find the printed menus at the front of the line. That said, it's a taco place.... What do you think they have?!?! Location and de-core... 4

The Staff: Pretty cool and outgoing folks, very happy to accommodate you and very hospitable while you wait. I had a bunch of my minions with me and the gave them chips while we waited! Score! Gonna go 10 on staff!

The Food:
Tacos: I have had all of the tacos, the best was the Shrimp Taco and the Alpastor! 10

Torta: It was good, not a big avocado guy... 8

Nachos: .... This is a sticking point for me.... I HATE Yellow Gunk Nacho Cheese.... It's just oil that tastes like Yuck! Please change to real cheese and just melt it ever so slightly :-).  That said, it was a nice presentation and everything else was great! 6.... Good cheese will earn 4 more points! 

Rice: I've said it on yelp before... I just don't like Spanish rice... It was ok... No rating since I'm bias...

Beans: I love that the side comes in a little Chip Bowl, tasty and deliciousness... 10

Burrito: Normal solid Burrito 8

Chips and Salsa: Outstanding!!!! Well seasoned chips with very tasty Salsa, little on the warm side so beware. 11!

Pineapple coconut punch!!!: Killer!!! 10!

I look forward to seeing this place grow over the coming months! Great owners and food! Little help needed on De-core and ambiance, and a menu would be awesome :-)

Food is so delicious. We ordered out the waitress gave us salsa and chips which were the best I've had in awhile. Food was a decent price. And not to mention the fact that the waitress was very attractive

I wanted to give this place 5 stars because it's a great discovery for us. We'e been there twice now, and the first time, we were blown away. This time was good too, but I have to be honest, they blew it with my carne asada. I asked for the steak medium well, and it was rare, or close to it. I think most people would have sent it back. I know they would have taken care of me if I'd sent it back, but I don't mind it rare.  Rare just wasn't my preference this evening.  

On the plus side, the food quality and presentation are way above what I would have expected at a place like this. The price is reasonable, and the service is very very friendly. This place serves some of the best Mexican food I've ever had. 

I was happy to hear they're expanding, with more seating. This place deserves all the success they seem to be having. In spite of the little issues I had, it's tops on my list for Mexican restaurants!

Taco Madre is a hidden gem in Montgomery. The salsa is served warm with fresh tortilla chips. Yum! The food is made fresh to order & Taco Madre also offers take out. We love the steak tacos (Mexican or American style) and guacamole, but the fajitas and burritos are very good as well. Refills are free & the horchata and virgin Pina Colada are delicious!  Located off of Rt. 30 in Montgomery. A little cramped for space if you decide to dine in, but an expansion is in the works.

So we've been here a couple times.. The person who is supposed to take your order when you walk up to the register is also the same person who happens to be on the phone taking an order at the same time so you kind of just stand there until she's done with her call. 

The carnitas tacos are probably the best thing here along with their rice and beans. They are to die for! Chicken tacos are good. However, I'm not the biggest fan of the weird seasoned salt they use on their chips and French fries. It's also a little pricy and doesn't have a lot of seating.

I also remember being very cold the last time we went. Might of been the fact that there are a lot of windows but I'm sure turning up the heat a bit would've helped. Everyone sitting around us were eating with their coats on.

A group of us are in town from SoCal.. this place has better food than most taco shops in San Diego ! The staff was super helpful and friendly and again, the food was phenomenal. Will be back before we go home.

After driving past this place for years I'm glad I finally tried it recently. Although it's a little challenging to enter from west-bound Route 30 (you have to pass it, turn left into the WalMart entrance and then an immediate left into the bank driveway which connects to the side street you can enter the Taco Madre lot from . . . whew! Got that?)

I ordered the fish tacos. Based on this initial experience I'll be back. They were excellent. Perhaps not as good as the best I've had in San Diego, but very, very good. Large pieces of fish, expertly fried and with fresh and tasty toppings plus several salsas available to dress them up with. Chips and salsa were also good.

They were very busy when I visited on a Sunday, mid-day, and so service was a tad slow but not to the extreme. Well worth the wait for some excellent fish tacos.

I am absolutely positively obsessed with Taco Madre. The food is phenom. The atmosphere is casual and they treat everyone like family. Their Mexican style tacos are my absolute fav. If you dine in they give you homemade chips and salsa.  I don't think that montgomery has much as far as food options go so not only is Taco Madre a well needed place to dine but it is top notch.  I saw a sign recently that said they now deliver....BONUS!!!!

Was out in Aurora for work and was looking for a non-chain restaurant for lunch. Found Taco Madre on yelp and man am I happy that I did. The food and service were excellent. This is a great gem in the midst of all the chain restaurants.
I will def be back soon!!!

Super good tacos and be sure to get their homemade flan with this 'special' sauce on it (don't remember what it's called).  Their chilango, shrimp and fish specialty tacos rock!  They make pork and chicken tamalas like once a week and they are usually gone the same day, or at the most, the day after.  They actually have margaritas and beer, but you don't usually see anyone drinking much there, as they atmosphere is kinda blah.  They are talking about expanding the restaurant which would be a very GOOD thing.  They also need to fix the very huge pot-holes coming into their parking lot.  OH!  I can't forget to tell you about their chips and salsa - YUM, the salsa is served warm and the chips are pretty darn fresh!

Being stuck all day in Aurora at softball fields, my family needed some real nourishment.  I found Taco Madre and couldn't have been happier!  
This place is an oasis in a sea of fast food.  The outside isn't much to look at, but inside it's the nicest taco joint I've seen.  Great prices, freshly cooked tacos, and a killer pineapple juice drink make this place tops in the area.  
The manager, Isreal, greeted me with a smile and even gave me a few things to try out, on the house.   For that alone, I give this guy props.   He wants his taco joint to survive, and knows customer service comes first.  
If you're in the area, don't miss Taco Madre!!
I've only had tacos from here but they are great. The El pastor is wonderful. I swear I could eat here every weekend. You have to try the weekend sauce yum!!!
The food is amazing!  It is always so fresh!  The service is just as good!!

The best mexican food around, especially on weekends since they have their special guac sauce. Was heading to a fancy restaurant for my boyfriends birthday and passed taco madre. ALMOST changed my mind for we could stop and get some amazing tacos.

A little pricey for just being tacos, but the food is really good, the staff is extremely friendly, and the dÃ©cor is much improved from the restaurants that have occupied that location in the past.  I always end up visiting Taco Madre when visiting my parents.

They also deliver now which is amazing.

The food here is good. I have been back a few times.  They are much busier than the old place that was here. The nachos Supreme are great.  I wish their drinks were larger on to go items. A bit pricey but you get good food.

Not happy with Taco Madre for raising their prices. I use to eat here all the time but everything was marked up and I agree the portions got smaller. I will not be coming back to Taco Madre unless they lower the prices.
Not a bad spot for Mexican food that is close to our house. My biggest gripe is the warm salsa they serve. It's not my favorite and warm salsa and chips don't seem to go together.

Food is great and prices are reasonable
Owner is a great guy always helpful and friendly. I have always done carry out never dined in. They do have delivery now takes the usual 45/60 minutes. I believe the delv charge is 3.00. Great place !!

Went here on a clients referral. Had American style chicken tacos. They were ok, not the greatest. The nachos were delicious, and I would recommend them. We ate as much as we wanted and still had some left over. It's not the cheapest place for tacos, we spent close to $30 for dinner for two. Be prepared to wait, it was pretty busy, but the food was fresh and hot.
Love this place. Their guacamole is awesome. My new favorite is the al pastor tacos, Mexican style. Service is OK, food is excellent. We are regular customers!
Fireeeeeeee. Amazing food with high grade meat that you can taste in each bite. Don't forget to get the shrimpyy doggie. Shrimp tacos

My wife and I celebrated our 1 year anniversary here this past Sunday night. I emailed the manager to see if he would be able to set the mood and make the table extra special for the occasion. They really did an amazing job! Not only was there rose pedals on the table but they also had roses in a vase and a card from them congratulating us.

The service was absolutely incredible. Everyone there smiled and welcomed us and our waitress explained everything in detail when it came time to order and made sure to supply us with everything we needed.

The food, the food was by far the best steak i have ever had in my life! I ordered medium/rare and it was perfectly cooked with the meat still maintaining its juicy tender flavor. My wife had the filet mignon and i swear i have never tasted anything so good before in my life!

Over all this place deserves more than just 5 stars. We were blown away and will no only recommend to others but also come back ourselves!

We were invited by friends to dine at Eddie Merlot's a while back and I had actually never heard of it before that evening. My wife and I were pleasantly surprised to find out what a great spot it is for food or just to hang out for a while. (If you ask, they will seat you in the back area where the chairs are like sitting in your living room.)
 The food is excellent, I am personally a fan of the Mary's Potatoes, but there are lots of great selections. Every time I have eaten there since, I have never been unhappy with my choice. The steak has always been cooked to the tempature I ordered, which doesn't always happen at every good steakhouse you go to. Price is about what you would expect for this type restaurant, not cheap, but not obnoxious either. Overall, I can say we put this on our "let's go once every couple months" list. 

FS

This is a review regarding the lunch entrees only (the salads). I have tried all of the different salads here and each one of them is bad. They all taste like coleslaw. Hate going here for a healthy lunch for that reason. Also, the lunch portions of the salads are HUGE and there is no one one person should/could finish one of the salads. It's wasteful to have them so large. Prices are also steep once you start adding protein to the salads. 
On the plus side, the other entrees (burgers, meatloaf, etc.) always look good. Service is usually OK. Bread is warm and good too, but I try to avoid going here for lunch.

I went for a late dinner and drinks with my closest girlfriends. The food was delicious, the drinks were great, and I loved the ambience. Be sure to save room for dessert, the bourbon butter cake is scrumptious.

This is my favorite place in the burbs.  It is very difficult to find 'city-worthy' spots in the area but this rivals the best steakhouses in the city.  I always sit in the bar area and Ashley and Nikki take great care of their customers.  They also have a loyalty program, which I highly recommend.  They have some really amazing wines by the glass that you don't see many places.  They also have 50% off bottles on Sundays!  The chef here was one of the original Alinea guys so he obviously knows his stuff (and is quite friendly as well).  

They have amazing salads for lunch that you can add steak (or other proteins) to.  They make their own dressings and I absolutely love the lemon basil.  The steaks themselves are outstanding.  Well seasoned, cooked to a perfect medium rare, and moist every time.  The steak tartar is very good as well.  I love the ambiance, love the food, and love the staff!

Came here for Valentine's Day 2-14-16 and I could not have been happier. The food was great, the service was phenomenal. 

The server helped us pick a bottle of wine and made suggestions for appetizers. We followed his advice and he did not steer us wrong! We had the barbecue shrimp and a bottle of the boomtown merlot.

For dinner we both made our own surf and turf. My filet mignon was cooked beautifully and so was the ribeye. The only this is that one lobster tail was about half the size of another (thinner and smaller). I did appreciably the server separating the lobster meat from the tail table side. And Parmesan truffle fries were amazing!!!! And there were a lot of them. The spinach was also good but there was only enough for one of us and the same goes for the mashed potatoes. But there were delicious regardless!!!

We are somewhat of regulars here you could say. We come about every 2 months. We came here for Mothers Day. I want to say that we were skeptical coming for a holiday buffet. It has been our exprience with other higher end places that trying to keep up the quality on a buffet to the level of a ususal dinner night has left us disappointed. We were so delighted that this was not at all the case here. They did a fantastic job and quality was as perfect as usual. 

The service was top notch as always. The meal was well worth the price. The cocktail shrimp was excellent as was everthing else. Most of the food was dinner items which was great for us with plenty of meat, fish and vegatable choices but if you wanted breakfast there was freach toast which looked incredible at about 2 inches high, bacon, sausage and an omelet station. There was a carving station that had some of the best ham off the bone and beef tenderloin. Who does this? It was over the top great and you could cut it with a fork. What a great surprise from the rubbery roast beef many other places have on a buffet. They also had a fancy desert section ans get this ... a bananas foster station. And to top all of this off for an extra 10 bucks you could opt for bottomless bloddy mary's and mimosas's. This was by far the best buffett outside of one of the hight end ones in Las Vegas I have ever been at. We will be back here again and again and certainly for the next buffet chance.
Exceptional Food! I continue to come here often and the food is outstanding! Great wine selection and great service! A+

Two couples went on a Saturday, day before St Valentines Day. Ordered the VD special, offering appetizer, salad, entree and dessert choices. Upgraded from the filet to strip for $10. Excellent food, service and engaging staff all around.
Complimentary valet parking too. Yes it's priced like a steak house, but they have good value specials too.

My mom, brother and I came in for the first time this past Saturday at 6pm. The service was good, the hostess was friendly and the valet was fast. I had a review all ready for the food by the time we left. However, Sunday afternoon all 3 of us came down with violent cases of food poisoning. The only thing we had all eaten in the past 24 hours was the steak and salad at this restaurant. I know it's impossible to prove where you get it, but it has to have been either bad meat or lettuce that we ate Saturday night. I missed 2 days of work and my brother missed 2 days of school. It was really awful. My mom called to speak to a manager who apologized but basically didn't even offer to look into it or anything. When the only food the 3 of us ate in common was this dinner, it seems likely we got it here. Just a warning to others for the future.

Unfortunately I was so excited to eat the food I did not get pictures :/...BUT this place was awesome. Came to Chicago for a business trip and this was our dinner choice. For appetizers bbq shrimp, tuna wontons and calamari. All these were so delicious. Especially the BBQ shrimp, so big! My entree I ordered the trio medallions which was 3-4oz filets all tops with something different. The steak was amazing and aged 21 days. Couldn't say anything bad about it. I also ordered the Lobster Mac & Cheese for a side which didn't have too much of a lobster taste but delicious regardless. Lastly I finished this amazing meal with Apple and peach crisp topped with vanilla ice cream. If in Chicago, GO TO THIS Place!!

I have been here multiple times and the food can be good to awful. The ribeye had way too much fat and was under season. The family is never cooked correctly when you order it medium it comes out medium well. Shrimp cocktail is good
Top notch food and service. Lobster bisque and salmon were spot on. Kudos to Jeton, our server.

This is a formula high end chain. The formula fortunately sets s high bar. They strive for excellence and probably make more mistakes than places not as bleeding edge. Rest assured any mistake is promptly corrected with an intent of perfection. 

A fine restaurant is Eddie Merlot,
It is a place you must go. 
You'll really enjoy the steak,
And cocktails too for Christ sake.
Relaxed friendly service, not slow.

Such an amazing experience. The service was so wonderful. Yulia (I think I misspelled) was our server and she was perfect. Her recommendations were great and she was so attentive. The manager stopped by various times but was not annoying at all he was funny and genuine. The food itself was great, too. We started with sweet and sour shrimp and it was cooked perfectly. Of course the steak was, too. Wine selection was great and Yulia was able to recommend a great pairing. Overall one of the best dining experiences I've had! I will definitely go back and request Yulia.

Great place! Even though the prices are insanely high, the food and service are impeccable. I got the short ribs. They were tender and packed with amazing flavor. My boyfriend got the steak so I had to try a little and it was probably the best steak I have ever had in my life. We were there for a birthday and she ordered the bananas foster. The waitress actually cooked the bananas right in front of us. So if you are coming here, make sure to order that because not only is it tasty, but you get a show. In fact, the service at this place is so good, the manager walked around to make sure we were enjoying our visit. That is a mark of excellent service. 
The ambiance was also very nice. They have a wine cellar display which gives the dining experience a very upscale and intimate feel. The chairs are extremely comfortable, which always makes dining pleasurable, and they have big enough tables to comfortably eat your food without feeling like you are going to knock something over. Overall, this place is definitely worth going to once, and while I probably won't become a regular because of the cost, I will definitely pick this place for special occasions. Food being great is necessary, but the service makes you want to come back.

After being spoiled at the Elite event I couldn't wait to come back.  We went during the week and kind of late.  This is where having a really odd schedule comes in handy.  The restaurant was obviously winding down for the night and all I could think about is driving copious amounts of steak and sweet potato casserole into my mouth.  

I ordered the Bourbon Ribeye medium rare and my wife ordered a salad with the sweet potato casserole.  My steak came out cooked to perfection.  The flavor and quality of the steak was impressive.  I ordered one additional bacon wrapped BBQ shrimp to accompany my steak.  How could you go wrong with such a glorious combination?  

I did have a couple of bites of my wife's salad which was also excellent.  The sweet potato casserole was amazing!  There is a thin layer of chopped pecans protecting the sweet and savory orange deliciousness hiding just below.  This things is basically a dessert that could go with any meal at any time.  We struggled to save some to enjoy at home.  

Our server was friendly, helpful, and was just the right amount of accessible for us throughout the dinner.  

Our experience at Eddie Merlots was extremely good.  The food, service, and atmosphere are very unique.  I would definitely recommend it and will definitely be thinking of bringing out of town visitors here.

I wish I would have known that this place existed sooner.  My husband and I went here last night with another couple based upon their recent experience here and I am so happy that they picked this place! ! We will Def be coming back!  The atmosphere is top notch along with their food and service.  It's so comfy inside its like you can spend an entire evening here (which we did ). They have a very large bar area that you can enjoy while you wait for your party to arrive or to have a couple drinks after dinner.  We did both lol.. I would recommend that you make reservations and try the white sangria!!! I already can't wait to go back!

I've started this review three times now, and each time I've hated what I've written because I don't think it's lived up to the standard that Eddie Merlot's provided to me last night. So I'm going to try this once more and hopefully I can convey the love I now feel for this restaurant.

--

Once upon a time in the kingdom of Willow Springs, a married couple got hungry. Too lazy to cook their own food, they turned to Yelp bookmarks to help decide on a place for dinner (because it would seem they couldn't possibly decide on a place that WASN'T already bookmarked). 

"Everything is the city is too far," one complained. 

"I don't feel like pizza," the other grouched.

"The place I really want to go closes in ten minutes."

"I don't want junk. I might as well just cook something."

"No, wait," the husband said, finally coming to a conclusion. "I have it. Let's go to Eddie Merlot's." 

"On a week night? I'm going to have to get dressed up."

"No, the lounge area has a really nice looking menu." He knew this from looking online. "But you might want to...y'know, put on pants."

So with pants on, the couple hopped in their chariot (okay, it was an SUV) and headed the few miles down the road to Eddie Merlot's...yes, on a week night.

When the couple arrived, they noticed a cute outdoor area with umbrella covered tables. Nice ones, not the type that advertise beer. But nobody was sitting there. It had been rather hot, but the sun was setting and the temperature was dropping faster than the wife's pants had when she arrived home. 

So bypassing the entire inside of the restaurant, or lounge area, they were seated in the cozy patio area, comfortably watching the sway of the trees and feeling the late summer breeze as the sun set in the west. 

Jim was their server for the evening, and he was training two other future servers. He was kind, attentive and gave helpful suggestions.

The couple ordered the meatloaf sliders, the escargot and the filet mignon potstickers (what?!). 

Potstickers: Absolutely stuffed with tender, melt-in-your mouth, buttery beef. Cooked medium rare and perfect. 

Escargot Bourguignon:
Not overcooked and rubbery at all. Perfect. Loved the flavor and the mushrooms complemented them nicely. Came with little puff pastries atop each one. Delicious.

Meatloaf Sliders:
Lovely beef. Kicky jalapeno pesto, and crispy onion straws.

The husband also ordered a martini, because, well, yum. And it was made with the good stuff. None of that bathtub gasoline swill they serve at lesser establishments (you know who you are). 

Fully satisfied with their choices, and full, but not too full, the couple happily perused the dessert menu. Being a steamy summer's night, everything seemed a bit heavy. And the husband was feeling particularly warm from the top notch alcohol in his martini. (Again, yum!)

When their eyes landed upon "Eddie's Mixed Berries" the couple was sold. Strawberries, blueberries, raspberries on vanilla ice cream? Oh yes. But that was only the tip of the iceberg.

Jim, the fantastic server, wheeled a black clothed cart out to the couple's table, and atop it sat a small burner, skillet and several dishes full of all things wonderful. He set to work making magic, melting butter and brown sugar, warming berries and mixing Bacardi Oakheart and raspberry liqueur, setting it aflame before delicately spooning it over two bowls of vanilla ice cream.

Their hearts could have stopped after the first bite, and they would have died happy. This concoction was the most magically delicious combination since (and before) Lucky Charms. Everything worked so well together and the taste was simply incredible. The husband's mouth waters even now thinking back to the wonderful dessert. 

And they lived happily ever after.

--

If I had half a complaint, it would be that Jim was a touch slower in returning to our table than I would've liked. Perhaps he had many tables to serve inside in addition to ours, but I felt like we waited longer for things than we should have. Maybe it's because it was a week night and I wasn't really up for a leisurely dinner. I kind of wanted things faster. I considered giving only 4 stars due to that, but then I tasted the dessert and I wished I could give 6 stars. It was THAT. GOOD.

Prices at Eddie Merlot's are a bit steep. But we pretty much decided that this will be our special occasion restaurant from now on, and we look forward to returning and having a full meal instead of just the appetizers and desserts. 

See you soon, Jim! (and Eddie)

An excellent restaurant with impeccable service. Truly the service is fantastic, our waitress was well-informed and engaging, the food was delivered quickly and warm and we were greeted kindly at the door. It is always nice when you are greeted by your last name and thanked for returning to the restaurant. The wine list is extensive. Pricing can be a little high and the location is nothing to brag about but we have been to this restaurant many times and have always had a great experience. A nice restaurant in a suburban location.

I've been here a few times now and have some mixed feelings about this restaurant. Decor is beautiful, it's very pricey, the food is high quality & delicious, but the service is only so-so...it really detracts from the experience. 

3ish star service. 
Totally underwhelmed by the quality of customer service at such an upscale restaurant. Expected friendly, attentive, nearly flawless service start to finish for the prices demanded by this restaurant. Host/hostesses are not very friendly. Waitstaff/hosts make errors on some very simple things. Have also had waiters who have condescending attitudes. 

4-5 star food. 
Quality is definitely there! Presentation is beautiful, and serving sizes are large. Most of the entrees do not come with a side, so you have to order them a la carte. The sides that we've ordered a la carte have been delicious.

This is an expensive restaurant, so missed things are not appreciated.  I was on a Monday (Birthday celebration), so it was very slow.  However, since the prices were not less, we should not receive less quality service or food.

We ordered the escargot.  It was perfect.  The puff pastry on top was incredible, light and airy.  It was perfect for sopping up the garlic butter.  The gorgonzola in the dish was not heavy.  You could taste it, but it melded with the butter and garlic so well.   The escargot, was not whole snails.  I had one that looked like a 1/2 inch by 1 inch piece of leather.  It tasted perfect.  I just never had sliced escargot.  I'm guessing that Monday diners do not get the regular meal.  Once again, we pay the same price.

I did not know what the difference was between a prime ribeye steak and a prime rib.  Neither did our waitress.  I ordered the red Simi, and did not know they had a white Simi.  The waitress did not mention that and I got the white one.

I was not warned that the Bourbon sauce on the steak would cover the flavor of the steak.  It was very think and spicy.  I like the sauce, but I wanted to taste the meat.  My wife's steak without any sauce was delicious.  The steaks were cooked perfectly.  We had to ask for water and bread, and was already served our wine. and placed our appetizer and were eating our appetizers, so there was a lot of time that expired.   The busboy (don't like this word) went in the back to get our bread and came back out.  He told us that they just put it in the oven so it would be fresh.  Don't you do that when someone sits down?  The bread was also very good.  Who ever makes their breads and pastry, really has a lot of passion.

The salted caramel cupcake had no salted caramel.  It was a delicious devil's food cupcake.  The carrot cake was incredible.  Every flavor shined.  It clearly can feed four people.  

The manager was very attentive and pleasant.  Constantly removing our dirty plates and utensils and giving us fresh ones.  Although, he missed the bread and water too.

Great atmosphere, bar area for 40+. Menu now has something for everyone and every price range.  Good solid food. Servers can be a little too over the top, if we have food in our mouth don't ask us how the food is....maybe I always have food in my mouth?  Anyway, we kind of make a joke of it. The servers write us thank you notes. That's nice, just let us enjoy our meal n conversation.  We eat here often- my husband likes the martinis. I am more of a purest so I do not like heavy sauces, add ons, 

I get the tuna- all forms, steaks w no extra sauces- wedge, Brussel sprouts, ...
My son is all over the desserts...after his steak

Was good, but for the price, the meal didn't blow me away. Service was great, so at least 3 stars for that. Honestly I don't know who they are kidding with some of those prices....this is the suburbs, not the city. I've paid less for a better piece of meat at Gibsons.

Recently went to Eddie Merlots because we had a gift card that was going to expire soon.  We decided to go on a weeknight to sit in the bar and watch the Bears game.  It was a mistake to watch the game because the Bears stink but our trip to Eddie Merlots was the best idea we had all week!

We made it just before Happy Hour ended which includes an assortment of cocktails for $5 and specially priced wines.  We landed on a bottle Cloudline Pinot Noir which was 1/2 price on the evening we went.  

We attempted to order a few items off the bar menu but both weren't availalbe (Filet Pot Stickers and Flatbreads)- which was a big disappointment and cost Eddie's a star for this visit.  Instead we decided on the Meatloaf Sliders and two of their famous side orders, Sweet Potato Gratin and Tempura Green Beans.  We enjoyed all three items immensely and the wine too.  Jeff our bartender for the evening was excellent as well.  

We've been to Eddie's a few times before and really enjoyed our dinners but the bar experience was great and something we might do more frequently.

Came here for a birthday dinner. Everything was pretty great, my husband had the bourbon steak and fries and loved it all. I had the crab stuffed shrimp and it was pretty good along with lobster bisque which was probably the best I've had, large chunks of lobster. Filet mignon pot stickers were great and ahi tuna wontons are a must have app wherever we go, weren't disappointed. Definitely have a lot more on the menu that I'd love to come back and try. As for the desserts, the cookies were hard as a rock. The bananas foster.....made at your table and was amazing.

Great food, excellent service... stuffy without being stuffy... didn't think it was possible until now.  Granted a casual dinner with my family, which included my parents turned more pricey than we were thinking of spending, i am glad we did because the night was perfect.  They have a children's menu, but surprisingly my daughter seemed to be the youngest around.  She was treated wonderfully.  She was even checked on by other workers possibly the maitre d to make sure she ate her mac and cheese and was told she would get a surprise if she finished it.  It was so nice to watch my daughter treated nicely at a pretty expensive restaurant.  Meal breakdown:

Bread - great, had a nice almost garlicky seasoning to it

Appetizer 
Sesame Calamari - so yummy and the sesame bowl is delightfully edible!  
French Onion Soup - the only disappointing part of the night.  It sounded so yummy with 5 types of onions, but it was kind of bitter.  A little salt fixed it, but I didn't want to have to add the salt. 

Salads
Cesar - same old yummy Cesar that you can get anywhere, the croutons were really great though

Main courses
Double Pork Chop - HUGE!!  Keep in mind that I am pretty full at this point.  I only ate about 1/4 of it, but it was cooked to my liking, the BBQ sauce was tasty, not too sweet and the mashed potatoes were great.

Steak Dinners - Can't really go into detail since I am not a red meat eater and didn't try it, but my parents raved about it.  

Pecan Crusted Trout - My hubby thought it was okay.  I tried it and it wasn't that spectacular.  He's a huge fan of pecans which is probably why he ordered it.  

Dessert - 
Red Velvet Cupcake - very good, and very homemade tasting which made it even better.  Very moist and it came with a cup of milk.. cute!

CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e - I am a sucker for this and will always order it.  It was just as good and yummy as I expected it to be.

It was a pricey night, over $300 plus several glasses of wine and a few beers, but definitely worth it, especially since service was excellent and they weren't snobby inside... especially since we weren't really dressed as well as the other patrons.  I didn't realize how fancy this place was, but nonetheless, we were treated so nicely.  Will be back!!

had a coupon- had a lunch here with the coupon.

The cheese burger I had was great- cooked rare just like I asked with lots of cheese. YUMMY!  The beer list was nice, with some unusual IPAs listed.  The bar tender came over to chat about the beer choices they offered.

However, I do think its not so nice to try to charge an EXTRA 2 bucks for fries AND 2 bucks for bacon when the burgers START at 11 bucks.  

Come on- fries should be included.  So a bacon cheese burger with fries starts 15 bucks here. 

Really? Please Eddie's, just include the fries. It's mean spirited to expect americans to eat potato chips with burgers! 

FREEDOM FOR FRIES!!!!!!!!!!

I had a gift certificate so took my daughter and two grand daughters for pre Easter dinner.  They said their meals were excellent, but my filet, on the "prix fixed" menu which I ordered, "rare", (a mistake as it was pretty raw), had the whole tendon attached underneath, and was almost impossible to cut.  At their listed prices, that is inexcusable, and I doubt we'll revisit the dining room.  The service, however, was truly a delight, and our waitress made the evening wonderful.

This review is specifically for the service and food of the lounge area of Eddie Merlots.

For an appetizer my guest and I tried the Calamari.  It was great! Not the best I've had but still pretty damn good.  Super tender and not chewy at all; and it had the most interesting, almost tempura like batter that I have never experienced before with Calamari.

Wow what a Burger! I've had about a handful of world class burgers and this now ranks at #1 for me.  This is no average burger, it is made with ground filet mignon/ribeye so as you can see it is made with the absolute best ingredients.  I ordered the Prime Burger with Bacon and cheddar cheese, and asked for it cooked medium.  It came out just how i wanted it and the bun complimented the burger to perfection.  Keep in mind this is a 14$ burger but you definitely get what you pay for.  Normally the Burger comes with a side of house made chips but my guest and I opted to add 2$ for the Parmesan truffle fries.  They were solid but nothing special; will probably just go with the chips next time that don't cost extra. For something on the healthier side we tried the Asparagus.  Honestly just tasted like boiled asparagus and had absolutely no seasoning on it from what i could tell.  It wasn't bad by any means but not worth the hefty price tag for just some veggies.  We were absolutely stuffed so we passed on the dessert, but i got to admit the table side bananas foster looked very tempting, next time...next time

Now for the service...Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the restaurant and the food, which was very respectable, professionalism at its finest at this point.  But throughout the whole meal he kept checking up on us a ridiculous amount of times and started making small talk/talking about the food/trying to get us to sign up for some Platinum Club that costs 25$?  I came here to have a relaxing evening and chat with my company but i'm serious that the waiter literally kept talking to us more than me and my guest got to talk to each other.  If he could just take it down a notch it would have been great service but he was sooo over the top it was mind boggling.  And he would not stop pestering us about signing up for the platinum club (the workers here must get some benefits if customers sign up for the club).  It was like he was a car salesman it was ridiculous. It got to the point where he actually brought the manager over and once again both of them kept bothering us about signing up for this platinum club.  I'm already spending alot of dough at your establishment and your going to keep bothering us about spending more money to sign up for some club!

Overall the food here is 5 stars and i will be back here without a doubt for a burger from time to time.  But at the same time my evening was  hampered by being constantly bothered by the wait staff trying to up-sell us (making it very hard to talk/enjoy the time with my company) i had to take the place down by one star.  Please guys just tone it down a bit please

I had an excellent dinner at Eddie's. The N.Y. strip was done just right and tasted great. The sides were served family  style and were also very good. The ambiance was nice, including the music. Would certainly go back.

I have been here 3 times- lunch, dinner, and their mother's day brunch.  The first time we came we had great seats right by the fire place and the service was excellent.  However, the 2nd time I went with my bf's siblings and mom and the service was horrible.  The waiter seemed to avoid our table.  We order a bottle of white wine which the waiter threw on the table and didn't even bother putting it in a bucket of ice.

Superb food, delicately prepared.  My salmon was delicious, as well as the calamari appetizer.  The waiter was extremely attentive and helpful with our wine selection.  He was cheerful and discrete - there is an art to that! I highly recommend this excellent establishment.

This restaurant is close to our house in Burr Ridge and we always come here for big family occasions (Easter, Christmas Eve, etc). When we really feel like having the best food, we will order carry out and enjoy their elegant meals at home. I think this place has outstanding entrees & salads/soups as well as the banana foster dessert (which they prepare table-side (see Pictures)). Only thing is, I would never be able to eat there on my own as it is pretty pricey $$. If my parents invite me to come, you know I will always say yes. Highly recommended.

We had an amazing meal here for my Mom's birthday!  The shrimp cocktail with the dry ice is one of our favorite dishes anywhere at any restaurant!  Scott, our server, went above and beyond!  He was attentive and professional.  He helped us enjoy our meal and made great suggestions!  He is very good at his job!  We will be back to visit again soon!  We recommend this restaurant especially for special occasions.  They also have a great bar menu!
I was disappointed with the roasted chicken but others enjoyed their dinner that dined with me. Great wine. Two people sent back dishes to be reheated. It was an average experience.

The low 2-3 star reviews I thought totally undeserved! I have passed here quite a few times and went elsewhere when I was in the area. Except for the drive here, you would not know that you aren't dining in the city. 
Ambience, staff attention, presentation and quality food can all be found here. I actually had a better meal here than in some (obviously I'm going to withhold names) city restaurants which was a pleasant surprise, once again because of the low reviews. 
Portions were generous and we had the BBQ shrimp, which was a hit, the bone in filet that had good flavor and was perfectly executed, added a couple of sides and topped off with a few excellent martinis. Was really a solid meal, will stop in when next in the area, even just for martinis in the bar.

It was my birthday so I choose to go to lunch here with my mom and I am so happy I did. I had a great experience. The service was phenomenal. The food was delicious. We told them it was my birthday and they brought me out my cake with candles. In addition to that they sent me home with a red velvet cupcake! I would recommend this place for any special occasion or if you just want to enjoy a nice lunch or dinner. I loved it!

Wonderful atmosphere and service!  Our server Paul was excellent, answered all my questions and was very nice.  Food was phenomenal and came out perfectly cooked.  My husband and I both got petite filets and they were cooked to perfection.  Desert was great too.  This was Valentines Day so we splurged on coffee drinks as well.  Paul sent us a post card a few days later thanking us for our visit.  We will go back!

Omg I can not rave about this place enough! The food and the service was one of the best I've ever experienced! 

My wife and I were in town on business and we were staying at a hotel down the street and really wanted a nice steak. The reviews were pretty good and since it was close we decided to check it out. I made reservations via opentable online since it was a Friday night. Making reservations was super easy. 

We arrived a few minutes early and were seated and not long after our waiter came to the table and spoke to us by name and since it was our first time, gave us a lil history about the place and told us about the specials and the different cuts of meats and fish. 

I decided to get the 7oz filet mignon and my wife got the 16oz bone in filet mignon. For sides we got the garlic mashed potatoes, roasted mushrooms and asparagus spears.

There was a slight issue with our dinner but our waiter was super informative and very attentive to our needs. He even comped us dessert because of the issue.

Now onto the food.. Both steaks were cooked to perfection and were the best steaks we have ever tasted! Being from Las Vegas, we have been to plenty of good steakhouses but nothing compares to this place! The sides were also amazing as well!

The place is pretty pricey but that's pretty standard for a nice steakhouse. Would definitely recommend to everyone to try it out! 

Totally wish they had a location in Vegas but if we ever go back to Chicago we will definitely be going back!

Wow.  Obviously Eddie Merlot's does not have a lot of fans here on Yelp.  What gives, people?  

We went on a Friday night.  The bar was hopping with live entertainment (often tough to find out in the "burbs"!) which was a definite plus for this girl.  Lots of windows on the bar side which was also nice and added to the decor.

Speaking the the decor- I know some people feel it is dated but the rooms are actually quite lovely. Done in tones of burnt umber, beige and gold, the rooms are really something to look at.  I know this is a chain and that they all look the same way but the effect works.  Plush, upholstered chairs, floor to ceiling drapes in the side room to minimize noise (it is a bit loud in the main dining room as the noise seems to echo off the raised ceiling).  If you want a more intimate experience- ask to sit in the room with the fireplace.  My only complaint (and it's a personal pet peeve of mine) is that our table wobbled.  C'mon.  If you are going for upscale dining- get the tables leveled.

Our server, Carly, was great.  She had lots of suggestions and told us her favs on the menu which is always appreciated.The menu is huge so wandering through all the choices is quite the task.  I could live without the raw steaks being brought to my table (I get that there is more marbling in a rib eye than a strip steak) but I guess that is part of the shtick of this place.

We started with a custom chosen seafood tower.  Now you can go with the two that they have identified, but we decided that we didn't want all of that.  Probably in the long run what we ordered cost more but it was exactly what we wanted.  Shrimp. lobster tail. crab meat, tuna tartar and a smattering of the two oysters of the day made a lovely presentation . . . . .although I could have lived without the dry ice making the whole thing look like a witches cauldron!.  And if you go- skip the tuna tartar- it is way over sauced and you lose the taste of the fresh tuna.

Our steaks were perfectly prepared and delicious.  I always order the same thing in steak houses just to make the comparison so this was one of the better NY strips that I have had.  Funny- I really wanted to order the meatloaf last night (yep- meatloaf in a steakhouse . . .go figure!)  but the NY strip always "calls to me" so that was the winner along with a side of crab legs.  So much food that I am lucky to have leftovers today.

Typical steakhouse in that the steaks come alone and the sides are separate.  We went with the Eddie's special potatoes which were potatoes with jalapenos and cheese (really, be still my heart!) and the sauteed spinach.

The service was excellent.  Carly and her team took excellent care of us, the busser made sure our water glasses were never empty and the plates were cleared at just the right time.  

There is complimentary valet parking (always makes me laugh as there is also a parking lot that you can just park yourself in but I guess that would deprive the valet of a tip).  This location is easy to get to as it is right off of I-55 and County Line Road.  Dinner for two with drinks ran about $220 which seemed reasonable to me given the quantity and quality of the food served. 

Interesting to me that this place has a bit of a reputation for being "expensive" and "fancy".  I tried to get my assistant to schedule a work dinner here and her response was it cost too much so we ended up at Topaz which is just down the street but the prices seem similar to me.  As for fancy?  Wear what you like.  People were in everything from nice jeans to dresses.

The other thing to note is that Eddie Merlot's has a wide range of prices on their menu including several "combinations" like Steak Diane for 2 or the California meals that was a set menu for a set price which both seemed very reasonable to me so maybe they just need to get the word out about the range of offerings that they have.

All in all, a lovely evening of food, drinks and a little entertainment which for this girl who likes to "play" in the city was surprised to find in the "burbs"!
Exceptional Service The chairs are outstanding and comfortable. Its a little pricey but out of this world service felt like I was in Mexico being served on.

First timer, absolutely the best dinner we have had in a long time. Bruce was our server, and attended to our every need beyond expectation. Crab cakes for appetizers,  lobster bisque for soup, wife had the best filet of her life, I enjoyed a fantastic ribeye, followed by creme brulee that we shared. We live in the neighborhood,  so we will be back.

Went on Christmas Eve for the first time.  Was surprised how big the restaurant felt.
Big delicious Caesar salad.  Incredible sweet potato side dish.  Outstanding bananas foster for dessert.  The entrees were good, as expected.  And I like that they give you your sauce on the side, rather than pouring it on the filter themselves, allowing you to control the portion. I AM THE MASTER OF MY SAUCE.

 Its on the pricey side, and won't be in the regular rotation.  But for a special event I'd certainly recommend it.

Great food , the best in burr ridge , we used to go to Gibson but this place took over our favorite steak house .
Great food friendly staff . 
Worth the money
Steak was very good. Side dishes were cold. Service was awful. I'm not opposed to spending big bucks for fine dining  but this is not the place. There are better options than Eddie Merlot's.
Food was outstanding and staff was attentive and courteous.  What more can you ask for?

Lunched with friends - beautiful restaurant- great service and delicious food.  Had the short rib stroganoff.  Would highly recommend.  

Eddie Merlots need to advertise more.  It's been there for 4 years but we never knew it was there.  We will surely recommend to family and friends.

I really needed a nice night out with a great friend. The service was nice. Jose was our waiter. He seemed very knowledgeable even though it felt as though he read the script a hundred times (he was still a nice fellow). He brought us perfect martini's and we had the sesame calamari which was perfectly cooked in a tempura batter. The sea bass was the best I have ever had. My guests Filet was also a hit. The only bummer was a small, squeally, shrieking child in the front was allowed to run around for 10 minutes while all the guests were stunned. I could not believe the clueless parents let this little ball of wonder dance around like a wild child while people were trying to eat. 
The seats and lighting were relaxing and the atmosphere (minus the sqeaker) were just great.

This place ROCKS. May be a bit pricey, but their service, especially Nicki the bartender and Collette are server were Fantastic. Pleasant very knowledgeable and do not rush you along like some others might. The Halibut melts in your mouth and they have a cauliflower augratin that is to Die for!! Lovely cocktails, there house wine pretty good! Nice atmosphere and quiet. Like the capability to eat either in a sunny relaxing table near the bar, which is more casual, or eat in the main for a bit more elegant atmosphere. A definite try!!!

We went for Easter Brunch.  Why Eddie Merlot's for Easter?  I had two criteria for picking a place and Eddie Merlot's satisfied both.  They had last minute available reservations at the time we wanted and they also had a buffet.  Too bad I didn't have a third criteria - good food!  The selection of food was limited.  For example, the salad table had only one kind of salad - Caesar.  The hot food section was also pretty limited in choices.  The carving station had only filet mignon and ham.  One time the entire filet was twell done (embarassing for a steak place) but the ham was pretty tasty.  The omelet station was kind of a bust too.  I asked for one egg over easy and the "chef" clearly did not know how to make one!  Desserts were not impressive, very institutional in presentation and appearance, and no great shakes in terms of taste.

The only redeeming thing about the brunch was the service - every trip back from the brunch line was met with the old dishes removed, a freshly folded napkin and clean silverware.

I expected more/better for $35 per person.

My husband and I come here quite a bit for date night. However, we went today for their Mother's Day brunch. Hands down, it was one of the best brunch buffets we've ever been to. And while we are use to the prices, at $40 per person, the brunch was a deal!

We choose to celebrate a Birthday here.......Most of the food was Delicious, but when the main entree;'s came....one was missing the shrimp and the side of hash brown potatoes...we were there for 3 long hours...it was not the waitress' fault and they did offer us more wine(?)  But...not too sure we will be back real soon.
On the other side of things,  the appetizers were FANTASTIC....!!!!
Maybe we'll try it again for Special Occasions, as it IS an upscale place..

Always outstanding. Have had two wonderful events at EM, each one was exemplary. The staff attentive & professional, the food mouthwatering, ambience lovely. One of my all time favorites. We have had just about everything on the menu, and never disappointed.

I have been here a few times. After my first experience I did not think I would return. It was just bad service. I did choose to try again. And happy to say it was a good choice. We sat in the bar area by the fireplace. Comfy chairs nice atmosphere in here. Service was right on. Our server was friendly and took good care of us. I have tried a few different items off the menu and a nice med rare Filet is my go to. The Oyster Rockefeller were very good, Beef Bourguignon, Jumbo Shrimp cocktail and Caesar salad all equally as good. Finish off with a nice bourbon and that made for a happy belly. good food and good service I will return.

Eddie Merlot's is excellent! We started with the Sweet and Spicy Rock Shrimp, which was excellent. I had the 30 Day Dry-aged Ribeye Steak with a side of sauteed spinach, while my lady had the New Orleans Mixed Grill, and all of it was cooked to perfection. The drinks were outstanding, as well. I dine out a lot, and I'm telling you, this is a top notch restaurant. I've been to Gibson's, Joe's, N9NE, Morton's, and Mastro's, and Eddie Merlot's can compete easily with all of those restaurants. Trust me, go to this restaurant. You will not regret it.

I was apprehensive coming here because of the mixed reviews.  Note: we had a $25 coupon and my wife is pregnant so she didn't drink.  

We were greeted by very friendly hostesses and we were seated.  We ate at 6:00 p.m. on a Friday so one, the place was not busy and we were easily the youngest people in there by 20 years (I'm in my early 40's).  

The decor made me think of  dining in Las Vegas, specifically, Bellagio.  Not that that's a bad thing, but rather, it seems stylishly overdone.  But, if the food is good, who cares what the decor is?

Yuliya, our waitress, could not have been nicer.  She helped us with recommendations and did not make us feel rushed.  I had the Venetian strip and my wife had the filet.  Both were good.  We split the Brussels sprouts and they were good.  We ordered the cheesecake which was both the best I've ever had and the biggest piece I ever had. 

My wife didn't drink due to being pregnant but I had a very good rye Manhattan and a glass of port with dessert.  Our dessert was free as a gift for us being pregnant.  It was certainly a nice surprise.

I'd like to come back here but the $25 coupon, free dessert, and only one of us drinking made our bill much lighter than it would be.  We spent about $72 and tipped generously due to the great service.

Is it the best steak place around?  No.  I reserve that for Golden Steer in Forest Park.  However, that place is nowhere near as ritzy as Eddie Merlot's.  Paying full price at Eddie Merlot's is an expensive evening out but the service, for us, more than made up for that.

I found the place to be very nice and the food pretty good. I thought i was in Vegas paying 55 for a cut of meat. Thats why i am rating it 3 stars.

I was happy with the bar and eatery. 

I would go again and i guess i will be bringing my visa card!!

Take out a home equity loan and enjoy. Good food at very high prices. I'd suggest eating at the bar and order appetizers to lower the costs.  Order the fried green beans - very good.

Decor is nice, certain seats are great for some romance points.  If you think you'll be back buy into the membership.  You'll get your money back and more.

All the seafood items are very good - no complaints.

I won a gift card to Eddie Merlot's and decided recently to follow up on the gift. My wife and I invited a great couple to join us. What an enjoyable evening! Sure, Eddie's is expensive, but we went there knowing it - it wasn't a surprise. The food was absolutely top notch! Mike, our server, was attentive and his humor was welcome. I commented to my friend that I had not had as enjoyable a night, awesome steaks, desserts, salads, and everything - in years! Thanks for a great night and a great memory! Eddie's, keep it up!

My husband and  I decided to try Eddie  Merlot's  to celebrate our 34th wedding anniversary last night. Perhaps  my expectations were too high after hearing  many good reviews, but I found it to be highly overrated. Our server was personable and informative, but difficult to understand with his accent. Our oyster appetizer was excellent, but everything went downhill from there. Our Caesar salads contained overdressed romaine and I had barely touched my salad when our entrees appeared. I detest being rushed, especially in a "high end restaurant". I ordered the sea bass and my husband order the bone-in bison ribeye, our intention was to share. My sea bass was small, dry and lacked flavor, for $37,  I expected much more. The ribeye was tasty but a bit tough. When asked about our food, my reply was 'it's just ok, I've had much better.' This brought the manager out (not my intention), he was over the top in wanting to please me (at one point kissed my hand, ugh!) and brought out the halibut special, which was better. Our server surprised us with a dessert, a chocolate cupcake, again rather boring. All in all, I'll never go back and will not recommend. 
Should have waited for a table at Hugo's or gone back to Perry's Steakhouse.

I was very much looking forward to trying this new upscale steak house in my ol' neck of the woods.  We went to celebrate my mother's birthday. 

The five of us walked in at 5pm right after they opened.  There were maybe five or six tables seated in the restaurant.  The decor was eye catching but cookie cutter.  Almost seemed like they were trying to channel Vegas in some regards with the giant lamps and the stained glass.  I could tell that they did not spare any expense from the silver to the wine glasses, menu, bathrooms, etc.   Overall much much nicer than Max and Erma's!

The menu was extensive but the prices were way off.  This place was more expensive than the highest end Steak Houses in Chicago.  More expensive than Sullivan's or Maestros without the swagger or ambiance that big boys carry.  

Furthermore, we sat down at five ordered each course at the beginning, app, soup, salad, entree.  We waited 50 minutes for the app, and a half hour between the rest of the courses.  We ended up sitting there for three hours and twenty minutes on a Sunday evening in a half crowded restaurant.  

My steak tasted great although they didn't have the one I originally requested.  My mom ordered medium and it came out well done.  She was pretty upset with her entire birthday experience.  The Mac and Cheese, and the Eddie's potato sides were sub par, yet the Brussels sprouts and creamed spinach were excellent.  

The manager was attentive and tried to make amends, but after over three hours of a comedy of errors, there was little that he could do to rectify the situation.   

Bottom like, if I am going to pay $60 for a steak I will be going to stick with the Big League players and steer clear of Eddie Merlot's.

Overall very mediocre. Space nice and service good but food just ok, especially for price. Steak and sea bass entrees were decent but nothing special and calamari, a house specialty supposedly, was some of the most rubbery I have ever eaten. Parmesan truffle fries very dry and need some sort of dipping sauce. Highlight was chopped salad but if a salad is highlight of a steakhouse meal, not saying much. Guess there isn't much else in the area but would rather drive to Perry's, wildfire, or Gibsons for a better meal.

One of my most memorable recent dining experiences took place this past
weekend at Eddie Merlot's in Burr Ridge.  

Immediately upon entering Merlot's, one is visually astounded by the
upscale contemporary dÃ©cor - the lighting is colorful and festive, the
stained glass pieces that hang from the ceiling are beautiful, the
chairs at each table are "living room" stuffed chairs, which
immediately makes you realize you will be comfortably seated in this
sophisticated arena.  Spacing of tables allows for easy movement around
the restaurant and is conducive to privacy in conversation.  Although
your eyes are roaming to take in all the beautiful dÃ©cor, the main
attraction would have to be the floor-to-ceiling wine "cellar" encased
in glass, which takes up the back wall of the restaurant.  The "cellar"
offers you a rare view of the large selection of the wines that
Merlot's has to offer.

You are escorted to your table by one of several hostesses and your
wait staff magically appears within minutes.  Our waiter, Jaime, gave a
short overview of the steaks for which Merlot's is known, and when
asked, comfortably offered suggestions and comment on our selections.
For appetizers, presentation of the calamari was most notable as it is
served in an edible "bowl" made to look like an open clam/seashell.
Upon our waiter's recommendation, we also ordered the blue cheese
potato chips which were flavorful and delicious, but not heavy.
Merlot's offers several salads, one being a wedge, however, what set
Merlot's apart, was the offer of a maple apple cider vinaigrette, which
caused the taste buds to water.

For the steak lover, the bourbon marinated rib eye is a flavor
explosion, while the bone-in rib eye with gorgonzola literally melted
in the mouth. Sides are perfect for sharing, and the Eddie's potatoes
(diced potato with jalapeno in au gratin sauce) are a great enhancement
to any entrÃ©e and something apart from the everyday baked potato.  The
Brussels sprouts with cippollini onions and diced bacon would make a
veggie eater out of anyone.  They were a taste bonanza.  Each course is
brought to the table and served by wait staff and managers so that the
entire table is served at one time.

Eddie Merlot's is a fine dining experience geared for the diner who
wants to savor and enjoy each course with the perfect down time in
between.  General manager Jeff Stoltman and his staff are devoted to
making you feel pampered.  Merlot's is the perfect place for that
special occasion, even if that special occasion is simply because it's
a Saturday!

Fantastic Service!  

Wow, it's not that often that I come out of a restaurant and say that the service was probably the best part of the night..... not that the food was bad, its just the service was fantastic.  Our waiter popped up out of no where at all the appropriate times!  

BEST OF ALL - Our waiter did not try to up-sell us on anything!  When was the last time you were at a restaurant and the waiter didn't push you for a 3rd glass of wine or an extra side dish or dessert?    We still spent over $150 (not including tip) for two people, but it was just very refreshing to NOT feel rushed into or out of our mean and NOT feel pushed into buying food we didn't want.   BRAVO.  

Minus one star because they were late by 10 mins on our reservation and the hostess was kind of rude.  

Oh yeah, even though the place reminded me of a las vegas steak house, it seemed to be full of the 50's and 60's generation... (I'm not saying that's a bad thing, just a different crowd vs. many of the downtown Chicago steak houses)

Great place- highly recommend it. For a Wednesday night, it was pretty full, which is a good sign. In a really cute area. Super nice when you walk in and the chairs at the table are super comfortable- I know kind of weird but they are like couch chairs- so great and different from other restaurants. great service and really great food and wine. Pricey but it's a nice restaurant so what would you expect.

Something I thought was interesting- we were sitting there and they were training someone and this new waiter was setting the table next to us and then had to have someone inspect.... the boss made him take 2 glasses back because they had fingerprints on them. So obviously they strive for great service!

My husband and I frequent this restaurant almost weekly. The food is always good. We usually have a variety of appetizers. The carpaccio is delicious. We also split the ahi tuna entree and have that as an app. The parmesan  truffle fries are not to be missed!
Why I decided to write this review though has to do with my outstanding experience. I was celebrating my birthday-nothing big. The reason we went there is for the bananas foster for dessert. When it came time to order that treat, the server informed us that they did not have any of the desserts with bananas because they were out!!! I was devastated. Then a manager stepped in-we joked that the grocery store is right across the street can't we get some bananas??
