Before we knew it he actually went to the store brought back the bananas and the table had the delicious flaming bananas foster!! Very impressive and a great way to end my birthday. 
So go! Have a great time with great food and outstanding service!

My husband and I received a gift card for this restaurant so we decided to go out for a nice dinner.  We made reservations online and were seated as soon as we sat down.  We were greeted by a lady who asked for our drink order.  We told her we needed another minute to decide and she informed us that our server would be back to take our order.  So we sat and waited. And waited....and then finally the manager (possibly?) came around to asked if we've been helped.  I said no since it had been almost 10 minutes and no one had come back to take our order.  He gladly took our drink order.

A minute or two later, the server came by.  No introduction, no hello. All we got was "Have you decided on your order yet?" It was slightly frustrating since we could hear another server's interaction with the table next to us explaining the soup of the day, the seafood specials and giving his opinion on the menu items.  We got nothing.  It seemed that since we were a younger couple, our waitress didn't bother to make an effort to appreciate our business.

We ordered drinks and calamari (which came in an edible shell) and both were delicious.  The guy who brought the food was very friendly and explained what the different sauces were.  The rest of our dinner was also very tasty (filet mignon and the trio of medallions).  We also opted for desserts made tableside.  The waitress seemed to warm up to us a little more.

Overall the service could have been a lot better but the food was delicious.  Didn't really appreciate the waitress's attitude. Maybe we'll be back, but not anytime in the near future.

I have been in the food business for over 50 years. Eddie Merlots is a great experience. The service and staff is outstanding. We ordered the Chateaubriand and were disappointed by the cut and preparation. The thickness of the tenderloin piece used made it difficult for the Chef to properly cook it. The outside was hard crusted and extremely dry while the center was blood raw (no balance). Because of the shape and the crustiness, our server had some difficulty cutting and serving the portions. At over $90.00 for the meal, we were disappointed with the quality.

Service and Bartender were first class and very professional.  Appetizers that we had were the Smoked Salmon and Ahi-Tuna which were delicious, The Bone-In Rib Eye, not so much.  If I didn't know better, I would have thought it was broiled.  Our friends with us had the Chateaubriand, for two,and loved it.  I'll come again and give Eddie Merlots another try....but it won't be a Rib Eye.

I have visited this place several times with the same mixed experience, but last night was the last straw. 

We arrived at 6 pm and were surprised that there were hardly any cars in the parking lot. All the other local restaurants nearby were almost full.

Upon entering, we were greeted with the strong smell of an open sewer! I had to stand there a moment and make surer I was smelling what I thought I was...then my wife asked "do we really want to eat here?" And we walked out.

I won't be going back.

I made reservations for 7:15 on a Friday night to give this place a second shot. We were seated in the bar next to the fireplace in one of the shorty tables with thick cushioned chairs. Made for a cozy night. We also had a shot at the TVs so we could keep up with the Hawks and their winning streak! Johnathon was our server and he kept us satisfied the whole evening. On the money, polite and knew his business. I started with the Ruffino pinot, that didn't last thru his next visit. We started with 6 west coast Rockefeller's and the famous smoking jumbo shrimp cocktail. Oh! I also switched to Crawford sb on our servers suggestion, which was a much better choice. The oysters Roc came out in short order. They were smokin hot and delicious!! Meaty, with just enough cheese and spinach that left them flavorful but not overpowering. I've had the shrimp before and was looking forward to them. I thought we ordered two, one for each of us as I explained to Johnathan that I didn't want to share any of my food. No big deal as we kept covering the table for the duration. This was my only disappointment of the evening. One of the shrimp was Irish! It was like almost half the size of the others? And the sauce that was supposed to be thick and spicy with the horseradish, was watered down and weak! I kept dipping the shrimp into it to try to get it to stick. To no avail! Our server came back with another glass of that fine wine and we placed out entrees. Not before they brought out a Caesar salad. Wow! This is one of the best that I have had. The first anchovie I bit into didn't have much flavor. Then I got the second and the party in my mouth had begun! The croutons added nothing to texture of the salad as they were too large and flavorless. They should be an option delete for future meals. I had a taste for some comfort food and the beef bourguignon hit the spot! Button mushroom and chunks of meat in a thick brown gravy over a pile of mashed that made me do the happy dance. It came in a bowl, so Johnathan was a bit surprised that I wiped it clean with their oven fresh and crusty, soft in the middle loaves of bread. I finished the night off with a big hunk of cheese cake and a glass of Belle Meiomi. Fine dining brought to a comfortable level of outstanding service and pleasant atmosphere!
Am a frequent diner at Eddie Merlots.  We have yet to have a bad meal.  The atmosphere and service is also superb!

Eddie Merlots is a worthy successor to Morton's, which closed its Westchester branch a couple years ago.  This is definitely less stuffy, with more emphasis on wine and not the over-the-top gigantic portions.

Very large wine selection by glass and bottle.  For such a large list I would have hoped for either carafe option or maybe wine flights -- maybe they'll consider this someday.  By the glass (we weren't up for more) the choices were mostly $8-14, though you could have spent much more on reserve vintages.  

I had a very decent gazpacho, classically prepared, though a bit salty (I often think restaurant chefs over-salt).  Also shared a chopped salad which did well.

We weren't up for steak, but our neighbors' plates looked good.  Instead, we had beef bourguignon and sesame crusted tuna sashimi (though it's not called that on the menu).  I wouldn't call Eddie Merlots a sushi destination, but my dinner was quite decent.  The beef was laid on a large helping of mashed potatoes.  I would have preferred more beef and less potatoes, but otherwise this was a good dish too.

We skipped desert, but were tempted by the carrot cake which again looked good at the next booth.

Our waiter Joseph was quite friendly, even chatty, which is a nice contrast to the Morton-style stuffiness.  I think we'll return if we get a steak craving.  (Maybe they'll create a $99 couples steak menu like Morton's had.  Hint!)

The "great hall" style of the room was classic - the high ceiling and generously spaced tables kept noise low.  Very nice.  I expected the food to be very good and it exceeded my expectations.  The cheese and charcuterie selection was excellent - aside from the meat and cheese, the sauces and chips alone were exciting.  My filet was cooked perfectly and plated as I expected.  
What really topped it was the top notch service.  Yulia was had somelier skills and the patience to pause when approaching the table instead of interjecting harshly as too many servers do.  Top marks all around.  We will be back soon.

Food - Outstanding. I  have been here 10 times and have never been disappointed.

Service - Over the top fantastic. The staff is polished and thoughtful. They know the menu well and can make suggestions. Valet is always one step ahead.

Environ - Comfortable. Homey. Spacious. The dining room has a touch of elegance, and the bar offers a welcoming spaces. 

Keep up the great work!

Food quality is very good and service fine but the seating was not what my wife and I like. I can't bring myself to give this place 4 stars. Prices seemed just too high for what they offered. For the best experience and best steak, you have to go to Mortons downtown on Wacker. Granted, the prices were somewhat higher for Mortons, but the superior food quality, seating and service just made it worth the money. If possible, I'd give Eddie Merlots 3.5 stars.
Ask for Todd!

Eddie Merlot's is a restaurant chain with restaurants in Indiana and Ohio and opened it's first in Illinois in Burr Ridge.  We dined there for Christmas Eve with 14 family members. I made the reservation when the restaurant first opened after Thanksgiving.

I also waited to try the restaurant because new restaurants have to iron out the kinks with food prep and help situations.

The valet, the coat check, the front reception were all accommodating with our group.  Our waiter and waitress were very professional.  Our drinks were well made. (Also,a little expensive when compared to other area restaurants but they
tasted so much better.  I had a Dewars Scotch old fashioned and it was the best I have had in a while.)
 
We ordered appetizers to start with the hot and cold fish platters.
OMG, the BEST fried calamari and the BEST BBQ Shrimp I have ever had!
I ordered the petite 6 oz. filet cooked medium with the side of lobster tail.  My husband had the New York strip.  Everyone's food appeared hot and delicious.  We ordered sides for the table to share.  The creamed spinach was a favorite, along with the hash browned potatoes which were crispy but not greasy or dry.

We were too full for dessert plus I had candy and cookies at the house for Christmas but the desserts appeared mountainous!  Red velvet cake, Carrot Cake, and Cheesecake looked absolutely scrumptious.  I would even entertain going around 10 pm for dessert and a cappaccino.

We returned the following week with another couple for New Year's Eve.  I ordered the exact same plate but ordered a crab cake appetizer and a chopped salad, which were superb.  My girlfriend had a cosmopolitan and she said it was perfectly made.

My only real complaint is that I feel the food is a tad expensive for what you receive.
I live in Burr Ridge and I am wondering if the prices will turn people away.  After all,
there are people that live in the area that can afford it.  But, are we stupid?  I think not.  So, a plea to Eddie Merlot's management would be to lower your prices on drinks and food.  Larger portions would not be necessary.  Just reduce the prices around 10%.

However, take into account that the 1) service is impeccable 2) drinks made to order are perfect 3) atmosphere is conducive for conversation and the acoustics are good.

We have been to other steak houses where we had to wait, even though we had a reservation. Also, the noise level can give me a headache in those "other" busy steak houses.  Eddie Merlot's was busy but was very comfortable and the atmosphere is wonderful.  The bar is beautiful, too.

Will I go back to Eddie Merlot's?  In a heartbeat.  I will give up eating out for a month just to dine there on a budget.  Yum and fun. Best fish and steak I have had prepared in a long time. I highly recommend this for a special occasion.   Happy dining!

Over-rated.  You can't charge prices on a par with Gibsons or just slightly under and supplement it with amateur service.  The food is average at best - nothing special, nothing makes it stand out.  The wait staff, greeters and even the bartenders are too inexperienced to make the dining experience anything more than average for most places and below average for a place that is priced as high as this.  I was being entertained by one of my vendors and were I the one paying for the meal, I would have asked for much better service than we were being given.  I would not go back to this restaurant, nor would I recommend it.  There are plenty of big name steak places in the area where you'll get a better experince and meal for your money.

If you haven't been to Eddie Merlot's in Burr Ridge, it's a must try. The bar is gorgeous and they are generous with their pours if ya know what I mean :) I had the Spinach Artichoke dip which was fabulous. My friend had the shrimp cocktail. The shrimp were on some serious steroids. Huge! Eddie Merlot's is in the old Max & Erma's building which they completely remodeled. They have live entertainment, at least on Saturday evenings.  Very nice place.. I'm looking forward to return for dinner.

Hi All!
Eddie Merlots is worth every penny of the money for the "cut of meat" as a yelper put!
Vegas paaaa Gibsons is in the city and Oak brook so is tht any cheaper-Just sayin!
ok back to Eddies-which was formerly the Max and Erma's in Burr Rigde. WOWOh
WOW- It is a beautiful place with Decor lighting the seating,dining and Bar all deserve the 5 stars I am giving it. We have gone for Anniversary 2x,New Years Eve 2x ,Birthdays 4x and in general dining with friends business partners. While the decor may feel like you are in downtown chicago ----NOT VEGAS! the customer service is as impeccable as the cleanliness and food are.
In all those times i listed above and some I forgot to mention meeting g/fs in the bar for apps which are also yumme presentation is awesome! I have not had a bad meal or service in fact the food is even tastier every time we go. I find the consistency
of Eddie's to be tried and true.
Go see for you self it is the place to dine in the burbs! oh and what we have eaten
There prices arent only 55 as stated below!- sorry to be this way. I think if you want to rate it 3 then say something other then it was $55 very miss leading-to those of us who yelp around to see where we would like to go!
first they have cuts of filet for $27 on up to $80+for a full RACK of Lamb. the salads start at $7 and $8 dollars very reasonable! The salads are pretty good size portions we split them and it is more then enuff for 2. if you want a salad entree try Caeser which is in big tilted bowl a meal they are in themselves. Apps start anywhere from$3 which is a "create your own melody" upwards to$66 for Seafood Platter which is huge.
No I do not work for them in any way just find them one of the hidden secrets!
Bbq shrimp app yumme,Ahi wontons another to try
sssmee calmari a must try
aged steak is nice however I am a rib eye gurl and her sooo worth it.
that we are going for valentines day.
while every restaurant has an off day I would say there on days by far out weight the off.

I really wish I took the time to read www.Yelp.com before I chose this restaurant for dinner this evening.

Our experience duplicated most everyone else's.  Here is my review:

Decor.  Very nice. Chairs were most comfortable.  Restroom clean.  No solar issue.  Parking very good.

Service.  Wendy the waitress was very good.  Water refill spot on.  Dish pick up non existent.  Rest of help just stands around, didn't do much for us. Two managers on duty, I guess.  One guy wearing a tie stopped at the table but didn't introduce himself, name or title.  Was he a manager?  Did he even work there?  He could have been another diner for all we knew.

Bar.  Mixed drinks good.  Wine not good.  This restaurant prides itself on its wine, we were served some horrible wine.  To me, this was the worst part.

Food. Sea Bass very good.  Italian Steak Very good.  Two rib eyes (their best steak) one OK the other so bad my guest left it on the plate uneaten.  Side dishes OK.

Dessert. Carrot cake excellent.  Ice cream and sorbet OK.

Price.  5 people, tip tax, out the door $540.00.

Conclusion.  Disappointing.  (And we are desperately looking for a nearby steak house to replace Morton's in Westchester that closed.)  As other people have pointed out, this restaurant just isn't worth it.  Our bill was too high but what was worse, our guests who didn't see the bill said they would not want to come back.

Sorry Eddie.  We really wanted to like your place but sadly, we did not.

Ok, so I'm reading reviews after my experience and have some of the same thoughts...but first, with all the positive ratings, either there are a lot of west 'burbers that seriously need to get out more, or I picked the wrong night to try Eddie Merlots.  Well for starters, our reservation was at 7:30.  I was finally served my salad at 9p.  Need I say more?  I will admit, the food was fab, really pretty damn good stuff here...but I must add, management needs to focus on service!!  I don't care how good your food is, if it takes an hour and a half to receive my salad, I'll never return.  In fact, we were surrounded by unhappy guests!  The manager was busy humoring a couple at the table next to us most of the night.  When I asked our server if they were short-staffed he said "yes, busboys."  Well, that explains why, even though he's walked past our table plenty (along with other staffers and they are all careful NOT to make eye contact), this explains why my bread plate and our empty cocktail glasses still litter our immediate landscape.  ;)  At one point, our server (who shall remain nameless) said to my friend "I know it seems like I've been ignoring you all night, blah, blah, blah..."  to which my friend said "that's because you HAVE been ignoring us."  ;)  He then launched into a few minutes of flattery and it's like dude, nice attempt at salvaging your tip.  You judged this book by the wrong cover.  I hope that table with the two "power couples" (he practically licked all evening) stiffed him.  I'm saving my next obscenely large tip for someone more deserving.  WAIT!  I should have started with the smell!  One reviewer said it smelled "like sewer" and those were my exact words!  Upon entering, it's like you're hit in the face with an odor of...sewage!  Ugh, def not appealing in the least.   2 stars ONLY for the food.  The service and that ODD odor were point deductions.

The steaks melt in your mouth and the burgers are actually cooked the way you ask and they taste like they threw a steak in a grinder, no cheap ground beef. The service was excellent and best of all if you sit in the bar area the chairs are like recliners, they are so comfortable you will not want to get up and the wait staff will not rush you out. They will serve you for hours and make you feel at home. A bit pricey but the food, drinks, and service are up to par with there prices.

The attitude is that we the customers are lucky they are here.  I have been there twice and that will be it for me.  With so many choices in the area I will spend my money where I feel like it is appreciated.  This might work in  Indianapolis and Louisville, but not here.  At least not for us.  My advise is to go visit Topaz or Capri or Dao in the immediate area for a much better experience.

Wow what a pleasant surprise! After reading so many mixed reviews we were not sure what to expect. The contemporary Art Deco ambiance was tastefully done. The filet and mashed potatoes rivaled the late Morton's. our server Jen was extremely pleasant and professional. We dined in the lounge area relaxing in the over sized very comfortable chairs enjoying the live music. Can't wait to go back!

These are some very nice people working at this restaurant, but I stopped by again last week for a cocktail.  Again, I ordered the exact same drink I have (until April 15th, anyway, when I switch to Boodles and tonic) and again the tab was $14.14 for the drink plus tip.  So I'm not going to stiff the bartender, so that's a $3 tip and I wind up with a $17 Manhattan.  I don't care where you are, that's a lot for a drink.  I had one at two of the swankiest bars/restaurants in Palm Beach just days before and even at the flippin' Breakers Hotel the exact same drink was only $11.  I so sincerely want to like this place, and it's nice, but it's not THAT nice. Why can't they get their act together on pricing? Even their chef (ex of Alinea) is a top shelf guy, but...  Well, enough. I've said my peace.

Just an amazing lunch!  

I was meeting a friend for lunch and she suggested Eddie Merlot's in Burr Ridge.  I told her I didn't think they did lunch but she said that someone had just dropped off a lunch menu at her workplace, so I agreed to meet her there.

First off, it is a beautifully done restaurant.  A little over the top with the decor, but I can appreciate the effort.  We got seats next to the fireplace and sat in the most comfortable restaurant chairs I have experienced in a long time. My friend ordered a combo of soup and flatbread... the french onion soup was the best (she let me try some) and they did an unusual take on a veggie flatbread with shaved brussel sprouts.  I had the BBQ, Bacon Wrapped shrimp with a side of tempura green beans.  There were only three shrimp, but they were HUGE and there was no upcharge to get the tempura beans (which came with a side of wasabi cream sauce).  We also got a complimentary Red velvet cupcake to finish the meal.  I had asked for a house glass of pinot noir too and when I looked over the bill, it was only $5.

This may be my new go-to lunch place. It's not diner cheap, but I''ll pay a couple bucks more for this level of food and atmosphere.  It also wasn't that busy, but I have a feeling that is going to change once word gets out.

Way too expensive with average food and average service.
If you must go, eat in the large bar but don't expect a lot of attention,

Great Lobster Mac n Cheese. The Waldorf salad was also delicious. But I don't eat beef - so in some ways the menu seemed very limited for me and I am very good at making things work. The Jackie O martini knocked me out.
We had lunch there today.  The service was wonderful and the food was out of this world.
Great place... Food = good, atmosphere =great(this was the old Max and ermas) service=great....

Loved this place. Went with my mom to split a salad but we ended up getting our own entrees. The steak was unbelievable. I had the cedar planked salmon, so delicious. I recommend splitting the salads though especially if your eating it before your main course. The chopped salad was to die for and my mom had the tomato and onion which was great and perfect for the season. Loved this place, looking forward to go again!

My husband and I came to enjoy ourselves near one of the bar/fireplace tables one evening.  After I was sexually harassed by a group of heavily intoxicated men at the bar, we were really shaken up, and expected that the management would handle the situation appropriately.  The manager apologized and told us that the men had been at the bar since noon...IT WAS 8 PM!  We were outraged!  The men were spilling drinks, and harassing us at our table. The manager offered us a free dessert to make up for the incident.  Seriously - it ruined our evening, and we will never come back.

Fantastic food with a vast menu. My husband stopped in and brought home the broasted chicken with potatoes. The potatoes were my favorite part, but then again-- it's hard to go wrong with potatoes. The broasted chicken was great too. The only thing I thought was lacking was the Cole slaw.

2.5 stars, unfortunately. Nothing special here. Had a couple hot dogs and fries, and if you've ever had a great hot dog, like at Gene & Jude's, there's no way you could like these. For Vienna dogs, they were surprisingly tasteless, and small. And, like many other reviewers here, my bun was dry and not steamed. I also didn't like the skinny "shoestring" fries that you need to eat with a fork. But at least they weren't greasy and soggy like I've read about. The restaurant was nice, though, with lots of TVs, and seems like a good local option for people in the area, and I'm sure kids like the food.

I love coming here after going to Cantigny or on my way home from anywhere in the WWW (Wheaton/Warrenville/Winfield)!  It's one of those local hole-in-the-wall spots that you know all the neighborhood kids go in the summer on their bikes.  And when they grow up their kids will be doing the same thing.  My family and I have come here and tried a variety of items.  There are things that we love (jumbo dog, gyros, fries) and there are things we don't like (steak sandwich - too dry/burnt).  But I wouldn't hold it against them because they're things that may have been an "off day".  The service is always great - you always feel welcome with the ladies who take your order (Are there guys who work the register? I've never had one.. but if there are, I'm sure they're great too!).

It was decent. We came here on a weeknight and ordered four gyros plates. The bread is extra if you want it with the platter. They also put feta and olives on the gyros so if you don't want it, let them know to put it on the side. 

The fries that come with the platter are also decent too. 
This location is in a plaza off of county farm road and Geneva  behind the walgreens. 

There is plenty of parking here as well so fear not! 
You can eat inside or take it to go. 

All in all average experience. 
They do have teenagers working who don't speak up very loud and look super nervous when you ask them a question. So be patient with the young ones!

I never thought this place was that good when ever I was in the area. Today I had a grilled chicken on a pitta with feta cheese and tomato. Let tell you, it was amazing!! The gentleman who made it for me gave an idea for next time. To request a wrap instead! Its in a bigger thinner pitta bread.
Everyone is so nice and friendly...great customer service!
Not very good. Had a jumbo dog with a limp pickle. Bun was soggy. Fries were too salty and not many of them. Place was very clean and friendly.

I want to love this place, but I keep getting disappointed. We've been here plenty of times, and it's time for a honest review. 

I'm not going to review this joint on the hotdogs. It's a Chicago style Vienna beef hotdog. Can't really mess it up... 

The problem is pretty much everything else on the menu. I ordered the chicken sandwich. The chicken was paper thin, and they served it up on a hamburger bun. The flavor was good, but the sandwich alone won't fill you up. The same goes for the bbq beef. Poor quality, served up on a hamburger bun. I could have eaten three.  

The soup is garbage. The cream of chicken rice was like broth, and not much flavor.

My girlfriend had the gyro, it was very tasty. Problem was, they put about a half teaspoon of sauce on it. 

The kitchen staff is nice, but not very helpful. They are all teenagers who don't seem to care about what they're serving up. 

I would eat here again, but only if I'm being lazy, and don't feel like driving a bit further for a better joint. 

Hotdog joints are a dime a dozen, and you need to bring the quality. It doesn't take much to drive down the road to another one.
Excellent as always. I had the Jumbo dog special with fries.  A solid value at $4.19.

Tony's Steamers (or just "Steamers" as I know it) was non existent to me up until about a year ago. I had learned of this place from a coworker at my last job, as she was quite the fan. I was curious as to why she knew about it and I hadn't, despite living in Wheaton for 17 years or so. After trying it a few times, I grew to like the place and their vast menu.

After having my Friday afternoon off and being out and about in the area, I realized I needed something to eat, and fast. I immediately decided on Steamers, as I enjoy hotdogs but my fiance does not. So I decided I would indulge without guilt.

I ordered the hot dog special with everything, which is a hot dog with fries. That doesn't include a drink, so I decided to order a small Sprite (they had Sierra Mist instead). Much like my last experience elsewhere ordering a hot dog, I was asked if I wanted celery salt, but also the obligatory "sport peppers?" I really, REALLY wish places would assume that if one wants "everything" on their dog, they DO want celery salt and hot peppers. I know they're just doing their job but.... I was slightly irritated. I blame it on my hunger pains.

No sooner than I paid for my order and sat down, it was ready.the lunch rush was long gone and only a couple of other diners were left. I chose a booth next to a window, and was about to sit down when they called out my order.  I grabbed my tray, sat down, and took a photo of the 'dog. 

My hot dog  was a bit overloaded, to say the least. I guess that's a good thing, however I'm not a fan of having to dislocate my jaw in order to eat something. I picked the pickle, cucumbers, and tomatoes off and ate them separately in order to eat the hot dog. No big deal really, I suppose it could have been worse with the hot dog lacking in toppings. The hot dog itself was quite delicious as my buddy Dan B. could tell you, so I won't elaborate. The fries were good and crispy and not overly salted, but between them and the hot dog, I was still hungry afterward. Nonetheless, I ate every crumb and disposed of my trash.

Usually I only get a hot dog and fries when I stop in here, but I've also had their  mini chicken tacos, which remind me of similar ones you can buy in your grocer's freezer. But, they're a bit cheaper so that's a-okay in my book. It gets the job done.

As I left, I turned around to say thanks and the gentleman waved and said "No, thank YOU! Have a great weekend!" All of the employees that work here are extremely friendly, and not once have I been given a 'tude. You gotta admire that.

Definitely give this place a chance if you're looking for a good hot dog/beef/burger joint and don't feel like dealing with the tourists that swamp Portillo's from open 'til close.

Owner here are fabulous. We love the hot dogs, gyros and fries. 
Not to mention the BEST ice cream around in our opinion. 
Lots of seats and, they even have a arcade for the kids to play and gumball machine. 
We enjoy coming to Tony Steamers

Seriously, is this the best strip mall in the Western Suburbs or what? Tony's does a great job on everything. I love their dogs, gyros, and everything else we've tried.  Service is great. This place gets busy for lunch, but they move quickly.
Good place, won't be diapointed. Great daily specials. I usually go with the gyro. Hot dogs are pretty much their thing, but you can good a good chicago dog lots of places
Not recommended.  Place is creepy and dated.  Overpriced.  Small portions.  Antiquated service and processes.  Couldn't even steam a hot dog bun properly.

Anytime I'm with anyone in the Wheaton/Winfield area I always convince them to come to Tony's Steamers with me! None of them have ever had anything bad to say about this place. The people are nice, they're locally involved & I love the decor they have! Their hot dogs are my favorite but their gyros & sandwiches are good too! Parking gets really full in front of their store so sometimes you have to park a few stores down. But that's a good thing right?! I live in Lisle now but still come out to Tony's when I'm at my parents!

My husband just had lunch here of a corned beef sandwich, small fries and a coke, $9.96. It was shameful in size, hardly filling. We wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt. Previously, i ordered a grilled chicken sandwich which was so thin I had to open it to find out they had split the breast lengthwise. No more doubt now. Not even close to getting your money's worth.

Always a hit for a quick tasty meal!  They offer the best Chicago style hot dog ever!!  The owners are great!  They truly care about the community!  They sponsor kids teams and always help with donations for local programs for kids!  The menu is huge!  Everything from hot dogs to chicken sandwiches to the best burgers in town!  Tony's is truly an icon for the little town of Winfield!

I love the feel of this place. They've been around for quite sometime, so they are doing something right.

This is your typical burger and hot dog place. A grease joint, if you will. They have other specialties, but stick to one of those because they are good.

I love how they wrap the hot dogs with fries in the wrap. Makes me feel nostalgic.

I'm biased towards Smoke House in Wheaton because it's very close to my humble abode, but they are both fantastically yummy.

I want to take a moment to compare Tony's Steamers to Scooby's.  Those who've seen my Scooby's review know I was pretty rough on them.  I make no apologies.  You might disagree.  You might say comparing Steamers to Scooby's is comparing apples to oranges.  Two different animals?  The better comparison would be to Smoke House in Wheaton?  No.  Not really.  Not at all.  The only differences I see?  Scooby's has drive-thru and promotes the hot dogs harder.  And Steamers will sell you a beer.  They're both old hot dog joints underneath.  They sell dogs and Italian beef and Italian sausage and burgers.  Steamers does a gyro plate.  Tony has the map of Greece stamped on his round little puss.  So he sells gyros.

Two observations:  Steamers prices are appreciably cheaper.  My beef sandwich, fries and medium diet pop cost nine bucks and change.  Try $12 for the same meal at Scooby's.  The Scooby's guys constantly grouch at their teenagers to get out and mop the dining area and clean the tables.  They make a loud show of barking that order.  Steamers is immaculate inside.  Cleaner than Scooby's.  I didn't hear anyone shouted at.  I did see a young man wiping down tables, collecting trays.  Tony, behind the counter, wasn't riding the kid.  No need.  He was doing his job.

Let's talk about Tony for a moment.  I sat and ate my Italian beef and watched him work.  He's out front with the line staff and misses nothing.  He greets folks with a friendly enough hello.  If someone wants a beer, he handles the bar sale.  He has one eye on the line.  One eye scanning the dining area.  He looks back over his shoulder to check the Mexican kitchen staff.  If the order line gets a little long he says (in a normal voice), "You guys okay?"  The idea being he's ready to jump in and help if he's needed.  Let's talk about his staff.  Pleasant looking young people.  He has a Help Wanted sign just as Scooby's does.  High turn-over business.  He wants his hires over 21 and "responsible."  Seems reasonable enough.  He must be a decent judge of talent.  Staff seems normal.  Seems to work for him.  

I may be all wrong.  Tony looks like he runs a tight ship.  We know the guys at Scooby's run a tight ship.  A Captain Queeg style tight ship.  A Jimmy Cagney in Mister Roberts tight ship.  Maybe Tony is a tyrant behind the scenes.  Maybe he's exactly like the old guys at Scooby's.  Wouldn't be the first time I've been fooled.  My gut tells me that isn't the case.  There's no place to hide at Steamers.  It's all out in the open, in public view.  The man isn't shouting.  Staff isn't shouting.  Both places are high volume lunch operations.  Probably about the same level of efficiency.  They differ in their corporate cultures.  The tone of behavior set by Tony is more sane, more grown-up.  You get the impression he treats employees like adults.  Probably until they prove otherwise.  Steamer's is Cheaper than Scooby's.  Steamers is cleaner that Scooby's.  Steamer's is friendlier than Scooby's.  That's all.

Stopped in here yesterday to-go. I have been here a few times over the years but it had been awhile.  Based on my experience from yesterday:

- hotdogs were a solid "good".  Not the best I've had, but far from poor.  I get mine with just salt, mustard, and sport peppers.  They put 3 peppers on each, which is cool.  The bun could have been steamed a bit more (it seemed - at least with my order - they were just taken right out of the box - dry.  But, I also had a 10 minute trip home so they could have lost their edge that way, too).  The dogs were good - could have had a bit more 'zest' to them.  They were 2.69 each - which is 30 cents cheaper than the very over-priced Scooby's in West Chicago.  

- Beef - great.  Nice flavor to it.  A bit over $5.00 (still almost $2 cheaper than Scooby's beefs which are 7.00 before tax).  It could have been a bit larger, but overall I liked it.

- Service was good.  I was out of there within 5 minutes of placing my order, and it was semi-crowded.

I would return again....

Every Chicago Suburb needs their own Vienna Beef hotdog joint.  These places rarely reach Portillo's levels of bliss, but can always be counted on for some reasonably priced greasy goodness.  

Tony Steamers is no different.  This place is a Winfield standard, and anyone who played little league in the area knows it well (WIA anyone?).  Expect your full menu of dogs, burgers, gyros and sandwiches, with plenty of deep fried appetizers to go around.

Reasons to go:
1. They have arcade machines
2. The hotdog special comes with loads of fries, and is not to be missed
3. They serve beer on tap (by the glass or pitcher)
4. I may or may not be addicted to pizza puffs

Perfect place to take kids after a baseball or soccer game.

It's 2014 everybody has free refills, what are you waiting for?

The food is good & I will increase my rating when refils are includes

The most below average hotdog joint in the area.

My husband and I were forced to eat at this place once a week for about two months since it was the closest option near a class we were attending.  We tried just about everything on thier menu, and were underwhelmed time and time again.  

I guess I wouldn't be as disenchanted, but they overcharge you for what you're getting.  For example, they charge around $5 for cheese curds, and you only get about 8 of them.  When I asked where the rest of our order was, they said you get 4 oz.  This place seriously nickel and dimes you for everything.  Want a refill on your soda?  That will cost you too - $.54.

My advice to you (if you have the time) - drive to Portillos where you pay the same, but get way better quality food, or check out Smoke House in Wheaton.

Great CHICAGO style food and great local atmosphere. Have been coming here since the 90's with family and friends and it is enjoyed ubiquitously.  This place is a staple of Winfield and the surrounding community!

I work down the street in West Chicago and my coworker and I get frustrated at the lack of options nearby....and then this gem was discovered!! Its slightly tucked behind the Walgreens so if you're not familiar with the area you can miss it.  It has an old school look and feel to it with their bench-like booth seats and nothing really seems updated or fancy, I loved this about the place. At first I thought they would just have your basic burger and hotdog options but they had more, so much more AND daily specials! I had to try the pepper and egg sandwich bc I was craving something different.  The picture doesn't look appetizing but it was sooo good and sooo flavorful! I think I ate it in two bites. If I could afford to come everyday for lunch I would but maybe I can since the prices are so low! My next lunch outting will definitely be here!

I have a Wendy's within walking distance of work, but I pass it up in favor of driving 10 minutes to get a burger at Tony's Steamers. This place is everything you want in a local eatery: classic rock, photos of their sponsored Little League teams, cops from the sherriff's department, and the owners ringing up your order. Plenty of sports, soaps, and cable news on the 4 muted TVs, but easy enough to ignore. The place is kept clean even though the furniture feels a little old school, but that's part of the charm. I recommend the cheeseburgers and chicken wraps, but its probably the fries that keep me coming back.

Everything on the menu is delicious, minus the French fries which are always limp and barely warm. the specials they offer are always a good deal which is nice in this day in age when there's so much competition for business.

This was the local place to go as a kid. I would ride my bike with my friends to "the corner" (aka the strip mall that steamers is in) and would grab a hotdog and fries which was about $3. I now work in the area and can frequent more often and still enjoy the nice atmosphere of a hometown hotdog shop

The "Smoke House" of Winfield. They have a nice sit down area with Tvs. Middle school kids from Monroe go here, and from Franklin stick to Smoke House, then they all form their alliances to who has the better gyros, hot dogs, beefs, etc. The non driving option for those who cannot make it to Portillos' 

This is a greasy joint for sure! Not a lot of healthy or vegetarian options...but I don't think that is the goal when you head here!
Out of my 2 carry out visits they messed up two orders. Both were hots dogs so I get it, it's tough. The owner wasn't apologetic. The consolation was i did get soggy fries.

Tony's Steamers is a small restaurant located in a shopping plaza on the corner of Geneva Road and County Farm road in Winfield. I decided to stop in having never visited before and was impressed by the size of the restaurant. There was a Monopoly Pinball Machine, and giant gumball machine and a few other coin operated machines in the corner. The place looked clean and had several TVs attached to the walls.

I placed my order for a hot dog with fries, my food was ready quickly and I was soon on my way. The hot dog I received look like it had just been used to pose for Vienna Beef promotional material, it seriously didn't look real. The hot dog came on a soft poppy seed bun. The first thing to note besides the picture perfect presentation of this item is the pickle. The pickle included was a thin pickle slice rather than a pickle spear, its taste was a bit on the sour side but overall complimented the hot dog nicely. The celery salt was visible on this dog, and it came with cucumbers which you only see occasionally on Chicago style hot dogs. The relish and onions were well applied and the sausage itself was well heated and tasted great. The only real problem here was that there was a tad too much mustard.

The fries included were straight and thin fries, they have a nice taste not too greasy and not too salty. Two other hot dog vendors I've visited have extremely similar fries (Mickey's in Villa Park and Jimmy's Dog House in Westmont). I've noticed this particular type of fry compliments hot dogs very well.

 I was very impressed with Tony Steamers hot dog, the attention detail in making it look almost exactly like a hot dog shown on a Vienna Beef poster was definitely noticed by me, and was quite a surprise. And it lived up to my expectations in terms of taste. The price was reasonable at under 6.00 for my hot dog, fries and an extra large pop. Overall I'd recommend Tony's Steamer's and will definitely visit again in the future.

One of the absolute best and most authentic Chicago-style hot dog places you can find in the Western suburbs.  There are so many hot dog places that suck and shame the name of Chicago-style but Tony's is not one of them.  I've never tried anything else on the menu, why bother when the dog is so great!!  Now that Smoke House in Wheaton has decided to serve crap instead of food, Tony's is one of the few spots I can depend on for a true Midwestern icon.  Ironically, it's close to Happy House in We-go, which is also fantastic!!  

Tony's is a great place and has been around for years and is active the the community.  My daughters love the meatball sub and it's a nice big roomy place with a Dairy Queen right next door for dessert!! Give Tony a shot.

Tony's Steamers is a good, solid choice for greasy Chicago fast food.

It gets pretty crowded during lunch time. Customers must order at the counter and there's usually a substantial wait before you get your food (even if it's to go). So if you're in a hurry, this isn't the place to go.

The food quality here is great though. If you want to get your grease on, Steamers will be a big hit.

I highly recommend their Bacon Cheeseburgers: all of the burger's ingredients are fresh. The bacon is particularly well-cooked, you will find no flaccid bacon here.

The Italian Beef portions are generous portions to feed the obese Chicagoland suburbanites. The Beef tastes alright, but it just doesn't knock my socks off. I'd suggest going elsewhere if you're in search of some great Beef. The verdict is the same for Chicago Dogs at Steamer's: they are underwhelming in taste. However, the quality of ingredients in their dogs is very high.

I love the fries here. They're always crispy, thin and freshly hot.

All-in-all, it's a great place for a burger and fries. Get your greasy Chicago food fix here.
Terrific local hot dog emporium.  Actually everything our table had was great.  Good value as well.  The type of place that stands the test of time.

Tony does a stand up business here.  Probably because I've never seen the guy sit down.  

Your average Beef and hot dog place.  When I was young ruffian in the mean streets of Winfield I ate here 3 times a week (7 in the summer).  Eventually I learned how to drive and my love affair with Steamers was kinda out the window.

I recommend the combo.  Good beef, good sausage.  They've gone up in price since the good ole days (Winfieldites see the pun I just made) but they're still affordable.  The little bar attracts some of Winfield's finest (and I don't mean the cops) so if you see someone sitting there buy em a drink and just listen.

Someone recently raved to me about this place so I decided to stop in before heading to work one afternoon. The person at the counter was friendly. The prices are very reasonable. I decided to try the jumbo hot dog special which came with fries- they wrap them together which I kind of feel makes the fries soggier. I was disappointed when I got to work to find that they had added mustard to my hot dog (I had specifically asked just for certain ingredients) and it was a TON of mustard- I had to use 7 of their little napkins! It still was pretty tasty but I was disappointed that it wasn't what I had asked for. I think I will give this place another try but it didn't stand out to me over other similar places.

This place reminds me of a small Portillo's.  You have the ordering, the waiting and the delish food delivered!

There was an early dismissal today, so I took 2 kids here.  One had the jumbo hot dog & fries, one had the regular dog and fries and I pigged out with a bacon cheeseburger and fries.  It tasted like I just took the burger off my bbq!

They also have "healthier" fare like chicken sandwiches and wraps, but sometimes you get tired of eating healthy and just want some grease!

One thing that I found kind of unique here was that I didn't see any Diet Coke on tap!  They had other beverages and cans, but no DC from the fountain.  They did have beer and lots of tvs, so I might have to come here to watch some sports and escape the pandemonium at home!
Super cute, fun little place.  Great spot for kids.  Friendly staff.  Support this local family run joint.  The food won't let you down.

We've been here several times during the day, when it looks like the owner and his wife run it.  Food's been great.  But then I decided to go there this evening for dinner and pick up food for my son and I.  First there is a guy who comes in behind me, walks back into the kitchen and starts making my food I just ordered without washing his hands.  Second, the other guy back in the kitchen keeps scratching his head while he's working with the food.  No gloves on at all.  I ordered two hot dogs, with everything, no peppers and fries for me, and a jumbo gyro plate for my son.  14$  Not too shabby, but a little high, considering what I got back for food tonight.  Usually, the gyro meet is towering.  Not so tonight.  4 slices of meat off the gyro spit and about 3 onions, one half slice of tomato and what looked like a enough sauce to put on a french fry.  Then he makes me one hot dog.  The girl who took my order turned and said, "you ordered two, right", I said, "yes".   I get home and the second hot dog that he made out of my line of sight had nothing on it.  I only live a mile or so away from this place, and when I got home and opened up the bag and found all these issues with the food, I had to sit down and write this.  I tried to go to the website on the menu to contact the owner somehow, but the website is a dead link.  I think that Tony's not going to be in business much longer if he's leaving his evening shift to this bunch.  The other girl was all decked out like she was from Jersey Shore, playing with her hair and her iPhone, picking at her zebra painted nails and not even noticing that there were customers there.  

So, if the owner of this place would ever like to contact me, please do.  We won't be coming back there in the evenings at all.  Maybe during the day...but if I do come back during the day time, he's getting an earful.  I'm just ticked off that I spent 14 bucks and didn't get what I ordered.  

Oh, and another thing the owner needs to know.  Tell your workers that if they want to make fun of the clientele in Spanish, behind the counter... that some of us English speaking people actually understand Spanish and all of the slang that goes with it.  It is not repeatable here and wasn't very nice.  And what he was saying to the underage teenage girls that were running the register, wasn't very nice either.  Do they realize that there are laws about that?

To sum up... careful in the evenings.  If you don't mind your food being made by some guys who don't wash their hands and don't make your food to order, so that when you open it up when you get home you get upset...then stay away from here in the evening.  Go during the day time only.

Disgusting! Ate here out of pure ravenous desperation. We ordered jalapeno poppers, a cajun grilled chicken sandwich, and an Italian beef. The poppers were so greasy and the breading fell apart. The chicken sandwich was ok. Overall, not good.  Won't be back.

I really would like to try something other than the Gyros plate, but I just cannot bring myself to do it! This is the only Gyros pate I have ever had where I cannot finish all the meat. They really pile it on! Love this place!

I've had hot dogs from here twice. I've waited both times in the car with my kids while my husband picked them up. The dogs are cold and the buns are soggy and we order 'Chicago' dogs. These are gross. My husband told me the dogs were just sitting there they were not made to order and the only topping on them was onions. Eew these hot dogs suck! they were COLD! Who wants cold soggy hot dogs??? And this happened both times we went. No thanks never again.

BEST HOTDOGS IN THE BURBS!!  I've been eating at Tony's Steamers since I was in little league with Winfield In Action.  I've lived in Chicago for the past 4 years and there are a couple places that stack up downtown but not in the burbs.  The hotdogs are just so juicy with soft sesame seed buns and all the fixins including celery salt, pickle, tomatoes peppers and cucumber.  Truly outstanding!
Great and consistently good. Try the broasted chicken for dinner!

tried to order a week or so ago - 
and they answered and said they were working on some remodeling.
Drove by today - and they are still dark and closed - 

I suspect they are GONE and actually CLOSED -

Read similar reviews of this restaurant on Yelp but wanted to give this place a chance.  Our order was placed and confirmed on the phone for delivery, but the food delivered did not match the order.  After calling for resolution, management was unable to resolve the discrepancy.  The only element of the order correct was the pizza and it was dry.
If you like soggy, unsatisfying food then you'll like this place. Stopped eating after a few bites and threw it out. They really went downhill, will not be ordering from them again.

Two hours and still waiting on a delivery order for three items. Called the place and nobody even apologized. Cool.

EDIT....

Now we are at 3+ hours waiting on our delivery. Called the restaurant again and my boyfriend talked to the delivery guy who 'swore' he delivered our pizzas. Ummm okay? We didn't even order PIZZAS. The owner said he will have the food to us right away...we'll see about that. 

I'm thinking never again with this joint.
Been here a few times now , so far everything I have had has  been extremely good .wife had the meatball sandwich I had the charbroiled cheeseburger.

Their hours are supposed to be 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. . I went in at 3:15 to see if I could get a couple slices and a sign said closed for lunch. The sign sais they won't open till 4 p.m. . Are you kidding me? A restaurant that closes for lunch? I only give them one try. They blew it. Maybe they should bring their lunch or eat their own food and keep customers

We placed our order for delivery last night, had our credit card charged $60, and waited. And then we waited, and waited, and waited, and the food never came. We are patient, understanding people; perhaps they had a lot of orders. After waiting over ninety minutes for two pastas, we finally decided to call. The phone rang and rang and rang. We called again, no answer. The third time I called I let the phone ring until a recording told me they had no answering machine and the call was disconnected. 

Terrible experience. We will never order again. If you decide to, make sure you choose pick-up.

Be Aware!!! I ordered delivery and saw the receipt with all my credit card info on it. I informed the manager, Rick Davis, but he stated he crossed out all the info. I had three copies of the receipt with nothing crossed out.

Good pizza. I'd give it 3-1/2 if I could. Nice crust. Fresh toppings. I've read other review complaining about the cheese but I thought the amount of cheese was just right, though it should have gone closer to the edges of the crust to cover all the sauce. The sauce itself was a little bland. The Mediterranean salad was very good, but not at all a good value. It should have been twice the size for $9.95.

Ordered pizza last night for the first time.
Went to pick it up and it was hot and ready.
Was very good...will definitely order from here again.

Awful service. Had to call three times about the location of our order. Took two hours for one pizza and salad. Pizza was cold upon arrival, still had to pay full price for the order and driver had to cash for change. Very disappointed.

Tried Ti Amo for the first time last night and was very pleasantly surprised.  It was delicious!  We got the pan pizza, which is really more like a deep dish.  Crust was really good and the ingredients are fresh.  Will definitely try the thin crust next time too.

Hey everybody !  There is now an on-line menu on the website. Just go to the website at:        www.Tiamopizzeria.com. 
For the full menu and money off coupons!!
There is more there than just fresh pies.

This was good.  I'd go again.

We had the thin crust pizza.  It had a nice flavorful sauce and they put on plenty of cheese.  Enough where sometimes it's a bit of a mess.  I'm heartened enough by it that I look forward to trying their non-pizza stuff.

It might be my #2 pizza for the area, though I should retry some other places.

The day we went they seemed to be having problems, hopefully that'll clear up.  I ended up waiting about 15 minutes or so beyond the stated time.
The only place in Naperville that I have been coming to sense I moved here 10 years ago
Good flavor, actually best around the are. The only downside is that they don't put enough meet in their pizza. But still my favorite!

First of all, the pizza is 5+ stars in my book.

We found this place on Seamless or GrubHub or something and gave it a shot. The pizza was delicious and delivered quickly.

The second time, however, was probably one of the most infuriating experiences. So, a little backstory. My fiance had just had surgery and was home by himself. We ordered a pizza online because neither of us felt like cooking. We set it up to be delivered at 6:30 PM because I wanted to make sure I was home so he would not have to go down the stairs. At 5:58 I had a missed call (I was in traffic so didn't answer.) Then I got another call - I pulled over to answer. This time, it was a manager named Kevin who said that the driver couldn't find our apartment so he was leaving and they didn't know if they'd be able to deliver our food since we didn't answer the phone.

Well, the driver ended up going back, and here's where things get interesting. My fiance goes down stairs to pay this guy and the driver snaps at him about giving them the wrong address - we did this shit online and the confirmation had the correct address - my fiance pays him and as the driver gets into his car, he tells my fiance to "fuck off"

OHHHHH HELL NO. I'm sorry but that is one of the most unprofessional, douchey things to say. At least close your door before you say something that rude. Both my fiance and I called to talk to a manger, and I spoke with Kevin who basically said there was nothing he was willing to do because they always have problems with that driver and he would have the owner contact my fiance. 

Lo & behold, still haven't heard from anyone. I'm not looking for free anything, just acknowledgement that this was shitty. Emailed the owner twice, still nothing.

Sad to say, but we will not be ordering from here again unless we can be promised that the douchebag driver will not be our delivery guy.
If you like double dough pizza, be sure to try this.  I think it's terrific and my easy top pick for delivery pizza in Fox Valley.

Had this pizza for the first time tonight and I have had the same exact pizza from another place called Taylor Street Pizza. The double dough crust was identical in flavor and texture, the cheese was the same. I swear whoever owns this place and Taylor Street are the same guy.

Best pizza in town. Everything is fresh, service is great, catering is excellent. I usually get either thin crust pizzas or double dough and neither ever disappoint. Their grilled chicken salads are awesome as well.

This is the second time I've ordered this place and I love it! 

I got the cheese burger this time and it was awesome, a little strange the bacon was crumbled but I'm not complaining. My boyfriend got the cheese dog and he said it was very good as well. I love the cheese fries, I always get the cheese on the side and they give you more than enough and I love that! And the cheese sticks are so delicious. The only thing that I would change is that they has a better ranch sauce, I'm a weirdo that likes ranch on my fries.

Highly recommend this place.
The chicken parm sandwich is delicious. Easy in to the store and I was served right away. I'll be back.

Awesome old fashion Italian pizza! Just like in Chicago but here in Naperville. Thin crust is well done. High quality ingredients. Nice staff. On a Saturday night it will take about 40 minutes for delivery, pizza is always hot. Coupons on their menu helps a bit. Large thin cheese pizza is about $20 which is average for the area. This is our go-to pizza joint!
Great pizza!  Quick and friendly service!  Order was ready fast and pizza was hot and fresh.  Great crust and sauce.  Highly recommend!
Delivery was very slow and 25 minutes after when they said that it would be there. Pizza, jalapeno poppers, and mozzarella sticks were all soggy.

I have ordered pizza from this place a few times, and while it's not terrible, there's nothing special about their pizza and there isn't anything that makes it stand out from the rest of the pizza joints in the area. The cheese to sauce ratio isn't very balanced and the sauce they do put on there is somewhat sour/tart. 

The guy answering the phone is always friendly and polite. I will perhaps try another menu item next time I am in the area.

Tried their chicken sandwich,it was good,the reason I put 2 stars because of fries:they look like they've been cooked last night,stored somewhere and then cooked again and sold it to me,very disappointed
Just ordered a thin crust and if you want a dry, tasteless crust then this is the place for you. Otherwise, you are better off to go to the grocery and get a pizza from the frozen section.

Pizza is pretty much my most favorite thing in the world (including my kids), so I love trying new places as I'm always looking for the perfect pizza. We received a coupon for a free pizza when we moved last year, so we tried it - and we have been ordering almost weekly ever since. I've only had their thin crust as I order Lou's when I want deep dish, but it is always delish. Moderately priced and a huge menu if you want to try something besides their pizza. Highly recommend.
Very large pizza. Extra care goes into their quality. They also have quick lunch specials for when you're driving by.

From out of town and stopped in for a quick slice on a recommendation, and glad I did!  The Italian beef with giardiniera was fantastic. The owner took time to answer a couple of questions, even though they were super busy.  Wish they'd deliver to Omaha!
found this place on accident.  and we really enjoyed it.  great topping choices.

Despite being under new ownership, little has changed about this location. 

Their pizzas pretty good, little too much cheese and not enough sauce. The crust is passable, but it really doesn't have any flavor. 

Getting a slice is the way togo. Their "Cheesy Beef" or Sausage is the way togo. 

They make an Antipasto Salad that could kick Chuck Norris hairy a$$. Get it with Greek dressing and you're good to go. 

Old town is nothing amazing, but I love ordering a couple slices and salad from them whenever I don't feel like making some food or cant decide on the limited delivery options in Naperville.

We ordered the thin crust pizza - four square(?) - had sausage, mushroom, onion and green peppers.  I swapped out half the sausage for pepperoni and I must say the pepperoni side was better.  The sausage was pretty good though.. just preferred the pepperoni.

I really liked the crust and the sauce was nice.  I have to agree with the other reviewers - there was a bit too much cheese in the middle of the pie.  The proportions just didn't work for me.  The crust pieces were good though.

All in all, there's too many choices to stop here.  I'm still looking for my Naperville pizza spot.  :)
Great place for a slice at lunch.

Not much to say about this place the pizza is five stars
Enough said its that good

Reviewed by the Naperville 
~ Food Dude ~
Pretty good slice. Really great cheese. The crust could use an update in my opinion but everyone likes their crust different.  Also, I think they make their own sausage which was really good.

Way overpriced for what you get. Prices on par with real Chicago pizza( Lou malnatti's, Giordano's.) I tried a thin crust cheese pizza so I have no idea how the other offerings compare. This pizza tasted like any good frozen pizza from the grocery store. Flavorless cracker-like crust. Lots of cheese and canned generic tasting sauce. For $20, I expect a lot more. This wasn't horrible but I can't say it was good either. The price is why it's rated so low. The slices they had in the warming case looked and smelled good but my daughter wanted thin crust. If they were to cut their prices in half I might return. For now, if I want real pizza, I'll stick with Lou's.

Best slice of pizza I have had in a long time. You know its a great spot when the actual owner checks you out too!!! Good stuff Old Town!!! Keep it up, ill be back for sure. I might even make it a Sat. ritual to get a sausage slice. So good!!!
Good food and surprisingly a large menu with a lot of choices...pizza..pasta..sandwiches....large portion sizes, good quality, and fast service. Highly recommend
Good PIZZA.  The people who work at the front counter and phones are so nice and helpful!

This place gets  4.5 stars for the food, and an extra 1/2 star for the service.  I have ordered catering here twice now and the newer owner Joe has been very helpfull.  Their pizza is good, but the secret of this place is the bruschetta, excellent!  Who woulda thunk a pizza joint would have such delicious fresh bruschetta?

Alot better than I originally thought.  Small thin crust with bacon ($12) was great.  The bacon and (especially) cheese really stood out and had a lot of flavor.  Reminded me of Michael Anthony's out in Berwyn, which was one of my favorite pizza joints growing up.  Service was also top notch as well.

The pizza here is pretty good, above average but nothing special.  Somewhat higher priced, but nothing out of a normal pizza ballpark.  The first time we ordered from there was because the new resident pack we got in the mail had a coupon, but when I went in to pick it up, it seemed like the cashier was annoyed I had the coupon.  We typically order from here last minute because its convenient to our neighborhood.

Went here on a Saturday night, wasn't very busy.  The food is awesome!  The service was great. The place is kinda hidden around the corner from the Arista hotel.  We didn't do the golf simulator so I can't comment on that.  I would recommend the steak sandwich or the turkey sandwich and they have these deep fried donut holes that are really good.  Will definitely come back.

The pluses here are the beer list, lot's of good local craft brews. The TV's are awesome for watching sporting events. (Came here for one of the Cubbies losses to the Mutts) it's a real nice place for a sports bar. They have golf clubs to test your driving abilities! 
The negative was the slow service, there were 7 of us and many of our glasses were empty for too long. 
The food itself is decent considering most of it is bar and grille food.  We had burgers, which were good and there was one portobello burger that she liked. The wing apps were ok as were the potato skins.

Tried the TTI Burger, was tasty and the fries were good.
My friends both had a pizza (I do not rate it, was 3 to 4 star)
The order did take a bit longer. But we were offered a free round oft beers instead before We could think of complaining. 
Comparing the service and honesty to the customers to the meal and price I paid I give a 5 star. Well done.

Don't let the size or location scare you. This is a small, off the beaten path place that has wonderful food and wonderful service! There are almost a dozen flat screen tvs throughout the place, HD virtual reality golf simulators, and a full bar. Definitely something for everyone! The food came out smoking hot...we actually had to let it cool down for a few minutes before we ate it. Our appetizer was poutine (the special of the day) - French fries topped with chicken, mozzarella, and gravy. Amazing!!! For the main course I got the fish and chips which also didn't disappoint. The owner was walking around throughout the night (a busy Saturday) which was also nice to see. Will definitely be back again!

Tap In has great ambience, and some good food, but their menu is really limited, especially for someone who doesn't eat beef or pork - but then again, it is a carvery. Because my choices are limited, I've only been exposed to certain things here - their fried pickles are awesome in taste, although I prefer mine to be in slices versus spear form. Their Mac and Cheese is AWESOME, but so very heavy! Their wings are good, but not the best. Their salads have all been mildly disappointing!!! Their Pepper Patty Burger is to die for (from days when I did consume beef) Now, their bread pudding, however, was singularly the BEST thing I'd tasted there, except it's no longer on the menu! Super disappointing!!!

You gotta try the Portobello Burger with Cottage Fries. No bread, no meat. The huge Portobello caps are the buns and the meat replacements. The caps were so thick and tasty. Grilled portobello caps, marinated vegetables, aioli, mozzarella, giardiniera peppers. I was satisfied when I left around 12:30 PM and was still not hungry by the time we went to dinner at 6:30 PM. We were the only ones eating at the time so the wait staff was attentive and friendly.

We were sick of room service from the nearby hotel. Walked over here and had a great dinner!  Very dead on a Saturday night at 8:30 PM, makes me wonder if they are going to make it.  

Greeted promptly and given choice to sit at the table or the bar.  Chose the bar.  Bartender was very friendly, engaging, and competent.  I got one (ok two) of the margaritas which were fantastic.  

We both had the steak sandwich, which was cooked to order.  Steak was cooked medium rare, as requested.  Blue cheese and horseradish aioli was awesome on the sandwich.  Homemade cottage fries were great.

Really enjoyed this place, but concerned it may not be there too much longer.  Maybe they should offer delivery to Hotel arista.  I would probably prefer that over the in house restaurant (from which we ordered multiple times).

I come here with my dad when he is in town, it's an incredibly modern and clean establishment! I usually order the turkey sliders (absolutely delicious). 

Bartenders are very friendly and welcoming. I highly recommend!
They have Kentucky bourbon barrel ale on tap!! The food is delicious and the bartenders are super sweet and fun:)

This is a nice convenient place for us to go to.  They have a decent beer selection, and if you're on cheaper side, you can get a selection of 4 old style beers (Beers of Yesteryear - Old Style, Hamm's, Olympia, and Old Milwaukee) for $2.50 per can.  I had flattish and disappointing Dogfish Head 60 Minute IPA and tried some of wife's Old Style which was both refreshing and nostalgic for me.  The 5 cheese pizza with chicken ($11) we had was very salty, and I would only give them 2 stars for the food, but a 3 overall.  Server kindly offered a remake or another item, but we did not bother.  They have a golf theme based on having golf simulators upstairs.  I'll probably be back for the reasonably priced beer selection and convenient location.
We live close by and want to like this place the food is good but third time we have been here with awful service!  We have been here 30 minutes - drinks empty - water empty - and it isn't even busy!

I have been to this place 4 times now and have had very mixed experiences. 

The first time we went it was great. I had the pastrami and it was great. My son is 2 and he had a mac and cheese. This place is great for kids. All kids are $1 and they even have mini utensils. 

The 2nd time I had the popcorn shrimp which again was very good. However, my wife had a salad. The first one was not edible for my wife so they exchanged it for another which was better but still not great. 

The most recent time I again had the pastrami which seemed to be missing the mustard it had the first time. My wife had the turkey and it was extremely salty and she didn't eat it. My son got the kids chicken tenders which tasted Ok but at least half of them were extremely over cooked. I tried to eat one and it was insanely hard and overcooked. Very sad our experiences turned bad :( I don't think we will return again Did the chef change? Did they just stop caring? Not sure..
Stephanie was awesome. Especially considering I was an out of towner late on a Sunday night.

Had a great experience. Brought my two boys for dinner. The server let us sit in the golf simulator booth and put the Bulls game on the big simulator screen. Was almost like a movie theater screen. Great choices of tap beer and my boys loved the thanksgiving sliders. I had the shrimp po boy. Great flavor profiles on both meals. Cottage fries are some of the best I have had. A little pricy however. Have been back 4 times and will continue to go. Never very crowded which appeals to me but maybe not to someone looking for some social interaction.
Good food and good service on a Friday night.... Ordered Sam Snead drink, truck tacos and Peppered Patty with my wife.  It was delicious.

Definitely impressed with this place!

I went with a $20 Groupon, quite honestly not expecting much...I mean, its attached to a corporate/hotel type complex, thinking maybe it really just catered to a lunchtime crowd and hotel guests who would really eat anything. The place wasn't very happening when we arrived on a Friday night around 7pm, so my first thought naturally was "Great we'll get reheated crap because the kitchen staff is being sent home."

It's a short but concise menu: sandwiches, a few hearty entrees, some pizzas, and apps. The appetizers cover a wide array (potato skins, beef/mushroom bites, tacos, wings), and we opted for the skins. You get three different kinds (buffalo chicken, steak/blue cheese, and another that I couldn't really figure out), so its good to share with another person. If you have more than one person, I wouldn't share, because you'll want to try all three. The potato was crispy and warm and had plentiful toppings. I would order this again, but would be interested to try the food truck tacos or beef/mushroom bites!

I ordered the Thanksgiving Sliders and hubz ordered the Skillet Cheeseburger. Both meals came out on a wood plank with awesome presentation (see picture). I'm not always huge on sliders because I feel like you end up getting more bun than meat, but it worked really well for these. It was fresh carved turkey, cranberry sauce, a heaping pile of sage stuffing on each slider, and some kind of creamy, fruity mayo or cream cheese or sauce on the bottom. Whatever it was...It was thanksgiving in my mouth! The varying textures worked so well together. I was full after the first two and took the third one home (tasted just as good the next day). I would absolutely recommend these. Hubz really enjoyed his cheeseburger...it was cooked med-rare (just the way he liked it) and served with gooey cheese and on a pretzel bun. Both were served with their cottage fries (like really thick chip-fries) in a little basket, very delicious and not soggy at all (if you've had the chip-fries at Quigley's in Naperville, you know what I'm talking about when I say "soggy"). And to boot, both came with a little pickle jar! It had 4-5 different pickles in a tiny little Mason jar, how cute is that?!

For the size of the bar, it had some good beer options. I mean really, only 6 drafts, but they had the local options like Solemn Oath and Two Brothers, so I appreciate that. They also have some craft bottles and tall boys of the cheap stuff to match every flavor. They have some whiskeys there for the liquor folks, and a small menu of interesting mixed drinks to boot (something with mint and madagascar vanilla and cherry...hmmmm).

I can't wait to order the chili next time, and would love to try their pizza buffet over lunch someday. Other reviews have said that they have a "creamier" type of cheese, which leads me to believe its kind of like St. Louis style (aka IMO'S), which I LOVE. If the open-faced turkey sandwich is as good as the sliders, I would definitely get that too, on a warm snowy day. And if you love stuffing, I'd order up a side of their sage version of this. It was the perfect consistency and flavor. 

Also...after we arrived, the place filled up pretty quickly. I'm glad this place is getting some business!

We came here to avoid the crowds and prices of the downtown Naperville restaurants. We got right in, so that worked out. But wait, is it really $8.00 for a draft beer?  I was in shock when the bill arrived. 

Sorry, back to the downtown restaurants.
We have been here few times. Its a nice place and their food is good. Definetly give it a try.

This is a great find. More people need to know about this place. Odd location. I had the pastrami egg rolls, aka Reuben egg rolls.  They were delicious.  Can't go wrong with some delicious bar food. Will be back.

The question is usually get when I mention this place is "Where is that?"  That always make me a little sad since there was obviously so much work and thought put into this little place.  They have a decent beer selection and a menu filled with tasty bar food. The Skillet Cheeseburger is fantastic and the fresh cut Cottage Fries are addictive. I have never seen them truly busy, so I wonder how long they will last. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is that the service can be slow at times, but I think this is partially due to the place not being very busy.
Awesome food and great service! Lots of TV's to enjoy the games that are on. We really enjoyed the wings and the cottage fries. Fabulous!

Underwhelming. Had a Groupon so decided to give the place a try. we started with the rib tips as an app, which was the best part of the meal, but also led us to cancel another item. The rib tips were good, but very messy. You pretty much have to eat these with your hands. Sauce had a nice tang to it. The rib tips were garnished with cole slaw though, and the cole slow was kinda soggy and very salty. 

My sweetie had ordered a $5 side of cole slaw with his meal, and after we tasted the cole slaw garnish for the rib tips he cancelled that portion of his meal. He had an Italian beef that was very very average - many hot dog places offer better. He was able to sub mashed taters for cottage fries, and he did not care for them - lumpy taters and bland gravy.

I had the Thanksgiving sliders - too much sage dressing and not enough meat. Also, these sliders are dressed with a cranberry jam which was not good - much too tart. They should just use regular cranberry sauce instead. I ended up not eating much of the buns because that sour jam had soaked into them. I received cottage fries that would have been much better straight outta the frier.

Sandwiches were served with a small jar of pickles - unique and a nice touch. Unfortunately I enjoyed the pickles much more than the sandwich. 

Service - kinda slow, but that waas OK since we were looking to relax. 

I would maybe go back because I did have a hard time deciding between several options, and there were some daily specials that sounded interesting. But I would definitely would need another Groupon to entice me as it was just OK. Had I paid full price I would have been more disappointed.

They can put out all the signs along the road they wish, but their prices are too high.  Unfortunately, there's a lack of decent lunch places in the area, but no one is going to pay upwards to $20 for lunch and a drink at this place. 

I'm sorry, but CityGate may have been a good idea in its time, but the economy has made the entire complex a great big fizzle.  

Tap In may still appeal to the few people who still throw their money around, but for we poor working stiffs, it's not in the cards.

Uninteresting environment. Four of us stumbled upon this place at the end of a long day. Everyone liked the food and the service was quite good. I'm a vegetarian in a group of carnivores and we were all delighted. I had the veggie pizza without cheese and some fries. I was told the rib tips, which looked like whole ribs, were delish as well the mac & cheese, tacos, and the pot pie which they made special for our table.

This is a gold themed restaurant/bar?.........

It was quite surprising upon arriving to find that the TV's were on ESPN pre season football coverage instead of the PGA Championship. I asked if we could switch the TV's to the major championship golf. It took them around 10 minutes to change it. They did not know what channel it was on. 

I ordered Beef & Mushroom Bites. The were 7/10. crispy somewhat flavorful.
My wide ordered the Thanksgiving Sliders. Those were 9/10. Great presentation and flavor. The turkey sliders went down nice and easy with the cranberry glaze. The fries were nice and crisp and came in a little basket.
