The waitress was not familiar with the beers on top. She was unable to provide the name of a certain beer on tap only that it was an IPA. I had to find our from overhearing the bar tender about the exact name.

might get better as time passes. Decent food. so so staff, no live golf when the PGA championship is on in a golf restaurant?
Super cute idea and atmosphere. Decent food- nothing special. Unenthusiastic staff. Little pricey ($9 cocktails). Overall good experience, just not sure I would come back.

Overall excellent experience. Food and service were top notch. The $1 kid's meal was fantastic and enough food for both my little girls. For $1 they got homemade apple sauce, carrot sticks, cottage fries, and four homemade chicken fingers! The waitress was also quick to bring out the kids' food first which is always nice when you have two hungry soon to be monsters. The wife and I ordered the burger and mushroom pizza which were both delicious. This place definitely earned a spot atop our family dining options as well as a date night spot.

This food is fantastic!
A few of my co-workers and I went there for lunch to check it out.
There was only one other table filled when we were there so I hope they stay in business.
The wait staff was a little slow during a lunch time but I think once they work out the 'new business in town jitters' this will be a "HOLE IN ONE!"
Keep up the good work on the food - I had the Thanksgiving Sliders - amazing
Others with me had a burger and the others beef sandwiches.
We were all very pleased with our meals.
Head there this weekend to watch the US OPEN, you won't be disappointed.
Small place. Went when they had a tap takeover by Ten Ninety and had a Great DIPA. The food is good and servers attentive. A local gem so close to Warrenville.

This was my second trip here and I would not come back. Food was Ok, no flavor but presented well and service was slow. The TVs in the bar we're playing non stop Beachbody exercise program infomercials - which were annoying and not condusive for a resturaunt trying to sell food. The staff couldn't figure out how to change the channel. stay away

After reading many other Yelp reviews, I decided that I just had to check out Tap In Pub and Carvery.  The food sounded good and it seemed like it could be a good place to have a family dinner with mostly adults but two little ones coming along.  I'm glad I took the leap and visited here as were my sister, brother, and their spouses.

We visited last Sat night.  As we pulled up the restaurant looked to be pretty empty, which was fine by us, since we had the kiddos in tow.  I'm always glad to visit places that are slightly less noisy with my nephews!  There were a few tables occupied in the seated area and a few more people in the bar area but that was it.  I'm glad I read reviews before the visit or I would have been scared!

We were quickly seated and a waitress came and took our drink order. My sis and I had the Angry Orchard Elderflower ($4.25), my brother-in-law was thrilled to order a Schlitz, sister-in-law a Miller Light, and my brother a PBR.  We are a very classy group as you can tell!  Drinks were quickly delivered to the table along with water and our orders were taken.

I had the Skillet Cheese Burger for my dinner, it is a beef patty with Colby cheese on a Pretzel Roll.  If you know me, you know my obsession with Pretzel buns, so I was beyond thrilled to find this!  I ordered the burger medium and it was moist and well seasoned.  The burger comes with fries which are thick cut and sliced like a potato chip.  The fries were really good and I ate my share and a few of my nephew's too. 

Added bonus, kids meals are $1!  It was nice for my brother that it didn't cost $8-10 to feed a finicky 2  1/2 yr old.  Great idea and wished that more places adopted this!

I tried a few other bites of food from the family as well.  The food truck tacos were amazing, the pork was moist and well seasoned  The taco wasn't spicy at all and was a perfect appetizer portion to share.  My brother-in-law raved about his chili, he ordered a bowl and we all got a taste, it was very good and I can't wait to order it on a cold day this winter.  Finally, I got to try a few bites of the Sausage Pizza; the sausage was amazing, but there was an odd taste to the pizza.  I'm not sure if it was the cheese or the sauce, but it had a bit of a tangy flavor kind of like cream cheese to it... I wasn't a big fan of that flavor but others at the table didn't mind it.

I would definitely recommend coming here for a few drinks and dinner.  I am kind of in love with the fact that the place was less than busy when we went... I'm sure after everyone starts reading these Yelp reviews, people are going to get smart and visit in droves.  Can't wait to visit again!

Really hope this place doesn't go out of business....and I say that because we've been through a lot of businesses over in that particular part of the plaza. 

We did a small work event here and it was great. We ordered a bunch of pizzas and apps and then obviously had drinks with everything. Agree with the other reviewers...prices are very reasonable, it's a nice atmosphere, the staff was really cool, and the food was really quite tasty--it's nice to go to a pub and not get a frozen pizza but the REAL deal. 

To anyone from the pub who is reading this....you guys should do more marketing in the office buildings across the street. There is so much untapped (no pun intended) business over there. Happy hour, 1/2 price coupons, 10% off this and that...anything to drive more business. You've got a nice thing going over there and I hope it stays as our office will definitely be back!

We sat in the bar tonight, and I will tell you that the service was excellent.  We got the nacho appetizer, I had the pizza burger (good quality with an excellent bun).  My husband had the shrimp po boy and he said it was good- the cole slaw added to it.  We left full and happy.  Other reviewers complained about beer prices, but they have several choices in the $3-4 range.

Came here a couple months ago as a group. I had a groupon so we decided to invite some friends. When we first arrived, we had to search for someone to seat us...kind of odd but whatever. We ordered some beer and water. We were informed that some of the beer was bottled, not on tap. That's fine, but at no point did the waitress ask us if we wanted a glass...we had to ask her twice. Through out our time, we had to ask for refills of beer and water....not a good sign. We then ordered food. The food was OK, no one got sick or complained it tasted funny, but it was definately nothing to write home about. Lastly, when our bill came, we asked to have it split 4 ways (4 couples), the waitress flat out told us "no". So we all put our credit cards in the sleeve anyway. She charged us equal amounts 4 ways. so if our bill was $100.00, she charged $25.00 to each card. How is that fair? I'm not sure if she was just stupid or what, but we ended up figuring out the math after the fact. (yay for knowing 3rd grade math!!) We will not be back.

We've been meaning to try this place for a few months and finally got the chance this week. We went during a Blackhawks playoff game, and the staff did not seem used to this crowd but did their best to keep up. I got a  5 dollar burger special (during Stanley cup finals) with fries which was one of the better burger I've had in a long time. Seemed as if it was at at least a 15 dollar burger. I am quite the beer fan and this place has quite the range from a 2.50 old milwaukee, hamms, ect. To a 8.00 Solomon oath draft (which is on the high end In my opinion) . Nice place, will return and hopes this place makes it as it is not noticeable from rt 59.

Awful. My mom and I stopped in here for lunch... Ordered the beef and mushroom wontons and they were salty, greasy and nothing wonderful despite our waitress emphasizing how they were "soo good". Then comes our meal- we split the cheesesteak so it came out on two plates- nice gesture. One bite and my mom says  uh oh.. it takes like "steak ems".. Great. I took a bite and literally had to find my manners and not spit it completely out. Gag. What I did spit out was a grizzled hard piece.. The overall flavor of the sandwich was just god awful. The "fries" were also awful. My mom never likes to complain but the meal was literally terrible. The manager or whoever came out to apologize and said she would take care of it and would be back with our bill... Whaa??? Ok so my mom had a glass of wine, I had a sprite.. 10.25 later we were paying for it... Soda!? Really? And left a few bucks for the waitress cause it wasn't her fault and my mom has a good heart. Never again.

5 stars for service!  Two of my friends and I went in to Tap in Pub a few weeks ago on a Sunday.  We decided to sit in the bar area and were taken care of by this adorable server named Elise!  She was so incredibly attentive and explained all of the menu items really well.  We ordered everything from buffalo wings to salads to potato skins (these are not just your average potato skins)!  Although some of the drinks/food are a bit overpriced, they do have some nice options (like $2 PBRs)!!  Thank you, Elise and other staff, for your great service!  We had a nice time!

Went here about a week ago on my way home.  There was only one other person there. I ordered a Domaine DuPage and it was $6.00  The other places I go to only charge $5.00  I ordered the chicken pot pie to go.  When I got home and ate it there was about three pieces of chicken in it and it cost $12.00.  I will not go back.
Good buffalo chicken sandwich and yummy soup..its a good place to eat..we had a good time..service was good too..

While looking for somewhere new in the area to eat, I found this place on Yelp.  The reviews looked good, so my husband, three year-old daughter, and I tried it out tonight.

The waitstaff was great and the food was excellent.  Bar food at its finest.  I had the veggie sandwich and my husband had the Thanksgiving sliders.  Each was served with homemade fries and pickles.  Yum!  The attention to detail and presentation of the food was great.  Our daughter had the chicken fingers, which were real meat.  She was also served homemade apple sauce, carrot sticks and a couple of the homemade fries.  Best of all, children under five eat for only $1.

We each splurged on a mixed drink, which were very tasty.  Prices were a bit high for the drinks, but it's a bar, so it's to be expected.  Prices on the food were reasonable. 

We moved out of Chicago about a year ago and truly miss the foodie experience that is so readily available there.  Tap In's food reminded us of Chicago and what we miss.  We will definitely be back.  Our biggest concern is its location- commercial property that was very quiet on a Saturday.  Please give this place a try so that it can stay in business!
I loved this place! The white cheddar Mac & Cheese was yummy, and the pizza was as well! It's very clean and looks brand new! I would definitely recommend this place!

I have been wanting to stop by this place as I drive by it every day to and from work. Decided to drop in on a Friday after work to see what they had to offer.  I thought with a name like  the Tap In Pub, there would be a lot if beer on tap.  No dice. Only 4 beers, but 3 of them are local breweries. (fyi:  tap-in is also a golf reference.  D'oh!).  Had the Solemn Oath, which not many places carry and it was pretty tasty.  They also carry a large variety of bottled beer and do offer daily specials (Friday was a bucket of Coors Light gernades).  What they lack in draft beers, the bartender Melissa more than made up in personality (an angler, really?!?!?). They also offer a full bar, which was a surprise since the place us so small.   Beers seemed a little pricey, but it is in City Gate, so kinda expected that.  I was surprised by the pizza, which was actually pretty good.  They do have a separate dining area if you're looking for a sit down meal.  The menu consists of what I'd call pub food.  The sandwiches looked good, but didn't try one. For a Friday after work, there weren't many people.  One large group and a couple at the bar.  A few others came in, but the place remained relatively quiet.  If you're looking for nice relaxing quiet place to wind down after a long week, this would be it.  Good food, a good bartender and a relaxed atmosphere.

Me and my wife live nearby so we decided to stop by and check it out. We set at the bar and we ordered beer and food (pizza, burger and a side). The service was perfect but what really pleased us was the food. You can easily tell that the food was cooked with care and the materials were of high quality, despite the reasonable price.
The pizza was amazing and the white cheddar mac&cheese side as well. 
The one downside is the ambient, a little sterile and uninviting, not very pub like but once you get your food delivered, you easily forget about it.
Can wait to go back and dine outside on a nice weather night.
Highly recommend this place.

Outstanding! Unlike most Yelp Egomaniac Morons, I sell food to restaurants so I know what it takes to succeed in this challenging biz. Only a few visits to this extremely friendly pub (I don't think you should review a business based one just one visit) and so far... spot on service, not to loud and amazing food and food presentation. I just had the Thanksgiving sliders and they were so unique and delicious. The fries/chips are so good and cruchy and the pickles were great as well. This is the type of place where the service, atmosphere and food are all so good that reasonable, nice and classy people don't even look at the prices. It's called VALUE and you are sure to receive plenty of value here.

My wife went in tonight to meet my brother and his fiancÃ© for dinner during the Blackhawks game.  We were not expecting much, as it is in an unassuming location.  We were surprised by the quality of the food.  I had the 'neck-down turkey' which I would give a 9/10.  I asked for a side of the cranberry that came with the thanksgiving sliders on a whim and it really jazzed up the meal.  Others at the table had the Roast Beef dinner, also a delicious option (probably a 9 as well).  The Thanksgiving Sliders that my brother shared with his fiancÃ© had an amazing presentation, with a really cool small basket that the potatoes came in and served on a cutting board.  The Chicago pizza was also surprisingly good, which is an homage to Chicago roast beef sandwiches and NOT traditional Chi-town deep dish.  Still, the crust was crisp and the toppings were generous.  Overall it was a great experience with a great Hawks victory.  Oh, and they also had the audio on for the game, which is a major plus.  We will definitely return.
Nothing really special.  Good food cheap beer.  Atmosphere can use some help. It seems to be a barren wasteland in the evening. I wish them the best. We will return. Keep plugging away

My sister and I took my Dad and brother-in-law here for Father's Day. It was clear it was a new restaurant and the staff was still a bit unorganized and under-staffed... and it did take quite awhile to get our food, but that is my only complaint. The food was delicious!!! I had the Farmstand Toasted Veggie sandwich and everything from the taste to the presentation was awesome! Their "pickle pot" was also great!! We will definitely be back!!! Everyone loved their food!...and the guys loved the golf theme! =)

Their boiled beef was so good and they gave you a lot of rice to absorb the spicy broth!

The dandan noodles however was disappointing as they taste somewhat like lard.

Waiter was attentive and even brought out complimentary pickled cabbage. Tastes great.

I did some take out from here & it was really good. I had mooshoe chicken(probably spelled that wrong) & it was great, nice & light, pancakes were good. Had a couple of spring rolls which were a little on the greasy side but very edible. 

The place looks nice for dining in but no alcohol served. 

My order was out in ten minutes, nice & quick. I think I've found my go to Chinese take out restaurant.

Why is this place empty!?! 

This is my second experience dining at Yu's Bistro. I have to say the ambiance is not going to blow you away. The food on the other hand is divine. I will continue to return trying new dishes each time. 

Tonight's meal started with fried dumplings and pork egg rolls. Both were the best I've had in years.

The main meal was combination rice with sweet and sour chicken. We also had orange beef and mu shu chicken. All out of this world. 

The two times we have come we have been greeted promptly and courteously. I strongly recommend this fantastic little jewel.

I hosted a medium sized group here for a Chinese dinner. There was a slight mixup as the owner had forgotten to tell the servers that we were coming, but that was cleared up once she returned. The waitress did get two of the orders crossed and insisted she was right, but we overlooked that as the food was really superb! We tried the Beef Broccoli, Cumin Lamb and Schezuan Fish. They were definitely worth the visit. I would go again just for the variety of entrees and be careful/double check that the orders were processed correctly.

I had a dream that I'd found the best Chinese and Thai food in the western suburbs, a place where the owners welcome you into their restaurant as if it were home, and treat you like family. Then that dream came true when I visited Yu's Bistro last night. 

Tucked away in an unassuming shopping center, you almost don't realize you're passing a restaurant until you spot it. But do yourself a favor, stop in and sample some of the amazing food. We tried out the potstickers, which were fresh, crispy and delicious, and we each had an order of pad thai. If you've followed my reviews, you may be familiar with my frustration with a lack of good pad thai anywhere around. I finally found the best, and if that means driving to Naperville to have it each time a craving hits, then so be it! The food is full of flavor, with just the right amount of tang. It's perfect.

New owners took over the restaurant in November 2015, so they're slowly making changes to both the restaurant itself and the menu, bringing in more thai specialities and changing things up. 

But the thing about Yu's that's different from any other restaurant is the way you feel. It's like coming home to a place you didn't know you missed. The server/hostes, Nancy is the friendliest lady you'll ever meet. She greets you warmly and takes care of you throughout your meal, making sure you're comfortable and have everything you need. The owners come out and chat with you and really treat you with care. I've never said this about an establishment before, but you can feel the love that was put into the restaurant and it really shines when the owners come out to visit. 

The decor is simple, but attractive and the dining room is spotless. They use paper on all the tables to keep things clean for each of the customers. The booths are very comfortable and roomy, but tall so there's also a sense of privacy. 

All in all, I look forward to visiting again and sampling more of the food. We played it safe last night, but now that we know we love it, we'll be back to try new things. Now that the construction on Route 59 is complete, it's easy to hop off I-88 and find your way to Yu's. In fact, let me know when you're going and I will meet "Yu" there.

Over-priced and under-flavored. 

Disappointed to order 2 dinners, rice and 2 egg rolls for $40.10 (WOW!!!) only to have the flavor fall very flat. I cannot believe that Chinese dinner for 2 was that much. WAY over priced and egg rolls were especially disappointing. They were hardly filled. Unfortunately, will not be back.

This used to me our favorite Chinese restaurant in the burbs but since the new management took over couple months ago things has gone downhill to bad. We use to come here on a regular basis. However, I think there's a management change earlier this year.

Ambiance:- 3 out of 5
This is one of the better ratings for this restaurant but still just ok. The place is decorated jsut like your typical chinese restaurant.

Service:- 3 out of 5
Service is typical of your regular Chinese restaurant. Our server is helpful.and friendly, explained the menu and check back with us promptly when the food came.

Food: -2 out of 5
This is the coup de gras. We order the few dishes we use to order here, They spicy beef and maw, fish fillet stew, and Spicy Shichuan chicken. When the food came, we immediately notice the portion has been reduced. Well, no biggy, we understand....there's inflation and it's an business decision. But then when we eat our food, we felt the taste has completed changed and the flavor is not just not changed but they were not flavorful and to us it felt tlike all it is now was just spicy, now wait a second you said, its Shichuan food, it meant to be spicy. Yes but then again, it should maintain some flavor and standard as well, which we found are totally missing.

Bottomline: 
I will not come back and do not recommend this place to others. Other restaurant in town like the one just opened recently at west Naperville is probably a better choice.I'm not endorsing other restaurant, just making a comparison.

DMAN

I walked in to find two woman sitting in back cleaning snow peas, a bit strange. They told me I could sit wherever I'd like. One of them walk up and handed me a menu, and walked back to her table to clean snow peas. It's a little bother sum that she didn't wash her hands prior to returning, knowing that we consume that food. 
Nevertheless, I looked through the menu and found the lunch special. I came 3mins before it ended, it was a sign. I got the garlic shrimp. Since it was a lunch special, it came with soup, a spring roll, and rice all for $10. 
The soup was great! I ordered the hot and soup-- not gonna lie, I wish it had a little bit of a kick to it, but nothing a little hot paste doesn't solve. The food finally arrived, and it was a large size portion. The spring roll was gross, do not recommend trying it!! The fried rice was good! And the garlic shrimp tasted more like shrimp in lobster sauce. It was very flavorful and had a great assortment of veggies. I wish it would have had more garlic in it. 

I will definitely be back to try something else on the menu. I think I may omit all the snow peas in the future.

Visited twice would go back for sure!

Superb customer services, food were great from appetizers to entrees!  

Highly recommend the chinese noodels bowl!

The reviews for this restaurant sounded great so last night I ordered some Kung Pow Beef and Pork Fried Rice along with some vegetable spring rolls to be delivered.  Delivery was super fast....for that I will totally give the restaurant a thumbs up.  We had our food in like twenty minutes.  

The spring rolls tasted delicious but the main dishes had absolutely NO flavor to them what-so-ever; both entrees were extremely bland! Worse still, about 45 min after eating, both my husband and myself felt extremely sick to our stomachs and I ended up calling in sick to work today due to being sick to my stomach all night long.

Needless to say, ALL left over rice and beef went straight down the disposal.

Yu's bistro always serves fresh food and in a timely fashion! They have a "dinner for two" deal on their menu that my girlfriend and I always get especially since they let you substitute the meats if it's not exactly what you are looking for. I've never been disappointed with the taste and I've never waited more than 15 minutes for my food. If I'm feeling for Chinese food, there is no other place I would recommend over Yu's.

The food is a little pricey for the portion, but it's usually pretty good.  

Salted & Seared Pork $11 - Favorite of the night - This dish had a lot of good flavors and ingredients.  The pork is sliced and fried with black bean sauce, leeks, and jalapenos.

Crispy Chicken in Garlic Sauce $11 - This dish was ok for me but might be good if you like just 1 ingredient (chicken).  The chicken pieces are breaded and deep fried and then covered in sauce.  I like to have other veggies with my protein.

Scallop in Garlic Sauce $15 - I like scallops and all, but this dish didn't do much for me.  The flavors were good, but I like the pork dish best.

The new ownership is amazing. This place is very quaint inside. The decor is nice and just has a homey type of feel to it. The food is also amazing. We got egg rolls, basil fried rice, orange chicken, and chicken pad thai. Everything was great. We also tried the sesame balls for desert and they were on point. I was looking for a great Chinese restaurant in the area and I think I found the place. I will definitely be back and think you need go check this place out.

Yu's Bistro let's see what to say about this place. One word AMAZING! The new owners Mike and Nancy are wonderful, superb customer service from them. They cater to your needs. 
Food is so filling, everthing from the appetizers to the entrees. The menu is huge, so many wonderful dishes to satisfy everyone's belly's. 
I had the crab rangoon, which was creamy delicious. 
The Koa Soy was what I went for and it hit the spot! I ate it so quickly that I forgot to snap a pic. The desserts were yummy as welll, pumpkin cake balls and  sesame balls...mmhmmm...I'm hungry again.
Definitely check this place out!!! 
After to burn those calories, go shopping. This is what myself and a few friends of mine did. Every shopping store is there!!! 

Go try it!!! Now!!!

Food was inedible. Had eaten here before and didn't realize ownership changed (which means the menu changed). Dry chili batter was too salty and when we told the waitress she said that's how Chinese spice is. I think the batter was off but she was adamant that we are used to "American spices". Never again.

A pleasant surprise stopping here for lunch. I had seen this place for years but never tried it. They weren't busy, but the food was high quality. I had the general Tao's and the chicken was nice and crispy.

We came here after a long day of shopping returning back to Chicago from the premium outlets.

My partner and I were thoroughly satisfied with the food at Yu's. The Sichuan items were exactly what you would expect from an authentic Chinese restaurant. If you are Asian and are nearby you should do yourself a favour and drop by. Your taste buds will thank you.

The owner and waitress were also very friendly and they were so nice to give us a complimentary hot and sour soup. Thank you! 

I only wish we had a restaurant like this closer downtown.

I got 3 others to try this place based on the yelp reviews. 

I can only assume people where paid for rating this place a 4. Unless you eat out of a garbage dump, you cannot like this place. 

between the 4 of us we had Egg drop soup, and wonton. Everyone had the same tasteless soup. Basically bad campbells, with nothing else in it. I did have 1 wonton just tasteless. 

Next we all got the appetizers add on to the meals. You get a spring roll, fried shrimp, and crab rangoon. The springroll was just cabbage, no taste. The fried shrimp was just mush and tasteless. The crab rangoon was not the best I have ever had but the cream cheese was by far the best thing on the menu. 

I got the mongolian Beef. If your going to call it a beef dish you need to actually have more beef than onions. The beef and onions are cooked but that is it. No salt, pepper, garlic, oil, hot pepper, random sauce etc. No flavor can be used it this cooking. The others had Kung pao shrimp, and pork dish that also just had no flavor at all. The orange chicken did have flavor..... sugar.... lots of sugar... enough to kill a horse. 

On a side not my dish came with pork friend rice.Here is a thought if its pork fried rice you actually need to put pork in it!!! It was rice and soy sauce. No vegetables, pork, anything. 

please do not waste your time with this place.

So, my husband and I stopped by Yu's for a quick lunch and I'm pretty sure we won't be back. The service was decent, the decor is ok, but the food was lackluster. The restaurant was oddly empty......as I've read in other reviews. Also, the fish tank concerned me. It's a big tank with some large koi fish and it greets you as you walk in, but the water is filthy and murky. It's so murky, you can't see through it.......eeeeuuuu. So, as for the food, I'm not even comparing them to Chinese restaurants that we frequent in Chicago, I'm just comparing them to the Chinese restaurants in this suburban area......Katy's Dumplings, Chinese Kitchen, and etc. In our opinion, Yu's was basically a waste of money. 

We both got lunch specials which come with a veggie spring roll, soup, and fried or steamed rice. My husband had orange chicken and I had Mongolian beef. The veggie spring rolls just weren't very tasty and the duck sauce was not very flavorful. Our next course was soup. I had wonton and my husband had egg drop. The egg drop soup was awful.....and it had corn in it. My husband said that it tasted "corny"....which we've never seen corn in egg drop soup before. The wonton soup was awful as well. The broth was flavorless and the wontons were small. Both of our soups were just hard to eat, so after 2-3 spoons, neither of us ate anymore soup. The spring rolls and soups were very low quality.  

The Mongolian beef was actually very good. It was the most flavorful dish we had. I saw that some other reviews were praising Yu's "authentic" dishes, so maybe the Mongolian beef falls into that category because it was really good. The orange chicken wasn't very good. It was fried chicken chunks and it was fried so hard that many of the pieces were hard to puncture with the fork. The fried rice was very average. Needless to say, we probably won't be visiting Yu's again.

Delicious food and wonderful customer service!!  We will be back again soon!  We started off with crab rangoons and the pork belly and they were both amazing.  Then we shared Mongolian beef, crispy duck, and sesame chicken and everything was flavorful and delicious!

First, I go to Yu's because my wife and her friends are Chinese, and we live in Beijing about half the year - so this group wants authentic Chinese food.  If anyone orders orange chicken you get the LoD (Look of Disdain) from my significant smother.  I was concerned about the reviews saying  ownership had changed and almost suggested another place on New Years Eve, but thankfully we stuck with our original plan.

I cannot tell you which dishes we ordered other than the cumin lamb (my choice).  Everything else involving the dinner was done in a language that wasn't English, so I remained out of the loop on decisions.  The food was excellent, and instantly reminded me of a typical meal in Beijing.  Staff was super nice and made sure we were happy.  My friends did comment that there were new owners, but everybody left satisfied.

Best Thai/Chinese food!  The new owners, Mike & Nancy, make you feel as if your are guests in their own home.  Best service in Naperville area, if not Chicago!  Warm, cozy & welcoming. Can't wait to go back!

Came back this weekend following a message from Michael, the new owner, and was very much impressed with the changes they've made. We ordered chicken fried rice, a pretty safe choice, but it was still some of the best I've had. We'll be back!

Recently moved to the area and have tried every Chinese restaurant/ carry out in a 5 mile radius from our home.  Sat down for dinner today...hands down, Yu's wins on quality and price.  Especially with the new management/ owners.  Since early November 2015 (I asked the nice waitress).

Ms T and I have eatern here a couple of times, once with Andrew T.  I have been here a couple of other times, so at least four total.  Yu's provides very good Chinese fare and I will certainly go back when I have a chance.  It is a little obscure, so if you go to the address be aware that you need to approach it from the east parking lots because there is no access from IL-59.  Another heads up, the times I have been there in the winter, it was cold inside, so dress warm.

Probably because of language barrier, it can be a little quirky, and by the way, my Mandarin Chinese is non-existent, so the blame is not on them.  Nevertheless things always seem to work out.  For lunch Ms T decided on eggrolls and sizzling rice soup and I chose Szechuan dumplings and Hot and sour soup.  When Ms T ordered the sizzling rice soup and egg roll, we were told this soup is for two.  The lady left, so, so much for my hot and sour soup and dumplings, but OK.  She brought the sizzling rice and two bowls.  The soup was OK for what it is, fairly bland but that is the nature of this soup.  The lady was right, there was plenty of soup for two.  Then she brought the egg rolls and THEN she asked me what I wanted.  This was a little strange.  Ms T had all of her food before I was asked what I wanted.  There was plenty of soup for two so I just ordered those dumplings that I like.  We still had soup left when my dumplings arrived, so I added them to my soup along with some of the chili sauce they were in and some hot mustard.  Now I had really good soup.  It is pretty common for me to do some "cooking" with soups at the table.  These dumplings are smothered in a good, oily chili sauce.  They are great as served, but are an awesome addition to soup.  

We have always had good meals at Yu's and while I have not kept immaculate records, I particularly like a beef (or was it pork?) dish with loads of jalapeno chiles.  They have a huge menu including things you normally find and things that you may not have seen.  If you go in cold weather, get some soup to warm you up.

My family went here for Christmas Eve and it was wonderful. The service was friendly and fast. The food was delicious and authentic. The best part of the night by far was the Peking duck! It was crispy and so flavorful. This was the perfect spot for a holiday dinner.

I'm very surprised at some of the negative reviews, our experience here is the opposite. This is our go-to Chinese spot. Sure, the food has taken a bit longer than normal to come out, but when it does its awesome, everything we've gotten here. Even the soups are great, and I'm picky in that arena. And last but not least, their prices are way under what you would expect for the quality and portion size. Yep, not everyone in there speaks English, but that's not an issue with me for what i get out of the place. Once again, this is our go-to place for Chinese. Give it a try.

Their dry chili chicken is probably one of the best I've had.  It was just the right amount of spice (more on the spicy side), and it wasn't soggy at all, which I hate when I am eating dry chili chicken. 

Every once in awhile I notice inconsistency with the dish (quantity, chicken/chili ratio, etc.) which is why I'm not giving it 5 stars.

Amazing food!!!!! I'd definitely try the dry chili chicken. Spicy but delicious. Menus are a little lo tech but don't let that fool you this place is great. The lunch special is such a good deal...you get tons of food.

Haven't been back since they changed management and chefs so wanted to check this place out again. Got the pot stickers, chicken with green bean, salt and pepper shrimp, beef chow fun,  white fish filet, wok fried tofu, and sesame sweet balls.  My daughter loves sesame balls and besides China Town we can never find it.  She loved them so that alone will make me come back.  But they surprisingly served a lot of meat with their meat dishes.  The tofu had a very good sweet basil sauce.  The string beans were nice and crisp. The shrimp was bigger with not a lot of breading which is good.  The beef chow fun and sole fish filet were made just the way I like them.  Everything was very tasty.  Gotta say it's just a tad more expensive than other Chinese restaurants but not overly that it would stop me from coming back.  The service was very efficient and we got our food very fast.  The waitress was very nice.  Definitely coming back!

If you love Chinese food you HAVE to try Yu's.  The food is amazing with a lot of variety.  Nancy, the owner, is a pure joy.  She is a delightful person and makes you feel special.  My fiancÃ©e and I try to go once a month, if not twice.  I recently moved here from Chicago and hands down Yu's is better than any food you'll have in Chinatown.  Go to Yu's!!! You will not be disappointed.
It's the best Szechuan Restaurant in the west Suburb. Salty pepper fish and spicy chicken are excellent. Definitely will go back again.

After living in China for quite some time I can confidently say I have found a good Chinese take-out place in America. This food is AMAZING and very authentic. I've been back many times, and have always found the service to be fast and polite. I'm a huge dumpling/pot sticker fan and I think these are as close to authentic as you're going to get, definitely recommend the Mandarin Dumplings.

Best Chinese food I ever had, very cozy, family atmosphere and the new owners Mike and Nancy were very friendly and truly cared that we had a great dining experience. They will be adding Thai food to the menu, can't wait.
They added Thai food to the menu. The pot stickers, Curry Chicken and Pad Siew were excellent and the road construction is completed so it's all good.

The new owners Mike and Nancy make you feel like family the minute you walk in, they went by far beyond my expectations when we celebrated my birthday, food was amazing! service can't get any better! Everything in their menu is so good!  My favorite dish was the kao soy and pad thai, my kids keep asking me to go back (including my picky eater!) we'll be back soon for sure! I highly recommend this place, KEEP IN MIND THAT THE RESTAURANT IS UNDER NEW OWNERSHIP SO THE OLD REVIEWS DON'T REFLECT THE CURRENT SERVICE AND QUALITY.

Well my husband and I are always on the hunt for good Asian food.  We had a late lunch at Yu's last week.  They were very gracias and friendly.  The service was great.  We were the only people there at the time.  Unfortunately the restuarant had an odor of a mixture of disinfectant & mildew, like they wiped the table with an old rag.  My husband unknowingly order an appetizer that he couldn't eat(not that it tasted bad) they so kindly took it off the bill(we didn't even request that).  Crispy duck was dry but my Szechuan Shrimp was very good and the shrimp were plentiful.  Maybe we will give them a second chance, but I doubt it.

We were happy to learn that Mike and Nancy, new owners, had bought another restaurant.  We had been regulars at their Oakbrook restaurant for the last16 years.  Their customer service is outstanding and they instill their attention to detail and genuine friendliness in their staff too.
Although it is much farther for us, the ride was well worth it.  The menu is extensive and focuses on Szechuan dishes.  However they also serve some of my favorite Thai noodle dishes like Kao Soy, Pad Kee Mao and Pad Thai. We started out with chicken lettuce wraps, which could be a meal in itself.  In fact there are so many appetizer choices, the next time ( Yes, there will be a next time.) I am tempted to just order them. The salt and pepper. Japanese styled tofu are golden round pillows of softness with a crispy coating on the outside garnished with minced jalapeÃ±os, green peppers and onions.  Next was the Kao Soy that I had been craving with the two types of noodles and the yellow curry sauce I remembered so well.  My daughter ordered Pad Kee Mao, because she loves the crispy fried rice noodles.  The portions are large and so we had to prioritize what we would finish at the restaurant and what we would take home.  We settled on taking the two noodle dishes home, as they would reheat the best.  We finished off with the sesame rice balls.  Usually I am not a fan but these were made on site, were not overly sweet, nor greasy.
Mike and Nancy have applied for a liquor license but until it is approved, it is BYOB.  I would recommend people try Yu's Bistro.  The food is authentic and the service can't be beat!

I've been here twice and both times were magnificent! The servers are so kind and helpful in choosing more traditional Chinese dishes. The portions are huge so I would call the Restraunt a family style experience (great for sharing). Definitely an appropriate price for all the deliciousness that ensues

As many of the other reviews pointed out, this place is oddly empty. The service was AWESOME. The owner / waitress was so polite & funny. We even ordered the diced rabbit appetizer but she told us not to and that "only us Chinese like it".

We had the Scallops with Garlic Sauce and Beef with Jalepnos. Both fantastic! The menu is not your "standard" Chinese food menu.

I'll be back for sure!
The food is excellent the ambience is okay but go there for the food you will not be disappointed I can't wait to go next time yummy

Yu's bistro has a large menu, and the food is excellent.  Coming soon is Thai food to the menu, cannot wait for that!  The new owners are super nice and welcoming.   I had the pork and leek dish it was awesome.  Great value for the lunch specials.   Can't wait to return soon...

This is some of the best Asian food I've had in a long time. We ordered for take out. I got the Chopped Chili Beef and my husband got the Mongolian Beef. It was the melt-in-your-mouth kind of goodness.

Oh man!  The scallops in garlic sauce themselves would be enough to keep me coming back for more.  I was expecting garlic butter covering some scallops with a heaping off veggies, but what I got was a heaping of scallops and tasty mushrooms in a unfamiliar but very tasty sauce that carried a garlic flavor!

The SO and I also tried the beef and beans (I can't remember the exact dish name) that almost tasted a little like dan-dan, but were simple and very tasty.

The meal came with a nice helping of well-cooked white rice and plenty of food, hot tea, and water.  The food was prepared very quickly and pretty close together - though in 2 separate trips.

The bill and prices are all reasonable and the restaurant was clean (despite a few non-obtrusive but un-bussed tables - see the next comment).  Definitely a place I have no problem dropping in to.

I can't complain per-say, but I did feel a bit bad for the one waitress (/owner I'd guess).  She was working super hard to take care of the register, phone orders, 2 large family tables, 2 smaller tables, and our pair.  Basic things took a little longer because of that, but she was very helpful, and we never had to ask twice for anything.  This could be because it was late on a Sunday night, but I might think about calling your order in if you are in a rush.

No matter what though... GREAT food and I will be back!

A Great alternative to Downer's Lao Sichuan if you like the spicy chili food and being in west burbs. Most spicy dishes are pretty comparable between these two. The outstanding service in Yu's definitely beats Lao Sichuan.

There are a few usual items we order: Scallion Pancakes, Dry Stir Fried Green Beans , Dried Chili Diced Chicken, and a fish dish. We also loved the Fish head soup which requires to call ahead to order since it takes a longer time to prepare. Every time we ate here, they were able to deliver the same great quality dishes. 

The service was always really warm and attentive. The owner always stopped a few time to talk to us. She recommended  their new dishes, made sure we liked what we got, and just chitchatted a bit. Actually, you could let her know what you like or want to try, she might come up with something to surprise you.

A very nice stop when I am craving for the spicy food after or before walk around in the Fox Valley mall.

The food here is excellent! I've gone to Yu's Mandarin in Schaumburg for years and this place is definitely competitive when it comes to the flavor of the food. The sautÃ© fish with vegetables is very tasty (my kids eat it up so we always order at least 2). The sczechuan dumplings are seriously legit! The beef tripe is also good. My family has found our go to in Naperville.

New owners and management, food was amazing. They are still adding more to the menu. Every recommendation from Nancy was amazing! Best Mongolian beef, some wide rice chicken noodle stir fry was amazing, and the green curry combo top notch!!!! High recommendation and a hidden gem off of a strip mall, worth the trip!

Yu's Bistro has new owners and the food and service are now both top notch.  We had pork egg rolls, chicken fried rice and Mongolian beef and the quality and quantity of the food was excellent.  I will definitely keep making the trip from the Elgin area for this tasty treat!

I am a great lover of Thai food. In fact since my favorite Thai restaurant in Oak Brook closed last winter, I have been on a hunt for really good Thai food. I bet I have been to most Thai restaurants in the South and West suburbs. Finally, the new owners of Yu's Bistro have come up with some really outstanding dishes. Although, it began as a Chinese Restaurant, there have been some outstanding dishes added to the menu. Their lettuce wraps are the best I have ever had. One of my favorite dishes is their chicken pad Thai. My 93 year mother claims their Lotus shrimp is the best shrimp she has ever tasted. We happily travel 35-40 minutes to eat at Yu's. If you like good food, I suggest you do the same.

This place is a great option for authentic Chinese food in the Naperville/Aurora area. The service is quick and friendly, and we almost always get a complimentary something! Owners have recently changed and I think the restaurant has been remodeled (floors), but decor is still casual and bright, not very fancy or overly stereotypical Chinese. My parents, husband, and I came here for dinner on Saturday night. I've been craving soups a lot and generally order a single cup of hot & sour soup when out with my husband since he's not a fan. But my parents are fans of soup so I tried to order a large bowl of H&S soup but the waitress gave us a recommendation! I'm generally wary of Chinese restaurant waitress recommendations (as I've found it to be more of a this-inventory-needs-to-be-moved-asap type deal than a this-is-really-delicious thing). She told us that if we were going to order a large bowl of soup, we should go for a specialty soup since those are prepared to ordered whereas the H&S soup is premade in a big vat and sits there all day. We decided to order the west lake beef soup. Great choice! There was enough soup for 2 bowls each (4 people). Not sure how much it was, probably a couple bucks more than the large H&S soup but worth it!

We also ordered 2 appetizers: fu qi fei pian (i think it's this one on the menu -- "SLICED BEEF & MAW IN CHILI SAUCE". Luckily it was more beef than maw!!) and some sort of spicy bean jelly. Both were spicy and delicious. Portion size was great. We then ordered 2 dishes: stir fried spinach and kung pao beef. Generally we order one dish per person but the waitress insisted it was sufficient, and it was! We even had leftovers. Halfway through the meal she brought us complimentary fried pumpkin cakes. They were so good and chewy. The texture was kind of like pumpkin mochi, except they were breaded and fried. My husband doesn't like mochi so two for me, yay!

The restaurant was maybe 50% full on a late Saturday night, most,if not all, patrons were Chinese. Prices are a little cheaper here, but then again, husband and I are used to prices from a little more up north/east (Chef Pings, Yu's Mandarin, Asian Bistro). We will make it a point to dine at Yu's Bistro more often when visiting my parents in Naperville!

This place used to have dimsum on the weekends (under prior owners), but not sure if that's the case anymore. We forgot to ask. It's unfortunate if there is no more dimsum since the closest location would be in International Mall in Westmont.

Noooooooo they changed ownership at Yu's Bistro. I'm pretty sure the chef changed too because the food isn't quite the same either. Still worth eating, but I can't rave about it like the way I used to :(

Horrible! We ordered Hunan chicken, orange chicken, pork fried rice, and egg rolls. It all tasted like vegetable oil. When we got home the leftovers didn't even make it into the house.it went straight into the garbage. The front door to the restaurant was dirty and nasty. Also I need to mention the fish tank was absolutely filthy. In my opinion this place really sucks!!

Entrees came 30 minutes apart. I guess they don't know it's rude to have one person finish their meal before the other one can start. Needless to say we had to have one entree warmed up. To top it off my food was made not even close to how I requested.

Oh no! Yu's sold to another owner!  The service was a disaster. A take out order that normally takes 15 minutes took 45.  The new owner speaks no English and will only converse with people who speak her native language. It took ten minutes for someone to take my order.

The order came late and was wrong and missing an item.  30 minutes later the missing item added. The wrong dish wasn't replaced but a promise of "we'll try again" wasn't worth the wait. I could hear people eating at the tables complaining that their orders weren't complete.  Another person who had take out and came in just after I did still hadn't received his order.

Finally, the food was ok. Normally it is exceptional. The Dry Chili Shrimp is now breaded (lightly) instead of just crispy.

We won't be back.

Our new favorite place!  We have been to Yu's four times in the last two months, and we cannot get enough!  The hardest decision you have to make is what to order, because it is all SO amazing.  For chinese, the crispy (and spicy) shrimp is to die for, as is the mongolian beef and orange chicken.  Make sure to get some fried rice and chicken lettuce wraps too....all so yummy!  If you are in the mood for thai, the pad that and kao soy are delicious.  I can't say enough good things.  Go and enjoy!!!

Took the Family here the other day, 3 kids and my wife. The service was great! Admittedly they were just about empty, but the server (maybe owner) was on top of everything.

Food wise you cannot go wrong. Shaved noodles were great with Beef. All of the soups are very tasty. Most of the food I got was because I told the staff what I like and they just made something, so I have no idea what the names were. Even the kids got some really good chicken that they loved. 

The ambiance is standard fare, nothing special. 

Overall it feels like you are walking into one of your family members Restaurants. They take very good care of you and don't mind some conversation as well. 

If you're in the area, well worth a try. Just ask em to make whatevers good!

The food and service was both good. Portion size, price were on par with similar restaurants. The one thing that really stands out here are the vegetables. The vegetables are bright and crispy (i.e. cooked perfectly). Most places over cook the vegetables until they are limp and over done but not Yu's! I will certainly be going back.

I love this place a lot! Each time we went to Premium outlet, we will stop by for either lunch or dinner. Their hotspot is sooo good and have very good price. We also tried their spicy food. Very authentic compare to other chinese restaurant!

I have been to this Chinese place a couple of times, and each time I have gone I have had something different, which has always left me happy.  I feel more of an authentic vibe when I go to this Chinese place as opposed to other places that have very basic choices: Orange Chicken, General Tso, Sweet and Sour, Beef and Broccoli.  Yu's has all of these items, but they also have 4 other pages of more unique dishes including a handwritten special menu that seems to change from time to time depending on what they have on hand and hotpots (love those).  

This particular visit, I was feeling dumplings.  I wasn't sure which ones to go with as Yu's has a few to choose from, but my waitress was happy to recommend Szechaun Dumplings seeing as I like things on the spicier side.  They were the best dumplings that I had ever had and I don't see my future visits to Yu's without these dumplings in it.  I also really enjoyed their tea.  If you are craving authentic Chinese in Naperville, Yu's is the place for You!  (sorry I had to)

HOW DID THEY MANAGE 4 stars???? This place is so bad it compelled me to write my first review. In any place. EVER! 

I have been a long time user, but not reviewer, of yelp and am finding people sling around 1 star or 5 stars to easy. Trust me on this one, I am not just throwing 1 star at it to be a jerk. 

The wife and I moved down to Oswego recently and in looking for a new Chinese place found this on yelp with a healthy number of reviews and 4 stars. I drove out of my way by almost 10 miles to pick it up. We ordered orange chicken, sesame chicken, and 2 orders of egg rolls. FOR THE FIRST TIME EVER, I could not even finish half the food. I am so "frugal" (cheap my wife calls it) I eat even marginally bad food just not to was money. This stuff was terrible. I even tried to pawn it off on one of my kids that eats almost anything and after 1 bite... no dice.

Not sure if just these items on the menu are bad, but even the egg rolls had a very strange taste to them. So if you want to throw away $32, just copy my order and drop it off in the garbage when you leave...

Very good and authentic chinese food. Definitely will come back again and again.   I would definitely choose Yu Bristro over Mapo.  6 of us, we ordered around 10 dishes, from pork, beef to fish. Eggplant was amazing.  The soup we ordered was kind of Hang Zhou soup, which reminded us about the trip in Hang Zhou. The service was great.  The location is great, along RT59, usually we will shop here during the weekend.

Attentive servers. Hot tea is free. If you are Korean, don't try Jjajangmyun (black bean noodle) and JjangPpong (spicy seafood noodle) even if you see them on the menu. They don't make them well. My  favorite dish was dry chili chicken.

I feel bad giving this place one star, but after returning to eat there after we learned they changed ownership, we won't be back again.

First visit: May 2014.  Ordered takeout on a Sunday evening.  Ready quickly.  We had crab rangoon, moo shu chicken, and combo lo mein.  Food was fairly good.  Price could have been a little less for how it tasted.

Second visit: August 16, 2014.  We were skeptical after reading all the negative reviews following the change in ownership.  Decided to try it just to see if they were true.  Our takeout order was ready in 15 minutes, so it didn't take an obscene amount of time like some reviewers said.  However, we were very disappointed with the food.  We ordered the exact same items we had in May: crab rangoon, moo shu chicken, and combo lo mein.

Crab rangoon: it's now dry, too hard, and pretty obvious they didn't make it in the restaurant.

Combo lo mein: SUPER greasy, very little meat.  Mostly noodles.  This dish actually made my husband ill shorty after eating it.

Moo shu chicken: the dish looked the same as it did in May, but we were given only about a tablespoon total of the sauce.  Plus, the sauce tasted way off, like soy sauce that had sugar mixed with it.

Unfortunately, we won't be going back again.  So disappointed after our more positive experience in May.  The Yelp reviewers were right: change in management = no longer the great Yu's.

Great food but service is a little slow. Had the mandarin dumpling, hot and sour soup, and the lo mein combination. Dumpling where great and so was the soup. Lo Mein was just okay.

Place is very authentic and many of the patrons were Chinese. Tables had the lazy Susan's.

Will come back. Looking forward to the hot pot!

The restaurant has changed the ownership, and the new owner has no idea how to run the restaurant. We used to be regulars but now we avoid it at all cost.  Last time we were there, with only few tables full, our food took more than an hour. I watched some people who ordered takeouts waiting there before we sat down, and still there after we got our food.  I wonder how long the restaurant will last with this kind of poor service.

I have been to this place multiple times in the last 6+ years.  The unfortunate thing is that this place keeps getting sold to different management / chefs and in a nut shell it is either a Feast Or Famine.  Still it remains to be one of the more authentic restaurants serving food in the area.

Over the years, the quality of food has consistently gone down.  It still stays good amount for the money but the taste has really been only a fraction of what it used to be.  

Btw, if you have a Mandarin speaking person with you, I have seen that it usually is better.  I would not think that it is because they are biased but it seems like they feel more comfortable asking specifics on how that dish needs to be flavored.

Off night?

Party ordered Spring Rolls, Pot Stickers, Moo Shu Pork, Lamb, Kung Pow Chicken, Orange Chicken.

The Spring rolls and Pot Stickers were both drop dead boring.  No flavor inside the Pot Stickers or Spring Rolls.  Thankfully the sauces were okay.

I've always maintained that a Chinese restaurant should always be able to prepare a decent Kung Pow or Orange Chicken.  Yu's failed miserably on both these dishes.  No flavor whatsoever combined with overcooked chicken.  Throwing red peppers on top at the end is not seasoning Kung Pow guys!  I had to bite into a red pepper and then use the heat for the next couple mouthfuls just to get a little taste.  Easily the worst Kung Pow I've had in 40 years.

The Orange Chicken was also tasteless with almost no orange flavor anywhere.  The diner said they'd had better at Panda Express!! Ouch.

The Lamb dish was okay, and had some flavor.

The Moo Shu Pork also was okay.

Didn't get the hot pot... probably should have given all the other reviews.

May try again for takeout, but after this visit, I can;t recommend the place.

I have eaten here several times for lunch with my Chinese coworkers.  Every time, I have really enjoyed the food.  We usually leave it to my colleagues to do the ordering for everyone and that works out well.

Very good! I'm from Sichuan and it really tastes like what I had back home! I recommend the fish, æ²¸è¾é±¼çï¼the tofu, éº»å©è±è, and å¤çªãI traveled from San Francisco and I guarantee it is as good as the Chinese restaurants I usually go there. And the device is also good!

FYI, they have really good hot pot. It's absolutely the perfect companion to a cold, winter's night. Also goes well with beer. :)

If you've not had hot pot, think savory fondue broth, either veggie based or spicy chili based. You can choose both, with a divider.

Here's the list of what we got for the hot pot:
shrimp
lamb
2 types of mushroom - enoki and something else
napa cabbage
chinese spinach
thin vermicelli noodles
thick fresh pulled noodles 
squid
tofu skin looking thing
fish fillets

The sauce/pastes were pretty good - not too salty - but you could eat the food standalone too. By the end of the meal, you finish it off by spooning out some broth - so many rich flavors and nutrients mm. 

My fav was the fish fillets - v. tender.

The wife and I had dinner here on a Saturday night.  We had sauteed fish fillet and stewed beef noodle soup.  The dishes were too salty for our taste.  The hostess was nice and offered up a complimentary egg drop soup.  The stewed beef noodle soup was mixed up as a beef tendon noodle soup, so they brought out a bowl of beef stew to correct the order.

Logistically, the restaurant is large and roomy and has very convenient parking off of Route 59 in both the front and back of the restaurant.  It might be logistically good for a big group dinner if that's in the offing for anyone.  Most of the patrons looked to be of mainland Chinese descent as that is the taste the restaurant caters to.

Such a shame that this place isn't more busy. Every time we come here, we're one of a few tables and it's so quiet. I don't know why this is since the food is really good and you get large portions. 

I am in love with the boiled fish here. Large pieces of tender white fish (cod?) are served in a spicy red chili oil with napa, celery, and scallions. It's comfortably spicy, not tongue-numbingly spicy, which is not enjoyable to me. 

I also really like their Szechuan string beans, sliced beef and maw in chili sauce, and dry chili chicken. 

Definitely a keeper. They also offer hot pot which I would like to try since it's the season for it now.

My parents took my family out for dinner and Yu's was their choice.  Upon entering the restaurant, the owner greeted my parents like old friends.  I had to ask my Dad how often they came here and he replied, "Only every once in a while." lol  The woman was very friendly and the very epitome of "front of the house" personality (in a good way)!

Normally, at a Chinese restuarant we let my parents do the ordering since I'm first generation, American-born Chinese and my parents can of course actually read the Chinese characters on the menu.  But this time they let the owner recommend some dishes, and I was surprised because they were the more "Americanized" dishes, not the traditional dishes they usually order for themselves.

We started with the szechaun beef jerky which was good and not as spicy as I thought it woudl be.  We had the honey walnut shrimp, which I typically don't like because this dish is usually too sweet for my taste.  But I enjoyed this version.  It was still sweet, but not too sweet.  And the shrimp were very good size.  We also had the orange chicken and pork fried rice, which were both exactly what you would expect.  They were above average, but again, it's orange chicken and pork fried rice.  We also had bbq pork shaved noodles which was really good.  The noodles were awesome!   And for veggies we had chicken and string beans, which was good and my favorite the Chinese version of collard greens in garlic sauce.  I don't really know what the veggie is, but it looks like collard greens, but not as leafy.  (I know total epic fail to my culture here! lol)  Regardless, they were awesome... fresh and not overcooked like I have found at other places.  Prices were very reasonable, and portions were generous.

And finally, the reason why Yu's got 5 stars instead of 4 stars, the owner got our son to eat all his veggies, as everytime she would come by, she would point out a veggie on his plate and said, "You have to eat your veggies!"  Love it!  As a "prize" for eating all his veggies, she gave us a plate of steamed pork dumplings on the house.  They were good and I'm excited to come back both for dinner and also to try the dim sum they do on weekend mornings.

Absolutely the best Szechuan food I've had anywhere in Chicagoland.  Authentic and delicious, and even great prices.  Their best dish is the Dry Chili Chicken, although my brother was able to order off-the-menu when he returned from 6 months in China, and told me what they served him was spot-on.  I've also gone to Yu's with Chinese friends who are able to order Beef Tendon soup, which I am told is a chinese comfort food analogous to european americans liking mac&cheese.  Anyway, point being that this place is authentic and very good if you're not limiting yourself to americanized menu items.
Thank God for this place! Don't need to drive all the way to Chinatown whenever I'm craving for some Chinese Hot Pot. The spicy broth taste so good with the peppercorn in it. Ohhh... I want some NOW

I came this place because I was craving Chinese and I'm from Dallas. The food is delicious and very friendly people. I'm surprised that this place is dead. I had lamb cumin and sweet pea leaf with garlic and it was just delicious. Will come back again wen I'm visiting Naperville.

5 stars all the way.

$20/pp for an absolutely delicious and filling hotpot experience, complete with the owner of the restaurant teaching you how to cook every single ingredient.

Haven't tried any of the other dishes, but given how good the hotpot was, I don't think I'll ever get the chance to.

Get the $17/pp seafood hotpot on the back of the menu. It comes with spinach, cabbage, shrimp, fish, lamb, beef, chicken, noodles, tofu, fish balls, tripe.

In my opinion, the best ingredients were: tripe, fish balls, lamb, fish, beef, cabbage (in that order) cooked in the spicy broth.

Yummm... I cant wait for the winter to come now that I've found a closer alternative to Chinatown!

Owner is very nice!  Every time we go there, she remembers us.  Service is top notch which is something you don't find often in Chinese restaurants. Portions are good and priced right. They have a variety of dishes from your typical to more authentic dishes.  This is the best Chinese restaurant in the Naperville/Aurora area.

What a gem! I once came here a long time ago, but I think it had a different name. Anyway, it was a nice change from the usual Mapo/Joy Yee run.

When we came in, we were one of two tables filled here. The waitress (owner?) came out and heartily greeted us and gave us some suggestions on what to have. We ended up ordering 5 spice beef, scallion pancakes, Szechuan string beans, basil tofu, chili beef, and dried chili chicken. All were winners and reasonably priced and service was top notch. I hope that when (if) this restaurant is busy, the service is the same. I'm getting tired of the staff at Mapo.

Will definitely repeat and update accordingly.

Kid-friendly and somewhere we can go as a family to eat food everyone enjoys. I'm a fan of their dry pot spareribs. Nice and spicy! The kids enjoy watching the fish in the tank. We've had decent service in the handful of times we've visited but occasionally, it seems a bit understaffed. Looking forward to the next meal out at Yu's Bistro.
Used to love this place. Last time we went there it was awful. Change in ownership = terrible tasting food. Have not gone back and I used to be a regular here, every week or two. So sad.

First thing that stands out to me about this place is how attentive the manager is to EACH party that eats here. Not only that, the food here is solid. 

I was recommended the "dumplings with red oil" dish to start things of; terrible translation I know, but it was amazing. Oh, it is called Szechuan Won Ton. The dumplings are VERY soft, so picking them up is a skill that you must master. I would also try the Stir Fried Lamb with Scallion and the Dry Stir Fried Green Beans. Both are very flavorful and Szechuan-esque. Their beef stew noodle soup is very good, delectable and of course, spicy. If noodle soup is your thing, please also try the Triple Delight Wonton and the Chengdu Noodle Soup. Szechuan Hot and Spicy Fish Filet is a good seafood dish, but this is recommended for those who enjoy their food, obviously, hot and spicy. 

One of the drawbacks to this place is that it tends to get a little snug during busy hours; by snug I mean they try to fit as many people as they can into the restaurant. I tend to also try to get a booth because the chairs make me a bit nervous. 

Perks of the place. Location! It is on the southeast corner of New York/Aurora and Route 59, which is directly across from the Westfield Shopping Center (forever Fox Valley in my book). Great service! Seriously, the manager asks us how the meal was EACH TIME I hit this joint. 

I know I recommended mostly spicy dishes, but they DO have non-spicy dishes. On the authenticity meter on a scale of 1-10, I give this an 8. 

Yay for good Chinese food! Cheers.

A friend introduced me to this place.  I love the spicy beef tip soup.  I can't wait to go in the winter for some Hot Pot.

I really enjoy the friendly staff and the authentic dishes.
Great service great food and great lunch specials was good not 5 stars only because my entree sweet and sour chicken was a tad bland but good none the less.
I love this place. The owner always acts so excited that we are here and does their very best to make sure each visit is good. I love the scallops with lemon, really good!
Great place. They provide the best hot pot I have tried in USA, and the price is  low, just 17 dollars per person after tax. The most important thing is the owner of the restaurant is super nice.

Yes, it is true, Yu's Bistro is under new management. My mom and I personally met the manager, and she is very nice. The food there is really good especially their noodle soups made with their hand-carved noodles. . . beef/beef tendon. They also make a stir-fry version of their hand-carved noodles which is also delicious. I also am a HUGE fan of their garlic eggplant dish! YUM! yum yum. . . . very authentic chinese food if you ask me. 

On weekends, you can also order "diou jiang you tiao" (chinese pin yin). And also dim sum dishes. . . but no kart service for their dim sum. Still delicious though.  

Would definitely come here many times when craving chinese food!

Not bad not great. Bump up to three star because service was friendly and quick. My egg drop soup had corn in it. What is that you say?  Yes corn kernels. Unless someone can enlighten me and tell me this is the actual authentic way to eat it ill have to assume this was a mistake. Beef fried rice was ok. Large chunks of meat but a little on the greasy side. General tso chicken had a few unedited chunks of fatty chicken but other than that was decent flavor. Sadly, since moving to the burbs this ok meal was the best Chinese I've had yet in the burbs. So I may be back and trying other menu items until I find that 4 star meal.
Quick service. Friendly owner greets u at door. More authentic than most. Be aware that its a little so dress warm. Will most definitely return

Have a nice lunch before we go to Aurora~ The food is very typical~ taste almost the same favor as it is of sizchuan. Highly recommend, especially when you re considering to give yourself a good treat~ XDDD~

I came here on a day when I was driving around Route 59 aimlessly looking for food. I was sick of burgers and sandwiches and just stumbled upon this place on a Saturday late morning.

When I walked in, the place looked very quiet (perhaps only 4 occupied tables). I was a bit unsure but went ahead anyways. I ordered some szechuan dishes and noodles (can't remember what were they called - I just remembered lots of chilli oil) and I was pleasantly surprised at how good it tasted! It wasn't as spicy as it looked and even my fiance (who tries to avoid spicy loved it) - the noodles were flavorful. The portions were just right (not too large), and they had a lot of authentic Chinese selection on the menu. Prices were OK too... there are some side-dishes that you can order at about $3-4, so you can mix-n-match (in case you just want a taste, and not stuff your face.)

I gave this 4 stars because the first impression wasn't much of an impression. Maybe it's the dim lighting, or lack of light coming in from outside that made the place look a little dull. Other than that, I'd recommend coming here for the food.
Good place to eat. I wish it was located in a less hectic area. Anyways, I love Chinese/Asian foods. It is a typical sit-down Chinese restaurant with a nice large menu.
The hot pot is a wonderful treat, and they have a great variety of authentic spicy dishes.  Always a warm welcome and very attentive service.

This restaurant recently changed ownership and unfortunately, in my experience, the change has not been for the better. We have been there three times since the ownership changed and will not be returning. So sad as it used to be my favorite chinese restaurant in the area. The first time we went there after the ownership change they brought the wrong dish. When we told the waiter we had not ordered chicken with broccoli but rather chicken with black bean sauce they just added black bean sauce to the chicken with broccoli they originally brought out. Not tasty at all. The next time we went I ordered homestyle tofu, which had been my favorite dish. This time it tasted funny and I threw out the leftovers. The last straw is that a few nights ago I ordered vegetable fried rice for take out. It was bland, tasteless and barely edible. Even my husband who will eat anything suggested I throw it out. the decor is better with the new owners but with the changes in the food, it definitely is not enough to keep me coming.

The food is always deliscious at this restaurant.  The owner is the sweetest!  Very authentic cuisine!  You will NOT be disappointed!  I highly recommend the hand shaved noodle dish!  The szechuan dumplings are A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!

We recently learned that Yu's Bistro changed management in the past year or so, so we decided to try it again.  Finally, we have an authentic and delicious Chinese restaurant in the far west suburbs.

When you go, I highly recommend that you ask for their specialty dishes.  These are Szechuan dishes that have a little bit of heat, but lots of flavor.  Other highlights are their noodle dishes where they use their own freshly prepared noodles.

Those looking for a traditional Chinese breakfast need to look no further.  They have my favorite combination, soy milk and fried chinese cruellers, for under $3!  If you're looking for authentic, non-americanized Chinese food, you should try it out.

Love this place! Awesome , friendly staff!
Always fresh food.
The chopped chicken salad is one of my favs!
Every sandwich & soup we have gotten has been delish

This place offers a great value for lunch. Nothing too crazy but everything is done to perfection. Until you have the Spicy Mushroom Soup. It's so good, you'll want to buy a quart to take home. Real mushrooms sliced up, eat it on the outdoor roof deck.

Super close to the train, downtown and the beautiful Lilac Park.

I was visiting Chicago and a friend of mine recommended Shannon's.  If you haven't been there you are missing out.  This was the friendliest restaurant I have ever been in.  They were very helpful and welcoming.  I had the pastrami on rye.  It was outstanding!  I also had the potato salad, it was amazing.  This was the best deli I have ever been to.  Go to Shannon's, you won't be disappointed!

Paul and Jennifer are outstanding owners.  This was the friendliest restaurant I have ever visited.  To tell you how invested they are in their customers, Jennifer personally walked an elderly patrons order out to her vehicle.

YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED WHEN YOU VISIT SHANNON'S!!!

Great place, I love how they expanded.
It is one of our staples for weekend lunches I between dropping kids off all over the place.

Food is always good, service is great, and we always leave with a double baked potato for dinner!

Gee, I wonder what could have drawn me to this place?! (hint: name)

Actually, it was proximity to my location today (Lilacia Park) and the fact that my dad and I both wanted a sandwich for lunch. Shannon's Deli met both criteria, and we both ordered the Pastrami and Swiss (on grilled rye, since they didn't have an onion roll for Dad).

The hot pastrami was meaty and spicy, but I felt like the taste of the rye warred with it a bit; might have done better on a plainer roll. 

I upgraded from chips to fries for $1; good choice! Crispy outside, still potato-y inside, and adorned with flaky salt. 

The deli has two rooms, with some interesting furniture (note the table and stools with claw-and-ball feet) and several (gladly muted) TVs, and then beyond in the next room is Shannon's butcher shop; though closed, the sprightly lady behind the deli counter actually went to get something from there for a customer, so that's service!

Their menu isn't enormous, but there is a "build your own sandwich" section so you can always create something yourself if you see a gap. Right by the Metra (and near Lilacia Park!)

I must have been in a funky mood my previous review. Maybe it was a challenging day at work. 

Shannon's is awesome. They have a wide selection of items on their menu, and everything I've tasted is delicious. I'm a huge fan of their buffalo chicken - this item seems to be my habitual order lately! The reason the items can sometimes take a while is because they are made FRESH! The staff is always friendly and helpful. Prices are reasonable and the restaurant is always clean. 

I'm a 5-10 minute walk away from this restaurant, and it has quickly become one of my Lombard go-to's.
Great sandwiches and setting. We had the Vinnie and the Reuben.  Both were great.  The service is friendly with a family owned business vibe.  The rooftop deck is awesome.

I've seen this place a few times but I have never been inside. What a mistake! Easily rectified.

We were looking for a new place to try out for lunch and found this gem on Yelp.  After browsing through some reviews we decided to go there for lunch.  It's right by the Lombard train station in one of the dead end streets.  They have a huge seating area next to the ordering area.

The staff was friendly and was cracking jokes with all the customers. It made the atmosphere very friendly.  I couldn't choose between the corned beef and the pastrami, but the guy who was taking my order (I can't remember his name but he was a friendly guy) recommended the corned beef on rye.  It did not disappoint.  Got some chips to go along with the sandwich.  

They have burgers too, which I didn't expect.  My friend got one and he said it was delicious.

I'll definitely be back.

Overall, I think the quality, price, service, and indoor seating all work in unison to make me a fan.  This little shop is becoming my go-to destination in Lombard for a quick bite to eat..  

I've just been 4 times so far.  On the first visit I ordered a salad with steak and it was SO very good.  On the next visits I had a wrap sandwich with potato chips.  It was generous in size and very hearty and tasty.  On 2 subsequent visits I have had the cup of soup and half sandwich option.  

My personal opinion is that salt is often overused in restaurants but not at Shannon's. I have  actually found the soups and food in general to be a little unsalted, but not in a bad way.  I prefer to have to add a little sprinkle of salt.

I thought I had reviewed the deli, but realized I only wrote about the meat market, so here goes:

We have been going to the meat market since it opened, and were thrilled to death when they opened the deli.  Now that it's expanded it's even better!  

Honestly - It's fantastic. Amazingly tasty sandwiches and soups.  And the orzo salad is TOTALLY awesome - the best side you can get. Sandwiches are VERY  generous - you can easily split.  So happy to have Shannon's in Lombard!!  We go nearly every weekend.

Like I said, everything we have had has been amazing (other than the Hot Steak - personally not a fan), but completely recommend the tuna, The Ham, and The Smoked.  Split them - they are huge!!  And the soups are consistently good too.  Just a REALLY solid place for lunch.

A nice big deli with plenty of seating even on their roof now. The place has typical deli type sandwich eating and is overall clean and well staffed as it has to be as there are people in this place all of the time and if it is busy that tell you something about the quality of their meats and eats.

Wow Shannon Deli, you are great! I've been here many times, typically for the Italian Sandwich but the sides are awesome too and worth mentioning.
