Had their shrimp poor boy (Fri Special), wife had asparagus soup, AMAZING! New roof top is so cool, as well as owners and staff.  Looking for a quick, inexpensive, simple and delicious meal - Shannon's Deli

When we finally had a chance to try Shannon's we were hooked!  The sandwiches are all great and the sides are amazing.  Great little neighborhood deli and butcher shop!  I'm a big fan of the Italian sub, and my husband likes the steak sandwich.  We've loved everything we've tried here, and we've even started getting our friends hooked too.

My wife and I had our wedding rehearsal at Shannon's and could not have been more pleased with the service. The owners were very attentive to our party and everything went smoothly. All our guests commented on how great dinner was and that it was a great venue.

Thank you again!

I am in love with Shannon's deli.  Me and the girls at the office finally got to try them after hearing so many great things.  I have been there three times since.

Everything we have tried is delicious.

Deli chicken sandwich is amazing.   
Chopped salad is huge

All sandwiches come with chips or you can substitute a side item such as fruit or pasta salad.

If you are in the neighborhood,this is the perfect place to stop for lunch.  They even have outdoor seating.

I'm not a local of Lombard, but due to circumstance (calamity) I found myself with some time to kill pre metra boarding.  Near the the station there are a surprising number of places to choose from.  This may be downtown Lombard.  

Shannon's deli is a right across the the street from the 'to Chicago' side of the tracks and stretches for a number of storefronts.  The deli is about the third door down.

Inside you'll find deli cases filled with salads and meats.  Behind the counter pandemonium.  

The tall, middle aged gentleman running the cash register had to be the owner.  He was barking orders, spilling sht, and generally barely keeping it together.  At one point, he ran from behind the counter and started yelling some dudes' name (manuel?) over and over again.  Finally manuel showed up and he was told to do something urgently.

I ordered the meatball sandwich and a side salad which consisted of cucumbers, tomatoes, and cheese.  Both were really quite delicious.   

It was an amusing experience.  Too bad the owner didn't have an engish accent.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8FypR17bDbw

I had a seminar this weekend in Lombard.  I went ten minutes out of my way to hit Shannon's Deli due to the outstanding reviews.  Yelp makes traveling more bearable!

I arrived at 12:15 on a Saturday and was unable to get a spot on the street due to construction.  So I parked on the sidewalk behind a construction sign... Whatever!

I walked in and immediately realized just how small it was.  Maybe eight tables, many just two-tops.  It was75% full so I got in line not knowing if I would get a seat.  Ordering is a bit stressful as many of the popular sandwich places are, once it's your turn you know you have to be ready cuz there's ten people behind you.... Cursing each question you ask!

I ordered the Reuben (great reviews) and a cup of hearty beef soup.  After I paid I looked around and......YESSSSSS, one table left!.  Only problem (and probably the only reason it was open) was it was right next to the door!  BRRRRRRR!

So I waited a few seconds and a gentleman (later realized it was the owner) came from behind the counter carrying my soup.  I watched as he ran into another customer with the arm carrying my soup, my crackers fell to the floor, and he never broke stride.  He set my cracker less soup,that had spilled over the side of the cup filling the soup spoon full of brothy beef and soaking the napkin, in front of me without acknowledging a thing... Or replacing my crackers.   Not a great start.....
Soup was OK : B- (crackers might have been the missing ingredient....?)

Next came the Reuben.  Have to give credit where credit is due.... GOOD F-ING RUEBEN! A++. Really tasty corned beef, perfectly toasted rye bread, and 1,000 island dressing that could change your life!!

I spoke briefly with the owner who informed me that the were in the process of expanding into the adjacent space.  Good! They need it!!

I will eat here again and you should too!  Killer sandwich, and I'm sure once they expand the chances of a beef broth, cracker calamity will be minimal!  Looking forward to upgrading my stars next visit!

Our company has been recently been catering from this delicious place.  

I never had chicken pot pie, I now crave their pie. 

The cheese cake was better than the cheese cake factory . 


The best part is we love supporting local small business. 

4/1/16---went to try for dinner. The food was great .  I had the shrimp po boy.
Nice place

I don't get the hype here. 

I've probably had Shannon's 3 or 4 times in the past couple of years. Each time the food has been decent. It was solid don't get me wrong but nothing exactly has ever wowed me. More importantly the quality of food doesn't justify the cost. 

One thing that drives me nuts is that customer service here has been kind of terrible. I know they are busy and I don't expect them to especially cater to me but the frantic behavior by the lady behind the counter and her being so short with me, has turned me off this place.

This place is better than most chain sub places but the combination of the food, cost, and customer service certainly doesn't make this place worth it.

I had a couple of corned beef sandwiches and they were just ok. It's not a place where they pile on the corned beef like a Jewish (or similar) deli.  Lovely folks and a very nice place to eat indoors. I will be back to give this another shot. The sandwiches are a good price and come with a pickle slice and a side pasta or potato salad. The potato salad is 5 stars in my book. Next time I'm taking a pound or two home.
Shannon's has the best brownies ever! They are huge too!! Shannon is always here and getting to know her customers. The staff are are always friendly and the service is great!
Amazing! Just so yummy every time! Love homemade soups and just everything. Check out the chicken burgers and also the subs!

I came with high expectations after reading all of 20 reviews, each with 5-star rating.  It was getting late and their website said they close at 7pm.  Amazingly, they had a Facebook feed on their website where they recently posted that they were opening until 8p that night.  How tech savy!!  That piece of info got me into those doors that night.  After my dinner here, I am happy to add to their 5-star streak.

The deli is adorable and is tucked away in one of the alleys in downtown Lombard.  Street parking is free and was easy to find.  There is both seating inside and outside.  The lady working here, I believe her name is Theresa, made us feel more than welcome.  She is enthusiastic and genuinely cares for the business and her customers.  What a delight to be at a place where the people are happy!

Shrimp Po Boy w/side was on special for $7.  Since it was towards the end of the day, some of the sides were almost gone and she threw in an extra side for us.  How sweet!  The sandwich looked and tasted amazing!  

Cobb Salad - $8 - Big salad, fresh and delicious!  The bacon on top was perfectly cooked.

The sub and sandwiches on the menu ranges from $5 - $8.  Great atmosphere, great food, and great prices. I'd go out of my way to come eat here again!

I've been known to have some impulse control problems..  

Lisa had an appointment, so we arranged to meet at a forest preserve (on her way to work) for lunch and I would pick up the food at Shannon's. My first time there.

I know that Lisa would be happy with half a sandwich and chips or soup.... But she ends up with a foot long Club Sandwich, cup of Spicy Shrimp and Rice Soup AND a pasta salad (I'm figuring she can take the rest to work for dinner) and a Chocolate Chip Cookie*

I got the Meatball Sub and French Fries and a Chocolate Chip Cookie.... and then I bought Lasagna for my sister in law and I to have for dinner..

Lisa thought the Club was great, good combo/quantity of fixings and really good soft and chewy bread, the pasta salad was tasty and the soup (a new one for Shannon's) was really delicious (not real spicy!)

Of course I loved my Meatball Sub, same great bread, meatballs with a really great texture.. everything just messy enough, cheese melted properly and a really tasty red sauce. The fries were pretty standard, they cook them more to the well done side, which I liked.. hot and crispy.. but not great fries, just good. I had the cookie with my coffee a little later, it was there.. and then it wasn't... I'm thinking it was pretty darn good**

The Lasagna ($5.99) was delicious, baked it in the oven for about 25 minutes at 350, I wished that I had some red sauce to pour over it... I might ask about that next time (see about getting a side)

The lady at the counter couldn't have been more friendly. She has a great attitude and made the process fun. I was there after the lunch rush so there were only a few other people there. She seemed to know everyone and how they wanted their stuff. I half expected her to know my name, even though I'd never been there before...

* Impulse control problem? or good planning? Lisa took one look at all of the food and handed the cookie to me and said "Thanks, but I'll never be able to eat this too"

** Due to the "accidental" over-purchase of cookies, I can now attest that  they are quite good (heavy on the chocolate!) as I forced myself to slowly savor the second one
After moving away a year ago, Shannon's Deli wins for my favorite place for soup in Illinois! (Cream of Chicken with Roasted Red Peppers and Rice soup!)
Wanted a family owned soup and sandwich place for lunch and found this great gem!  Yummy lunch and the owner was so friendly!

This is a great little deli in downtown Lombard near the train station.  Paul and Jennifer do a great job in the area, have great service and have great food!  I would highly recommend them if your near the downtown Lombard area.

Picking up our kids from a sleepover at grandmas today, and a flyer from Shannon's Deli was on their door. We decided to check it out for lunch. Really happy with our meal!  The sandwiches are huge, you really only need a half. I always order buffalo chicken sandwiches, and the sandwich here was great. Plenty of sauce, heat, blue cheese on soft bread. The Shrimp Po Boy special was also great, as was the tortilla soup. The man behind the counter, who we assume is the owner, had the unique combination of surliness and humor. He stopped by our table a couple times to chat, which my dad ate up. He loves to chat with strangers. The owner let us know they are expanding into the space nextdoor soon, and will have more seating. We will definitely be back - want to try the Italian beef on that awesome
bread.

Pretty good stuff. Burgers are a little under seasoned for my liking. 

Large menu of American food

It makes me sad that people would rather settle for Jersey Mike's or Jimmy John's when they can enjoy an authentic deli sandwich from a local business at the same price. 

Shannon's is my go to because I have yet to be disappointed from anything I've ever ordered there. They make two soups daily, but make sure to get there early because they sell out because they're just that good. The Chicken Salad on a croissant is fabulous and the Corned Beef sandwich is the best I've had in the suburbs. Even their desserts like their brownies and bread pudding are great.

The owner Paul is very hospitable and you can tell he takes a lot of pride in their business. They're expanding more seating soon, so fill up the seats!
The PERFECT spot to order for lunch.... Always a little crowded in-house, but SO good!!

They have daily specials that are always changing,so you will have to check online. Shrimp Po-boy , Cubano , Rib eye steak sandwich, half pound burger for two . call ahead because they do run out . Same goes for soups . Everyday menu is Boars head meats . Try "The Smoked". I had the fish fry dinner and the 6 pieces of McNugget sized fish were tasty but not enough food for a man . Salads , deserts , key lime pie , Cheesecake, Cannoli , everything is fresh and Reasonably priced. A affiliated butcher shop next door . Pick up some knuckle bones for your dog .

whoever makes the soup here should get a raise! not a promotion, keep making soup!! but definately a raise!!

cilantro chicken soup = awesome
cream of anything = awesome
sipcy mushroom = awesome

also, ruebens are to die for! 

love this place!!

In Lombard for the day and decided to try Shannon's Deli. What a great place for a weekday lunch. 

I had the Reuben, fries and a lemon bar. The sammich and fries were almost perfect. Bread was awesome, toasted perfect. Everything was in perfect proportion. The fries were perfectly done- crispy, golden, hot, perfectly salted. Yep! That good! The owner was friendly and the outdoor seating was comfortable and relaxing. There was construction going on nearby but nothing that Shannon's Deli could have done to fix that.

The only negative I could give Shannon's was the average lemon bar. I might have high standards there, since I grew up eating the best lemon bars ever. 

Definitely stop by Shannon's for a sammich and a relaxing lunch. Put the phone down, enjoy the happy patrons around you, and relax a little.
Great service, even better food. Big sandwich guy and this is a solid spot. First time going there today, and I will definitely be back.

Love this place!  Really great, fresh sandwiches and tasty sides.  We live right in the area and like to take a walk downtown Lombard to grab lunch.  Staff is always friendly too.  

The portions are rather large - I usually save the other half of my sandwich for later.

Wow, I knew this place was here but I had no idea it was so popular!

I met up with a friend on a gloriously warm Saturday and she suggested we come to Shannon's before hitting up Dairy Queen. Great idea!

It was busy, busy, busy, but we got our order in pretty quickly and managed to snag a table. The menu is on the wall but they also have printed versions you can grab at the register.

I ordered the veggie sandwich, and honestly, I should have gotten a half. It was two big halves, with awesome bread, cheese, lettuce, tomato, roasted red pepper and a pesto mayo. Kind of sloppy to eat but very tasty. I got chips on the side (and took them home) but you can also select fries (fairly basic frozen variety, but tasty) or one of their salads. Everything looked really good. They have a big variety of subs, hot sandwiches, hot dogs, burgers, chicken, wraps, soup, salads, etc. They ALSO have beer and wine, including local nanobrewery Flesk, which is awesome.

It did take a little while for our sandwiches to come out, but considering how busy it was -- and how many takeout orders there were -- it was unsurprising. Definitely call ahead if you're in a hurry and just want to pick something up.

The food was very good, and you better believe next time I need some lunch downtown I'm coming here -- please ignore that spot across the street.

Great little deli and butcher shop in downtown Lombard that we happened upon while out riding today with the family.  Great variety, fresh ingredients and superb service!  Couldn't ask for anything more.  There isn't much of a reason to come to downtown Lombard but Shannon's makes it worthwhile!

Amongst the four of us we had a chicken salad sandwich, Italian sub (the Vinny), a meatball sub and of course a hot dog for the little guy!  Everything was perfectly done right down to the hearty multi-grain bread for my chicken salad sandwich.  They even have ice cream for desert on a hot summer day.  It isn't fancy but they sure know how to do what they do really well!

Can't wait to go back!

I've lived in Lombard for almost two years and finally tried Shannon's Deli, which is about 1 minute driving distance from my house. Oh how I wish I discovered it sooner! 

I ordered the turkey sandwich with a side of fruit. The fruit was the tastiest I've had in a long time, I've been craving it ever since. The sandwich was also really good, basic, but good. My brother got the pulled pork sandwich and said it was the best pulled pork he's ever had, which is saying a lot. 
I'll definitely be back to try more things off the menu, everything sounds delicious. 

Customer service is so-so. Workers seem a little stressed but did make us feel welcome once we sat down to eat. Thought about hacking a star off for the service but I loved the food so 5 stars it is.

Chicken fajita wrap is to die for!
Have now lived in lombard for a year and can't resist this place!  They are also very nice people suggest going here to everyone!

I love this place, not only are their sandwiches and soups the best but the staff is always polite and friendly. I go there at least twice a week and not once have I been disappointed with the service or quality of the food

Great sandwiches, reasonable prices, and hearty portions.  I love that they carry boar's head meat, so you know it's good quality.  I had a build-your-own sandwich with turkey, munster, cucumber, mustard, and oil and vinegar on focaccia. Delicious!

Friendly employees and equally awesome food. I usually go for whatever the special is which includes a large portion of a side of your choice. The food is always fresh and have never had anything here I didn't like. Great spot for a lunch time sandwich.

All I have to say is the Hot Ruben Sandwich and the Turkey Burgers are my favorites. I have never been disappointed with anything I've ordered from them. 

Great place for kids and/or lunch with girlfriend(s).When ever my customers ask about a great place to eat in Lombard, Shannon's is the first  place I recommend to all my customer especially those that are not from our area. It's the perfect place to grab a bite and/or pick up something on the go. However, if you are in a hurry - depending on time and day, I recommend you to phone your order in. 

Teresa and her staff are fun friendly people. You won't be disappointed.

I came with a large group based on 5 star Yelp! reviews and dog friendly status.  The service was excellent and maybe a bit overwhelmed by our large group.  I had the Reuben sandwich which was delicious and I like that you can order 1/2 sandwiches.  I think most of our group had lukewarm comments about our other food which included multiple different sandwiches (including Italian beef, the Vinnie (an Italian sub), corned beef, tuna salad) and the steak salad.

The dog friendly status refers to the outside seating which consists of three tables on the sidewalk which is really quiet (U N L E S S  T H E R E  I S  A  T R A I N  G O I N G  B Y ! ! ! !)

My go-to sandwich place for the past 10 years used to be "so fast you'll freak". I found the Shannon's Butcher Shop through Yelp and tried the deli on a whim as my fiance and I have one of those "freaky-fast" places a few blocks away.

I skipped my normal BLT and I ordered the Veggie Sub. All of the subs come with a bag of chips which you can upgrade (tiny charge included). The sandwich was awesome. The bread and the ingredients were fresh. I usually don't order an all veggie sub but I'm glad I did. 

I've been back there twice more and Shannon's has now become my go-to sandwich place in Lombard. 

The prices are great, you get a full meal for what you pay for. If you aren't a huge eater, you can order a half sandwich. I do this as the subs and sandwiches are big enough where I cannot eat a full one. 

The staff is very friendly and the deli has always been clean.

If you're looking for a sandwich place in the Lombard area I highly suggest stopping in and trying Shannon's out.

Hands down best sandwich in my life. It's one of those things where you feel like a sandwich is a sandwich and the difference between a good sandwich and an ok sandwich isn't much. This is that difference, quality everything and not a "pumped out" generic sandwich. 

Recommendation: pastrami and Swiss

Very good. Quite affordable pricing. EXCELLENT bread.

Had a doc appointment around the corner, stopped to grab lunch to-go here first.

Got a custom sandwich on the French bread (sub roll) and was pretty happy with it - beef, turkey, bacon, Swiss, Provolone, lettuce, tomato, cucumbers, mayo. Would ask for heavier mayo the next time. And maybe some mustard.

Had some of their tomato-cucumber-mozz salad. Pretty good, but nothing to write home about.

Wow - this is some of the best customer service I've seen in a long time!

Shannon's Deli cute "little" shop that can probably hold quite a bit of traffic and even has a few tables for outdoor seating.  There is a public fridge with pasta, cheese, ribs, and other items for purchase along with a rack full of some jams / honey etc.  The real reason I came in was for the food.

The SO ordered a cobb salad and I ordered the special for the day - a shrimp po' boy.  It was a little confusing as all of the other sandwiches are served / priced as a foot long with a 6 inch option and this was the opposite without mention on the board, but the price was still reasonable and this was not really a bother.  The cashier did mention it when I started to place our order.  I ordered red potato salad for my side.  The cashier noted there wasn't much left since it was the end of the day (even though it filled a side container), so she offered a second side for free!  The sides were great, the po' boy was very tasty (though a bit messy).  I tried a few bites of my SO's salad which was good as well.  Portions were plenty and the food just tasted all around good.  The cookies on the counter looked fantastic too, but I knew I'd be full.  I'll have to stop in for one or bring one home next time.

The cashier checked on us repeatedly, asked how we liked the food, and was very helpful the whole time.  When she was on the phone she was offering to bring food to the bar across the street and some other people had called in orders.  This is the kind of customer service that you can't pay for with money - you've gotta pay for by coming back again (and again, and again).  We definitely will, and we'll be just as happy and full when we do!

On a side note - They own the butcher shop next door and Shannon's Irish pub in Glen Ellyn... so their experience must help.  I'll have to give them all a try!
Had lunch there today what a great place. I ordered the black and blue salad and it was fantastic. just a good place to eat at very reasonable prices. The soup was good also

Hands down my favorite deli. Everything I've had here has been great. I am especially fond of the soups and rotating specials, but often stick with the turkey sandwich. They use high quality meat, but I think what really makes the sandwiches shine is the bread.

Go support this small business.
Was here with my dad today.  I had a buffalo chicken sandwich and he had a meatball sandwich.  I loved my food and my dad was fond of his as well.  Sandwich bread was fresh and tasty.
They also have a soda fountain - so refill your drink to your content.
Top notch customer service on top of it.  Wish I lived in the area so I could go here more often.  I will definitely be back next time I am in the area.
Unique and delicious soups and sandwiches plus desserts baked by angels and sent down from heaven makes Shannon's a local favorite for me.

This place is great! Fresh baked bread and hand cut fresh cold cuts. The owner and staff are very friendly! I asked for suggestions and the owner gave me four of their more popular items. I could not pass up the bread pudding. Looks absolutely amazing- and my favorite desert. I am traveling but hope to return here soon if not even tomorrow :)

I've only been here once and discovered that it's not the place for Italian Beef.  No sweet peppers available, the gravy was too salty and otherwise didn't have much taste, and the roll was very doughy.  I expected that the beef would be superior from a deli that charges $7.95 for the sandwich but it was just mediocre (to be fair, the $7.95 includes chips - fries are a dollar extra).  They automatically put cheese on the sandwich - in my opinion it should be available for an extra charge but not automatic since a traditional Chicago Italian Beef lover doesn't want it.  The fries were just OK, originally frozen like fries at most places.  The corn chowder soup (which I was overcharged for since the menu says it's $2.00 with a sandwich rather than the usual price of $2.69) was good.

Best deli around! My boyfriend and I both love this place! The food is delicious and the service is excellent. The employees are so friendly and actually make an effort to get to know and remember you. 

I love the variety of menu options and daily specials. I'm a huge fan of the turkey pot pie and hanger burger. The parking and seating is limited and it can get packed in there pretty quickly, but honestly the quality of the food is worth it.

They also own the butcher shop two doors down that is just as fantastic. I stopped shopping for dinner meat and deli food at the grocery store and have been exclusive to Shannon's for the past several months.

Whenever I have friends or relatives come in from out of town, I make it a point to take them here to get the full experience! I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone!
Great little find in downtown Lombard. The owners are always in there and know everything about the little downtown area. Not a fan of the fries but the pasta salads are amazing!
Best Reuben. Best service. Really good desserts too! Cute little location and the owner even chatted us up about their developing their neighboring space.
Great service, always smiles and good food! I Love their soups! THey are really in touch with their customers and the community!

Excellent sandwiches, I have a new favorite every couple of months (currently it's the the "Smoke").  The soups are what I always imagined the Soup Nazi sold on Seinfeld, except with polite and excellent service.  I've probably tried a couple dozen over the last year and very few have disappointed.  Can't recommenced this place enough.

The sandwiches are great, and not too expensive. The sides are good, too.

Teresa is super friendly, and the service is great. If I could improve one thing it would be to have a larger selection of chips or sides.

I heard about this place today when my son's grade school had a Walk-A-Thon for their PTA. They donated 20% of everyone's bill for all that came out for lunch from 12-3 after the Walk. I think that is Awesome of this business to do for these young children's grade school's in Lombard! Not only that but the food is fantastic & customer service was wonderful also! Their portions are really big also! I will definitely be back & be telling everyone about this place! I grew up in the restaurant business & worked in it my whole life and this place definitely deserves the 5 Stars all around! You won't be disappointed at all.

What is there not good to say about Shannon's Deli?  I don't go there as often as I used to only because I was putting on too much weight - it's that good!  Everything we've had on the menu is simply delicious.  Sandwiches are always plentiful, soups are rich and tasty and the Boars Head brand deli meat is second to none!  My two favorites are the Hot Steak Supreme sandwich (grilled hanger steak, onions, tomatoes & jalapenos with cheese & sour cream on a soft roll) and there new semi-regular special, the Po' Boy sandwich (fried shrimp, tomatoes, cole slaw and some sort of amazing spicy spread).
If you're in Lombard, trust me, it's worth stopping by.  While you're there, be sure to check out Shannon's Deli a couple of doors down and check out the Hanger Steaks.  It's the best (and ugliest) cut of meat you've ever had and never heard of!

Excellent food with great service. The parking is ample and the shop is adorable. There are tables both inside and outside and it wasn't packed when I wandered in for lunch. The deli case is filled with delicious pasta and potato salads. The menu also boasts both subs and sandwiches, along with burgers and fajitas. I opted for a build-your-own sandwich with the feta orzo pasta salad. The pasta salad was awesome, but I think I accidentally got gluten free bread. Oh well, can't win it all. Everything was fresh and fast, all for less than $10. I'll be back.

This was my first time here and I wish it had been a mainstay, as it's going to be now, or at least whenever I'm in Lombard! It simply does the town proud. Everything from the taste to the price to the quality is fantastic. I'm impressed!! Wish this place had a locale near work and home. Thankfully, my parents live close by. I want to try almost everything on the menu, especially after looking at what everyone else was enjoying. While we didn't order traditional deli food - my friend ordered the Italian beef which was awesome. I had the best turkey burger (fresh, lots of vege's, cranberry sauce) with a side of fantastic pasta salad. For around 17 bucks, iced tea and coke included, it's a steal - especially considering similar places selling the same items for double.  The next time, it's for deli food. The deli sandwiches looked amazing, as did the salads. I'll often go next door to stock up on top grade meats, of which are used at the deli. Just fabulous! I can't wait to go back.

Perfect little spot, not far from the Great Western Prairie Trail, to pick up a sandwich for a quick picnic!  A few tables and chairs are outside for dining, but other than that, not much seating there inside the deli.  Looks like they also do some catering that I would definitely entertain for a casual party!
This place is amazing! It's a little hidden, but everyone is really nice and service is top notch! Everything is served fresh!

I have not had a sandwich I didn't relish yet!  The service is prompt and with a smile.
The breads are always fresh and they use Boars Head meats and cheeses which is a definite plus.  This is by far the best place to eat in downtown Lombard.
first time at the deli today. i had the shrimp po'boy special, with a side of potato salad. the portions are huge, and everything was delicious. how did i not know this little gem was there?

I've only had a sub and some sides but I can see what everyone is taking about!  Best sandwiches around.  The subs are similar to the old Fontanos in Elmhurst.  The interior isn't anything amazing but the food speaks for itself.  This place is a MUST TRY for anyone and everyone who works there is overwhelmingly nice.  New favorite place.

Decent sandwiches. I had the club, which was a huge sandwich! I could only eat half. But it was good, and did not skimp on any ingredients. I also heard good things about the reuben, salads, and other cold subs. Overall, I think this is a pretty good place to grab a sandwich. Good quality meats and cheeses and friendly service.

Great sandiwiches, soup, potato salad, cookies and employees.  This place has it all.  I'm never disappointed when I pick up lunch at Shannon's.  Such a needed and fabulous addition to this area!

Thank you Shannons for consistent and outstanding quality!

Downtown Lombard's starting to get it going on! Is it possible?

On the one-block strip of Park Avenue that's between St. Charles Road and the Lombard train station, Shannon's Deli sits two doors down from Shannon's Butcher Shoppe. It took a while for the deli to open, and despite the quiet opening, it seems to be taking off. This will be the first of many good reviews, I'm sure.

Shannon's Deli is still in the process of developing their total offering. Several chalkboards on the wall display entrees (without prices) that are not on the orange flier of a menu. A glass-lined case holds desserts of different prices and (perhaps) values, but I've yet to offer the stomach space for such sweets.

When I see a new local eatery, my first couple of visits help me decide what's good to eat and what's to avoid. But there's a problem with that strategy here. I've visited the deli four times, and I can't remember having anything that wasn't worth getting again. 

Today's visit with my wife was exceptional. We decided to split two sandwiches: pastrami sandwich and albacore tuna. Writing them together sounds gross, but we eat all of one sandwich before starting the other, because mixing them one bite at a time would not be very pleasant. Especially if you decide to down a bag of tasty jalapeno chips while waiting for entree.

My biggest, and possibly only, complaint is the cozy confines. You'll feel a chill when the door opens on a cold day. There are not many tables available, and if people are waiting in line to take their orders and go, it can feel a little claustrophobic. I'm thinking of Yogi Berra's line about no one going to a certain restaurant because it's too crowded. 

We waited several minutes after the friendly and energetic Theresa took our orders for food to start arriving. My wife's turkey and rice soup came first, and she told me to take my spoonful immediately, for it would soon be gone. It was excellent. Tasty but not salty, hearty but not overly so. 

The pastrami on rye with spicy mustard was exactly what I wanted, with tender slices of pastrami of a good thickness. Served warm, it was as if my teeth wanted to keep nestled inside the sandwich. But it wasn't the better sandwich. I give that nod to the albacore tuna. I've been wanting to get the tuna for a while, but was once talked out of it by Theresa in favor of the taco special. (Oh yeah, watch for the special. It's often the unexpected.) The albacore didn't disappoint. The hearty but soft bread melded with the tuna, lettuce and tomato in an appealing manner. The right amount of red onion was mixed with with the salad, giving it a good flavor without a bad effect on the noses nearby. My wife might disagree with me on the better sandwich - she used the word "incredible" to describe at least one of them - but why debate it? They both rock.

All of the Shannon's locations push their (burgundy pepper) hangar, a part of cow I've never seen mentioned anywhere else. You can try it at the deli in a steak sandwich. I've had the hangar from the butcher and didn't think it lived up to the hype, but I liked the steak sandwich from the deli on a prior visit, so what do I know?

Is Shannon's Deli the type of eatery that most hip downtowns have? Probably. Did downtown Lombard need it? Definitely. Once the rooftop is renovated into an outdoor patio (something that won't happen for a while, or so I've been told) and I can enjoy a beer and a sammich while viewing the evolution of my downtown, I'll be a regular. As it stands, they know me by name and that's enough to keep me from becoming a stranger. 

I've noticed that the Corner House carries some of their sandwiches in the grab-and-go case, and the Vino Cellar is considering carrying some of their cheeses to pair with glasses of wine. If other hip businesses are getting busy with the deli, why shouldn't you? Shannon's Deli deserves your patronage.

Shannon's is the best deli you will find in Lombard. I cater from Shannon's at least once a month for business events and it's always perfect. The sandwiches are amazing  and their potato salad always gets race reviews. The owners are great people to work with who always know what I want and always willing to help. Don't miss this downtown gem!!

Their sandwiches are so yummy!  Very fairly priced for the great quality meats and cheeses.  Downtown Lombard has cruise nights on Saturday evening during the summer.  It's great to grab a sandwich from Shannon's, go to Punky's across the way and grab a beer and sit outside to enjoy it!  There is usually a band playing right there, too.

I LOVE, LOVE LOVE, Shannon's Deli. Theresa is amazing and helpful. They are always busy and the sandwich specials are delicious. We always end up taking food home when we get the full orders. Over Valentine's Day they had a fantastic "dinner at home" special which came with two filets (it was incredibly tender and buttery almost), two twice baked potatoes, and four stuffed mushrooms...we added some asparagus to our meal and were absolutely stuffed. Shannon's also has a kid's menu which has the typical tenders/burgers on it, my 3 year old eats everything every time! They always have soups which has been great during this extremely cold winter... I can't wait until it is warmer out and will be able to walk over there for lunch. If you're looking to support a small business, this is definitely the place to go. I've sent many a patron over their way and everyone always talks about how happy they were with their experiences. They also have a section of locally made marinades and other items for purchase, I love that they work to support other local businesses. Keep it up!

Shannon's is a lovely deli in downtown Lombard. Sandwiches are delicious. I am a big fan of the Smoked. Large sandwich with a perfect blend of sauce and meets. 

Highly recommend Shannon's. Always a warm and welcoming place to get lunch.

sandwiches are great and the workers are awesome, I love the fact that she remembers me every time I go in there by name, which is maybe once every few months! I am  horrible with names myself so i love that she pays that extra special attention to detail makes all the difference in my eyes

Great place to quickly grab a bite. Recently tried the soup and it was great! Service is good too, always someone checking in to see if you have been helped. My recommendations are the bread pudding and twice baked potatoes. Stay clear of the Italian sandwich though, a little to much dressing on the sandwich for my tastes, as all the deli meat there is excellent.

Shannon's is within walking distance of my office, which is the best thing about working in Lombard.  Their daily specials are great when you are trying to be budget-conscious, but I typically order either the corned beef or pastrami warm , and have never been disappointed.  The service is also quick and professional, which makes this place my go-to deli.

I love this place, it reminds me of a deli you would expect to find in a neighborhood in the city, the sandwiches are really big, and the staff is very friendly.  Its a great addition to downtown Lombard!
A proper place to get amazing sandwiches and food. Everything is good, try the specials!

I really enjoyed my sandwich.  Nice little place, nice people.  The sandwich, as a portion, was generous and  much better in taste and quality than what you find at a chain shop.  I bought a container of noodle salad to go...gonna bring it to a party tomorrow...might try and pass it off as my own secret recipe :-)

Their prices are not to bad for the food you get! Love their chicken salad, and other sandwiches.  I visit here once to twice a week to grab food before heading to work. Once I call; Theresea always knows what I want before i even tell her. The chopper chicken salad, love the salad and the dressing, I look forward to it every Tuesday! Amazing place to stop in an grab a bite!
Great food, a bit pricey for 2 people, but I support small business. This place is great all around, great customer service; you won't be disappointed.

Shannon's is the absolute best. Fresh meats, fresh bread, great customer service where the owners learn your name and say hi every time you walk in. I would highly recommend any of the hot sandwiches or salads as they get all their meats fresh from their own butcher shop. LOVE the Italian beef! They also always give a hot dog to my pup when we walk by so you can't beat that!

Fresh quality exceptional food.  Love it all but try the chicken salad, chicken burgers for something different,  and the fish fry when offered.  Good soups. Catering is excellent and they take care of you with service.  Butcher shop two doors down is also theirs and you can buy some items there too.
Always impressed with Shannon's deli! It's a great neighborhood place and everything on the menu is outstanding. Be sure to try their soups..amazing!

We moved to Lombard in September 2013 and we were in search of something a little closer to home rather than run all the way to Roosevelt road when we discovered Shannons.  This place is great, have not had a bad thing to eat there yet. I probably go there twice a week.  Hidden gem!

Fantastic! Definitely best deli around town.  My boyfriend and I both love this place! Everything we've tried off the menu has been delicious and the service is great.  The employees are so nice and knowledgable.  I love the different specials each day and the special occasion specials they run for holidays.  Their potato salad is by far the best potato salad I've ever had. Their butcher shop, 2 doors down, is also fantastic. Amazing food and service, what more could you ask for?!?

I love this place. Food is all fresh made, and delicious. Soups are out of this world.  You can call and order ahead if you are in a hurry. We have also had them cater for a meeting and everything was great.
This place is fantastic. The food is as good as it is affordable, and the staff of this locally-owned shop goes out of their way to make sure everyone feels welcome.

Date of my visit: 5-August-2016
Time of my visit: around lunch time

This was my first visit at this establishment.  It's not very big for sit ins lunches/dinners, but that's okay, most of places like that are intended to be that.  I came to the counter and the female owner took my order, she was extremely nice and upon me mentioning that it was my first time, she made a few recommendations.

I settled on half slab of ribs.  The wait was not long and the owner kept refilling my water promptly.  The ribs and fries came out fresh and hot!  The fries were well seasoned and surprisingly good (I usually don't care for the fries, fries are fries and my expectations are always low).

Now to the ribs, the ribs were awesome!  Top 2 in my book!  The right amount of bbq, the firmness of the ribs (not too firm to where it's hard to bite in or chew on, just a right amount of firmness).  I would say they were pretty delicious!

I should not have gotten a desert.  Overall a solid A!

It is amazing as to how difficult it is to find a good pizza place in the far western suburbs. I was hoping Capones would be different based on the reviews.
Not so. Their business is located in a small strip mall near Stratford Square Mall. Nice small cozy take out joint with a couple of tables, for those waiting for their food I imagine.

I had ordered a large thin crust pizza with sausage and ricotta along with a meatball sandwich late on a Saturday afternoon.

The order was hot and ready when I arrived. The people behind the counter were friendly. My disappointed only started when I came home and opened up the box.  I could tell by the edges of the crust that the pizza had been overcooked. Most of the outer crust had started to blacken.  The underside of the crust was dark brown dry and tough. I didn't mind that the top of the pizza was well done but that taste of crunchy burnt crust really doesn't go down well.

Crispy pizza...good. Crunchy dry burnt pizza...bad.

The meatball sandwich was average at best although I must say I am spoiled by family recipes.

Had this pizza been taken out five minutes or so earlier I may have been writing a better review. Given that this semi-burnt pizza was boxed up and given to a customer tells me that the business may not give top priority to the quality of their food.

The pizza wasn't bad, but not as good as I expected based on other reviews. I only ordered once and will probably try them again at some point, but it's not one of my favorites in town.

My wife did enjoy getting a gluten-free pasta though. If they could offer a gluten-free pizza that would probably win us over some.
One of my new go to pizza spots in Bloomingdale!!  Absolutely love their pizza, but their entire menu is fantastic.  Some of the best fried calamari I've ever had.  An easy 5 stars!!
Ordered sausage pizza.  Cheese was good. Sauce was good.  Sausage was good. Crust was tough and pretty much ruined the pizza.

The food here is delicious. Outstanding service, huge portions, and reasonable prices. 

The last time my family was there we ordered a lot of food. We were moving this day and hadn't eaten so we treated ourselves. We started with an order of the fried ravioli. They were freshly made and served with the homemade marinara sauce. The inside was still gooey, while the outside had a good crunch. We were served warm bread with an olive oil and basil dipping sauce.

We then ordered a Caesar salad to split. it looked like too much dressing, but ended up being amazing and full of flavor. Their dressing is homemade and you can taste he difference.

My sister ordered a small deep dish pepperoni pizza. The crust is by far the best part. Lots of cheese throughout the pizza. My dad ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs were amazing with a rich flavor. My mom ordered the eggplant parmesan, the same thing she always gets. She loved her dish. I ordered the angel pasta with vodka sauce and a side of Italian sausage. My food was probably the worst and yet still amazing and full of flavor.

We each left with a to-go container and enough food for two meals each. Overall this restaurant is amazing and the workers truly want you to have a good family experience.

What an amazing place!!! Called in to take a pizza to a work party and was so happy I did. The woman on the phone was also the one that made the pizza she told me when I got there. The toppings tasted so fresh, the service was impeccable, the pizza perfectly cooked, and price was spot on. I will certainly be back in the future as this was one of my favorite pizzas in quite some time.

Had a friend from work order here against my recommendation..

He also was very disappointed.  His pizza tasted bland and just unappetizing..  I guess its hit or miss.   Sounds like its a BIG miss.  You are bettere  off going somewhere else in area.

We felt like we were having dinner with Dawn and her family. Such a delightful experience. And the food!!! This stuffed artichoke was an adventure. Fun to eat and delicious. We shared a family-style salad. Full of tomatoes, olives, homemade croutons. Perfectly dressed. 

My husband had the chicken parm and I had  the eggplant parm. So good. Crispy breaking full of flavor. And the sauce-oh my! Fresh tomatoes with great texture and flavor. 

Almost forgot the bread and dipping oil. That was a heavenly experience. Seriously, hoping to enjoy that in eternity! 

Uncle Tony does the cooking and shared his meal with us. A yummy pasta pomodoro. What a treat! 

We will definitely come back!
Great food and even better people!  The eggplant parmesan was fantastic and the portion size was easily enough for two.

I was really excited to try this place out for the pizza per all the great reviews; but the pizza was okay. Ordered a large pepperoni, onion, and green pepper thin crust pizza. The green peppers were cut too large and tasted too green like not ripe enough or under cooked. The crust was maybe the best part of the pizza but it wasn't thin enough.  We also ordered the fried zucchini and that was also okay. The zucchini was very watery. I will try again someday for the other recommended items but don't think I'll be ordering the pizza again.

I've been a fan of this place since it was on the other side of Bloomingdale.  Have ordered pizza and picked up for lunch and it's on point.   Might be my new go to for pizza very soon.   Nice family owned place and great location for me.   I will eat more items to update the review.

Wow what a great find! Had the calamari and some fettuccine Alfredo. Fantastic! Very friendly staff, fast service and clean place. Was in town on business and found them on Yelp. I'll definitely be back!

Haven't had their food in years.  Although just a little expensive, it was fantastic!  Very happy I found them again. Delicious, friendly and efficient. The pizza box felt like it had weights in it... Meaning that even though it was a thin crust, it was very filling. And my family was very pleased.  Looking forward to trying her other stuff.
Excellent service and reasonably quick delivery considering that I ordered during rush hour.  The pasta was excellent.   I will definitely be ordering from here again when I'm in the area.

OMG
This place is amazing. The food is great and made fresh.  So much food to chose from.  Only 5 tables in the place which made it even better. Owners and staff is outstanding.
An awesome meal.   Meatball sandwich was perfect.  Finished off with gelato that was creamy and refreshing on a hot Chicago day.

Great food.  Cannoli was wonderful as well. We did a pick up and the previous order accidentally took part of our order.  We discovered it after we return to our room.  We called and they delivered it to us within 10 minutes with some extras to make up for it.  Couldn't ask for better service.

After coming back for the second night in a row, I could not be more convinced that this is a 5 star restaurant. The people, the food, the atmosphere, and price are right on point.  A real authentic gem with huge portions. Feels like you are sitting down with an Italian family for a home cooked meal. The people working here obviously love this place, and what they are doing. My favorite dish of the two nights was the gnocchi with vodka sauce and a side of sautÃ©ed broccoli.  - 10 stars
An hour and 10 minutes to get wings and 2 meatballs delivered and didn't get the ranch I asked for. Now I have ranch with no dipping 70 minutes after I ordered.

House salad fresh and big enough for two.  The best eggplant parm over pasta that I have ever had.  Good amount of homemade sauce with a layer of mozzarella over top.  If you like eggplant, I recommend it.  Portion was too big, but I ate it all.

Great pizza, the best in the Dupage area.

Try the tiramisu and the ribs, both delicious!
After living in Roselle for over 3 years and trying all the places within a 15 minute drive, this is one of my new favorite local 'regular' pizzerias.

I give this place a 2 and a 1/2 stars

I had full slab of ribs with fries and "coleslaw"

The fries were pretty mushy and soft, definatly made from frozen, no salt added, very plain

The coleslaw, if i can even call it that was like a genric one you get from any grocey store not very flavorful. What was worse is that the portion size was about 2 fork fulls litterally. It came in a sauce container that you would use for like a side of ketchup or relish.

Lastly the ribs which is the only thing saving this place from a 1 star. It was juicy and fall off the bone, but lacked the flavor on the meat. They depended more on the sauce, it was very lightly added on and there was a container of it on the side too. The sauce was pretty good but was more vinagar than i would like to taste. ( i am not a big fan of vinagar is all)

Overall not a place i would go back to eat at, also this meal was $22

This place is amazing! The people are so friendly and the food is amazing! We ordered a medium pizza and a pasta but it was so filling and satisfying, even though we came in one hour before closing time they didn't rush us at all! The atmosphere was great and this place is relatively clean, I cannot recommend this enough. We will definitely come back for more!
Loved the food here! Best ribs ever. The small environment is so nice. Makes you feel like family.

I had the pleasure of trying out some of the food prior to the official opening and was blown away - simple but authentic! The Sandwiches are fantastic - THE PIZZA "Forget about it" that means good in Italian! You might get lucky and meet Dominic Capone the proprietor a real live descendant of the one and only AL Capone! During your visit add this to your bucket list!
I really like the pizza but for me that was just an appetizer the real winner were the ribs. I'm a rib guy and  this is definitely in my top 3 places to get ribs at now.
Amazing pizza so fresh the sausage is delicious with pepperoni and the ribs are so soft and great taste!

Had food delivered to a local resort we are staying at. Food came in a timely manner and was still nice and hot. Very disappointed though that no plastic ware, napkins, little salt packets, parmesan or hot pepper flakes came with our meal especially since part of our order was pasta which, obviously, needs to be eaten with a fork. Ended up having to run around to the restaurants in the hotel asking for utensils, napkins and salt. Having said that, the food was good just wish they had taken into consideration that when delivering an order to a hotel that their customer will most likely need these little extras.
Awesome pizza best I ever had! The ribs and chicken parm are also the best I have had hands down. I travel all over the United States quite often and this place is one of a kind! The best!

I just tried the Ribs at Capone's and let me tell you I never had Better Ribs in my life. I also ordered the chicken franchise  and it was fantastic . I had them delivered because when I drove by they only had a few tables and they where all filled up with people. I'm truly happy to have a new place like this in town. The next thing I'll try is going to be the stuffed Pizza. Thanks again Capone's for opening up near my home. : )

First time eating here and we couldn't be happier! Absolutely delicious- the meatballs we agreed were the best we've both ever had! Giant portions- hot, delicious, many menu choices- I can't wait to go back and try more- and we didn't even try the pizza, their specialty! So lucky they are in our neighborhood! We are about to become regulars.

This is more of a 2.75 star. First of all place doesn't have a lit up neon outside, you can miss it, I get it, must be Al Capone hide out like theme. It honestly looks OK inside, service was decent and I've got a cheese pizza on a thin crust to go Got home and I want to taste it right away,  I thought that somehow I've lost my taste buds from the time I've gone out and came back so I've tried something else, seems to be fine, back to pizza, it's plain, absolutely flavorless, I check out the crust, it's not what I've envisioned when placing an order for thin one, it's thicker then sauce and cheese on the pizza. I really was hoping for more, what I've got was some flavorless cheese on top of the most bland sauce I've seen come out of a kitchen proclaiming to be Italian, all of that smeared on crust I find acceptable for panini and not pizza, not a fan at all.
Had the ribs delivered and was not disappointed. The woman who took my order was great and assured me I would order again. Looking forward to trying other menu items.
I really enjoyed their pizza. The ribs however are a little overrated. Bon the less a decent joint with good customer service. Fed recommend it!
Wish this place didn't leave Lombard. Excellent pizza for a great value. Highly recommended.

We were staying in a hotel near here  for a night out of the city and decided to stop for some take-away food to bring back to our room.  My husband got the Muscles in the Arrabiata Sauce as an appetizer and just loved them. He also loved his spaghetti and meatballs that night and  for a few days after, the portions were huge so there were definitely left overs.  I had the Chicken Marsala which was delicious one of the best I have had. Although I was very sad because I left the remainder of my meal in the hotel refrigerator and forgot to bring it home, what a disappointment :( 

The service was wonderful as well, I had quite a few bags so they helped me to my car.  The only reason I cannot give them 5 stars is because I got back to the hotel after smelling the delicious food ready to eat it and there was no cutlery in the bag.  We had a hard time scavenging for some utensils and it was just torture smelling the food and not being able to eat it when we were starving :)
Liked the lasagna and chicken parmesan. Wasn't fond of the meatballs. Also liked their antipasta salad
I went there and Dominic was sexy! He sat and poured my frosty beverage while we had a great discussion! Incredible experience! Like being in Italy !

OMG! First time here and I LOVE IT! The food is great and the service and family atmosphere is so good. Very friendly restaurant! Calamari and Cheese Pizza were hot and fresh! Bread and oil some of the best! Please come here to eat!

I don't understand the good reviews; the owner must have a lot of friends on yelp.   This place was horrible.   It took an hour and a half to get my pizza, which was room temperature when I got it.  I ordered calamari, which they forgot, and had to bring back.  The calamari was absolutely disgusting!  Pizza was average at best.  It was sliced so poorly, some pieces were tiny, while slices on the other side were huge.  A "large" pizza would be considered medium anywhere else.  I seriously recommend skipping this place!

Great Pizza,  nothing else can be said but, I will. Old World Style not the hurry up instant pizza with the generic toppings that's out there now. Care goes into all the food here! Wish I lived closer!

The food selection was good and online ordering fairly painless. However, the cheese in the stuffed pizza was not what we expected. It was tough and chewy. The salads were ok. The regular thin crust pizzas were also ok. All in all, it was an average experience.

this  is  as  good  as  it  gets , this  is  very  good , everything  we   had  was  great  from  the  appetizers  to the  pizza  to  the  veal and  chicken parm  just  like  grandma  used  to  make  and  portions  were  not  small everyone  took  home  extras. the  price was  right  also  the  service  and  staff  very  friendly  and  helpful. we  were  there  with  some  fireman from  southern Illinois  who  were  here  on  conference  they  were  very  impressed  also.we  enjoyed  the  appetizer combo, calamari,stuffed  pizza   and  veal and chicken parm and the bread  with oil and herbs  was  very  good,

I have visited Capone's two different times . The first time I had the ribs which were amazing! The second time we tried the pizza which was also amazing. I would definately recommend Capone's to family and friends! #GoodEats I know they make most, if not all of their food from scratch!

Omg
1st time customer originally intrigued by the name.
I ordered stuffed pizza with sausage and extra cheese and it was amazing. My fiance ordered an Italian beef sandwich with mozzarella cheese and he loved it. Better then Portillo's. I was shocked because he grew up on Portillos. And I normally order pizza from Lou Malnati's. But the pizza at capones pizzeria was so much better. I truly wish I found this place earlier because they are fantastic.

My husband has gotten on a kick of ordering pizza from all different pizza places lately, this by far has been our favorite!  We ordered a thin crust pizza, it was delivered in a timely fashion and most importantly delicious!!!  It was a thin crust and cooked to perfection.  The crust was amazing, the perfect crunch on the bottom and ratio to doughy-ness.  The sauce, cheese, and toppings we chose were all perfect too!!!  It takes a lot for us to get excited about a pizza and I can say they nailed it!

Capone's pizza is the BEST pizza place in the western suburbs! The food is outstanding & everything that's made there is made with much care from Dominic! The pizza is wonderful, the ribs, the beefs...even the wonderful cookies his mom bakes...I get to buy there! I'm excited! Great delivery service....it's the best place by far! I'm so glad I live close
THE BEST pizza that we've had in many years ! Stopped in a got one to go and was just as impressed with how clean the place is. We will DEFINITELY be back !!!!

The Customer Services is Great. Good location. Lots to choose from. Pizza is really good. Had A Sausage and there Veggie. Both where great. Cannoli is great. Have a chance stop in and eat UP. And there hours fit people that have to work.

Being adventurous one evening, we decided to give Old Vilnius CafÃ© a try. They serve traditional Lithuanian cuisine. Now, I know no nothing about Lithuanian food, so consider that in reading this review. I had the Lithuanian Combo Platter to get a varied taste of the cuisine.  It included Kugelis (a thick potato pancake), Zeppelin (a meat-stuffed potato dumpling), a potato sausage and a Lithuanian sausage. The platter included sides of sauerkraut, sour cream and bacon bits. It was good, but different than anything I've had before. My wife had the Lithuanian pork tenderloin which was lightly breaded and fried. It was topped with sautÃ©ed mushrooms, onions and cheese. It was served with mashed potatoes, a creamy mushroom sauce and mixed vegetables.  She enjoyed her meal. The service was polite and attentive.

To the side of the restaurant is a store where they sell  Lithuanian foods, magazines and other such items. While we dined, we noticed a number of people stopping in to pick up to-go orders. If you're in the western suburbs and looking for some Lithuanian cuisine, give Old Vilnius CafÃ© a try.

Definitely something different. It's not hard finding Eastern European fare in Greater Chicago but in a city where the European scene is dominated by Polish and Ukrainian fare Lithuanian is a lesser known speciality that this place thrives on. There's an array of Lithuanian dishes such as Sausage, kugelis, and zeppelins but for those unfamiliar with Lithuanian food (and I'll be honest it can be a bit heavy) there's the better known polish dishes and also their schnitzel is super good. It's about as authentic as you can get and be sure to check out their local bookstore. It's about as close to modern day Lithuania as you can get around here. Worth a try!

Born and raised in Lithuania I know what the real Lithuanian food taste. So I was excited to try this place and didn't mind a long drive from the city for some good food. Unfortunately I was not impressed. First of all it took 45min for our food to be done and when it was served it was cold. I have no idea what was the name of our not so polite waitress either, she never introduced herself. Drinks...umm yeah. I had Moscow mule and that was a fail as well. I will not waste my time on this place ever again.
This place is amazing! The food is delicious and it reminded me so much of my moms cooking. The portions are large and extremely filling. Definitely recommend this place to everyone.

I try to avoid getting Eastern European food as take out because for some reason it doesn't seem to hold up as well and of course I like the beer to be readily refilled. But my takeout here didn't disappoint. The menu had items from various Eastern European traditions - I ordered a wide variety and had some great dishes I'm not sure if some were new takes or just new to me. At any rate all incredible!

This place was a gem in the rough. Very easy to miss if you don't know about it. The interior was very cozy and the addition of a Lithuanian gift shop/store was a neat thing to find.
The food was delicious. I had the Lithuanian Combo plate which I recommend you have if this is your first time visiting here. It has a little bit of everything that is good. I also had the meat pockets (which were so yummy) and the fried bread with cheese and garlic blanket (this was so much better then I had been prepared for - do not pass this up). 
Their selection of unique beers and wine was also worth taking note of.
My only issue and the main reason I don't award this place five stars is the wait time. We waited much longer then I think was appropriate for our drinks and our main dishes (though the appetizers did show up promptly).
They seemed to be short staffed.
But for the food alone and the unique atmosphere this place was pleasantly surprising. I plan to visit again and hope my wait isn't nearly as long next time. 
Thank you for a delicious meal!

It was our first time here and it won't be our last!!! If you're looking for good Authentic, fresh, homemade European food this is the place!!!! We had stuffed cabbage, breaded pork tenderloin, Zeppelin, and pierogis. Everything was delicious and the service was great!

Very cute, very small,very delicious, very large portions, very cold beer.
Authentic Lithuanian service, Slow easy pace. 
In a hurry? Order to go. Don't sit down.
Potato pancakes are so so good.

I really like the murals on the wall.
Only negative:
Lighting is too bright.

Not open on the hours posted. 
If you're going to post hours, at least post accurate ones.
Lamb stew is great and the stuffed cabbage. They also have a deli where you can buy Lithuanian specialties.

Old Vilnius is more than a cafe. The small store front also contains a grocery and souvenir shop. In this review, I will attempt to highlight all aspects of this fascinating new addition to Darien. 

First, let's discuss the souvenir shop. When you enter Old Vilnius, you pretty much walk straight into it. The souvenir shop has tons of fascinating items: flying witches on broomsticks, Joseph Stalin and Vladimir Lenin glassware, wooden religious figures, beer steins, etc. The list goes on. Behind the souvenir shop is the grocery. There are various pastries being prepared fresh, I believe, and other Eastern European grocery items. You can even find books and DVDs here. It is a fun place to browse. You will find some odd and rare merchandise here. 

Now to the actual cafe. First of all, it is very small. There are only a handful of tables. The walls are painted to look like night. They are all black and what appears to be a church is painted on the wall. Very unique artwork. I ordered a huge Russian beer and the Lithuanian sausage platter. The Russian beer went down easy like a Miller. There was nothing special about it. It was just enormous. Also, I found the Lithuanian sausage too mild. It didn't taste like anything. It was a substantial sausage but it needed seasoning. Everything else was quite average as well. Perhaps Eastern European food is meant to be mild.

In any case, Old Vilnius is such an interesting place that I will return. Most likely, it will be to browse the oddities in the souvenir shop.

What can i say about the place?  The food here is amazing.  The prices may seem a bit high but wait till you see the portions.  You walk in, and the retail counter is first. No one really helps you, so you have to know to go to the restaurant side and wait to be seated there.  The place is small!  I would have knocked off some stars for slow service but the excellent food makes up for it!

We've been meaning to try Old Vilnius CafÃ© for some time since we pass it nearly every day.  We headed over around 7:30pm on Saturday night.  There was a 20 minute wait so we headed to the bar in Mi Hacienda next door for a beer.  I purchased a $25 for $12 Groupon while we waited, score!  Our table was ready when we walked back over 20 minutes later.  The menu is extensive and we had a difficult time deciding!  We ordered the fried bread in warm cheese & garlic sauce and 2 large Svyturys beers to start.  Think of the fried bread as large toasted croutons with a thick, melted garlic cheese on top.  A little heavy but absolute heaven.  The hubby and I decided to share 2 different combo plates in order to get a taste of everything.  We tried polish sausage, potato pancakes, sauerkraut, fried zeppelin, kugelis, & potato sausage.  Everything was OUTSTANDING!  I think it's very easy for potato-based foods to be bland and heavy, but the food was FAR from that.

Our server was incredibly friendly and answered all of our questions.  I have to deduct 1 star because they were out of stuffed cabbage rolls for the evening.  I am a cabbage roll addict and was pretty disappointed.  But it gives us another reason to visit soon!

What a pleasant surprise.

We stopped on a Saturday night and had a great meal.  Cocktails were very good and our entrees, zeppelins and stuffed cabbage were great.  

Looking forward to returning.

I just finished eating at Old Vilnius Cafe for the last time. 

Why? 

Because this once 4-star (according to my original review) restaurant has seriously declined over my past few visits, culminating in tonight's horrible meal. 

The service has slid to the point that you have to wait and wait and wait for your food, your drink refills, and ultimately your check. Tonight our soup and meal came out at the same time, so our food sat getting cold while we ate our soup.

I thought it was perhaps a singular occurrence last time we came, which is why we decided to try it again tonight. No. Clearly this establishment has gone downhill. 

My meal was burned to the point of being inedible. The kugelis was blackened on the top. Our server, Anda asked how it was and I told her it was awful. She offered to have the cook make me another, but I told her I didn't want another one. It was terrible.

I told her again how bad it was when she came to clear the mostly uneaten meal from the table. I was never offered something different, and when the bill came the burned food was on the bill. 

I told Anda how disappointed I was and she proceeded to argue with me that 1) that's how the food is supposed to be and 2) she offered to bring me something different, which, she didn't. She offered to bring me another kugelis. 

I am so disappointed in the decline of this establishment, especially to see that the staff simply doesn't seem to care about customer concerns, or in pleasing them. I was, what I'd consider, a semi-regular customer. We came about once every few months. But from now on I will drive a little further and go to Grand Duke's on Harlem for Lithuanian food, where the food and service continue to be excellent.

EDIT: I am shocked to read another reviewer state that they are owned by the same family as Grand Duke's. The food is vastly different, and the service is so much better there.

I use to like this place in past but no more longer. Reason - food became disgusting! I didn't visit Old Vilnius for a couple of month and when I decide to come back and to give the last chance I was totally disappointed! 

Arunas

(Tip: Turn in on Main St. from East bound 75th St. It's just East of the big shopping center with the Kohl's in it.)  The service was good but the food was average at best.  We started with the tomato rice soup of the day.  Right out of a Campbell's can.  The cabbage rolls were large but were room temperature when they were served.  The filling was OK but needed seasoning.  The tomato sauce was too sweet for our taste.  The Lithuanian pork tenderloin was covered in some cheese and mushroom glop.  I noticed a lot of dishes come with cheese and/or a creamy mushroom sauce.  We assumed this was traditional.

Here's my question.
How have the Lithuanian People survived so long eating this food?
I have German/Polish blood in me, and I've never shied away from a hearty meal. Then again, there might be cause to state I've never shied away from ANY meal, but I digress. How is it Lithuanians aren't all 750 pounds? How do any Lithuanians live to any age past 35 without their hearts exploding in a Cholesterol rage? Do the Chefs have to join OPEC? I have never encountered such a wall of starch and grease like I did during today's throwdown at Vilnius. 
I don't know anything about Lithuanian eating habits, save for one of my high school chums was Lithuanian and his family et open-faced Ham Sandwiches for breakfast. (This was in the early sixties before gourmet eating was legal in the US). 
Maybe what I had today was the epitome of Litho fare. I don't know. The place was packed, and people were tucking in, that's for sure. All the plates that came out looked like what I had, and I ordered what the non-English-speaking waitron suggested. It also wasn't the most expensive thing on the menu, so I know I wasn't being grandstanded.
Lunch started with a Wild Mushroom soup that was delicious, and quite light, despite being described as a "creamy" soup. I had heard this place was a haven for Garlic, and as a strict aficionado of the "stinking rose", I ordered what is purported to be the menu "Garlic Bomb", the "Fried Bread". What came out was a large dish of thick matchsticks of what appeared to be Pumpernickel, fried crisp in Garlic-infused oil. Over the top was some sort of mozzarella-type cheese. There was about a quarter-inch oil slick on the bottom of the dish, that did not look inviting. Here was the first "Uh-Oh". Heating certain cheeses in a Microwave melts the cheese, but also effects a byproduct of gredue that slinks to the bottom of the cooking vessel. It's not appetizing. This plate was obviously the work of "Chef Mike". Sampling the sticks "up top", they were indeed chock full of the stinky stuff, and rich to the taste. A few bites in and I was done. That cloying feeling when you eat too much rich stuff was on the horizon, and I still had my Entree to go. I set the plate aside, and it appeared untouched, even though I had et my share.
The Entree (the "Lithuanian Sampler") came, and it looked like a platter for 4. A hunk of Kugelis the size and shape of a building brick; a long, browned tube that was ostensibly "Potatoe Sausage", alongside another short and squat grey sausage that had absolutely NO plate appeal, and a Litho specialty called a "Zeppelin"-which was again, a doughy white football that looked uncooked. A mound of dark Kraut rounded out the plate. Yes, and over EVERYTHING was sprinkled some pinkish meat  preparation that I could not identify.
What I DID identify was another off-putting oil slick at the bottom of the plate.
I sampled everything before me, and found none of it except the Kraut to have any discernible flavor whatsoever. The Kraut was greasy, and tasted reheated and old. There were also a LOT of whole Bay leaves that kept getting stuck in my teeth and resisted being chewed, I made a pile of them on the bread plate. I don't think I've ever left that much food on a plate in a restaurant. I didn't complain, because I had no reference as to whether this was actually a fine fine Litho Resto, or a Crime against cuisine. As I saw the same plate come out a number of times, and the folks accepting them were digging in, I figured I had just chosen wrong, and that's not the resto's fault. I asked for a few doggy boxes, and when I went to put the remainder of the Fried Bread in one, it tipped over and I saw the congealed mess at the bottom of the pile. Ug. Same thing as I dumped the remainder of the sampler plate in the box. I put both boxes in the provided plastic bag. 
I paid thirty dollars for this lunch. $30.05, to be exact. No Booze, No Coffee, No Dessert.
I contemplated this on the way out, as I was toting the bag that, if you told me contained a child's bowling ball, I would have believed you. It was that heavy.
I further contemplated the family what walked in and sat down opposite me. An older Mom and Dad of Bovine/Porcine proportions, and two gorgeous, young middle-aged daughters with slim, spectacular figures. I noticed the first thing they ordered was the fried bread. You do the math. 
And also-that Lithuanian friend who et the Ham Sarnies for Breakfast was a superstar in the locker room due to his enormous Penis. Another Math problem...
The service wasn't as lax as the reviews here would have you believe, it actually wasn't bad. Will I be back? A few bowls of the Mushroom soup would be a fine Lunch. There were also some straight meat dishes that looked good on the menu, so even though I'm throwing only one star, I will prolly be back. 
Maybe.
Do they have Ham Sandwiches on the menu?

My friends and I all enjoyed our long lunch with no pressure to leave. We tried pork cutlets (more like meatballs), salmon, dumpings, borscht and Lithuanian beer. The waitress was attentive and helpful. The little store attached to the restaurant offers an excellent selection of items as well, from groceries and liquor to DVDs and folk crafts.
Incredible from start to finish. Finally stopped in here after years of passing by and was not disappointed. This is my new favorite spot. Details aren't necessary, just go.

Amazing food, great portions. Everything we tried was delicious, and I loved the little shop next to the restaurant where you can buy alot of their authentic food and goods. My friend and I both loved everything we ordered and shared it all so we could try everything!
Oh my gosh. The beet soup and the sauerkraut. Amazing. Took some home. Ate it all up. Want more.

Delicious, hot European food. We enjoyed it very much! A lot of great Polish and Lithuanian options on the menu. We had mushroom soup and red beat soup with pork to start. For dinner we had potato pancakes, potato sausage and Lithuanian dumplings. Everything we had was superb. Great portions, nice server very comfortable chairs. We took the Napoleon dessert home with us. We will definitely be back.

The people giving negative reviews here don't know what the heck they're talking about.  This is some of the best-quality Lithuanian food in Chicagoland.  The quantities of food that you get are amazing for the price.  The only justifiable complaint that anyone can put forth is that the service is slow, which it is, and for good reason - everything is cooked from scratch to order!  How can you beat that?  People who are looking for eastern European "fast food" have their heads you know where.  This type of food simply CANNOT be prepared expediently.
Additionally, they have a cute shop that sells many hard-to-get eastern European goods and small gifts.
I will most certainly be back many times.  YUM!

Really like this place . .  I'm Polish/Russian, so have been exposed to a fair amount of Slavic food, but they had plenty of things that I've never tried before, and they were all good. Particularly, the herring appetizer and dumpling soup got our meal off to a fantastic start. The 1/2 duck w/ sauerkraut and kugel was stellar, and the Stroganoff first rate (albeit the accompanying potatoes were a only just warm). The only disappointments was the chicken Kiev, which was actually dry.  We left feeling confident that anything on the menu that had the "Vilnius" logo next to it was going to be something special though.  Worth mentioning too that the decor, while simple was rather charming, and the service was terrific. Will take this over any of the other Slavic specialty places along 75th street *any* day!

Everytime I come back and visit my hometown of Chicago (I live in California) I make a priority to eat the food of my ancestors that I can't get out west. Checked this place out with my mom and was very happy. They have some lunch specials ranging from $5 - $7 that were of good portions. mom got some meat crepes that were very tasty. I ended up getting the fried Lithuanian platter consisting of Kugelis, potato-sausage and "zeppelins" which were fried potatoes topped with a bit of sausage. Everything I ordered was potato-based topped with bacon bits served with a side of sour-cream, but I didn't care. It was downright delicous. Probably not the healthiest thing to order, so for only an additional .99 I got a bowl of creamy tomato soup. I went home with plenty of leftovers. 
I liked the interior decor, dark, with a large wall mural of a castle in the night. Very Prussian-Germanic-Goth inspired. The women that worked there were all beautiful.
