IN ADDITION, Old Vilnius has a store/deli in the front where you can buy some Lithuanian-pride clothing, trinkets, books, dvds, and pretty much anything you can think of.

We called in advance to set up a dinner reservation for two with someone who barely spoke English.  It became apparent after spending several minutes on the phone that they had availability for two of us.  We arrived a few minutes later and found the restaurant to be full except for one table that seated 5.  Nevertheless we were ushered by the waitress to have that table.  Once we sat down, a few minutes later another waitress arrived only to tell us that this table was reserved for a party of 5 and instructed us to get up to go back to the waiting area.  My wife and I just picked up our coats and walked straight out and never to come back again.  DO NOT SIT GUESTS DOWN ON A DINNER TABLE ONLY TO ASK THEM TO GO BACK AND WAIT BECAUSE YOU WANT TO GIVE THE TABLE TO ANOTHER LARGER PARTY.  Any restaurant that does that deserves negative criticism.

Best kugelis since Harriet and Joe Bartkus sold Palanga in Marquette Park! 

I've found that kugelis made in restaurants is typically dry or flavorless. This gives my Dad's kugelis a run for his money! (Does my Dad work at Old Vilnius Cafe and he never told me! Lol!)

The Lithuanian sausage and sauerkraut was delicious! The hot beet soup was great!

Definitely going back! Terrific!

I was very skeptical trying this place out, i don't usually go to places where they serve "authentic" food. A lot of times the food that they call authentic doesn't taste remotely close to what it should. I love lithuanian dishes, i ordered hot beat soul and zeppelins (DELICIOUS!!!!) the food was great!!! and to top it all off i had a groupon so my meal was under $20. Awesome place!

I would have given this joint 5 stars, but can't due to the temperature of the food they are serving. Soup and the entree was barely warm! 
Decor is nice, food tasted great. Service was fast. I would recommend this place for a good Lithuanian grub

The food is exactly as it should be heavy, hearty and somewhat bland. As I said that is what your buying when looking for Lithuania food. It's old Vilnius not a modern take on Vilnius. Is that not clear. I'm not sure what's up with the flip flopping on the reviews, the food is what it is and you can try it and understand what it's like or go buy tacos next door and yes no one is in a hurry just like in Europe. It's authenticity is what makes it good and I score it as a 4 for that reason, otherwise it's average and not comparative with standard fair.
Potato pancakes very greasy, also had chicken dish and just so so. Not great service either, definitely won't be back.

Very good food, my wife and I shared the bohemian combo plate.
One stuffed cabbage,one Lithuanian sausage with sour kraut ,two pork tenderloins and mashed potatoes.
My daughter ordered the perogi's with onion and bacon.
The 3 of us shared everything and everything was delicious.
To top it off,they even let me use the groupon.
Will be back here for sure.

It's potato kugel. I can't believe my eyes.  I feel like I've just found a pearl in my oyster! 
Needless to say, I had to get my kugel fix. And man,  was it good!
This is truly a rare find.  I hope that I don't go into a kugel coma.

Carry out from the deli area offers an affordable alternative to fast food, with the taste of mom and grandma's cooking.
The cabbage rolls w/mashed potatoes are enough for 2 people.  The  zeppelins are extremely filling and can be stretched to last for several days. The Polish platter is substantial.  Oh, the potato kugel, delish.  Tasty good choice for the price. Haven't been disappointed yet.
Nice European deli.

It pains me to have to write this review but I was very confused by this restaurant! I very much enjoyed it, fabulous food but they charged $3.75 extra for a tiny ramekin of extra gravy and they didn't tell us until we got our bill! Then I bring the leftovers home and I swear I can still smell all the garlic almost a week later!!? Monstrous portions of food, enough for a family!! We had a Groupon and tried it out. It was very good. Tiny little restaurant. nicely painted walls, very cute little store in the front with all sorts of Lithuanian type housewares. I will try it again but I'll let all the garlic subside first.

Once I found out this place was owned by the same people that own Grand Dukes I had to go there. Mainly b/c it's way closer. 

It's nothing like Grand Dukes as far as the atmosphere. This is a cafe, so the dining room is smaller, and nothing special. It also wasn't very warm inside, we had our coats on for most of the dinner. 

The menu options were pretty much the same as Grand Duke. The bread was not the ample assortment they give you at GD, it was just one type of rye. The sour cream was just regular sour cream and not the bacon sour cream. 

The Lithuanian combo platters were a hit and very good. Other dishes we ordered were: Pork Kabob, Pork Tenderloin and potato pancakes. 

The potato pancakes were really soggy and  just not very good. Pork tenderloin was really tasty. The pork Kabob was served on rice, the rice was really good however the meat was on the fatty side. 

Our waiter was really nice and attentive.   

I think I'd go back with a Groupon or some coupon. It's nice that this location is closer to my house, so if I really have a taste for some kugilus I know where to go. If I want to make the dinner a special one I'd much rather go to Grand Dukes.

This place is amazing.  I've been there a couple of times ill have to say the food is delicious and the staff is very nice and friendly. I was a bit nervous going there not being Lithuanian for the first time but the staff was very welcoming and informative. I would definitely recommend this place.

Food was okay, the sausage was over cooked and bland. The worst part was the service. Sooooooooo slooooooowwwwwww. We waited for drinks, we waited for soup, we waited for main course. We waited for her to come and offer beer refills. Then we waited even loooooooonger for the check. People were waiting at the door for a table and stared at us waiting for sooooooo long for the the check with our coats on for 15 looooooooong minutes. So it gets a three because except for the sausage the rest of the food was pretty good. If you have a looooooooong time to just sit and wait. This is your place.
I would not recommend it.

It was a little confusing getting seated for some reason.I really like the look of this place, a small but beautiful dining area. I ordered the forest potato pancakes which was filled with wild mushrooms. This is maybe the best mushroom dish I ever had. The filling was gushing 'shrooms and the butter-sour cream sauce had the perfect amount of tang to keep the dish from being too one-note. I have to take a star away for being overcharged $2 for adding a cup of hot beet soup to my meal but I didn't have time to haggle as I was already late getting back to work. Even so, those pancakes are a mushroom fan's dream.

This is a cute little place. And the food is wonderful. However, it is very small. and the service is slow. They need to be a little faster on the service and  pass the coffee more often. The little store that is attached is very nice.
One of the best places to go in Chicago's suburbs for authentic Lithuanian food.  Small, cozy place with great service.

My parents had purchased us a goupon after they ate here.  I was excited to share some of my Lithuanian heritage cuisine with my girlfriend.  
We called early Saturday and they said the last seating was at 5:30.  Strange for a place open until midnight. We arrived promptly at 5:30 and were told by the hostess we needed to be out by 6:20. As we were seated the whole dining room silently stared at us. There is that warm Eastern European hospitality.  
Our waitress quickly came over and said we would have to be out more like 6:15.  I asked if that was time to order and eat.  She replied, "if you order in the next 4 minutes."  Guess no appetizers then? 
We decided to leave with no one offering an apology.  I appreciated driving all the way out there.  We will let the groupon go to waste and never going back.

I went to check this place out for dinner tonight with a Groupon.  Being a Wednesday evening - around 5pm, not very busy.   There were 2 other tables of people there when we arrived.  There was a continual flow of people coming in to the storefront to buy packaged food or go to the deli.  

All in all, a very cute place with friendly staff.    Our waiter was friendly and he was attentive.  I ordered the Lithuania platter and my husband the Polish platter.  Everything was really tasty with exception of the sauerkraut.  My husband and I both agreed that it was kind of bland. 

While waiting for our food order, I checked out the store.  They had all kinds of food items from Eastern Europe.  The deli had a nice selection of cheese and meats.  I am intrigued by cheese not from the US because you don't have to worry about Organic this way.  Cheese from Europe has strict rules about not using hormones like they do in the US.  So I may be back again to visit the deli.  They had some delicious pastries sitting on top of the deli counter too.

There were around 10 tables in there and was a good amount of space - much bigger than the area to eat at most Subway restaurants (to give you an idea).   they had 2 flat screen TVs on the walls.  Very nice European decor.   Very nice menus with some photos.   

I think we'll be going back!

I may regret writing this review because the cafÃ© only has 9 tables, but I have now learned to love Lithuanian food.

This space used to house a carpet store and I strongly suggest that they get rid of the industrial florescent lights.  The one over the checkout register (I will explain farther into this review) is blinding to 2 of the tables near the front window.

When you walk in, there is a checkout register.  That is because they sell Lithuanian products, including pre-made and frozen food.  As I said, there is a very small dining area with one table placed adjacent to, what I thought was, the kitchen swinging doors. Turns out, on the other side of the wall is a deli with all sorts of Lithuanian foods for sale.  The products for sale include used books, in Lithuanian, soccer jerseys, CDs, and a whole lot of other tchotchke.  Beware, all signage is written in Lithuanian.

Now, for the good stuff ~ the fresh, made to order food  After speaking with the manager, we learned there is a large Lithuanian population in the area and this place was very busy.  They, of course, ordered their food by calling the meal what it is, I needed the English translation but fully intend to work on my pronunciation.  Lenten specials include cod, salmon, smelt served hot, beautiful presentation, and mouth watering sides and sauces.  All employees were extremely polite, helpful, and very patient answering all our questions.  Suggestions made by our server were spot on and even my husband has a new favorite beer.  That's saying a lot considering we have dined at Bavarian Lodge, formerly known as Chef Paul, for over 20 years and anyone who drinks beer knows that place carries more beers than you could probably ever sample.  It all worked out because he was able to purchase the beer over on the deli side :)

They open at 10, for a late breakfast, 9 on week-ends, and serve lunch and dinner.

Go and enjoy ~ you can thank me later.

This place is great! It's a small cafe so if you plan on going there on the weekend I would call first for seating. My husband and I ordered their fried bread in a garlic cheese blanket as an app an it was delicious! Also, their Borszcz soup is fantastic-either one hot or cold! I ordered the hot and hubs ordered the cold-they were excellent! I tried their Noblesmen Zeppelins as a main dish and it was very good. Portions are big! They have a souvenir shop and deli/grocery store as well. We will be back as I want to try more off the menu and hopefully next time leave room for dessert. Service was fast-we went at an off time (Monday at 3pm) so the place was not crowded. Check them out online as they have an extensive menu of unique offerings for those who've never dined Lithuanian.
Tasty European Food, with lovely service; each time I come. Clean place. Hot Beet Soup is super tasty, as the rest on the menu.

Had a lunch special. $5.99 for a pork cutlet. Not what I expected, it was ground meat and round like a large meatball and I had to ask to heat it more, the middle was barely warm, but when I got it back it tasted wonderful.

This place was pretty good.  My fiancÃ© had never had food like this before but she definitely likes it now.  It's a small place that brings back memories of my grandmothers home cooking on holidays.  The prices are fair and the people are pretty nice too.  They also have a small market at the entrance to buy different things.

I like this place. It is very clean and has a nice eastern european style decor.  The staff is very friendly and attentive and the food is traditional Lithuanian and well prepared.

I had the Lithuanian Combo Plate and everything was excellent.  It was enough to feed two people and the price was around $13.

I will go back again the next time I visit Chicago!

I had a long day and was really hungry. It was around 8pm and not busy. The dining area is super clean. I asked the server for help ordering and he aimed me in the right direction. The portions of food is way too large. I took home a too go bag, had it for lunch today. All the soup is great.. I had a tasty Lithuanian tap beer.
 I give it 5 stars. The food is really heavy. Be ready to eat!

Just got back from eating dinner here and it was great. We arrived at about 6 for dinner and there were two tables left. There are only about 10 tables here so call ahead if you have a big group. We ordered drinks and also ordered potato pancakes as an appetizer. Very delicious, served with applesauce and sour cream. We ordered our food - my husband got the Lithuanian platter and I ordered the stuffed cabbage. Very large portions! We definitely have leftovers in the fridge. We saved room for honey cake, and we were so glad we did. It was so good - I would go there just for the cake. The service was a tiny bit slow, which is why I gave it the 4 star rating instead of the 5 star rating, but the food was amazing and very reasonable for the amount of food you get. We had an Amazon Local deal - $12 for $25 worth of food - so our bill came to $35 - which for two drinks, an appetizer, two huge entrees and two desserts was not bad at all. I cannot wait to go back and try more of the menu items!
True Lithuanian cuisine. Not as good as my grandmas, but very good for something thats outside of Lithuania
This place is round the corner from our house and never went till recently, now will be regulars. All food was good. In particular the soups are delicious. Also like the Lithuanian beer.

Please let me say that I never knew I liked stuffed cabbage before I had it here.  It is amazing!!  I had a plater with homemade mashed potatoes, sauerkraut, pork tenderloin, and the amazing stuffed cabbage.  Hubby had dumplings and the sauerkraut soup, which his was also a fan of.  This is a family friendly place, so feel free to bring the kids.  Prices are pretty standard.  This is our 2nd time here and we will be back!

We tried it and liked it.  Service was a little slow and some of the menu items were a bit heavy, but we expected that,  Definitely a "come back to" place.  Also, the deli has quite a selection, at very reasonable prices, especially the desserts.
Very good authentic Lithuanian food. Cepelinai and Svyturys beer on tap were the best!

Picked up a Groupon on a whim to this little cafe off of 75th Street. When we walked in I was surprised that this was also a store and deli more like a cultural center housed in a restaurant space. The eating area is small but very well put together, I could see this in downtown Chicago easily. Sat down for lunch and couldn't make up our mind, everything looked very interesting. Ordered the beet soup and two sampling platters to share. Wait staff is overly attentive (in a good way) and extremely polite; well belonging to a much higher scale restaurant. Food was new but very close to the German food I grew up on. The cabbage rolls stood out as a great part of the meal but all of the food items were great, the dumpling sampler had its merits as well as the mushroom schnitzel (sorry forgot the restaurant term). Most definitely not the place to go if you are on a diet but man was everything good. Not a bad bite in the meal. I will be going back when I feel the need for an excellent eating experience but must be shared with friends or you'll be taking half of it home in a doggy bag.

Love the Cantina! This is definitely my favorite restaurant to visit during the summertime. Their outdoor patio has a fun, lively atmosphere. Great for hanging out with friends or listening to the live music that they often have. 
I've been here so many times and I've always enjoyed what I've ordered. Their chips are a great starter. They always come out warm and the salsa tastes homemade and delicious. My favorite menu items are the enchiladas or the chicken tacos.
Their bar is also great and they sure know how to make a good margarita!

Had the passion fruit kicker beer...sugary but balanced...very refreshing.  I ordered the battered cod fish tacos with refried beans and rice. Nice presentation of food: looks good enough to eat! Fish is crispy/fresh and not oily. It has good flavor even with the strong black beans. Every taste has its place. Also had a $2 taco...shredded beef...good! Ordered the warm apple empanada: seemingly prepared with a gelatin that actually was tasty. I enjoyed it.

Salsa was fresh and tasty. I dumped it in the beef taco.

Waitress is Mrs. COOL chick lady named:  Riley 

Give her a good tip before you hit THE DOOR OUT!

Nice joint..see you next time!
Received a private message from a Jose M. from Darien in regards to my review stating I incorrectly counted my tacos.

First time here and I was impressed. Decor is very nice. Lots of indoor seating plus outdoor seating. Waitresses were very attentive. Food was very good especially the shredded beef taco, rice, and beans. Left here stuffed. Located in downtown Lemont in the first floor of a newer condo complex. Lots of free parking and is just a block away from a Metra  station.

This place was great! John, our server, and Rob were amazing! They have the best selection of margaritas, anything you can ask for.  The food was delicious.  But the servers were great.  John and Rob served us well and filled our drinks as quickly as we finished them.  A hidden gem, a definite place we'll be back to!!!!

Cute little place in downtown Lemont.  Next door kids can play in large grassy area.  Outside has plenty of seating, even accommodating to leashed pets.  Food was phenomenal.  Service was awesome.  I went outside my comfort level and had Corona Beer Battered tacos which blew me away, finished the entire entree.  Frozen margaritas are super with a shaved ice consultancy, we preferred lemon over mango.  We will be back.  Best meal we've had out in a while.

I came here for lunch and ordered the fish tacos which are supposed to be a favorite on the menu. The cod tasted like frozen fish sticks and not fresh at all. The meal came with beans and rice, the beans were very bland. the best part of the dish was the side of rice. The service was good and the restaurant itself is in a nice location, but for the quality of food it was way over priced.

Ok place to hang out and have a drink. The wait staff are very friendly. The food is kinda bland, and when your at  a so called "Mexican" restaurant and ask for hot sauce, the last thing you would expect is a bottle of Tabasco sauce. Also how could a burrito with a side of beans and rice cost almost $15. The staff is the BEST thing about this place.
Its great location with outdoor dining  but the food falls short. It reminds me of food like you could get at a Chi Chi,s. In other words the food is on the same level as Taco Bell
I saw some negative comments but I do have to say all of my experiences have been pleasent here. Great managment & great atmosphere. I would definitely recommend it.

Location is nice especially sitting outside even with loud trains going by. The food is ok. I ordered the ceviche with blood orange but didn't get blood orange in it. Instead they used canned mandarin oranges. If you don't have the ingredient, how bout taking it off the menu or letting me know. My friend ordered a salad and said no to the guacamole. She still got it and was charged $2. My friends and I hadn't seen each other for a while so we were hanging out chatting enjoying the outdoor seating while the employees peered at us through the door waiting for us to leave. They could have just told us they were closing soon and we would have left.

I find it hard to believe that Mexican food actually costs this much! I had some chicken dish with peppers, onions and cheese. Glad they had a bottle of Cholula on the table so I could add some flavor to their flavorless dish. Also had an al-a-carte pork tamale, again was very bland. Waitress seemed less-than-interested to be doing her job. Not a real good 1st experience here.

We had a great time at Front Street last night.  The food, while good, isn't why I'm writing this review.  I'm a working chef and can make about anything I want to eat.  When we go out, it's for the service (and so we don't have to clean up!).  Our server was Chris, a young guy that is a college student.  What a personality!  Not only was he very friendly, he had a keen sense of humor.  He said his goal is to be the best server there, and I'd say he's got that locked down.  My wife and I both commented after we left how great it is to see younger people with personalily, not just robots who take your order and that's it.  Keep up the great work man, you have a bright future in public speaking, if that's what you end up pursuing.

My wife & I stopped here for dinner last night. We both ordered the steak tacos. We paid $12.50 each for two steak tacos with rice and beans. The tacos were loaded with lettuce, tomatoes, and shredded yellow (cheddar?) cheese. What little steak was on the tacos, lacked flavor and tenderness. The rice was bland, lacked flavor. The beans appeared to be a version of refried black beans and were different but tasty. Salsa was pretty good but the chips didn't appear to be very fresh.  Our server (Sarah J) was very attentive & was on top of her game. Great service but the food was disappointing. It's a nice looking place, nice location but the food just didn't impress. It definitely wasn't worth the money we spent.......
Great food, Carmen in the bar is fantastic. I had the chicken flautas.  Although they are pretty plain, pour the house salsa over them and they are to die for.

Met my daughters here to celebrate Fathers Day and my oldest birthday. The service was great, attentive, and friendly. The food was pretty good and priced reasonably . It's not the best Mexican food I have had but it was a pretty good place to meet and have a decent meal. The staff at the Lemont location were super and I will return to enjoy time with family.

This was our first time coming to Front Street. We had parked in front of it a few times and walked to a few other places in Lemont. This time, we decided to try it. It was a beautiful night and sat outside. Our server (John if I remember correctly) was good and took care of our needs. I'm not one much for Mexican food, so I had the chicken sandwich which was very good. My wife really liked the tostados. We will be back.
Was here last summer and loved it!! Excellent food, excellent service, and excellent Sangria! I will be back!!!

Don't know if the 4th star is particularly worthy, but my 2nd experience here (this time for dinner) was much better. I do love the chips and salsa and this time I had the chicken flautas  and they were very tasty, albeit a little burnt. My husband had the steak fajitas and loved them. Not the best Mexican food Ive ever had, but absolutely not the worst either. Service has been very good both times also.
Great food and service.   I recommend the enchiladas!  Servers are very attentive.  I wish that had a larger bar area.

The food is just okay. Wasn't expecting "authentic" and it isn't, but overall it's just okay.  Everything is a bit bland. Chips okay (lack seasoning); salsa just okay (lacks seasoning) - it's a salsa fresca (aka pico de gallo) - would have preferred a chile-based salsa. 

Tacos al pastor lacked seasoning.  (Please! What's with the dearth of salt?) The tortillas used could be of better quality and thinner, since they'll be doubled for service.  The rice was okay. The beans were the best thing on the plate though, unsurprisingly, needed salt. 

Good house margaritas. 

Excellent service at the bar. 

Nicely laid out place. Nice patio.  Food needs improvement.

We have always enjoyed the food here, but the service is terribly inconsistent.  When they're busy, the service seems better!  The past three times we went, the service was very poor.  Recently, we left before ordering anything.  We waited for 20 minutes and a server never even came to take our drink order.  On the plus side, the bus boy was very nice and offered to bring us chips -- unfortunately he "couldn't" bring us glasses of water because according to him he wasn't our server.  He was polite, and when we left the hostess was likewise polite and apologetic.  She also didn't charge us for the basket of chips we ate.  

I hope to go back because the food has always been pretty good, but I'm going to give them a few months to sort out their service deficiencies.

Stopped in just to pass the time while waiting for another place in town to open.  They do have a nice patio area but it is on the west side of the building, total sun, just an FYI for summer.

We sat indoors near the bar and a door that obviously opens, but it was closed on the day we were here.  There was a funky, musty smell in that corner.  We only had drinks and chips and salsa so that was fine.  Nothing outstanding, LOTS of staff running around.

There is a lower area at the end of the bar but we tried to sit there and the regular chairs were too low for comfort so I think this might be one of those misses for seating.  Can't address the dining area since we stayed only in the bar area.
Very nice fish tacos. Lovely sangria try this cute place you won't be disappointed. Great wait staff.

I like the food here but it's turning into chuckee  cheeses with all the squealing kids. And one lady had her 1 year old standing on a chair at the bar. Unless they corral the families into an area where they can disrupt themselves, we won't  return.

I have always enjoyed meeting friends here because the food and service have always been great. Tonight I arranged a dinner here with my children because I was in town visiting. This is the first time I have ever been to a restaurant where they spilled not one but two drinks on us and didn't comp anything in apology. I have doubts we will return after this experience. They didn't offer any compensation at all. Very poor practices.
Just a slightly better than Taco Bell or Speedway gas station. I honestly don't see the appeal. An American attempt at Mexican food. Epic fail

Delicious food, great margaritas and friendly staff. Tacos have a ton of flavor and just enough kick. Outdoor patio is really pleasant. John H. was our waiter and was very knowledgeable about the food and beer and was able to answer every question we had, I love that.

Love this place. I don't normally review places, but I wanted to mention this. Ate there for lunch today and a female server who seemed to be in charge of the other servers started telling a waiter off. Mind you this was right next to our table. I understand if there is an issue you need to talk about with an employee, but right next to guests is not the place to do it, especially when doing so in such a demeaning way. I love this place, food is great, but I will not be coming back after seeing a staff member treat an employee in that way.

This was our first time here and it was great. The salsa is delish. Very fresh and the chips are homemade! The Tortilla soup was rich and flavorful. The only bad thing was it came out with dinner. The fajitas were sizzling and flavorful. Tacos yummy and burrito was good too. The meals came with rice and beans. We will be back for sure.

This was our 2nd time here. The service is terrible, and it wasn't busy. The food is worse. We ordered nachos as an app and returned them because they were burnt. My husband ordered a mango margarita and it was watery and didn't taste good. He also ordered tacos and the soft shells were hard. The salsa and guacamole were both bland. For the price, you'd think you'd get more than what you get. We won't be back.

Came back with a groupon.  The service was great this time.  The nachos were still gloious.  I got the Pedro Pollo for dinner. It was really good, but I'd probably get something different next time.  They had happy hour margaritas for $4 and Wednesday Special $5 margaritas for when happy hour was over.  The magaritas were the bomb.  They really kicked ass.  I'm not sure I've tasted a better one.

This was our first time here. The food was delicious! Our server was terrible. Chandler I believe was her name. Terrible. We had to wave our arms and call her over to get our check after waiting 10 minutes when we finished eating. We literally were her only table!!! She just sat at a table with other workers chatting. The worst service we have had at any restaurant in quite a long time. Do. Your. Job...  The food was pretty good, we got the sampler platter, queso fundito and margaritas. My margarita was okay. My boyfriends was so strong it was almost too strong to drink! Just all tequila. No consistency... we might come back. It would definitely not be our first choice. And if we got the same server I would ask for a different one. The other girl taking care of the one other table there seemed nice and attentive. I would have given this 4.5 stars for the food and 0 stars for service. I settled on 3. Unbelievable..
Sat outside great day, frigging gnats were bad tho! Food was amazing and I eat Mexican all the time! Service was good, I will go back for sure

They advertise this place as " Authentic Mexican Food " ... Personally it didn't come close, with its boxed rice and flavorless beans. Flour tortillas are the norm for their dishes, corn is the Mexican standard. Atmosphere was nice, very clean. Staff was very attentive and polite.... This was at Saturday noon time for lunch. We won't be back.. Moving on to find that Authentic food.
I don't feel the food is authentic. The guacamole is not too bad but I still have other places I would go to waaaay before I would go here again.
This place has good, basic Mexican-style food. As a vegetarian, a go-to disk is the Chile Rellenos, which they do well but not fantastically.   In the summer time it is great to get a table outside.

Let me begin by saying that I can not attest to the food at Front Street. I can tell you that the bar tending is top notch! The atmosphere is very welcoming and clean. In the warmer months they have live music outside at times. The bartenders, Sarah and Nichole, are always quick and efficient, and, at the same time, very friendly and welcoming. If you're on the fence about paying Front Street a visit for a drink, give it a try. You won't be disappointed.

I have given this place the last chance.  The food is so bland and I have tried many of their dishes over the past 2 years.  Some basic seasoning would go along way.   We stopped in for dinner on a Sunday evening and we could barely hear our conversation due to the open microphone night.  Service was just ok.  I wanted so badly for this place to be good but it really needs a lot of help.  Might be a good opportunity for Restaurant Impossible!
It's nice in the summer because you can eat outside and they also have music. The food is ok but it's not authentic. The service is good.

Where do I begin! This place is top notch all around...

Facility is spotless and there is always ample tables and employees. You never have to wait long before your pleasantly greeted. We love sitting outside when the weather permits since the tables are spread out. I'm a big fan of the chicken & steak fajitas but I don't start there. Their queso fundido is some of the best I've ever had. We drive from Chicago just to get our fill! Just writing this review makes my mouth water.

To wash it all down, their margaritas strongly poured and always made to order which I appreciate - there's nothing worst than a premixed margarita. We've gone about a dozen times in the last year and it just simply isn't enough. Every time we come, Amy  (appears she runs the show there) treats us like  family.

This place has it all: from live music to an endless beer selection, perfectly cooked/seasoned authentic Mexican flavors and to top it all off, wonderful servers and staff.  

PS. MAKE SURE YOU GET A CHANCE TO TRY THIS INSANELY GOOD FOOD AND  MEET AMY - SHE IS ONE OF THE MOST INCREDIBLE PEOPLE YOU WILL EVER MEET!!!!!

So, I've been here a couple times. The food really is awesome. I love the guac. They serve it in a giant tortilla chip bowl, basically, so you get like 5 extra chips' worth of dippage without having to lose any precious guac. The guac itself is a nice mix of limey without being overpowering and overly salty. The chimichanga was my entree and it was rad. I don't normally enjoy black beans, but these black beans and rice sides for the entrees are straight bangin'. My margarita was excellent, and I was blown away by the depth of the beer list. They didn't over indulge in any one brewery's beer. Nice and even across the board with A TON of variety. Our server was John and he was great. Very welcoming and accommodating. It would seem that this place has a lot going for it!!! Shouts out to John for treating my family so well on my dad's birthday.

Funny thing--since this place had only a 2.5 star rating at the time of dining, I wasn't planning on coming here anytime soon. But when my sister-in-law wondered if there was somewhere in Lemont where our party of 4+baby could dine al fresco, the memory that came to mind was of driving past the people happily clinking their drinks at Front Street Cantina.

Plus, I think our friendly upstairs neighbor works here in the kitchen.

Turns out we had a really pleasant Sunday evening dining experience. They'd just wrapped up their open mic thing (something like 6-8pm on Sundays?), and we were readily hosted at the outdoor table of our choice.

Service was pretty good -- it took them a little longer than ideal for our food to come out, but they didn't mind getting us an extra basket of chips and salsa or two to tide us over. Ice water was refilled readily.

Food: my wife's chili was pretty spicy, but a good-sized bowl with great flavor for $5. I had probably among the best fish taco's that I've had; probably have the guacamole sauce to thank for that. And my bro/sis-in-law seemed to enjoy their meals, as well. 

Their baby daughter liked when the christmas/string/fairy lights came on around us.

Minus .5 points for the server not asking me if I wanted my tacos soft- or crunchy-shelled, but we'll round up. Maybe she had something on her mind.

I really want to like this local "Mexican" restaurant, however I gave it 3 tries and I give up.  I have tried 3 different dishes and each is basically the same.  BLAND!  I guess I am jaded after having lived in Chicago very close to Pilsen where Excellent Mexican food is on every corner.  

The service we had last night was great!  New girl who was really working hard, but I had to return a glass of Sangria because it was undrinkable, my daughter got a burger and had one bite and went back to the chips and salsa, and my fajitas came home for me to fix.  

By the way, on a positive note, the salsa has improved from ketchup to maybe jarred grocery store quality.  I really wish the owners would take a field trip to some of the Mexican neighborhoods in the city to try quality, no frills, excellent Mexican food in order to have a grasp of what they should be serving.

They make a really good sangria here. Most places make a fruit juice drink with a splash of wine. Just the opposite here. Really hits the spot on a hot day. It's right off the I & M Canal Trail so it's a nice stop on a bike ride.

I love coming here for margaritas and guacamole! I am a vegetarian and there are a lot of delicious options for me. My favorite things to eat here are the quesadillas, enchiladas, and anything with the portobello mushrooms. Many of their servers are great, but if Darci is there I'll ways ask for her, she's fantastic!

Have been there several times and the service and food are always good.  They also have several options on the kids menu.  Nice patio area for outside seating.  I live in the area and it's by far the restaurant I go to most often.

Love this place!!! The food is served fast and it's so good! Love everything I've had there. Charmaine and Darci are super friendly servers, and give great recommendations on what to try! Right now my favorite item is the portobello enchilada.....YUM!!!

The food is really good. Unfortunately that's the only good thing I have to say about this place. I'm at a loss of words to describe how incompetent the staff is here. I ordered a Margarita and they botched it up. Twice. I feel sorry for the cooks, because they are the only ones here that know what they are doing. If you're in the area and can eat somewhere else I recommend making this a last resort.

I was really excited to have a local Mexican restaurant in Lemont and I really wanted to like it.  I love Mexican food.

The wife and I gave this place a try 3 times. 
The first time, the food was ok. I thought perhaps it was just the meal I ordered. 
(Although I got a combo plate.)

Then the second time I tried something different and I was starting to wonder if it was everything on a whole/ that didn't appeal to me. 
So I gave the place one last chance and that was the end of it. It was really not good at all. Nothing seemed close to authentic at all/
It all seemed very bland and just thrown together. I had some strange unknown spices that did not work well together.
I was very disappointed to say the least. As was the wife.

Unfortunately we won't be going back.

I eat here frequently for lunch and am never disappointed, though I will admit, I more or less get the same couple of things every time. There are two dishes that I really like at Front Street, the steak campos tacos and the chili (which they give free bowls of during Bears games). I also occasionally go there for their fajita Thursday special, but it really is a lot of food and I can't finish it.

I've also never had any incidents of bad service there even once in the many, many times I've been there. 

Front Street's management goes to great lengths to keep their beer offerings current as well. They rotate their offerings frequently to feature interesting and local craft beers. 

I'm pretty sure some of the lower reviews they've received on here were when they first opened (when every restaurant goes through growing pains) or just isolated incidents and/or bad blood between a worker and patron (this really does happen, especially in a small town like Lemont).

This place is awesome. I dont know what the other reviewers are even THINKING. 
The food is great, the bar atmosphere is incredible and the service is GREAT for a common bar/grill type place. 

The head bus boy? He works so freaking hard and cleans the tables so fast. The sweet little brunette waitress? She is amazing.

The chips and salsa... the spicy salsa....AMAZING.

The female staff is hot too!! 

Whoever doesn't like this place doesn't like a good time and I MEAN this. The beer is good and cheap and the shots are priced well and the bar staff is lively. I go there to have a good meal and get a bit tipsy and it does the job. 

This is probably one of the best places to eat in Lemont.

When you go to front street you should go in expecting It is equivalent of like a PEPE's except it is waaaaay better then PEPE's. 

You do not go there expecting authentic food. Go there expecting Pepe's and you will be blown away.

Very pleasant dining on the patio (they do have a shady area).  The fact that dogs are welcomed and even served water is a good reason to go there in itself. It's more enjoyable knowing Fido isn't locked in his cage.  Food was better than expected going by some of the reviews. I had shrimp tacos and specified what I wanted on them. I got just that and they were pretty good. I was told the fresh ahi tuna salad was quite good as well. If you're expecting authentic Mexican it's not that. If you would like better than Chipotle, Pepe's and the like you will be happy with the fare here. Wine list is more extensive than you would expect and mojitos aren't bad either.

My wife and I have been to this location several times, and not only is the food fresh and tasty, but the service and atmosphere is also second to none.  My wife doesn't really like Mexican food that well, so when she lets me, we always go here.

"Mexican" restaurant complete with spinach, olives, mushrooms, bright yellow cheese and everything else "Mexican" you can think of.  As a Mexican-American, I felt insulted to be in this place but I didn't go on my own free will (boss' choice). The waiter filled my boss' ice tea cup with coke instead of a refill. The food was subpar and EXPENSIVE. I can't get over how outrageously overpriced this "Mexican" food was. No surprise, they were really into Cinco de Mayo...

I was here last week for dinner.  The menu was big and the had a lot of options to choose from.  I ordered carne asade pizza from the specials menu.  It was ok but nothing special.  The chips and salsa were ok.  A couple of the other people in my group order fajitas which looked good.  Maybe it would have been the better option.  All in all not a horrible experience just not sure if I would return.

I've visited here only a handful of times and so far, they've made a good impression on me. The place has good chips and salsa and great margaritas! Awesome flavors! I haven't had any food here that I didn't enjoy and the service is good too.

My friends and I were just here a couple weekends ago. We had SO much fun! : D We got a HUGE blue drink and spent the night filling the building with our giggles. Our bartender was super fun too : ) She came and sat with us for a while and we all became instant best friends : ) 

Come here and eat their chips, order delicious food and tip the servers heavily because they will treat you very well : )

Nothing about this place is good.  The service sucks and I can make better mexican food for one sixteenth the price in my own kitchen.  Go to taco bell instead (i'm dead serious).  I'm sorry to be so mean but this is such a good space I really wish some other restaurant would take over and give me something worth getting out of the house for.

I visit this restaurant often. Adam usually takes care of us and does a great job. The place is spotless and the food is always consistently good. They have a wide variety of drink choices and the patio is always a good option for the warmer months. Good food, great service, great restaurant.

This was the worst restaurant experience I've had in a long time.  It started out promising, and it looked like this was a good place to watch a Saturday afternoon Hawks game.  Let me start by saying the manager was very nice and apologetic for all our issues and the meal was on the house.  Every thing we ordered was wrong,  it started with the cocktails and continued with the meal where things were completely wrong,  redone, and wrong again. The waiter then argued with us, stating that was how we asked for it.  I asked for a second beer and when it came it was not what I was drinking, and when I inquired I was told it was my brand. I then asked another waiter who informed me the keg had run out of my beer and they had no more. So I guess they were just attempting to slip it by me and lie.  I really wanted to like this place since my daughter live down the street and this would be a great place to meet for lunch. If the service was this bad and the food was good I may have given it another try, but the food was terrible also. Save yourself the aggravation and go somewhere else.

Good if you want bland hospital grade food that's called Mexican. Calling this place Mexican is a disservice. It's loud, service is sub par and the food is bland. Go to el burrito junior instead for takeout. Food there is ok but is consistent.

Let's start off with an understanding of what Front Street Cantina is.  It's a modern bar and grill setup that serves Mexican style food spun in a way that people in the Lemont area will enjoy.  Period.  It's NOT an authentic taqueria serving street tacos by a Mexican mother that gets the official 'authentic' stamp of approval.  Knowing that, this place is a nice addition to the ever growing downtown Lemont scene.  As a fan of Mexican cuisine, I'm happy to have this place in the area.

If you are a lover of spice, anything labeled as spicy on the menu is actually mild.  Keep that in mind.  That's my one complaint about the menu, I wanted more heat.  From the chips and salsa to the guacamole to my tacos Mexicanos that had the little chile icon next to it on the menu, everything needed more heat.  I want my nose to run and my throat to feel that warmth while eating Mexican food.  It simply wasn't there.  The chips and salsa to start were decent.  It was your standard salsa and yes, you can find better elsewhere.  The guacamole is sort of prepared fresh.  My brother and I noted that there's no way they could prepare it that fast so I'm guessing they make large batches ahead of time.  I prefer to see someone cutting the avocados to order but I'm picky.

I asked for corn tortillas with my tacos mexicanos and really enjoyed them.  Streak topped with cilantro and onion, a squeeze of fresh lime and finished with their salsa verde, the flavor was wonderful.  I don't think anyone would be disappointed in ordering these.  And I was extremely happy with the rice.  Most Mexican places serve bland and boring rice but this place was a step up.  I actually finished the rice on my plate which surprised me.  The beans were decent.  Slightly chunky in texture which I liked though the flavor was more mild than expected.

On a Sunday this place was half full.  It's a new restaurant that's looking to expand their customer base.  With the food they serve, it won't be long before new customers make this place a regular stop.  I'll be back with the family.

I don't know what these reviews are talking about.  The first time I came here I got the shrimp fajitas.  They were amazing.  They are full of flavor and enough food to eat for lunch the next day. My husband got the chicken fajitas.  Every time we come back we try to order something different but the fajitas are just that good!  The drinks are strong,  the salsa is good and the wait staff has always been friendly.  I'm never ran into the problems the other reviewers described.

The patio is great and peaceful.  There is usually parking and I've always seen a clean restaurant.  Either way it's one of our favorite places!  We love it here!
Service is not good,food is not good,music is too loud. I wouldn't suggest this.

Try the Tacos Compos, mexicano, Pedro Pollo, Yucatecan Red Pork, Chicken picado. So much flavor in those dishes, Gauc is fresh, great beers on tap, great specials. Also have some great lunch specials too, worth the stop if your in the area.

Never mind the food - the service here was absolutely awful.  Awful, awful, awful.  As in, the worst experience I've had at a restaurant in a long time.

As a prior poster mentioned, we were part of a large party that would dine on Cinco de Mayo.  As such, we called a week in advance to secure a reservation and confirm that the restaurant would be able to accommodate us.  The hostess explained that while the restaurant does not typically take reservations (contrary to what's posted on their website), since we were such a large party they would take our reservation.  We called again the day beforehand, May 4th, to confirm our reservation.  We were once again told that, even know the restaurant does not take reservations, they would do so for us.  They told us that we would have to wait a maximum of 30 minutes (which doesn't necessarily square with the idea of a reservation, but hey - it was Cinco de Mayo so we were willing to be flexible).  They told us to arrive promptly at 7pm to ensure minimal waiting times.

Our party was there promptly at 7pm, at which point the hostess on staff told us they could not honor our reservation.  The manager was then called over, who did not even have the decency to acknowledge us or speak to us directly, and confirmed that they were not going to honor our reservation.  No apologies, no offers to discount our meal.  They told us we would have to wait an hour to be seated.  

The wait ended up being closer to 75 minutes.  When we were finally seated, we were surprised to find that we were being placed at a table outside.  It was now 8:30 pm in early May in Chicago - someone please explain to me why this is an acceptable thing to do?  Particularly when the patio is exposed to the wind and there were no heat lamps or other ways to warm ourselves.  Most of us were not dressed for the weather as we were not anticipating eating outdoors, so we spent the next 2 hours alternately freezing our butts off and trying to shout at each other over the noise of the freight trains and screaming children who were running around unattended.  

The final kicker was when the server skipped over my husband and I when taking drink orders (still not sure why), which you can imagine did not go over well - by now we were in sore need of a drink.  

In the end, my husband and I paid $60 to sit at a cheap patio table in the freezing cold by the train tracks, eating mediocre food.  We would have been better off camping - at least then we might have been prepared for the elements.  

Shame on you Front Street Cantina.  With this kind of service you will not be in business long.

Food was great!  Fresh, appealing, and delicious.  In fact, the Tacos Campos were some of the best tacos I've ever had.   The server told us that they pride themselves on the fresh made from scratch food...  And it was.

If you like good Mexican (Americanized) this is the place to go!
I tried this place many times. It's not bad, but it's not good either. Kind of in the middle the road.
get rid of benches!!!

Possibly one of the worst Mexican restaurants in the greater Chicagoland metropolitan area.  
It seemed that one of the servers stole our table from someone else - which was a shame because the other server had to be better than the one we got.  She didn't know the specials, took our drink orders separately, (because my husband was using the restroom) and brought our bill before we asked - so I guess I was done, whether I wanted to be or not.
The food was bad, too.  The guac was grocery store variety, no heat, no spice, nothing special.  The salsa was a mix of chopped up tomatoes, nothing more.  My two tacos campos, one chicken, one steak, were really bad.  The meat seemed as if it was flat ironed on to the grill, because both sides of each piece of meat had a hardened crust on it.  My husband said there were no words to describe how bad his tamale was and that his burrito was edible.  Don't even get me started on the watery beans.  In a city that has a Mexican restaurant every few miles, my advice is to just keep on driving.

Front Street Cantina is wonderful. Best Sangria I've had, much better than Emilio's in Napes. Love the guacamole and the delicious flaky shell they serve it in. My husband loves the steak they use , I believe he got a steak enchilada, said it was the best he's had. The restaurant is so cool looking inside, a warm, inviting atmosphere. The owners are young, hard-working, earnest and friendly, stopping at our table to make sure we're enjoying ourselves. We've been there about 4 times and will continue to go back, as the Front Street Cantina in our town is tough to get a table in.
Great food, always fresh and flavorful. Meet with friends to enjoy dinner and drinks on their outdoor patio in the warm months.

I want to start off by saying that that the salsa that is served complimentary was outstanding!!  It was made fresh and tasted delicious!

My quesadilla were awesome...I tried them with mushrooms for the first time and it was a treat!  

This is good Americanized Mexican food with an ok atmosphere.

After hearing a few people say how good this place is, we went for dinner yesterday.  What a mistake!  If I could give zero stars, I would.

My first impression when we walked in was that the restaurant was not clean and  not managed well (we waited 5 minutes for a hostess to show up).  After sitting down, I confirmed the restaurant could have been cleaner.  Our waiter disappeared after taking our drink order; he showed up 15 minutes later -- only because I flagged him down and asked him to take our orders.  His response was that he forgot about us.  The food was poor.  My husband and I each ordered a combination platter (different combinations) and we agreed that all three items on our plates tasted the same.  You could not distinguish a taco from an enchilada, from a tamale, etc.  Plus, every item on the plate (except for the rice) had a large amount of cheese melted on top; I like cheese and expect it in Mexican food, but this was excessive (perhaps they are trying to cover up that the food is not good quality and does not taste good).

I will never return, nor could I recommend it.  There are too many other great Mexican restaurants in the city to bother with this place.

This place is just OK. It's big with a large outdoor dining area, which is a plus, but the noise level inside can make conversation a challenge even when the place is half-full. Our server was Brittany, and she did a great job in seeing to the needs of our table of 12.  It was a Tuesday, so the house mojito was on special at $4, but I found it to be quite watery and flavorless. The summer special margarita was much better. As for the food, the reviewer who noted that this was Mexican cuisine tailored to a suburban audience was spot on. I ordered a combo plate w. a taco, chile relleno, and a tamale, but didn't notice until I was halfway through that the tamale had been left off. Oh well. I thought the prices were about average. On the whole, the food could benefit from a lot more heat, as the choices marked "spicy" were anything but. A passable meal, but we're in no hurry to go back.

The Front Street Cantina is a nice restaurant located in historic downtown Lemont, which unfortunately lacks any real character.  We were quickly served the chips and salsa and the salsa was among the best I have had in a very long time.  Our server was very friendly and fairly attentive.  However, what was lacking was our main course.  My wife had the Chicken Fajita Burrito dinner and I had the Chicken Fajitas dinner.  Unfortunately, neither had any flavor.  Both tasted as though the chicken and vegetables were simply cooked in a skillet with water and without any type of seasoning (maybe the chef forgot).  Fajitas tend to be a dish that is not very consistent for whatever reason, even among the same restaurant.  In fact, I can only think of one restaurant were I have had the fajitas more than three or four times and it has been consistenly good--La Carretta in Merriville, IN.  But that place is a hike for me.  As for the Front Street Cantina, I wanted to like the place because it is not too far from my home and as I said, the salsa is excellent (although only the first basket of chips is complimentary, which I think they should reconsider).  If they did, I might revisit them for some cocktails and chips and salsa.  But, if you're not big on fajitas like me, try the place out and see what else they have to offer.  But, if you are a fan, beware that you might waste around $14.

My husband and I moved to Lemont about 2 months ago from Chicago.  We knew we were going to get downgraded in terms of restaurant choices and we have been pleasantly surprised at some, and proven right by others.  Wanting Mexican food this evening, we ventured over to Front Street Cantina.  Not much good I can say about the place other than the waitress was friendly.  Room is not really inviting and while they have a huge patio space, we didn't want to sit outside.  I'm not a huge fan of Mexican cooking so I ordered a taco salad.  I mean how can you go wrong?  Well the meat was tough and mealy and sour cream and guacamole cost extra when they generally are standard fare in most mexican restaurants.  My husband ordered the Yucatecan Pork and he said it was just ok.  Looks like we will be going back into the city for our Mexican dinner fixes, or to another restaurant that knows how to cook them.

Sad.  I was hoping for a decent Mexican place in this town full of roast beef joints and endless "bar &grills", but I was pretty disappointed.  While my chile relleno and chicken enchilada w/ mole combo wasn't bad, Front Street Cantina definitely lost a few stars for selling "queso" described as fondue when I'm pretty sure it was the nasty, fake, liquid cheese from a can served with nachos at a ballpark dressed up with some pico de gallo on top.  Seriously?

I can honestly say that this place has the worst service of any restaurant I have been to over the last few years. Went there last Saturday night, they said it would be about a 10 minute wait for a table outside. We waited about 20 minutes, but no problem there. After sitting there about 15 minutes we flagged a waitress who said that she would get someone. No one shows. I go back inside the restarant, I see the hostess, she acts surprised said she would get someone. No one comes. It is now 25 minutes since we were seated. We try to flag a waitress or the hostess but they dont even look over to our table. There are other numerous tables where people are sitting down and getting served immediately. We should have left already but it was a beautiful night. The table next to us just needed a fork and after numerous requests the customer went inside the restaurant and pulled one off a a table. He told us we should leave, that the food and service was awful. We get up to leave and and saw the hostess (short heavy set blond) and  I told here we were leaving. She shrieked at us "I TOLD YOU I WAS GETTING SOMEBODY OUT THERE!! Sorry never ever again. We wasted a good part of a Saturday night there - I will NEVER go back.

Unfortunately the food is not very authentic...there is no queso fresco served on the tacos and the back beans leave much to be desired. Th chicken quesadilla was great and the salsa very tasty. The taco or burrito meat was not very seasoned. I think it is subpar compared to El Faro or Zaca Tacos, but keep in mind I am from the southside and expect very authentic mexican

There is a TON of seafood here, if you don't like seafood, don't go. 
Overall lunch is ok for the price, I wouldn't pay for dinner here
I didn't eat any of the American Chinese food (ie things you find on the lunch special menu of Chinese restaurants)
Half the seafood is fresh the other half is not fresh, ie smells fishy, be wary.
I am impressed with the selection of seafood though
Remember it's a buffet, the waiter will be by to clear tables, that's about it.

Fish in general - Fairly tasty and fresh, well cooked, and very moist
Red Snapper - watch out, this one has bones in it even though it doesn't look like it
Muscles - getting not so fresh, you can taste the fishiness, not good
Clams in Black bean sauce - yummy, I had quite a few of these
Chinese egg plant - this was super yummy, wish they broke down the skin a bit more as parts of that were a bit tough. It was sweet and savory at the same time
Beef and Tofu - decent, not the same flavor you get with it being cooked at home but it was decent
Salt and Pepper Calamari - not really salt and pepper at all, more like fried calamari, lacked in flavor and spice
Coconut Shrimp - not the best way to eat at a buffet but it was nice fried shrimp with a sweet coconut cream sauce. Nice and thick sauce. I liked it.
Steamed conch - moist soy sauced fish
Sushi - not the greatest selection and lots of rice, not very flavorful overall, the spicy mayo did add a bit of flavor but the contents weren't super flavorful
Sashimi - lots of not so fresh stuff on here, a lot of it smelled fishy as I ate it
Blackened white fish - this was actually quite good, it's near the grill, it's kinda like battered fish but done with a marinade so it's quite flavorful
Calamari - kinda fishy = not fresh 
Pot stickers = they were decent, though not memorable
Lobster = It was empty most of the time then I suddenly saw it as I was on my last trip for dessert so I grabbed a piece, it tasted fresh though a bit overcooked so not as tender as I would like but it was tender enough that I enjoyed it, a nice way to cap off my meal.

This place sucks. We used to live in this area and stored in because we loved the old place that way here.... Same concept different management. The first thing you notice when you walk in is the smell.  Very strong smell of fish, not very appetizing.

The sushi does not taste right. Not sure what it is but I felt uncomfortable eating it.  I would find another place to eat.

Let me start off saying I am a large man, and I love buffets. As long as the food is moderately warm, the trays are kept full,  and tastes better than a frozen chicken pot pie I am a happy camper. This is not a cheap buffet at $25 plus $3 for a soda. So when advertised all you can eat crab legs and lobster I expected butter to be coursing through my veins by the end of our trip. 

It was indeed the exact opposite. The food was COLD, and quite a bit of the selection could fuel a week's worth of nightmares.

In the hour we were there I saw no food taken off the buffet by staff. It was obviously past its holding time. 
I saw the crab and lobster refilled once during our visit. And to my dismay it was a total of 4 small lobsters that were gone in a heartbeat.

Also the folks that rave about the sushi, it isn't terrible but it is by no means good. They call it spicy mayo for a reason, not spicy miracle whip.

So to sum it up the food is gross, the floors are wet, and the lobster is a lie. 

Head over to Osaka grill for a decent buffet, and sushi ya in joliet for good sushi.

Avoid the trouble of going here, we will never be back.

The facility is nice and large. The buffet is huge! 

I would not suggest the seafood. My husband loves shellfish and said the oysters were bland and couldn't finish the rest of his seafood. I tried some cod and there were bones in the fillet.

The sushi seems fresh and there is a large variety. They did not label the various rolls and I would prefer to know what I'm putting in my mouth.

The staff was a bit awkward. They were clearly over staffed for a Sunday AM and the waiters stood around in silence staring. I also felt like the sushi chefs were staring intently at what I was selecting from the sushi buffet. My husband commented that the surfaces all seemed sticky. Gross.

Overall, I enjoy all you can eat sushi but feel like there are better places to go.

Took quiet a drove to get here but it was worth. This place still seems to not be that very popular of a place yet. I do got to say that is very good. Once I got in no wait at all right away seated us so we can start eating.

The food option were alright they had a while section to circle around and get food from. The sushi was very well prepared and fresh as I could taste while downing salmon sashimi. The lobster came out quiet often like every 20 min and since it was so less people I got so much lobster. Made it worth the price I paid in the end

Checked out Sumo buffet in Naperville for lunch on a windy but somewhat mild Winter day on Chicagoland. This place is located on route59 near New York ave in Naperville. It was originally tagged to open as Royal Buffet but not sure what happened or if someone else took over. First off the place is HUGE! There is a big private section along with table top seating. As I entered I noticed how big the place was and that there was a good number of Asian patrons. The buffet area is also huge! Food quality wise I would rate the quality slightly higher than your standard new China buffet fare. They do have a good selection of sushi, grilled items, and standard Chinese food. They had lobster in some type of sauce but the sign stated to only take 1 piece. It was pretty tasty and I wish I could have taken more. The guy sitting next to me took 2 platefuls. Not sure how he got away with that??

Overall 3.5 stars! Check it out!

Honest reviews: i love buffets because im cheap n this one is good but really pricey like 24 dollars a person. None of the food tasted funky alot of times when u go to a chinese buffet the food tastes funky or it has a weird odor because its not fresh. Some of the food was cold but it wasnt as bad as other buffets. The restaurant was clean like the floors tables n bathrooms which is a big plus. The service sucked they were just standing there not doin anything or being on the phone. The food was good but nothing made me be like wow this is the best food i ever had. That being said they do have a huge selection of food! If u want seafood for a bargain i think the price is a steel because u could get unlimited amount of crab legs, lobster, oysters which is more affordable then red lobster so if u want to save money instead of wasting it on red lobster i would rather come here. They also have a hibachi grill. If i wanna go to a buffer ill go to my neighborhood one but if i want crab legs ill for sure come here over red lobster

Issues: i think its way to expensive like for nothing being that amaizing i think its to pricy but its cheaper then red lobster n u get more crab legs

* food was good but there wasnt any standouts. Alot of the food is just boiled nothing wrong with that but i like flavor in my food

* its suppose to be a sushi place and the sushi selection aint that great. Its better hen ur neigborhood chinese buffet but still no stand outs all ur basic sushi items. One thing i like is they had alot of sashimi which i like. All the fish tasted fresh. One thing i wish they did was offer the spicy mayo because thats the best dipping sauce

* service wasnt that good they need more qualified professionals they were all just standing there staring at u which is really uncomfortable.

If you're looking for your typical Chinese buffet this is not it. That being said, this place is amazing! The crab legs, dungeness crab & lobster are definitely worth the price. We went on a Saturday night & they were a little busy. We did wait about 5 minutes for the lobster once, but it was worth the short wait. I'm very happy we didn't listen to the other reviews & gave it a try.

This is a buffet.  I have a real problem with "servers" bringing 1 drink, no refills, irritated that you are there, wanting to know why there was no tip left.  The guy actually came back to the table upset that there was no tip for him, he walked away and called me something in his language. The bill was over $70 for ok food and not so good service.  I don't need to leave a tip, tips are for good service. 

Food is not refilled after 9, but they're opened until 10 on Saturday...

This is the second time at an Asian buffet where the people who basically clear tables demand a tip and stop you before leaving wanting to know where their tip is.  That isn't how this works.

A large variety of not so fresh sea food, especially lobster, crab and shell fish. Desserts are awful don't try. Fruit are fresh but not so sweet. So why am I still giving it a three star?

1. 12.99 lunch buffet and 10% off coupon. Ehhh, this price for seafood, that is what I could expect.
2. Great grill bar with squid, grilled fish ( totally forget its Japanese name, called qiudaoyu and Changyu in Chinese) and grilled shrimp. These are literally grilled fresh and taste great.
3. Some white fish sashimi. I won't expect for salmon by only paying 12.99 lol.
4. Keep adding new food during my time there. 

Anyway, may come sometime if I get really hungry.

Selection:
Food selection is great, grilled, sushi, sashimi, stir fried, fried food, shrimp, lobsters, crabs, etc. it would be best if you tour the food first before start putting food on your plate. 

Taste:
The taste of food is okay. Lobsters are meaty, sauce on fish is tasty. But temperature of food needs improvement. Fish and steak are overcooked. Sushi is okay and has great selections. But the uniqueness and creativity of sushi rolls got lost among all the other food. Sashimi is great. Very fresh and tasty. 

Service:
Maybe it's because the traffic is slow, food was not replaced promptly. Some food on the plates are old and cold. 

The servers are not very attentive. I don't expect much from buffet servers, but they didn't really try to earn the obligatory 10% tip. Some of them were standing around their station joking around, instead of walking around to make sure people don't need anything. Took a while to refill tea pot. Couldn't track anybody down to get low sodium soy sauce (btw, they don't have any). Once it got busier, service picked up too. 

Summary:
For $23 (sat and sun lunch), I expected more. I might return, depending on my mood.

I came with my family on Tuesday night hoping to try this new place out. We all kinda disappointed because there's not much choice and quality of food isn't that good. Salad bar is not fresh. Sushi bar isn't as good as Ginza's. And at 8 pm they stop serving steam lobster and other dishes. They close at 9:30 but at 8 pm they start serving stir fried lobster instead of steamed lobster. Those stir fried lobsters aren't fresh, the meat is soft and weird taste. And at 8:30 there were no new dishes coming out. Dessert is the worst cuz all the cake are dried and hard due to not covering it and leaving it out in the air for too long. 

All in all, nothing special. Usually, new buffets are good when they first open. But for the price and quality of food that Sumo is providing, I don't think it is worth to try. It's $24 per person before tax, tip and drink. So it will be about $30 per person on weekdays. Don't think I'll come back again.

Went here for a work lunch.  I wasn't super impressed, but my coworkers really liked it. There was a ton of food and a huge variety.  I am trying to eat healthy, so I avoided the fried stuff, which was most of the stuff.  The beef and broccoli was very good, as was a lot of the spicy fish things, but some things were really not very good.  Like, the hot and sour soup was SO cornstarchy it was almost a solid.  It's a buffet, though, so you can skip the gross stuff.

I will probably end up coming back, because I can see this place being popular with people I work with.  At 12ish $ a person, it's a pretty good deal for lunch.  I am curious about the dinner offerings, but I would have to be very hungry to pay 23$ for mediocre buffet food.  When it comes down to it, I am just not a buffet person.  But, if you're going with a large group, buffets are super easy.

This is the third time a "Japanese Seafood House" has opened on these premises. The previous two followed a similar trajectory: Opened big with attractive tasty stuff, prepared well, and then slowly but surely descended into shite, followed by "closed for remodeling".
Why can't any of these joints stay lit? When these places are open, I patronize them more than any other restaurant, and stop going there when I finish my meal and get that slight icky "regret" vibe. Lying to myself that OF COURSE the food is "up to date", and OF COURSE the no-see-um kitchens are clean, and OF COURSE that Sushi/Sashimi is "perfectly fresh".
And all of this goes skidding directly into the bucket as the queasies take their toll.
This describes the last meal I had here at Sumo. The once-gloried hot dishes now appear haphazardly thrown onto the platters, The Korean short ribs are a symphony of grease.
The Crab Legs are anorexic. The boilerplate Chinese stuff is disgusting,
The Sushi is still edible, but it's like supermarket sushi. Close but no cigala. It'll do in a pinch, though if I'm cruising anywhere near one of the AYCE "real" sushi joints, I ain't goin' to Sumo.
What possesses these entrepreneurs to find the biggest room they can, launch these epic restaurants that are NEVER full, and sink like lead ingots every time? 
I'm throwing two for the Sushi alone. 
I give this joint until the new year and it will be closed.

LOL Every business who tried to make it here failed. It will happen again soon. Food is poor, like it has been sitting for a long time. I would bet it's the same ownership as the Chinese buffet that was here  Previous.  Save your money, go to the royal buffet in hoffman estates  if you want a teal seafood buffet experience

Service was below average.  
Foods was tasteless and hot foods is not hot enough.
Premium selection is a joke. Nothing is premium. 
Lobster is bad and not fresh. 
Sashimi was ok. 
Staffs is not filling foods. ( it's only 6pm)
I'm really regret to walk in there for dinner. I was paying $32 for myself and I don't know what I just ate.

This placed wasn't the greatest buffet we've been to. We have been to better ones. It was maybe an two hours before closing and all the food was basically gone. We thought they would make more fresh foods but they didn't. Everything was cold. When we went back for our second round the only thing that was fresh from the kitchen was french fries and fried rice. The dessert area was empty as well. The fruits were basically all gone. 

In my opinion, the inside of the buffet could of been better but it's still nice. It is clean but once it gets to closing time the floor gets dirty with food on the floor and they don't bother to clean up, so watch your step. The workers there are very kind; If you need anything they are willing to help. 

I will not be returning back. For the price of this buffet i can go somewhere else worth my money.
The service is okay, the food is alright. Most of the food are cold already . Good thing their shrimps, crabs and lobsters are fresh.

Very good seafood buffet. A lot of sashimi and sushi. Sashimi are extremely fresh. To me there is not much variety of other Chinese food. People mainly come here for the seafood . Do not come here if you do not love seafood because they charge $24 per person on weekday and $28 on weekend. Drinks are not included. They stock the lobster fairly quick. There lobster are fresh and yummy. Staffs are very friendly. I love their salad bar. I have never seen a Asian buffet with so many variety of cheese! The grill steaks are on point. Not too well done or too raw. 

Pretty long drive from Chicago. Might return in future :) Lost one star because I was excepting to have more variety like Royal Buffet and better deserts like they advertised on their website.

Eh, the seafood doesn't seem that fresh- I didn't sample the lobster and crab legs, but did try the oysters, clams, & fish. Other food was ok, maybe the best part were sushi, seaweed salad , fruits, and desserts. There were some bugs flying above the fruits which made me hesitate the 2nd go around. Place had about 5 other small tables filled around 7 something on a Wednesday evening. Maybe the lunch is better since it's half the price - which makes more sense considering the quality of the food. Wouldnt go again :/

Although I had bad experience with the previous buffet at this location, Sumo is not bad at all. Perhaps I had my expectation set so low, I thought it was well worth the price. Paid $13 for lunch on a Friday, had sushi, rolls, sashimi and stir fry lobster....would def go back for lunch!

$13 for lunch buffet on this President's Day.  What a feast!!!  Lobsters, stone crabs, jumbo scallops, crayfish, steamed flounders, and many more.

Not sure if they offer lobsters, stone crabs and jumbo scallops going forward, or just part of grand opening promo to entice new patrons.

Sushi chef's are generous with fish/roe portions, lots of sashimi's too (no need to throw away the rice on nigiri's)

Use promo code GO2016 to get 15% off the bill, excluding weekends & holidays, good til Feb 29, 2016.

Good sushi & seafood selection but quantities of the great stuff like crab & lobster limited.  Saw one guy take all available oysters.  But so much to choose from like dragon fruit and pot stickers I was happy.  Price is high, but worth it.

Came in late on a Wednesday! The place was full of patrons and almost all of them were Asian! Everybody seemed to really be enjoying their food, so we decided to stay despite the higher than expected price! Boy! That really was a good call! Fresh hot Lobster! Fresh fresh Sashimi! Baked Salmon! They have their act together here!!! Don't forget they have a Senior Discount!

Very expensive for two people on a Sunday at noon. $24 per person. They have the smallest take out menu posted in their window with the price and don't tell or have it posted anywhere else until you get the bill at the end. Food was only ok. Nothing more than a regular china buffet really (where we usually spend half the price per person). Seafood is NOT the quality that I would pay this money for. Neither is the sushi. Most of the hot dishes were luke warm as well. Staff mostly stood around and talked even though plates had accumulated on our table and drinks were empty. Place was clean. Unfortunately, we won't be back.

Awesome addition to the neighborhood.
Good section of food. Whitefish was outstanding. 
To our surprise while dinning for lunch they brought Lobster which was prepared Chinese style. 
Lamb Soup was delicious.
Sushi was very good, but the rolls had too much rice.

The Salad Bar which you can purchase alone is pretty basic, but had more choices than I expected to see. Spinach on the bar was really fresh.

Will try Dunn in the future where they offer Whole Lobsters.
This picky eater will be back.

The reviews here are pretty accurate. Came on a Sunday for lunch and it was pretty empty. Decent sushi although the selection was a bit small , good seafood spread including lobster, crab, crawfish, oysters and clams. 

They were slow at replenishing the lobster plate and once it came out everyone jumped at getting a piece like a hawk. My husband ended up not getting a piece and so we split mine. we were there for 2 hours just periodically checking and still no luck. Overall Lunch for $24 pp was pricey, would try a different buffet next time.

So we had a party of 2 adults, a 5 year old and a 2 year old. Our bill was 78$ which wouldn't have been so bad if the food wasn't dry as the desert and room temp. If I'm spending 80$ to go out to eat, I expect a better experience. 
Honey chicken, dry and hard. 
Noodles dry 
Broccoli beef, old. 

I gave up after that.
