My 5 year old liked the nuggets, they were hot. 
So yay for 80$ nuggets.

Just opened up on Friday, Jan. 22, 2016. Largest buffet seafood bar I have seen. Staff was courteous, fast and efficient The food was refreshed often. The food was good and included a sushi bar also. It is all you can eat. Check the copy of the menu for prices as they are very different depending what days and times you go. Would go back again.

Foods are good not the greatest! Seafoods are fresh, lobsters that they advertised in the buffet is less, you have to wait a while before they have batches of it!  Crabs are alright! Pricey for a dinner on the weekend! Will probably try to comeback on a weekday lunch buffet!

This is the third time that he owner has changed: Nagoya, Royal, and now Sumo. Not sure if it's the location or staffing issues. This was once great when it was Nagoya, then just went down to terminally mid-level dining. It's good when you have a craving. I save my addiction up for a month, and let it all out at a sushi buffet. I just haven't seen this place exceeding its level.

Pros: 
Unlimited lobster and crab. You have to wait a bit for the lobster as you can only get one at a time tho. 

Cons: 
Every platter of lobster they take out can serve around 7 people, with a server making sure each customer gets only one at a time. Takes around 10 minutes for the next platter to arrive. 

They apparently REQUIRE you to pay at least 10% for the tip. First time I've seen this in any buffet, OR any other fancier restaurants for that matter. I'd understand if we had a large party but we didn't. The way the server asked us for it was less than appropriate as well.
Selection of food is great! We came at lunchtime, not a lot of people but the buffet was full of food, many items were cold and over held so the quality of product was not good.

So, I'm trying to think of one word to sum up my first dining experience at SUMO.  I think the best word to describe it is "subpar".  Trust me, don't let the pretty new sign, and grand opening memorabilia fool ya.   It's WAY WAY WAY WAY overpriced for what you get.   Service was "okay" and the food was "okay".  My girlfriend and I went for dinner and it was over $50 for the two of us.  The buffet on 75 in Woodridge easily tops this.  Trust me guys, save your money.  It's no wonder the place hasn't quite taken off yet.

Okay, I've actually been to the location before. It used to be another seafood buffet but my party and I had a very hard time remembering what the darn name was. I'm honestly torn between a 3 and 4 stars, so perhaps a 3.5 would do. I love this place because they actually have stir fried crawfish (even though it was a little too spicy) instead of the ones that are just left on top of ice by the oysters.  The lobsters came out rapidly and there was even uni (sea urchin)!!! Now, they stingy out on the uni after a little bit which was disappointing because that was what was great about you guys compared to other seafood buffets! They also have this hibachi grill thing at the end where they cook meats and other things in front of you. I just hope they are consistent with the quality and efficiency of the delivery of food because most buffet places are usually less of those as they are opened longer.

My husband and I took a huge risk and chose to come here for an early dinner on a Saturday evening. We were very impressed on the HUGE selection of food items in the buffet.  The quality of the sushi and sashimi was amazing. I highly recommend this place if you need a change for dinner especially with a group.

Took the family there with hopes that some decent seafood would be available but to our dismay, the vast majority of the offerings were those found at your 9.95 Chinese Buffet.  Lots of low quality, mostly tasteless food. They did have some seafood options like shrimp, smalll snow crab legs and even some tiny under a pound lobsters that were cut in half netting a piece of meat about the size of your thumb.  Of course the lobster was served next to a sign saying one piece of lobster per trip "No excuses".  I think they meant no exceptions, but I got the point.  Service was ok.  Our server was not friendly at all.  Not unfriendly or rude, just very matter of fact, "Here's your drink" attitude.  Even with the reduced weekday rate, our bill came to $101, pretty steep for what you get.  My advice is either go to a much cheaper Chinese buffet and save some money, or add some cash and go to a decent seafood place.  We won't be back.

Tried it last night and I felt that the quality of the food is worth it's price! I don't understand the other low ratings.  It was crowded.  They use top quality ingredients.  I hope this place can make it because seriously, I don't know how they can make money with what they charge.  At a regular sushi restaurant, a regular sashimi plate costs the same as this place! I think I have at least consumed $60 worth of sashimi last night.  Lol
